372 
FXUS64 KMRX 312013
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST TUE DEC 31 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER FLOW GRADUALLY BECOMES 
SOUTHWESTERLY THROUGH THE PERIOD WHILE THE SURFACE RIDGE SLIPS OFF 
THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC COAST. 85H FLOW ALSO GOES SOUTHWEST BUT MOISTURE 
RETURN WON'T BE QUICK ENOUGH TO KEEP THE SUN FROM SHINING. IT SHOULD 
BE A GOOD DAY WITH HIGHS BUMPING UP A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR 
EARLY JANUARY. STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND FOR THE SHORT 
TERM.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SOUTHERN STREAM SPEED 
MAX MOVES NE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY THURSDAY. UPPER 
TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. WITH SW-NE SPEED MAX ON EAST SIDE OF 
TROUGH MOVING INTO THE OH VALLEY. SYSTEMS ARE NOT PHASED WHEN THEY 
MOVE THROUGH MRX CWA ON THURSDAY. BULK OF PRECIPITATION WITH 
SOUTHERN SYSTEM WILL REMAIN SE OF THE AREA. ISENTROPIC LIFT IN UPPER 
SW FLOW WILL BRING RAIN ACROSS THE REGION THURSDAY IN ADVANCE OF 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT. UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL SLIDE EAST INTO THE 
AREA THURSDAY EVENING PUSHING COLD FRONT THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW AS FREEZING LEVEL PLUMMETS 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON. DECENT LIFT FROM BACK SIDE SPEED MAX WILL 
ENHANCE SNOW THURSDAY EVENING. LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION CAN BE 
EXPECTED INTO FRIDAY MORNING. SYSTEM QUICKLY TRANSITIONS INTO NW 
UPSLOPE FLOW OVERNIGHT INTO EARLY FRIDAY. LAYER MOISTURE LOWERS BUT 
PATTERN IS FAVORABLE FOR MAINLY UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS FRIDAY MORNING. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES SE ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH SATURDAY. 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY. RAIN 
WILL LIKELY END AS LIGHT SNOW AS THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH SUNDAY 
NIGHT. STRONGER HIGH PRESSURE AND A COLD AIR MASS POSED TO MOVE INTO 
THE AREA EARLY NEXT WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

320 
FXUS64 KMRX 310801
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EST TUE DEC 31 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A WEAK 
WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE 
CAROLINAS. A WEAK COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY 
LOW IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...BUT NO PRECIP IS EXPECTED WITH THIS FRONT DUE TO A LACK OF 
MOISTURE AND WEAK UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS. THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD BRING 
A GENERAL DECREASE IN CLOUDS OVER THE REGION TODAY...ALTHOUGH SOME 
HIGH CLOUDS FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MAY CONTINUE TO MOVE 
NORTHEASTWARD OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AN ACTIVE EXTENDED FORECAST 
WITH THE GFS AND ECMWF SOLUTIONS BECOMING QUITE DIFFERENT THIS 
WEEKEND/EARLY NEXT WEEK. FIRST SYSTEM WILL DEVELOP WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AS A FAIRLY PROGRESSIVE BUT STRONG JET PULLS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS. THE JET ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER TROUGH AND 
NORTHERN STREAM JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY PRODUCE STRONG PRESSURE 
FALLS OVER THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THE AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL 
CIRCULATION AROUND THE JETS HELP PULL MOISTURE NORTHWARD FROM THE 
GULF WITH PRECIPITATION EXPANDING NORTHEAST INTO THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY BY EARLY THURSDAY MORNING.

FOR THURSDAY...STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE/FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL PRODUCE WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION. AS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY PULLS EAST ACROSS THE REGION THURSDAY...COLD AIR WILL COLD 
ARCTIC AIR WILL SPILL INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE TO SNOW FROM WEST 
TO EAST AND HIGH ELEVATIONS FIRST. BY LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING...A GOOD
PART OF THE REGION WILL EXPERIENCE SNOW.

FOR THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY MORNING...OROGRAPHIC NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWS 
WILL BE PRODUCING FAIRLY DECENT SNOWFALLS OVER THE NORTHWEST FACING 
SLOPES. ALSO...STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION ALONG WITH SOME LOW-LEVEL 
INSTABILITY WILL PRODUCE SNOWS EVEN ACROSS THE VALLEY. WARNING 
CRITERIA IS POSSIBLE OVER THE FAR EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND MOUNTAINS OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...SUCH AS HIGH KNOB. ADVISORY CRITERIA SNOWS ARE 
POSSIBLE ACROSS THE PLATEAU...CENTRAL VALLEY...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...
VALLEYS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND CHEROKEE/CLAY COUNTIES OF NORTH 
CAROLINA. WILL INCLUDE IN THE HWO.

FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST WITH RIDGING OVER 
THE AREA WITH VERY COLD TEMPERATURES.

FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...THE GFS AND ECMWF DIVERGE GREATLY. THE ECMWF 
SHOWS VERY STRONG CYCLOGENESIS DEVELOPING OVER THE MID-ATLANTIC 
STATES PRODUCING HEAVY SNOWS OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. GFS 
SHOWS A MUCH WEAKER SYSTEM. CONFIDENCE IS VERY LOW AND WILL TREND 
TOWARD THE GFS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   46  28  53  36  46 /   0   0   0  40  90 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     44  26  52  34  43 /   0   0   0  10  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN             44  26  52  33  43 /   0   0   0  20  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    41  23  50  29  44 /   0   0   0  10  80 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMRX 310216
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
916 PM EST MON DEC 30 2013

.DISCUSSION...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO THE SOUTH AND EAST WITH
MOISTURE LINGERING BEHIND IT THIS EVENING. UPPER TROUGH OVER
NORTHEAST HALF OF THE COUNTRY. MOISTURE CONTINUES TO FEED IN FROM
THE SW. LOW LEVEL CLOUDS WILL GIVE WAY TO MID AND HIGH LEVEL
MOISTURE LATER TONIGHT. WEAK SHORT WAVE ACTIVITY TO WRING OUT SOME
SPRINKLES SOUTH AND FLURRIES NORTH AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS NEXT
SEVERAL HOURS. SKIES ARE STILL MOSTLY CLOUDY WITH TEMPERATURES IN
THE MID TO UPPER 30S AND DEW POINTS UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S. EXPECT
CLOUDS TO SLOWLY DECREASE FROM WEST TO EAST AFTER MIDNIGHT. LOWS
SHOULD STILL DROP ANOTHER 10 DEGREES BY MORNING AS CLOUDS THIN AND
WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES.

044 
FXUS64 KMRX 302002
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EST MON DEC 30 2013

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND TUESDAY
CLOUD DECK WILL REMAIN RATHER CONSISTENT LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO
AT LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF THE NIGHT. THERE MAY BE SOME THINNING
AND PERHAPS SOME HINT OF SUNSHINE TRYING TO PEEK THROUGH BUT THE
CLOUDS WILL THICKEN UP SHORTLY AFTER. AFTER MIDNIGHT THE LOWER
CLOUDS SHOULD BREAK UP FROM WEST TO EAST WITH THICKER CLOUD COVER
HANGING ON OVER PARTS OF SW VA. OTHERWISE THIN HIGH CLOUDS ARE
EXPECTED FOR TUESDAY WITH DAYTIME HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER
30S NORTH AND IN THE MOUNTAINS TO THE UPPER 40S SOUTH. 

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH
WEDNESDAY. DRY CONDITIONS WITH MILD WARMING TREND. UPPER TROUGH
APPROACHES THE AREA FROM THE WEST. THIS FEATURES IS TAKING ON A
MORE AMPLIFIES AND SLIGHTLY SLOWER SOLUTION IN LATEST MODEL RUNS.
AREAS OF RAIN WILL ADVANCE INTO THE AREA FROM THE SW ON THURSDAY.
COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE EXPECTED LATE THURSDAY WITH PRECIPITATION
BECOME MORE SCATTERED AND SHOWERY IN NATURE. PRECIPITATION WILL
CHANGE OVER TO SNOW OVERNIGHT BEFORE IT TAPERS OFF EARLY FRIDAY.
TEMPERATURES COOL OFF THROUGH SATURDAY AS SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS BACK
INTO THE REGION. ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST ON
SUNDAY. CLOUD COVER WILL INCREASE WHILE TEMPERATURES WARM BACK UP.
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION INCREASES FOR SUNDAY EVENING WITH RAIN
TAPER OFF AS SNOW BEFORE ENDING MONDAY. AVAILABLE MOISTURE WITH
THIS SYSTEM REMAINS LIMITED AT THIS TIME.

&&

1053 AM EST MON DEC 30 2013

.DISCUSSION...
THE FORECAST AREA IS IN THE WAKE OF A COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH
EARLY THIS MORNING. AS SUCH...UNDER CLOUDY SKIES TEMPERATURES WILL
BE NEARLY STEADY FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY...PERHAPS ONLY RISING
A COUPLE MORE DEGREES BEFORE SUNSET. HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO
THE REGION THE REST OF THE DAY AND INTO TONIGHT. UPDATED THE
FORECAST TO REFLECT THE NEAR STEADY TEMPERATURES AND A FEW OTHER
MINOR EDITS. LATEST ZONE FORECAST HAS BEEN SENT.

846 
FXUS64 KMRX 300807
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EST MON DEC 30 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WITH TEMPS IN THE MID 
30S TO LOWER 40S OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS 
COLD FRONT WILL PRODUCE AREAS OF DRIZZLE OVER MAINLY SOUTHWEST VA 
AND NORTHEAST TN...SO WILL MENTION AREAS OF DRIZZLE THIS MORNING IN 
THESE AREAS. WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO FALL BELOW FREEZING OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET...THINK THAT FREEZING DRIZZLE WILL 
BE POSSIBLE SINCE MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE TEMPS AROUND -5 CELSIUS 
IN THE PRECIP GENERATION REGION (WHICH COULD RESULT IN SUPERCOOLED 
WATER INSTEAD OF SNOW). FOR NOW...WILL MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF A 
LIGHT ICE GLAZE OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER 
OUTLOOK. MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES SHOULD LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY (AND ONLY SLOWLY DIMINISH TONIGHT)...AS A BROAD 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE COOL/DRY CONDITIONS WILL 
CONTINUE ON NEW YEARS EVE WITH A WNW FLOW IN PLACE ACROSS THE 
REGION. WINDS WILL THEN SHIFT BACK TO THE SOUTH AS SOME SLIGHTLY 
WARMER AIR MOVES IN ON NEW YEARS DAY...RETURNING HIGHS TO THE LOWER 
50S TO COMPLIMENT THE MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS. A BROAD UPPER-TROUGH 
WILL THEN MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY...WHICH WILL 
BRING ANOTHER SHOT OF COOLER AIR INTO THE REGION. HOWEVER...THE 
AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE SOMEWHAT LIMITED ATTM... 
THOUGH THE ECMWF CONTINUES TO HINT AT THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER QPF AMOUNTS. FOR NOW...HAVE CONTINUED TO TREND WITH 
THE GFS/CMC AND EARLY RUNS OF THE NAM...WHICH INDICATE FAIRLY LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION/QPF DUE TO A LIMITED AMOUNT OF MOISTURE. HAVE 
MAINTAINED THE SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW-END CHANCE POPS IN THE 20 TO 30 
PERCENT FOR NOW DURING THIS TIME PERIOD...WITH THE HIGHER VALUES 
FAVORING THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND FAR NORTHEAST ZONES. DRIER AIR WILL 
MOVE IN FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...BEFORE THE NEXT STORM 
SYSTEM APPROACHES FROM THE WEST ON SUNDAY AND GIVES THE REGION ITS 
BEST SHOT AT MEANINGFUL PRECIPITATION TO START OFF THE FIRST FULL 
WORK WEEK OF 2014.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   46  30  48  30  52 /  10  10   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     45  29  44  29  51 /  10  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             45  28  45  29  49 /  10  10   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    42  26  41  26  48 /  10  10   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

944 PM EST SUN DEC 29 2013

.DISCUSSION...RAIN HAS ENDED OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING
WITH SOME PARTIAL CLEARING. A COLD FRONT WAS APPROACHING THE
PLATEAU. TEMPERATURES HAVE DROPPED INTO THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S
ACROSS THE REGION. FOR THE REST OF THE NIGHT A WEAK SHORTWAVE OVER
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MOVING INTO THE MS VALLEY AND WESTERN TN VALLEY
AT THIS TIME WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT AND
MONDAY. THICKENING CLOUDS ARE MOVING TOWARDS THE REGION NOW AND
SHOULD BECOME SOLID IN A FEW HOURS. TOOK OUT MOST OF THE RAIN
EXCEPT FOR THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA. LATER TONIGHT A LITTLE LIGHT RAIN AND OR SNOW WILL MOVE
BACK IN. FREEZING LEVELS DROP TO AROUND 4000 FEET AFTER MIDNIGHT 
AND THEN AROUND 2000 FEET LATE TONIGHT. SOME SNOW IS POSSIBLE LATE
TONIGHT BUT MAINLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS. LOWERED HOURLY TEMPERATURES
AND DEW POINTS TO MATCH CURRENT TEMPERATURES WHICH WERE LOWER DUE
TO THE CLEARING THE LAST FEW HOURS...BUT CURRENT LOWS LOOK GOOD.
UPDATED FORECAST OUT SOON.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EST SUN DEC 29 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...RAIN WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE
NORTH OF THE AREA AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM PROGRESSES UP THE EAST
COAST. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO CLEAR BEHIND THIS SYSTEM THROUGH THE
EVENING. A WEEK COLD FRONT WILL THEN MOVE DOWN THROUGH THE AREA
OVERNIGHT SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. EACH MODEL RUN INTRODUCES MORE DRY
AIR INTO THE ATMOSPHERE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FRONT. HAVE LOWERED
POPS FOR THE AREA...WITH FREEZING DRIZZLE AND LIGHT SNOW AMOUNTS
POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS EARLY MONDAY MORNING. BEHIND THIS
FRONT...HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO MOVE INTO THE AREA FOR MONDAY
EVENING AND TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW
NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER FLOW FLATTENS
OUT FOR A BRIEF PERIOD TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY BUT NEXT
FEATURE AMPLIFIES INTO THE CENTRAL U.S. BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT.
ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW PRESSURE OVER THE MID SOUTH WILL DRAG A COLD
FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY. TRAILING MOISTURE
BEHIND THE DEPARTING PRESSURE SYSTEM MAY LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF
SOME SNOW SHOWERS IN THE COLD AIR ADVECTION PATTERN THURSDAY NIGHT.
THE FORECAST STILL LOOKS NICE AND DRY IN THE FIRST HALF OF THE
WEEKEND. NEXT MOVES INTO POSITION ACROSS THE CENTRAL STATES
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. MOISTURE ADVANCING NORTH AHEAD OF THE
SYSTEM COLD FRONT SHOULD LEAD TO THE FORMATION OF RAIN SHOWERS
AGAIN ON SUNDAY WITH ANOTHER CHANCE FOR A COUPLE SNOW SHOWERS
FOLLOWING IN THE COLDER AIR BEHIND THE FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT. STAYED A
LITTLE BELOW 12Z MEX MOS GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH THE LONG TERM
PERIOD.

460 
FXUS64 KMRX 291036
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED SHORT TERM DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
535 AM EST SUN DEC 29 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE FL PANHANDLE...WITH AN 
INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH EXTENDING NORTH OF IT AND INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH MOST OF THE HEAVIER RAINFALL NOW 
LOCATED NORTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS LOW IS PROGGED TO 
QUICKLY MOVE NORTHEASTWARD UP THE EASTERN SEABOARD TODAY...WITH RAIN 
GRADUALLY DIMINISHING OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS EVENING AS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH. MODELS INDICATE SOME VERY LIGHT 
PRECIP AMOUNTS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TONIGHT...BUT SOUNDINGS 
REVEAL ONLY SHALLOW LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN MOSTLY 
AREAS OF DRIZZLE. WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO FALL BELOW FREEZING OVER 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN LATE 
TONIGHT...IT APPEARS THAT FREEZING DRIZZLE WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THESE 
AREAS AFTER MIDNIGHT. FOR NOW...WILL MENTION THIS THREAT IN THE 
HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...ANOTHER PASSING WEAK 
SHORTWAVE WILL SKIRT THE REGION ON MONDAY AND BRING ANOTHER SHOT OF 
COLDER AIR INTO THE AREA...AND THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME NORTHWEST FLOW 
SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS OF NORTHEAST AND EAST TENNESSEE. WITH 
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 30S IN THE VALLEYS AROUND DAYBREAK...SOME 
LIGHT SNOW COULD BRIEFLY MIX IN WITH SOME LIGHT RAIN. WITH 
TEMPERATURES REACHING THE UPPER 30S AND LOWER 40S IN MOST SPOTS 
LATER IN THE DAY...ANY FROZEN PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE OVER TO 
LIQUID BY MID-MORNING OR SO...EXCEPT ALONG THE PEAKS OF THE SMOKIES. 
ANY SNOWFALL THAT DOES OCCUR IS NOT EXPECTED TO PRODUCE ANY 
MEANINGFUL ACCUMULATIONS. HOWEVER...SOME MINOR AMOUNTS ALONG THE 
PEAKS OF THE MOUNTAINS AND THE PLATEAU WILL CERTAINLY BE POSSIBLE 
THROUGH MONDAY EVENING.  

THE COOLER...BUT DRIER CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE ON NEW YEARS EVE... 
BEFORE WINDS VEER TO THE SOUTH AND SOME SLIGHTLY WARMER AIR MOVES IN 
ON NEW YEARS DAY TO COMPLIMENT THE MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS. HEADING 
INTO THURSDAY...MODELS SHOW A BROAD UPPER-TROUGH SWINGING THROUGH 
THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS TO CLOSE OUT THE WORK WEEK. THE GFS 
HAS COME IN LINE WITH THE ECMWF REGARDING THE TRACK AND INTENSITY OF 
THE SYSTEM...BUT THE PRECIPITATION FORECAST REMAINS UNCERTAIN GIVEN 
THE DIFFERENCES ON THE AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE IN PLACE. THE 
GFS BRINGS SOME LIGHT QPF THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING...WHILE 
THE ECMWF INDICATES A BROAD AREA OF HEAVIER PRECIPITATION MOVING IN 
THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY. GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS NEXT SYSTEM 
AND THE MODEL FLUCTUATION...HAVE BEEN CAUTIOUS WITH POPS. HAVE 20 TO 
30 PERCENT FOR NOW DURING THIS TIME PERIOD...WITH THE HIGHER VALUES 
FAVORING THE NORTHEAST ZONES. DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN FOR SATURDAY... 
MAKING FOR A PLEASANT FIRST WEEKEND OF 2014. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   51  36  43  26  46 /  60  20  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     50  36  41  23  43 /  70  20  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             50  35  40  24  44 /  70  20  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    50  35  39  22  41 /  80  20  30  10  10

OVERNIGHT AND BE MOSTLY EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY MORNING. HEAVY

TN THEN SHIFTING INTO NE TN SUNDAY MORNING. LATEST MODEL RUNS SHOWS

693 
FXUS64 KMRX 282014
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EST SAT DEC 28 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...RAIN SHIELD CONTINUES TO 
SLOWLY ADVANCE NE INTO SE TN AND SW NC THIS AFTERNOON...WITH LIGHT 
RAIN NOW FALLING AT CHATTANOOGA. TEMPS HAVE BEEN SHUNTED DOWNWARD 
DUE TO THE EVAPORATIVE COOLING AND THICKENING CLOUD COVER. THE AREA 
OF RAIN/SHOWERS SHOULD SPREAD INTO EVEN NE TN AND SW VA BEFORE 
29/00Z...SO KEPT POPS RELATIVELY UNCHANGED FROM NEAR 100 PERCENT. 
THINK THERE WILL BE TWO ENHANCED AREAS OF LIFT AND QPF...1) NRN 
PLATEAU COUNTIES AND 2) SW NC PLUS MTNS ALONG TN-NC LINE. ADDED 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS TO THOSE AREAS...WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW OCCURS IN 
THE 06Z TO 12Z PERIOD SUNDAY.  

THE RAIN WILL CLEARLY EXTEND WELL WESTWARD ACROSS OUR ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND JUST INTO SUNDAY MORNING...THEN EXPECT 
THE DRY SLOT TO WORK ACROSS SE TN AREAS AS THE LOW LIFTS NE OUT OF 
THE REGION BY NOON SUNDAY. PRECIPITATION SHOULD DIMINISH IN THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...THEN A CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW SHOWERS SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO AT LEAST MONDAY MORNING. THE NAM MODEL IS LIKELY TOO 
ROBUST WITH PRECIPITATION ON MONDAY...AND WAS AN OUTLIER COMPARED TO 
ANY OTHER MODEL SOLUTION. THUS...I TONED DOWN THE NAM MOS POPS TO 
MORE OF A BLEND WITH THE DRY GFS MODEL. CARRYING 30 TO 40 PERCENT 
POPS FOR FAVORED HIGH TERRAIN AREAS ON MONDAY MORNING...WITH SOME 
VERY LIGHT SNOW ACCUMS ALLOWED IN THOSE SECTIONS SUCH AS WISE COUNTY 
VA. MIDNIGHT SHIFT CAN LOOK OVER ANOTHER MODEL RUN AND SEE IF ANY 
OTHER MODEL TRENDS TOWARD THE WETTER NAM.

OTHERWISE...MOS MINS VERY CLOSE AND FOLLOWED FOR BOTH NIGHTS. THE
MOS MAX TEMPS LOOK TOO WARM EACH DAY...ESPECIALLY ON MONDAY...SO I
UNDERCUT THE COOLER MAXES. UPDATED THE FLOOD STATEMENT PRODUCT THAT
WAS ISSUED YESTERDAY...PLUS AN UPDATE TO THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER
PRODUCT.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE TAIL END OF 
TRAILING SHORT WAVE COULD BRING A COUPLE SNOW SHOWERS TO THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER FOR A BRIEF TIME MONDAY 
NIGHT BUT COLD HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE 
WORK WEEK SHUTTING DOWN ANY CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION MONDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...MODELS COMING INTO A LITTLE BETTER AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ARRIVAL OF ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH ON THURSDAY. THE SYSTEM'S 
SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS WELL SOUTH ACROSS THE GULF OF MEXICO AND SHIFTS 
NORTHEAST OFF THE SOUTHEAST ATLANTIC COAST BY FRIDAY MORNING. ENOUGH 
MOISTURE AND SUFFICIENTLY COLD AIR FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A PERIOD 
OF SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA...MAINLY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY 
MORNING BEFORE DRIER AIR SPILLS BACK INTO THE REGION. THE REMAINDER 
OF THE FORECAST PERIOD FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT 
COULD BE DRY AND SEASONABLY COLD.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             38  51  34  42  24 / 100  70  20  20   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  38  48  33  40  21 / 100  80  20  20   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  50  33  39  22 / 100  80  20  20   0

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1252 PM EST SAT DEC 28 2013

.AVIATION...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING EAST NORTHEAST FROM
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BRINGING A
LARGE SHIELD OF LIGHT TO OCCASIONALLY MODERATE RAIN TO THE REGION
THROUGH THE PERIOD. RAIN IS INCHING NORTH TOWARD CHA AND SHOULD
BEGIN SHORTLY HERE ALTHOUGH CEILINGS MAY TAKE A WHILE TO DROP TO
MVFR AS DRY AIR NEEDS TO BE MOISTENED. THE RAIN WILL TAKE EVEN
LONGER TO EFFECTIVELY LOWER CEILINGS AND VISIBILITY FARTHER NORTH
ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY AT TYS AND TRI WITH THE ADDED BENEFIT OF
SHADOWING COMPLIMENTS OF STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW ACROSS THE
HIGH TERRAIN. EVENTUALLY MVFR CONDITIONS WILL DETERIORATE TO IFR
AND POSSIBLY EVEN LIFR FOR A PERIOD LATER TONIGHT. THE SYSTEM WILL
BE MAKING ITS WAY EAST THROUGH THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD DURING THE DAY
SUNDAY GRADUALLY BRINGING AN END TO THE RAIN WITH IMPROVING
VISIBILITY. HOWEVER...MVFR CEILINGS MAY HANG ON THROUGH THE END OF
THE FORECAST PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 281659 AAA

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1159 AM EST SAT DEC 28 2013

.DISCUSSION...OPTED TO LOWER MAX TEMPS AND SLIGHTLY INCREASE POPS
FOR THIS AFTERNOON...BASED ON LATEST SURFACE OBSERVATIONS AND RADAR
TRENDS. THE CLOUDS HAVE THICKENED ENOUGH ALREADY TO INHIBIT MAX
TEMPS...WHILE SOME EVAPORATIONAL COOLING STILL WILL OCCUR INITIALLY
PRIOR TO LIGHT RAIN REACHING THE SURFACE. 

ALSO...ADDED LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE TONIGHT ACROSS NRN
PLATEAU AND MTNS ALONG NC-TN LINE.

857 
FXUS64 KMRX 280825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST SAT DEC 28 2013

.SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT
AN UPPER LOW WAS SPINNING OVER SOUTHEAST TEXAS EARLY THIS MORNING.
MID AND HIGH CLOUDS WILL STREAM NORTHWARD ACROSS MS...AL AND TN
THROUGH THE DAY. THE SURFACE HIGH THAT BROUGHT A SPECTACULAR DAY TO
THE REGION YESTERDAY WILL TRANSLATE OFF THE COAST OF NC TODAY.
CLOUDS WILL THICKEN AND LOWER THROUGHOUT THE DAY. TEMPERATURES
TODAY SHOULD BE MILD UNDER THOSE CLOUDIER SKIES. 

FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A VERY DRY LAYER OF AIR BELOW 700 MB
THROUGH AT LEAST NOON FOR SOUTHERN AREAS. THE LOWER LEVELS DO
MOISTEN UP BY LATE AFTERNOON SO HAVE STARTED TO SHOW SLIGHT CHANCE
CATEGORY FOR RAIN STARTING BY NOON AND INCREASING TO CHANCE BY THE
AFTERNOON. THE RAIN THAT DOES FALL WILL BE LIGHT AT FIRST AND
BECOME LOCALLY HEAVY TONIGHT. THE FORECAST SOUNDINGS ARE SUPPORTED BY
THE ISENTROPIC SURFACES. NOTED THE 06Z RUN OF THE NAM IS ABOUT 6
HOURS FASTER SATURATING THE 305K AND 300K SURFACES. NO DOUBT ALL
AREAS WILL RECEIVE MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION TONIGHT AND THERE MAY
BE SOME POCKETS OF HEAVIER RAINFALL WILL OCCUR. 

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY
A BROAD AREA OF MODERATE TO PERHAPS LOCALLY HEAVY SHOWERS WILL
CONTINUE TO QUICKLY MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE REGION SUNDAY
MORNING...BEFORE TAPERING OFF BY MIDDAY INTO THE AFTERNOON FROM
WEST TO EAST. THE LATEST RUN OF THE NAM IN PARTICULAR...ALONG THE
OTHER MODELS HAVE CONTINUED TO TREND FASTER...AND SHOW MOST
MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION CLEARING THE FORECAST AREA BY 21-00Z
SUNDAY OR SO. AS A RESULT...HAVE SCALED BY QPF AND POPS SLIGHTLY TO
INDICATE THIS TREND...WHICH ALSO WILL SIGNIFICANTLY DIMINISH ANY
LOCALIZED FLOODING POTENTIAL. BEHIND THE INITIAL TROUGH PASSAGE ON
SUNDAY...AN ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY WILL
BEING THE REGION ANOTHER SHOT OF COLDER AIR AND THE POTENTIAL FOR
SOME NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE CUMBERLAND
MOUNTAINS...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS OF NORTHEAST
AND EAST TENNESSEE. THE NAM IS SHOWING SOME MORE WIDESPREAD LIGHT
QPF SIGNALS LINGERING ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA DURING THE DAY ON
MONDAY AS WELL...WHICH COULD ALLOW FOR A BRIEF RAIN/SNOW MIX TO BE
OBSERVED IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS AS WELL.
HOWEVER...THIS SNOWFALL IS NOT EXPECTED TO PRODUCE MUCH...IF ANY IN
THE WAY OF ACCUMULATION...OTHER THAN SOME MINOR AMOUNTS ALONG THE
PEAKS OF THE MOUNTAINS AND THE PLATEAU.

A COOL/DRY AIR MASS WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER NEW YEARS EVE AND THE 
FIRST DAY OF THE NEW YEAR. THEREAFTER...MODELS SHOW A BROAD 
UPPER-TROUGH SWING THROUGH THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS THURSDAY 
INTO FRIDAY. HOWEVER...THE AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE CONTINUES TO 
BE IN QUESTION AS THE GFS DOES NOT SHOW ANY PRECIPITATION WITH THIS 
NEXT SYSTEM...WHILE THE ECMWF INDICATES SOME A BROAD AREA OF LIGHT 
SHOWERS MOVING IN THURSDAY NIGHT. GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS 
NEXT SYSTEM AND THE MODEL FLUCTUATION...HAVE INCREASED CLOUD 
COVER...BUT HAVE KEPT POPS BELOW MENTIONABLE LEVELS FOR NOW.

FXUS64 KMRX 272016
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EST FRI DEC 27 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...CIRRUS CLOUDS STILL WELL TO 
OUR SOUTH THIS AFTERNOON...FROM THE LOWER MS VALLEY EAST ACROSS THE 
GULF COAST STATES. SURFACE RIDGE HOLDS GENERALLY IN PLACE OVERNIGHT 
WITH A DRY AIRMASS...SO MIN TEMPS WILL ONLY BE AFFECTED BY HOW THICK 
THE CIRRUS CLOUDS GET OVERNIGHT. A BLEND OF THE SIMILAR MOS MINS 
LOOKED GOOD AND CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS/NWS NEIGHBORS.

CLOUDS INCREASE ON SATURDAY BUT NOT EXPECTING ANY RAIN BEFORE 29/00Z
EXCEPT ACROSS THE SRN TIER OF THE FORECAST AREA...WHERE POPS WERE 
KEPT IN THE 20 TO 30 PERCENT RANGE. MOS MAX TEMPS CLOSE AND 
REASONABLE...SINCE THE CLOUDS ONLY LOWER TO A MID DECK IN THE 
AFTERNOON. 

SHOWERS INCREASE QUICKLY SATURDAY NIGHT AND I NUDGED POPS UP TO 100 
PERCENT FOR ALL AREAS. THE LIFT IS ENHANCED BY A BRIEF PERIOD OF 
UPSLOPE FLOW INTO WRN NC...ESPECIALLY FROM 29/06Z TO 29/12Z. ADDED A 
MENTION OF HEAVY RAINS FOR SW NC COUNTIES AND OUR ADJACENT MTN 
COUNTIES ALONG NC-TN LINE. QPF UP TO 2 INCHES POSSIBLE IN THOSE 
AREAS WITH A RIVER STATEMENT AND AN UPDATE TO THE HWO PRODUCT 
EARLIER.

SHOWERS TAPER OFF FROM THE WEST SUNDAY MORNING...BUT A CONSENSUS OF 
MODEL SOLUTIONS DOES EXTEND THE RAIN SHIELD WELL WEST INTO THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AREA AT THE START OF THE DAY. BUMPED POPS UP TO 
LIKELY SUNDAY MORNING IN THE WEST AND STILL CATEGORICAL IN THE EAST. 
WESTERLY FLOW AS THE LOW PRESSURE EXITS TO THE EAST...AND COLD AIR 
ADVECTION IS NOT THAT STRONG. THUS...EASED MAX TEMPS UP A FEW 
DEGREES IN LINE WITH THE LATEST NAM/GFS MOS. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...STAYED CLOSER TO THE 
ECMWF THROUGH THE FORECAST WHICH FEATURES SOME TRAILING SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY AND SUFFICIENT MOISTURE FOR A CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN 
TRANSITIONING TO LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS MUCH OF THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT. 
BY MONDAY MOST OF THIS PRECIPITATION WILL HAVE ENDED. HOWEVER...SOME 
SNOW SHOWERS MAY CONTINUE THROUGH THE DAY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER. DRY AND COLD AIR STREAMS ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH 
TUESDAY. ANOTHER CLIPPER BUILDS ACROSS MAINLY THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH JUST 
ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME RAIN SHOWERS ON THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU TERRAIN DURING THE DAY WITH SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS 
POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT ACROSS HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND ACROSS THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS OF FAR EAST TENNESSEE. 
THE WORK WEEK FINISHES OUT WITH MORE DRY AND COLD ADVECTION. WENT 
A LITTLE CLOSER TO...IF NOT A COUPLE DEGREES BELOW THE ECM TEMPS 
THROUGH THE PERIOD.

INTO THE MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON SATURDAY. AHEAD OF THIS
SYSTEM...SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL ADVECT WARMER AIR...ALONG WITH
SOME GULF MOISTURE INTO THE REGION. THIS WILL SET THE STAGE FOR
SOME WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME BRIEF PERIODS OF
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THE SYSTEM IS
MOVING AT A PRETTY GOOD CLIP...SO UNLIKE THE PREVIOUS STORM SYSTEM
LAST SUNDAY/MONDAY...FLOODING WILL NOT BE A BIG CONCERN.
HOWEVER...BEHIND THE INITIAL TROUGH PASSAGE ON SUNDAY...AN
ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY WILL BEING THE REGION
ANOTHER SHOT OF COLDER AIR AND THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME NORTHWEST
FLOW SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS...SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS OF NORTHEAST AND EAST TENNESSEE.
HOWEVER...THIS SNOWFALL IS NOT EXPECTED TO PRODUCE MUCH...IF ANY IN
THE WAY OF ACCUMULATION...OTHER THAN SOME MINOR AMOUNTS ALONG THE
PEAKS OF THE MOUNTAINS. THEREAFTER...A COOL/DRY AIR MASS WILL
DOMINATE THE WEATHER NEW YEARS EVE AND THE FIRST DAY OF THE NEW
YEAR...BEFORE ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM BRINGS THE NEXT OPPORTUNITY FOR
PRECIPITATION ON THURSDAY.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES
MADE IN FORECAST GRIDS THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH A DRY AIRMASS
IN PLACE AS A LARGE SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE HOLDS ACROSS THE
SE STATES AND MID ATLANTIC REGION. A ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AMPLIFIES BY
SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE DEVELOPING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE SRN PLAINS.
SEASONABLY COOL NIGHTS WITH A GRADUAL WARMING OF MAX TEMPS EACH
DAY. MOS TEMPS WERE QUITE CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED.

NAM MODEL TRENDING WETTER BY 00Z TO 06Z SUNDAY...STILL A BIT SLOWER 
IN BRINGING THE RAIN NORTHWARD THAN OTHER MODEL SOLUTIONS SATURDAY 
NIGHT. BULK OF RAIN SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL 06Z TO 12Z SUNDAY...BUT I 
DID NUDGE LOW POPS INTO SMOKIES AND CENTRAL E TN VERY LATE SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON. CLOUDS DON'T RACE NE...SO ALLOWED FOR MAX TEMPS TO WARM 
CLOSE TO LATEST MOS ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN ON SATURDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS NOT TOO 
DISSIMILAR THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD BUT DIVERGE ABOUT MID WEEK. 
SATURDAY NIGHT A RELATIVELY STRONG SHORT WAVE DRIVES NORTHEAST 
ACROSS THE MID ATLANTIC STATES WITH DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT OVER 
THIS REGION. HOWEVER...PRECIPITATION SHIELD LARGE ENOUGH FOR SOME 
HIGH POPS FOR SHOWERS SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. COLDER 
AIR SPILLS INTO THE REGION ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS SYSTEM WITH 
ANOTHER MODIFIED ARCTIC BOUNDARY DROPPING INTO THE DEEP SOUTH. THIS 
SHOULD CAUSE A CHANGE OVER TO SNOW SHOWERS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA 
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. PRECIP WILL BE ENDING DURING THE MORNING 
HOURS MONDAY MOST OF THE AREA WITH EXCEPTION OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 
THE COLD...DRY AIRMASS BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHEAST KEEPING THREAT OF 
PRECIPITATION OUT OF THE FORECAST UNTIL THURSDAY WHEN RETURNING 
MOISTURE AHEAD OF ANOTHER FRONTAL SYSTEM BRINGS A CHANCE OF RAIN AND 
THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SNOW IN THE COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND THE 
FRONT THURSDAY NIGHT. TRENDED A FEW DEGREES BELOW MEX MOS GUIDANCE 
THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM.

THIS MORNING OR AFTERNOON BECOMING MOSTLY SUNNY FOR THE REST OF THE
DAY WITH WINDS BECOMING NORTH TO NORTHWEST REINFORCING COLD AIR
MASS OVER THE REGION. LOWS TONIGHT SHOULD BE LOWER TO MID 20S AGAIN
TONIGHT. MAV GUIDANCE FOR TODAYS HIGHS AND TONIGHTS LOW
TEMPERATURES LOOKS GOOD SO WENT CLOSE FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY 
WEAKENS AND SHIFTS EAST THROUGH SATURDAY WITH TEMPERATURES WARMING.
SHORT WAVE APPROACHING FROM THE SW BECOMING MORE IMPRESSIVE WITH 
EACH MODEL RUN. DEVELOPING SW-NE JET EAST OF SHORT WAVE INCREASES IN 
STRENGTH AS IT MOVES INTO SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SATURDAY NIGHT. GOOD 
FRONTOGENESIS DEPICTED AT H70 SAT NGT AND EARLY SUNDAY. GFS 
CONTINUES TO BE MOST AGGRESSIVE WHILE ECMWF AND CMC COMING MORE IN 
LINE WITH GENERAL PATTERN AS SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS OVER SE GA BY SUN 
MORNING. GOOD WARM CONVEYOR BELT EXTENDS BACK INTO E TN VALLEY. 
SYSTEM CONTINUES TO DEEPEN AND MOVE NE THROUGH THE MID ATLANTIC ON 
SUNDAY. DRIER AIR MASS WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA BEHIND DEPARTING 
SYSTEM WITH PCPN TAPERING OFF ON SUN AFTN. LONG WAVE TROUGH 
APPROACHES FROM THE WEST PUSHING COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA ON 
MONDAY. MOISTURE LIMITED WITH FRONT BUT SCATTERED SNOW AND RAIN 
SHOWERS WILL MOVE THROUGH WITH FRONT WITH CONTINUING SNOW SHOWERS IN 
SW VA AND THE TN MOUNTAINS BEHIND FRONT MON NIGHT. NW FLOW PATTERN 
AND COOL TEMPERATURES INTO THE MID WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST WED DEC 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...A QUIET REST OF THE AFTERNOON
AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE HAS MOVED OFF TO OUR EAST AND LIGHT
SOUTHERLY WINDS HAVE DEVELOPED. NOT QUITE AS COLD TONIGHT WITH LOWS
5 TO 8 DEGREES WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT...BUT STILL ROUGHLY 5 DEGREES
BELOW NORMAL AREA WIDE. A QUICK MOVING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH TO OUR
NORTH WILL PASS THROUGH LATE TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY TOMORROW
MORNING. DUE TO LIMITED MOISTURE...IMPACTS WILL BE MINIMAL OTHER
THAN A BRIEF PERIOD OF CLOUDS. CLOUDS WILL MAINLY BE FROM KNOXVILLE
NORTH AND GREATER IN COVERAGE UP TOWARDS NETN AND SWVA WHERE THESE
AREAS MAY SEE PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY CLOUDY CONDITIONS AS THE
TROUGH PASSES THROUGH. SKIES SHOULD QUICKLY BEGIN TO CLEAR AS THE
TROUGH MOVES FURTHER TO OUR EAST LATER TOMORROW MORNING WITH MOSTLY
SUNNY SKIES EXPECTED TOMORROW. TEMPERATURES WILL BE FEW DEGREES WARMER
TOMORROW FOR AREAS SOUTH OF KNOXVILLE. THE UPPER TROUGH WILL KEEP
TOMORROWS TEMPS SIMILAR TO TODAY'S FOR AREAS NORTH OF KNOXVILLE,
ESPECIALLY FOR SWVA AND EXTREME NETN. OVERALL...A RELATIVELY QUIET
SHORT TERM WITH PLEASANT CONDITIONS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT TROUGH WEDNESDAY)...STARTS OFF FAIR AND
MILD. BUT THE MODELS ARE CAREENING TOWARD A WET WEEKEND...ONCE
AGAIN. MOSTLY SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MIDDAY SUNDAY. 12Z RUN OF
ECMWF HAS COME TOWARD THE GFS SOLUTION. IN THE GRIDS I HAVE NOT
JUMPED FULLY ONTO THIS YET...GIVEN THE CHANGING SOLUTIONS OF LATE.
GOING MOSTLY WITH CHANCE POPS /30-50%/ BUT GIVEN THE INCREASING
AGREEMENT OF MODELS TOWARD THE WET SOLUTION /INCLUDING THE
CANADIAN/...EXPECT FUTURE FORECAST PACKAGES TO FACE GOING EVEN
HIGHER WITH THE POPS. THE 06Z DGEX RUN IS A DRY OUTLIER...HENCE MY
HESITATION TO JUMP IN WITH BOTH FEET. TEMPERATURES SHOULD MAKE THIS
MOSTLY A RAIN EVENT. FOLLOWING THE EVENT THIS WEEKEND...ANOTHER BIT
OF A CHANCE OF PRECIP WILL FOLLOW WITH A FROPA LATE SUNDAY NIGHT
INTO MONDAY. COLDER TEMPS MONDAY MORNING MAY ALLOW FOR SNOW
FLAKES...BUT THIS SYSTEM WILL BE SOMEWHAT MOISTURE STARVED WITH NO
NOTABLE ACCUMULATIONS.

456 
FXUS64 KMRX 241953
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST TUE DEC 24 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND CHRISTMAS DAY/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH THAT HAS CONTROLLED THE WEATHER OVER THE
REGION FOR THE PAST SEVERAL DAY HAS FINALLY LIFTED OFF TO THE
NORTHEAST BY THIS AFTERNOON. IN ITS WAKE...THE LOW STRATUS THAT WAS
ENTRENCHED OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING HAS DISSIPATED AND ANY
LINGERING LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN WILL SUBSIDE
BY THE EARLY EVENING. WITH CLEARING CONDITIONS ACROSS THE
VALLEYS...GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING WILL TAKE PLACE AFTER SUNSET AS
TEMPERATURES WILL QUICKLY PLUMMET INTO THE TEENS AND 20S. IN
FACT...LOW TO MID TEENS WILL BE COMMON ACROSS THE NORTHEAST ZONES
BY DAYBREAK CHRISTMAS MORNING...WITH UPPER TEENS TO LOWER 20S
EXPECTED OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS. WINDS WILL QUICKLY
SHIFT TO THE SOUTHWEST AS A RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS ON CHRISTMAS DAY. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A WARM UP INTO
THE 40S BY THE AFTERNOON...ALONG WITH A SUNNY AND PLEASANT DAY.

.LONG TERM /CHRISTMAS NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
GRADUAL WARMING WILL TAKE PLACE AFTER LOW TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S
THURSDAY MORNING. WE WILL SEE ANOTHER FRONT MOVE THROUGH THE REGION
LATER ON THURSDAY WITH NO CHANGE TO TEMPERATURES HOWEVER WINDS WILL
SHIFT. IT WILL REMAIN PRECIPITATION FREE THROUGH SUNDAY. BY SUNDAY
NIGHT A COLD FRONT WILL MAKE ITS WAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THE
FAST NORTHWEST FLOW MAY BE ABLE TO SQUEEZE OUT SOME LIGHT RAIN OR
SNOW SUNDAY NIGHT PARTICULARLY IN THE OROGRAPHIC FAVORED AREAS. A
STRONGER SHORTWAVE WILL TRANSLATE ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY AND MONDAY
NIGHT WHICH MAY ALLOW FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF LIGHT SNOW. THE
MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED SO CONFIDENCE IS RATHER LOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...
THE BASE OF AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES IS PUSHING
THROUGH THE REGION LATE THIS MORNING...AND BRINGING WITH IT ANOTHER
REINFORCING SHOT OF CANADIAN AIR...ALONG WITH SOME LOW STRATUS AND
SOME LIGHT ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS TO PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN
PLATEAU...CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE GREAT
SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND THEIR FOOTHILLS. HOWEVER...OTHER THAN MAKING
THE DAY A LITTLE MORE FESTIVE FOR CHRISTMAS EVE...NO ACCUMULATIONS ARE
EXPECTED IN THE VALLEYS AND ONLY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED
ABOVE 2500 TO 3000 FEET OR SO. THE PRECIPITATION WILL TAPER OFF
THIS AFTERNOON AS THE ENERGY FROM THIS LONGWAVE TROUGH SCOOTS EAST
BY MID-AFTERNOON. IN ITS WAKE...DRIER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER
INTO THE REGION...AND HELP TO BREAK UP THE BKN/OVC LOW CLOUD DECK
THAT IS CURRENTLY STRADDLING MOST OF THE MRX CWA. HAVE INCREASED
CLOUD COVER THIS MORNING AND THROUGH THE EARLY AFTERNOON...BEFORE
FINALLY CLEARING THE ENTIRE AREA LATE IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING.
OTHERWISE...THE REST OF THE FORECAST IS ON TRACK.

FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WARM ABOVE NORMAL FRIDAY AND

AND DRAGS A WEAK FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY EVENING. LIGHT
RAIN AND SNOW LATE SUNDAY NIGHT WILL BE BRIEF BEHIND FRONT THEN
MOVE OUT WITH HIGH PRESSURE ONCE RETURNING MONDAY.

IMPROVE DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. A FEW LIGHT SPRINKLES ARE 
POSSIBLE WITH THIS FEATURE. NORTHWEST WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE NE LATE IN 
THE PERIOD AND WEAKEN.

556 
FXUS64 KMRX 231935
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST MON DEC 23 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
CANADIAN AIR CONTINUES TO FILTER INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS
AFTERNOON...RESULTING IN TEMPERATURES GRADUALLY LOWERING
THROUGHOUT THE DAY. AS OF MID-AFTERNOON...TEMPERATURES HAVE DROPPED
FROM THE LOW TO MID 50S AT DAYBREAK INTO THE UPPER 30S AND LOWER
40S. THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS AS LOWS
TONIGHT WILL PLUMMET INTO THE UPPER TEENS/LOWER 20S LATER TONIGHT
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND THE MID TO UPPER 20S IN THE VALLEYS.
WHILE MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION HAS SHIFTED OFF TO THE EAST OF THE
FORECAST AREA...SOME LINGERING FREEZING DRIZZLE MAY BE POSSIBLE
ABOVE 3000 FT IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH SUNSET GIVEN THE
COLDER TEMPERATURES THERE. 

OTHERWISE...DRIER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE INTO THE REGION
ALOFT...AND EVENTUALLY HELP TO ERODE SOME OF THE CLOUD COVER THAT
HAS REMAINED ENTRENCHED OVER THE REGION TODAY. STILL THINK THAT
BKN/OVC LOW CLOUDS WILL LINGER THROUGH MUCH OF THE EVENING...BUT
SHOULD BEGIN TO BREAK UP SOMEWHAT BY DAYBREAK...AS MORE
SIGNIFICANT CLEARING OCCURS LATER IN THE MORNING. TEMPERATURES
TOMORROW WILL BE MUCH COOLER AND STRUGGLE TO CLIMB OUT OF THE UPPER
20S TO LOWER 30S IN MOST AREA DESPITE THE MOSTLY/PARTLY SUNNY
CONDITIONS GIVEN THE BRISK NORTHERLY FLOW. THE PASSAGE OF THE
UPPER-TROUGH MAY BRING A FEW NORTHWEST FLOW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS TO
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE. HOWEVER...NO MEANINGFUL ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED AS
THE PRECIPITATION WILL BE SCATTERED AND LIGHT. 


.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. 
UNDER CLEAR SKIES THE LOW TEMPERATURES CHRISTMAS MORNING WILL BE IN 
THE TEENS AND LOWER 20S ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA. IN GENERAL...THE 
AREA WILL REMAIN PRECIPITATION FREE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE 
WEEK. HIGH TEMPERATURES ON CHRISTMAS WILL ONLY REACH THE MID 30S 
NORTH TO LOWER 40S SOUTH. A GRADUAL AND SLOW WARM UP EACH DAY WILL 
OCCUR. BY FRIDAY A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL DIVE OUT OF THE MIDWEST BUT 
THE SURFACE HIGH OVER THE TEXAS/LOUISIANA GULF COAST WILL HINDER 
MOISTURE. ADDITIONALLY THE UPPER TROUGH MAY ACTUALLY BE FARTHER 
NORTH THAN THE POSITIONING OF THE 12Z GFS. THEREFORE LITTLE TO NO 
MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION WILL OCCUR WITH THIS SYSTEM. THE NEXT 
ARCTIC FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA SUNDAY. TIMING OF THIS 
COLDER AIR WILL SIGNIFICANTLY ALTER TEMPS FROM CURRENT FORECAST BUT 
WILL BE A GOOD TARGET OF OPPORTUNITY TO BEAT THE MODELS FOR THE NEXT 
SEVERAL FORECAST CYCLES. WILL KEEP AN EYE ON FUTURE RUNS TO ADJUST 
FORECAST AS NEEDED.


&&

.DISCUSSION...
SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO DRIFT EAST AND EXIT THE REGION
BY THE EARLY AFTERNOON AS DRY AIR MOVES IN ALOFT ON THE BACKSIDE OF
THIS STORM SYSTEM. IN ADDITION TO THE DRY AIR...SOME MUCH COOLER
CANADIAN AIR WILL CONTINUE TO INFILTRATE THE REGION FROM THE NORTH
AND WEST IN THE WAKE OF A SECONDARY COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING. AS A RESULT...TEMPERATURES WILL
ACTUALLY DROP THROUGHOUT THE DAY INTO THE 30S BY MIDDAY. ALSO...
SOME LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE MAY BE POSSIBLE ABOVE 3000 FT OR SO IN
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKIES AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS WELL
BY THE LATE MORNING. HOWEVER...ANY ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE MINOR
AND MOST AREAS IN THE VALLEY SHOULD ACTUALLY STAY DRY. THE OTHER
QUESTION FOR THE FORECAST WAS THE CLOUD COVER...WHICH APPEARS WILL
HANG ON FOR MOST OF THE DAY DESPITE SOME DRYING TAKING PLACE ALOFT.
HAS A RESULT...HAVE INCREASED THE WORDING IN THE GRIDS TO
PARTLY/MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR THE AFTERNOON...AS SOME DISSIPATION WILL
TAKE PLACE IN THE WESTERN ZONES BY THE LATE AFTERNOON...AND
EVENTUALLY THE EASTERN AREAS THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EST SUN DEC 22 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...MAIN BAND OF RAIN HAS BEEN 
EXITING TO THE EAST...BUT AS UPPER TROUGH DIGS TO OUR WEST EXPECT 
RAIN TO INCREASE AGAIN OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. DOES NOT APPEAR THIS 
SECOND ROUND OF PRECIP WILL BE HEAVY...BUT WILL CARRY CATEGORICAL 
POPS ALL BUT FAR WEST ZONES.  SURGE OF MUCH COLDER AIR WILL BEGIN 
MOVING VERY LATE TONIGHT INTO MONDAY.  TEMPS WILL BE NEARLY STEADY 
OR SLOWLY FALLING FOR MUCH OF THE AREA MONDAY.  SOME RAIN WILL BE 
LINGERING ESPECIALLY EASTERN ZONES INTO MONDAY BUT WILL BE EXITING 
EAST.  APPEARS MUCH OF THE PRECIP WILL MOVE OUT AHEAD OF THE COLDER 
AIR...BUT COULD SEE A BIT OF LIGHT SNOW OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS MONDAY BEFORE THE PRECIP ENDS.  HOWEVER...LITTLE OR NO 
ACCUMULATION EXPECTED.  GFS MOS TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE SHORT 
TERM PERIOD.  

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...BY MONDAY
EVENING...CANADIAN AIR WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER INTO THE REGION IN
WAKE OF THE STRONG COLD FRONT THAT WILL PUSH THROUGH. WITH
IT...COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA AND REMAIN IN
PLACE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR MUCH OF THE HOLIDAY WEEK
AHEAD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE MUCH COOLER ON MONDAY NIGHT AS LOWS
BOTTOM OUT IN THE TEENS AND 20S...AND HIGHS WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB
MUCH ABOVE THE LOW TO MID 30S ON CHRISTMAS EVE DAY DESPITE THE
AMPLE SUNSHINE. WINDS WILL THEN SHIFT BACK TO THE SOUTH AND WEST BY
CHRISTMAS DAY AS AN UPPER- RIDGE AXIS PASSES OVER THE
AREA...ALLOWING FOR A WARM UP OF AROUND 10-15 DEGREES AND AN
OVERALL BEAUTIFUL MOSTLY SUNNY DAY AS HIGHS WILL PEAK INTO THE 40S.

A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE WILL PASS THROUGH THE REGION ON 
THURSDAY...BUT BRING LITTLE MORE THAN A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUD 
COVER AS NO PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED GIVEN THE LACK OF AVAILABLE 
MOISTURE. THE PLEASANT WEATHER WILL CONTINUE ON FRIDAY AND INTO THE 
WEEKEND DESPITE ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH SWINGING THROUGH WITH HIGHS 
GENERALLY IN THE MID 40S TO AROUND 50 DEGREES EACH DAY. ANOTHER 
STRONGER UPPER-TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO ARRIVE BY MONDAY WHICH 
COULD GIVE THE REGION ITS NEXT BEST SHOT OF PRECIPITATION. 
.LONG TERM...(

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH THE REGION DURING THE SHORT TERM.  AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A

THE MAIN LINE OF CONVECTION IS WEAKENING WITH LIMITED CHANCE OF

JET MOVING THROUGH THE AREA...CREATING STRONG GUSTY WINDS OVER 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  A WIND ADVISORY WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT OVER THE 
EAST TN MOUNTAINS THROUGH 15Z.  WINDS WILL STAY BREEZY THROUGHOUT 
THE DAY WITH SOME VALLEY LOCATIONS EXPECTING BREEZY 15 TO 25 MPH 
WINDS AS WELL THIS AFTERNOON.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER 
INTO MONDAY AS AN UPPER LOW MOVES THROUGH TO OUR NORTH AND LIFTS OUT 
OF THE AREA.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ON TUESDAY WITH FLOW 
ALOFT BECOME ZONAL.  THIS WILL CONTINUE TO BRING IN COOL...DRY AIR.  
FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD...MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT AND CONFIDENCE 
LOW.  HOWEVER...OVERALL PATTERN SHOWS TEMPERATURES BEGINNING TO 
MODERATE AND A SERIES OF WEAK IMPULSES MOVING THROUGH.  FOR THE MOST 
PART...THE IMPULSES APPEAR TO HAVE LITTLE MOISTURE OR ENERGY AND 
EXPECTED MAIN EFFECT WILL BE A OCCASIONAL BAND OF CLOUDS MOVING 
THROUGH.  HAVE LEFT THE FORECAST DRY FOR NOW WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 220151
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
851 PM EST SAT DEC 21 2013

.DISCUSSION...
THE LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS WAS CURRENTLY MARCHING ACROSS MS AND TN. THE
LINE WAS MOVING AT ABOUT 70 MPH TO THE NNE WHICH MAY BRING IT INTO
THE NORTHEASTERN PLATEAU IN ABOUT 4 HOURS OR SO. THE SOUTHERN PART
OF THE LINE WILL LAG BEHIND BUT WILL BE WATCHING FOR ANY STORMS
THAT MAY DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE LINE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
EVENING. STRONGEST STORMS MAY OCCUR OVER THE SOUTHERN VALLEY WHERE
THE BEST INSTABILITY WILL OCCUR. DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE THE MAIN
THREAT AS THESE STORMS MOVE THROUGH. 

MADE MINOR CHANGES TO THE FORECAST GRIDS TO BETTER REFLECT CURRENT
UNUSUALLY WARM CONDITIONS AND HIGHER DEWPOINTS. IT APPEARS AS
THOUGH THE LINE WILL MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH AFTER SUNRISE SUNDAY AND
SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA BY MID-DAY WITH SOME LINGERING SHOWERS IN
ITS WAKE.

181 
FXUS64 KMRX 211936
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 PM EST SAT DEC 21 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER 
ARKANSAS WILL TRACK NORTHEAST TO THE GREAT LAKES REGION...DRAGGING A 
COLD FRONT INTO OUR AREA SATURDAY.  STRONG LOW LEVEL JET WILL PUMP 
PLENTY OF MOISTURE INTO THE REGION. RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE 
UPPER JET WILL HELP TO ENHANCE LIFT.  LOW LEVEL SHEAR IS 
STRONG...AND APPEARS THERE WILL BE SOME LIMITED 
INSTABILITY...ESPECIALLY SOUTH AND WEST ZONES.  SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE IN LATE...AND SOME THUNDERSTORMS MAY BE 
SEVERE ESPECIALLY WEST AND SOUTH LATE TONIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY.  
DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE THE PRIMARY THREAT...BUT AN ISOLATED TORNADO 
CANNOT BE RULED OUT.  WILL CONTINUE MENTION IN HWO.  STRONG PRESSURE 
GRADIENT WILL LEAD TO STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS AHEAD OF THE FRONT 
TONIGHT INTO EARLY SUNDAY...WITH THE STRONGEST WINDS EXPECTED OVER 
THE HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS. WILL LEAVE WIND ADVISORIES AS THEY ARE 
FOR NOW.  THE FRONT WILL HANG UP OVER THE REGION...SO WHILE PRECIP 
WILL DIMINISH FROM WEST TO EAST DURING THE DAY SUNDAY...WILL LINGER 
LIKELY POPS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON EAST ZONES.  WILL GO A BIT ABOVE 
MAV TEMPS FOR MOST LOWS TONIGHT...BUT LESS ARGUMENT WITH HIGHS 
SUNDAY.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)... THE INITIAL PACIFIC
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE JUST EAST OF THE REGION BY THE EARLY
EVENING...WHICH SHOULD HELP TO TAPER OFF PRECIPITATION OVER THE
WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...A SUBTLE SHORTWAVE
ROTATING AROUND THE NORTHEASTWARD PROPAGATING LOW WILL HELP TO DRAW
ADDITIONAL GULF MOISTURE INTO THE AREA...AND KEEP A DECENT CHANCE
FOR SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS... NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE
NIGHT. AFTER SUNRISE ON MONDAY...SOME CLEARING WILL BEGIN TO TAKE
PLACE AS THE BASE OF THE BROAD UPPER-TROUGH APPROACHES. THIS WILL
PUSH A COOLER/DRIER AIR MASS INTO THE AREA WHICH WILL BE IN PLACE
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR MUCH OF THE HOLIDAY WEEK AHEAD.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MUCH COOLER ON MONDAY NIGHT AS LOWS BOTTOM OUT
IN THE TEENS AND 20S...AND HIGHS WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB MUCH ABOVE
THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S ON CHRISTMAS EVE DAY DESPITE THE AMPLE
SUNSHINE. SOME RIDGING WILL BEGIN TO TAKE PLACE BY CHRISTMAS
DAY...ALLOWING FOR A WARM UP OF AROUND 10-15 DEGREES AND AN OVERALL
BEAUTIFUL MOSTLY SUNNY DAY.

THE SECOND HALF OF THE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND WILL BE CHARACTERIZED BY 
A SERIES OF WEAK DISTURBANCES MOVING THROUGH THE AREA...WHICH DO NOT 
APPEAR WILL HAVE MUCH OF AN IMPACT OTHER THAN PERHAPS A GRADUAL 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER. A WEAK FRONT IS PROGGED TO PASS THROUGH THE 
AREA THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY...BUT VERY LIMITED MOISTURE WILL LIKELY 
PREVENT ANYTHING MORE THAN A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS AT WORST. 
THUS...HAVE MAINTAINED THE DRY FORECAST THROUGH SATURDAY. ANOTHER 
BROAD UPPER-TROUGH MAY ARRIVE BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND WHICH COULD 
GIVE THE REGION ITS NEXT BEST SHOT AT ANY PRECIPITATION. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  70  46  48  26 /  90 100  30  20   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  69  44  47  26 / 100  90  20  20   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              58  70  45  46  24 /  70 100  40  20  10

FXUS64 KMRX 210827
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST SAT DEC 21 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG SHORT WAVE EJECTING FROM 
LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE NORTHEAST THROUGH TEXAS TODAY AND 
CONTINUE INTO THE GREAT LAKES ON SUNDAY. SURFACE LOW WILL DEEPEN 
OVER ARKANSAS TODAY AND MOVE TO WESTERN NEW YORK LATE ON SUNDAY. 
STRONG LOW LEVEL JET WILL DEVELOP OVER THE TN AND OH VALLEYS TODAY
AND CONTINUE TONIGHT. SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL BECOME STRONG BY TONIGHT 
WITH FAVORABLE SET UP FOR DOWNSLOPING WINDS ACROSS THE FOOTHILLS OF 
THE TN MOUNTAINS. THE STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL ALSO RESULT IN 
TEMPERATURES WELL ABOVE NORMAL FOR THE FIRST DAY OF WINTER. 1967 HIGH 
TEMPERATURES RECORDS WILL BE THREATENED...CHA 72...TYS 74...TRI 71. 
THE WARM TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT WITH THE COLD FRONT 
MOVING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. DEW POINTS WILL RISE INTO THE 60S 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA LATER TODAY. THE AIRMASS WILL BECOME 
UNSTABLE AND THIS DESTABILIZATION WILL CONTINUE SOMEWHAT OVERNIGHT. 
WIND SHEAR INCREASES IN ADVANCE OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT. 
ONGOING CONVECTION...WHICH WILL LIKELY REACH SEVERE LEVELS TODAY 
WILL MOVE INTO THE MRX CWA LATER TONIGHT. THE CONVECTION IS EXPECTED 
TO WEAKEN SOME OVERNIGHT BUT THE THREAT FOR SEVERE WEATHER CONTINUES 
TONIGHT ...ESPECIALLY ALONG AND WEST OF I75. CONVECTIVE COVERAGE 
SHOULD BE LIMITED TODAY WITH THE BULK OF CONVECTION MOVING EAST INTO 
THE AREA LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY SUNDAY. THE ACTIVITY WILL MOVE EAST 
INTO THE TN MOUNTAINS BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  
 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SOME DIFFERENCES IN 
MODELS WITH THE DETAILS REGARDING THE EXIT OF SUNDAY/S COLD FRONT.  
MODELS TRENDING TOWARD BRIEFLY SLOWING THE FRONT JUST TO THE EAST OF 
THE APPALACHIAN AND A WEAK WAVE MOVING THROUGH.  THIS MAY KEEP 
SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE APPALACHIANS SUNDAY NIGHT.  THEN...THE 
TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH MONDAY...LINGERING INTO MONDAY NIGHT FOR 
ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER MAINLY UPSLOPE FAVORED LOCATIONS. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH FLOW ALOFT 
BECOMING ZONAL BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.  MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT FOR 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  THE GFS KEEPS A WEAKENED SURFACE HIGH IN PLACE 
FOR THURSDAY AND THE ECMWF BRINGS A WEAK...BROAD FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
THROUGH.  WILL LEAVE THINGS DRY FOR NOW BUT WILL MONITOR TO SEE HOW 
THIS DEVELOPS.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...COOLER AIR MOVES IN EARLY IN 
THE PERIOD BEHIND THE EXITING COLD FRONT...WITH TEMPERATURES SLOWLY 
MODERATING BY THE END OF THE PERIOD.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 201941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EST FRI DEC 20 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL 
DEVELOP AND MOVE NORTHEAST ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WELL TO OUR 
WEST DURING THE SHORT TERM.  THE LOW LEVEL JET WILL 
INCREASE...BRINGING ADDITIONAL MOISTURE TO THE AREA.  FORCING WILL 
BE WEAK DURING THE SHORT TERM...SO ANY RAINFALL SHOULD BE LIGHT.  
APPEARS LOW LEVEL WIND DIRECTION WILL PROVIDE SOME DOWNSLOPING 
SATURDAY OVER PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY. WILL KEEP 
POPS THERE ON THE LOW SIDE...WITH LOW LIKELY POPS CONFINED TO THE 
SOUTH AND PLATEAU. IT WILL ALSO BE QUITE WARM SATURDAY WITH HIGHS IN 
MOST LOCATIONS WELL INTO THE 60S.  WINDS WILL BEGIN TO PICK UP AS 
WELL MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT WILL KEEP BELOW WIND 
ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR NOW.  WILL GENERALLY GO NEAR TO A BIT ABOVE 
MAV TEMPS FOR THE SHORT TERM...BLENDING IN SOME OF THE HIGHER MET 
NUMBERS.         

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)... A STRONG UPPER-
LEVEL STORM SYSTEM WILL IMPACT THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT AND
SUNDAY...BRINGING SOME HIGH WINDS...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS AND
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL TO THE AREA. MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...AS THE HEAVIEST
PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE IN LATE SATURDAY NIGHT /9Z/ AND OVERSPREAD
THE AREA AFTER SUNRISE...BEFORE QUICKLY MOVING OUT OF THE AREA BY
MID TO LATE AFTERNOON /18-21Z ON SUNDAY/. AHEAD OF THE
PRECIPITATION...A STRONG 60-70 KT LOW-LEVEL WILL ROTATE OVER THE
AREA...AND HELP TO PRODUCE SOME STRONG ADVISORY-LEVEL WINDS
/PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN/. SOME OF THE GUSTS MAY
APPROACH THE HIGH-END ADVISORY/HIGH WIND CRITERIA. HOWEVER...THE
LACK OF A STABLE LAYER ALOFT WILL LIKELY HINDER THE MOUNTAIN WAVE
POTENTIAL DESPITE THE SLIGHTLY BACKED SSE FLOW OVER THE MOUNTAINS.
STILL...THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME STRONG/GUSTY WINDS EXISTS AREAWIDE
AND WILL HIGHLIGHT THIS IN THE HWO.

IN ADDITION TO THE GRADIENT WINDS...THE STRONG WIND SHEAR COMBINED 
WITH SOME INSTABILITY WILL YIELD THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME ORGANIZED 
STRONG TO POSSIBLY ISOLATED SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS LATE SATURDAY NIGHT 
INTO SUNDAY MORNING /PARTICULARLY ALONG THE PLATEAU AND THE SOUTHERN 
AND CENTRAL VALLEY/...AS A DECAYING LINE OF HEAVY SHOWERS/STORMS 
WORKS IT WAY IN FROM MIDDLE TENNESSEE. DO NOT THINK THE THREAT WILL 
BE TERRIBLY WIDESPREAD...BUT SOME DAMAGING CONVECTIVE WINDS GUSTS 
WILL CERTAINLY POSSIBLE DURING THIS TIMEFRAME. ALSO...WITH PWATS 
OVER 1.5 INCHES AND STRONG DIVERGENCE ALOFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET...SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND 
PERHAPS SOME MINOR FLOODING WILL BE POSSIBLE FROM THESE SHOWERS AND 
STORMS. 

IN WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM SUNDAY NIGHT...COOL/DRY AIR WILL QUICKLY 
FILTER INTO THE AREA...SHUTTING OFF PRECIPITATION QUICKLY. THE NAM 
WANTS TO BRING SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT SHOWERS/CLOUDS ALONG THE 
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST ZONES ON MONDAY AS THE BASE OF THE TROUGH 
SWINGS THROUGH...BUT HAVE NOT GONE ABOVE LOW-END CHANCE POPS AS 
THINK THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE FAIRLY ISOLATED TO WIDELY SCATTERED FOR 
THE MOST PART. AS MENTIONED...SOME LOWER TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN 
PLACE FOR THE NEW WEEK...WITH HIGHS GENERALLY REACHING THE 40S TO 
AROUND 50 DEGREES IN THE VALLEYS. ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...WITH SOME 
RIDGING BY CHRISTMAS DAY WILL ALLOW FOR SUNNY AND PLEASANT 
CONDITIONS FOR AT LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF THE HOLIDAY WEEK...BEFORE 
CLOUDS INCREASES AHEAD OF ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH TO CLOSE OUT THE 
WEEK. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             49  69  63  68  43 /  30  60 100  90  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  67  62  68  45 /  20  40  90 100  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       47  65  61  66  42 /  30  50 100  90  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              41  67  57  66  42 /  20  30  70 100  40

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 200833
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EST FRI DEC 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGING OVER THE AREA GRADUALLY 
SUPPRESSING TO THE SE THROUGH THE PERIOD. ZONAL FLOW ALOFT BECOMES 
INCREASINGLY SOUTHWESTERLY BLANKETING THE AREA WITH HIGH CLOUDS. LOW 
LEVEL FLOW INCREASES BRINGING LOW CLOUDS INTO THE AREA LATER TODAY 
FROM THE SOUTHWEST. MODEST WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL BRING AN INCREASE 
IN TEMPERATURES...ESPECIALLY TONIGHT. ISENTROPIC LIFT SUFFICIENT 
LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT TO AID IN LIGHT SHOWER ACTIVITY MORE 
FAVORABLE IN WESTERN AREAS.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN CONCERN THOUGH THE 
EXTENDED WILL BE A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT 
INTO SUNDAY.  AHEAD OF THE FRONT...WARM...MOIST AIR WILL SLIDE IN ON 
INCREASING SOUTHERLY WINDS.  BY SATURDAY NIGHT...WINDS ALOFT WILL 
INCREASE AS A 70KT 850MB JET PUSHES IN.  THIS WILL LIKELY CREATE THE 
NEED FOR AT LEAST A WINDS ADVISORY IF NOT A HIGH WIND WARNING FOR 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  THERE REMAINS SOME DIFFERENCES IN TIMING OF THE 
ASSOCIATED LINE OF CONVECTION.  MAIN BAND SHOULD MOVE THROUGH 
BETWEEN 09Z AND 15Z SATURDAY.  INSTABILITY IS WEAK...BUT SHOULD 
LIKELY SEE A FEW STRAY THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE LINE.  ADDITIONALLY 
...IF ANY OF THESE STORMS REACH HIGH ENOUGH INTO THE STRONG WIND 
FIELD ALOFT...THE STORM MAY GENERATE STRONG GUSTY WINDS.  A FEW 
SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO MONDAY AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM PULLS AWAY 
FORM THE AREA.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM BRINGING IN 
COOL...DRY AIR BY TUESDAY WITH TEMPERATURE SLOWLY MODERATING THROUGH 
THE REST OF THE PERIOD.



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 192002
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EST THU DEC 19 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...BROAD UPPER RIDGE OVER THE 
REGION WILL SHIFT EAST AS WILL THE SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR EAST 
THAT EXTENDS INTO OUR AREA.  MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE...WITH 
INCREASING MAINLY HIGH CLOUDS TONIGHT AND SOME LOWER CLOUDS MOVING 
IN DURING FRIDAY.  MOISTURE SHOULD BE ON THE SHALLOW SIDE FOR FRIDAY 
AND FORCING WEAK...SO WILL ONLY CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN 
THE AFTERNOON FOR OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE 
FOR THE MOST PART SO NO MAJOR ADJUSTMENTS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... THE MAIN FORECAST
CONCERN FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE THE STRONG UPPER-LEVEL
STORM SYSTEM PROGGED IN IMPACT THE REGION THIS WEEKEND.
ATTM...THERE ARE STILL SOME SUBTLE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS
REGARDING A POTENTIAL BREAK IN THE PRECIP SATURDAY NIGHT AND A
POSSIBLE START TO THE HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION ON SUNDAY.
HOWEVER...BOTH THE GFS...NAM...ECMWF AND CMC ALL SHOW A BROAD AREA
OF LOCALLY HEAVY SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS APPROACHING THE AREA
LATE SATURDAY NIGHT AND OVER SPREADING THE AREA ON SUNDAY
MORNING...AND THEN EXITING THE AREA BY SUNDAY EVENING.

AS MENTIONED...THE POTENTIAL FOR THE HEAVIEST RAIN APPEARS TO BE 
BETWEEN 09Z TO 18Z ON SUNDAY. WITH A 60-70 KT LOW LEVEL JET ROTATING 
OVER THE AREA AND SOME INSTABILITY PRESENT...THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME 
ORGANIZED STRONG THUNDERSTORMS IN ADDITION TO THE LOCALLY HEAVY 
SHOWERS THAT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA. ALSO...GIVEN THE DEEP WARM 
CLOUD LAYER AND PWAT VALUES OVER 1.5 INCHES...WIDESPREAD LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE A BIG CONCERN WITH THIS ACTIVITY AS WELL. 
ANOTHER BIG CONCERN WILL BE THE STRONG GRADIENT SOUTHERLY WINDS 
PROGGED TO BE OCCURRING AHEAD OF THIS STORM SYSTEM SATURDAY NIGHT 
AND SUNDAY MORNING. A WIND ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED FOR PORTIONS OF 
THE VALLEY...AND PERHAPS A HIGH WIND WATCH/WARNING FOR THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF THE SMOKIES. 

IN WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM SUNDAY NIGHT...DRY AIR WILL QUICKLY FILTER 
INTO THE AREA...SHUTTING OFF PRECIPITATION QUICKLY. SOME COOLER 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN PLACE FOR THE NEW WEEK...WITH HIGHS 
GENERALLY REACHING THE 40S TO AROUND 50 DEGREES IN THE VALLEYS. 
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...WITH SOME RIDGING BY CHRISTMAS DAY WILL ALLOW FOR 
SUNNY AND PLEASANT CONDITIONS FOR AT LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF THE 
HOLIDAY WEEK.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 190844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EST THU DEC 19 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...VERY QUIET ON FRONT END OF 
THIS FORECAST...WITH THICKENING OF CIRRUS CLOUDS TODAY ABOUT THE 
BIGGEST ISSUE.  HOWEVER...BIG PUSH OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BY 
FRIDAY...AND ENTIRE AREA WILL LIKELY BE SWALLOWED UP BY LOW CLOUDS 
DURING THE DAY.  WAS TEMPTED TO NOT HAVE ANY POPS FOR FRIDAY DUE TO 
HOW SHALLOW THE MOISTURE WILL BE AND WITHOUT ANY SIGNIFICANT 
INSTABILITY THIS FAR EAST...BUT LEFT IN LOW POPS IN WEST AND 
SOUTHWEST JUST IN CASE THEY GET SOME HEAVIER DRIZZLE IF IT GETS 
JUICY ENOUGH OR A LIGHT SHOWER WITH LIMITED INSTABILITY.

WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE ON TEMPERATURES...MAINLY TWEAKED PLATEAU MIN 
TEMP TONIGHT TO RAISE THEM DUE TO INCREASING WINDS AT THOSE ELEVATED 
LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
THE GFS...ECMWF..AND CMC ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE GENERAL 
TIMING OF STRONGEST LIFT/DEEPEST MOISTURE FOR THE WEEKEND. THE NAM 
APPEARS TO BE AN OUTLIER...HOLDING BACK PRECIP MUCH SLOWER THAN THE 
OTHERS. WILL FOLLOW THE GFS/ECMWF/CMC...WHICH IS CLOSE TO THE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST...SO NO MAJOR CHANGES WILL BE MADE. 

THE WINDOW OF HEAVIEST PRECIP APPEARS TO BE 09Z SUNDAY TO 18Z 
SUNDAY. DURING THIS TIME...A 70 KT LLJ WILL BE OVER THE AREA...WITH 
850 MB THETA-E VALUES ABOVE 330K. THIS SHOULD GIVE AT LEAST A CHANCE 
OF THUNDERSTORMS...ANY OF WHICH COULD PRODUCE DAMAGING WIND 
GUSTS...LIKELY IN THE FORM OF A SQUALL LINE. STRONG DIVERGENCE ALOFT 
IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET ACTING ON PW VALUES OVER 1.5 
INCHES WILL MEAN WIDESPREAD MODERATE TO LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. WIND 
ADVISORIES OR A HIGH WIND WATCH/WARNING MAY BE NEEDED IN HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AS WE DRAW CLOSER TO THE EVENT. DRY ADVECTION FROM THE 
WEST WILL BRING AN END TO THE PRECIP BEFORE 12Z MONDAY...A BIT 
FASTER THAN PREVIOUSLY FORECAST. 

MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY LOOK DRY WITH TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO OR 
SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       58  36  59  52  66 /   0   0  20  30  50

FXUS64 KMRX 182005
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST WED DEC 18 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE AREA WILL DRIFT EAST AS WILL THE LOW AMPLITUDE UPPER RIDGE.  
SOME HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE TONIGHT AND 
THURSDAY...SO WILL SEE AN INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS.  OTHERWISE...A 
TRANQUIL PERIOD FOR THE SHORT TERM.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE 
OVERALL SO WILL STAY CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE 
RIDGE RETREATS TO THE SOUTHEAST THURSDAY NIGHT WITH SURFACE HIGH 
MOVING OFF THE EAST COAST. SOUTHERLY FLOW STILL NOT REAL STRONG BUT 
HIGH CLOUDS WILL ALLOW LOWS TO WARM A FEW DEGREES FRIDAY MORNING. 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES FRIDAY WITH CONTINUED SOUTH WINDS. 
HIGHS FRIDAY SIMILAR TO THURSDAY IN THE UPPER 50S TO THE LOWER 60S.
RAIN CHANCES SLOWLY INCREASE FRIDAY BUT MODELS A LITTLE SLOWER SO 
LOWERED CHANCES TO MAINLY LATE IN THE DAY. DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE 
WESTERN STATES FRIDAY WILL MOVE OUT INTO THE PLAINS SATURDAY WITH 
DEEP SURFACE LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS/MS VALLEY WITH LONG PLUME 
OF MOISTURE TO THE NE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS 
DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF COLD FRONT AND LOW WARMING TEMPERATURES INTO 
THE 60S SATURDAY. AIR MASS BECOMES UNSTABLE ENOUGH FOR THUNDERSTORMS 
AND SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS JUST AHEAD OF FRONT. COLD FRONT TO MOVE 
THROUGH DURING THE DAY SUNDAY. WRAP AROUND CLOUDS BEHIND FRONT AND 
LEFTOVER MOISTURE WILL KEEP A FEW SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST AREA INTO 
MONDAY MORNING. MUCH COOLER SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. HIGH 
PRESSURE REBUILDS OVER THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT. MOSTLY CLEAR AND 
COOL TO COLD TEMPERATURES FOR CHRISTMAS EVE AND DAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 180729
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 AM EST WED DEC 18 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WAS BUILDING INTO THE REGION EARLY THIS
MORNING. THE SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT OVER SW VA AND ALONG THE
TN/NC MOUNTAINS SHOULD BEGIN TO RELAX AS THE MORNING GOES ON...SO
EXPECT LESS WIND AS THE DAY PROGRESSES. MAX DAYTIME AND OVERNIGHT
LOW TEMPERATURES TODAY AND TONIGHT WILL BE SLIGHTLY BELOW SEASONAL
NORMALS.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A RIDGE OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST WILL PROVIDE A MILD SW FLOW TO THE 
AREA FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK...WITH TEMPERATURES RISING WELL ABOVE 
NORMAL. OUTSIDE OF SOME INCREASING HIGH CLOUDS THURSDAY NIGHT...THE 
COLUMN REMAINS QUITE DRY UNTIL FRIDAY. POSITIVE THETA-E ADVECTION 
AND ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BRING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS STARTING ON 
FRIDAY. 

MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN GENERALLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE SYSTEM FOR 
THE WEEKEND. THE SW FLOW PATTERN REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT...AND THE STRONG LIFT STAYS TO OUR WEST THROUGH 
SATURDAY. WILL BEGIN TO SLOWLY EDGE POPS UPWARD IN THE PLATEAU ON 
SATURDAY...A BIT SLOWER THAN PREVIOUSLY FORECAST. THE PATTERN 
BECOMES MORE PROGRESSIVE ONCE THE SOUTHERN STREAM LOW MERGES WITH 
THE NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. WE WILL BEGIN TO SEE SOME 
STRONG LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH A DYNAMIC JET AND GOOD LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE LATE SATURDAY NIGHT. 850 MB THETA-E VALUES AROUND 330K 
SUGGEST A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS IS WARRANTED THROUGH SUNDAY. A 
THREAT OF SOME SEVERE STORMS CANNOT BE RULED OUT EITHER AS THE LLJ 
IN THE GFS IS 60-70 KTS. 

SURFACE FROPA OCCURS SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT WITH THE POSITIVELY-TILTED 
UPPER TROUGH...THERE IS NOT A STRONG SURGE OF COLD AIR BEHIND IT. 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY SHOULD BE DRY AND MOSTLY SUNNY AS DRY AIR AND 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILD IN...WITH TEMPS CLOSE TO NORMAL.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 172040
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 PM EST TUE DEC 17 2013

.SHORT TERM...
DYNAMIC CLIPPER SYSTEM NOW CROSSING OHIO RIVER IS POISED TO ENHANCE
LIFT AND INSTABILITY OVER THE NORTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA IN THE
NEXT FEW HOURS. MOST OF THIS ACTION WILL OCCUR PRIOR TO 00Z...SO
ZONES WILL HAVE A PRE-FIRST PERIOD TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS SHORT EVENT.
LATEST MODEL READINGS LOOK SLIGHTLY WARMER...BUT STILL THINK PRECIP
WILL TURN TO SNOW SHOWERS BEFORE ENDING IN MOST OF NORTHEASTERN
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE ABOUT 3500 FEET
MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION WILL LIKELY BE SNOW...SO SOME LIGHT
ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED. IN THE ZONE FORECAST WILL PUT IN UP TO
1 INCH IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF WISE AND RUSSELL COUNTIES.

AHEAD OF THE FRONT TEMPERATURES LOOK TO BE RUNNING WARMER THAN
EXPECTED SO THAT WILL DELAY COOLING SOMEWHAT...AND THEREFORE THE
CHANGEOVER TO SNOW.

WINDS GUSTY THIS AFTERNOON...BUT MAINLY STAYING BELOW ADVISORY
LEVELS AND EXPECTED TO STAY BELOW CRITERIA FOR MOST LOCATIONS.

EVERYTHING SHOULD SETTLE DOWN FOR TOMORROW...WITH PLENTY OF SUN AND
WINDS GETTING LIGHTER AND LIGHTER.


.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...OVERALL...A FAIRLY 
ACTIVE LONGTERM. STILL SOME DISAGREEMENT ON TIMING OF THE WEEKEND 
SYSTEM BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF. WILL STILL TREND TOWARD THE SLOWER 
ECMWF SOLUTION AS DID THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. DIDNT ALTER POPS MUCH 
AT ALL AS PREVIOUS GRIDS STILL LOOK VERY REASONABLE BASED ON LATEST 
DATA. THE FIRST FEW PERIODS OF THE LONG TERM LOOK CALM...BUT THINGS 
BEGIN TO CHANGE ON FRIDAY AS A CLOUDY AND WET WEEKEND LOOK TO BE IN 
STORE WITH CLEARING CONDITIONS EXPECTED BY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. A 
BIG WARMING TREND FOR BOTH HIGHS AND LOWS WILL TAKE PLACE THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND WITH TEMPS RETURNING TO NORMAL BY MONDAY BEHIND A COLD FRONT.

WEAK RIDGING FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT WHICH SHOULD 
PROVIDE CALM AND PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT LOWS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. THURSDAY HIGHS IN THE 
MID TO UPPER 50S WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE MID 30S TO NEAR 40. 
MOSTLY ZONAL FLOW BEGINS TO SHIFT TO MORE OF A SW FLOW THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY IN RESPONSE TO A DEEPENING TROUGH ACROSS THE 
WESTERN US. CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE ON FRIDAY DUE TO AN INCREASINGLY 
MOIST SW FLOW ALONG WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS THROUGH THE DAY DUE TO 
ISENTROPIC LIFT. KEPT THE SAME LINE OF THINKING AS PREVIOUS FORECAST 
WITH LESSER CHANCES FOR SHOWERS ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA DUE TO SLIGHT 
DOWN SLOPING WINDS ON FRIDAY. HIGHS ON FRIDAY EXPECTED TO BE IN THE 
UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S.

CHANCES FOR SHOWERS INCREASE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AS THE 
WESTERN TROUGH CONTINUES TO DEEPEN OVER TEXAS AND PUSH MORE 
MOISTURE UP INTO OUR AREA OUT OF THE GULF. GFS SOUNDINGS SHOW PWS 
RANGING FROM 1.4 TO 1.6 INCHES SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WHICH IS VERY 
MOIST FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR AND PUTS US NEAR THE 99TH PERCENTILE 
COMPARED TO NORMAL PW VALUES. HOWEVER...THE MODELS SHOW NEGATIVE 
TILTING WHICH WILL FORCE THE LOW PRESSURE CENTER OVER TEXAS TO RACE 
UP TOWARD THE OHIO RIVE VALLEY THEREFORE KEEPING THE MAIN PRECIP 
AXIS BACK OFF TO OUR WEST ON SATURDAY. HAVING SAID THAT...WE COULD 
STILL PICK UP A FEW INCHES OF RAINFALL BETWEEN SATURDAY AND MONDAY 
WITH THE BULK OF IT LIKELY OCCURRING ON SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT AS A 
STRONG COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. SOUNDINGS SHOW ROUGHLY 100 
J/KG CAPE ON SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY SO CANT RULE OUT A RUMBLE 
OF THUNDER OR TWO. MOST AREAS WILL SEE HIGHS OVER THE WEEKEND IN THE 
MID 60S WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE 50S. 

THE HEAVIEST PRECIP IS OFF TO OUR EAST BY MONDAY ALONG WITH THE 
DEPARTED COLD FRONT. HOWEVER...ANOTHER WAVE OF ENERGY QUICKLY MOVES 
THROUGH AND WILL ALLOW FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT SHOWERS TO 
LINGER THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF THE DAY ON MONDAY AREA WIDE AND 
ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS IF THERE IS ENOUGH 
MOISTURE PRESENT. THE POST FRONTAL AIRMASS WILL RESULT IN MONDAYS 
HIGHS RETURNING BACK INTO THE UPPER 40S TO NEAR 50 WITH LOWS IN THE 
UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S FOR MONDAY NIGHT. CALM AND CLEAR CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED ON TUESDAY AS WE BEGIN TO RETURN TO A ZONAL FLOW WITH NEAR 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 170906
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
404 AM EST TUE DEC 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH EMBEDDED 
IN THE BROAD CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY 
AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TODAY AND TONIGHT. COOLING TEMPS ALOFT WILL 
ARRIVE IN THE AFTERNOON...AND WILL BRING INCREASING CLOUDS TO 
NORTHERN AREAS. WINDS WILL BECOME GUSTY LATE TODAY WITH THE SURFACE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE...BUT SHOULD STAY JUST BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. 
STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES WILL PROVIDE INSTABILITY FOR SHOWERS 
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
INITIALLY THE SHOWERS WILL BE RAIN...THEN CHANGE TO SNOW AFTER 
SUNSET AS TEMPS DROP QUICKLY. SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS LESS THAN 1 
INCH MAY OCCUR IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS BEFORE THE PRECIP ENDS...WHICH 
IS EXPECTED TO BE AROUND MIDNIGHT ONCE THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS MOVES 
EAST AND MIDLEVELS STABILIZE AND DRY OUT. 

A RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...PROVIDING SUNNY 
SKIES AND A WARMING TREND. WITH THE RIDGE AXIS TO OUR EAST AND A 
STRENGTHENING SW FLOW...TEMPS ON THURSDAY WILL RISE INTO THE UPPER 
50S TO NEAR 60 IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WENT CLOSER TO THE 
SLOWER GFS FOR THE FIRST 24 HOURS AND THEN FOLLOWED THE ECMWF WHICH 
SLOWS A BIT LATE IN THE LONG TERM PERIOD. LIKED THE GFS THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY WHICH IN ADDITION TO BEING SLOWER TO BRING LIGHT 
SHOWERS INTO THE FORECAST AREA...ALSO HAS A MORE REALISTIC LOOK TO 
THE NORTHERN REACHES OF THE GREAT VALLEY THAT OFTEN TIMES ENJOYS 
RAIN SHADOWING AS SOUTHERLY FLOW FORMS ACROSS THE BLUE RIDGE 
MOUNTAINS. THEREFORE GRADUALLY ADJUSTED POPS HIGHER DURING THE DAY 
FRIDAY WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OVER THE NORTHERN VALLEY. 
ISENTROPIC LIFT STRENGTHENS IN INCREASINGLY MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND MAINTAINED THE GOOD CHANCE EAST THROUGH LIKELY WEST 
SCENARIO HERE. MAJOR SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE BECOMES NEGATIVELY 
TILTED DURING THE DAY SATURDAY CAUSING THE FLOW TO BACK ALLOWING 
EVEN MORE OF A CROSS TERRAIN LOOK TO THE LOW LEVEL WINDS. 
THEREFORE...THERE MAY BE A PERCEPTIBLE DECREASE IN SHOWER ACTIVITY 
ON SATURDAY SO TRIED TO INDICATE THIS WITH JUST HIGH CHANCE POPS IN 
THE VALLEY AND SLIGHTLY HIGHER LIKELY PROBABILITIES ON THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN FEATURES. GRADUALLY INCREASED POPS SATURDAY NIGHT AS THE 
UPPER TROUGH LIFTS OUT THROUGH THE MID MISSISSIPPI AND OHIO VALLEY 
WHILE STAYING WITH THE HIGH LIKELY POPS ON SUNDAY AS THE BRUNT OF 
THE SYSTEM BUILDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS MAINTAINED SOME 
INSTABILITY WITH THE COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE ON SUNDAY SO KEPT A CHANCE 
OF THUNDER GOING. WITH UNCERTAINTY A LITTLE HIGHER AT THIS REMOTE 
PERIOD OF THE FORECAST AND FOLLOWING THE SLIGHTLY SLOWER 
ECMWF...STAYED WITH A GO SLOW APPROACH TO THE SYSTEM DEPARTURE 
SUNDAY NIGHT. BOTH THE GFS AND ECM INDICATE SOME TRAILING MOISTURE 
AND SHORT WAVE ENERGY ON MONDAY WHICH MAY KEEP A FEW SHOWERS AROUND 
MAINLY DURING THE MORNING HOURS. PRECIPITATION APPEARS TO BE PRETTY 
MUCH GONE BY LATE AFTERNOON WITH DRY...COLD ADVECTION BUILDING IN 
FOR MONDAY NIGHT. 

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
852 PM EST MON DEC 16 2013

.DISCUSSION...
MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO THE WINDS THIS EVENING...BUT OTHERWISE THE
FORECAST REMAINS ON TRACK. AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE
WILL PROMOTE CLEAR CONDITIONS...THOUGH SOME PASSING CLOUD COVER OVER
FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WILL BE POSSIBLE
LATE TONIGHT AS AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORTWAVES SWINGS SOUTHEAST FROM THE
GREAT LAKES. TEMPERATURES WHICH HAD PEAKED IN THE 50S TODAY HAVE
ALREADY FALLEN BACK INTO THE 30S IN MOST SPOTS ALREADY. HOWEVER...WITH
DEWPOINTS RUNNING IN THE UPPER 20S AND MID 30S...LOWS WILL NOT DROP
OFF TOO DRAMATICALLY OVER THE COURSE OF THE NIGHT /ESPECIALLY WITH
SOME 5-10 MPH SOUTHERLY WINDS HELPING TO KEEP THE BOUNDARY LAYER
MIXED/. AS A RESULT...TEMPERATURES SHOULD BOTTOM OUT IN THE 30-35
DEGREE RANGE IN MOST SPOTS BY DAYBREAK...WITH SOME UPPER 20S
EXPECTED ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 162007
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EST MON DEC 16 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...IN THE UPPER LEVELS WE ARE
UNDER A NWLY FLOW THAT IS QUIET TONIGHT...BUT HAS A SIGNIFICANT
DYNAMIC SHORT WAVE IN THE FLOW FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...IT
LOOKS LIKE THE DYNAMICS WILL STAY JUST NORTH OF THE AREA AND ALSO
HAS MINIMAL MOISTURE WITH WHICH TO WORK. WILL MENTION SPRINKLES OR
FLURRIES IN THE EXTREME NORTHERN SECTIONS...OTHERWISE WILL KEEP IT
DRY TUESDAY AFTERNOON.

FOR TEMPS...WENT CLOSE TO GFS MOS GUIDANCE...SLIGHTLY COOLER 
NORTHERN SECTIONS DUE TO CLOUD COVER TUESDAY AFTERNOON. ALSO...
MADE MAX TEMP EARLY IN THE AFTERNOON AND COOLED TEMPS FAIRLY
QUICKLY IN THE LATTER PARTS OF THE AFTERNOON.

FOR FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS...WINDS WILL BE GUSTY TUESDAY...BUT RH 
VALUES WILL ONLY BE LOWERING TO ROUGHLY 50 PERCENT AT MOST 
LOCATIONS...MAYBE A LITTLE LOWER IN SW NC.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LONG TERM PERIODS WILL 
START OUT DRY PROBABLY INTO EARLY FRIDAY. SOME COLD AIR ADVECTION 
BEHIND THE PASSING WEAK SHORTWAVE TUESDAY...WHICH KEEPS MIN TEMPS 
BELOW CLIMO FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND ALSO KEEPS WEDNESDAY MAX TEMPS 
JUST A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW CLIMO.

THE WARM-UP WILL BE QUITE NOTICABLE ON THURSDAY INTO THE WEEKEND... 
WITH MAX TEMPS JUMPING ABOUT 10 DEGREES ON THURSDAY WITH SRN STREAM 
SW FLOW PLUS SOUTH LOW LEVEL FLOW. MOISTURE INCREASES FROM FRIDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY...JUSTIFYING INCREASING POPS. HOWEVER...WE MAY 
SEE A BREAK IN ROUNDS OF SHOWERS OVER THE WEEKEND. SOME TIMING 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS...SO I DID NOT MAKE ANY 
MAJOR ADJUSTMENTS TO PREVIOUS GRIDS. MODELS SEEM TO SLOW THE ONSET 
OF SHOWERS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...THUS I KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR NE AREAS 
FOR NOW. 12Z GFS MODEL KEEPS LIGHT PRECIPITATION THROUGH EARLY 
MONDAY NIGHT WHILE ECMWF MOVES MOISTURE OUT OF THE REGION ON MONDAY. 
CHANCE POPS CARRIED FOR MONDAY DAYTIME AND MOSTLY DRY MONDAY NIGHT. 

OTHERWISE...TEMPERATURES ON THE RISE UNTIL FRONTAL PASSAGE SUNDAY 
NIGHT OR EARLY MONDAY. CANT RULE OUT A FEW LOWER 70S FOR HIGHS ON 
THE WEEKEND...IF SHOWERS MOVE OUT AND ANY BREAKS OF SUNSHINE OCCUR. 
FOUND THE 16/12Z GFSX MOS CLOSE TO 16/00Z MOS...AND BLENDED WITH 
SIMILAR ECMWX MOS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             32  54  27  53  33 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  31  51  24  48  31 /   0  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       32  50  26  49  31 /   0  10   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              29  49  22  43  24 /   0  10   0   0   0

SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE TUESDAY MORNING. FOR

SURFACE RIDING OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/ SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A
GOOD DEAL OF CIRRO AND CIRRO-STRATUS CLOUDS WILL SPREAD INTO THE
REGION PRODUCING PARTLY SUNNY/MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS.

FXUS64 KMRX 151944
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST SUN DEC 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
SECONDARY COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH A COLD AIR MASS 
LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A LARGE 
AREA OF CLOUDS LINGERING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH THESE 
CLOUDS EXTENDING AS FAR WEST AS THE MS RIVER VALLEY WITH ONLY SLOW 
EROSION TAKING PLACE ON ITS WESTERN EDGES. SINCE THESE LOW CLOUDS 
ARE TRAPPED UP AGAINST THE MOUNTAINS AND UNDERNEATH A MID LEVEL 
INVERSION...THINK THEY WILL ONLY SLOWLY ERODE TONIGHT. THUS...WILL 
BE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH SKY CONDITIONS IN THE FORECAST TONIGHT... 
WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES LIKELY LINGERING THROUGH MONDAY OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN AS A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH REMAINS 
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. SINCE THIS UPPER TROUGH IS NOT 
TOO AMPLIFIED...IT APPEARS THAT IT WILL BRING JUST AN INCREASE IN 
CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT AND 
MONDAY...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT EARLY ON...BUT INTERMODEL AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY IS 
POOR BY THE END OF THE PERIOD. SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL 
BRUSH BY TO OUR NORTH MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. WILL SEE SOME CLOUDS 
ESPECIALLY NORTH BUT MOISTURE WILL BE SHALLOW.  CANNOT TOTALLY RULE 
OUT A BIT OF DRIZZLE OR FREEZING DRIZZLE NORTH BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP 
THE FORECAST FOR BOTH PERIODS PRECIP FREE.  DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WE SHOULD SEE DRY CONDITIONS WITH A WARMING TREND 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  BY FRIDAY THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE 
APPROACHING.  MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THAT A COLD FRONT WILL 
AFFECT THE REGION FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND...BUT DETAILS ON HOW FAST 
IT MOVES IN AS WELL AS ANY WAVES OF LOW PRESSURE ON THE FRONT ARE 
QUITE UNCERTAIN AT THIS TIME GIVEN THE POOR CONSISTENCY MENTIONED 
ABOVE. LOOKS LIKE ANY PRECIP FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WILL MOST LIKELY 
BE LIQUID...AND FOR NOW WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY...EXCEPT FOR LOW LIKELY FRIDAY NIGHT.  HOWEVER...FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE IS BELOW AVERAGE FOR THESE LAST FEW PERIODS AT THIS TIME.
