AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 AM EST SUN DEC 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
OBS ACROSS THE AREA SHOW COLDER AIR BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST. WITH 
DRIZZLE IN NORTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS...SOME ICY PATCHES WILL BE 
POSSIBLE THIS MORNING. WILL CONTINUE TO HANDLE THIS WITH A SPS. 

OVERCAST CLOUDS EXTEND WELL WEST OF THE MS RIVER...BUT SOME EROSION 
OF THE CLOUD DECK IS EXPECTED THROUGH THE AFTERNOON WITH DAYTIME 
MIXING..MAINLY IN SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTION. MODELS MAY BE 
CLEARING THE CLOUDS OUT TOO QUICKLY...SO WILL LEAN TOWARD MORE CLOUD 
COVER AND COOLER TEMPS. TEMPS WILL NOT RISE MUCH THROUGH THE DAY 
WITH COLD ADVECTION AND CLOUD COVER. CLOUDS LINGER THROUGH TONIGHT 
IN NORTHERN AREAS WITH THE PASSAGE OF A WEAK VORT MAX IN THE NW FLOW.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL START THE LONG-TERM FORECAST WITH A
SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES MOVING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND
NORTHEAST MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THE ASSOCIATED MOISTURE WILL MOVE AS
FAR SOUTH AS THE THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. WILL INCLUDE PERIODS OF
MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY..OTHERWISE DRY AREA-WIDE.

FOR MID-WEEK FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL WITH SURFACE RIDGING PRODUCING 
WARMER CONDITIONS AND CONTINUED DRY WEATHER.  FOR THE LATTER HALF OF 
THE WEEK/EARLY WEEKEND...A STRONG UPPER TROUGH WILL ESTABLISH ITSELF 
OVER THE ROCKIES WITH UPPER FLOW BECOMING SOUTHWEST. SURFACE RIDGING 
WILL ALSO MOVE EAST ALLOWING GULF MOISTURE TO RETURN INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. INCREASING ISENTROPIC 
LIFT ALONG WITH AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL INCREASE 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES BY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. GFS AND ECMWF HAVE 
DIFFERENCE EVOLUTIONS OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE ECMWF SHOWS A 
SLOWER EASTWARD MOVEMENT. WILL CALL FOR HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY POPS 
BEGINNING LATE FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE FORECAST.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 142042
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 PM EST SAT DEC 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER NORTHERN KY... 
WITH MILD TEMPS IN THE 40S AND AREAS OF DRIZZLE OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. THE COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA AROUND SUNSET THIS EVENING...WITH SATELLITE IMAGERY 
REVEALING AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS ALL THE WAY BACK INTO THE 
PLAINS STATES. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE 
BELOW 800 MB LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH SUNDAY 
MORNING...WITH A MID-LEVEL INVERSION DEVELOPING OVER THE TOP OF IT. 
THUS...EXPECT CLOUDY SKIES AND AREAS OF DRIZZLE TO LINGER THROUGH 
SUNDAY MORNING. IN FACT...THIS SHALLOW BOUNDARY LAYER OF MOISTURE 
APPEARS TO BE RIGHT AT THE TEMP THRESHOLD FOR SUPER-COOLED WATER TO 
CHANGE OVER TO SNOW...BUT PRECIP LATE TONIGHT MIGHT REMAIN AS RAIN 
AS TEMPS FALL BELOW FREEZING IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 
FEET. THUS...WILL MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING DRIZZLE OR 
SNOW AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET... 
WITH THIS LIGHT PRECIP LINGERING INTO SUNDAY MORNING. WILL ALSO 
ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THE POSSIBILITY OF A 
LIGHT ICE GLAZE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATE TONIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE 
THEN BUILDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT... 
WITH A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE BRINGING AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS 
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT 
WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE FIRST PART OF THIS 
PERIOD IS PRETTY QUIET WITH THE ONLY CHANCE OF PRECIP BEING CENTERED 
ON LATE TUESDAY AS A MODERATE DISTURBANCE DIVES TO THE 
SOUTHEAST...JUST CLIPPING OUR NORTHEAST SECTIONS.  HOWEVER...IT 
LOOKS LIKE THE DEEPER LIFT IS REALLY CENTERED FARTHER NORTH...SO 
HAVE LEFT BOTH PERIODS DRY.

THE ONSET OF THE NEXT SYSTEM LOOKS TO BE LATE THURSDAY OR ON FRIDAY 
AS A LARGE SYSTEM FROM THE GULF MOVES INTO THE AREA.  IT LOOKS LIKE 
THIS SYSTEM AT THE ONSET AND DURING ITS MAIN PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE 
ALL LIQUID PRECIP FORM.  THE TAIL-END OF THIS SYSTEM IS BEYOND THIS 
FORECAST BUT COULD OFFER SOME LIGHT UPSLOPE SNOWS FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS.  BEFORE QUICKLY DRYING OUT.  ALSO WITH THIS 
SYSTEM...INSTABILITY STILL LOOKS WEAK...SO HAVE LEFT THUNDER OUT FOR 
NOW.  LOOKS LIKE NO WIND EVENT FOR NOW AS THIS SYSTEM APPROACHES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 141531
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EST SAT DEC 14 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED NEAR 
NASHVILLE...WITH TEMPS IN THE 30S ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AREA 
RADARS REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...WITH SOME REPORTS OF SNOW AND SLEET OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...A STRONG WARM AIR 
ADVECTION PATTERN AHEAD OF THIS LOW WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH TEMPS INTO 
THE 40S THIS AFTERNOON...BEFORE A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA AROUND SUNSET THIS EVENING. A FAIRLY STRONG 850 MB 
SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW WAS ALSO OCCURRING OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING...WITH A STABLE LAYER OCCURRING OVER THE MOUNTAINS. THUS... 
IT APPEARS THAT WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO BE GUSTY IN THE FOOTHILLS DUE 
TO MOUNTAIN WAVES. CAMP CREEK AND COVE MOUNTAIN WIND TOWERS HAVE 
ALREADY REPORTED WIND GUSTS UP TO 45 TO 50 MPH EARLY THIS MORNING... 
BUT THINK THAT SUSTAINED WINDS WILL REMAIN BELOW 25 MPH TODAY...SO 
WILL NOT ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE FOOTHILLS.
 
MOST OF THIS RAIN THIS MORNING SHOULD TRANSITION TO AREAS OF DRIZZLE 
THIS AFTERNOON...WITH COLDER AIR WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE REGION 
TONIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE 
LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT...AS SUB-FREEZING AIR 
MOVES ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THIS SHALLOW BOUNDARY LAYER 
MOISTURE WILL BE POSSIBLY COLD ENOUGH TO CHANGE OVER TO FREEZING 
DRIZZLE OR SNOW AFTER MIDNIGHT. THUS...MAY NEED TO CONSIDER A WINTER 
WX ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET AFTER MIDNIGHT 
TONIGHT. WILL WAIT UNTIL THE 12Z MODEL RUNS HAVE COMPLETELY ARRIVED 
BEFORE MAKING THE FINAL DECISION.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE LATER THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MORNING PRECIP WORDING AND 
TO CHANGE THE PRECIP WORDING TO AREAS OF DRIZZLE IN A FEW AREAS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   52  35  43  27  52 / 100  20   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     49  34  42  26  48 / 100  30  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             49  34  42  26  48 / 100  30  10   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    45  34  39  23  44 / 100  50  10  10  10 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 140755
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 AM EST SAT DEC 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
RAIN WILL SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA IN ASSOCIATED WITH GOOD Q-G FORCING 
WITH A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND JET. A DEEP WARM LAYER 
SHOULD KEEP ALL PRECIP AS LIQUID THIS MORNING...WITH WARM ADVECTION 
OFFSETTING EVAPORATIVE COOLING. THE MAIN SHOT OF PRECIP MOVES 
THROUGH QUICKLY THIS MORNING...AND MOST OF THE MODERATE RAINFALL 
WILL END BY 18Z. POPS WILL DROP QUICKLY TO JUST A CHANCE BY 21Z AS A 
DRY SLOT MOVES OVERHEAD AND MOISTURE BECOME CONFINED BELOW 800 MB. 
WEAK 850 MB CONVERGENCE WITH THE TROUGH PASSAGE PROVIDES SOME WEAK 
LIFT FOR AREAS OF DRIZZLE OVERNIGHT. COLD ADVECTION KICKS IN AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...WITH A UPSLOPE NW FLOW. LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING...BUT GENERALLY 
LESS THAN ONE INCH IS EXPECTED. SOME PARTIAL CLEARING OF CLOUDS MAY 
ARRIVE FROM THE WEST IN THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT TROUGH FRIDAY)...
A GENERALLY QUIET AND DRY PERIOD UNTIL WE GET TO THE VERY END.
STILL EXPECTING A WARMING TREND FOR NEXT WEEK...WENT MORE TOWARD
THE WARMER ECMWF TEMPERATURES THAN THE GFS. WEATHER SYSTEM FOR THE
END OF THE WEEK LOOKS POTENTIALLY FOREBODING. BOTH GFS AND ECMWF
INDICATE A SLOW MOVING FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE TENNESSEE AND OHIO
VALLEYS FROM FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH A NOTABLY MOIST GULF FLOW
FEEDING THE WARM SECTOR. PRECIPITATION MAY BE FAIRLY EFFICIENT IN
THIS SET UP...AND RAINS OF A DAY OR TWO DURATION SOMEWHERE IN
MIDDLE OR EAST TENNESSEE MAY ACCUMULATE ON THE ORDER OF SEVERAL
INCHES. BEING OUT IN THE DAY 7 TIME FRAME AND BEYOND...THE MODELS
WILL LIKELY STRUGGLE TO PIN IT DOWN BEFORE EARLY NEXT WEEK. WHAT
MATERIALIZES WILL DEPEND ON THE STRENGTH OF THE WESTERN TROUGH AND
THE SW FETCH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. THEN...HOW MUCH OF A TROPICAL
TAP WILL ALL OF THIS MAY MUSTER? BUT THE SITUATION BEARS MONITORING
PRIMARILY FOR PLACEMENT OF HEAVY PRECIP AXIS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  36  43  27  52 / 100  20   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  48  35  42  26  48 / 100  20  10   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       47  35  42  26  48 / 100  20  10   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              44  34  39  23  44 / 100  40  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 140239 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
939 PM EST FRI DEC 13 2013

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR TWEAKS TO THE FORECAST MADE THIS EVENING AS JUST INTRODUCED
LOW-END CHANCE/SLIGHT CHANCE POPS BETWEEN 03-06Z OVER THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TO ACCOUNT FOR SOME LIGHT RAIN POSSIBLY MOVING
IN BEFORE MIDNIGHT. A BROAD AREA OF THIS LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN
CURRENTLY OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE WILL CONTINUE TO WORK ITS WAY IN
OVERNIGHT...AND OVERSPREAD THE REGION EARLY THIS MORNING. GIVEN THE
COLDER AIR PRESENT IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...THE RAIN WILL QUICKLY
CHANCE OVER TO SNOW IN AREAS OVER 2800 FEET OR SO. AS A RESULT...UP
TO ONE INCH OF SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG THE PEAKS OF THE SMOKY
MOUNTAINS AND ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...MOST OF THE REGION WILL EXPERIENCE A COLD
LIGHT RAIN...WITH ACCUMULATIONS AROUND ONE-TENTH OF AN INCH OR SO
BY DAYBREAK. GIVEN THE CLOUD COVER AND RAIN...LOWS WILL BE AROUND
10-15 DEGREES WARMER TONIGHT...IN THE MID TO UPPER 30S IN MOST
AREAS.

&&


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 132030
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST FRI DEC 13 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE 
CAROLINA COAST...WITH AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY OUT AHEAD OF THIS DEVELOPING LOW...WITH MOISTURE 
PROGGED TO CONTINUE INCREASING OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AS 
THIS LOW MOVES EASTWARD. WITH A VERY DRY LOW-LEVEL AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...THINK THAT IT WILL TAKE A WHILE FOR THE 
INITIAL PRECIP TO REACH THE GROUND...WITH MOST OF THE MEASURABLE 
PRECIP AFTER MIDNIGHT. THIS VERY DRY AIR MASS WILL ALSO CREATE SOME 
EVAPORATIVE COOLING WITH THE INITIAL PRECIP...WITH SOME LIGHT SNOW 
POSSIBLE OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...A 
STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN OVER THE FORECAST AREA SHOULD 
CAUSE THIS INITIAL LIGHT SNOW TO BE BRIEF IN DURATION...WITH LOWS 
TONIGHT LIKELY OCCURRING DURING THE EVENING HOURS WITH TEMPS THEN 
SLOWLY RISING OVERNIGHT. STRONG 850 MB SOUTHERLY WINDS ARE ALSO 
PROGGED BY THE NAM MODEL TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON 
SATURDAY MORNING...WITH A STABLE LAYER OCCURRING OVER THE MOUNTAINS. 
THUS...IT APPEARS THAT WINDS COULD BE GUSTY IN THE FOOTHILLS DUE TO 
MOUNTAIN WAVES. HOWEVER...THE GFS MODEL 850 MB WINDS ARE WEAKER AND 
FURTHER NORTH THAN THE NAM MODEL...SO WILL NOT ISSUE ANY WIND 
ADVISORIES WITH THIS FORECAST ISSUANCE DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTIES WITH 
THE STRENGTH OF THE 850 MB WINDS.

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THE BULK OF THE RAINFALL WITH THIS 
NEXT SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE MORNING HOURS 
ON SATURDAY. A SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE THEN LINGERS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING...WHICH 
SHOULD RESULT IN CLOUDY SKIES AND AREAS OF DRIZZLE. IN FACT...THIS 
SHALLOW LOW-LEVEL LAYER OF MOISTURE APPEARS TO POSSIBLY NOT COOL 
ENOUGH TO CHANGE OVER TO SNOW LATE SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL 
CONTINUE TO MENTION A CHANCE FOR SNOW LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY MORNING SINCE THE TEMP PROFILE APPEARS TO BE RIGHT AT THE 
THRESHOLD FOR SUPER-COOLED WATER IN THE CLOUD LAYER TO FREEZE. WITH 
A MID-LEVEL INVERSION EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE TOP OF THIS 
MOISTURE LAYER...IT MAY TAKE A WHILE FOR CLOUDS TO COMPLETELY ERODE 
ON SUNDAY...SO WILL BE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH THE CLOUD FORECAST. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS PERIOD 
A LARGE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IS COVERING MUCH OF THE EASTERN U.S. WITH 
THE AXIS OF THE TROUGH JUST PAST OUR AREA.  AT THE SURFACE...POST 
FRONTAL HIGH PRESSURE HAS BUILT INTO THE AREA...WITH THE SURFACE 
RIDGE ON TOP OF US.  A QUICK RE-ENFORCING FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH THE 
AREA TUESDAY NIGHT...THE 12Z MEX DATA BUMPED UP THE POPS QUITE A 
BIT...BUT WILL HOLD OFF FOLLOWING FOR NOW AS 00Z ENSEMBLE MEMBERS 
WERE ALL MUCH DRIER AND IT LOOKS LIKE PRECIP COULD EASILY STAY 
FARTHER NORTH.

AFTER THIS FRONT MOVES EAST AND THE SURFACE RIDGE PASSES...WE START 
GEARING UP FOR A MORE SIGNIFICANT STORM SYSTEM...WITH THE RETURN 
FLOW OF MOISTURE BUILDING INTO THE PLAINS ON THURSDAY AND SPREADING 
INTO OUR AREA ON FRIDAY.  CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION SHOULD RETURN TO 
THE AREA BY FRIDAY.  LOOKS TO BE A DEEP PUSH OF GULF MOISTURE SO NOT 
ANTICIPATING ANY WINTRY WEATHER WITH THE ONSET OF THIS STORM 
SYSTEM.  MIGHT BE SOME THREAT OF THUNDER...BUT INSTABILITY IS 
EXPECTED TO BE VERY LIMITED...SO JUST HAVE PRECIP AS SHOWERS NOW.  
ANY POTENTIAL FOR POST-FRONTAL NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWS ARE BEYOND THIS 
FORECAST...LOOKS LIKE SOME POTENTIAL FOR THAT...BUT MODELS ARE 
WAFFLING ON POST-FRONTAL MOISTURE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   37  51  36  43  27 /  80 100  30  10   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     36  48  35  42  26 /  70 100  40  20   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             36  47  35  42  26 /  70 100  30  20   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    33  45  34  39  23 /  60 100  50  30   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 130803
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 AM EST FRI DEC 13 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE BUILDING ACROSS THE AREA TODAY AS A SOUTHERN 
STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES FROM THE FOUR CORNERS REGION ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF 
THIS SYSTEM AND QPF AMOUNTS. IT LOOKS LIKE A QUICK SHOT OF 
RAIN...OCCURRING MAINLY BETWEEN 09Z AND 18Z...BUT LIFT LOOKS STRONG 
WITH FAVORABLE UPPER JET POSITIONING AND A 40-50 KT LLJ PROVIDING 
GOOD MOISTURE ADVECTION. WITH THIS SOUTHERLY LLJ...WINDS MAY 
APPROACH ADVISORY CRITERIA IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND FOOTHILLS. 
INITIALLY...LOW LEVELS WILL BE DRY...SO POPS HAVE BEEN PUSHED BACK 
TO AFTER MIDNIGHT. PRECIP COULD BEGIN AS SNOW IN HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...BUT CHANCES OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ABOVE ONE INCH LOOK 
VERY SLIM WITH A DEEP WARM NOSE IN FORECAST SOUNDINGS AND STRONG 
WARM ADVECTION OVERNIGHT. POPS WILL BE CATEGORICAL SATURDAY MORNING 
ONCE THE COLUMN FULLY MOISTENS. RAPID DRYING ALOFT OCCURS SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON AS THE UPPER JET MOVES OVERHEAD. WILL SPEED UP THE 
DECREASE IN POPS...LOWERING INTO THE CHANCE RANGE EVERYWHERE AFTER 
21Z. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT TROUGH THURSDAY)...
THE OPENING 18 HOURS OF THIS PERIOD /SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MIDDAY
SUNDAY/ WILL EXPERIENCE THE REMAINS OF THE DEPARTING WEATHER
SYSTEM...PROBABLY SOME UPSLOPE AND WEAKLY CONVECTIVE SHOWERY
PRECIP...SOME OF WHICH MAY MIX WITH OR SWITCH TO FLURRIES BETWEEN
06Z AND 18Z SUNDAY. DRIER AIR INTRUDING INTO AREA WILL FINALLY KILL
OFF THIS WEAK ACTIVITY BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...AND THEN HIGH PRESSURE
WILL KEEP A FIRMLY DRY HOLD ON THE AREA THROUGH THE REST OF THE
PERIOD /SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY/. LOOKS LIKE TEMPS WILL
WARM UP WITH VALLEY HIGHS BEING MOSTLY IN THE 50S FOR THE UPCOMING
WORK WEEK...A NICE CHANGE FROM THIS CURRENT CHILLY WEEK.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  37  49  37  42 /   0  70 100  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  36  48  36  42 /   0  50 100  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  36  47  36  42 /   0  60 100  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              45  33  48  34  40 /   0  30 100  50  20

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 121943
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST THU DEC 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR MEMPHIS 
TN...WITH A LEE TROUGH ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. THIS HIGH IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING 
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON FRIDAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE 
FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A VERY DRY 
LOW-LEVEL AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA AS MID- TO 
HIGH-LEVEL MOISTURE SPREADS ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. SOME 
EVAPORATIVE COOLING PROCESSES ASSOCIATED WITH THE INITIAL PRECIP 
SHOULD HELP TO CREATE SOME LIGHT SNOW INITIALLY OVER SOUTHWEST VA 
AND NORTHEAST TN...BUT THIS PRECIP SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT UNTIL AFTER 
SUNRISE ON SATURDAY WHEN TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO RISE ABOVE FREEZING. 
THUS...DO NOT EXPECT MUCH IN THE WAY OF SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS...BUT 
UP TO AN INCH MAY STILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 
2500 FEET. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL THEN MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS 
THE DEEP SOUTH ON SATURDAY...BRINGING RAIN OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST 
AREA THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING. COLDER AIR BEHIND THIS SYSTEM WILL 
THEN RE-ENTER THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT ON SATURDAY NIGHT... 
WITH LIGHT RAIN (OR DRIZZLE) CHANGING BACK TO LIGHT SNOW OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. IT APPEARS THAT MOST OF THE MOISTURE WITH THIS 
SYSTEM WILL BE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH 
ONLY SOME SHALLOW LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINING. THUS...DO NOT EXPECT 
MUCH IN THE WAY OF SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS...EXCEPT POSSIBLY OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN WHERE UP TO AN 
INCH WILL AGAIN BE POSSIBLE ABOVE 2500 FEET. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT... 
AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...ON SUNDAY...COOLER AIR AND 
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE WILL ROTATE IN AS SATURDAY/S SYSTEM PULLS AWAY 
FROM THE AREA. THIS WILL ALLOW A FEW LINGERING RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS 
TO HANG OVER MAINLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR MUCH OF THE DAY. WITH 
LIMITED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...NOT EXPECTING MUCH...IF ANY IN THE WAY 
OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. MONDAY AND TUESDAY...SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN 
WITH FLOW ALOFT BECOMING RATHER ZONAL. THIS WILL USHER IN A DRYING 
AND WARMING TREND. THE TAIL END OF A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL SLIDE IN 
AROUND THE WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY TIME FRAME. MOISTURE AND LIFT QUITE 
WEAK AND ONLY EXPECT TO SEE A MINOR BAND OF MID LEVEL CLOUDS AT THIS 
TIME.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 120759
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 AM EST THU DEC 12 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS MOVING TROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
EARLY THIS MORNING...BRINGING A REINFORCING SHOT OF CANADIAN AIR
INTO THE REGION...AND AN AREA OF SCT TO BKN LOWER STATUS CLOUDS
ALONG THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND THE CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS. IN
GENERAL...MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT...BUT THESE CLOUDS SHOULD
EXPAND SOUTHWARD AND LINGER THROUGH AT LEAST PART OF THE
MORNING...BEFORE THE SKY COMPLETELY CLEARS BY THE LATE MORNING AND
INTO THE AFTERNOON. GIVEN THE PREVAILING NORTHERLY FLOW AND THE
COOL/DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE...HIGHS TODAY WILL BE EVEN LOWER AS THEY
WILL ONLY REACH THE 30S TO AROUND 40 DEGREES. THEN...WITH MOSTLY
CLEAR CONDITIONS AND CALM WINDS EXPECTED LATER TONIGHT LOWS WILL
BOTTOM OUT IN THE TEENS TO LOWER 20S ONCE AGAIN. 

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
MAIN WEATHER SYSTEM FOR THE EXTENDED PERIODS WILL BE DEVELOPING
FRIDAY NIGHT...MUCH IN LINE WITH EARLIER MODEL RUNS. THIS SOUTHERN
STREAM LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS HANDLED SIMILARLY BY ALL BUT
NAM...WHICH HAS TRENDED DRIER FOR FRIDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER...THE
WETTER GFS HAS SUPPORT OF ECMWF/CANADIAN AND SREF...SO I STILL
SPREAD PRECIPITATION (MOSTLY RAIN) NE INTO ALL AREAS BY 06Z TO 12Z
SATURDAY. SURFACE AND 850 MB LOW POSITION INDICATES SE TO S LOW
LEVEL FLOW...THUS I KEPT POPS BELOW LIKELY FOR NE TN AND SW VA WITH
LOWEST POPS OVER NRN VALLEY COUNTIES...WHERE DOWNSLOPE FLOW SHOULD
INHIBIT MEASURABLE RAIN UP TO 12Z SATURDAY.

VERY WET SATURDAY THEN COLDER AIR WILL INFILTRATE ON THE BACK SIDE 
OF THE EXITING LOW LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THIS ALLOWS A 
CHANGE OVER OR MIX WITH LIGHT SNOW...MAINLY FOR NRN PLATEAU/SW VA/
NRN MTNS OF E TN. A CONSENSUS OF MODELS SHOWS SLIGHTLY CYCLONIC FLOW 
ALOFT THROUGH AT LEAST 18Z SUNDAY...WITH GFS KEEPING JUST ENOUGH 
LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO SUPPORT LOW POPS ON SUNDAY. THE 
LIKELIHOOD OF ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL IS VERY LOW AT THIS TIME.

UPPER FLOW IS NORTHWEST AND GULF MOISTURE STILL CUT OFF FOR EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...SO WILL CONTINUE THE DRY FORECAST FOR MONDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. 12Z AND 00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE QUITE CLOSE AND GENERALLY 
FOLLOWED. MAY ACTUALLY WARM A FEW DEGREES ABOVE CLIMO BY TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 111949
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST WED DEC 11 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
CAROLINAS...WITH A COLD FRONT STRETCHING FROM CHICAGO SOUTHWESTWARD 
ACROSS THE OZARKS REGION. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON...AND THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS EVENING. THIS COLD FRONT WILL BRING AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS FOR 
TONIGHT...AND COOLER AND DRIER AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON 
THURSDAY. A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE THEN BECOMES REESTABLISHED 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH CLEAR 
SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS EXPECTED. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO 
DEVELOP OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY BY FRIDAY NIGHT...AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES. MOISTURE 
WILL INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT OUT AHEAD OF THIS 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING THE INITIAL 
PRECIP BEGINNING AS LIGHT SNOW OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS THAT SOME LIGHT SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...USED A BLEND OF THE 
GFS/ECMWF FOR THE PERIOD WHICH FEATURES ONE MAIN SYSTEM WHICH 
EMERGES FROM THE PLAINS AND BUILDS INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THE SYSTEM APPEARS TO HAVE A DECENT 
AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE WHICH WILL FALL AS RAIN ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY. THE SURFACE THROUGH LOW LEVEL 
AIR MASS MAY NOT WARM SUFFICIENTLY FOR PRECIPITATION TO FALL IN 
LIQUID FORM AT THE ONSET OF THE EVENT SATURDAY MORNING. COULD BE A 
MIXTURE OF LIGHT SLEET AND SNOW TO START OVER MUCH OF THE REMAINDER 
OF THE FORECAST AREA INCLUDING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. 
HOWEVER...ENOUGH WARM AIR DOES RETURN BY MID DAY WITH ONLY RAIN 
EXPECTED DURING THE AFTERNOON. TRAILING SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND 
MOISTURE BUILD ACROSS THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AND THE 
AIR SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR THE PRECIP TO FALL IN THE FORM OF 
LIGHT SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS. PROBABILITY OF PRECIP 
WILL BE LOWER ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TENNESSEE BUT THERE COULD BE A 
BRIEF PERIOD OF LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES LATER SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SUNDAY MORNING. THE TRAILING SYSTEM SHOULD BE MOVING OUT BY SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHEST 
TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND SMOKY MOUNTAINS OF TENNESSEE. 
THE REST OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD COULD REMAIN DRY EVEN WITH A 
FRONTAL PASSAGE EARLY IN THE WEEK. LOOKS LIKE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE WITH THE GULF CUT OFF BY A NICE SURFACE RIDGE 
OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL U.S.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 110821
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 AM EST WED DEC 11 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
CLEAR AND DRY CONDITIONS ARE PREVAILING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION EARLY THIS MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE HAS BUILT
IN AT THE SURFACE. THE CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS HAVE ALLOWED
TEMPERATURES TO DROP TO THEIR COOLEST LEVELS OF THE MONTH SO
FAR...INTO THE UPPER TEENS TO MID 20S ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN
ZONES. LATER TODAY...SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AND MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS
WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB BACK INTO THE 40S TO AROUND 50
DEGREES BY THE AFTERNOON. THEN...A WEAK DRY SHORTWAVE/FRONT WILL
MOVE THROUGH THE AREA LATER TONIGHT...SHIFTING WINDS TO THE
NORTHWEST AND BRINGING IN ANOTHER REINFORCING SHOT OF COLDER
AIR...DROPPING SOME SHELTERED AREAS INTO THE MIDDLE TO UPPER
TEENS...WITH LOWER 20S PREVAILING IN MOST OTHER LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
FIND MODELS QUITE CONSISTENT WITH THE EARLY PERIODS OF THE
EXTENDED INTO SUNDAY. CONTINUED SUPPORT FOR HIGH POPS BY
SATURDAY...AS STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT DEVELOPS AHEAD OF THE SRN
STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS SHOULD SEND MOSTLY RAIN
OUR WAY...ALTHO THE DRY LOW LEVELS NOTED IN FORECAST SOUNDINGS WILL
ALLOW FOR EVAPORATIONAL COOLING. PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS
LOOKED GREAT FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. I CHOSE TO STAY WITH
CHANCE POPS FOR NE TN AND SW VA FOR NOW...AS THE DRY LOW LEVELS AND
A HINT OF SE DOWNSLOPE FLOW SHOULD INHIBIT MEASURABLE PCPN UNTIL
AFTER 12Z SATURDAY IN THOSE AREAS.

RAIN DIMINISHING FROM THE WEST SATURDAY NIGHT WITH A MIX OR BRIEF 
CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW IN NRN AREAS...AS IN CURRENT GRIDS. THREAT OF 
ANY SNOW FOR SUNDAY DOES NOT LOOK VERY IMPRESSIVE. THE UPPER FLOW IS 
QUICKLY ZONAL WITH NO INDICATION OF ANY WRAP AROUND MOISTURE. IN 
FACT ANY LINGERING MOISTURE BY 15Z TO 18Z SUNDAY IS BARELY SURFACE 
TO 850 MBS. THUS...I LOWERED THE SUNDAY POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR NE 
AREAS AND ERN MTNS BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...AND ALSO DROPPED POPS FOR 
SUNDAY NIGHT. 

OTHERWISE...KEEPING THU...FRI...MON AND TUE DRY AS IN PREVIOUS 
GRIDS. 11/00Z GFS MOS TEMPS VERY CLOSE TO 10/12Z GFS MOS...EXCEPT 
FOR A LARGE DEVIATION (00Z WARMER) FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THE 
ADVERTISED PATTERN IS NOT SUPPORTIVE OF THE MUCH WARMER 00Z MAXES
...SO I STAYED CLOSE TO A BLEND WHICH MESHES WELL WITH ADJACENT NWS 
GRIDS.


&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 101942
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EST TUE DEC 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...
FAIR AND COLD TONIGHT. A BRIEF WARM-UP WEDNESDAY WILL ALLOW
WEDNESDAY TO BE THE WARMEST DAY OF THE TODAY-TO-THURSDAY STRETCH...
BUT SHOULD STILL BE A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL. THOSE MILDER DAYTIME
TEMPS WEDNESDAY WILL BE DUE TO WESTERLY SFC WINDS AHEAD OF THE
NEXT COLD FRONT WHICH WILL USHER IN THE COLDER DAY THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS CONTINUE WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH LOWS IN
THE LOW TO MID 20S. A WEAK UPPER LEVEL WAVE BEGINS TO APPROACHES
THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY BRINGING ANOTHER SHOT OF
COLD AIR. MODELS STILL SHOW THE WAVE STAYING WELL NORTH TO OUR AREA
AND SHOULDNT HAVE TOO BIG OF AN IMPACT OTHER THAN COOLER TEMPS AND
SOME POSSIBLE CLOUDS ACROSS NETN AND SWVA. CLOUDS SHOULD BEGIN TO
CLEAR OUT THURSDAY AFTERNOON AS THE WAVE MOVE FURTHER OFF TO THE
NORTHEAST. HIGHS AND LOWS FOR THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT STILL LOOK TO
BE ROUGHLY 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.
 
FRIDAY STILL LOOKS LIKE A NICE DAY BUT THINGS CHANGE AS WE GET INTO 
FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY. MODELS STILL SHOWING A CUTOFF LOW OFF THE 
COAST OF CALIFORNIA THAT GETS SWEPT UP IN AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
COMING DOWN OUT OF THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST ON THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY. THE SYSTEM BEGINS TO APPROACH OUR AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY MORNING. TEMPS WARM SLIGHTLY ON FRIDAY OUT AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING WESTERN TROUGH WITH FRIDAY NIGHT TEMPS BEING 10 TO 15 
DEGREES WARMER THAN THURSDAY DUE TO A SHIFT TO A SW FLOW IN THE LOW 
AND MID LEVELS AND INCREASING CLOUDS. RAIN LOOKS TO BEGIN FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND CONTINUE THROUGH THE DAY ON SATURDAY AS THE SYSTEM MOVES 
ACROSS OUR AREA. A FEW ISOLATED AREAS ACROSS SWVA AND EXTREME NE TN 
COULD SEE SOME SNOW FLAKES EARLY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT/EARLY SATURDAY 
MORNING BEFORE SWITCHING TO ALL RAIN. A WARM RAIN EXPECTED ON 
SATURDAY AS TEMPS WILL BE NEAR 50 ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND MID 
TO UPPER 40S ELSEWHERE. LATEST MODELS STILL INDICATE THAT SOME 
WINTRY PRECIP IS POSSIBLE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AS COLDER AIR 
GETS PULLED INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM. WILL KEEP RAIN OR SNOW 
WORDING IN GRIDS AT THIS TIME. DETERMINING WHETHER WE SEE RAIN OR 
SNOW WILL DEPEND ON HOW SOON THE COLD AIR CAN PULL IN AND HOW MUCH 
PRECIP IS STILL AROUND OUR AREA. THE WEEKEND SYSTEM MOVES OFF TO THE 
EAST SUNDAY AFTERNOON/NIGHT WITH CLEARING CONDITIONS EXPECTED INTO 
MONDAY. MONDAY AND TUESDAY BOTH LOOK NICE WITH CALM WEATHER AND 
CLEAR SKIES. SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES EXPECTED BY TUESDAY WITH 
HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S.

FXUS64 KMRX 100831
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 AM EST TUE DEC 10 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RAIN MOVING NE ACROSS THE REGION 
AS EXPECTED THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...TEMPS REMAIN IN THE MID 30S TO 
MID 40S...EXCEPT FOR PERHAPS LOWER 30S ACROSS OUR NRN MOST PLATEAU 
COUNTIES. RUC MODEL SHOWS 850 MB TEMPS FALLING BELOW 0 DEGS CELSIUS 
ACROSS THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY AREAS BY 09Z TO 12Z...SO STILL 
SOME POTENTIAL FOR A BRIEF PERIOD OF ICING. ICE ACCUMS WERE LOWERED 
IN FORECAST GRIDS DUE TO SURFACE TEMPS STILL ABOVE FREEZING FOR A 
BIT LONGER. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW MAINLY LIGHT SNOW AS WEATHER TYPE 
AFTER 12Z AS THE AIRMASS COOLS QUICKLY...SO DOWNPLAYED FREEZING RAIN 
AND WENT WITH MAIN TYPE AS SNOW. ALL PCPN ENDS BY 16Z EVEN IN THE 
FAR NE AREAS. NO CHANGES MADE TO THE ADVISORY AREA OR ENDING TIME. 

OTHERWISE...STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION FAVORS GOING WITH OR BELOW THE 
COOLER MOS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY. CLEAR AND CHILLY TONIGHT AS SURFACE 
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE REGION.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
IN WAKE OF THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION ON 
TUESDAY...ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL PREVAIL FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 
WORK WEEK AS A SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. THIS WILL RESULT IN 
MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS...WITH HIGHS IN THE 40S TO LOWER 
50S. BY FRIDAY HOWEVER...CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY BE ON THE INCREASE AS 
ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND 
INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF THIS 
SYSTEM WILL INCREASE GULF MOISTURE ACROSS THE AREA AND ALLOW FOR 
PRECIPITATION TO OVERSPREAD THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. 
THEN AS THE BASE OF THE TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...COOLER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA 
AND RESULT IN THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME WINTERY PRECIPITATION 
/PARTICULARLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU... 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE/. ATTM 
THERE IS A GREAT DEAL OF UNCERTAINTY WITH RESPECT TO THE POTENTIAL 
IMPACT OF THE WINTER WEATHER GIVEN UNCERTAINTIES IN THE TIMING AND 
TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM. THUS...HAVE BEEN CAUTIOUS IN ADJUSTING THE 
FORECAST TOO MUCH ATTM...BUT HAVE INCREASED POPS TO SHOW A GREATER 
CONFIDENCE IN PRECIPITATION OCCURRING DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. THE 
PRECIPITATION WILL WANE ON SUNDAY...RESULTING IN DRY CONDITIONS TO 
BEGIN THE NEW WORK WEEK ON MONDAY.

UPSLOPE LOCATIONS.  A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT TONIGHT 
FOR THESE LOCATIONS.  ALL ON TRACK IN THE CURRENT FORECAST 
PACKAGE...WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 092031
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 PM EST MON DEC 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...
A QUICK HIT OF WINTRY PRECIP WILL DEVELOP TONIGHT...AS COLD AIR
ADVECTS INTO THE CWA FROM THE NW WHILE PRECIP BUILDS IN FROM OUR
SW. FIRST CHANCES FOR WINTRY PRECIP WILL BE THE PLATEAU
COUNTIES...WITH THE WINTER WEATHER LINE EASING SOUTHEASTWARD
THROUGH MORNING. PRECIP MOSTLY ENDS BY 9-11 AM TUES MORNING. PRECIP
WILL MAINLY BE IN FORM OF FREEZING RAIN...COLUMN MAY COOL ENOUGH
BEFORE MOISTURE MOVES OUT TO SEE A SWITCH OVER TO SLEET AND OR SNOW
ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE PRECIP SHIELD. WE KNOW TERRAIN WILL HAVE AN
IMPACT ON INDIVIDUAL REPORTS BUT GENERALLY EXPECTING ICE
ACCUMULATIONS TO REMAIN BELOW ONE QUARTER OF AN INCH...ANY SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS TO REMAIN BELOW 2 INCHES. THOSE TWO INCHES OF SNOW
WILL PROBABLY BE RESTRICTED TO ELEVATED UPSLOPE SIDES OF THE
PLATEAU AND THE HIGH KNOB AREA. WARM TONGUE ABOVE THE SURFACE
SHOULD PROHIBIT THE SMOKIES FROM SEEING MUCH. WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY WILL COVER THE PLATEAU DOWN TO MARION COUNTY...SW VA
COUNTIES...AND THE VA BORDER COUNTIES OF NE TN. PRECIP SHOULD BE
UNDERWAY BY LATE EVENING.
 
.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE EXTENDED IS MUCH LESS ACTIVE COMPARED TO THE PATTERN THAT WE
HAVE BEEN STUCK IN SINCE THE MIDDLE OF LAST WEEK. FIRST HALF OF
EXTENDED IS QUIET WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVING IN FRIDAY NIGHT AND
INTO THE WEEKEND.

PRECIP GONE BY TUESDAY NIGHT AS WE RETURN TO A ZONAL FLOW. SKIES
CLEAR TUESDAY NIGHT WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP INTO THE MID 20S AND
UPPER TEENS. CALM CONDITIONS CONTINUE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT
WITH CLEAR SKIES. WEDNESDAY HIGHS ROUGHLY 5 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL
AND WED NIGHT LOWS AROUND 7 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. ANOTHER SHOT OF
COLD AIR...ALONG WITH A WEAK UPPER LEVEL WAVE...APPROACHES THE AREA
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING BUT SHOULD STAY WELL NORTH OF
OUR AREA. THIS SHOULDNT HAVE TOO BIG OF AN IMPACT OTHER THAN
COOLER TEMPERATURES AND SOME POSSIBLE CLOUDS ACROSS NETN AND SWVA.
CLOUDS SHOULD BEGIN TO CLEAR OUT THURSDAY AFTERNOON AS THE WAVE
MOVE FURTHER OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. HIGHS AND LOWS FOR
THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT LOOK TO BE AROUND 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL.
 
FRIDAY LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE THE LAST NICE WEATHER DAY OF THE PERIOD 
UNTIL CONDITIONS BEGIN TO IMPROVE ON MONDAY. CUTOFF LOW OFF THE 
COAST OF CALIFORNIA GETS SWEPT UP IN AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH COMING 
DOWN OUT OF THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST ON THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. THE 
SYSTEM IS ACROSS TEXAS ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND WILL BEGIN TO 
APPROACH OUR AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING. A BRIEF 
RETURN TO A SW FLOW AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM ON FRIDAY WILL INCREASE OUR 
TEMPS FRIDAY AROUND 6 TO 8 DEGREES COMPARED TO THURSDAY. CLOUDS 
INCREASE LATE AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY EVENING WITH LOWS ABOUT 10 
DEGREES WARMER THAN THURSDAY NIGHT DUE TO SW FLOW AND INCREASED 
CLOUD COVER. RAIN LOOKS TO BEGIN FRIDAY NIGHT AND LOOKS LIKELY 
THROUGH THE DAY ON SATURDAY AS THE SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS OUR AREA. 
TEMPS WILL BE EVEN WARMER ON SATURDAY WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER 50S IN 
THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND NEAR 50 FOR THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND NETN. LATEST 
GFS RUN INDICATES THAT THERE COULD BE SOME WINTRY PRECIP LATER 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM AS IT 
PULLS COLDER AIR IN. ITS DIFFICULT TO SAY AT THIS TIME ON HOW MUCH 
IF ANY WINTRY PRECIP WE WILL SEE. THIS IS BECAUSE IT REALLY DEPENDS 
ON HOW/WHEN/WHERE THE CUTOFF LOW AND TROUGH PHASE TOGETHER ON FRIDAY 
AND THEN TRYING TO DETERMINE THE EXACT TRACK OF THAT SYSTEM. THE WEEKEND 
SYSTEM MOVES OFF TO THE EAST SUNDAY AFTERNOON/NIGHT WITH CLEARING 
CONDITIONS EXPECTED INTO MONDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       33  38  23  46  25 / 100  40  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 090923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
423 AM EST MON DEC 9 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...RAIN CONTINUES TO TRACK NE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...ALTHOUGH NOT AS SOLID 
COVERAGE OVERALL. SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY WAS NOTED THROUGH 12Z 
TODAY...MAINLY ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC. LATEST TRENDS WERE FOR 
LIGHTNING TO DECREASE TO OUR SOUTH...SO NO MENTION OF TSRA WITH 
TODAYS GRIDS. 

EXPECTING THE RAIN TO TAPER OFF FROM THE WEST THIS AFTERNOON AS THE 
COLD FRONT SLIPS TO OUR EAST. YET ANOTHER WAVE DEVELOPS ON THE FRONT 
EARLY TONIGHT...SPREADING MORE RAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
OVERNIGHT. MODELS TRENDING COLDER FOR LATE TONIGHT AND ON TUESDAY... 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS NRN AREAS. DROPPED TEMPS DOWN AND CHANGED RAIN 
OVER TO LIGHT SNOW OVER NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA...PLUS A MENTION OF 
LIGHT FREEZING RAIN. ALLOWING FOR UP TO 2 INCHES OF SNOW 
ACCUMULATION IN WISE COUNTY VA THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING...AND UP TO 1 
INCH OVER THE REMAINDER OF SW VA. KEPT ANY ICING TO JUST A FEW 
HUNDREDTHS FOR NOW. 

NO ADVISORY ISSUED AT THIS POINT...AS CONFIDENCE ON GETTING ADVISORY 
SNOW AMOUNTS IS LOW. UPSLOPE FLOW DOESNT DEVELOP UNTIL 15Z TUESDAY 
WHEN MOISTURE IS DECREASING...AND PROGGED LOW LEVEL CAPE IS LIMITED. 
WILL MENTION THIS WINTRY WX POTENTIAL IN HWO AND A SPECIAL WEATHER 
STATEMENT. 

GFS MOS TEMPS REASONABLE FOR ALL PERIODS...BUT I OPTED FOR COOLER 
TEMPS WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE FINALLY
SHUTS OFF PRECIPITATION TUESDAY NIGHT. SKIES CLEAR AND TEMPERATURES
DROP INTO THE UPPER TEENS TO MID 20S. DRY TREND TO CONTINUE THROUGH
FRIDAY WITH COOL DAYS AND COLD NIGHTS. WEAK SYSTEM TO PASS JUST
NORTH OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT SO COULD HAVE A FEW CLOUDS OVER 
SW VA. REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR MOVES IN THURSDAY AND FRIDAY
FOR MOSTLY SUNNY DAYS AND ANOTHER COLD NIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT. FRIDAY
LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AS SURFACE HIGH
SHIFTS EAST. RETURN FLOW MOISTURE FRIDAY NIGHT OVER COLD AIR MASS
PRODUCES SOME WINTER PRECIPITATION. RIGHT NOW LOOKS LIKE SOME SNOW
OR POSSIBLE FREEZING RAIN LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY
BEFORE TEMPERATURES WARM. THE ONLY AREA AFFECTED BY WINTER
PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND NE TN AND SW VA.
THIS WEEKEND SYSTEM TAKES A MORE SOUTHERN TRACK ALONG THE GULF
COAST AND IF ENOUGH COLD AIR COMES IN ON THE BACK SIDE OF IT THE
RAIN COULD CHANGE TO SNOW SUNDAY. RIGHT NOW WILL KEEP IT MOSTLY A
COLD RAIN BUT LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO ADD MORE SNOW.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TOMORROW)...THE SAME OVERALL PATTERN
AND THEME CONTINUES DUE TO A MEAN SW FLOW THAT CONTINUES TO STREAM
MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. ANOTHER ROUND OF MODERATE TO LOCALLY HEAVY

AND CENTRAL VALLEY. CURRENT RADAR IMAGERY SHOWS THAT THIS ACTIVITY EXTENDS
ALL THE WAY DOWN INTO LOUISIANA AND IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE MOVING
ACROSS OUR AREA OVERNIGHT AND THROUGH TOMORROW. ABUNDANT MOISTURE
ALONG WITH A 35 TO 45 KNOT 850MB JET WILL HELP TO SUPPORT POSSIBLE
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. THE BULK OF THE PRECIP LOOKS TO OCCUR
BETWEEN THE 00 UTC AND 12 UTC HOUR WHERE AMOUNTS FROM ONE AND A
HALF INCHES UP TO 2 INCHES OF RAIN ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS A FEW
LOCATIONS. MOST AREAS WILL SEE ONE TO ONE AND A HALF INCHES OF RAINFALL.
OVERNIGHT MINS WONT FLUCTUATE MUCH FROM THE CURRENT TEMPS AS DENSE
CLOUD COVER AND LOW LEVEL WAA WILL NOT ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP MUCH IF
ANY OVERNIGHT. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A RUMBLE OF THUNDER OR
TWO AFTER MIDNIGHT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AS THERE WILL BE SOME
ELEVATED INSTABILITY PRESENT.

RAIN CONTINUES TOMORROW BUT SHOULD BEGIN TO TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO 
EAST THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS. TEMPS WILL BE A  DEGREE OR TWO 
WARMER TOMORROW.  



.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...FAIRLY PROGRESSIVE PATTERN 
WILL BE NOTED THROUGH THE EXTENDED AS THE CURRENT WESTERN H5 TROF 
MOVES TO THE EASTERN U.S. EARLY IN THE PERIOD. RESULTING WEATHER 
WILL BE WARM SECTOR PRECIP EVENT AS THE WESTERN TROUGH APPROACHES TN 
AND TAPS GULF MOISTURE. FOLLOWING...FAIR WEATHER AND COOL TEMPS WILL 
OCCUR FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK. BUT IF YOU LIKE WET 
WEEKENDS THEN TAKE HEART FOR ANOTHER ONE IS SHAPING UP...AS A NEW 
WESTERN TROUGH WILL MOVE OUT OF THE ROCKIES INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
AND TAP INTO THE GULF ONCE AGAIN...SPREADING RAIN ACROSS THE AREA FOR 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
446 AM EST SUN DEC 8 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN AREA OF WINTRY PCPN
CONTINUES TO OUR WEST ACROSS MOST OF MIDDLE TN NE INTO EASTERN KY
THIS MORNING. RAIN FINALLY STARTING TO DEVELOP TO OUR SOUTH ACROSS
NRN AL AND NRN GA. SURFACE ANALYSIS FROM 06Z TO 08Z...PLUS MODEL
FORECAST SOUNDINGS...SEEM TO PIN DOWN THE AREAS FOR A BRIEF PERIOD
OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET TO SCOTT COUNTY TN AND WISE COUNTY
VA. CALLS MADE TO ADJACENT COUNTIES ALONG NRN PLATEAU INTO LEE
COUNTY VA REVEALED A CHILLY LIGHT RAIN OR NO PCPN AT ALL. WISE
COUNTY DISPATCH REPORTED A LIGHT ICY RAIN IN COEBURN WITH ROADS
WEST TO KY LINE GETTING A BIT OF ICING. THIS ALL FITS WELL WITH OUR
CURRENT FREEZING RAIN ADVISORY WHICH WILL RUN THROUGH 7AM EST.

WILL RUN A PRE FIRST PERIOD FOR FORECAST AS THE WINTRY PCPN LOOKS TO 
END IN OUR AREA BY 12Z TODAY...TRANSITIONING TO ALL RAIN AS LOW 
LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION WORKS N-NE. MAX TEMPS TRICKY AND ARE 
DEPENDENT ON HOW FAR NE THE WARM FRONT REACHES. CLOUDS AND RAIN LED 
ME TO UNDERCUT GFS MOS MAXES...WHICH ALSO MESHED BETTER WITH 
ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. WENT AT LEAST CLOSER TO MOS BLEND FOR MAXES SW 
OF PROGGED WARM FRONT LOCATION...AND ALSO FOR TRI WHERE DOWNSLOPING 
E TO SE WINDS OCCUR.

NOT A LOT TO SAY ABOUT TONIGHT...EXCEPT THAT THE RAIN SHOULD 
CONTINUE. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS AS IN PREVIOUS GRIDS 
ALTHOUGH SOUNDINGS ARE COOL IN THE LOW LEVELS AND WARM ALOFT...NOT 
EXACTLY SUPPORTIVE OF TSRA. THIS LIMITS INSTABILITY TO ELEVATED TO 
MY THINKING. QUITE MILD FOR MIN TEMPS TONIGHT WITH GFS OR BLEND 
CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...RAIN CONTINUES MONDAY AS
FRONT DRAPED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA MOVES SLOWLY EAST. CONTINUED
WARMING TEMPERATURES BUT WITH RAINFALL HIGHS STILL ONLY CLIMB TO
THE UPPER 40S TO THE LOWER 50S. RAINFALL AMOUNTS COULD BE HEAVY
DURING THE MORNING HOURS EASTERN AREAS THEN SHIFT EAST OUT OF THE
REGION AFTER 18Z AS LOW PRESSURE MOVES NORTHEAST ALONG THE FRONT.
THE RAIN DECREASES LATE MONDAY AND EARLY MONDAY NIGHT BEFORE MODELS
DEVELOP ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TO THE SW WITH MORE PRECIPITATION MOVING
ACROSS THE EASTERN TN VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. WITH CLOUD
COVER AND RAIN TEMPERATURES WILL BE SLOW TO FALL MONDAY NIGHT WITH
LOWS TUESDAY MORNING MOSTLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 30S. PARTS OF THE
PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA MAY REACH THE LOWER 30S. AS
ATMOSPHERE COOLS ALOFT THERE MAY BE SOME SLEET MONDAY NIGHT AND
SNOW BUT LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION. EARLY TUESDAY RAIN CHANGES TO
SNOW BUT ONLY SLIGHT ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED...MAINLY HIGHER
ELEVATIONS AND IN THE MORNING BEFORE ATMOSPHERE BEGINS TO DRY OUT
AND TEMPERATURES BECOME TO WARM. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN TUESDAY
NIGHT AND CONTINUES A DRY PATTERN OVER THE REGION THROUGH THURSDAY
NIGHT. NEXT SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER TEXAS FRIDAY THEN TREKS EAST INTO
THE LOWER MS VALLEY AND TN VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. LOWS
FRIDAY NIGHT WILL BE IN THE 30S AND SOME SNOW COULD MIX IN
INITIALLY BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN. THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE MAINLY
THROUGH THE GULF COAST STATES ON SATURDAY WITH THE FORECAST AREA ON
THE NORTHERN FRINGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EST SAT DEC 7 2013

.DISCUSSION...THE COLD FRONT THAT PUSHED THROUGH THE REGION ON 
FRIDAY STALLED TO OUR SOUTH AND WILL LIFT NORTH ACROSS THE AREA ONCE 
AGAIN BEGINNING LATE TONIGHT.  THIS WILL RETURN DEEP GULF MOISTURE 
ACROSS THE AREA AND BRING A SLIGHTLY WARMER AIR MASS IN BEHIND THE 
BOUNDARY.  AS A RESULT...ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP AND 
MOVE IN FROM SOUTH TO NORTH LATE TONIGHT.  CONFIDENCE IS HIGH THAT 
LOCATIONS GENERALLY AROUND AND SOUTH OF I40 WILL REMAIN ABOVE 
FREEZING FOR ALL RAIN.  FURTHER NORTH SOME LOCATIONS WILL FALL TO OR 
BELOW FREEZING...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...THE NORTHEAST TN MOUNTAINS AND PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA.  
THESE LOCATIONS COULD SEE POCKETS OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN...THOUGH 
MOST OF THESE AREAS WILL RECEIVE A TRACE TO A COUPLE HUNDREDTHS.  
HOWEVER...WISE COUNTY VA AND SCOTT COUNTY TN COULD SEE AROUND A 
TENTH OF AN INCH OF ICE ACCUMULATIONS AND A FREEZING RAIN ADVISORY 
IS IN EFFECT OVERNIGHT FOR THOSE LOCATIONS.  ALL ON TRACK IN THE 
CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE ZONE PACKAGE TO REMOVE EVENING 
WORDING.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 072052
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
352 PM EST SAT DEC 7 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT)...ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIP BEGINS TO MOVE IN 
OVER NIGHT WITH THE RETURN OF GULF MOISTURE. THE MAJORITY OF OUR 
AREA WILL SEE LIQUID PRECIP DUE TO STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION AT 850MB 
AND ABOVE FREEZING SURFACE TEMPS. MOST AREAS COULD RECEIVE UP TO ONE 
QUARTER OF AN INCH OF RAIN BY 12 UTC TOMORROW MORNING. PRECIP BEGINS 
TO MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN AREAS AROUND 06 UTC AND UP INTO NETN AND 
SWVA BETWEEN 09 AND 12 UTC. IT LOOKS AS IF THERE COULD BE SOME 
TROUBLE SPOTS FURTHER NORTH IN REGARDS TO LIGHT FREEZING RAIN AND 
MINOR ICE ACCUMULATIONS. THE MAIN AREAS OF CONCERN APPEAR TO BE 
SCOTT COUNTY TN AND WISE COUNTY VA WHICH ARE UNDER A FREEZING RAIN 
ADVISORY BEGINNING AT 06 UTC AND LASTING THROUGH 12 UTC TOMORROW MORNING. 
CURRENT MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THAT THESE AREAS WILL STAY COLD 
ENOUGH TO POSSIBLY RECEIVE UP TO ONE TENTH OF AN INCH OF ICE 
ACCUMULATION BEFORE SWITCHING OVER TO ALL RAIN TOMORROW MORNING. 
OTHER AREAS NOT IN THE ADVISORY...INCLUDING THE REST OF THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU...SWVA AND EXTREME NETN...WILL LIKELY SEE A BRIEF PERIOD OF 
LIGHT FREEZING RAIN BEFORE SWITCHING OVER TO ALL RAIN BUT ICE 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED TO ONLY BE A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH IF 
ANY DUE TO SURFACE TEMPS CLIMBING ABOVE FREEZING QUICKER THAN SCOTT 
AND WISE. 

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY THROUGH SATURDAY/...PICKING UP THE FORECAST AFTER 
WINTRY THREAT HAS WANED SUNDAY MORNING.  SHOULD BE LONG DURATION OF 
RAIN.  ANY FLOODING DURING THIS PERIOD SHOULD BE LIMITED.  EXPECTED 
AMOUNTS ARE ONLY BETWEEN 1-2 INCHES IN THE SUNDAY/MONDAY TIMEFRAME 
WITH INCH EAST AND 2 INCHES WESTERN AREAS.  HOWEVER...THE OVERALL 
4-5 DAY TOTALS MAY CAUSE SOME MINOR FLOODING OF LARGER 
STREAMS...RIVERS...AND OTHER FLOOD-PRONE LOW-LYING AREAS.

AFTER MIDNIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT ELEVATED INSTABILITY COMES STREAMING OVER 
THE SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA.  LOOKS LIKE A SLIGHT THREAT OF SOME 
THUNDER MONDAY BETWEEN 06Z AND 15Z.  WILL PLAN ON THE SOUTHERN 2 
TIERS OF COUNTIES TO HAVE THUNDER INCLUDED.

THE WINDS WILL PICK UP SUNDAY AS THE RETURN FLOW SETS UP.  NOT A 
GOOD ORIENTATION OF THE WIND OVERALL FOR A MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT.  
BEST WINDS ABOUT 15Z WITH SOME DOWNSLOPING...BUT THEN WINDS VEER FOR 
THE AFTERNOON AND GET ALIGNED WITH THE RIDGELINE ALONG THE TN/NC 
BORDER.  FOR NOW WILL NOT ISSUE ANY ADVISORY. 

ON TUESDAY COLDER AIR WILL BE PUSHING INTO THE AREA...FOR SNOW 
ACCUMULATION...PUTTING IN A COUPLE OF TENTHS FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON 
IN THE NW SECTIONS...ALSO MAY HAVE SOME ACCUMULATION TUESDAY NIGHT 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN 1/3 OF THE AREA...WITH THE LAST WAVE OF 
MOISTURE/LIFT.  THIS IS JUST BEYOND THE CURRENT SNOW AMOUNT FORECAST 
GRIDS...BUT GENERALLY THINK IT WOULD BE LESS THAN 1 INCH.  THIS IS 
MOSTLY SYNOPTIC MID LEVEL LIFT RATHER THAN UPSLOPE OF LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE...SO NOT EXPECTING MOUNTAINS TO GET MUCH ENHANCEMENT.

AFTER ALL THE PRECIPITATION FINALLY MOVES OUT OF THE AREA...IT 
SHOULD TURN DRY FOR 2-3 DAYS.  GOING A FEW DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE 
FOR THIS DRY PERIOD.  THEN TOWARD THE WEEKEND THE NEXT SYSTEM IN THE 
GULF WILL MAKE A RUN TOWARD THE AREA...ALTHOUGH THE LATER MODEL RUNS 
ARE TRACKING THIS SYSTEM FARTHER SOUTH.  ALSO HAVE KEPT ALL THE 
PRECIP WITH THIS SYSTEM LIQUID FOR NOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EST SAT DEC 7 2013

.DISCUSSION...THE CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. SURFACE OBS INDICATE 
ALL AREAS HAVE CHANGED TO RAIN AT THIS POINT EXCEPT FOR ISOLATED 
SPOTS ACROSS WISE COUNTY VA. WISE COUNTY MAY STILL SEE A WINTER MIX 
OVER THE NEXT HOUR OR SO AS WELL AS A FEW SLICK ROADWAYS BEFORE 
CHANGING OVER TO ALL RAIN. ALL AREAS WILL SEE RAIN TODAY AS A MEAN 
SW FLOW WILL KEEP GULF MOISTURE STREAMING INTO OUR AREA. 
HOWEVER...THE HEAVIEST RAINS LOOK LIKE THEY WILL CONTINUE TO STAY 
WEST OF I-75 AND I-80 WHICH WILL ALLOW THESE AREAS TO POTENTIALLY 
PICK UP BETWEEN ONE HALF AND THREE QUARTERS OF AN INCH OF RAIN WITH 
LOCALIZED HIGHER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE. AREAS TO THE EAST OF I-75 AND 
I-80 WILL LIKELY SEE LESSER AMOUNTS BETWEEN ONE QUARTER AND UP TO 
ONE HALF INCH. DENSE CLOUD COVER WILL REMAIN THE REST OF THE DAY BUT 
DOWNSLOPING WINDS MAY ALLOW FOR SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS ALONG THE 
FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS ACROSS COCKE...GREENE...AND WASHINGTON 
COUNTY TN. LOW LEVEL WAA WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HELPING 
TO RAISE TEMPS INTO THE MID TO UPPER 40S ACROSS THE EXTREME SOUTHERN 
AREAS...MID 40S IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY...LOWER TO MID 40S FOR NE 
TN...AND NEAR 40 TO LOWER 40S FOR SWVA. NO UPDATES PLANNED AT THIS 
TIME OTHER THAN TO REMOVE MORNING WORDING FROM A FEW OF THE ZONE 
GROUPINGS. NEW ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

FXUS64 KMRX 070949
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
449 AM EST SAT DEC 7 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THANKFULL TO SEE THE MAIN AREA
OF RAIN MOVING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING. MAY SEE SOME
LINGERING PATCHY LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE THIS MORNING...AND I
INCLUDED A MENTION OF LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE IN THE COLDEST SPOTS
OF NRN AREAS SUCH AS NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA.

ENJOY THIS BRIEF BREAK IN WET WEATHER TODAY AS GULF MOISTURE QUICKLY 
RETURNS TONIGHT. VERY GOOD AGREEMENT IN TIMING THIS NEXT ROUND OF 
WET WEATHER AMONGST MOST MODELS...WITH RAIN REACHING WELL INTO SRN 
1/2 OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 06Z SUNDAY...THEN ONTO REMAINDER OF NRN 
AREAS BEFORE 12Z SUNDAY. THE WARM AIR ADVECTION IS STRONG WITH 850 
MB TEMPS WARMING IN THE SMOKIES TO 8 TO 10 DEGS CELSIUS BY 12Z 
SUNDAY. MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A CHANCE...JUST A CHANCE...
OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET LATE TONIGHT ACROSS NRN MOST 
COUNTIES OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SW VA AND POSSIBLY ERN MOST 
PARTS OF JOHNSON AND CARTER COUNTIES IN FAR NE TN. 

OTHERWISE...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE TO MAX/MIN TEMP GRIDS AS GFS 
MOS LOOKED GOOD FOR TODAY. I DID NUDGE MIN TEMPS UP JUST A BIT 
ACROSS SRN AREAS FOR TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RAIN INCREASES AGAIN SUNDAY
THROUGH MONDAY AS SURFACE LOW NORTH OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO THE
SOUTH CONTINUES TO BRING MOISTURE OVER IT. FIRST WAVE OF RAIN MOVES
THROUGH SUNDAY THEN ANOTHER SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS AND MOVES
NORTHEAST INTO THE TN VALLEY MONDAY FOR EVEN MORE RAIN...POSSIBLY
HEAVY. NAM MODEL THEN BRINGS A THIRD LOW PRESSURE AREA NORTHEAST
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH THE LOW PASSING ALONG THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN CREST JUST SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH SYSTEM
FINALLY EXITING THE REGION BY TUESDAY EVENING. GFS LESS AGGRESSIVE
WITH THE LAST PART OF THE SYSTEM AND HAS LAST LOW FARTHER SOUTH IN
GEORGIA MOVING NE INTO THE CAROLINAS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.THIS
SCENARIO WOULD MEAN LESS RAIN AFFECTING THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY AND COLDER TEMPERATURES. TEMPERATURES WARM INTO THE 40S MONDAY
THEN ONLY COOL A FEW DEGREES SUNDAY NIGHT. WARMER TEMPERATURES
MONDAY BEFORE COLD AIR MOVES SOUTHEAST LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND
TUESDAY. RAIN CHANGES TO SNOW LATE MONDAY NIGHT OR TUESDAY MORNING
MAINLY PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. TEMPERATURES MONDAY NIGHT
ONLY DROPPING A COUPLE DEGREES BELOW FREEZING PLATEAU AND PART OF
SW VA SO ONLY LIGHT ACCUMULATION AMOUNTS EXPECTED. HIGHS TUESDAY
MID 30S HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO MID 40S SOUTH. RIVER FLOODING MAY BE A
CONCERN BY MONDAY OR TUESDAY DUE TO THE PROLONGED RAINFALL EVENT
THAT BEGINS AGAIN LATE TONIGHT. RAINFALL AMOUNTS FROM EARLY SUNDAY
TO TUESDAY HOWEVER LOOK TO BE MOSTLY 2 TO 3 INCHES ON AVERAGE.
HIGH PRESSURE TAKES HOLD TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT BUT
NEW SYSTEM APPROACHES FRIDAY WITH CHANCE OF RAIN SOUTHWEST SECTIONS
LATE IN THE DAY.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1240 AM EST SAT DEC 7 2013

.AVIATION...A COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY MOVE THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT.  A WIDE BAND OF SHOWERS IS 
EXITING THE AREA...BUT THE LOW CLOUDS AND VISBY WITH ASSOCIATED MVFR 
TO IFR CONDITIONS WILL STAY OVER THE TAF SITES THROUGHOUT THE 
NIGHT.  COOLER AIR SLOWLY SLIDING IN BEHIND THE FRONT WILL DROP 
TEMPERATURES TO NEAR FREEZING OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS...MAINLY NORTH 
OF TRI.  THESE AREAS COULD SEE POCKETS OF VERY LIGHT FREEZING RAIN 
OR DRIZZLE BETWEEN 08Z AND 12Z.  THE FRONT WILL STALL TO OUR SOUTH 
LATER TODAY...PROVIDING A BREAK IN PRECIP...ALLOWING CLOUDS AND 
VISBY TO LIFT TO VFR CONDITIONS BY THIS AFTERNOON.  

HOWEVER...CONDITIONS WILL BEGIN TO DETERIORATE ONCE AGAIN SATURDAY 
EVENING AS THE FRONT LIFTS BACK INTO THE AREA...PROVIDING ANOTHER 
ROUND OF LOW CIGS AND VISBY WITH SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN DEVELOPING 
PRIOR TO 06Z SUNDAY.  ALONG WITH THE RAIN...MVFR CONDITIONS WILL 
RETURN AND THEN DROP INTO IFR OR LOWER CATEGORY IN THE 06Z TO 12Z 
PERIOD SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST FRI DEC 6 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH MUCH COLDER AIR MOVING 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. IN FACT...FREEZING TEMPS HAVE PUSHED INTO 
SOUTHEAST KY...AND WERE NEARING THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
CUMBERLAND MTN RANGE. PHONE CALLS TO DISPATCHES IN WISE COUNTY VA 
AND SCOTT COUNTY TN INDICATE RAIN IN THESE COUNTIES WITH NO ROAD 
PROBLEMS. AREA RADARS REVEAL THE BACK EDGE OF THE RAIN APPROACHING 
THESE AREAS...SO THESE AREAS MAY BE ABLE TO ESCAPE THE POSSIBILITY 
OF FREEZING RAIN AND ICING PROBLEMS TONIGHT...BUT WILL NEED TO 
CONTINUE MONITORING FOR ANY CHANGES. OTHERWISE...RAIN SHOULD 
GRADUALLY DECREASE IN COVERAGE OVERNIGHT...AS COLDER AIR SLOWLY 
FILTERS INTO THE FORECAST AREA.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK FOR TONIGHT...BUT 
WILL UPDATE LATER THIS EVENING TO REMOVE ANY EVENING WORDING.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 062056 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 PM EST FRI DEC 6 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SHALLOW COLD FRONT HAS HUGGED 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING. STRONG LOW LEVEL INVERSION 
FROM 1400-3000 FEET WEST OF THE COLD FRONT. THIS FEATURE IS 
TRAPPING STRATUS CLOUDS ACROSS THE EAST TN VALLEY TODAY. TAIL END OF 
STRENGTHENING UPPER JET WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE TN VALLEY 
TONIGHT. RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF JET WILL ENHANCE LIFT AND AID IN 
THE DEVELOPMENT OF ELEVATED CONVECTION BETWEEN FRONT AND UPPER JET. 
BEST CHANCES FOR CONVECTION WILL BE BETWEEN 9PM AND 1 AM. MOST AREAS 
SHOULD SEE AN ADDITIONAL INCH OF RAINFALL. COLDER AIR BEGINS 
FILTERING IN OVERNIGHT. SOME MIXED PRECIPITATION WILL LIKELY OCCUR 
ON BACK SIDE OF PRECIPITATION. RELATIVELY HIGH FREEZING LEVEL WILL 
DROP DOWN TO AROUND 1500 FEET BY DAY BREAK. AREAS ALONG THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND PORTIONS OF NE TN MAY 
SEE SOME LIGHT ICE ACCRETION PRIMARILY ALONG TREE LIMBS AND POWER 
LINES. CONDITIONS SHOULD CLEAR OUT BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON WITH SOME 
HIGH CLOUDINESS IN UPPER SW FLOW. TONIGHT TEMPERATURE WILL BE NEAR 
STEADY OR FALL SLOWLY WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES IN THE SATURDAY 
MORNING HOURS. AFTERNOON HIGHS WILL REMAIN COOL...MAINLY IN THE 
40S.  

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/...STILL LOOKING TO THIS 
NEXT SYSTEM THAT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND WILL 
CONTINUE WITH PRECIPITATION THROUGH MONDAY...THEN START TO TAPER OFF.

THERE ARE SEVERAL CONCERNS/ITEMS OF INTEREST....WILL BREAK THEM DOWN 
HERE...

1...WILL THERE BE ANY FREEZING PRECIP ON THE FRONT SIDE OF THIS 
SYSTEM SATURDAY NIGHT AS THE PRECIPITATION OVERSPREADS A COLD/COOL 
AIR MASS?  ONLY SMALL AMOUNTS...THINK THAT MOST FAVORED AREAS ARE IN 
THE NORTHWARD DRAINING BASINS...NORTHERN CAMPBELL AND SCOTT COUNTIES 
IN TN...AROUND THE TOWN OF THE JELLICO...AND NORTHERN WISE COUNTY IN 
VA...WHERE NORTHEAST SURFACE WINDS WILL TRAP COLD AIR IN THESE 
VALLEYS.  RIGHT NOW LOOKS LIKE LITTLE IF ANY IMPACT...AND FOR IMPACT 
IT WOULD BE VERY LOCALIZED.

2...WILL THERE BE FLOODING RAINS DURING THIS LONG 
DURATION...SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY?  ANY FLOODING DURING THIS 
PERIOD SHOULD BE LIMITED.  EXPECTED AMOUNTS ARE ONLY BETWEEN 1-2 
INCHES...1 INCH EAST AND 2 INCHES WESTERN AREAS...AND THIS IS SPREAD 
OVER A PERIOD OF TWO DAYS.  HOWEVER...THE OVERALL 4-5 DAY TOTALS MAY 
CAUSE SOME MINOR FLOODING OF LARGER STREAMS...RIVERS...AND OTHER 
FLOOD-PRONE LOW-LYING AREAS.

3...WILL THERE BE A MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WIND EVENT SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT?  RIGHT NOW...THIS LOOKS TO BE A VERY MINIMAL WIND EVENT.  THE 
WINDS ARE NOT OVERLY STRONG AND ALSO ALIGN PRETTY QUICKLY WITH THE 
SPINE OF THE MOUNTAINS...WHEREAS IN GOOD WIND EVENTS...THE WINDS ARE 
FROM THE SOUTH OR SOUTHEAST CROSSING THE MOUNTAINS.

4...WILL THERE BE THUNDER DURING THE WARM ADVECTION PHASE SUNDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY?  LOOKS LIKE MOST OF THE THUNDER WILL STAY SOUTH OF 
THE AREA...WILL NOT MENTION THUNDER IN THE FORECASTS FOR SUNDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY.

5...WILL THE BACK SIDE OF ALL THIS PRECIP HAVE ANY MEANINGFUL WINTRY 
PRECIPITATION ON MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY?  RAIN SHOWERS WILL BE 
TURNING TO SNOW SHOWERS AS THE COLDER AIR MOVES IN.  THERE IS A 
LITTLE MORE MOISTURE IN THE FLOW THAT COULD ENHANCE THE POSSIBILITY 
OF A MEASURABLE SNOW...ESPECIALLY IN THE MOUNTAINS FOR LATE MONDAY 
NIGHT AND INTO TUESDAY...STILL A LITTLE EARLY TO DEFINE THIS.

6...HOW COLD WILL THE TEMPERATURES BE NEXT WEEK?  LOOKS PRETTY 
COLD...BUT NOT AS COLD AS IT DID IN YESTERDAYS MODELS.

7...WHEN THE NEXT SYSTEM COMES IN FOR LATE NEXT WEEK...WILL THERE BE 
ANY WINTRY PRECIPITATION?  WHEN THIS SYSTEM COMES IN...THE MODELS 
AGREE THAT THE WARMER AIR AND MOISTURE WILL COME INTO THE AREA 
TOGETHER...THEREBY MINIMIZING THE CHANCES FOR WINTER PRECIPITATION.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             37  46  40  47  45 / 100  10  90 100  90 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  38  44  36  46  43 / 100  20  80  90  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       35  43  35  44  42 / 100  10  80  90  90 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              38  41  34  46  37 / 100  20  80  80  90 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

VA...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 PM EST FRI DEC 6 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SHALLOW COLD FRONT HAS HUGGED 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING. STRONG LOW LEVEL INVERSION 
FROM 1400-3000 FEET WEST OF THE COLD FRONT. THIS FEATURE IS 
TRAPPING STRATUS CLOUDS ACROSS THE EAST TN VALLEY TODAY. TAIL END OF 
STRENGTHENING UPPER JET WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE TN VALLEY 
TONIGHT. RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF JET WILL ENHANCE LIFT AND AID IN 
THE DEVELOPMENT OF ELEVATED CONVECTION BETWEEN FRONT AND UPPER JET. 
BEST CHANCES FOR CONVECTION WILL BE BETWEEN 9PM AND 1 AM. MOST AREAS 
SHOULD SEE AN ADDITIONAL INCH OF RAINFALL. COLDER AIR BEGINS 
FILTERING IN OVERNIGHT. SOME MIXED PRECIPITATION WILL LIKELY OCCUR 
ON BACK SIDE OF PRECIPITATION. RELATIVELY HIGH FREEZING LEVEL WILL 
DROP DOWN TO AROUND 1500 FEET BY DAY BREAK. AREAS ALONG THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND PORTIONS OF NE TN MAY 
SEE SOME LIGHT ICE ACCRETION PRIMARILY ALONG TREE LIMBS AND POWER 
LINES. CONDITIONS SHOULD CLEAR OUT BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON WITH SOME 
HIGH CLOUDINESS IN UPPER SW FLOW. TONIGHT TEMPERATURE WILL BE NEAR 
STEADY OR FALL SLOWLY WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES IN THE SATURDAY 
MORNING HOURS. AFTERNOON HIGHS WILL REMAIN COOL...MAINLY IN THE 
40S.  

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/...STILL LOOKING TO THIS 
NEXT SYSTEM THAT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND WILL 
CONTINUE WITH PRECIPITATION THROUGH MONDAY...THEN START TO TAPER OFF.

THERE ARE SEVERAL CONCERNS/ITEMS OF INTEREST....WILL BREAK THEM DOWN 
HERE...

1...WILL THERE BE ANY FREEZING PRECIP ON THE FRONT SIDE OF THIS 
SYSTEM SATURDAY NIGHT AS THE PRECIPITATION OVERSPREADS A COLD/COOL 
AIR MASS?  ONLY SMALL AMOUNTS...THINK THAT MOST FAVORED AREAS ARE IN 
THE NORTHWARD DRAINING BASINS...NORTHERN CAMPBELL AND SCOTT COUNTIES 
IN TN...AROUND THE TOWN OF THE JELLICO...AND NORTHERN WISE COUNTY IN 
VA...WHERE NORTHEAST SURFACE WINDS WILL TRAP COLD AIR IN THESE 
VALLEYS.  RIGHT NOW LOOKS LIKE LITTLE IF ANY IMPACT...AND FOR IMPACT 
IT WOULD BE VERY LOCALIZED.

2...WILL THERE BE FLOODING RAINS DURING THIS LONG 
DURATION...SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY?  ANY FLOODING DURING THIS 
PERIOD SHOULD BE LIMITED.  EXPECTED AMOUNTS ARE ONLY BETWEEN 1-2 
INCHES...1 INCH EAST AND 2 INCHES WESTERN AREAS...AND THIS IS SPREAD 
OVER A PERIOD OF TWO DAYS.  HOWEVER...THE OVERALL 4-5 DAY TOTALS MAY 
CAUSE SOME MINOR FLOODING OF LARGER STREAMS...RIVERS...AND OTHER 
FLOOD-PRONE LOW-LYING AREAS.

3...WILL THERE BE A MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WIND EVENT SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT?  RIGHT NOW...THIS LOOKS TO BE A VERY MINIMAL WIND EVENT.  THE 
WINDS ARE NOT OVERLY STRONG AND ALSO ALIGN PRETTY QUICKLY WITH THE 
SPINE OF THE MOUNTAINS...WHEREAS IN GOOD WIND EVENTS...THE WINDS ARE 
FROM THE SOUTH OR SOUTHEAST CROSSING THE MOUNTAINS.

4...WILL THERE BE THUNDER DURING THE WARM ADVECTION PHASE SUNDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY?  LOOKS LIKE MOST OF THE THUNDER WILL STAY SOUTH OF 
THE AREA...WILL NOT MENTION THUNDER IN THE FORECASTS FOR SUNDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY.

5...WILL THE BACK SIDE OF ALL THIS PRECIP HAVE ANY MEANINGFUL WINTRY 
PRECIPITATION ON MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY?  RAIN SHOWERS WILL BE 
TURNING TO SNOW SHOWERS AS THE COLDER AIR MOVES IN.  THERE IS A 
LITTLE MORE MOISTURE IN THE FLOW THAT COULD ENHANCE THE POSSIBILITY 
OF A MEASURABLE SNOW...ESPECIALLY IN THE MOUNTAINS FOR LATE MONDAY 
NIGHT AND INTO TUESDAY...STILL A LITTLE EARLY TO DEFINE THIS.

6...HOW COLD WILL THE TEMPERATURES BE NEXT WEEK?  LOOKS PRETTY 
COLD...BUT NOT AS COLD AS IT DID IN YESTERDAYS MODELS.

7...WHEN THE NEXT SYSTEM COMES IN FOR LATE NEXT WEEK...WILL THERE BE 
ANY WINTRY PRECIPITATION?  WHEN THIS SYSTEM COMES IN...THE MODELS 
AGREE THAT THE WARMER AIR AND MOISTURE WILL COME INTO THE AREA 
TOGETHER...THEREBY MINIMIZING THE CHANCES FOR WINTER PRECIPITATION.






THERE ARE TWO ISSUES WITH THIS NEXT WAVE OF PRECIPITATION...FIRST IS 
THE THREAT FOR ANY FREEZING/FROZEN PRECIPITATION THROUGH ABOUT 15Z 
SUNDAY...WHEN THE WARMER AIR SHOULD WIN-OUT...AND THE SECOND ISSUE 
IS HOW HEAVY THE RAIN WILL GET.

THE PATTERN PRETTY MUCH STAYS UNSETTLED FOR THE FIRST 3 DAYS OF THIS 
PERIOD...UNTIL THE TROUGH AXIS FINALLY CLEARS THE AREA...ROUGHLY 
LATE TUESDAY.  SO FROM 00Z WED THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST WILL 
KEEP IT DRY.

GETTING BACK TO SATURDAY NIGHT...LOOKS LIKE MOST OF THE AREA WILL 
JUST GET A COLD RAIN...BUT CONCERNED ABOUT NORTHWESTERN AREAS THAT 
WILL HAVE UPSLOPE NORTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW...SUCH AS JELLICO AND 
ONEIDA...THAT THE COLD AIR MASS MAY BE LOCKED INTO PLACE LONGER AND 
THERE WILL BE A BETTER CHANCE OF FREEZING RAIN...BUT ONLY EXPECTING 
A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF ACCRUAL...SO AT THIS TIME...NOT ANTICIPATING 
MANY PROBLEMS.  ALSO AM MENTIONING PARTS OF WISE AND RUSSELL VA
COUNTIES FOR LIGHT FREEZING RAIN...BUT PRECIP SHOULD BE LIGHTER 
THERE OVERNIGHT.

FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...PRECIP SHOULD BE RAIN...THEN AS 
COLD AIR RETURNS ON TUESDAY...WILL LIKELY HAVE SOME SNOW SHOWERS ON 
THE BACK END OF THE SYSTEM.

IN THE SECOND WAVE OF PRECIP...FROM SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SUNDAY...WE HAVE PRECIP OF ABOUT 1/2 INCH TO AN INCH ACROSS THE 
AREA.  THERE WILL BE MORE RAIN ON MONDAY...THAT WILL BE ADDRESSED IN 
FUTURE FORECASTS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             37  46  40  47  45 / 100  10  90 100  90 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  38  44  36  46  43 / 100  20  80  90  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       35  43  35  44  42 / 100  10  80  90  90 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              38  41  34  46  37 / 100  20  80  80  90

.AVIATION...COLD FRONT HUGGING FOOTHILLS OF EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND
WILL MOVE LITTLE THROUGH 07/09Z. STRONG POST FRONTAL INVERSION FROM
AROUND 600-3200 FEET. LOW CLOUDS GETTING TRAPPED BENEATH INVERSION
AND WILL CONTINUE INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. LOW LEVEL WINDS WILL BE
NORTHERLY AROUND 10 KTS WHILE STRONG SOUTHWEST WINDS AROUND 3000 FT
WILL INCREASE TO NEAR 50 KTS THIS AFTERNOON. STRENGTHENING LAYER
JET WEST OF THE AREA WILL ENHANCE CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT AND THIS
ACTIVITY WILL MOVE INTO THE TAF SITES THIS AFTERNOON AND CONTINUE
THROUGH MUCH OF THE NIGHT. PRECIPITATION SHOULD END AROUND DAYBREAK
WITH CLOUDS THINNING BY END OF THE PERIOD. RELATIVELY HIGH FREEZING
LEVEL WILL LOWER RAPIDLY TO AROUND 1300 FEET AROUND 07/12Z AS
SHALLOW COLD AIR MASS MOVES IN FROM THE NW.

1015 AM EST FRI DEC 6 2013

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT HAS MOVED SE TO ALONG THE TN FOOTHILLS
WITH LOW PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR VA/NC/TN BORDER. ADJUSTED WESTERN
TEMPERATURES DOWN FOR TODAY. STRONG POST FRONTAL INVERSION SHOULD
KEEP THOSE AREAS IN CLOUDS THROUGH TONIGHT. EASTERN AREAS MAY SEE
PERIODS OF SUNSHINE AND BREAKS IN PRECIPITATION. FORECAST
ADJUSTMENTS MADE MAINLY IN THE GRIDDED DATA. STRENGTHENING JET WEST
OF AREA WILL AID IN ELEVATED CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT THAT WILL SHIFT
INTO THE AREA BY LATE AFTERNOON.


&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 060939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
439 AM EST FRI DEC 6 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT APPEARS TO BE 
EASING SE INTO THE NE PLATEAU AND CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES THIS 
MORNING. RAINFALL HAS BEEN VERY SPARSE IN COVERAGE AND GENERALLY 
LIGHT IN AMOUNT SO FAR OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...HAVE TO AGREE WITH 
SHOWERS INCREASING DURING THE MORNING AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES A BIT 
FURTHER EAST...THEN STALLS ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF EAST TN INTO 
WRN NC. PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED RIGHT ON TRACK...AND I 
INCLUDED THE MENTIONS OF ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS AS BEFORE. POTENTIAL 
TRAINING OF SHOWERS ALONG THE FRONT...WITH HPC 6 HOURLY QPF 
FOLLOWED. WILL CONTINUE THE MENTION OF HEAVY RAINS IN THE HAZARDOUS 
WEATHER OUTLOOK AND GRAPHICAST.

THE STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND A SURFACE LOW TRACKING ALONG THE 
BOUNDARY WILL SUPPORT CATEGORICAL POPS AGAIN TONIGHT, HOWEVER...
THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD END RATHER ABRUPTLY SATURDAY MORNING. NO 
SIGNIFICANT THREAT OF ANY WINTRY TYPE ACCUMULATIONS...AND PREVIOUS 
POP AND WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED VERY GOOD. 

MAX TEMPS VERY CHALLENGING FOR TODAY WITH THE VERY MILD NAM MOS 
MAXES DISCARDED IN FAVOR OF THE MORE SENSIBLE/COOLER GFS MOS MAXES. 
A BLEND OF SIMILAR MOS MINS WAS CHOSEN FOR TONIGHT...AND AGAIN ON 
SATURDAY MAXES...WITH SURFACE RIDGE MOVING OVER THE UPPER MIDWEST 
STATES AND A COOL N TO NE LOW LEVEL FLOW INTO THE LOCAL REGION.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...FRONTAL SYSTEM
JUST TO THE SOUTH DEVELOPS WAVE OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY AND
NORTHERN GULF SATURDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SUNDAY. SURFACE LOW MOVES NE
INTO THE TN VALLEY SUNDAY WITH DEEP SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. COLD AIR
IN PLACE INITIALLY COULD LEAD TO SOME BRIEF FREEZING RAIN NORTHERN
PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA BEFORE WARMING LATER SATURDAY NIGHT
AND EARLY SUNDAY. ICE ACCUMULATION AMOUNTS WILL BE VERY LIGHT AND
MAINLY NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WITH TEMPERATURES
WARMING ABOVE FREEZING BY MID MORNING. RAINFALL AMOUNTS COULD REACH
UP TO ABOUT 2 INCHES FROM EARLY SUNDAY TO EARLY MONDAY. ANOTHER ONE
HALF TO ONE INCH POSSIBLE MONDAY BEFORE FRONTAL SYSTEM FINALLY
SHIFTS SOUTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT. AS COLD AIR
MOVES IN BEHIND FRONT MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING SOME LIGHT
SNOW SHOWERS MAY PRODUCE LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS. COLD HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY. LOWS WILL BE IN THE 20S
AND HIGHS IN THE MID 30S TO MID 40S WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

&&

A SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS ON THE FRONT...BRINGING INCREASING RAIN 
CHANCES AND POTENTIAL FOR MORE MVFR TO IFR CONDITIONS IN THE 06/18Z

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 060256
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED MIN TEMPS IN PRELIM SECTION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 PM EST THU DEC 5 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG COLD FRONT ALONG THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...PRODUCING A SHARP TEMP GRADIENT RANGING FROM 
THE UPPER 60S OVER THE GREAT TN VALLEY TO THE UPPER 30S OVER MIDDLE 
TN. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO ONLY SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD 
TONIGHT...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW REMAINS PARALLEL TO THIS SURFACE 
BOUNDARY. AREA RADARS REVEAL SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS EVENING...BUT SHOWER COVERAGE SHOULD INCREASE LATER 
TONIGHT AS A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE ROCKIES AND 
INCREASES LIFT OVER THE TN AND OHIO RIVER VALLEYS. TEMP FORECAST FOR 
TONIGHT WILL BE VERY TRICKY DUE TO THE SHARP TEMP GRADIENT ALONG THE 
COLD FRONT. AS A RESULT OF THIS SHARP GRADIENT...THE NAM AND GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS SHOW SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE MIN FORECAST FOR 
TONIGHT. FOR NOW...WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THESE TWO SETS OF 
GUIDANCE.

WILL ALSO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO REMOVE ANY EVENING 
PRECIP WORDING OF THUNDER. SOME ELEVATED THUNDER IS STILL BEING 
OBSERVED OVER MIDDLE TN...BUT MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A STABILIZING 
AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TONIGHT.
&&

.AVIATION...IT SURE LOOKS LIKE THE WRF MODEL VERIFIED MUCH BETTER

WILL BE OVER THIS SHALLOW COLD AIR WHICH WOULD KEEP A FAIR AMOUNT
OF THE RAIN JUST WEST OF THE GREAT VALLEY ONCE AGAIN. BASICALLY
KEPT TRI AND TYS IN A VFR CATEGORY WITH SOME PERIODS OF LIGHTER
RAIN AND HIGHER CEILINGS WHILE OPTING FOR MVFR CATEGORY FLIGHT


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 052020
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST THU DEC 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO 
THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EXTREME SW VA TONIGHT. THE UPPER 
JET CORE AND THE COLDER SURFACE TEMPERATURE WILL REMAIN NW OF THE 
AREA. SOUTHWESTERLY LAYER SHEAR CONTINUES TO INCREASE TONIGHT. PWAT 
VALUES IN EXCESS OF 1.50 ARE WELL ABOVE NORMAL. ONGOING CONVECTION 
WILL MOVE INTO THE EAST TN VALLEY TONIGHT. THIS ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY 
TRAIN OR REDEVELOP ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
MOVES LITTLE ON FRIDAY WITH PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 
LOCALIZED FLOODING BECOMES POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY ALONG THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND AREAS SOUTH OF KNOXVILLE. A STRONG UPPER JET 
SEGMENT WILL MOVE NE THROUGH MIDDLE TN BY FRI AFTN. THIS FEATURE 
WILL LIKELY ENHANCE CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT WITH A LOW CHANCE OF 
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE COLD FRONT 
BEGINS TO MOVE BACK SE BY FRIDAY EVENING. THE SHALLOW AND MUCH 
COLDER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT. THE BACK END 
OF THE TAPERING CONVECTION WILL LIKELY SEE SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN 
BEFORE ENDING SAT MORNING. SOME ICE ACCUMULATION IS POSSIBLE ACROSS 
SW VA AND THE NORTHERN PLATEAU. TREE LIMBS AND POWER LINES WILL 
LIKELY SEE SOME ACCRETION. TEMPERATURES WILL BE FRONTAL POSITION 
DEPENDENT. LEANED TOWARD A WARMER SOLUTION SE OF THE FRONT.

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY/...THIS PERIOD BEGINS 
SATURDAY EVENING WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHING FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST...WITH A COLD AIR MASS IN PLACE AT THE SURFACE.  ALOFT A 
STRONG AND DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW STREAMS OVER THE REGION...BETWEEN 
A TROUGH IN THE ROCKIES AND A RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN CARIBBEAN.  

THERE ARE TWO ISSUES WITH THIS NEXT WAVE OF PRECIPITATION...FIRST IS 
THE THREAT FOR ANY FREEZING/FROZEN PRECIPITATION THROUGH ABOUT 15Z 
SUNDAY...WHEN THE WARMER AIR SHOULD WIN-OUT...AND THE SECOND ISSUE 
IS HOW HEAVY THE RAIN WILL GET.

THE PATTERN PRETTY MUCH STAYS UNSETTLED FOR THE FIRST 3 DAYS OF THIS 
PERIOD...UNTIL THE TROUGH AXIS FINALLY CLEARS THE AREA...ROUGHLY 
LATE TUESDAY.  SO FROM 00Z WED THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST WILL 
KEEP IT DRY.

GETTING BACK TO SATURDAY NIGHT...LOOKS LIKE MOST OF THE AREA WILL 
JUST GET A COLD RAIN...BUT CONCERNED ABOUT NORTHWESTERN AREAS THAT 
WILL HAVE UPSLOPE NORTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW...SUCH AS JELLICO AND 
ONEIDA...THAT THE COLD AIR MASS MAY BE LOCKED INTO PLACE LONGER AND 
THERE WILL BE A BETTER CHANCE OF FREEZING RAIN...BUT ONLY EXPECTING 
A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF ACCRUAL...SO AT THIS TIME...NOT ANTICIPATING 
MANY PROBLEMS.  ALSO AM MENTIONING PARTS OF WISE AND RUSSELL VA
COUNTIES FOR LIGHT FREEZING RAIN...BUT PRECIP SHOULD BE LIGHTER 
THERE OVERNIGHT.

FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...PRECIP SHOULD BE RAIN...THEN AS 
COLD AIR RETURNS ON TUESDAY...WILL LIKELY HAVE SOME SNOW SHOWERS ON 
THE BACK END OF THE SYSTEM.

IN THE SECOND WAVE OF PRECIP...FROM SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SUNDAY...WE HAVE PRECIP OF ABOUT 1/2 INCH TO AN INCH ACROSS THE 
AREA.  THERE WILL BE MORE RAIN ON MONDAY...THAT WILL BE ADDRESSED IN 
FUTURE FORECASTS.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       52  69  36  44  34 / 100 100 100  20  70

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1230 PM EST THU DEC 5 2013

.AVIATION...A COLD FRONT WILL VERY SLOWLY APPROACHED THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION FROM THE WEST DURING THE TAF PERIOD.  AHEAD OF 
THE FRONT...WARM AND VERY MOIST AIR MASS IS IN PLACE.  A LOW CLOUD 
DECK WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA AND SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP 
AND MOVE IN DURING THE AFTERNOON.  THE AIR MASS DOES BECOME WEAKLY 
UNSTABLE AND A FEW THUNDERSTORM MAY DEVELOP.  HOWEVER...THIS 
ACTIVITY SHOULD BE ISOLATED AND WILL NOT MENTION IN TAFS AT THIS 
TIME.  ADDITIONALLY...WITH A STRONG WIND FIELD ALOFT...A STRAY STORM 
COULD GENERATE STRONG GUSTY WINDS.  BY THE END OF THE PERIOD...THE 
FRONT WILL STILL BE TO OUR WEST...BUT A LARGE BAND OF CONVECTION 
WILL PUSH IN FOR LOWERING CLOUDS AND VIS AND MVFR TO IFR CONDITION 
ANYTIME AFTER 00Z.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 050758
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 AM EST THU DEC 5 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL VERY SLOWLY 
APPROACHED THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION FROM THE WEST DURING THE 
SHORT TERM.  AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A SEASONALLY WARM AND VERY MOIST 
AIR MASS IS IN PLACE.  SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP AND MOVE 
INTO THE AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON.  THE AIR MASS DOES BECOME WEAKLY 
UNSTABLE AND COULD SEE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP OVER THE AREA.  WITH A 
STRONG WIND FIELD ALOFT...A STRAY STORM COULD GENERATE STRONG GUSTY 
WINDS.  BY TONIGHT...THE FRONT WILL STILL BE TO OUR WEST...BUT A 
LARGE BAND OF CONVECTION WILL PUSH IN FOR LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN...ALTHOUGH STILL SOME 
DIFFERENCES IN THE DETAILS. TWO ROUNDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY 
PRECIPITATION EXPECTED...AS DEEP MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW FEEDS PLENTY 
OF MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. THE COLD FRONT OVER THE AREA FRIDAY WILL 
EXIT FRIDAY NIGHT...ALLOWING FOR A BRIEF DRIER PERIOD ON SATURDAY.  
THEN MOISTURE WILL SURGE BACK IN SATURDAY NIGHT AS A WAVE OF LOW 
PRESSURE FORMS ON THE FRONT...WITH THE RAIN CONTINUING INTO MONDAY. 
TOTAL RAINFALL AMOUNTS BY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT WILL LIKELY BE IN EXCESS 
OF 2 INCHES OVER PARTS OF THE AREA ESPECIALLY SOUTH AND WEST ZONES 
WITH THE FIRST ROUND OF PRECIP...THEN ADDITIONAL HEAVY RAIN WITH THE 
SECOND ROUND WILL INCREASE THE THREAT OF FLOODING. THIS THREAT WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE MENTIONED IN THE HWO.   

WHILE MOST OF THE PRECIP SHOULD BE RAIN...THE COLDER AIR MOVING IN 
MAY CHANGE THE PRECIP OVER TO A LITTLE LIGHT SLEET OR FREEZING RAIN 
ACROSS PARTS OF THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA BEFORE ENDING LATE FRIDAY NIGHT/EARLY SATURDAY.  
ALSO AS THE PRECIP MOVES BACK IN SATURDAY NIGHT THERE MAY BE A 
LITTLE LIGHT SLEET/FREEZING RAIN/SNOW ON THE FRONT EDGE OF THE 
PRECIP IN THESE SAME AREAS BEFORE IT ALL CHANGES TO RAIN. AT THIS 
POINT THE THREAT FOR SIGNIFICANT WINTER PRECIP APPEARS TO BE 
LOW...SO FOR NOW WILL JUST INCLUDE SOME SLEET MENTION IN THE 
FORECAST IN THESE AREAS AND CONTINUE TO MENTION IN THE HWO.   

DRIER AND COLDER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY BEHIND THE DEPARTING COLD FRONT.  RAIN SHOWERS EXPECTED TO 
TRANSITION TO SOME SNOW SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT. MAY BE SOME LINGERING  
SNOW SHOWERS ESPECIALLY MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST TUESDAY. DRY 
WEDNESDAY.    


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED WARM FRONT 
OVER SOUTHERN WV AND WESTERN VA...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND 
MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE ZONAL
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WILL BECOME 
MORE SOUTHWESTERLY OVERNIGHT...WITH SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY HELPING TO GENERATE PATCHY LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE... 
MAINLY OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC AFTER MIDNIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO REMOVE SOME EVENING PRECIP 
WORDING AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS.
