000 
FXUS64 KMRX 042013
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST WED DEC 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA 
SHIFTS EAST TONIGHT AS SHORT WAVE MOVES NORTHEAST THROUGH THE TN 
VALLEY ON THURSDAY. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST THROUGH MIDDLE TN 
ON THURSDAY. WARM AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES WITH SOUTHWESTERLY LOW 
LEVEL FLOW. TEMPERATURES WELL ABOVE NORMAL IN PREFRONTAL AIRMASS. 
DRY MID LEVELS MOISTEN UP ON THURSDAY. EXPECT EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. FORECAST PROBLEM IS PRECIPITATION COVERAGE. 
UNDERCUT BLENDED MOS POP GUIDANCE BY HALF FOR THURSDAY DUE TO LACK 
OF GOOD TRIGGER. BEST CHANCE APPEAR TO BE ACROSS SW NC AND THE 
PLATEAU WHERE LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND UPSLOPE FLOW MAY AID 
CONVECTIVE INITIATION. THUNDERSTORMS BECOME POSSIBLE BY THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON. STORM MOTION WILL BE TO THE NE NEAR 45 MPH. DEEPER 
CONVECTION SHOULD STAY WEST OF THE AREA UNTIL LATE IN THE PERIOD. 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
UNSETTLED WEATHER WILL DOMINATE THE END OF THE WEEK AND BEGINNING OF 
THE NEW WEEK AS A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM WILL IMPACT THE 
REGION...BRINGING SEVERAL ROUNDS OF PRECIPITATION AND THE POTENTIAL 
FOR SOME LOCALIZED FLOODING. MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT OF 
SHOWING A BROAD AREA OF SHOWERS BEGINNING TO MOVE INTO THE REGION 
ALONG/AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT MOVING IN FROM THE WEST. WITH DEEP 
MOISTURE AVAILABLE...WIDESPREAD SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED LATE THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...BEFORE THINGS BEGIN TAPER OFF LATE FRIDAY NIGHT 
INTO SATURDAY. THE CONCENTRATION OF THE HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION WILL 
LIKELY BE TO THE NORTH AND WEST OF THE REGION...BUT A WIDESPREAD 
SOLID 1 TO 2 INCHES...WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS CERTAINLY SEEMS 
POSSIBLE THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING. WITH A BOUNDARY DRAPED ACROSS THE 
REGION ON FRIDAY AND SOME MODEST INSTABILITY...SOME ISOLATED STRONG 
THUNDERSTORMS MAY ALSO BE POSSIBLE DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY. LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT...SOME COLDER AIR WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE REGION MAY 
ALSO HELP TO CHANGE OVER SOME WINING PRECIPITATION OVER THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU TO SLEET. HOWEVER...DID NOT THINK THAT TEMPERATURES WILL 
COOL ENOUGH BEFORE THE PRECIPITATION EXITS TO MAKE A MENTION OF THIS 
ATTM. 

AFTER A BRIEF BREAK IN THE PRECIPITATION DURING THE DAY SATURDAY... 
THE AFOREMENTIONED BOUNDARY WILL LIFT BACK UP TO THE NORTH AS A WARM 
FRONT...AND BRING IN SOME DEEP GULF MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTH. THIS 
WILL TRIGGER OFF ANOTHER ROUND OF LOCALLY HEAVY SHOWERS SATURDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AS DEEP UPPER-TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH THE AREA. 
THE PROLONGED RAINFALL ACROSS THE REGION MAY BRING AN ADDITIONAL 1 
TO 3 INCHES AND CAUSE A THREAT FOR FLOODING DUE TO THE ALREADY 
SATURATED GROUND AND THE HIGHER CREEKS/STREAMS. A STRONG PUSH OF 
COLDER AIR WILL THEN MOVE IN MONDAY NIGHT...CHANGING OVER THE 
LINGERING SHOWERS ON THE BACKSIDE OF THIS SYSTEM TO SNOW SHOWERS AS 
THE SYSTEM WINDS DOWN. THEREAFTER...DRY AND COLD AIR WILL LINGER 
ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.   



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  71  52  55  38 /  30  50  90 100 100 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              51  70  53  62  37 /  10  30  70  90 100

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EST WED DEC 4 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK WARM FRONT WILL SLIDE 
ACROSS THE AREA FROM SOUTH TO NORTH TODAY.  ALONG THE FRONT... 
ISOLATED LIGHT RAIN OR SPRINKLES MAY DEVELOP.  RAINFALL AMOUNTS WILL 
BE PATCHY AND MINIMAL.  A WARM...MOIST AIR MASS WILL MOVE IN BEHIND 
THE WARM FRONT FOR SEASONALLY WARM TEMPERATURES THIS AFTERNOON.  
ASSOCIATED COLD FONT WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA OVERNIGHT.  THE 
MAIN BAND OF CONVECTION ALONG THE FRONT WILL STAY TO OUR WEST 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM...BUT A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS IN ADVANCE OF 
THE FRONT MAY REACH INTO THE AREA BY SUNRISE AND WILL RANGE POPS 
FROM 30 WEST TO 20 EAST.  

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO
BE IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN...ALTHOUGH SOME
DIFFERENCES IN THE DETAILS. WILL BE IN FOR A PERIOD OF UNSETTLED
WEATHER FOR THE PERIOD...AS MUCH OF THE PERIOD WILL BE DOMINATED BY
DEEP AND MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW. A SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT WILL
MOVE INTO THE REGION EARLY ON...AND WILL PUSH THROUGH BEFORE MOVING
BACK NORTH AS A WARM FRONT AS LOW PRESSURE FORMS ON THE FRONT
SATURDAY NIGHT AND ADVANCES TOWARD THE AREA ON SUNDAY. WITH PLENTY
OF MOISTURE AVAILABLE...SOME HEAVY RAIN MAY OCCUR AT TIMES AND WITH
THE PROLONGED NATURE OF THE PRECIP THE MULTIDAY RAINFALL AMOUNTS
MAY BE QUITE HIGH ESPECIALLY OVER WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA.
WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION THE FLOODING THREAT IN THE HWO.

ON THURSDAY...MODELS INDICATE SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY DEVELOPING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT...WITH A 
FAIRLY STRONG VEERING WIND PROFILE ALSO EXPECTED. A FEW STRONG TO 
SEVERE STORMS CANNOT BE RULED OUT THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION THIS THREAT IN HWO. 

MODELS STILL INDICATE A TEMPORARY BREAK FROM THE MORE SIGNIFICANT 
RAIN ON SATURDAY...AS COLDER AIR TEMPORARILY MOVES INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA. WITH THE SHALLOW COLD AIR MOVING IN...SOME SUBFREEZING AIR MAY 
MAKE IT INTO PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND PERHAPS WESTERN 
PORTIONS OF OUR SW VA COUNTIES...WHICH COULD LEAD TO SOME FREEZING 
RAIN OR SLEET AS THE PRECIP SURGES BACK IN SATURDAY NIGHT.  
HOWEVER...AT THIS POINT IT APPEARS MORE LIKELY TO STAY ABOVE 
FREEZING...SO WILL KEEP OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR NOW.

DRIER AND COLDER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA TUESDAY BEHIND THE 
DEPARTING COLD FRONT.  MAY BE SOME LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS ESPECIALLY 
MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST TUESDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 032003
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST TUE DEC 3 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...ANOTHER MOSTLY CLOUDY DAY OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. PERSISTENT LOW LEVEL SOUTHEAST FLOW OVER 
THE PLATEAU COUNTIES...SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA AND SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT KEPT SKIES CLOUDY AND TEMPERATURES 
ONLY IN THE LOWER TO MID 50S. FARTHER NORTH A BREAK IN THE CLOUDS 
FROM LATE MORNING THROUGH EARLY AFTERNOON IN NORTHEAST SECTIONS 
ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO REACH TO THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. CLOUDS 
WERE MOVING BACK INTO NORTHEAST SECTIONS AS WEAK SHORTWAVE IS MOVING 
INTO THAT REGION LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. LIFT IS WEAK 
SO DO NOT EXPECT ANY RAIN. FOR TONIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY WITH LOW 
LEVEL SOUTHEAST FLOW AND ALREADY SATURATED ATMOSPHERE AND WEAK 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING THROUGH BEST CHANCE OF RAIN OR DRIZZLE 
ALTHOUGH SLIGHT WILL BE ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC. A WEAK WARM FRONT 
WILL MOVE NORTH OVERNIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY AS LOW PRESSURE 
DEVELOPS OUT AHEAD OF DISTINCT ARCTIC FRONT OVER THE WESTERN STATES. 
PATCHY FOG WILL FORM AS WELL ESPECIALLY SOUTH...AND LOCALLY DENSE. 

THE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE TO THE EAST WILL STRENGTHEN AND BRING WARMER 
AIR NORTH WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL CHANGE LITTLE OVERNIGHT IN 
THE SOUTH NEAR WARM FRONT. LOWS NEAR 50 SOUTH AND MID TO UPPER 40S 
ELSEWHERE. EXPECT SOME CLEARING AGAIN NORTHEAST HALF WEDNESDAY LIKE 
TODAY BUT MOSTLY CLOUDY SOUTH. HIGHS SHOULD REACH THE MID 60S TO 
NEAR 70 SOME 10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL AND ABOVE TODAY AS A 
STRONGER SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS BEHIND THE WARM FRONT AND AS 
PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS AHEAD OF LOWER PRESSURE IN THE PLAINS 
STATES.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND REVEAL A DEEP AND PERSISTENT SOUTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW 
DEVELOPING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY THURSDAY AND LINGERING 
THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. IN FACT...IT APPEARS THIS SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW WILL EMANATE FROM THE EASTERN PACIFIC OCEAN...RESULTING IN A 
DEEPER MOISTURE FETCH WHICH COULD CREATE MORE RAIN THAN THE MODELS 
CURRENTLY SUGGEST. THIS UPPER-LEVEL SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL BECOME 
PARALLEL TO A SLOW-MOVING ARCTIC COLD FRONT OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY...SO IT APPEARS THAT A PROLONGED RAINFALL EVENT WILL DEVELOP 
FOR SEVERAL DAYS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FROM THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT. RIGHT NOW...WIDESPREAD RAINFALL TOTALS OF TWO TO FIVE INCHES 
APPEAR POSSIBLE BY MONDAY NIGHT...ESPECIALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. WHILE IT APPEARS THAT FLASH 
FLOODING FROM THUNDERSTORMS WILL NOT BE A PROBLEM...THE PROLONGED 
NATURE OF THIS RAINFALL WILL LIKELY EVENTUALLY LEAD TO WIDESPREAD 
FLOODING OF RIVERS AND STREAMS (AND OTHER LOW LYING AND FLOOD PRONE 
AREAS).

ON THURSDAY...MODELS INDICATE SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY DEVELOPING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT...WITH A 
FAIRLY STRONG VEERING WIND PROFILE ALSO EXPECTED. THUS...IT APPEARS 
THAT A FEW STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE ON THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL BEING THE 
MAIN THREATS.

MODELS STILL INDICATE A TEMPORARY BREAK FROM THE RAIN ON SATURDAY... 
AS COLDER AIR TEMPORARILY MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. ECMWF MODEL 
STILL INDICATES THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SUB-FREEZING LOW-LEVEL AIR 
MOVING ONTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AFTER MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT... 
WHICH COULD CREATE SOME SLEET OR FREEZING RAIN WITH ICING CONCERNS. 
THE LATEST GFS MODEL RUN STILL KEEPS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ABOVE 
FREEZING EARLY SATURDAY MORNING...SO WILL JUST MENTION RAIN FOR 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING...BUT WILL MENTION THE POSSIBILITY 
OF SLEET OR FREEZING RAIN IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL THEN TREND COOLER THEREAFTER...WHICH 
IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   52  68  59  71  55 /  20  20  40  70  90 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     48  67  57  70  54 /  20  20  40  60  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN             47  66  58  70  52 /  10  10  40  70  90 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    41  65  53  68  53 /  10  10  40  60  90

INTO FIRST PART OF TONIGHT. WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS SOUTH INTO 
CENTRAL AND INTO NORTHEAST TN MOUNTAINS BOTH PERIODS.  WILL UNDERCUT 
MAV TEMPS A BIT SOUTH AND CENTRAL TODAY GIVEN EXPECTED CLOUD 
COVER...BUT LESS ARGUMENT WITH MINS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WILL BE IN A WET AND UNSETTLE 
WEATHER PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED.  AN EXITING SHORT WAVE WITH 
STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW AND WIDESPREAD ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL PROVIDE 
ISOLATED CONVECTION AND UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE 
REGION ON WEDNESDAY.  STRONG SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ON THURSDAY WILL 
CONTINUE TO PULL IN ABUNDANT DEEP MOISTURE AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING 
COLD FRONT.  THE FRONT WILL STALL OR SLOWLY SIGNIFICANTLY TO OUR 
WEST WITH BANDS OF SHOWERS CONTINUING TO MOVE ACROSS THE MRX CWA 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT.  WHILE SOME BREAK IN THE RAIN AREA 
EXPECTED...MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN SHOWERS WILL MOVE THROUGH FOR 
LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.  THE FRONT 
WILL PUSH TROUGH AROUND THE FRIDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME PROVIDING A 
BRIEF BREAK IN SHOWERS ON SATURDAY.  THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL THEN 
LIFT BACK INTO THE AREA AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM REDEVELOPS SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY.  THIS WILL ONCE AGAIN PROVIDE LIKELY POPS AND THE 
POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAINFALL.  WITH THE POTENTIAL OF SEVERAL DAYS OF 
THE MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN...MAY SEE SOME FLOODING ACROSS THE 
REGION.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   58  50  70  59  71 /  20  20  20  40  50 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     58  47  66  55  68 /  20  20  20  40  50

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 022007
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST MON DEC 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE STILL TRAPPED 
ACROSS FORECAST AREA WITH CLOUDY SKIES AND A FEW SPRINKLES. AREAS OF 
DRIZZLE AND SOME FOG STILL ONGOING ESPECIALLY SOUTH VALLEY AND 
PLATEAU. TEMPERATURES HAVE CHANGED LITTLE ACROSS CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS AFTER LOWS IN THE LOWER TO MID 40S HAVE ONLY 
WARMED TO THE MID TO UPPER 40S. WARMEST TEMPERATURES ACROSS NE TN 
AND SW VA WHERE TEMPERATURES NEAR 50 AT MID AFTERNOON. ONLY A FEW 
BREAKS HAVE BEEN SEEN IN CLOUD COVER. THE BREAKS HAVE BEEN ACROSS
THE NE TN MOUNTAINS AND SW VA. A WEAK SHORTWAVE OVER MAINLY NORTHERN 
AL WAS MOVING SE TOWARD GA AT THIS TIME. SE TN AND SW NC WILL BE ON 
THE NORTHERN SIDE OF THIS FEATURE WITH SOME LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE 
POSSIBLE NEXT SEVERAL HOURS. A SERIES OF WEAK SHORTWAVES MOVING FROM 
WEST OR NORTHWEST TO EAST SOUTHEAST WILL OCCUR OVER THE NEXT 24 
HOURS KEEPING SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY SOUTH WITH SOME CLEARING NORTH AND 
SLIGHT CHANCES OF LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE MAINLY SOUTH THROUGH 
TUESDAY. LOWS TONIGHT WILL ONLY DROP A FEW DEGREES CENTRAL AND SOUTH 
AND MORE IN THE NE WHERE PARTIAL CLEARING COULD TAKE PLACE. TUESDAY 
LIGHT SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WIND FLOW AND SOME CLEARING AT TIMES...MORE 
THAN TODAY...SHOULD WARM TEMPERATURES 10 DEGREES ABOVE TODAYS...INTO 
THE MID 50S HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO AS WARM AS MID 60S VALLEYS.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND REVEAL A DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW DEVELOPING OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY BY THE END OF THE WEEK. BEFORE THEN...A WARM AIR 
ADVECTION PATTERN WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA...RESULTING IN 
UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPS AND SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE REGION. 
THIS ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL CREATE EXTENSIVE CLOUDINESS AND THE 
POSSIBILITY OF AN ISOLATED SHOWER THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. BY 
THURSDAY...THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL BECOME SOUTHWESTERLY OVER MOST 
OF THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE NATION....WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A DEEP 
MOISTURE FETCH EMANATING FROM THE EASTERN PACIFIC OCEAN. THIS UPPER- 
LEVEL FLOW WILL ALSO BECOME PARALLEL TO A SLOW-MOVING FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...SO IT APPEARS THAT A PROLONGED 
HEAVY RAINFALL EVENT COULD DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. WHILE THERE MAY BE A TEMPORARY 
BREAK FROM THIS HEAVY RAIN WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS 
REVEAL A SIMILAR PATTERN DEVELOPING AGAIN FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS 
THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY DRIFTS BACK NORTHWARD INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
AND A DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW REDEVELOPS. THUS...IT 
APPEARS THAT A VERY WET PATTERN (WITH A GOOD POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING) 
WILL LINGER FOR SEVERAL DAYS OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY THE END OF 
THE WEEK AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

ANOTHER CONCERN BY FRIDAY NIGHT WILL BE THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME 
SUB-FREEZING LOW-LEVEL AIR MOVING ONTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AFTER 
MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT...WHICH COULD CREATE SOME FREEZING RAIN AND 
ICING CONCERNS. THE LATEST GFS MODEL RUN HAS TRENDED TOWARD A WARMER 
SCENARIO FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...SO FOR NOW...WILL JUST MENTION RAIN FOR 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING...BUT A FREEZING RAIN POSSIBILITY 
WILL NEED TO BE MONITORED IN LATER FORECASTS. AS FOR TEMPS..WILL 
GENERALLY TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE END OF 
THE WEEK...AND WILL THEN TREND COOLER THEREAFTER...WHICH IS IN 
BETTER LINE WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

ADVECTION INCREASES WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY AS MAJOR UPPER TROUGH 
BECOMES ESTABLISHED ACROSS THE WESTERN U.S. PACIFIC MOISTURE WILL 
STREAM INTO THE REGION AS THE GRADIENT IN PRESSURE BETWEEN THE 
TROUGH AND A PERSISTENT RIDGE OVER THE GULF OF MEXICO TIGHTENS. IN 
THE LOWER LEVELS MOISTURE WILL BE BE TAPPED OFF THE GULF. THE 
DEEPENING MOIST COLUMN WILL ENCOUNTER A VERY SLOW MOVING FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY SEPARATING MODIFIED ARCTIC AIR FROM A MILD SUB-TROPICAL 
AIRMASS. PERIODS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN CAN BE EXPECTED THURSDAY 
INTO FRIDAY AS THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY MAKES ITS WAY SLOWLY SOUTH 
THROUGH THE REGION. DROPPED POPS OFF INCREMENTALLY FROM NORTHWEST TO 
SOUTHEAST ON SATURDAY AS THE COLD FRONT FINALLY SLIPS ACROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS INTO THE CAROLINAS. KEPT SOME WINTER PRECIPITATION OVER 
PART OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE WEEKEND WITH MOISTURE 
OVERRUNNING THE CHILLY AIRMASS IN THE PREVAILING SOUTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT. WENT CLOSER TO THE ECM NUMBERS FOR MAX AND MIN TEMPS. IT 
SHOULD BE A NICE WORK WEEK WITH TEMPERATURES RISING WELL ABOVE 
NORMAL FOR SEVERAL DAYS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 012012
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EST SUN DEC 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
CLOUDS OVER MIDDLE TN THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE MOVING INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE WEST THROUGH THE EVENING. MOISTURE IS CONFINED TO A
SHALLOW LAYER...BELOW 700 MB. SOME WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT SKIRTS OUR
SOUTHERN COUNTIES AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND THE NAM/GFS PRODUCE SOME
LIGHT QPF IN THAT AREA LATE TONIGHT AND INTO MONDAY. WILL HAVE A
SLIGHT CHANCE POP SOUTH. THE NAM SPREADS PRECIP INTO NORTHERN
SECTIONS AROUND 12Z...BUT THIS SEEMS OVERDONE AND WILL GO CLOSER TO
THE GFS. THIS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LINGERS OVER THE ENTIRE AREA
THROUGH MONDAY...KEEPING CLOUDY SKIES IN PLACE...ALTHOUGH LIFT
REMAINS VERY WEAK AND ONLY IN SOUTHERN AREAS. ALTHOUGH THERE IS
SOME WEAK 850 MB WARM ADVECTION TOMORROW...WILL LEAN ON THE COOL
SIDE OF MOS TEMPS DUE TO EXPECTED CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH THE LONGER TERM WILL PROVIDE
SEVERAL CHANCES FOR RAIN. MODELS STILL IN DISAGREEMENT ON PRECIP
CHANCES AND AMOUNT FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED. WILL CONTINUE THE
TREND TOWARD THE DRIER GFS SOLUTION.

SOUTHERLY FLOW AT 850MB BEGINS TO DEVELOP MONDAY NIGHT WHILE A WEAK 
WAVE OF ENERGY MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. LIFT AND MOISTURE HOWEVER 
APPEAR TO BE LACKING...WILL KEEP MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN 
OVERNIGHT MONDAY EXCEPT FOR EXTREME SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SW NC WHERE 
CHANCE POPS WILL BE IN PLACE. ANY PRECIP THAT OCCURS WILL LIKELY BE IN 
THE FORM OF LIGHT SHOWERS OR DRIZZLE. THE WAVE IS OFF TO OUR EAST BY 
TUESDAY...BUT ANOTHER SYSTEM IS BEGINNING TO TAKE SHAPE ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS. MODELS SHOW A SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING SOMEWHERE 
ALONG THE FRONT RANGE ON TUESDAY WITH AN ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT THAT 
WILL BE BACK TO OUR SOUTHWEST THAT WILL BEGIN TO APPROACH OUR AREA. 
MODELS WANT TO BRING IN LIGHT PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH WARM FRONTAL 
OVERRUNNING...BUT DEEP MOISTURE AND LIFT APPEAR TO BE LACKING 
ACCORDING TO GFS WHILE THE NAM IS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH PRECIP. WILL 
KEEP JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT PRECIP IN FOR TUESDAY FROM 
KNOXVILLE SOUTH AND ALONG THE PLATEAU. KEPT POPS OUT FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT.

850MB SOUTHERLY FLOW CONTINUES TO STRENGTHEN TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING PLAINS SYSTEM. BY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING THE WARM FRONT IS TO OUR NORTH ACROSS INDIANA AND 
ILLINOIS...WHICH APPEARS TO BE TOO FAR TO OUR NORTHWEST TO PROVIDE 
ANY SUBSTANTIAL LIFT OVER OUR AREA AS WE SHOULD BE WELL IN THE WARM 
SECTOR AT THIS POINT. WILL LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE 
PLATEAU AND FROM KNOXVILLE SOUTH BUT DRY FURTHER EAST. BY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT THE COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THE PLAINS SYSTEM IS JUST OFF 
TO OUR WEST AND SHOULD BEGIN TO ENTER OUR AREA BY THE THURSDAY 
MORNING/AFTERNOON TIME FRAME. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A 
THUNDERSTORM IN FOR THURSDAY AS TEMPS WILL BE IN THE 60S AND 
DEWPOINTS IN THE 50S AHEAD OF THE FRONT. 

A MORE INTERESTING STORY DEVELOPS ALONG THE STALLED OUT COLD 
FRONT...A LARGE DEEPENING TROUGH ACROSS THE WESTERN US WILL SHIFT 
THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS INTO A SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WEDNESDAY INTO 
THURSDAY ALONG WITH A SUBSTANTIAL UPPER LEVEL JET THAT WILL MOVE 
INTO OUR AREA FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. STRONG SW FLOW WILL TAP 
INTO GULF MOISTURE AND BEGIN TO INCREASE PWS. GFS SOUNDINGS SHOW PWS 
OF AT LEAST ONE INCH FROM WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY 
MORNING...TOPPING OUT AT 1.4 TO 1.5 INCHES ON THURSDAY WHICH PUTS US 
IN THE 99TH PERCENTILE BASED ON THE PW CLIMATOLOGY FOR EARLY 
DECEMBER. IT APPEARS THAT A PROLONGED PERIOD OF HEAVY RAINFALL IS 
POSSIBLE ACROSS OUR AREA DURING THE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY 
TIME FRAME IF THIS SETUP DOES INDEED TAKE PLACE. THIS IS SOMETHING 
THAT WILL HAVE TO BE MONITORED CLOSELY WITH FUTURE MODEL RUNS. THE 
GFS SHOWS A BREAK IN THE RAIN SHOWERS ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON BEFORE 
MORE POSSIBLE RAIN COMES IN FOR SUNDAY. A FEW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS 
ARENT OUT OF THE QUESTION SATURDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT AS THE DEEP 
TROUGH BRINGS IN COLDER AIR BEHIND THE DEPARTED COLD FRONT.

TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO WARM THROUGH THE EXTENDED AND WILL MAX 
OUT THURSDAY AHEAD OF THE FRONT WITH TEMPS IN THE MID 60S AND WILL 
BEGIN TO DROP ON FRIDAY BEHIND THE FRONT WITH HIGHS IN THE 40S OVER 
THE WEEKEND.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             42  54  46  63  47 /  20  20  30  30  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  37  52  41  58  43 /  10  10  20  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  52  41  58  44 /  10  10  20  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              30  51  34  55  37 /   0  10  10  10  10

MIDNIGHT. THESE CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN OVER THE AREA THROUGH
TOMORROW...AND MAY LOWER TO THE MVFR RANGE AT CHA LATE TONIGHT.
SHOULD THE ONSET OF THESE CLOUDS BE DELAYED...THERE COULD BE SOME
FOG DEVELOPMENT AT TRI...BUT WILL NOT MENTION ANY FOG IN THE TAFS
FOR NOW AS IT LOOKS LIKE CLOUDS WILL ARRIVE EARLY ENOUGH.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

.DISCUSSION...

EARLIER THIS MORNING...BUT WITH DAYTIME MIXING THE CLOUDS HAVE
HALTED THEIR APPROACH INTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THUS WE WILL SEE
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES TODAY WITH HIGH TEMPS NEAR NORMAL..IN THE 50S IN
MOST SPOTS. WITH NIGHTFALL...WE SHOULD SEE THESE CLOUDS RESUMING
THEIR PROGRESS TOWARD OUR AREA. THE FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK
SO FAR...NO UPDATE IS PLANNED.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST SUN DEC 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION WILL 
WEAKEN AS A WEAK SHORT WAVE APPROACHES DURING THE SHORT TERM.  SOME 
HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE AREA TO START TODAY...BUT MOISTURE WILL 
INCREASE LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT WITH AN INCREASE IN LOWER CLOUDS.  
MOISTURE LOOKS TO BE RATHER SHALLOW AND FORCING WILL BE WEAK. 
APPEARS BEST CHANCE FOR SOME LIGHT RAIN WILL BE SOUTH...SO WILL 
INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS THERE. WILL GO DRY 
REMAINDER OF THE AREA.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL 
STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS STRUGGLING WITH AN 
INITIAL PERIOD OF UNSETTLED WEATHER EARLY IN THE LONG TERM AND ARE 
NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT WITH TIMING CONCERNING THE LATE WEEK 
SYSTEM. MODELS DEPICT PASSAGE OF A FEW RIPPLES OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. 
THE WAVES ARE RATHER WEAK WITH SOMEWHAT LIMITED AVAILABLE MOISTURE. 
THERE IS A LEVEL OF UNCERTAINTY WITH PROBABILITY OF PRECIP WITH THE 
EARLY WEEK PERIOD SO KEPT A REDUCED CHANCE OF RAIN WITH THIS LOW 
PROBABILITY EVENT. HOPEFULLY LATER MODEL RUNS RESOLVE THESE INITIAL 
WAVES. UPPER LEVEL HEIGHTS GRADUALLY RISE ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES 
BY MID WEEK AS A TROUGH TAKES UP RESIDENCE OUT WEST...AMPLIFYING AS 
IT DOES SO. INCREASING WARM AND MOIST ADVECTION DEVELOPS OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH ENOUGH MOISTURE AND LIFT IN PLACE ACROSS 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SHOWER ON WEDNESDAY. 
POPS CRANK UP INTO THE LOW TO MEDIUM CHANCE RANGE WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
INTO THURSDAY AS A RIVER OF DEEP MOISTURE BUILDS EAST TOWARD THE 
APPALACHIAN REGION. ADDED SOME THUNDER TO THE MIX ON THURSDAY WITH 
MODELS PROGGING SOME WEAK INSTABILITY. A SHARP COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
EDGES STEADILY EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH LATER THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY ENHANCING LIFT. LIKELY POPS WERE APPLIED MAINLY FRIDAY INTO 
FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE BOUNDARY MOVES ONLY SLOWLY EAST. STAYED CLOSER 
TO THE SLOWER EUROPEAN MODEL CONCERNING FRONTAL TIMING HERE. WAS 
ABLE TO LOWER POPS BACK TO CHANCE CATEGORY SATURDAY WHILE DROPPING 
ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. MUCH OF THE LONG 
TERM PERIOD WILL BE UNSEASONABLY WARM WITH MILD DAYS AND NOT SO COLD 
NIGHTS IN THIS HIGHLY AMPLIFIED PATTERN.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...UPPER LEVEL ZONAL FLOW WILL

TOWARD TYS. THE BULK OF THE CLOUD COVER SHOULD STAY SOUTH OF 
KNOXVILLE. CLOUDS SHOULD BEGIN TO DECREASE LATE TOMORROW MORNING BUT 
WILL STILL KEEP SOME CLOUDS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS. HIGH TEMPS 
TOMORROW WILL BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER BUT STILL A FEW DEGREES 
BELOW NORMALS.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS 
EAST SUNDAY NIGHT AND WEAK SHORTWAVE AND FRONT MOVES INTO TN VALLEY 
MONDAY. THERE NOW LOOKS LIKE ENOUGH MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT FOR 
SOME LIGHT RAIN SOUTHERN SECTIONS. INCREASED POPS TO 40 PERCENT 
SOUTH BUT LEFT NORTH AT 20 PERCENT. MODELS SHOW WEAK RIDGING TO DRY 
ATMOSPHERE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AS DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE 
WESTERN STATES FORMS STRONGER STORM. CANADIAN AND GFS SHOW DEEPENING 
SURFACE LOW OVER THE PLAINS TO MOVE NORTHEAST INTO SOUTHEAST CANADA 
BY LATE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH MOISTURE INCREASE OVER 
FORECAST AREA AND A FEW SHOWERS SPREADING IN LATE WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. BUT ECMWF IS MUCH SLOWER AND FARTHER WEST WITH DEEP 
LOW MOVING INTO CANADA THURSDAY AS TROUGH DIGS EVEN DEEPER INTO THE 
DESERT SOUTHWEST. THAT COULD MEAN DRY CONDITIONS WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT GFS HAS FRONT MOVE 
ACROSS TN WITH HIGHEST POPS JUST AHEAD AND ALONG FRONT. ECMWF MOVING 
FRONT MUCH SLOWER WITH FRONT NOT APPROACHING EAST TN UNTIL THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND ONLY SLOWLY CROSS THE REGION FRIDAY. ECMWF SHOWS MORE 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY FOLLOWING THE FRONT WITH MORE SHOWERS FRIDAY NIGHT 
INTO SATURDAY. FOLLOWED THE SLOWER SOLUTION WITH HIGHEST CHANCES 
FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES ABOVE FREEZING SUNDAY NIGHT 
AND WARMING TO THE 50S MONDAY AND TUESDAY AND LOWER 60S POSSIBLE 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. COOLER TEMPERATURES SATURDAY BEHIND LATE 
WEEK FRONT.

EASTERN STATES MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. SUFFICIENT MOISTURE ALONG WITH 
SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT MAY ALLOW FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOME LIGHT 
RAIN ACROSS THE AREA DURING THIS PART OF THE FORECAST. A MORE 
AMPLIFIED SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE EASTERN STATES LATER IN THE 
WEEK. A NICE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE REGION FOR WEDNESDAY 
PROVIDING SUNSHINE AND MILDER TEMPERATURES. THE SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
ALOFT STRENGTHENS WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY AS A SLOW MOVING UPPER 
TROUGH EDGES VERY SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE WESTERN U.S. THE SYSTEM 
MOVES SO SLOWLY THAT I TRIED TO ONLY GRADUALLY RAISE POPS WITH A 
RELATIVE POP MIN IN THE DOWNSLOPE REGION OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. BY THURSDAY 
NIGHT...INCREASING MOISTURE ADVECTION AND LIFT AHEAD OF THE 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL LEAD TO HIGHER POPS FOR SHOWERS FRIDAY 
AND FRIDAY NIGHT. IT SHOULD BE A LENGTHY PERIOD OF ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES DUE TO THE PERSISTENT SOUTHERLY FLOW.

DROPPING INTO THE GREAT LAKES SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. THE WEAK COLD

DEVELOPING OVER THE EASTERN STATES. THIS FRONT WILL MAKE IT THROUGH 
THE TN VALLEY MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. AS THE TROUGH DIGS SOUTH THE 
FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE REGION MONDAY WITH JUST A LITTLE LIGHT 
RAIN MAINLY MONDAY AFTERNOON INTO MONDAY NIGHT. THEN RIDGING ALOFT 
STRENGTHENS AS LONGWAVE TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE WESTERN STATES

WARMING TEMPERATURES INTO THE MID 50S TO NEAR 60 WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER FRIDAY. TIMING OF THE LATER SYSTEM IS 
UNCLEAR AS GFS BRINGS PRE FRONTAL SHOWERS INTO FORECAST AREA 
THURSDAY WITH FRONT MOVING THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. WHILE ECMWF KEEPS 
BULK OF THE PRECIPITATION TO THE WEST THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND ONLY SLOWLY ADVANCES FRONT THROUGH FRIDAY WITH FRONT NOT MOVING 
THROUGH UNTIL AFTER THE 7 DAY FORECAST. WILL KEEP GOOD RAIN CHANCES

PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT 
AS THE SYSTEM SHIFTS EAST. HEIGHTS RISE BEHIND THE EARLY WEEK SYSTEM

FOR RAIN SHOWERS WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH INCREASING 
MOISTURE/TEMPERATURE ADVECTION ON SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS AS AMPLIFIED 
PATTERN DEVELOPS WITH LONG WAVE TROUGH BUILDING SLOWLY EAST THROUGH 
THE END OF THE WEEK. THE WARMING TREND WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO 
RISE ABOVE NORMAL BY MID WEEK.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST FRI NOV 29 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A NEAR ZONAL PATTERN FOR THE NEXT 
24 HOURS WITH PWS REMAINING QUITE DRY. BESIDES SOME CI/CS OVER THE 
AREA...CLEAR SKIES WILL REMAIN. AT THE SURFACE...RIDGING WILL 
CONTINUE AS WELL WITH WINDS REMAINING LIGHT/CALM.

FOR TONIGHT...MODELS DO SHOW SURFACE RELATIVE HUMIDITY BECOMING 
NEARLY SATURATED. WE MAY SEE SOME FOG DEVELOP NEAR AREA 
LAKES/STREAMS. AS FOR TEMPERATURES...FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE CLOSELY.


.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...00Z GFS/ECMWF GENERALLY 
AGREE WITH ZONAL CONFIGURATION TO THE UPPER LEVEL PATTERN SATURDAY  
AND SATURDAY NIGHT WITH SURFACE RIDGING KEEPING DRY WEATHER IN PLACE 
THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEKEND. HOWEVER...BY SUNDAY NIGHT AN UPPER 
TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY DRIVING A COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE 
EASTERN STATES. THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SOME LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT 
AS THE SYSTEM SHIFTS EAST. HEIGHTS RISE BEHIND THE EARLY WEEK SYSTEM 
ALLOWING FOR A DRY TUESDAY. MAINTAINED A GRADUAL INCREASE IN POPS 
FOR RAIN SHOWERS WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH INCREASING 
MOISTURE/TEMPERATURE ADVECTION ON SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS AS AMPLIFIED 
PATTERN DEVELOPS WITH LONG WAVE TROUGH BUILDING SLOWLY EAST THROUGH 
THE END OF THE WEEK. THE WARMING TREND WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO 
RISE ABOVE NORMAL BY MID WEEK.

NORMAL FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL 
AFFECT THE REGION MONDAY. SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT 
WITH THIS FEATURE. MODELS DIVERGE SOMEWHAT FOR TUESDAY WITH GFS DRY 
AND THE CANADIAN AND ECMWF WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AS SHORTWAVES 
CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH. WEDNESDAY A MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM MOVES 
INTO THE PLAINS STATES. A WARM FRONT BRINGS INCREASING RAIN CHANCES 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND ESPECIALLY THURSDAY. THE COLD FRONT WILL LIKELY 
NOT APPROACH UNTIL LATE THURSDAY OR FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES A LITTLE 
BELOW NORMAL MONDAY AND TUESDAY AND THEN SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 AM EST THU NOV 28 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHALLOW LOW-CLOUDS OVER THE
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE AREA WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY
ERODE THROUGH MID-MORNING. WILL CALL FOR PARTLY CLOUDY SKY THIS
MORNING...THEN BECOMING SUNNY. UPPER FLOW WILL BE NORTHWEST
TODAY...BUT WILL BECOME MORE WESTERLY THROUGH TONIGHT AND FLOW
BECOME MORE ZONAL OVER THE UNITED STATES AS NORTHEAST UPPER TROUGH
EXITS. SOME CI/CS WILL SPREAD INTO THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AS FLOW BECOMES MORE
ZONAL THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A ZONAL UPPER- 
LEVEL PATTERN THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY. THE ZONAL UPPER-LEVEL PATTERN 
WILL RESULT IN DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS THROUGH THE WEEKEND... 
ALONG WITH A WARMING TREND. ECMWF AND GFS MODELS AGREE THAT THE 
SHORT WAVE ON MONDAY WILL NOT HAVE MUCH MOISTURE TO WORK WITH...SO 
WILL ONLY INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. A LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED 
TO AMPLIFY OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE NATION BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT 
WEEK...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE DEVELOPING OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY. THIS PATTERN WILL BRING A CONTINUED WARMING TREND OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...WITH A WARM FRONT ON WEDNESDAY BRINGING ADDITIONAL 
SHOWERS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EST WED NOV 27 2013

.SHORT TERM...WILL OPEN THE FORECAST WITH A PRE FIRST PERIOD
STATEMENT ABOUT ACCUMULATING MOUNTAIN SNOWS CONTINUING. WILL EXTEND
THE WSW UNTIL 7 PM AS RADAR AND OBS SHOW MUCH THE SAME FETCH FROM E
KY INTO OUR CWA CONTINUES. THINKING AFTER SUNSET THINGS WILL
LESSEN...SO THE WARNING EXTENSION IS JUST FOR THREE HOURS. KEEP IN
MIND THAT BRISK WINDS AND COLD TEMPS ARE PRODUCING SINGLE DIGIT
WIND CHILLS. 

AFTER SUNSET THE GRADUAL TAPERING OF SNOW SHOULD REALLY
COMMENCE...SUCH THAT BY SUNRISE SNOWS WILL BE GONE. A COLD
THANKSGIVING DAY WILL GIVE WAY TO MINOR WARMING LATE WEEK BUT STILL
BELOW SEASONAL NORMS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL KEEP THE AREA UNDER FAIR
SKIES THANKSGIVING AND FRIDAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE AND ZONAL FLOW WILL BE ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH
SUNDAY EVENING. A SHORTWAVE APPROACHES THE AREA...BRINGING A CHANCE
OF RAIN OVERNIGHT SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. MODELS DISAGREE ABOUT
PLACEMENT OF CONVECTION DEVELOPING...WITH GFS TAKING SYSTEM TOO FAR
SOUTH TO IMPACT THE AREA. INCLUDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW.
LITTLE CAPE IS PRESENT WITH WEAK SHEAR. EXPECTING RAIN SHOWERS AS
THE MAIN ACTIVITY. TUESDAY EXPECTED TO BE DRY AS THE SHORTWAVE
MOVES TO THE EAST. A COLD FRONT WILL THEN APPROACH THE AREA
WEDNESDAY MORNING. RAIN EXPECTED WITH THIS FRONT AT THIS TIME.
GRADUAL WARMING TREND THROUGH THE WEEK...WITH TEMPERATURES
APPROACHING NORMAL VALUES FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 AM EST WED NOV 27 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONTO-GENETIC BAND WILL MOVE
ACROSS THE AREA EARLY THIS MORNING WITH SNOW ENDING OVER MUCH OF
THE AREA BY 10 AM OR EARLIER. CURRENT REPORTS SHOW MODERATE SNOW
ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA WITH SOME ACCUMULATIONS OVER THE GRASSY
SURFACES. WILL CONTINUE WITH THE SNOW ADVISORIES FOR THE CENTRAL
VALLEY..PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA THROUGH 10 AM AND
NORTHEAST SECTIONS UNTIL 1 PM. 

NAM AND GFS CONTINUE TO SHOW A PERIOD OF NORTHWEST FLOW OROGRAPHIC
LIFT INTO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. HOWEVER...DURATION IS MUCH LESS THAN
PREVIOUS RUNS...SO HAVE REDUCED SNOW ACCUMULATIONS AND WILL END
WARNING AT 4 PM. HOWEVER..NAM DOES SHOW SOME BOUNDARY LAYER
INSTABILITY OVER SOUTHEAST KENTUCKY/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THIS
AFTERNOON WHICH WILL HELP KEEP SNOW SHOWERS GOING FOR WISE COUNTY..
VIRGINIA.

WILL LIKELY ISSUE AN UPDATE BEFORE 8 AM AS SNOW ENDS ACROSS THE AREA.

AS FOR CLOUDS...LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF LOW-
LEVEL DRY AIR JUST WEST AND NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
WHICH WILL ADVECT INTO THE AREA TODAY. THE DRY AIR WILL HELP ERODE
THE LOW-CLOUDS FAIRLY QUICKLY TODAY FROM WEST TO EAST.

FOR TONIGHT...BESIDES A FEW LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS OVER FAR
NORTHERN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND A CHANCE OF FLURRIES OVER THE
NORTHEAST THIRD OF THE AREA...SKIES WILL BE CLEARING WITH COLD
TEMPERATURES FOR THANKSGIVING MORNING.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS SHOW A ZONAL UPPER- 
LEVEL FLOW PATTERN DEVELOPING ON THANKSGIVING AND LINGERING THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND...WHICH WILL RESULT IN DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS FOR 
THE FORECAST AREA. A WARMING TREND WILL ALSO DEVELOP THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...AS SOUTHERLY WINDS DEVELOP OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON THE 
BACK SIDE OF AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE NORTHEAST. 
MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THAT A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
PUSH A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY... 
RESULTING IN SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY 
TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.

050 
FXUS64 KMRX 261954
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EST TUE NOV 26 2013

.SHORT TERM....SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY 
TROUGH/UPPER LOW AND THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES/UPPER MIDWEST UPPER 
TROUGH EDGING A LITTLE CLOSER TO PHASING LATE TONIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY. AT MID AFTERNOON LARGE AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN 
PRESSING GRADUALLY NORTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. 
THE WIDESPREAD HEAVIER RAIN WILL LARGELY DIMINISH THROUGH THE 
EVENING HOURS WHILE THE FORECAST AREA AWAITS THE SUB-FREEZING AIR 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE NORTHERN STREAM SYSTEM. SHORTLY AFTER MIDNIGHT 
THE RAIN WILL BE CHANGING TO SNOW IN THE HIGHER CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
TERRAIN...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER. BY 3 AM EST...ENOUGH COLD AIR WILL BE STREAMING 
EAST ACROSS THE REGION FOR MUCH OF THE PRECIPITATION TO CHANGE OVER 
TO LIGHT SNOW. ADJUSTED THE WINTER STORM WATCH TO A WARNING FOR THE 
AFTERNOON FORECAST ISSUANCE. BASICALLY KEPT THE SAME WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORY FROM THE PREVIOUS ISSUANCE...ALTHOUGH ADDED EXTREME 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AS WELL AS CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES IN NORTH 
CAROLINA. ALSO...I TRUNCATED THE TIMING OF THE ADVISORY EVENT BACK 
TO 18Z WEDNESDAY AS MODEL FORECASTS AGREE THAT THE DEEPEST MOISTURE 
AND LIFT SHIFT EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS TIME. MORE THAN 
SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND UPSLOPE FLOW WILL LIKELY KEEP THE SNOW 
FLYING ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE 
MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY 
EVENING. SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION FOR MUCH OF THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE FROM AROUND 2 OR 3 AM EST TO AROUND 10 AM 
EST. THE BEST CHANCE FOR ACCUMULATING SNOW WILL BE ON GRASSY 
SURFACES IN THE GREAT VALLEY WHERE TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY COOL A 
DEGREE OR TWO BELOW FREEZING LATE TONIGHT. IN MUCH OF THE ADVISORY 
AREA SNOWFALL WILL ACCUMULATE TO AROUND 1 TO 2 INCHES MAINLY ON THE 
GRASS. FARTHER SOUTH AROUND CHATTANOOGA ACCUMULATION SHOULD BE LESS 
THAN AN INCH. THE HIGHER TERRAIN (IN THE WINTER STORM WARNING) COULD 
SEE AMOUNTS CLOSER TO 2 TO 4 INCHES WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS ON 
THE ORDER OF 4 TO 8 INCHES. ADDING DISCOMFORT TO THE LATE NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY PERIOD WILL BE A GUSTY NORTH TO NORTHWEST WIND.  


.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS A BIT
INCONSISTENT ABOUT TIMING OF THE SNOWFALL EXITING THE AREA. BY
WEDNESDAY NIGHT UPSLOPE FLOW DOMINATES THE FORCING FOR SNOW
ACCUMULATION...MAINLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. INCLUDED A SLIGHT
CHANCE FOR LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS IN THESE AREAS UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY
NIGHT. WINDS WILL BECOME GUSTY AS THE LOW PRESSURE MOVES UP THE
EAST COAST. WIND CHILL VALUES COULD EASILY REACH THE TEENS THURSDAY
MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE THEN SETTLES OVER THE AREA FOR THURSDAY
THROUGH SUNDAY...WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND A WARMING TREND PRESENT
THROUGH THIS TIME. TEMPERATURES WILL APPROACH NORMAL FOR THIS TIME
OF YEAR. NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN MOVES INTO THE AREA MONDAY MORNING
THROUGH MID DAY TUESDAY. RAIN LOOKS LIKE THE MAIN CONCERN WITH THIS
SYSTEM.

.AVIATION...LIFR/IFR CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL AT ALL TAF SITES 
THROUGH THE FORECAST..EXCEPT FOR MVFR CONDITIONS AT TRI BETWEEN 12 
AND 15Z THIS MORNING. ANOTHER CONCERN WILL BE WIND SHEAR CONDIITONS 
AT ALL TAF SITES TODAY AS SURFACE WINDS WILL BE NORTHEAST AT WINDS 
BETWEEN 1 AND 3KFT ABOVE GROUND BECOMING SOUTHWEST AT 30KTS.

STRONG UPPER LEVE STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
TODAY AND TONIGHT PRODUCING WIDESPREAD RAIN TODAY...THEN BECOMING 
SNOW AT ALL TAF SITES BETWEEN 07-09Z WEDNESDAY MORNING. AS THE 
SURFACE LOW MOVES NORTHEAST OF THE AREA THIS EVENING...SURFACE WINDS 
WILL CHANGE FROM NORTHEAST TO NORTHWEST AND INCREASE TO 10 TO 20KTS 
WITH GUSTS TO 25KTS BETWEEN 04-06Z.

FXUS64 KMRX 260903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST TUE NOV 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED NEAR THE MOUTH OF THE MS 
RIVER...WITH ALMOST ALL OF THE OBSERVATIONS IN THE FORECAST AREA 
REPORTING RAIN WITH ABOVE FREEZING TEMPS. THERE MAY STILL BE SOME 
POCKETS OF FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET IN A FEW VALLEYS...BUT THESE 
FREEZING POCKETS SHOULD DISAPPEAR BY SUNRISE AS A STRONG WARM AIR 
ADVECTION PATTERN CONTINUES OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT ONE TO THREE INCHES OF RAIN WILL FALL OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THIS EVENING...WITH THE HIGHEST AMOUNTS EXPECTED 
OVER THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NC. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL 
THEN MOVE INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SLEET DEVELOPING LATE 
TONIGHT DURING THE TRANSITION FROM RAIN TO SNOW...DUE TO A WARM 750 
MB LAYER THAT STAYS ABOVE FREEZING FOR A FEW HOURS AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A DEFORMATION ZONE WILL 
DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT...BEFORE NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW DEVELOPS BEHIND THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS ON WEDNESDAY. THUS...IT 
APPEARS THAT PRECIPITATION INTENSITY COULD BE ENHANCED OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA AS THE RAIN CHANGES TO SNOW LATE TONIGHT. WITH THIS IN 
MIND...WILL ISSUE A WINTER STORM WATCH FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 
A WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR MOST OF THE LOWER ELEVATIONS (WITH THE 
EXCEPTION OF SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC). AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW BEHIND 
EXITING NORTHEASTER WILL WEAKEN WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH SNOW SHOWERS 
AND CLOUDS DIMINISHING. ANOTHER 1/2 TO 1 INCH OF ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL 
IS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS.

FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED...DRY NORTHWEST-WEST UPPER FLOW AND SURFACE 
RIDING WILL PRODUCE A DRY AND MOSTLY CLEAR FORECAST THROUGH THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT. SURFACE RIDGING MOVES EAST BY SUNDAY ALLOWING 
MOISTURE TO MOVE BACK INTO THE REGION WITH SKY BECOMING MOSTLY 
CLOUDY AREA-WIDE. ANOTHER SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE MOVES ACROSS 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY PRODUCING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS. AT THIS TIME...ANTICIPATE 
MAINLY RAIN FROM THIS SYSTEM.

.DISCUSSION...THE ATMOSPHERE IS MOISTENING UP OVER THE EASTERN

PLATEAU AND THE CENTRAL VALLEY. THE PRECIPITATION WAS ADVANCING
NORTHEAST INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS WELL AT THIS HOUR.
TEMPERATURES RANGED FROM THE LOWER 40S IN SW NC TO THE LOWER 30S ON
THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE MOUNTAINS OF SW VA. DEW
POINTS ARE IN THE TEENS IN THE PRECIPITATION FREE AREAS TO 20S
WHERE PRECIPITATION HAS STARTED. SOME SLEET...SNOW AND LIGHT
FREEZING RAIN HAS BEEN REPORTED ON THE PLATEAU AND THE EAST CENTRAL
VALLEY AND INTO SW VA. WET BULB COOLING HAS ALLOWED A FEW PLACES ON
THE PLATEAU AND ALONG THE NORTHERN TN BORDER INTO SW VA TO DROP
BELOW FREEZING. EXPECT THIS AREA TO WARM ABOVE FREEZING DURING THE
NEXT FEW HOURS. IF THIS AREA STAYS BELOW FREEZING MAY HAVE TO
ISSUE A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. THE AREA
TO THE EAST AND NORTHEAST SHOULD SEE PRECIPITATION DEVELOP THE NEXT
FEW HOURS. THE FORECAST AREA WILL SEE THE PRECIPITATION CHANGE TO ALL
LIQUID AS THE LOWER LEVELS WARM ABOVE FREEZING BY AROUND 6Z.
UPDATED FORECAST SENT.

398 
FXUS64 KMRX 251950
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST MON NOV 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WIDESPREAD CLOUDS COVER THE
STATE OF TENNESSEE...SOUTHWEST VA AND SOUTHWEST NC. SURFACE
DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE SINGLE DIGITS TO MIDDLE TEENS ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA. WILL EXPERIENCE VERY LIGHT RAIN FIRST FROM
CHATTANOOGA WEST EARLY THIS EVENING. EXPECT THIS AREA OF
PRECIPITATION TO SPREAD NORTHEASTWARD. WITH THE LOW DEWPOINTS AM
SLIGHTLY CONCERNED THAT WETBULB COOLING WILL OCCUR FOR A LITTLE
LONGER THAN CURRENT FORECAST SUGGESTS PARTICULARLY OVER THE
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND PORTIONS OF SW VA. ANTICIPATING THE
FREEZING RAIN BEGINNING AROUND 10 OR 11PM FOR AN HOUR OR TWO BEFORE
CHANGING OVER TO RAIN. THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE NORTHWARD INTO SW
VA TOWARD SUNRISE...BEFORE CHANGING TO ALL LIQUID AS THE LOWER
LEVELS WARM ABOVE FREEZING.

ON TUESDAY...PERIODS OF HEAVY RAIN WILL OCCUR ESPECIALLY ALONG AND 
EAST OF I-75. AT THIS TIME THE HEAVIEST RAINFALL WILL BE 2.5 TO 2.75 
INCHES ACROSS SW NC AND SE TN. EXPECT THE RAINFALL TO LESSEN IN 
INTENSITY BY LATE IN THE AFTERNOON TUESDAY.


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LOW PRESSURE WILL
CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST...WITH PRECIP IN FORECAST THROUGH
WEDNESDAY EVENING. TUESDAY NIGHT...SOUNDINGS ACROSS THE AREA SHOW
ABOVE FREEZING TEMPERATURES FROM SFC TO MIDLEVELS THROUGH 00Z.
COLD AIR WILL QUICKLY ADVECT INTO THE AREA FROM THE
NORTHWEST...TAKING THE ENTIRE SOUNDING TO BELOW ZERO TEMPERATURES.
DURING THIS TIME THE TEMPERATURE DROPS QUICKLY ENOUGH... SO EXPECT
ANY RAIN TO TRANSITION FULLY TO SNOW. ANY SLEET WILL BE VERY SHORT
LIVED...SO LEFT OUT OF FORECAST. NORTHERN PLATEAU COULD SEE THIS
TRANSITION FIRST BETWEEN 9 PM AND 11 PM...WITH THE REST OF THE
PLATEAU AND VALLEY BETWEEN 10 PM AND 12 AM. SHORTLY AFTER
MIDNIGHT...EXPECT THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA TO DROP BELOW FREEZING
WITH SNOW AS THE MAIN EVENT.

THE SOUNDING IS VERY MOIST THROUGH UPPER MID LEVELS THROUGH
THE EARLY MORNING. AMOUNTS OF UP TO 3-6 INCHES ARE POSSIBLE IN
NORTHEASTERN TN...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF
THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. NORTHERN PLATEAU COULD SEE LOCALLY HEAVY
BANDING OF SNOW AS THE WRAP AROUND MOISTURE FROM THE LOW PRESSURE
MAKES ITS WAY INTO THE AREA. DRY AIR WILL THEN MOVE IN BEHIND THIS
LOW...WITH SNOW ENDING AROUND CHATTANOOGA SHORTLY AFTER SUNRISE. BY
MID MORNING...THE REST OF THE PLATEAU AND VALLEY WILL SEE SNOW
ENDING. UPSLOPE FLOW WILL BE PRESENT WITH SNOW CONTINUING FOR THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. EVEN
THOUGH MOISTURE IS SHALLOW IN THE SOUNDINGS AT THIS
TIME...EXPECTING ANOTHER ONE TO TWO INCHES ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. MOST ACCUMULATION WILL BE ON ELEVATED SURFACES
AND GRASSY AREAS...WITH SOME MELTING ON ROADWAYS. 

WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL STAY 
IN THE LOW TO MID 30S...WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THROUGH THE LATE 
AFTERNOON. ANY SNOW LEFT ON THE GROUND MAY LOWER TEMPERATURES 
ANOTHER DEGREE OR TWO FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT LEFT LOW 
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID TEENS TO THE LOWER 20S. WINDS WILL 
BE GUSTY WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH WIND CHILL VALUES 
REACHING THE TEENS ACROSS THE AREA. 

FOR THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE IN FOR THE 
REST OF THE WORK WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND. CLEARING SKIES AND A WARMING 
TREND WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL APPROACH
NEAR NORMAL BY FRIDAY. NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN LOOKS TO BE LATE SUNDAY NIGHT
INTO MONDAY.

.DISCUSSION...
OPAQUE CLOUD COVER WAS OBSERVED OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA LATE
THIS MORNING. VERY DRY AIR WAS AT THE SURFACE WHERE DEWPOINTS WERE
IN THE SINGLE DIGITS AND TEENS. EXPECT THE LOW LEVELS TO SATURATE
BY EARLY EVENING. THEREFORE...THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY SHOULD
REMAIN PRECIPITATION FREE.

UPDATE WAS MADE TO THE ZONES TO TRIM PRECIP CHANCES FOR LIGHT
RAIN/SLEET MIX TO OCCUR ACROSS OUR SOUTHERN VALLEY LOCATIONS LATER
THIS AFTERNOON. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE THE DRY LOW LEVELS WILL
LIKELY INHIBIT ANY MEASURABLE PRECIP TO OCCUR. HOWEVER...BY EARLY
EVENING SLEET MAY OCCUR FOR A COUPLE OF HOURS BEFORE CHANGING TO
ALL RAIN PARTICULARLY OVER SOUTHWEST NC...NE TN AND SW VA AS WELL
AS THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES. MORE ON THIS IN THE
AFTERNOON DISCUSSION. OTHERWISE UPDATED WIND GRIDS...DEWPOINTS AND
MAX TEMP GRIDS.

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC REGION...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD 
AND VERY DRY AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY THIS MORNING...WHICH WERE OCCURRING OUT AHEAD OF AN UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. CEILINGS WILL CONTINUE TO 
GRADUALLY LOWER TODAY AS THIS UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES FURTHER...AND 
DEVELOPS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TONIGHT OVER THE NORTHERN GULF OF 
MEXICO. RAIN WILL QUICKLY SPREAD NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE TAF SITES 
THIS EVENING...WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME SLEET MIXED WITH THE RAIN INITIALLY...AS THE DEEPER MOISTURE 
BEGINS TO MOVE INTO THE REGION. MVFR CEILINGS AND VISIBILITIES 
SHOULD DEVELOP LATER TONIGHT AS THE RAIN INTENSIFIES OVER THE TAF 
SITES.

505 
FXUS64 KMRX 250827
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST MON NOV 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AND VERY DRY AIR MASS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF 
HIGH CLOUDS MOVING NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY...OUT 
AHEAD OF AN AMPLIFYING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL HELP TO DEVELOP A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER 
THE NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO TONIGHT...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED MOISTURE 
RAPIDLY SPREADING NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN DEVELOPING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH A WELL-ABOVE-FREEZING 850 MB 
LAYER DEVELOPING SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET THIS EVENING. THIS TYPE OF 
VERTICAL TEMP PROFILE IS SUPPORTIVE OF EITHER SLEET OR FREEZING 
RAIN...BUT SINCE TONIGHT'S TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO EITHER REMAIN ABOVE 
FREEZING OR QUICKLY RISE ABOVE FREEZING AFTER THE PRECIP BEGINS... 
WILL JUST MENTION RAIN AND A CHANCE OF SLEET (WITH NO SLEET 
ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED). AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE 
WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL STORM 
SYSTEM WILL IMPACT THE REGION TUESDAY...TUESDAY NIGHT AND INTO THE 
DAY ON WEDNESDAY...BEFORE EXITING THE AREA LATE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. WIDESPREAD AREAS OF PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE OVER THE 
AREA TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT /SOME LOCALLY HEAVY AT TIMES/...WITH 
STORM TOTAL AMOUNTS OF BETWEEN 2 TO 4 INCHES OF LIQUID PRECIPITATION 
POSSIBLE THROUGH 12Z THURSDAY. THERE ARE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES 
BETWEEN THE MODELS...BUT THEY ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH RESPECT 
TO BRINGING PRECIPITATION TO THE AREA DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. HAVE 
GONE CATEGORICAL POPS ALL DAY TUESDAY...BEFORE GRADUALLY LOWERING 
THEM TO LIKELY ALONG THE PLATEAU LATE TUESDAY AND EVENTUALLY 
TAPERING THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST ON WEDNESDAY. THE INITIAL 
IMPACTS FROM THIS SYSTEM WILL BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND PERHAPS 
SOME FLOODING DUE TO THE PERSISTENT RAINS EXPECTED ON TUESDAY/ 
TUESDAY EVENING. THEN...AS COLDER AIR MOVES INTO THE REGION TUESDAY 
NIGHT...THIS RAIN WILL TURN TO SNOW AND RESULT IN SOME ACCUMULATIONS 
ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE SMOKIES...THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND 
CUMBERLAND MOUNTAINS AND PORTIONS OF FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. 

ON TUESDAY MORNING...TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH TO SUPPORT 
SOME SLEET MIXING IN WITH THE RAIN AND PERHAPS RESULT IN SOME MINOR 
ICING AND BLACK ICE FORMING ON THE AREA ROADWAYS. HOWEVER...BY MID 
TO LATE MORNING TEMPERATURES WILL INCREASE AND A MODERATE TO LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAIN WILL LIKELY FALL FOR MOST OF THE DAY. A COLD FRONT IS 
THEN PROGGED TO SWEEP THROUGH THE REGION LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND 
WILL USHER IN SOME COOLER INTO THE AREA BY THE EVENING AS WINDS 
SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST. THE TEMPERATURE PROFILE ALOFT PARTICULARLY 
COOLS...AND THIS COMBINED WITH A STILL FAIRLY MOIST ATMOSPHERE WILL 
SUPPORT AN EVENTUAL CHANGE OVER FROM RAIN TO SNOW OVERNIGHT. THIS 
WILL OCCUR FIRST IN THE EVENING HOURS ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...AND THEN 
ACROSS THE VALLEY AFTER MIDNIGHT AS TEMPERATURES APPROACH THE 
FREEZING MARK. BY WEDNESDAY MORNING...THE SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO PULL 
EAST OF THE AREA...BUT SNOW SHOWERS FROM WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE 
BACK SIDE OF THE TROUGH WILL BE POSSIBLE /ESPECIALLY ALONG THE 
MOUNTAINS AND THE NORTHEAST ZONES/. BY THE AFTERNOON...DRY AIR WILL 
FILTER INTO THE AREA FROM WEST TO EAST AS THE SYSTEM DEPARTS... 
DIMINISHING ANY LINGERING PRECIPITATION BY THE EVENING. 

AS IS USUALLY THE CASE WITH ANY WINTER WEATHER FORECAST ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALCHIANS...THERE IS UNCERTAINTY IN 
THE EXACT TRACK OF THE UPPER LOW...THE DURATION OF THE DEEP MOISTURE 
PLUME AND WHEN IT WILL COINCIDE WITH THE COLDER AIR MOVING IN. 
THOUGH THE MODELS ARE GENERALLY IN AGREEMENT...THERE ARE SOME SUBTLE 
DIFFERENCES WHICH CERTAINLY HAVE A LARGER IMPACT WHEN IT COMES TO 
SNOWFALL FORECASTING AND ACCUMULATIONS. AS IT STANDS NOW...THE 
POTENTIAL FOR ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL APPEARS TO BE GREATER THAN IT 
DID YESTERDAY GIVEN COLDER AIR MOVING IN FASTER COMBINED WITH A 
STILL VERY MOIST ATMOSPHERE TUESDAY NIGHT. AIDING THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SNOW ALONG THE TERRAIN WILL BE A STOUT NORTHWEST FLOW ON WEDNESDAY 
ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW WHICH WILL ENHANCE OROGRAPHIC LIFT. THIS 
MAY ALLOW FOR SOME LOCALLY HEAVIER SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS ON WEDNESDAY. 
THUS...THINK THAT SOME ADVISORY-LEVEL SNOWS ARE FAIRLY LIKELY 
ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...FAR NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND THE GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS. ADDITIONALLY...SOME 
ACCUMULATIONS OF AROUND AN INCH WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU AND NORTHERN VALLEY. ELSEWHERE...SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS 
LESS THAN HALF AN INCH WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY 
AND FOOTHILLS. THOSE WITH TRAVEL PLANS DURING THIS TIME PERIOD 
SHOULD CERTAINLY MONITOR THE PROGRESS OF THIS STORM SYSTEM AND THE 
LATEST FORECAST INFORMATION OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. 

IN WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM...UPPER-RIDGING WILL BUILD IN FOR 
THANKSGIVING AND THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND...RESULTING IN A DRY FORECAST 
THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD. HOWEVER...VERY CHILLY CONDITIONS CAN 
BE EXPECTED FOR THANKSGIVING AND BLACK FRIDAY...AS HIGHS WILL REACH 
THE MID 30S TO MID 40S AND LOWS WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE UPPER TEENS 
AND 20S.
&&

821 
FXUS64 KMRX 241947
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EST SUN NOV 24 2013

.SHORT TERM...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA THROUGH
MONDAY. DRY CONDITIONS AND GUSTY WINDS WILL BE PRESENT THIS
EVENING...WITH CLOUD COVER INCREASING EACH PERIOD AHEAD OF AN
APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. DEWPOINTS VERY LOW...SO NO FOG
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP THIS EVENING. WIND CHILL VALUES WILL BE IN THE
TEENS OVERNIGHT TONIGHT. FLOW IS OUT OF THE NORTH AND LOW TEMPERATURES
WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. MONDAY
IS EXPECTED TO BE WARMER THAN TODAY DUE TO THE INFLUENCES OF THE
HIGH PRESSURE...AND THE WIND FIELD SHIFTING TO OUT OF THE SOUTH SOUTHEAST.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...BY MONDAY NIGHT THE
UPPER LOW WILL BE LOCATED OVER THE TX AND OKLAHOMA PANHANDLES.
ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL STREAM OVER THE SE U.S. INCLUDING
E TN...SW VA..AND SW NC. PRECIPITATION WILL BEGIN BY MONDAY NIGHT
FIRST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SPREAD NORTHEASTWARD. FORECAST
SOUNDINGS FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD INDICATE THAT THE NORTHERN
PLATEAU AND PARTS OF SW VA MAY SEE A WINTRY MIX AFTER MIDNIGHT WITH
FREEZING RAIN AND/OR SLEET. LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS (LESS THAN ONE
TENTH INCH) OF ICE WILL BE POSSIBLE BY SUNRISE. THANKFULLY
TEMPERATURES WILL RISE ABOVE FREEZING QUICKLY AND CHANGE ANY FROZEN
PRECIP BACK TO LIQUID FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY ON TUESDAY.

THE UPPER LOW WILL DIG INTO SOUTHEAST TX/SW LA. FARTHER NORTH 
ANOTHER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS. THE COMBINATION 
OF THE TROUGHS COMING INTO PHASE SHOULD CAUSE THE SYSTEM TO BE A 
LITTLE MORE PROGRESSIVE. RECALLING YESTERDAY/S MODELS...THIS IS MORE 
IN LINE WITH THE ECMWF SOLUTION AND THE MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT TODAY WITH THIS SOLUTION. 

TUESDAY NIGHT COLDER AIR WILL FILTER IN FROM THE NORTHWEST. THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SW VA SHOULD SEE RAIN BEGIN TO CHANGE OVER TO 
SNOW BEFORE MIDNIGHT..PERHAPS CHANGING TO SLEET BRIEFLY. MANY 
LOCATIONS WILL EXPERIENCE THE CHANGEOVER TO SNOW BY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. PREVIOUS FORECAST DRIED THINGS OUT A LITTLE TOO QUICKLY 
GIVEN NORTHWEST FLOW AND OROGRAPHIC SNOW POTENTIAL FOR 
WEDNESDAY...IN THE WAKE OF THE TROUGH. SO...ADDITIONAL LIGHT 
SNOWFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE UNTIL AT LEAST EARLY AFTERNOON ON 
WEDNESDAY. FIRST GUESS SNOW TOTALS WILL BE HIGHEST ACROSS RUSSELL 
COUNTY VA AND HIGHEST MOUNTAIN ELEVATIONS WITH 3 TO 6 INCHES 
POSSIBLE. OTHER AREAS LIKE THE PLATEAU AND PARTS OF THE NORTHERN 
VALLEY MAY SEE 1 TO 2 INCHES OR LESS. ICE ACCUMULATIONS LOOK TO BE 
LESS THAN TWO TENTHS OF AN INCH WITH MAX ICE ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE 
OVER SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN. 

AFTER WEDNESDAY THE SKY WILL CLEAR AND NO SIGNIFICANT WEATHER IS 
EXPECTED THROUGH NEXT WEEKEND. 




&&

746 
FXUS64 KMRX 240821
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EST SUN NOV 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY... 
WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AND VERY DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. THE CENTER OF THIS HIGH WILL BECOME LOCATED OVER THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS BY THIS EVENING...WITH UNSEASONABLY COLD AND TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA INTO TONIGHT. HIGH 
CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT OVER THE FORECAST AREA...AHEAD OF AN 
AMPLIFYING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY 
AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE MAIN FOCUS OF THE 
EXTENDED FORECAST WILL BE A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
THAT WILL IMPACT THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY... 
BRINGING ANOTHER SHOT OF COOLER AIR AND WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION TO 
THE REGION. A SURFACE LOW WILL SHIFT NORTHEASTWARD FROM THE GULF 
COAST TOWARD THE CAROLINAS/MID-ATLANTIC MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. 
AS ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES OVER THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT...THIS 
WILL PRODUCE BROAD AREAS OF SHOWERS THAT WILL LIFT NORTHEASTWARD 
INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA QUICKLY AFTER 
SUNSET...AND BRING ADDITIONAL ROUNDS OF PRECIPITATION TUESDAY AND 
TUESDAY NIGHT...BEFORE SHIFTING EAST OF THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. THERE ARE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE 
MODELS...BUT THEY ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH RESPECT TO BRINGING 
PRECIPITATION TO THE AREA DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. GIVEN THIS...HAVE 
INCREASED POPS MONDAY NIGHT TO LIKELY ACROSS A GOOD PORTION OF THE 
AREA...AND HAVE GONE CATEGORICAL TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...BEFORE 
BEGINNING TO GRADUALLY TAPER THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST ON WEDNESDAY.

THE PRIMARY QUESTION WILL BE THE TIMING OF A COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE 
AND THE LOCATION/TRACK OF THE UPPER-LEVEL LOW. THIS WILL HAVE A 
LARGE IMPACT ON PRECIPITATION TYPE...WHICH COULD CHANGE FROM 
RAIN/SLEET TO RAIN TO RAIN/SNOW AND SNOW OVER THE COURSE OF THE 
EVENT. STARTING MONDAY NIGHT...TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN ABOVE 
FREEZING OVER MUCH OF THE VALLEY AND EVEN SOME OF THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OVERNIGHT /DUE TO A WARM NOSE ALOFT/. HOWEVER...MODEL 
SOUNDINGS ARE INDICATING THAT A CHANGE OVER FROM RAIN TO SLEET WILL 
BE POSSIBLE LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY MORNING ACROSS THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...PORTIONS OF THE FOOTHILLS/NORTHERN VALLEY AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. HOWEVER...AM NOT EXPECTING 
MUCH IN THE WAY OF ACCUMULATIONS...THOUGH THE THREAT FOR SOME PATCHY 
LIGHT ICING AND BLACK ICE TO DEVELOP ON ROADS WILL BE POSSIBLE BY 
TUESDAY MORNING. 

TEMPERATURES WILL WARM ALOFT AND INTO THE UPPER 30S AT THE SURFACE 
AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT ON TUESDAY AND ALLOW FOR A COLD RAIN TO FALL 
FOR MUCH OF THE DAY. THEN...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE 
REGION LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON...USHERING IN COLDER AIR INTO THE 
AREA BY SUNSET AS TEMPERATURES COOL ALOFT. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A 
GRADUAL CHANGE OVER FROM RAIN TO SNOW OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 
EVENTUALLY PORTIONS OF THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY LATE TUESDAY 
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. AIDING THE POTENTIAL FOR SNOW SHOWERS ALONG 
THE TERRAIN WILL BE A STOUT NORTHWEST FLOW ON WEDNESDAY ON THE BACK 
SIDE OF THE LOW WHICH WILL ENHANCE OROGRAPHIC LIFT. THIS MAY ALLOW 
FOR SOME LOCALLY HEAVIER SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS ON WEDNESDAY. THUS...DO 
THINK THAT SOME SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS SEEM PROBABLE ALONG THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT OTHERWISE ANY ACCUMULATIONS ALONG THE NORTHERN 
VALLEYS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE SHOULD BE 
MINOR TO NONE. 

IN WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM...UPPER-RIDGING WILL BUILD IN FOR 
THANKSGIVING AND THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND...RESULTING IN A DRY FORECAST 
THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD. HOWEVER...VERY CHILLY CONDITIONS CAN 
BE EXPECTED FOR THANKSGIVING AND BLACK FRIDAY...AS HIGHS WILL REACH 
THE MID 30S TO MID 40S AND LOWS WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE UPPER TEENS 
AND 20S.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   40  24  48  35  43 /   0   0  10  80  90 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     36  22  46  34  42 /   0   0  10  70  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN             36  22  45  33  42 /   0   0  10  60  80

FXUS64 KMRX 231941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EST SAT NOV 23 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...CLOUDS HOLDING ON ACROSS THE
FOOTHILLS AND ERN MTNS AT MID AFTERNOON...WHILE CLEARING TREND
DOMINATES ELSEWHERE. THE BREAKS OF SUNSHINE ALLOWING A MINOR WARM
UP BEFORE THE COLD AIR BLAST ARRIVES BY LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY
EVENING. WIND CHILL INDICES IN THE SINGLE DIGITS FOR COLDEST SPOTS
OVERNIGHT. 

THINKING THERE WILL BE ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LATE TONIGHT
ACROSS SW VA AND THE NRN MTNS OF E TN TO JUSTIFY ADDING A FEW
CLOUDS. THE STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION PLUS SOME UPSLOPE FLOW...SO I
ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS. MOS MINS LOOKED RIGHT ON
TRACK. 

ABUNDANT SUNSHINE FOR SUNDAY BUT COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES WELL
INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. GENERALLY WENT CLOSE TO THE NEARLY
IDENTICAL MOS MAXES FOR SUNDAY. 

 
.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A VERY COLD MORNING 
EXPECTED MONDAY MORNING WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER TEENS TO 20S. 
SHOULD SEE A RELATIVELY GOOD WARM UP MONDAY AS THE UPPER LOW OVER 
SOUTHWEST TX APPROACHES.

THERE REMAINS A BIG DISCREPANCY BETWEEN MODELS AND THEIR HANDLING OF 
MOISTURE AND LOW PRESSURE POSITIONING. THE NAM REMAINS THE MOST 
AGGRESSIVE...YET NOT AS DEEP AS THE ECMWF AND THE GFS. THE SREF 
MODELS LOOK TO FAVOR INCREASING PRECIPITATION CHANCES BEGINNING 
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY EVENING...DEPENDING ON THE 
SPEED AND TRACK OF THE LOW. MONDAY NIGHT MAY PRODUCE A MIX OF 
RAIN...SLEET AND SNOW AT TIMES BUT ANTICIPATE WARM AIR ADVECTION 
EARLY TUESDAY MORNING TO CHANGE OVER THE WINTRY PRECIP TO ALL RAIN 
SHORTLY AFTER SUNRISE. RAIN WILL CHANGE BACK TO A WINTRY MIX TUESDAY 
NIGHT AS LOW LEVEL TEMPERATURES COOL YET AGAIN. THE SURFACE LOW 
SHOULD BE SOMEWHERE BETWEEN MOBILE AND ATLANTA...AGAIN THERE IS A 
LOT OF UNCERTAINTY TO THE SFC LOW LOCATION. MIXED PRECIPITATION WILL 
BE A GOOD POSSIBILITY THROUGH THE DAY WEDNESDAY. DO NOT BE SURPRISED 
TO SEE HIGHER ELEVATIONS RECEIVE RAIN...RATHER THAN WINTRY WEATHER 
BECAUSE OF THE WARMER AIR ALOFT.

THE ECMWF IS FARTHEST EAST WITH THE UPPER LOW AND THE GFS IS NOT TOO 
FAR BEHIND MOVING THE PRECIP RAPIDLY TO THE EAST. VERY FEW CHANGES 
WERE MADE TO THE PREVIOUS FORECAST WITH ALL THE UNCERTAINTY. 
PRECIPITATION COULD COME TO AN END AS EARLY AS LATE WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.

AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME LIGHT DRIZZLE LINGERING AROUND THE TAF SITES

VISIBILITIES BELOW 6 MILES DUE TO THE PERSISTENT NORTHWESTERLY 
WINDS. IN FACT...BREEZY NORTH TO NORTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL BE THE 
MAIN STORY THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD AT ALL THREE TAF SITES. 
CEILINGS WILL GRADUALLY RISE THIS MORNING...WITH VFR CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED BY THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO TONIGHT.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

$$

DMG





049 
FXUS64 KMRX 230811
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EST SAT NOV 23 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH ANOTHER STRONGER COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS NEXT COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON...WITH BREEZY NORTHWESTERLY 
WINDS BEHIND IT BRINGING MUCH COLDER AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY 
TONIGHT. A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THIS COLD 
FRONT THIS MORNING...BUT MUCH DRIER AIR BEHIND THE COLD FRONT SHOULD 
BRING AN END TO ANY PRECIP. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL 
COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...COOL/DRY AIR MOVING INTO THE 
AREA ON SUNDAY IN WAKE OF THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR 
MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS ALONG WITH SOME CHILLY TEMPERATURES GIVEN 
THE NORTHERLY FLOW AS HIGHS WILL LIKELY STRUGGLE TO CLIMB OUT OF THE 
30S...THE LOWEST READINGS OF THE AUTUMN SEASON BY FAR. IN 
FACT...MOST LOCATIONS WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB MUCH ABOVE FREEZING. 
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING WILL OCCUR SUNDAY NIGHT GIVEN THE 
CLEAR/CALM/DRY CONDITIONS...ALLOWING LOWS TO DROP INTO THE UPPER 
TEENS TO MID 20S IN MOST SPOTS. ATTENTION WILL THEN TURN TO A STRONG 
UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM THAT WILL IMPACT THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

A SURFACE LOW WILL SHIFT NORTHEASTWARD FROM THE GULF COAST TOWARD 
THE CAROLINAS/MID-ATLANTIC MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. AS ISENTROPIC 
LIFT INCREASES ON MONDAY NIGHT INCREASES OVER THE REGION...THIS WILL 
PRODUCE BROAD AREAS OF SHOWERS THAT WILL LIFT NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA OVERNIGHT MONDAY INTO 
TUESDAY. THERE ARE SOME DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE NAM /WHICH IS MORE 
AGGRESSIVE/ AND THE GFS /WHICH IS SLIGHTLY SLOWER AND FAVORS THE 
HIGHEST INITIAL QPF SIGNALS ALONG/EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS/. STILL... 
FELT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO INCREASE POPS TO CHANCE TO LIKELY MONDAY 
NIGHT AND THEN WIDESPREAD LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL ON TUESDAY/TUESDAY 
NIGHT...BEFORE BEGIN TO GRADUALLY TAPER THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST 
ON WEDNESDAY.

SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THAT THE TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL BE WELL ABOVE 
FREEZING FOR THE VALLEYS ON MONDAY NIGHT...BUT AS TEMPERATURES COOL 
AFTER MIDNIGHT SOME SNOW AND PERHAPS SOME LIGHT SLEET WILL BE 
POSSIBLE ALONG THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND THE MOUNTAINS. THE BIGGEST 
QUESTION WILL ALSO BE THE STRENGTH OF THE WARM NOSE WHICH MAY ALSO 
HELP TO KEEP SOME ELEVATED SURFACES ABOVE FREEZING. THEN...AFTER 
SUNRISE ON TUESDAY MOISTURE AND LIFT INCREASE WILL INCREASE... 
ALLOWING FOR WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION TO OVERSPREAD THE REGION. 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM WELL INTO THE 40S ACROSS THE VALLEYS... 
RESULTING IN A COLD RAIN TO FALL IN MOST SPOTS DURING THE DAY AND 
INTO THE NIGHT AS WELL. HOWEVER...LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY 
THE REAL PUSH OF COLDER AIR WILL MOVE IN AS THE BASE OF THE TROUGH 
PASSES THROUGH. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SNOW OR A 
RAIN/SNOW MIX OVER THE VALLEYS AND PERHAPS SOME HEAVIER SNOW OVER 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN. STILL...SOME COLDER TEMPERATURES ALOFT AND THE 
HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT COULD ALLOW FOR SOME SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS 
OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. ANY DEGREE OF IMPACT 
OR ACCUMULATION WILL DEPEND ON THE AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE AND 
THE TRACK OF THE UPPER-LOW. HOWEVER...IT DOES APPEARS THAT THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE SMOKIES WILL LIKELY EXPERIENCE SOME 
ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...WHILE A MOSTLY 
RAIN OR RAIN/SNOW MIX EVENT SEEMS MORE LIKELY FOR THE VALLEYS. 
THEREAFTER...DRY AIR WILL WORK ITS WAY INTO THE REGION FOR 
THANKSGIVING DAY...AS THE PRECIPITATION MOVES EAST.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   56  25  39  25  45 /  20   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     54  22  36  22  44 /  20   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             53  23  36  21  44 /  20   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    52  20  32  18  43 /  20   0   0   0  10 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

IMPROVE THE LOW VISIBILITIES ACROSS THE AREA. MADE A FEW DIFFERENT 
GRID ADJUSTMENTS...KEPT OVERNIGHT LOWS AS IS BUT ADJUSTED HOURLY 
TEMPS TO REFLECT SLOWER COOLING. SCALED BACK POPS QUITE A 
BIT...MAINLY FROM THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND WESTWARD TO CORRELATE WITH 
FRONTAL PASSAGE AND ALSO TWEAKED DEWPOINTS. NEW ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

293 
FXUS64 KMRX 222024
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EST FRI NOV 22 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...APPROACHING COLD FRONT HAS 
PASSED THROUGH BOWLING GREEN KY...NASHVILLE AND MUSCLE SHOALS AL AT 
MID AFTERNOON. THE RAIN AHEAD OF THE FRONT IS GENERALLY WIDESPREAD 
AND LIGHT. KEEPING RAIN CHANCES AROUND CATEGORICAL THROUGH THE 
EVENING...WITH INCREASING FRONTOGENETIC FORCING ON THE WAY. HOWEVER
THIS FORCING DOES FALL SHARPLY BY AND AFTER 06Z SATURDAY. THUS...
I OPTED TO DECREASE POPS FROM THE NW BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z SATURDAY.
THIS CHANGE ALSO MESHES MUCH BETTER WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS.

LOWERED POPS FOR SATURDAY...BUT CAN'T TAKE POPS OUT UNITL LATE 
AFTERNOON. THIS IS DUE MOSTLY TO THE WEAK SURFACE LOW THAT MODELS 
DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT...OVER NE GA/WRN SC AROUND 12Z SATURDAY. 
THIS WOULD FAVOR HIGHER CHANCE POPS OVER SE TN...SW NC AND SMOKIES 
THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON. 

FOR TEMPS...GFS MOS MINS LOOKED VERY REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT. THERE 
IS VERY STRONG LOW LEVEL COLD AIR ADVECTION STILL ADVERTISED FOR 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON...SO MAXES IN THE MORNING THEN FALLING TEMPS IN 
THE 18Z TO 22Z PERIOD. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THIS PERIOD...SATURDAY EVENING...SURFACE COLD HIGH PRESSURE IS 
BUILDING INTO THE AREA.  MOST OF THE PRECIP WILL BE OUT OF THE 
AREA...HOWEVER THERE COULD BE SOME UPSLOPE LIGHT SNOWS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT AND INTO SUNDAY MORNING.  ALSO 
THERE WILL BE A SIGNIFICANT WIND CHILL...WITH THE MOUNTAINS GETTING 
DOWN TO NEAR ZERO AND VALLEY LOCATIONS IN THE TEENS.  FOR THESE 
SNOWFALL AMOUNTS...JUST GOING WITH ABOUT A HALF INCH FOR THE HIGHEST 
ELEVATIONS ALONG THE TN/NC BORDER.  WITH THE WINDS...THE SNOW WILL 
BE BLOWING AROUND A LOT ANYWAY. HAVE THIS UPSLOPE MOUNTAIN SNOW 
ENDING BY DAYBREAK SUNDAY MORNING.  

FOR THE SYSTEM NEXT WEEK...IT WILL TAKE A WHILE FOR THE AIR MASS TO 
MOISTEN UP...SO KEEPING POPS LOW MONDAY NIGHT...AND MAKING A 
NON-NOCTURNAL TEMPERATURE TREND AS LOW LEVEL JET INCREASES AND TAKES 
TEMPERATURES STEADY OR WARMER OVERNIGHT.  HAVE HIGH POPS FOR TUESDAY 
AND TUESDAY NIGHT...THEN STARTING TO TAPER ON WEDNESDAY AS THE NEXT 
WAVE OF COLD AIR SURGES IN.  FOR NOW HAVE THE WARMING TREND SOON 
ENOUGH THAT ALL THE PRECIP ON THE FRONT END...LATE MONDAY NIGHT...IS 
RAIN FOR NOW...WHEREAS COLD ADVECTION ON WEDNESDAY SHOULD TURN 
PRECIP TO SNOW...BUT WITH DIMINISHING MOISTURE. FOR WEDNESDAY...
HAVE TEMPERATURES ALSO STEADY OR FALLING DURING THE DAY. HAVE THAT
PRECIP TAPERING OFF IN THE MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LOOKS LIKE
THE HEAVIEST OF THE PRECIP WILL SLIDE SOUTH OF OUR AREA. NONE OF
THESE SYSTEMS HAVE MUCH INSTABILITY...SO DO NOT HAVE ANY THUNDER IN
THESE PERIODS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       44  50  23  37  21 /  90  20   0   0   0

184 
FXUS64 KMRX 220817
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EST FRI NOV 22 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OFF THE MID ATLANTIC COAST...WITH A 
WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDING FROM NEAR INDIANAPOLIS SOUTHWEST TO NEAR 
MEMPHIS AND SHREVEPORT. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME SHOWERS ALREADY 
AFFECTING SOUTHEAST TN THIS MORNING...WITH ADDITIONAL SHOWERS 
EXPECTED LATER TODAY AS THIS COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVES ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA AROUND SUNSET...WITH SHOWERS CONTINUING BEHIND IT AS 
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. 
ANOTHER STRONGER COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...WHICH WILL BRING AN END TO THE SHOWER 
ACTIVITY AND MUCH COLDER AIR BY SATURDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THANKSGIVING DAY)...DRY AIR WILL 
QUICKLY FILTER INTO THE REGION IN WAKE OF THE FRONTAL PASSAGE ON 
SATURDAY...QUICKLY ENDING THE RAIN POTENTIAL AFTER 00Z AND USHERING 
IN A COOLER AIR MASS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MOSTLY CLEAR 
CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL FOR SUNDAY...WITH THE LOWEST HIGHS OF THE 
SEASON BY FAR AS TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY STRUGGLE TO CLIMB OUT OF 
THE 30S. IN FACT...IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS...HIGHS MAY 
STRUGGLE TO CLIMB MUCH ABOVE FREEZING. AFTER A CLEAR/CALM AND COLD 
NIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT /IN WHICH LOWS WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE TEENS TO 
LOW 20S/...CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AHEAD OF A STRONG UPPER- 
LEVEL STORM SYSTEM THAT WILL IMPACT THE REGION TUESDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

A SURFACE LOW WILL SHIFT NORTHEASTWARD FROM THE GULF COAST TOWARD 
THE CAROLINAS/MID-ATLANTIC ON MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. AS 
ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES ON MONDAY NIGHT OVER ALABAMA...THIS WILL 
PRODUCE BROAD AREAS OF SHOWERS THAT WILL LIFT NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA OVERNIGHT MONDAY INTO  
TUESDAY. SOUNDINGS SUGGEST THAT THE TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL BE WELL 
ABOVE FREEZING FOR THE VALLEYS ON MONDAY NIGHT...BUT SOME SNOW AND 
PERHAPS SOME LIGHT SLEET WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG THE NORTHERN PLATEAU 
AND THE MOUNTAINS. AFTER SUNRISE ON TUESDAY...MOISTURE AND LIFT 
INCREASE...BUT TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM WELL INTO THE 40S ACROSS THE 
VALLEYS...ALLOWING FOR A COLD RAIN TO FALL IN MOST SPOTS DURING THE 
DAY AND INTO THE NIGHT AS THE REAL PUSH OF COLDER AIR WILL NOT 
ARRIVE UNTIL WEDNESDAY WHEN THE BASE OF THE TROUGH MOVES THROUGH. 
STILL...SOME COLDER TEMPERATURES ALOFT AND THE HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT 
COULD ALLOW FOR SOME SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 
A CHANGE OVER TO SOME LIGHT SNOW IN THE VALLEYS WILL ALSO BE 
POSSIBLE ON WEDNESDAY AFTER THE COLDER AIR FILTERS IN. HOWEVER...ANY 
DEGREE OF IMPACT OR ACCUMULATION WILL DEPEND ON THE AMOUNT OF 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE AND THE TRACK OF THE UPPER-LOW. AS IT APPEARS 
NOW...ANY SNOW OR RAIN/SNOW MIX WILL BE OCCURRING IN THE VALLEY AS 
THE SYSTEM IS WINDING DOWN AND SHIFTING EAST. THE BEST CHANCE FOR 
ANY ACCUMULATIONS WOULD LIKELY BE ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA... 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE MOUNTAINS. STAY TUNED FOR LATER MODEL 
RUNS AND FORECAST UPDATES ON THE PROGRESS OF THIS SYSTEM. 
THEREAFTER...DRY AIR WILL WORK ITS WAY INTO THE REGION FOR 
THANKSGIVING DAY...AS THE PRECIPITATION MOVES EAST.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   63  49  56  28  40 /  90  90  50   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     63  48  55  25  37 /  90  90  50   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             63  47  53  25  37 /  90  90  40   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    63  45  52  22  33 /  90  90  50   0   0

305 PM EST THU NOV 21 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SUNNY SKIES AND SOME
DOWNSLOPING E-SE WINDS HAVE SENT TEMPS SOARING OVER NE TN AND SW VA
THIS AFTERNOON...UP TO 10 TO 12 DEGREES ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS.
EXPECTING CLOUDS TO ADVANCE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT...
ALONG WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN OVER SW NC/SMOKIES AND WRN
PLATEAU COUNTIES. THIS SHOULD PRODUCE A VERY MILD NIGHT...SO I
OPTED TO GO WITH THE WARMER NAM MOS MINS. NOTED THAT GFS MOS WAS 8
DEGREES TOO COOL AT CHA THIS MORNING!

MODELS SEEM IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON SHOWERS REACHING WELL INTO THE WRN
1/3RD TO 1/2 BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON FRIDAY...SO PUSHED POPS UP IN
LINE WITH THE LATEST MOS AND ADJACENT NWS GRIDS. SAW NO REASON NOT
TO GO CATEGORICAL ON POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT KEPT THUNDERSTORMS
OUT FOR NOW. 

FOR SATURDAY...TEMPTED TO LOWER POPS FASTER OVER WRN AREAS AND MAY
NEED TO MAKE THIS CHANGE WITH LATER FORECAST ISSUANCES. TEMPS WILL
HAVE NO WHERE TO GO BUT DOWN AS STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION QUICKLY
FOLLOWS THE PASSING COLD FRONT. HAVE MAX TEMPS IN THE MORNING HOURS
THEN STEADY OR FALLING. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS 
SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. AND OUT TO SEA SATURDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING. ANOTHER MODIFIED ARCTIC AIRMASS WILL 
DROP SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE APPALACHIAN REGION SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SUNDAY NIGHT CHILLING THE REGION TO THE BONE ON STRONG NORTHWESTERLY 
WINDS. THE ACCOMPANYING SURFACE HIGH WILL SHIFT SLOWLY ACROSS THE 
REGION SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. AT LEAST THERE IS A CHANCE FOR SOME 
SUNSHINE TO RETURN ON SUNDAY WITH DRY ADVECTION ACROSS THE AREA. MAX 
TEMPERATURES STRUGGLE TO MAKE IT BACK INTO THE 40S ON MONDAY AS A 
DEEPENING UPPER LEVEL LOW SLIDES SOUTHEAST FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. ASSOCIATED 
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE NORTHEAST FROM THE UPPER WESTERN GULF 
COAST TO THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC COAST THROUGH 12Z WEDNESDAY. ISENTROPIC 
LIFT WILL INCREASE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE SURFACE 
LOW MOVES ALONG A TRACK JUST SOUTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE 
ECMWF IS FASTER AND COLDER THAN THE GFS WITH THE SYSTEM. WENT WITH A 
BLENDED APPROACH WHICH HAS RAIN BUILDING IN (WITH A SMALL CHANCE OF 
WINTERY PRECIP IF THE COLDER NORTHERN VALLEYS DON'T WARM FAST ENOUGH 
MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY) MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY BUT MIXES SNOW 
INTO THE PICTURE AS MORE CHILLY AIR DROPS INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. WILL HAVE TO WAIT FOR LATER 
MODEL GUIDANCE TO SEE WHAT SCENARIO WILL PLAY OUT DURING THE MID  
WEEK TIMEFRAME. WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THANKSGIVING LOOKS LIKE IT 
SHOULD DRY OUT WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SUNSHINE RETURNING.     


&&

THROUGH THE SMOKIES FOR LATE TONIGHT IN THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE.
