641 
FXUS64 KMRX 210941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
441 AM EST THU NOV 21 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A LARGE SURFACE HIGH CENTERED
OVER THE NE STATES WAS BEGINNING TO SHIFT FAR ENOUGH TO THE
NORTHEAST OF THE FORECAST AREA AS SOUTH TO SOUTHEAST FLOW AROUND
THE HIGH WAS PULLING IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE NORTH FROM THE GULF INTO
THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY IN THE FORM OF LOW
CLOUDS. THIS WAS SLOWING THE DROP IN TEMPERATURES OVER THE SOUTHERN
AND WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES RANGED FROM
THE 40S TO LOWER 50S SOUTH AND WEST TO THE LOWER TO MID 30S
NORTHEAST. FOR THE REST OF TODAY AS SOUTHEAST TO EAST SURFACE FLOW
CONTINUES SKIES SHOULD REMAIN MOSTLY CLOUDY IN THE SOUTH AND WEST
AND PARTLY CLOUDY NORTHEAST. WITH WARMER START SOUTH THIS MORNING
HIGHS SHOULD BE FAIRLY UNIFORM IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S.
UPSLOPE FLOW IN NC MAY BRING SOME VERY LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE MAINLY
CLAY AND CHEROKEE COUNTIES EARLY TODAY. TONIGHT MOISTURE INCREASES
EVEN MORE WITH SKIES STAYING MOSTLY CLOUDY AND TEMPERATURES MOSTLY
MID TO UPPER 40S. PARTIAL CLEARING NE TN TONIGHT WITH EASTERLY FLOW
SO LOWS THERE NEAR 40. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ONLY VERY SLOWLY EAST
WITH RAINFALL STAYING WELL TO THE NW OF THE REGION THROUGH THE NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...JET STREAMS CONTINUE
PHASING OVER THE OHIO VALLEY ON FRIDAY. MODERATELY STRONG ZONAL
COMPONENT OVER THE TN VALLEY WILL PUSH COLD FRONT RAPIDLY THROUGH
THE TN VALLEY FRIDAY AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY
SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL IN ADVANCE OF THE
FRONT. BEST PRECIPITATION CHANCE OCCUR ACROSS MRX CWA LATE FRIDAY
AND FRIDAY NIGHT. FRONT HANGS UP SOME ACROSS SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
SATURDAY MORNING. PRECIPITATION WILL TRANSITION TO MAINLY UPSLOPE
SHOWERS ON SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN FALLING THROUGH THE
DAY SATURDAY WITH WIND CHILL READINGS IN THE 30S BY THE LATE
AFTERNOON. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA
THROUGH MONDAY. WELL BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND DRY CONDITIONS
CAN BE EXPECTED INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. CUT OFF LOW MOVES THROUGH TX
EARLY NEXT WEEK. CONFIDENCE IS LOW WITH SYSTEM TRACK AND TIMING.
SURFACE LOW SHOULD DEVELOP OVER THE NW GLFMEX AND TRACK NE WITH
TIME. RESULTING PRECIPITATION COVERAGE AND TYPE QUESTIONABLE BUT
LEANING TOWARD A WARMER AND DRIER SOLUTION FOR NOW.

535 
FXUS64 KMRX 201938 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED FOR INITIALS
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 PM EST WED NOV 20 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE AMPLIFIES OVER 
THE SE STATES OVERNIGHT AND THURSDAY...WHILE SURFACE RIDGE ALONG THE 
EASTERN COAST MOVES VERY LITTLE. THE LIGHT E-SE LOW LEVEL FLOW 
AROUND THE RIDGE MAY BRING SOME LOWER CLOUDS INTO THE SRN AND 
CENTRAL VALLEY PLUS SRN MTNS OVERNIGHT...AND ALSO WILL KEEP MIN 
TEMPS A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN LAST NIGHT. TRENDED CLOSER TO THE 
WARMER MOS MINS IN THE SRN AREAS...AND CLOSER TO THE COOLER MOS MINS 
FOR NE TN AND SW VA. 


OTHERWISE...EXPECTING HIGH CLOUDS TO ALSO INCREASE ON THURSDAY. 
THESE CLOUDS DON'T LOOK THICK ENOUGH TO SIGNIFICANTLY HINDER WARMING 
UP TO THE SIMILAR MOS MAX TEMPS. OVERALL JUST MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO 
PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS FOR BOTH PERIODS.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
BY THURSDAY NIGHT THE EXITING HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE OVER THE 
NEW ENGLAND STATES AND THE FOCUS WILL SHIFT BACK TO THE WEST. THE 
NEXT COLD FRONT WILL MARCH INTO WEST TENNESSEE EARLY FRIDAY MORNING. 
WITH THE UPPER TROUGH LAGGING A LITTLE FARTHER WEST THE FRONT WILL 
MEANDER DURING THE DAY INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND MOVE RATHER SLOWLY. 
EXPECTING BETTER CHANCES OF LIGHT RAIN TO BEGIN IN THE AFTERNOON 
HOURS ON FRIDAY ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA. THE FRONT 
WILL PUSH ACROSS THE ENTIRE REGION OVERNIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING 
AND MOST AREAS WILL RECEIVE MEASURABLE RAINFALL. 

ON SATURDAY...COLD AND BLUSTERY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED BEHIND THE 
FRONT AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. THE 
RAIN SHOULD EXIT MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY SATURDAY 
EVENING. COOL AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL EXIST THROUGH AT LEAST MONDAY 
NIGHT WHEN THE NEXT SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO BRING INCREASING CHANCES 
OF PRECIPITATION TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. MODEL ENSEMBLE SPREADS ARE 
RATHER HIGH GIVING LOW CONFIDENCE ON THE EVOLUTION AND PRECIP TYPE. 
WITH THE GIVEN FORECAST PROGS SOME RAIN MAY CHANGE TO SNOW LATE 
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WED MORNING BEFORE CHANGING BACK TO RAIN. 
LOCATIONS IN SW VA MAY SEE SNOW FALL FOR ABOUT 6 TO 8 HOURS. 
AGAIN...CONFIDENCE IS VERY LOW.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORT WAVE
WITH EXTENSIVE MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS EXITING THE FORECAST
AREA AT THIS TIME. CLEARING SKIES THE NEXT FEW HOURS WILL ALLOW

MID 30S. AS AREA IS INFLUENCED BY SURFACE HIGH CENTERED OVER THE

INTO THE 30S TONIGHT WHICH IS NEAR NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.
WINDS SHOULD STAY EAST TO SOUTHEAST THROUGH TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
WEAKENS AND DRIFTS SE OF THE AREA THROUGH FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL
BE ABOVE NORMAL. UPPER JETS BEGIN PHASING OVER THE N TN AND OH RVR
VALLEY ON FRI. GOOD LIFT AND INCREASING MOISTURE FRIDAY.
PRECIPITATION MOVES INTO THE AREA LATE FRIDAY WITH BEST COVERAGE
FRIDAY NIGHT. BROAD UPPER TROUGH AXIS MOVES EAST THROUGH THE AREA
SATURDAY. COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE LIKELY SATURDAY MORNING.
PRECIPITATION WILL TAPER OFF SATURDAY AFTERNOON WHILE TEMPERATURES
FALL DURING THE DAY LIGHT HOURS. TEMPERATURES WILL FALL INTO THE
20S SATURDAY NIGHT WITH WIND CHILLS IN THE TEENS MOST AREAS. COLD
AIR MASS CONTINUES AS SURFACE RIDGE SLIDES SE ACROSS THE AREA INTO
EARLY NEXT WEEK. CONFIDENCE LOWERS WITH REGARDS TO POTENTIAL
DEVELOPMENT AND TRACK OF GLFMEX SURFACE LOW ON TUESDAY. GOOD
POTENTIAL FOR PRECIPITATION BY TUESDAY. LOW TRACK WILL DETERMINE
PRECIPITATION TYPE...TIMING AND COVERAGE.

058 
FXUS64 KMRX 191949
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EST TUE NOV 19 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
A WEAK SHORTWAVE IS MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON...WHICH HAS ALLOWED SOME SCATTERED TO BROKEN DECKS OF
HIGH CLOUDS INTO THE REGION TO WORK THEIR WAY INTO THE AREA.
ADDITIONALLY...IT HAS HELPED TO REINFORCE THE COOL/DRY POST FRONTAL
AIR MASS THAT IS SITTING OVER THE AREA. WITH NORTHEASTERLY BREEZES
PREVAILING THIS AFTERNOON...TEMPERATURES HAVE REMAINED IN THE MID
40S TO LOWER 50S...DESPITE THE PARTLY/MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS.
OVERNIGHT...THE COMBINATION OF THESE LIGHT WINDS AND SOME OF THE
CLOUD COVER MAY HELP TO KEEP TEMPERATURES A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER
THAN THE MIGHT HAVE BEEN ON A TYPICAL CLEAR/CALM NIGHT. HOWEVER...
AM EXPECTING LOWS TO BOTTOM OUT IN THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S IN
MOST AREAS ONCE AGAIN. WINDS WILL VEER TO THE SOUTHEAST ON
WEDNESDAY AND INCREASE SLIGHTLY AS ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVES OVER THE
REGION. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER...WITH MOST
VALLEY LOCATIONS REACHING THE 50S. 

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
A RIDGE CENTERED NEAR THE FL/GA/SC COASTLINE SHOULD PROVIDE 
DRY WEATHER OVER THE REGION THROUGH THURSDAY...ALONG WITH ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPS. AS THE RIDGE SAGS SOUTHWARD AND A TROUGH MOVES INTO 
THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES REGION...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE OVER THE 
AREA THURSDAY NIGHT. A STRENGTHENING JET STREAK TO OUR NW AND 
FALLING 500 MB HEIGHTS WILL PROVIDE THE IMPETUS FOR LIFT AND PRECIP 
BEGINNING FRIDAY MORNING. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ONSET TIMING...AND WITH THE HIGHEST POPS BEING ON FRIDAY NIGHT AHEAD 
OF THE COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE. MODELS DIFFERENCES BECOME MORE APPARENT 
WITH THE DEPARTURE OF THE PRECIP...WITH THE GFS AND CMC BEING FASTER 
THAN THE ECMWF AND GEFS MEAN. WILL SPEED UP THE DECLINE OF POPS ON 
SATURDAY SLIGHTLY...BUT WILL STILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE GOING FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT DUE TO SOME POTENTIAL FOR UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS AS 
COLD AIR BUILDS IN.

SUNDAY LOOKS DRY BUT VERY COLD AS AN ARCTIC AIR MASS DROPS SOUTHWARD 
ON THE WEST SIDE OF A DEEP CLOSED LOW OVER EASTERN CANADA. WENT A 
LITTLE BELOW MOS TEMPS...WITH HIGHS IN THE 30S TO LOWER 40S. A 
SLIGHT AIR MASS MODERATION WILL OCCUR MONDAY BEFORE THE ONSET OF THE 
NEXT PRECIP EVENT. THE GFS AND ECMWF MERGE A CUT OFF LOW OVER THE 
DESERT SW WITH THE NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS...WITH THE 
ECMWF BEING THE FASTER OF THE TWO MODELS. IN THIS TYPE OF 
PATTERN...THE SLOWER SOLUTION USUALLY PANS OUT...SO WILL KEEP 
MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT DRY AND BEGIN CHANCE POPS ON TUESDAY. A FASTER 
SOLUTION COULD MEAN A BETTER POTENTIAL TO SEE SOME SNOW AS THE AIR 
MASS WILL HAVE LESS TIME TO MODERATE...BUT WILL KEEP THE FORECAST 
WITH RAIN FOR NOW. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             35  57  38  63  47 /   0   0   0  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  32  55  35  61  45 /   0   0   0   0  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       32  56  36  60  45 /   0   0   0  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              28  52  29  59  38 /   0   0   0   0  10

AIR MASS QUICKLY DRIES OUT SUNDAY AND MONDAY. MUCH COLDER
TEMPERATURES BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS COLD HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS
DOWN FROM THE NORTHWEST INTO THE FORECAST AREA.

189 
FXUS64 KMRX 181933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 PM EST MON NOV 18 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE HAS BUILT INTO THE REGION IN THE
WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH THE AREA LAST NIGHT.
THIS HAS HELPED TO PROMOTE SUNNY CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON AND A DRY
DAY...ALLOWING FOR HIGH TEMPERATURES TO REACH THE UPPER 50S TO MID
60S DESPITE THE NORTHWEST FLOW AT THE SURFACE. THIS EVENING...A
WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL PASS THROUGH THE REGION AND BRING WITH IT A
STRONGER PUSH OF COOLER AND DRIER AIR INTO THE AREA. THIS /ALONG
WITH THE CLEAR CONDITIONS/ WILL RESULT IN SUBFREEZING TO NEAR
FREEZING TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT.
WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST AFTER SUNRISE TOMORROW AND A
LIGHT TO MODERATE BREEZE WILL HELP TO REINFORCE TO SHOT OF COOLER
AIR...AS HIGHS WILL BE NOTABLY LOWER ON TUESDAY /PEAKING IN THE MID
40S TO MID 50S/ DESPITE THE CLEAR CONDITIONS AND ABUNDANT SUNSHINE.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
RIDGING WILL SHIFT TO OUR EAST FOR WEDNESDAY...BECOMING POSITIONED 
NEAR THE COAST. THE RESULTING SW FLOW WILL PROVIDE A WARMING TREND 
FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. WE SHOULD SEE HIGH TEMPS REACHING INTO 
THE 60S BY FRIDAY.

MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL INCREASE ON FRIDAY AS A TROUGH AND UPPER JET 
STREAK DROP INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION. SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER A 
WARM FRONT WILL BRING A SLIGHT/LOW CHANCE OF SHOWERS THURSDAY 
NIGHT...BUT MOST OF THE SHOWERS IN THE WARM SECTOR OF THE 
APPROACHING LOW WILL MOVE IN FRIDAY AFTERNOON. MODELS AND GEFS 
MEMBERS ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF BEST 
LIFT AND MOISTURE BEING FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. POPS DURING THESE 
PERIODS WILL BE RAISED INTO THE LIKELY RANGE. COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE 
APPEARS TO COME SATURDAY EVENING...WITH POPS DROPPING QUICKLY AS DRY 
AIR BUILDS IN. A BRIEF PERIOD OF SNOW IN NORTHERN AREAS AND 
MOUNTAINS MAY BE POSSIBLE SATURDAY NIGHT. THE AIR MASS BEHIND THE 
FRONT APPEARS VERY COLD AS THE UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO DEEPEN AS 
IT MOVES OFFSHORE. WILL HAVE TEMPS SUNDAY AND MONDAY WELL BELOW 
CLIMO AND A BIT BELOW GFS MOS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

BEFORE THE COOLER AIR ARRIVES. HIGHS WILL PEAK IN THE UPPER 50S AND
LOWER 60S ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...AND
THE LOW TO MID 60S OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY ZONES.

AIRMASS WILL DRY OUT DRAMATICALLY WITH PWAT VALUES FALLING TO BELOW 
.25 BY TONIGHT. SURFACE DEW POINTS WILL BE ON A DOWNWARD TREND

FALL SOME TODAY BUT THIS SHOULD BE OFFSET SOME BY LONG PERIOD OF 
SUNSHINE.    

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE REGION TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  THIS WILL 
PROVIDE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES...LIGHT WINDS AND SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES.  WILL TRANSITION INTO AN UNSETTLE WEATHER PATTERN ON 
THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT AS A WARM FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA.  
DEEP MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT SHOULD GENERATE SCATTERED SHOWERS LATE 
THURSDAY AND MAINLY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT.  THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
WILL THEN MOVE IN FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY.  THIS BOUNDARY ALSO BRINGS 
IN DEEP MOISTURE BUT WITH MUCH STRONGER LIFT FOR WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS.  THE SYSTEM SHOULD EXIT THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT FOR A 
RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS ON SUNDAY.

137 
FXUS64 KMRX 180155
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
855 PM EST SUN NOV 17 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT STRETCHING GENERALLY 
ALONG A LINE FROM NEAR CINCINNATI TO NEAR NASHVILLE AND MEMPHIS. AN 
UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR MASS WAS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA... 
WITH DEWPOINTS CURRENTLY IN THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S. CURRENT LAPS 
DATA AND LATEST RUC MODEL RUN INDICATES A STABLE AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...SO EXPECT THE CONVECTIVE LINE ALONG THE COLD FRONT 
TO WEAKEN AS IT MOVES EAST THIS EVENING. HOWEVER...A STRONG 850 MB 
JET (WITH WINDS AROUND 60 KT) WAS STILL LOCATED OVER EASTERN KY AND 
WESTERN WV...WITH THE TAIL END OF THIS LOW-LEVEL JET PROGGED TO 
SWING OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN THIS EVENING. THUS...IT 
APPEARS THAT A FEW STORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE THIS 
EVENING.

OVERALL...FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT HAVE 
ALREADY UPDATED THIS EVENING TO MENTION THE SEVERE TSTORM WATCH 
UNTIL 1 AM EST.

653 PM EST SUN NOV 17 2013

.AVIATION...A FEW SHOWERS STILL WORKING EAST ACROSS THE GREAT
VALLEY EARLY THIS EVENING. FLIGHT WEATHER CONDITIONS HAVE IMPROVED
AT TRI AND TYS WHERE VFR HAS RETURNED. STILL QUITE A BIT OF LOWER
CLOUD IN PLACE AT CHA WHERE IFR CONDITIONS REMAIN. HOWEVER BELIEVE
SOME IMPROVEMENT MAY BE SEEN HERE IN A COUPLE OF HOURS. THE BREAK IN
THE ACTION MAY LAST UNTIL AROUND 06Z WHEN THE CONVECTIVE LINE
BUILDS ACROSS THE VALLEY. KEPT THUNDER IN THE FORECAST ALTHOUGH
INSTABILITY WILL BE LIMITED AS THE LINE MOVES INTO EAST TENNESSEE.
KEPT ABOUT A TWO HOUR PERIOD OF ACTIVE WEATHER (MVFR) WITH THE COLD
FRONTAL PUSH FOLLOWED BY DECREASING WEST TO NORTHWESTERLY FLOW AND
A RETURN TO VFR CONDITIONS THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST.

344 
FXUS64 KMRX 172013
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 PM EST SUN NOV 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL
CONTINUE TO PROGRESS EASTWARD THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY THIS EVENING.
RAIN SHOWERS FROM THIS MORNING WILL REMAIN OVER EAST TN THROUGH THE
LATE AFTERNOON. BEHIND THIS CONVECTION...DEWPOINTS WILL INCREASE
AND ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE
FRONT. A FEW OF THESE STORMS COULD BECOME SEVERE...WITH DAMAGING
WIND BEING THE MAIN THREAT. VERY STRONG MID AND UPPER LEVEL WINDS
ARE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT MOVING IN...WITH A SQUALL LINE
STRUCTURE DEVELOPING IN IL AND IN. THE FRONT WILL ARRIVE ON THE
PLATEAU BETWEEN 10 AND 12 PM.

FROM THE WIND PROFILE...LOOKS LIKE DAMAGING WINDS ARE THE MAIN 
THREAT. THERE IS A VERY SMALL AMOUNT OF CAPE AND VERY LITTLE TURNING 
OF THE WINDS IN THE LOW LEVELS...SO A TORNADO POSSIBILITY IS VERY 
LOW. HOWEVER...CAN NOT COMPLETELY RULE OUT A TORNADO IN A BOOK END 
VORTICE OR BOWING SEGMENT OF THE SQUALL LINE. AMPLE MID AND UPPER 
LEVEL DRY AIR IS ADVECTED INTO THE AREA WITH THIS LINE...REINFORCING 
THE DAMAGING WIND POTENTIAL. 

TWO MINUTE WIND SPEEDS AND WIND GUSTS ARE RIGHT ON THE BORDER OF A
WIND ADVISORY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...SOUTHWEST VA...AND
PLATEAU. DUE TO THE LINE MOVING INTO THE AREA...HAVE DECIDED TO
GO WITH AN ADVISORY THROUGH 4 AM. THE FRONT LOOKS TO MOVE EAST OF
THE SMOKIES A LITTLE BEFORE SUNRISE ON MONDAY MORNING. GUSTY WINDS
MAY STILL BE PRESENT ON MONDAY...WITH SKIES CLEARING QUICKLY
THROUGH THE MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN SET IN FOR MONDAY AND
MONDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL COOL BEHIND THE FRONT TO A FEW
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. 


.LONG TERM...COOL AND DRY AIR WILL REMAIN IN PLACE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK AS A SURFACE HIGH BUILDS 
INTO THE REGION. THIS WILL RESULT IN NOTABLY LOWER TEMPERATURES FOR 
THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WORK WEEK AS HIGHS WILL PEAK IN THE MID 
40S TO LOWER 50S...BEFORE A GRADUAL WARMING TREND OCCURS LATER IN 
THE WEEK AS WINDS VEER TO THE SOUTH. THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY 
NIGHT...A BROAD UPPER TROUGH WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT INTO THE 
AREA...YIELDING A GOOD CHANCE FOR RAIN THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT...BEFORE IT CLEARS THE REGION SOMETIME ON SATURDAY. THUS... 
HAVE INCREASED POPS TO HIGH-END CHANCE DURING THIS TIME PERIOD GIVEN 
THE FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE MODELS ON THE TIMING/TRACK OF 
THIS SYSTEM. NORTHWEST FLOW WILL THEN PREVAIL IN WAKE OF THIS 
SYSTEM...BRINGING ANOTHER SHOT OF COOL AIR INTO THE REGION FOR THE 
WEEKEND. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  48  63  34  52  33 /  90  10   0   0   0

LOW...WITH LIMITED VISIBILITIES IN SOME AREAS WITH PRECIP THAT
MOVES THROUGH. COLD FRONT WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE PLATEAU CLOSER
TO MIDNIGHT. WITH THE STRONG WINDS IN THE MIDLEVELS AND ALOFT...CAN
SEE DAMAGING WINDS. TORNADO POSSIBILITY CAN NOT BE RULED OUT...BUT
THE LIKELIHOOD IS LOW. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN IN THE UPPER 60S
AND LOWER 70S.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EST SUN NOV 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO 
INCREASE TODAY IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING COLD FRONT. DEW POINTS WILL 
RISE INTO THE 60S ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY. STRONG 
UPPER JET DIGS INTO OH VALLEY LATER TODAY RESULTING IN NEGATIVELY 
TILTED TROUGH NW OF THE AREA. BEST LIFT AND FORCING REMAINS W AND NW 
OF THE AREA TODAY. PER MODEL Q-VECTOR CONVERGENCE 
AGREEMENT...ONGOING PREFRONTAL CONVECTION WILL LIKELY MOVE INTO THE 
AREA FROM THE WEST BY THIS AFTERNOON. SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL BE 
POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THIS COMPLEX FAVORING THE S AND SE EARLY. 
INSTABILITY IS LOW BUT SHEAR VALUES VERY SUPPORTIVE OF CONVECTION. 
BEST CHANCE FOR WIDESPREAD COVERAGE AND STRONG TO SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE THIS EVENING. WIND DAMAGE APPEARS TO THE MAIN 
THREAT WITH LARGE HAIL A LESSER THREAT. HELICITY VALUES SUPPORT LOW 
CHANCE FOR TORNADOES ESPECIALLY ALONG DEW POINT BOUNDARY. ADDITIONAL 
CONVECTION WILL LIKELY MOVE IN TO THE AREA TONIGHT ALONG COLD FRONT. 
WARM TEMPERATURES TODAY WITH HIGHER TEMPERATURES POSSIBLE ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN VALLEY IN THE FAVORABLE DOWNSLOPE AREAS. WINDS WILL 
INCREASE IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT AND A WIND ADVISORY MAY BE REQUIRED 
TONIGHT ACROSS NE AREAS. FRONT MOVES THROUGH TONIGHT BUT COLD AIR 
ADVECTION SHOULD LAG SOME AND LEANED ON THE WARM SIDE OF MOS 
GUIDANCE.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AS SUNDAY/S SYSTEM PULLS AWAY 
FROM THE REGION...A FEW SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER FAR NORTHEASTERN 
AREAS EARLY MONDAY MORNING.  BEHIND THE SYSTEM...SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN WITH ZONAL TO WEAK RIDGING ALOFT DEVELOPING 
ON MONDAY.  THIS QUIET WEATHER PATTERN WILL DOMINATE AREA WEATHER 
THROUGH THURSDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS AND SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD.  THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM OF 
CONCERN WILL MOVE IN LATE IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD.  THERE REMAINS SOME 
DIFFERENCES IN TIMING BUT WILL INTRODUCE LOW POPS ON FRIDAY WITH 
CHANCE POPS FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY.

919 
FXUS64 KMRX 170137
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
835 PM EST SAT NOV 16 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. A SOUTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY IS PROGGED TO STRENGTHEN OVERNIGHT...WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT 
HELPING TO GENERATE A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT. TEMPS 
HAVE FALLEN QUICKLY SINCE SUNSET...BUT ARE CURRENTLY CLOSE TO THE 
DEWPOINTS...SO DO NOT EXPECT MUCH MORE COOLING OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER... 
WILL NEED TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO LOWER MINS FOR 
TONIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR THE CURRENT TRENDS.

ON SUNDAY...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT WIND SHEAR WILL BECOME 
FAIRLY STRONG OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...WITH 
BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS REVEALING HELICITY VALUES IN EXCESS OF 
500 M2/S2. IN FACT...THE NAM MODEL INDICATES THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOME 
MARGINAL INSTABILITY ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON...WHICH WOULD SUGGEST THE 
POSSIBILITY OF A FEW SUPERCELLS FORMING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. HOWEVER...THE GFS MODEL IS NOT AS UNSTABLE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT DOES REVEAL SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY 
ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON. IF THE NAM MODEL VERIFIES...IT APPEARS THAT 
ISOLATED TORNADOES WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON...BUT EITHER WAY...IT APPEARS THAT SEVERE TSTORMS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE AS SOON AS SUNDAY AFTERNOON OUT AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT... 
AND THEN AGAIN LATER SUNDAY EVENING ALONG THE COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT...HAVE UPDATED THE HAZARDOUS 
WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION THESE POSSIBILITIES ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
656 PM EST SAT NOV 16 2013

.AVIATION...STRONG STORM SYSTEM PRESSING EAST ACROSS THE PLAINS
WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATER IN THE DAY SUNDAY
TRHOUGH SUNDAY EVENING. STRENGTHENING GRADIENT IN PRESSURE BETWEEN
THE RETREATING WESTERN ATLANTIC RIDGE AND DEEPENING TROUGH ACROSS
THE PLAINS WILL LEAD TO FASTER LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW ACROSS THE
HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER AND A NICE DOWNSLOPE
PATTERN OVER THE GREAT VALLEY MAINLY FROM AROUND TYS NORTHEAST
THROUGH TRI. THEREFORE...IT WILL BE A LITTLE HARD TO KEEP AN MVFR
OR LOWER CEILING FROM FORMING HERE UNTIL LATER IN THE DAY SUNDAY.
HOWEVER...THE LACK OF DEEPER MOISTURE AT THESE TERMINALS MAY ALLOW
FOR SOME MVFR TO OCCASIONALLY IFR REDUCTION IN VISIBILITY IN FOG
LATER TONIGHT. CHA IS A DIFFERENT STORY WHERE THE WEDGE HAS KEPT
POOR FLIGHT WEATHER ALL DAY LONG. WAS WONDERING IF THIS AIRPORT MAY
BREAK OUT A BIT WITH BETTER FLIGHT CONDITIONS BUT WITH NIGHTFALL
AND A STRENGTHENING MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW...CONDITIONS MAY REMAIN
MVFR/IFR OVERNIGHT. CHA WOULD BE THE FIRST LOCATION TO SEE SOME
PRE-FRONTAL SHOWERS DEVELOP AND ADDED THESE AT 16Z WHILE TYS AND
TRI MAY NOT EXPERIENCE THE ADVANCING SHOWERS UNTIL 21Z OR LATER. OF
COURSE...WITH THIS DYNAMIC SYSTEM THERE IS THE POSSIBILITY OF
CONVECTION BUT LEFT OUT FOR NOW AS INSTABILITY APPEARS TO SOMEWHAT
LIMITED.

816 
FXUS64 KMRX 161956
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EST SAT NOV 16 2013

.SHORT TERM(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
OVER THE NORTHERN OHIO VALLEY WILL CONTINUE NORTHEAST...WITH A COLD
FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA THROUGH SUNDAY. FLOW IS GENERALLY FROM
THE SOUTHWEST...WITH PLENTY OF ISENTROPIC LIFT KEEPING LOW LEVELS
VERY MOIST. OVERCAST SKIES WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS THIS
FRONT APPROACHES. FOR TONIGHT...LOWS WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL DUE TO
THE TEMPERATURE ADVECTION AND CLOUD COVER. DIVERGENCE ALOFT WILL
SET IN OVER THE AREA FOR THE LATE MORNING. THERE IS ENOUGH LIFT FOR
ISOLATED LIGHT SHOWERS TO DEVELOP...MAINLY ON THE PLATEAU AND
HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON MODELS ARE SHOWING A LITTLE BIT MORE 
INSTABILITY THAN PREVIOUS RUNS ALTHOUGH INSTABILITY IS STILL WEAK. 
BUT FORCING SEEMS TO BE IN PLACE FOR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. A FEW 
OF THESE COULD BECOME SEVERE...ALTHOUGH THE PROBABILITY IS LOW. THE 
MAIN THREAT WITH THESE STORMS IS STRONG WINDS. 

FOR SUNDAY EVENING INTO SUNDAY NIGHT...THE FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT. ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS COULD 
DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT...WITH WINDS INCREASING IN STRENGTH. 
THE WIND PROFILE SHOWS BACKING WINDS AT THE SURFACE...CHANGING TO 
MORE UNIDIRECTIONAL FLOW AS THE FRONT NEARS. A SQUALL LINE STRUCTURE 
IS EXPECTED WITH THIS FRONT...WITH DAMAGING WINDS BEING THE MAIN 
THREAT. THE THREAT FOR TORNADOES LOOKS UNLIKELY...BUT DUE TO THE 
NATURE OF THE SQUALL LINE...CAN'T RULE OUT A TORNADO DEVELOPING IN A 
BOOK END VORTICE OR BOWING SEGMENT OF THE LINE. THE FRONT IS THEN 
EXPECTED TO MOVE EAST OF THE AREA A LITTLE AFTER SUNRISE MONDAY 
MORNING...WITH CLEARING SKIES BEHIND THE FRONT.

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/... IN WAKE OF THE STORM
SYSTEM THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT...DRY AND
COOLER AIR WILL QUICKLY FILTER INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS
WILL RESULT IN NOTABLY LOWER TEMPERATURES FOR MUCH OF THE WEEK
AHEAD AS HIGHS WILL PEAK IN THE MID 40S TO LOWER 50S THROUGH
MIDWEEK...BEFORE A GRADUAL VEERING OF THE SURFACE FLOW OCCURS TO
THE SOUTH AND EAST BY THURSDAY. WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT FOR MUCH OF
THE WEEK AHEAD...DRY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL AT THE SURFACE AS WELL
THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. THEREAFTER...A STORM SYSTEM IS
PROGGED TO MOVE IN FROM THE WEST AND PUSH A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE
REGION...BRINGING A GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR
THE UPCOMING WEEKEND.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 AM EST SAT NOV 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WEAKENS OVER 
THE AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. LOW LEVEL SW JET WILL INCREASE TO NEAR 
40 KTS BY LATE TONIGHT. SHORT WAVE RIDGING ALOFT TODAY WILL GIVE WAY 
TO INCREASING WSW JET ALOFT. 

LOW LEVELS REMAIN MOIST AND WEAKLY CAPPED THIS MORNING WITH 
EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER DESPITE DRY MID LEVELS. SOME MIXING LATER 
TODAY SHOULD RESULT IN PERIODS OF SUNSHINE THIS AFTERNOON. WARM 
TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL PERSIST TONIGHT. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
TRANSPORT INCREASES TONIGHT. SCATTERED PRECIPITATION WILL ADVANCE 
INTO THE AREA AFFECTING SOUTHERN AREAS LATE TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS TRENDING FASTER WITH THE 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT EARLY IN THE PERIOD AND HAVE INCREASE POPS TO 
CATEGORICAL FOR SUNDAY AND CONTINUED TO HIGH POPS INTO SUNDAY 
EVENING.  STRONG 850 MB JET WILL BRING WARM...MOISTURE AND UNSTABLE 
AIR INTO THE AREA...INCREASING DEW POINTS INTO THE 50S AND LOW 60S.  
ADDITIONALLY...THE STRONG WINDS ALOFT WILL PROVIDE STRONG SHEAR.  
THIS WILL ALL COMBINE TO CREATE ORGANIZED SCATTERED CONVECTION ALONG 
AND AHEAD OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY.  SOME OF THESE STORM MAY BECOME 
STRONG TO SEVERE WITH THE AIR MASS CAPABLE OF SOME SUPERCELL 
DEVELOPMENT AS WELL.  THE CONVECTION SHOULD WEAKEN OVERNIGHT TO 
SCATTERED SHOWERS WHICH WILL EXIT THE AREA LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
EARLY MONDAY MORNING.  BEHIND THE SYSTEM...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN WITH ZONAL TO WEAK RIDGING ALOFT MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY 
FOR DRY CONDITIONS AND SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES.  AN 
APPROACHING SYSTEM ON FRIDAY WILL SEE CLOUDS INCREASE BUT ASSOCIATED 
SHOWERS SHOULD HOLD OFF THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD.



&&

559 
FXUS64 KMRX 152001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EST FRI NOV 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...AN UPPER LEVEL
DISTURBANCE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION. ENOUGH UPPER
LEVEL DIVERGENCE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL KEEP RAIN SHOWERS
DEVELOPING AND MOVING NORTHEAST THROUGH THE AREA THROUGH THE LATE
EVENING. THE MID LEVELS WILL THEN DRY CONSIDERABLY WITH THE LOWER
LEVELS REMAINING VERY MOIST. DRIZZLE IS STILL POSSIBLE IN NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA IN THE LATE EVENING TO MIDNIGHT. A
STRATUS DECK WILL SET IN OVERNIGHT...WITH FOG DEVELOPMENT ACROSS
THE CWA. A FEW PLACES COULD SEE DENSE FOG...WITH LOW VISIBILITIES.
SATURDAY WILL REMAIN DRY WITH CLOUDY SKIES. A COLD FRONT WILL THEN
APPROACH THE AREA FROM THE WEST. MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT OVERNIGHT
SATURDAY...BUT THERE SEEMS TO BE ENOUGH FORCING FOR ISOLATED
SHOWERS. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL FOR
TONIGHT AND TOMORROW NIGHT.


.LONG TERM /SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/...
A STRONG STORM SYSTEM WILL IMPACT THE REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK... 
BRINGING THE POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND STRONG TO 
POSSIBILITY SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING... 
BEFORE IT CLEARS THE AREA BY MONDAY MORNING. AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT...A STRONG 40-50+ KT SOUTHERLY LLJ WILL HELP TO PUSH UPPER 
50S/LOWER 60S DEWPOINTS INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY. HOWEVER...THERE IS 
STILL A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY ABOUT THE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY GIVEN THE 
POTENTIAL FOR CLOUD COVER/SHOWERS DURING THE MORNING ACROSS THE WARM 
SECTOR. ADDITIONALLY...INSTABILITY DOES WANE SOMEWHAT AFTER 
SUNSET...SO THE TIMING OF STORMS AND THE AFOREMENTIONED FRONT WILL 
BE IMPORTANT TO ASSESSING THE SEVERE WEATHER POTENTIAL. HOWEVER... 
GIVEN THE STRONG DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM AND FAVORABLE 
WIND PROFILES FOR SUPERCELLS/ORGANIZED ROTATING STORMS...THINK THAT 
A REASONABLE SHOT FOR SEVERE WEATHER WILL EXIST LATE SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY 
ZONES/. MODEL NAM SOUNDINGS AT KCHA AND KTYS SHOW CURVED/SICKLE 
SHAPED HODOGRAPHS...INDICATING GOOD 0-1 KM SPEED AND DIRECTIONAL 
SHEAR. THUS...CANNOT RULE OUT SOME ISOLATED TORNADOES IN ADDITION TO 
THE PRIMARY THREATS OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND DAMAGING 
THUNDERSTORM WINDS.

AFTER MIDNIGHT...THE FRONT WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE MOUNTAIN 
ZONES AND TO THE EAST OF THE REGION BY MONDAY MORNING. IN ITS WAKE 
COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION AND BE ACCOMPANIED 
BY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT FOR MUCH OF THE WEEK AHEAD. THIS WILL RESULT IN 
MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS FOR THE UPCOMING WEEK...BUT ALSO NOTABLY 
COOLER CONDITIONS WITH HIGHS ONLY PEAKING IN THE MID 40S TO LOWER 
50S EACH DAY AND LOWS BOTTOMING OUT IN THE 20S TO MID 30S EACH 
NIGHT. 


&&

DRIZZLE...MAINLY EAST. LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES INCREASE TODAY BUT

DOWN...ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTH. TONIGHT SHOULD BE WARM AND MAY 
BECOME FOGGY.

DOMINATE AREA WEATHER ON SATURDAY FOR GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS AND 
WARMING TEMPERATURES.  MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT ON TIMING OF AN

FRAME.  WEAK INSTABILITY MAY ALLOW FOR A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER AND

RAINFALL.  WILL KEEP HIGHEST POPS AROUND WEDNESDAY 00Z.  A FEW 
SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO MONDAY MORNING BUT WEAK RIDGING AND SURFACE 
HIGH BUILDS IN FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED FOR DRY CONDITIONS 
THROUGH THURSDAY WITH SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

BEFORE THINGS DRY OUT FOR SATURDAY. SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL HELP TO
PUSH HIGHS INTO THE MID TO UPPER 60S THIS WEEKEND BEFORE ANOTHER
STRONGER UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM AND ITS ASSOCIATED COLD TRACK
MOVE INTO THE AREA SUNDAY EVENING INTO MONDAY. THIS FRONT WILL
BRING VERY GOOD CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND SOME ISOLATED STORMS
BEGINNING SUNDAY EVENING AND INCREASING THROUGHOUT THE
NIGHT...BEFORE THE FRONT SHIFTS EAST OF THE BY MONDAY AFTERNOON.
THUS...HAVE INCREASED POPS DURING THE SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY MORNING
TIME PERIOD TO LIKELY... BEFORE CLEARING THEM QUICKLY BY MONDAY
AFTERNOON/EVENING AS DRIER AIR QUICKLY FILERS IN MONDAY NIGHT. FOR
THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK THE REGION WILL PRIMARILY BE UNDER ZONAL
FLOW ALOFT AND A PREVAILING NORTHERLY TO NORTHEASTERLY FLOW AT THE
SURFACE AS HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE BUILDS BACK IN. THIS WILL
RESULT IN MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS FOR MUCH OF THE WEEK AHEAD...BUT
ALSO NOTABLY COOLER CONDITIONS WITH HIGHS ONLY PEAKING IN THE MID
40S TO LOWER 50S EACH DAY AND LOWS BOTTOMING OUT IN THE 20S TO MID
30S EACH NIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 140851

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST THU NOV 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...TODAY WILL BE ANOTHER DAY FILLED 
WITH SUNSHINE AS A DRY AIRMASS COVERS MOST OF THE EASTERN HALF OF 
THE U.S. THE PROTECTIVE RIDGE OVER THE REGION WILL GRADUALLY SHIFT 
EAST TO THE WESTERN ATLANTIC WHILE A WEAK UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES 
THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SLIPS EAST THE LOW 
LEVEL FLOW WILL BECOME SOUTHERLY. THIS WIND SHIFT AND NEARLY FULL 
INSOLATION WILL BOOST TEMPERATURES A GOOD 10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE 
YESTERDAY'S MAXIMUMS. STEADILY STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW ALOFT 
AHEAD OF THE UPPER TROUGH WILL LEAD TO AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA LATER TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE TRENDING TOWARD A 
MORE AMPLIFIED SHORTWAVE TROUGH ON FRIDAY COMPARED TO PREVIOUS RUNS. 
POSITIVE THETA-E ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL MOVE INTO 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS FRIDAY MORNING AND SPREAD NE. POPS WILL BE RAISED 
ACROSS THE BOARD FRIDAY AFTERNOON...BUT WILL REMAIN IN THE CHANCE 
RANGE. A STRENGTHENING RIDGE OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST WILL BRING A 
WARM SW FLOW TO THE AREA SATURDAY...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID TO UPPER 
60S.  

MODELS ARE COMING INTO BETTER AGREEMENT FOR SUNDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY...BUT STILL HAVE SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES WITH THE GFS 
CONTINUING TO SHOW A FASTER OPEN WAVE TROUGH...AND THE ECMWF AND 
CANADIAN SHOWING A SLOWER CLOSED UPPER LOW. SPREAD AMONG GEFS 
MEMBERS IS LESS...AND MOST MEMBERS ARE CLUSTERING AROUND SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES. WILL HAVE LIKELY 
POPS IN THIS PERIOD. WITH A LLJ OF 40-50 KTS AND 850 MB THETA-E 
VALUES AROUND 330K...WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. 
UPPER JET IS NOT IN A FAVORABLE POSITION TO PROVIDE A THREAT OF 
SEVERE STORMS. EVEN THE SLOWER ECMWF HAS MOST PRECIP OUT OF THE AREA 
BY 12Z MONDAY. WILL CUT BACK POPS TO A CHANCE EAST MONDAY 
MORNING...WITH ALL POPS ENDING IN THE AFTERNOON. 

TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WILL BE DRY AND MOSTLY SUNNY...BUT THERE ARE 
LARGE DIFFERENCES IN TEMPS BETWEEN THE GFS...ECMWF...WPC 
GUIDANCE...AND MOS ENSEMBLE MEAN. THE 00Z GFS HAS SUDDENLY COME IN 
WARMER. WILL TREND TEMPS UPWARD BUT STILL UNDERCUT GFS MOS BY 
SEVERAL DEGREES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             56  35  55  45  69 /   0   0  30  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EST WED NOV 13 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE REGION WILL DRIFT EAST DURING THE PERIOD...WITH A VERY DRY 
AIRMASS IN PLACE AS WELL OVER OUR AREA.  EXPECT A CLEAR SKY BOTH 
TONIGHT AND THURSDAY.  IT WILL BE RATHER COLD TONIGHT...BUT MILDER 
ON THURSDAY. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY A FEW 
MINOR TWEAKS.   

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A WARMING TREND 
CONTINUES THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY AS COLD AIR MASS CONTINUES TO 
MODIFY AND RIDGING ALOFT SHIFTS OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST. SURFACE HIGH 
SHIFTS TO THE CAROLINAS THURSDAY NIGHT WITH SW FLOW ALOFT WARMING 
LOWS 5 TO 10 DEGREES. FRIDAY WARMING IS CURTAILED BY INCREASE IN 
MOISTURE AS 500 MB SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES THE REGION. LOW LEVEL 
WARM ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT TO INCREASE CLOUDS FRIDAY MORNING 
AND AFTERNOON. MODELS DIFFER ON STRENGTH OF SYSTEM AND AMOUNT OF 
PRECIPITATION PRODUCED. WILL TREND TO THE LIGHTER AMOUNTS OF THE GFS 
AND NAM MAINLY SOUTH AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS FOR LATE FRIDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY. WITH THE VERY DRY AIR MASS IN PLACE RIGHT NOW. IT WILL 
TAKE AWHILE BEFORE AIR MASS SATURATES.  

TROUGH DEEPENS TO THE WEST SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT OVER THE 
PLAINS. THE ATLANTIC COAST RIDGE STAYS STRONG THROUGH SUNDAY. SW 
FLOW WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES MILD WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S THROUGH 
MONDAY. LOWS FRIDAY STILL MOSTLY BELOW FREEZING BUT ABOVE FREEZING 
SATURDAY. AS NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES SUNDAY BEST RAIN CHANCES WILL BE 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY THEN DECREASING LATE MONDAY INTO 
MONDAY NIGHT. STRONG SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FLOW AHEAD OF SYSTEM AND 
CONSIDERABLE CLOUD COVER HAS NIGHT TIME LOWS ONLY DROPPING INTO TO 
40S TO LOWER 50S SUNDAY MORNING. A WARM FRONT MOVING THROUGH EARLY 
SUNDAY WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM TO THE MID 60S TO NEAR 70 AND 
THEN FALL INTO THE MID TO UPPER 50S EARLY MONDAY AHEAD OF A 
SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT. TUESDAY SHOULD BE 10 TO 15 DEGREES COLDER 
BEHIND FRONT AND EVEN COLDER WEDNESDAY AS THE LARGE CANADIAN HIGH 
BRINGS MORE COLD AIR ADVECTION SOUTHEAST INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MAY SEE SOME ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS 
SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY AHEAD OF COLD FRONT.

LOWER DEWPOINTS...DECIDED TO BUMP EVERYONE DOWN ONE DEGREE FOR
OVERNIGHT LOWS. CLOUD COVER ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA SHOULD CONTINUE
TO DIMINISH DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS AND BE MOSTLY CLEAR TOWARD
SUNRISE. NEW ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

FXUS64 KMRX 121953
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST TUE NOV 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...BEHIND AN EXITING COLD 
FRONT....MUCH COLDER AIR IS STREAMING IN AND TEMPERATURES WILL 
CONTINUE TO FALL OVERNIGHT FOR ONE OF THE COLDEST NIGHT YET THIS 
SEASON.  LOWS WILL BE IN THE 20S ACROSS THE VALLEY AND INTO THE 
TEENS ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN.  A FEW POCKETS OF LIGHT SNOW OR 
FLURRIES WILL LINGER OVER THE NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS BUT NO 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN ON WEDNESDAY AND 
ABUNDANT SUNSHINE WILL BEGIN TO MODERATE TEMPERATURES.  HOWEVER... 
HIGHS WILLS STRUGGLE TO CLIMB AND WILL ONLY REACH INTO THE 40S 
ACROSS MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE BRIEFLY 
AMPLIFIES OVER THE REGION THURSDAY...THEN SW FLOW ALOFT DEVELOPS AS 
HEIGHTS FALL SHARPLY ACROSS THE WRN HALF OF THE NATION. A SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH IS STILL PROGGED TO TRACK ENE FROM THE UPPER MIDWEST AND 
CENTRAL PLAINS STATES BY MONDAY. USUALLY NOT PRONE TO GO LIKELY ON 
POPS AS FAR OUT AS DAY 6...BUT THERE IS GOOD CONSENSUS AMONGST THE 
GFS/ECM/CMC MODELS AGAIN TODAY. 

CHILLY TEMPS TO START AS THE SURFACE RIDGE SETTLES ACROSS THE REGION 
THURSDAY MORNING. MIN TEMPS MODERATE A BIT BY THURSDAY NIGHT...THEN 
INCREASE SIGNIFICANTLY BY THE WEEKEND AS THE SURFACE RIDGE SLIPS 
EAST. THE SW FLOW ALOFT WILL ALSO BRING AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS WHICH 
WILL KEEP MINS IN THE 40S TO LOWER 50S THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. MAX 
TEMPS MAY ALSO WARM AS MUCH AS 10 DEGREES ABOVE CLIMO FOR MID 
NOVEMBER...SO I CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE SIMILAR 00Z/12Z GFSX AND ECMX 
MOS TEMPS.  

IF TIMING ON THE MONDAY SYSTEM HOLDS TRUE...THEN FALLING TEMPS MAY 
OCCUR ON TUESDAY BEHIND PASSAGE OF ANOTHER STRONG COLD FRONT. NOT 
SEEING TEMPS DROP ENOUGH TO JUSTIFY ANY MENTION OF SNOW JUST YET.
HOWEVER...I DID UNDERCUT THE GFSX MOS MAX TEMPS ON TUESDAY...A BIT 
OF COMPROMISE WITH THE MUCH COOLER ECMX MAXES.

527 
FXUS64 KMRX 120742
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 AM EST TUE NOV 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A STRONG COLD FRONT CURRENTLY LOCATED ACROSS KY WILL PUSH INTO THE 
AREA THIS MORNING. A FEW SHOWERS ARE MOVING THROUGH SW VA AND NE TN 
EARLY THIS MORNING...BUT THE BULK OF THE SHOWERS ARE ALONG OR BEHIND 
THE FRONT. OBS AROUND THE OHIO RIVER SHOW A RAPID DROP IN TEMPS WITH 
A CHANGE TO SNOW...AND EXPECT A SIMILAR TREND LATER THIS MORNING IN 
OUR NORTHERN COUNTIES. MODELS INDICATE WEAKENING LIFT AS THE FRONT 
APPROACHES...WITH A NARROW WINDOW OF MOISTURE DEEP ENOUGH FOR 
MEASURABLE PRECIP...12Z-18Z. THUS TOTAL LIQUID QPF AMOUNTS ARE 
EXPECTED TO BE AT MOST A TENTH OF AN INCH IN SW VA. 

FREEZING LEVELS DURING THE PRECIP PERIOD DROP FROM 2500 TO 2000 FT.
WITH WARM GROUND TEMPS...SNOW ACCUMULATION WILL BE LIMITED...EVEN
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. UP TO ONE INCH IS EXPECTED AT HIGH
KNOB...NE TN MOUNTAINS...AND THE SMOKIES. WITH STEEP LAPSE RATES
BEHIND THE FRONT...SNOW SHOWERS WITH ABOVE FREEZING SURFACE TEMPS
WILL LIKELY OCCUR IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA...NE TN...AND
NORTHERN PLATEAU...BUT NO ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED AS MOISTURE
DEPTH IS GONE ONCE SURFACE TEMPS DROP LOW ENOUGH. THERE IS SOME
LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY IN THE AFTERNOON ALONG WITH A 20-25 KT
UPSLOPE WIND...AND THIS MAY BRING SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT
ACCUMULATION TO THE SMOKIES AND NE TN MOUNTAINS IN THE
AFTERNOON...WITH UP TO ONE INCH POSSIBLE. ALL PRECIP WILL END IN
THE EVENING AS MOISTURE EXITS.

NORTH WINDS TODAY WILL BE GUSTY...PERHAPS AS HIGH AS 35 MPH...BUT 
SHOULD STAY JUST BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. WILL CONTINUE THE SPS 
MENTIONING BREEZY CONDITIONS...LOW WIND CHILL VALUES...AND LIGHT 
SNOW ACCUMULATION IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
RIDGING BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL START THE EXTENDED PERIOD FOR
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH CLEAR SKY WITH COLD MORNINGS AND MILD
AFTERNOONS. AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL BE QUITE DRY WITH
VALUES DROPPING INTO THE 20S EACH DAY.

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY...UPPER RIDGING MOVES EAST WITH FLOW 
BECOMING SOUTHWEST. A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL EJECT NORTHEAST 
FROM A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE GREAT BASIN/ROCKIES. 
INITALLY...MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED TO THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...BUT SURFACE RIDING INTO THE SOUTHEAST WEAKENS 
DURING THE WEEKEND. THE WEAKENING RIDGE WILL ALLOW A SOUTHERLY 
LOW-LEVEL JET TO STRENGTHEN OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR LATE 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY AHEAD OF THE MAIN UPPER TROUGH LIFTING NORTHEAST 
INTO THE MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL INCREASE 
FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. GFS AND ECMWF SHOW A STRONG 
UPPER JET DYNAMICS OVER THE AREA FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. EVEN 
THOUGH INSTABILITY WILL BE LIMITED...STRENGTH OF SYSTEM MAY PRODUCE 
A CHANCE OF THUNDER OVER THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE AREA.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  23  45  24  55 /  40  10   0   0   0

LIGHT SNOW AND MVFR VIS/CIG AT TRI FOR A SHORT PERIOD. THE

NORTH...AND AN INCREASE IN WIND SPEEDS/GUSTS TO AROUND 15 KTS WITH
GUSTS TO AROUND 25 KTS. WINDS SHOULD DROP OFF A BIT TO AROUND 10
KTS IN THE EVENING.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 120230 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EST MON NOV 11 2013

.DISCUSSION...
THIS EVENING...CLOUD COVER IS CONTINUING TO STREAM INTO THE
FORECAST AREA FROM THE NORTH AND WEST AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD
FRONT OVER THE OHIO VALLEY. LATE TONIGHT AS THE FRONT SAGS
SOUTH...SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL BEGIN TO APPRAOCH
THE FAR NORTHERN ZONES ALONG THE TENNESSEE/KENTUCKY BORDER AND
ALONG THE KENTUCKY/VIRGINIA BORDER. TEMPERATURES /ESPECAILLY IN THE
VALLEYS/ SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH TO KEEP THIS PRECIPITATION IN THE
FORM OF RAIN. HOWEVER...LOCATIONS ABOVE 2000-2500 FT COULD SEE A
MIX OF SNOW AND RAIN OR EXPERIENCE SOME LIGHT SNOW CLOSE TO
DAYBREAK AS COOLER AIR WORKS ITS WAY IN...MAINLY IN THOSE HIGHER
LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE LIMITED
MOISTURE AND THE BEST CHANCES NOT OCCURRING UNTIL LATER IN THE
MORNING...AM NOT EXPECTING MUCH /IF ANY/ IN THE WAY OF ACCUMULATIONS
OF RAIN OR SNOW.

676 
FXUS64 KMRX 112003 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EST MON NOV 11 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PULLING 
OUT OF THE AREA TONIGHT...ALLOWING A STRONG COLD FRONT TO APPROACH 
FROM THE NORTH.  THIS WILL ALLOW THE NIGHT TO BEGIN WITH MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES...LIGHT WINDS AT SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.  HOWEVER...IN 
ADVANCE OF THE FRONT...MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN..  
THEN...TOWARDS SUNRISE AS THE FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA...CLOUDS 
WILL LOW AND THICKEN AND LIGHT RAIN WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA.  THE 
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH QUICKLY DURING THE MORNING AND EARLY 
AFTERNOON.  BEHIND THE FRONT....MUCH COLDER AIR WILL PUSH IN.  THIS 
WILL CAUSE TEMPERATURES TO FALL DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS WITH THE 
LIGHT RAIN TRANSITIONING OVER TO LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES...FIRST OVER 
NORTHER LOCATIONS IN THE LATE MORNING AND IN THE SOUTH MID TO LATE 
AFTERNOON.  ADDITIONALLY...WINDS WILL INCREASE WITH THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE.  SUSTAINED WINDS OF 10 TO 20 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS COMBINED 
WITH THE COLDER TEMPERATURES WILL CREATE WIND CHILLS IN THE 
20S...TEENS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BY THE END OF THE DAY.  AS FOR 
SNOWFALL...MOST LOCATIONS WILL ONLY SEE A TRACE OF SNOW.  THE ONLY 
EXCEPTION WILL BE MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OF UP TO AN INCH ON GRASSY 
SURFACES OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  A FEW SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER 
OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN TUESDAY EVENING...THEN WILL DRY AND VERY 
COLD CONDITIONS EXPECTED THROUGH THE REST OF THE NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...TURNING CHILLY FOR WEDNESDAY 
AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT BEHIND PASSAGE OF THE SHORT TERM COLD FRONT. A 
DEEPENING SW FLOW ALOFT STILL PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE WEEKEND 
AND A HINT OF A NRN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH BY MONDAY.

THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPS...ESPECIALLY MIN TEMPS...TO BECOME QUITE MILD 
BY FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...AS CLOUDS INCREASE. KEPT IN A 
MENTION OF SHOWERS BY SATURDAY...THEN HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY. KEEPING OPTIONS OPEN TO POSSIBLY BUMP POPS UP TO LIKELY 
FOR SUNDAY OR MONDAY WITH LATER FORECAST ISSUANCES. LOCAL ENSEMBLE 
PROGRAM HIGHLIGHTING THE WEEKEND OUT TO MONDAY AS TARGETS TO IMPROVE 
ON MOS...SO OPTED TO WAIT FOR ANOTHER MODEL RUN OR TWO.  

GFSX MOS TEMPS CONSISTENT FROM 11/00Z TO 11/12Z RUN AND GENERALLY 
FOLLOWED. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     40  43  24  45  24 /  10  40  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             40  42  24  46  24 /  10  50  10   0   0


500 
FXUS64 KMRX 110751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 AM EST MON NOV 11 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A DRY ZONAL FLOW WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA TODAY AND THIS EVENING. 
EXPECT PLEASANT TEMPERATURES IN THE 60S UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES 
TODAY. 

TONIGHT...A DEEP CLOSED LOW MOVES ACROSS ONTARIO WITH A TRAILING 
UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE COLD FRONT PUSHING SE. THE FRONT MOVES INTO 
OUR AREA AROUND 09Z...WITH LIFT AND MOISTURE LOCATED ALONG OR BEHIND 
THE FRONT. NAM AND GFS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM. LIFT
APPEARS TIED TO 850-700 MB CONVERGENCE...WHICH GRADUALLY WEAKENS AS
IT MOVES ACROSS KY. ALTHOUGH WE ARE IN THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF
A STRONG UPPER JET...THE CONTRIBUTION OF AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL
CIRCULATION TO LIFT IS WEAK AS IT IS STEEPLY SLOPED TOWARD
HORIZONTAL. FRONTOGENESIS IS WEAK BY THE TIME IT REACHES OUR AREA.
MOISTURE DEPTH TO THE -10C LEVEL IS LIMITED TO A NARROW WINDOW
BETWEEN 14-18Z. ALL THIS ADDS UP TO A LIGHT PRECIP EVENT.

WITH MOST OF THE PRECIP TRAILING THE SURFACE FRONT AND 850 MB 
TROUGH...WE WILL SEE STRONG COLD ADVECTION OCCURRING IN CONJUNCTION
WITH THE PRECIP ON TUESDAY. TEMPS WILL BE FALLING THROUGH THE DAY.
A QUICK CHANGE FROM RAIN TO SNOW IS EXPECTED IN SW VA TUESDAY
MORNING...WITH THE CHANGE COMING IN THE AFTERNOON ACROSS THE
NORTHERN PLATEAU...NORTHERN TN VALLEY...AND MOUNTAINS. STEEP LAPSE
LOW LEVEL RATES AND A 20 KT NORTH WIND AT 925-850 MB WILL SLIGHTLY
ENHANCE SNOW AMOUNTS IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATE IN THE AFTERNOON.
HOWEVER...MOST PRECIP WILL STILL BE LIGHT DUE TO WEAK LIFT AND
SHALLOW MOISTURE...SO FOR NOW WILL HAVE THE HIGHEST SNOW AMOUNTS
AROUND 1 INCH IN WISE CO. AND IN THE SMOKIES. AT MOST...A DUSTING
IS POSSIBLE IN NORTHERN VALLEY LOCATIONS INCLUDING TRI-CITIES.
ABOVE-FREEZING SURFACE TEMPS DURING PRECIP WILL LIMIT ANY
ACCUMULATIONS IN THE VALLEY. KNOXVILLE MAY SEE A FEW FLAKES LATE
IN THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
UPPER TROUGH AND FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA
TUESDAY NIGHT WITH THE MAIN THEME FOR THE EXTENDED BEING THE RETURN
OF SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AS SHORT-WAVES DIG INTO THE GREAT
BASIN/ROCKIES THEN LIFT NORTHEAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND
MID-WEST FOR THE LATER HALF OF THE WEEK INTO NEXT WEEKEND.
INCREASING HIGH AND MID-LEVEL CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED. SHORT-WAVES
LIFTING NORTHEAST WILL PROVIDE INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT AS
SURFACE RIDING MOVES EAST NEXT WEEKEND.

INCREASING THICKNESS/HEIGHTS WILL ALLOW FOR A WARM-UP DURING THE 
WEEK. VERY DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED WITH AFTERNOON RELATIVE 
HUMIDITIES DROPPING INTO THE 20S WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  45  50  27  48 /   0   0  20   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  43  44  24  45 /   0  10  40   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  42  43  25  46 /   0  10  40   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 101955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST SUN NOV 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS HIGH WILL BECOME CENTERED OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN TONIGHT...WITH DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH MONDAY. ANOTHER STRONGER 
COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE 
MONDAY NIGHT...WITH AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BEHIND IT 
CREATING SOME POST-FRONTAL PRECIP ON TUESDAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE THAT THE UPPER LEVELS WILL COOL ENOUGH ON TUESDAY FOR LIGHT 
SNOW TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED WITH THIS QUICK-MOVING 
FRONT...AND THUS...IT APPEARS THAT ONLY LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS 
AROUND AN INCH OR TWO WILL BE POSSIBLE ABOVE 2500 FEET. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
THROUGH TUESDAY...BUT THEN REVEAL SOME LARGER DISCREPANCIES BY 
TUESDAY NIGHT WHEN A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SEEMS BEST.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A COLD AIR MASS AND A STRONG 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN BEHIND AN EXITING COLD FRONT ON 
WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL PROVIDE A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS BUT HIGHS 
WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB...WITH SOME NORTHERN VALLEY LOCATION NOT 
EXPECTED TO PUSH OUT OF THE 30S. THE SURFACE HIGH SETTLES INTO THE 
AREA FOR THE REST OF THE WORK WEEK AS TEMPERATURES MODERATE. BY LATE 
FRIDAY...THE HIGH WILL BE PULLING OUT THE REGION AND WE WILL MOVE 
INTO AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. THIS 
WILL USHER IN A CHANCE OF SHOWERS WITH BEST CHANCE CURRENTLY LOOKS 
TO BE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EST SUN NOV 10 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT ALONG THE SPINE OF 
THE APPALACHIANS...WITH A MORE MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
(COMPARED TO YESTERDAY). BREEZY NORTHWEST WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO 
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS SOUTHWEST AND NORTHEAST TN...WHERE 
RELATIVE HUMIDITIES ARE EXPECTED TO FALL INTO THE 30S. WITH THIS 
NORTHWEST FLOW...WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO BE STRONGER OVER THE EASTERN 
SLOPES OF THE APPALACHIANS DUE TO THE USUAL DOWNSLOPING 
ACCELERATIONS...AND DO NOT THINK THAT RED FLAG CRITERIA WINDS 
(SUSTAINED WINDS IN EXCESS OF 20 MPH) WILL BE OBSERVED IN EXTREME 
SOUTHWEST VA. HOWEVER...SINCE THE WINDS AND RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL 
BE CLOSE TO RED FLAG CRITERIA ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA...HAVE ISSUED A 
SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO MENTION AN INCREASED FIRE DANGER FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON (AFTER COORDINATION WITH FORESTRY PERSONNEL).

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TODAY APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL UPDATE THIS MORNING TO MENTION BREEZY WINDS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA 
AND NORTHEAST TN...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE 
LATEST TRENDS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

MAIN CONCERN WILL BE THE FIRST TASTE OF WINTER ACROSS MUCH OF THE
AREA TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. A STRONG NORTHERN STREAM JET WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY
NIGHT WITH A COLD FRONT PULLING SOUTH ACROSS THE REGION TUESDAY.
THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET WILL BE OVER THE AREA
PRODUCING DIVERGENCE ALOFT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE
DIRECT AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL CIRCULATION AROUND THIS JET WILL
CONTINUE TO ENHANCE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING ALONG THE FRONTAL
BOUNDARY. A BAND OF PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
REGION...ESPECIALLY OVERNIGHT EASTERN AND NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE
AREA. THE COLDEST AREA OF THE SEASON...THUS FAR...WILL CHANGE THE
RAIN TO SNOW. LIGHT SNOW/FLURRIES WILL BE POSSIBLE AS FAR SOUTH AS
KNOXVILLE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.

TEMPERATURE PROFILE AND MOISTURE SUGGEST A LIGHT ACCUMULATION 
EXPECTED OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...FAR 
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND POSSIBLE THE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA. ACCUMULATIONS OF 1 TO 2 INCHES ARE POSSIBLE. A 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED FOR THIS EVENT ACROSS THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN.

BESIDES THE PRECIPITATION...HIGH TEMPERATURES TUESDAY WILL LIKELY BE 
EARLY IN THE DAY...THEN DROP...ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE AREA. 

PRECIPITATION WILL END TUESDAY NIGHT WITH RIDGING AND WARMING TREND 
ANTICIPATED FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS 
ALOFT ANTICIPATED TOWARD NEXT WEEKEND.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             66  36  66  44  53 /   0   0   0   0  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  35  63  39  47 /   0   0   0  10  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       63  34  63  41  46 /   0   0   0  10  40

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST SAT NOV 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN ELONGATED AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. 
THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
LATE TONIGHT...BRINGING ONLY AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS. A LARGE DOME OF 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN REBUILD OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY...WITH DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED. ANOTHER 
STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE 
MONDAY NIGHT...BRINGING A CHANCE FOR LIGHT RAIN BEFORE SUNRISE OVER 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE 
WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...ECMWF BEGINNING TO COME IN 
LINE WITH THE FASTER GFS TIMING OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. MODELS 
CONTINUE TO TREND FASTER WITH THE FRONT AND NOW EXPECTED FRONTAL 
PASSAGE ON TUESDAY. MUCH COOLER AIR WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE WHICH WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO FALL DURING THE DAY ON 
TUESDAY. ACCOMPANYING RAIN WILL SLOWLY TRANSITION TO LIGHT SNOW OR 
FLURRIES FROM NORTH TO SOUTH LATE TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY EVENING. THE 
SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH QUICKLY AND THE RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS WILL END 
OVER THE VALLEY LOCATIONS TUESDAY NIGHT WITH ONLY A FEW LINGERING 
SNOW SHOWERS EXPECTED OVER FAR NORTHEASTERN MOUNTAINS INTO 
WEDNESDAY. ANY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE MINOR AND GENERALLY 
CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. A COLD SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
PUSHES IN BEHIND THE FRONT FOR COLD TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE HIGH REMAINS POSITIONED OVER THE REGION THROUGH 
THE REST OF THE EXTENDED FOR DRY CONDITIONS WITH TEMPERATURES SLOWLY 
MODERATING.

083 
FXUS64 KMRX 090721
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
221 AM EST SAT NOV 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A ZONAL MID AND UPPER LEVEL FLOW TODAY WILL BRING SOME HIGH CLOUDS 
TO THE AREA FROM THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER TX. IN THE LOW 
LEVELS...HIGH PRESSURE TO THE EAST AND A LOW TRACKING ACROSS THE 
GREAT LAKES WILL CREATE A SW FLOW WITH WEAK WARM ADVECTION. THIS 
SHOULD OFFSET THE SLIGHT INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS...SO TEMPS WILL 
TREND WARMER WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S. SOME HIGH AND 
MID CLOUDS MAY CONTINUE TONIGHT IN SOUTHERN AREAS AS THE WEAK TROUGH 
PASSES SOUTH OF OUR AREA...BUT NORTHERN AREAS SHOULD BE CLEAR. LOW 
TEMPS WILL BE NEAR MOS GUIDANCE...IN THE MID 30S TO LOWER 40S SOUTH.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
SUNDAY WILL USHER IN HIGH PRESSURE UNDER NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT.
SIMILAR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED MONDAY. THE RESULT WILL BE NEAR
SEASONAL TEMPERATURES. THE BIG STORY WILL BE THE COLD AIR MARCHING
IN QUICKLY FROM THE NORTHWEST FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.

MODELS CAME IN BETTER AGREEMENT YESTERDAY AND THIS EVENING WITH A 
MORE PROGRESSIVE SYSTEM. JET DYNAMICS ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE TROUGH 
AXIS WOULD SEEM TO KEEP THE TROUGH MOVING FAST ACROSS THE AREA. THE 
COLD FRONT WILL LIKELY BEGIN PUSHING INTO THE AREA LATE MONDAY 
NIGHT. EXPECT THE WARMEST TEMPERATURES TO OCCUR NEAR MIDNIGHT AND 
DROP THROUGH THE DAY. ADDITIONALLY PRECIPITATION WILL FALL...FIRST 
AS RAIN AND THEN TRANSITION INTO SNOW SHOWERS BY TUESDAY NIGHT. THE 
BEST CHANCE WILL OCCUR OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA HOWEVER THE SYSTEM 
WILL BE MOVING QUICKLY AND LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATIONS ARE 
ANTICIPATED WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE HIGHEST TERRAIN OF SW VA AND 
THE TN MOUNTAINS. DRY AIR WILL QUICKLY FILTER INTO THE REGION ENDING 
THE PRECIPITATION BY EARLY WEDNESDAY. WEDNESDAY MORNING WILL BE COLD 
BUT THE COLDEST OF THE MORNINGS WILL BE THURSDAY UNDER CLEAR SKIES 
AND GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS. UNDERCUT GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
SLIGHTLY WED AND THU FOR BOTH MAX AND MIN TEMPERATURES. DRY 
CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT WITH SLIGHT WARMING 
EXPECTED INTO THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEKEND. /AC

173 
FXUS64 KMRX 081944
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST FRI NOV 8 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY...WITH A COOL AND VERY DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS HIGH WILL LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH SUNDAY 
NIGHT...BRINGING DRY CONDITIONS AND NEAR NORMAL TEMPS. AS THIS HIGH 
GRADUALLY SLIDES EASTWARD THIS WEEKEND...SOUTHERLY WINDS ON ITS BACK 
SIDE WILL BRING A GRADUAL WARMING TREND THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH 
SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A DRY AND WARM MONDAY STILL ON 
TRACK WITH SURFACE HIGH IN PLACE AND ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. HOWEVER... 
MODELS SIGNIFICANTLY DIVERGE TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH 
THE TIMING...MOISTURE...AND STRENGTH OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT.  
MODELS HAVE BEEN TRENDING FASTER WITH THIS SYSTEM. GFS IS THE 
FASTEST...MOVING THE FRONT THROUGH TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT WITH 
LIMITED MOISTURE.  ECMWF IS SLOWER...BUT IS TRENDING FASTER THAN 
PRIOR RUNS.  THIS MODEL BRINGS THE FRONT IN TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY WITH A DEEPER AND WIDER BAND OF MOISTURE.  DUE TO LACK OF 
RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY WITH EITHER MODEL...CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW.  
HAVE KEPT WITH A COMPROMISE SOLUTION BETWEEN THE TWO MODELS AND HAVE 
TREND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE THROUGH EARLIER WITH THE HIGHEST POPS 
CENTERED AROUND LATE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING.  MUCH COLDER 
AIR MOVES IN WITH THE FRONT AND RAIN SHOWERS MAY TRANSITION INTO 
SNOW SHOWERS AS THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH.  WITH THE SPEED OF THE GFS 
FRONTAL PASSAGE...A TRACE OF SNOW IS ALL THAT IS EXPECTED.  THE 
SLOWER PASSAGE OF THE ECMWF COULD GENERATE MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OVER 
HIGHER TERRAIN.  FOR THURSDAY THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED... 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE REGION WITH THE COLD AIR SLOWLY 
MODERATING.
&&

703 
FXUS64 KMRX 080709
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
209 AM EST FRI NOV 8 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE DRIFTING FROM WEST TO EAST ACROSS TN TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. WITH A DRY ZONAL FLOW IN THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS...WE WILL 
SEE CLEAR SKIES THROUGH THE PERIOD. WITH THE CENTER OF THE 850 MB 
RIDGE DISPLACED TO THE SOUTHWEST AND A NORTHERLY FLOW OVER OUR 
AREA...WE WILL SEE SOME COLD ADVECTION THAT WILL HOLD TEMPS IN THE 
50S TODAY. TONIGHT WILL BE CLEAR AND CALM WITH LOWS IN THE MID 20S 
TO MID 30S. DID NOT DEVIATE FAR FROM MOS GUIDANCE ON TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
QUIET WEATHER PATTERN PERSISTS THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE
WEEKEND WITH GENERALLY ZONAL UPPER FLOW AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDING ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH MONDAY.

LONGER RANGE MODELS VARY SIGNIFICANTLY IN TERMS OF PRECIPITATION AND 
TIMING OF THE NEXT FRONTAL SYSTEM. WHILE THIS WILL BE THE COLDEST 
AIR OF THE SEASON TO MOVE INTO THE AREA IT MAY ALSO BE THE FIRST 
CHANCE OF SNOW. THERE WE SAID IT. EVEN THOUGH SNOW WILL FALL THERE 
IS STILL QUITE A DIFFERENCE IN IF IT WILL ACCUMULATE TO MUCH. ONE 
MODEL IS MUCH DRIER/FASTER MOVING THAN THE OTHER AND WOULD BE THE 
DIFFERENCE BETWEEN A TRACE AND PERHAPS A FEW INCHES IN HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. ALL THAT TO SAY THAT CONFIDENCE REMAINS QUITE LOW FOR A 
SIGNIFICANT WINTER TYPE EVENT BUT WE WILL KEEP A CLOSE EYE ON 
CHANGING DEVELOPMENTS. LITTLE TO NO CHANGES WERE MADE TO PREVIOUS 
POP FORECASTS FOR THIS TIME PERIOD.

THE COLD FRONT WILL LIKELY MOVE IN EARLY ON TUESDAY. SHALLOW COLD 
AIR MASSES ARE USUALLY NOT HANDLED WELL BY THE MODELS AND IN REALITY 
THE COLD AIR MOVES MUCH FASTER. THEREFORE THE DIURNAL TEMPERATURES FOR 
TUESDAY WERE TWEAKED TO SHOW WARMEST TEMPERATURES BY MID 
MORNING...DROPPING THROUGH THE DAY. ADDITIONALLY THE MENTION OF SNOW 
WAS ADDED PARTICULARLY LATE IN THE AFTERNOON AND TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
EARLY WEDNESDAY. THE MODELS ARE LIKELY UNDERDOING THE DRY AIR AND 
MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS ARCTIC AIR MASS. AS 
SUCH HAVE LOWERED DAYTIME TEMPERATURES FOR WED AND THU AS WELL AS 
LOWERED DEWPOINT TEMPERATURES TO BETTER REPRESENT THE COLD DRY AIR 
THAT WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             58  35  61  39  67 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  32  60  38  62 /   0   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       55  33  60  37  62 /   0   0   0   0  10

SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

MID WEEK. GFS HAS SPED UP APPROACHING SYSTEM BRINGING IT IN LATE 
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. THE ECMWF IS SLOWER...MOVING IT IN WEDNESDAY 
INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT. CONFIDENCE LOW ON TIMING AND WENT WITH A 
COMPROMISE SOLUTION WITH HIGHEST POPS OF CHANCE CATEGORY TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. FOR NOW...WILL LEAVE THURSDAY DRY AS THE SYSTEM 
PULLS AWAY FROM THE AREA. AS FOR TEMPERATURES...SEASONAL 
TEMPERATURES AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH COOLER 
READING LATE IN THE PERIOD.

118 
FXUS64 KMRX 070733
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 AM EST THU NOV 7 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
EARLY THIS MORNING...A BROAD AREA OF SHOWERS CONTINUES TO ADVANCE
EASTWARD INTO THE REGION FROM MIDDLE TENNESSEE INTO THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU AND EAST TENNESSEE AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. THIS RAIN WILL
CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD THE REGION OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS AS THE
FRONT PROGRESS EAST...WITH MOST LOCATIONS RECEIVING BETWEEN ONE-
QUARTER TO ONE-HALF INCH OF RAINFALL. GIVEN THAT THE FRONT IS A
LITTLE SLOWER THAN PREVIOUSLY PROJECTED...HAVE INCREASED POPS
THROUGH MID-MORNING ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE CWA...AS SOME
SHOWERS SEEMS LIKELY THROUGH 15-18Z. HOWEVER...AFTER 18Z COOL AND
DRY AIR WILL QUICKLY FILTER INTO THE REGION...ENDING THE RAIN
POTENTIAL AND RESULTING IN A MUCH COOLER DAY AS HIGHS WILL PEAK IN
THE 50S IN MOST LOCATIONS. CLEAR AND MUCH COOLER CONDITIONS WILL
PREVAIL TONIGHT WITH SOME PATCHY FOG POSSIBLE NEAR AREA LAKES AND
RIVERS AFTER MIDNIGHT. 

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES NEEDED FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE LONG
TERM...AS THE UPPER FLOW BECOMES ZONAL AFTER PASSAGE OF UPPER
TROUGH LATE TODAY. THUS... DRY WEATHER WITH SLIGHTLY BELOW SEASONAL
TEMPS FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT.

ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND SURFACE RIDGING KEEPS DRY WEATHER AT LEAST INTO 
TUESDAY...WITH TEMPS MODERATING OVER THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. AN EAST TO WEST ORIENTED COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE 
REGION BY LATE TUESDAY. HOWEVER...BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS SHOW 
A CLOSED AND POSSIBLY CUTOFF UPPER LOW DEVELOPING OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY. THIS COULD SLOW THE SOUTHWARD PUSH OF THE COLD 
FRONT...ALTHOUGH CAN'T ARGUE WITH THE HIGHER TREND IN GFSX MOS POPS 
FOR LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SO I MADE THOSE 
ADJUSTMENTS TO POP AND WEATHER GRIDS.

GFSX MOS TEMPS GENERALLY CONSISTENT FROM 06/12Z TO 07/00Z RUN...
EXCEPT FOR LARGE DEVIATIONS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. GIVEN THE 
UNCERTAINTY AT THIS POINT...I POPULATED WITH A GFS ENSEMBLE AVERAGE 
MAX TEMP FOR THOSE DAYS...RATHER THAN MAKE SUCH A DRASTIC CHANGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

GUIDANCE FOR THE MAX TEMP NEXT WED...DUE TO THIS INITIAL 
DISAGREEMENT...BUT DID BUMP UP THE POPS BY ABOUT 10% IN THE FINAL 
PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 060804
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 AM EST WED NOV 6 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY/...
AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL QUICKLY SHIFT TO THE SOUTH AND EAST
OF THE REGION TODAY...AS BROAD UPPER-TROUGH MOVES EASTWARD INTO THE
OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. A SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL ACCOMPANY THE
PASSAGE OF THIS UPPER-TROUGH AND PROMOTE A BRIEF WINDOW FOR SOME
SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD SHOWER ACTIVITY LATER TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY
MORNING. AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM...CLOUD COVER WILL INCREASE THROUGHOUT
THE DAY. BUT...WITH A STOUT SOUTHERLY FLOW...TEMPERATURES SHOULD
ONCE AGAIN REACH THE MID TO UPPER 60S...TO AROUND 70 DEGREES IN
MOST LOCATIONS BY THE AFTERNOON. THEN AS THE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH
OVERNIGHT...SHOWERS WILL BEGIN TO OVERSPREAD THE REGION FROM WEST
TO EAST BETWEEN 03Z TO 06Z...WITH THE GREATEST POTENTIAL BEING
BETWEEN 06-12Z. AS SUCH...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO CATEGORICAL
AREAWIDE DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. ALSO HAVE HIGH POPS ALONG THE
MOUNTAINS DURING THE EARLY MORNING ON THURSDAY...BEFORE QUICKLY
TAPERING THEM OFF AFTER 15Z AND REMOVING THEM ALL TOGETHER AFTER
18Z. COOL/DRY AIR WILL QUICKLY MOVE INTO THE REGION IN WAKE OF THE
FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH HIGHS ON THURSDAY REACHING THE MID 50S TO
AROUND 60 DEGREES IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
GENERALLY A 
PROLONGED DRY AND TRANQUIL PERIOD BEHIND PASSAGE OF THE UPPER TROUGH 
AND COLD FRONT EARLY THURSDAY. COOLEST NIGHT WILL BE THURSDAY NIGHT
THEN MIN TEMPS SLOWLY RISE TO AT OR JUST ABOVE CLIMO OVER THE 
WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. 

HEIGHTS RISE OVER THE WEEKEND BUT THE UPPER FLOW REMAINS NEARLY 
ZONAL. SURFACE RIDGE WILL BE A DOMINANT FEATURE AS WELL...AND 
MOISTURE MAY NOT RETURN UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT OR EARLY WEDNESDAY. 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS KEPT IN FOR TUESDAY NIGHT. MAX TEMPS NOT PROGGED 
TO WARM ANY HIGHER THAN 50S TO MID/UPR 60S DURING THIS PERIOD...
WHICH IS JUST SLIGHTLY ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS. THE 06Z GFSX MOS MAX 
TEMPS TRENDED SLIGHTLY COOLER FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...WITH MAX TEMP 
GRIDS ADJUSTED TO REFLECT THIS TREND AND MESH WITH NWS NEIGHBORS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 052000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST TUE NOV 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...
LAST OF THE QUIET DAYS BEFORE THE WEATHER SYSTEM ENTERS THE PICTURE
WED NGT. BUT AS FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY...MOSTLY WILL BE
EXPERIENCING VARIABLE CLOUDINESS AND A MOISTENING OF THE LOWER
LEVELS. AIR MASS WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 50S/60S ACROSS LA/AR/MO WILL
REPLACE OUR 30S DEWPOINTS AIR MASS...ESPECIALLY DURING WED AS S/SW
WINDS PICK UP A BIT. WILL MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN OUR
WESTERNMOST ZONES WED AFTN AHEAD OF APPROACHING SYSTEM. WENT A
LITTLE WARMER THAN GUIDANCE ON MIN TEMPS TONIGHT IN KEEPING WITH
PREVIOUS FCST PACKAGE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
MODELS IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH
SOLUTIONS START TO DIVERGE MORE LATE. FORECAST CONFIDENCE ABOVE
AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR AT LEAST UNTIL LATE IN THE PERIOD. A
COLD FRONT WILL SWING THROUGH EARLY. MODEL TREND HAS BEEN FASTER
WITH THIS SYSTEM...SO WILL SPEED THINGS UP A BIT. WILL GO CAT POPS
ALL ZONES WED NIGHT...THEN LIKELY FAR NORTHEAST DOWN TO SLIGHT
CHANCE WEST FOR FIRST PART OF THURSDAY. DRY THU AFTERNOON.
INSTABILITY LOOKS WEAK AT BEST SO NO THUNDER MENTION AT THIS TIME.
HIGH PRESSURE WILL TAKE CONTROL BEHIND THE FRONT WITH DRYER AIR
MOVING IN. A WEAK COLD FRONT MAY SAG INTO THE REGION SAT OR SAT
NIGHT...BUT LITTLE MOISTURE OR FORCING SO WILL KEEP THE FORECAST
DRY. NEXT SYSTEM MAY APPROACH BY TUESDAY...BUT MODEL AGREEMENT POOR
AND CONSENSUS SEEMS TO HOLD PRECIP OFF UNTIL AFTER TUE...SO WILL
KEEP TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW. WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             49  70  54  62  37 /   0  10  80  20   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  45  70  52  61  34 /   0  10  80  30   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  68  52  61  34 /   0  10  80  30   0

353 
FXUS64 KMRX 050808
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 AM EST TUE NOV 5 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY AND VERY TRANQUIL FALL
WEATHER PATTERN CONTINUES AS AN UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE HOLDS
ACROSS THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION. SURFACE RIDGE ALSO LOCKED
IN PLACE FROM THE NE STATES TO DEEP SOUTH STATES. 

VARYING AMOUNTS OF HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS TODAY...WHICH CURRENTLY WERE
QUITE THICK ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. ADJUSTED SKY COVER GRIDS UP
THROUGHOUT THE DAY...ALTHO THE HIGH CLOUDS MAY THIN OUT SOME IN THE
AFTERNOON. TEMPS GET OFF TO A MILD START THIS MORNING AND SHOULD
EASILY REACH THE GFS MOS MAXES GIVEN ANY SUNSHINE. 

FOR TONIGHT...SOME HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO STREAM ACROSS...
WHILE LOW LEVEL CLOUDS ARE PROGGED TO ADVECT NORTHWARD LATE TONIGHT.
THESE LOW CLOUDS SHOULD EASILY REACH THE CENTRAL AND SRN COUNTIES
OVERNIGHT...POSSIBLY AS FAR AS NE TN BEFORE 12Z WEDNESDAY. WENT
WITH THE MILDER MOS MINS AND EVEN A FEW DEGREES ABOVE WHERE CLOUDS
INCREASE THE MOST.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE THE BROAD 
UPPER-TROUGH AND ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. MODELS HAVE 
HONED IN ON THE TIMING A LITTLE BETTER...INDICATING THE BEST CHANCE 
FOR PRECIPITATION TO BE LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY 
MORNING...BEFORE THE FRONT CLEARS THE REGION BY THURSDAY EVENING. 
GIVEN THIS...HAVE ADJUSTED POPS SLIGHTLY TO REFLECT THIS AND HAVE 
REMOVED ANY MENTIONABLE POPS AFTER 00Z FRIDAY. THEREAFTER...RIDGING 
BRIEFLY BUILDS IN FOR FRIDAY BEFORE ANOTHER WEAK FRONT MOVES THROUGH 
SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY. HOWEVER...THERE WILL BE LIMITED MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE AND THUS DO NOT THINK PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BE 
SUBSTANTIAL ATTM. A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS MAY BE POSSIBLE...BUT GIVEN 
THE UNCERTAINTY THIS FAR OUT...HAVE OPTED TO KEEP POPS SILENT FOR 
NOW. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

245 
FXUS64 KMRX 042008
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EST MON NOV 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE CONTROLLING THE AREA/S WEATHER...AND WILL PROVIDE THE
ADVERTISED WARMING TREND THROUGH WEDNESDAY. SE WINDS NEAR CHA HAVE
BEEN AROUND 7-15 KTS TODAY BUT THIS SHOULD EASE A LITTLE FOR
TUESDAY. CIRRUS COMING IN AND OUT OF AREA WILL HAVE ITS USUAL
IMPACTS ON TEMPS. NAM/CANADIAN/ECMWF SUGGEST ISOLATED SHOWERS
POSSIBLE ALONG AND EAST OF THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS LATE
TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT HAVE LEFT OUT A MENTION FROM THE FCST FOR NOW.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
AT THE START OF THIS PERIOD THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM IS BEARING DOWN
ON THE AREA...WITH THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH STRETCHING FROM THE GREAT
LAKES SSWWD INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...AND AN INCREASING SWLY FLOW
ALOFT OVER OUR AREA. PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT BETWEEN MODELS THAT THE
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA QUICKLY ON THURSDAY. RIGHT NOW IT
LOOKS LIKE THE POST-FRONTAL AIR WILL BE TOO DRY FOR UPSLOPE SNOWS
THURSDAY EVENING...SO WILL NOT INCLUDE ANY FLURRIES, ETC. AT THIS
TIME. WILL INCLUDE SOME LIGHT POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY
EVENING...BUT THAT IS ONLY TO ACCOUNT THE POSSIBILITY OF SLIGHTLY
SLOWER TIMING OVERALL--IF IT SLOWS DOWN...THE COLD AIR WOULD SLOW
DOWN AS WELL...SO JUST KEEPING THIS PRECIP AS RAIN SHOWERS. GOING
DRY WITH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST.

FOR TEMPS...FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT WENT SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN GUIDANCE 
OVER WESTERN AREAS AS CLOUDS AND INCREASING WINDS CUT DOWN ON 
RADIATIONAL COOLING.  WOULD HAVE GONE EVEN WARMER IN THOSE 
AREAS...BUT THE COLD FRONT COULD ARRIVE BEFORE END OF THIS OVERNIGHT 
PERIOD AND START COOLING THE AREA.  INSTABILITY WILL BE VERY 
WEAK...SO KEEPING PRECIP AS JUST SHOWERS.

&&

277 
FXUS64 KMRX 040911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
411 AM EST MON NOV 4 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE TO OUR NE THIS 
MORNING WAS PROVIDING LIGHT NE TO CALM WINDS ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. TEMPS ALREADY IN THE LOW TO MID 30S ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN 
UNDER CLEAR SKIES. THE UPPER RIDGE TO OUR WEST WAS AMPLIFYING WITH 
THE BULK OF HIGH CLOUDS STAYING W AND N OF THE TN VALLEY AND SRN 
APPALACHIANS. SHOULD SEE PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AGAIN TODAY WHICH FAVORS 
THE SIMILAR MOS MAX TEMPS...SO MAX TEMPS WERE NUDGED UP A FEW 
DEGREES.  

FOR TONIGHT...HIGH CLOUDS MAY THICKEN OVER AT LEAST THE NRN 2/3RDS 
OF THE FORECAST AREA...PLUS INCREASING SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW. 
FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A DEEP LOW LEVEL TEMPERATURE INVERSION 
SETTING UP OVERNIGHT. SHELTERED CENTRAL AND NRN VALLEY SPOTS SHOULD 
DROP SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMO AGAIN...BUT PLATEAU AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
WILL BE MUCH MILDER THAN THIS MORNING. GFS MOS MINS QUITE REASONABLE 
WITH A LAPSE RATE ADJUSTMENT IN THE MTNS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE TUESDAY WILL
CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY BEFORE GIVING WAY TO SYSTEM APPROACHING
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. INSTABILITY IS LACKING WITH THIS
SYSTEM AND TIMING OF APPROACH OF FRONT EARLY THURSDAY SHOULD PREVENT
ANY THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. REMOVED THUNDERSTORMS FROM FORECAST
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES TUESDAY BUT
WARMER WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF FRONT. THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
TEMPERATURES DROP WITH CLOUDS AND RAIN ON THURSDAY AND THEN BEHIND
FRONT FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS BUILDS IN.

&&

CONVECTION. WEATHER WILL BE NICE THROUGH WEDNESDAY...AND THEN NICE 
AGAIN FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY ALTHOUGH COOLER DUE TO FROPA.

FXUS64 KMRX 031518
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EST SUN NOV 3 2013

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. MINOR UPDATE TO REMOVE MORNING 
WORDING. CHANCE FOR SHOWERS TOO LOW FOR MENTION. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NW FLOW ALOFT AND SOME LINGERING 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL KEEP SOME AMOUNT OF CLOUDINESS ACROSS SW VA 
AND NE TN THIS MORNING. THIS MOISTURE IS LIMITED TO AROUND 925 TO 
850 MBS...AND FORECAST INSTABILITY IS ONLY 30 J/KG OR LESS UP TO 18Z 
TODAY. THUS...NO MENTION OF PRECIPITATION...BUT I WOULD NOT BE 
SURPRISED IF A FEW SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES ACCOMPANIED THE CLOUDS 
AFTER SUNRISE TO MID MORNING. 

WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION TODAY PLUS SOME CLOUDS EARLY FAVORS THE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER GFS MOS MAX TEMPS. CLEARING AND CHILLY TONIGHT WITH 
A LIGHT NORTH WINDS POSSIBLY CONTINUING OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...A WEAK 
SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW COULD DEVELOP ACROSS THE PLATEAU AFTER 06Z 
TUESDAY. GFS MOS MINS REFLECTED THIS AND WERE FOLLOWED. 

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE NORTHEAST STATES WILL INFLUENCE THE FORECAST AREA 
CONDITIONS THROUGH MIDWEEK. TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY WARM THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. UPPER TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN STATES SLOWLY PROGRESSES 
WEST INTO THE CENTRAL STATES. A DEEPENING AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL 
MOVE NE FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY. THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE RAPIDLY THROUGH THE EASTERN TN 
VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. REMOVED POPS WEDNESDAY AS 
RIDGING AHEAD OF SYSTEM KEEPS AREA DRY UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT. BEST 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. INSTABILITY RIGHT 
NOW LOOKS TO BE LIMITED BUT DYNAMICS JUST AHEAD OF FRONT COULD STILL 
CAUSE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS EARLY THURSDAY. THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SATURDAY HIGH PRESSURE REBUILDS OVER THE REGION. TEMPERATURES ONLY 
SLIGHTLY COOL BEHIND THURSDAY SYSTEM.

TRI AND TYS...BUT ANY CEILING WILL BE VFR. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD 
INHIBIT FOG FROM DEVELOPING AT TRI...AND NOT EXPECTING ANY 
ADDITIONAL SPRINKLES THROUGH 12Z TODAY.

OTHERWISE...REMNANT CLOUDS SHOULD CLEAR OUT BY MID MORNING AND GIVE 
WAY TO VFR CONDITIONS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.AVIATION...

CALM. THE QUESTION IS WHETHER CLOUDS WILL DECREASE ENOUGH AT TRI
OVERNIGHT TO ALLOW FOR FOG DEVELOPMENT. IF THERE IS CLEARING...LIFR
CONDITIONS WILL PEOBABLY OCCUR. SINCE CONFIDENCE AT THIS POINT IS
LOW...WILL CONTINUE WITH A MENTION OF MVFR FOG AND ALLOW LATER TAFS
TO REVISE AS NEEDED. OTHERWISE...TAFS WILL BE VFR...AND WINDS
TOMORROW WILL BE LESS THAN 10 KTS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.THIS EVENING...SCATTERED INSTABILITY SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TIL 
SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET. ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WITH SMALL HAIL 
POSSIBLE. A COLD FUNNEL IS REMOTELY POSSIBLE.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST 
THROUGH THE AREA EARLY TONIGHT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN WITH 
COLD AIR ADVECTION CONTINUING. DRY CONDITIONS ON SUNDAY WITH LATE 
DAY WARM UP TO BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
NO CHANGE TO THE PREVIOUS THINKING. WARMING TREND THE FIRST HALF OF 
THE WEEK IN RESPONSE TO RIDGING BUILDING OVER THE AREA AHEAD OF A 
ROCKIES TROUGH. WHEN THE TROUGH LIFTS TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES 
THURSDAY...A TRAILING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH OUR AREA AND 
INTERACT WITH THE WARMING AND MOISTENING AIRMASS...RESULTING IN BANDS 
OF CONVECTION THURSDAY. WITH THE QUICK PASSING OF THE WEATHER 
SYSTEM...FAIR WEATHER RETURNS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH MORE 
SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES.

1050 AM EDT SAT NOV 2 2013

.FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATES PLANNED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CLOUDS SLOW TO INCREASE THIS 
MORNING EXCEPT FOR ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN. SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
APPROACHES BY 18Z WHICH SHOULD BRING SOME DEGREE OF CLOUDINESS TO 
ALL BUT EXTREME SRN COUNTIES. LIFT SEEMS TO BE LACKING AND MODELS 
SHOW JUST SOME VERY LIGHT QPF IN THE AFTERNOON. STAYED CLOSE TO 
PREVIOUS POP AND WX GRIDS...BUT DROPPED SPRINKLES OUT OF MOST OF SE 
TN AND SW NC AREAS. STEEP LAPSE RATES AND COOLING TEMPS ALOFT...SO 
KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SNOW SHOWER FOR THE HIGHEST TERRAIN OF THE 
NRN AND SMOKY MTNS OF E TN. FOR TEMPS...STAYED MOSTLY IN THE 50S 
WHERE CLOUDS INCREASE OVER SW VA AND NE TN...BUT NUDGED UP TO NEAR 
GFS MOS OVER CENTRAL AND SRN AREAS.

FOR TONIGHT...MODELS DIFFER ON THE AMOUNT OF CLEARING WITH A 
COMPROMISE FAVORED LEAVING PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES OVERALL. GFS MOS MINS 
WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS EAST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY WITH CLEARING SKIES AS SURFACE HIGH BUILDS 
OVER REGION. HIGHS SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN TODAY. SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY UPPER RIDGE MOVES THROUGH WITH WARMING TEMPERATURES. LARGE 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE THEN SHIFTS TO THE EAST COAST MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY AS NEXT MAJOR SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS. MONDAY NIGHT 
ANOTHER MOSTLY CLEAR NIGHT WITH LOWS IN THE 30S. TUESDAY SLIGHTLY 
WARMER HIGHS AND LITTLE CLOUD COVER. CLOUDS SLOWLY INCREASE TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES INTO LOWER TN AND OH 
VALLEYS. SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN WEDNESDAY BUT BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THIS SYSTEM 
SHOULD BE A QUICK MOVER WITH HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING BACK IN FRIDAY.
