FXUS64 KMRX 011850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT FRI NOV 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...AIR MASS HAS DRIED OUT THIS 
AFTERNOON. SECONDARY COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SE THROUGH THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT. UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE AREA ON 
SATURDAY. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE IN THE H85-H60 LAYER. VERY STRONG 
COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL OCCUR AT H70. H85-H70 LAPSE RATES BECOME 
STEEP FALLING TO NEAR 8C/KM BY THE AFTERNOON. DESPITE LIMITED 
MOISTURE...ESPECIALLY IN THE LOWEST LAYERS...INSTABILITY SHOWERS 
WILL LIKELY DEVELOP. MOST AREAS WILL SEE VERY LIGHT ACTIVITY AND 
VIRGA BUT A FEW SHOWERS COULD BECOME BRIEFLY SIGNIFICANT. FREEZING 
LEVEL DROPS TO NEAR 5000 FEET IN THE AFTERNOON. THERE IS SUFFICIENT 
MOISTURE IN THE SNOW GROWTH REGION SO THE VERY TOPS OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS MAY SEE SOME SNOW. ABOVE NORMAL MOS TEMPERATURE 
GUIDANCE APPEARS SUSPECT AND LEANED ON A COOLER BLEND CLOSER TO 
01/00Z ECMWF. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
FAIR WEATHER SUNDAY THROUGH MOST OF WEDNESDAY...WITH A WARMING TREND 
EACH AFTERNOON. DEEP UPPER TROUGHING OVER THE ROCKIES EARLY IN THE 
WEEK WILL PLACE US BENEATH A RIDGE ALOFT...AND GRADUALLY BRING US 
INTO A SOUTHERLY SURFACE FLOW REGIME. BESIDES AIDING THE WARM-UP... 
THIS WILL TAP THE GULF FOR THE NEXT RAIN MAKER...WHICH WILL OCCUR 
OVER OUR AREA MAINLY THURSDAY...AS THE ROCKIES TROUGH LIFTS TO THE 
GREAT LAKES BY THURSDAY MORNING AND ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT PUSHES 
THROUGH THE AREA DURING THE DAY. HAVE BUMPED POPS BACK UP TO 60 PCT 
FOR THE AREA THURSDAY IN KEEPING WITH THE WETTER SIDE OF THE ECMWF 
ENSEMBLE RUN. COOL AND DRY AIR COMES IN FOR THE END OF THE WEEK.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EDT FRI NOV 1 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN BAND OF CONVECTION (SHOWERS) 
MOVING EAST INTO VALLEY COUNTIES AND MOST OF SW VA AT THIS TIME. NO 
LIGHTNING STRIKES AT ALL OVERNIGHT...SO DROPPED ANY MENTION OF TSRA.

GUSTS IN THE SMOKIES AND FOOTHILLS...ALTHOUGH PEAK GUSTS PROBABLY HAVE 
ALREADY OCCURRED. WILL LET THE WIND ADVISORY AND HIGH WIND WARNING 
RUN ITS COURSE THROUGH 7AM EDT AS ISSUED EARLIER.

LOWERED AND DROPPED RAIN CHANCES A BIT FASTER THIS MORNING THAN IN 
PREVIOUS GRIDS...WITH CLOUDS ALSO GIVING WAY TO VARIABLE AMOUNTS OF 
SUNSHINE LATER TODAY. WESTERLY WINDS AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE PLUS 
SUNSHINE WOULD FAVOR BUMPING MAX TEMPS UP CLOSER TO SIMILAR MOS 
MAXES.  

CLOUDS INCREASE MAINLY AFTER 06Z SATURDAY...BUT MODELS HAVE TRENDED 
DRIER OVERNIGHT. THUS...DROPPED POPS AS ANY SHOWERS LOOK TO HOLD OFF 
UNTIL AFTER 12Z SATURDAY. MOS MINS VERY CLOSE AND REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DEEP SYSTEM MOVING OUT
OF THE NE STATES HAS TRAILING SECONDARY TROUGH/FRONT THAT
APPROACHES SATURDAY MORNING. THIS WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY
WITH CHANCE SHOWERS NE AND SLIGHT CHANCE SW PART OF FORECAST AREA
THROUGH THE DAY LINGERING INTO THE EVENING NE. TEMPERATURES MUCH
COOLER SATURDAY BEHIND FIRST FRONT TODAY AND MUCH COOLER SATURDAY
NIGHT BEHIND SECONDARY FRONT. THEN HIGHER PRESSURE SETTLES OVER
REGION SUNDAY AND MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WARM TUESDAY AS HIGH SHIFTS
EAST. NEW FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES OUT INTO PLAINS TUESDAY NIGHT CLOUDS
INCREASE AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM. WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT
INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY
NIGHT AND THURSDAY AHEAD OF NEXT FRONT. ECMWF AND CANADIAN NOW A
LITTLE SLOWER WITH MID WEEK SYSTEM HOLDING IT OFF UNTIL ABOUT
THURSDAY MORNING. FOR NOW WILL KEEP POPS WEDNESDAY ALTHOUGH LOWERED
TO SLIGHT CHANCE INCREASING WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY.

.AVIATION...MAIN CONCERN FOR TAF SITES OVER THE NEXT 3 TO 6 HOURS 
WILL BE THE STRONG AND GUSTY SW WINDS AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. 
SHOWERS WILL BE THE MAIN WEATHER TYPE WITH NOT HARDLY ANY LIGHTNING 
DETECTED AT THIS TIME. THESE SHOWERS SHOULD PRODUCE STRONGER GUSTS 
AT TAF SITES THAN CURRENTLY NOTED. A BRIEF MVFR TO IFR CEILING/VISBY 
MAY ALSO ACCOMPANY THE PASSING SHOWERS.

OTHERWISE...EXPECTING VFR CONDITIONS TO DOMINATE AFTER ABOUT 13Z TO 
15Z TODAY.

627 
FXUS64 KMRX 010111
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 PM EDT THU OCT 31 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE MID WEST AND MS 
RIVER VALLEY...GENERALLY STRETCHING FROM NEAR CHICAGO SOUTHWARD TO 
NEAR MEMPHIS AND SHREVEPORT. AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR MASS WAS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WITH AREA RADARS REVEALING SOME 
LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA OUT AHEAD OF SOME PRE- 
FRONTAL CONVECTIVE BANDS DEVELOPING OVER WEST TN. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT A STRONG 850 MB JET BETWEEN 55 AND 65 KT WILL SWING ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS TONIGHT...AND VAD WIND PROFILES FROM KMRX AND KHTX 
CONFIRM STRONG WINDS AROUND 50 KT AT 4000 FT ABOVE THE RADARS. IT 
APPEARS THE WIND DIRECTION WITH THIS 850 MB JET SHOULD HAVE ENOUGH 
OF A WESTERLY COMPONENT TO PREVENT ANY MOUNTAIN-WAVE-INDUCED 
ACCELERATION OF THE LOW-LEVEL WINDS. THUS...WILL CONTINUE WITH THE 
WIND ADVISORY WITH NO UPGRADE TO A WARNING FOR THE FOOTHILLS. MODELS 
INDICATE SOME WEAK INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
LATER THIS EVENING AS THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES. THUS...THINK THAT 
SOME STRONGER SHOWERS (OR TSTORMS) LATER THIS EVENING AND AFTER 
MIDNIGHT MAY BE ABLE TO PULL SOME OF THE STRONGER 850 MB WINDS DOWN 
INTO THE VALLEYS TO POSSIBLY PRODUCE WIND GUSTS UP TO 55 MPH.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS EVENING TO INCREASE WIND SPEEDS IN ALL ZONES AND MENTION THE 
STRONGER WIND GUSTS WITH THE STRONGER SHOWERS.
&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT THU OCT 31 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER SPEED MAX WILL MOVE FROM AR 
TO EASTERN GRTLKS TONIGHT. SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL DEEPEN AS IT 
MOVE THROUGH THE CENTRAL LAKES REGION. PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL 
CONTINUE TO TIGHTEN WITH WEAKENING LOW LEVEL JET MOVING THROUGH THE 
EAST TN VALLEY BETWEEN 01/00-06Z. WINDS WILL BECOME STRONG AND 
REMAIN GUSTY FOR MUCH OF TONIGHT. LIGHT PATCHES OF PCPN ARE POSSIBLE 
INTO THE EARLY EVENING HOURS WITH DEEPER CONVECTION POISED TO MOVE 
EAST OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AFT 01/00Z. STRONG SPEED SHEAR WITH 
LOW CAPE ENVIRONMENT WHILE STORMS MOVE THROUGH LATER THIS EVENING. 
THUNDERSTORM THREAT IS LOW WITH STRONG GUSTY WINDS POSSIBLE WITH ANY 
SHOWERS. PWAT VALUES REMAIN WELL ABOVE NORMAL...>200% ~ 1.60 AND 
WARM LAYER IS VERY THICK WITH SKINNY CAPE. THESE SIGNALS INDICATE 
POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAINFALL. COLD FRONT SHOULD BE SPEEDING UP ITS 
EASTWARD MOVEMENT TONIGHT SO HEAVY RAINFALL PERIODS SHOULD BE BRIEF. 
COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY WITH BULK OF PRECIPITATION 
MOVING EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS FRIDAY MORNING. LAYER DRIES OUT RAPIDLY 
FOR A MOSTLY SUNNY FRIDAY AFTN. WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS AGAIN 
TONIGHT WITH READINGS COOLING TO CLOSER TO NORMAL FRIDAY. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
THIS PERIOD WILL BE A FAIR STRETCH OF WEATHER EXCEPT FOR SOME 
RAINFALL BOOKENDS. LIGHT PRECIP POSSIBLE SATURDAY...WITH BEST 
CHANCES NE THIRD AND LEAST CHANCES SW THIRD...AS COOL TROUGH AXIS 
PASSES BY. ONCE THIS SYSTEM LIFTS AWAY...DRY WARMING TREND TAKES 
PLACE THROUGH WEDNESDAY UNDER DOMINANT RIDGING ALOFT EAST OF A 
DIGGING TROUGH OVER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THE TIMING OF THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE LATE IN THE PERIOD WILL PROBABLY WAFFLE A BIT...HAVE PLACED 
A 60 PCT POP IN FOR THURSDAY ATTM BUT LATEST 12Z GFS IS A LITTLE 
FAST WITH IT NOW. ECMWF HAS NOT UPDATED YET BUT 00Z RUN WAS 
SLOWER...FOCUSING ON THURS. WE/LL SEE. 17

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
146 PM EDT THU OCT 31 2013

.AVIATION...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE DEEPENING ACROSS THE WESTERN GREAT
LAKES THIS EVENING. PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL CONTINUE TO TIGHTEN
ACROSS THE REGION. SOUTH TO SOUTHWESTERLY LOW LEVEL JET REMAINS
STRONG THROUGH TONIGHT. THESE WINDS WILL MIX DOWN AND BE GUSTY AT
THE SURFACE ON OCCASION BUT WILL LIKELY CAUSE SOME LLWS FOR SPEED
SHEAR. LIGHT PRECIPITATION EARLY IN THE PERIOD. CIGS WILL LOWER AS
DEEPER CONVECTION MOVES INTO THE AREA TONIGHT IN ADVANCE OF AN
APPROACHING COLD FRONT. PREVAILING CONDITIONS SHOUILD BE MVFR IN
SHOWERS WITH GUSTY WINDS THROUGH MUCH OF TONIGHT. COLD FRONTAL
PASSAGE AND WIND SHIFT CAN BE EXPECTED PRIOR TO 01/12Z.
PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE OFF TO THE EAST FOR END OF PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 311148 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
745 AM EDT THU OCT 31 2013

.AVIATION...A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION THIS TAF 
PERIOD.  A STRONG 850MB JET ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT CONTAINS WINDS 
OF 50 AND 70 KTS.  THESE STRONG WINDS ALOFT WILL BEGIN TO EFFECT TAF 
SITES BY THIS AFTERNOON.  THE STRONGEST OF THE WINDS ARE NOT 
EXPECTED TO REACH THE GROUND BUT SHOULD CREATE LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE TAF PERIOD.  THE MAIN BAND OF CONVECTION 
ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT THAT SHOULD PUSH IN AFTER 00Z...AND WILL 
USHER IN LOWER CIGS AND POSSIBLY SOME REDUCED VIS FOR OCCASIONAL 
MVFR CONDITIONS.  ALSO OF CONCERN IS THE POTENTIAL OF SOME 
SHOWERS/STORMS BRINGING DOWN SOME OF THE STRONGER WINDS ALOFT LATE 
IN THE PERIOD CREATING VERY STRONG TO SEVERE WIND GUSTS.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

023 
FXUS64 KMRX 310653
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 AM EDT THU OCT 31 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WILL BE MOVING INTO AN ACTIVE 
WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE SHORT TERM AS A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVES INTO 
THE REGION.  A STRONG 850MB JET WITH WINDS REACHING BETWEEN 50 AND 
70 KTS ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT WILL BEGIN TO EFFECT THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION THIS AFTERNOON INCREASING GUSTY WINDS AND SHOULD 
BRING ADVISORY CRITERIA WINDS TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  THE 
SOUTHERN FLOW WILL ALSO CARRY IN WARM TEMPERATURES FOR AN 
UNSEASONABLY WARM DAY WITH HIGHS ACROSS THE VALLEY REACHING INTO THE 
70S.  LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING...CONVECTION ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA.  A WIDE BAND OF SHOWERS 
ALONG WITH A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL MOVE IN FOR CATEGORICAL POPS BY 
00Z.  THESE STORMS COULD POTENTIALLY REACH INTO THE STRONG 850MB 
WINDS AND GENERATE STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WIND GUSTS.  WINDS 
WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE OVERNIGHT AS THE STRONGEST PART OF THE JET 
MOVES IN.  CURRENT NAM MODEL TRENDING TOWARD A MORE SOUTHERLY WIND 
FIELD.  IF THIS IS THE CASE...THIS MAY SET THE STAGE FOR A 
SIGNIFICANT WIND EVENT ACROSS THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS.  
HOWEVER...THE GFS CONTINUES TO HAVE A WESTERLY COMPONENT WHICH WOULD 
LIMIT MOUNTAIN WAVE CONDITIONS.  FOR NOW...WILL ONLY ISSUE A WIND 
ADVISORY BUT THIS MAY NEED TO BE UPGRADED TO A HIGH WIND WARNING IF 
CONDITIONS WARRANT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
OVERALL AND RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY HAS BEEN FAIRLY GOOD AT LEAST 
UNTIL LATE IN THE PERIOD. FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD IS ABOVE AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. MAY BE SOME LINGERING 
SHOWERS BEHIND THE INITIAL FRONT FRIDAY...MAINLY EAST.  SHOULD BE 
DRY FRIDAY NIGHT...THEN UPPER TROUGH WILL DIG IN SATURDAY...AS 
COLDER AIR SURGES IN. WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS NORTH AND SLIGHT CHANCE 
CENTRAL ZONES SAT.  A FEW SHOWERS OR SNOW SHOWERS MAY LINGER FAR 
NORTHEAST ZONES INTO SATURDAY NIGHT...SO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
THERE...THEN DRY FOR SUNDAY AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN.  DRY WEATHER 
WITH A WARMING TREND EXPECTED INTO TUESDAY. MODELS HAVE SLOWED THE 
NEXT SYSTEM...BUT IT SHOULD BE APPROACHING BY WEDNESDAY...SO WILL 
CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS. GENERALLY JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS 
TO GFS MOS TEMPS.    


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             75  61  72  45  65 /  50 100  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  74  59  73  45  61 /  50 100  20  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       74  59  73  44  61 /  50 100  20  10  20

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED WARM FRONT 
OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...ASSOCIATED WITH A STRENGTHENING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR 
MASS WAS IN PLACE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WITH 
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALING AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY AND LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD PREVENT 
ANY FOG FORMATION OVERNIGHT...AND SHOULD KEEP TEMPS FROM FALLING TOO 
MUCH.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS EVENING TO MENTION MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES EVERYWHERE...AND TO 
TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 301900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT WED OCT 30 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA 
TONIGHT SLIDES EAST EARLY THURSDAY. STRENGTHENING UPPER JET MOVES 
FROM N TX TO UPPER MS VALLEY ON THURSDAY. PRESSURE FALLS OVER THE 
CENTRAL U.S. RESULT IN A TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENT ACROSS THE TN 
VALLEY AND THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WINDS WILL INCREASE THROUGH 
THURSDAY BECOMING BREEZY BY THE AFTERNOON. WINDS MAY MEET WIND 
ADVISORY CRITERIA ACROSS SOME AREAS. DOWNSLOPING WINDS POSSIBLE BUT 
CURRENT PROGS SHOW WIND DIRECTION EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS BECOMING 
SOUTHWESTERLY BEFORE WEAKENING CORE OF LOW LEVEL JET REACHES THE 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. LEANED ON THE HIGH SIDE OF GUIDANCE 
WITH STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION CONTINUING THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. DEEP 
CONVECTION WILL MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY THURSDAY AND APPROACH MRX 
CWA LATE IN THE PERIOD. BULK SHEAR REMAINS STRONG IN LOW CAPE 
ENVIRONMENT. STRONG STORMS WITH WIND DAMAGE POSSIBLE WITH WEAKENING 
CONVECTION THAT MOVES INTO THE AREA THURSDAY EVENING. UPPER SPEED 
MAX MOVES NE INTO THE OH VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT. WARM LAYER IS VERY 
DEEP AND PWAT NEAR 1.60 ARE WELL ABOVE NORMAL FOR LATE OCTOBER/EARLY 
NOVEMBER. PERIODS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINFALL CAN BE EXPECTED 
THURSDAY NIGHT WITH A LESSENING THREAT OF WIND DAMAGE OVERNIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN WARM WITH COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE 
AREA IN THE MID MORNING HOURS ON FRIDAY. UPPER TROUGH AXIS REMAINS 
OVER OR WEST OF AREA SO PRECIPITATION CHANCES CONTINUE EARLY FRIDAY 
ACROSS EASTERN AREAS. COLD AIR ADVECTION NOT VERY STRONG BEHIND COLD 
FRONT AND SKIES SHOULD CLEAR NICELY BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON.  

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
IN WAKE OF THE FRONT THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION ON HALLOWEEN 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...A SECONDARY LONGWAVE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE OHIO 
VALLEY...BRINGING ANOTHER BOUT OF CLOUD COVER AND PERHAPS SOME LIGHT 
SHOWERS TO FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA ON 
SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT. AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...SOME 
SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE IN 
THE NIGHT. SUNDAY WILL BE A MUCH COOLER DAY AS A COOL/DRY AIR MASS 
FILTERS IN. HIGHS WILL REMAIN IN THE MID 50S TO AROUND 60 DEGREES. 
HOWEVER...A GRADUAL WARM UP THROUGH MIDWEEK IS EXPECTED AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN PROMOTING MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS. ANOTHER STORM 
SYSTEM WILL THEN APPROACH THE REGION LATE TUESDAY...BRINGING A 
DECENT SHOT FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS HEADING INTO WEDNESDAY.

436 
FXUS64 KMRX 300639
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 AM EDT WED OCT 30 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WARM FRONT CONTINUES TO LIFT 
NORTH ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA THIS MORNING.  THIS WILL 
GENERATE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ALONG THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY DURING THE MORNING.  THE PRECIP WILL SLOWLY MOVE OUT OF THE 
AREA IN THIS AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...WIDESPREAD MID TO HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE OUT DURING THE DAY BUT SHOULD SEE A FEW 
BREAKS OF SUN BY LATE IN THE AFTERNOON...AT LEAST OVER SOUTHERN 
LOCATIONS.  THE FRONT WILL HAVE LIFTED NORTH OF THE AREA BY THIS 
EVENING FOR DRY AND SEASONALLY WARM CONDITIONS.  HOWEVER...CLOUDS 
WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AND THICKEN BY MORNING IN ADVANCE OF AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT OVERALL FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE 
IS HIGHER THAN AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR AT LEAST THROUGH MONDAY.  
MAIN FEATURE WILL BE THE COLD FRONT THAT SWINGS ACROSS THE AREA 
THURSDAY NIGHT.  A STRONG WIND FIELD WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS 
FRONT...WITH AN 850 JET OF 60+ KTS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP. AT THIS TIME 
DIRECTION FORECAST TO BE MORE SOUTHWEST...BUT IF THE JET ENDS UP 
BEING MORE SOUTHERLY COULD SEE A MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT SET UP...SO 
THIS WILL BEAR WATCHING.  INSTABILITY LOOKS QUITE WEAK...BUT WITH 
THE STRONG WIND FIELD IT WILL NOT TAKE MUCH FOR ANY STORMS TO BECOME 
SEVERE.  WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION THREAT IN HWO.  WILL CARRY LIKELY 
POPS WEST LATE THU WITH LOWER POPS FURTHER EAST...THEN CAT POPS ALL 
ZONES THURSDAY NIGHT.  ANY LINGERING SHOWERS WILL END FRIDAY BEHIND 
THE FRONT...BUT THE MAIN SURGE OF COLDER AIR WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL 
SATURDAY AS THE UPPER TROUGH DIGS IN.  MAY BE A FEW SHOWERS NORTH 
SATURDAY AND SHOWERS OR SNOW SHOWERS FAR NORTHEAST SAT NIGHT IN THE 
COLD ADVECTION...BUT FOR NOW JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THESE 
AREAS.  RIDGING TO BUILD IN SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WITH DRY WEATHER AND 
A WARMING TREND.  MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE A BIT BY TUESDAY...WITH 
THE GFS FASTER WITH THE MOISTURE RETURN.  FOR NOW WILL LEAN TOWARD 
ECMWF SOLUTION AND KEEP TUESDAY DRY AS IN CURRENT FORECAST.

451 
FXUS64 KMRX 291836
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT TUE OCT 29 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS KY AND WV TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. VORTICITY ADVECTION AHEAD OF THIS DISTURBANCE WILL INCREASE 
HIGH CLOUDS THROUGH THE EVENING...WITH POSITIVE TEMPERATURE AND 
MOISTURE ADVECTION BETWEEN 925-700 MB BUILDING OVERNIGHT. WHILE LIFT 
REMAINS FAIRLY WEAK IN OUR AREA...SATURATION TO NEAR 500 MB SHOULD 
PRODUCE SOME LIGHT QPF BETWEEN 06Z AND 15Z IN NORTHERN AREAS. MODELS 
ARE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT...AND SO POPS WILL BE RAISED TO LIKELY 
IN SW VA TONIGHT. WITH THE SYSTEM TO THE EAST AND A BUILDING 
RIDGE...POPS WILL END IN THE AFTERNOON WITH DECREASING CLOUDS. TEMPS 
WILL BE QUITE MILD IN THE WARM SECTOR WITH A SW FLOW...WITH HIGHS IN 
THE 70S IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH THE MAIN FEATURE AFFECTING THE FORECAST 
AREA BEING A COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY NIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT A VERY STRONG WIND FIELD (850 MB WINDS OF 65 TO 75 
KT) WILL DEVELOP OVER THE TN AND OHIO RIVER VALLEYS AHEAD OF THIS 
COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. IN FACT...WITH A 
STABLE AIR MASS LOCATED OVER THE MOUNTAINS...IT APPEARS THAT A 
MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT MIGHT DEVELOP IN THE WESTERN FOOTHILLS...BUT 
RIGHT NOW THE MODELS ARE INDICATING MORE OF A SOUTHWESTERLY WIND 
AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT INSTEAD OF WINDS FROM THE MORE 
MOUNTAIN-WAVE-CONDUCIVE SOUTHEASTERLY DIRECTION. GFS MODEL CONTINUES 
TO REVEAL VERY HIGH HELICITY VALUES (AROUND 1000 M2/S2) OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT THE AMOUNT OF 
FORECASTED INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA REMAINS WEAK. LATEST 
GFS AND CMC MODEL RUNS ARE FASTER THAN THE NAM AND ECMWF MODELS WITH 
THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE PRE- FRONTAL CONVECTION ON 
THURSDAY...BUT WOULD THINK THAT THE AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
WOULD SUPPORT A LATER ARRIVAL FOR THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...DO NOT 
EXPECT ANY PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION TO ARRIVE IN EAST TN UNTIL AFTER 
SUNSET ON THURSDAY NIGHT. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS THAT THE LOCAL AIR 
MASS WILL ONLY BE WEAKLY UNSTABLE (AT BEST) ALONG THE COLD FRONT AS 
IT ARRIVES THURSDAY NIGHT...SO WILL EMPHASIZE SHOWERS MORE THAN 
TSTORMS IN THE FORECAST. HOWEVER...WITH THE STRONG WIND SHEAR 
EXPECTED AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT...IT WOULD NOT TAKE MUCH 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT TO CREATE DAMAGING WINDS AND A FEW ISOLATED 
TORNADOES OVER THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN 
PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY...WITH A FEW UPSLOPE RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   54  78  58  73  59 /  10  10   0  40  90 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     55  76  56  71  57 /  20  10   0  30  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN             55  76  56  71  58 /  30  10   0  40  90

MRX CWA BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  MAIN CONCERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED WILL 
BE A STRONG COLD FRONT PUSHING THROUGH THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT.  A 
STRONG 850MB JET WITH WINDS OF 60 TO 70 KTS IS ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
FRONT.  AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON THURSDAY...WINDS WILL BEGIN TO 
INCREASE AND SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL MOVE IN.  WITH THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE THURSDAY NIGHT...WIND WILL SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE... 
ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  A WIND ADVISORY OR WARNING MAY BE 
NEED.  INSTABILITY WILL BE MINIMAL WITH THE MAIN LINE OF CONVECTION 
JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT...HOWEVER...WITH THE STRONG WIND FIELD... 
VERY HIGH HELICITY WILL DEVELOP OVER THE AREA.  THIS MAY ALLOW FOR 
THE POTENTIAL OF ISOLATED SUPERCELLS.  THE SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH 
RATHER QUICKLY.  SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL LINGER INTO FRIDAY WITH AN 
UPPER TROUGH MOVING IN LATE FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND.  FLOW ALOFT 
WILL EVENTUALLY TURN NORTHWESTERLY...HOWEVER...MOISTURE BECOMES 
QUITE LIMITED BY THIS POINT AND DO NO EXPECT UPSLOPE PRECIP AT THIS 
TIME.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN ON SUNDAY AND WILL BE THE MAIN 
INFLUENCE OF AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE REST OF THE PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   72  53  77  56  73 /   0  10  10  10  60 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     69  52  75  54  70 /   0  20  10  10  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN             69  52  75  55  70 /  10  20  10  10  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    66  47  72  51  68 /  10  30  20  10  50

233 
FXUS64 KMRX 281912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON OCT 28 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE OFF 
TO OUR EAST THIS EVENING. WILL DROP ALL POPS BY 00Z EXPECT FOR A 
PORTION OF SW VA WHICH WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE UP UNTIL 04Z. CLOUDS 
SHOULD SLOWLY BEGIN TO DISSIPATE OVERNIGHT FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST AS THE SHORT WAVE MOVES FURTHER EAST...BUT MOST AREAS 
SHOULD STILL STAY PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY. NORTHEAST TN AND SW VA 
WILL HANG ON TO CLOUD COVER THE LONGEST WITH ONLY PARTIAL CLEARING 
COMING BY 09-12Z TOMORROW MORNING. PATCHY FOG IS POSSIBLE 
OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS ANY AREAS THAT SAW RAIN TODAY. OVER 
NIGHT LOWS SHOULD BE ROUGHLY 5 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL DUE TO CLOUD 
COVER. TOMORROW SHOULD BE A BETTER DAY WEATHER WISE WITH A DRY 
FORECAST IN PLACE...THOUGH SOME CLOUDS WILL STILL BE IN PLACE DUE TO 
A WEAK WAVE OF ENERGY MOVING THROUGH THE FLOW TO THE NORTH OF OUR 
AREA. HIGHS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL TOMORROW DUE TO A 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AT 850MB DEVELOPING BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WITH THE MAIN FEATURE BEING A COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY NIGHT. 
BEFOREHAND...A WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO BE LOCATED AROUND SOUTHWEST 
VA AND NORTHEAST TN ON WEDNESDAY...WITH SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT 
EXPECTED TO CREATE A FEW SHOWERS ALONG IT. THE GFS AND NAM MODELS 
HAVE SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE EXACT LOCATION OF THIS WARM 
FRONT...AND THUS...HOW MUCH RAINFALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN. FOR NOW...WILL MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THESE 
AREAS ON WEDNESDAY...WITH THIS WARM FRONT EXPECTED TO MOVE NORTH OF 
THE FORECAST AREA BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...ENDING THE CHANCES FOR RAIN 
TEMPORARILY. MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT THAT A COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH A 
VERY STRONG WIND FIELD DEVELOPING ALONG IT. IN FACT...THE GFS MODEL 
REVEALS VERY HIGH HELICITY VALUES OVER THE FORECAST AREA (IN EXCESS 
OF 1000 M2/S2) ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT THE AMOUNT OF 
INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA REMAINS IN QUESTION SINCE THE 
BULK OF THE PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION APPEARS TO NOT ARRIVE IN EAST TN 
UNTIL AFTER SUNSET. RIGHT NOW...THE LOCAL AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO BE 
FAIRLY STABLE AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...WITH ONLY A WEAKLY UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS EXPECTED OVER THE FORECAST AREA ALONG THE COLD FRONT. 
HOWEVER...WITH THE STRONG WIND SHEAR EXPECTED AHEAD OF THIS COLD 
FRONT...IT WOULD NOT TAKE MUCH INSTABILITY TO CREATE A FEW 
SUPERCELLS AND THE POSSIBILITY OF AN ISOLATED TORNADO. AN AMPLIFIED 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH THEN SWINGS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY...BUT THE GFS MODEL INDICATES ONLY A SLIGHT 
INCREASE IN CLOUDS WITH IT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE 
THEN BUILDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...BRINGING 
DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE 
GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

131 
FXUS64 KMRX 280820
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EDT MON OCT 28 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE REGION TODAY. LOOKS LIKE BEST COVERAGE OF PRECIP WILL BE 
NORTH...SO WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS NORTH AND CHANCE ELSEWHERE.  
FORCING NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE SO PRECIP AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO BE ON THE 
LIGHT SIDE.  WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH EARLY TONIGHT FOR 
ANY LINGERING SHOWERS...OTHERWISE EXPECT GRADUAL DRYING.  SOME FOG 
WILL LIKELY DEVELOP OVERNIGHT SO WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FOG FOR AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE FOR TODAY...BUT WILL GENERALLY 
BUMP UP A BIT FOR LOWS TONIGHT.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE MODELS CONTINUE TO COME 
INTO BETTER AGREEMENT ON THURSDAY'S STORM SYSTEM. HEIGHTS WILL BE ON 
THE RISE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF THE WESTERN STATES UPPER 
TROUGH LEADING TO INCREASING AMOUNTS OF SUNSHINE AND A MOST PLEASANT 
WARMING TREND. AS THE WARM AIR ADVANCES ON GRADUALLY STRENGTHENING 
LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW...THERE WILL BE A SMALL CHANCE FOR A SHOWER 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA CLOSE TO A WARM 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE WARM FRONT SHOULD MOVE NORTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY ENDING THE CHANCE FOR SHOWERS. POPS 
WILL INCREASE DURING THE DAY THURSDAY AS THE UPPER TROUGH BUILDS 
INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. HOWEVER...THE BEST CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL 
BE THURSDAY NIGHT WHEN THE STORM SYSTEM COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS THE 
MID SOUTH. THE MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW A STRONG UPPER LEVEL JET 
BUILDING IN WITH THE TROUGH BUT SIGNIFICANT INSTABILITY APPEARS TO 
BE LIMITED TO THE DEEP SOUTH. THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE IN THE RRQ 
OF THE UPPER JET WITH DECENT CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
SO CONVECTION LOOKS LIKE A GOOD BET BUT THE STRENGTH OF THE 
CONVECTION IS STILL IN QUESTION. WE WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THIS 
DEVELOPING SYSTEM FOR THE POTENTIAL OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS. POPS 
DROPS OFF QUICKLY BEHIND THE FRONT ON FRIDAY AND COOLER AIR BUILDS 
INTO THE REGION HOWEVER...THE STRONGEST COLD AIR ADVECTION MAY NOT 
DEVELOP UNTIL SATURDAY AS TRAILING ENERGY DROPS INTO THE BACK SIDE 
OF THE MEAN EASTERN U.S. TROUGH. ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR A 
SHOWER OR TWO ACROSS MAINLY THE HIGHER TERRAIN IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE ON SATURDAY. THE TROUGH FINALLY LIFTS OUT BY 
SUNDAY WITH DRY ADVECTION IN STORE.

986 
FXUS64 KMRX 271849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT SUN OCT 27 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...
A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH EVIDENT IN SATELLITE IMAGERY OVER 
AR WILL BE MOVING TOWARD OUR AREA TONIGHT. MOISTURE DEPTH WILL BE 
INCREASING THROUGH THE EVENING...WITH QG FORCING PROVIDING LIFT 
AFTER MIDNIGHT. WE SHOULD BEGIN TO SEE SOME SHOWERS ENTERING 
SOUTHERN AREAS AROUND 06Z-09Z...SPREADING NORTHWARD OVERNIGHT. QPF 
LOOKS LIGHT AS LIFT IS NOT VERY STRONG. POPS BEGIN TO TAPER OFF 
TOMORROW AFTERNOON AS THE SYSTEM MOVES EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. 
WILL END ALL POPS BY 00Z TUESDAY AS MIDLEVELS DRY OUT. MODELS KEEP 
PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN PLACE MONDAY NIGHT BEHIND THE
SYSTEM.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH MONDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
OVERALL...NO BIG CHANGES TO THE LONG TERM FORECAST. MODELS IN A
LITTLE BETTER AGREEMENT ON TIMING OF LARGE PLAINS SYSTEM AT THE END
OF WEEK WITH A WARMING TREND CONTINUING UNTIL FRONT PUSHES THROUGH.

A WARM FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THE LARGE PLAINS SYSTEM WILL LIFT NORTH 
THROUGH OUR AREA SOMETIME ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON/WEDNESDAY MORNING.  
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN PLACE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. AN INCREASE 
IN CLOUD COVER WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT ALONG WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR SOME LIGHT SHOWERS MAINLY FOR OUR NORTHERN AREAS. NO POPS IN 
PLACE FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE WARM FRONT WILL BE WELL NORTH OF 
OUR AREA. BY THURSDAY THE FLOW HAS BECOME LARGELY AMPLIFIED AS THE 
SYSTEM TO OUR WEST IS APPROACHING. 

MODELS STILL HAVE TIMING ISSUES BUT ARE CLOSER TOGETHER THAN THEY 
WERE YESTERDAY. LATEST GFS BRINGS IN PRECIP TO THE PLATEAU AROUND 18Z 
ON THURSDAY WHILE THE ECMWF WAITS UNTIL AROUND 00Z ON FRIDAY. WILL 
CONTINUE TO GO WITH A BLEND OF BOTH MODELS FOR TIMING BUT WILL PUT 
MORE WEIGHT INTO THE ECMWF. THE FRONT SHOULD PUSH THROUGH THE AREA 
SOMETIME BETWEEN THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY AFTERNOON. THE POSSIBILITY 
OF THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE FRONT STILL EXISTS. IT STILL REMAINS TO 
BE SEEN HOW MUCH IF ANY CAPE WE WILL HAVE TO WORK WITH...SHEAR 
HOWEVER WILL BE PLENTIFUL DUE TO A STRONG 300MB AND 850MB JET IN PLACE. 
MADE SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO POPS WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE BUT 
NOTHING MAJOR. HAVE LIKELY POPS IN PLACE FOR EVERYONE BY 03Z ON 
FRIDAY AND KEEP THEM UP UNTIL 12Z FRIDAY. AFTER 12Z FRIDAY LIKELY 
POPS REMAIN IN PLACE FOR THE FAR EASTERN AREAS WITH CHANCE 
EVERYWHERE ELSE. MOST PLACES WILL BE DRY BY 00Z SATURDAY BUT LEFT 
SLIGHT CHANCE IN FOR FAR EASTERN AREAS UNTIL 12Z SATURDAY MORNING. 

ANOTHER WAVE OF ENERGY SWINGS THROUGH ON SATURDAY BEHIND THE 
DEPARTED COLD FRONT RE-DEEPENING THE TROUGH BASE OVER OUR AREA. DUE 
TO DRIER AIR IN PLACE BEHIND THE FRONT...KEPT THE FORECAST DRY FOR 
SATURDAY AT THIS TIME. A BRIEF NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN SETS UP 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING DUE TO THE RE-DEEPENING OF 
THE TROUGH BASE AND WILL ALLOW FOR GUSTY WINDS ACROSS THE AREA. A 
MORE ZONAL FLOW RETURNS BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON AS THE TROUGH PUSHES OFF 
TO OUR EAST.


&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 AM EDT SUN OCT 27 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE WEAKENING COLD FRONT THAT IS 
PUSHING INTO THE AREA WILL DISSIPATE.  SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
WILL MOVE OVER THE REGION TONIGHT.  SOME PARTIAL CLEARING EXPECTED 
TO WORK INTO AT LEAST NORTHERN AND PERHAPS CENTRAL AREAS 
TODAY...THEN CLOUDS WILL INCREASE AGAIN TONIGHT. WHILE FORCING LOOKS 
WEAK AND MOISTURE ON THE SHALLOW SIDE...MAY BE A FEW SHOWERS OR 
SPRINKLES TONIGHT.  WILL INCLUDE A  SLIGHT CHANCE POP ALL ZONES.  
MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL SO WILL STAY CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS IN A LITTLE BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH A WEAK SHORT WAVE TROUGH PROGGED TO MOVE EAST ACROSS 
THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. ON MONDAY. THERE COULD BE ENOUGH MOISTURE AND 
JUST ENOUGH ISENTROPIC LIFT FOR A SMALL CHANCE OF A LIGHT SHOWER ON 
MONDAY WITH THIS WEAK SYSTEM SO ADDED POPS HERE. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL 
BE IN TRANSITION TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AS THE PATTERN BECOMES 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED WITH A DEEPENING WESTERN STATES TROUGH AND BUILDING 
HEIGHTS OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. IN THE WARM AIR ADVECTION 
PATTERN STRENGTHENING AHEAD OF THE WESTERN TROUGH MODELS ARE 
INDICATING THE POSSIBILITY OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN PART OF 
THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. KEPT POPS IN THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY AT THIS TIME WITH BEST WARM FRONTAL LIFT WEST 
OF THE APPALACHIAN REGION. FOR THE BIG LATE WORK WEEK STORM SYSTEM 
THE MODELS STILL HAVE TIMING ISSUES WITH THE GFS ABOUT SIX HOURS 
FASTER THAN THE ECMWF/CMC. ONCE AGAIN STAYED WITH THE PREVIOUS 
FORECAST IDEOLOGY WHICH IS MORE IN LINE WITH THE SLOWER MODELS. THIS 
MEANS ONLY A SMALL CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ON THURSDAY WITH THE MAIN 
FRONTAL PUSH AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA LATER THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY MORNING. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW THE POSSIBILITY OF 
CONVECTION AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM COLD FRONT WITH RELATIVELY STRONG 
SHEAR BUT LIMITED BUOYANCY FOR THE EVENT. WENT AHEAD AND TWEAKED 
POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS UP TO THE LIKELY CATEGORY FROM 
06Z THROUGH 15Z FRIDAY. GRADUALLY TAPERED POPS BACK ON FRIDAY WITH 
DRIER AIR BUILDING IN BEHIND THE DEPARTING COLD FRONT. MAINTAINED A 
DRY FORECAST FOR SATURDAY AT THIS TIME...ALTHOUGH IT APPEARS THERE 
MAY BE SOME TRAILING ENERGY AND MOISTURE AVAILABLE IN THE NORTHWEST 
FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE LONG WAVE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. 
ON SATURDAY.

&&

780 
FXUS64 KMRX 261919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT SAT OCT 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
AN AREA OF ISENTROPIC LIFT AT THE 295K LEVEL IS PRODUCING SOME 
CLOUDS ACROSS KY INTO MIDDLE TN. THESE CLOUDS WILL MOVE INTO OUR 
AREA TOWARD EVENING...AND CONTINUE THROUGH THE NIGHT. THIS SHOULD 
HOLD LOW TEMPS UP BY QUITE A BIT OVER LAST NIGHT...MAINLY IN THE 
UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. THE LAYER OF MOISTURE IS ONLY ABOUT 100 MB 
DEEP AT BEST...AND LIFT WILL NOT BE STRONG ENOUGH TO PRODUCE 
MEASURABLE PRECIP...ALTHOUGH A FEW SPRINKLES CANNOT BE RULED OUT 
ENTIRELY. THE AREA OF ISENTROPIC LIFT AND MOISTURE GETS PUSHED 
SOUTHWARD TOMORROW...AND WE SHOULD SEE CLOUDS DECREASING FROM NORTH 
TO SOUTH THROUGH THE DAY. THUS...THE TEMPS FOR TOMORROW WILL BE 
TRICKY. WENT ON THE WARM SIDE OF MOS NORTH WHERE MORE SUNSHINE IS 
EXPECTED...AND ON THE COOL SIDE SOUTH WHERE CLOUDS WILL LAST LATER 
IN THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON THE RISE THROUGH THE EXTENDED BEFORE A
STRONG SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS OUR AREA NEAR THE END OF THE WORK WEEK.

A MOSTLY ZONAL FLOW WILL BE IN PLACE SUNDAY NIGHT WITH A WEAK WAVE 
JUST TO OUR SOUTH...CENTERED OVER MISSISSIPPI AND ALABAMA. THIS 
PASSING FEATURE SHOULDN'T BRING MORE THAN PERHAPS SOME ADDED CLOUDS 
ACROSS OUR SOUTHERN AREAS AS MOISTURE AND LIFT ARE LACKING. MONDAY 
LOOKS PLEASANT WITH NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES 
AS ZONAL FLOW CONTINUES. CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE THROUGHOUT 
THE DAY ON TUESDAY AS A WARM FRONT TO OUR SOUTH BEGINS TO APPROACH 
THE AREA. THE WARM FRONT IS ASSOCIATED WITH THE LARGE PLAINS SYSTEM 
TO OUR WEST. MODELS GENERALLY AGREE THAT THE WARM FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH DURING THE TUESDAY EVENING/WEDNESDAY MORNING TIME-FRAME. THE 
WARMING TREND PEAKS ON WEDNESDAY WITH TEMPS A FEW DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN PLACE FOR WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH BUT NOT EXPECTING MUCH AS THE 
LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE WARM FRONT ISN'T ALL THAT STRONG. 

ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY THE FLOW BECOMES LARGELY AMPLIFIED IN 
RESPONSE TO THE APPROACHING PLAINS SYSTEM. STRONG RIDING RESIDES 
OVER THE ENTIRE EASTERN U.S. WITH A DEEP TROUGH ACROSS THE PLAINS. 
AS WITH THE PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...ALL OF THE MODELS AGREE THAT A 
STRONG SYSTEM WILL MOVE ACROSS OUR AREA BUT THE TIMING ISN'T AGREED 
UPON. THE 12Z GFS IS A LITTLE SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS BUT IT IS 
STILL THE QUICKEST SOLUTION. THE GFS WANTS TO BRING THE SYSTEM IN ON 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING AND HAVE IT OUT OF OUR AREA BY 12Z 
FRIDAY. THE CANADIAN AND ECMWF AGREE ON A SLOWER SOLUTION AND DON'T 
BRING IT IN UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT/MORNING. THE ECMWF DOESN'T GET THE 
SYSTEM OUT OF OUR AREA UNTIL 12Z SATURDAY. DUE TO THE LARGE AMOUNT 
OF UNCERTAINTY WITH THE TIMING...I CHOSE TO GO WITH A COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF. WILL BRING IN CHANCE POPS TO ALL AREAS BY 
00Z FRIDAY AND KEEP THEM THROUGH 00Z SATURDAY. FROM 00Z SATURDAY UP 
UNTIL 12Z SATURDAY WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS ONLY FOR FAR EASTERN AREAS 
WITH A DROP OF POPS FOR ALL AREAS AT 12Z ON SATURDAY. TIMING OF 
PRECIP WILL HAVE TO BE ADJUSTED AS MODELS CONTINUE TO RESOLVE THIS 
SYSTEM. 

THUNDERSTORMS ARE ALSO POSSIBLE WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE AS DEEP 
MOISTURE/STRONG LIFT/AND SHEAR WILL ALL BE IN PLACE. AS OF NOW...IT 
LOOKS LIKE THIS COULD BE A HIGH SHEAR/LOW CAPE SETUP. SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW INCREASES ON THURSDAY ALLOWING FOR GULF MOISTURE TO BE PULLED 
INTO THE AREA. THERE WILL LIKELY BE STRONG CONVERGENCE ALONG THE COLD 
FRONT ALLOWING FOR FRONTOGENETIC FORCING. THE AMOUNT OF 
INSTABILITY...IF ANY...IS STILL UNCERTAIN DUE TO THE UNCERTAIN 
TIMING OF THE SYSTEM. A 120KT 300MB JET AND 60KT 850MB JET WILL 
ACCOMPANY THE FRONT AND ALLOW FOR ROBUST SHEAR.

THINGS COOL BACK DOWN A BIT AFTER THE FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH HIGHS IN 
THE UPPER 50S NORTH AND LOW TO MID 60S SOUTH. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             42  66  49  69  51 /   0  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  42  64  42  67  46 /  10  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       42  64  40  67  47 /  10  10   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              39  61  35  61  39 /  10   0   0   0   0

HAS OCCURRED IN THAT AREA.

AFTERNOON...AND AREA ASSOCIATED WTIH AN AREA OF WARM ADVECTION AT
850 MB AND A BROAD UPPER TROUGH. THE CURRENT FORECAST OF INCREASING
CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON CAPTURES THE GENERAL TREND...AND FORECAST

590 
FXUS64 KMRX 260807
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SAT OCT 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE REGION WILL 
GIVE WAY TO A WEAKENING AND MOISTURE STARVED COLD FRONT THAT WILL 
PUSH IN TONIGHT.  CURRENT FREEZE WARNING WILL BE ALLOWED TO STAY AS 
IS...AND IT APPEARS THAT IT WILL LIKELY BE COLD ENOUGH THIS MORNING 
TO END THE FALL FREEZE PROGRAM FOR THOSE AREAS STILL IN IT.  WILL 
SEE AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS LATER TODAY INTO TONIGHT. THE MOISTURE 
WILL BE SHALLOW AND FORCING WEAK...SO AT THIS POINT WILL KEEP THE 
FORECAST PRECIP FREE.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL SO WILL 
STAY CLOSE.    

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...ONCE AGAIN MODELS ARE CLOSE 
WITH DEPICTION OF EXPECTED WEATHER DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD BUT THE GFS AND CANADIAN START TO OUTPACE THE ECMWF 
WITH A PLAINS STORM SYSTEM LATE IN THE WORK WEEK. HOWEVER...ALL 
MODELS AGREE THAT THE PATTERN WILL BECOME AMPLIFIED WITH A 
STRENGTHENING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AHEAD OF THE STRONG SYSTEM. THIS 
WILL LEAD TO A NICE WARMING TREND THROUGH THE WEEK. INITIALLY THERE 
WILL BE A FEW CLOUDS AROUND ON SUNDAY AS A WEAK PERTURBATION 
CURRENTLY PRESSING INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...AND A WEAKENING 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. I DON'T 
BELIEVE THIS SYSTEM WILL BE ABLE TO GENERATE MUCH MORE THAN A PERIOD 
OF SCATTERED TO BROKEN CLOUDS SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. HOWEVER...THERE 
WILL BE A SMALL CHANCE FOR A SHOWER TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AS 
WARMER AIR IS LIFTED OVER THE RETREATING LOW LEVEL AIRMASS. AN 
INCREASING CHANCE FOR SHOWERS WILL BE SEEN LATER IN THE DAY THURSDAY 
INTO THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE PLAINS SYSTEM DRIVES EAST INTO THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THE STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL PULL 
INCREASINGLY MOIST AIR INTO THE REGION. STRONG LIFT IN THE PRESENCE 
OF A POWERFUL UPPER JET AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE ALONG THE COLD 
FRONT WILL LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE LATE 
WORK WEEK TIME FRAME. STAYED CLOSER TO THE SLOWER ECMWF SOLUTION 
WHICH DOESN'T BRING THE FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL FRIDAY. 
GRADUALLY DROPPED POPS LATER IN THE DAY THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS AS 
THE BOUNDARY MOVES ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
953 PM EDT FRI OCT 25 2013

.DISCUSSION...LOW CLOUDS ARE DISSIPATING RAPIDLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA WITH CLEAR SKY ANTICIPATED AREA-WIDE OVERNIGHT. HOURLY
TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING SEVERAL DEGREES COLDER THAN CURRENT
FORECAST. LATEST GFS MOS IS ALSO COLDER..SO HAVE LOWERED MINS FOR
TONIGHT SEVERAL DEGREES AS CLEAR SKY AND CALM WINDS WILL ALLOW FOR
GOOD RADITIONAL COOLING.

CURRENT FREEZE WARNING LOOKS GOOD. HAVE ADDED WIDESPREAD FROST FOR
ALL AREAS FOR TONIGHT. COLD AIRMASS ACROSS RELATIVELY WARM AREA
LAKES/STREAMS MAY PRODUCE PATCHY FOG AS WELL.

FORECAST LOWS WILL ALSO BE BELOW OR NEAR RECORDS MINS FOR OCTOBER 26TH.
CURRENT RECORD LOWS ARE AS FOLLOWS:

TRI...27 DEGREES SET BACK IN 1962/1948
TYS...27 DEGREES SET BACK IN 1962
CHA...29 DEGREES SET BACK IN 1982/1968

WILL MENTION IN FORECAST.

712 
FXUS64 KMRX 251905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT FRI OCT 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE AREA TONIGHT...WHILE AN 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BE DEPARTING TO THE EAST WITH A DRY NW FLOW 
BEHIND. WITH CALM WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT...WE SHOULD SEE LOW 
TEMPS IN THE 20S JUST ABOUT EVERYWHERE...WHICH WILL LIKELY BRING AN 
END TO THE FREEZE PROGRAM FOR THE SEASON. THE FREEZE WARNING IN 
EFFECT FOR TONIGHT WILL BE ONLY FOR THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY 
AREAS...AS ALL OTHER AREAS HAVE ALREADY SEEN A HARD FREEZE.

A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA ON SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON. MOISTURE IS LIMITED TO A VERY THIN LAYER AROUND 850-750 
MB...AND WILL ONLY SERVE TO BRING INCREASING CLOUDS LATE IN THE DAY. 
HIGHS WILL BE IN THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THIS PERIOD STARTS WITH 
AN UPPER TROUGH OVER EASTERN CANADA AND THE GREAT LAKES THAT EXTENDS 
SOUTHWARD TOWARD OUR AREA...AND A WEAK UPPER RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN 
U.S. STATES.  THIS PATTERN SLOWLY MORPHS OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS 
AS THE TROUGH LIFTS TO THE NORTHEAST AND A CUTOFF LOW MOVES INTO THE 
WESTERN STATES FROM THE PACIFIC. BY EARLY TO MID NEXT WEEK...THIS 
INDUCES WEAK UPPER RIDGING OVER OUR AREA.  AS THE CUTOFF LOW HEADS 
EASTWARD LATE NEXT WEEK...OUR RIDGE GETS PUSHED TO THE EAST...THE 
UPPER FLOW BACKS...AND A COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING INTO THE AREA.  
TIMING IS THE BIG ISSUE...WILL FOLLOW CONSENSUS WISDOM OF GOING 
SLOWER THAN THE GFS SOLUTION...WHICH KEEPS THINGS MOSTLY DRY THROUGH 
MUCH OF NEXT WEEK.

WITH THIS SLOWER PROGRESSION FOR EVERYTHING...AM KEEPING POPS 
GENERALLY DRIER THROUGH MID WEEK...AND WILL KEEP LOW TEMPS A LITTLE 
COOLER INTO MID WEEK...AND ONCE THE HIGHER DEW POINTS SWELL INTO THE 
AREA....WILL HOLD ONTO THEM THURSDAY NIGHT.  HAVE HIGHER POPS COMING 
IN FINALLY...OVER THE LAST COUPLE OF DAYS.  THIS SYSTEM LOOKS PRETTY 
DYNAMIC...BUT THIS MODEL RUN LOOKS LIKE THE UPPER FLOW IS POSITIVELY 
TILTED...SO MAY JUST HAVE A LINE OF STORMS...OR POSSIBLY SHOWERS IF 
IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT...COME ROLLING THROUGH THE AREA.
  
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             30  60  42  67  41 /   0   0  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  29  58  40  64  38 /   0   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       28  57  39  65  36 /   0   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              25  56  35  60  33 /   0   0   0   0  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN TODAY 
AND WILL REMAIN OVER THE REGION TONIGHT.  ANY CLOUDS EARLY MAINLY 
NORTHEAST WILL DIMINISH AND TONIGHT SHOULD BE MAINLY CLEAR.  SUB

TO DEFER TO THE DAY SHIFT TO ISSUE ANY FREEZE WARNINGS ONCE IT IS 
DETERMINED WHAT AREAS WILL STILL BE IN THE FREEZE PROGRAM AFTER THIS 
MORNING.  WILL INCLUDE FROST WORDING IN THE AREAS STILL IN THE 
PROGRAM AS OF NOW AND MENTION THE FREEZE THREAT IN THE HWO.  WILL 
ALLOW CURRENT FREEZE WARNING FOR THIS MORNING TO CONTINUE AS IS.  
MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL SO JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS.    

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS ARE SIMILAR EARLY IN 
THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH A FEW CLOUDS SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AS 
A WEAK UPPER WAVE BUILDS THROUGH THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. BY MID WEEK 
SOLUTIONS DIVERGE WITH THE EUROPEAN AND CANADIAN SIMILAR WITH A 
DEEPER AND SLOWER SHORT WAVE TROUGH EMERGING OUT OF THE SOUTHWESTERN 
STATES INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS WHILE THE LESS AMPLIFIED GFS IS ABOUT 
900 MILES EAST OF THIS POSITION SITUATED OVER THE EASTERN GREAT 
LAKES. STAYED CLOSER TO THE ECM AND CANADIAN SOLUTION WHICH ALSO 
WERE SIMILAR TO THE PREVIOUS FORECAST FEATURING GRADUALLY INCREASING 
POPS WITH A FEW SHOWERS POSSIBLE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY IN THE 
WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN OUT AHEAD OF THE AMPLIFYING PLAINS STATES 
TROUGH FOLLOWED BY A BETTER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY 
THUNDERSTORMS WITH THE RELATIVELY STRONG FRONTAL SYSTEM ON THURSDAY.

169 
FXUS64 KMRX 241919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT THU OCT 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL BE PASSING THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT. AHEAD 
OF THE TROUGH...THE NAM SHOWS MOISTURE EXTENDING UP TO ABOUT 750 MB 
WITH STEEP LAPSE RATES IN NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. THE GFS IS 
DRIER. WILL CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP NORTH TO ACCOUNT FOR THE 
NAM...BUT ANY PRECIP CHANCE WILL END BY 06Z. 

TEMPERATURES WILL FALL INTO THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S ACROSS THE 
AREA. THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CENTRAL-SOUTHERN VALLEY LOCATIONS 
REMAIN IN THE FREEZE PROGRAM...AND SO THE FREEZE WARNING WILL BE 
CONTINUED FOR THESE AREAS. ON FRIDAY WE WILL SEE CLEARING SKIES AS A 
HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA. HOWEVER COLD TEMPS WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A DEEP NW FLOW...AS HIGHS WILL BE IN THE 40S NORTH TO 
LOWER 50S SOUTH.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
ANOTHER COLD NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE SETTLES OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA AND UPPER TROUGH MOVES TO THE EAST COAST. ADJUSTED 
LOWS SLIGHTLY UPWARD. LOWS STILL LOOK TO BE IN THE MID 20S TO NEAR 
30 SO AREAS THAT DO NOT FREEZE TONIGHT WILL LIKELY HAVE A LIGHT TO 
HARD FREEZE BY SATURDAY MORNING. A FREEZE WARNING MAY NEED TO BE 
REPEATED FOR PART OF THE AREA ONCE AGAIN. FROM SATURDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS SLOWLY EAST WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. HIGHS 
SATURDAY 5 TO 10 DEGREES WARMER AND WINDS BECOME SW. SATURDAY NIGHT 
LOWS MOSTLY IN THE 30S TO LOWER 40S AND ABOVE FREEZING EXCEPT 
COLDEST VALLEYS AND HIGH ELEVATIONS.

A WEAKENING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT 
AND SUNDAY WITH SOME CLOUDS BUT NO PRECIPITATION. SUNDAY AND MONDAY 
SLIGHTLY WARMER EACH DAY WITH LOWS SIMILAR TO SUNDAY. WEAK HIGH 
PRESSURE REMAINS OVER THE TN VALLEY AND APPALACHIANS MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY BUT SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE CENTRAL STATES WILL SPREAD 
CLOUDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA AT TIMES. WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY THE 
FORECAST BECOMES MORE UNCERTAIN AS ECMWF BRINGS IN A WEAK SYSTEM 
WEDNESDAY THEN DEVELOPS A STRONGER SYSTEM THURSDAY WHICH COULD 
APPROACH THE REGION THURSDAY EVENING. AT THE SAME TIME THE GFS 
DEVELOPS ONE SYSTEM TO THE NORTH WEDNESDAY AND A TRAILING SOUTHERN 
SYSTEM INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY THAT 
MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE LAST 24 HOURS OF THE 
EXTENDED. SO WILL INTRODUCE RAIN CHANCES WEST TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY AND INCREASE CHANCES FOR ALL AREAS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY WITH THUNDER POSSIBLE THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY MILD 
AT NIGHT AND NEAR AVERAGE DURING THE DAYTIME. 

&&

.DISCUSSION...
BASED ON AN ANALYSIS OF LOW TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING...SW VA...NE
TN...AND SW NC SAW A WIDEPSREAD FREEZE...AND THUS WILL BE REMOVED
FROM TONIGHT'S FREEZE WARNING. POCKETS OF BELOW FREEZING TEMPS WERE
OBSERVED IN THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND CENTRAL VALLEY...BUT WERE
ISOLATED ENOUGH TO KEEP THE WARNING GOING IN THOSE AREAS. 

THIS AFTERNOON...WE WILL SEE STEEPENING LAPSE RATES AS A 850-700
MB SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES THE AREA...WHICH SHOULD HELP
GENERATE SOME ISOLATED RAIN SHOWERS. ALL MODELS ARE SHOWING SOME
LIGHT PRECIP IN NORTHERN AREAS...AND WILL EXPAND THE AFTERNOON POP
AREA WITH THE MORNING UPDATE.

263 
FXUS64 KMRX 240709
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 AM EDT THU OCT 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN CONCERN IS THE EXPECTED
FREEZING TEMPERATURES ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA TONIGHT. FOR THIS
MORNING...A WIDESPREAD FREEZE IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND SMOKY MOUNTAINS. INCOMING CLOUD COVER THIS MORNING
WILL LIKELY LIMIT THE AREAL EXTENT OF THE FREEZE ACROSS SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA..NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.

ANOTHER WEAK SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEYS
TODAY AND THIS EVENING WITH A GOOD DEAL OF MID/LOW CLOUDS TODAY...
THEN DECREASING TONIGHT. THIS WAVE WILL PULL COLDER AIR INTO THE
REGION WITH TEMPERATURES DROPPING AT OR BELOW FREEZING OVER MOST
LOCATIONS TONIGHT. HAVE ISSUED ANOTHER FREEZE WARNING ACROSS THE
AREA..EXCEPT THE FAR NORTHEAST/CENTRAL MOUNTAINS.

BESIDES THE COLD TEMPERATURES..UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE MOUNTAINS WILL
PRODUCE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND
EVENING. NO ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND 
GENERALLY REVEAL A PATTERN CHANGE WITH A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION GRADUALLY BEING REPLACED BY A 
HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION. A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH A HARD FREEZE EXPECTED OVER THE 
ENTIRE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY MORNING. A RAPID WARMING TREND WILL 
THEN DEVELOP FOR THE REST OF THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...AS A 
DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS HIGH BRINGS TEMPS ABOVE 
NORMAL BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. A COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON TUESDAY NIGHT...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE NATION. AN EXTENSIVE 
AREA OF CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
WITH THIS COLD FRONT...BUT WILL JUST MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH A STABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED. THIS 
AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO EVENTUALLY DEVELOP A 
STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY BY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...AND IS CURRENTLY PROGGED TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
POSSIBLE STRONG CONVECTION ON HALLOWEEN (OUTSIDE OF THE FORECAST 
PERIOD). AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

855 
FXUS64 KMRX 231853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT WED OCT 23 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
STRATOCU OVER THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON IS EXPECTED TO DISSIPATE WITH 
SUNSET AS WE SEE STABILIZATION FROM WARMING 500 MB TEMPS AND 850 MB 
TEMP ADVECTION BECOMING NEARLY NEUTRAL. HOWEVER...MIDLEVEL CLOUDS 
ASSOCIATED WITH A 700 MB VORT MAX SEEN IN SATELLITE OVER THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS WILL BE MOVING IN TONIGHT. BOTH THE GFS AND NAM SHOW 
MOISTURE INCREASING AFTER MIDNIGHT AROUND THE 700 MB LEVEL. THIS 
WILL HAVE SOME IMPACT ON OUR LOW TEMPERATURES...ADDING UNCERTAINTY 
TO THE CURRENT FROST/FREEZE PRODUCTS. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WARM SIDE 
OF MOS GUIDANCE FOR LOW TEMPS...WHICH STILL PUTS MOST OF THE 
SOUTHERN/CENTRAL VALLEY IN A FROST ADVISORY...WITH A FREEZE WARNING 
NORTH AND IN THE MOUNTAINS. WILL CONTINUE THE FROST ADVISORY AND 
FREEZE WARNING AREAS UNCHANGED. 

ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH CROSSES THE AREA...BUT 
IT WILL HAVE LIMITED MOISTURE TO WORK WITH. THE NAM...SREF...AND 
CANADIAN PRODUCE LIGHT PRECIP IN THE NORTHERN HALF...WHILE THE GFS 
HAS PRECIP JUST NORTH OF OUR AREA. STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES IN 
THE NAM SOUNDING COULD PRODUCE SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS. WILL INCLUDE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR NORTHERN AND CENTRAL AREAS IN THE AFTERNOON. 
WITH LIMITED SUNSHINE...HIGHS TOMORROW WILL AGAIN BE IN THE 50S.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
A WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL SLIDE THROUGH THE AREA...MAINLY EFFECTING
NORTHERN LOCATIONS THURSDAY EVENING. LIMITED MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT
WILL ONLY ALLOW FOR A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS. AS COOLER AIR CONTINUES
TO FILTER INTO THE REGION...THE LIGHT SHOWERS MAY TRANSITION INTO A
FEW POCKETS OF LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS
THURSDAY NIGHT. NO ACCUMULATIONS AREA ARE EXPECTED. HIGH PRESSURE
BUILDS IN ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS. HOWEVER...WITH
A COLD AIR MASS CONTINUING TO PUSH IN...OVERNIGHT LOWS SHOULD DROP
BELOW FREEZING ACROSS MUCH OF THE MRX CWA FRIDAY NIGHT. A FREEZE
WARNING WILL LIKELY BE NEEDED...ESPECIALLY FOR AREAS THAT HAVE YET
TO SEE FREEZING TEMPERATURES. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN ON
SUNDAY BUT MODELS SHOW LITTLE MOISTURE OR DYNAMICS AND WILL KEEP
THINGS DRY FOR NOW. ZONAL FLOW ALOFT DEVELOPS OVER THE REGION
MONDAY AND TUESDAY. A SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH TO OUR NORTH TUESDAY
INTO WEDNESDAY. ISOLATED SHOWERS MAY REACH INTO OUR AREA BY TUESDAY
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WITH BEST CHANCES ACROSS NORTHERN LOCATIONS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1001 AM EDT WED OCT 23 2013

.DISCUSSION...
THE GENERAL FORECAST TREND IS ON TRACK...BUT MINOR CHANGES WILL BE
MADE TO REMOVE AFTERNOON POPS. CURRENT RADAR TRENDS SHOW THE LIGHT
SHOWERS IN SW VA EXITING SOON...AND WE WILL SEE MIDLEVEL
STABILIZATION THROUGH THE DAY AS THE 500 MB TROUGH MOVES EAST. 850
MB COLD ADVECTION IS PRODUCING SOME BROKEN TO OVERCAST STRATOCU TO
OUR WEST AND INTO THE PLATEAU. SOME DOWNSLOPE OFF THE PLATEAU IS
CURRENTLY PRODUCING SOME LARGER BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS IN THE
VALLEY...SO HIGH TEMPS TODAY MAY NEED TO BE RAISED SLIGHTLY. 

THE FORECAST CHALLENGE TODAY WILL BE WHETHER THE CLOUDS WILL CLEAR
ENOUGH TONIGHT TO ALLOW FOR A FREEZE OR FROST TO DEVELOP. THE NAM
SHOWS MORE CLOUDS TONIGHT THAN THE GFS. HOPEFULLY THE PICTURE WILL
BECOME CLEARER WITH THE 12Z MODEL RUNS.

561 
FXUS64 KMRX 230802
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 AM EDT WED OCT 23 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
AREA BY 15 UTC IN RESPONSE TO A FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE OVER THE
OHIO VALLEY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED WITH THIS SYSTEM AND DYNAMICS IS
MAINLY OVER THE OHIO VALLEY...SO LOW CHANCE POPS FOR TODAY.
SATELLITE SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF MID-LEVEL CLOUDS WITH LOW-CLOUDS
MOVING ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF KENTUCKY. BROKEN LOW-CLOUDS WILL
MOVE EAST INTO THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE REGION TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT...MAIN CONCERN IS POTENTIAL OF FREEZING TEMPERATURES
AND FROST. CLOUDS WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY..EXCEPT MOSTLY CLEAR
SOUTHEAST OVERNIGHT. MODELS DO HAVE A DISAGREEMENT ON HOW FAST AND
MUCH MID-LEVEL CLOUDS SPILL INTO THE REGION LATE TONIGHT. GFS TENDS
TO KEEP CLOUD COVER WEST...WHILE NAM SHOWS A MORE PROGRESSIVE EAST
MOVEMENT OF CLOUDS INTO THE AREA. WENT A MIDDLE GROUND. HAVE ISSUED
A FREEZE WARNING FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA..NORTHEAST TENNESSEE..FAR
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. FROST
ADVISORY ELSEWHERE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND 
REVEAL GENERALLY A QUIET PATTERN FOR THE FORECAST AREA INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. ON THURSDAY...A LONG-WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL LINGER 
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION...WITH ANOTHER QUICK-MOVING 
CLIPPER SYSTEM AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA LATE THURSDAY INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT. WHILE PRECIP AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT WITH 
THIS SYSTEM...850 MB TEMPS ARE PROGGED TO QUICKLY FALL BELOW 
FREEZING...SO WILL MENTION SOME SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN SETTLE OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH A HARD FREEZE EXPECTED OVER 
THE ENTIRE AREA ON SATURDAY MORNING. ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...BEFORE A PATTERN CHANGE 
BEGINS TO DEVELOP EARLY NEXT WEEK. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL BEGIN 
TO AMPLIFY OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE NATION ON TUESDAY...WHICH 
WILL RESULT IN A WARMING TREND OVER THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT TUESDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND 
CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD... 
WHICH ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 230520
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
120 AM EDT WED OCT 23 2013

.AVIATION...VFR (MARGINAL MVFR DUE TO CEILINGS EARLY THIS MORNING) 
CONDITIONS WILL BE RULE THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD AT ALL TAF 
SITES. NOT MUCH HAS CHANGED SINCE LAST DISCUSSION. UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH CONTINUES TO PROGRESS EASTWARD AND ITS COLD FRONT IS NOW 
LOCATED ACROSS WESTERN KY/TN. THE FRONT IS STILL ON PACE TO REACH 
OUR AREA AROUND 10-14Z. IT LOOKS LIKE CHA AND TYS WILL STAY 
RELATIVELY CLOUD FREE UNTIL FRONT ARRIVES. TRI SHOULD HANG ON TO 
CLOUDS THROUGH THE NIGHT. LOWEST CIGS AT TRI AND TYS SHOULD OCCUR 
BETWEEN 10-15Z. GUSTY WINDS WITH FRONT ARRIVAL CAN ALSO EXPECTED. 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF PRECIP FOR NORTHERN AREAS BUT NOT ENOUGH TO INCLUDE 
IN TAFS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT TUE OCT 22 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...LIGHT RAIN DWINDLED 
SIGNIFICANTLY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LEAVING 
BEHIND A SMATTERING OF SC AND AC. THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM TO AFFECT 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IS A HEALTHY SHORT WAVE TROUGH CURRENTLY 
DROPPING SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE MIDWESTERN U.S. WAY TOO MUCH WEST TO 
NORTHWEST FLOW AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WITH NO CHANCE OF LOW LEVEL FLOW 
DEVELOPING OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO. THEREFORE...STAYED WITH SLIGHT 
AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE MOST PART AND LIMITED TO THE NORTHERN 
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE SYSTEM IS A FAST MOVER AND MAY BE 
ENTIRELY ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS BY 18Z. MOS GUIDANCE BLEND LOOKS 
GOOD AND WAS USED FOR THE SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO 
CURRENT FORECAST. LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF 
THE NATION WITH CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEKEND. UNSEASONABLY COLD 
NORTHWEST FLOW INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL PULL SEVERAL FAST 
MOVING SHORT-WAVES ACROSS THE REGION...ESPECIALLY SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. PERIODS OF 
LIGHT SHOWERS WILL SPREAD ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE AREA/FAR 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT...BUT 
VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR A MENTION OF 
LIGHT SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN. NO ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED.

BESIDES THE PRECIPITATION...CHILLY AIRMASS WILL SETTLE INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH WIDESPREAD FROST/ 
LOCALIZED FREEZE ANTICIPATED WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY NIGHT WITH 
WIDESPREAD FREEZE EXPECTED FRIDAY NIGHT. 

UPPER TROUGH WILL LOOSE ITS GRIP EARLY NEXT WEEK...AS UPPER TROUGH 
LIFTS NORTHEAST AND FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL BEGINNING SUNDAY...THEN 
SOUTHWEST FLOW FOR MONDAY. WARMER CONDITIONS WILL RETURN EARLY NEXT 
WEEKEND.

.DISCUSSION...WEAK UPPER TROUGH SHIFTING SLOWLY EAST WITH A BAND OF

BEST CHANCE OF MORE THAN JUST A COUPLE DROPS OF RAIN WILL BE ACROSS
THIS HIGHER TERRAIN REGION SO ADJUSTED POP TO LIKELY CATEGORY WITH
A SLIGHT UPWARD TWEAK ACROSS ADJACENT AREAS IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.
DIFFICULT FORECAST IN A WAY WHEN A WEAKENING SYSTEM IS MOVING IN
BECAUSE IT IS NOT ENTIRELY APPARENT HOW FAST OR HOW MUCH THE LIFT
WILL FADE. MODELS SUGGEST A SLOW WEAKENING TREND AND I SUPPOSE THE
LOW POPS MATCH THIS TO SOME DEGREE. AT ANY RATE...IT WILL BE A
LIGHT RAIN EVENT WHICH WILL BE TOUGH TO ACTUALLY MEASURE IN THE
BUCKETS. WAS CONCERNED ABOUT EDGING MAX TEMPS BACK WITH THE
APPROACHING MID DECK BUT NOTICED THE RATHER DECENT WARMING THIS
MORNING SO WILL STAY WITH CURRENT TEMPERATURE FORECAST.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WESTERN LAKES/MIDWEST UPPER

WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT WITH

MOISTURE ADVECTION IN THE LOWER LEVELS. A VORT AXIS MOVES ACROSS THE 
REGION ON TUESDAY AND THERE MAY BE JUST ENOUGH LIFT TO PRODUCE SOME 
SPOTTY LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MIN/MAX 
TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...STAYED CLOSE TO ONGOING 
FORECAST. WEST RIDGE/EAST TROUGH PATTERN SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH 
MUCH OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. MODELS LOOSELY HANDLING E PAC UPPER 
LOWS BUT INDICATIONS ARE LESS AMPLITUDE TO EASTERN TROUGH IN THE MID 
TERM. REGARDLESS...PERIODS OF GOOD COLD AIR ADVECTION CAN BE 
EXPECTED INTO THE WEEKEND. SECONDARY COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE 
AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. LIGHT NORTHWEST FLOW SHOWER ACTIVITY POSSIBLE 
INTO WEDNESDAY. COOLER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA AND BE 
REINFORCED BY A STOUT NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. THE PRIMARY RESULT OF 
THIS NEW AIRMASS 
/COMBINED WITH MOSTLY CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS AT THE SURFACE/ WILL 
BE HIGHS RUNNING 10 TO 15 DEGREES COOLER IN THE 50S BY WEDNESDAY AND 
A WIDESPREAD FROST AND FREEZE FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY MORNING. 
THUS A FROST AND/OR A FREEZE ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED MAY BE NEEDED 
LATER THIS WEEK ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND PERHAPS THURSDAY NIGHT. 
ANOTHER STRONGER FRONT WILL THEN MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY... 
KNOCKING HIGHS INTO THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S AND GIVING THE REGION A 
FIRST HARD FREEZE IN SEVERAL LOCATIONS LATER THAT NIGHT. CONFIDENCE 
HIGH FOR THIS FAR OUT IN FORECAST. DRY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER 
CONDITIONS WILL THEN ENSUE FOR END OF WEEKEND AS SOUTHWEST FLOW AND 
MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS PREVAIL WITH A SURFACE HIGH BUILDING IN. 
MIDDAY TEMPERATURES SHOULD RETURN TO NORMAL BY MONDAY. ANOTHER STRONG
COLD FRONT POSSIBLE BY HALLOWEEN. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE APPALACHIANS...WITH A COOL 
AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS HIGH IS PROGGED TO 
SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD TODAY...WITH SOUTHERLY WIND DEVELOPING ON ITS 
WESTERN SIDE OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON. THESE 
SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL HELP TO RAISE DEWPOINTS AND TEMPS TODAY...WITH 
CLOUDS INCREASING TONIGHT AS A WEAK COLD FRONT FROM THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY APPROACHES THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED 
TO GENERATE SCATTERED SHOWERS ALONG IT...SO WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT OVER THE NORTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SERIES OF WEAK COLD FRONTS 
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA DURING THE WEEK AHEAD...RESULTING A MUCH 
COOLER TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE REGION. THE FIRST FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH ON TUESDAY...PERHAPS BRINGING A SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
SHOWERS /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN/NORTHEAST ZONES AND 
MOUNTAINS/. A SECONDARY FRONT MOVING THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY  WILL 
BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION AS WELL. IN BOTH CASES... 
COOLER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA AND BE REINFORCED BY A STOUT 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. THE PRIMARY RESULT OF THIS NEW AIRMASS 
/COMBINED WITH MOSTLY CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS AT THE SURFACE/ WILL 
BE HIGHS RUNNING 10 TO 15 DEGREES COOLER IN THE 50S BY WEDNESDAY AND 
A WIDESPREAD FROST AND FREEZE FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY MORNING. 
THUS A FROST AND/OR A FREEZE ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED MAY BE NEEDED 
LATER THIS WEEK ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND PERHAPS THURSDAY NIGHT. 
ANOTHER STRONGER FRONT WILL THEN MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY... 
INCREDIBLY KNOCKING HIGHS INTO THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S AND GIVING 
THE REGION A FIRST HARD FREEZE POTENTIALLY IN SEVERAL LOCATIONS 
LATER THAT NIGHT. DRY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER CONDITIONS WILL THEN ENSUE 
FOR WEEKEND AS SOUTHWEST FLOW AND MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS PREVAIL 
WITH A SURFACE HIGH BUILDING IN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
919 PM EDT SUN OCT 20 2013

.DISCUSSION...CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
HAVE ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO DROP RAPIDLY INTO THE 40S TO LOWER 50S
ALREADY THIS EVENING. WITH FROST IN SOME LOCATIONS THIS MORNING AND
LOWS NEAR THE SAME TO POSSIBLY LOWER NE SECTIONS TONIGHT HAVE
ISSUED A FROST ADVISORY TONIGHT. AREAS OF FROST ARE EXPECTED TO
FORM IN MOST OF THE COUNTIES WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE KNOXVILLE
AND CHATTANOOGA URBAN AREAS WHERE IT WILL BE MORE PATCHY AS LOWS
THERE EXPECTED TO BE IN THE UPPER 30S TO NEAR 40. HIGHER RIDGES IN
SW VA AND ON THE PLATEAU WILL LIKELY SEE LOWS MORE IN THE LOWER 40S.
FOG MAY BE PRESENT IN RIVER VALLEYS BUT DO NOT THINK IT WILL BE
WIDESPREAD. IF IT DEVELOPS LATE MAY NEED TO ADD IN EARLY MORNING
UPDATE FOR THE MORE FOG PRONE AREAS.

566 
FXUS64 KMRX 201911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT SUN OCT 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...A VERY QUIET SHORT
TERM IN STORE. HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL THROUGH MONDAY
MORNING AND WILL START TO PUSH OFF TO THE EAST THROUGHOUT THE DAY
AS THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES.

TONIGHT WILL BE SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHT WITH EXPECTED LOWS IN THE MID 
TO UPPER 30S NORTH...UPPER 30S TO NEAR 40 CENTRAL...AND NEAR 40 
SOUTH. PATCHY FOG AND FROST WILL ONCE AGAIN BE POSSIBLE AS MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS WILL BE IN PLACE. MOST OF MONDAY WILL 
REMAIN SUNNY BEFORE CLOUDS START TO INCREASE MONDAY EVENING AHEAD OF 
AN APPROACHING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. LOW 
TEMPS ON MONDAY NIGHT WILL BE 5 TO 10 DEGREES WARMER DUE TO THE 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER THUS PREVENTING GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING
WITH MOST AREAS SEEING LOW TEMPS IN THE MID 40S.



.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE LONG TERM PERIOD WILL
FEEL MORE LIKE LATE NOVEMBER AS A LONG WAVE TROUGH SETS UP OVER THE
EASTERN U.S. THE TROUGH WILL BE IN NO HURRY TO DEPART WITH SEVERAL
SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES BUILDING SOUTHEAST OUT OF CANADA INTO
THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. AS THE SEASONS
CHANGE...THE FLOW ALOFT STRENGTHENS LEADING TO FAST MOVING SYSTEMS
TYPICAL OF THE COLDER PART OF THE YEAR. THE FIRST FEATURE BUILDS IN
ON TUESDAY WITH A SMALL CHANCE FOR SHOWERS MAINLY ACROSS THE
NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

ANOTHER STRONGER WAVE DROPS INTO THE REGION LATER TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY BRINGING A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS THROUGH THE 
DAY WEDNESDAY. MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT WITH STRENGTH AND 
TIMING OF YET ANOTHER SHORT WAVE BUILDING ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO 
VALLEY THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY WITH LIMITED AVAILABLE MOISTURE. 
THEREFORE...OPTED NOT TO ADD POPS AT THIS TIME FOR THIS ACTION. WE 
MAY SEE A SLIGHT REBOUND IN TEMPERATURES SATURDAY WITH SOME SUNSHINE 
RETURNING AS THE UPPER FLOW TRENDS TOWARD ZONAL WHILE AWAITING THE 
FINAL WEATHER SYSTEM OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. PREFERRED THE SLOWER 
ECMWF FOR THIS UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM WHICH 
WOULD IMPACT THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MAINLY DURING THE DAY SUNDAY 
WITH ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS. CONCERNING THE TEMPERATURE 
FORECAST...EDGED MAX AND MINS TEMPS A FEW DEGREES BELOW MEX MOS 
GOING A LITTLE CLOSER TO ECM NUMBERS. STILL APPEARS THAT THE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA MAY BE SEEING LOW TEMPERATURES 
VERY NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING THURSDAY...FRIDAY AND SATURDAY MORNING.




&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  69  46  65  42 /   0   0   0  20  20

552 
FXUS64 KMRX 200717
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT SUN OCT 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS HIGH PRESSURE AREA WILL BRING DRY AND TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS TO THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH NEAR NORMAL 
TEMPS EXPECTED. WILL PLAN TO LEAVE THE FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT 
AROUND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHERE TEMPS ARE CURRENTLY IN THE 30S 
WITH CALM WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES. HOWEVER...WILL CANCEL THE FROST 
ADVISORY FOR SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...WHERE TEMPS/DEWPOINTS 
ARE STILL IN THE 40S WITH A TIGHTER PRESSURE GRADIENT PRODUCING A 
PERSISTENT LIGHT WIND FLOW. CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS ARE EXPECTED 
TONIGHT...SO WILL MENTION PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING ALONG THE WATERWAYS 
DUE TO THE EXPECTED LARGE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE AIR AND WATER 
TEMPS. WILL ALSO PLAN TO MENTION SOME PATCHY FROST TONIGHT OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...AND THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU... 
WHERE TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO FALL INTO THE 30S BEFORE SUNRISE. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SURFACE WINDS WILL SHIFT TO 
THE SOUTH ON MONDAY...RESULTING IN A BRIEF WARM UP AS HIGHS WILL 
RETURN TO THE LOWER 70S IN MOST SPOTS. HOWEVER...THE OVERALL TREND 
FOR THE WEEK AHEAD WILL BE THE COOLER TEMPERATURES IN STORE FOR THE 
REGION AS A SERIES OF WEAK FRONTS PUSH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE FIRST FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH ON 
TUESDAY...PERHAPS BRINGING A STRAY SHOWER OR TWO...WITH AN A 
SECONDARY FRONT MOVING THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY. A PUSH OF COOLER AIR 
WILL KNOCK HIGHS IN THE MID 50S AND LOWER 60S AND LOWS IN THE 30S 
FOR THE MIDDLE TO LATER HALF OF THE WEEK. WITH FAIRLY CALM AND 
MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS IN PLACE BY TUESDAY NIGHT... NEARING 
FREEZING TEMPERATURES SEEM PROBABLE IN MANY LOCATIONS AND THINK THAT 
THE FIRST FREEZE OF THE SEASON WILL BE POSSIBLE /AT LEAST ACROSS 
PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/ BY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. AT THE VERY LEAST...WIDESPREAD FROST SEEMS LIKE A GOOD 
PROBABILITY THOSE DAYS AND AN ADVISORY FOR A FROST AND/OR A FREEZE 
MAY BE NEEDED LATER THIS WEEK. ADDITIONAL COOL NIGHTS WITH LOWS NEAR 
FREEZING TO THE MID TO UPPER 30S SEEM PROBABLE THROUGH THE END OF 
THE WORK WEEK...BEFORE A VERY SUBTLE WORK UP MAY BE ON THE WAY FOR 
THE UPCOMING WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
909 PM EDT SAT OCT 19 2013

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT HAS NOW MOVED EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS
THIS EVENING WITH DRIER...COLDER AIR MASS PUSHING INTO THE FORECAST
AREA. CLOUDS HAVE ALREADY DECREASED WITH SKIES BECOMING MOSTLY
CLEAR OVER SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS. PRESSURE GRADIENT IS
ALREADY RELAXING OVER MIDDLE TN AND KY AND TEMPERATURES ARE DROPPING
INTO THE 40S THERE. DECIDED TO ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY FOR THE
PLATEAU COUNTIES AND PART OF THE MOUNTAINS FROM THE SMOKIES SOUTH
WITH RAPID COOLING IN THE VALLEYS IN THESE AREAS AND LIGHT WINDS
EXPECTING FROST TO FORM LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY SUNDAY MORNING. SOME
FOG ALSO POSSIBLE ESPECIALLY NEAR WATERWAYS. NEXT SHIFT MAY HAVE TO
ADJUST OR ADD COUNTIES TO ADVISORY IF WINDS LIGHTEN AND CAUSE MORE
OF A TEMPERATURE DROP IN THE LOWER PARTS OF THE TN VALLEY AND NE
FORECAST AREAS. UPDATED FORECAST SENT.

446 
FXUS64 KMRX 191852
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EDT SAT OCT 19 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH
WILL SWING THROUGH THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON ALONG WITH ITS
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. CURRENT SURFACE OBS INDICATE THAT THE COLD
FRONT IS LOCATED ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND WILL MOVE INTO
THE CENTRAL VALLEY SHORTLY. MODELS SHOW THE FRONT EXITING OUR AREA
LATER THIS EVENING. A LIGHT SHOWER IS POSSIBLE WITH THE FRONTAL
PASSAGE BUT MOST PLACES WILL STAY DRY. BRIEF GUSTY WINDS OF AROUND
20 TO 25 KTS CAN ALSO BE EXPECTED WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH
WINDS DROPPING BACK DOWN BETWEEN 5 AND 15 KTS BEHIND THE FRONT.

CLOUDS SHOULD CLEAR BEHIND THE FRONT TONIGHT ALLOWING LOWS TO DROP 
DOWN INTO THE UPPER 30S NORTH TO NEAR 40 SOUTH....WHICH WILL BE 5 TO 
10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. SOME SHELTERED VALLEY LOCATIONS COULD SEE 
PATCHY FROST TOWARD SUNRISE. ALSO...PATCHY AREAS OF FOG MAY DEVELOP 
TOWARD SUNRISE AS WELL. HOWEVER...IF WINDS STAY UP THROUGH THE 
NIGHT...FOG AND FROST WILL BE LESS LIKELY. WILL MENTION PATCHY AREAS 
OF 4SM FOG AND PATCHY FROST IN ZONES.

CONDITIONS GREATLY IMPROVE TOMORROW AS THE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT ARE 
WELL OFF TO OUR NORTHEAST. MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES ARE EXPECTED WITH HIGH 
TEMPS A FEW DEGREES COOLER DUE TO THE FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH MID TO UPPER 
60S SOUTH...MID 60S CENTRAL...AND UPPER 50S TO NEAR 60 NORTH. MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES SUNDAY NIGHT WITH LOWS ONCE AGAIN IN THE UPPER 30S NORTH 
TO NEAR 40 SOUTH.


.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MONDAY STARTS OUT DRY WITH A
FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE. HOWEVER...CLOUDS AND SOME LIGHT SHOWERS
WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER NORTHERN SECTIONS ON TUESDAY AS AN AMPLIFIED
UPPER TROUGH BUILDS INTO THE EASTERN U.S. AS MODELS HAVE BEEN
ADVERTISING...MORE ENERGY DROPS INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE LONG WAVE
TROUGH ON WEDNESDAY BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR A FEW SHOWERS
ACROSS THE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE TROUGH
WILL BE VERY SLOW TO LIFT OUT SO BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL BE
A MAIN FEATURE OF THE FORECAST THROUGH THE WORK WEEK WITH A SLIGHT
WARMING TREND POSSIBLE BY SATURDAY AS THE EASTERN TROUGH EDGES EAST
TO THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD. IT WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR FREEZING
TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AS WELL
AS TERRAIN ABOVE 3000 FEET FARTHER SOUTH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
953 AM EDT SAT OCT 19 2013

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE MOSTLY ON TRACK THIS 
MORNING. SURFACE OBS STILL SHOWING COLD FRONT BACK ACROSS WESTERN 
TN. SHOWERS ALONG THE FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST THROUGH THE 
DAY BUT MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY WILL LIFT JUST TO OUR NORTH AS THE 
BASE OF THE TROUGH LIFTS NORTH AS WELL. HOWEVER...MOST AREAS CAN 
STILL EXPECT TO SEE SOME PATCHY AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN AND DRIZZLE WITH 
BETTER CHANCES BEING ACROSS OUR NORTHERN MOST AREAS. CLOUD COVER 
SHOULD HANG IN THROUGH THE REST OF THE DAY HELPING TO KEEP TEMPS A 
FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL

THE ONLY CHANGES MADE TO THE FORECAST WERE TO KNOCK THE WINDS DOWN A 
BIT. MODELS SHOW THE CORE OF THE 850MB JET LIFTING JUST TO OUR 
NORTH. ALSO, SHOWERS LOOK TO BE ON THE LIGHTER SIDE THEREFORE MAKING 
IT HARDER FOR THEM TO PULL THESE FASTER WINDS ALOFT DOWN TO THE 
SURFACE. WILL SEND OUT UPDATE TO ZONES SHORTLY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   71  40  67  40  73 /  20   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     69  39  64  37  71 /  20   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             69  39  65  38  71 /  20   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    66  37  61  37  68 /  30   0   0   0   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

571 
FXUS64 KMRX 190702
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT SAT OCT 19 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT OVER CENTRAL KY AND WEST TN...GENERALLY ALONG A 
CINCINNATI TO MEMPHIS LINE. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY 
MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING...AND ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA AROUND NOON. WESTERLY WINDS WILL INCREASE THIS 
AFTERNOON BEHIND THIS FRONT...BUT TEMPS SHOULD NOT FALL MUCH UNTIL 
AFTER SUNSET. CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF 
CLOUDS OVER THE SOUTHEAST AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT AND WITH THE 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BEHIND IT. THUS...WILL PLAN TO MENTION MOSTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES THROUGHOUT THE DAY...WITH CLEARING SKIES EXPECTED AFTER 
SUNSET. MODEL ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL CREATE SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS...BUT RAINFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LIGHT. WILL 
MENTION LOW CHANCE POPS AREAWIDE TODAY...WITH SOME PATCHY FROST 
POSSIBLE LATER TONIGHT AS TEMPS FALL INTO THE 30S BEFORE SUNRISE. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...IN WAKE OF THE FRONT THAT WILL 
MOVE INTO THE REGION ON SATURDAY...A STOUT NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT 
WILL HELP TO REINFORCE SOME COOLER AIR INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS FOR SUNDAY. THIS WILL RESULT IN HIGH TEMPERATURES IN 
THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S DESPITE THE ABUNDANT SUNSHINE. THE REAL 
NOTICEABLE CHANGE WILL BE AT NIGHT WHEN GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING 
WILL DROP LOWS INTO THE MID TO UPPER 30S IN MANY LOCATIONS. WILL 
CONTINUE TO MONITOR FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A FREEZE SUNDAY NIGHT... 
THOUGH THINK TEMPERATURES SHOULD MOSTLY STILL IN THE 35-40 DEGREE 
RANGE WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND A FEW SHELTERED 
AREAS SUSCEPTIBLE TO COLD AIR DRAINAGE. HOWEVER...THINK THAT A FROST 
ADVISORY COULD BE NEEDED LATE SUNDAY NIGHT SO WILL MONITOR LATER 
MODEL GUIDANCE TO DETERMINE THIS. ON MONDAY...SURFACE WINDS WILL 
SHIFT TO THE SOUTH...RESULTING IN A BRIEF WARM UP BEFORE ANOTHER 
COUPLE OF WEAK FRONTS AND SOME ADDITIONAL COOLER AIR MOVES IN 
TUESDAY AND THEN AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY. THIS SECONDARY PUSH OF EVEN 
COOLER AIR WILL KNOCK HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S AND LOWER 60S AND LOWS 
IN THE 30S FOR THE MIDDLE TO LATER HALF OF THE WORK WEEK. THINK THAT 
THE FIRST FREEZE OF THE SEASON WILL BE POSSIBLE /AT LEAST ACROSS 
PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/ BY THURSDAY 
OR FRIDAY GIVEN THE CLEAR/CALM/DRY NIGHTS EXPECTED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   71  40  67  40  73 /  20   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     69  39  64  37  71 /  20   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             69  39  65  38  71 /  20   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    66  37  61  37  68 /  30   0   0   0   0
