505 
FXUS64 KMRX 181904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT FRI OCT 18 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT SEEING MUCH SIGNIFICANT 
WEATHER CONCERNS FOR THESE PERIODS...AS A STEADY INCREASE IN CLOUDS 
OVERNIGHT INHIBITS FOG DEVELOPMENT. SOME CHILLY MIN TEMPS FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT POSSIBLY AS LOW AS MID TO UPPER 30S IN SHELTERED 
HIGHER VALLEYS. HOWEVER...LIGHT NW WINDS BEHIND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE 
CERTAINLY DON'T FAVOR MUCH FROST FOR SUNDAY MORNING. COORDINATED 
WITH NWS NEIGHBORS AND FOUND SIMILAR THINKING...SO WON'T MENTION 
FROST JUST YET. COLDER MINS BY SUNDAY NIGHT LOOK MORE FAVORABLE...
AND THIS IS ALREADY HIGHLIGHTED IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK.

HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LEVEL JET ARE ALREADY STREAMING 
ACROSS THE REGION. MID LAYER CLOUDS WILL INCREASE LATER TONIGHT WITH 
THE APPROACH OF THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING ACROSS THE MS 
VALLEY REGION. ADDED A DEGREE OR TWO TO THE GFS MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT 
DUE TO ANTICIPATED CLOUDS.

MODELS SEEM QUITE CONSISTENT ON LIMITED RAIN CHANCES WITH FRONT ON 
SATURDAY...BUT I DID NUDGE SW VA POPS UP TO LOW CHANCE. KEEPING BULK 
OF SE TN DRY WITH SPRINKLES MENTIONED FOR CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES OF 
E TN. CLEARING SKIES FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND MOSTLY SUNNY ON SUNDAY. 
BLENDED THE SIMILAR MOS MINS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...AND THINKING AT 
LEAST AS WARM AS GFS MOS MAXES FOR SUNDAY. ALL IN ALL A GREAT 
WEEKEND!


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...AT THE MOMENT...THIS 
PERIOD OF THE FORECAST IS LOOKING RATHER INACTIVE WITH A 
SOUTHWESTERLY UPPER LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPING INTO TUESDAY AS A LONG 
WAVE TROUGH AMPLIFIES AS IT DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF THE CANADIAN 
PRAIRIES INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND MIDWESTERN U.S. DRY WEATHER WITH 
PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND A TYPICAL TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL MID 
OCTOBER TEMPERATURE REGIME WILL EXIST BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY. BY 
TUESDAY MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ENOUGH FOR SOME CLOUD COVER BUT THIS 
SYSTEM LOOKS A BIT MOISTURE STARVED WITH LIMITED LOW LEVEL RELATIVE 
HUMIDITY. THUS...STAYED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NORTHERN 
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. BOTH THE EUROPEAN AND GFS HINT AT A 
TRAILING SHORT WAVE FOR SOME LIGHT QPF ON WEDNESDAY MAINLY ACROSS 
THE OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. KEPT A DRY FORECAST ON 
WEDNESDAY FOR NOW AWAITING LATER MODEL RUNS TO DETERMINE IF POPS 
SHOULD BE INCLUDED WITH THE TRAILING MID WEEK WAVE. UPPER TROUGH 
HANGS OUT ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. INTO THE END OF THE WORK WEEK WITH 
THE POSSIBILITY OF DRY...ALBEIT COLDER CONDITIONS WITH HIGHS SEVERAL 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT FRI OCT 18 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH A COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS SLOWLY MOVING INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA. WITH THE RECENT RAINFALL...LIGHT WINDS...AND 
CLEARING SKIES...WILL CONTINUE THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY THIS 
MORNING...ALTHOUGH THERE ARE STILL SOME CONCERNS WITH HOW WIDESPREAD 
THIS DENSE FOG CAN BECOME EAST OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WITH CLOUDS 
SLOW TO COMPLETELY DISSIPATE AND WINDS NOT COMPLETELY CALM. OUTSIDE 
OF THIS MORNING'S FOG...EXPECT TRANQUIL CONDITIONS TODAY AND TONIGHT 
AS HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE REGION. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
AND WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A BROAD TROUGH MOVING 
THROUGH THE EASTERN CONUS WILL DRAG ANOTHER FRONT THROUGH THE AREA 
AND BRING WITH IT ANOTHER SHOT OF COOLER AUTUMN AIR INTO THE REGION 
ON SATURDAY. GIVEN THE LACK OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE...AM NOT EXPECTING 
MUCH /IF ANY/ IN THE WAY OF PRECIPITATION. STILL...SOME ISOLATED 
SPOTTY SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE DURING THE DAY ON SATURDAY...BEFORE 
THE FRONT CLEARS THE REGION LATER THAT EVENING. IN ITS WAKE...THE 
AFOREMENTIONED COOLER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION WHICH COULD 
RESULT IN SOME HIGHER ELEVATIONS LOCATIONS AND OTHER SHELTERED AREAS 
SUSCEPTIBLE TO COLD AIR DRAINAGE TO APPROACH THE FREEZING MARK AS 
LOWS WILL BOTTOM OUT IN THE 30S IN MANY LOCATIONS. WINDS WILL SHIFT 
TO THE SOUTH BY MONDAY...RESULTING IN A BRIEF WARM UP BEFORE ANOTHER 
WEAK FRONT AND SOME ADDITIONAL COOLER AIR MOVES IN TUESDAY/TUESDAY 
NIGHT. THIS WILL RESULT IN HIGHS IN THE UPPER 50S AND LOWER 60S AND 
LOWS IN THE 30S FOR THE MIDDLE TO LATER HALF OF THE WORK WEEK. WITH 
THE LACK OF MOISTURE...THIS FRONT SHOULD BE DRY AS WELL AND HAVE 
MAINTAINED SILENT POPS FOR NOW.

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR 
SLOWLY MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN THIS

HOW CALM THE WINDS WILL BECOME BEFORE SUNRISE. THUS...WILL BE A 
LITTLE CONSERVATIVE WITH THE EXPECTED VISIBILITIES AT KCHA AND KTYS 
LATER THIS MORNING...AND WILL MENTION ONLY IFR VISIBILITIES AT KCHA 
AND LIFR CONDITIONS AT KTYS. SINCE DENSE FOG DEVELOPMENT AT KTRI IS 
EASY THIS TIME OF YEAR...WILL MENTION VLIFR CONDITIONS TOWARDS 
SUNRISE. OTHERWISE...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED 
THROUGHOUT THE REST OF THE TAF PERIOD AT ALL THREE TAF SITES.

497 
FXUS64 KMRX 180157 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
957 PM EDT THU OCT 17 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS ARE GRADUALLY CLEARING FROM THE WEST BEHIND AN EXITING COLD
FRONT. HOWEVER SURFACE DEWPOINTS UPSTREAM ARE STILL IN THE MID TO
UPPER 40S...AND WINDS ARE LIGHT...SO WE ARE NOT GOING TO SEE STRONG
DRY AIR ADVECTION OVERNIGHT. WITH THE MOIST GROUND FROM EARLIER
RAINFALL...AREAS OF DENSE FOG ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP. CONFIDENCE
OF FOG IS HIGHEST IN THE PLATEAU WHERE SKIES ARE ALREADY
CLEAR...BUT WILL ISSUE A DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE AREA
WITH ADDITIIONAL CLEARING IN THE EASTERN SECTIONS EXPECTED IN THE
NEXT FEW HOURS. SOME SMALL ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMP/DEWPOINT GRIDS WILL
BE MADE TO BRING THEM IN LINE WITH OBSERVATIONS.

FXUS64 KMRX 171909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EDT THU OCT 17 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...INTENSITY OF SHOWERS ALONG 
THE COLD FRONT HAS INCREASED OVER SE TN...BUT NO LIGHTNING STRIKES 
INDICATED YET. BEST COVERAGE OF LINGERING SHOWERS AND PERHAPS AN 
ISOLATED TSRA...WILL BE BEFORE 8PM EDT. OTHERWISE...TRENDED CLOSE
TO PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS IN TIMING THE END OF THE RAIN BEFORE
MIDNIGHT. IF MODELS ARE CORRECT IN PARTIAL CLEARING THEN THE
STAGE MAY BE SET FOR AREAS OF DENSE FOG TO FORM. I PUT IN SOME
PATCHY DENSE FOG WITH VISBY 1/4 MILE IN THE TYPICALLY FAVORED SPOTS
BY 09Z FRIDAY. DUE TO FOG FORMATION...I CHOSE TO GO AROUND A DEGREE
OR SO ABOVE THE GFS MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT.

GENERALLY NO REAL CHANGES FOR FRIDAY OR FRIDAY NIGHT WITH DRY 
WEATHER AND NEAR SEASONAL TEMPS. I DID CARRY THE PATCHY DENSE FOG 
JUST INTO MID MORNING FRIDAY...AND BROUGHT IN MORE CLOUDINESS LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. EXPECTING A FEW SPOTS OF FOG AGAIN LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT UNCERTAINTY DUE TO THE POTENTIAL INCREASING 
CLOUDS. 

RAIN CHANCES ON SATURDAY ARE NOT TOO GREAT AT THIS POINT...AND ARE 
DUE TO SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE MID MS AND OHIO RIVER 
VALLEYS. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL REINFORCE OUR COOLER OR 
SEASONAL TEMPS...BUT FORCING IS NOT THAT SIGNIFICANT. GFS AND NAM 
MODEL SOLUTIONS SUGGEST LOW CHANCE OVER SW VA AND NE TN...WITH ONLY 
SREF SOLUTIONS SPREADING LIGHT QPF OVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
KEPT THE CENTRAL AND SRN VALLEYS OF E TN DRY FOR NOW...WITH 20 TO 30 
PERCENTS POPS ELSEWHERE FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON. TRENDED CLOSE TO GFS 
MAX TEMPS EACH DAY.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE 12Z RUNS OF THE 
GFS/ECMWF CAME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THIS PERIOD OF THE 
FORECAST. A MOISTURE STARVED SHORT WAVE MOVES OUT SATURDAY NIGHT 
WITH THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW FLATTENING OUT IN ITS WAKE. A NICE LARGE 
SURFACE HIGH AND DRY AIR SHOULD KEEP ANY PRECIP AWAY THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT. HOWEVER...AN AMPLIFYING UPPER TROUGH BUILDS INTO THE EASTERN 
STATES TUESDAY WITH ADDITIONAL ENERGY DROPPING INTO THE MEAN TROUGH 
ON WEDNESDAY. THIS SYSTEM APPEARS TO LACK DEEP MOISTURE AND 
THEREFORE KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR SHOWERS TUESDAY INTO 
TUESDAY NIGHT. SOME UNCERTAINTY IN THE FORECAST WEDNESDAY INTO 
THURSDAY CONSIDERING THE IMPACT OF THE TRAILING WAVE BUT THIS 
FEATURE LOOKS MOISTURE STARVED AS WELL SO DID NOT MENTION PRECIP FOR 
WEDNESDAY OR THURSDAY. FALL IS IN THE AIR AND GENERALLY KEPT MAX AND 
MIN TEMPS A FEW DEGREES BELOW THE SEASONAL NORM FOR MID OCTOBER 
ESPECIALLY LATE IN THE PERIOD AS THE AMPLIFIED DEPARTING TROUGH 
PULLS SOME FRESH CANADIAN AIR INTO THE REGION.

UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES. THERE WILL ALSO BE AN AXIS OF WEAK ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY THROUGH 18/00Z. THUS...I WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS WHERE MENTIONED IN THE EASTERN SECTIONS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
414 AM EDT THU OCT 17 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK COLD FRONT LIES OVER
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. SATELLITE PICTURES SHOW CONSTANT STREAM
OF GULF AND PACIFIC MOISTURE FLOWING INTO REGION FROM THE
SOUTHWEST. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH DIGGING SOUTH THROUGH THE CENTRAL
PLAINS AND MID MS VALLEY WITH SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING ALONG FRONT
FROM THE SOUTHWEST WILL ENHANCE RAIN SHOWER ACTIVITY THIS MORNING
AND INTO THE AFTERNOON. RAIN SHOULD DECREASE WEST THIS AFTERNOON
AND EASTERN AREAS BY EARLY EVENING BEFORE ENDING AS DRIER AIR MASS
MOVES IN BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. AIR MASS BECOMES SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE
IN THE NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON SO ADDED SLIGHT
CHANCE THUNDER THERE. TEMPERATURES NOW NEAR 60 TO THE MID 60S ARE
NEAR LOWS FOR THIS MORNING AND WILL ONLY RISE A FEW DEGREES AS RAIN
KEEPS TEMPERATURES DOWN. THEN COLDER DRIER AIR MASS BEHIND FRONT WORKS
IN BY AFTERNOON. MUCH COLDER TONIGHT WITH CLEARING SKIES FROM WEST
TO EAST. LOWS FALL INTO THE 40S. WINDS TO DROP OFF THIS EVENING
BEHIND FRONT AND PATCHY FOG SHOULD FORM IN ALL AREAS AS GROUND WILL
BE WET FROM TODAYS RAINFALL.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND 
DRIER AIR MASS BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST FRIDAY WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR 
NORMAL. STRONG JET SEGMENT SWINGS THROUGH THE OH VALLEY ON 
SATURDAY. ANOTHER STRONG JET SEGMENT MOVES NE THROUGH THE SE U.S. 
THESE FEATURES WILL DRIVE COLD FRONT THROUGH THE TN VALLEY LATER ON 
SATURDAY WITH MILD WARM UP IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. AVAILABLE 
MOISTURE IN QUESTION SO PRECIPITATION CHANCES REMAIN LOW. SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE...DRY AIR MASS AND NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES CAN BE 
EXPECTED SUNDAY AND MONDAY. PATTERN BECOMING INCREASINGLY AMPLIFIED 
INTO THE MID RANGE. NEXT COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH LATE TUESDAY AND 
ONCE AGAIN APPEARS TO HAVE LIMITED MOISTURE. STRONG COLD AIR 
ADVECTION GETS UNDERWAY BY MID WEEK AND CONTINUES INTO NEXT WEEKEND. 
GFS CURRENTLY DEPICTING SUB ZERO H85 TEMPERATURES DOWN THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS INTO NEXT WEEKEND. ECMWF NOT QUITE AS COLD.

583 
FXUS64 KMRX 161926
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EDT WED OCT 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL
CONTINUE TO PUSH EAST TOWARDS THE AREA THROUGH THE NIGHT. LIGHT
ISOLATED SHOWERS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS FRONT IN THE
LATER AFTERNOON HOURS...WITH THE MAIN AREA OF PRECIP ARRIVING ON
THE PLATEAU IN THE EARLY EVENING. MODELS HAVE CONSISTENTLY SHOWED
THE FRONT SLOWING DOWN...SO PUSHED TIMING OF POPS BACK FROM
PREVIOUS FORECAST ISSUANCES. WITH WEAK INSTABILITIES AND A MOIST
ATMOSPHERIC PROFILE...RAIN LOOKS TO BE THE ONLY FORM OF CONVECTION
EXPECTED THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT.

ANOTHER WAVE OF GEOSTROPHIC FORCING WILL MAKE ITS WAY UP THE COASTAL 
STATES TOWARDS OUR AREA...BRINGING A HIGHER CHANCE FOR PRECIP AND 
HIGH RAINFALL AMOUNTS FOR THURSDAY. INSTABILITIES AND WINDS FAIRLY 
WEAK ON THURSDAY...SO AGAIN ONLY EXPECT PRECIP. THE FRONT WILL EXIT 
THE REGION IN THE LATE HOURS THURSDAY. UPSLOPE FLOW IS EXPECTED WITH 
THE BEST CHANCES FOR ANY RAIN ON THURSDAY EVENING IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. 

OVERCAST SKIES WILL BE PRESENT THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. WITH 
THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE PRESENT IN THE LOW LEVELS AND WEAK 
WINDS...EXPECT FOG DEVELOPMENT IN THE EARLY MORNING HOURS ON 
THURSDAY...ESPECIALLY IN AREAS THAT RECEIVED HEAVY RAINFALL. 
TEMPERATURES WILL COOL BEHIND THIS FRONT TO SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL. 


.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...THESE PERIODS WILL FIND AN
OVERALL SEMI-PERMANENT SETUP IN THE UPPER LEVELS...WITH A TROUGH IN
EASTERN CANADA AND THE GREAT LAKES...FLANKED BY RIDGES OVER THE
WESTERN ATLANTIC...AND OFF THE PACIFIC COAST. THIS SCENARIO PUTS
OUR AREA INTO A FAIRLY PROGRESSIVE WESTERLY OR NORTHWESTERLY FLOW
WITH A FEW DISTURBANCES THAT WILL PROPAGATE THROUGH THE REGION.

DISTURBANCE #1 LOOKS TO BE ON SATURDAY...BUT MOISTURE LOOKS MAINLY 
NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE AREA...SO KEEPING POPS LOW ON THE EDGES AND 
DRY IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY.  THERE MAY BE ANOTHER WEAK DISTURBANCE 
AROUND MONDAY...AND THEN THE AMPLIFIED TROUGH IS APPROACHING THE 
AREA TOWARD THE END OF THIS PERIOD WITH A STRONGER FRONT.

WE SHOULD ALSO HAVE SEVERAL WEAK SHOTS OF COOLER AIR THAT WILL GET 
US CLOSER TO SEASONAL AVERAGE TEMPERATURES FOR THESE DAYS.  THERE 
WILL BE LITTLE TIME TO RECOVER DEEP/RICH MOISTURE BETWEEN ALL THESE 
SYSTEMS...SO NOT ONLY SHOULD THERE BE NO SEVERE WEATHER...BUT WILL 
KEEP THE LIMITED PRECIP AS JUST SHOWERS AS WELL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EDT WED OCT 16 2013

...CORRECTED EXTENDED PART OF FORECAST DISCUSSION...

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SKIES HAVE BEEN PARTLY TO
MOSTLY CLOUDY EARLY THIS MORNING WITH SOME BREAKS SOUTHEAST AND
NORTHEAST SECTIONS. PATCHY FOG IS POSSIBLE THERE AS AIR MASS
MOISTENS. SURFACE MAP SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE STILL ALONG THE EAST
COAST AND EXTENDING SOUTHWEST INTO GA AND AL. LOW PRESSURE LIES
OVER THE NW GREAT LAKES AND A WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDED SOUTH
THROUGH THE WESTERN OHIO AND TN VALLEYS TO THE TX GULF COAST. AS IT
HAS OVER THE LAST 24 HOURS THE COLD FRONT WILL MAKE SLOW PROGRESS
EAST TODAY AND TONIGHT ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS NOT
REACHING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU SECTION UNTIL LATE TONIGHT. RAINFALL
AHEAD AND ALONG THE FRONT TO THE WEST HAS BEEN VERY LIGHT SO FAR.
AS A RESULT HAVE LOWERED POPS AND SLOWED THE PROGRESSION EAST EVEN
MORE TODAY. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING ARE IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER
60S AND THESE READINGS SHOULD ONLY LOWER A FEW MORE DEGREES BEFORE
SUNRISE. TEMPERATURES TUESDAY WERE IN THE LOWER TO MID 70S WITH
HIGHS WARMEST IN THE NE. THINK CLOUDS WILL BE MORE WIDESPREAD
NORTHEAST BUT TEMPERATURES WILL BE SIMILAR OTHER AREAS SO WILL
KEEP HIGHS ABOUT THE SAME TODAY IN THE LOWER 70S LOWER
ELEVATIONS...60S HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TONIGHT AS FRONT APPROACHES
RAIN CHANCES INCREASE TO LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL WITH CONTINUED MILD
LOWS IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...COLD FRONT MOVING
THROUGH THE AREA ON THURSDAY WITH GOOD UPPER SUPPORT. WIDESPREAD
AND MODERATELY HEAVY PRECIPITATION CAN BE EXPECTED. SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO AND MOVES EAST ACROSS THE AREA FOR THE
WEEKEND. THIS RELATIVELY DRY AIR MASS WILL COOL TEMPERATURES TO
NEAR NORMAL FOR THE WEEKEND. UPPER JET AXIS REMAINS NORTHWEST OF
THE AREA INTO SAT NIGHT. LOWERED POPS FOR SAT WITH LIMITED
AVAILABLE MOISTURE. SURFACE RIDGE SHIFTS EAST EARLY NEXT WEEK. A
MILD WARM UP WILL BEGIN. SW-NE ORIENTATED STRENGTHENING JET WEST OF
THE ARE MAY BRING A RETURN OF SHOWERS TO SOUTHERN AREAS ON TUE.
MODELS SHOWING DIFFERING SOLUTIONS PERTAINING TO CANADIAN VORTEX SO 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS MODERATE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EDT WED OCT 16 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SKIES HAVE BEEN PARTLY TO
MOSTLY CLOUDY EARLY THIS MORNING WITH SOME BREAKS SOUTHEAST AND
NORTHEAST SECTIONS. PATCHY FOG IS POSSIBLE THERE AS AIR MASS
MOISTENS. SURFACE MAP SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE STILL ALONG THE EAST
COAST AND EXTENDING SOUTHWEST INTO GA AND AL. LOW PRESSURE LIES
OVER THE NW GREAT LAKES AND A WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDED SOUTH
THROUGH THE WESTERN OHIO AND TN VALLEYS TO THE TX GULF COAST. AS IT
HAS OVER THE LAST 24 HOURS THE COLD FRONT WILL MAKE SLOW PROGRESS
EAST TODAY AND TONIGHT ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS NOT
REACHING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU SECTION UNTIL LATE TONIGHT. RAINFALL
AHEAD AND ALONG THE FRONT TO THE WEST HAS BEEN VERY LIGHT SO FAR.
AS A RESULT HAVE LOWERED POPS AND SLOWED THE PROGRESSION EAST EVEN
MORE TODAY. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING ARE IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER
60S AND THESE READINGS SHOULD ONLY LOWER A FEW MORE DEGREES BEFORE
SUNRISE. TEMPERATURES TUESDAY WERE IN THE LOWER TO MID 70S WITH
HIGHS WARMEST IN THE NE. THINK CLOUDS WILL BE MORE WIDESPREAD
NORTHEAST BUT TEMPERATURES WILL BE SIMILAR OTHER AREAS SO WILL
KEEP HIGHS ABOUT THE SAME TODAY IN THE LOWER 70S LOWER
ELEVATIONS...60S HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TONIGHT AS FRONT APPROACHES
RAIN CHANCES INCREASE TO LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL WITH CONTINUED MILD
LOWS IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...COLD FRONT MOVING
THROUGH THE AREA ON THURSDAY WITH GOOD UPPER SUPPORT. WIDESPREAD
AND MODERATELY HEAVY PRECIPITATION CAN BE EXPECTED. SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO AND MOVES EAST ACROSS THE AREA FOR THE
WEEKEND. THIS RELATIVELY DRY AIR MASS WILL COOL TEMPERATURES TO
NEAR NORMAL FOR THE WEEKEND. UPPER JET AXIS REMAINS NORTHWEST OF
THE AREA INTO SAT NIGHT. LOWERED POPS FOR SAT WITH LIMITED
AVAILABLE MOISTURE. SURFACE RIDGE SHIFTS EAST EARLY NEXT WEEK. A
MILD WARM UP WILL BEGIN. SW-NE ORIENTATED STRENGTHENING JET WEST OF
THE ARE MAY BRING A RETURN OF SHOWERS TO SOUTHERN AREAS ON TUE.

315 
FXUS64 KMRX 151853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT TUE OCT 15 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
THE AREA REMAINS SITUATED BETWEEN A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE TO THE
SOUTHWEST OF THE REGION AND AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM OVER THE
NORTHERN PLAINS WHICH WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE FORECAST
AREA TOMORROW. AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM...MID TO HIGH-LEVEL DECKS OF
CLOUDS CONTINUE TO INFILTRATE THE REGION...THOUGH SOME BREAKS IN
THEM AND A SOUTHERLY FLOW HAVE ALLOWED TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB WELL
INTO THE 70S ONCE AGAIN. MODELS HAVE SLOWED THE TIMING OF THIS
SYSTEM AND ITS ASSOCIATED PRECIPITATION...AS BOTH THE NAM AND GFS
DO NOT SHOW ANY QPF SIGNALS APPROACHING THE WESTERN PLATEAU
COUNTIES BEFORE 12Z. AS A RESULT...HAVE SCALED BACK POPS TONIGHT TO
LOW-END CHANCE ALONG THE WESTERN CWA BOUNDARY BETWEEN 06-12Z TO
ACCOUNT ADDITIONALLY...HAVE ONLY A NARROW BAND OF LIKELY POPS IN
THE FAR WEST BEFORE 18Z TOMORROW...BEFORE GRADUALLY INCREASING THEM
BY THE AFTERNOON AS FRONT MOVES IN. CURRENT THINKING IS THAT THE
HEAVIEST PRECIPITATION WILL BE 00Z THURSDAY AND BEYOND...AS
PRECIPITATION MAY BE ON THE LIGHTER SIDE INITIALLY WITH THE
WEAKENING BOUNDARY. ALSO...GIVEN THE SLOWER PROGRESS OF THE
FRONT...THINK TEMPERATURES MAY BE ABLE TO REACH THE LOWER 70S
ACROSS THE VALLEY...BEFORE THE BLAST OF COOLER AIR MOVES IN FOR
THURSDAY.


.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL BEGIN WITH A FRONT STALLED NEAR THE 
AREA. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL LIFT NE FROM THE PLAINS TO THE 
GREAT LAKES...WHICH WILL ENHANCE LIFT ALONG THE STALLED FRONT LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THE NAM IS MUCH MORE ENTHUSIASTIC WITH 
LIFT OVER THE AREA ON THURSDAY THAN THE GFS...WITH A LARGE SPREAD IN 
MOS POPS BETWEEN THE TWO. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE HIGHER NAM 
POPS...CATEGORICAL SOUTH TO LIKELY ELSEWHERE THURSDAY MORNING. THE 
SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH QUICKLY...WITH ALL POPS ENDING BY 06Z FRIDAY. 
WITH THE FRONT PUSHING TO OUR EAST...A COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS 
BUILDS IN ON FRIDAY.

THE LATEST GFS MODEL RUNS HAVE TRENDED TOWARD A SHARPER TROUGH THAT 
WILL BRING PRECIP TO THE SOUTHEAST ON SATURDAY. IT HAS BEEN TRENDING 
TOWARD THE ECMWF...WHICH HAS BEEN CONSISTENTLY SHOWING A MORE 
AMPLIFIED TROUGH EACH RUN FOR THE PAST FEW DAYS. THE GEFS MEMBERS 
ARE IN MUCH BETTER AGREEMENT TODAY...SHOWING A SWATH OF PRECIP OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND NOTHERN GA ON SATURDAY. WHILE WETTER 
THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...THE OPERATIONAL GFS REMAINS A DRY OUTLIER 
COMPARED TO THE ENSEMBLE MEMBERS AND ENSEMBLE MEAN...AS IT 
SUPPRESSES PRECIP FARTHER SOUTH. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE ENSEMBLE 
SOLUTION. AS A RESULT...WILL INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY IN SOUTHEASTERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA FOR SATURDAY. 

A BROAD UPPER TROUGH REMAINS OVER THE EASTERN CONUS FOR THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST. GULF MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE SUPPRESSED WELL SOUTH OF 
THE AREA. WILL HAVE A DRY FORCAST SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WITH 
TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  74  60  67  46 /  30  60  70  80  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  57  72  57  68  45 /  10  50  50  80  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  71  55  65  44 /  20  60  50  70  10

.DISCUSSION...
LATE THIS MORNING...WINDS HAVE BEGUN TO SHIFT TO THE SOUTH AND
SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING STORM SYSTEM OVER THE
NORTHERN/CENTRAL PLAINS THAT WILL PUSH A FRONT TOWARD THE REGION
TOMORROW. THE SUBTROPICAL RIDGE HAS SHIFTED BACK TO THE SOUTHWEST
AND STRONG SOUTHWEST/WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT HAS ALLOWED FOR SOME DECKS
OF MID/HIGH CLOUDS TO MOVE IN ACROSS THE REGION AHEAD OF THIS STORM
SYSTEM. DESPITE THIS CLOUD COVER...SOME BREAKS IN IT ALONG WITH THE
SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO ONCE AGAIN CLIMB INTO THE
MID TO PERHAPS UPPER 70S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS BY THIS
AFTERNOON. SOME ISOLATED HIGH-BASED SHOWERS COULD DEVELOP OVER
MIDDLE TENNESSEE LATE THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THINK THIS ACTIVITY WILL
REMAIN WEST OF THE PLATEAU AND HAVE MAINTAINED THE SILENT POPS IN
THE FORECAST.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE

LEVEL FLOW WILL BECOME SOUTHERLY THROUGH THE PERIOD. NEAR NORMAL

RISING TO NEAR 1.50 LATER TONIGHT. TEMPERATURE WILL CONTINUE ABOVE 
NORMAL AND WENT ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE WHICH HAS BEEN UNDERCUTTING 
OBSERVED VALUES LATELY. UPPER RIDGE MOVES EAST TODAY WITH A 
STRENGTHENING WSW MID LEVEL JET GETTING UNDERWAY ACROSS THE TN 
VALLEY. LAYER WILL MOISTEN FROM THE TOP DOWN. LIFT IS FAIRLY WEAK 
THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH LIGHT PRECIPITATION WORKING INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE WEST LATER TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER
THE GREAT LAKES AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS CENTRAL OHIO
VALLEY AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS WEDNESDAY WITH CLOUDS AND INCREASING
SHOWERS. THE FRONT BRINGS IN EXTENSIVE MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTHWEST.
A SECONDARY AREA OF LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS ALONG THE FRONT PROLONGING
THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS THROUGH THURSDAY. THE FRONT AND PRECIPITATION
MOVES EAST THURSDAY NIGHT WITH DECREASING CLOUDS AS HIGHER PRESSURE
BUILDS IN. UPPER TROUGH DIGGING SOUTH FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT OVER
THE PLAINS AND LOW PRESSURE ALONG FRONT IN NORTHWEST GULF BRINGS A
SURGE OF GULF MOISTURE NORTH SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS MAY
BRING A FEW SHOWERS TO THE FORECAST AREA. IMPROVING CONDITIONS AS
SKIES CLEAR SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. TEMPERATURES MUCH COOLER THURSDAY
THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. HIGHS WILL BE MOSTLY IN THE
60S AND LOWS WILL BE IN THE 40S.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
CAROLINAS AND MID ATLANTIC STATES...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY MILD AIR 
MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN 
EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDINESS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...BUT MOST OF 
THIS APPEARS TO BE THIN HIGH CLOUDS WITH SOME BREAKS EXPECTED FROM 
TIME TO TIME. THUS...EXPECT PATCHY DENSE FOG TO DEVELOP LATER 
TOWARDS SUNRISE...ESPECIALLY AROUND THE WATERWAYS.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO MENTION PATCHY DENSE FOG WITH 
VISIBILITIES LESS THAN A FOURTH OF A MILE IN SOME AREAS...AND WILL 
TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

140 
FXUS64 KMRX 141854
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EDT MON OCT 14 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO FLATTEN OVERNIGHT AS AN
UPPER-LOW OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS SHIFTS EAST AND DRAGS A FRONT
SLOWLY TOWARD THE AREA. DESPITE THE CLOUD COVER IS THAT EXPECTED
TO CONTINUE TO FILTER ACROSS THE AREA OVERNIGHT AND AGAIN TOMORROW
AHEAD OF THE AFOREMENTIONED STORM SYSTEM...ONE MORE NIGHT AND DAY
OF FAIRLY MILD AND DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED. GIVEN THE MOIST
BOUNDARY LAYER CONDITIONS... AND CALM WINDS...PATCHY FOG SEEMS
PROBABLE ONCE AGAIN ACROSS THE REGION /ESPECIALLY IN SHELTERED
VALLEYS AND NEAR RIVERS AND LAKES/ AFTER MID NIGHT THROUGH MID-
MORNING. WINDS WILL QUICKLY VEER TO THE SOUTHWEST AFTER SUNRISE AND
INCREASE...ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO ONCE AGAIN REACH THE MID TO
UPPER 70S IN MOST SPOTS BY THE AFTERNOON...UNDER A PARTLY SUNNY
SKY.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BR TRACKING ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS TO 
GREAT LAKES TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...AND PRECIP ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE TRAILING COLD FRONT WILL PUSH INTO OUR AREA LATE TUESDAY 
NIGHT. THE MID-UPPER FLOW REMAINS FAIRLY ZONAL OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST...AND WITH THE LOW PRESSURE CENTER SO FAR NORTH...LIFT 
NEAR THE FRONT WEAKENS AS IT MOVES EAST. SO HIGHEST POPS ON 
WEDNESDAY WILL BE IN WESTERN AREAS...LIKELY POPS WEST TO CHANCE POPS 
EAST. WITH THE FRONT BECOMING ORIENTED PARALLEL TO THE SW UPPER 
FLOW...THE FRONT STALLS NEAR THE APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. NAM 
AND GFS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS SCENARIO.

A SECOND SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS SHOWN BY THE NAM...GFS...AND ECMWF TO 
CROSS THE OHIO VALLEY ON THURSDAY. THIS WILL BRING POPS BACK UP INTO 
THE CHANCE RANGE FOR THURSDAY...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS SOUTHEAST 
CLOSER TO THE STALLED FRONT. THERE ARE SOME MODEL DIFFERENCES IN THE 
AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE...SO WILL NOT RAISE POPS INTO THE 
LIKELY RANGE JUST YET. THE TROUGH MOVES THROUGH QUICKLY...AND DRIER 
AIR BUILDS IN THURSDAY NIGHT. 

FOR THE WEEKEND...THE GFS AND ECMWF DIFFER CONSIDERABLY..SO 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW. THE GFS MAINTAINS A BROAD UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS WITH VERY LITTLE NORTHWARD MOISTURE ADVECTION FROM THE 
GULF. THE ECMWF HAS A MUCH SHARPER TROUGH...DEEP MOISTURE ADVECTION 
AHEAD OF A FRONT FOR SATURDAY...AND A PRONOUNCED COLD FROPA SATURDAY 
NIGHT. THERE IS ALSO A WIDE SPREAD AMONG THE GEFS MEMBERS...WITH 
ONLY ONE MEMBER RESEMBLING THE ECMWF. THE GFS IS PREFERED AT THIS 
TIME...BUT WILL MAINTAIN THE CURRENT FORECAST OF A SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
FOR SAT/SAT NIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR THE ECMWF.

OVERNIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 131843
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 PM EDT SUN OCT 13 2013

.SHORT TERM....SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CLOUD COVER WILL CONTINUE TO 
INCREASE OVER THE AREA FROM AN UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVING OFF THE EAST 
COAST. MOISTURE WRAPPED AROUND FROM THIS LOW...AS WELL AS WEAK 
FORCING FROM A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE TN VALLEY WILL CAUSE 
LIGHT SHOWERS TO DEVELOP IN THE AFTERNOON...MAINLY IN AREAS NORTH OF 
I-40. INSTABILITIES AND WINDS ARE VERY WEAK...SO EXPECT ONLY A 
COUPLE OF TENTHS OF AN INCH OF ACCUMULATION WITH THESE SHOWERS. THIS 
ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO END IN THE LATE EVENING AS THE FRONT MOVES 
EAST OF THE SMOKIES. A MOIST LAYER IS PRESENT INTO THE MIDLEVELS FOR 
THE OVERNIGHT HOURS...WITH DENSE FOG POSSIBLE IN THE EARLY HOURS 
MONDAY MORNING. FOR THE REST OF THE DAY MONDAY...SKIES WILL SLOWLY 
BEGIN TO CLEAR AND WINDS WILL REMAIN LIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN 
A COUPLE OF DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. 


.LONG TERM /MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY/...
ONE LAST WARM AND DRY DAY IS EXPECTED ON TUESDAY BEFORE AN UPPER-
RIDGE FLATTENS AND MOVES BACK TOWARD THE SOUTH AND WEST. THIS WILL
ALLOW A COLD FRONT TO APPROACH THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT...AND MOVE
INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BRINGING A GOOD
CHANCE OF SHOWERS TO THE AREA. THE ECMWF IS STILL IS A LITTLE
SLOWER...BUT THE NAM HAS COME IN LINE WITH THE GFS WHICH HAD BEEN
TRENDING FASTER. AS SUCH...HAVE INCREASED POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AND
REORIENTED THE HIGHER POPS OVER THE EASTERN ZONES WEDNESDAY NIGHT
TO REFLECT THE FRONT MOVING EAST. HAVE MAINTAINED CHANCE POPS FOR
THURSDAY...GIVEN SOME UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING...BUT DO FEEL THIS MAY
NEED TO ADJUSTED IN LATER FORECASTS SHOULD AN EARLIER FRONTAL
PASSAGE SEEM MORE LIKELY AS DRIER AIR WILL FILTER IN QUICKLY BEHIND
THIS SYSTEM. CLEARING WILL OCCUR THURSDAY AFTERNOON/NIGHT INTO
FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT AS COOLER/DRIER AIR MOVES IN...RESULTING IN
HIGHS RUNNING 10 TO 15 DEGREES COOLER. MODELS DISAGREE ABOUT
ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM AND PRECIP CHANCES LATE IN THE WEEK...SO FOR
NOW HAVE LOW MENTIONABLE POPS FOR SATURDAY/SATURDAY NIGHT.

&&

BE TIMING DIFFERENCES BETWEEN MODELS AND RUNS SO CONFIDENCE REMAINS 
TOO LOW TO INCREASE POPS TO LIKELY FOR ANY PARTICULAR DAY.  
HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE IS HIGH THAT THERE WILL BE A BAND OF SHOWERS 
MOVING THROUGH IN ADVANCE OF THE SYSTEM.  HAVE TRIED TO GO WITH A 
BLENDED SOLUTION FOR NOW AND HAVE TRENDED HIGHEST POPS TOWARDS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THOUGH CHANCE POPS WILL REMAIN SPREAD OVER THE 
AREA FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.  MODELS DIVERGE FURTHER FOR 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AND CONFIDENCE QUIET LOW FOR THIS PERIOD.  
THEREFORE...WILL MAKE LITTLE CHANGE TO THE FORECAST AND HAVE 
CONTINUED WITH DRY CONDITIONS FOR NOW.

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND SUNDAY...

FOR LIGHT RAIN AS SHORTWAVE TRANSLATES ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND CENTRAL

MODELS CRANK OUT MEASURABLE PRECIP GENERALLY NORTH OF I-40.

IN WAKE OF A WEAK FRONT CLEARING THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT...A
RETURN OF MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL RESULT IN PATCHY FOG
DEVELOPMENT BY EARLY MONDAY MORNING AND ANOTHER WARM START TO THE
WORK WEEK WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THE MAIN
FORECAST CONCERN CONTINUES TO BE THE STORM SYSTEM PROGGED TO IMPACT
THE REGION DURING THE MIDDLE TO LATER PART OF THE WORK WEEK. THE
LATEST RUN OF THE GFS CONTINUES TO SHOW THE FRONT AND ASSOCIATED
PRECIPITATION MOVING INTO THE REGION LATE WEDNESDAY AND
OVERSPREADING THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. THE ECMWF
IS SLIGHTLY SLOWER IN THE TIMING... BUT STILL SHOWS A
THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME OF THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. AS
SUCH...HAVE MAINTAINED THE HIGHEST POPS ON WEDNESDAY
NIGHT/THURSDAY...BUT HAVE HELD OFF ON GOING LIKELY JUST YET GIVEN
THE TIMING UNCERTAINTIES. STILL HAVE CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT
GIVEN THE POTENTIAL FOR A LATER FRONTAL PASSAGE...BUT SHOW GOOD
CLEARING FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT GIVEN THE DRIER AIR PROGGED TO
MOVE IN. NEXT SATURDAY IS STILL A BIT UNCERTAIN GIVEN THE HIGH
MODEL SPREAD ON THE LOCATION OF ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM...SO FOR NOW
HAVE OPTED TO KEEP POPS SILENT. IN WAKE OF THE FRONT PASSAGE BY THE
END OF THE WEEK...COOLER AUTUMN AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION...
RESULTING IN HIGHS RUNNING 10 TO 15 DEGREES COOLER.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT SAT OCT 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SLOW MOVING LOW PRESSURE CONTINUES

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LOW TRACKING ALONG THE 
EAST COAST WILL PULL MOISTURE INTO AT LEAST THE NORTHEASTERN AREAS 
OF THE MRX CWA ON SUNDAY.  ADDITIONALLY...A WEAKENING COLD FRONT 
APPROACHING FROM THE WEST WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  
THE COMBINATION OF THESE TWO FEATURES SHOULD PRODUCE ISOLATED 
SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE AREA.  A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE BRIEFLY BUILDS IN BEHIND THE FRONT MONDAY AND TUESDAY FOR A 
RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS.  THE MAIN SYSTEM OF CONCERN FOR THE PERIOD 
CONTINUES TO BE A STRONGER COLD FRONT PROGGED INTO THE AREA BY END 
OF THE EXTENDED.  MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW SOME DIFFERENCES IN TIMING 
AND CONFIDENCE LOW ON DETAILS.  HOWEVER...WITH THE STRENGTH AND DEEP 
MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE...CONFIDENCE IS HIGH THERE 
WILL BE A BAND OF WIDESPREAD SHOWERS MOVING THOUGH AROUND THE 
WEDNESDAY OR THURSDAY TIME FRAME.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN 
WEDNESDAY WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCE OF PRECIP ON THURSDAY.  PRECIP 
SHOULD DECREASE FROM WEST TO EAST THURSDAY NIGHT WITH ONLY A FEW 
LINGERING SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVER FAR EASTERN MOUNTAINS BY FRIDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT FRI OCT 11 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE REGION 
WEAKENS A BIT DURING THE PERIOD...AND THE UPPER LOW WILL REMAIN NEAR 
THE COAST TO OUR EAST AND NORTHEAST. SOME CLOUDS ROTATING AROUND THE 
UPPER LOW ARE EXPECTED TO AFFECT MAINLY NORTHEAST ZONES TONIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY.  OTHERWISE...MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL BE THE RULE. 
JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS...WHICH LOOK REASONABLE 
OVERALL.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE THE PREDOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE
CONTROLLING THE WEATHER ACROSS THE REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS
WILL RESULT IN MAINLY WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS FOR THE THROUGH
TUESDAY...WITH HIGHS PEAKING IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S EACH
DAY. HOWEVER...A WEAK FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY
COULD PROVIDE JUST ENOUGH LIFT TO TRIGGER SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS
OVER SW VIRGINIA/NE TENNESSEE ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON BEFORE CLEARING
THE AREA BY SUNDAY NIGHT. THE MAIN FORECAST CONCERN CONTINUES TO BE
THE STORM SYSTEM PROGGED TO IMPACT THE REGION DURING THE MIDDLE TO
LATER PART OF THE WORK WEEK. THE LATEST RUN OF THE GFS HAS COME
SLIGHTLY SLOWER...BUT IS STILL A BIT FASTER THAN THE ECMWF. GIVEN
THIS TREND...HAVE SCALED BACK POPS A BIT FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY...AND SHOW A BULK OF THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES MOVING IN
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...BEFORE BEGINNING TO TAPER THEM OFF
THURSDAY NIGHT. ALSO...HAVE ADDED LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS FOR
FRIDAY GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY BETWEEN THE MODELS ON WHEN THE FRONT
WILL CLEAR THE AREA. IN WAKE OF THE FRONT...DRIER AND MUCH COOLER
AUTUMN AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE REGION...WITH HIGHS RUNNING 10 TO
15 DEGREES COOLER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EDT THU OCT 10 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE FOR THE SHORT 
TERM AS UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL BE TO OUR WEST...WITH AN UPPER LOW 
MOVING SLOWLY NEAR THE VA COAST.  SOME CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO BRUSH 
NORTHEAST ZONES INTO TONIGHT...BUT SHOULD BE LESS CLOUDS ON FRIDAY. 
OTHERWISE...MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL BE THE RULE. WILL GENERALLY 
USE A BLEND OF MAV/MET TEMPS FOR TONIGHT...AND WILL STAY CLOSE TO 
MAV NUMBERS FOR MAX TEMPS FRIDAY. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... AN UPPER-LEVEL
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE THE PREDOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE
CONTROLLING THE WEATHER ACROSS THE REGION THIS WEEKEND AND EARLY
NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL RESULT IN MAINLY WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS FOR
THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...WITH HIGHS PEAKING IN THE UPPER 70S TO
LOWER 80S EACH DAY. AN UPPER-LOW OFF OF THE VA/NC COAST COULD
RESULT IN SOME CLOUD COVER WORKING ITS BACK BACK INTO THE
REGION...BUT FOR THE MOST PART MOSTLY TO PARTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS
ARE EXPECTED DURING THE DAY...WITH SOME PATCHY FOG POSSIBLE NEAR
AREA LAKES/RIVERS AT NIGHT. THE OTHER FEATURE OF NOTE IS A DRY COLD
FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY...BUT GIVEN THE
LACK OF MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH IT...AM NOT EXPECTED ANY SHOWER
DEVELOPMENT WITH IT. LATE IN THE PERIOD...MODELS DIFFER ON A STORM
SYSTEM PROGGED TO IMPACT THE REGION DURING THE MIDDLE TO LATER HALF
OF NEXT WEEK. THE GFS IS MUCH MORE PROGRESSIVE...SHOWING A FRONT
MOVING IN LATE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AND EXITING THE AREA BY
THURSDAY. THE ECMWF IS MUCH SLOWER AND DOES NOT BRING THE FRONT IN
UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. GIVEN THIS...HAVE BEEN CAUTIOUS ON
ADJUSTING POPS TO MUCH...BUT HAVE STILL GONE WITH SOLID CHANCE POPS
FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY FOR SHOWER DEVELOPMENT ALONG THIS
FRONT. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE LATEST MODEL TRENDS IN LATER
FORECASTS AND ADJUST AS NECESSARY.

275 
FXUS64 KMRX 100639
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 AM EDT THU OCT 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...NOT MUCH CHANGE IS 
EXPECTED OVER THESE FOUR PERIODS...WITH THE UPPER LOW WOBBLING IN 
PLACE OVER THE MID ATLANTIC. MODELS SHOW NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF 
OUR AREA POSSIBLY GETTING BRUSHED BY SOME WEAK LIFT.  BUT AIR MASS 
LOOKS PRETTY DRY OVERALL.  THINKING THAT CONGESTED CUMULUS CLOUDS 
WILL BE ABOUT ALL THAT WILL DEVELOP OVER THIS AREA...SW VA/NE TN.  
FARTHER SOUTHWEST...THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN RESPONSE TO THE 
APPROACHING TROUGH FARTHER WEST.  THIS PUTS US IN A CONFLUENT NWLY 
FLOW ALOFT THAT ALSO FAVORS SUBSIDENCE AND DRY WEATHER. SO WILL KEEP 
THINGS DRY THROUGH THESE PERIODS.  STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS OVER AL/MS 
LOOK LIKE THEY WILL STAY MOSTLY WEST OF US.

FOR TEMPERATURES...WENT PRETTY CLOSE TO GFS MOS GUIDANCE OVERALL.  
BIGGEST EXCEPTION...WENT ABOUT 2-3 DEGREES WARMER ON THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN PLATEAU FRIDAY NIGHT AS WINDS STAY UP A BIT AND HAMPER 
RADIATIONAL COOLING.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
GFS AND ECMWF AGREE THAT HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE THE DOMINANT FEATURE 
FOR THE WEEKEND AND BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. DRY WEATHER AND ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED BENEATH THE RIDGE FOR SATURDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY. THE NAM AND GFS PUSH A COLD FRONT INTO WEST TN/KY 
ON SUNDAY...BUT THERE IS VERY LITTLE MOISTURE AVAILABLE...AND IT 
STALLS/DISSIPATES BEFORE REACHING OUR AREA.

THE MODELS ARE COMING INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THEIR DEPICTIONS OF 
A CLOSED LOW TRACKING EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS TO UPPER MS 
VALLEY FOR TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE ADVECTION IN THE 
SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL BRING INCREASING CLOUDS ON 
TUESDAY...WITH CHANCE POPS IN WESTERN AREAS TUESDAY NIGHT. THE GFS 
TRANSITIONS THE CLOSED LOW INTO AN OPEN WAVE AT 500 MB...AND SO IS A 
BIT FASTER THAN THE ECMWF. IN EITHER CASE...HIGH CHANCE POPS ARE 
WARRANTED FOR WEDNESDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             81  49  82  50  82 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  78  47  79  48  80 /   0   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       79  47  80  47  80 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              71  45  74  42  76 /  10   0   0   0  10

.AVIATION...SURFACE RIDGING OVER THE NE STATES AND OHIO RIVER VALLEY

LOOKS MOIST ENOUGH WHERE WINDS ARE CALM TO ALLOW PATCHY FOG... SOME 
LOCALLY DENSE...TO DEVELOP BEFORE DAYBREAK. THE USUAL PROBLEM AREA 
SHOULD BE TRI...SO ADDED MVFR TO IFR FOG THERE...AND UPPER END OF 
MVFR BRIEFLY AT CHA.

LAKES AND DRIFTING OVER LAND IN LIGHT WINDS.

788 
FXUS64 KMRX 091919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT WED OCT 9 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL BE TO 
OUR WEST...WITH AN UPPER LOW MOVING UP NEAR THE NC COASTLINE.  THIS 
LOW MAY BRING SOME CLOUDS LATER TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY TO MAINLY FAR 
NORTHEAST ZONES. ELSEWHERE EXPECT MAINLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WITH TEMPS 
NOT FAR FROM NORMAL TONIGHT AND BIT ABOVE NORMAL THURSDAY.   

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CLOSED WEAK LOW
JUST OFF NC COAST TO REMAIN IN ABOUT THE SAME PLACE THURSDAY NIGHT
THROUGH FRIDAY AND THEN BEGIN TO WEAKEN FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.
NAM MODEL A LITTLE MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH MOVING THE MOISTURE INTO NE
TN THURSDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. PREFER THE GFS WHICH KEEPS RAIN
EAST OF THE CWA BUT SOME CLOUDS WILL BE IN NE SECTIONS AT TIMES
THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. A FEW SPRINKLES POSSIBLE IN
NE TN FRIDAY OTHERWISE DRY CONDITIONS AS RIDGING ALOFT DOMINATES
THE EASTERN TN VALLEY. THE CLOUDS MAY KEEP THE NE SECTIONS SLIGHTLY
WARMER AT NIGHT AND A DEGREE TWO COOLER DURING THE DAY THROUGH THE
WEEKEND. ELSEWHERE IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS TEMPERATURES WILL BE
SIMILAR TO TODAYS MID TO UPPER 70S WITH LOWER 80S POSSIBLE EXTREME
SOUTH AND LOWS IN THE MID 40S TO LOWER 50S...NEAR NORMAL FOR THIS
TIME OF YEAR.

SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY A DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN STATES 
ALLOWS A COLD FRONT TO MOVE EASTWARD INTO THE MS VALLEY. THIS FRONT 
WEAKENS AND SLOWS SUNDAY AS IT APPROACHES THE EASTERN TN VALLEY AND  
BUMPS INTO THE RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES. THE SURFACE LOW WITH 
THIS SYSTEM MOVES FAR TO THE NORTH INTO CANADA. ANOTHER SURFACE LOW 
ALONG THE SAME FRONT BECOMES MORE DOMINANT AS IT MOVES OUT OF THE 
ROCKIES MONDAY AND HEADS FOR THE MID MS VALLEY TUESDAY. THIS SHOULD 
FINALLY BREAK DOWN THE RIDGE WITH SHOWERS DEVELOPING IN ADVANCE OF 
THE FRONT. THE GFS AND ECMWF STILL DIFFER SLIGHTLY IN THEIR 
DEPICTIONS AND TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM. GFS BRINGS A WELL-DEFINED 
FRONT THROUGH THE CWA WEDNESDAY WITH ENOUGH DYNAMICS FOR SOME 
THUNDERSTORMS. THE ECMWF HAS MORE OF A SPLIT SYSTEM INITIALLY SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AND THEN BRINGS THEM TOGETHER TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS TUESDAY INCREASING TO 
CHANCE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE ALONG AND 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT WEDNESDAY.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 090645
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT WED OCT 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
CLOSED LOW OVER E NC WILL NOT BE A WEATHER MAKER FOR US THROUGH
TONIGHT. THUS OUR WEAK RIDGING WILL BRING ANOTHER COOL MORNING AND
MILD DAY TODAY. FAIR AGAIN TONIGHT. WINDS WILL BE FAIRLY LIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A CLOSED CIRCULATION WILL BE NEARLY STATIONARY OVER NC FOR THE FIRST 
SEVERAL DAYS OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD. THIS WILL PLACE THE TN VALLEY 
UNDER RIDGING...PROVIDING DRY AND MILD CONDITIONS. THE ONLY IMPACT 
THE LOW MAY HAVE IS TO BRING SOME CLOUDS TO SW VA AND NE TN THURSDAY 
THROUGH FRIDAY. THE NAM AND GFS DISAGREE ON THE AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE...AND THUS HAVE LARGE TEMPERATURE DIFFERENCES. WILL LEAN 
TOWARD COOLER TEMPS NE AND WARMER TEMPS ELSEWHERE...ALTHOUGH THE GFS 
MOS LOOKS WAY TOO WARM WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 80S FRIDAY. 

ON MONDAY A TROUGH MOVES EAST ACROSS THE PLAINS...AND THE RIDGE 
BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN. THIS SHOULD BRING INCREASING CLOUDS MONDAY 
NIGHT WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS TUESDAY. THE GFS AND ECMWF DIFFER IN 
THEIR DEPICTIONS AND TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...LOWERING CONFIDENCE. 
GFS IS FASTER WITH A WELL-DEFINED FRONTAL PASSAGE ON TUESDAY...WHILE 
THE ECMWF SHOWS A SPLIT FLOW WITH THE SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE 
BRINGING PRECIP LATE TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP TUESDAY FOR NOW.

126 
FXUS64 KMRX 090217
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 PM EDT TUE OCT 8 2013

DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. MIN TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE SLIGHTLY 
WARMER TONIGHT. CLOUD COVER WILL INCREASE AT TIMES. DEW POINTS HAVE 
RISEN TODAY. SREF ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ARE MAINLY ABOVE FORECAST MINS
SO WILL STAY THE COURSE WITH CURRENT FORECAST. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION: 

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...WILL REMAIN IN A QUIET WEATHER 
PATTERN THROUGH THE SHORT TERM WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE IN 
CONTROL.  THIS WILL KEEP CONDITIONS DRY WITH SEASONAL TEMPERATURES. 

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...EARLY PART OF THE LONG 
RANGE AFFECTED BY THE WEAK UPPER LOW JUST OFF THE FL/GA COAST. 
MODELS SIMILAR IN MOVING THIS CIRCULATION NORTHWARD THROUGH THE 
CAROLINAS TO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES ON THURSDAY...ALTHO THE NAM 
DOES SPREAD SLIGHTLY MORE CLOUDINESS INTO THE SRN APPALACHIANS PLUS 
LIGHT QPF FOR MAINLY NE TN/SW VA ON THURSDAY. MADE A FEW ADJUSTMENTS 
TO ACCOMMODATE AT LEAST A BIT MORE CLOUDS WHILE KEEPING POPS LIMITED 
TO FAR NE AREAS. MIN TEMP WED NIGHT AND MAX TEMP THU ARE CHALLENGING 
AS THE INCREASE IN CLOUDS IS ALSO ACCOMPANIED BY DOWNSLOPE E TO NE 
LOW LEVELS WINDS. LARGE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN MOS GUIDANCE FOR THOSE 
TWO PERIODS...WITH MINS A BIT MILDER AND MAXES MORE OF A MOS BLEND.

THE UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGE HOLD RATHER FIRMLY IN PLACE FOR FRIDAY 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WHICH SHOULD EQUATE TO VERY NICE FALL WEATHER 
WITH SLIGHTLY ABOVE SEASONAL NORMAL TEMPS. A DEVELOPING UPPER TROUGH 
AND WEAK COLD FRONT MAY LEAD TO A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS BY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...TIMING THIS IS STILL UNCERTAIN WITH VERY LOW 
POPS ONLY JUSTIFIED FOR NOW. LITTLE EFFECT ON MAX TEMPS NOTED FOR 
MON OR TUE...BUT MIN TEMPS SHOULD RISE BY A FEW DEGREES IN LINE WITH 
LATEST GFSX MOS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

125 
FXUS64 KMRX 080134 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
934 PM EDT MON OCT 7 2013

.DISCUSSION...
IN WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH THE REGION LAST
NIGHT...A MUCH COOLER AND DRIER AUTUMN-LIKE AIR MASS HAS SETTLED
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. TEMPERATURES THIS EVENING HAVE
ALREADY DROPPED INTO THE 50S IN MOST LOCATIONS AS GOOD RADIATIONAL
COOLING HAS OCCURRED AFTER SUNSET. GIVEN THAT DEWPOINTS ARE STILL IN
THE MID 40S TO AROUND 50 DEGREES...THINK THAT LOWS IN THIS RANGE
SEEM LIKELY FOR LATER TONIGHT IN MANY PLACES...THOUGH SOME SPOTS IN
THE NORTHEAST ZONES COULD SLIP INTO THE LOWER 40S BY DAYBREAK.
THOUGH DRIER AIR IS IN PLACE...GIVEN THE STILL WARM WATER...PATCHY
FOG IN SHELTERED VALLEYS/NEAR LAKES AND RIVERS SEEMS LIKELY GIVEN
THE CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS...SO HAVE ADDED THIS TO THE FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT MON OCT 7 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MOVING INTO A QUITE WEATHER 
PATTERN AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.  THIS WILL BRING  
COOLER...DRIER AIR INTO THE REGION.  LOW TONIGHT ACROSS THE TN 
VALLEY WILL DROP INTO THE 40S TO LOW 50S...HIGHS ON TUESDAY 
GENERALLY IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOW 70S.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS IN BETTER 
AGREEMENT ON THE EARLY PARTS OF THE LONG RANGE NOW...AS 12Z GFS 
MODEL HAS TRENDED MUCH DRIER AND QUITE CLOSE TO THE ECMWF AND NAM.  
THE DIFFERENCES HAD BEEN WITH THE REMAINING WEAK CIRCULATION AND 
MOISTURE OVER FL/GA/SC OVER THE NEXT 2 TO 3 DAYS. LOWERED POPS TO 
JUST SLIGHT CHANCE FOR ERN MOST AREAS FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...THEN 20 TO 
30 PERCENT WEDNESDAY FOR AREAS ADJACENT TO GSP AND FFC GRIDS. 
KEEPING SOME DERGEE OF CLOUDINESS FOR ALL BUT THE FAR NW AREAS 
DURING THESE PERIODS...WHICH WILL ALSO AFFECT AT LEAST MIN TEMP 
FORECAST. PATCHY FOG MAY OCCUR IN THE FAVORED VALLEYS LATE TUESDAY 
NIGHT...ESPECIALLY IF CLOUDS ARE SCATTERED OR LESS IN COVERAGE.

UPPER RIDGE BUILDS FROM LATE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND AND THE AIRMASS 
REMAINS DRY...SO NUDGED MIN TEMPS DOWN A BIT AND MAX TEMPS UP A BIT 
GENERALLY FROM WEDNESDAY NIGHT OUT TO SUNDAY. THIS ALLOWS FOR A 
LARGER DIURNAL RANGE...AND ALSO IN LINE WITH THE TREND FROM 00Z TO 
12Z GFSX MOS. 

OTHERWISE...INTRODUCED NEW DAY 7 (MONDAY) DRY WITH SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS BY MONDAY NIGHT OVER OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES AHEAD OF A POTENTIAL 
COLD FRONT.

FXUS64 KMRX 070132 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
932 PM EDT SUN OCT 6 2013

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE CONTINUES TO SLOWLY DRAG ITS
WAY INTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS EVENING...BRINGING WITH IT
SOME AREAS OF RAIN SHOWERS AND PERHAPS A FEW ISOLATED RUMBLES OF
THUNDER. AN ADDITIONAL PLUME OF GULF MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH
TROPICAL STORM KAREN AS ALSO PUSHED NORTHWARD AND HAS BROUGHT ABOUT
SOME LIGHT RAIN ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST ZONES THIS
EVENING AS WELL. THESE SHOWERS WILL SPREAD INTO THE REGION
OVERNIGHT FROM WEST TO EAST RESULTING IN LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINFALL
ACROSS THE REGION /WITH MOST AREAS RECEIVING BETWEEN ONE-HALF TO
PERHAPS AN INCH OF RAINFALL/. BY DAYBREAK...MOST OF THESE SHOWERS
SHOULD MAINLY BE CONFINED TO THE MOUNTAIN AND FAR NORTHEASTERN
ZONES AS THE FRONT BEGINS TO EXIT THE REGION. IN WAKE OF THE
FRONT...SOME COOLER AIR WILL BEGIN TO FILTER INTO THE
REGION. THIS WILL RESULT IN LOWS DROPPING INTO THE UPPER 40S TO
LOWER 50S ALONG THE PLATEAU BY DAYBREAK...WITH LOCATIONS ACROSS THE
CENTRAL/NORTHEAST ZONES GENERALLY BOTTOMING OUT IN THE MID TO UPPER
50S.

ZONES INCLUDE SEVERE POTENTIAL WORDING FROM LATE AFTERNOON INTO
EVENING. EXPECT FAIRLY RAPID IMPROVEMENT DURING THE MORNING.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...

WEATHER WILL REMAIN FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK. HIGH PRESSURE SETS UP
ACROSS THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT AND STRENGTHENS MID WEEK.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND EACH
DAY. THE NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN LOOKS TO BE MOVING INTO THE AREA AT
THE END OF NEXT WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 AM EDT SUN OCT 6 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL BE STRENGTHENING THROUGH TODAY AS A 
DEEP CLOSED LOW OVER THE PLAINS TRACKS EAST. PRECIP WILL BEGIN 
MOVING INTO WESTERN AREAS THIS AFTERNOON AS MOISTURE ADVECTION 
INCREASES. THE STRONGEST LIFT IS TIED TO FRONTOGENETIC 
FORCING...WHICH CROSSES THE AREA FROM 03Z TO 09Z IN THE NAM...AND 
00Z TO 06Z IN THE GFS. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE FASTER GFS FOR TIMING OF 
HIGHEST POPS. SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS WILL SEE SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AND WILL HAVE A CHANCE 
OF THUNDERSTORMS IN THAT AREA. SEVERE POTENTIAL LOOKS LIMITED BY THE 
LACK OF INSTABILITY...BUT THERE WILL BE A SMALL CHANCE OF DAMAGING 
STRAIGHT LINE WINDS IN THE HIGH SHEAR ENVIRONMENT...MAINLY SOUTH AND 
WEST. POPS WILL BEGIN TO DECREASE LATE TONIGHT WITH THE PASSAGE OF 
THE SURFACE COLD FRONT. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
DEEP UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WILL LIFT NORTHEAST INTO 
SOUTHEAST CANADA MONDAY AND TUESDAY. FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE JUST 
EAST OF THE REGION WITH FRONTAL-GENETIC BAND EXITING THE NORTHEAST 
SECTIONS OF THE AREA MONDAY MORNING. WILL CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS FOR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WITH DRY 
CONDITIONS RETURNING FOR THE REST OF THE REGION. FOR THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGING WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYER 
WITH CHILLY MORNING AND WARM AFTERNOONS. THE DRY AIR WILL ALLOW FOR 
RELATIVELY LARGE DIURNAL SWINGS. WILL LIKELY HAVE EARLY MORNING FOG 
DEVELOP NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS FOR MID AND LATE WEEK.

PATCHY FROST IS ALSO POSSIBLE FOR THE SHELTERED VALLEYS FOR 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS TUESDAY 
AND WEDNESDAY MORNINGS.

848 PM EDT SAT OCT 5 2013

.DISCUSSION...
WITH A SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE STILL CONTROLLING THE WEATHER ACROSS
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS ARE
PREVAILING ACROSS THE REGION THIS EVENING. THIS WILL RESULT IN SOME
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING AS TEMPERATURES QUICKLY DROP FROM THE LOW TO
MID 80S INTO THE LOWER 70S JUST AFTER SUNSET. WITH SUFFICIENT
BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE IN PLACE AND DEWPOINTS IN THE LOW TO MID
60S...LOWS WILL BE MILD ONCE AGAIN AND BOTTOM OUT IN THE LOWER 60S
IN MOST SPOTS...THOUGH SOME HIGHER LOCATIONS ACROSS SW VIRGINIA MAY
DIP INTO THE UPPER 50S. THESE CONDITIONS WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE
POTENTIAL FOR SOME FOG DEVELOPMENT AFTER MIDNIGHT...PARTICULARLY IN
SHELTERED VALLEYS AND NEAR BODIES OF WATER. THUS...HAVE A MENTION
OF THIS IN THE HWO. SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO
RUMBLE TO THE NORTHWEST OF THE AREA...WHICH WILL HELP TO INCREASE
CLOUD COVER /ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN AND WESTERN ZONES LATER
TONIGHT/. HOWEVER...FEEL THAT THIS ACTIVITY WILL REMAIN OUT OF THE
FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND HAVE MAINTAINED A DRY FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
225 PM EDT SAT OCT 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR MASS LINGERING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH THE LOCAL AIR MASS REMAINING MOSTLY 
UNCHANGED SINCE YESTERDAY...EXPECT PATCHY DENSE FOG TO FORM AGAIN 
LATE TONIGHT ALONG THE WATERWAYS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 
A STRONG COLD FRONT (CURRENTLY OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY AND 
OZARKS REGION) WILL SLOWLY MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
ON SUNDAY...AS MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF TROPICAL STORM KAREN 
MOVES NORTHEASTWARD AHEAD OF IT. IT APPEARS THAT SUNDAY NIGHT WILL 
BE THE PERIOD WHEN WIDESPREAD SHOWERS SPREAD ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH KAREN SHOULD STAY 
EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS...WITH AROUND AN INCH OF RAIN EXPECTED OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. THIS RAIN WILL THEN EXIT THE FORECAST AREA ON 
MONDAY AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH...WITH MUCH COLDER AND DRIER 
AIR MOVING IN BY MONDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE ACTUALLY IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREEMENT THIS FORECAST CYCLE... 
AND WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE 
OVER THE REGION FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD. DRY WEATHER AND CLEAR 
SKIES WILL BE PRESENT EACH DAY...WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND 
THROUGH THE WORK WEEK. NEXT CHANCE FOR ANY PRECIP LOOKS TO BE LATE 
IN THE WEEKEND...AS AN UPPER LEVEL LOW AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
APPROACH THE AREA.

DENSE FOG ALONG THE WATERWAYS AGAIN THIS MORNING...BUT CURRENT OBS 
INDICATE THAT MOST OF IT HAS DISSIPATED. 

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MENTION OF FOG...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A 
LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 050706
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 AM EDT SAT OCT 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA TODAY...THEN WILL SLOWLY 
DIRFT EASTWARD TONIGHT. AFTER SOME PATCHY MORNING FOG...WE WILL SEE 
ANOTHER DAY WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. 
GFS MOS TEMPS HAVE BEEN TOO WARM LATELY...SO WILL UNDERCUT THEM BY A 
FEW DEGREES. A STABLE SOUNDING AND LACK OF LIFT WILL KEEP THE AREA 
DRY TODAY. A SOUTHERLY FLOW FROM THE SURFACE TO 300 MB WILL DEVELOP 
TONIGHT WITH THE AXIS OF THE RIDGE TO THE EAST. HIGH CLOUDS WILL 
INCREASING FROM THE WEST LATE TONIGHT AS LOW PRESSURE TRACKS EAST 
ACROSS THE PLAINS. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
MAIN EVENT DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD WILL BE DEEP UPPER TROUGH
MOVING ACROSS THE MID-SECTION OF THE NATION INTO THE OHIO
VALLEY/GREAT LAKES SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. STRONG UPPER JET WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY PLACING THE TENNESSEE VALLEY UNDER THE
FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION. THE STRONG AGEOSTROPHIC VERTICAL
CIRCULATION AROUND THE JET WILL ENHANCE THE FRONTAL-GENETIC FORCING
ALONG A FRONTAL ZONE WHICH WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE SUNDAY AND
EXIT MONDAY. A WIDESPREAD BAND OF SHOWERS WILL ACCOMPANY THE
FRONTAL BAND. INSTABILITY IS LIMITED...BUT WILL INCLUDE THUNDER FOR
THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY
MORNING.

TROPICAL SYSTEM KAREN WILL REMAIN WELL SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST OF THE 
AREA AND WILL HAVE LIMITED EFFECT ON THE WEATHER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS.

FOR MONDAY NIGHT...DRIER AIR WILL PULL INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS WITH SKY CLEARING WITH MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES PULLING 
INTO THE REGION FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. UPPER TROUGH WILL LIFT 
NORTH OF THE AREA WITH UPPER RIDGING DEVELOPING BACK ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. 
UPPER RIDGING WILL ALLOW AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES TO WARM BACK INTO 
THE MIDDLE AND UPPER 70S (SOME LOWER 80S POSSIBLE). 

&&

LOWS IN THE LOWER 60S TO PERHAPS THE UPPER 50S IN FAR NORTHEAST
ZONES SEEMS LIKELY FOR TONIGHT. THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER AND
CLEAR/CALM CONDITIONS WILL ALLOW FOR WIDESPREAD PATCHY FOG
DEVELOPMENT ONCE AGAIN...WITH SOME SHELTERED VALLEY LOCATIONS AND
AREAS NEAR BODIES OF WATER EXPERIENCING SOME LOCALLY DENSE FOG.
THUS...WILL MAINTAIN A MENTION OF THIS IN THE HWO.

698 
FXUS64 KMRX 041825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
225 PM EDT FRI OCT 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR MASS LINGERING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WITH THE LOCAL AIR MASS REMAINING MOSTLY 
UNCHANGED SINCE YESTERDAY...EXPECT PATCHY DENSE FOG TO FORM AGAIN 
LATE TONIGHT ALONG THE WATERWAYS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT 
THE REMNANTS OF TROPICAL STORM KAREN WILL MOVE NORTHEASTWARD THIS 
WEEKEND...WITH ITS MOISTURE BEGINNING TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA ON 
SUNDAY AS A COLD FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. MODELS THEN 
BEGIN TO DIVERGE SOME SUNDAY NIGHT WITH THE TIMING OF THIS COLD 
FRONT...WITH THE NAM AND ECMWF MODELS FASTER THAN THE GFS MODEL. 
WITH A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW PROGGED BY ALL THREE MODELS TO DEVELOP 
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY BEHIND THIS COLD FRONT ON SUNDAY 
NIGHT...THINK THAT THE SLOWER GFS MODEL SOLUTION IS MORE REALISTIC. 
MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF KAREN SHOULD INCREASE OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH THIS DEEP TROPICAL MOISTURE 
PRODUCING MOSTLY SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH A FEW TSTORMS. 
AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS CONTINUE TO REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH THE GFS NUMBERS CONTINUING 
TO DISPLAY AN UNREALISTICALLY LARGE DIURNAL SPREAD (WHICH HAS NOT 
VERIFIED VERY WELL EITHER). THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO TREND TOWARDS 
THE NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH SUNDAY...BUT WILL TREND CLOSER TO 
THE WARMER GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ON SUNDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A DEEP TROUGH AND UPPER LEVEL 
LOW WILL CONTINUE TO BRING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA 
THROUGH THE DAY ON MONDAY. INSTABILITY IS VERY LOW...WITH A STRONG 
CAPPING INVERSION IN THE LOW LEVELS. THE ATMOSPHERE IS VERY MOIST IN 
THE EARLY MORNING...THEN QUICKLY DRIES OUT AS THE FRONT PASSES 
THROUGH. THIS FRONT IS EXPECTED TO WEAKEN AS IT MOVES ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. WIND SHEAR IS STRONG WITH VERY STRONG MID AND 
UPPER LEVEL WINDS. AT THIS TIME...LOOKS LIKE MAIN CONVECTION WILL BE 
SHOWERS...WITH A FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE. SEVERE WEATHER 
IS NOT EXPECTED AT THIS TIME. HOWEVER...WITH THE WIND PROFILE AND 
THE DRY MID-LEVEL AIR...THERE DOES SEEM TO BE A POSSIBILITY THAT A 
FEW OF THE STORMS COULD PRODUCE STRONG GUSTY WINDS. THE COLD FRONT 
IS THEN EXPECTED TO EXIT THE AREA OVERNIGHT MONDAY...WITH THE LOW 
PRESSURE CENTER MOVING TOWARDS THE NORTHEAST.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE IN FOR THE REST OF THE WORK WEEK. LOWERED 
TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES FROM PREVIOUS UPDATES. FLOW SHIFTS FROM 
THE SOUTH TO THE NORTH...BRINGING SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS IN THE 
FORECAST. CLEARING SKIES AND DRY WEATHER WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE 
WEEK...WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     61  86  63  81  61 /   0  10  10  60  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN             61  86  63  81  61 /   0  10  10  60  90

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 AM EDT FRI OCT 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
FROM THE SURFACE TO 300 MB...A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL BE OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY AND TONIGHT. CHANCES OF AFTERNOON 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LOOKS TOO LOW TO WARRANT ANY POPS...AS 
LIFT IS LACKING UNDER THE RIDGE AND FORECAST SOUNDINGS FROM BOTH THE 
NAM AND GFS MAINTAIN AN AREA OF CIN. HIGH TEMPS TODAY WILL CONTINUE 
THE WARMING TREND...REACHING THE LOWER TO MID 80S IN THE VALLEY. 
LOWS TONIGHT WILL FOLLOW PERSISTENCE...IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY...MAIN CONCERNS ARE UPPER TROUGH MOVING
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS SUNDAY AND REMAINS OF
TROPICAL SYSTEM KAREN PULLING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE CAROLINAS.
SATURDAY WILL START OUT DRY WITH CHA SOUNDING SHOWING A MID-LEVEL
CAPPING INVERSION. BY SUNDAY...MOISTURE INCREASES WITH AIRMASS
BECOMING MARGINALY UNSTABLE WITH CAPES OF 500 J/KG. PWS WILL
INCREASE TO 1.7 TO 1.8 INCHES WITH MOST OF TROPICAL MOISTURE FROM
KAREN REMAINING SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA. A STRONG JET MOVING
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY/GREAT LAKES WILL PLACE THE REGION UNDER THE
FAVORED RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION. THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET
WILL ENHANCE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY
EVENING...WHICH WILL PRODUCE THE BEST CHANCES OF SHOWERS. WILL
INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER...BUT MAINLY SHOWERS.

FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...GFS AND ECMWF DIFFER GREATLY IN 
REGARD TO CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
ECMWF KEEPS AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH MOISTURE 
FROM REMAINS OF KAREN REMAINING OVER THE AREA...WHILE THE GFS PULLS 
MOISTURE EAST. WILL FOLLOW GFS FOR NOW WITH DRIER CONDITIONS FOR 
MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.

039 
FXUS64 KMRX 031838
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT THU OCT 3 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON...OCCURRING IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY (WHICH WAS SLOWLY DRIFTING NORTHEASTWARD). CLOUDS ARE 
EXPECTED TO DECREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT BEHIND THIS 
SHORT WAVE...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW FOR A BETTER COVERAGE OF FOG ON 
FRIDAY MORNING. WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION PATCHY FOG SINCE IT SHOULD 
MAINLY OCCUR NEAR THE RELATIVELY WARM WATERWAYS. THE NAM MODEL 
CONTINUES TO BE MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN THE GFS MODEL IN CREATING 
SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...MAINLY DUE TO ITS MORE 
UNSTABLE VERTICAL PROFILE. SINCE THE NAM MODEL SEEMS TO HAVE A 
BETTER HANDLE ON THE CURRENT SITUATION...WILL ADD A MENTION OF 
ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC FOR FRIDAY. 
OTHERWISE...A DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL KEEP MOSTLY DRY AND 
UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...SO WILL GENERALLY TREND 
TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST SINCE THE AIR MASS IS NOT EXPECTED TO 
CHANGE MUCH DURING THE PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER 
THE NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THIS SYSTEM LOOKS TO PUSH TROPICAL STORM KAREN 
TOWARDS THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS MONDAY INTO TUESDAY. 
A COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW WILL BRING SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA BEGINNING SUNDAY MORNING. CAPE IS LESS 
THAN 500 J/KG WITH PW VALUES AROUND 1.8 INCHES. THERE IS A GOOD 
AMOUNT OF SHEAR THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERE...BUT DO NOT EXPECT MUCH 
SEVERE ACTIVITY WITH THIS SYSTEM. WITH THE INCREASED MOISTURE FROM 
THE GULF...ATMOSPHERE HAS A DEEP MOIST LAYER...LIMITING SEVERE 
WEATHER DEVELOPMENT.

MODELS ARE IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH THE COLD FRONT EXITING THE AREA 
MONDAY EVENING. A FEW ISOLATED LIGHT SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE MONDAY 
NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS DUE TO UPSLOPE 
FLOW BEHIND THE FRONT. TEMPERATURES WILL COOL SLIGHTLY MONDAY...WITH 
A GRADUAL WARMING TREND THROUGH THE REST OF THE WORK WEEK. HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL SET IN ON TUESDAY...WITH DRY WEATHER EXPECTED THROUGH 
THE REST OF THE PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL THROUGH 
THURSDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   62  86  62  86  65 /   0  20   0  10  30

THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS.

ANY MENTION OF MORNING FOG...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING 
TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

027 
FXUS64 KMRX 030724
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 AM EDT THU OCT 3 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
EARLY THIS MORNING...DECKS OF MID TO HIGH CLOUDS CONTINUE TO STREAM
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AS AN UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE
TRACKS JUST TO THE NORTH AND WEST OF THE REGION. GIVEN THIS CLOUD
COVER...THE POTENTIAL FOR PATCHY DENSE FOG WILL BE LIMITED GIVEN
THE LESSEN RADIATIONAL COOLING. HOWEVER...SOME POCKETS OF PATCHY
FOG WILL CERTAINLY BE POSSIBLE THROUGH 12Z OR SO ALONG BODIES OF
WATER AND IN SHELTERED VALLEYS. LATER TODAY...THIS UPPER-LEVEL
DISTURBANCE MAY TRIGGER SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS /WITH THE NORTHERN TN
AND SW VIRGINIA ZONES BEING THE MOST FAVORED LOCATIONS/. WITH THE
MID/HIGH CLOUD DECKS LIFTING NORTH AND EAST BY THE AFTERNOON...
PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO REACH THE LOWER 80S
ONCE AGAIN. 

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
UPPER RIDGE AMPLIFIES EARLY 
IN THE LONG RANGE AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING TROUGH AND COLD FRONT 
MOVING EAST OUT OF THE PLAINS STATES. A NEW PLAYER IN THE WEEKEND 
WEATHER IS THE POTENTIAL TROPICAL SYSTEM CURRENTLY MOVING NORTH IN 
THE YUCATAN AND WRN CUBA VICINITY. MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT ON 
THIS TROPICAL SYSTEM TO TRACK NE ACROSS GA AND THE CAROLINAS...AS 
THE UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT APPROACH FROM THE WEST ON SUNDAY. 

THE CURRENT FORECAST GRIDS FIT A SENSIBLE FORECAST FOR THE WEEKEND
WITH LITTLE CHANGES MADE FOR NOW. PRECIPITABLE WATER INCREASES TO 
AROUND 1.5 TO 1.75 INCHES BY LATE SUNDAY...BUT THE MAX VALUES STAY 
TO OUR SE. NOT SEEING MUCH CONCERN FOR THUNDERSTORMS OR EXCESSIVE 
RAINFALL FOR OUR AREA FOR SUNDAY NIGHT OR MONDAY. KEPT A CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR SUNDAY...BUT THE SATURATED AIRMASS SEEMS TO LIMIT 
INSTABILITY EVEN DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS SUNDAY. 

ECMWF IS SLOWER THAN GFS TO DRY OUT THE AIRMASS ON TUESDAY...THUS 
MADE NO CHANGES WHERE LOW POPS WERE MENTIONED ON TUESDAY. ECMWF 
SEEMS TOO WET FOR WEDNESDAY WITH GFSX MOS POPS BELOW CLIMO BY THEN.
KEEPING WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT DRY FOR NOW. 

GFS MOS TEMPS WERE GENERALLY FOLLOWED FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.
HOWEVER...CONSIDERING THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE AHEAD OF...AND SOME 
COOLING BEHIND THE UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT...I KEPT MAX TEMPS 
BELOW BOTH THE 02/12Z AND 03/00Z GFSX MOS FOR NOW ON SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY.

145 
FXUS64 KMRX 021849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT WED OCT 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY IS 
PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHEASTWARD TONIGHT AND WEAKEN...BRINGING 
MAINLY AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THE NAM MODEL 
IS MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN THE GFS MODEL IN CREATING SHOWERS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY WITH THIS SHORT WAVE...AND WILL COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO SOLUTIONS BY MENTIONING ISOLATED SHOWERS AREA WIDE 
ON THURSDAY. OTHERWISE...A DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL KEEP DRY AND 
UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...AND WILL GENERALLY TREND 
TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND 
EXPECTED OVERALL.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...TOOK A COMBINED ECM/GFS 
APPROACH TO THE MODELS DURING THE PERIOD...FAVORING SOMETHING CLOSER 
TO THE "SLOWER" GFS SOLUTION EARLY IN THE WORK WEEK. DEEP UPPER 
TROUGH/LOW DRIVES EAST THROUGH THE PLAINS INTO THE MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY. SYSTEM WILL BE FAR ENOUGH WEST OF THE 
REGION FOR A DRY DAY ON SATURDAY BUT LATER SATURDAY NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY INCREASING MOISTURE ADVECTION AND LIFT AHEAD OF THE STRONG 
FRONTAL SYSTEM REQUIRES INCREASING PROBABILITY OF SHOWERS. MODELS 
INDICATE SOME INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON SUNDAY SO 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE. THE DEEPEST MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL 
BE IN PLACE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY WITH THE COLD FRONT BUILDING 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...THUS LIKELY POPS WERE 
MAINTAINED. THE GFS SHOWS A TRAILING SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE POSSIBLY 
SLOWING THE FRONT'S PROGRESS LATER MONDAY INTO EARLY TUESDAY SO 
KEEPING SOME CHANCE POPS IN PLACE LOOKS GOOD DURING THE EARLY PART 
OF THE WORK WEEK. SYSTEM FINALLY MOVES OUT BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON WITH 
DRY ADVECTION ALLOWING FOR A RETURN TO DRY WEATHER MUCH OF TUESDAY 
AND CONTINUING ON WEDNESDAY. STAYED CLOSER TO THE COOLER ECM 
GUIDANCE TEMPS FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM.

868 
FXUS64 KMRX 020714
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 AM EDT WED OCT 2 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE TO THE EAST OF THE AREA WILL
CONTINUE TO PROMOTE DRY CONDITIONS TODAY AND TONIGHT. HOWEVER...THE
COMBINATION OF THE MOSTLY/PARTLY CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS HAS
RESULTED IN LOCALIZED PATCHY FOG DEVELOPMENT THIS MORNING...AND IS
EXPECTED TO ONCE AGAIN LATER TONIGHT. AN UPPER-LEVEL DISTURANCE
OVER TEXAS/LOUISIANA WILL DRIFT NORTH AND EAST TODAY...AND PERHAPS
SPREAD SOME MID/HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE REGION. HOWEVER...ANOTHER
PLEASANT DAY WITH MOSTLY/PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS IS STILL EXPECTED
WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER 80S IN MOST LOCATIONS ONCE AGAIN BY THIS
AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
WEAK CIRCUALTION OVER THE 
LOWER MS VALLEY REGION THIS MORNING WILL TRACK NORTH TODAY AND THEN 
NE ON THURSDAY TOWARD THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...BRINGING AN INCREASE 
IN MOISTURE TO MAINLY WRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. OPTED TO PUT 
BACK IN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR AFTERNOON SHOWERS ON THE NRN PLATEAU
AND ALSO ERN MTNS TO MESH WITH GSP AND RNK GRIDS. 

THINKING DRY EVERYWHERE FOR THURSDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS BACK OVER THE REGION. PROBABLY MORE PATCHY VALLEY 
FOG FOR THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT WON'T ADD THAT JUST YET. THE MAIN 
PROBLEM FOR LATE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK IS STILL TIMING THE 
APPROACHING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. GFS AND 
ECMWF LOOKING SLOWER THIS RUN...ALTHO STILL SUPPORTING LIKELY POPS 
BY SUNDAY NIGHT. THE SLOWER TREND LED ME TO LOWER SATURDAY AFTERNOON 
POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE...AND ALSO LOWER POPS SLIGHTLY FOR SATURDAY 
NIGHT. NUDGED MAX TEMPS UP SOME FOR SATURDAY IN LINE WITH THE SLOWER 
TIMING OF COLD FRONT AND 02/00Z GFSX MOS. 

SOME INSTABILITY ALONG THE FRONT SUNDAY EVENING...BUT LIMITED ANY 
THUNDER MENTION TO JUST SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AFTERNOONS. PERHAPS BEST 
INSTABILITY WILL BE MONDAY WITH THE APPROACH OF THE UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH. THE COOLER AIR ALOFT AND DAYTIME HEATING WILL FAVOR 
THUNDERSTORMS...ESPECIALLY JUST TO OUR EAST OVER THE CAROLINAS. I 
DID INCREASE POPS FOR MONDAY OVER FAR NE AND EXTREME ERN AREAS...
AND ADDED A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS THERE AS WELL. DETERMING THE 
STRENGTH OR SEVERITY OF STORMS IS CHALLENGING UNTIL TIMING OF THE 
COLD FRONT AND HOW MUCH THE UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS IS CLEARER. 

ANY CHANGES TO PREVIOUS MAX/MIN TEMPS WAS MINIMAL...AS 12Z AND 00Z 
GFSX TEMPS WERE VERY SIMILAR AND ALSO CLOSE TO LATEST ECMX MOS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

252 PM EDT TUE OCT 1 2013

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...
SCATTERED CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR SHORTLY
AFTER SUNSET. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL AND WINDS
WILL BE LIGHT AND VARIABLE OVERNIGHT. ANTICIPATE ANOTHER ROUND OF
MORNING FOG AGAIN AROUND SUNRISE WITH SOME LOCATIONS EXPERIENCING
LOCALLY DENSE FOG IN THE FAVORED AREAS.

THERE IS A DEVELOPING LOW OVER SOUTHERN LOUISIANA LATE TONIGHT. THE
ASSOCIATED MOISTURE CONVERGENCE WILL REMAIN WELL WEST OF THE AREA.
EXPECT MIDDLE AND WEST TENNESSEE...NORTHWEST AL AND N MS TO SEE THE
BULK OF SHOWER ACTIVITY. BY LATE WEDNESDAY COULD SEE SOME HIGHER
LEVEL CLOUDINESS MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA IN THE AFTERNOON.
OTHERWISE...WARM AND INCREASINGLY MUGGY CONDITIONS WILL SPREAD
OVER THE REGION. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES ARE IN DECENT AGREEMENT EARLY...BUT SOME DISAGREEMENT AND 
CONTINUITY ISSUES ARISE BY THE WEEKEND AND BEYOND.  FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE EARLY BUT FALLS TO BELOW AVERAGE FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR LATE. SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY LIFTING INTO THE 
EASTERN RIDGE WILL SLIDE BY TO OUR WEST AND NORTH THURSDAY...BUT 
LOOKS LIKE WE WILL STAY PRECIP FREE.  RIDGE BUILDS AGAIN OVER THE 
AREA FRIDAY...THEN AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL DIG TO OUR WEST AND 
TRACK SLOWLY EAST DURING THE WEEKEND/EARLY NEXT WEEK AS A COLD FRONT 
PUSHES THROUGH.  THERE ARE MODEL DISAGREEMENTS IN HANDLING 
THIS...BUT THE TREND HAS BEEN FOR A DEEPER TROUGH AND SLOWER 
MOVEMENT.  WILL SLOW THINGS DOWN AGAIN WITH THIS FORECAST AND WILL 
CARRY THE HIGHEST POPS SUNDAY NIGHT AT THIS POINT.  HOWEVER...STILL 
QUITE A BIT OF TIMING UNCERTAINTY WITH THIS.  WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED 
IF THINGS HAVE TO BE SLOWED DOWN EVEN MORE WITH LATER ISSUANCES.  
WILL GO DRY TUESDAY FOR NOW BUT OF COURSE A SLOWER MOVEMENT MAY 
CHANGE THIS.

400 
FXUS64 KMRX 010718
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 AM EDT TUE OCT 1 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
HAS BUILT BACK ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...AND WILL HOLD IN 
PLACE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS OR MORE. ONLY ITEM OF CONCERN CONTINUES 
TO BE PATCHY AREAS OF LOCALLY DENSE FOG OVERNIGHT...AS IS THE CASE 
AGAIN THIS MORNING IN OUR TYPICAL VALLEY SPOTS. 

TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINE ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS...AIDED BY 
AMPLIFICATION OF THE UPPER RIDGE AND WEAK SW-W LOW LEVEL FLOW. I 
TRENDED VERY CLOSE TO THE MILDER GFS MOS MAX TEMPS...ALTHO ENOUGH 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL ALLOW AT LEAST SCATTERED CUMULUS CLOUDS IN 
THE AFTERNOON. MOS MINS TONIGHT VARIED BY UP TO 5 DEGREES...AND I 
LEANED CLOSER TO THE COOLER GFS MOS MINS GIVEN THE SURFACE RIDGE 
ACROSS THE REGION.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE TO THE EAST OF THE REGION WILL PROMOTE 
GENERALLY WARM/MILD AND DRY CONDITIONS THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK 
WEEK. THE ONE MINOR EXCEPTION MAY BE ON THURSDAY AS A WEAK PASSING 
UPPER-WAVE COULD TRIGGER A FEW ISOLATED STORMS. HOWEVER...DRY 
WEATHER WILL GENERALLY BE THE RULE THROUGH MOST OF THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING INTO SUNDAY AS A STRONG 
UPPER-LOW TRACKING FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES WILL DRAG A 
COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION. THIS FRONT WILL SERVE AS A FOCUS FOR 
PERHAPS SOME WIDESPREAD SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY FOR THE 
LATER HALF OF THE WEEKEND. MODELS HAVE BEEN TRENDING A LITTLE LATER 
WITH THIS SYSTEM...SO HAVE SHIFTED THE HIGHEST POPS TO SATURDAY 
NIGHT AND SUNDAY...BEFORE GRADUALLY TAPERING THEM OFF SUNDAY NIGHT 
INTO MONDAY FROM WEST TO EAST. MUCH MORE SEASONABLE...AUTUMN-LIKE 
TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO FOLLOW THE FROPA BY SUNDAY AS COOLER AIR 
FILTERS INTO THE REGION.  

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT AND TUESDAY
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WAS GENERALLY ACROSS MUCH OF THE SOUTHEASTERN
U.S. THERE IS A SHORTWAVE IN THE WEAK NORTHWEST FLOW THAT HAS
CREATED THICKER CLOUD COVER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER DAYTIME HIGH
TEMPERATURES OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NE TN. EXPECT SKIES TO
CLEAR SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET AND RAIN CHANCES THIS AFTERNOON TO
DIMINISH RATHER QUICKLY. SOME AREAS OF FOG WILL DEVELOP OVERNIGHT
ESPECIALLY NEAR THE TRI-CITIES. TUESDAY WILL BE DRY WITH
TEMPERATURES GENERALLY IN THE 80S.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT EARLY...BUT SOME SIGNIFICANT DISAGREEMENTS ARISE BY THE 
LATTER PERIODS WITH THE HANDLING OF THE UPPER TROUGH AND COLD 
FRONT.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS A BIT ABOVE AVERAGE EARLY BUT FALLS 
TO A BIT BELOW AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR LATE.  UPPER RIDGE AND 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD KEEP THINGS DRY FOR TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH AT LEAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL 
MOVE ACROSS ON THURSDAY...BUT MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY LOOK LIMITED 
AND WITH LITTLE FORCING SHOULD BE MOSTLY DRY.  UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
BRIEFLY AGAIN FOR FRIDAY THEN AN UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT WILL 
APPROACH DURING THE WEEKEND.  GIVEN UNCERTAINTIES OF TIMING WILL 
HAVE TO CARRY CHANCE POPS SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.  FOR NOW WILL GO 
DRY MONDAY BEHIND THE FRONT BUT STILL CONSIDERABLE UNCERTAINTY ABOUT 
HOW FAST THIS SYSTEM WILL EXIT.  WILL GENERALLY UNDERCUT GFS MOS MAX 
TEMPS DURING MOST OF THE LATTER PERIODS. LESS ARGUMENT WITH GFS MOS 
MINS SO MOSTLY SOME MINOR TWEAKS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
422 AM EDT MON SEP 30 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PARTIAL CLEARING OVER THE BULK 
OF THE FORECAST AREA MAY ALLOW PATCHY AREAS OF FOG TO DEVELOP BEFORE 
DAYBREAK...ESPECIALLY OVER THE CENTRAL AND SRN VALLEY COUNTIES. 
WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS SHOW GOOD DRYING IN THE MID TO UPPER 
LEVELS TODAY...BUT SOUNDINGS AND TIME HEIGHTS SHOW A GREAT DEAL OF 
MOISTURE LINGERING AT AND BELOW 700 MBS WELL INTO TUESDAY. DROPPED 
POPS FOR THIS MORNING WITH A MENTION OF SPRINKLES...BUT OPTED TO 
KEEP A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS.

OTHERWISE...THE WEAK COLD FRONT TO OUR WEST WILL DISSOLVE WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE REGAINING CONTROL OF THE REGION'S WEATHER THROUGH MID WEEK. 
MOS GUIDANCE SUGGESTS PATCHY FOG FOR LATE TONIGHT WITH ANY DECREASE 
OR PARTIAL CLEARING...AND VERY LIGHT WINDS AS THE SURFACE RIDGE 
SETTLES OVER THE SRN APPALACHIANS. 

FOR TEMPS...UNDERCUTTING THE VERY SIMILAR MOS HIGHS FOR TODAY...AND 
A BLEND OF MOS FOR TONIGHT...WHICH WILL BE SLIGHTLY ABOVE THE COOLER 
GFS MOS MINS.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AS HIGH PRESSURE
RIDGE REBUILDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA EXPECT WARMING TEMPERATURES
AND MOSTLY SUNNY TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES THROUGH WEDNESDAY. AN
INCREASE IN MOISTURE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS SURFACE HIGH SHIFTS
EAST WILL ALLOW ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP.
UPPER TROUGH DIGS SOUTHWARD OVER THE WESTERN STATES FRIDAY WHICH
SHOULD DELAY STRONG COLD FRONTS PROGRESS EAST TO LATER SATURDAY AND
SUNDAY. HAVE DECREASED POPS SOMEWHAT SATURDAY WITH BEST CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND STORMS SATURDAY NIGHT. RIGHT NOW MODEL TIMING
DIFFERENCES IN THE SPEED OF THE SYSTEM LOWERS CONFIDENCE IN THE
DETAILS FOR THE LAST COUPLE DAYS OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH
FRIDAY WITH RIDGING DOMINANT AND IF SYSTEM SLOWS PROBABLY
SATURDAY TOO. COOLER TEMPERATURES EXPECTED SUNDAY.

ALOFT. OTHERWISE EXPECT SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES INTO 
FRIDAY. MODELS ARE STARTING TO SLOW THE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT. TRIED TO INDICATE IN THE CURRENT GRID FORECAST WITH HIGHEST 
CHANCES OCCURRING SATURDAY NIGHT. MODELS HINTING AT RATHER STABLE 
CONDITIONS UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON...THUS HELD OFF ON MENTIONING 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE ZONES UNTIL THAT TIME. AS THE WEEKEND

THROUGH LATER ON SUNDAY OR PERHAPS MONDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
432 AM EDT SUN SEP 29 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...EASTERLY FLOW AROUND THE
850 MB RIDGE IS BRINGING AREAS OF LOWER CLOUDS THIS MORNING...WHICH
SHOULD INHIBIT ANY SIGNIFICANT FOG FROM DEVELOPING. SOME SUNSHINE
SHOULD OCCUR TODAY AHEAD OF THE WEAK COLD FRONT...BUT WEAKENING OF

HIGHS.
