UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT AFFECTS MAINLY THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS. CONVECTION OVER THE GULF COAST STATES WILL ALSO LIMIT 
THE COVERAGE OF SHOWERS ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC. THUS...KEPT POPS 
AROUND 20 PERCENT OR SO FOR BOTH PERIODS. STAYED VERY CLOSE TO GFS 
MOS FOR MIN AND MAX TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE REBUILDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA AS FRONT SETTLES SOUTH
OVER THE GULF COAST. MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS TO
PREVAIL MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ECMWF INDICATES MORE
LEFT OVER MOISTURE BEHIND FRONT WITH A FEW SHOWERS POSSIBLE
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY BUT PREFER DRIER GFS WHICH KEEPS RIDGING
STRONG OVER THE EAST TN VALLEY UNTIL THURSDAY. THURSDAY ECMWF
BREAKS DOWN RIDGE AS SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS AND UPPER
TROUGH DEEPENS. GFS KEEPS RIDGE IN PLACE ANOTHER 24 HOURS. WILL
KEEP LOW POPS IN THURSDAY AND INCREASE SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM
CHANCES FRIDAY.

GFS THEN MOVES FRONTAL SYSTEM INTO REGION FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY
SATURDAY WITH ECMWF BRINGING IN SCATTERED SHOWERS IN MOIST AIR
MASS INTO REGION BUT DEEPENS UPPER TROUGH FRIDAY TO THE WEST
SLOWING COLD FRONT DOWN AND NOT MOVING IT THROUGH FORECAST AREA
UNTIL SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP CHANCE PRECIPITATION
IN THROUGH SATURDAY SIMILAR TO ECMWF. TEMPERATURES STAY MILD
TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AND THEN COOLER SATURDAY WITH SHOWERS MORE
LIKELY AND MORE CLOUD COVER.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             79  59  81  59  83 /  10  10  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  76  58  78  58  81 /  10  10  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       76  57  79  57  82 /  10  10  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              75  54  76  52  79 /  10  20  20  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 281859
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT SAT SEP 28 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS 
THE AREA WEAKENS SOME ON SUNDAY. H85 RELATIVE HUMIDITY REMAINS 
FAIRLY HIGH THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH PERIODS OF STRATO CU DECKS. MID 
LEVELS REMAIN DRY AS UPPER LEVEL MOISTURE MOVES INTO THE AREA BY 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON. LIGHT WINDS WITH TEMPERATURES CONTINUING ABOVE 
NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...LONGER TERM MODELS 
ARE IN MUCH BETTER AGREEMENT THROUGH MUCH OF THE FORECAST PERIOD 
TODAY. THERE ARE A COUPLE EXCEPTIONS INTO THE WEEKEND.

THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY LOSES ITS IDENTITY SOMETIME SUNDAY BUT THE 
WEAK NORTHWEST UPPER LEVEL FLOW MAY PROVIDE SLIGHT CHANCES FOR A FEW 
SHOWERS SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. CONFIDENCE IS VERY LOW AND MOST 
AREAS WILL LIKELY REMAIN PRECIPITATION FREE. THE ONLY EXCEPTION MAY 
BE SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA DUE TO THE POSITION OF A SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
TRANSLATING ACROSS WEST VIRGINIA. 

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL OCCUR TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. A WEAK 
UPPER LOW MAY PROVIDE SOUTHERN AREAS WITH SOME SHOWERS BUT LOW LEVEL 
FEATURES ARE LACKING. BY THE END OF THE WEEK THERE ARE SOME TIMING 
DIFFERENCES WITH THE MODELS WHERE THE GFS IS MUCH FASTER THAN THE 
ECMWF IN REGARDS TO THE UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. SORT 
OF SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE MODELS AND INCREASED CHANCES FOR 
SHOWERS STARTING FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY.

1105 AM EDT SAT SEP 28 2013

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION: 

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
EXTENDING FROM THE NE STATES SOUTH INTO THE SRN APPALACHIANS THIS 
MORNING...WHILE UPPER RIDGE HOLDS STRONG OVER THE ERN STATES. SOME 
AREAS OF LOWER CLOUDS DEVELOPING OVER WRN NC IN THE NE TO E FLOW 
AROUND 850 MBS...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACROSS E TN AND SW VA. 
STILL EXPECTING SOME PATCHY AREAS OF FOG TO DEVELOP BEFORE DAY BREAK 
AND POSSIBLY LOCALLY DENSE IN FAVORED AREAS LIKE TRI-CITIES REGIONAL 
AIRPORT.

WEATHER PATTERN IN PLACE SHOULD PRODUCE IDENTICAL CONDITIONS TO 
YESTERDAY. GFS MOS TEMPS PERFORMING WELL LATELY AND WERE CLOSELY 
FOLLOWED. GENERALLY ONLY MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO PREVIOUS FORECAST 
GRIDS FOR THE SHORT TERM.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A WEAKENING COLD FRONT TO 
APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA LATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT THEN MOVE 
SOUTH TO THE GULF COAST MONDAY. REMOVED RAIN CHANCES FROM THE PLATEAU
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AS MODELS HAVE TRENDED WEAKER WITH THE FRONT. ONLY 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS WITH FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. RIDGE 
OF HIGH PRESSURE MOVES IN BEHIND FRONT TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AND 
THEN BREAKS DOWN THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY WITH DRYING TREND MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. GFS AND ECMWF DIFFER ON TIMING BUT BRINGS IN STRONGER 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. HAVE RAIN CHANCES BACK 
IN FORECAST THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY BUT CONFIDENCE IN DETAILS REMAINS 
LOW. TEMPERATURES TO BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED.

FXUS64 KMRX 271848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EDT FRI SEP 27 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE AREA. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WILL 
PERSIST. LATE NIGHT FOG WILL DEVELOP ALONG WATERWAYS. WINDS WILL BE 
LIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE ABOVE NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...LONG RANGE MODELS IN 
FAIR AGREEMENT THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK BUT BEGIN TO DIVERGE BY MID 
WEEK. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL TRANSLATE ACROSS WEST TENNESSEE EARLY 
SUNDAY MORNING. ASSOCIATED PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED TO WANE AS THE 
FRONT PROGRESSES EAST. AS WHAT USUALLY HAPPENS AS THE FRONT AND 
PRECIP MOVE OVER THE PLATEAU INTO THE VALLEY THE PRECIP BREAKS UP 
AND DISSIPATES. THEREFORE HAVE DELAYED ANY PRECIPITATION UNTIL 
MAINLY FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND CONTINUED WITH SLIGHT CHANCE 
WORDING. THE LINGERING FRONT AND WEAK UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVES MAY 
PRODUCE CHANCES OF ADDITIONAL SHOWERS INTO MONDAY. IN GENERAL MOST 
LOCATIONS WILL REMAIN DRY WITH LOW CHANCES OF SHOWERS THROUGH THE 
MAJORITY OF THE WEEK...DEPENDING ON WHICH MODEL YOU BELIEVE. AS 
MENTIONED PREVIOUSLY...THE MODELS DIVERGE BY THE END OF NEXT WEEK. 
THE CONFIDENCE IN THE FORECAST DROPS SIGNIFICANTLY AFTER TUESDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

845 PM EDT THU SEP 26 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION...AND EXTENDING OVER MOST OF THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION. THIS HIGH WILL BRING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH FOG DEVELOPING TOWARDS SUNRISE. 
WITH A DECENT RAINFALL OBSERVED OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA 
YESTERDAY...THINK THAT DENSE FOG WILL BE A GOOD POSSIBILITY 
OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY AROUND THE WATERWAYS. THUS...WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MENTION PATCHY DENSE FOG WITH 
VISIBILITIES LESS THAN A FOURTH OF A NILE IN SOME AREAS.

WIND FIELDS. GOOD WARM UP EXPECTED FRIDAY AFTERNOON.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...VERY MINOR CHANGES MADE TO 
PREVIOUS FORECAST FOR THE LONG TERM. MODELS CONTINUE TO AGREE THAT A 
WEAK FRONT WILL DISSIPATE OVER THE VALLEY ON SUNDAY. KEPT IN THE 
MENTION OF SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY. 
CONFIDENCE IS RATHER LOW HOWEVER THE LINGERING STALLED FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY COULD STILL INHIBIT A FEW SHOWERS TO OCCUR. SOME LOW 
CHANCES OF SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE FOR SOUTHERN AREAS TUESDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY BUT CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW AS THE FORECAST AREA 
WILL BE UNDER UPPER LEVEL RIDGING.

666 
FXUS64 KMRX 261511
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1108 AM EDT THU SEP 26 2013

.DISCUSSION...STRATUS SLOWLY BURNING OFF THIS MORNING. GOOD WARM UP 
EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON. MINOR CHANGE TO INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS ACROSS SW NC WHERE SOME UPSLOPE FLOW WILL OCCUR. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ANY LINGERING SHOWERS OVERNIGHT 
ARE ENDING ACROSS THE REGION.  HOWEVER...WITH THE RECENT 
RAINFALL...AREAS OF FOG ARE DEVELOPING ACROSS THE AREA.  LOCALLY 
DENSE FOG IS POSSIBLE THROUGH AT LEAST 13Z.  OTHERWISE...LOOK FOR 
IMPROVING CONDITIONS TODAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FROM THE 
WEST.  THIS WILL USHER IN CLEARING SKIES...LIGHT WIND AND DRY 
CONDITIONS.  ALSO...WILL SEE TEMPERATES WARM TO NEAR NORMAL LEVELS 
THIS AFTERNOON WITH HIGHS EXPECTED TO REACH INTO THE UPPER 70S TO 
AROUND 80 ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO BE  IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT OVERALL...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. AN AMPLIFIED UPPER 
RIDGE WILL BE OVER THE REGION FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND...KEEPING THE 
FORECAST DRY.  A WEAKENING COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH LATE SUNDAY AND 
SUNDAY NIGHT...AND WILL LIKELY DISSIPATE BY LATE MONDAY OR MONDAY 
NIGHT.  LOOKS LIKE FORCING AND INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAK...SO WILL 
JUST CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS LATE SUNDAY WEST AND ALL ZONES 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
SOUTHERN HALF FOR TUESDAY...THEN DRY ON WEDNESDAY AS UPPER RIDGE 
EXPECTED TO BE BUILDING OVER THE AREA.  WILL GENERALLY STAY CLOSE TO 
GFS MOS TEMPS EARLY ON...BUT WILL TRIM A FEW DEGREES FROM MOST HIGH 
TEMPS FOR THE LATTER PERIODS.

252 
FXUS64 KMRX 251908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT WED SEP 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW CENTER WILL MOVE EAST 
ACROSS WV TONIGHT. UPPER TROUGH WILL LINGER ACROSS AREA AS JET 
SEGMENT MOVES SE THROUGH THE MID SOUTH TONIGHT. MID LEVEL DRY SLOT 
HAS MOVED NE THROUGH MUCH OF THE AREA TODAY WITH A DECREASE IN AREAL 
COVERAGE OF PRECIPITATION IN ITS WAKE. CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT 
CONTINUES THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING CLOSER TO THE UPPER LOW CENTER 
WHERE MORE FAVORABLE LAPSE RATES RESIDE. SENSIBLE WEATHER SHOULD 
TRANSITION TONIGHT TO MORE OF A DRIZZLE/FOG SET UP AS UPPER LOW 
CENTER SHIFTS EAST. BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE REMAINS HIGH OVERNIGHT 
WITH LIGHT WINDS. CONDITIONS WILL DRY OUT ON THURSDAY AS HIGH 
PRESSURE SLOWLY BUILDS INTO THE AREA. WARM TEMPERATURES 
CONTINUE...LEANED TOWARD COOL SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE FOR THURSDAYS 
HIGHS. 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...RESULTING IN MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS TO 
CLOSE OUT THE WORK WEEK. THE RIDGING AND PLEASANT WEATHER WILL 
CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY BEFORE AN UPPER-TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE 
GREAT LAKES DRAGS A WEAK FRONT TOWARD THE AREA SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. THE LATEST MODEL PROJECTIONS INDICATE A LIMITED RAIN 
POTENTIAL GIVEN THE WEAKENING TREND WITH THIS SYSTEM SO HAVE ONLY 
GONE LOW-END CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY FOR SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND SOME ISOLATED STORMS. MODELS DIFFER SOMEWHAT IN THE 
EXTENDED...BUT THE LATEST RUN OF THE GFS INDICATES A SECONDARY 
SHORTWAVE MAY TRIGGER OFF SOME ADDITIONAL SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE CWA MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...SO HAVE ADDED 
LOW-END MENTIONABLE POPS THERE FOR THOSE TWO PERIODS. AN UPPER-RIDGE 
AND SOME DRIER WEATHER LOOKS AS THOUGH IT WILL MOVE IN HEADING INTO 
THE MIDDLE TO LATER PART OF NEXT WEEK.  

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 250640
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 AM EDT WED SEP 25 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...IT WILL BE A WET DAY ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY.  AN UPPER LOW MOVING THROUGH THE 
REGION IS SPREADING A BAND OF SCATTERED SHOWERS WITH SOME EMBEDDED 
THUNDER ACROSS THE MRX CWA.  THIS WILL BRING HIGH LIKELY TO 
CATEGORICAL POPS INTO SOUTHERN AREAS EARLY IN THE PERIOD...WITH 
CATEGORICAL POPS SHIFTING INTO THE CENTRAL CWA BY LATE MORNING AND 
INTO THE NORTHEAST DURING THE AFTERNOON.  LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND 
NORTHWEST FLOW SHOULD KEEP SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE AREA INTO THE 
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS.  THICK CLOUD COVER AND RAINFALL WILL 
KEEP HIGHS ON THE COOL SIDE THIS AFTERNOON AND MILD LOWS OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT OVERALL...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD 
IS SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. MAY BE A FEW 
LINGERING SHOWERS AT LEAST IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS THURSDAY WITH 
THE EXITING UPPER TROUGH.  THEN DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED THURSDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT AS AN AMPLIFIED UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN.  
BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL BE APPROACHING...AND THIS 
FEATURE WILL BRING SOME SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY THUNDERSTORMS MAINLY 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED TO RETURN FOR 
TUESDAY BEHIND THIS FRONT.  WILL GENERALLY STAY CLOSE TO GFS MOS 
TEMPS EARLY ON...BUT WILL TRIM A FEW DEGREES FROM MOST HIGH TEMPS 
FOR THE LATTER PERIODS.

DECREASE. HOWEVER...AS THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE MOVES 
FURTHER EAST OVERNIGHT...STILL EXPECT A WIDESPREAD AREA OF LIGHT 
RAIN SHOWERS TO DEVELOP IN THE 06Z TO 12Z PERIOD...LOWERING 
CONDITIONS INTO THE MVFR CATEGORY.

KEPT THUNDERSTORMS OUT OF THE TAFS FOR NOW...BUT STEADY SHOWERS 
LIKELY DURING THE MORNING AND AFTERNOON HOURS WEDNESDAY. MOSTLY MVFR 
BUT BRIEFLY IFR POSSIBLE WHERE HEAVIER SHOWERS DEVELOP.  

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

TG









291 
FXUS64 KMRX 241924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT TUE SEP 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...TRANSITION PERIOD HAS 
CONTINUED TODAY AS WEATHER ACROSS FORECAST AREA DETERIORATES. CLOUDS 
WERE STEADILY INCREASING FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST AHEAD OF 
DEVELOPING FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVING EAST ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES AND 
COMBINING WITH MOISTURE MOVING OVER A NEARLY STATIONARY FRONT ALONG 
THE GULF COAST. LONG RANGE RADAR SHOWED A LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS AND 
STORMS OVER EASTERN MS AND WESTERN AL JUST AHEAD OF A LOW PRESSURE 
AREA ACROSS IN SE LA AND JUST NORTH OF THE FRONT ALONG THE GULF 
COAST. THE FORECAST AREA HAD MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES NE HALF AND MOSTLY 
CLOUDY SW HALF. TEMPERATURES WERE IN THE 70S.

THE FRONT IN THE PLAINS IS EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE TN VALLEY 
OVERNIGHT AND BECOME OCCLUDED. RAIN SPREADING OUT AHEAD OF IT WILL 
MOVE INTO SOUTHEAST TN AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS EVENING AND 
THEN MOVE ACROSS NE SECTIONS BY LATE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. AS THIS 
SOUTHERN SYSTEM MOVES EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY MORE 
RAIN AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE. BY AFTERNOON THERE SHOULD 
BE A BREAK IN THE STEADY RAIN IN THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST. AN UPPER 
LEVEL LOW ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT WILL BRING MORE SHOWERY 
CONDITIONS LATER IN THE AFTERNOON. MILD TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WITH 
CLOUDS AND RAIN WITH BOTH MODELS CLOSE ON LOWS IN THE UPPER 50S TO 
MID 60S. UP TO THREE QUARTERS OF AN INCH COULD FALL TONIGHT IN THE 
SOUTH AND WEST AND THEN THE HEAVIEST RAINFALL SHIFTS TO THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WEDNESDAY. WEDNESDAY LOWERED 
HIGHS A FEW DEGREES. MET GUIDANCE OF NEAR 70 TO MID 70S WAS 
PREFERRED BUT THAT WILL DEPEND ON A BREAK IN THE RAIN DURING THE 
AFTERNOON. MOUNTAIN TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY STAY IN THE 60S 
POSSIBLY COOLER AT THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND REVEAL A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE FOR THE END 
OF THE WEEK WITH A COLD FRONT APPROACHING DURING SUNDAY NIGHT/MONDAY 
TIME FRAME. A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND THURSDAY BEHIND A DEPARTING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION. DRY CONDITIONS AND SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS 
WILL THEN DEVELOP FOR LATE IN THE WEEK AND INTO THE WEEKEND...AS A 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE DEVELOPS OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY. LATEST RUNS OF THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS ARE NOW DELAYING THE 
ARRIVAL OF A COLD FRONT LATE IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND THUS... 
WILL REMOVE ANY POPS FOR SUNDAY BUT WILL MENTION CHANCES FOR 
CONVECTION SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY (DUE TO THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF 
THIS COLD FRONT). AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   64  75  61  81  61 /  80  80  40  20   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     63  75  60  80  60 /  60  80  40  20   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             62  75  60  80  60 /  60  80  40  20   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    55  73  56  78  56 /  30  70  40  20   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 AM EDT TUE SEP 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO 
RETREAT EAST AS UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MOVES IN FOR THE SHORT TERM 
PERIOD.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND SOME SHOWERS 
WILL MOVE IN AS WELL ESPECIALLY SOUTH.  WILL CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS 
SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND SLIGHT CHANCE REMAINDER OF SOUTH AND THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU TODAY WITH THE WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT AND MOISTURE 
RETURN TODAY. FORCING LOOKS A BIT BETTER TONIGHT SO LIKELY POPS 
SOUTH...CHANCE CENTRAL AND SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH.  INSTABILITY LOOKS 
RATHER LIMITED SO NO THUNDER MENTION IN THE SHORT TERM. WILL 
UNDERCUT SOME MAV MAX TEMPS A BIT MAINLY SOUTH TODAY GIVEN EXPECTED 
CLOUD COVER...OTHERWISE WILL STAY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AN UPPER LOW WILL SWING 
THROUGH THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY.  AS A RESULT...INCREASING LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE...WEAK INSTABILITY AND SUFFICIENT LIFT WILL COMBINE TO 
GENERATE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS 
THE AREA WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
BEHIND THIS SYSTEM FOR DRY AND SEASONALLY WARM CONDITIONS THURSDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY.  BY THE END OF THE EXTENDED...THERE IS SOME 
DIFFERENCES IN TIMING OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT.  WILL KEEP BEST 
CHANCE OF FRONTAL PASSAGE ON MONDAY NIGHT WITH REDUCED POPS LATE 
MONDAY AND ON TUESDAY.

229 
FXUS64 KMRX 231909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON SEP 23 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES EXTENDS ACROSS THE NE SECTION OF THE COUNTRY...INCLUDING THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. AFTER COOL TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING AND SOME LOW 
CLOUDS AND FOG IN THE NE...SKIES ARE MOSTLY SUNNY WITH TEMPERATURES 
IN THE 70S AREA WIDE. THIS TRANQUIL PATTERN WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT 
BUT CHANGES WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE REGION TUESDAY. AN OLD FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY TO THE SOUTH WITH A LOW IN THE GULF WILL MOVE NORTH WHILE A 
LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE PLAINS AND DEVELOPING FRONT WILL MOVE 
EAST. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH WITH LOW CLOUDS EXPECTED 
TO MOVE INTO SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE LATER TONIGHT AND POSSIBLY INTO THE 
KNOXVILLE AREA BY MORNING. MOISTURE STREAMING NORTH OVER THE OLD 
FRONT AND AHEAD OF THE FRONT TO THE WEST WILL SPREAD INTO WESTERN 
AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS WITH SHOWERS DEVELOPING AND POSSIBLY A 
THUNDERSTORM. THE AIR MASS STAYS STABLE FOR MOST OF THE DAY BUT MAY 
BECOME UNSTABLE FAR WEST OR SOUTHWEST WITH HEATING OF THE DAY. JUST 
HAVE LOW POPS WEST AND SOUTHWEST AS BEST CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION 
HOLDS OFF UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT. LOWS TONIGHT WARMEST SW WITH 
INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S NE SKIES WILL BE 
CLEAR EXCEPT FOR WHERE STEAM FOG MAY FORM...POSSIBLY RISING TO LOW 
CLOUD DECK AROUND SUNRISE. ADDED PATCHY FOG IN THE USUAL RIVER AND 
LAKE REGIONS. HIGHS TUESDAY WILL BE DEPENDENT ON CLOUD COVER. HAVE 
USED A BLEND OF THE MET/MAV FOR HIGHS WITH UNCERTAINTY OF HOW FAST 
CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN FROM WEST AND SOUTHWEST.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL TWO MAIN WEATHER FEATURES: AN UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH ON WEDNESDAY AND A COLD FRONT ON SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT. A 
FAIRLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE 
TN RIVER VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...WITH THE MODELS 
INDICATING ENOUGH MOISTURE WITH IT TO INCLUDE LIKELY POPS FOR THIS 
PERIOD. INSTABILITY APPEARS TO BE FAIRLY WEAK OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA...SO WILL EMPHASIZE SHOWERS WITH JUST A FEW TSTORMS. AN 
AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE WILL THEN DEVELOP OVER THE EASTERN HALF 
OF THE NATION THE REST OF THE WEEK...WITH DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED 
ALONG WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND THROUGH SATURDAY. BOTH THE ECMWF 
AND GFS MODELS REVEAL A COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
ON SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED 
ALONG AND AHEAD OF IT. THESE MODELS THEN DIVERGE AFTER SUNDAY NIGHT 
WITH THE AMPLITUDE OF THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BEHIND THIS COLD 
FRONT...WITH THE ECMWF MODEL INDICATING A MORE AMPLIFIED TROUGH (AND 
CONSEQUENTLY A WETTER SOLUTION) THAN THE GFS MODEL. FOR NOW...WILL 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THESE TWO SOLUTIONS BY MENTIONING A SLIGHT CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS ON MONDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN 
THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS 
IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   60  80  63  79  62 /  10  30  70  60  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     56  80  62  78  60 /   0  10  50  60  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN             56  78  62  78  60 /   0  10  50  60  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    47  78  57  75  55 /   0  10  40  50  40

531 
FXUS64 KMRX 230748 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTION TO DAYS IN EXTENDED FORECAST
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 AM EDT MON SEP 23 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AND SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE OUR MAIN WEATHER FEATURES FOR THE SHORT TERM. 
THE RIDGE AXIS WILL SHIFT TO OUR EAST BY LATE IN THE PERIOD AND 
MOISTURE MAY START TO RETURN FROM THE SOUTH. SHOULD BE PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE TODAY.  NAM MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN GFS IN BRINGING MOISTURE 
RETURN AND WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT TO SOUTHERN ZONES LATE TONIGHT.  FOR 
NOW WILL TREND TOWARD A QUICKER MOISTURE RETURN AND START TO 
INCREASE CLOUDS LATE...BUT WILL INCLUDE NO PRECIP THROUGH 12Z.  MAV 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THIS PERIOD BEGINS
TUESDAY MORNING WITH A WEAK UPPER RIDGE THAT HAS SLID JUST EAST OF
THE AREA...AS HAS THE SURFACE HIGH CENTER...ALLOWING A RETURN FLOW
BEGINNING DURING THE DAY. A POTENT-LOOKING SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND
WEAK COLD FRONT AREA ARE MOVING TOWARD US FROM THE PLAINS. THE
FIRST CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION ARE TUESDAY AFTERNOON OVER THE
WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA. PRECIP CHANCES STICK AROUND TUESDAY NIGHT
THOUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THEN THURSDAY THE AREA SHOULD DRY OUT AS
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA. CONDITIONS LOOK DRY
UNTIL AROUND SUNDAY AS THE NEXT SYSTEM COMES TOWARD US.

RIGHT NOW FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY THE SEVERE STORM 
POTENTIAL LOOKS WEAK DUE TO LACK OF INSTABILITY...HOWEVER...IF THIS 
SYSTEM IS REALLY AS DYNAMIC LOOKING AT THE MID LEVELS AS ADVERTISED 
IN THE CURRENT MODELS...IT WOULD NOT BE AT ALL SURPRISING IF 
LARGE-SCALE ASCENT WAS ABLE TO DESTABILIZE THE AIR MASS MORE.  WILL 
NEED TO MONITOR THIS SITUATION.

FOR TEMPS...HAVE GONE ON THE COOL SIDE OF MAX TEMPS...WITH THE 
LARGEST CHANGE BEING IN THE NORTHEAST ON THURSDAY...WHEN THE UPPER 
LOW WILL BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO KEEP A LARGE SUPPLY OF CUMULUS AND 
STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS THAT WILL BOTH BLOCK THE SUN AND WILL DISSIPATE 
THE SURFACE HEATING THROUGH DEEPER CONVECTIVE MIXING.  SO WENT ABOUT 
2 CATEGORIES BELOW GUIDANCE ON THURSDAY NE OF KTRI.  WENT CLOSE TO 
MIN GUIDANCE...SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN GUIDANCE AROUND FRIDAY...AS 
RADIATIONAL COOLING SHOULD BE GOOD.  LASTLY...TRIMMED DEW POINT 
TEMPERATURES BACK 1-2 DEG ON FOR A COUPLE OF DAY...AS VALUES SEEMED 
TOO HIGH CONSIDERING THAT THE RETURN FLOW WILL BE SOMEWHAT FILTERED 
WITH A LOW IN THE GULF AND A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY DOWN THERE THAT 
WILL LIMIT THE MOVEMENT ON THE REALLY RICH GULF AIR.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             82  61  82  65  78 /   0  10  30  70  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  78  56  81  62  76 /   0   0  20  50  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       79  55  82  61  76 /   0   0  20  50  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              76  47  79  54  74 /   0   0  10  30  50 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...

SKIES AND CALM WINDS. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN PATCHY FOG ACROSS MOST
OF THE AREA...WITH AREAS OF DENSE FOG POSSIBLE NORTH AND IN THE
MOUNTAINS. WILL HAVE A MENTION OF FOG IN THE GRIDS AND ZONES...BUT

SHIFT EVALUATE. LOW TEMPS NORTH WILL DROP INTO THE 40S...WITH LOWER
TO MID 50S IN MOST OTHER VALLEY LOCATIONS. TOMORROW LOOKS SUNNY
WITH SCATTERED CU...AND HIGH TEMPS REACHING THE MID 70S NORTH TO
LOWER 80S SOUTH.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
MOSTLY DRY WEATHER AND SEASONAL TEMPERATURES FOR THE LONG
TERM...OUTSIDE OF 2 RAIN CHANCES. MOISTURE MAKES A RETURN WITH
ISENTROPIC LIFT DEVELOPING LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. THE
GFS MODEL AND NAM/GFSX MOS POPS HAVE COME INTO GOOD AGREEMENT WITH
THE LATEST ECMWF MODEL...WHICH SUPPORTS LIKELY POPS ACROSS THE SRN
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA BY WEDNESDAY. KEEPING THE MAX TEMPS DOWN
FROM GFSX MOS FOR WEDNESDAY...WHICH WAS ALSO NOTED IN THE TREND
FROM 22/00Z TO 22/12Z GFSX MOS.

SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGING DOMINATE AFTERWARDS UNTIL A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES BY SUNDAY...BUT POSSIBLY AS LATE AS EARLY MONDAY. NOT TOO 
DETAILED JUST YET FOR TIMING THE FRONT...BUT I DID INTRODUCE SLIGHT 
CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.

OTHERWISE...KEPT MIN AND MAX TEMPS CLOSE TO A BLEND OF THE COOLER 
ECMWF AND THE 22/12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT SUN SEP 22 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE TO OUR WEST WILL 
BUILD EAST AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILD IN FROM THE NORTHWEST AND 
NORTH.  DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN.  SHOULD SEE PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TODAY 
AND MAINLY CLEAR CONDITIONS TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE 
OVERALL SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE MORE AMPLIFIED AND SLOWER 
ECMWF WAS PREFERRED OVER THE GFS FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST. 
RIDGING KEEPS THE FORECAST AREA DRY ON MONDAY BUT THE RIDGE WILL 
GIVE WAY TO A HEALTHY UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WHICH APPROACHES THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON TUESDAY. AS THE TROUGH SHIFTS EAST LATER 
TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT SURFACE LOW PRESSURE LURKING OVER THE 
WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO WILL MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS MISSISSIPPI AND 
ALABAMA. THE ECMWF SHOWS INCREASING MOISTURE OFF THE GULF WILL BE 
LIFTED IN ISENTROPIC FASHION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
GENERATING SCATTERED SHOWERS MAINLY TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. 
THE WAVE WILL BE EXITING THE REGION LATER IN THE DAY WEDNESDAY BUT 
TRAILING ENERGY BUILDING SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
DEPARTING UPPER TROUGH MAY KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER AROUND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER UPPER RIDGE SHIFTS SLOWLY EAST INTO THE 
EASTERN STATES THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY BRINGING MORE DRY WEATHER 
TO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR THE LAST THREE DAYS OF THE WEEK. 
TRENDED THE TEMPERATURE FORECAST CLOSER TO ECM GUIDANCE DUE TO THE 
MID WEEK SYSTEM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT SAT SEP 21 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
PRECIP WILL BE MAKING ITS EXIT TO THE EAST OVER THE NEXT FEW 
HOURS...AND IS PROJECTED TO BE OUT OF OUR AREA AROUND 22Z. WILL 
CARRY AN EARLY EVENING PERIOD IN THE ZFP...BUT DROP ALL POPS AFTER 
00Z. CLEARING SKIES WILL FOLLOW A FEW HOURS LATER AS THE SURFACE 
FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH AXIS SWING THROUGH. FALLING DEWPOINTS AND A 
NORTH WIND WILL PREVENT MUCH FOG FROM DEVELOPING. HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE PLAINS WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA SUNDAY...PROVIDING MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES AND HIGH TEMPS IN THE 70S IN MOST SPOTS. 

LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
RIDGING WILL LIE OVER THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT 
AS HIGHER PRESSURE SLIDES FARTHER EAST AND SOUTH. WINDS WILL BE 
LIGHT AND THIS WILL ALLOW RADIATIONAL COOLING. LOWS IN THE UPPER 40S 
TO MID 50S WILL BE COMMON. MONDAY COOL HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO 
MODIFY WARMING TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES ABOVE SUNDAYS HIGHS. 

MONDAY NIGHT HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST AS NEW FRONTAL SYSTEM BEGINS 
TO MOVE INTO THE ROCKIES...AND TODAYS FRONT ALONG THE GULF COAST
BEGINS TO MOVE BACK NORTH WITH WARM AIR ADVECTION TO THE WEST AND
SOUTHWEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. THAT MOISTURE WILL INCREASE CLOUDS
MONDAY NIGHT AND ESPECIALLY TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. THE FRONT WILL
MOVE SLOWLY EAST ALONG THE GULF COAST. ONLY LIGHT SHOWERS ARE
EXPECTED NOW. GFS IS SOMEWHAT SLOWER THAN THE ECMWF AND BOTH MODELS
ARE TRYING TO DIG A TROUGH INTO THE REGION AS THE FRONT AND
PRECIPITATION MOVES EAST POSSIBLY EXTENDING THE CHANCE OF SHOWERS
INTO THURSDAY. FOR NOW WILL KEEP RAIN OUT THURSDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE
RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST. ANOTHER CHANGE BEGINS SATURDAY AS
RIDGE BREAKS DOWN AND NEW FRONT APPROACHES A FEW SHOWERS POSSIBLE
LATE SATURDAY WEST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SAT SEP 21 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST
STARTS OUT WET AS SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND SURFACE FRONT...TAPPING A
TROPICAL PLUME FROM THE PACIFIC AND NORTHERN GULF...CROSSES THE
REGION TODAY. THE BACKSIDE OF THE TROUGH CROSSES INTO NC THIS
EVENING AND SO THE RAIN WILL BE DIMINISHING FROM W TO E THIS
AFTERNOON THROUGH MIDNIGHT. SOME LOCATIONS MAY SEE OVER AN INCH OF
RAIN BUT MOST OF IT SHOULD BE OF A SOAKER VARIETY RATHER THAN
CONCENTRATED HEAVY DOWNPOURS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST 
STARTS OUT DRY AS HIGHER PRESSURED BUILDS IN BEHIND THE DEPARTED 
EASTERN STATES UPPER TROUGH. THE FAIR WEATHER MAY LAST INTO MONDAY 
NIGHT. HOWEVER...ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE 
EASTERN U.S. TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THE ECMWF INDICATED MORE 
AMPLIFICATION WITH THIS FEATURE AND WAS PREFERRED OVER THE GFS. USED 
SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE MID WEEK SYSTEM WHICH SHOULD BE 
MOVING AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
MORE RIDGING IS IN STORE AT THE END OF THE LONG TERM WHICH SHOULD 
ALLOW FOR A DRY AND WARMER END OF THE WORK WEEK. BECAUSE OF THE 
SLIGHTLY DIFFERING MODELS SOLUTIONS BETWEEN THE GFS AND 
ECMWF...STAYED CLOSER TO THE COOLER ECMWF CONCERNING MAX TEMPS 
DURING THE MID WEEK UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE.

670 
FXUS64 KMRX 201924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT FRI SEP 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A FEW ISOLATED LIGHT SHOWERS ARE CLOSE TO OUR SW VA COUNTIES...AND 
WILL DISSIPATE ONCE DAYTIME HEATING IS LOST. TO OUR WEST...SHOWERS 
OVER WEST TN ARE MAKING SLOW EASTWARD PROGRESS...AND MODELS PROJECT 
THEY WILL REACH THE PLATEAU AROUND 08Z...GIVE OR TAKE AN HOUR. 
MAXIMUM LIFT WITH QG-FORCING AND A 40-50 KT LLJ WILL CROSS THE AREA 
AROUND 10Z-16Z. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH TIMING. THERE IS 
SOME INSTABILITY SHOWN IN FORECAST SOUNDINGS TO ENHANCE LIFT DESPITE 
A LACK OF SURFACE HEARING...AND SO WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS. THE SURFACE COLD FRONT BEGINS TO PUSH INTO THE AREA 
IN THE LATE AFTERNOON...AND VERY DRY MIDLEVEL AIR BEHIND THE 500 MB 
TROUGH AXIS BRINGING SOME PARTIAL CLEARING TO WESTERN SECTIONS LATE 
IN THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
PRE FRONTAL SHOWERS AND FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL LIKELY EXIT THE
FORECAST AREA AROUND 00Z AHEAD OF STRONG UPPER TROUGH WITH ONLY A
FEW SHOWERS JUST AHEAD OF THE FRONT ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS
AND ADJACENT AREAS OF VA AND NC SATURDAY EVENING. AS RAIN
ENDS...SKIES WILL CLEAR AND TEMPERATURES SHOULD DROP INTO THE 50S
AS DRIER AIR MASS DROPS DOWN FROM THE NW. NAM MODEL BRINGS COOL
HIGH PRESSURE FARTHER SOUTH WITH DEW POINTS DROPPING TO THE UPPER
40S AND LOWER 50S VERSUS GFS ABOUT 5 DEGREES WARMER. PREFER TO
FOLLOW COOLER NAM TREND OF LOWS IN THE 50S SATURDAY NIGHT AND UPPER
40S TO MID 50S SUNDAY NIGHT. SUNDAY WITH NORTHERLY FLOW AND FULL
SUNSHINE HIGHS STILL MAY ONLY REACH UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S NORTH
AND MID TO UPPER 70S SOUTH. MODELS STILL KEEP A SYSTEM IN THE
WESTERN GULF OFF TEXAS SUNDAY THEN BRING IT EAST NORTHEAST TO THE
CENTRAL GULF COAST MONDAY AND NORTHWARD TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY.
THIS SHOULD BRUSH OVER THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AS
MOISTURE LIFTS OVER OLD FRONT. RIGHT NOW JUST HAVING LOW POPS AS
TRACK OF SYSTEM MAY STAY FARTHER SOUTH. RIDGING ALOFT BUILDS BACK
OVER THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY WITH TEMPERATURES
SLIGHTLY WARMER AND NO RAIN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

BE LACKING BUT THERE WILL BE SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO WORK WITH.
THE CURRENT FORECAST OF SCATTERED TO ISOLATED POPS APPEARS
REASONABLE WITH NO COMPELLING EVIDENCE TO WARRANT A CHANGE. TEMPS
APPEAR ON TRACK AS WELL AND IN LINE WITH THE LATEST GUIDANCE...SO
NO UPDATE WILL BE NEEDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT FRI SEP 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE AREA 
WILL GIVE WAY TO TROUGHING OVERNIGHT...AND A COLD FRONT WILL BE 
APPROACHING LATE TONIGHT.  BEST INSTABILITY TODAY...ALBEIT STILL ON 
THE WEAK SIDE...WILL BE NORTH.  WILL CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS NORTH 
WITH SLIGHT CHANCE EXTENDING INTO CENTRAL AREAS.  WILL INCREASE POPS 
TO CATEGORICAL FAR WEST AND LIKELY ELSEWHERE EXCEPT FAR NORTHEAST 
ZONES BY LATE TONIGHT AS FRONT APPROACHES.  INSTABILITY STILL LOOKS 
WEAK OVERNIGHT SO WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE OF 
THUNDER.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO JUST SOME MINOR 
TWEAKS.      

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY DRIVING A 
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. TWEAKED POPS UP A TAD FOR THE 
BIG FRONTAL PUSH WHICH APPEARS LIKE IT MAY COME THROUGH WITH LIMITED 
INSTABILITY. THEREFORE...KEPT THE WIDESPREAD SHOWER LOOK TO THE 
ZONES WITH JUST A CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS. FRONTAL TIMING STILL A 
LITTLE UNCERTAIN WITH MODELS INDICATING A WAVE ON THE BOUNDARY. 
BASICALLY HAD THE HIGHEST POPS DURING THE MORNING WITH A TAPERING 
TREND AFTERNOON. JUST HELD ONTO A SLIGHT OR SMALL CHANCE POP FOR THE 
EASTERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT DUE TO UNCERTAINTY 
IN SYSTEM DEPARTURE. HOWEVER...SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY LOOKS DRY WITH 
HEIGHTS BUILDING IN THE WAKE OF THE EASTERN TROUGH. THE TUESDAY 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY PERIOD IS INTERESTING WITH GFS/ECMWF DISSIMILAR IN 
STRENGTH AND TIMING OF AN UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE ACROSS THE EASTERN 
U.S. THE FEATURE ENHANCES LIFT IN THE LOW LEVELS ACROSS THE GULF 
COASTAL REGION AND DEEP SOUTH WHERE ONE WOULD ASSUME THE HIGHER 
PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION WOULD BE LOCATED. ISENTROPIC LIFTING 
COULD GENERATE SOME LIGHT QPF ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AS 
WELL. HOWEVER...DECIDED TO KEEP POPS BELOW 15 PERCENT FOR THIS 
SYSTEM AT THIS TIME WHILE AWAITING BETTER MODEL AGREEMENT IN LATER 
RUNS. RIDGING BUILDS BEHIND THIS FEATURE ON THURSDAY SO THIS WILL BE 
A DRY DAY AS WELL WITH A SLIGHT WARMING TREND.

156 
FXUS64 KMRX 200120
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT THU SEP 19 2013

.DISCUSSION...SHORT WAVE UPPER RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT. SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS NORTHEAST AREAS
ALONG EDGE OF DEW POINT BOUNDARY. TEMPS AND DEW POINTS RUNNING A 
COUPLE DEGREES WARMER THAN WEDNESDAY AND CURRENT FORECAST MINS LOOK 
GOOD. PATCHY OVERNIGHT FOG POSSIBLE. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED OVER ERN KY...AND MAY AFFECT
SW VA AND NE TN THIS EVENING. WITH THE 850-700 MB RIDGE REMAINING
NEARLY STATIONARY...THE NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA WILL KEEP
A CHANCE OF PRECIP THROUGH FRIDAY AS WEAK DISTURBANCES CROSS OVER
THAT AREA IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT. SOUTHERN AREAS SHOULD REMAIN DRY
UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF THE RIDGE. WITH SUCH WEAK FORCING FOR
LIFT...THE NAM POPS POPS IN THE LIKELY RANGE APPEAR TOO HIGH...SO
WILL KEEP POPS IN THE SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE RANGE...CLOSER TO THE
DRIER GFS MOS. TEMPS TOMORROW WILL CONTINUE TO TREND WARMER...WITH
MID 80S SOUTH UNDER MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES...TO MID 70S NORTH UNDER
BROKEN CLOUDS.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHEAST BREAKS DOWN FRIDAY NIGHT AS COLD FRONT
APPROACHES WITH SHOWERS AND CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS LATE FRIDAY
NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. RAINFALL AMOUNTS MAY BE ONE HALF INCH OR
MORE SATURDAY IF TROPICAL MOISTURE GETS PUMPED INTO REGION FROM THE
GULF. LOWS SATURDAY MORNING ABOVE NORMAL IN THE 60S WITH HIGHS
SATURDAY 70S TO NEAR 80 BUT MAY BE AFFECTED DOWNWARD BY AMOUNT OF
RAIN THAT FALLS.

SHORT RANGE MODELS MOVING FRONT THROUGH FASTER BUT ECMWF 
SLOWER SOLUTION WITH LOW PRESSURE OVER TX AND THE LOWER MS VALLEY 
WITH POSSIBLE TROPICAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE GULF MOVING INLAND AND 
LINGERING SUNDAY AND THEN MOVING SLOWLY NORTHEAST MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY. NAM/GFS KEEP TROPICAL SYSTEM FARTHER SOUTH AND OFFSHORE IN 
WESTERN GULF SATURDAY AND SUNDAY ALLOWING FRONT TO MOVE MOISTURE 
SOUTH OF THE REGION FASTER AND TAKE PRECIPITATION OUT AS EARLY AS 
LATE SATURDAY. HAVE COMPROMISED AND KEPT RAIN CHANCES HIGH THROUGH 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON WITH LOWERING POPS SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. 
THEN KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY NIGHT AS SYSTEM 
IN GULF MOVES NORTHEAST BUT STAYS MOSTLY SOUTH AND EAST OF FORECAST 
AREA. LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE COOLER BEHIND FRONT. SUNDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY HIGHS IN THE MID 70S TO NEAR 80 WITH LOWS MID 50S TO 
NEAR 60 NEAR SEASONAL TEMPERATURES. TUESDAY ANOTHER POSSIBLE WEAK 
BOUNDARY OR FRONT MAY PASS THROUGH WITH RAIN CHANCES LOW ENOUGH TO 
NOT INCLUDE NOW. NORTHERLY FLOW BEHIND BOUNDARY AND BUILDING HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER REGION WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO BE SIMILAR WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY BUT COOLER NIGHTS AS SKIES WILL BE MOSTLY CLEAR. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  84  67  78  59 /  10  20  60  80  40

416 
FXUS64 KMRX 190718
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 AM EDT THU SEP 19 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS
LOCATED ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THIS
BOUNDARY ALONG WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL ONCE AGAIN PRODUCE
SCATTERED SHOWERS. INSTABILITY REMAINS LIMITED SO DID NOT INCLUDE
THUNDER. CONVECTION WILL DISSIPATE SOON BEFORE SUNSET. BESIDES
CHANCES OF SHOWERS...AREAS/PATCHY FOG CAN BE EXPECTED THIS MORNING
AND AGAIN FRIDAY MORNING.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LATEST MODEL RUNS ARE IN 
BETTER AGREEMENT (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY) WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE 
PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A WET 
SCENARIO ON SATURDAY WITH THE PASSAGE OF A COLD FRONT. ON FRIDAY... 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC AND AN UPPER-LEVEL 
RIDGE WILL COMBINE TO CREATE A VERY WARM DAY WITH TEMPS AROUND TEN 
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING 
IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...EXPECT SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION TO 
DEVELOP...ESPECIALLY OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. A COLD 
FRONT WILL THEN MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY...WITH THE MODELS INDICATING SOME DEEP MOISTURE FROM THE 
WESTERN GULF ADVECTING NORTHEASTWARD AHEAD IT. THUS...IT APPEARS 
THAT SATURDAY COULD BE A FAIRLY WET DAY WITH WIDESPREAD RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS OF 1 TO 3 INCHES POSSIBLE. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE ONLY A 
WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL EMPHASIZE 
SHOWERS WITH JUST A CHANCE OF TSTORMS. THE LONG-RANGE MODELS ARE IN 
BETTER AGREEMENT THIS MORNING WITH THE STRENGTH OF THE AMPLIFIED 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BEHIND THIS FRONT...WITH MOST OF THE POST-FRONTAL 
RAIN EXPECTED TO MOVE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY. THE ECMWF 
MODEL INDICATES SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY...DUE TO CYCLOGENESIS OVER THE SOUTHEAST. 
THUS...WILL KEEP SOME SMALL CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST FOR EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE IS THEN PROGGED TO BUILD OVER 
THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...RESULTING IN 
DRIER AND WARMER CONDITIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND 
CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD... 
WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             85  63  86  68  79 /  10  10  20  70  70

290 
FXUS64 KMRX 190039
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
836 PM EDT WED SEP 18 2013

.DISCUSSION...SHORT WAVE ALOFT MOVING EAST OF THE AREA THIS EVENING. 
OVERNIGHT RAIN CHANCE BELOW 20 PERCENT. IMPULSE MOVING THROUGH WV 
OVERNIGHT MAY AID IS SOME LIGHT RAIN SPRINKLES ACROSS NORTHERN 
AREAS. FORECAST MINS VERY CLOSE TO SREF MEAN AND LOOK GOOD. SON
   
PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS MAY LINGER IN NE SECTIONS THIS EVENING...BUT 
MOST PRECIP WILL END BY 00Z AS A VORT MAX EXITS THE REGION. WEAK 
ISENTROPIC LIFT IS SHOWN BY THE MODELS TO PERSIST OVERNIGHT IN 
NORTHERN AREAS...WHICH SHOULD KEEP SIGNIFICANT CLOUD COVER OVER THAT 
AREA. WILL LEAN TEMPS TOWARD THE WARMER NAM MOS GUIDANCE TONIGHT. 

A MID-UPPER RIDGE WILL BE BUILDING OVER THE MS VALLEY 
TOMORROW...KEEPING A NW FLOW OVER THE AREA. THE NAM CONTINUES TO 
SHOW WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT ACROSS THE NORTH WITH THIS PATTERN...BUT 
OTHER LIFTING MECHANISMS FOR PRECIP ARE LACKING. THE NAM MOS POPS 
ARE IN THE CATEGORICAL RANGE NORTH...WHICH APPEARS WAY TOO HIGH 
GIVEN THE LACK OF STRONG LIFT AND DEEP MOISTURE ADVECTION. SO WILL 
LEAN MORE TOWARD THE GFS MOS POPS...WHICH ARE IN THE CHANCE RANGE 
NORTH. THE UPPER RIDGE TO OUR WEST PROGRESSES INTO THE AREA THURSDAY 
NIGHT...WHICH SHOULD END ANY CHANCE OF PRECIP AFTER MIDNIGHT.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
THIS PERIOD STARTS FRIDAY MORNING WITH A SHORT WAVE UPPER LEVEL
RIDGE OVER THE AREA...WITH THE SURFACE RIDGE JUST TO THE EAST OF
THE AREA...WITH THE ANTI-CYCLONIC RETURN FLOW JUST BEGINNING.
ALSO...THERE IS AN APPROACHING SHORT WAVE TROUGH LOCATED OVER THE
PLAINS WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. THE APPROACH OF THE FRONT
SLOWS AND A INVERTED TROUGH BUILDS NORTHWARD FROM THE GULF. MODELS
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT TO KEEP THE FRONT IN OR NEAR THE AREA ALL
WEEKEND. BY MONDAY...THE SYSTEM IS STARTING TO EXIT THE AREA...BUT
MIGHT HAVE SOME WRAP-AROUND / TROWAL TYPE PRECIPITATION
CHANCES...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTH. ALSO...WITH THE COLD CORE UPPER
LOW NOT TOO FAR AWAY...THE AREA MAY KEEP SOME MINIMAL
INSTABILITY...ONCE AGAIN NORTH AND ESPECIALLY NORTHEAST WILL HAVE
BETTER CHANCES.

AS SLOWLY MOVING AS THIS SYSTEM IS...IT IS A LITTLE DANGEROUS TO GO 
WITH THE POPS AS HIGH AS THIS LATEST GUIDANCE FOR SATURDAY WITH POPS 
IN THE 80 PERCENT RANGE...ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ARE NOT NEARLY AS 
AGGRESSIVE FOR SATURDAY. IF IS SLOWS DOWN OR SPEEDS UP WITH A DRY 
SLOT SOME STATIONS COULD BE DRY THAT 12 HOUR PERIOD. 

FOR TEMPS WENT PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE FOR THE FIRST COUPLE OF 
PERIODS...AND THEN WENT 2-4 DEG COOLER FOR THE NORTHEAST FOR HIGH 
TEMPS FOR THE LAST SEVERAL PERIODS DUE TO THE COLD CORE INSTABILITY 
MIXING ANY SURFACE HEATING UPWARD.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             62  84  63  88  68 /   0  10  10  10  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  61  81  62  86  65 /  10  20  10  10  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  80  62  87  64 /  10  20  10  10  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              59  77  60  85  59 /  10  30  20  10  30 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

MVFR CIGS AND VSBY AT TRI WILL LOWER TO IFR CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT.

AND STRATUS BURN OFF THURSDAY MORNING. MOST OF THE LOWER BROKEN

EXPECTED FOR THURSDAY. LIGHT SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EDT WED SEP 18 2013

.AVIATION...
CONSIDERABLE CLOUDINESS AND LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ARE OVER THE AREA
THIS MORNING...THANKS TO WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT AT 300K AND A
MIDLEVEL VORT MAX OVER WEST/CNTL KY. THE 12Z OHX SOUNDING SHOWS
DEEP MOISTURE UPSTREAM...SO EXPECT THAT CLOUDY CONDITIONS AND LIGHT
RAIN SHOWERS WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE DAY...WITH THE GREATEST
PRECIP CHANCES NORTH CLOSER TO THE VORT MAX. WILL UPDATE TO ADJUST
POP/WX GRIDS TO BETTER MATCH RADAR TRENDS. TEMPS APPEAR ON TRACK
AND WILL NOT BE CHANGED.

ARE TOO LOW TO MENTION IN THE TAF. CONTINUED SURFACE RIDGING WILL

360 
FXUS64 KMRX 180653
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 AM EDT WED SEP 18 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGING JUST EAST OF THE
APPALACHIANS AND UPPER RIDGING ALOFT WILL REMAIN THROUGH TONIGHT.
WEAK SOUTHERLY WINDS ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SURFACE RIDGE WILL
PRODUCE WEAK TO MODERATE ISENTROPIC LIFT ACROSS THE TENNESSEE AND
OHIO VALLEYS TODAY AND TONIGHT. THIS LIFT WILL GENERATE BROKEN
5-8KFT CLOUDS OVER THE AREA. ALSO...SCATTERED SHOWERS ANTICIPATED
OVER THE OHIO VALLEY AND WESTERN/MIDDLE TENNESSEE VALLEY WHERE
ISENTROPIC LIFT IS THE STRONGEST. SOME OF THIS ACTIVITY MAY MOVE
INTO THE PLATEAU AND WESTERN SECTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED A COMPROMISE OF NAM/GFS MOS DUE TO BEST
PERFORMANCE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT THEN 
SHOW SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE HANDLING OF AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC AND AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE WILL COMBINE TO 
CREATE A WARMING TREND WITH ISOLATED CONVECTION DEVELOPING IN THE 
AFTERNOONS AND EVENINGS. A COLD FRONT WILL THEN MOVE ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...WITH THE MODELS INDICATING 
SOME TROPICAL MOISTURE FROM THE WESTERN GULF ADVECTING NORTHEASTWARD 
AHEAD IT. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT SATURDAY COULD BE A FAIRLY WET DAY 
WITH WIDESPREAD RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF 1 TO 2 INCHES POSSIBLE. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE A FAIRLY STABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA...SO WILL EMPHASIZE SHOWERS WITH JUST A CHANCE OF TSTORMS. THE 
MODELS THEN REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH HOW LONG THIS RAIN WILL 
LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH THE GFS AND 
CANADIAN MODELS DEVELOPING A DEEPER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH ON SUNDAY 
THAN THE ECMWF MODEL...RESULTING IN A SLOWER EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF 
THIS SYSTEM AND ITS ASSOCIATED RAINFALL. FOR NOW...WILL COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THESE TWO SOLUTIONS BY MENTIONING A CHANCE OF RAIN THROUGH 
SUNDAY NIGHT...AND DRY CONDITIONS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             82  62  87  63  88 /  10  10  20  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  79  60  85  61  86 /  10  10  20  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       78  60  86  61  87 /  20  10  20  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              76  56  83  58  84 /  10  10  30  30  30 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT TUE SEP 17 2013

.DISCUSSION...
OVERALL NOT MUCH CHANGE TO THE FORECAST. LOWERED POPS IN NORTHERN
PLATEAU THROUGH THE NIGHT. INSTABILITY IS LOW NOW THAT SUN HAS SET
AND REALLY DO NOT SEE ANYTHING ELSE DEVELOPING. CLOUD COVER WILL
CONTINUE TO INCREASE THROUGH THE NIGHT ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE. THIS WILL
LIMIT THE RADIATIONAL COOLING...SO HAVE RAISED LOW TEMPERATURES A
FEW DEGREES. OTHERWISE...ISOLATED SHOWERS EXPECTED AGAIN TOMORROW
MORNING INTO AFTERNOON.

689 
FXUS64 KMRX 171932
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT TUE SEP 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...A LOW LEVEL EASTERLY 
FLOW OFF THE ATLANTIC HAS LED TO SLIGHTLY REDUCED TEMPERATURES TODAY 
ALONG WITH SOME MOISTURE AROUND 850-700 MB. THE LOWER LEVEL FLOW 
WILL GRADUALLY BECOME SOUTHERLY WITH INCREASING TEMPERATURE AND 
MOISTURE ADVECTION LATER TONIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. THE LOW LEVEL WARM 
ADVECTION AND A WEAK SHORT WAVE TROUGH MAY LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT 
OF A COUPLE SHOWERS ON WEDNESDAY...MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS. 
LIFT IS NOT PARTICULARLY IMPRESSIVE AND THEREFORE...KEPT PROBABILITY 
OF SHOWERS LOW. HELD ONTO A SLIGHT CHANCE WEDNESDAY EVENING AS THE 
FEATURE MAKES ITS WAY ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS. STAYED NEAR THE 
MIDDLE OF GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES THROUGHOUT THE SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...NOT A WHOLE LOT HAS 
CHANGED IN THE IMMEDIATE LONG TERM...BUT THERE ARE CHANGES FOR THE 
WEEKEND SYSTEM. BRIEF RIDGING FOR THURSDAY FLATTENS OUT ON FRIDAY IN 
ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. TEMPS LOOK TO BE IN 
THE LOW TO MID 80S FOR MOST PLACES WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER TO 
NEAR 60S. WILL LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR A POSSIBLE AFTERNOON 
SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM FOR BOTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  

NOW ON TO THE WEEKEND. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH IS STILL PROGGED TO 
SWING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES OVER THE WEEKEND WITH ITS ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH OUR AREA ON SATURDAY. YESTERDAY THE GFS 
WAS SHOWING THE FRONT MOVING THROUGH ON SATURDAY WITH CLEARING 
CONDITIONS BY LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON. THE 06Z RUN OF THE GFS SHOWED 
VORTICITY IN THE BASE OF THE TROUGH BECOMING CUT OFF FROM THE MAIN 
TROUGH WITH SOMEWHAT OF A CUT-OFF LOW DEVELOPING OVER OUR AREA. THIS 
IS COMPLETELY DIFFERENT FROM YESTERDAYS RUN AND WOULD SIGNIFICANTLY 
DELAY THE EXIT OF THIS FEATURE. TODAYS 12Z RUN OF THE GFS ALSO 
DEVELOPS SOMEWHAT OF A CUT OFF LOW BUT KEEPS IT MUCH FURTHER TO OUR 
SOUTH...THUS HAVING LESS OF AN IMPACT ACROSS OUR AREA THAN THE 06Z 
SOLUTION. THE ECMWF IS LINE WITH YESTERDAY'S GFS RUN...A QUICKER 
EXIT WITH NO CUT-OFF LOW. NEEDLESS TO SAY...THE MODELS ARE NOT IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS SYSTEM. REGARDLESS OF 
WHICH SOLUTION IS RIGHT...IT DOES LOOK LIKE RAIN WILL MOVE THROUGH 
OUR AREA ON SATURDAY WITH THE ARRIVAL OF THE FRONT...BUT HOW QUICKLY 
IT EXITS IS YET TO BE DETERMINED. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AROUND THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT BUT CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON POPS PAST 
SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY DRY FOR NOW WITH 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING BACK IN BEHIND THIS WEEKENDS SYSTEM. TEMPS 
AND CLOUDS WITH THE WEEKEND SYSTEM ARE TRICKY DUE TO THE 
AFOREMENTIONED REASONS. FOR NOW...WILL TREND A TAD COOLER THAN 
GUIDANCE IS SUGGESTING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             62  81  62  84  62 /  10  20  
10  10  10 KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  79  60  82  61 
/   0  20  20  10  10 OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  79  
60  83  60 /  10  20  20  10  10 TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              
52  77  56  80  55 /   0  30  20  20  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

FXUS64 KMRX 171746
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
146 PM EDT TUE SEP 17 2013

.AVIATION...LOW LEVEL EASTERLY FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE EASTERN
SEABOARD RIDGE IS KEEPING A SCATTERED TO BROKEN LAYER OF SC AROUND
FIVE TO SEVEN THOUSAND FEET TODAY. A LOWER SCATTERED TO BROKEN DECK
IS OVER THE EXTREME SOUTHERN EXTENT OF THE APPALACHIANS. THIS LAYER
WILL IMPACT CHA THIS AFTERNOON. A WEAK SHORT WAVE WITH A FAIR
AMOUNT OF AC AND CI WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY. THERE
WILL BE A SMALL CHANCE FOR A SHOWER MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS
OF THE GREAT VALLEY. THE CHANCE IS TOO LOW FOR MENTION IN THE TAF
AT TRI. ALL IN ALL NOT BAD FLYING WEATHER WITH A DECENT CHANCE FOR
VFR CONDITIONS THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.

643 
FXUS64 KMRX 171401
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1001 AM EDT TUE SEP 17 2013

.DISCUSSION...ANOTHER RELATIVELY QUIET WEATHER DAY IN STORE ACROSS
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER AND
DRIER AIR IN PLACE FOLLOWING MONDAY'S FRONTAL PASSAGE. THE AIR IS
ALSO MORE STABLE WITH A WARM LAYER HANGING IN AROUND 700 MB. WILL
FINE TUNE THE FORECAST WITH THIS IN MIND. NOT SO SURE THERE WILL BE
MUCH PRECIP TODAY IN THIS STABLE AIR. IF A SHOWER DEVELOPS (AND THE
CHANCE REMAINS SLIGHT) THIS AFTERNOON WITH WEAK IMPULSE SLIDING
EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH...IT MAY BE LIMITED TO THE HIGHER
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TERRAIN AS WELL AS THE MOUNTAINS ACROSS EXTREME
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THE EASTERLY FLOW
AROUND THE WEDGE MAY PROVIDE THE NECESSARY OROGRAPHIC LIFT. THE 
TEMPERATURE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             85  62  80  59  84 /  10  20  30  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  82  62  79  59  82 /   0  20  30  10  10

879 
FXUS64 KMRX 170712
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT TUE SEP 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS...WITH A 
MILD AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH 
IS PROGGED TO REMAIN AROUND THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
WITH A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE COMBINING WITH IT TO TRIGGER A 
FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS. MODELS SOUNDINGS REVEAL A FAIRLY STABLE AIR 
MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL NOT MENTION ANY TSTORMS. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES 
WITH MAXES FOR TODAY...MAINLY DUE TO DIFFERENCES IN THEIR CLOUD 
COVER FORECASTS. WILL BASICALLY TREND CLOSE TO A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...FOR WEDNESDAY...MODELS SHOW 
A WEAK SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO AND TENNESSEE RIVER 
VALLEYS. INSTABILITY IS LACKING...BUT WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW POPS 
AND MOSTLY CLOUDY SKY. FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...SURFACE AND UPPER 
RIDGING WILL PRODUCE MOSTLY DRY CONDITIONS AND WARMER TEMPERATURES 
AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS FRIDAY.

THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY PRODUCING PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR SATURDAY. MODELS SHOW INSTABILITY LIMITED...SO 
MAINLY SHOWERS. MAIN FORCING WILL BE FRONTO-GENETIC SATURDAY WITH 
OROGRAPHIC FORCING FOR SUNDAY AS UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST OF THE AREA 
AND NORTHWEST DEVELOPS.

UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST OF THE AREA FOR MONDAY WITH RETURN OF DRY 
CONDITIONS.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 161916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT MON SEP 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...COLD FRONT CURRENTLY 
ALONG A LINE JUST SOUTH OF TRI EXTENDING WEST TO NEAR CSV WITH SOME 
ISOLATED SPRINKLES...POSSIBLY A LIGHT SHOWER OCCURRING JUST BEHIND 
THE SURFACE FRONT. AIRMASS IS CERTAINLY LACKING MOISTURE AND 
WOULDN'T EXPECT MUCH IN THE WAY OF MEASURABLE RAIN TONIGHT. 
HOWEVER...THERE MAY BE A SHOWER IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS EXTREME 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AS THE FRONT BUILDS 
SOUTH SO INCLUDED HERE. LOOKS LIKE A FAIR AMOUNT OF SC BEHIND THE 
FRONT TONIGHT SO KEPT SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY. FOG PROBABLY WON'T BE 
MUCH OF A PROBLEM BUT THERE COULD BE SOME PATCHY LIGHT FOG MAINLY 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. ON TUESDAY THE 
LOW LEVEL FLOW BECOMES SOUTHEASTERLY AROUND THE WEDGE SURFACE HIGH 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND OROGRAPHIC 
LIFT COULD SPARK A SHOWER IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER AND ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ON TUESDAY. 
ANOTHER WAVE WITH INCREASING MOISTURE ADVECTION ON LOW LEVEL 
SOUTHERLY COMPONENT MAY PROVIDE FOR A LIGHT SHOWER MAINLY ACROSS THE 
SOUTHWESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. TRENDED MIN 
TEMPS CLOSER TO THE MILDER MET TEMPS TONIGHT WHILE STAYING IN THE 
MIDDLE OF MET/MAV GUIDANCE FOR MAXES ON TUESDAY AND ALSO FOR MINS 
TUESDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GENERALLY SOUTHERLY FLOW 
AT 850MB AND THE SURFACE WILL CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY AND HELP TO 
SLOWLY INCREASE DEWPOINTS FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR 
THE CHANCE OF DIURNAL CONVECTION EACH DAY. UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO 
FLATTEN OUT ON WEDNESDAY WITH RIDGE AXIS MOVING OFF TO OUR EAST DUE 
TO A PROGRESSIVE UPPER LEVEL FLOW. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION OVER THE WEEKEND AND ITS ASSOCIATED 
FRONT LOOKS TO MOVE THROUGH OUR AREA DURING THE FRIDAY 
NIGHT/SATURDAY TIME-FRAME. OUR BEST CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED WILL BE WHEN THIS FEATURE MOVES THROUGH ON 
FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY. MODELS SHOW THE FRONT MOVING THROUGH FAIRLY 
QUICKLY AND EXITING OUR AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY MORNING. 
THIS SHOULD ALLOW FOR A NICE SUNDAY AFTERNOON AFTER EARLY MORNING 
CLOUD COVER PUSHES OFF TO THE EAST WITH THE FRONT. AS OF NOW...A 
PLEASANT MONDAY IS IN STORE AS THE FRONT WILL BE WELL TO OUR SOUTH 
BY THIS TIME AND RIDGING STARTS TO BUILD BACK IN. TEMPS WILL REMAIN 
CLOSE TO SEASONAL AVERAGES THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

FXUS64 KMRX 160720
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT MON SEP 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FOR THIS MORNING...PATCHY FOG CAN
BE EXPECTED..ESPECIALLY NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS.

AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEAST
WILL PULL A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. CURRENTLY FRONT IS
LOCATED NEAR THE OHIO RIVER PRODUCING SCATTERED SHOWERS. MODELS
SHOW THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SLOWLY
MOISTENING...BUT MID-LEVEL INVERSION WILL KEEP INSTABILITY VERY
LIMITED. ALSO...ANY UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT WITH TROUGH WILL STAY WELL
NORTH AND EAST OF THE AREA..SO ONLY SLIGHT POPS AT BEST FOR TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT...DRIER AIR WILL ONCE AGAIN ADVECT INTO THE AREA
PRODUCING PARTLY CLOUDY/MOSTLY CLEAR SKY WITH PATCHY FOG.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY/...
A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS 
THE REGION FOR THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL HELP 
TO DRAW BACK SOME GULF MOISTURE INTO THE REGION AND ALLOW FOR SOME 
ISOLATED CONVECTION ON TUESDAY AND SCATTERED STORMS ON WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY AS THE RIDGE BEGINS TO FLATTEN AND MOVE TO THE SOUTHWEST BY 
FRIDAY. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH PROGRESSING EASTWARD OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY WILL SEND A COLD FRONT INTO WESTERN/MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE ON FRIDAY AND EVENTUALLY THE SOUTHERN APPALCHIANS FRIDAY 
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SOME EVEN BETTER CHANCES 
FOR MORE ORGANIZED CLUSTERS OF STORMS LATE IN THE WEEK. THE FRONT 
SHOULD CLEAR THE AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH RIDGING SLOWLY 
BUILDING BACK IN FOR SUNDAY. HIGHS WILL REMAIN FAIRLY STEADY IN THE 
LOW TO PERHAPS MID 80S FOR MUCH OF THE UPCOMING WEEK...WITH PERHAPS 
SOME SLIGHT COOLER READINGS THIS WEEKEND.

FXUS64 KMRX 151911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT SUN SEP 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS 
WILL SLOWLY BE ON THE CLIMB THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. ANOTHER QUIET 
NIGHT IN STORE WITH TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN LAST 
NIGHT. A FEW AREAS OF PATCHY FOG ARE AGAIN POSSIBLE TOMORROW 
MINORING...ESPECIALLY NEAR ANY BODIES OF WATER. HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO MOVE OFF TO OUR EAST OVERNIGHT IN ADVANCE OF AN 
APPROACHING TROUGH ON MONDAY. THE TROUGH SWINGS DOWN ACROSS THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY BUT WILL MAINLY STAY TO OUR NORTHEAST. ITS ASSOCIATED 
FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH THROUGH OUR AREA DURING THE DAY ON MONDAY. A 
LACK OF FORCING WILL RESULT IN A MOSTLY DRY FRONTAL PASSAGE. WILL 
KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS PORTIONS OF NE TN AND SW VA. A BRIEF 
RETURN TO NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT AND FRONTAL 
PASSAGE. CLOUDS WILL ADVANCE FROM NORTH TO SOUTH WITH THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE AND RESULT IN MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS FOR MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY FROM THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND NORTHWARD. 
WEAK RIDGING RETURNS ON TUESDAY...BUT TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS 
WILL BE SUPPORTIVE OF POSSIBLE DIURNAL CONVECTION DURING THE 
AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...FLAT UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
BUILDS INTO THE EASTERN STATES THROUGH MID WEEK AS WEAK SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY COMBINES WITH AN INCREASINGLY SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL COMPONENT 
TO THE FLOW. THE INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD LEAD TO THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF WIDELY SCATTERED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS AND A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. MODELS CONTINUE TO PORTRAY 
DIFFERING SPEED TO A HEALTHY LONG WAVE TROUGH AS IT SHIFTS ACROSS 
THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. FRONTAL 
TIMING WITH THIS SYSTEM IN QUESTION LATE IN THE WEEK SO MAINTAINED 
THE PREVIOUS FORECAST SCENARIO WHICH PLACES THE HIGHEST POPS FOR 
FRONTAL CONVECTION ON FRIDAY NIGHT. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN SYSTEM 
TIMING WITH POSSIBILITY OF ANOTHER WAVE ON THE SOUTHERN END OF THE 
COLD FRONT SLOWING FROPA...KEPT MEDIUM AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING 
THROUGH THE END OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST.

469 
FXUS64 KMRX 150745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT SUN SEP 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOUTHEAST BOUNDARY LAYER WINDS IS
PULLING SHALLOW MOISTURE (AROUND 5KFT) INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. SCATTERED CLOUDS ARE ALREADY DEVELOPING ACROSS
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. SINCE THE
MOISTURE WILL BE FAIRLY SHALLOW WILL ONLY INCLUDE PARTLY CLOUDY SKY
WORDING. BESIDES THE CLOUDS...PATCHY FOG IS POSSIBLE THIS MORNING..
MAINLY NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS.

RIDGING AND CONTINUED DRY AIRMASS (PWS LESS THAN 1 INCH) WILL KEEP
FORCAST DRY. 

.LONG TERM /MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY/...
A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL FLATTEN ON MONDAY AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
PASSES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND WILL ALLOW A WEAK COLD FRONT TO 
MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONT WILL PROVIDE VERY LITTLE 
IN THE WAY OF PRECIPITATION CHANCES AS ONLY ISOLATED STORMS ARE 
EXPECTED AND WILL MAINLY BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN. THE 
AFOREMENTIONED RIDGE WILL THEN BUILD BACK IN AS ZONAL FLOW PREVAILS 
ALOFT FOR MUCH OF THE WORK WEEK. HOWEVER...SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL 
ALLOW FOR GULF MOISTURE TO RETURN INTO THE REGION ON TUESDAY... 
ALLOWING FOR SOME INCREASING CHANCES FOR DIURNALLY DRIVEN SCATTERED 
CONVECTION UNDERNEATH THE RIDGE EACH DAY THROUGH THURSDAY. ON 
FRIDAY...A STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE REGION FROM THE 
WEST AND GIVE THE AREA AN EVEN BETTER SHOT OF STORMS TO CLOSE OUT 
THE WORK WEEK INTO THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. HIGHS WILL REMAIN FAIRLY 
STEADY IN THE LOW TO PERHAPS MID 80S FOR MUCH OF THE UPCOMING 
WEEK...WITH PERHAPS SOME SLIGHT COOLER READINGS THIS WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT SAT SEP 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...NOT A WHOLE LOT GOING ON IN 
THE IMMEDIATE SHORT TERM. OVERNIGHT TEMPS WILL BE SLIGHTLY WARMER 
THAN LAST NIGHT BUT STILL WELL BELOW SEASONAL AVERAGES. WINDS SHOULD 
BE A LITTLE CALMER TONIGHT WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR A FEW PATCHY AREAS 
OF STEAM FOG AS LOCAL RIVERS AND LAKES ARE STILL WARM. HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD THROUGH SUNDAY WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES EARLY 
AND A FEW CLOUDS MOVING IN LATER IN THE DAY. SOUTHERLY SURFACE FLOW 
RETURNS SUNDAY AND WILL ALLOW FOR TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS TO REBOUND. 
ANOTHER TROUGH BEGINS TO APPROACH THE REGION ON MONDAY. THE HEART OF 
THE TROUGH SHOULD STAY TO OUR NORTHEAST BUT ITS ASSOCIATED FRONT 
WILL MOVE SOUTH THROUGH OUR AREA SOMETIME ON MONDAY 
AFTERNOON/EVENING. CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE ON MONDAY AS 
MOISTURE INCREASE AT ALL LEVELS...BUT A LACK OF LIFT WILL PREVENT 
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS. SO ONLY A FEW SPOTTY SHOWERS AND A POSSIBLE 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM IS ANTICIPATED AT THIS TIME. WILL GO SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR PORTIONS OF NE TN AND SW VA.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...STAYED CLOSE TO 
PREVIOUS FORECAST WHICH FEATURES LOW PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION 
THROUGH MOST OF THE WEEK WITH THE ATMOSPHERE ONLY SLOWLY MOISTENING 
IN THE WAKE OF THE EARLY WEEK COOL FRONT. MODELS APPEAR TO BE 
CONVERGING ON A SCENARIO WHICH INCLUDES THE APPROACH OF ANOTHER COLD 
FRONT FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. BEST FRONTAL TIMING AT THIS TIME APPEARS 
TO BE FRIDAY NIGHT SO ADJUSTED POPS A LITTLE HIGHER TO MEDIUM CHANCE 
RANGE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DURING THIS PERIOD WHILE 
DROPPING BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE BY SATURDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR POSSIBLE 
SLOWER FRONTAL MOVEMENT.

607 
FXUS64 KMRX 140718
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 AM EDT SAT SEP 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL BE THE MAIN WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH
TONIGHT. THIS MORNING AND AND AGAIN EARLY SUNDAY MORNING...PATCHY
FOG WILL BE POSSIBLE...MAINLY NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS DUE TO STEAM
FOG. OTHERWISE...A MOSTLY CLEAR SKY EXPECTED. GENERALLY FOLLOWED A
COMPROMISE OF MAV/MET GUIDANCE DUE TO BETTER PERFORMANCE.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY/...
A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL REMAIN CENTERED OVER THE REGION ON 
SUNDAY...PROMOTING SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS...BUT STILL MAINTAINING 
A SLIGHTLY COOLER AUTUMN-LIKE AIRMASS. AN UPPER-TROUGH WILL THEN 
SHIFT FROM THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEAST U.S. ON MONDAY AND 
PUSH A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION. THIS FRONT WILL DO LITTLE 
TO PRODUCE ANY MEANINGFUL OPPORTUNITIES FOR PRECIPITATION OR EVEN 
CHANGE TEMPERATURES. IN FACT...IN WAKE OF THE FRONT ADDITIONAL 
RIDGING AND A MORE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT SHOULD RESULT IN SOME PLEASANT 
WEATHER FOR MOST OF THE WORK WEEK. HOWEVER...SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE WILL HELP TO RESTORE GULF MOISTURE INTO THE 
REGION...AND ALLOW FOR SOME ISOLATED TO PERHAPS SCATTERED DIURNALLY 
DRIVEN CONVECTION TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. BY THE END OF THE WEEK 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT MAY IMPACT THE REGION...SO HAVE INCREASED POPS 
SLIGHTLY ON THURSDAY. HOWEVER...MODELS DIFFER IN THE TIMING AND 
INTENSITY OF THIS SYSTEM SO HAVE KEPT POPS AT LOW-END CHANCE FOR 
FRIDAY AS WELL AND WILL WAIT FOR BETTER MODEL CONTINUITY AS THIS 
SYSTEM IS STILL A WEEK OUT. ADDITIONALLY...WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING BACK IN HIGHS WILL CLIMB BACK INTO THE MID 80S BY THE 
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

828 
FXUS64 KMRX 131912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT FRI SEP 13 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...CURRENTLY MOSTLY SUNNY
SKIES ARE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER
60S TO LOWER 70S NORTH TO THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S CENTRAL AND
SOUTH WITH DEW POINTS IN THE COMFORTABLE LOWER TO MID 50S. SURFACE
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES CONTINUES TO
BUILD SOUTHEAST TONIGHT AND SATURDAY PROVIDING MUCH COOLER NIGHTS
AND MOSTLY SUNNY COOLER AFTERNOONS THROUGH THE WEEKEND. STEAM FOG
IS EXPECTED AT/NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS LATE TONIGHT AND AGAIN
SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING. SKIES WILL OTHERWISE BE MOSTLY CLEAR
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. LOWS TONIGHT WILL BE THE COLDEST SO FAR THIS
LATE SUMMER OR EARLY FALL WITH LOWS IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S HIGHER
ELEVATIONS AND NORTHEAST VALLEYS TO THE LOWER TO MID 50S LOWER
ELEVATIONS. SATURDAY HIGHS WILL BE MOSTLY IN THE 70S TO NEAR 80 AT
CHA THEN WARMING A FEW DEGREES SUNDAY. SATURDAY NIGHT LOWS WILL BE
SIMILAR TO TONIGHTS ALTHOUGH A FEW DEGREES WARMER SOUTH.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A LONG WAVE TROUGH 
MIGRATES EAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION SUNDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT DROPS THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY BUT MOISTURE IS RATHER LIMITED AHEAD OF 
THE FRONT SO KEPT MOST OF THE REGION DRY WITH THIS FROPA. SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS SOUTHEAST TO THE ATLANTIC COAST THROUGH MID 
WEEK CAUSING THE LOW LEVEL FLOW TO TURN SOUTHERLY ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY THROUGH THE WEEK. AS THE 
LOW LEVELS MOISTEN...THERE WILL BE A SMALL CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WITH DEVELOPMENT MAINLY ON THE HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES 
INITIALLY. WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY THE CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH DRIVES 
EAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN U.S. A COLD FRONT BUILDS TOWARD THE REGION 
LATE IN THE PERIOD BUT MODELS ARE NOT ALL ON THE SAME PAGE WITH THE 
LATE WEEK SCENARIO. IN FACT...THE ECMWF IS ABOUT AN ENTIRE DAY AHEAD 
OF THE GFS WITH THE SYSTEM PASSAGE. THEREFORE...CONFIDENCE NOT TOO 
HIGH FOR THE END OF THE WORK WEEK FRONTAL TIMING. STAYED CLOSER TO A 
MEX/ECM BLEND FOR TEMPERATURES DURING THE LONG TERM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 AM EDT FRI SEP 13 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EARLY THIS MORNING COLD FRONT WAS
LOCATED ACROSS SOUTHEAST KENTUCKY. MODELS SHOW THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY
MOVING SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING ENDING CHANCES OF SHOWERS.
MAIN CONCERN IN THE VERY SHORT TERM IS THE AREAS OF DENSE FOG. AREA
OBSERVATIONS AND WEBCAMS SHOW AREAS OF FOG ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF
OF EAST TENNESSEE..SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.
COVERAGE IS NOT EXTENSIVE ENOUGH TO WARRANT AN ADVISORY..BUT HAVE
INCLUDED PATCHY DENSE FOG IN THE FORECAST AND NOWCAST.

FOG AND LOW CLOUDS WILL MIX OUT BY MID-MORNING AS DRIER AIR ADVECTS
INTO THE REGION WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKY ANTICIPATED THIS AFTERNOON. 

FOR TONIGHT...SURFACE RIDGING WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA WITH A COOL
NIGHT IN STORE. STEAM FOG IS EXPECTED AT/NEAR AREA LAKES AND
STREAMS LATE.

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY/...
A COOLER AUTUMN-LIKE AIR MASS WILL SETTLE INTO THE REGION ON SATURDAY 
AS HIGHS WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB MUCH ABOVE THE UPPER 70S TO AROUND 
80 DEGREES. A FLAT SUBTROPICAL RIDGE TO THE SOUTH WILL CONTINUE TO 
BUILD IN DURING THE WEEKEND...PROMOTING MOSTLY CLEAR AND DRY 
CONDITIONS. HOWEVER...AN UPPER-TROUGH PASSING WELL TO THE NORTH WILL 
PUSH A WEAK FRONT THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY INTO TUESDAY WHICH COULD 
ALLOW FOR PERHAPS SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
THEREAFTER...SUBTROPICAL RIDGING BUILDS BACK IN AND A FAIRLY ZONAL 
FLOW WILL PREVAIL ALOFT. WINDS WILL SHIFT BACK TO THE SOUTHWEST BY 
WEDNESDAY AND ALLOW FOR GULF MOISTURE TO FILTER INTO THE AREA. THIS 
WILL CREATE SOME HIGHER CHANCES FOR DIURNAL CONVECTION /ESPECIALLY 
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN/ ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...THOUGH MOST 
LOCATIONS WILL PROBABLY STAY DRY. ADDITIONALLY...WITH INCREASED 
THICKNESS VALUES/TEMPERATURES ALOFT...HIGHS WILL CLIMB BACK INTO THE 
MID 80S BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. 

&&

.DISCUSSION...
UPDATE WILL ADJUST POP/WX GRIDS TO BETTER MATCH RADAR TRENDS. A
SECOND LINE OF CONVECTION IS MOVING ACROSS THE AREA ALIGNED WITH
THE 850-700 MB FRONTAL ZONE...AND IS MUCH WEAKER THAN THE FIRST
LINE. DRIER AIR ALOFT WILL BE FOLLOWING THIS LINE AS SEEN IN THE
00Z ILN SOUNDING...SO NO ADDITIONAL DEVELOPMENT IS EXPECTED BEHIND
IT. THE CURRENT STORMS ARE PROJECTED TO EXIT THE AREA 05-07Z...SO
WILL LOWER POPS SHARPLY AFTER THAT TIME...AND REMOVE POPS AFTER 12Z
FRIDAY.

&&

NC...NONE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 PM EDT THU SEP 12 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...CONVECTION AHEAD OF THE 
COLD FRONT WILL BE AFFECTING THE SMOKIES...SE TN AND SW NC FOR THE 
NEXT FEW HOURS. THE COLD FRONT HAS PUSHED SE INTO NRN MIDDLE TN AND 
ACROSS SE KY...WITH TSRA COVERAGE ON THE INCREASE ALONG THE FRONT AT 
FORECAST ISSUANCE. THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE LIKELY POPS FOR NRN 
AREAS INCLUDING SW VA IN THE 12/19Z TO 13/00Z GRIDS...WITH A PRE 
FIRST PERIOD GROUPING IN THE ZFP PRODUCT.

FOR TONIGHT...THE FRONT DROPS INTO AND JUST ABOUT OUT OF THE REGION 
BY 12Z FRIDAY. OPTED FOR VERY HIGH CHANCE POPS WITH SCATTERED 
WORDING FOR THIS EVENING AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. THIS KEEPS THE 
FORECAST POPS HIGHER THAN GFS MOS POPS. DID NOT GO LIKELY SINCE...
1) THE FRONTOGENETIC FORCING STAYS ON THE WEAK SIDE AND 2) AIR MASS 
WILL BECOME LESS UNSTABLE AFTER SUNSET. 

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...LATER SHIFTS MAY BE ABLE TO DROP THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE FOOTHILLS AND MTNS IN THE EXTREME 
EASTERN COUNTIES ON FRIDAY...WHICH I KEPT FOR CONTINUITY.

FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY SHAPING UP VERY NICELY AS SURFACE AND 
UPPER RIDGE BUILD INTO THE REGION. STAYED VERY CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS 
FOR MAX TEMPS...AND NEAR A MOS BLEND WITH THE COOLER NAM ON MINS 
EACH NIGHT. EXPECTING PATCHY VALLEY FOG NEAR AREA LAKES FRIDAY 
NIGHT. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH DROPS 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHEAST U.S. SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY HELPING 
TO DRIVE A MOISTURE STARVED COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. 
DRIER AIR BUILDS IN BEHIND THE FRONT KEEPING FAIR WEATHER IN PLACE 
FOR MUCH OF THE REGION THROUGH TUESDAY. HOWEVER...LOW LEVEL 
SOUTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY 
INTO THURSDAY ALLOWING FOR MORE BUOYANT CONDITIONS AREA WIDE AND 
ASSOCIATED CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT WITH EMPHASIS ON THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN FEATURES. TRENDED TEMPERATURES TOWARD A MEX/ECM MOS BLEND.

947 AM EDT THU SEP 12 2013

.DISCUSSION...CONVECTION GETTING AN EARLY START AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT THIS MORNING...ESPECIALLY OVER NE TN AND IN THE SMOKIES. 12Z 
UNMODIFIED OHX/RNK SOUNDINGS SHOW INSTABILITY OF 2500 TO 3000 J/KG. 
WINDS ALOFT STILL VERY LIGHT AND ERRATIC...ALTHOUGH STORM MOTION OF 
SE AT 10 MPH WILL BE A BIT FASTER THAN YESTERDAY. WINDS MIGHT 
INCREASE IN THE EVENING...BUT SEVERE THREAT LOOKS LIMITED TO GUSTY 
WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS AT THIS POINT...ALTHO STRONGEST STORMS 
COULD PRODUCE HAIL. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES UP TO NEAR 1.75 
INCHES. 

13Z SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACED COLD FRONT FROM NEAR PADUCAH KY NE INTO 
EXTREME SRN IL AND SW IN. RUC AND NAM12 KM SUPPORT LIKELY POPS THIS 
AFTERNOON OVER NRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA...AND ALSO IN THE 
FOOTHILLS AND SMOKY MTNS. MAY TWEAK POPS UP IN A FEW LOCATIONS.

TEMPS RUNNING CLOSE TO FORECAST GRIDS FOR NOW...BUT EARLY ONSET OF 
CONVECTION MAY AFFECT MAX TEMPS. WILL FRESHEN GRIDS AND PRODUCTS 
AROUND 11 AM EDT. 

SOME GREAT WEATHER STARTING FRIDAY RIGHT THROUGH THE WEEKEND!

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
431 AM EDT THU SEP 12 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ANOTHER RATHER WARM AND MUGGY
NIGHT AND EARLY MORNING ACROSS THE TN VALLEY WITH CURRENT
TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S WITH DEW POINTS MID AND
UPPER 60S. SKIES WERE PARTLY CLOUDY FOR THE MOST PART ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA...WITH SOME PATCHY FOG LOCALLY DENSE ACROSS SW VA
WHERE RAINFALL OCCURRED WEDNESDAY. A COLD FRONT WAS MOVING SLOWLY
SOUTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND EASTERN GREAT LAKES WITH SOME
THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF IT ACROSS NW IN...NORTHERN IL AND NORTHERN
MO. THIS FRONT WILL MAKE GOOD PROGRESS SOUTH AND REACH THE NC AND
TN BORDER BY AROUND 00Z TONIGHT AND A SECONDARY FRONT WITH A DRIER
AIR MASS WILL REACH INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT TONIGHT. MODEL DEW
POINTS DROP TO THE LOWER TO MID 60S. STRONG SURFACE HEATING IN THE
UNSTABLE AIR MASS AHEAD OF THE FRONT WITH LEAD SHORTWAVE WILL
LIKELY PRODUCE A LINE OF STORMS THAT WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE
REGION DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON INTO EARLY EVENING. THERE MAY BE A
FEW STRONG STORMS WITH DAMAGING WINDS. THIS ACTIVITY WILL MOVE
THROUGH QUICKLY AND DECREASE RAPIDLY IN INTENSITY AS AIR MASS
COOLS. FOLLOWED YESTERDAYS PERSISTENCE FOR HIGHS NEAR 90 SOUTH AND
CENTRAL AND UPPER 80S NE TN. TONIGHT CLOUDS WILL HOLD TEMPERATURES
UP INTO THE UPPER 60S TO NEAR 70 SOUTHEAST AND CENTRAL VALLEY AND
NEAR 60 TO THE LOWER 60S NE. RAIN CHANCES INCREASE AS FRONT NEARS
THIS AFTERNOON THEN DECREASES AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING INTO THE REGION FROM THE NW FRIDAY. LINGERING LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE AND UPPER IMPULSE IN NW FLOW COULD INITIATE SOME SHOWERS 
ACROSS THE TN MNTS FRIDAY. THICKNESS VALUES FALL FRI NIGHT WITH 
BELOW NORMAL MORNING LOWS INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. DRY MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES WILL LEAD TO GOOD DAY TIME WARM UPS. SOME LOW LEVEL CLOUDS 
WILL STACK AGAINST SOUTHERN MNTS AND MAY BLEED INTO SE TN AS SURFACE 
RIDGE SLIDES EAST OF THE AREA. ANOTHER WEAK FRONT MOVES SOUTHEAST 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY MONDAY AND MOVES THROUGH THE AREA BY 
TUESDAY. AVAILABLE MOISTURE WITH THIS FRONT IN QUESTION...SO KEPT 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES LOW. TEMPERATURES THROUGH MID WEEK NEAR OR 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL.

VISIBILITIES. WILL INCREASE FOG COVERAGE TO AREAS OF FOG
NORTH...AND WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE NEED FOR A DENSE FOG
ADVISORY.

872 
FXUS64 KMRX 111924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EDT WED SEP 11 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...CONVECTION FORMED 
ACROSS THE NRN PLATEAU...SE KY AND SWRN VA THIS AFTERNOON...AND 
CONTINUES TO DRIFT SLOWLY SE. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS POSSIBLE...BUT
THIS ACTIVITY WON'T GET VERY FAR SOUTH BEFORE SUNSET. I TWEAKED POPS 
JUST A BIT TO ALLOW THIS CONVECTION TO REACH THE CENTRAL VALLEY 
COUNTIES AND SMOKIES. STILL LOOKED SAFE TO DROP RAIN CHANCES AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...WITH AN ADDITION OF PATCHY FOG LATE IN THE VALLEYS OR 
WHERE RAIN OCCURS TODAY.

BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON THE COLD FRONT WILL BE APPROACHING SE KY AND 
SW VA...SO KEPT THE PREVIOUS LIKELY POPS FOR THOSE AREAS. PASSING OF 
FRONT SHOULD INCREASE SHOWERS AND STORMS OVER SE AREAS THURSDAY 
EVENING...WITH SHOWERS ENDING BEFORE DAYBREAK FRIDAY. JUST A FEW 
ADJUSTMENTS TO GRIDS FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. GENERALLY 
FOLLOWED THE GFS MOS FOR MAX/MIN TEMPS...BUT TRENDED CLOSER TO THE 
HIGHER NAM/MET MOS POPS. 


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...BY THE START OF THIS PERIOD 
ON FRIDAY MORNING THE COLD FRONT WILL BE CLEAR OF THE AREA...WITH 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE STARTING TO BUILD IN.  DRIER AIR IS EXPECTED 
WITH THE CHANGE OF AIR MASSES...SHOULD FEEL THE FIRST TOUCH OF FALL 
SATURDAY MORNING.  EASTERN CANADIAN TROUGH HANGS TOUGH AND STILL HAS 
AN INFLUENCE ON OUR AREA...AS WE REMAIN IN AN UPPER NW FLOW INTO THE 
WEEKEND...WITH A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVE TROUGHS WITHIN THIS FLOW.  
HOWEVER...WITH MINIMAL MOISTURE...THINK THESE SHORT WAVES WILL ONLY 
RESULT IN SUBTLE REINFORCING SHOTS OF COOL AIR FOR THIS WEEKEND.

BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...THE EASTERN CANADA TROUGH SWINGS TO THE EAST 
ALLOWING FOR RIDGING OVER OUR AREA.  MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
WITH THIS SCENARIO...WITH THE EURO SHOWING A STRONGER RIDGE.  

WILL KEEP NEXT WEEK MOSTLY DRY.  GFS PUTTING SOME LIGHT PRECIP 
OVER OUR AREA...BUT IT IS OBVIOUS THAT THE FOCUS FOR ORGANIZED 
PRECIP IS EITHER WELL TO THE SOUTH OR TO THE WEST AND NORTH.  ONLY A 
FEW ENSEMBLE MEMBERS SHOWING SOME LIGHT PRECIP OVER OUR AREA.  WITH 
THE CURRENT DRY TREND OVER THE LAST COUPLE OF WEEKS...AM LEANING 
THAT WAY WITH THESE EXTENDED PERIODS. 

FOR OTHER PARAMETERS...KEEPING DEW POINTS ON THE LOW SIDE OF 
GUIDANCE...THINKING THAT WE WILL NOT GET A REAL RETURN FLOW WITH 
THIS SCENARIO...RATHER IN EARLY TO MID NEXT WEEK...BACK DOOR FRONT 
EAST OF APPALACHIANS WILL HAVE ITS AIR SEEP AROUND AND INTO OUR AREA 
FROM THE SOUTH...BUT NOT REALLY TAPPING THE RICHER GULF AIR.  WITH 
THAT IN MIND FOLLOWED MOS MAX TEMPS PRETTY CLOSELY THIS RUN AS THEY 
ARE WARMER THAN LAST RUN...WITH DRIER DEW POINTS...EXPECTING WARMER 
MAX TEMPS. 


&&

SUBSIDENCE ALOFT. DRY CONDITIONS WITH GOOD DIURNAL TEMPERATURE
RANGE THIS WEEKEND FEATURING BELOW NORMAL MINS. SURFACE HIGH

AND LOW CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION.
