135 AM EDT WED SEP 11 2013

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS 
LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS HIGH WILL BRING MOSTLY VFR 
CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD...WITH THE 
EXCEPTION BEING SOME FOG DEVELOPMENT AROUND SUNRISE. WITH THE AIR 
MASS VERY SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY...WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST WITH THIS FOG AT KTRI...BUT WILL MENTION A LITTLE THICKER 
FOG AT KTYS DUE TO THE EARLIER RAINFALL. ISOLATED CONVECTION IS 
EXPECTED AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON...BUT WILL NOT MENTION IN THE TAFS AT 
THIS TIME DUE TO THE LOW PROBABILITY OF OCCURRENCE AT THE TAF SITES.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 PM EDT TUE SEP 10 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEALS SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION 
LINGERING OVER CENTRAL EAST TN AND NORTHEAST TN...WITH THE MODELS 
INDICATING A MARGINALLY TO POSSIBLY MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
LINGERING THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT. THUS...THINK IT IS PRUDENT TO KEEP A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE FORECAST OVERNIGHT FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST 
AREA. PATCHY FOG SHOULD AGAIN DEVELOP LATER TONIGHT TOWARDS 
SUNRISE...MAINLY AROUND BODIES OF WATER AND IN AREAS THAT RECEIVED 
RAINFALL THIS EVENING.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO KEEP A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP OVERNIGHT...TO ADD A MENTION OF PATCHY FOG AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST 
TRENDS.

666 
FXUS64 KMRX 101851
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT TUE SEP 10 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO SIT OVER THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THIS AFTERNOON...
AND HAS PROMOTED A VERY WARM...DRY AND MOSTLY SUNNY DAY. SOME
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED STORMS WILL REMAIN POSSIBLE LATER THIS
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...THOUGH THEY SHOULD GENERALLY REMAIN
CONFINED TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA. TONIGHT...SOME PATCHY FOG WILL BE POSSIBLE NEAR AREA
LAKES AND RIVERS GIVEN THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER CONDITIONS...BUT IT
WILL QUICKLY DISSIPATE AFTER SUNRISE.

AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL BEGIN TO FLATTEN
THE RIDGE...AND ALLOW FOR SOME HIGHER CHANCES FOR SCATTERED
CONVECTION BY THE AFTERNOON AS TEMPERATURES ALOFT COOL. GIVEN THE
DEEP GULF MOISTURE IN PLACE...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL ALONG WITH
LIGHTNING WILL BE THE BIGGEST IMPACT FROM THIS ACTIVITY.
HOWEVER...GIVEN SOME INSTABILITY IN PLACE A FEW OF THESE STORMS MAY
BECOME STRONG AND BE CAPABLE OF GUSTY WINDS AS WELL. HIGH TOMORROW
WILL BE COOLER BY A DEGREE OR TWO GIVEN THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER
BUT WILL STILL REACH THE UPPER 80S TO AROUND 90 IN MOST VALLEY
LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
AN UPPER TROUGH WILL BE DROPPING SE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES ON 
THURSDAY...PUSHING A SURFACE COLD FRONT INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. 
THURSDAY WILL FEATURE CONTINUED WARM TEMPS IN THE 85-90 RANGE WITH 
AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY FOCUSED IN HIGHER 
TERRAIN AS SYNOPTIC FORCING REMAINS WEAK DURING THE DAY. FORCING FOR 
LIFT BECOMES STRONGER AROUND 00Z FRIDAY IN NORTHERN AREAS AS THE 
UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES...ALONG WITH A PRE-FRONTAL SURFACE TROUGH. 
STILL...MOISTURE IS LIMITED WITH A W-NW FLOW ALOFT...AND THE GFS 
REMAINS WEAKER WITH LIFT THAN THE NAM. AS A RESULT...WILL KEEP POPS 
IN THE CHANCE RANGE...WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES NORTH. MODELS HAVE 
TRENDED A BIT SLOWER WITH THE COLD FRONT...SO WILL KEEP A SLIGHT 
CHANCE IN THE SOUTHERN HALF FRIDAY MORNING. LOWER DEWPOINTS WILL 
BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT THROUGH THE DAY ON FRIDAY. 

THE WEEKEND WILL FEATURE COOLER TEMPS AND A DRY AIR MASS AS HIGH 
PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE OHIO AND TN VALLEY REGIONS. THE ECMWF MOS 
WAS FOLLOWED CLOSELY FOR TEMPS...WHICH IS COOLER THAN THE GFS. HIGH 
IN MOST SPOTS WILL BE IN THE 70S TO LOWER 80S...WITH LOWS IN THE 50S 
AND A FEW SPOTS IN THE 40S NORTH AND IN THE MOUNTAINS. WILL CONTINUE 
WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE POP MONDAY AND TUESDAY AS THE ECMWF AND GFS 
SHOW ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH SWINGING THROUGH THE AREA...BUT WITH 
LIMITED MOISTURE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  90  68  91  69 /  10  20  20  30  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  88  68  88  67 /  10  30  20  30  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       68  88  68  88  67 /  10  30  20  30  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              64  86  64  85  63 /  20  40  20  50  50 

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 101448 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1048 AM EDT TUE SEP 10 2013

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE HAS BECOME CENTERED OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY
AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING...PROMOTING MOSTLY CLEAR...
WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS ONCE AGAIN. HOWEVER...WITH A SOUTHWESTERLY
GULF MOISTURE FETCH IN PLACE...SCATTERED CU AND EVENTUALLY SOME
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE BY
EARLY TO MID AFTERNOON AND PERSIST THROUGH THE EARLY TO MID EVENING
HOURS. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD FAVOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE
OROGRAPHIC LIFT WILL AID IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS CONVECTION...SO
HAVE RAISED POPS TO CHANCE THERE. STILL...ISOLATED STORMS WILL
CERTAINLY BE POSSIBLE AS WELL ELSEWHERE AND HAVE INCLUDED A MENTION
OF THIS IN THE FORECAST AS WELL. OTHERWISE...WITH THE CENTER OF THE
RIDGE CLOSE BY IT WILL BE ANOTHER VERY WARM DAY AS HIGHS WILL
APPROACH OR EXCEED 90 DEGREES ONCE AGAIN IN SEVERAL VALLEY
LOCATIONS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 AM EDT TUE SEP 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO 
RIDGE INTO THE AREA FROM THE EAST WHILE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM 
THE WEST. THICKNESS VALUES RISING A BIT TODAY AND SOME TEMPERATURES 
IN THE 90S CAN BE EXPECTED IN THE VALLEYS. EARLY MORNING FOG WILL 
BURN OFF BY MID MORNING. ABOVE NORMAL PWAT VALUES COUPLED WITH THE 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL RESULT IN ISOLATED PULSE TYPE 
THUNDERSTORMS. SLOW MOVING STORMS WILL PRODUCE HEAVY RAINFALL 
FAVORING THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS. COVERAGE SHOULD BE BELOW 20 PERCENT 
FOR MOST AREAS.  

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
MAINLY SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY... 
ALTHOUGH FRONT WILL ENTER THE REGION LATE THURSDAY AND KEEP PRECIP 
OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE NIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT AND INTO FRIDAY 
MORNING. COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL SPREAD SOUTHEASTWARD AND RID AREA 
OF PRECIP BY MIDDAY FRIDAY...AND SEVERAL PLEASANT DAYS WILL FOLLOW 
WITH A BEAUTIFUL WEEKEND. WILL PROBABLY FLIRT WITH THE 40S FOR 
SUNDAY MORNING LOWS OVER SW VA AND THE APPALACHIANS.

757 PM EDT MON SEP 9 2013

.AVIATION...WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER SOUTHERN MIDDLE
TENNESSEE AND SOME OROGRAPHICS HELPED A FEW SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS INTO EXISTENCE ALONG THE EDGES OF THE GREAT VALLEY
THIS AFTERNOON. LOSS OF HEATING IS CAUSING THESE AREAS OF
CONVECTION TO DWINDLE EARLY THIS EVENING. SHOULD BE ANOTHER
FORECAST PERIOD CONTAINING MOSTLY VFR WEATHER. HOWEVER...ENOUGH
COOLING ALONG WITH SUFFICIENT SURFACE MOISTURE WILL ALLOW FOR SOME
FOG FORMATION AT THE TERMINALS WITH THE WORST CONDITIONS DEVELOPING
AT TRI WHERE VLIFR VSBY MAY OCCUR AROUND SUNRISE WITH IFR
CONDITIONS POSSIBLE AT TYS. THE FOG SHOULD BURN OFF BETWEEN 12 AND
14Z LEAVING VFR CONDITIONS THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST.

585 
FXUS64 KMRX 091831
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EDT MON SEP 9 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS THE DOMINATE WEATHER
FEATURE ACROSS THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON...AND IT HAS PROMOTED
ANOTHER WARM AND PARTLY SUNNY LATE SUMMER DAY ACROSS THE REGION.
HOWEVER...A WEAKNESS IN THIS RIDGE HAS ALLOWED A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL
TROUGH TO SLIP INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND TRIGGER SOME ISOLATED TO
LOCALLY SCATTERED CONVECTION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. WITH POCKETS OF ENHANCED INSTABILITY NOTED IN
THIS AREA...SOME OF THIS ACTIVITY MAY PRODUCE SOME LIGHTNING AND
PERHAPS BRIEF GUSTY WINDS. HOWEVER...LOCALLY HEAVY DOWNPOURS WILL
BE THE PRIMARY IMPACT FROM ANY CONVECTION THAT DOES DEVELOP. MOST
OF THIS ACTIVITY WILL REMAIN CONFINED TO THE PLATEAU...SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND SHOULD DIMINISH AFTER
SUNSET THIS EVENING.

MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER CONDITIONS WILL ALLOW FOR PATCHY FOG TO
DEVELOP ONCE AGAIN ACROSS THE REGION AFTER MIDNIGHT...BUT IT WILL
QUICKLY DIMINISH AFTER SUNRISE TOMORROW. SOME SLIGHTLY BETTER
CHANCES FOR SOME DIURNALLY DRIVEN ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION
WILL BE IN PLACE BY THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS MOISTURE
INCREASES UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE. 

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
PRECIP CHANCES WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WILL BE RISING AS THE UPPER 
RIDGE RETROGRADES AND A TROUGH BEGINS TO DROP INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION. WITH A LACK OF WELL DEFINED SYNOPTIC FORCING...CONVECTION ON 
WEDNESDAY WILL BE MAINLY DIURNAL AND FAVOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS. 
COVERAGE LOOKS TO BE A BIT MORE EXTENSIVE FOR THURSDAY AHEAD OF A 
COLD FRONT THAT MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY REGION...WITH THE BEST 
CHANCES NORTH. MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON THIS FRONT MOVING INTO 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF OUR AREA ON THURSDAY NIGHT...AND EXITING 
SOUTHERN AREAS FRIDAY MORNING. A NICE PUSH OF DRIER AIR FOLLOWS THE 
FRONT...WHICH SHOULD PRODUCE LOWS FRIDAY NIGHT IN THE 50S IN MOST 
SPOTS. THE WEEKEND LOOKS DRY AND SUNNY WITH TEMPS NEAR TO SLIGHTLY 
BELOW NORMAL AS A RIDGE MOVES OVER THE REGION. THE PATTERN BECOMES 
MORE PROGRESSIVE...AND THE RIDGE MOVES TO OUR EAST LATE SUNDAY. THE 
GFS AND ECMWF HAVE SHOWN A COLD FRONT APPROACHING ON MONDAY FOR THE 
PAST COUPLE OF MODEL RUNS...SO WILL INTRODUCE MONDAY WITH A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  91  67  91  69 /  20  20  20  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  88  67  88  68 /  10  20  20  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  88  66  88  68 /  10  20  20  30  20

FXUS64 KMRX 091435 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1035 AM EDT MON SEP 9 2013

.DISCUSSION...
PATCHY FOG HAS DISSIPATED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING WITH
DAYTIME HEATING BEGINNING TO TAKE EFFECT AND THUS ANOTHER FAIRLY
BENIGN DAY WEATHER WISE IS ON TAP ACROSS THE REGION TODAY. AN
UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE TO THE NORTHWEST OF THE AREA REMAINS THE DOMINANT
WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE REGION AND WILL PROMOTE A PARTLY SUNNY
AND WARM DAY ONCE AGAIN...WITH MOST PLACES LIKELY REMAINING DRY.
HOWEVER...THERE IS A WEAKNESS IN THE RIDGE AND AN UPPER SHORTWAVE
PROGRESSING SOUTHEAST ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THIS HAS TRIGGERED
SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER WESTERN/MIDDLE TENNESSEE THIS
MORNING WHICH COULD CLIP THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE THIS AFTERNOON. ADDITIONALLY...SOME DIURNALLY DRIVEN
CONVECTION ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE ONCE
AGAIN...BUT THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE FAIRLY ISOLATED /WITH MOST
AREAS REMAINING DRY AS PREVIOUSLY MENTIONED/.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             91  69  91  70  91 /  20  10  20  10  30

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT MON SEP 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVER 
THE AREA. MORNING FOG WILL GIVE WAY TO MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. WEAK MID 
LEVEL TROUGH OVER MIDDLE TN WILL DRIFT SE AND CONTINUE TO WEAKEN TODAY.
THIS FEATURE WILL BRING SOME CLOUDS AND ENHANCE A LOW CHANCE FOR 
ISOLATED SHOWERS...MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHERN PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON. 
ISOLATED MOUNTAIN SHOWERS ALSO POSSIBLE. FORECAST TEMPERATURES 
INSIDE MOS GUIDANCE MAX AND MINS.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WILL REMAIN UNDER THE 
INFLUENCE OF A STRONG RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  
THIS WILL MAINTAIN HOT AND INCREASINGLY HUMID CONDITIONS TUESDAY 
INTO WEDNESDAY AS TEMPERATURES CLIMB BACK INTO THE UPPER 80S AND 90S 
ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.  ALSO DURING THIS PERIOD...WE WILL SEE LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE CONTINUE TO PUSH INTO THE REGION...PROVIDING NORMAL 
SUMMERTIME DIURNAL CONVECTION EACH AFTERNOON.  WEDNESDAY SHOULD  SEE 
THE GREATER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION AS A WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVES 
THROUGH THE AREA.  THE MAIN WEATHER SYSTEM OF CONCERN THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD FRONT EXPECTED TO REACH INTO THE AREA LATE 
THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS FRONT WILL PROVIDE OUR BEST 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION AND WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST..  
THE FRONT SHOULD BE PULLING AWAY FORM THE AREA BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
WITH DRIER AND SLIGHT COOLER CONDITIONS MOVING IN FOR THE REST OF 
THE EXTENDED.

FXUS64 KMRX 090102
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT SUN SEP 8 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE DEEP 
SOUTH...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT SOUTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
OVERNIGHT...BUT IT SHOULD REMAIN DRY AS THE LOCAL AIR MASS 
STABILIZES. OVERALL...THIS COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO BRING MAINLY 
JUST A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUDS TONIGHT...WITH AREAS OF FOG LIKELY 
DEVELOPING AGAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT.

CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...AND WILL NOT 
PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING.

607 
FXUS64 KMRX 081914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EDT SUN SEP 8 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...THINGS LOOK DRY TONIGHT AS ANY 
SHOWERS FROM EARLIER THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD QUICKLY DISSIPATE AFTER 
SUNSET. OVERNIGHT TEMPS WILL BE ONE TO TWO DEGREES WARMER THAN LAST
NIGHT. SOME AREAS WILL SEE PATCHY FOG AGAIN OVERNIGHT...WITH FOG DEVELOPING
AFTER MIDNIGHT AND TOWARD EARLY MORNING. FOG SHOULD BEGIN TO CLEAR
BETWEEN 9AM AND 10AM EST. HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR WEST WILL CONTINUE TO
SHIFT EAST OVERNIGHT AND THROUGH TOMORROW. THIS WILL RESULT IN A
RETURN TO A SOUTHERLY FLOW IN THE LOW LEVELS AND HELP TO SLOWLY
INCREASE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF DIURNAL CONVECTION
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS TOMORROW. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ROUGHLY 5
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL AREA-WIDE DUE TO BUILDING HIGH PRESSURE.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL CONTINUE BUILD INTO THE REGION THROUGH THE
MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...RESULTING IN A MOSTLY WARM FORECAST FOR THE
EXTENDED PERIOD AS DAYTIME HIGHS WILL PEAK IN THE MID 80S TO AROUND
90 DEGREES FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...SOME GULF MOISTURE
WILL FEED UP UNDERNEATH THE RIDGE AND ALLOW FOR SOME LOW CHANCES
FOR ISOLATED TO SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION TO DEVELOP. ON
WEDNESDAY...AN UPPER-TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES WILL
DROP A COLD FRONT INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AS THE RIDGE BEGINS TO
FLATTEN AND EVENTUALLY SPLIT INTO TWO PARTS BY THURSDAY AS EACH
PART MOVES TO THE EAST AND WEST OF THE REGION. THE COLD FRONT WILL
THEN MOVE SOUTH INTO THE REGION ON THURSDAY...GIVING THE AREA THE
BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION THIS WEEK. MODELS ARE NOW HINTING
THAT THIS FRONT MAY BE A LITTLE SLOWER TO CLEAR THE AREA.
THUS...HAVE CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
ACROSS THE EASTERN/SOUTHERN HALF OF THE CWA ON FRIDAY BEFORE
TAPERING THEM OFF BY FRIDAY MORNING AS THE FRONT EXITS THE AREA. A
MORE AUTUMN-LIKE COOLER AIR MASS WILL BE WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE
REGION IN WAKE OF THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...DROPPING LOWS BACK INTO THE
MID 50S TO LOWER 60S AND HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S FOR
THE END OF THE WEEK.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  91  69  91  70 /  10  20  10  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  89  66  88  68 /  10  20  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  89  66  88  67 /  10  20  10  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              61  86  60  85  65 /  10  20  10  20  10

FXUS64 KMRX 080650
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EDT SUN SEP 8 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
REMAINS OVER THE AREA. A WEAK H70-H50 TROUGH WILL MOVE SE THROUGH 
THE AREA TODAY. THIS FEATURE WILL BRING PERIODS OF CLOUD COVER 
TODAY. WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT MAY AID IN DEVELOPMENT OF ISOLATED LIGHT 
SHOWERS OR SPRINKLES. LEANED INSIDE MOS TEMPERATURE RANGE DUE TO 
CLOUD COVER AND RECENT TRENDS. PATCHY MORNING FOG SHOULD CONTINUE
MAINLY ALONG WATERWAYS. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A STRONG HIGH PRESSURE IN 
PLACE EARLY IN THE EXTENDED WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB BACK 
INTO THE UPPER 80S AND 90S ACROSS THE TN VALLEY MONDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY.  ALSO DURING THIS PERIOD...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL SLOWLY 
INCREASE...ALLOWING DIURNAL CONVECTION TO DEVELOP.  WEDNESDAY WILL 
SEE GREATER COVERAGE AS A WEAK SHORT WAVE SETTLES INTO THE REGION.  
THE MAIN WEATHER MAKER FOR THE PERIOD WILL BE A COLD FRONT PROGGED 
INTO THE REGION LATE FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS FEATURES WILL 
PROVIDE OUR BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION...HOWEVER...DUE TO UNCERTAINTY 
REGARDING TIMING AND STRENGTH...WILL KEEP POPS AT CHANCE CATEGORY 
FOR NOW.  THE FRONT SHOULD EXIT THE AREA BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON WITH 
DRIER AND SLIGHT COOLER CONDITIONS MOVING IN THE THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
753 PM EDT SAT SEP 7 2013

.AVIATION...ANOTHER FORECAST PERIOD FEATURING MOSTLY VFR WEATHER
CONDITIONS FOR FLIGHT OPERATIONS. SHORT WAVE DROPPING SOUTHEAST
THROUGH THE NORTHEASTERN STATES AND A COOL FRONT WILL BRING A MIX
OF CI AND AC TO THE TERMINALS ON SUNDAY. GENERALLY FAIR WX CU WILL
ALSO BE PRESENT AS HEATING GETS UNDERWAY AND THE TERRAIN MAY BE
ABLE TO AID THE FORMATION OF A COUPLE SHOWERS AND A THUNDERSTORM
MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.
STILL...PROBABILITY A BIT TOO LOW FOR MENTION AT TRI SO LEFT OUT.
THE MAIN ISSUE FOR AVIATORS WILL BE THE LIKELIHOOD OF FOG FORMATION
AGAIN LATE TONIGHT. EXPECT SOME IFR CONDITIONS AT THE TERMINALS AND
EVEN LIFR RESTRICTIONS AT TYS AND TRI AROUND THE 08-12Z TIME FRAME.

856 
FXUS64 KMRX 071915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT SAT SEP 7 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER HIGH CENTERED OVER 
CENTRAL HIGH PLAINS WITH UPPER TROUGH STILL IN EASTERN 
CANADA...COMBINING FOR A NORTHWESTERLY UPPER FLOW OVER OUR AREA.  BY 
TOMORROW THE UPPER RIDGE EDGES CLOSER TO US...BUT WE STILL KEEP A 
NORTH TO NORTHWESTERLY UPPER FLOW.  WITHIN THIS FLOW...MODELS AGREE 
ON WEAK UPPER LEVEL WAVE PASSING THROUGH THE AREA THAT WILL OFFER AT 
LEAST SOME WEAK ORGANIZED LIFT.

LOTS OF SHALLOW CUMULUS BUILD-UP THIS AFTERNOON.  THE LIFT TOMORROW 
SHOULD AT LEAST BUILD DEEPER CUMULUS AND MAY GENERATE SOME 
SHOWERS/WEAK STORMS.  ALSO BY TOMORROW THE SURFACE RIDGE WILL BE 
EAST OF US...ALLOWING FOR HIGHER DEW POINTS WEST AND SW OF US TO 
MOVE INTO THE AREA.  BEST CHANCES LOOK TO BE ON THE ELEVATED TERRAIN 
OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU.  WITH THE NW-N FLOW THE CONVECTION SHOULD 
BE SLOW TO COME OUT ONTO THE VALLEY...SO HIGHEST POPS WILL BE ON THE 
PLATEAU.  ALSO HAVE ELEVATED POPS IN THE APPALACHIANS TOMORROW. FOR 
TEMPS...WENT PRETTY MUCH BETWEEN TWO MOS GUIDANCE VALUES FOR 
TONIGHT'S MIN AND SUNDAY'S MAX.

WILL MENTION PATCHY FOG EARLY TOMORROW MORNING.  VALLEY LOCATIONS 
AGAIN SHOULD BE ABLE TO FORM FOG PRETTY WELL WITH INCREASING 
MOISTURE AND LIGHT WINDS.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY/...
A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION 
EARLY NEXT WEEK...RESULTING IN A MOSTLY WARM FORECAST FOR THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD AS DAYTIME HIGHS WILL PEAK IN THE MID 80S TO AROUND 
90 DEGREES EACH DAY IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. HOWEVER...SOME GULF 
MOISTURE WILL FEED UP UNDERNEATH THE RIDGE MONDAY AND TUESDAY AND 
ALLOW FOR SOME LOW CHANCES FOR ISOLATED TO PERHAPS SCATTERED  
DIURNAL CONVECTION AS SOME GULF MOISTURE GRADUALLY BEGINS TO WORK 
ITS WAY BACK UP INTO THE AREA. BY WEDNESDAY...AN UPPER-TROUGH MOVING 
THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES LOOKS AS IF IT WILL DROP A COLD FRONT INTO 
THE OHIO VALLEY AS THE RIDGE BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST OF THE AREA. AHEAD 
OF THIS FRONT...MODELS ARE HINTING AT THE POTENTIAL FOR A PREFRONTAL 
TROUGH/WAVE TO MOVE INTO THE AREA...AND TRIGGER OFF SOME MORE 
WIDESPREAD SCATTERED CONVECTION FOR WEDNESDAY AND PERHAPS WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. THE COLD FRONT WILL THEN MOVE SOUTH INTO THE REGION ON 
THURSDAY...GIVING THE AREA THE BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION IN OVER 
A WEEK. THUS...HAVE INCREASED POPS DURING THIS TIME TO SOLID CHANCE. 
MODELS DIFFER ON HOW QUICKLY THE FRONT WILL EXIT THE AREA...SO HAVE 
CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AS WELL BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF BY 
FRIDAY MORNING AS THE FRONT EXITS THE AREA..SOME SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR 
WILL BE WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE REGION IN WAKE OF THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE...DROPPING LOWS BACK INTO THE MID 50S TO UPPER 60S AND HIGHS 
IN THE UPPER 70S TO MID 80S FOR NEXT WEEKEND.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             66  90  66  91  69 /   0  30  10  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  87  65  87  67 /   0  30  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  86  63  88  67 /   0  30  10  20  10

NORTHEAST TN...SW VA...AND SW NC WHERE TEMPERATURES WILL BE
SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN OTHER AREAS THUS ALLOWING FOR A SMALLER
DEWPOINT DEPRESSION AND FOG DEVELOPMENT. FOG SHOULD QUICKLY
DISSIPATE BY AROUND 14Z TOMORROW MORNING. TOMORROW...NORTHWEST FLOW
WEAKENS BUT CONTINUES ALOFT. HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR NORTH SHIFTS
FURTHER EAST AND RESULTS IN SURFACE WINDS BECOMING SOUTHERLY.
MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED TOMORROW WITH TEMPERATURES
A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. CONTINUED TO STAY WITH A MOS MAX/MIN
TEMP BLEND FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER ACROSS THE REGION EARLY
NEXT WEEK...RESULTING IN A MOSTLY DRY AND WARM FORECAST FOR THE
EXTENDED PERIOD AS DAYTIME HIGHS WILL PEAK IN THE MID 80S TO AROUND
90 DEGREES EACH DAY IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. HOWEVER...SOME GULF
MOISTURE WILL FEED UP UNDERNEATH THE RIDGE SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY
AND ALLOW FOR SOME LOW CHANCES FOR ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION. BY
TUESDAY...MORE SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION IS EXPECTED AS MOISTURE
INCREASES AS AN UPPER-TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST. BY
WEDNESDAY...THIS UPPER-TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES LOOKS
AS IF IT WILL DROP A COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA...GIVING THE REGION
THE BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION IN OVER A WEEK BEGINNING
WEDNESDAY. ACCORDINGLY...HAVE BUMPED POPS UP TO SOLID CHANCE
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. MODELS DIFFER ON HOW QUICKLY THE
FRONT WILL EXIT THE AREA...SO HAVE CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY AS WELL
BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT EXITS THE AREA
TO CLOSE OUT THE WORK WEEK ON FRIDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  89  66  88  67 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  87  65  85  65 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       62  87  64  84  64 /   0   0   0  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              57  83  59  81  60 /   0  10   0  20  10

WEDNESDAY WITH LOWER POPS FOR THURSDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT THU SEP 5 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...QUIET WEATHER REMAINS THROUGH 
THE SHORT TERM. A LONG WAVE TROUGH TO OUR NORTHEAST AND A RIDGE TO 
OUR WEST...WILL KEEP A PREDOMINATELY NORTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE AREA. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CURRENTLY OVER THE GREAT LAKES...WILL CONTINUE 
TO DROP SOUTH AND BUILD ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH TOMORROW. NORTHWEST 
FLOW COMBINED WITH BUILDING SURFACE HIGH WILL KEEP US DRY THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM. HOWEVER...MODELS SHOW A WEAK COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE TROUGH TO OUR NORTHEAST CONTINUING TO DRIFT SOUTH INTO SW VA 
BY THIS EVENING AND REACHING THE SOUTHERN VALLEY BY TOMORROW
MORNING. THE FRONT APPEARS RATHER WEAK AND SHOULDN'T IMPACT OUR
WEATHER OTHER THAN MAYBE A FEW CLOUDS ALONG THE FRONT. WILL INCLUDE
PATCHY FOG IN ZONES FOR NE TN AND SW VA AREAS...AS SLIGHTLY COOLER
AIR BEHIND THE FRONT WILL NARROW THE DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS ACROSS
THE AFOREMENTIONED AREAS AND LEAD TO POTENTIAL FOG DEVELOPMENT LATE
TONIGHT AND EARLY TOMORROW MORNING. STAYED WITH MOS MAX/MIN TEMP
BLEND FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER ACROSS THE REGION THIS
WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...RESULTING IN A MOSTLY DRY AND WARM
FORECAST FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD AS DAYTIME HIGHS WILL PEAK IN THE
MID 80S TO AROUND 90 DEGREES EACH DAY IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. BY
SUNDAY INTO MONDAY...SOME GULF MOISTURE WILL FEED UP UNDERNEATH THE
RIDGE AND ALLOW FOR SOME LOW CHANCES FOR ISOLATED DIURNAL
CONVECTION...BUT MOST OF THE AREA SHOULD REMAIN DRY HEADING INTO
THE MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...BY WEDNESDAY AN UPPER-
TROUGH MOVING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES LOOKS AS IF IT WILL DROP A
COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA...GIVING THE REGION THE BEST CHANCE FOR
PRECIPITATION IN OVER A WEEK. ACCORDINGLY...HAVE BUMPED POPS UP TO
SOLID CHANCE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BEFORE THE FRONT IS
PROGGED TO CLEAR THE AREA BY THURSDAY.

POSSIBLE...MAINLY NORTH OF KNOXVILLE. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR
NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...VERY QUIET
PATTERN OVERALL. THIS PERIOD STARTS WITH THE UPPER HIGH CENTERED
OVER COLORADO AND ITS ASSOCIATE RIDGE TO THE SOUTHEAST INTO THE
BAHAMAS...AND AN UPPER TROUGH OVER EASTERN CANADA. THIS PUTS OUR
AREA AT THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE THURSDAY EVENING. THIS
PATTERN HOLDS THROUGH THE WEEKEND...THEN FINALLY BY MONDAY...THE
UPPER HIGH FROM COLORADO WEAKENS...BUT MOVES MORE DIRECTLY OVER OUR
REGION. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE STARTS TO INCREASE OVER THE
WEEKEND...AND BY SUNDAY WE START POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND CONTINUE
THIS TREND THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. HOWEVER...WILL
KEEP VALLEY LOCATIONS DRY THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST. FOR
TEMPERATURES...WENT A LITTLE BELOW GUIDANCE FOR MAX TEMPS ON MOST
DAYS. FOR MIN TEMPS WENT A LITTLE ABOVE GUIDANCE AT THE END OF THE
FORECAST WHEN AN APPROACHING FRONT SHOULD INDUCE HIGHER DEWPOINTS
AND A LITTLE MORE BREEZE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  89  63  89  65 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  86  62  86  63 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       60  85  62  86  63 /   0   0   0   0   0

NICELY BY 10 AM EDT. MAX TEMP GUIDANCE LOOKS A BIT TOO WARM TODAY SO 
BACKED OFF A DEGREE OR TWO TODAY WHILE STAYING CLOSE TO THE MIDDLE 
GROUND OF SUGGESTED MINS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A STRONG HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
WILL BE SLOWLY DRIFTING FROM THE MS VALLEY REGION TO THE MID 
ATLANTIC COAST THROUGH THE PERIOD. THIS WILL KEEP DRY WEATHER AND 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES OVER THE TN VALLEY EACH DAY. THE GFS MOS 
HIGH TEMPERATURES APPEAR TOO WARM...AND ARE ON THE HIGH END OF THE 
ENSEMBLES...AND WILL BE UNDERCUT BY A FEW DEGREES. A SLIGHT CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS MAY COME ON DAY 7 WHEN THE GFS SHOWS A WEAKNESS IN THE 
RIDGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EDT TUE SEP 3 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
SETTLE IN BEHIND THE COLD FRONT THAT PASSED THROUGH EARLIER THIS 
AFTERNOON. DRIER WEATHER AND CLEARING SKIES WILL BE PRESENT THROUGH 
MONDAY EVENING. LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL 
TONIGHT...SO THE CHANCE FOR PATCHY FOG WILL BE PRESENT IN THE EARLY 
MORNING HOURS...MAINLY IN AREAS NORTH OF KNOXVILLE. OTHERWISE...HIGH 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 

FOR THE NEXT FEW HOURS...SEEING SPOTTY SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE TSRA
POP UP ALONG THE ACTUAL FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THIS BOUNDARY WAS RUNNING
FROM ROUGHLY ALONG I-81 TO I-75 AND SLIPPING SOUTHWARD. ADDED
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS BACK INTO THE GRIDS WITH A LATE AFTERNOON PERIOD
ADDED TO ZFP PRODUCT. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...EXTENDED 
PERIODS START OUT DRY WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN BY FRIDAY. 
THIS WILL BE DUE TO ESE LOW LEVEL FLOW AROUND THE SURFACE TO 850 MB 
RIDGE. LIMITED THESE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO ERN MTNS AND SW NC...
ADJACENT TO GSP AND FFC GRIDS. 

NW FLOW ALOFT FOR THE WEEKEND AS THE UPPER RIDGE AXIS STAYS OVER THE 
PLAINS STATES. CAN'T RULE OUT SPOTTY DIURNAL CONVECTION FOR BOTH SAT 
AND SUN...MAINLY LIMITED TO HIGHER TERRAIN. PREVIOUS GRIDS ALREADY 
REFLECTED THIS SO LITTLE CHANGES MADE. 

BY MONDAY AND TUESDAY...MODELS IN GENERAL CONSENSUS IN BUILDING THE 
UPPER RIDGE EASTWARD...WHILE THE SURFACE RIDGE HAS MOVED ENOUGH EAST 
TO ALLOW SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW TO DEVELOP. THIS INCREASE IN 
MOISTURE AND DAYTIME HEATING SUPPORT 20 TO 30 PERCENT CHANCE POPS 
FOR BOTH DAYS...BUT LIMITED TO THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. 

00Z AND 12Z GFSX MOS PLUS ECMX MOS VERY CLOSE ON TEMPS EACH PERIOD 
AND CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

FXUS64 KMRX 030801
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT TUE SEP 3 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
CURRENTLY MOVING THROUGH THE AREA ARE OCCURRING ALONG A MID-UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH AXIS...WHICH THE MODELS PROJECT TO BE EAST OF OUR AREA 
SHORTLY AFTER 12Z. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE MORNING IN 
EASTERN AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS. OTHERWISE...THE SHORT TERM PERIOD 
WILL BE DRY AS THE RIDGE OVER THE PLAINS BUILDS EASTWARD AND 
PRODUCES A DRY NW FLOW. DRIER AT THE SURFACE WILL BUILD IN 
TONIGHT...WITH DEWPOINTS FALLING INTO THE 50S TO LOWER 60S. THIS 
SHOULD MAKE FOR COMFORTABLE TEMPS AT NIGHT. DAYTIME HIGHS WILL STILL 
BE REACHING WELL INTO THE 80S IN MOST SPOTS TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY 
AS THERE IS NOT MUCH COLD ADVECTION OCCURRING AT 850 MB...AND SKIES 
WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS PRETTY CLOSE IN 
DEPICTION OF A LONG WAVE TROUGH AMPLIFYING OVER THE NORTHEASTERN 
QUARTER OF THE NATION AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD. HEIGHTS 
GRADUALLY BUILD OVER THE EASTERN STATES FROM THE WEEKEND INTO THE 
BEGINNING OF THE WORK WEEK. IN THIS PATTERN ANOTHER "COLD" FRONT 
BUILDS SOUTH THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. 
THERE SHOULD BE A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUDS BUT IT APPEARS TOO DRY 
FOR ANY SHOT AT PRECIP WITH THE FROPA THURSDAY NIGHT. KEPT SLIGHT 
CHANCE DIURNAL POPS FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN AREAS FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY WITH JUST ENOUGH MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY IN PLACE. UNDERCUT THE SUGGESTED MEX MOS MAXES BY AT 
LEAST A COUPLE DEGREES MUCH OF THE FORECAST PERIOD AND ABOUT A 
DEGREE FOR MINS IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN.

MIDDLE TENNESSEE THIS EVENING TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. ALONG THIS
BOUNDARY...SOME CLUSTERS OF THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO FIRE AND
SLOWLY MOVE OFF TO THE EAST TOWARD THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND
EVENTUALLY EAST TENNESSEE HEADING INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. WITH THE
LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING...THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE WEAKER BUT SOME
ELEVATED INSTABILITY SHOULD STILL KEEP SOME SCATTERED STORMS GOING
THOUGH THE NIGHT. THE MAIN IMPACTS WITH THE STRONGEST STORMS WILL
BE LIGHTNING AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. OTHERWISE...PARTLY CLOUDY
AND SLIGHTLY COOLER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED WITH LOWS IN THE MID
60S TO AROUND 70 DEGREES.

819 
FXUS64 KMRX 021847
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT MON SEP 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...A COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED TO
MOVE THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND INTO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING.
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE CURRENTLY DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THIS
FRONT. THIS CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EVENING AND INTO
THE NIGHT. CAPE VALUES ARE AROUND 2500 J/KG WITH LI VALUES UP TO
-5. WIND SHEAR IS WEAK BUT STRONG WINDS ALOFT. A FEW OF THESE
STORMS COULD BECOME SEVERE. WIND LOOKS TO BE THE MAIN THREAT AT
THIS TIME...AS WELL AS MODERATE SIZE HAIL AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING.
THERE IS A DECENT MIDLEVEL DRY AIR LAYER IN EACH SOUNDING.
DEPENDING ON WHEN THE DRY AIR DOES PROGRESS INTO THE AREA...COULD
SEE DENSE FOG IN THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. COOLER TEMPERATURES AND
CLEARING SKIES WILL BE PRESENT BEHIND THIS FRONT THROUGH THE DAY ON
TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...COLD FRONT
PROGGED THRU THE AREA BY TUESDAY EVENING WILL USHER IN DRY
WEATHER...MOST LIKELY WELL INTO FRIDAY. WEAK ESE LOW LEVEL FLOW MAY
SET UP AROUND THE SURFACE AND 850 MB RIDGE BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON...SO
I KEPT THE PREVIOUS SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR MAINLY THE EASTERN
MTNS FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

KEPT LOW POPS IN FOR POSSIBLE DIURNAL CONVECTION SATURDAY...BUT MOS 
POPS ARE TRENDING DOWNWARD. THE UPPER RIDGE AXIS ACTUALLY BUILDS 
EASTWARD ACROSS THE REGION BY SUNDAY INTO MONDAY...WHICH TAKES THE 
FORECAST AREA OUT OF THE NW FLOW ALOFT...AND MAY PROLONG THE DRY 
WEATHER. HOWEVER...I SAW NO REASON NOT TO CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
ALL AREAS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...ABOUT 10 PERCENT BELOW GFSX MOS 
POPS. INTRODUCING NEW DAY 7 (MONDAY) WITH JUST TOKEN 15 PERCENT POPS 
FOR SW VA/NE TN AND ERN MTNS AT THIS POINT...AND DRY MONDAY NIGHT.

FOR TEMPS...12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE CONSISTENT WITH 00Z MODEL RUN...
WITH LATEST ECMX MOS TEMPS JUST A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER ON HIGHS EACH 
DAY. ALL MOS MINS VERY CLOSE...SO JUST VERY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS MADE.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  89  66  90  64 /  40  10   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 AM EDT MON SEP 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THE NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN WITH EMBEDDED DISTURBANCES WILL CONTINUE 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH A COLD FRONT PUSHING INTO THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY. A 500 MB VORT MAX IS PRODUCING SOME SHOWERS OVER SOUTHERN 
MIDDLE TN AND NRN AL THIS MORNING...AND THE NAM BRINGS SOME SHOWERS 
INTO OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES LATER THIS MORNING...WHICH APPEARS 
REASONABLE. SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS MAY BE POSSIBLE 
THROUGH THE DAY...BUT PRECIP CHANCES APPEAR TO INCREASE IN THE 
EVENING WITH THE PASSAGE OF A MID-UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS. THE NAM 
SOUNDINGS SHOW PLENTIFUL CAPE AND SOME STEEP 850-700 LAPSE 
RATES...SO THERE WILL BE SOME ISOLATED SEVERE POTENTIAL. SURFACE TO 
MIDLEVEL THETA-E DIFFERENCES ARE 20-30 DEGREES C...SO WIND GUSTS 
WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE AS 
MOISTURE DEPTH IS LIMITED IN THE NW FLOW.

THE SURFACE COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA TUESDAY MORNING. WILL 
KEEP SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE MORNING WITH WEAK FORCING WITH 
THE FRONT...BUT RAPID DRYING ALOFT AND MIDLEVEL STABILIZATION WILL 
END PRECIP CHANCES BY THE AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO
THE FORECAST AREA BRINGING DRIER AIR AND SLIGHTLY COOLER
TEMPERATURES. A DRY FORECAST REMAINS IN PLACE THROUGH MUCH OF THE
WORK WEEK. CONFIDENCE LESSENS WHEN IT COMES TO RAIN CHANCES FOR
LATE WEEK AND INTO THE WEEKEND. AS SUCH HAVE CONTINUED WITH ONLY
SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE MENTIONED FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO THE
WEEKEND.

FXUS64 KMRX 011840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT SUN SEP 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE WESTERN 
ATLANTIC...WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. AREA 
RADARS INDICATE A DECREASE IN CONVECTIVE COVERAGE OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS AFTERNOON...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE EXITS THE 
FORECAST AREA IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. HOWEVER...ADDITIONAL 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT WILL BE POSSIBLE LATER THIS AFTERNOON INTO 
TONIGHT...AS THE AIR MASS REMAINS MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AND ADDITIONAL 
SHORT WAVES MOVE THROUGH THE LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL PUSH THE 
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT...WITH A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS PROGGED TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF IT ON 
MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THUS...EXPECT A GOOD COVERAGE OF 
CONVECTION ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD BE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNRISE ON TUESDAY MORNING...WITH A FEW 
LINGERING SHOWERS STILL POSSIBLE BEHIND IT. HIGH PRESSURE THEN 
BUILDS INTO THE REGION ON TUESDAY...WITH DRIER AND COOLER CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED THEREAFTER. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MINS TONIGHT AND MONDAY NIGHT...AND LOOK 
REASONABLE. DISCREPANCIES ARE SEEN WITH MAXES FOR BOTH MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY...MOSTLY DUE TO THEIR DIFFERENCES IN CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP 
COVERAGE FORECASTS. FOR NOW...WILL TREND MAXES CLOSE TO A 
PERSISTENCE FORECAST BOTH DAYS. ON TUESDAY NIGHT...FAIRLY LARGE 
DIFFERENCES DEVELOP WITH MINS AND WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO 
SETS OF GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WILL 
BE DRY WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AS HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE 
AREA. A SLIGHT WARMING TREND IN HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL TAKE PLACE 
EACH DAY. A SHORTWAVE APPROACHES THE REGION FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY...INCREASING CLOUDS AND THE CHANCE FOR RAIN IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. MODELS NOT IN AGREEMENT ON TIMING FOR THIS NEXT CHANCE 
OF RAIN...SO LOW CONFIDENCE ON THE EXTENT OF THIS SYSTEM. TEMPS WILL 
BE NEAR NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.
&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 AM EDT SUN SEP 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
MID LEVEL DISTURBANCES IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL CONTINUE TO 
BRING PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. THE MODELS HAVE NOT BEEN DOING WELL WITH THIS PATTERN. 
CONFIDENCE IN THE FINER MODEL DETAILS AND TIMING OF CONVECTION IS 
LOW...SO WILL BROAD BRUSH POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT. THIS 
MORNING...RADAR TRENDS SHOW DECREASING INTENSITY TO THE REMNANTS OF 
AN MCS...WHICH WILL MAINLY AFFECT THE PLATEAU COUNTIES. ADDITIONAL 
DEVELOPMENT IS EXPECTED TO OCCUR THIS AFTERNOON WITH SOME 
DESTABILIZATION...AND WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS EVERYWHERE. WILL KEEP 
HIGH CHANCE POPS GOING OVERNIGHT. AFTER MORNING CONVECTION 
DISSIPATES...THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH SUNSHINE TO BRING TEMPS INTO THE 
MID AND UPPER 80S THIS AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (LABOR DAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
WARM AND HUMID AIRMASS WILL REMAIN WILL ACROSS THE FORECAST BEFORE
A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. SHORT RANGE
MODELS DIFFER ON TEMPS AND POPS...PREFERRED THE GFS AND ITS
HANDLING OF THE FROPA WHEREAS NAM SHOWED THE FRONT WASHING
OUT/STALL IN NW FLOW. CLOUDS MAY NOT INHIBIT DAYTIME TEMPS WARMING
UP INTO THE 80S. SOME LINGERING SHOWER CHANCES WILL PERSIST INTO
MONDAY NIGHT AND THROUGH AT LEAST MID-DAY TUESDAY BEFORE DRYING
OUT. 

ANOTHER TREND IN THE MODELS HAS BEEN WARMER DAYTIME TEMPS
INCLUDING THE ECMWF. THEREFORE TWEAKED THOSE TEMPS THROUGH THE REST
OF THE WEEK. OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURE FORECAST LOOKED REASONABLE AND
MADE ONLY MINOR CHANGES.

THE MAJORITY OF THE WEEK WILL BE DRY. BY FRIDAY THERE IS A HINT OF
A DECENT SHORTWAVE DIVING INTO THE MID-MS VALLEY WHICH COULD BRING
CHANCES FOR ADDITIONAL RAINFALL BY SATURDAY.

OUTFLOW WINDS WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE WITH THESE STORMS AS WELL.
GIVEN THE SHOWER/STORM ACTIVITY...THINK THAT FOG DEVELOPMENT MAY BE
A LITTLE LESS WIDESPREAD TONIGHT SO HAVE KEPT A MENTION OF THIS OUT
OF THE ZONES. HOWEVER...SOME LOCALIZED POCKETS WILL CERTAINLY BE
POSSIBLE LATE TONIGHT IN SHELTERED/PRECIP FREE LOCATIONS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT SAT AUG 31 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MID WEST...WITH A VERY 
MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER 
70S MOST EVERYWHERE. AREA RADARS INDICATE SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA...BUT ESPECIALLY OVER SOUTHWEST VA. THIS 
CONVECTION WAS OCCURRING AHEAD OF AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE...WHICH 
WAS MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION IN 
THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION IS 
EXPECTED ON SUNDAY...AS THE AIR MASS BECOMES MODERATELY UNSTABLE IN 
THE AFTERNOON AND A LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. THIS UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL EVENTUALLY 
PUSH THE COLD FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON LABOR DAY...WITH A 
GOOD COVERAGE OF CONVECTION EXPECTED AGAIN. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT... MAINLY DUE TO THE DIFFERENCES IN CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP 
COVERAGE. FOR NOW...WILL TREND CLOSE TO A PERSISTENCE FORECAST 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...LINGERING SHOWERS MAY BE 
POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TUESDAY MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE 
MOVES INTO THE REGION. CLEAR SKIES AND DRY WEATHER WILL REMAIN 
THROUGH THE REST OF THE WORK WEEK. DUE TO UPSLOPE FLOW FROM THE 
NORTHWEST WINDS...THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE MOUNTAINS FRIDAY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN 
CANADA AND AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL SWING DOWN OVER SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...INCREASING CLOUDS BEGINNING 
FRIDAY EVENING. THIS FRONT WILL BRING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
DEVELOPING SATURDAY EVENING. MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ABOUT RAIN 
CHANCES WITH THIS FRONT. SEVERE WEATHER IS NOT EXPECTED AT THIS 
TIME...BUT THE CONVECTION IS STILL TOO FAR OUT IN TIME TO TELL WITH 
HIGH CONFIDENCE. TEMPERATURES WILL COOL TUESDAY AS THE HIGH PRESSURE 
SETS IN. WITH FLOW FROM THE NORTHWEST...NOT MUCH WARMING IS EXPECTED 
THROUGH THE WEEK. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN A FEW DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL CONSISTENTLY IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOW 80S. LOW TEMPERATURES 
WILL REMAIN NEAR NORMAL IN THE 60S.

SHORT WAVE...WHICH IS PROGGED TO MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD TODAY IN THE 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED 
TO DEVELOP AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON...THINK THAT SCATTERED CONVECTION 
SHOULD DEVELOP AREAWIDE THIS AFTERNOON AND INTO TONIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO HANDLE THIS WEATHER SITUATION 
FINE...BUT WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MORNING 
PRECIP WORDING...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS...POPS...AND SKY CONDITIONS A 
LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
228 AM EDT SAT AUG 31 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL CONUS WILL BE LOOSENING ITS GRIP ON THE 
TN VALLEY REGION...WITH A DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHEAST. 
REMNANTS OF A MCS NOW NEAR THE OHIO RIVER WILL BE APPROACHING THE 
NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS MORNING. BY AFTERNOON SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD BE SCATTERED ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA. NAM
SHOWS GOOD INSTABILITY IN SOUTHERN AREAS...WITH THE GFS SHOWING
LESS INSTABILITY. A FEW STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE STORMS MAY BE
POSSIBLE SOUTH. MOISTURE IS STILL LIMITED IN THE DEEP NW FLOW...SO
WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE. WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE MCV AND
STABILIZATION AFTER SUNSET...WILL LOWER POPS BACK TO A SLIGHT
CHANCE AFTER MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
A BROAD TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. ALONG WITH A COLD FRONT
MOVING ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY WILL PLACE THE FORECAST
AREA UNDER FAVORABLE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH
EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE ATMOSPHERE BECOMES INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE
SUNDAY AFTERNOON BUT UPPER FLOW REMAINS WEAK. STRONGER STORMS ARE
EXPECTED ON MONDAY WHEN THE COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH BY LATE
MONDAY AFTERNOON. FORECAST MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE CAPES OF
2500-3500 J/KG AND LI/S AROUND -8 DEG C. THESE UPDRAFTS...ONCE
DEVELOPED COULD PRODUCE LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS. WILL
CONTINUE TO HIGHLIGHT THIS THREAT IN THE HAZ WX OUTLOOK. DUE TO
MODELS SLOWING THE FROPA THROUGH...HAVE HELD ON TO SLIGHTLY HIGHER
POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY BEFORE THE SURFACE HIGH BUILDS
IN WHICH WILL RAPIDLY LOWER RAIN CHANCES BY LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON.
COOLER AND DRIER CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED FOR MUCH OF THE AREA
THROUGH FRIDAY. THE EXCEPTION MIGHT BE SW NC AND THE MOUNTAINS OF E
TN BY FRIDAY WHEN THESE AREAS ARE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF UPSLOPE
FLOW ON THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE SURFACE HIGH.

WILL BE AN MCS CURRENTLY PROGRESSING SOUTH ACROSS THE NORTHERN
GREAT LAKES. THE NAM WANTS TO BRING THE REMNANTS OF THIS COMPLEX TO
THE KENTUCKY/TENNESSEE BORDER BY EARLY/MID MORNING...WHILE OTHER
SOLUTIONS ARE MUCH MORE PESSIMISTIC. FOR NOW...THINK THAT THE NAM IS
OVERDONE WITH PRECIPITATION AND HAVE MAINTAINED JUST A SLIGHT
CHANCE. HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE LATEST TRENDS THIS
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. OTHERWISE...PATCHY FOG WILL LIKELY FORM BY
MIDNIGHT GIVEN THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER CONDITIONS WITH CALM WINDS
AND LOWS IN THE UPPER 60S/LOWER 70S.

965 
FXUS64 KMRX 301855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT FRI AUG 30 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK NORTHWEST-TO-SOUTHEAST ORIENTED STATIONARY 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER CENTRAL KENTUCKY AND CENTRAL EAST TN... 
GENERALLY STRETCHING FROM NEAR LOUISVILLE TO KNOXVILLE TO MURPHY NC. 
THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL LIKELY NOT MOVE MUCH THIS WEEKEND... AS 
THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW REMAINS NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE SURFACE 
BOUNDARY. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A STABLE CAPPING LAYER IN MID 
LEVELS BETWEEN 750 AND 550 MB...WHICH SHOULD CONTINUE TO LIMIT THE 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION TONIGHT. HOWEVER...THIS MID-LEVEL CAPPING 
STABLE LAYER SHOULD ERODE ON SATURDAY...AS A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL HIGH 
OVER THE CENTRAL PART OF THE NATION WEAKENS AND AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT 
WAVE MOVES OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. AS A RESULT...THERE SHOULD BE A 
BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION ON SATURDAY AS THE AIR MASS BECOMES 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE IN THE AFTERNOON. A LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
IS THEN PROGGED TO BEGIN AMPLIFYING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION ON SUNDAY...WHICH SHOULD CREATE AN EVEN BETTER COVERAGE OF 
CONVECTION FOR SUNDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY MONDAY. ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
BE POSSIBLE IN THE EARLY HOURS MONDAY MORNING... WITH INCREASING 
COVERAGE THROUGH THE DAY. WIND PROFILE IS UNIMPRESSIVE THROUGH THE 
DAY...BUT WITH INSTABILITIES AROUND 1500 TO 2000 J/KG AND LI VALUES 
AROUND -6 TO -8 MONDAY AFTERNOON...SOME OF THE THUNDERSTORMS THAT DO 
DEVELOP COULD BECOME SEVERE. 

HIGH PRESSURE OUT IN THE MIDWEST WILL THEN BRING WINDS FROM THE 
NORTHWEST ALONG WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES TO THE AREA. DRY WEATHER AND 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WILL REMAIN FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK. UPSLOPE 
FLOW WILL BRING THE POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...FRIDAY AND INTO 
THE WEEKEND. TEMPS WILL BE A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS 
TIME OF YEAR ONCE THE COLD FRONT PASSES ON MONDAY EVENING.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 300708
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 AM EDT FRI AUG 30 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE IN THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS CENTERED OVER THE PLAINS 
TODAY WILL SLOWLY RETROGRADE THROUGH TONIGHT. TODAY WILL CONTINUE TO 
FEATURE A DRY NW FLOW ALOFT...AND A MIDLEVEL STABLE LAYER THAT WILL 
FURTHER SUPPRESS CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW 
A WEAKER STABLE LAYER AROUND 700 MB AT CHA THAN AT TRI...SO WILL 
HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP SOUTH AND IN HIGHER TERRAIN. THE NAM 
DEVELOPS PRECIP OVER THE AREA TONIGHT AHEAD OF A MIDLEVEL TROUGH. 
THE GFS IS DRIER AND SHOWS MUCH LESS TROUGHING TONIGHT. WILL SIDE 
WITH THE GFS AND GO WITH A DRIER FORECAST TONIGHT. TEMPS ARE 
EXPECTED TO BE SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY...WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S TO 
LOWER 90S AND LOWS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL WEAKEN OVER THE
FORECAST AREA BY EARLY SATURDAY. A SHORTWAVE IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW
WILL BISECT THE REGION BY THE AFTERNOON. THERE WILL BE INCREASING
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGHOUT THE DAY STARTING FIRST OVER
THE NORTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES. FOR TEMPERATURES COMPROMISED BETWEEN
NAM/GFS. NAM WAS REALLY WET WHICH HAD A COOLING EFFECT AND THE GFS
WAS WARMER AND DRIER. EXPECT ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT FORMED SATURDAY
AFTERNOON TO DISSIPATE BY 9PM. FEEL THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT MAY
REMAIN DRY HOWEVER KEPT IN LOW CHANCE POPS. THE TROUGH REMAINS
NEARLY STATIONARY WITH ANOTHER SHORTWAVE FILLING IN FOR SUNDAY.
COMBINE THE SHORTWAVE WITH THE EXPECTED INSTABILITY AND WE WILL
LIKELY SEE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OCCUR BY AFTERNOON. LOCALLY
HEAVY RAINFALL UP TO AN INCH AND A QUARTER COULD OCCUR OVER THE
SOUTHERN PLATEAU/VALLEY.

A WELL DEFINED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY. 
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED. SOME OF THESE 
STORMS MAY BE SEVERE ACROSS PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE BULK OF 
THE UPPER DYNAMICS WILL BE ACROSS W VA...HOWEVER PROGGED LIFTED 
INDICES ARE -8 DEG C AND CAPE VALUES FROM 2500-3500 J/KG. BY MONDAY 
NIGHT HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD IN HOWEVER SOME RAINFALL 
COULD STILL OCCUR IN THE UPSLOPE AREA IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. THIS 
MAY PERSIST INTO TUESDAY. OTHERWISE OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
NOTICEABLY COOLER/DRIER AND DAYTIME TEMPERATURES WILL BE PLEASANT. 
DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGH THE REST OF NEXT WEEK.

SOUNDINGS INDICATE A FAIRLY STRONG STABLE LAYER IN MID LEVELS 
(BETWEEN 750 AND 550 MB) WHICH SHOULD CAP THE LOCAL AIR MASS ENOUGH 
TO LIMIT ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT TO JUST ISOLATED COVERAGE 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. BY SATURDAY...THIS MID-LEVEL CAPPING STABLE 
LAYER SHOULD ERODE AS A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL HIGH OVER THE CENTRAL 
PART OF THE NATION WEAKENS AND AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BEGINS TO 
AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL 
HELP TO CREATE A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION ON SATURDAY AND 
SATURDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE. TEMPS 
ARE NOT EXPECTED TO FALL MUCH BEHIND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY...WITH THE 
TEMP FORECAST ESSENTIALLY BEING A PERSISTENCE FORECAST OF ABOVE 
NORMAL VALUES.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UNSETTLED WEATHER WILL 
DOMINATE THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED.  A WEAKENING FRONT 
WILL BE EXITING THE REGION ON SUNDAY WITH ASSOCIATE CONVECTION 
LINGERING INTO SUNDAY NIGHT.  THE MAIN SYSTEM FOR THE EXTENDED WILL 
BE A RATHER STRONG COLD FRONT THAT WILL SLIDE IN AROUND THE MONDAY 
TIME FRAME.  WILL CONTINUE LIKELY POPS IN THE FORECAST FOR THIS.  A 
FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY 
TUESDAY.  THEN...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
WILL TAKE OVER FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD PROVIDING DRY CONDITIONS.  
SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND MONDAY/S FRONT...WITH 
TEMPERATURES BEGINNING TO WARM BY THE END OF THE PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   72  91  72  90  72 /  10  20  20  40  50 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     71  89  71  88  71 /  20  20  20  40  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN             71  89  71  88  71 /  10  20  20  40  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    68  87  67  86  68 /  20  20  20  40  50

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...

SHOULD NOT BRING MUCH IN THE WAY OF COOLER AIR AS HIGHS WILL REACH
THE MID 80S TO LOWER 90S ONCE AGAIN. IN ADDITION...SOME ISOLATED TO
PERHAPS SCATTERED SHOWERS AND STORMS MAY DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT

YESTERDAY MOST LOCATIONS WILL REMAIN DRY. THE UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE IN
PLACE WILL PROMOTE SOME CLEARING CONDITIONS LATER TONIGHT ALONG
WITH CALM WINDS AND MILD LOWS ONCE AGAIN.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
GFS MODEL CONTINUES TO BE GENERALLY CONSISTENT FROM RUN TO
RUN...ALTHO FURTHER OUT IN TIME THE ECMWF IS FAVORED. THIS LENDS
MUCH SUPPORT TO TIMING A MORE SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE
TOWARD MONDAY NIGHT...WITH LIKELY POPS A GOOD BET FOR DAYTIME
MONDAY. KEPT POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WITH
SCATTERED WORDING ADDED FOR SUNDAY. OTHERWISE...DROPPED POPS A BIT
SOONER OVER NRN AREAS ON TUESDAY WITH NO CHANGES MADE FOR TUESDAY
NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

FOR THE EARLIEST PERIODS OF THE EXTENDED...BACKDOOR COLD FRONT 
PUSHES THROUGH ON FRIDAY...BUT TIME HEIGHTS AND SOUNDINGS STILL SHOW 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY. THUS...KEPT TOKEN 20 TO 30 PERCENT POPS IN 
FOR NOW. TOOK A COUPLE OF DEGREES OFF OF GFS/GFSX MAX TEMPS EARLY... 
THEN TRENDED TOWARD A BLEND OF LATEST ECMX AND 29/00Z GFSX MOS FOR 
MAX TEMPS FROM SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. FOLLOWED THE SIMILAR MOS 
MINS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 281907
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT WED AUG 28 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MID WEST. NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT IS EXPECTED TO QUICKLY PUSH THIS COLD FRONT SOUTHEASTWARD INTO 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY BY THIS EVENING...INTO SOUTHWEST VA BY SUNRISE 
ON THURSDAY MORNING...AND ACROSS THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON 
THURSDAY. ON FRIDAY...THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO STALL OUT 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES WEAKER AND 
MORE WESTERLY. AT LEAST A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO 
REMAIN OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH A 
MODERATELY TO POTENTIALLY HIGHLY UNSTABLE (ACCORDING TO THE NAM 
MODEL) AIR MASS DEVELOPING AROUND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THUS... 
EXPECT ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH TEMPS NOT REALLY FALLING MUCH BEHIND THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ATMOSPHERE SHOULD BECOME A 
LITTLE MORE ACTIVE OVER THE WEEKEND AND INTO THE EARLY PART OF THE 
WORKWEEK AS MODELS AGREE THE CENTRAL U.S. UPPER RIDGE RETROGRADES 
BACK OVER THE WESTERN U.S. WHILE UPPER TROUGHING ONCE AGAIN 
ESTABLISHES ITSELF ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. SEVERAL SHORTER 
WAVELENGTH FEATURES WILL DROP INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH 
THE GRADUALLY STRENGTHENING NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY WILL BE AVAILABLE TO THE SYSTEMS LEADING TO THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND PERIOD. USED A BLEND OF MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE POPS SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY WHILE ADVANCING THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA INTO THE GOOD 
CHANCE CATEGORY BY MONDAY WHEN A SYNOPTIC COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
BUILDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL FORECASTS INDICATE THE FRONT 
SHOULD BE SOUTH OF THE BY 12Z TUESDAY BUT DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN 
FRONTAL TIMING DURING THIS REMOTE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST HELD ONTO 
JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ON TUESDAY. 
WEDNESDAY SHOULD BE DRY AND PLEASANT WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER 70S TO 
MID 80S AND MUCH LOWER HUMIDITY.

167 
FXUS64 KMRX 280702
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 AM EDT WED AUG 28 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SUBTROPICAL RIDGE TO THE WEST OF THE REGION
CONTINUES TO PROMOTE MILD AND DRY CONDITIONS EARLY THIS MORNING.
ALONG THE NORTHEASTERN PERIPHERY OF THIS LARGE RIDGE...A COMPLEX OF
STORMS IS STILL MOVING ACROSS OHIO AND INTO NORTHERN WEST
VIRGINIA. THIS COMPLEX MAY EVENTUALLY BUILD BACK TO THE SOUTHWEST
LATER TODAY INTO CENTRAL/SOUTHERN WEST VIRGINIA AND EASTERN
KENTUCKY LATER TODAY AND PERHAPS ALLOW FOR SOME SCATTERED
CONVECTION TO CLIP SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE
LATER THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. HOWEVER...STILL THINK THAT MOST
OF THE AREA WILL REMAIN DRY AS MODELS/TRENDS ARE INDICATING MOST OF
THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE CONCENTRATED WELL NORTHEAST OF THE AREA.
STILL...GIVEN SOME MODERATE INSTABILITY VALUES...LOCALLY STRONG TO
BRIEFLY SEVERE STORMS COULD BE POSSIBLE WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL BEING THE PRIMARY CONCERNS. OTHERWISE...
PARTLY SUNNY AND WARM CONDITIONS IN THE MID 80S TO LOW 90S ARE
EXPECTED BY THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
UPPER RIDGE STILL THE DOMINANT FEATURE THROUGH FRIDAY...AND SHOULD
KEEP ANY LATE NIGHT CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES N AND NE OF THE FORECAST
AREA. DIURNAL CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE FOR THURSDAY WITH ONLY LOW
POPS JUSTIFIED. KEPT THURSDAY NIGHT DRY FOR NOW IN LINE WITH SHORT
RANGE MODELS AND MOS POPS...THEN MAINLY LOW POPS FOR ERN MOST AREAS
FRIDAY WITH A BIT OF DRYING ELSEWHERE BEHIND WEAK BACKDOOR COLD
FRONT.

BY THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...THE UPPER RIDGE RETROGRESSES 
WESTWARD WITH A GRADUAL SHIFT TO TROUGHINESS OVER GREAT LAKES AND 
OHIO VALLEY. THIS ALLOWS FOR AN INCREASE IN RAIN CHANCES AND SETS UP 
THE FORECAST AREA FOR SOME LATE NIGHT CONVECTION AS WELL. BEST 
CHANCES ARE INDICATED FOR SUNDAY INTO LABOR DAY AS IN PREVIOUS 
GRIDS. STAYED BELOW LIKELY POPS FOR NOW FOR THOSE PERIODS...ALTHO 
THE 28/00Z GFSX MOS POPS ARE TRENDING SLIGHTLY UPWARD FROM 27/12Z 
RUN. TUESDAY MAY SHAPE UP AS A DRY DAY...DEPENDING ON TIMING OF A 
STRONGER COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE. HUNG ON TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW 
ON TUESDAY FOR CONTINUITY. 

FOR TEMPS...GFS MOS HAS CONSISTENTLY BEEN ABOUT 1 TO 3 DEGREES TOO 
WARM ON MAX TEMPS OF LATE. THE 28/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS DID REFLECT 
SLIGHTLY COOLER HIGHS FROM SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...WHICH SEEMS 
REASONABLE GIVEN THE PATTERN CHANGES THAT OCCUR. ADJUSTED MAX AND 
MIN TEMPS GENERALLY IN LINE WITH LATEST GUIDANCE...TAKING SEVERAL 
DEGREES OFF OF TUESDAY NIGHT MIN TEMPS AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       89  69  91  69  91 /   0  10  20  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT TUE AUG 27 2013

.SHORT TERM...STORM MONITOR AND SPC ANALYSIS SHOWS INCREASING
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE CENTRAL
APPALACHAINS. FLOW ALOFT WILL REMAIN NORTHWEST OVER THE EASTERN
THIRD OF THE NATION ALLOWING SHORT-WAVE ENERGY TO MOVE ACROS THE
OHIO VALLEY INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS AND MID-ATLANTIC STATES.
MOST OF THE CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH THESE WAVES WILL REMAIN
NORTH AND EAST OF THE AREA. HOWEVER...AS LIKE THIS AFTERNOON A FEW
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDESTORM WILL MOVE INTO SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND POSSIBLY NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. WILL MAINTAIN LOW CHANCE
POPS THERE.

OTHERWISE...RIDGING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL LIMIT CONVECTION
DUE TO THE MID-LEVEL INVERSION. A GOOD DEAL OF CONVECTIVE DEBRIS
WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS MOST OF THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

PATCHY FOG WILL ONCE AGAIN BE POSSIBLE EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING. AS
FOR TEMPERATURES...GENERALLY FOLLOWED NAM HIGHS AND COMPROMISE OF
GFS/NAM MINS DUE TO PAST PERFORMANCE

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
BE IN DECENT AGREEMENT OVERALL AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY IS NOT 
BAD. FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR...WITH BIGGEST AREA OF UNCERTAINTY BEING MODEL HANDLING OF ANY 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES COMING DOWN THE EAST SIDE OF THE RIDGE.  THE 
LARGE UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN TO OUR WEST...AND WILL RETROGRADE EVEN 
FURTHER WEST LATE IN THE PERIOD.  FIRST CONCERN WILL BE ANY 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES THAT MAY COME DOWN THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE 
RIDGE.  LOOKS LIKE HIGHEST POPS SHOULD BE NORTH IN THIS 
SCENARIO...AND WILL KEEP POPS ON THE LOWER SIDE GIVEN UNCERTAINTY.  
BY LATE IN THE PERIOD UPPER TROUGH WILL DEEPEN ACROSS THE EASTERN 
US.  A COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO SWING THROUGH MONDAY OR MONDAY 
NIGHT.  WILL CARRY HIGHEST POPS ON MONDAY.  WILL GENERALLY TRIM A 
FEW DEGREES FROM GFS MOS MAX TEMPS...WITH ONLY A FEW TWEAKS TO 
MINS.      

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             69  91  71  93  72 /   0   0  10  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  89  71  90  70 /  10  10  10  20  10

805 
FXUS64 KMRX 270738
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 AM EDT TUE AUG 27 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PATCHY AND LOCALLY DENSE FOG
DEVELOPING ONCE AGAIN THIS MORNING...ESPECIALLY IN THE FAVORED
VALLEY LOCATIONS SUCH AS TRI-CITIES AIRPORT...ABINGDON AND MURPHY
NC. A BAND OF THICKER HIGH CLOUDS MAY DRIFT ACROSS AND IMPROVE
VISBYS BRIEFLY BEFORE DAYBREAK. CARRIED A MENTION OF FOG JUST
BEYOND 12Z TODAY...AND ALSO ADDED VALLEY/AREA LAKES FOG FOR LATE
TONIGHT AS WELL.

BULK OF OUR FORECAST AREA IS NOW INCLUDED IN THE DAY ONE CONVECTIVE
OUTLOOK FOR GENERAL TSRA...WITH NAM MODEL THE MOST ZEALOUS IN
CREATING BOTH DIURNAL CONVECTION...AS WELL AS TRACKING SOME LATE
NIGHT MCS ACTIVITY ACROSS NRN 1/2 OF THE FORECAST AREA. NO OTHER
MODEL OR SREF DEPICTS THE MCS TRACK THIS FAR SOUTH FOR TONIGHT...SO
I JUST ADDED LOW POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING ACROSS SW VA
AND PARTS OF NE TN FOR NOW. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW AN INCREASE IN
MOISTURE TODAY...BUT CHA SOUNDING SHOWS A DECENT CAPPING INVERSION
AROUND 650 TO 700 MB LEVEL TO INHIBIT TSRA. NOTED DRY AIR BELOW
CLOUD BASES AND ALSO IN THE MID LEVELS...SO I MAY MENTION ISOLATED
STRONG STORMS WITH WIND GUSTS UP TO 45 MPH IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER
PRODUCT. 

OTHERWISE...I HEDGED A BIT CLOSER TO THE COOLER NAM MOS OR A BLEND
OF MOS FOR HIGHS TODAY. GFS MINS LOOKED QUITE REASONABLE AND WERE
CLOSELY FOLLOWED.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH LABOR DAY/...
A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL SUBTROPICAL RIDGE OVER THE MID-MISSISSIPPI RIVER 
VALLEY WILL REMAIN THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK. ALONG THE NORTHERN 
PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE...A COMPLEX OF STORMS WILL ROLL FROM THE 
GREAT LAKES INTO WEST VIRGINIA AND CLIP THE FAR NORTHEAST ZONES ON 
WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...THINK THAT ONLY LOW TO PERHAPS MODERATE CHANCE 
POPS ARE WARRANTED ATTM GIVEN THE SCATTERED NATURE OF THIS ACTIVITY. 
ADDITIONAL SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW END CHANCE POPS WILL CONTINUE 
THURSDAY INTO THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND AS ISOLATED TO SCATTERED DIURNAL 
CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE EACH DAY GIVEN THE MOISTURE UNDERNEATH 
THIS RIDGE. PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE SUNDAY INTO 
LABOR DAY AS THE RIDGE RETROGRADES TO THE WEST AND A BROAD 
UPPER-TROUGH SWINGS INTO THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY. WARM 
TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH HIGHS IN THE 
UPPER 80S TO LOWER 90S EACH DAY.

CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS ALL BUT SOUTH WED AND ALL
ZONES THU. A BIT OF DRYING INDICATED FRIDAY THEN MOISTURE EXPECTED
TO INCREASE AGAIN DURING THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY. WITH THE INCREASE
IN MOISTURE AS WELL AS THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME MORE WEAK SHORT WAVE
ENERGY COMING DOWN THE EAST SIDE OF THE RIDGE...WILL CARRY LOW POPS
ALL ZONES SAT THROUGH MONDAY. WILL UNDERCUT SOME MAX TEMPS A
BIT...BUT OVERALL WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS.

THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATE WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. THEN
SLIGHTLY COOLER AND DRIER AIR FRIDAY OVER NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE

AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS NW FLOW BRINGS
SHORTWAVE ACTIVITY AROUND RIDGE INTO THE FORECAST AREA. WITH TN
VALLEY ON EASTERN EDGE OF CENTRAL STATES UPPER RIDGE TEMPERATURES
WILL BE AT OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

EVENINGS ACROSS ENTIRE FORECAST AREA AS SHORTWAVES MOVE SE IN NW

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
227 PM EDT SAT AUG 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER
THE AREA...BRINGING SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS THROUGH THE WEEKEND.
HOWEVER...SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AND SOUTHEAST TENNEESSEE WILL
HAVE BROKEN CLOUDS THROUGH A LARGE PART OF THE AFTERNOON. WITH THE
SMALL AMOUNT OF MOISTURE REMAINING AND THE INSTABILITY PRESENT...AN
ISOLATED SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM COULD BE POSSIBLE. OTHERWISE MOSTLY
CLEAR SKIES CAN BE EXPECTED. LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES
BELOW NORMAL WITH HIGHS NEAR NORMAL THROUGH SUNDAY.


.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...STRONG RIDGING ACROSS
THE MID-SECTION OF THE NATION WILL PLACE THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY/
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS UNDER DRY NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THROUGH MID-
WEEK NEXT WEEK. ALSO...SURFACE RIDGING WILL REMAIN AS WELL. END
RESULT WILL BE A DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE OVER THE AREA WITH PWS AT OR
BELOW 1.25 INCHES THROUGH TUESDAY. ALSO...MID- LEVEL INVERSION IS
ALSO NOTED. WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST THROUGH TUESDAY.

FOR LATE WEDNESDAY...AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST UNITED 
STATES WILL PULL A FRONT SOUTH/SOUTHWEST TOWARD THE AREA WEDNESDAY 
WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AS SURFACE RIDGING WEAKENS. FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION FOR THURSDAY WITH SCATTERED 
CONVECTION ANTICIPATED.

FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS WEST OF THE AREA...BUT
ENOUGH MOISTURE REMAINS TO KEEP SLIGHT POPS GOING MAINLY FOR THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS.

GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE OR TWO LOWER THAN GFX HIGHS AND FOLLOWING LOWS
CLOSELY.

TN AND SW NC. DEW POINT TEMPS STAYING IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S IN

JUSTIFIED.

FOR NOW DUE TO DRIER AIR MOVING IN. STUCK CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR HIGHS 
TODAY...AND ALSO FOR MINS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...BUILDING UPPER RIDGE OVER
THE REGION AND DRIER AIR MASS WILL KEEP FORECAST AREA DRY SUNDAY
AND MONDAY. SHORT RANGE MODELS SHOWS THE RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE
MID MS VALLEY SUNDAY AND THEN SLOWLY RETROGRADING TO THE CENTRAL
AND SOUTHERN PLAINS BY TUESDAY. FOLLOWED NEAR GUIDANCE WITH LOW
TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S SUNDAY NIGHT AND HIGHS
MID TO UPPER 80S SUNDAY AND MONDAY. 

TUESDAY AS RIDGE RETROGRADES TO THE WEST SHORTWAVES WILL BEGIN TO
MOVE SOUTHEAST AROUND EDGE OF RIDGE AND CAUSE A FEW SHOWERS AND
STORMS OVER NE TN AND SW VA. WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY RIDGE BREAKS
DOWN MORE WITH BETTER CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO MOVE
AROUND PERIPHERY OF RIDGE. LOWS WILL BE WARMER WITH INCREASE IN
MOISTURE AS DEW POINTS RISE. HIGHS STILL MID 80S TO NEAR 90.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONVECTION HAS STAYED WELL NORTH

THUNDERSTORMS WITH HIGHEST CHANCE POPS OVER NRN MOST AREAS. LOWERED
POPS A BIT QUICKER FROM THE NW THIS EVENING. MAX AND MIN TEMPS
CHANGED VERY LITTLE FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS.

UNDER THE RELATIVELY CLEAR SKIES.

AIR MASS BUILDS IN SATURDAY AND WITH SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE IN THE
MOUNTAINS WILL MAINTAIN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY. SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLE MODELS KEEP BUILDING
RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL STATES BUT EXTENDING EAST THROUGH
THE TN VALLEY. NW FLOW INTO THE FORECAST AREA IS DRY FROM SATURDAY
EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY SO HAVE NO POPS. MONDAY AND TUESDAY HEATING AND
INSTABILITY TO DEVELOP AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY RIDGE RETREATS SLIGHTLY WEST
SO NW FLOW TO BRING MOISTURE AND A BETTER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. FOR TEMPERATURES KEPT HIGHS SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE
FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S...THEN FOR THE
LATER EXTENDED LOWER 90S SOUTH. IF RIDGE BUILDS IN STRONGER HIGHS
MAY HAVE TO BE RAISED A FEW DEGREES HIGHER. NIGHT TIME LOWS WILL BE
A FEW DEGREES COOLER NE HALF SUNDAY AND MONDAY MORNINGS AND THEN
WARM AS MOISTURE INCREASES AT MID WEEK.

&&

OF IT.

CONVECTION. HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SCATTERED CONVECTION AFTER MIDNIGHT AS THE FRONT NEARS THE FORECAST 
AREA. CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD HELP TO LIMIT 
THE AREAL COVERAGE OF FOG OVERNIGHT (COMPARED TO LAST NIGHT)...BUT

685 
FXUS64 KMRX 221859
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EDT THU AUG 22 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE BEGUN TO DEVELOP IN SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SURROUNDING AREAS. THIS CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH 
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AND WEAKEN AFTER SUNSET. WINDS ARE WEAK 
AND THERE IS A GOOD AMOUNT OF MIDLEVEL DRY AIR TO LIMIT SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPMENT. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE OVERNIGHT AHEAD OF A 
FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA FROM THE NORTH. WITH AMOUNT OF MOISTURE 
ALREADY IN AREA FOG LOOKS TO BE PRESENT FRIDAY MORNING.

CONVECTION FROM THIS FRONT EXPECTED TO AFFECT TRI CITIES AREA
EARLY MORNING...WITH KNOXVILLE AND CHATTANOOGA AROUND LATE
MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON. HEAVY RAIN LOOKS TO BE THE BIGGEST THREAT
WITH THIS SYSTEM. PW VALUES ARE AROUND 1.8 WITH INSTABILITIES
AROUND 2000 J/KG. WINDS ARE WEAK WITH VERY LITTLE SHEAR. KEPT LOW
TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES ABOVE GUIDANCE TONIGHT DUE TO THE AMOUNT
OF CLOUDS MOVING INTO THE AREA. HIGH TEMPERATURES TOMORROW ARE
CLOSE TO GUIDANCE IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S.

.LONG TERM.../FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY/...BY THE START OF THIS 
PERIOD THE WEAK COLD FRONT SHOULD BE THROUGH THE AREA...WITH 
SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR STARTING TO FILL INTO THE REGION.  TRAJECTORY 
FORECASTS SUGGEST THAT THE POST-FRONTAL AIR MASS SOURCE REGION WILL 
BE EASTERN ONTARIO/WESTERN QUEBEC WHERE CURRENT POST-FRONTAL DEW 
POINTS ARE IN THE 45-55 DEGREE RANGE.  WITH THE LONG ANTICYCLONIC 
PATH THIS AIR MASS WILL TAKE ON THE WAY HERE...THE DEW POINTS WILL 
MODIFY QUITE A BIT...BUT EVEN WITH THESE MODIFICATIONS...OUR DEW 
POINTS SHOULD DEFINITELY FALL FROM OUR CURRENT 65-72 DEGREE 
READINGS.  HAVE GONE 1-2 DRIER THAN MODEL GUIDANCE FOR DEW POINTS 
OVERALL THROUGH ABOUT NEXT TUESDAY.  

UPPER HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE PLAINS WILL BE BUILDING OVER THE NEXT 
COUPLE OF DAYS...AND SWELLING FARTHER EAST TO HELP KEEP WEATHER 
SYSTEMS AWAY FROM THE AREA.  THE NEXT HALF-WAY ORGANIZED SYSTEM 
LOOKS TO BE AROUND MID WEEK WHEN A WEAK SYSTEM COMES SOUTH. KEEPING 
POPS RELATIVELY LOW FOR THE LATER PERIODS...THINKING THAT THE UPPER 
RIDGE MAY KEEP THESE CHANCES PUSHED TO OUR EAST AS WELL.  DEFINITELY 
A DRIER PATTERN THAN WE HAVE BEEN IN FOR THE PAST SEVERAL WEEKS.

RIDGE TO THE EAST SHIFTS SLIGHTLY WEST ON THURSDAY. THE LAYER RH 
LOWERS IN THE WAKE OF THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS WHILE THE LOWER LAYER RH 
AND THICKNESS VALUES CHANGE LITTLE. TEMPERATURES NEAR OR SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE NORMAL.

NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF SCATTERED SHOWERS AND

INCREASED POPS THERE SLIGHTLY...AS WELL AS ON FRIDAY BETWEEN 12-18Z 
AS THE FRONT MOVES SOUTH...BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF AFTER 00Z 
SATURDAY AFTER THE FRONT CLEARS THE REGION. THIS WEEKEND INTO NEXT 
WEEK AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE LOOKS TO BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
ALTHOUGH SOME LOW-END DIURNAL STORM CHANCES WILL EB POSSIBLE EACH 
AFTERNOON...DRIER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED GENERALLY HEADING INTO THE 
LAST WEEK OF AUGUST ALONG WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND.

AFTERNOON WITH HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS EXPECTED.  THE TROUGH WILL

SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE THROUGH THE NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
OVERALL FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT 
AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE 
AREA FRIDAY AND IS FORECAST TO EXIT BY EARLY SATURDAY.  SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CAN BE EXPECTED THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AHEAD 
OF THIS FRONT.  SOME DRYING BEHIND IT BUT NOT A MUCH COOLING AS 
UPPER RIDGE TO OUR WEST BUILDS EAST. WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES EACH AFTERNOON FOR THE 
WEEKEND...THEN LOW CHANCE EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES MONDAY AND TUESDAY 
WITH SLIGHT CHANCE ELSEWHERE. GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE SO JUST SOME TWEAKS. 


&&

724 
FXUS64 KMRX 201844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EDT TUE AUG 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE/PLATEAU AS
WELL AS A LONG THE TENNESSEE/NORTH CAROLINA STATE LINE THIS
AFTERNOON. THE CONVECTION IS AIDED BY AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE
WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH DAYTIME HEATING PRODUCING MODERATE
INSTABILITY WITH STORM MONITOR AND SPC SHOWING CAPES OF 1000-1500
J/KG. CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EVENING...THEN DIMINISH
IN COVERAGE BY SUNSET. DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH LOW/MID LEVEL CLOUDS
REMAIN...COULD BE AREAS OF FOG OVERNIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING.

FOR WEDNESDAY...UPPER THROUGH WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE
LOWER OHIO VALLEY AND EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY. AS WAS THE CASE FOR
MIDDLE TENNESSEE...SCATTERED/BROKEN CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP A
LITTLE FARTHER EAST INTO MOST OF EAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
AND WESTERN CAROLINA BY AFTERNOON. MODELS SHOW CAPES BETWEEN
1500-2000 J/KG...SO STORMS WILL LIKELY BE A LITTLE STRONGER
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. MAIN CONCERN WILL BE STRONG/GUSTY WINDS UP TO
40 MPH..LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS AND FREQUENT LIGHTNING. HAVE INCLUDED
IN THE HWO.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GENERALLY FOLLOWED A MIX OF NAM/GFS DUE TO NEAR
TERM PERFORMANCE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND SHOW NORTHWEST UPPER-LEVEL FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH BUILDING OVER 
THE CENTRAL PORTION OF THE NATION THIS WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
IT APPEARS THE NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY 
WILL PUSH A WEAK COLD FRONT INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON 
THURSDAY...AND INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY. WHILE THIS COLD 
FRONT WILL HELP TO TRIGGER SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA...TEMPS WILL LIKELY NOT FALL MUCH BEHIND IT FOR THE WEEKEND AS 
A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH BUILDS OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. THIS UPPER 
HIGH SHOULD HELP TO SUPPRESS MOST CONVECTION THIS WEEKEND AND EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...AS AN INCREASINGLY WARM LAYER IN THE MID LEVELS OF THE 
ATMOSPHERE HELPS TO CAP THE LOCAL AIR MASS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...DUE TO THE RELATIVELY HIGH SOIL MOISTURE CONTENT 
OVER THE REGION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

WIDESPREAD ORGANIZED BAND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM EXPECTED TO 
PUSH THROUGH THE MRX CWA.  FLOW ALOFT BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY FOR 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES AND THE REMNANTS OF 
A WEAKENING BOUNDARY TRACKING THROUGH.  THIS WILL KEEP SCATTERED 
CONVECTION IN THE FORECAST.  STRONG UPPER RIDGE OVER THE EASTERN 
U.S. WILL SLOWLY BUILD EASTWARD INTO THE AREA FOR THE WEEKEND 
PUTTING US IN A SOMEWHAT DRY NORTHERLY FLOW.  MAIN CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION FOR SATURDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD WILL BE MOSTLY 
DIURNALLY DRIVEN WITH BEST CHANCES OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.

028 
FXUS64 KMRX 191841
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT MON AUG 19 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SKIES HAVE BEEN MOSTLY CLOUDY 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY WITH SOME PARTIAL CLEARING. SHOWERS 
HAVE BEEN WIDELY SCATTERED THIS MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON... 
MOSTLY OVER SOUTHERN SECTIONS...BUT HAVE INCREASED THE LAST COUPLE 
HOURS AS TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED (ALTHOUGH MORE SLOWLY THAN 
FORECAST).

THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE REGION WILL REMAIN WEAK...BUT THE 
UPPER FLOW AROUND THE UPPER RIDGE OFF THE SOUTHEAST COAST WILL 
CONTINUE A SW FLOW OF MOISTURE UP FROM THE GULF INTO THE EASTERN 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. THIS WILL KEEP DEW POINTS UP AND HELP TO DEVELOP 
MORE SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THROUGH EARLY TONIGHT. DEEPER MOISTURE LOOKS TO SHIFT EAST LATE THIS 
EVENING...WITH MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION ENDING THEN. FOLLOWED CLOSE 
TO MET GUIDANCE FOR TONIGHTS LOWS AND TOMORROW...WITH THE PATTERN 
SIMILAR TO TODAYS. WILL UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS AGAIN...WHICH WILL BE 
CLOSE TO MET GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND SHOW AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY WITH A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH BUILDING 
OVER THE CENTRAL PORTION OF THE NATION BY THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. MODELS AGREE THAT THE SHORT WAVE ON WEDNESDAY WILL 
INCREASE LIFT AND INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA...RESULTING IN 
A GOOD COVERAGE OF CONVECTION AREAWIDE. NORTHWEST UPPER-LEVEL FLOW 
THEN DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY...WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME ORGANIZED CONVECTION FROM THE 
MID MS AND LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEYS MOVING TOWARDS THE FORECAST 
AREA. A WEAK COLD FRONT IS ALSO EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTHWARD ACROSS 
THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ON FRIDAY...BUT IT WILL LIKELY STALL OUT 
BEFORE REACHING THE FORECAST AREA AS A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL HIGH BUILDS 
OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. THIS UPPER HIGH WILL HELP TO DECREASE RAIN 
CHANCES AND INCREASE TEMPS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE WEEKEND 
AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN 
THE GFS GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...DUE TO THE 
HIGH SOIL MOISTURE CONTENT OVER THE REGION.
&&

TODAY INTO TONIGHT...WILL JUST CARRY CHANCE POPS ALL BUT EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS WHERE WILL GO LOW LIKELY FOR TODAY...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE TO 
LOW CHANCE POPS TONIGHT.  WILL UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS ONLY SLIGHTLY FOR 
TODAY AS DO EXPECT SOME SUN TO BREAK THROUGH...AND HAVE EVEN LESS 
ARGUMENT WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS KEEP UPPER TROUGHING 
AND A FAIR AMOUNT OF MOISTURE AROUND THE MID SOUTH THROUGH MUCH OF 
THE WORK WEEK. A GRADUAL TREND TOWARD HIGHER PRESSURES SEEMS TO BE 
IN THE WORKS AS THE WEEKEND APPROACHES. WITH THIS IN MIND...TRIED TO 
GRADUALLY TAPER POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS BACK 
INCREMENTALLY WITH LITTLE CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION BY SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY. THERE IS SOME LEVEL OF FORECAST UNCERTAINTY BY ABOUT FRIDAY 
INTO THE WEEKEND AS THE MODELS ONLY SLOWLY ALLOW FOR THE DEPARTURE 
OF THE EASTERN U.S. LONGWAVE TROUGH. THE PREVAILING NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW BETWEEN THE TROUGH AND THE APPROACHING RIDGE WOULD ARGUE FOR 
THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME UPSTREAM CONVECTION STREAMING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA OR EVEN A BACK DOOR COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY BUILDING 
INTO THE REGION. TRIED TO KEEP AN EVER SO SLIGHTLY HIGHER POP ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE TOWARD THE END OF THE 
PERIOD TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD SLOWLY 
CLIMB A DEGREE OR EVEN TWO EACH DAY INTO THE END OF THE WORK WEEK 
WITH THE DEPARTURE OF THE UPPER TROUGH. HOWEVER...DID NOT TREND 
QUITE AS WARM AS MOS WHICH SEEMS TO BE A LITTLE OPTIMISTIC 
ESPECIALLY IF THE EASTERN STATES TROUGH HANGS AROUND A LITTLE LONGER 
THAN CURRENT MODEL DEPICTION SUGGESTS. NOTICED EARLIER IN THE SUMMER 
WHEN THE MODELS TRIED TO BRING A MASSIVE UPPER RIDGE INTO THE 
EASTERN STATES AND THE ATMOSPHERE DIDN'T REALLY PLAY ALONG. SUPPOSE 
WE'LL SEE WHAT HAPPENS DURING THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             84  69  86  69  86 /  40  30  50  30  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  67  84  68  85 /  40  30  40  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       85  66  84  68  85 /  40  20  30  30  30
