761 
FXUS64 KMRX 181912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT SUN AUG 18 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...WATER VAPOR LOOP SHOWS A
WEAKENING UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE MID-MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY.
THIS TROUGH IS PULLING TROPICAL MOISTURE NORTH TOWARD THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS...HOWEVER CONTINUED CONVECTION ALONG THE CENTRAL GULF
COAST HAS LIMITED DEEP TROPICAL MOISTURE MOVING NORTHWARD. STORM
MONITOR SHOWS PWS BETWEEN 1.5 AND 1.75 INCHES. 

GFS AND NAM DEPICT BROAD UPPER DIVERGENCE ALOFT AND WEAK
DEFORMATION ZONE OVER THE AREA TONIGHT...SO EXPECT A BAND OF LIGHT
TO MODERATE RAIN TO MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. IN THE
NEAR TERM...ENOUGH BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS PRODUCING MARGINAL
INSTABILITY (CAPES OF 500-1000 J/KG). I EXPECT CONTINUED
DEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED TO BROKEN SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A
THUNDERSTORM THIS THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING.

FOR MONDAY...MORE OF THE SAME AS WEAK UPPER TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO
DESTABILZE THE AREA. A LITTLE MORE DAYTIME HEATING WILL PRODUCE
CAPES OF 1000-1500 J/KG DURING THE AFTERNOON. ANOTHER ROUND OF
SCATTERED AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS ANTICIPATED.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WENT TOWARD THE COOLER SIDE OF MAX
TEMPERATURES FOR MONDAY DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND SCATTERED CONVECTION.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE REMAINS 
OVER THE WESTERN STATES AND STRONG RIDGE OFF THE SOUTHEAST COAST. 
THE FORECAST AREA REMAINS NEAR A SHEAR AXIS BETWEEN THESE FEATURES. 
DEEPER MOISTURE IS TRAPPED OVER THE SOUTHEAST EXTENDING NORTH INTO 
THE EASTERN TN VALLEY. A WEAK UPPER TROUGH LIES OVER THE NORTHEAST 
AND MID ATLANTIC WITH WEAK DISTURBANCES PASSING THROUGH THE REGION 
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH AT LEAST THURSDAY. THE CANADIAN AND GFS DEEPEN 
UPPER TROUGH WITH MORE DISTURBANCES RIDING SOUTHEAST INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA THURSDAY INTO SATURDAY. WHILE THE ECMWF MOVES WEAK 
UPPER LOW AND TROUGH TO THE NE THURSDAY THEN BUILDS A LARGE 
ELONGATED RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHEAST STATES BEGINNING 
FRIDAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE WEEKEND. CONFIDENCE IS LOW FOR 
THE LAST FEW DAYS THAT WE WILL WARM UP AND DRY OUT TO THE EXTENT OF 
THE ECMWF CONSIDERING THE COOL AND WET TROUGH PATTERN WE HAVE BEEN 
IN LATELY. SO KEEPING CHANCE POPS AND LOWER TEMPERATURES IN FOR 
TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AND THEN SLIGHTLY WARMER AND DRIER LAST 3 
DAYS AS RIDGE TRIES TO TAKE HOLD.

KEEPS A SHEAR AXIS IN PLACE JUST TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
WHILE THE EUROPEAN AND CANADIAN MODELS EXTEND THE PLAINS STATES 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE EAST TO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE GFS 
EVENTUALLY ALLOWS THIS PRESSURE SYSTEM TO BUILD INTO OUR PART OF THE 
COUNTRY BUT NOT UNTIL ABOUT SATURDAY/SUNDAY. SO BASICALLY KEPT SOME 
MEDIUM THROUGH HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
GOING ON MONDAY WITH THE WEEKEND TROUGH GRADUALLY WEAKENING WITH 
SOME DEEP MOISTURE STILL HANGING AROUND AND THEN TRIED TO KEEP POPS 
QUITE LOW IN THE SLIGHT OR LOW CHANCE RANGE FAVORING HIGHER TERRAIN 
FEATURES THROUGH MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK WITH NO MAJOR 
PRECIPITATION FOCUS REVEALING ITSELF. TWEAKED MAX TEMPS BACK A 
DEGREE OR TWO THROUGHOUT THE LONG TERM PERIOD WHICH APPEARS TO BE 
TRYING TO TUG THE NUMBERS CLOSER TO CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMS...BUT THIS 
IS JUST NOT A NORMAL SUMMER.

615 
FXUS64 KMRX 171930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT SAT AUG 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
CONFIDENCE IN MODEL PRECIP DEPICTIONS IS LOW AS FORECAST PRECIP HAS 
FAILED TO MATERIALIZE TODAY. MOS GUIDANCE POPS WILL BE SIGNIFICANTLY 
UNDERCUT TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY NORTH. HOWEVER...SOME GENERAL MODEL 
TRENDS CAN BE USED TO EXTRAPOLATE CURRENT OBSERVED CONDITIONS 
THROUGH THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THE MODELS SHOW THE RIDGE IN THE ATLANTIC 
BUILDING WEST WESTWARD...AND THIS APPEARS REASONABLE WHEN COMPARED 
TO WV AND IR SATELLITE TRENDS. AS THIS OCCURS...THE MOISTURE AXIS 
FROM THE MS/AL COAST TO SC WILL SHIFT INTO THE TN VALLEY...MAINLY ON 
SUNDAY. THE FORECAST TREND WILL BE TO INCREASE POPS FROM SE TO NW 
ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT...BRINGING POPS INTO THE LIKELY RANGE SUNDAY 
MORNING AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE DAY. OVERCAST CLOUDS AND RAIN 
SHOWERS WILL HOLD TEMPS BACK IN THE LOWER TO MID 70S. WITH VERY 
LITTLE INSTABILITY...NO THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MENTIONED. THE CLOSED 
LOW TO OUR WEST BECOMES AN OPEN WAVE THAT LIFTS NE ON SUNDAY 
NIGHT...SO POPS WILL BEGIN TO DECREASE FROM THE WEST SUNDAY NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
MODEL FORECASTS FOR MONDAY STILL SHOW UPPER TROUGH LIFTING
NORTHEAST WITH BULK OF MOISTURE ALONG AND EAST OF THE APPALCHIANS.
HAVE CONTINUED LOWERING TREND OF POPS MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT.
STATIONARY FRONT TO THE SOUTH KEEPING DEEPER MOISTURE OVER THE
SOUTHEAST STATES. CANADIAN AND GFS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH TROPICAL
MOISTURE OVER SOUTHERN STATES WITH CANADIAN BRINGING HEAVY RAIN
INTO THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY AS IT MOVES A TROPICAL SYSTEM INTO
THE LOWER MS VALLEY SUNDAY AND THEN NE INTO THE TN VALLEY MONDAY.
GFS BRINGS DEEP MOISTURE FARTHER NORTH WITH GOOD RAIN CHANCES OVER
SOUTHERN SECTIONS AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS ALL WEEK. PREFER DRIER NAM
AND ECMWF THAT KEEP TUESDAY MOSTLY DRY EXCEPT FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS
AND THEN BRING A LITTLE MORE ENERGY MOVES THROUGH THE WEAK NW FLOW
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY FOR HIGHER RAIN CHANCES ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA. FRIDAY AND SATURDAY RIDGING ALOFT OVER THE TN VALLEY
DECREASES RAIN CHANCES AS. HAVE WARMED TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES
MONDAY INTO TUESDAY WITH HIGHS UPPER 70S TO MID 80S AND THEN MID
80S TO NEAR 90 FOR LATE WEEK AND SATURDAY. WILL HAVE SATURDAY DRY
FOR NOW.

POPS OUT IN THE LIKELY CATEGORY ON SUNDAY FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WHILE EDGING BACK TO MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE PROBABILITY 
DURING THE DAY MONDAY WITH THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS JUST TO THE WEST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA...BUT WITH THE DEEPEST MOISTURE PUSHING EAST OF 
THE APPALACHIAN SPINE. PRESSURES WILL BE ON THE RISE WITH A DECREASE 
IN MEAN RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOLLOWING THE DEPARTURE OF THE LONG WAVE 
TROUGH SO TRIED TO KEEP CONVECTIVE POPS IN THE SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE 
FAVORING HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. THE MODELS 
TRY TO BRING A LONG WAVE TROUGH INTO THE NORTHEAST STATES TOWARD THE 
END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. THIS TYPE OF PATTERN MAY BRING A LITTLE 
MORE ORGANIZED CONVECTION INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BUT 
UNCERTAINTY RATHER HIGH THIS FAR OUT IN THE GAME SO JUST TWEAKED 
POPS UP SLIGHTLY ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. STAYED CLOSE TO A GUIDANCE 
BLEND CONCERNING TEMPERATURES FOR THE LONG TERM.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             78  65  80  67  85 /  30  40  70  40  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  81  64  79  65  84 /  30  40  70  40  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       82  63  79  65  84 /  30  30  70  40  40

286 
FXUS64 KMRX 162002
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
402 PM EDT FRI AUG 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...
LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS HAVE STAYED IN EXTREME SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE 
AREA...ALTHOUGH SOME DEVELOPMENT IS OCCURRING IN THE PLATEAU. 
DOWNSLOPE WINDS ALOFT ARE LIKELY REDUCING CLOUD COVER IN THE 
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS. THE SLOW EASTWARD DRIFT OF THE 
LOW OVER ALABAMA TONIGHT IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE 850-700 MB MOISTURE 
A BIT TONIGHT...BUT MUCH OF THE FORCING WITH A JET STREAK STAYS EAST 
OF THE APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. WILL HAVE LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
MAINLY IN SOUTHERN AND EASTERN AREAS TONIGHT. ON SATURDAY THE 
700-500 MB LOW BECOMES MORE AMPLIFIED AND CLOSED OFF...BRINGING 
DEEPER GULF MOISTURE. WILL SPREAD CHANCE POPS FARTHER NORTH AND 
WEST...WITH LIKELY POPS EAST CLOSER TO THE STRONGER JET FORCING. 
INSTABILITY APPEARS VERY WEAK WITH PLENTY OF CLOUD COVER...SO WILL 
HAVE JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. POPS DECREASE SATURDAY 
NIGHT AS THE JET WEAKENS AND A SHORTWAVE TROUGH LIFTS NORTH OF THE 
AREA. TEMPS WILL BE ABOVE MOS AT NIGHT AND BELOW MOS DURING THE DAY 
TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPECTED OVERCAST TO BROKEN CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SUNDAY STRONG RIDGING REMAINS 
ALONG THE EAST COAST WITH WEAK TROUGH OR POSSIBLE CLOSED LOW OVER 
THE MID MS VALLEY. MOST OF THE DEEPER MOISTURE FORECAST BY SHORT 
RANGE MODELS TO MOVE NORTH FROM THE GULF ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF THE 
UPPER RIDGE INTO THE SOUTHEAST STATES. THEN MOVE NORTH NORTHEAST 
ALONG OR EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. HOWEVER A WEAK INVERTED TROUGH 
JUST TO THE WEST WILL TRAP SOME MOISTURE ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS. ALSO IF MOISTURE FROM THE GULF MOVES FAR ENOUGH NW AND 
THEN INLAND INTO TX AND LA IT WILL GET PULLED INTO THE WEAK UPPER 
TROUGH OR LOW.

RAIN CHANCES WILL BE HIGHEST SUNDAY AND THEN DECREASE SLIGHTLY 
MONDAY AS UPPER LOW OR TROUGH WEAKENS. THE AIR MASS WILL BECOME A 
LITTLE MORE UNSTABLE SUNDAY AND AGAIN MONDAY SO THUNDERSTORMS A 
LITTLE MORE LIKELY ESPECIALLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING. UPPER PATTERN BEGINS TO CHANGE MONDAY AS UPPER TROUGH LIFTS 
NE BUT MODELS DISAGREE AFTER THAT WITH THE CANADIAN BRINGING A 
TROPICAL SYSTEM INTO TX AND THEN BRINGING CLOUDS AND RAIN INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA AS IT DISSIPATES AND IS PUSHED EAST MID AND LATE WEEK. 
GFS TRIES TO BUILD A RIDGE OVER THE AREA AT MID WEEK DECREASING 
MOISTURE AND WARMING TEMPERATURES. FINALLY ECMWF KEEPS A TROUGH OR 
FORMS A WEAK UPPER LOW OVER THE TN VALLEY WHICH WOULD EXTEND THE 
COOLER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND WETTER TREND. FOR NOW WILL KEEP 
TEMPERATURES COOL SUNDAY THEN WARM TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY FROM MONDAY 
THROUGH MID WEEK BUT KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS EACH DAY. 
HIGHER CHANCES IN THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS AND DURING 
PEAK HEATING TIMES.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             64  79  66  80  67 /  40  50  40  50  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  64  78  65  80  65 /  20  50  40  60  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       63  79  64  80  65 /  10  50  40  50  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              61  73  62  77  62 /  10  70  60  60  40

FOR THE AREA OVER THE WEEKEND AS THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE

OVER METROPOLIS SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. AT THE SURFACE AN INVERTED 
TROUGH WILL BE IN PLACE INITIALLY OVER MIDDLE AND THEN WESTERN 
TENNESSEE AS THE NEW WEEK BEGINS. MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE 
ON LOW LEVEL SOUTHEASTERLY AND THEN SOUTHERLY FLOW. THERE SHOULD BE 
A DECENT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND MAYBE EVEN SOME THUNDER OVER THE 
WEEKEND. BETTER COVERAGE OF SHOWERS APPEARS TO BE IN THE WORKS 
ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY AS MOISTURE 
DEEPENS COMPLIMENTS OF THE GULF OF MEXICO AND SHORT WAVELENGTH 
ENERGY SWINGS NORTHEAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY UPPER LOW/TROUGH GRADUALLY LIFTS OUT ACROSS THE 
UPPER OHIO VALLEY ON MONDAY SO IT STILL APPEARS LIKE THERE WOULD BE 
A GOOD CHANCE FOR SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT AT THIS 
TIME. HOWEVER TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY POPS WILL BE ON THE DECLINE 
AS PRESSURES RISE A BIT AND DEEPER MOISTURE GETS SHOVED TO THE 
EASTERN SEABOARD. LOOKS LIKE A MUCH LOWER CHANCE FOR CONVECTION 
DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST.

947 
FXUS64 KMRX 160205
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT THU AUG 15 2013

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. LOW CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS ACROSS SE AREAS. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY NIGHT)...
A MID-UPPER TROUGH WILL SLOWLY BE DEEPENING OVER THE MS VALLEY 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. IN RESPONSE...A WEAK SURFACE LOW WILL BE FORMING 
OVER SOUTHERN MS/AL...WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING TOWARD THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE CLOUD COVER OVER GA/SC TODAY IS EXPECTED 
TO GRADUALLY SPREAD NORTHWARD INTO THE SOUTHERN VALLEY THIS 
EVENING...AND NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE VALLEY LATER TONIGHT AS THE 
TROUGH/LOW DEVELOPS. WITH DRY AIR IN PLACE ABOVE 700 MB...THE LACK 
OF DEEP MOISTURE AND LIFT SHOULD LIMIT PRECIP CHANCES TO EXTREME 
SOUTHERN AREAS TONIGHT. PRECIP CHANCES WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE NORTH 
ON FRIDAY AS THE UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES AND A DEEPER SOUTHERLY FLOW 
DEVELOPS IN THE 850-500 MB LAYER...PROVIDING BETTER MOISTURE 
ADVECTION. STILL...LIFT REMAINS WEAK...AND WILL KEEP POPS IN THE 
CHANCE RANGE THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES EAST 
AND LOWEST CHANCES WEST. CLOUD COVER ON FRIDAY WILL KEEP HIGH TEMPS 
IN THE 75 TO 80 RANGE IN MOST SPOTS.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
UPPER TROUGH OVER THE MS AND TN VALLEY DEEPENS SATURDAY INTO
SUNDAY WITH STRENGTHENING RIDGE OFF THE EAST COAST. INVERTED
SURFACE TROUGH CONTINUES OVER THE MIDDLE TN VALLEY. MOISTURE WILL
BE PULLED UP ALONG THE EAST COAST STATES AND THIS WILL KEEP RAIN
CHANCES HIGH AND TEMPERATURES COOLER THAN NORMAL. DEW POINTS WILL
SLOWLY RISE INTO THE LOWER TO MID 60S. RAINFALL WILL BE GREATEST
OVER SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AND THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND LOWEST
TO THE NORTH AND NORTHWEST. HOWEVER WILL BE HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY
EVERYWHERE. HIGHS MOSTLY MID 70S TO LOWER 80S SATURDAY AND SUNDAY
WITH LOWS IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S. MONDAY THE TROUGH BEGINS TO LIFT
NE WITH UPPER RIDGE STAYING STRONG ALONG THE EAST COAST. RAIN
CHANCES WILL STILL BE HIGH MONDAY THEN FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
RIDGING BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST AND TROUGH SHIFTS A LITTLE FARTHER
NE. EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO WARM A FEW MORE DEGREES AND RAIN CHANCES
LOWER WITH CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY MORE TIED TO THE HEATING OF THE DAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  80  66  80  67 /  30  50  30  50  50

VFR CONDITIONS WILL BE THE RULE AT ALL TAF SITES THROUGH THE 
FORECAST PERIOD. MAIN CONCERNS WILL BE CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS CHA 
BETWEEN 19-02Z. MVFR CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED WITH SHOWERS ALONG 
WITH GUSTS WINDS. MVFR CONDITIONS ARE ALSO EXPECTED AT TRI BETWEEN 
06-12Z DUE TO FOG DEVELOPMENT.

SURFACE RIDGING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WILL PULL MOISTURE BACK 
INTO THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH 
CEILING BETWEEN 4-5KFT ANTICIPATED TODAY ACROSS CHA AND SCATTERED TO 
BROKEN AT TYS.

621 
FXUS64 KMRX 150728
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 AM EDT THU AUG 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER TROUGH RE-DEVELOPS
ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS TODAY AND TONIGHT WITH
AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH OVER THE PLATEAU. SATELITE AND SURFACE
OBSERVATIONS ALREADY SHOW BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE INCREASING ACROSS
THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH BROKEN CLOUD COVER. NAM
AND GFS SHOW AIRMASS DESTABILIZING THIS AFTERNOON NEAR THE INVERTED
SURFACE TROUGH WITH CAPES OF 500-1000 J/KG. WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW
CHANCE OF CONVECTION OVER THE SOUTHERN AND PLATEAU AREAS FOR THIS
AFTERNOON/EVENING. 

FOR TONIGHT...SURFACE WEDGE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WILL DEVELOP
EASTERLY WINDS INTO THE MOUNTAINS. AREAS OF SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP
OVER WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA OVERNIGHT..SOME OF THIS RAIN WILL SPILL
INTO THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS. DOWNSLOPE
WINDS INTO THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY WILL LIMIT CHANCES OF
RAIN THERE..SO WENT A LITTLE LOWER POPS THAN GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND INDICATE A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION THIS WEEKEND. LATEST MODEL RUNS REVEAL A 
LITTLE MORE DISCREPANCIES WITH HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL BE PULLED 
NORTHWARD FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS 
WEEKEND. AT THIS POINT...ONLY THE CANADIAN MODEL DEVELOPS A TROPICAL 
SYSTEM IN THE GULF OF MEXICO THIS WEEKEND...BUT ALL THREE EXTENDED 
MODELS (GFS...ECMWF...CANADIAN) BRING AT LEAST SOME MOISTURE INTO 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH THE ECMWF MODEL DEVELOPING THE WETTEST 
SOLUTION. DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTIES WITH THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE 
MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA...WILL PLAN TO ONLY MENTION CHANCE 
POPS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED FORECAST. THIS WET PATTERN WILL BE SLOW 
TO CHANGE...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BECOMES CUT OFF FROM THE MAIN 
NORTHERLY JET STREAM AND A LARGE UPPER RIDGE DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS 
BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND 
CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE WEEKEND...AND THEN A 
LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS NUMBERS NEXT WEEK DUE TO THE EXPECTED WET 
PATTERN.

693 
FXUS64 KMRX 141901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT WED AUG 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION TODAY WILL SHIFT EAST AND 
BE NEAR THE MID ATLANTIC REGION TOMORROW. THIS WILL GIVE A MORE 
EASTERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW OFF THE ATLANTIC...BRINGING INCREASING 
MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. THIS WILL BRING INCREASING CLOUDS FROM THE 
EAST LATE TONIGHT. MEANWHILE...A WEAK LOW PRESSURE AREA WILL DEVELOP 
OVER SOUTHERN ALABAMA...WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH STRETCHING INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS WILL AID THE DEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED TO 
ISOLATED SHOWERS IN THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY AND SW NC. PRECIP SHOULD 
BE LIGHT AS MOISTURE DEPTH IS MAINLY BELOW 700 MB AND INSTABILITY IS 
WEAK. GREATER STABILITY...A LACK OF FORCING FOR LIFT...AND DRY AIR 
ABOVE 700 MB SHOULD PREVENT SHOWER DEVELOPMENT IN NORTHERN AND 
WESTERN AREAS. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO BE BELOW NORMAL...WITH LOWS 
TONIGHT IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S...AND HIGHS TOMORROW IN THE 
UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
WILL BE IN AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE EXTENDED. AN UPPER
TROUGH WILL DROP INTO THE REGION EARLY IN THE PERIOD AS A SERIES OF
WEAK IMPULSES MOVE THROUGH. THIS SCENARIO WILL PROVIDE SCATTERED
CONVECTION ON AND OFF THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED. THE MAIN CONCERN
THROUGH THE PERIOD IS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING IN FROM THE GULF
PULLING TROPICAL MOISTURE NORTHWARD. HOWEVER...MODELS SHOW SOME
DISCREPANCY AS TO WHETHER THIS MOISTURE WILL REACH INTO EAST TN. IF
THIS MOISTURE WORKS INTO THE MRX CWA...THE POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAIN
AND ASSOCIATED LOCALIZED FLOOD INCREASES...MAINLY DURING THE
WEEKEND TIME FRAME. BY THE END OF THE PERIOD...THE CENTRAL U.S.
RIDGE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD EASTWARD AND SHOULD AT LEAST BRIEFLY
REDUCE PRECIP CHANCES.

MENTION THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME FLOODING THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. THIS WET PATTERN WILL BE SLOW TO CHANGE...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH BECOMES CUT OFF FROM THE MAIN FLOW. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL

FXUS64 KMRX 131900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT TUE AUG 13 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A BRIEF END TO THE MISERABLE 
HIGH HUMIDITY AND NEVER ENDING RAIN MAY BE IN SIGHT AS AN AMPLIFIED 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH SHIFTS FROM THE APPALACHIANS THIS EVENING TO NEW 
ENGLAND BY WEDNESDAY EVENING. WITHIN THE CYCLONIC FLOW PATTERN...A 
PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH AND A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA. THE TROUGH IS BUILDING JUST SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40 AT THE 
CURRENT HOUR AND SHOULD EXIT THE REGION BY 00Z WEDNESDAY WHILE THE 
COLD FRONT BUILDS INTO THE NORTH LATE THIS EVENING AND EXITS BY 12Z 
WEDNESDAY. THERE SHOULD BE A FEW SHOWERS AROUND THE AREA WITH THESE 
BOUNDARIES LIFTING THE HUMID AIRMASS. NOT REAL CONFIDENT IN THE 
CHANCE FOR CONVECTION SO FORECAST SHOWERS WITH THE ACTION TONIGHT. 
BELIEVE THERE WILL BE SOME LOW CLOUDS AND PATCHY FOG LEFT BEHIND THE 
FRONTAL PUSH LATE TONIGHT BUT THIS POST FRONTAL MESS MAY BE GONE BY 
MID MORNING OVER MOST OF THE REGION AS A STRONGER NORTHERLY FLOW 
FILLS IN ON STRENGTHENING SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE. SHOULD BE A DRY DAY 
EVERYWHERE BUT EXTREME SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA ON WEDNESDAY WHERE THE MODELS CONTINUE TO POINT TOWARD SOME 
LINGERING MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WHICH MAY PRESENT ITSELF IN THE 
FORM OF A COUPLE SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM. NOT SURE HOW 
COOL IT WILL BE ON WEDNESDAY WITH QUITE A BIT OF STILL STRONG AUGUST 
SUNSHINE RETURNING BUT THOUGHT IT BEST TO STAY RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE 
OF MAV/MET GUIDANCE WITH THE NORTHERLY WIND COMPONENT. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO 
CURRENT FORECAST. SURFACE RIDGING WILL BE IN CONTROL EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD...PRODUCING DRY CONDITIONS..EXCEPT FOR SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA. THE DRY WEATHER DOES NOT STAY AROUND LONG AS AN INVERTED 
SURFACE TROUGH SETS UP ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY INTO THE WEEKEND. 
THIS ALLOWS MOIST LOW LEVEL SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW TO RETURN TO THE 
AREA. UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES WEST OF THE AREA WITH SOUTHWESTERLY 
LAYER FLOW AND INCREASED MOISTURE IN THE LAYER THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
OPERATIONAL GFS POPS ABOVE ENSEMBLE RUNS THROUGH THE PERIOD.  
SIGNIFICANT CONVECTION MAY MOVE UP THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS 
WEEKEND. SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE MID 
RANGE.

IN ALL THREE TAFS...SINCE TIMING THE EXACT OCCURRENCE OF CONVECTION 
AT THE TAF SITES WILL BE PROBLEMATIC. HOWEVER...WILL MENTION SOME 
TEMPORARY IFR CONDITIONS AT KCHA DUE TO THE SHOWERS CURRENTLY OVER 
SOUTHEAST TN. A WIND SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST WILL OCCUR AT THE TAF 
SITES DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS BEHIND THE COLD FRONT...BUT 
OVERALL...WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LESS THAN 10 KT THROUGHOUT THE 
TAF PERIOD.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

772 
FXUS64 KMRX 130701
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT TUE AUG 13 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH OVER SOUTHEAST KY...WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY. AREA RADARS REVEAL SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER KY 
AHEAD OF THIS PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH AND COLD FRONT...AS A BROAD UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. THIS UPPER 
TROUGH IS PROGGED TO PUSH THIS COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
TODAY...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION OCCURRING ALONG AND AHEAD OF IT. 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE TO BE A CONCERN TODAY WITH SOME 
CONVECTION...AS A VERY HUMID AIR MASS LINGERS OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES IN THE 1.5 TO 2.0 INCH RANGE. 
IT APPEARS THAT ANY FLOODING CONCERNS WILL NOT BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH 
TO JUSTIFY A FLASH FLOOD WATCH...BUT WILL MENTION 'LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL POSSIBLE' IN THE ZONE FORECASTS. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE 
COLD FRONT WILL QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY THIS 
EVENING...WHICH SEEMS REASONABLE CONSIDERING THE FAIRLY STRONG 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH BEHIND IT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL 
COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE RIDGING WILL BE IN 
CONTROL FOR WEDNESDAY PRODUCING DRY CONDITIONS..EXCEPT FOR SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA. THE DRY WEATHER DOES NOT STAY AROUND LONG AS AN 
INVERTED TROUGH SETUP ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY AS WELL AS RIDGING INTO THE CAROLINAS HELPING TO PULL 
MOISTURE BACK INTO THE REGION.  

FOR THE WEEKEND THROUGH MONDAY...BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF AGREE WITH 
TROUGHING REMAINING OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH MAINLY DIURNAL 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING EACH DAY AS GULF MOISTURE 
RESIDES OVER THE AREA.

DUE TO CONTINUE CHANCES OF CONVECTION AND CLOUD COVER...GENERALLY 
WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN GFX MOS HIGHS THROUGH THE 
PERIOD...ESPECIALLY OVER THE SOUTHERN VALLEY WHERE LOW-CLOUDINESS 
WILL PERSIST THE LONGEST DUE TO WEDGING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS 
INTO NORTHERN GEORGIA.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     84  64  81  60  83 /  70  30  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             84  65  81  58  82 /  60  30  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    82  60  78  55  80 /  70  40  10  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1014 PM EDT MON AUG 12 2013

.DISCUSSION...UPPER LOW CONTINUES MOVING SOUTH OVER SOUTHERN CANADA
WITH TROUGH DIGGING SOUTH THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY.
TROPICAL AIR MASS TO THE SOUTH WITH HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES
AND DAY TIME HEATING MADE AIR MASS UNSTABLE OVER THE TN VALLEY TODAY.
NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

THE STORMS HAVE WEAKENED THE LAST FEW HOURS BUT SIGNIFICANT SHORT
WAVE ROTATING THROUGH THE LOWER OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS SPARKED
LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION OVER WESTERN KY AND TN AND INTO AR EARLY
THIS EVENING. THE STRONGEST ACTIVITY IS NOW SHIFTING SOUTHEAST INTO
MS AND AL WITH ANOTHER PART MOVING EAST ACROSS KY. SHOWERS AND
STORMS BROUGHT HEAVY RAIN TO NE AND SE SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST
AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF AN INCH OR
TWO IN A FEW SPOTS.

DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT THE SHORT WAVE TROUGH AHEAD OF
THE FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION LATER TONIGHT WITH SHOWERS AND
SOME STORMS REDEVELOPING. BECAUSE TIME OF DAY WILL BE LATE DO NOT
EXPECT SEVERE BUT WHERE HEAVY RAIN HAS ALREADY FALLEN SOME RUNOFF
PROBLEMS COULD RESULT. OUTSIDE OF RAIN AREAS PATCHY FOG IS LIKELY
LATE. ADJUSTED HOURLY TEMPERATURE GRIDS DOWN SLIGHTLY AS EARLIER
RAIN LOWERED TEMPERATURES AND SPED UP SLIGHTLY THE HIGHER POPS FOR
THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. FORECAST UPDATE SENT.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT MON AUG 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...THERE WILL BE A FEW SHOWERS AND 
A COUPLE THUNDERSTORMS AROUND DURING THE EVENING. HOWEVER...RAINFALL 
MAY BECOME A LITTLE MORE WIDESPREAD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATER 
TONIGHT AS A HEALTHY SHORT WAVE TROUGH CURRENTLY OVER THE 
MIDWEST...BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. USED LIKELY 
POPS FOR THE EVENT WHICH WILL BE COMING INTO THE WESTERN REACHES OF 
THE VIEWING AREA AROUND 06Z WITH EXIT AROUND 12-14Z. THE SYSTEM WILL 
NOT HAVE A TREMENDOUS AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE INSTABILITY DUE TO THE 
LATE NIGHT ARRIVAL SO CONVECTION SHOULD BE HELD IN CHECK. 
CERTAINLY...WITH THE RECENT HIGHER RAINFALL TOTALS MAINLY ACROSS THE 
NORTHWEST HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...THERE COULD BE SOME LOCALIZED 
FLASH FLOODING WITH THE ADDITIONAL RAIN. A COOL FRONT WILL FINALLY 
BE MOVING INTO THE REGION ON TUESDAY AND COULD SPARK A FEW SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE DAY AS IT FOLLOWS THE OVERNIGHT SYSTEM. 
TRIED TO TAPER POPS BACK ESPECIALLY LATER IN THE DAY AS DRIER AND 
MORE STABLE AIR FILTERS INTO NORTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS. STAYED 
IN THE MIDDLE GROUND BETWEEN WARMER MAV AND COOLER MET MOS 
CONCERNING HIGH TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...BROAD UPPER TROUGH MOVES 
SLOWLY SOUTH INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY EARLY IN THE PERIOD. THE LONG 
STANDING COLD FRONT WILL SLIDE SE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
BY WEDNESDAY. THE AIRMASS WILL DRY OUT CONSIDERABLY BY WED 
AFTERNOON. SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL REMAIN POSSIBLE...MAINLY ACROSS 
THE SE MOUNTAINS WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW MAY ENHANCE DEVELOPMENT FOR THE 
END OF THE WORK WEEK. TROUGH CONTINUES TO DIG WEST OF THE AREA AND 
IS TRENDING TO CUT OFF BY THE WEEKEND. DRY PERIOD IS SHORT LIVED AS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY RETURNS NORTH AS AN INVERTED TROUGH. PWAT VALUES 
BEGIN TO RISE THURSDAY AND CONTINUE TO RISE INTO THE WEEKEND. 
TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL.

539 
FXUS64 KMRX 120737
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT MON AUG 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MOIST LOW LEVEL AIR MASS CONTINUES 
ACROSS THE REGION FOR THESE FIRST TWO PERIODS.  AGAIN HAVE PATCHY 
FOG MENTIONED FOR THIS MORNING.  DEEP CONVECTION SHOULD BLOSSOM 
AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON WITH SHOWERS AND SOME STORMS. HOWEVER...MODELS 
INDICATE THAT TODAY THERE WILL BE NO DISTURBANCES TO ENHANCE 
STORMS/PRECIPITATION...SO QPF SHOULD BE FAIRLY LIGHT.

FOR TONIGHT...ALTHOUGH NIGHTTIME COOLING WILL BE TAKING 
EFFECT...MODELS AGREE THAT A DISTURBANCE WILL MARCH INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE WEST.  THE TIMING IS UNCERTAIN...SO THE POP TONIGHT IS JUST 
ONE 12-HOUR BLOCK.  

FOR TEMPERATURES...WENT A LITTLE COOLER THAN GFS MOS GUIDANCE FOR 
MAX TEMPS IN THE WESTERN 1/2 OF THE AREA...WITH WESTERN-MOST 
LOCATIONS ABOUT A CATEGORY LOWER.  

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY/...
A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION ON TUESDAY AS AN UPPER-LEVEL 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AMPLIFIES OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. 
ALL MODELS SEEM TO INDICATE THE POTENTIAL FOR MORE WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS AND STORMS PUSHING ACROSS THE AREA FROM NORTHWEST TO 
SOUTHEAST WITH THE MOVEMENT OF THE FRONT. GIVEN THIS GOOD MODEL 
CONSENSUS FOR SEVERAL DAYS NOW...HAVE OPTED TO INCREASE POPS TO 
CATEGORICAL OVER MOST OF THE EASTERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY. MODELS HAVE COME MORE INTO AGREEMENT OF THE FRONT CLEARING 
THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...SO HAVE CONTINUED TO 
CAUTIOUSLY SHOW THIS TREND WHICH WOULD SUPPORT MORE WIDELY SCATTERED 
ACTIVITY ON WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...LATE THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND FRIDAY ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH IS PROGGED TO GRADUALLY MOVE IN FROM 
THE WEST AND COMBINE WITH ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE TO ONCE AGAIN GIVE 
US A DECENT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS ONCE AGAIN FRIDAY INTO THE 
WEEKEND. THE BETTER DAYS LOOKS TO BE ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY ATTM AS 
THE BASE OF THE TROUGH WILL APPROACH AND PASS ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. 

GIVEN THE VERY MOIST ATMOSPHERE AND THE  ALREADY SATURATED SOIL 
CONDITIONS...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING IS PROBABLE IN 
AREAS THAT RECEIVE MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF PRECIPITATION. ALSO...WITH THE 
EXPECTED CLOUD COVER/PRECIPITATION CHANCES...HAVE TRENDED SLIGHTLY 
LOWER ON DAYTIME HIGHS THROUGH THE PERIOD.  

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT SUN AUG 11 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...CONVECTION FROM EARLIER
TODAY WAS EXITING THE NE PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH TSRA
FIRING MAINLY ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SE TN AND SW NC AT
FORECAST TIME. STORMS OVER NORTHERN AREAS MOVING CLOSER TO 20
MPH...WHILE SRN STORMS WERE SLIGHTLY MORE SLUGGISH AND SLIPPING
ESE. MESO ANALYSIS OF 18Z SURFACE DATA DOES NOT REVEAL MUCH
ORGANIZED AREAS OF CONVERGENCE...SO THINK POPS CAN BE KEPT AROUND
30 TO 40 PERCENT FOR THIS EVENING...ABOVE THE SLIGHT CHANCE GFS MOS
POPS. ADDED SCATTERED WORDING WITH LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS MENTIONED. 
LOSS OF HEATING SHOULD DEAL A MAJOR BLOW TO COVERAGE...WHILE
PARTIAL CLEARING LEADS TO AREAS OF FOG LATE.

FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...AIRMASS JUST ISNT MUCH DIFFERENT AT
ALL FOR MONDAY. THUS...EXPECT A BRIEF LULL OVERNIGHT INTO MONDAY
MORNING THEN SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND STORMS TO DEVELOP
YET AGAIN. SEEMS TO BE A WEAK SHORTWAVE MONDAY TO AID COVERAGE AND
A STRONGER ONE FOR TUESDAY. THIS LEAD ME TO KEEP POPS AT LIKELY FOR
BOTH MONDAY AND TUESDAY. 

GFS MOS MINS GENERALLY FOLLOWED AND CONTINUED TO UNDERCUT GFS MOS
MAXES EACH DAY...STAYING CLOSER TO A BLEND WITH THE COOLER NAM MOS.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...ANOMALOUSLY DEEP EASTERN 
STATES UPPER TROUGH BECOMES EVEN DEEPER TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY 
PULLING COOLER AND GRADUALLY DRIER INTO THE REGION LEADING TO LOWER 
PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION. MODELS TRY TO BRING SOME MOISTURE AND 
PRECIPITATION BACK INTO THE FORECAST AREA AS EARLY AS THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY WITH MORE UPPER LEVEL TROUGHINESS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE 
EASTERN U.S. HOWEVER...WITH SUCH AN AMPLIFIED NORTHWESTERLY 
PREVAILING FLOW PATTERN DEVELOPING DON'T SEE HOW THE REGION MOISTENS 
UP ENOUGH FOR WIDESPREAD SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT UNTIL 
ABOUT SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WHEN THE UPPER TROUGH SHARPENS ACROSS THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY/MIDWEST STATES. SHOULD BE ENOUGH MOISTURE RETURN 
AND INSTABILITY BY THE WEEKEND FOR A LITTLE BETTER CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SO TWEAKED THE POPS A BIT FOR THIS LATE 
PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. MODELS CONTINUE TO TRY TO LOWER MAX TEMPS 
DURING THE PERIOD WITH THE NORTHWEST FLOW IN PLACE...BUT LATE SUMMER 
INSOLATION STILL STRONG AND WITH INCREASING AMOUNTS OF SUNSHINE IN 
THE DRIER AIRMASS PUSHED MAXES UP A COUPLE DEGREES ABOVE GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS.

FXUS64 KMRX 110731
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 AM EDT SUN AUG 11 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SAME AIR MASS CONTINUES OVER THE 
AREA DURING THESE TWO PERIODS...WITH SURFACE DEW POINTS REMAINING 
VERY HIGH ACROSS THE AREA.  FOR TODAY...MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON A 
WEAK DISTURBANCE SAGGING INTO THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON THAT HAS GOOD 
TIMING AND LOCATION FOR WHEN DIURNAL HEATING WOULD BE TAKING EFFECT 
ON THE PLATEAU.  WILL GO ABOVE MAV GUIDANCE...GENERALLY ABOUT 50-60 
PERCENT.

FOR TEMPS...GOING A LITTLE BELOW MAV GUIDANCE FOR WESTERN 
AREAS...CONSIDERING EARLY BUILD-UPS OF CUMULUS CONGESTUS...FOLLOWED 
BY SHOWERS AND STORMS IN THE EARLY AFTERNOON.  WENT ABOUT ONE 
CATEGORY LOWER IN THOSE AREA...WHILE ELSEWHERE WENT CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE.  BUMPED UP LOW TEMPS TONIGHT...JUST A DEGREE OR TWO OVER 
GUIDANCE...CONSIDERING HIGH DEW POINTS.

THIS MORNING...FOG SETTLING INTO MANY AREAS...WILL MENTION IN 
FORECAST...BUT NOT PLANNING ON AN ADVISORY.

.LONG TERM /MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY/...
THE WET PATTERN WILL CONTINUE INTO NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM AMPLIFIES OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY...SENDING A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES INTO THE MOISTURE RICH 
ENVIRONMENT IN PLACE OVER OUR REGION. SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION 
IS EXPECTED FOR MONDAY BEFORE A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE REGION 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS THE UPPER-LOW AMPLIFIES. THINK THAT TUESDAY 
WILL SEE THE BEST CHANCE FOR WIDESPREAD AND LOCALLY HEAVY 
PRECIPITATION GIVEN THE FRONT THAT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA FROM THE WEST. WITH THE VERY MOIST ENVIRONMENT IN 
PLACE AND STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT...MODELS ARE GENERATING SOME 
STRONG QPF SIGNALS TUESDAY AND SO HAVE INCREASED POPS TO HIGH-END 
LIKELY DURING THIS TIME PERIOD...BEFORE SHOWING A GRADUALLY WANING 
TREND TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT MOVES EAST. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE 
WITH THIS ACTIVITY...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND FLOODING IS PROBABLE 
IN AREAS THAT RECEIVE MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF PRECIPITATION GIVEN THE 
VERY MOIST ENVIRONMENT AND SATURATED SOIL CONDITIONS. 

THERE IS SOME VARIABILITY BETWEEN THE MODELS AS TO HOW FAST THE 
FRONT WILL CLEAR THE AREA...SO HAVE KEPT CHANCE POPS IN PLACE ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...WITH A DRIER 
NORTHWEST FLOW IN PLACE BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...A BREAK IN THE 
PRECIPITATION MAY OCCUR HEADING INTO THURSDAY. HOWEVER...A RETURN TO 
A MOIST GULF FETCH FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND AND THE PASSAGE OF SOME 
ADDITIONAL UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCES WILL WARRANT CHANCE POPS TO 
CLOSE OUT THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EDT SAT AUG 10 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...ORGANIZED CONVECTION 
CONTINUES OVER NE TN AND SW VA...WHICH ORIGINATED EARLIER ALONG OR 
NEAR THE STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY...AND ALSO A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE 
IN CONVECTION OVER THE PAST 1 TO 2 HOURS FROM NRN AL NE INTO SE TN. 
STORMS GENERALLY STAYING BELOW SEVERE THUS FAR...ALTHO SOME LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINS DID OCCUR OVER EXTREME NRN PARTS OF SCOTT COUNTY TN. A 
GUST TO 30 MPH NOTED WITH A PASSING TSRA AT CHA. 

PREVIOUS LATE AFTERNOON GRIDS WITH 50 TO 70 PERCENT RAIN CHANCES ARE 
HOLDING UP WELL...AND I TWEAKED THE POPS FOR EARLY TONIGHT (OUT TO 
11/06Z) UP TO LOWER END OF LIKELY OVER SW VA AND MOST OF NE TN. 
THINK ADDING LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS IS A WISE 
MOVE. 

OTHERWISE...FRONTAL BOUNDARY LOOKS TO STAY TO OUR NORTH FOR THESE 
PERIODS. THIS LEAVES OUR CONVECTION MORE ON THE RANDOM OR JUST 
BRIEFLY ORGANIZED PATTERN THROUGH MONDAY. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS IN THE 
AFTERNOONS AND EVENINGS APPEAR TO BE A PROLONGED THREAT. HARD TO 
TIME CONVECTION OR HIGHLIGHT AREAS FOR BEST DEVELOPMENT...SO JUST 
MADE A FEW ADJUSTMENTS TO PREVIOUS WEATHER/POP GRIDS FOR NOW. 

GFS MINS FOLLOWED CLOSELY...BUT OPTED FOR A BLEND OF THE COOLER NAM 
AND HOTTER GFS MOS FOR MAX TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...EASTERN U.S. UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH DEEPENS TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY WHICH HELPS TO DRIVE A 
COOL FRONT THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING THIS TIME FRAME. 
STAYED WITH A HIGHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH A NICE 
BIT OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND FRONTAL PUSH ON TUESDAY TAPERING BACK 
TO JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY. ENOUGH DRY AIR 
WILL BE IN PLACE WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY FAR ENOUGH SOUTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA THAT POPS WERE REMOVED OVER MOST OF THE REGION 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. HOWEVER...NO REST FOR THE WEARY AS 
TROUGHINESS GRADUALLY BECOMES REVITALIZED OVER THE EASTERN STATES 
AGAIN FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. ENOUGH INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE WILL BE 
AVAILABLE IN THE PRESENCE OF THE UPPER TROUGH FOR SLIGHT AND SMALL 
CHANCE POPS FOR A FEW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS THE WEEKEND 
BEGINS.

GAGE (MOUNTAIN CITY) MEASURING 3.62 INCHES FROM MIDNIGHT TO 8 AM EDT.

SLUGGISH TO PUSH MUCH SOUTHWARD TODAY. 12Z SOUNDINGS FROM OHX AND 
RNK SHOW HIGH MOISTURE WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER RUNNING 1.75 TO 2.00 
INCHES AS OVER PAST FEW DAYS. MODIFIED SOUNDINGS YIELD POSITIVE CAPE 
OF AROUND 2000 J/KG WITH TEMPS REACHING INTO THE 80S. 

THINK I WILL ADJUST FORECAST GRIDS A BIT IN A LATE MORNING UPDATE... 
TO REFLECT HIGHER RAIN CHANCES OVER NORTHERN AREAS (NEAR THE FRONT) 
AND ALSO HIGHLIGHT THUNDERSTORMS MORE THAN CHANCE WORDING. ALSO...
GIVEN THE POTENTIAL FOR TRAINING OF STORMS I WILL MENTION LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINS...AS NOTED IN THE UPDATED EXCESSIVE RAINFALL OUTLOOK FOR 
TODAY. MAIN CONCERNS REMAIN FLOODING...WHICH HAS OCCURRED SO FAR 
JUST IN A FEW COUNTIES NOT REALLY AREAWIDE AT ALL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT SAT AUG 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
MORE OF THE SAME...ALTHOUGH THE MAIN STORM TRACK FROM W TN TO E KY MAY
SAG A LITTLE SOUTHWARD TOWARD OUR AREA OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THE
TIMING OF WEAK SHORTWAVES AND BREAKS IN THE CLOUDINESS WILL MAKE
MAX TEMPS TODAY IFFY EITHER DIRECTION BUT WILL STICK CLOSE TO A
ROUGH AVERAGE OF MIDISH 80S IN THE VALLEY EVEN THOUGH WE SAW UPPER
80S TO 90 ON FRIDAY AND LOW TO MID 80S ON THURSDAY. LOCALIZED HEAVY
RAIN AMOUNTS REMAIN POSSIBLE TODAY AND TONIGHT HERE AND THERE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
A WET PATTERN WILL CONTINUE INTO NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM AMPLIFIES OVER THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY...SENDING A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES INTO THE MOISTURE RICH 
ENVIRONMENT IN PLACE OVER OUR REGION. THUS...REASONABLE CHANCES FOR 
SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION WILL EXIST FOR MOST OF THE 
UPCOMING WEEK. A COLD FRONT WILL BE EXITING THE AREA ON 
SUNDAY....LEADING TO SCATTERED CONVECTION ACROSS IT MOVES THROUGH 
/WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES FAVORING THE EASTERN ZONES/. MORE WIDELY 
SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION IS EXPECTED FOR MONDAY BEFORE 
ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVES BEGIN TO DROP SOUTH OUT OF THE OHIO VALLEY AND 
INTO THE REGION TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS THE UPPER-LOW AMPLIFIES. 
HAVE INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY ON TUESDAY AS MODELS ARE INDICATING  
ANOTHER FRONT PROGRESSING TOWARD THE AREA RESULTING A FEW ROUNDS OF 
HEAVIER SHOWERS AND STORMS BEGINNING LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY 
BEFORE SLOWLY TAPERING OFF TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING. 

ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVE PASSAGES ON WEDNESDAY AND TO A LESSER EXTENT 
THURSDAY WILL LEAD TO CHANCE POPS ONCE AGAIN ON THOSE DAYS AS THE 
UNSETTLED PATTERN CONTINUES. SOME SLIGHTLY DRIER CONDITIONS COULD BE 
IN STORE FOR FRIDAY...THOUGH IT APPEARS THAT GULF MOISTURE AND 
ADDITIONAL UPPER-WAVES MAY LEAD TO ADDITIONAL RAIN CHANCES HEADING 
INTO NEXT WEEKEND AS WELL. GIVEN THE VERY MOIST ATMOSPHERE AND THE 
ALREADY SATURATED SOIL CONDITIONS...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND 
FLOODING IS PROBABLE IN AREAS THAT RECEIVE MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF 
PRECIPITATION. ALSO...WITH THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER/PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES...HAVE TRENDED SLIGHTLY LOWER ON DAYTIME HIGHS THROUGH THE 
PERIOD.

047 
FXUS64 KMRX 091901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT FRI AUG 9 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FEW AREAS OF CONVECTION
TRYING TO GET ORGANIZED THIS AFTERNOON...OVER SRN MIDDLE TN INTO NW AL
THE CENTRAL AND NE PARTS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...AND OVER SW NC
EAST TO GSP. FIRST AREAS APPEAR TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH AN EARLIER
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY...AND THE LAST AREA MOST LIKELY DUE TO OROGRAPHIC
LIFT OR CONVERGENCE. WHAT EVOLVES FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE
AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT IS STILL CHALLENGING...GIVEN THE WEAK
FRONTAL BOUNDARY STILL WELL TO OUR N-NW. LIKELY SHOWERS AND
SCATTERED STORMS STILL LOOKS LIKE A GOOD START...AND QUITE CLOSE TO
OR JUST ABOVE GFS MOS POPS FOR TONIGHT. 

AIRMASS HAS BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...
ESPECIALLY WRN AREAS. HIGHLY MOIST AIRMASS AND WETTER THAN NORMAL
GROUNDS FOR EARLY AUGUST SUGGEST A FLOOD CONCERN. HOWEVER...STORM
MOTION IS MUCH FASTER THAN YESTERDAY (ENE AT 20 TO 25 MPH)...AND A
SYNOPTIC FEATURE TO FOCUS CONVERGENCE IS STILL LACKING. NO DEFINITE
UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT OVERNIGHT...SO COVERAGE AND INTENSITY MAY
DIMINISH AFTER 10/06Z. POCKETS OF HEAVY RAINFALL OVER THE PAST 2 TO
3 DAYS HAVE BEEN RANDOM AND VERY LIMITED...SO CONSIDERING ALL OF
THESE FACTORS...OPTED TO NOT ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH FOR NOW. I DID
HIGHLIGHTED LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS TONIGHT AND AGAIN ON SATURDAY.

OTHERWISE...STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR SATURDAY
THROUGH SUNDAY...WITH SLIGHT CHANGES TO LOWER POPS A BIT FOR
SUNDAY. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO SAG SOUTH SATURDAY... 
BUT COULD LIFT NORTH OF THE REGION BY SATURDAY NIGHT OR SUNDAY. 
MOS POPS AND MIN TEMPS CLOSELY FOLLOWED...BUT STAYED BELOW THE GFS
MOS FOR MAX TEMPS EACH DAY.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UNSETTLED CONDITIONS
WILL PERSIST IN THIS PERIOD OF THE FORECAST AS SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO FORM IN THE MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIRMASS IN
THE WARM SECTOR OUT AHEAD OF A COOL FRONT WHICH EDGES VERY SLOWLY
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. KEPT LOW THROUGH MEDIUM
CHANCE POPS FOR THE PRECIPITATION EXCEPT ON TUESDAY WHEN A STRONGER
SHORT WAVE TROUGH RIDES OVER THE BOUNDARY ENHANCING THE POSSIBILITY
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. GRADUALLY TAPERED POPS BACK WEDNESDAY
THROUGH FRIDAY AS THE SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY PUSHES JUST A LITTLE
FURTHER SOUTH OF THE REGION. SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL MAX TEMPS WERE
PREFERRED IN THIS SEEMINGLY NEVER ENDING ANOMALOUS PATTERN
FEATURING AN AMPLIFIED EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH.

786 
FXUS64 KMRX 090734
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
334 AM EDT FRI AUG 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NOT A LOT OF RAIN ACTIVITY
KNOCKING ON OUR DOOR RIGHT NOW. JUST DEVELOPING LOW CLOUDS AND
PATCHY FOG. THE GFS AND NAM SUGGEST A CONTINUATION OF THE CURRENT
INACTIVITY THROUGH MID MORNING...WITH SHOWERS THEN DEVELOPING BY
LATE MORNING...INCREASING IN THE AFTERNOON WITH SOME TSTMS AS WELL...
THEN MAYBE A BIT MORE ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY MOVING IN FROM
THE WEST BY LATE AFTERNOON. BUT OVERALL...GIVEN THE EXTENSIVE
CLOUDINESS AND MOISTURE...WE ARE BASICALLY LOOKING AT THE
CONTINUATION OF THE WET PATTERN OF THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS EVEN
THOUGH DETAILS OF TIMING WILL BE A BIT FUZZY TO DECIPHER. FOR MAX
TEMPS TODAY...GOING CLOSER TO NAM AND ECMWF MOS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WET PATTERN CONTINUES 
THIS WEEKEND AND INTO NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AND A
SERIES OF SHORTWAVES MOVE THROUGH A MOISTURE RICH ENVIRONMENT.
THUS...CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS SEEM PLAUSIBLE FOR SEVERAL PERIODS
OVER THE NEXT SEVEN DAYS. A COLD FRONT LOOKS TO DROP INTO THE AREA
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. AHEAD OF THE FRONT...INCREASING LIFT
WILL HELP TO LEAD TO SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD SHOWER AND
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT ON SATURDAY...WITH CONTINUED HIGH-END
CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS CONTINUING ALONG THE FRONT ON SUNDAY AS IT
DROPS SOUTH. MORE DIURNAL CONVECTION IS EXPECTED FOR MONDAY BEFORE
ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVES BEGIN TO DROP SOUTH OUT OF THE OHIO VALLEY
AND INTO THE REGION TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS THE UPPER-LOW
AMPLIFIES. HAVE INCREASED POPS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY GIVEN THE
HIGHER CONFIDENCE OF MORE SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD CONVECTION EACH
DAY....BEFORE TAPERING THEM BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE BY LATE
THURSDAY AS THE FRONT SLIDES EAST OF THE AREA. GIVEN THE MOIST
ENVIRONMENT...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND SOME FLOODING MAY BE
POSSIBLE IN AREAS THAT RECEIVE MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF PRECIPITATION.
ALSO...WITH THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER/PRECIPITATION CHANCES...HAVE
TRENDED SLIGHTLY LOWER ON DAYTIME HIGHS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

209 
FXUS64 KMRX 081910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT THU AUG 8 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...STILL LOOKING TO BE A
VERY MOIST AND UNSTABLE PERIOD WITH LIKELY OR HIGHER POPS NEEDED AT
TIMES...AND HARDER TO DEFINE WHEN AND WHERE BY THE 3RD AND 4TH
PERIODS. CERTAINLY BEST COVERAGE ALONG OR JUST AHEAD OF THE WEAK
FRONTAL BOUNDARY...WHICH MOVES EVER SO SLIGHTLY SE WITH TIME.

BEST COVERAGE HAS GENERALLY ALREADY OCCURRED THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS
THE NRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT NOTHING REALLY NOTEWORTHY
AS FAR AS HEAVY RAINS. STRONGER CONVECION WITH VERY HEAVY RAINS
OVER MIDDLE TN WITH NEW DEVELOPMENT POISED TO TRACK INTO SE TN BY
LATE AFTERNOON OR EARLY EVENING. ELSEWHERE...THINK CONVECTION WILL
LIKELY BE MORE RANDOM IN COVERAGE THIS EVENING WITH A TENDENCY TO
DIMINISH AFTER 06Z FRIDAY. OPTED TO CONTINUE THE HIGH PRE 09/00Z
POPS IN THE GRIDS...THEN A RANGE OF 40 TO 60 PERCENT POPS FOR EARLY
TONIGHT WITH SCATTERED WORDING WHERE HIGH CHANCE POPS WERE USED. 
ALSO...CARRIED A MENTION OF HEAVY RAINS THROUGH FIRST HALF OF
TONIGHT GIVEN THE HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT AND RATHER SLOW MOVEMENT.

OTHERWISE...KEPT GOOD CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR FRIDAY
THROUGH SATURDAY WITH JUST SOME VERY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS. A BIT
PUZZLED AS TO HOW WARM THE GFS MOS MAX TEMPS ARE FOR FRIDAY AND
SATURDAY. EVEN A BLEND WITH THE LOWER NAM MOS MAXES WOULD APPEAR TO
BE TOO WARM...SO I STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR EACH DAY.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A COOL FRONT WILL BE 
WORKING ITS WAY SLOWLY THROUGH THE AREA SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL ACCOMPANY THIS FEATURE IN A 
RATHER MOIST ENVIRONMENT AHEAD OF THE FRONT. MORE ENERGY DROPS 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON TUESDAY 
AMPLIFYING THE UPPER FLOW. THIS AMPLIFICATION SHOULD HELP ANOTHER 
COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIDE THROUGH THE REGION AND BUMPED UP 
CONVECTIVE POPS TO GOOD CHANCE FOR THIS EVENT. GRADUALLY TAPER BACK 
THE CHANCE POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY AS THE LIFTING INFLUENCE FROM THE SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY 
PRESSES SOUTH. APPLIED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM ON THURSDAY WITH MODELS HINTING AT MORE SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY BUILDING INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. STAYED CLOSER TO THE 
ECM TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
425 AM EDT THU AUG 8 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PATTERN DOES NOT SHOW MUCH
CHANGE FROM YESTERDAY THROUGH TONIGHT WITH A DEEP UPPER LOW OVER
SOUTHERN CANADA AND WEAK COLD FRONT EXTENDING OUT OF IT AND
WRAPPING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. HIGH PRESSURE IS STILL
ANCHORED OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND SOUTH CENTRAL STATES. SOUTHWEST
FLOW SOUTH OF THE FRONT AND HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES TO
TRIGGER MORE ROUNDS OF SHOWERS AND STORMS TODAY...DECREASING
TONIGHT. MCS ACTIVITY MOVING WEST TO EAST ACROSS OK...SOUTHERN MO
AND NORTHERN AR.

ONLY A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS MOVED THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THE LAST
FEW HOURS BUT MODELS SHOW SIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE
KY/TN BORDER AREA THIS MORNING. THIS SHORTWAVE IS REFLECTED ON AREA
RADARS AS AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WAS INCREASING IN COVERAGE
AND INTENSITY OVER NORTHERN MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND SOUTHERN MIDDLE
KENTUCKY. THIS AREA COULD BE THE BEGINNINGS OF A NEW MCS EAST OF
THE AR ACTIVITY. THE STORMS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN SECTIONS
OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES AT THIS HOUR
ARE STILL MILD IN THE LOWER 70S WITH EXTENSIVE LOW CLOUD COVER AND
NOT MUCH FOG. EXPECT HIGHEST RAIN CHANCES EARLY IN THE NORTH AS
SHORT WAVE TRACKS EAST BUT EVENTUALLY ALL PARTS OF THE AREA TO HAVE
LIKELY SHOWERS AND A FEW STORMS. A FEW STRONG STORMS POSSIBLE BUT
THE MAIN THREAT TODAY WILL BE LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINFALL. HIGHS TODAY
SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO WEDNESDAY LOWER TO MID 80S WITH MID TO UPPER
70S IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TONIGHT LOWER POPS TO CHANCE AS
HEATING ENDS...HOWEVER COULD BE AN INCREASE LATE WEST OR NORTH IF
ANY SHORTWAVE GETS GOING LIKE THIS MORNING. LOWS TONIGHT AGAIN NEAR
70 TO LOWER 70S.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...ZONAL UPPER FLOW PERSISTS 
OVER THE AREA POSITIONED BETWEEN LARGE VORTEX TO THE NORTH AND HIGH 
PRESSURE TO THE SOUTH. HIGH LAYER MOISTURE CONTINUES INTO THE 
WEEKEND. ON AND OFF CONVECTION INTO THE WEEKEND. LOCALIZED FLOODING 
IS POSSIBLE WITH SLOW MOVING AND TRAINING STORMS. FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
PROGGED TO SHIFT SOUTH INTO THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT. POSITION AND 
SOUTHERN EXTENT REMAIN IN QUESTION AT THIS TIME. NOT OVERLY 
ACCEPTING THE COOLER AND DRIER CONDITIONS DEPICTED FOR NEXT 
WEEK.

433 
FXUS64 KMRX 071921
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EDT WED AUG 7 2013

RETRANSMITTED...

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL 
CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND INTO THE EVENING HOURS AS HIGH 
PWS AND MODEST CAPE WILL MAKE FOR AN UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT. LATEST 
NAM SOUNDINGS SHOW PWS RANGING FROM 1.8 TO 2 INCHES WITH ROUGHLY 800 
TO 1500 J/KG OF CAPE. AS MENTIONED IN THE MORNING UPDATE...THESE 
HIGHER PWS PUT US IN THE 75TH TO 90TH PERCENTILE RANGE FOR THIS TIME 
OF YEAR. WARM LAYER CLOUD DEPTHS WILL CONTINUE TO REMAIN WELL ABOVE 
10K FEET THROUGH THE EVENING WHICH IS AN CONDUCIVE ENVIRONMENT FOR 
LOCALIZED POCKETS OF HEAVY RAINFALL DUE TO THE HIGHER PRECIP 
EFFICIENCY OF THE WARM RAIN PROCESS. MODELS INDICATE A DECREASE IN 
ACTIVITY BY AROUND 03Z BUT ONLY FOR A BRIEF PERIOD. TEMPERATURES 
WILL REMAIN A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL TONIGHT AS CLOUD COVER WILL 
PREVENT MUCH RADIATIONAL COOLING.

HIGH PWS AND MODEST CAPE VALUES AGAIN ON THURSDAY WILL GIVE WAY TO 
MORE SHOWERS AND STORMS. MODELS SHOW NEW ACTIVITY BEGINNING TO 
DEVELOP BETWEEN 12Z AND 15Z ON THURSDAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE DAY. 
THIS NEW ACTIVITY WILL BE IN RESPONSE TO AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT
THAT STALLS OUT TO OUR WEST. MODELS SHOW THE FRONT STALLING OUT...THUS
KEEPING THE FRONT TO OUR WEST THROUGH THE DAY ON THURSDAY. MAX
TEMPS WILL BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER AIR PATTERN 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL CONTINUE TO BRING UNSETTLED WEATHER FOR 
THE NEXT WEEK. THE NORTHERN EXTENT OF THE UPPER RIDGE WILL PLAGUE US 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND ALONG WITH A PESKY QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY. THE BOUNDARY WILL SERVE AS A FOCI FOR SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT NEARLY EVERY DAY. ONE ISSUE MAY BECOME 
HEAVY RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH THE BOUNDARY AND INCREASING PW VALUES. 
THE CURRENT HAZ WX OUTLOOK COVERS THESE POSSIBILITIES WELL.

BY MONDAY A BROAD TROUGH WILL REDEVELOP WITH MORE MCS ACTIVITY FOR 
SOUTHERN MO AND WESTERN KY. THIS OCCURS EACH DAY THROUGH THE MIDDLE 
OF NEXT WEEK. LOOKS LIKE A VERY SIMILAR PATTERN TO THE PAST FEW 
DAYS. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

838 
FXUS64 KMRX 071851
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT WED AUG 7 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL 
CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND INTO THE EVENING HOURS AS HIGH 
PWS AND MODEST CAPE WILL MAKE FOR AN UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT. LATEST 
NAM SOUNDINGS SHOW PWS RANGING FROM 1.8 TO 2 INCHES WITH ROUGHLY 800 
TO 1500 J/KG OF CAPE. AS MENTIONED IN THE MORNING UPDATE...THESE 
HIGHER PWS PUT US IN THE 75TH TO 90TH PERCENTILE RANGE FOR THIS TIME 
OF YEAR. WARM LAYER CLOUD DEPTHS WILL CONTINUE TO REMAIN WELL ABOVE 
10K FEET THROUGH THE EVENING WHICH IS A CONDUCIVE ENVIRONMENT FOR 
HEAVY RAINFALL DUE TO THE HIGHER PRECIP EFFICIENCY OF THE WARM RAIN 
PROCESS. HOWEVER...ONLY LOCALIZED POCKETS OF HEAVY RAINFALL ARE 
EXPECTED. MODELS INDICATE A DECREASE IN ACTIVITY BY AROUND 03Z BUT 
ONLY FOR A BRIEF PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN A FEW DEGREES 
ABOVE NORMAL TONIGHT AS CLOUD COVER WILL PREVENT GOOD RADIATIONAL 
COOLING. IT APPEARS THAT SOME CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUD COVER WILL 
REMAIN THROUGH THE NIGHT BUT SOME AREAS COULD SEE PARTIAL CLEARING 
WHICH WOULD LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF PATCHY FOG. AMOUNT OF 
CLEARING IS UNCERTAIN...BUT DID INCLUDE PATCHY FOG IN ZONES OVERNIGHT.

HIGH PWS AND MODEST CAPE VALUES CONTINUE FOR THURSDAY... GIVING WAY TO 
MORE SHOWERS AND STORMS. MODELS SHOW NEW ACTIVITY BEGINNING TO 
DEVELOP BETWEEN 12Z AND 15Z ON THURSDAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE 
DAY. THIS NEW ACTIVITY WILL BE IN RESPONSE TO AN APPROACHING COLD 
FRONT THAT STALLS OUT TO OUR WEST. MAX TEMPS ON THURSDAY WILL BE A
DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN TODAY.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER AIR PATTERN 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL CONTINUE TO BRING UNSETTLED WEATHER FOR 
THE NEXT WEEK. THE NORTHERN EXTENT OF THE UPPER RIDGE WILL PLAGUE US 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND ALONG WITH A PESKY QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY. THE BOUNDARY WILL SERVE AS A FOCI FOR SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT NEARLY EVERY DAY. ONE ISSUE MAY BECOME 
HEAVY RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH THE BOUNDARY AND INCREASING PW VALUES. 
THE CURRENT HAZ WX OUTLOOK COVERS THESE POSSIBILITIES WELL.

BY MONDAY A BROAD TROUGH WILL REDEVELOP WITH MORE MCS ACTIVITY FOR 
SOUTHERN MO AND WESTERN KY. THIS OCCURS EACH DAY THROUGH THE MIDDLE 
OF NEXT WEEK. LOOKS LIKE A VERY SIMILAR PATTERN TO THE PAST FEW 
DAYS.

.AVIATION...
VCTS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND INTO THE EARLY EVENING

THE ACTIVITY...CHOSE TO GO WITH IFR TEMPO CONDITIONS FOR LOWERED VIS 
AND CIGS INSTEAD OF TRYING TO INCLUDE IN THE PREDOMINATE OR A FM 
GROUP. ACTIVITY SHOULD START TO DECREASE AROUND 03Z AND PICK BACK UP 
AGAIN TOMORROW MORNING OUT AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. 
CONFIDENCE IS ON THE LOW SIDE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF FOG TONIGHT DUE TO THE 
UNCERTAIN AMOUNT OF CLEARING THAT WILL TAKE PLACE. THERE WILL LIKELY 
BE SOME CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUD COVER THAT WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE 
NIGHT BUT ANY AREAS THAT SEE PARTIAL CLEARING WILL LIKELY SEE FOG. 
FOR NOW...WILL GO 5SM AT CHA AND TYS WHILE BRINGING TRI DOWN TO 3SM.

.DISCUSSION...
MADE A FEW ADJUSTMENTS TO POP AND WX GRIDS. INCREASED POPS FOR THE 
CENTRAL VALLEY AND PORTIONS OF NE TN TO LIKELY THROUGH 15Z AND WENT 
LIKELY FOR EVERYONE STARTING AT 16Z. WIDESPREAD TO SCATTERED SHOWERS 
WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THROUGH THE AFTERNOON ALONG WITH A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS. THIS ACTIVITY IS DEVELOPING OUT AHEAD OF AN MCS THAT 
IS LOCATED ACROSS THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL AND WEST TN. IR IMAGERY 
SHOWS THE MCS TO BE WEAKENING. HOWEVER...THE SOUTHERN AREAS STILL MAY 
SEE SOME ACTIVITY FROM THE DECAYING MCS THIS AFTERNOON AS CORFIDI 
VECTORS HAVE IT TRACKING OVER THESE AREAS. ALSO...PWS GENERALLY 
RANGE FROM 1.8 TO 2.0 INCHES ACROSS THE AREA WHICH PUTS US IN THE 
75TH TO 90TH PERCENTILE RANGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. WARM LAYER CLOUD 
DEPTHS FROM 12 TO 13K FEET ALONG WITH TALL SKINNY CAPE PROFILES WILL 
LEAD TO AN EFFICIENT RAINFALL PROCESS...MEANING LOCALIZED POCKETS OF 
HEAVY RAIN IS POSSIBLE WITH CURRENT AND FUTURE ACTIVITY. TEMPS LOOK 
GOOD FOR NOW...NO OTHER GRID UPDATES PLANNED AT THIS TIME. NEW ZONES 
OUT SHORTLY.

EAST TN LATER TODAY AND BEFORE THAT CURRENT SHOWER ACTIVITY TO
EXPAND EAST. SLOWLY INCREASE POPS TODAY FROM SW TO NE. DAYTIME HEATING
AND HIGH MOISTURE OF AIR MASS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO SCATTERED

STRONG WINDS. TONIGHT GFS SHOWS ANOTHER COMPLEX MOVING INTO KY AND

NIGHTS. EXPECT HIGHS TODAY TO BE A COUPLE DEGREES COOLER THAN
TUESDAY WITH EXTENSIVE CLOUDS AND MORE PRECIPITATION. TONIGHT LOWS
IN THE LOWER 70S BUT UPPER 60S NORTH.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN CURRENT 
FORECAST. TN VALLEY IN ZONAL FLOW BETWEEN LARGE LOW TO THE NORTH AND 
SOUTHERN HIGH PRESSURE. LOW LEVEL FLOW REMAINS SOUTHWESTERLY WITH 
PWAT VALUES IN EXCESS OF 2.00 INTO THE WEEKEND. FORECAST SOUNDING 
INDICATE POTENTIAL FOR SLOW MOVING HEAVY RAINSHOWERS IN THE MID 
RANGE FORECAST. CONVECTIVE TIMING FAVORS DIURNAL ACTIVITY BUT 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES POSSIBLE INTO THE NIGHT HOURS WITH WESTERLY 
STEERING. PRECIPITATION CHANCES INCREASING FOR SATURDAY. AIR MASS 
PROGGED TO DRY OUT SOME ON SUNDAY AS WEAK FRONT MOVES SE THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. DIURNAL...OROGRAPHIC CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY CAN 
BE EXPECTED INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL 
ESPECIALLY AT NIGHT.

316 
FXUS64 KMRX 061853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT TUE AUG 6 2013

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE REMAINED MOVING ACROSS
WEST TN AND NORTH MS AND AL. SCATTERED SHOWERS CONTINUE TO DEVELOP
OVER MIDDLE TN BUT DISSIPATE RATHER QUICKLY ALONG AND EAST OF THE
PLATEAU AS THEY MOVE INTO THE VALLEY. THE 12Z KOHX AND FORECAST
SOUNDINGS OVER OUR FORECAST AREA INDICATE A FAIRLY DEEP DRY LAYER
FROM ABOUT 650MB TO 200MB.

THE HIGH CENTERED OVER THE TX GULF COAST WILL KEEP THE SE US IN
NORTHWEST FLOW. TONIGHT ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE ACROSS SE
MO...NE AR AND W KY. THIS WAVE WILL GENERATE MORE SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. ANTICIPATE THE THUNDERSTORMS TO MOVE INTO OR NEAR
THE PLATEAU COUNTIES NEAR MIDNIGHT AND MOVE SLOWLY IN A
SOUTHEASTERLY MOTION THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS ESPECIALLY OVER THE
SOUTHERN VALLEY. THE BEST RAIN CHANCES FOR THE ENTIRE AREA WILL
OCCUR AFTER SUNRISE WEDNESDAY.

BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT THE AREAS OF RAIN SHOULD TAPER OFF BEFORE
MIDNIGHT. TEMPERATURES THROUGH THIS TIME PERIOD WILL BE NEAR NORMAL
OR SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...GENERALLY ZONAL FLOW UPON
THE NORTH SIDE OF A FLAT DIRTY GULF COAST RIDGE. HIGHEST POPS
/LIKELIES/ ATTM SET FOR THURSDAY...AS STEERING SEEMS TO AIM MCS
PATH FROM LOWER OHIO VALLEY INTO OUR AREA...AS SHOWN BEST BY ECMWF
QPF FCSTS AND HPC ACCEPTANCE OF THAT SOLUTION. THE SOUTHERN
SECTIONS OF THE FCST AREA IS THE FAVORED AREA THURSDAY...ALTHOUGH E
TN MTNS MAY LIKEWISE BE IMPACTED BY WEAK UPSLOPE FLOW FROM THE
SOUTH. BEYOND THURSDAY...THE ADVERTISED FRONTAL BOUNDARY FROM THE
NORTH MAY CONTINUE TO BE HUNG UP...AS GFS STRUGGLES TO BRING IT
THROUGH THE AREA...WHILE ECMWF PROVIDES US WITH A FROPA AND SHARPER
UPPER TROUGH BUT NOT UNTIL MAYBE MONDAY. THUS...GIVEN THE MOISTURE
EXPECTED TO BE TRAPPED OVER THE AREA...AND NOT WITHSTANDING ONE OR
TWO HARD-TO-PIN-DOWN DISTURBANCES CROSSING THE AREA...SCATTERED
DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE IN THE FCST FRIDAY THROUGH
TUESDAY.

&&

RIDGE. MORE ACTIVITY TO DEVELOP IN NORTHWEST FLOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND
THURSDAY. SOME STORMS MAY BECOME STRONG IN NORTHERN AND WESTERN
SECTIONS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY CLOSEST TO FRONT. HEAVY RAINFALL OF
OVER ONE INCH POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE
PLATEAU. THE PATTERN WILL NOT CHANGE MUCH THROUGH THE WEEKEND BUT
CHANCES COULD LOWER WITH FRONT FINALLY MAKING IT THROUGH LATE IN
THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
234 PM EDT MON AUG 5 2013

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
ONGOING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CURRENTLY OVER W TN/W KY AND THE
MO BOOTHEEL SLOWLY MIGRATING SOUTHEAST. A LOT OF CLOUD DEBRIS FROM
THIS SYSTEM HAS BEEN TRACKING ACROSS MIDDLE AND E TN. ANTICIPATE
THE MAJORITY OF THIS RAIN TO WEAKEN AS IT MOVES CLOSER TO THE
FORECAST AREA. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN MAYBE EVEN A
STRAY THUNDERSTORM TO MOVE ACROSS MARION OR SEQUATCHIE COUNTIES...
PERHAPS AS FAR EAST AS HAMILTON COUNTY A FEW HOURS AFTER MIDNIGHT.
THE ISENTROPIC SURFACES SUPPORT THE SLIGHT CHANCE WORDING BUT THE
LOWER ATMOSPHERE DOES NOT HAVE THE NEEDED SATURATION. SOME PATCHY
FOG MAY OCCUR GENERALLY NORTH OF KNOXVILLE.

TUESDAY LOOKS FAIRLY DRY BUT BY THE AFTERNOON A FEW SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE PARTICULARLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN
OF SW VA AND E TN/NC. TUESDAY NIGHT THE NORTHWEST FLOW PERSISTS.
ANOTHER SHORTWAVE SHOULD BRING GOOD CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS AFTER MIDNIGHT.  

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GENERALLY ZONAL FLOW THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED. WEDNESDAY IS THE EASIEST-TO-IDENTIFY HIGH POP DAY 
DURING THE EXTENDED...WITH LIKELY POPS AREA WIDE DUE TO PASSING 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH...POSSIBLE MCS. THEN WE/LL SEE SCATTERED CONVECTION 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...THEN ANOTHER SUMMER FROPA FOR SATURDAY 
ALTHOUGH THE MODELS HAVE BEEN DRIFTING ON THE TIMING OF FRONT. WILL 
GO WITH 40 PCT THURS...30-40 PCT FRI...THEN 50 PCT SAT...AND WE CAN 
THEN MODIFY UP OR DOWN AS CONFIDENCE INCREASES. TEMPS WILL BE KEPT A 
LITTLE LOWER THAN MEX MOS...MORE IN LINE WITH EC MOS BUT MAYBE EVEN 
A DEGREE OR TWO LOWER THAN THAT. FOLLOWING THE SATURDAY FROPA...POPS 
WILL BE NO MORE THAN 30 PCT EARLY NEXT WEEK.

TO ACCOUNT FOR HIGHER CLOUD COVER THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. ALL

WILL GENERATE 20 POPS NORTH AND 30 SOUTH.  MODELS CONTINUE TO HAVE

WILL LEAN TOWARD GFS TIMING BUT CONFIDENCE LOW.  THIS WILL BRING AN 
SHORT WAVE THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY IN ADVANCE OF THE APPROACHING 
FRONT.  THE RESULT WILL BE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION ACROSS THE AREA.  
THE FRONT SHOULD PUSH IN LATE THURSDAY OR FRIDAY AND LINGER OVER THE 
AREA INTO SATURDAY.  THIS WILL KEEP HIGH CHANCE POPS IN PLACE FOR 
SCATTERED CONVECTION ON AND OFF FOR THIS TIME FRAME.  MAY SEE 
IMPROVING CONDITIONS WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS ON SUNDAY AS THE LINGERING BOUNDARY AT LEAST 
BRIEFLY DROPS TO OUR SOUTH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 PM EDT SUN AUG 4 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...MOSTLY QUIET WEATHER 
EXPECTED OVER THE SHORT TERM. TONIGHT WILL REMAIN PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY
CLEAR AS DRIER AIR CONTINUES TO FILTER IN ACROSS OUR AREA. THE
ADDITION OF LOWERED DEWPOINTS WILL LEAD TO OVERNIGHT MINS FROM 5 TO 8
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. NORTHWEST FLOW RESUMES ON MONDAY AND PROVIDES
PLEASANT CONDITIONS WITH MAX TEMPS A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL AND
DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 50S NORTH TO LOWER 60S SOUTH. CLOUDS WILL
BEGIN TO INCREASE TOMORROW AFTERNOON AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. WILL
KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER THE HIGHEST PEAKS OF THE APPALACHIANS
FOR AN ISOLATED AFTERNOON SHOWER OR STORM. A WARM FRONT WILL LIFT
NORTH ACROSS WEST TN ON MONDAY EVENING. THIS FRONT SHOULD STAY TO
OUR SOUTH BUT SHOWERS GENERATED ALONG THE FRONT WILL MOVE FROM
NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST...POSSIBLY IMPACTING PORTIONS OF OUR AREA ON
MONDAY NIGHT. WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR LIGHT RAIN
SHOWERS BEGINNING AT 00Z MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH 12Z TUESDAY MORNING.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...FOR TUESDAY FAVORED THE NAM 
OVER THE GFS IN TERMS OF POPS. THE NAM WAS MORE IN LINE WITH THE 
SREF IN HAVING LOWEST POPS IN THE VALLEY AND HIGHER POPS ELSEWHERE. 
ALSO TRIED TO TIME THE BETTER RAIN CHANCES TO THE MORNING 
HOURS...HOWEVER LATER HIGHER TERRAIN CONVECTION WILL BE A 
POSSIBILITY. 

BY TUESDAY NIGHT A SHORTWAVE WILL TRANSLATE ACROSS WESTERN/NORTHERN 
KENTUCKY. CONFIDENCE FOR BETTER RAIN CHANCES SLIGHTLY HIGHER FOR 
NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. LACK OF FOCUS FOR 
SOUTHERN AREAS WILL KEEP RAIN CHANCES AT A MINIMUM. 

A SLOW MOVING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SLOWLY ENCROACH E TN/SW VA/SW NC 
WEDNESDAY. THIS BOUNDARY WILL LIKELY SERVE AS A GOOD FOCUS MECHANISM 
FOR NUMEROUS SHOWERS TO DEVELOP ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE AREA 
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. THE PESKY BOUNDARY WILL PROBABLY LINGER 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK AND INTO NEXT WEEKEND. AREAS THAT 
BECOME NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER AND DRIER. 

TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD WILL GENERALLY BE AT OR 
SLIGHTLY BELOW SEASONAL NORMALS. PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS OVER THIS 
TIME FRAME SHOULD BE LESS THAN 2 INCHES.

MOVE INTO AN UNSETTLE PATTERN.  CONVECTIVE CHANCES INCREASE TUESDAY 
AS A WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH.  PRECIP CHANCES CONTINUE TO 
INCREASE ON WEDNESDAY IN ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT.  
MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW INCONSISTENCY IN TIMING BUT THE FRONT SHOULD 
MOVE IN AROUND THE THURSDAY/FRIDAY TIME FRAME FOR OUR BEST CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION.  CONVECTION WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA INTO SATURDAY WITH 
THE BOUNDARY JUST TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EDT FRI AUG 2 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...WEAK RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL REMAIN THROUGH TODAY AND
TONIGHT BEFORE WEAKENING SATURDAY. PWS AND INSTABILITY REMAIN
LIMITED ACROSS MUCH OF AREA TODAY...EXCEPT FOR ATURDAY BEFORE A
COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA FOR SOUTHEAST NORTH CAOLINA. LATEST
STORM MONITOR ANALYSIS PROGRAM AND SPC DATA SHOW MOISTURE/MARGINAL
INSTABILITY POOLING THERE THIS AFTERNOON WITH MLCAPE VALUES NEAR
1000 J/KG. HAVE INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS OVER CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES UNTIL MIDNIGHT.

FOR TONIGHT...PLENTY OF CIRRUS/CIRRUS-STRATUS CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE
TO STREAM INTO THE REGION. ANOTHER ROUND OF PATCHY FOG...SOME
LOCALLY DENSE...IS EXPECTED.

FOR SATURDAY...INCREASING PWS AND MOISTURE IN THE AFTERNOON SO WILL
CONTINUE WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...
MAINLY ALONG THE TERRAIN FEATURES.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL TWO COLD FRONT PASSAGES DURING THE 
SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY TIME FRAMES. IN 
ADDITION...NORTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL REMAIN OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY THROUGHOUT MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD...SO THINK THAT 
A FEW ORGANIZED MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS ORIGINATING FROM THE 
HIGH PLAINS OR MID MS RIVER VALLEY MAY AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA AT 
TIMES. AS A RESULT...IT APPEARS THERE WILL BE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
CONVECTION DEVELOPING ALMOST EVERY DAY IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT 
ESPECIALLY TOWARDS THE END OF NEXT WEEK AS A COLD FRONT STALLS OUT 
AROUND THE TN RIVER VALLEY WITH THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMING ZONAL. 
AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT THU AUG 1 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...WATER VAPOR SHOWS A SHOW-WAVE
MOVING ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY/CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. THIS WAVE
ALONG WITH A WEAK SURFACE TROUGH COMBINED WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY
WITH CAPES BETWEEN 1000-1500 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES OF -4...
CONTINUES TO PRODUCE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS.
THE CONVECTION IS MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST KENTUCKY. THIS ACTIVITY
WILL MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA THIS EVENING...BUT
WILL DISSIPATE BY AROUND SUNSET. HAVE INCLUDED AN EVENING WORDING
IN THE ZONES TO ACCOUNT FOR THE SCATTERED CONVECTION.

FOR TONIGHT...RIDGING WILL BUILD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH
SKIES BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY AND WINDS DIMINISHING TO LIGHT/CALM.
PLENTY OF LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE TO INTRODUCE PATCHY FOG...SOME DENSE
FOR FRIDAY MORNING.

FOR FRIDAY...FOG AND LOW-CLOUDS WILL DISSIPATE BY MID-MORNING
GIVING WAY TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKY. PWS DROP BELOW 1 INCH WITH A WEAK
MID-LEVEL INVERSION...SO DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED.

FOLLOWED GFS MOS MINS...BUT UNDER-CUT A DEGREE OR TWO FOR FRIDAYS
HIGH SINCE GUIDANCE HAS BEEN RUNNING TOO WARM FOR MAX TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE BASIC WEATHER 
PATTERN OVER THE U.S. WILL REMAIN STATUS QUO WITH THE TROFS OVER 
EASTERN CANADA AND PAC COAST...WHILE THE UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES 
GENERALLY OVER TEXAS.  THIS KEEPS US IN A RELATIVELY BUSY UPPER 
LEVEL NORTHWEST FLOW THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD...WITH 
WEAK COLD FRONTS PASSING EVERY FEW OF DAYS.  AT THE END OF THE 
PERIOD THERE IS A HINT THAT THE PATTERN MAY BE WEAKENING AS THE FLOW 
BECOMES MORE ZONAL...AS CANADIAN TROF WEAKENS...ALLOWING THE EDGE OF 
THE RIDGE TO ENCROACH ON THE SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA.

WITH THIS IN MIND AND SEEING THAT MOS MAX TEMPS HAVE BEEN RUNNING 
TOO HIGH...HAVE GONE ABOUT A CATEGORY LOWER THAN MOS MAX TEMPS 
IN GENERAL FOR THESE DAYS.

12Z MEX POPS FOR SUN-MON FOR THE AREA LOOK TOO DRY IN COMPARISON 
WITH 00Z ENSEMBLES AND EURO/CAN QPF PLACEMENTS...ESPECIALLY OVER 
SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA.  SO WILL BUMP UP THOSE POPS.  LOOKING 
RIGHT NOW THAT THE BIGGEST LULL IN PRECIP CHANCES MAY BE CENTERED 
AROUND TUESDAY...SO HAVE LOW POPS ON TUESDAY.  TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
INTO WED...MODELS AGREE ON WARM ADVECTION LIFTING ACROSS THE 
AREA...THAT SHOULD ENHANCE PRECIP CHANCES.   

&&

FOR MAXES AND MINS IN THE SHORT TERM. PATCHY FOG SHOULD LIFT AROUND 
9 AM OR SHORTLY THEREAFTER.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THERE IS VERY LITTLE CHANGE 
IN THE PATTERN THROUGH THIS PERIOD...WITH A STATIONARY RIDGE OVER TX 
AND A WEAK ATLANTIC TROUGH KEEPING A NW FLOW OVER THE AREA. PRECIP 
CHANCES WILL DEPEND ON UPSTREAM MCS DEVELOPMENT...WHICH ADDS TO THE 
FORECAST UNCERTAINTY AND MODEL DISCREPANCIES. HOWEVER THE GENERAL 
MODEL CONSENSUS IS THAT THE ATLANTIC TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY SLIGHTLY ON 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...PUSHING A FRONT TOWARD THE AREA. THIS 
APPEARS TO BE THE PERIOD OF HIGHEST PRECIP CHANCES...BUT WILL STILL 
KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE AS MOISTURE APPEARS LIMITED WITHOUT A 
CONNECTION TO THE GULF. THIS FRONT BECOMES PARALLEL TO THE ZONAL NW 
FLOW FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. DUE TO UNCERTAINTIES OF SMALL 
DISTURBANCES THAT MAY OCCUR IN THIS PATTERN...WILL BROAD BRUSH 
CHANCE POPS DURING THE DAY AND SLIGHT CHANCES AT NIGHT. TEMPERATURES 
THROUGH THE PERIOD WILL BE WELL UNDER GFS MOS GUIDANCE...WHICH 
APPEARS WAY TOO WARM FOR THE PATTERN.

THE MORNING IN THE EAST TO ACCOUNT FOR TIMING UNCERTAINTIES. FRIDAY 
LOOKS DRY AND MOSTLY SUNNY AS A SURFACE HIGH BUILDS OVER THE AREA. 
CONDITIONS APPEAR FAVORABLE FOR MCS DEVELOPMENT IN THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS FRIDAY...AND THE REMNANT MCV IS SHOWN BY THE NAM TO AFFECT 
OUR AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY. THE GFS LOOKS SIMILAR BUT IS A 
BIT SLOWER THAN THE NAM. WILL LEAN TOWARD THE GFS AND HAVE HIGH 
CHANCE POPS NORTH AND WEST SATURDAY...SPREADING ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
AREA FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

FOR SUNDAY...MODELS SHOW A FRONT BECOMING PARALLEL TO THE NW FLOW 
ALOFT...AND STALLING SOMEWHERE NEAR THE AREA. THERE ARE SOME MODEL 
DIFFERENCES WITH THE FRONTAL PLACEMENT...WITH THE ECMWF FARTHER 
SOUTH THAN THE GFS...BUT ALL SOLUTIONS WARRANT A CHANCE POP OVER THE 
AREA. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSAGE ON MONDAY SHOWN BY THE GFS AND 
ECMWF WILL BRING AN ENHANCED CHANCE OF SHOWERS THAT DAY...WITH POPS 
LOWERING TO A SLIGHT CHANCE TUESDAY AS A BIT OF DRYING ALOFT FOLLOWS 
THE TROUGH.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...AN APPROACHING WEATHER SYSTEM 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MRX CWA DURING THE SHORT TERM.  INCREASING 
CLOUDS EXPECTED THIS EVENING WITH ASSOCIATED PRECIP PUSHING INTO THE 
AREA LATE TONIGHT.  A LARGE BAND OF SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS 
WILL SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA FOR CATEGORICAL POPS EARLY WEDNESDAY

SYSTEM BEGINS TO PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...GENERAL WNW FLOW WILL 
BE STEERING THE WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST PERIOD 
AS UPPER TROUGHING SEEMS TO ENJOY THE EAST COAST. WE BEGIN WITH THE 
TAPERING OFF OF THE WEDNESDAY RAIN EVENT...THUS ACTUALLY WE WILL 
HAVE AN IMPROVING DAY DURING THURSDAY...AND THEN A DRY 24 HOURS FROM 
THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...MAY EVEN GET THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT 
MOSTLY DRY TOO. THEN THE NEXT SYSTEM SWEEPS IN SATURDAY AND SAT NGT. 
AFTERWARD THE MODEL RESOLUTION OF SHORTWAVES BECOMES A BIT MORE 
FUZZY...BUT COUNT ON ANOTHER ROUND OR TWO OF PRECIP DURING THE FIRST 
HALF OF NEXT WEEK AS WNW FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES.

THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...MAY EVEN GET THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT 
MOSTLY DRY TOO. THEN THE NEXT SYSTEM SWEEPS IN SATURDAY AND SAT NGT. 
AFTERWARD THE MODEL RESOLUTION OF SHORTWAVES BECOMES A BIT MORE 
FUZZY...BUT COUNT ON ANOTHER ROUND OR TWO OF PRECIP DURING THE FIRST 
HALF OF NEXT WEEK AS WNW FLOW ALOFT CONTINUES.

039 
FXUS64 KMRX 300714
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 AM EDT TUE JUL 30 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS THAT HAS PROVIDED VERY 
PLEASANT CONDITIONS FOR LATE JULY WILL DRIFT EAST TODAY...WHILE LOW 
PRESSURE OVER THE PLAINS SLOWLY APPROACHES. DEWPOINTS WILL BE 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER TODAY...AND HIGH TEMPS A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN 
YESTERDAY AS THE AIR MASS MODERATES...THOUGH STILL A BIT BELOW
NORMAL.

MODELS SHOW A CONVECTIVELY-INDUCED VORT MAX OVER THE OZARKS THIS 
MORNING MOVING INTO OUR AREA TONIGHT. ASSOCIATED LIFT MOVES INTO THE 
PLATEAU COUNTIES IN THE EVENING. POPS WILL RISE OVERNIGHT TO LIKELY 
AS THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AXIS PASSES THROUGH. A SECONDARY SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH WILL MOVE THROUGH IN THE LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING...AND WILL
BE AIDED BY GOOD INSTABILITY AND A 30 KT LLJ. THERE WILL BE A
POTENTIAL FOR SOME STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WEDNESDAY...WITH
DAMAGING WINDS THE MAIN THREAT. DRIER AIR ALOFT MOVES IN WEDNESDAY
NIGHT...BUT WITH THE WEAK SURFACE FRONT/CONVERGENCE ZONE MOVING
THROUGH THE AREA...CHANCE POPS WILL CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE SEEMINGLY PERMANENT EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH HOLDS ITS GROUND
THROUGH THE LONG TERM WITH A DRY FRIDAY IN STORE BEHIND THE MID
WEEK SYSTEM. HOWEVER...MORE SHORT WAVE ENERGY BUILDS INTO THE
REGION SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY WITH ANOTHER COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY
MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING THE DAY SUNDAY.
TWEAKED POPS UP FOR THE BIG FRONTAL PUSH SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY
AND THEN HELD ONTO SOME LOWER CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO
MONDAY AS FRONT SLOWS DOWN AND STALLS NEAR THE GEORGIA BORDER.
ADJUSTED MAX TEMPS BACK A FEW DEGREES THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT MON JUL 29 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO DOMINATE AREA WEATHER TONIGHT.  WITH LOW DEW POINTS AND 
FEW CLOUDS...WILL BE BE ANOTHER COOL NIGHT WITH NEAR RECORD LOWS 
POSSIBLE ACROSS THE AREA.  LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL EVER SO SLOWLY 
BEGIN TO RETURN INTO THE REGION ON TUESDAY AS THE HIGH SHIFTS 
EASTWARD.  AN APPROACHING SYSTEM WILL INCREASE MID TO HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS BY THE AFTERNOON BUT DRY CONDITIONS AND A BIT WARMER 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED FOR THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO WEAKEN AS A SHORTWAVE APPROACHES THE AREA. TUESDAY WILL 
REMAIN MOSTLY DRY...WITH CLOUDS AND PRECIP CHANCES INCREASING IN THE 
EVENING HOURS. EXPECTING THUNDERSTORMS THROUGHOUT THE DAY WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY AS THE SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH. NOT LOOKING AT ANY 
SEVERE STORMS ON WEDNESDAY AS THE INSTABILITIES AND SHEAR ARE WEAK. 
THE STORMS ON THURSDAY HAVE A LITTLE MORE INSTABILITY AND DRYER AIR 
IN THE UPPER LEVELS. THE THREAT FOR SEVERE STORMS IS STILL LOW...BUT 
COULD SEE SMALL HAIL AND GUSTY WINDS. FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT LOOK 
TO BE DRY WITH RAIN CHANCES INCREASING THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY DUE 
TO A FRONT MOVING THROUGH. THE THREAT FOR SEVERE WEATHER IS LOW AT 
THIS TIME...BUT WILL HAVE TO UPDATE WITH FURTHER MODEL RUNS. 
OTHERWISE...KEPT TEMPERATURES FAIRLY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE THROUGH THE 
MIDDLE OF THE WORK WEEK. TOWARDS THE WEEKEND...SKIES WILL CLEAR 
SOMEWHAT AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SO RAISED HIGH TEMPERATURES SEVERAL 
DEGREES ABOVE GUIDANCE.

FXUS64 KMRX 290705
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EDT MON JUL 29 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A PLEASANT DAY IS ON TAP FOR LATE JULY...WITH LOW HUMIDITY AND HIGH 
TEMPS 3 TO 5 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. SOME CIRRUS CLOUDS WILL BE OVER 
THE AREA THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY...WHICH WILL HELP MODERATE 
TEMPERATURES A BIT ALONG WITH WEAK 850 MB COLD ADVECTION. AT THE 
SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED OVER CENTRAL AND EASTERN KY 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...KEEPING DEWPOINTS IN THE 50S. WITH CLEAR AND 
CALM CONDITIONS TONIGHT...LOWS WILL DROP INTO THE MID 50S TO LOWER 
60S. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
THE UPPER FLOW FROM TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY WILL BE CHARACTERIZED
BY NORTHWEST-WEST FLOW WITH A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES MOVING ACROSS
THE GREAT LAKES PULLING COLD FRONTS THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY.
THIS UNSEASONABLY PATTERN FOR LATE JULY/EARLY AUGUST WILL KEEP THE
REGION UNDER PERIODS OF CONVECTION AND BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES.
TUESDAY WILL BEGIN WITH A SURFACR RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY..WHICH WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA TUESDAY
NIGHT/WEDNESDAY. BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW BECOMING SOUTHERLY WEDNESDAY
THROUGH THURSDAY WILL PRODUCE PERIODS OF ISENTROPIC LIFT AND
INCREASING INSTABILITY WITH CAPES OF 2000-2500 J/KG FOR THURSDAY.

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT BECOMING NEARLY STATIONARY JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA 
FRIDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH HIGH CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
FOR THURSDAY. A BRIEF PERIOD OF DRIER CONDITIONS FRIDAY WILL BE 
FOLLOWED WITH A RETURN CHANCE OF CONVECTION FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY 
AS WINDS BECOME SOUTHERLY PULLING MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY BACK INTO 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AHEAD OF ANOTHER FRONTAL BOUNDARY.

AS USUAL FOR THIS TIME OF THE YEAR...GFS AND ECMWF DISAGREE ON THE 
TIMING AND ASSOCIATED CONVECTION WITH THESE FRONTAL BOUNDARIES.
