634 
FXUS64 KMRX 281824
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
225 PM EDT SUN JUL 28 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...WITH DRIER AIR (DEWPOINTS IN THE 50S) ON THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BUT NOT QUITE YET IN THE GREAT TN VALLEY. 
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS SOME HIGH CLOUDS (ASSOCIATED WITH 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY) MOVING EASTWARD 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THESE HIGH CLOUDS WILL LIKELY CONTINUE 
MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND MONDAY...AS CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY CONTINUES OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY AND THE UPPER-LEVEL 
FLOW BECOMES ZONAL. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
REVEAL SOME MINOR DISCREPANCIES FOR TONIGHT...BUT ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT ON MONDAY. WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO FOR TONIGHT...WITH LOWS POSSIBLY SETTING DAILY 
RECORDS FOR EVERY LOCATION. THE RECORD LOWS FOR THE 29TH ARE FAIRLY 
WARM (CHA 61...TYS 60...OQT 60...AND TRI 58)...SO IT APPEARS THAT 
SEVERAL RECORDS MAY BE BROKEN ON MONDAY MORNING.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SURFACE RIDGING WILL 
REMAIN IN CONTROL THROUGH TUESDAY...ALLOWING FOR MOSTLY DRY 
CONDITIONS. MUCH DRIER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO HANG AROUND FOR MONDAY 
WITH MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES. LOW TEMPS WILL STILL BE 5 TO 10 DEGREES 
BELOW AVERAGE ON TUESDAY MORNING BUT STILL A FEW DEGREES TOO WARM 
FOR MOST AREAS TO SEE ANY LOW TEMP RECORDS BROKEN. ONLY THE NORTHERN 
AREAS ARE EXPECTED TO APPROACH RECORD LOW TEMPS. TUESDAY MORNING 
WILL HAVE A FALL-LIKE FEEL TO IT. CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE AGAIN ON 
TUESDAY AHEAD OF THE NEXT APPROACHING SYSTEM...WITH CHANCES OF RAIN 
AND A FEW STORMS BY TUESDAY EVENING.

THE PAST FEW MODEL RUNS HAVEN'T BEEN TOO IMPRESSIVE FOR THE MIDWEEK 
SYSTEM. MODELS HAVE BEEN KEEPING THIS SYSTEM AND ITS WARM FRONT 
FURTHER TO OUR WEST...THUS LIMITING THE SEVERE THREAT. CURRENT 
MODELS SHOW LESS INSTABILITY ACROSS OUR AREA WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON 
THAN PREVIOUSLY INDICATED AS THE WARM FRONT IS OVER WEST TN. I STILL 
EXPECT SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS OUR AREA AS THE SYSTEM 
MOVES EAST...JUST NOT AS STRONG AS PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT. I BELIEVE THE 
DRIER AIR THAT IS COMING IN TODAY AND MONDAY...ALONG WITH THE 
SURFACE RIDGE...REALLY PREVENTS THE WARM FRONT FROM MAKING IT THIS 
FAR EAST. WILL CONTINUE TO LEAVE SEVERE WORDING OUT OF THE HWO FOR 
NOW.

SHOWERS AND STORMS CONTINUE WED NIGHT AS THE WAVE LOOKS TO BE 
CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE 
MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES WILL PULL ANOTHER FRONT INTO 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR THURSDAY. A RETURN TO A SOUTHWEST FLOW AT 
THE SURFACE ON WED NIGHT AND THUR WILL ALLOW FOR A INSTABILITY TO 
BUILD OUT AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY. CURRENT GFS SHOWING CAPES AROUND 
2000 J/KG. TIMING OF THURSDAYS FRONT IS STILL IN QUESTION...SO WILL 
LEAVE POPS WHERE THEY ARE AT FOR NOW. THE FRONT SHOULD BE WELL TO 
OUR EAST ON FRIDAY...MAKING FOR A DRIER DAY COMPARED TO WED AND 
THU...BUT WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN FOR A ISOLATED AFTERNOON 
SHOWERS AND STORMS. GFS AND ECMWF SHOW ANOTHER TROUGH DIVING DOWN 
FOR THE WEEKEND...BRINGING ANOTHER FRONTAL BOUNDARY WITH ANOTHER 
ROUND OF STORMS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   61  87  62  88  68 /   0   0  10  10  40 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     59  84  60  85  67 /   0   0  10  10  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN             58  84  59  85  66 /   0   0  10  10  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    56  82  54  83  62 /   0   0  10  10  40

AFTERNOON AS DRIER AIR MOVES INTO THE REGION.

WILL UPDATE THIS MORNING TO REMOVE MORNING PRECIP WORDING AND TO 
MENTION DECREASING CLOUDINESS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT SUN JUL 28 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A COLD FRONT IS BRINGING SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS THIS MORNING. 
FORCING ALONG THE FRONT IS WEAK AND WV IMAGERY SHOWS DEEP MOISTURE 
HAS MOVED WELL EAST...SO ONLY ISOLATED TO SCATTERED COVERAGE IS 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE MORNING AS THE FRONT PUSHES THROUGH. SHOWERS 
SHOULD END BY THE AFTERNOON AS VERY DRY AIR BUILDS IN ABOVE 800 MB 
AND A CAPPING INVERSION DEVELOPS AT THAT LEVEL. CLEAR SKIES ARE 
EXPECTED BY TONIGHT...WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 50S MAKING FOR A VERY 
PLEASANT NIGHT FOR LATE JULY. LOW TEMPS WILL BE IN THE MID 50S TO 
LOWER 60S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
SURFACE RIDGING WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.
BESIDES AREAS OF CIRRO-STRATUS CLOUDS...PLENTY OF SUNSHINE WITH DRY
AIRMASS. SURFACE RIDGE MOVES EAST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
WEDENSDAY WITH INCREASING SOUTHERLY FLOW. LATEST MODEL RUNS SHOW
BEST INSTABILITY/CAPES STAYING OVER THE WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY AS
WEAK RIDGING REMAINS ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE. THE WEAK RIDGING WILL
LIMIT CHANCES OF SEVERE STORMS FOR WEDNESDAY...SO PLAN ON TAKING
OUT OF THE HWO.

AN FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES 
WILL PULL ANOTHER FRONT INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR THURSDAY. 
SOUTHWEST WINDS AHEAD OF THE BOUNDARY WILL PULL INSTABILITY BACK 
INTO THE REGION WITH CAPES APPROACHING 2000 J/KG. WOULD GO HIGHER ON 
POPS FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY EVENING...BUT HAVE LOW CONFIDENCE ON 
TIMING OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY. ANOTHER FRONTAL BOUNDARY APPROACHES FOR 
LATE SATURDAY WITH ANOTHER ROUND OF STORMS.

082 
FXUS64 KMRX 271834
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT SAT JUL 27 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT OVER THE MID WEST AND LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY... 
STRETCHING FROM NEAR DETROIT SOUTHWEST TO NEAR MEMPHIS. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE FORECAST AREA...AS AN 
UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION DRIFTS ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT WILL BE POSSIBLE THIS EVENING ALONG THE COLD FRONT AS IT 
NEARS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TOWARDS SUNSET...BUT WILL MENTION 
SCATTERED COVERAGE TONIGHT SINCE THE CURRENT PRE-FRONTAL ACTIVITY 
MAY LIMIT ANY ADDITIONAL REDEVELOPMENT ALONG THE FRONT. A FEW POST- 
FRONTAL SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE ON SUNDAY AS THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
LINGERS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS COLD FRONT MAY EVEN GET 
HUNG-UP TEMPORARILY BY THE MOUNTAINS ON SUNDAY...SO WILL KEEP AT 
LEAST A SLIGHT CHANCE POP OVER THE MOUNTAINS THROUGHOUT THE DAY. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME MINOR 
DISCREPANCIES FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY...AND WILL GENERALLY TREND 
TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...EXPECT A QUIET SUNDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...THE REST OF THE EXTENDED IS MUCH MORE ACTIVE 
WITH SEVERAL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

BY SUNDAY NIGHT...THINGS SHOULD BE MUCH IMPROVED AS WE WILL BE UNDER 
THE INFLUENCE OF A DEEP TROUGH WHOSE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL BE 
ON THE LEEWARD SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS BY THIS TIME. THIS WILL 
ALLOW FOR CLEAR SKIES AS DRIER AIR BUILDS IN. THESE CONDITIONS WILL 
ALLOW FOR UNSEASONABLY COOL AIR...GIVING US A SHOT AT RECORD LOWS ON 
MONDAY MORNING. THE ONLY CAVEAT...LATEST NAM AND GFS SOUNDINGS ARE 
HINTING AT SOME POSSIBLE CLOUD COVER MOVING IN OVERNIGHT SUNDAY INTO 
MONDAY. IF THIS HAPPENS...RECORD LOW TEMPS MAY NOT BE REACHED. AT 
THIS TIME...WILL CONTINUE TO TREND TOWARD MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WITH 
RECORD LOW TEMPS. MONDAY AND MOST OF TUESDAY LOOK TO REMAIN QUIET AS 
HIGH PRESSURE BRIEFLY RETURNS. NEAR RECORD LOWS EXPECTED ACROSS SOME 
AREAS ON TUESDAY MORNING BUT MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN LOCATIONS. 

BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON OUR NEXT SYSTEM IS APPROACHING. MODELS SHOW A 
WARM FRONT LIFTING THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...THERE IS 
STILL DISAGREEMENT ON THE TIMING AND POSITIONING OF THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY. NONETHELESS...LOOK FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS TO MOVE IN 
SOMETIME IN THE TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY MORNING TIME-FRAME... 
WITH WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY. THE 
LOCATION OF THE BOUNDARY WILL PLAY A ROLE IN THE SEVERE POTENTIAL... 
STILL TOO MUCH DISAGREEMENT BETWEEN MODELS TO NAIL DOWN EXACT SEVERE 
POTENTIAL. AS OF NOW...STILL GOING WITH THE IDEA THAT A FEW ISOLATED 
SEVERE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE ON WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

THURSDAY CONTINUES TO STAY ACTIVE AS ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH MOVES 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES AND SOUTHERN CANADA. AN ASSOCIATED 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE THROUGH SOMETIME DURING THE DAY...HELPING 
TO GENERATE MORE SHOWERS AND STORMS. WEAK RIDGING RETURNS FOR 
FRIDAY...BUT MODELS SHOW ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVING IN FOR THE WEEKEND 
THAT COULD BRING MORE SHOWERS AND STORMS.

CONTINUED THE TREND WITH TEMPS...GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER 
THAN GFS MOS...BUT FOLLOWED MINS CLOSELY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   67  86  59  85  64 /  30  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     66  84  57  83  62 /  30  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             65  84  56  83  60 /  30  20  10  10  10

641 
FXUS64 KMRX 270652
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 AM EDT SAT JUL 27 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS OVER WEST TN THIS MORNING WILL BE MOVING 
EAST...BRINGING SHOWERS TO MOST OF THE AREA TODAY...MAINLY IN THE 
LATE MORNING THROUGH EARLY AFTERNOON. MODEL DEPICTIONS OF LIFT AND 
INSTABILITY ARE NOT PARTICULARLY STRONG OR ORGANIZED THIS THIS 
SYSTEM...BUT CURRENT PRECIP COVERAGE OVER WEST TN THIS MORNING 
SUGGESTS LIKELY POPS ARE WARRANTED. THERE IS GREATER UNCERTAINTY 
ABOUT PRECIP CHANCES TONIGHT...AS THE NAM DEVELOPS CONVECTION ALONG 
THE SURFACE FRONT AND A SECONDARY SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSAGE...WHILE 
THE GFS SHOWS A DRY FROPA TONIGHT. THE NAM SEEMS REASONABLE WITH LOW 
LEVEL CONVERGENCE ZONE ALONG THE FRONT GENERATING THE PRECIP...SO 
WILL HAVE A CHANCE POP THROUGH TONIGHT. LOWER DEWPOINTS WILL BEGIN 
BUILDING INTO THE AREA TONIGHT BEHIND THE FRONT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
A UNSEASONABLY DEEP UPPER TROUGH WILL BE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES
SUNDAY...EXITING MONDAY. A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE BUILDING
INTO THE REGION SUNDAY WITH SHOWERS ENDING ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND
FAR NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA IN THE MORNING.
DRY...UNSEASONABLY LOW DEWPOINTS AND PLENTY OF SUNSHINE CAN BE
EXPECTED DURING THE LATER HALF OF SUNDAY THROUGH MOST OF TUESDAY.

FOR THE LATER HALF OF TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES WILL LIFT NORTH AS A WARM FRONT WITH 
ISENTROPIC LIFT GETTING ITS ACT TOGETHER...ESPECIALLY FOR WEDNESDAY 
AS FRONT LIFTS NORTH THROUGH THE AREA. A GOOD DEAL OF SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY CAN BE EXPECTED. WOULD GO HIGHER IN POPS IF 
NOT FOR DIFFERENCES BETWEEN GFS AND ECMWRF ON THE EVOLUTION OF THIS 
SYSTEM. INSTABILITY INCREASES OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WEDNESDAY. 
STILL A THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS WEDENSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES AND 
SOUTHERN CANADA FOR THURSDAY. ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE 
INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THURSDAY. WILL CONTINUE CHANCE OF SHOWER 
AND THUNDERSTORMS WITH THE FROPA. WEAK RIDGING FOR FRIDAY...BUT 
BOUNDARY IS DEPICTED TO MOVE BACK NORTH FOR NEXT WEEKEND.

AS FOR TEMPEATURES...GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN GFS 
MOS...BUT FOLLOWED MINS CLOSELY.

685 
FXUS64 KMRX 261832
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT FRI JUL 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC 
REGION...WITH LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE SLOWLY WORKING ITS WAY BACK INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA (DEWPOINTS ALREADY NEAR 70 AT KCHA). SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALS SOME HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY MOVING 
EASTWARD TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...AS AN UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS UPPER TROUGH 
IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY FURTHER OVERNIGHT...AND WILL GRADUALLY PUSH A 
COLD FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS (AND POTENTIALLY MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE ACCORDING TO THE NAM MODEL) WILL DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT. WITH A FAIRLY AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH 
(FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR)...THINK THAT SOME ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS 
WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA...SO HAVE UPDATED THE 
HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION THIS POSSIBILITY. WILL CONTINUE 
TO MENTION LIKELY POPS AREAWIDE ON SATURDAY...WITH PRECIP CHANCES 
SLOWLY DECREASING SATURDAY NIGHT AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL 
SOME MINOR DISCREPANCIES THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...AND WILL GENERALLY 
TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW A COLD 
FRONT MOVING EAST OF OUR AREA SOMETIME ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON/EARLY 
EVENING. MODELS HINT AT A QUICKER EXIT THAN CURRENT POPS REFLECT... 
THIS IS DUE TO ENSEMBLE MEMBER POPS STILL BEING ON THE HIGHER SIDE. 
ALSO...IT IS NOT UNCOMMON FOR SUMMERTIME COLD FRONTS TO LOSE SOME OF 
THEIR ENERGY AND MOMENTUM AS THEY DROP THIS FAR SOUTH AND TRY AND 
CROSS OVER THE APPALCHIANS. IF SUNDAY'S FRONT GETS SLOWED UP BY THE 
MOUNTAINS AND HAS A SLOWER EXIT...THIS WOULD KEEP SHOWERS AROUND 
LONGER OVER OUR FAR EASTERN AREAS VERSES A QUICKER EXIT RESULTING IN 
A DRIER OUTCOME. FOR NOW...WILL PRETTY MUCH KEEP POPS WHERE THEY AT 
WITH DECREASING CHANCES FROM WEST TO EAST AS THE DAY PROGRESSES AND 
A DROP OF POPS BY 00Z. 

SURFACE RIDGING WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR LATE SUNDAY THROUGH MOST 
OF TUESDAY. THIS WILL KEEP THE TENNESSEE VALLEY MOSTLY DRY AND 
UNSEASONABLY COOL...ESPECIALLY FOR THE OVERNIGHT LOWS. NEAR RECORD 
LOWS ARE POSSIBLE AREA WIDE ON MONDAY MORNING. NEAR RECORD LOWS ARE 
POSSIBLE AGAIN ON TUESDAY MORNING...BUT MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
AREAS.

TUESDAY...MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE AGAIN AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM 
WITH MOST AREAS HAVING CHANCE POPS IN PLACE BY TUESDAY NIGHT. WITH 
THIS SYSTEM...THE GFS SHOWS A WARM FRONT LIFTING NORTH INTO THE 
REGION FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. THE WARM FRONT LIFTING NORTH WILL 
LEAD TO INCREASING INSTABILITY AND CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS. THIS 
COULD POTENTIALLY SETUP A FAIRLY ACTIVE WEDNESDAY DEPENDING ON THE 
LOCATION OF THE FRONT. HOWEVER...SHEAR IS NOT EXPECTED WITH THIS 
SYSTEM AS THE JET IS WELL TO OUR NORTH. THE LACK OF SHEAR WILL 
HELP TO LIMIT THE OVERALL SEVERE POTENTIAL. CURRENT HWO TALKS ABOUT 
THE POTENTIAL OF SEVERE WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY. WILL LEAVE THE HWO AS 
IS FOR NOW...AS THE PREVIOUS WORDING IS STILL IN-LINE WITH CURRENT 
THINKING.

DUE TO UNCERTAINTY ON THE LOCATION OF THE BOUNDARY...CONFIDENCE IS 
LOW ON POPS FOR THE WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY PERIODS. THE FINAL LOCATION 
OF THE BOUNDARY WILL PLAY A LARGE ROLE IN PRECIP COVERAGE. EXPECT 
MORE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO CONTINUE ON FRIDAY AS ENOUGH 
INSTABILITY IS PRESENT TO GENERATE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DURING 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   69  85  67  83  59 /  30  60  30  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     67  84  65  82  59 /  30  60  30  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             67  83  65  82  57 /  30  60  30  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    63  79  61  81  54 /  30  60  40  30  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 AM EDT FRI JUL 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OH AND TN VALLEY REGION THIS MORNING WILL 
SHIFT EASTWARD THROUGH THE DAY...AND A TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS WILL DROP SOUTHEAST. AS THE HIGH MOVES EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS...A WEAK S-SE FLOW WILL DEVELOP IN WESTERN NC THIS 
AFTERNOON...WHICH SHOULD HELP INITIATE A FEW SHOWERS AND TSTMS IN SW 
NC AND THE SMOKIES. THE VALLEY SHOULD REMAIN DRY WITH A PRETTY 
STABLE TEMPERATURE PROFILE IN FORECAST SOUNDINGS.

FALLING 500 MB HEIGHTS WITH THE APPROACHING TROUGH AND INCREASING 
UPPER DIVERGENCE IN A JET ENTRANCE REGION WILL PROVIDE SOME LIFT 
LATE TONIGHT...MAINLY AFTER 06Z. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES RISE TO 
1.5 TO 1.75 BY 12Z. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS COMING INTO THE PLATEAU 
AND TN VALLEY IN THIS TIME FRAME. INSTABILITY WILL BE LACKING 
OVERNIGHT...SO WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF TSTMS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
A FAIRLY STRONG SHORT-WAVE FOR LATE JULY WILL MOVE ACROSS THE A
SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY SATURDAY THROUGH
MONDAY PULLING A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY LATE
SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. MODELS SHOW A UPPER JET MOVING
ACROSS EASTERN OHIO VALLEY PLACING THE AREA UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT
ENTRANCE REGION. THE JET CONFIGURATION WILL HELP ENHANCE THE
FRONTAL-GENETIC FORCING OVER THE AREA. ALSO... ISENTROPIC LIFT
NOTED AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING FRONT FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY
NIGHT. WILL CALL FOR LIKELY POPS FOR SHOWERS AND ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS.

SURFACE RIDING WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA FOR LATE SUNDAY THROUGH MOST 
OF TUESDAY KEEPING THE TENNESSEE VALLEY MOSTLY DRY AND UNSEASONABLY 
COOL..ESPECIALLY FOR THE OVERNIGHT LOWS.

FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON POPS SINCE A LOT 
DEPENDS ON HOW FAR NORTH WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY PULLS NORTH. GFS 
SHOWS FRONT PULLING NORTH INTO THE REGION FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY
WITH INCREASING INSTABILITY AND CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS. WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON/EVENING COULD BE ACTIVE DEPENDING ON LOCATION OF BOUNDARY.
CURRENT HWO TALKS ABOUT THE POTENTIAL OF SEVERE WEATHER FOR 
WEDNESDAY. PLAN ON CONTINUING THIS POTENTIAL.

725 
FXUS64 KMRX 251919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT THU JUL 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WHICH WAS 
BRINGING A VERY DRY AIR MASS (FOR JULY) INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THIS 
HIGH WILL CONTINUE TO CREATE TRANQUIL CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH FOG LIKELY DEVELOPING LATE TONIGHT 
AROUND THE RELATIVELY WARM WATERWAYS. MODELS INDICATE SOME MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY DEVELOPING FRIDAY AFTERNOON OVER THE FORECAST AREA...AND 
WITH A LACK OF ANY UPPER-LEVEL TRIGGERS...THINK THAT ANY ISOLATED 
CONVECTION SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME MINOR DISCREPANCIES 
FOR TONIGHT AND FRIDAY...AND WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A 
COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO. IT APPEARS THAT LOWS ON FRIDAY MORNING 
COULD BE RECORD-SETTING ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA 
(CURRENT RECORD AT KTRI FOR JULY 26TH IS 58 SET BACK IN 2003).

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...OVERALL...LITTLE HAS 
CHANGED FROM PREVIOUS DISCUSSION. FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY 
MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE AS WE TRANSITION TO A SOUTHWEST FLOW 
AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. 
MODELS STILL SHOWING THE COLD FRONT ARRIVING BY SATURDAY EVENING. A 
SHORTWAVE OUT AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT WILL ENABLE SOME SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP BY SATURDAY MORNING...BUT WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED DURING THE EVENING AND 
OVERNIGHT HOURS WITH THE ARRIVAL OF THE COLD FRONT. MODELS STILL 
SUPPORTIVE OF A SLOWER FRONTAL PASSAGE...MODELS INDICATE FRONT WILL 
STILL BE DRAPED ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY MORNING. THE FRONT 
SHOULD MOVE OFF TO OUR EAST BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR MOST ARES DURING THE DAY WITH CHANCE ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS. 
DROPPED ALL POPS BY 06Z ON MONDAY. 

MOSTLY ZONAL FLOW RETURNS FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. MONDAY LOOKS 
PLEASANT AS DRIER AIR FROM PREVIOUS DAYS FRONTAL PASSAGE CONTINUES 
TO SPILL INTO OUR REGION...COMBINED WITH RETURNING SURFACE RIDGE. 
DID LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE ERN MTNS MONDAY AFTERNOON FOR 
CONTINUITY AND TO MESH WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS TO OUR EAST. SURFACE 
RIDGE MOVES OFF QUICKLY TO THE EAST TUESDAY AS MOISTURE INCREASES 
AHEAD OF THE NEXT APPROACHING SHORTWAVE. MOISTURE INCREASE ALONG 
WITH APPROACHING WAVE WILL WARRANT CHANCE POPS THROUGH MUCH OF 
TUESDAY AND INTO WEDNESDAY. DURING THIS TIME-FRAME...PWS GENERALLY 
INCREASE TO 1.5 TO NEAR 2 INCHES. THINGS LOOK TO QUIET DOWN ON 
THURSDAY IN COMPARISON TO TUE/WED...BUT STILL KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR ALL AREAS.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT THU JUL 25 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL
CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE
VALLEY WITH PWS DROPPING BELOW 1 INCH. THE DRY AIRMASS WILL ALLOW
FOR MOSTLY CLEAR SKY. HOWEVER...PATCHY FOG CAN BE EXPECTED DUE TO
THE GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS. ALSO...TEMPERATURES
DROPPING INTO THE MIDDLE 50S TO LOWER 60S THURSDAY NIGHT COMBINED
WITH RELATIVELY WARM LAKE TEMPERATURES WILL ALLOW FOR STEAM FOG
DEVELOPMENT. SOME OF THE FOG THURSDAY NIGHT COULD BECOME DENSE AT
AND NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE KEEP 
OUR AIRMASS ON THE DRY SIDE FRIDAY...BEFORE MOISTURE CREEPS UPWARDS 
AGAIN FROM FRIDAY NIGHT TRHOUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT SHOULD CREATE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND SOME
THUNDERSTORMS...MOST LIKELY BY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY SUNDAY. 
MODELS ALL SUPPORT A SLOWER FRONTAL PASSAGE...SO NUDGED POPS UP SOME 
FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING. FELT POPS SHOULD BE LOWERED 
AS EARLY AS SUNDAY AFTERNOON...SO LOWERED POPS TO SLIGHT CHANCE IN 
FAR WRN AREAS AT THAT TIME...AND DROPPED POPS ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA BY 06Z MONDAY.

FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...MONDAY IS LOOKING TO BE A DRY PERIOD WITH 
ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND SURFACE RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE REGION. SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS IN THE ERN MTNS MONDAY AFTERNOON WERE FOR CONTINUITY AND 
TO MESH WITH ADJACENT NWS GRIDS TO OUR EAST. SURFACE RIDGE MOVES OFF 
QUICKLY TO THE EAST TUESDAY AND MOISTURE INCREASES AHEAD OF THE NEXT 
SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. INCREASED POPS TO AROUND 40 
PERCENT FOR WEDNESDAY GIVEN CONSISTENCY AMONGST LONG RANGE MODELS 
AND 25/00Z GFSX MOS. GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO THE SIMILAR 24/12Z 
AND 25/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS EACH PERIOD.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE NORTHWESTERN BORDER OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...GENERALLY ALONG A NASHVILLE TN TO MIDDLESBORO KY TO 
BLUEFIELD WV LINE. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE 
SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING AHEAD OF IT 
DUE TO THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. ISOLATED CONVECTION SHOULD LINGER 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET THIS EVENING... 
WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE EXPECTED TONIGHT. ALTHOUGH HIGH TEMPS ON 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WILL NOT CHANGE MUCH BEHIND THIS COLD FRONT... 
THE NOTICEABLY DRIER AIR BEHIND THE FRONT WILL ALLOW FOR COOLER LOW 
TEMPS AT NIGHT. WITH ONLY WEAK INSTABILITY EXPECTED ON THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON AND FRIDAY AFTERNOON...ANY ISOLATED CONVECTION THAT 
MANAGES TO DEVELOP SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN BOTH DUE 
TO THE HIGHER THAN NORMAL GROUND MOISTURE CONTENT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL 
CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES ON SATURDAY AS SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY SWINGS AROUND THE BASE OF THE TROUGH ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH LATER SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT. A COOL FRONT WILL BUILD 
INTO THE REGION IN THIS PATTERN LATER SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY 
ENHANCING THE PROBABILITY FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THERE IS 
SOME CONCERN THAT THE FRONT WILL MAKE SLOWER PROGRESS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY SO MAINTAINED LOW THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCE POPS 
FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST FOR LINGERING SHOWERS ALONG THE 
BOUNDARY. MODELS AGREE THAT A DRIER NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BE IN PLACE 
MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT. THE DRY PERIOD MAY EVEN EXTEND INTO 
TUESDAY BUT MORE SHORT WAVE ENERGY APPEARS ON THE HORIZON ACROSS THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY EARLY ON TUESDAY AND SOME OF THIS ACTION MAY PUSH 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE DAY SO USED A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. ACTIVE WEATHER IS BACK IN THE 
FORECAST AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY WITH MODELS INDICATING THE CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS MOIST AIR IS LIFTED IN ADVANCE OF YET 
ANOTHER APPROACHING SHORT WAVE TROUGH.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 AM EDT WED JUL 24 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A MOIST AIRMASS REMAINS ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA WITH PLENTY OF LOW CLOUDS AREA-WIDE. LOW CLOUDS
AND PATCHY FOG WILL LIFT THIS MORNING DUE TO MIXING AHEAD OF AN
APPROACHING COLD FRONT. MODELS SHOW THE FRONT ACROSS SOUTHEAST
KENTUCKY AT 12Z...THEN SLOWLY MOVES INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHERN PLATEAU BY NOON. DAYTIME MIXING AHEAD OF FRONT WILL ONLY
ALLOW FOR VERY SLOW SOUTHWARD PROGRESSION OF BOUNDARY...PER SURFACE 
THETA-E AND WIND MODEL FORECAST. BOUNDARY WILL ONLY BE ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN PLATEAU TO TYS TO GREENEVILLE LINE AT 21Z. MODEL SOUNDINGS
DEPICTS ARE MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE
FRONT WITH CAPES OF 2000-2500 J/KG. 

MODEL SOUNDING ANALYSIS SHOW SOME MID-LEVEL DRY AIR WITH MDPI AND
WINDEX VALUES SUPPORTING ISOLATED STRONG/POSSIBLY SEVERE DOWNBURST WINDS.
ALSO...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL ONCE AGAIN BE A CONCERN...
ESPECIALLY SINCE STORM MOTION WILL BE PARALLEL TO THE BOUNDARY...BUT
RUNOFF PROBLEMS WILL BE LOCALIZED.

FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES SOUTH OF THE AREA THIS EVENING. PATCHY FOG
EXPECTED TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...DRIER AIR FLOWS INTO THE 
REGION ON THURSDAY BEHIND THE COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE. FOR NOW I KEPT 
THE SLIGHT CHANCE AFTERNOON POPS FOR THE EASTERN MTNS ALONG THE TN 
AND NC LINE. FRIDAY ALSO LOOKS DRY OVER THE MAJORITY OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...WITH JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE AFTERNOON ALONG TN-NC 
LINE AND OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA.

MEDIUM TO LONG RANGE MODELS SEEM FAIRLY CONSISTENT WITH A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHING BY LATE SATURDAY...AND PREVIOUS GRIDS HAVE 40 TO 50 
PERCENT POPS IN ALREADY. THINK IT IS PROBABLY A BIT EARLY TO GO WITH 
LIKELY POPS JUST YET...AS THESE POPS ARE VERY CLOSE TO THE 24/00Z 
GFSX MOS POPS. 

24/00Z GFSX MOS POPS ARE TRENDING DOWN FROM THE 23/12Z GUIDANCE FOR 
SUNDAY...SO I KEPT RAIN CHANCES CLOSE TO CLIMO AND BELOW MOS. 
SOUNDINGS FOR SUNDAY SHOW WARMING ALOFT WITH LIMITED INSTABILITY... 
SO JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS MENTIONED FOR THE 
AFTERNOON. KEEPING BULK OF THE AREA DRY FOR SUNDAY NIGHT...MORE IN 
LINE WITH THE DRIER CANADIAN AND GFS MODEL SOLUTIONS (ECMWF THE 
WETTEST). 

OTHERWISE...NO CHANGES MADE FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...OR WITH MAX/MIN 
TEMPS IN GENERAL.

MINIMUM...SO THE SEVERE THREAT MENTIONED YESTERDAY...NOW HAS FADED.

SHOWERS...THEREFORE ONLY "CHANCE" POPS ARE MENTIONED IN GENERAL.
LEAVING SOME POPS IN FOR TOMORROW AFTERNOON AS DRIER AIR REALLY

TEMPS.

A COLD FRONT WILL BE LOCATED ACROSS THE SOUTH/SOUTHEASTERN PORTION

UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL PROVIDE THE MAJORITY OF THE REGION WITH 
DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR. THE EXCEPTION WILL BE WHERE THE FRONT 
GETS HUNG UP IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ALONG THE NC/TN BORDER. THURSDAY 
NIGHT ANY SHOWERS THAT DO DEVELOP SHOULD END RATHER QUICKLY AFTER 
SUNSET AND REMAIN DRY. 

BY FRIDAY ANOTHER CHANCE FOR AFTERNOON SHOWERS WILL OCCUR OVER THE 
MOUNTAINS AND INTO PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. FRIDAY NIGHT A DEEP 
TROUGH EXTENDING FROM THE GREAT LAKES TO LOUISIANA WILL EDGE CLOSER 
TO THE AREA ALONG WITH AN ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
INCREASE AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM ALONG WITH WEAK WAVES IN THE 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW HAS CAUSED THE MENTION OF CHANCE OF SHOWERS. THE 
CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL INCREASE MORE AS WE GET INTO SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON. ALONG WITH THE RAIN...TEMPERATURES WILL BE SLIGHTLY 
COOLER THAN SEASONAL NORMALS DUE TO EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER AND 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER PRESSURE.

OF THE APPALACHIANS BEFORE THIS AFTERNOON. ADJUSTED POP AND WEATHER
GRIDS ACCORDINGLY IN LINE WITH A MOS BLEND AND ADJACENT NWS GRIDS.
CLOUDINESS SEEMS TO FAVOR CLOSER TO THE COOLER NAM MOS FOR HIGHS
TODAY.

ANY LINGERING INSTABILITY SUPPORTS 40 PERCENT POPS NORTH TO 30
PERCENT SOUTH. LOSS OF HEATING AFTER THE EVENING HOURS...SO DROPPED
DOWN TO SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT. GFS MOS MINS
CLOSELY FOLLOWED.

MORNING...THEN MOVE SLOWLY SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA INTO THE AFTERNOON. 
SCATTERED/BROKEN SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL ACCOMPANY BOUNDARY 
GIVEN MODERATE CAPE VALUES BETWEEN 1500-2000 J/KG. A FEW STRONG 
THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA.

BOUNDARY WILL MOVE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...STALLING JUST EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN CONTROL WITH MAIN 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION NEAR THE TENNESSEE/NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS. 

FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO THE WEEKEND...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS SHOW A 
SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM IS STILL IN QUESTION SINCE THE 
GFS AND ECMWF SHOW SOME DISAGREEMENT. MODELS DO SHOW ISENTROPIC LIFT 
ALONG AND NORTH OF THE STALLED BOUNDARY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS AS WELL AS DIVERGENCE ALOFT/FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING. 

INSTABILITY IS LIMITED...SO ANTICIPATE MAINLY SHOWERS...EXCEPT 
DURING THE AFTERNOON. INCREASING CLOUDS AND RAIN WILL LOWER 
TEMPERATURES AS WELL. SYSTEM WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA FOR MONDAY.

079 
FXUS64 KMRX 221937
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 PM EDT MON JUL 22 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...AS HAPPENS QUITE OFTEN...THE 
LARGE OVERNIGHT SHOWERS AND STORMS FROM MIDDLE TENNESSEE FADED 
SLOWLY DURING THE DAY TODAY.  RADAR IS A MIX OF LEFT OVER ISOLATED 
SHOWERS FROM THAT COMPLEX AND ISOLATED CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPED 
FROM TODAY'S SURFACE HEATING.  THINK MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY WILL FADE 
WEST TO EAST AS WEAK UPPER LIFT EXITS TO EAST AND WILL FADE WITH 
EVENING COOLING.  RELATIVELY DRY MID AND UPPER LAYERS SHOULD ALLOW 
FOR RADIATIONAL COOLING TONIGHT...AS LOW LEVELS REMAIN VERY MOIST.  
SHOULD SET UP FOR FOG TONIGHT...AND THINKING FOR NORTHERN 2/3 OF 
AREA...DECENT CHANCE FOR DRIZZLE.  THINKING THAT RELATIVELY HIGH 
POPS IN MOS ARE MORE FROM HEAVY/WET DRIZZLE THAT GOT A COUPLE OF 
CLICKS ON THE RAIN GAGE. QPF FORECAST REFLECTS THIS SCENARIO WITH 
ONLY 0.01 TO 0.03 INCH VALUES FORECAST LATE TONIGHT.  THE 
FOG/DRIZZLE SHOULD BE SLOW TO LIFT IN THE MORNING...THEN EXPECTING 
SOME CONVECTION IN THE HEATING OF THE DAY ON TUESDAY. A WEAK COLD 
FRONT WILL BE MOVING TOWARD THE AREA ON TUESDAY FROM THE NORTH.
SHEAR IS ONLY EXPECTED TO BE MARGINAL...BUT THERE SHOULD BE
INCREASING INSTABILITY AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. WOULD THINK THERE IS A
CHANCE OF SEVERE STORMS FOR NW HALF OF AREA...DEPENDING ON TIMING
OF DIURNAL HEATING...COULD BE A LITTLE MORE OR LESS OF THE AREA.
WENT A COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER ON THE MAX TEMP FOR
TUESDAY...FIGURING THAT THE HEATING WILL BE SLOW-GOING AT FIRST.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...BY TUESDAY NIGHT A 
COLD FRONT WILL BE SITUATED ACROSS KENTUCKY. SHORT RANGE MODELS 
DIFFER ON TIMING OF FROPA BUT THINK HIGH CHANCE TO LIKELY 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT.
LATEST SPC SHOWS A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS JUST NORTH 
AND WEST OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. ISOLATED STRONG 
STORMS POSSIBLE...BUT FEEL GREATEST THREAT WILL BE ALONG THE FRONT.

FRONT SLOWLY MOVES SOUTH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...SO EXPECT HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY SOUTH WITH 
ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH.

RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY PRODUCING MOSTLY DRY CONDITIONS AND LESS 
HUMIDITY. BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS SHOW ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE MOVING 
SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. 
INCREASING CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE WEEKEND IS 
EXPECTED. TIMING OF THIS NEXT WAVE IS UNCERTAIN.

.DISCUSSION...
LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS/STORMS STILL HEADED TOWARD THE AREA. IT IS

OVER WEST/MIDDLE TN STRUGGLE THE FOLLOWING DAY COMING INTO E TN.
THESE SHOWERS/STORMS DO HAVE SOME WEAK UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT...BUT
CLOUD TOPS HAVE BEEN WARMING AND THE OVERALL RADAR SHOWS WEAKENING
ON THIS LEADING EDGE. SO HAVE SHUFFLED POPS A LITTLE FOR THIS
AFTERNOON...RAISING WEST AND LOWERING EAST...BUT STILL MOST OF THE
AREA IN THE "LIKELY" CATEGORY. ALSO HAVE TAKEN OUT THE MENTION OF
HEAVY RAINS FOR THIS AFTERNOON. FARTHER WEST...WARM ADVECTION
AREA...MOVING FROM W TN INTO MID TN...LOOKS TO BE MUCH BETTER AT
SUSTAINING ITSELF. THIS AREA IS MOVING EAST...BUT THE NORTHERN EDGE
IS SLIDING SLIGHTLY SOUTH...SO IT APPEARS THAT SOUTHERN AREAS OF
OUR CWA WILL HAVE THE BEST CHANCE OF GETTING THIS PRECIP. HAVE LEFT
THE MAX TEMPS AS IS.

480 
FXUS64 KMRX 220822
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
422 AM EDT MON JUL 22 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...IN THE MIDST OF A BREAK IN 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EARLY THIS MORNING...SO FORECAST GRIDS 
WERE ADJUSTED IN THE PRE 12Z GRIDS TO REFLECT THIS. SATELLITE PICS 
SHOW A SHORTWAVE MOVING ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION 
AND I THINK THAT THE NAM 12KM MODEL HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THIS 
FEATURE FOR TODAY. THE 22/00Z RNK/OHX UPPER AIR SOUNDINGS SHOWED 
PRECIPITABLE WATER (PWAT) VALUES ON THE ORDER OF AROUND 1.75 TO 2.05 
INCHES. EXPECTING RATHER WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS TO BE UNDERWAY BY MID TO LATE MORNING ACROSS AT LEAST 
THE WRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. NUDGED POPS UP BY 16Z TO THE 
UPPER END OF LIKELY...AND CONSIDERED CATEGORICAL POPS BRIEFLY.

COORDINATED ON POSSIBLY ISSUING A FLOOD WATCH (FLASH FLOODING)...
BUT THE POCKETS OF HEAVY RAINS OVER THE PAST 24 TO 48 HOURS HAVE 
BEEN QUITE RANDOM AND LOCALIZED. RIVERS ALSO RUNNING WELL BELOW 
FLOOD STAGES AT THIS TIME. THUS...AFTER COORDINATION WITH ADJACENT 
NWS OFFICES...WILL JUST HIGHLIGHT LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS IN FORECAST 
PRODUCTS (ZFP/HWO) FOR NOW. 

MOS POPS ARE RUNNING HIGHER FOR TONIGHT...BUT COVERAGE SHOULD BE ON 
THE DECREASE AFTER 23/00Z TO 23/03Z. INCREASED POPS SLIGHTLY FOR 
EASTERN AREAS WITH GOOD CHANCE POPS IN WESTERN AREAS EARLY TONIGHT. 

GIVEN THE EARLY ONSET OF CONVECTION TODAY AND HIGH PWAT VALUES...
WILL UNDERCUT THE GFS MOS MAXES BY A FEW DEGREES AGAIN TODAY. MOS 
MINS FOR TONIGHT CLOSELY FOLLOWED.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MAIN SHORT WAVE WITH UPPER
TROUGH AXIS TO SHIFT EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY TUESDAY WITH
NEXT WEAK FRONT MOVING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY BY LATE TUESDAY. THIS
NEXT FRONT WILL TRIGGER SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS BY
AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. SOME STORMS MAY BECOME STRONG ALONG THE PLATEAU
BEFORE WEAKENING MOVING INTO THE LOWER ELEVATIONS. THE WEAK FRONT
WILL MAKE IT SOUTHEAST AS UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS ACROSS THE EASTERN
STATES WEDNESDAY. RIGHT NOW NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO HAVE POPS
LIKELY BUT CHANCE AS NAM AND GFS SUGGEST ALTHOUGH GFS NOT AS
AGGRESSIVE WITH RAIN CHANCES. A LITTLE MORE SUN TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY WHICH WILL WARM TEMPERATURES BACK TO NEAR NORMAL. BY
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY FRONT WILL BE SOUTH OF THE REGION. RESIDUAL
MOISTURE AND HEATING WILL ALLOW MAINLY ISOLATED SHOWERS AND STORMS
OVER SOUTHEAST SECTIONS...MAINLY EASTERN MOUNTAINS. AS MAJOR TROUGH
RESIDES OVER THE EASTERN STATES A NEW DISTURBANCE AND FRONT WILL
MOVE SOUTHEAST IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT AND GIVE THE REGION RENEWED
CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS LATE SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES
WILL BE SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL FROM THURSDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

&&

NOT RULE OUT A SEVERE WARNING OR TWO.

MONDAY MORNING...BEFORE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS BEGIN DEVELOPING 
AGAIN. WITH AMOUNT OF MOISTURE REMAINING IN THE ATMOSPHERE...MAIN 
THREAT WILL CONTINUE TO BE HEAVY RAIN...WITH LOCALIZED FLASH 
FLOODING POSSIBLE. WITH MOISTURE AND CLOUD COVER...LOWERED TEMPS A 
COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE TONIGHT AND TOMORROW. BROKEN TO 
OVERCAST SKIES WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA THROUGH MONDAY. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS ARE STILL
CONSISTENT ON THE WHOLE...GRADUALLY DIMINISHING PRECIP CHANCES
TUESDAY TO THURSDAY WITH ONLY 20 PCT CHANCES THURS AND
FRI...CREEPING BACK UP TO CHC POPS AREAWIDE SATURDAY. THE WET
PATTERN WILL BE TEMPORARILY SCOURED OUT BY UPPER TROUGH AND SFC
FRONT MIDWEEK. TEMPS MAY BE TRICKY AS ECMWF MOS IS IN MID 80S FOR
KNOXVILLE FOR HIGH TEMPS LATTER HALF OF WEEK...BUT GFS IS NEAR 90.
I/LL LEAN TOWARD THE WARMER SIDE WITH THE REDUCED CLOUD COVER.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
409 AM EDT SUN JUL 21 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ISOLATED SHOWERS AND STORMS OVER 
THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY COUNTIES OF EAST TN HAD NEARLY 
DISSIPATED AT FORECAST PACKAGE ISSUANCE. A MORE CONCENTRATED AREA OF 
CONVECTION OVER NRN MIDDLE TN AND CENTRAL KY HAD ALSO WEAKENED 
OVERNIGHT. I ADJUSTED THE PRE 12Z AND MORNING FORECAST GRIDS TO 
REFLECT THIS BRIEF BREAK IN SHOWERS AND STORMS...WITH INCREASING 
RAIN CHANCES BY THE AFTERNOON. 

WEAK COLD FRONT IS STILL WELL TO OUR NORTH PER 07Z SURFACE MAP... 
ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THE FRONT SAGS A BIT SOUTHWARD TODAY 
AND SATELLITE PICS SHOW A DEVELOPING CIRCULATION OVER THE SRN AND 
MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THIS MORNING. THESE FEATURES PLUS THE MOIST 
AND UNSTABLE AIR MASS IN PLACE...EASILY SUPPORT LIKELY POPS FOR LATER 
TODAY AS WELL FOR AT LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF TONIGHT. NUDGED POPS UP 
IN LINE WITH 21/00Z MOS POPS. 

SPOTTY AREAS HAVE SEEN SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS FROM LATE WEEK INTO 
SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT MUCH OF THE AREA HAS SEEN NO RAIN TO LESS THAN 
1/2 INCH. THUS...WILL NOT ISSUE ANY FLOOD WATCHES JUST YET...ALTHOUGH 
RAIN CHANCES REMAIN ABOVE CLIMO RIGHT INTO MID NEXT WEEK.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO
THE NORTH AND GULF MOISTURE BEING ADVECTED INTO THE REGION WILL
KEEP SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
MONDAY AND MONDAY EVENING...DECREASING LATER MONDAY NIGHT. RAINFALL
AMOUNTS COULD BE AROUND AN INCH IN PARTS OF THE REGION. NOT SURE
WHERE HIGHEST TOTALS WILL BE AT THIS TIME BUT LOCALIZED FLOODING
WILL REMAIN POSSIBLE IN SOME LOCATIONS. UPPER TROUGH SETTLES OVER
THE FORECAST AREA AND THEN SHIFTS SLIGHTLY EAST INTO NC BY TUESDAY.
MODELS TRY TO SHIFT BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT TO THE SOUTH AND EAST
TUESDAY SO SLIGHTLY LOWER POPS TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. WEDNESDAY
SURFACE LOW TO THE NORTH ALONG SLOW MOVING FRONT TO PASS THROUGH
AND INCREASE SHOWERS AND STORMS AGAIN. FRONT FINALLY EXPECTED TO
DROP SOUTH DURING THE DAY THURSDAY. SOME DRYING TO TAKE PLACE LATER
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT SO DROPPED POPS THURSDAY NIGHT. FRIDAY
WEAK HIGH PRESSURE MOVES IN BEHIND FRONT WITH UPPER TROUGH STILL
OVER EASTERN STATES FOR A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY. THIS CHANGE WILL BE
BRIEF AS NEW SURFACE LOW MOVES INTO THE TN VALLEY WITH ANOTHER
FRONT. CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION AGAIN LATE SATURDAY OR SATURDAY
NIGHT. DAY TIME TEMPERATURES WILL BE SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL THROUGH
MOST OF THE EXTENDED BUT NEAR NORMAL AT NIGHT. WILL FOLLOW CLOSE TO
THE WARMER MAV NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TONIGHT IN THE EARLY MORNING PACKAGE. CARRIED VCSH FOR NOW IN THE

743 
FXUS64 KMRX 201847
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT SAT JUL 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...A COLD FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO
MOVE TOWARDS THE AREA. INSTABILITIES AHEAD OF THIS FRONT WILL CAUSE
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO CONTINUE TO DEVELOP INTO THE EARLY
EVENING. A MIDLEVEL CLOUD DECK MOVING INTO THE AREA WILL KEEP A
WEAK CAP ON THE ENVIRONMENT. ANY STORMS THAT DO FORM THIS AFTERNOON
AND EVENING ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE SEVERE. ISOLATED SHOWERS ARE
POSSIBLE LATE INTO SATURDAY EVENING AS THE COLD FRONT STALLS NORTH
OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT.

A BRIEF BREAK FROM THE PRECIP EARLY SUNDAY MORNING...AND SCATTERED
SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP EARLY IN
THE AFTERNOON ON SUNDAY. INSTABILITIES ARE VERY WEAK...WITH A LOT
OF MOISTURE PRESENT THROUGH THE ATMOSPHERE. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS
LOOK TO BE THE MAIN THREAT...WITH VERY LOW CHANCE FOR ANY SEVERE
STORMS. WINDS COULD BECOME GUSTY AROUND ANY THUNDERSTORM...BUT
OTHERWISE WILL REMAIN LIGHT THROUGH THE PERIOD. 

CLOUD COVER WILL INCREASE TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY
TO OVERCAST SKIES EXPECTED. TEMPERATURES WILL HAVE LESS OF A
GRADIENT BETWEEN HIGH AND LOW THAN THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS...DUE
MAINLY TO THE CLOUD COVER AND MOISTURE ADVECTION FROM THE
SOUTHEAST. HIGH TEMPERATURES ON SUNDAY WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES
COOLER THAN HIGH TEMPERATURES THIS PAST WEEK.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS ARE STAYING
CONSISTENT WITH THE MAIN THEMES...WHICH INCLUDE THE BEST CHANCES OF
RAIN EARLY IN THE WEEK INCLUDING MONDAY...THEN A DIMINISHING OF
DAILY CONVECTION BEGINNING WEDNESDAY TO THE SCATTERED VARIETY...
THEN DIMINISHING FURTHER TO THE ISOLATED VARIETY BY THE END OF THE
WEEK. TEMPS WILL PROBABLY WARM DUE TO DECREASED CLOUDINESS DURING
THE SECOND HALF OF NEXT WEEK...BUT ANY NOTABLE RIDGE BUILDING INTO
THE AREA IS NOT ON TAP UNTIL FRIDAY...AND THAT MAY BE A SHORT-LIVED
TRANSIENT RIDGE AS MODELS SUGGEST ANOTHER EAST COAST TROUGH BY THE
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEKEND.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DEBRIS CLOUDS ABOUT THINNED OUT 
THIS MORNING...SO PATCHY AREAS OF FOG SHOULD BE DEVELOPING. MOIST 
AIR MASS REMAINS UNSTABLE EVEN AT THIS EARLY HOUR...SO ISOLATED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE JUST ABOUT ANY TIME TODAY.

THE UPPER RIDGE IS STILL A BIT OF A FACTOR FOR TODAY WITH UPPER FLOW 
BECOMING MORE ZONAL WITH TIME. THUS...THINKING CONVECTION FOR LATER 
TODAY AND TONIGHT WILL BE ON THE ORDER OF ISOLATED TO SCATTERED IN 
COVERAGE. PREVIOUS WEATHER AND POP GRIDS LOOKED ON TRACK AROUND 30 
TO 40 PERCENT FOR TODAY...THEN 40 TO 50 PERCENT FOR TONIGHT. 

FOR TEMPS...07Z TEMPS QUITE MILD WHERE NO RAIN OCCURRED YESTERDAY 
WHICH FAVORS GOING CLOSE TO THE WARMER GFS MOS MAXES FOR TODAY. 
STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO GFS MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...BERMUDA HIGH OFF THE EAST
COAST STAYS PUT WHILE COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO VALLEY SINKS SLOWLY
SOUTH AND COMBINES TO PRODUCE INFLOW OF MOISTURE AND INCREASE IN
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY CONTINUING THROUGH MID WEEK. THE
FRONT WILL SLOWLY PUSH THROUGH WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY WITH SOME
DRYING AND MORE TYPICAL SUMMERTIME CONVECTION THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.
HIGHS WILL BE COOLER SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY IN THE 80S...BUT MAY
WARM A LITTLE SOUTH WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. NIGHT TIME
TEMPERATURES STAY MILD THROUGH THE PERIOD MOSTLY UPPER 60S TO LOWER
70S. A FEW STRONG STORMS EACH DAY WITH HIGH WINDS AND LOCALIZED
FLOODING POSSIBLE DUE TO ALREADY SATURATED GROUND.

EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK WILL GRADUALLY TRANSITION TO A LITTLE MORE 
DEFINED TROUGH BY MIDWEEK. LOTS OF MOISTURE WILL BE IN PLACE FOR 
DAILY ROUNDS OF DIURNAL CONVECTION. MODELS ARE NOT IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
ABOUT TIMING OF CONVECTION-ORGANIZING DISTURBANCES...BUT GFS 
ENSEMBLES AND ECMWF ENSEMBLES BOTH AGREE ON GOOD CHANCES OF PRECIP 
EACH PERIOD /40-50%/ UNTIL WEDNESDAY...THEN CHANCES DIMINISH TO 
20-30% RANGE FOR THUR AND FRI. IF NOT A SFC FROPA...THEN PROBABLY AN 
H5 TROUGH PASSAGE WILL HELP SCOUR OUT THE ABUNDANCE OF MOISTURE 
LEADING TO THE LESS ACTIVE LATE-WEEK PATTERN.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
423 AM EDT FRI JUL 19 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CLOUDS THINNED OUT OVERNIGHT
BUT FOG HAS BEEN VERY PATCHY AND NOT THAT DENSE SO FAR. AIR MASS
WILL BECOME QUITE UNSTABLE BY LATE MORNING INTO THIS AFTERNOON...BUT
COVERAGE LOOKS TO BE SCATTERED AT BEST. WILL CONTINUE THE CHANCE
POPS FOR ALL BUT SRN VALLEY (CHA) WHERE POPS WERE LOWERED TO SLIGHT
CHANCE. MODEL SOUNDINGS SUGGEST A THREAT OF MARGINAL SEVERE HAIL
WITH DRIER AIR IN THE MID LEVELS AND BELOW CLOUD BASES...SO
DAMAGING WINDS POSSIBLE AGAIN WITH THE STRONGEST STORMS THIS
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. LET RAIN CHANCES FALL TO SLIGHT CHANCE AFTER
MIDNIGHT WITH LOSS OF HEATING...AND WEAK COLD FRONT STILL WELL TO
OUR NW.

PERSISTENCE ON MAX TEMPS TODAY...STAYING BELOW MID 90S GIVEN THE 
WEAKENING OF THE UPPER RIDGE...PLUS HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER CONTENT.
GFS MOS MINS LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...BERMUDA HIGH OVER THE
SOUTHEAST RETREATS MORE TO THE SOUTHEAST AS COLD FRONT MOVES DOWN
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY AND
SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS FRONT MOVES TO JUST NORTH OF THE REGION SUNDAY
BUT WILL GET HUNG UP AND NOT MOVE THROUGH. THE HIGH OVER THE SOUTHEAST
AND GULF MOVES LITTLE AND THE SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL CONTINUE
TO KEEP ABUNDANT MOISTURE OVER THE AREA. RAIN CHANCES SATURDAY
SIMILAR TO TODAY BUT WILL INCREASE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY.
KEEPING POPS HIGH THROUGH TUESDAY MONDAY AS SHORTWAVES BRING WAVE
AFTER WAVE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE
LIKELY IN THE AFTERNOON AND A CHANCE OVERNIGHT. ANOTHER FRONT
APPROACHES THURSDAY SO STILL HAVE CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE END OF
THE EXTENDED. RAINFALL AMOUNTS SUNDAY AND MONDAY MAY BE HEAVY
ENOUGH FOR LOCALIZED FLOODING LIKE HAS BEEN SEEN THIS PAST WEEK.
A FEW STRONG STORMS MAY PRODUCE DAMAGING WINDS AND LARGE HAIL ALSO.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             92  71  90  72  88 /  20  20  40  50  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  90  71  90  71  87 /  30  20  40  50  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       91  70  90  71  87 /  30  20  30  60  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              89  67  89  67  86 /  30  20  30  50  60

SYNOPTIC SHIFTS. SCATTERED SLOW MOVING THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN POSSIBLE 
ON FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...EXTENDED WILL SEE 
GRADUAL TRANSITION FROM WEAK FLOW ALOFT BETWEEN BERMUDA HIGH OVER 
BERMUDA AND WEAK LOW OVER LA ON FRIDAY NIGHT...TO WEAK ZONAL FLOW BY 
SUNDAY NIGHT...TO TROUGHING BY WEDNESDAY. THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD 
MOISTURE WILL BE FAIRLY ABUNDANT OVER THE REGION...ALLOWING FOR 
MAINLY DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION THROUGH THE PERIOD. HIGHEST POPS 
IN FCST ARE SAT NGT AND SUNDAY WITH LIKELY CATEGORY CONVECTION FOR 
THE NORTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS AS SHORTWAVE CROSSES TO THE NORTH.

FXUS64 KMRX 180631

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 AM EDT THU JUL 18 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE IN THE WEATHER 
PATTERN THROUGH THE SHORT TERM WITH A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
REMAINING ANCHORED OVER REGION.  THIS TRANSLATED INTO CONTINUED HOT 
AND HUMID CONDITIONS TODAY WITH NORMAL AFTERNOON DIURNAL CONVECTION 
EXPECTED.  COVERAGE SHOULD BE LESS THAN WEDNESDAY/S ACTIVITY WITH 
BEST CHANCE OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  LIMITED CONVECTION MAY LINGER 
INTO THE EVENING HOURS WITH ONLY A STRAY STORM POSSIBLE OVER THE 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
OVERALL AGREEMENT FOR THE SYNOPTIC PATTERN FOR THE LONG 
TERM...ALTHOUGH RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN A BIT SUSPECT.  
FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE.  WEAKENING UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
OVER THE REGION WILL CONTINUE TO BREAK DOWN FRIDAY AND WILL BE 
REPLACED BY A SHALLOW EASTERN US TROUGH BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND 
INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.  A COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO PUSH IN DURING 
THE WEEKEND...BUT WILL LIKELY STALL OUT OVER THE AREA.  LOOKS FAIRLY 
UNSETTLED FOR THE PERIOD...WITH SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY.  WILL CARRY HIGHEST POPS SAT NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY WHEN THE FRONT WILL MOST LIKELY BE SAGGING INTO THE AREA.    
GFS MOS TEMPS LOOK A BIT HIGH AT TIMES FOR MAX TEMPS GIVEN EXPECTED 
CLOUDS AND CONVECTION. WILL MAKE SOME MOSTLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.

FXUS64 KMRX 172331
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
731 PM EDT WED JUL 17 2013

.AVIATION...INTENSE HEATING AND A WEAK DISTURBANCE BUILDING WEST IN
THE CIRCULATION AROUND THE MIDWEST HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM LEAD TO THE
DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION. THE GREATEST COVERAGE OF CONVECTION AT THE
CURRENT HOUR IS AROUND TRI WITH SOME THUNDERSTORMS LOITERING IN THE
SMOKYS AND SMOKY FOOTHILLS. WOULD EXPECT PRECIPITATION AROUND TRI
FOR ANOTHER COUPLE HOURS AND SOME SHOWERS COULD BUILD INTO THE
VICINITY OF TYS IN THE NEXT TWO HOURS BEFORE WEAKENING WITH THE
LOSS OF HEATING. FOG LOOKS LIKE A GOOD IDEA AT TRI WHERE THE
HEAVENS OPENED UP FOR A LENGTHY PERIOD. MVFR CONDITIONS WILL LIKELY
DETERIORATE TO IFR AND POSSIBLY LIFR AROUND SUNRISE. THURSDAY
MAY BE SIMILAR WITH CONVECTION FIRING ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN.
PROBABILITY TOO LOW TO INCLUDE TSRA AT A PARTICULAR TERMINAL IN THE
RIDGE PATTERN.

241 
FXUS64 KMRX 171835
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT WED JUL 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
VERY LITTLE CHANGE IN THE OVERALL WEATHER PATTERN IS EXPECTED IN THE 
SHORT TERM AS A DEEP RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE 
OHIO AND TN VALLEY REGIONS. CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON WILL DISSIPATE 
AFTER SUNSET WITH NO MID/UPPER LEVEL FORCING FOR LIFT OVERNIGHT. 
PATCHY VALLEY FOG MAY DEVELOP...ESPECIALLY NEAR BODIES OF WATER OR 
LOCATIONS THAT SAW RAIN THIS AFTERNOON. EXPECT MUCH THE SAME 
TOMORROW...WITH AFTERNOON CONVECTION DEVELOPING IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN AND SLOWLY DRIFTING INTO THE VALLEY. WHILE A FEW STORMS MAY 
BECOME STRONG...NO SEVERE STORMS ARE EXPECTED. WILL FOLLOW 
PERSISTENCE FOR TEMPERATURES...WITH LOWS IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 
70S BOTH NIGHTS...AND HIGHS TOMORROW IN THE UPPER 80S LOWER 90S IN 
MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)... 
THE UPPER-RIDGE BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN ON FRIDAY AS IT PUSHES EAST
AND A BROAD LONGWAVE TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION.
THIS WILL DRIVE A SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT INTO THE OHIO VALLEY LATE
FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...AND EVENTUALLY INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY LATE SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY. MODELS
ARE ALSO INDICATING THE POTENTIAL FOR A PLUME OF GULF MOISTURE TO
PUSH NORTHWARD INTO THE REGION THIS WEEKEND...WHICH COULD LEAD TO
SOME SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCES FOR DIURNAL CONVECTION ON SATURDAY.
THEREAFTER...POPS INCREASE TO LIKELY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY AS
THE FRONT SAGS SOUTH INTO THE AREA. THOUGH NOTHING WIDESPREAD IS
EXPECTED...HIGH INSTABILITY AND SOME MODERATE SHEAR WILL ALLOW FOR
SOME STORM ORGANIZATION AND FOR SOME STORMS TO BECOME STRONG TO
SEVERE...BRINGING THE POSSIBILITY OF DAMAGING WINDS...HAIL AND
ESPECIALLY LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL.

THE FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH AND OUT OF THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY...BUT THE SLOW MOVING UPPER-TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL 
ALLOW FOR A FEW SHORTWAVES TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA DURING THE EARLY 
TO MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL YIELD A REASONABLE CHANCE 
FOR SCATTERED CONVECTION EACH DAY AND SOME COOLER TEMPERATURES IN 
THE MID TO UPPER 80S GIVEN THE ADDITIONAL CLOUD COVER EXPECTED. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             72  93  72  92  72 /  20  30  10  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  71  92  72  90  72 /  20  20  10  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       71  92  71  89  72 /  20  20  10  30  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              68  91  68  87  68 /  30  20  20  30  30

.AVIATION...
SO FAR THIS AFTERNOON...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE BEEN
DEVELOPING OVER SW VA AND NE TN. THUS TRI IS THE SITE WITH THE BEST
CHANCES OF THUNDER THROUGH SUNSET...SO WILL INCLUDE A VCTS THERE.
CHANCES AT TYS AND CHA ARE TOO LOW AT THIS POINT TO WARRANT A
MENTION...BUT CANNOT BE ENTIRELY RULED OUT. SOME MODEL GUIDANCE IS
INDICATING DENSE FOG AT TRI OVERNIGHT...AND THIS CERTAINLY MAY
OCCUR IF A SHOWERS HITS THE TERMINAL THIS AFTERNOON. BUT AT THIS
POINT...WILL JUST HAVE A PERIOD OF MVFR FOG...AND LET LATER TAFS
LOWER VIS IF NEEDED.

FXUS64 KMRX 171331 AAA

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
931 AM EDT WED JUL 17 2013

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN CENTERED OVER THE OHIO VALLEY
TODAY...PRODUCING A NE FLOW ALOFT OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.
WITH A LACK OF SYNOPTIC FORCING...CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT WILL FAVOR
THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU. LIKE
YESTERDAY...CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER WESTERN
NC...AND DRIFT W-SW. THE RUC AND NAM ARE IN AGREEMENT WITH THIS
SCENARIO. POPS WILL BE ADJUSTED UPWARD SLIGHTLY IN THE MOUNTAINS
AND PLATEAU...AND LOWERED SLIGHTLY IN THE VALLEY. 

BASED ON THE 1000-850 THICKNESS VALUES FROM THE 12Z OHX
SOUNDING...WHICH ARE HIGHER TODAY THAN YESTERDAY...AND CURRENT OBS
WHICH ARE RUNNING A BIT ABOVE FORECAST...WILL RAISE HIGH TEMPS A
FEW DEGREES.

FXUS64 KMRX 170631
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 AM EDT WED JUL 17 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES 
TO SIT OVER THE REGION TODAY.  THIS WILL PROVIDE ANOTHER HOT DAY 
WITH TEMPERATURES REACHING TO AROUND 90 ACROSS MANY VALLEY 
LOCATIONS.  WITH STRONG HEATING AND DEW POINTS AROUND THE 70 DEGREE 
MARK...THE AIR MASS WITH BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON.  
A WEAK IMPULSE TRACKING THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW WILL AID THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS.  COVERAGE SHOULD BE A BIT 
MORE THAN TUESDAY/S CONVECTION BUT SHOULD REMAIN SCATTERED WITH BEST 
CHANCES OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  CONVECTION WILL LINGER INTO THE EVENING 
EVENING BEFORE ENDING OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
OVERALL AGREEMENT FOR THE SYNOPTIC PATTERN FOR THE LONG TERM.  UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE REGION WILL GRADUALLY BREAK DOWN AND BE 
REPLACED BY AN EASTERN US TROUGH BY THE END OF THE WEEKEND INTO 
EARLY NEXT WEEK.  A COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO PUSH INTO THE AREA 
DURING THE WEEKEND...BUT EXACTLY HOW FAR SOUTH IT WILL MAKE IT IS 
STILL UNCERTAIN.  EXPECT SCATTERED CONVECTION ESPECIALLY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING FOR THU AND FRIDAY...THEN INCREASED CHANCES FOR 
CONVECTION DURING THE WEEKEND AS THE FRONT APPROACHES/MOVES IN.  
SOME AT LEAST LIMITED DRYING INDICATED EARLY IN THE WEEK BUT FRONT 
MAY BE STALLED OVER THE AREA SO WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS BOTH MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY.  GFS MOS TEMPS LOOK A BIT HIGH AT TIMES FOR MAX TEMPS 
AND A BIT LOW FOR MINS...SO WILL MAKE SOME MOSTLY MINOR
ADJUSTMENTS. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             92  72  92  72  92 /  30  30  30  20  30

606 
FXUS64 KMRX 161912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT TUE JUL 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A MOSTLY SUNNY AND WARMER DAY 
SO FAR ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH TEMPERATURES REACHING THE UPPER 
80S TO NEAR 90.  CLOUD COVER IS SCATTERED WITH ONLY A FEW SHOWERS 
JUST BEGINNING TO DEVELOP ACROSS SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. AIR MASS 
IS MODERATELY UNSTABLE TODAY WITH MORE MOISTURE SOUTH AND DRIER 
NORTH. EXPECT MOST OF THE ACTIVITY TO BE SOUTH AND OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS THROUGH EARLY THIS EVENING.

A PERSISTENCE FORECAST TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY FOR TEMPERATURES...WITH 
LOWS TONIGHT LIKE THIS MORNINGS AND HIGHS WEDNESDAY SIMILAR TO 
TODAYS. AIR MASS EVEN MORE UNSTABLE WEDNESDAY WITH NO CAP SOUTH AND 
MORE OF A CAP NORTH. AS THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS WEST THE FORECAST 
AREA WILL BE ALONG THE SOUTHERN SIDE OF THE RIDGE WHERE STRONG 
HEATING...INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE WILL ALLOW SCATTERED MULTI CELL 
STORMS TO DEVELOP WITHIN THE MOIST AND MODERATELY UNSTABLE WARM 
SECTOR AND SPREAD WEST ALONG THE SOUTHERN BORDER OF THE UPPER RIDGE. 
SOME OF THIS ACTIVITY MIGHT PRODUCE ISOLATED STRONG TO DAMAGING WIND 
GUSTS PER SPC DAY 2 OUTLOOK.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE WEEKEND...AND 
SHOW THE MID-WESTERN HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM WEAKENING LATER THIS WEEK 
WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA THIS WEEKEND. 
MODELS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE STRENGTH OF AN UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH THIS WEEKEND...WITH THE GFS MODEL INDICATING A DEEPER TROUGH 
WHICH PUSHES THE WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...THE ECMWF AND CANADIAN MODELS REVEAL A WEAKER 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WHICH DOESN'T PUSH THIS COLD FRONT COMPLETELY 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA EARLY NEXT WEEK. FOR NOW...WILL PLAN TO 
TREND TOWARDS THE WETTER ECMWF AND CANADIAN SOLUTIONS FOR EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...SINCE THIS SCENARIO OF STALLING COLD FRONTS AROUND THE 
MOUNTAINS IS MORE TYPICAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. OVERALL...THE 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION SHOULD SLOWLY INCREASE THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... 
ESPECIALLY AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...WITH THE GFS AND ECMWF 
MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT ORGANIZED CONVECTION WILL BEGIN TO 
AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT. WITH A MODERATELY TO 
HIGHLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS PROGGED TO DEVELOP EACH AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...THINK THAT SOME STORMS COULD BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE WITH 
DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL...ESPECIALLY THIS WEEKEND 
WHEN THE COLD FRONT NEARS THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS MORE IN LINE WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

NEAR OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE 90 DEGREES THIS AFTERNOON.  MAV TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO JUST SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS...MAINLY 
DOWN SLIGHTLY ON HIGHS AND UP SLIGHTLY ON LOWS.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BE POSITIONED OVER THE EASTERN U.S EARLY IN THE EXTENDED WITH 
THE UPPER FLOW SLOWLY BECOMING ZONAL OVER THE REGION BY FRIDAY.  
THE COMBINATION OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN PLACE...A WEAK TO 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS AND A COUPLE OF MINOR IMPULSES RIDING 
THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW WILL PROVIDE THE INGREDIENTS FOR SCATTERED 
CONVECTION...MAINLY DIURNAL... WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.  
HOWEVER...MAIN SYSTEM OF CONCERN THROUGH THE PERIOD WILL BE A COLD 
FRONT PROGGED INTO THE AREA LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  THIS 
WILL PROVIDE OUR BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION AND HAVE KEPT LIKELY POPS 
OVER THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND ADDED LIKELY POPS NORTH SATURDAY NIGHT.  
IMPROVING CONDITIONS ON MONDAY WITH POPS DECREASING TO LOW CHANCE 
CATEGORY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON JUL 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING CONTINUES 
OVER THE MID ATLANTIC AND OHIO VALLEYS EXTENDING SOUTH INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON. CLOCKWISE FLOW AROUND THE SYSTEM IS 
KEEPING AN EAST TO SOUTHEAST FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SKIES ARE 
MOSTLY SUNNY NORTH TO PARTLY CLOUDY SOUTH. SHOWERS AND STORMS OVER 
SC AND GA ARE MOVING FROM SE TO NW BUT ARE DISSIPATING BEFORE THEY 
REACH SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. SOUNDINGS 
SHOW THE SOUTHERN AREA IS CAPPED TODAY BUT MODELS STILL BRING SOME 
OF THE ACTIVITY LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING INTO THE 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS BEFORE DYING OUT WITH COOLING. TEMPERATURES AND 
DEW POINTS ARE FAIRLY UNIFORM WITH HIGHS REACHING THE MID 80S SO 
FAR...COOLER HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND DEW POINTS MID TO UPPER 60S.  

WILL KEEP THE ISOLATED POPS IN BEFORE 00Z TONIGHT WITH SKIES CLEARING
AND TEMPERATURES DROPPING INTO THE MID 60S NORTH TO NEAR 70 SOUTH. 
TUESDAY ALMOST A REPEAT OF TODAYS FORECAST BUT A LITTLE MORE 
MOISTURE. HAVE ISOLATED POPS PLATEAU AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS FROM VA 
TO NC. THE INSTABILITY IS GREATER AND WITH NO CAP SO IF ACTIVITY 
DEVELOPS A FEW STORMS COULD BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE. HIGHS ALSO A 
LITTLE WARMER. NAM PRODUCING MORE CLOUDS AND BETTER CHANCE SHOWERS 
SO COOLER THAN MAV WHICH IS BONE DRY AND 90 TO 95. WILL GO WITH 
HIGHS 90 TO 92 VALLEYS AND 80S ELSEWHERE OUTSIDE THE HIGHER 
MOUNTAINS.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL THE MID WEST HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WEAKENING THIS WEEK WHICH WILL ALLOW A WEAK COLD FRONT TO APPROACH 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS WEEKEND. MOISTURE IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY 
INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS WEEK...WITH THE COVERAGE OF 
CONVECTION SLOWLY INCREASING EACH DAY...ESPECIALLY AROUND THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. WITH A MODERATELY TO HIGHLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS PROGGED TO 
DEVELOP EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING...THINK THAT SOME STORMS COULD 
BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL. THE HIGHEST POPS FOR THIS WEEK WILL BE OVER THE WEEKEND... 
WHEN THE WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND LIKELY STALLS NEAR THE 
FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE 
GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS MORE IN 
LINE WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION WITH EVEN BETTER CHANCES FOR

CONVECTION FORMING UPSTREAM ACROSS THE MIDWEST AND DROPPING 
SOUTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. THE UPPER TROUGH 
AMPLIFIES TO SUCH A DEGREE BY SUNDAY THAT A COOL FRONT BUILDS SOUTH 
INTO THE REGION. RAISED POPS TO THE LIKELY CATEGORY FOR THE BIG 
FRONTAL PUSH. FOR TEMPERATURES TRIED TO STAY A LITTLE COOLER THAN 
MEX MOS MAXES WHILE ADJUSTING A LITTLE ABOVE SUGGESTED MINS.

144 
FXUS64 KMRX 141830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT SUN JUL 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...
A SE FLOW ON THE SW SIDE OF A STRONG RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO FEED 
MOISTURE INTO THE AREA TONIGHT. HOWEVER THERE IS LITTLE ORGANIZED 
LIFT...AND SHOWERS ARE DIURNALLY DRIVEN. SO THE CURRENT ACTIVITY 
WILL LIKELY DISSIPATE A FEW HOURS AFTER SUNSET. BY MORNING THE 
STRONG RIDGE WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE UPPER OH RIVER REGION...WHICH 
WILL PUSH THE DEEP MOISTURE TO OUR WEST AND HAVE A STABILIZING 
INFLUENCE OVER MOST OF OUR AREA. SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA LOOK TO 
REMAIN UNDER AN EASTERLY FLOW OFF THE ATLANTIC...SO WILL KEEP A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING THERE. SUBSIDENCE UNDER THE RIDGE AND SOME 
DOWNSLOPE WINDS WILL HELP RAISE TEMPS TOMORROW INTO THE UPPER 80S 
AND LOWER 90S IN MOST SPOTS WITH SCATTERED CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH THE END OF 
THE WORK WEEK. TUESDAY LOOKS TO HAVE THE BEST CHANCE FOR DRY 
WEATHER...WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS AND THE PLATEAU. MOISTURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE ADVECTED INTO THE AREA THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED...WITH THE CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS INCREASING EACH DAY. 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY HAVE ENOUGH INSTABILITY EACH DAY FOR DIURNAL 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP. THE SOUNDINGS DO NOT LOOK TOO IMPRESSIVE IN 
TERMS OF WIND SHEAR AND INSTABILITY...SO DO NOT EXPECT MUCH SEVERE 
WEATHER WITH THESE STORMS.

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN CANADA WILL PROGRESS EASTWARD WITH A COLD 
FRONT AFFECTING THE AREA FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND. MODELS HAVE 
BEEN CONSISTENT WITH WIDESPREAD COVERAGE EACH DAY SO CONFIDENCE 
FAIRLY HIGH WITH THIS SYSTEM. HOWEVER...STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY OF 
WHETHER THE FRONT WILL BE STRONG ENOUGH FOR SEVERE WEATHER. RECENT 
MODEL RUNS SHOW A VERY MOIST PROFILE WITH UNIMPRESSIVE WINDS. WITH 
THIN CAPE AND WEAK SHEAR...DONT EXPECT ANYTHING SEVERE WITH THIS 
SYSTEM AT THIS TIME. 

HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL TRY TO REACH 90...BUT WITH THE AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE AND CLOUD COVER OVER THE NEXT WEEK...DONT EXPECT TOO MANY 
PLACES OTHER THAN THE FAR SOUTHERN AREA TO GET INTO THE 90S. WENT 
SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPERATURES AND SEVERAL 
DEGREES ABOVE GUIDANCE FOR THE LOW TEMPERATURES EACH DAY. WITH THE 
AMOUNT OF MOISTURE RECENTLY RECEIVED...AS WELL AS THE ADDITIONAL 
MOISTURE EACH DAY...NOT LOOKING AT A WIDE RANGE OF TEMPERATURES. 

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 140759
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT SUN JUL 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW IS CENTERED TO OUR WEST 
OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY...AND WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE WEST.  BAND 
OF DEEPER MOISTURE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA TODAY AND THEN OFF TO 
OUR WEST.  LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCES FOR CONVECTION WILL BE SOUTH 
TODAY...SO WILL CARRY POPS AS HIGH AS LIKELY FOR SOUTHWEST ZONES.  
LOWER CHANCES FURTHER NORTH ESPECIALLY IN THE VALLEY WHERE DOWNSLOPE 
FLOW SHOULD HELP TO INHIBIT CONVECTION.  ISOLATED SHOWERS OR 
THUNDERSTORMS MAY LINGER INTO EARLY TONIGHT SOUTHERN ZONES...BUT 
OTHERWISE TONIGHT EXPECTED TO BE PRECIP FREE.   WILL MAKE ONLY A FEW 
MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS FOR THE SHORT TERM.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MASSIVE RIDGE CENTERED OVER 
THE MIDWEST WILL BUILD ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. THROUGH THE FIRST 
HALF OF THE WORK WEEK AND THEN WILL GRADUALLY WEAKEN AS IT IS 
SHUNTED SOUTH BY A LONG WAVE TROUGH DROPPING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES 
AND NORTHEASTERN U.S. SUBSIDENCE IN THE RIDGE PATTERN SHOULD 
SUPPRESS CONVECTION ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY WITH JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ON 
THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MODELS CONTINUE TO 
HOLD ONTO A SLIGHTLY HIGHER PROBABILITY FOR CONVECTION AREA WIDE ON 
WEDNESDAY BUT WITH EMPHASIS AGAIN OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES 
AS A WEAK PERTURBATION DROPS SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST IN THE CLOCKWISE 
CIRCULATION AROUND THE WEAKENING RIDGE. STAYED THE COURSE WITH A 
GRADUAL INCREASE IN POPS THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY AS THE EASTERN 
U.S. HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO WEAKEN AHEAD OF THE 
AMPLIFYING GREAT LAKES TROUGH. ECM MOS TEMPS LOOK MORE REALISTIC 
THAN MEX MOS AND WERE FAVORED THROUGHOUT THE LONG TERM FORECAST.

450 
FXUS64 KMRX 131813
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
213 PM EDT SAT JUL 13 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND 
PLATEAU AREAS. SOME SMALL HAIL MAY BE POSSIBLE BENEATH THE CLOSED 
UPPER LOW...BUT SEVERE HAIL LOOKS UNLIKELY. THE ORIENTATION AND 
MOVEMENT OF THE CELLS SO FAR SUGGESTS SOME POTENTIAL FOR LOCALIZED 
FLOODING WHERE TRAINING OCCURS.

AS THE CLOSED UPPER LOW OVER KY CONTINUES TO RETROGRADE...WE WILL 
SEE DEEP MOISTURE INCREASING FROM THE ATLANTIC. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
WILL SPREAD CLOUDS INTO SE TN TONIGHT...WITH PW VALUES RISING TO 
AROUND 2 INCHES BY TOMORROW. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL INCREASE 
THROUGH THE DAY...WITH POPS RISING TO THE LIKELY RANGE IN THE 
AFTERNOON IN SOUTHERN AREAS. CENTRAL AND NORTHERN AREAS HAVE LOWER 
CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND WILL SEE MORE SUN DUE TO DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS 
FROM THE SE FLOW AT 850-700 MB. WARMEST TEMPS WILL LIKELY BE AT TRI 
TOMORROW. THE MAIN CONCERN WILL BE FLOODING CAUSED BY TRAINING CELLS 
PRODUCING HEAVY RAIN. WITH WEAK INSTABILITY AND LACK OF DYNAMIC 
FORCING ALOFT...THE SEVERE THREAT LOOKS LOW. A STRONG RIDGE BUILDING 
IN SUNDAY NIGHT WILL PUSH THE MOISTURE AXIS TO OUR WEST...ENDING 
POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN OVER THE WEEKEND WILL REMAIN OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY THROUGH THURSDAY. MODELS IN SLIGHT DISAGREEMENT THROUGH THE 
WEEK ON TIMING OF PRECIP. WENT WITH GFS AS SEEMS TO BE HANDLING 
SYSTEM A LITTLE BETTER. HAVE LOWERED THE POPS FOR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY...WITH THE BEST CHANCE FOR ANY PRECIP IN SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA AND FAR SOUTH EASTERN TENNESSEE. MOST OF THE MOISTURE IS 
BEING ADVECTED SOUTH OF THE AREA...SO WILL ONLY SEE LIGHT ISOLATED 
DEVELOPMENT. HOWEVER...MOISTURE DOES MOVE IN BEHIND THE HIGH 
PRESSURE...WITH ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED EACH 
AFTERNOON WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. 

THE HIGH PRESSURE THEN LOOKS TO WEAKEN AND A ZONAL FLOW TO TAKE ITS 
PLACE. A FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH FROM THE NORTH EARLY NEXT 
WEEKEND...RAISING PRECIP CHANCES THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY. AS OF 
NOW...WIND PROFILE AND INSTABILITIES DO NOT SUPPORT SEVERE 
WEATHER...BUT WILL HAVE TO KEEP A WATCH AS THE WEEKEND APPROACHES. 
TEMPERATURES WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE THROUGH THE WEEK UNDER THE HIGH 
PRESSURE. NEAR NORMAL HIGHS IN THE UPPER 80S EXPECTED...WITH A FEW 
LOCATIONS MAINLY SOUTH OF KNOXVILLE EXPECTED TO REACH LOW 90S. 
MOISTURE MOVING IN WILL KEEP DEWPOINTS FAIRLY CONSTANT...WITH LOW 
TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. TEMPS WILL COOL SLIGHTLY AS 
THE HIGH WEAKENS...BUT OTHERWISE REMAIN IN THE UPPER 80S THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             69  84  70  89  71 /  30  60  30  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  88  68  88  70 /  20  30  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  87  68  87  69 /  20  30  10  10  10

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW OVER NORTHERN ZONES WILL

CONVECTION OVER OUR AREA FAIRLY POORLY WITH THIS SYSTEM...SO LITTLE 
CONFIDENCE IN MODEL DETAILS OF WHERE AND WHEN CONVECTION WILL OCCUR.

SHORT TERM ESPECIALLY GIVEN TREND TOWARD INCREASING DOWNSLOPE LOW 
LEVEL FLOW INTO THE VALLEY.  WILL CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS AND SLIGHT CHANCE ELSEWHERE FOR NOW.  MAV TEMPS LOOK 
REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.       

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE PERIOD STARTS OUT ON SUNDAY 
WITH A MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ACROSS MAINLY THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN FEATURES AS WELL AS THE VALLEY OF SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. 
MODELS CONTINUE TO PULL DEEP MOISTURE INTO THE REGION FROM THE 
WESTERN ATLANTIC AND CARIBBEAN IN THE GRADIENT BETWEEN RETROGRADING 
LOW PRESSURE OVER THE PLAINS AND HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHEASTERN 
U.S. STILL DECENT INSTABILITY WITH SOME UPSLOPE ENHANCEMENT FOR 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THIS SCENARIO. HOWEVER...THE 
DECREASING PROBABILITY OF PRECIP WITH WELCOME DRYING IS STILL IN THE 
WORKS THROUGH AT LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF THE WORK WEEK AS THE 
MASSIVE EASTERN U.S. RIDGE DOESN'T BEGIN TO WEAKEN UNTIL THURSDAY 
INTO FRIDAY WHEN THERE WILL BE AT LEAST A SMALL CHANCE FOR A COUPLE 
SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS AREA WIDE. OTHERWISE...LEFT OUT POPS 
FOR MOST OF THE GREAT VALLEY WITH JUST SLIGHT OR SMALL CHANCES FOR 
CONVECTION OVER THE APPALACHIANS AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WITH A WEAK 
EASTERLY STEERING FLOW. LIMITED CLOUD COVER AND SUBSIDENCE IN THIS 
PATTERN ARGUE FOR TEMPERATURES EDGING A FEW DEGREES ABOVE 
NORMAL...ESPECIALLY MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. DID NOT GO QUITE AS 
WARM AS THE MEX MOS GUIDANCE BUT TRENDED HIGHER WITH MAX AND MIN 
TEMPS THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT FRI JUL 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...
A MIDLEVEL STABLE LAYER IS EFFECTIVELY CAPPING CONVECTION OVER THE 
AREA THIS AFTERNOON. WHILE A VERY ISOLATED SHOWER MAY BE POSSIBLE IN 
SW VA OR NE TN THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON...WILL NOT CARRY 
ANY POPS AFTER 00Z. SHOWERS AND CU FIELD THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD 
DISSIPATE WITH SUNSET...LEAVING CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT WITH SOME 
PATCHY FOG POSSIBLE.

THE UPPER LOW OVER THE UPPER OH VALELY TODAY WILL DRIFT TO THE SW
TONIGHT AND SATURDAY. THIS WILL SHIFT THE COOLER MIDLEVEL TEMPS
MORE OVER OUR AREA...AND WITH DAYTIME HEATING WE SHOULD SEE 850-700
MB LAPSE RATES TOMORROW AFTERNOON ON THE ORDER OF 6.5-7 DEGREES
C/KM. WILL HAVE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE ENTIRE
AREA TOMORROW AFTERNOON...WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN THE WESTERN
HALF CLOSER TO THE UPPER LOW. WITH THE LOW TO OUR WEST SATURDAY
NIGHT...A DEEP SE MOISTURE FLOW DEVELOPS...WITH PW VALUES RISING TO
1.5-2.0 INCHES. WILL KEEP A LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP
OVERNIGHT...THOUGH SYNOPTIC FORCING AND INSTABILITY WILL BE
LACKING.

LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CURRENTLY OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL CONTINUE
TO RETROGRADE AND PROGRESS WESTWARD TOWARDS THE PLAINS. THE FLOW
AROUND THIS LOW WILL BRING MOISTURE INTO THE AREA FROM THE
SOUTHEAST. WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE AND LIFT FROM UPSLOPE FLOW...THE
BEST CHANCE FOR ANY CONVECTION WILL BE MAINLY IN THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKIES AND THE PLATEAU. HIGH PRESSURE CURRENTLY
OVER THE ATLANTIC STATES WILL MOVE BEHIND THIS LOW AND SLOWLY
STRENGTHEN. MONDAY AND TUESDAY WILL REMAIN MOSTLY DRY...WITH
MOISTURE INCREASING TO THE AREA THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.
DO NOT SEE STRONG FORCING OR INSTABILITY TO SUGGEST ANY SEVERE
WEATHER...HOWEVER EXPECT DIURNAL SETUP OF THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY.
TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN NEAR NORMAL THROUGH THE NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EDT FRI JUL 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW WILL DRIFT SOUTH AND 
SOUTHWEST INTO OUR AREA DURING THE PERIOD. SOMEWHAT DRYER AIR WILL 
MOVE INTO THE AREA ON NORTH TO NORTHEAST WINDS TODAY.  DESPITE SOME 
DRYING...STILL LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND 
INSTABILITY...ESPECIALLY GIVEN SOME COOLING ALOFT WITH THE 
APPROACHING UPPER LOW...FOR ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION AT 
LEAST ACROSS NORTH AND MOUNTAIN ZONES. WILL CARRY LOW POPS IN THESE 
AREAS.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING TONIGHT EASTERN MOUNTAIN 
ZONES.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A REFRESHINGLY DIFFERENT 
WEATHER PATTERN IS IN STORE THROUGH MUCH OF THIS PORTION OF THE 
FORECAST WHEN COMPARED TO LAST WEEK'S PATTERN. THE EASTERN STATES 
UPPER LEVEL LOW WILL RETROGRADE STEADILY SOUTHWEST THROUGH THE OHIO 
VALLEY EARLY IN THE PERIOD TO THE DESERT SOUTHWEST BY THE END OF THE 
LONG TERM. A MASSIVE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL REPLACE THE DEPARTING 
LOW LEADING TO PROGRESSIVELY WARMER AND DRIER CONDITIONS NEXT WEEK. 
RELATIVELY DEEP MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL BE PRESENT ON SATURDAY 
WITH THE UPPER LOW IN THE VICINITY AND WHILE THE LOW DRIFTS FARTHER 
WEST ON SUNDAY...MODELS KEEP A FLUX OF DEEP MOISTURE IN PLACE 
BETWEEN THE TWO PRESSURE SYSTEMS SO MAINTAINED OR EVEN SLIGHTLY 
INCREASED POPS FOR CONVECTION ON SUNDAY. AS THE UPPER LEVEL HIGH 
GRADUALLY BUILDS SOUTH MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...TRIED TO LIMIT 
PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...FAVORING THE HIGHER TERRAIN ON THE PLATEAU AND ACROSS THE 
APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. MODELS SEEM TO BE OVERDOING POPS TO SOME 
DEGREE DURING THIS PERIOD AS ONE WOULD EXPECT SUBSIDENCE AND THE 
RESULTING WARMING ALOFT TO LIMIT CONVECTION. CONCERNING TEMPERATURES 
BASICALLY STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE THROUGH THE WEEKEND BUT ADJUSTED 
MAX TEMPS A FEW DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE NUMBERS WHILE TWEAKING MINS 
UP A DEGREE OR TWO FROM MINS.

901 
FXUS64 KMRX 111846
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EDT THU JUL 11 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
SHOWERS HAVE BEGUN TO DEVELOP OVER MIDDLE TN AND S-CNTRL KY AHEAD OF 
AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. EXPECT THAT THE COVERAGE OF STORMS WILL 
REMAIN SCATTERED DUE TO THE PRESENCE OF DRY AIR ALOFT. HOWEVER STEEP 
THETA-E LAPSE RATES WILL MEAN A THREAT OF STRONG WIND GUSTS WITH THE 
STORMS. ALTHOUGH THE FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT...CONVECTION WILL LIKELY DISSIPATE AROUND MIDNIGHT WITH 
THE LOSS OF INSTABILITY. EXPECT THAT WITH MIXING BY WINDS NEAR THE 
FRONT AND FALLING SURFACE DEWPOINTS...LOW STRATUS WILL DEVELOP 
RATHER THAN FOG. 

FRIDAY LOOKS LIKE A PLEASANT DAY FOR MID JULY WITH COMFORTABLE 
DEWPOINTS AND SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL TEMPS IN THE LOWER TO MID 80S. 
THE NAM DEVELOPS SOME SHOWERS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS WHERE AN INVERTED 
SURFACE TROUGH LINGERS BEHIND THE FRONT...SO WILL HAVE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP IN THE SMOKIES AND SW NC TOMORROW AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS PERIOD...WE ARE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A
SMALL TROUGH WITH A WEAK CUT OFF UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTHEAST. MODELS
AGREE THAT THIS SYSTEM WILL DRIFT WESTWARD FOR SEVERAL
DAYS...GETTING WELL WEST OF OUR AREA BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. IN THE
WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM UPPER HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AND SHOULD START
TO HEAT UP THE AREA NEXT WEEK. WITH THIS UPPER HIGH TAKING
CONTROL...HAVE TRIMMED BACK POPS OVER THE AREA FOR ALL OF THESE
LATER PERIODS. MODELS DIDNT SHOW THIS CONTROLLING RIDGE LAST
RUN...SO DONT WANT TO JUMP IN AND STRIP ALL POPS OUT OF EXTENEDED
PERIODS...BUT IF THIS SCENARIO INDEED OCCURS...IT WILL LIKELY TURN
DRY NEXT WEEK.

BACK IN THE SHORTER PERIODS...DEEP MOIST FLOW SETTING 
UP...IMMEDIATELY BEHIND UPPER LOW BY SUNDAY.  WILL GO FAIRLY HIGH 
POPS FOR SUNDAY...ALSO MODERATE SELY STEERING FLOW WILL LIKELY BRING 
STORMS OFF APPALACHIANS OUT INTO THE VALLEY SUNDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             69  86  66  87  68 /  30  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  85  65  86  68 /  30  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  85  64  87  67 /  20  10  10  10  10

1030 AM EDT THU JUL 11 2013

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT LOCATED ALONG THE OHIO RIVER.
DEWPOINTS AHEAD OF THE FRONT REMAIN IN THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S.
ALOFT...THE 12Z OHX SOUNDING SHOWS VERY DRY AIR ABOVE 650 MB. THE
RUC IS SHOWING SOME CONVECTION DEVELOPING OVER CNTL KY AND MIDDLE
TN THIS AFTERNOON IN A WEAK CONVERGENCE ZONE AHEAD OF THE FRONT. RUC
FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW VERY LITTLE CIN THIS AFTERNOON...WITH CAPE
VALUES IN THE 1500-2000 J/KG RANGE. THE DRY AIR ALOFT RESULTS IN
HIGH DCAPE VALUES AND SURFACE-TO-MIDLEVEL THETA-E DIFFERENCES
AROUND 30 DEGREES. SO WHILE THE DRY AIR ALOFT SHOULD REDUCE
COVERAGE OF STORMS THROUGH ENTRAINMENT COMPARED TO YESTERDAY...ANY
STORMS THAT DEVELOP COULD PRODUCE DAMAGING WIND GUSTS.

THE RUC SHOWS GREATEST INSTABILITY AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE ACROSS
SOUTHERN AREAS THIS AFTERNOON...SO WILL ADJUST POPS UPWARD IN THAT
AREA AND DOWNWARD NORTH SLIGHTLY. EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER THIS
MORNING IS HOLDING TEMPS BACK A BIT...SO WILL LOWER HIGH TEMPS
SLIGHTLY.
