814 
FXUS64 KMRX 110731
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 AM EDT THU JUL 11 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A GOOD DEAL OF LOW CLOUDS WILL
START THE DAY EARLY THIS MORNING...BUT WILL DISSIPATE BY 15Z. COLD
FRONT...CURRENTLY NEAR THE OHIO RIVER...WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA FOR
THIS AFTERNOON. AIRMASS WILL BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH CAPES
OF 2500 J/KG OR MORE...SO ANTICIPATE SCATTERED TO BROKEN
DEVELOPMENT OF THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON. MODELS SHOW BEST UPPER
SUPPORT...ASSOCIATED WITH OHIO VALLEY UPPER JET...OVER THE
MOUNTAINS EASTWARD FOR THE DAY.  

WATER VAPOR SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF MID-LEVEL DRY AIR MOVING INTO THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY. MODELS SOUNDINGS SHOW MID-LEVELS DRYING OUT
SUBSTANTIALLY FOR THIS AFTERNOON SETTING THE STAGE FOR THE
POTENTIAL OF WET MICROBURTS. MODELS ALSO SHOW HIGH MDPI AND WINDEX
VALUES FOR THIS AFTERNOON WITH DELTA K OVER 30.

BESIDES THE POTENTIAL OF DAMAGING WINDS...LOCALIZED HEAVY RAIN LIKELY...
SO POTENTIAL OF LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING. ANOTHER POTENTIAL IS
MARGINAL SEVERE HAIL GIVEN LOWER WBZ VALUES APPROACHING 11KFT.

BY THIS EVENING...STRONG WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA. DRIER AIR WILL
SLOWLY FILTER IN FOR TONIGHT...BUT ENOUGH RESIDUAL MOISTURE TO
INCLUDE PATCHY FOG.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE WEEKEND...AND REVEAL A 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION CREATING A CUT-OFF UPPER LOW OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES ON 
FRIDAY. THIS UPPER LOW IS PROGGED TO RETROGRADE WESTWARD ACROSS THE 
MID WEST THROUGH THE WEEKEND...AND THEN COULD MOVE SOUTHWARD ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY EARLY NEXT WEEK (ACCORDING TO THE ECMWF MODEL) 
OR POSSIBLY SOUTHWESTWARD ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY AND OZARKS 
(ACCORDING TO THE GFS MODEL). IN EITHER CASE...IT APPEARS THAT 
MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF TROPICAL SYSTEM CHANTAL WILL BE PULLED 
WESTWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION 
HIGHER POPS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...ALTHOUGH NOT AS HIGH AS THE WETTER 
ECMWF SOLUTION WOULD SUGGEST. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND 
TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT 
WILL STAY A FEW DEGREES COOLER DUE TO THE ABOVE-NORMAL GROUND 
MOISTURE AND DECENT RAIN CHANCES.

AT TAF SITES AROUND 18Z TO 20Z.

FXUS64 KMRX 101842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT WED JUL 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A VERY MOIST AIR MASS WILL BE OVER THE AREA TONIGHT AND 
THURSDAY...UNTIL A COLD FRONT PUSHES INTO THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT. 
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...ONGOING SHOWERS WILL BE MOVING 
SLOWLY AND PRODUCE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. THE MAIN CONCERN WILL BE 
FLASH FLOODING...BUT DO NOT EXPECT WIDESPREAD PROBLEMS WHICH WOULD 
WARRANT A WATCH AT THIS TIME. AN ISOLATED STORM MAY PRODUCE DAMAGING 
WIND GUSTS. 

A MCV FROM EARLIER CONVECTION OVER MO/IL/WRN KY IS NOW TRIGGERING 
DEVELOPMENT OVER CNTL KY...AND IS SHOWN BY THE MODELS TO CROSS THE 
AREA LATER TONIGHT...SO STORMS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE 
NIGHT. PLENTY OF MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL BE IN PLACE TOMORROW 
AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING FRONT TO CONTINUE LIKELY POPS AREA WIDE. A 
LITTLE HIGHER 0-6 KM SHEAR MAY LEAD TO A BETTER SEVERE POTENTIAL 
TOMORROW AFTERNOON...THOUGH FLOODING POTENTIAL MAY BE LOWER DUE TO
FASTER STORM MOTION. THE FRONT AND THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AXIS MOVE
THROUGH 03Z- 09Z FRIDAY...WITH MUCH DRIER AIR BUILDING IN. WILL END
ALL POPS BY MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
DRY NORTHERLY FLOW BEHIND THURSDAY/S COLD FRONT WILL BRING IN A 
DRIER...SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR MASS FOR THE WEEKEND.  MINIMAL DIURNALLY 
DRIVEN CONVECTION IS POSSIBLE SATURDAY AND SUNDAY BUT THIS SHOULD 
REMAIN CONFINED TO HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND MAINLY OVER THE SOUTHEAST.  
STRONG HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. WILL SHIFT A BIT 
NORTHWARD EARLY IN THE WEEK ALLOWING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO RETURN TO 
THE AREA.  REMNANTS OF CHANTAL MAY WILL ADD TO THIS MOISTURE 
INFLUX.  THIS WILL AID DEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED CONVECTION ACROSS 
THE AREA MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

759 
FXUS64 KMRX 101409 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1009 AM EDT WED JUL 10 2013

.DISCUSSION...
THERE IS PLENTY OF MOISTURE OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING WITH
DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER 70S...AND PW VALUES IN THE 1.5-2.0 INCH
RANGE IN THE 12Z REGIONAL SOUNDINGS. SHOWERS HAVE ALREADY BEGUN TO
DEVELOP IN SOME AREAS...AND COVERAGE WILL INCREASE THROUGH THE
AFTERNOON. THERE APPEARS TO BE A GOOD AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY
AVAILABLE...BASED ON THE 12Z OHX SOUNDING AND RUC FORECAST
SOUNDINGS. HOWEVER FORCING MECHANISMS FOR SYNOPTIC LIFT ARE
LACKING...SO CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT WILL DEPEND ON OUTFLOW
BOUNDARIES AND WEAK CONVERGENCE ZONES. WITH LITTLE SHEAR OR
FORCING...EXPECT THAT STORMS THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE SHORT-LIVED
PULSE STORMS...A FEW OF WHICH MAY PRODUCE LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN AND
GUSTY WINDS.

THE CURRENT FORECAST OF HIGH CHANCE POPS IN THE VALLEY AND LIKELY
POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU LOOKS REASONABLE. THE TEMPS AND
DEWPOINTS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK SO FAR...SO NO UPDATE WILL BE
NEEDED.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

555 
FXUS64 KMRX 100657
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 AM EDT WED JUL 10 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SERIES OF WEAK WAVES WILL
MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS TODAY. ONE SUCH WAVE IS
HELPING TO PRODUCE A GOOD DEAL OF MID-LEVEL CLOUDS OVER THE
NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING WITH
WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS. THIS WAVE WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA BY
SUNRISE. MODELS SHOW ANOTHER WAVE MOVING INTO THE AREA FOR THIS
AFTERNOON. GIVEN THE HIGH PWS AND MODERATE INSTABILITY WITH CAPES
OF 2000-2500 J/KG...I EXPECT SCATTERED TO BROKEN CONVECTION TO
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON. GREATEST COVERAGE WILL AGAIN BE OVER THE
TERRAIN FEATURES. BOUYANCY AND PRESENCE OF MID-LEVEL DRY AIR
SUGGEST ISOLATED TO STRONG/SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE WITH THE MAIN
CONCERN BEING DAMAGING WINDS. ALSO...HIGH PWS AND RELATIVELY SLOW
STORM MOTION...COMBINED WITH LOW FFG...ENHANCES THE CONCERN OF
ISOLATED FLASH FLOODING.

FOR TONIGHT...WEAK COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING ACROS THE OHIO RIVER
WITH ASSOCIATED CONVECTION MOVING INTO THE AREA OVERNIGHT...SO
CONTINUED HIGH CHANCE/LIKELY POPS OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.
MAIN CONCERN OVERNIGHT WILL BE LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING POTENTIAL.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND 
GENERALLY REVEAL AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION BY THE END OF THE WEEK. IN ADDITION...IT 
APPEARS THAT MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF TROPICAL STORM CHANTAL 
MAY AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS AMPLIFYING UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON 
THURSDAY...WITH A GOOD COVERAGE OF CONVECTION EXPECTED AREAWIDE. 
WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS PROGGED TO DEVELOP...ALONG WITH 
A FAIRLY DECENT UPPER-LEVEL WIND FLOW...IT APPEARS THAT ORGANIZED 
SEVERE TSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE ON THURSDAY. RIGHT NOW...THE MODELS 
SUGGEST THAT THIS COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THE MORNING HOURS...WHICH WOULD LIMIT THE AREAL COVERAGE OF 
ANY SEVERE TSTORMS FOR THURSDAY. A DRIER AIR MASS WILL THEN MOVE 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...WITH MINS TEMPS 
EXPECTED TO BE LOWER EACH MORNING BUT MAX TEMPS SHOULD STILL BE 
ABOUT THE SAME AS THE PRE-FRONTAL TEMPS. ISOLATED CONVECTION WILL 
STILL BE POSSIBLE AROUND THE MOUNTAINS ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY... 
WHERE SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP EACH AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
WEAKENING TROPICAL STORM CHANTAL AS IT NEARS THE SOUTHEAST BY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. THE CANADIAN MODEL KEEPS CHANTAL TOGETHER AS A FAIRLY 
DECENT TROPICAL SYSTEM BRINGING SIGNIFICANT AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA EARLY NEXT WEEK...BUT THIS SOLUTION APPEARS 
TO BE AN OUTLIER RIGHT NOW. FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION ONLY 
A SLIGHT INCREASE IN POPS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY DUE TO AN INCREASE 
IN MOISTURE FROM THE REMNANTS OF CHANTAL. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND 
TOWARDS THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT 
GENERALLY A FEW DEGREES COOLER DUE TO THE ABOVE-NORMAL GROUND 
MOISTURE.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT TUE JUL 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...ATMOSPHERE IS A LITTLE MORE 
UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON AND YESTERDAY BUT NO MAJOR FOCUS APPARENT SO 
CONVECTION IS FIRING RATHER NICELY ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES AND 
DRIFTING EAST INTO THE VALLEY WITH LIMITED SUCCESS. BELIEVE THIS 
CONVECTION WILL WEAKEN AND DISSIPATE THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS. LEFT 
A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD ON THE POSSIBILITY 
OF SOME OF THE MIDWEST CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH BUILDING SOUTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. THE 
WRF TRIES TO DEVELOP AN MCS WHICH DROPS SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE LOWER 
OHIO VALLEY TRANSITING MIDDLE SECTIONS OF TENNESSEE TOWARD DAYBREAK. 
NOT REAL CONFIDENT ABOUT THIS SCENARIO BUT SOME CONVECTIVE ELEMENTS 
MAY SURVIVE THE OVERNIGHT HOURS AND DRIFT INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND POSSIBLY EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE DURING THE PRE-DAWN HOURS 
WEDNESDAY. LOOKS LIKE A BETTER CHANCE FOR MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE IN PLACE ON WEDNESDAY AS THE WESTERN GREAT 
LAKES LONG WAVE TROUGH AMPLIFIES INTO THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF 
THE NATION. MODELS INDICATE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE MODERATELY UNSTABLE 
AIDING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THUNDERSTORMS. WHILE NO WIDESPREAD SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORM OUTBREAK IS IN THE CARDS FOR THE DAYTIME HOURS WEDNESDAY
A FEW STORMS COULD PRODUCE STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS AND SOME SMALL 
HAIL. USED A MOS BLEND FOR MINS AND MAXES.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
ASSOCIATED WITH SHARPENING EASTERN UPPER TROUGH WILL BRING LIKELY 
POPS WED NGT AND THURS BEFORE MOVING EAST OF THE AREA THURSDAY 
NIGHT. FAIRLY DRY DAY FRIDAY EXCEPT MAYBE HIGH MOUNTAIN SLIGHT 
CHANCES IN THE AFTERNOON/EVE. ISOLATED DIURNAL ACTIVITY RETURNS 
SATURDAY...THEN COVERAGE INCREASES TO SCATTERED SUNDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY. MODELS MAY STRUGGLE WITH THE LATE PERIOD PATTERN AS THE 
EASTERN TROF CUTS OFF ON THE GULF COAST AND INTERACTS WITH CHANTAL 
IN WAYS THAT MAY BE FUZZY TO DISCERN FOR A WHILE. WILL HAVE TO WATCH 
HOW THINGS EVOLVE LATE THIS WEEK.

172 
FXUS64 KMRX 090713
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT TUE JUL 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
BERMUDA HIGH CENTERED OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC...WHICH WAS BRINGING 
A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW AND A VERY MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THAT A MARGINALLY TO POSSIBLY 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AS A 
RESULT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE ONLY MODEST MID-LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES...SO IT APPEARS THAT THIS CONVECTION SHOULD NOT BECOME TOO 
SEVERE...ALTHOUGH SOME GUSTY WINDS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL 
STILL BE POSSIBLE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY...BUT ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TONIGHT. WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WITH TEMPS A DEGREE WARMER TODAY COMPARED TO 
YESTERDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WILL PULL A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE FORECAST 
AREA THURSDAY. AHEAD OF THE FRONT THE AIRMASS WILL BE VERY MOIST AND 
UNSTABLE. PWS WEDNESDAY WILL BE NEAR 2 INCHES WITH CAPES OF 
2000-2500 J/KG. GIVEN CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURES ONLY IN THE LOWER 
80S...SCATTERED TO BROKEN CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP...ESPECIALLY 
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. GREATEST COVERAGE WILL BE ACROSS THE 
TERRAIN FEATURES...THEN SPREAD INTO THE VALLEY.

FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT WILL PULL 
INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. SOUNDINGS SHOW AIRMASS REMAINING MOIST 
AND UNSTABLE WITH CAPES OF 2500 J/KG...BUT SOME MID-LEVEL DRY AIR IS 
ALSO EVIDENT. THE MID-LEVEL MINIMUM THETA-E WILL PROVIDE A BETTER 
ENVIRONMENT FOR WET-DOWNBURSTS. WILL INCLUDE A BETTER CHANCE AND 
COVERAGE OF STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON.

FRONT MOVES SLOWLY SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY 
MORNING...ENDING CHANCES OF CONVECTION OF MOST OF THE AREA...EXCEPT 
FOR THE FAR SOUTH.

FOR THE WEEKEND...MODELS SHOW A WEAK UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO. THE CIRCULATION AROUND THIS TROUGH WILL 
HELP PULL MOISTURE BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR SUNDAY. 
ALSO...OF INTEREST IS DEVELOPING TROPICAL SYSTEM CHANTAL. HURRICANE 
CENTER PULLS CHANTAL TOWARD THE SOUTHEAST COAST-LINE LATE THIS 
WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE CIRCULATION AROUND THIS SYSTEM WILL 
ALSO PULL ABUNDANT TROPICAL MOISTURE TOWARD THE SOUTHEAST UNITED 
STATES EARLY NEXT WEEK...INCLUDING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.
&&

AT KTYS...AND LIFR CONDITIONS AT KTRI. SCATTERED CONVECTION IS 
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS...BUT WILL MENTION 
VCTS IN THE TAFS DUE TO PROBLEMS WITH TIMING THE EXACT OCCURRENCE AT 
THE TAF SITES. OVERALL...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED 
OUTSIDE OF THIS MORNING'S FOG AND ANY AFTERNOON CONVECTION.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF LARGE RIDGE THAT STRETCHES FROM THE ATLANTIC
ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES AND ANOTHER CENTER OVER THE SOUTHWEST.
UPPER LOW IS NOW SHIFTING TOWARDS THE NE STATES AS RIDGE ACROSS
SOUTH GETS STRONGER. UPPER FLOW IS MORE NW WITH LEFT OVER CIRRUS
MOVING SOUTH FROM STORMS THAT HAD FORMED OVER THE OHIO VALLEY
EARLIER TODAY. VARIABLE CLOUDS THE REST OF THE NIGHT AND WITH HIGH
MOISTURE CONTENT IN THE AIR FROM RECENT RAINS PATCHY FOG WILL AGAIN
FORM AND PERSIST THROUGH MID MORNING. UPDATE ALREADY SENT.

628 
FXUS64 KMRX 081935
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT MON JUL 8 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...REMNANT MOISTURE...OROGRAPHIC 
LIFT AND PROXIMITY OF A WEAK UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY OF ALABAMA MAY ALLOW FOR THE CONTINUATION OF A COUPLE SHOWERS 
AND MAYBE EVEN AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE 
AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA DURING THE EVENING. OTHERWISE...THE LOW 
LEVEL THROUGH SURFACE AIRMASS MAY OFFER UP MORE LOW CLOUDS AND FOG  
AS SOAKED GROUND CONDITIONS AID FORMATION AFTER MIDNIGHT. THE MOIST 
LOW LAYER SHOULD BURN OFF BY MID MORNING TUESDAY. THE AIRMASS WILL BE
SLIGHTLY MORE UNSTABLE ON TUESDAY BUT STILL BELIEVE CONVECTION WILL 
FAVOR HIGHER TERRAIN FEATURES WITH SOMEWHAT LOWER CHANCES FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. THE WILD CARD MAY 
BE THE POSSIBILITY OF HIGHER PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WHERE SOME SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY AND HIGHER MEAN RH MAY CLIP THIS PART OF THE APPALACHIANS ON 
ITS WAY INTO THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES. TRIED TO STAY IN THE MIDDLE 
OF WARMER MAV MAX AND COOLER MET TEMPS ON TUESDAY WITH DEWPOINTS 
EDGING SLIGHTLY HIGHER.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UNUSUAL WEATHER LOOKS 
LIKE IT WILL REAPPEAR DURING THE EXTENDED FORECAST PERIOD. WEAK 
TROFFING WILL REMAIN OVER THE EASTERN U.S. THROUGH MIDWEEK...BETWEEN 
THE PLAINS RIDGE AND THE BERMUDA HIGH. SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION 
TUESDAY EVENING AND WEDNESDAY WILL GIVE WAY TO MORE ORGANIZED 
ACTIVITY THURSDAY AS EASTERN TROUGH SHARPENS AND FORCES FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY THROUGH AREA. BEST RAIN CHANCES BEGIN LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND PERSIST THROUGH THURSDAY BEFORE DIMINISHING THURSDAY NIGHT. 
FRIDAY MAY ACTUALLY BE A FAIRLY NICE DAY. BUT THE PATTERN TAKES A 
TURN TOWARD THE UNUSUAL FRIDAY AS THE EAST COAST TROUGH BECOMES 
SHARP ENOUGH TO FORM ANOTHER CUTOFF LOW IN THE SE STATES BY 
SATURDAY. THE PLAINS RIDGE MAY NOSE NORTH OF THE CUTOFF LOW AND 
FORCE IT WESTWARD...BRINGING A SOUTHEASTERLY FETCH INTO OUR AREA. 
THIS FETCH MAY OR MAY NOT BECOME INVOLVED WITH REMAINS OF TS 
CHANTAL...JUST TOO EARLY FOR ANY CERTAINTY...CANADIAN MODEL SUGGESTS 
THE CHANTAL MOISTURE POTENTIAL MORE THAN THE GFS OR EC AT THIS TIME. 
EVEN SO...MAY BE EXPERIENCING ANOTHER SHOWERY WEATHER PATTERN 
BEGINNING LATE WEEKEND INTO MUCH OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

204 
FXUS64 KMRX 080714
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 AM EDT MON JUL 8 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A GOOD DEAL OF LOW AND MID-LEVEL CLOUDS REMAINING ACROSS EAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA...BUT SOUNDINGS SHOW MID-
LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING EAST. DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH CLOUDS EXIT AND
RADIATIONAL COOLING DEVELOPS...FOG COULD BECOME DENSE ACROSS THE
REGION THIS MORNING. CURRENTLY HAVE PATCHY FOG...BUT MAY HAVE TO
HIGHTEN FOG WORDING LATER THIS MORNING.

STORM MONITOR SHOWS DRIER AIR ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING WITH
PWS IN THE 1.3-1.4 INCHES AT TRI/TYS AND 1.9 INCHES AT CHA. MODELS
SHOW BEST MOISTURE/INSTABILITY OVER THE SOUTH TODAY WITH A LOW-
LEVEL BOUNDARY NEAR THE GEORGIA/TENNESSEE STATE-LINE...SO GREATEST
CHANCE OF AFTERNOON/EVENING CONVECTION WILL BE ACROSS SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA TODAY.

CONVECTION WILL DIMINISH THIS EVENING WITH AREAS OF FOG LIKELY
DEVELOPING MONDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY/...
AN UPPER-RIDGE WILL BE THE DOMINATE WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...HELPING TO PROMOTE 
SOME WARMER AND PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS. HOWEVER...MOISTURE 
UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE WILL ALLOW FOR DIURNALLY DRIVEN SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE AREA EACH DAY. WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY...A BROAD UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND 
PUSH A COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION...THIS WILL PROVIDE AN EVEN BETTER 
CHANCE FOR SOME ORGANIZED THUNDERSTORMS. THUS...HAVE GONE LIKELY 
POPS AREAWIDE DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE THE PAST 
SEVERAL DAYS...THE PRIMARY IMPACTS FROM THESE STORMS WILL CONTINUE 
TO BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL GIVEN THE HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT/PWAT 
VALUES PROGGED TO BE IN PLACE. MODELS ARE CONTINUING TO SHOW THIS 
TROUGH DEVELOPING INTO A CUT-OFF LOW THAT DROPS SOUTHWEST INTO THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY THIS WEEKEND. THIS WOULD RESULT IN 
ADDITIONAL RAIN CHANCES AND COOLER TEMPERATURES FOR FRIDAY INTO THE 
WEEKEND ONCE AGAIN. GIVEN THIS...HAVE UNDERCUT MOS GUIDANCE BY A FEW 
DEGREES AT THE END OF THE PERIOD AND HAVE RAISED POPS TO CHANCE 
DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. 

&&

633 
FXUS64 KMRX 071921
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EDT SUN JUL 7 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER LOW MOVING ENE INTO
WRN OHIO THIS AFTERNOON AND CONTINUES TO AFFECT MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA. INITIAL AREA OF MODERATE SHOWERS HAS PUSHED INTO NE
TN AND SW VA...WHILE AIRMASS BEHIND THIS AREA HAS BECOME SLIGHTLY
UNSTABLE. GETTING SCATTERED NEW DEVELOPMENT OVER WRN PARTS OF THE
FLOOD WATCH AREA WITH RAINFALL RATES AS HIGH AS 1/4 TO 1/2 INCH PER
HOUR IN A FEW SPOTS. THOUGHT ABOUT DROPPING THE FLOOD WATCH FOR THE
PLATEAU COUNTIES...BUT BASED ON NEW CONVECTION I OPTED TO CONTINUE
THE WATCH THROUGH 8PM EDT. THUNDER IS A REMOTE POSSIBLITY...SO I
CARRIED A SLIGHT CHANCE THROUGH THE EVENING. DECREASING CHANCES OF
SHOWERS AFTER MIDNIGHT. 

ALL URBAN AND SMALL STREAM FLOOD ADVISORIES WERE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE
WHILE RIVER FLOODING CONTINUES FOR A FEW RIVERS. 

OTHERWISE FOR LATER PERIODS...FLOW ALOFT BECOMES W TO NW AS THE
UPPER LOW LIFTS FURTHER NE. PLENTY OF RESIDUAL MOISTURE FOR DAYTIME
CONVECTION EACH DAY WITH FORECAST GRIDS GENERALLY ON TRACK. MADE A
FEW ADJUSTMENTS AND WENT CLOSE TO MOS POPS AND TEMPS...OTHER THAN
TO UNDERCUT THE AGRESSIVELY WARM GFS MAX TEMPS EACH DAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MORE RAIN IN STORE FOR 
THE REGION AS A SOUTHERLY FLOW GRADUALLY STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF 
ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. THE TROUGH BUILDS INTO THE NORTHEASTERN 
U.S. WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. KEPT MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR 
CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY AND THEN TWEAKED A BIT HIGHER THROUGH THE 
LIKELY RANGE ON THURSDAY AS THE TROUGH AND SURFACE COLD FRONT SWING 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MAINTAINED JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND BUT MODELS 
ARE POINTING TOWARD THE POSSIBILITY OF A SLIGHTLY MORE ACTIVE PERIOD 
AT THE END OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST AS AN UPPER LOW RETROGRADES 
ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. THE POSITION OF THE UPPER LOW COULD 
LEAD TO GREATER COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. WILL AWAIT 
LATER MODEL RUNS TO SEE HOW THIS SCENARIO PLAYS OUT. STAYED A LITTLE 
UNDER MOS MAX TEMPS WHILE TWEAKING MINS ABOUT A DEGREE WARMER 
THROUGH THE PERIOD.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 071356
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EDT SUN JUL 7 2013

.DISCUSSION...SOME IMPRESSIVE RAIN AMOUNTS OVER THE PLATEAU AND SE 
TN COUNTIES OVERNIGHT...GENERALLY 2 1/2 TO 4 INCES WITH MAX AMOUNT 
SO FAR OF 4.87 INCHES NEAR DUNLAP IN SEQUATCHIE COUNTY. FAR NE TN 
AND SW VA AREAS A MEAGER 1/10 TO 1/2 INCH OF RAIN IN THE PAST 24 
HOURS. 24 HOUR RAINFALL TOTALS ALSO WERE ON THE LOW SIDE IN THE 
SMOKIES AND FOOTHILLS...AROUND 1/2 TO 1 INCH. 

RADARS SHOW THIS BAND OF HEAVIER RAINS HAS MOVED OUT OF SE TN AND
MOST OF OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES AT MID MORNING...WHICH WILL HELP THE 
FLOOD SITUATION. LINGERING RAINS FALLING AT 1/4 TO 1/2 INCH PER HOUR 
IN HEAVIEST SPOTS...BUT OVER AREAS WHICH HAVE RECEIVED VERY LITTLE 
RAINFALL OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS. A FEW RIVERS IN FLOOD OR HEADED 
THAT WAY...BUT APPEARS THAT ENDING THE FLOOD WATCH AT 8PM EDT WILL 
WORK OUT JUST FINE.

12Z UPPER AIR PLOTS AND SATELLITE PICS SHOW THE UPPER LOW/TROUGH HAS 
LIFTED NE INTO SRN INDIANA THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...FORECAST AREA 
DOES REMAIN IN THE RIGHT REAR QUADRANT OF THE ASSOCIATED UPPER LEVEL 
JET...AND SCATTERED SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS ARE LIKELY TO 
DEVELOP AGAIN ACROSS SE TN AND SW NC TODAY.  

A FEW ADJUSTMENTS TO FORECAST GRIDS AND PRODUCTS AS NEEDED BEFORE 
NOON. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FLOOD WATCH THROUGH THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...FLOOD WATCH THROUGH THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...BRADLEY...
     CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...

FXUS64 KMRX 070730
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT SUN JUL 7 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE SLOWLY
EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY WITH THE UPPER FLOW BECOMING
WESTERLY BY THIS EVENING PULLING ABNORMALLY HIGH PWS SOUTH AND EAST
OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. ALSO...ASSOCIATED UPPER JET WILL PULL
EAST AS WELL WITH DIVERGENCE ALOFT AND FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING
MOVING EAST OF THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON.

BANDS OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAINS OVER THE AREA WILL CONTINUE MOST
OF THE DAY WITH ISOLATED AFTERNOON STORMS. DUE TO SATURATED
GROUND...ANY ADDITIONAL RAINFALL MAY CAUSE PROBLEMS SO WILL
CONTINUE FLOOD WATCH. AS UPPER TROUGH MOVES NORTHEAST OF THE AREA
THIS EVENING...COVERAGE OF SHOWERS WILL DIMINISH...SO WILL ALLOW
WATCH TO EXPIRE.

.LONG TERM /MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY/...
WITH THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH FINALLY EXITING THE REGION INTO THE 
UPPER OHIO VALLEY ON MONDAY AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE WILL BUILD IN FOR 
THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE ABUNDANT GULF 
MOISTURE PRESENT UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE...DECENT CHANCES FOR 
SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL EXIST EACH DAY...THOUGH MORE 
SUNSHINE AND SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES ARE ALSO EXPECTED. THE 
NEXT UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM WILL DROP A COLD FRONT SOUTH FROM THE 
OHIO VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY...PROVIDING AN EVEN BETTER CHANCE FOR ORGANIZED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. THUS...HAVE GONE LIKELY POPS AREAWIDE DURING THIS 
TIME PERIOD. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS...THE 
PRIMARY IMPACTS FROM THESE STORMS WILL CONTINUE TO BE LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL GIVEN THE HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT/PWAT VALUES PROGGED TO BE 
IN PLACE. MODELS ARE NOW HINTING AT ANOTHER CUT-OFF LOW DRIFTING 
SOUTH LATE THIS WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND...WHICH COULD RESULT IN 
ADDITIONAL RAIN CHANCES AND COOLER TEMPERATURES NEXT WEEKEND. GIVEN 
THIS...HAVE UNDERCUT MOS GUIDANCE BY A FEW DEGREES AT THE END OF THE 
PERIOD. 


&&

486 
FXUS64 KMRX 070045
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EDT SAT JUL 6 2013

.DISCUSSION...UPPER LEVEL LOW CONTINUES TO SPIN ACROSS THE MID MS
VALLEY AND VERY SLOWLY MOVE EAST UP THE OHIO VALLEY. LONG FETCH OF
GULF AND ATLANTIC MOISTURE CONTINUES TO FEED INTO THE FORECAST
AREA. PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES OVER NE TN AND SW VA ALLOWED
TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB INTO THE LOWER AND MID 80S WHICH DESTABILIZED
THE ATMOSPHERE AND CAUSED SOME THUNDERSTORMS TO FORM NE OF
KNOXVILLE INTO SW VA. THESE PRODUCED BRIEF GUSTY WINDS AND HEAVY
RAINFALL. THE CORRIDOR OF STEADY RAIN SHOWERS WAS STILL OVER
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE...THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND HAD ADVANCED INTO
THE EAST CENTRAL TN VALLEY THIS EVENING. IT WAS STARTING TO NARROW
ON THE WESTERN END WHILE MORE ACTIVITY WAS DEVELOPING IN WESTERN
NORTH CAROLINA WITH MORE THUNDERSTORMS MOVING UP THROUGH CENTRAL
AND NE GA. ADJUSTED TEMPERATURES DOWN IN MOST PLACES IN THE RAIN
COOLED AIR MASS AND ADDED ISOLATED THUNDER TO THE NE SECTIONS.
OTHERWISE FORECAST ABOUT THE SAME WITH OCCASIONAL SHOWERS
OVERNIGHT. MOST REPORTS SO FAR THE LAST FEW HOURS HAVE BEEN FOR
NUISANCE FLOODING BUT MAJOR SE RIVERS WERE STILL RISING. 

&&

567 
FXUS64 KMRX 061929
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 PM EDT SAT JUL 6 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...EASTERN EDGE OF HEAVIER
RAINS HAS ONLY INCHED EASTWARD DURING THE AFTERNOON...SO I SLOWED
DOWN THE ARRIVAL OVER NE TN AND SW VA A BIT MORE. CAN'T ARGUE WITH
THE SHOWERS (SLIGHT CHANCE TSRA) SWINGING ENE OVERNIGHT...BUT NEXT
SHIFT MIGHT HAVE TO MAKE FURTHER ADJUSTMENTS GIVEN THE PERSISTENT
UPPER RIDGE FROM THE ATLANTIC INTO THE CAROLINAS. LOCALLY HEAVY
RAINS SEEM MOST LIKELY TO AFFECT OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES...SE TN AND
SW NC AREAS. 

OTHERWISE...NO CHANGES MADE FOR SUNDAY CONCERNING THE SHOWERS AND
FLOOD WATCH. I DID LOWER POPS SLIGHTLY FROM THE WEST AFTER 06Z
MONDAY IN LINE WITH NEIGHBORS AND LATEST MODEL TRENDS. RESIDUAL
MOISTURE AND REMNANTS OF UPPER LEVEL TROUGH STILL TO OUR W TO NW ON
MONDAY...SO CONTINUED CHANCE POPS (30 TO 50 PERCENT).

MIN TEMPS NEAR PERSISTENCE EACH NIGHT. MOS MAX TEMPS SUNDAY LOOK
VERY UNREALISTIC CONSIDERING HOW COOL RAINY AREAS HAVE BEEN EACH
AFTERNOON. NOT ENOUGH DRYING OUT MONDAY TO REACH THE GFSX MOS MAXES
AND I CHOSE THE MOS BLEND WITH THE COOLER NAM HIGHS. 

MINOR FLOODING STILL EXPECTED ON THE PIGEON AND FRENCH BROAD RIVERS
AND WILL ALSO ISSUE A FLOOD WARNING FOR THE SEQUATCHIE RIVER AT
WHITWELL. SOUTH CHICKAMAUGA CREEK NOW EXPECTED TO GET WITHIN 1 FOOT
OF THE FLOOD STAGE OF 18 FEET BY EARLY MONDAY MORNING. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...PERHAPS THE CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION WILL BE A LITTLE CLOSER TO CLIMATOLOGY FOR EARLY JULY 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH A BRIEF PERIOD OF RIDGING AND SUFFICIENT 
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY A LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL AMPLIFY AS IT 
SHIFTS INTO THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION. IN THIS REGIME 
THERE WILL BE A GOOD CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ON THURSDAY AHEAD OF AN 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT THAT WILL BUILD SOUTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
THERE IS SOME CONCERN THAT THE FRONT WILL NOT MAKE RAPID PROGRESS 
ACROSS THE REGION AND MAY SLOW DOWN. THEREFORE...HELD ONTO CHANCE 
POPS THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL DRY 
OUT AGAIN FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. TRIMMED A FEW DEGREES OFF WARM 
MOS MAX TEMPS THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD.  


&&

OUT OF THE PICTURE AND MAY CONTINUE TO DO SO FOR THE NEXT EIGHT OR

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1019 AM EDT SAT JUL 6 2013

.DISCUSSION...MAIN AXIS OF PERSISTENT MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINS IS 
STILL TO OUR WEST ACROSS MIDDLE TN TO THE EASTERN EDGES OF THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS MORNING. RAINFALL OVER OUR FORECAST AREA WAS 
MAINLY 0.50 INCH OR LESS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS...WITH A FEW SPOTS 
AROUND 1 INCH OR SO (NEWFOUND GAP - 1.37...DUNLAP - 0.92 AND SIGNAL 
MTN - 0.88). 

CURRENT RADARS STILL SHOW THE PROLONGED DOWNSLOPE/RAIN SHADOW LOOK 
OVER CENTRAL PARTS OF EAST TN NE INTO SW VA. FORECAST IS ON TRACK... 
BUT IF RADAR TRENDS DON'T PUSH THE RAIN EAST SOON...PLAN TO LOWER 
THE RAIN CHANCES FOR NE TN AND SW VA OR AT LEAST DELAY IT A BIT.
MAX TEMPS MAY BE AFFECTED AGAIN OVER SE TN AND THE PLATEAU...SO 
FORECAST GRIDS PROBABLY WILL NEED SOME ADJUSTMENTS THIS MORNING.

FLOOD WATCH LOOKS ON TRACK WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 1.5 
TO 2.0 INCHES...SATURATED GROUNDS AND A PUSH OF THE RAINS EASTWARD 
OVERNIGHT THROUGH AT LEAST SUNDAY EVENING. JUST ISSUED AN FLW FOR 
THE FRENCH BROAD AND PIGEON RIVERS IN COCKE COUNTY.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SLOW MOVING UPPER TROUGH ACROSS
THE MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY
SUNDAY. SOUTHERLY FETCH FROM THE TROPICS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE
PERIOD WITH PWS TONIGHT APPROACHING THE 99TH PERCENTILE (PWS
BETWEEN 2 AND 2.2 INCHES). MODELS SHOW UPPER JET MOVING ACROSS THE
OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEY PLACING THE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE
FAVORED RIGHT ENTRACE REGION LATER TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY ENHANCING
FRONT0-GENETIC FORCING OVER THE AREA. THE STRONGEST FRONTO-GENETIC
FORCING WILL BE OVER THE PLATEAU AND WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY.

CONCERNED THAT SHOWERS/STORMS WITH TORRENTIAL RAINS WILL TRAIN OVER
THESE AREAS TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY WITH 3 TO 5 INCHES OF RAINFALL
LIKELY WITH LOCALIZED AREAS OF 6 INCHES+. SINCE UPPER FORCING
REMAINS THROUGH MOST OF SUNDAY...HAVE EXTENDED FFA THROUGH 00Z MONDAY.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/...
THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL FINALLY BEGIN TO SHIFT OUT OF THE AREA 
AND INTO THE UPPER OHIO RIVER VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT...ALLOWING A 
SUBTROPICAL RIDGE TO BEGIN TO BUILD BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALCHIANS EARLY NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...REASONABLE CHANCES FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL EXIST EACH DAY GIVEN THE ABUNDANT 
GULF MOISTURE STILL PRESENT UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE. A GREATER AMOUNT 
OF SUNSHINE THOUGH WILL HELP HIGHS RETURN TO THE MID TO UPPER 80S IN 
MOST LOCATIONS. THIS PATTERN OF SEASONABLE WEATHER WITH DIURNALLY 
DRIVEN CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK UNTIL 
ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH PUSHING THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES WILL DROP A 
FRONT TOWARD THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...BRINGING WITH 
IT SOME BETTER CHANCES FOR ORGANIZED STORMS AND SOME SLIGHTLY COOLER 
AIR IN ITS WAKE. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS...THE 
PRIMARY IMPACTS FROM THESE STORMS WILL CONTINUE TO BE LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL GIVEN THE HIGH MOISTURE CONTENT/PWAT VALUES PROGGED TO BE 
IN PLACE. 

&&

AL...PARTS OF MIDDLE TN AND CENTRAL KY. SE FLOW OVER MOUNTAINS
STILL KEEPING NE HALF OF FORECAST AREA MOSTLY DRY. CURRENT RADAR
TRENDS SHOW SHOWERS MAY INCREASE NEXT FEW HOURS IN SOUTH AND WEST
SO WILL KEEP LEAVE HIGH POPS THERE AND LOWER NE. REMOVED THUNDER
FOR THE REST OF THE NIGHT. ALSO ADJUSTED TEMPERATURES AND DEW
POINTS DOWN SLIGHTLY OVER WETTER SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS AND
SOME TEMPERATURES UP IN THE NE WHERE TEMPERATURES WERE WARMER
TODAY.

740 
FXUS64 KMRX 051931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
331 PM EDT FRI JUL 5 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...AFTER A BREAK IN THE SHOWERY
WEATHER...ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS WAS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE GULF
COAST STATES. THIS ACTIVITY IS SPREADING NORTH INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS WITH A BAND OF HEAVIER SHOWERS TO OUR WEST ACROSS
MIDDLE TN AND TO OUR SE OVER EASTERN GA AND SC. REALLY NOT SEEING
MUCH IF ANY LIGHTNING STRIKES ANYWHERE NEAR THE FORECAST AREA...SO
ONLY WORDED AS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE
EVENING. AN APPARENT SHORTWAVE IN THE FLOW SHOULD SPREAD THE
SHOWERS INTO MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...THE
SYNOPTIC PATTERN STILL HAS DOWNSLOPING INTO THE NRN AND CENTRAL
VALLEYS OF EAST TN AND SW VA...SO PREFERRED TO STAY WITH HIGH
CHANCE POPS AND SCATTERED WORDING IN THOSE AREAS.

CATGORICAL POPS IN WRN AND SRN AREAS SATURDAY TO MAINLY LIKELY POPS
ELSEWHERE. MODEL QPF OVER HIGHER POP AREAS THROUGH MAYBE SUNDAY
NIGHT WILL POSE A THREAT OF FLOODING...AND MODELS MIGHT BE UNDER
DOING THE POTENTIAL RAINFALL OVER WRN NC WHERE PROLONGED UPSLOPE
FLOW IS SUGGESTED. THIS RAINFALL AND RUNOFF INTO NE TN BRINGS A
POSSIBILITY OF ADDITIONAL FLOODING (NOTING RECENT RISES ON THE
PIGEON AND FRENCH BROAD RIVERS). 

AFTER COORDINATION WITH NEARBY NWS OFFICES...OPTED TO EXTEND AND
EXPAND THE FLOOD WATCH OUT TO 12Z SUNDAY FOR NOW. UPDATED FLOOD
WATCH PRODUCT ALREADY ISSUED. THE COUNTIES LEFT OUT HAVE NOT
EXPERIENCED MUCH RAINFALL AT ALL OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS...AND ALSO
HAVE THE LOWEST FORECASTED RAIN AMOUNTS THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...OUR OLD UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE...STUCK BETWEEN THE BERMUDA AND SOUTHERN 
ROCKIES HIGH PRESSURE RIDGES...WILL CONTINUE TO BE THE MAIN WEATHER 
FEATURE DURING THE EARLY PART OF THE EXTENDED...KEEPING GULF 
MOISTURE FLOW OVER THE AREA THROUGH SUNDAY. HOWEVER...THE LOW WILL 
FINALLY SLIDE UP THE NW SIDE OF THE BERMUDA HIGH AS THE SOUTHERN 
ROCKIES HIGH NOSES EASTWARD. THUS...AFTER A WET SUNDAY...TEMPS WILL 
BECOME MORE SEASONABLE AND PRECIP CHANCES WILL DECREASE JUST IN TIME 
FOR THE NEW WORK WEEK. YEAH. EVEN SO THE RIDGING THAT NOSES INTO THE 
AREA...OR ACTUALLY KIND OF PINCHES INTO THE AREA FROM EAST AND 
WEST...WILL REMAIN DIRTY. AND WITH LOTS OF SURFACE MOISTURE IN 
PLACE...EXPECT DIURNAL CONVECTION TO BE POSSIBLE THROUGHOUT THE WEEK. 
BY NEXT FRIDAY IT IS POSSIBLE THAT A SHORTWAVE TROUGH CROSSING THE 
GREAT LAKES /AND ITS ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY/ WILL SCOUR OUT THE 
REMAINING MOISTURE AND MAYBE PROVIDE A BETTER WEEKEND NEXT WEEKEND. 
HOWEVER...ONE CAVEAT IS THAT AN EASTERLY WAVE BENEATH THE BERMUDA 
HIGH MAY MOVE INTO THE GULF DURING THE LATTER HALF OF NEXT WEEK...SO 
THE LATE WEEK DYNAMICS REMAIN A LITTLE FLUID.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 051353
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
953 AM EDT FRI JUL 5 2013

.DISCUSSION...OTHER THAN RISES AGAIN ON THE FRENCH BROAD AND PIGEON 
RIVERS IN COCKE COUNTY...THERE ARE NO FLOOD CONCERNS THIS MORNING. A 
CHECK OF RAINFALL OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS INDICATED MOST SPOTS GOT 
AROUND 1/2 INCH OR LESS. A FEW EXCEPTIONS NOTED WERE 1.50 INCHES AT 
SPRING CITY (RHEA CO)...1.16 INCHES AT LOOKOUT MTN (HAMILTON CO) AND
1.03 INCHES AT ROAN MTN (CARTER CO). 

AREA RADARS THIS MORNING SHOW VERY SPOTTY LIGHT SHOWERS WITH THE 
BULK OF OUR FORECAST AREA JUST UNDER CLOUDY SKIES. 12Z BNA AND RNK 
SOUNDINGS ARE VERY MOIST AND SO SATURATED THAT THE PROSPECTS OF 
THUNDERSTORMS LOOK VERY MINIMAL. NOT EVEN ANY THUNDER NOTED LAST 
NIGHT WITH THE LOW LEVEL JET THAT DEVELOPED...SO I WILL DECREASE 
THE MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS TO A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THIS AFTERNOON. 

DAYTIME HEATING WILL BRING ABOUT AN INCREASE IN COVERAGE OF SHOWERS
ESPECIALLY WHERE UPSLOPE LOW LEVEL FLOW IS A FACTOR. PLAN TO LOWER 
POPS SLIGHTLY ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES TO HIGH CHANCE... 
SIMILAR TO NRN VALLEY AREAS OF NE TN AND SW VA. 

UPDATED GRIDS AND PRODUCTS TO FOLLOW SHORTLY...AND THE FLOOD WATCH 
REMAINS IN EFFECT WITH SOME ADJUSTMENTS/EXTENSIONS POSSIBLE WITH THE 
AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

     CHEROKEE...CLAY.

026 
FXUS64 KMRX 050739
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 AM EDT FRI JUL 5 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...PERSISTENT UPPER TROUGH
WILL REMAIN ACROSS MISSOURI/ARKANSAS THROUGH SATURDAY PULLING
ABUNDANT TROPICAL MOISTURE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN
APPALACHAINS. STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL PRODUCE DOWNSLOPING WINDS
INTO THE NORTHERN VALLEY WHICH WILL LIMIT QPF AMOUNTS OVER
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. PLAN ON DROPPING FFA THERE.
MODELS SHOW BEST LOW-LEVEL CONVERGENCE LATER TODAY OVER THE PLATEAU
COUNTIES AND WESTERN VALLEY.

FOR TONIGHT AND ESPECIALLY SATURDAY...MODELS SHOW INCREASING
DIVERGENCE ALOFT AS THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION ENHANCES DIVERENCE
ALOFT OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. GIVEN PWS OVER 2 INCHES..
WHICH IS WELL ABOVE NORMAL..A RETURN OF HEAVY RAINFALL AND
POTENTIAL FLOODING. 

FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST NORTHEAST INTO
THE OHIO VALLEY WITH MODELS SHOWING CONTINUE DIVERENCE ALOFT AND
LOW-LEVEL FORCING TO PRODUCE AREAS OF HEAVY RAINS. I AM CONCERNED
WE MAY SEE A BETTER CHANCE OF FLOODING FROM SATURDAY THROUGH
SUNDAY. WILL HAVE TO WATCH FOR THIS POTENTIAL GIVEN SATURATED
GROUNDS. AN EXTENSION OF THE FFA IS POSSIBLE LATER THIS WEEKEND.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY/...
THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA THAT WILL 
HAVE PLAGUED THE REGION WITH RAIN THROUGH THE WEEKEND WILL BEGIN TO 
SHIFT BACK TO THE EAST. THIS WILL RESULT IN SOME ELEVATED CHANCES 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AS A FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION ON 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. IN IT'S WAKE...SUBTROPICAL RIDGING WILL 
BEGIN TO BUILD BACK INTO THE REGION...RESULTING SOME MOSTLY/PARTLY 
SUNNY AND MORE SEASONABLE WEATHER FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK 
AHEAD. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE HIGH AMOUNT OF GULF MOISTURE PRESENT 
BENEATH THIS RIDGE...DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE 
EACH DAY AND EVENING FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. SOME STORMS 
COULD BECOME STRONG GIVEN SOME MODERATE INSTABILITY...BUT THINK THAT 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE THE PRIMARY IMPACT FROM ANY STORM 
THAT DOES DEVELOP GIVEN THE HIGH PWATS IN PLACE. HOWEVER...HIGHS 
SHOULD RETURN TO THE MID TO UPPER 80S IN MOST LOCATIONS BY THE 
MIDDLE TO LATER PART OF THE WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             79  69  79  70  82 /  80  90  90  70  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  81  68  81  69  81 /  70  80  80  70  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       79  67  80  68  82 /  80  80  80  70  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              83  65  84  66  82 /  50  50  50  60  60 

&&

     CHEROKEE...CLAY.

115 AM EDT FRI JUL 5 2013

.AVIATION...
MVFR CONDITIONS CAN BE EXPECTED AT CHA THROUGH 15Z WITH PERIODS OF
MVFR CONDITIONS AT TYS. DOWNSLOPE WINDS WILL KEEP TRI VFR THROUGH 
THE FORECAST PERIOD. ABUNDANT TROPICAL-LIKE MOISTURE WILL REMAIN 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALAHIANS WITH AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY PRODUCING PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND AFTERNOON/EVENING
THUNDERSTORMS. LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN MAY PRODUCE BRIEF IFR 
PERIODS...BUT CHANCES ARE TOO LOW TO MENTION AT THIS TIME. SOME 
INSTABILITY IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE SOME TS TOMORROW AFTERNOON...AND 
WILL INCLUDE AS VCTS AT ALL LOCATIONS.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
916 PM EDT THU JUL 4 2013

.DISCUSSION...
AXIS OF MODERATE PRECIP WITH EMBEDDED HEAVY SHOWERS IS SHFTING BACK
TO THE EAST AS A VORT MAX MOVES AROUND THE BASE OF THE CLOSED LOW.
THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA CONTINUES TO HAVE THE HIGHEST THREAT
OF HEAVY RAIN AND FLOODING AS DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS IN THE EAST ARE
REDUCING PRECIP AMOUNTS. HOWEVER WITH ADDITIONAL RAIN STILL EXPECTED
OVER THE ENTIRE AREA WITH SATURATED CONDITIONS AND HIGH RIVER
LEVELS...WILL KEEP THE FLOOD WATCH GOING EVERYWHERE. SOME MINOR
WORDING CHANGES WILL BE MADE TO THE FORECAST...ALONG WITH SLIGHT
TEMP/DEWPOINT ADJUSTMENT TO MATCH THE LATEST OBS.

278 
FXUS64 KMRX 041918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EDT THU JUL 4 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...THERE HAS GENERALLY BEEN
A BREAK IN THE SHOWERS THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH HAS ALLOWED THE
PIGEON AND FRENCH BROAD RIVERS TO FALL BELOW OR NEAR FLOOD STAGE
ALREADY THIS AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...MODELS AND SATELLITE PICS SHOW
SHORTWAVE ENERGY SWINGING NE OUT OF THE BASE OF THE UPPER LOW TO
OUR WEST. THIS SHORTWAVE WILL BRING AN INCREASE IN CONVECTION
(MOSTLY SHOWERS) BACK INTO THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS...
ESPECIALLY LATE TONIGHT. THE SAME S-SE LOW LEVEL DOWNSLOPE FLOW FOR
THE CENTRAL AND NRN VALLEY COUNTIES WILL BE UPSLOPE FLOW OVER WRN
NC. MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON ANOTHER SWATH OF MODERATE TO LOCALLY
HEAVY RAINS TO OUR EAST AGAIN...WHICH COULD AFFECT A FEW STREAMS
AND RIVERS OVER NE TN OVERNIGHT. THE INCREASING LOW LEVEL JET WILL
GENERATE ENOUGH LIFT AND ELEVATED INSTABILITY...SO I KEPT A SLIGHT
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS AS WELL. DON'T SEE A PATTERN FAVORABLE FOR
A MTN WAVE...ALTHO I DID INCLUDE SOME GUSTY WINDS IN THE MTN GROUPS
OVERNIGHT. 

THUS...FOR THIS REASON AND CONTINUITY WITH NWS NEIGHBORS I WILL
CONTINUE THE FLOOD WATCH THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING...WITH THE OPTION
FOR LATER SHIFTS TO EVALUATE THIS AGAIN ON FRIDAY. 

HARD TO TIME AND JUDGE HOW WIDESPREAD CONVECTION WILL BE FROM
FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH A POTENTIAL DECREASE INDICATED BY
FRIDAY NIGHT. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS LOOKED ON TRACK OVERALL AND
WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS
SLOWLY EAST SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY NIGHT WITH MODELS IN 
AGREEMENT ON RELATIVELY HIGH POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
DURING THIS PERIOD. STAYED WITH LOWER CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION 
MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS RIDGING BRIEFLY ESTABLISHES ITSELF 
ALBEIT WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY FOR SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. BY THURSDAY ANOTHER SIGNIFICANT SHORT 
WAVE AND FRONTAL BOUNDARY BUILD INTO THE REGION SO TWEAKED POPS UP 
AT THE END OF THE EXTENDED. STAYED IN THE MIDDLE OF ECM/MEX MOS 
GUIDANCE TEMPS FOR THE LONG TERM.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 041428
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1027 AM EDT THU JUL 4 2013

.DISCUSSION...MAIN CONCERNS THIS MORNING ARE MINOR RIVER FLOODING IN 
COCKE COUNTY ON THE FRENCH BROAD AND PIGEON RIVER...BUT THESE RIVERS 
HAVE CRESTED AND ARE ON THE WAY DOWN. HEAVIEST RAIN OVERNIGHT WAS 
AROUND TRI WHERE 1.73 INCHES WAS MEASURED. OTHER NOTABLE AMOUNTS WERE
2.85 INCHES AT ROAN MTN...2.39 INCHES AT JOHNSON CITY...AND 2.10 
INCHES AT ABINGDON VA. 

ELSEWHERE IN THE WATCH AREA RAINFALL WAS NOT THAT HEAVY...PER RADAR 
ESTIMATES AND AVAILABLE RAIN GAGES. WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS THIS 
MORNING SHOW THAT THE MAIN AXIS OF DEEP MOISTURE HAS SHIFTED TO OUR 
WEST FROM AL NORTH ACROSS MIDDLE TN. ALSO...THE 12Z UPPER AIR PLOTS 
REVEAL ABOUT 20 KNOTS OF SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW...PROVIDING THE 
DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS AS FORECAST YESTERDAY. WILL LOWER POPS TO A LIKELY 
RANGE ACROSS THE NRN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS...AND ALSO LESSEN THE 
MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS TO ISOLATED OR SLIGHT CHANCE (BASED ON 
MODEL SOUNDINGS).

PLAN TO CONTINUE THE FLOOD WATCH FOR NOW...BUT WILL RE-EVALUATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AFTER VIEWING 12Z MODEL DATA AND SEEING HOW MUCH RAIN 
FALLS ACROSS THE REGION.

CONTINUE AT CHA...WHICH WILL LOWER VIS AND CIGS TO IFR AND MVFR
RESPECTIVELY. AS AXIS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN SHIFTS WEST LATER
TODAY...THIS MAY ALLOW FOR JUST VCSH AND P6SM VIS AT TRI INTO THE

FXUS64 KMRX 040816
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
416 AM EDT THU JUL 4 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE
CONTINUES ACROSS THE LOWER MS VALLEY. STRENGTHENING RIDGE OFF THE
EAST COAST WILL KEEP STRONG MOISTURE FEED FROM THE ATLANTIC AND
GULF OVER THE WESTERN PART OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY WITH THE
AIR MASS BECOMING MODERATELY UNSTABLE FOR THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP.
SOME THUNDERSTORMS MAY BECOME STRONG WITH LOCALLY HIGH WINDS PER
SPC DAY ONE DISCUSSION. MODELS SHOWING THE HEAVIEST RAINFALL
SHOULD BE FROM KNOXVILLE WEST WITH DOWN SLOPING AFFECTING RAINFALL
AMOUNTS IN THE NORTHEAST. PRECIPITABLE WATER AMOUNTS STILL MOSTLY
1.75 TO 2.00 INCHES TODAY AND TONIGHT AND SLIGHTLY LOWER ACROSS NE
TN. WITH THE HEAVY RAINFALL THAT FELL IN NORTHEAST TN WEDNESDAY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING ANY MODERATE RAINFALL COULD CAUSE STILL CAUSE
LOCALIZED FLOODING IN NE TN. KEPT HIGHS ONLY IN THE MID TO UPPER
70S SIMILAR TO WEDNESDAY WITH CONSIDERABLE CLOUD COVER AND EXPECTED
RAINFALL. TONIGHT SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TO
CONTINUE. PLACED HIGHEST QPF WEST AND LOWER AMOUNTS NE TN AND SW VA.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO CURRENT 
FORECAST. PROLONGED PERIOD OF WET WEATHER WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND. THE TROUGH OVER MS RVR VALLEY WILL CONTINUE PUMPING 
ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH EARLY 
SUNDAY. HIGH RAIN CHANCES WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND. 
HEAVIEST RAINFALL WILL OCCUR OVER THE SOUTHERN VALLEY OF TN AND 
ALONG THE PLATEAU COUNTIES WHILE AREAS ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN WILL 
SPARED WITH LESSER RAINFALL AMOUNTS. THE FLOOD WATCH MAY NEED TO BE 
EXTENDED AND RE-CONFIGURED IN LATER SHIFTS TO BETTER HIGHLIGHT THE 
TIMING AND AREAS OF CONCERN.

BY MONDAY...HIGH PRESSURE AND A DRIER AIR MASS WILL BUILD INTO THE 
AREA. THEREFORE MORE DIURNAL TYPE SHOWERS/THUNDER WILL OCCUR IN THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. TEMPERATURES 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 040002 AAA

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
802 PM EDT WED JUL 3 2013

.DISCUSSION...

RAINFALL REPORTS OVER NE TN AND SW VA INDICATE 2 TO 3 INCHES HAS
FALLEN IN THE PAST 12 HOURS. WE ARE GETTING SOME REPORTS OF
FLOODING PROBLEMS AND ROAD CLOSURES IN THIS AREA. RAINFALL RATES
IN THIS AREA SHOULD BEGIN TO DECREASE THIS EVENING AS IR SATELLTIE
SHOWS WARMER CLOUD TOPS APPROACHING FROM THE SOUTH. THE AXIS OF
HEAVIEST RAINFALL IS EXPECTED TO SHIFT TO THE WESTERN HALF
OVERNIGHT. THE NAM AND RUC SHOW INCREASING FRONTOGENEIC FORCING
OVER MIDDLE TN AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AFTER MIDNIGHT.

WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE EARLY TO ADJUST QPF AMOUNTS TO MATCH THE
TRENDS DISCUSSED ABOVE...AND BRING HOURLY FORECAST TEMPS/DEWPOINTS
CLOSWER TO OBSERVATIONS. NO CHANGES ARE NEEDED TO THE FLOOD WATCH.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
721 PM EDT WED JUL 3 2013

.AVIATION...
RAIN WILL PERSIST AT ALL TAF SITES THROUGH THE NIGHT. OVERAL
FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS LOW AS CONDITIONS WITH THE RAIN WILL BE
HIGHLY VARIABLE...BUT WILL ATTMEPT TO KEEP THE TAFS SIMPLE AND
SHORT. WINDS ALOFT FROM THE SE WILL CREATE A DOWNSLOPE EFFECT AT
TYS AND TRI...WHICH WILL LIKELY PREVENT CLOUDS FROM DROPPING BELOW
VFR. VIS AT THOSE SITES WILL BE PREDOMINANTLY MVFR WITH THE
RAIN...ALTHOUGH HEAVIER POCKETS OF SHOWERS MAY LOWER VIS TO IFR AT
TIMES. RAIN WILL SPREAD INTO CHA TOWARD MIDNIGHT...WHICH WILL
LOWER VIS AND CIGS TO IFR AND MVFR RESPECTIVELY. THE AXIS OF
MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINFALL IS EXPECTED TO SHIFT WESTWARD
TOMORROW...WHICH MAY ALLOW FOR JUST VCSH AND P6SM VIS AT TRI AND
TYS IN THE AFTERNOON.

FXUS64 KMRX 031911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT WED JUL 3 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...SHOWERS AND
ISOLATED EMBEDDED TSRA CONTINUE TO STREAM NORTH WITH NO IMMEDIATE
END IN SIGHT THIS AFTERNOON. RAINFALL SO FAR HAS GENERALLY BEEN
LIGHT TO MODERATE...BUT SHOULD INCREASE TONIGHT. THE BEST SWATH OF
LIFT AND RAINFALL AMOUNTS ARE PROGGED FOR WRN HALF OF THE FORECAST
AREA...BUT DOWNSLOPE FLOW IS NOT INDICATED UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING.
THUS...KEPT A MENTION OF HEAVY RAINS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE REGION
TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING. TEMPS SHOULD NOT FALL MUCH GIVEN
CURRENT TEMPS AND DEW POINT TEMPS.

LOWERED POPS SLIGHTLY BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND
NRN VALLEY AREAS...DUE TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF S-SE DOWNSLOPE LOW
LEVEL FLOW. NOT SURE IF CLOUDS WILL ACTUALLY BREAK OUT COMPLETELY
BUT LOWER RAIN CHANCES AND CLOSER TO MOS MAX TEMPS FOR THOSE AREAS.  

FOR THURSDAY NIGHT...LOWERED POPS A BIT MORE FOR NE AREAS AND IF
NAM MODEL IS CORRECT...A FURTHER LOWERING OF POPS MAY BE NEEDED.
OTHERWISE...RAINFALL INENSITY IS SHOWN TO DROP OFF AND FLOOD WATCH
MAY BE NEEDED TO ADJUSTED IN AREAL COVERAGE AND DURATION AT THAT
POINT. CURRENT THINKING IS NE TN AND SW VA AREAS COULD BE DROPPED
WITH THE FLOOD WATCH STILL NEEDED FOR SE TN/SW NC AND NRN PLATEAU 
PERHAPS INTO FRIDAY NIGHT OR SATURDAY.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
A VERY PROLONGED PERIOD OF WET WEATHER WILL PERSIST ON FRIDAY AND 
INTO SATURDAY. THE DEEP TROUGH OVER ARKANSAS AND TEXAS WILL CONTINUE 
PUMPING ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL GULF MOISTURE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
FRIDAY. CLOUDY AND RAIN COOLED CONDITIONS WILL OCCUR DURING THE DAY 
FRIDAY. LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY WILL BE IN PLACE HOWEVER ONLY AN 
ISOLATED RUMBLE OF THUNDER WILL OCCUR. 

THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS REMAINS IN PLAY THROUGH AT LEAST SUNDAY NIGHT. 
THUS HIGH RAIN CHANCES WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND. 
HEAVIEST RAINFALL WILL OCCUR OVER THE SOUTHERN VALLEY OF TN AND 
ALONG THE PLATEAU COUNTIES WHILE AREAS ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN WILL 
SPARED WITH LESSER RAINFALL AMOUNTS. THE FLOOD WATCH MAY NEED TO BE 
EXTENDED AND RE-CONFIGURED IN LATER SHIFTS TO BETTER HIGHLIGHT THE 
TIMING AND AREAS OF CONCERN.

BY MONDAY THE FLOW OVER THE REGION WILL BE RATHER WEAK AND ZONAL. 
THEREFORE MORE DIURNAL TYPE SHOWERS/THUNDER WILL OCCUR IN THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.


&&

.DISCUSSION...WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS SHOW THE PLUME OF MOISTURE 
STREAMING NORTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. ALREADY 
SEEING CONVECTION INCREASE TO OUR SOUTH...WITH AN AREA OVER THE 
SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS AND ACROSS THE WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY ON 
EASTERN PARTS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. OHX 12Z SOUNDING HAD 
PRECIPITABLE WATER UP TO 1.3 INCHES WHILE RNK WAS A MOISTER 1.65 
INCHES. 

FORECAST GRIDS LOOK GOOD FOR TODAY WITH POPS INCREASING TO HIGH 
LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL THIS AFTERNOON. WILL ALSO MAINTAIN THE CURRENT 
FLOOD WATCH TIMING...ALTHO THE THREAT OF SHOWERS AND STORMS DOES 
LINGER INTO THE WEEKEND. 

LATEST MODELS ARE ADVERTISING A POTENTIAL SHIFT OF THE HEAVIER RAINS 
TO OUR WEST ON THE 4TH OF JULY...BUT STILL THE AXIS WOULD RUN FROM 
SE TN ACROSS MIDDLE TN INTO CENTRAL KY. WILL EVALUATE THE 12Z MODEL 
RUNS BEFORE ANY CHANGES ARE CONSIDERED TO THE FLOOD WATCH.

.AVIATION...A NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL
BOUNDARY STILL LIES ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WITH A VERY
MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED AND
PERSISTENT UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY CONTINUES TO
BRING A DEEP AND MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
REGION THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD. THIS SCENARIO WILL RESULT IN
SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AROUND THE TAF
SITES THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD...ESPECIALLY AFTER ABOUT 18Z TODAY
AND THROUGH TONIGHT. USED VICINITY WORDING FOR THUNDERSTORMS DURING
THE DAY TODAY AND PREVAILING SHOWERS TONIGHT. SOME MVFR FOG THIS
MORNING AT TYS AND LATE TONIGHT AT ALL SITES. OTHERWISE...MOSTLY
VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS TODAY AND THEN MVFR CEILINGS IN
SHOWERS ALL SITES LATE TONIGHT.

862 
FXUS64 KMRX 030830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EDT WED JUL 3 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BASIC PATTERN REMAINS
UNCHANGED WITH UPPER RIDGE IN THE WEST AND DEEP UPPER TROUGH OVER
THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY AND ATLANTIC RIDGE OFF THE EAST COAST.
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SOME STRONG HAVE OCCURRED
OVERNIGHT ALONG A STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY LYING NORTH TO SOUTH
OVER EAST TN. RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF UP TO ABOUT ONE INCH HAVE
OCCURRED IN PARTS OF SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE OVERNIGHT. IN BRADLEY
COUNTY UP TO ABOUT TWO INCHES FELL AFTER MIDNIGHT. FLASH FLOOD
GUIDANCE VALUES ARE ABOUT 1.5 TO 2.0 INCHES FOR ONE HOUR AND 2 TO 3
INCHES FOR 3 HOURS SO ANY PROLONGED HEAVY RAIN WILL LIKELY CAUSE
FLOODING. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY TODAY
AND TONIGHT BUT MAY SHIFT SLIGHTLY WEST BY EARLY THURSDAY. AS
TEMPERATURES WARM UP LATE THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BECOME MORE NUMEROUS WITH HEAVY RAINFALL
POSSIBLE BY LATE AFTERNOON OR EVENING. NAM MODEL FORECASTS
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES TO REACH 1.75 TO 2.00 INCHES THIS
AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. HAVE CONTINUED FLOOD WATCH FOR TONIGHT AND
KEPT IT THROUGH FRIDAY. A FEW STORMS MAY BECOME STRONG DURING THE
AFTERNOON BUT HEAVY RAIN WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT. HIGH TEMPERATURES
STAY COOL TODAY MOSTLY CLOSE TO THE MET GUIDANCE OF MID 70S TO
LOWER 80S. TONIGHT LOWS COOL TO THE MID TO UPPER 60S WITH POPS NEAR
100 PERCENT.

.LONG TERM...(INDEPENDENCE DAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MINOR CHANGES TO
THE FORECAST THROUGH FRIDAY. PATTERN REMAINS FAVORABLE FOR GOOD
MOISTURE TRANSPORT FROM TALC AND CLIMAX. UPPER LOW OVER MISSOURI
SHIFTS SLIGHTLY WEST EARLY IN THE PERIOD. SOUTHEASTERLY LOW LEVEL
JET AROUND 35 KTS ACROSS SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS INTO FRIDAY MORNING
WILL LEAD TO SOME DOWNSLOPE FLOW WEST OF THE ROSELINE INTO EXTREME
E TN VALLEY. ALL MODEL QPF DEPICTING MINIMUMS IN EXPECTED RAINFALL
FROM THE LOWER GASMAN UP TO THE TRI CITIES AREA. CONFIDENCE IN RAIN
SHADOW NOT ENOUGH TO REMOVE THESE AREAS FROM FLOOD WATCH. DAMPENING
UPPER LOW BEGINS MOVING NE OVER THE WEEKEND INTO THE OH VALLEY.
THIS DRAWS PEAT VALUES IN EXCESS OF 2.00 IN AN UP VALLEY FLOW
THROUGH THE E TN VALLEY. INCREASED POPS OVER THE WEEKEND WITH
GROWING CONCERN FOR ADDITIONAL HEAVY RAINFALL FROM DEEP CONVECTION.
UPPER LOW TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. THIS SHOULD LEAD
TO LOWER POPS CHANCES HOWEVER DIURNAL CONVECTION SHOULD BE ABOVE
NORMAL INTO NEXT WEEK. THICKNESS VALUES ARE ALSO ON THE RISE
SUPPORTING TEMPERATURES IN THE 90S FOR SOME AREAS. DID NOT GO THIS
HIGH EXPECTING ABOVE NORMAL STORMS AND CLOUD COVER.


&&

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED QUASI- 
STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...WITH A VERY MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED AND PERSISTENT UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY WILL CONTINUE TO BRING A DEEP AND MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD. THIS 
SCENARIO WILL RESULT IN THE POSSIBILITY OF SCATTERED CONVECTION 
AROUND THE TAF SITES THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD...BUT ESPECIALLY 
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. SINCE TIMING THE EXACT 
OCCURRENCE AT THE TAF SITES WILL BE PROBLEMATIC...WILL JUST MENTION 
VICINITY WORDING FOR NOW. OTHERWISE...SOME FOG IS EXPECTED TO 
DEVELOP AGAIN AT KTRI DUE TO THE RAIN REPORTED EARLIER THIS 
AFTERNOON AND WILL MENTION IFR CONDITIONS TOWARDS SUNRISE. 
OTHERWISE...MOSTLY VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED 
THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD (OUTSIDE OF ANY CONVECTION).

905 PM EDT TUE JUL 2 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED QUASI- 
STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...WITH A VERY MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED AND PERSISTENT UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY WILL CONTINUE TO BRING A DEEP AND MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT. IN FACT...THE NAM MODEL 
REVEALS PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES RISING TO AROUND 2 INCHES BY 
SUNRISE ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN. THIS SCENARIO WILL RESULT IN SCATTERED 
CONVECTION CONTINUING OVERNIGHT...WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL WITH SOME STORMS. PATCHY FOG SHOULD DEVELOP AGAIN 
AFTER MIDNIGHT...ESPECIALLY IN AREAS THAT RECEIVED RAINFALL EARLIER 
TODAY.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO LOWER POPS A LITTLE TO MENTION 
SCATTERED CONVECTION. ALSO...WILL TWEAK TEMPS AND SKY CONDITIONS A 
LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

740 PM EDT TUE JUL 2 2013

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED QUASI- 
STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...WITH A VERY MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED AND PERSISTENT UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY WILL CONTINUE TO BRING A DEEP AND MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD. THIS 
SCENARIO WILL RESULT IN THE POSSIBILITY OF SCATTERED CONVECTION 
AROUND THE TAF SITES THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD...BUT ESPECIALLY 
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. SINCE TIMING THE EXACT 
OCCURRENCE AT THE TAF SITES WILL BE PROBLEMATIC...WILL JUST MENTION 
VICINITY WORDING FOR NOW. OTHERWISE...SOME FOG IS EXPECTED TO 
DEVELOP AGAIN AT KTRI DUE TO THE RAIN REPORTED EARLIER THIS 
AFTERNOON AND WILL MENTION IFR CONDITIONS TOWARDS SUNRISE. 
OTHERWISE...MOSTLY VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED 
THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD (OUTSIDE OF ANY CONVECTION). 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FLOOD WATCH FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR 
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY

459 
FXUS64 KMRX 021834
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
234 PM EDT TUE JUL 2 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE MISSOURI BOOTHEEL HAS ONCE AGAIN
TRIGGERED SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS ACTIVITY WILL
CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AND
MAY ACTUALLY EXPAND IN COVERAGE LATER TONIGHT AS THE LOW SLOWLY
NAVIGATES WEST AND LIFT/MOISTURE INCREASES. MODELS ARE INDICATING
ADDITIONAL BANDS OF PRECIPITATION DEVELOPING OVER NORTHERN GEORGIA
AND WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA...AND WORKING THEIR WAY INTO THE REGION
LATE TONIGHT. GIVEN THE VERY MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER...LOCALLY HEAVY
RAINFALL IS EXPECTED WITH MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY THAT DOES DEVELOP.
SOME PATCHY FOG WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE GIVEN THE HIGH MOISTURE
CONTENT AND LIGHT WINDS IN THE USUAL PRONE AREAS THAT REMAIN FREE
OF THE HEAVIER SHOWER ACTIVITY. 

SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL FURTHER EXPAND IN COVERAGE/INTENSITY ON
WEDNESDAY AS MOISTURE/LIFT CONTINUES TO RAMP UP. THUS...HAVE GONE
CATEGORICAL POPS AREWIDE FOR THE AFTERNOON AS ALL MODELS ARE IN
AGREEMENT OF THIS. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL AGAIN BE THE PRIMARY
THREAT WITH THIS ACTIVITY WHICH MAY EVENTUALLY LEAD TO FLOODING
CONCERNS HEADING INTO THE INDEPENDENCE DAY HOLIDAY...WHICH WILL BE
ADDRESSED IN THE SECTION BELOW. HAVE GONE BELOW GUIDANCE ON HIGHS
FOR WEDNESDAY GIVEN THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND RAIN CHANCES...
AS MOST AREAS WILL STRUGGLE TO CLIMB MUCH ABOVE 80 DEGREES.

.LONG TERM /INDEPENDENCE DAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
POPS WILL RISE TO CATEGORICAL WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND REMAIN IN THAT 
RANGE THROUGH FRIDAY AS DEEP TROPICAL MOISTURE FEEDS NORTHWARD INTO 
THE AREA BETWEEN A CLOSED LOW IN THE MIDWEST AND A HIGH OFF THE 
ATLANTIC COAST. PW VALUES WILL BE 1.8 TO 2 INCHES...WITH A DEEP WARM 
CLOUD LAYER DEPTH LEADING TO HIGH PRECIP EFFICIENCY. THE POSITION OF 
THE JET ENTRANCE REGION WILL PRODUCE VIGOROUS UPPER DIVERGENCE AND 
MIDLEVEL FRONTOGENESIS FOR LIFT. THERE ARE SOME MODEL DIFFERENCES ON 
THE FINER DETAILS AND QPF AMOUNTS/LOCATIONS. THE NAM HAS A STRONGER 
RIDGE AND PUSHES THE MAX QPF AXIS TO MIDDLE TN AND THE PLATEAU. THIS 
APPEARS TO BE AN OUTLIER AS THE GFS/ECMWF/CMC CENTER THE MAX QPF 
OVER OUR AREA. HOWEVER THE 12Z GFS HAS TRENDED A BIT FARTHER WEST 
FROM PREVIOUS RUNS. AS A RESULT...WILL SHIFT THE MAX QPF AREA 
SLIGHTLY TOWARD THE WESTERN HALF. SOME DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS MAY ALSO 
TRIM A BIT OFF THE QPF AMOUNTS IN THE NORTHEAST. STILL...WE ARE 
LOOKING AT 2 TO 5 INCHES ON AVERAGE ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH 
FRIDAY...WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS. FLOODING POTENTIAL APPEARS 
HIGH...SO THE FLOOD WATCH WILL BE MAINTAINED AS IS. 

THE UPPER LOW TO OUR WEST TRANSITIONS TO AN OPEN WAVE TROUGH FRIDAY 
NIGHT...AND THE ATLANTIC RIDGE BEGINS TO EXTEND TO THE WEST. WE WILL 
REMAIN UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF THIS RIDGE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF 
THE FORECAST PERIOD. WHILE MOISTURE DEPTH DECREASES AS THE RIDGE 
BUILDS IN...A SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SOME 
ACCESS TO GULF MOISTURE. SCATTERED TO ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE MAINLY DIURNAL AND WILL FAVOR THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU. TEMPS WILL RISE ABOVE NORMAL 
FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY BENEATH THE MIDLEVEL RIDGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             69  82  70  79  70 /  60  80 100 100  90 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  68  81  69  79  70 /  60  70 100 100  90 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  81  69  79  70 /  50  70 100 100  90 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              65  80  66  78  67 /  60  70 100  90  80

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1036 AM EDT TUE JUL 2 2013

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW CONTINUES TO SPIN OVER THE MISSOURI BOOTHEAL THIS
MORNING...BRINGING BANDS OF CLOUDS AND EVENTUALLY SOME ADDITIONAL
SHOWERS AND STORMS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON. MODELS
ARE INDICATING THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE SCATTERED IN NATURE AND
DEVELOP ALONG THE PLATEAU...AND EXPAND IN COVERAGE AS IT SPREADS
NORTH AND EAST THROUGHOUT THE AFTERNOON. THE MORE FAVORED AREAS FOR
CONVECTION WILL BE ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST ZONES LATE
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT A REASONABLE CHANCE FOR
PRECIPITATION WILL EXIST ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA TODAY. THE
SEVERE THREAT SHOULD BE FAIRLY MINIMIZED TODAY...THOUGH SOME STORMS
COULD BECOME STRONG THIS AFTERNOON. THE PRIMARY THREAT WILL BE
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL GIVEN THE VERY MOIST ENVIRONMENT IN PLACE.
GIVEN THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER...HIGHS TODAY WILL BE AROUND 10
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL IN SOME SPOTS...RANGING FROM THE UPPER 70S TO
LOWER 80S.

FXUS64 KMRX 020848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
448 AM EDT TUE JUL 2 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW WILL LINGER OVER SE 
MISSOURI. WEAK SURFACE TROUGH FROM GLFMEX TO MID TN VALLEY WITH 
BERMUDA HIGH ESTABLISHED TO THE EAST. EAST TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS REMAIN IN DEEP SOUTHERLY LAYER FLOW. PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST IN ORDER WITH MINOR CHANGES IN PATTERN. DRY SLOT IN MID 
LEVELS KEEP PWATS VALUES ONLY SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL. WEAK MID LEVEL 
IMPULSE COUPLED WITH AFTN DESTABILIZATION WILL HELP TRIGGER 
CONVECTION FAVORING AFTN AND EVENING HOURS. BETTER CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION ACROSS NE AREAS. TEMPERATURES INSIDE CLIMATIC NORMALS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...PERSISTENT UPPER LEVEL
TROUGH OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY AND BUILDING RIDGE JUST OFF THE
EAST COAST WILL FUNNEL COPIOUS AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE NORTH FROM THE
GULF INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AND THEN
THE RIDGE BUILDS FARTHER WEST SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY WITH THE
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DECREASING AND BECOMING MORE
TERRAIN INDUCED. RAIN CHANCES WILL BE HIGH THROUGH FRIDAY AND THEN
LOWER SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. KEPT HIGHS IN THE LOWER 80S
WEDNESDAY AND THEN UPPER 70S THURSDAY ON THE 4TH OF JULY. HIGHS
FRIDAY SIMILAR TO THURSDAY AND THEN WARMING A FEW DEGREES EACH DAY
TO MID 80S TO NEAR 90 BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD AND
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS IN THE VALLEYS AND CHANCE OF STORMS MOUNTAINS.
FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY FOR 3 TO 5
INCHES OF RAIN BY FRIDAY EVENING. LOCALIZED FLOODING EARLY FOLLOWED
BY RIVER FLOODING POSSIBLE BY THE END OF THE WEEK. SOME STRONG
STORMS ALSO POSSIBLE WITH A FEW SEVERE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT MON JUL 1 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED QUASI- 
STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH A MORE 
HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY). A 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED AND QUASI-STATIONARY UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS 
RIVER VALLEY WILL CONTINUE TO BRING A DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW OF 
MOISTURE INTO THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. THUS...EXPECT SCATTERED 
CONVECTION TO CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT WITH LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL POSSIBLE IN A FEW AREAS.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS LATER EVENING TO REMOVE ANY EVENING PRECIP 
WORDING...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS AND SKY CONDITIONS A LITTLE ACCORDING 
TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

.AVIATION...SOME SHOWERS WILL BE EXITING THE VICINITY OF TRI WITHIN

THE MOIST ENVIRONMENT PRESENT ACROSS THE REGION. STAYED WITH SOME
MVFR RANGE FOG AT CHA AND TYS BUT TRI MAY DROP INTO THE IFR
CATEGORY WITH THE EARLY EVENING CONVECTION DEVELOPING HERE. PLACED
VICINITY THUNDER IN AT ALL SITES DURING THE AFTERNOON ON TUESDAY AS

984 
FXUS64 KMRX 011842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 PM EDT MON JUL 1 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER WESTERN TENNESSEE HAS
HELPED TO GENERATE SEVERAL CLUSTERS OF THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE
REGION THIS AFTERNOON. WITH SOME MODERATE INSTABILITY AND SHEAR TO
WORK WITH /WITH MUCAPE AOA 2000 J/KG AND BULK SHEAR VALUES AOA 30
KTS/ SOME OF THESE STORMS HAVE BEEN ABLE TO ORGANIZE AND BECOME
STRONG TO SEVERE. THE PRIMARY THREATS WITH THE STRONGEST STORMS
WILL BE DAMAGING WINDS AND HAIL /GIVEN THE LOWER MELTING LEVELS
WITH THE COOLER AIR ALOFT/. ALSO...GIVEN THE VERY MOIST ENVIRONMENT
IN PLACE...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THIS
ACTIVITY AS WELL. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BEGIN TO WANE AFTER
SUNSET...BUT SOME CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL STILL PERSIST
OVERNIGHT. LATE TONIGHT...THE POTENTIAL FOR PATCHY FOG WILL EXIST
GIVEN THE MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER CONDITIONS AND CALM WINDS...SO HAVE
ADDED A MENTION OF THIS IN THE FORECAST AS WELL.

WITH THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH REMAINING THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE
ACROSS THE REGION...ADDITIONAL ROUNDS OF SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL BE
POSSIBLE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AS WELL...THOUGH COVERAGE MAY BE
A BIT LESS THAN THIS AFTERNOON. GIVEN THE CLOUD COVER AND
PRECIPITATION CHANCES...HIGHS WILL BE A BIT ON THE COOL SIDE AND
GENERALLY ONLY REACH IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S IN MOST SPOTS BY
THE LATE AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
THE CLOSED UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTHWEST WILL RETROGRADE TO THE MS 
VALLEY...AND THE AXIS OF DEEP MOISTURE THAT HAS BEEN OVER THE 
ATLANTIC COAST THE PAST FEW DAYS WILL SHIFT TO OUR AREA. FLOODING 
POTENTIAL APPEARS HIGH FOR THE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY PERIOD.
UNFORTUNATELY...INDEPENDENCE DAY CELEBRATIONS LOOK TO BE VERY SOGGY.

THE NAM AND GFS DIFFER WITH THE ONSET OF PRECIP WEDNESDAY...WITH THE 
NAM PRODUCING MUCH MORE QPF DURING THE DAY THAN THE GFS. WILL LEAN 
TOWARD THE SLOWER GFS...WITH POPS RAMPING UP TO CATEGORICAL 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE SYNOPTIC FORCING REALLY INCREASES. WITH THE 
RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF THE JET MOVING INTO A FAVORABLE POSITION 
AND REMAINING NEARLY STATIONARY...WE WILL SEE FRONTOGENETIC FORCING 
SITTING OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS WILL BE 
ACTING ON A VERY MOIST AIR MASS WITH PW VALUES AROUND 2 INCHES AND A 
DEEP WARM CLOUD LAYER ABOVE 4000M. AT THIS TIME...PRECIP AMOUNTS 
THROUGH FRIDAY MAY BE ON THE ORDER OF 2 TO 5 INCHES ON 
AVERAGE...WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE. WITH THE ONSET OF 
THE HEAVY PRECIP STILL OVER 48 HOURS AWAY...WILL HOLD OFF ON A FLOOD 
WATCH FOR NOW...ALTHOUGH IT APPEARS HIGHLY LIKELY THAT ONE WILL BE 
NEEDED EVENTUALLY AS WE GET CLOSER TO THE EVENT. 

AS THE UPPER LOW BEGINS TO RETREAT NORTHWARD AND BECOME AN OPEN WAVE 
TROUGH ON FRIDAY...THE ATLANTIC RIDGE WILL BUILD WEST AND BECOME 
MORE DOMINANT THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THE RIDGE BECOMES CENTERED OVER 
GA AND THE CAROLINAS BY SUNDAY NIGHT. SUBSIDENCE UNDER THE RIDGE 
WILL GIVE DECREASING POPS AND ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR THE 
BEGINNING OF THE WEEK. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  85  68  83  70 /  30  40  50  60  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  82  67  82  69 /  30  50  50  70  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  82  66  83  68 /  30  50  50  60  80

1002 AM EDT MON JUL 1 2013

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW CONTINUES TO SPIN ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE THIS
MORNING...AND WILL BRING THE FORECAST AREA A SHOT OF SOME MORE
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LATER THIS AFTERNOON. FOR NOW...SOME DRY
SLOTTING HAS ALLOWED FORM SOME PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE
AREA WHICH SHOULD ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO RISE INTO THE 80S BY EARLY
TO MID AFTERNOON. LATER...ANOTHER SHORTWAVE AND LOBE OF MOISTURE IS
PROGGED TO TRACK INTO THE REGION BY 18-21Z...WHICH ALONG WITH
DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD TRIGGER SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION ACROSS THE
ENTIRE AREA. THOUGH THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT SHOULD BE FAIRLY
MARGINAL...SOME MODEST INSTABILITY COULD RESULT IN A FEW STORMS
BECOMING STRONG/SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS BEING THE PRIMARY
THREAT. ADDITIONALLY THOUGH...ANY SHOWERS/STORMS THAT DO DEVELOP
WILL BE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL GIVEN THE VERY
MOIST ENVIRONMENT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT MON JUL 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW OVER SW KY WILL CONTINUE 
TO DRIFT SW. SURFACE TROUGH CONTINUES FROM THE GLFMEX THROUGH THE 
MID TN VALLEY. A DEW POINT FRONTAL BOUNDARY CONTINUES ALONG THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. DEEPER MOISTURE WILL REMAIN EAST OF THIS DEW 
POINT BOUNDARY WHILE A MID LEVEL DRY SLOT MOVES NE THROUGH MRX CWA 
EARLY TODAY. LOW PRECIPITATION CHANCES EARLY WILL INCREASE THIS 
AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY OUTSIDE THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEYS. 
AFTERNOON DESTABILIZATION WILL BE COUPLED WITH SOME LIFT PROVIDED BY 
MID LEVEL JET SEGMENT OVER THE SMOKIES. JET SEGMENT MOVES OUT OF THE 
AREA TONIGHT WITH MID LEVEL DRYING IN ITS WAKE. TEMPERATURES NEAR 
NORMAL. 
 
.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SOUTHERLY FLOW OVER THE REGION 
WITH AN UPPER TROUGH POSITIONED ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. ON TUESDAY 
WILL CARRY LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE MRX CWA.  THIS LONG WITH 
DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD ALLOW FOR NORMAL SUMMERTIME CONVECTION TO 
DEVELOP OVER THE AREA MAINLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  THE UPPER 
TROUGH BEGINS TO SHIFT WESTWARD ON WEDNESDAY ALLOWING SOUTHERLY FLOW TO 
TAP INTO GULF MOISTURE...SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE MOISTURE OVER THE 
REGION.  WIDESPREAD CONVECTION IS EXPECTED WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY 
AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE STREAMS INTO THE REGION AND A COUPLE OF WEAK 
IMPULSES IN THE UPPER FLOW TRACK THROUGH.  HAVE INCREASED POPS IN 
THURSDAY TO CATEGORICAL.  ALL THIS MOISTURE MAY CAUSE  HEAVY 
RAINFALL AND THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALIZED FLOODING FOR THE MIDDLE 
PART OF THE EXTENDED.   A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO NUDGE ITS 
WAY INTO THE EASTERN U.S. BY THE WEEKEND AND THIS SHOULD DECREASE 
THE CHANCE OF CONVECTION FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

ASSOCIATION WITH A HEALTHY SHORT WAVE DRIVING NORTH ACROSS THE MID
ATLANTIC REGION. THE OTHER SPOT THAT HAS A CHANCE OF SEEING A

ROTATING EAST AROUND THE BASE OF THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY UPPER LOW.
THIS CONVECTION LOOKS LIKE IT IS DEVELOPING JUST EAST OF THE
TERMINAL. TYS MAY SEE SOME OF THIS LATER TONIGHT BUT PROBABILITY
TOO LOW AT THIS TIME. TRI MAY SEE SOME LIGHT FOG LATE TONIGHT BUT
NOT EXPECTING MUCH PROBLEMS WITH VSBY AT THE OTHER TERMINALS. WOULD
EXPECT MONDAY TO BE A LITTLE MORE ACTIVE DAY WITH SOME SHOWERS AND
A LITTLE THUNDER AROUND AS THE ATMOSPHERE CONTINUES TO MOISTEN IN
THE PRESENCE OF THE STRENGTHENING DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW.

284 
FXUS64 KMRX 301851
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT SUN JUN 30 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...UPPER LOW WILL REMAIN CENTERED 
TO OUR WEST AND NORTHWEST DURING THE PERIOD.  DIFFICULT TO TIME ANY 
WEAK IMPULSES THAT MAY HELP TO ENHANCE CONVECTION...AS MODELS HAVE 
BEEN HANDLING THE DETAILS POORLY. INSTABILITY EXPECTED TO REMAIN ON 
THE MODEST SIDE FOR THE PERIOD.  WILL GENERALLY UNDERCUT MOS POPS 
FOR TONIGHT AND KEEP ALL AREAS IN THE CHANCE RANGE.  WILL LOWER POPS 
MONDAY TO CHANCE IN CENTRAL VALLEY AND SOUTHEAST ZONES...BUT WILL 
HAVE LOW LIKELY POPS ELSEWHERE.  WILL GENERALLY ADJUST MAV TEMPS UP 
A BIT FOR LOWS TONIGHT...BUT NOT MUCH ARGUMENT WITH HIGHS FOR 
MONDAY.  


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH
WILL BE THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION THIS UPCOMING WEEK...PROVIDING GOOD CHANCES FOR
PRECIPITATION EACH DAY...ALONG WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY AND COOLER
CONDITIONS. THE UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT FROM THIS SYSTEM WILL COMBINE
WITH ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE AND DAYTIME HEATING WILL HELP TO
TRIGGER SOME SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND STORMS ACROSS THE
ENTIRE AREA FOR MUCH OF THE WORK WEEK.

A BRIEF LULL IN THE ACTIVITY MAY ACTUALLY OCCUR ON TUESDAY AS MORE 
SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION IS EXPECTED. HOWEVER...AS THE LOW 
BEGINS TO RETROGRADE BACK TOWARD THE WEST TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY...IT WILL HELP TO FURTHER INCREASE A SOUTHERLY GULF 
MOISTURE FETCH. THUS...FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT LIKELY 
POPS SEEM REASONABLE AS SEVERAL UPPER-LEVEL SHORTWAVES WILL 
RESULTING IN THE POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND STORMS AND 
POTENTIALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND LOCALIZED FLOODING. THIS THREAT WILL 
CERTAINLY NEED TO BE MONITORED THE NEXT FEW DAYS...ESPECIALLY FOR 
THOSE WITH OUTDOOR PLANS FOR THE UPCOMING INDEPENDENCE DAY HOLIDAY. 
THUS...WILL ADDRESS THIS IN THE HWO. THE LATEST MODELS RUNS ARE 
BEGINNING TO HASTEN THE WESTWARD MOVEMENT OF THIS SYSTEM...SO 
CONVECTION MAY BE A LITTLE LESS WIDESPREAD ON FRIDAY AND BEGIN TO 
BECOME MUCH MORE SCATTERED ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AS SOME 
UPPER-LEVEL RIDGING BEGINS TO BUILD IN FROM THE EAST. 


&&

HIGH CHANCE CATEGORY THROUGH FRIDAY.  RIDGING BEGINNING TO BUILD 
TOWARDS THE AREA IN SATURDAY WILL LOWER POPS TO LOW CHANCE.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A 
WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. RADAR AND

VALLEY...WHICH WAS WEAKENING WITH THE SETTING OF THE SUN. THE UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SURFACE LOW OVER THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY IS PROGGED TO FURTHER AMPLIFY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
OVERNIGHT. AS A RESULT...SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION MAY AFFECT THE 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TONIGHT...BEFORE COMPLETELY DISSIPATING.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO REMOVE SOME EVENING WORDING AND TO ADD A 
MENTION OF TSTORMS ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU.

199 
FXUS64 KMRX 291903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT SAT JUN 29 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO 
DIG IN TO OUR WEST...AND FLOW WILL TAKE ON MORE OF A SOUTHERLY 
COMPONENT DURING THE PERIOD.  A SPOKE OF ENERGY ROTATING THROUGH 
UPPER TROUGH MAY BRING SOME SHOWERS TO NORTHWEST ZONES TONIGHT...SO 
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MAINLY NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA.  
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INCREASES A BIT FOR SUNDAY SO WILL CARRY 
CHANCE POPS ALL ZONES.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL NOT STRAY 
FAR.  

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)... AN UPPER-LEVEL
TROUGH WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
REGION THIS UPCOMING WEEK...PROVIDING DECENT CHANCES FOR SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY...ALONG WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY AND COOLER
CONDITIONS. SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY THIS LOW WILL DROP SOUTH FROM
THE OHIO VALLEY INTO MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THE UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT FROM
THIS SYSTEM WILL COMBINE WITH ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE AND DAYTIME
HEATING TO TRIGGER SOME SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND STORMS
/PARTICULARLY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS/ ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT.
THUS...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY ON MONDAY BEFORE TAPERING THEM
OFF SLIGHTLY TO HIGH END CHANCE MONDAY NIGHT.

THE AFOREMENTIONED LOW WILL BEGIN TO RETROGRADE BACK TOWARD THE  
WEST TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...HELPING TO FURTHER INCREASE A 
SOUTHERLY GULF MOISTURE FETCH. FROM WEDNESDAY THROUGH AT LEAST 
FRIDAY HIGH-END CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS SEEM REASONABLE AS SEVERAL 
UPPER-LEVEL SHORTWAVES WILL PROPAGATE AROUND THE BASE OF THE LOW AND 
ACROSS THE AREA...RESULTING IN THE POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD SHOWERS 
AND STORMS AND POTENTIALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND LOCALIZED FLOODING. 
UNFORTUNATELY...THE BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION MAY BE 
INDEPENDENCE DAY...BUT THERE IS STILL UNCERTAINTY REGARDING WHICH 
AREA AND TIME PERIOD MAY BE MORE FAVORED ATTM THIS FAR OUT. 
HOWEVER...WILL CERTAINLY KEEP A MENTION OF THIS HEAVY RAINFALL 
POTENTIAL IN THE HWO. BY THE WEEKEND...SOME RIDGING MAY BEGIN TO 
NUDGE IN FROM THE EAST...SO HAVE TAPERED POPS OFF A BIT HEADING INTO 
SATURDAY FOR NOW.

TN VALLEY TODAY AND TONIGHT. STEERING FLOW BECOMES INCREASING SW 
TONIGHT WITH A HINT OF LIFT INDICATED...MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THIS AREA WILL HAVE BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION 
OVERNIGHT WITH STORM MOTIONS MAKING EASTERN AREAS LESS LIKELY TO SEE 
SHOWERS OVERNIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...OVERALL...WILL CONTINUE WITH 
THE UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN IN PLACE FOR THE EXTENDED.  
INITIALLY...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL DROP SOUTH OVER THE EASTERN U.S.  
STRONG DAYTIME HEATING WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE DAILY CONVECTION.  
ADDITIONALLY..A SERIES OF WEAK IMPULSES RIDING THROUGH THE UPPER 
FLOW WILL AID CONVECTION SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.   BY 
WEDNESDAY...THE UPPER TROUGH WILL SHIFT TO OUR WEST ALLOWING A GOOD 
FETCH OF GULF MOISTURE TO STREAM NORTH INTO THE AREA.  THE ADDED LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE WILL AID INSTABILITY AND CONVECTION THROUGH THE REST 
OF THE PERIOD.

FRONT. WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE EVENING
HOURS THEN HAVE A DRY FORECAST AFTER MIDNIGHT. SATURDAY LOOKS DRIER
THAN RECENT DAYS. INSTABILITY EXPECTED TO BE LIMITED...BUT ENOUGH
THAT STILL CANNOT RULE OUT CONVECTION SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE

LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY/...
AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN WILL CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD AS A UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL INTENSIFY AS IT REMAINS 
ENTRENCHED ACROSS THE EASTERN CONUS. WITH A BROAD SUBTROPICAL HIGH 
TO THE EAST...A SOUTHERLY MOISTURE FETCH OFF THE GULF WILL INCREASE. 
THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SCATTERED TO PERHAPS WIDESPREAD AT TIMES SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP FOR THE WEEK AHEAD AS SEVERAL IMPULSES
SCOOT ACROSS THE REGION ALONG THE BASE OF THE TROUGH. BY THE MIDDLE
OF NEXT WEEK...THIS TROUGH WILL RETROGRADE BACK WEST WHICH WILL
FURTHER ENHANCE THE GULF MOISTURE STREAM...AND MAKE FOR A COOLER
AND WETTER INDEPENDENCE DAY HOLIDAY WEEK AS THE BEST CHANCES FOR
THIS ACTIVITY LOOK TO BE TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS
ACTIVITY WILL BE DIURNALLY DRIVEN...WITH THE BEST CHANCES
OCCURRING DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. AS PREVIOUSLY
ELUDED TO...THE HIGHER CLOUD COVER/RAIN CHANCES WILL ALLOW FOR
BELOW NORMAL HIGHS /IN THE UPPER 70S TO MID 80S/ THROUGH THE END OF
NEXT WEEK.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE 
PATTERN...AND REVEAL A LONG WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER 
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION THIS WEEKEND AND LINGERING THROUGH 
THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. AS A RESULT...AN UNSETTLED PERIOD WILL BE 
IN STORE FOR THE FORECAST AREA THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED...WITH TEMPS 
A LITTLE COOLER THAN NORMAL AND SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING EACH 
DAY. RIGHT NOW...THE BEST CHANCES FOR CONVECTION APPEAR TO BE ON 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WHEN THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS BECOMES LOCATED OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY. BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS MODELS AGREE THAT THIS 
UPPER TROUGH WILL SLOWLY RETROGRADE TO THE WEST ON TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY...AND GRADUALLY DISSIPATE ON THURSDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.
