AND POSSIBLY TYS. FELT THE BEST CHANCE FOR THUNDER WILL BE AT TYS
THIS MORNING. THERE STILL COULD BE SOME ISOLATED TO WIDELY
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON BUT FELT
PROBABILITY WAS TOO LOW TO INCLUDE IN THE FORECAST AT ANY OF THE
TERMINALS. APPLIED SOME MVFR FOG AT TRI LATE TONIGHT. LOW LEVEL
PRESSURE GRADIENT MAY KEEP THE LOW LEVELS MIXED NEGATING THE
POSSIBILITY OF FOG AT TYS AND CHA.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

474 
FXUS64 KMRX 270759
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT THU JUN 27 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...TRIED TO TIME THE MAIN 
AXIS OF CONVECTION IN ASSOCIATED WITH THE TWO CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES 
MAKING THEIR WAY ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. SO PLACED HIGHEST POPS 
SOUTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS WITH LOWER POPS FARTHER NORTHWEST. 
STILL SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY WITH DECENT INSTABILITY FOR THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS SO MAINTAINED AT LEAST CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION 
DURING MAX HEATING. THE NEXT SHOT AT HIGHER POPS LOOKS TO BE FRIDAY 
AS MODELS INDICATE ANOTHER SIGNIFICANT WAVE DROPS INTO THE REGION ON 
THE PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW COMPLIMENTS OF THE EASTERN U.S. 
LONGWAVE TROUGH. SUFFICIENT INSTABILITY ALONG WITH ADEQUATE SHEAR 
SHOULD ALLOW FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF ANOTHER CONVECTIVE COMPLEX TO 
MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SO USED LIKELY POPS ON FRIDAY WHILE 
DROPPING OFF TO SLIGHT CHANCE FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE ACTION SHIFTS 
SOUTHEAST AWAY FROM THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. FOR THE MOST PART STAYED 
IN THE MIDDLE OF GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES WITH THE EXCEPTION OF 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE WHICH HAS POPPED UP TO THE WARMEST MOS MAXES FOR 
A FEW DAYS IN A ROW NOW. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...27/00Z MODELS WERE FAIRLY 
CONSISTENT FROM 12Z RUN AND STILL ADVERTISE THE LONGWAVE TROUGH 
SETTING UP OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION. THIS LEADS TO 
PERIODS OF CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION...MORE THAN JUST DIURNAL 20 TO 
30 PERCENT POPS EACH DAY.

27/00Z GFSX MOS POPS ARE STILL QUITE HIGH FOR SATURDAY...BUT 
GENERALLY ALL MODELS PREDICT A BREAK WITH JUST DIURNAL ACTIVITY. 
WILL KEEP OUR CURRENT LOWER POPS IN FOR SATURDAY WHICH ARE QUITE 
CLOSE TO A MOS BLEND OF THE GFS AND NAM POPS...AND STAY WELL BELOW 
THE HIGH CHANCE GFSX MOS POPS.

SOME UNCERTAINTY AS FAR OUT AS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...BUT STILL 
SEEING SIGNS OF A SURFACE WAVE DEVELOPING ON THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
MONDAY NIGHT OR TUESDAY. THIS SUPPORTS HIGHEST POPS FOR TUESDAY...SO 
NUDGED POPS UP TO A SOLID 50 PERCENT (ABOVE CLIMO). CARRYING CHANCE 
POPS FOR WEDNESDAY CLOSE TO CLIMO AND LATEST GFSX MOS POPS.

OTHERWISE...LITTLE CHANGES MADE TO MAX OR MIN TEMPS FOR NOW.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 261845
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT WED JUN 26 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...A SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE 
SOUTHEAST INTO THE AREA TONIGHT.  MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW SIGNIFICANT 
INSTABILITY OVERNIGHT AND THE LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR INCREASES.  A 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX IS EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE AREA THIS 
EVENING...AND THERE IS THE POSSIBILITY OF DAMAGING WINDS WITH THESE 
STORMS.  GIVEN THE INCREASING LOW LEVEL WIND SHEAR AN ISOLATED 
TORNADO CANNOT BE RULED OUT AS WELL.  WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION 
SEVERE THREAT IN HWO.  WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS ALL ZONES TONIGHT.  
SHORT WAVE WILL BE EXITING BY EARLY THURSDAY...BUT ENOUGH 
MOISTURE/INSTABILITY WILL LINGER TO KEEP HIGH CHANCE TO LOW LIKELY 
POPS.     


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AN ACTIVE PATTERN IN PLACE FOR THE FORECAST AREA FOR THIS FORECAST 
PERIOD. THE UPPER LOW WILL BE LOCATED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION 
PLACING THE FORECAST AREA UNDER/NEAR THE TROUGH AXIS THROUGH THE 
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. THIS UPPER LOW IS EXPECTED TO RETROGRADE INTO 
THE NORTHERN PLAINS STATES THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. NEEDLESS TO SAY 
WITH THE ACTIVE PATTERN THERE WILL BE AT LEAST A CHANCE OF 
PRECIPITATION EVERY DAY AND NIGHT THROUGH NEXT WEEK. 

TRIED TO TIME PRECIPITATION AS BEST WE COULD WITH FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
LOOKING LIKE THE BETTER DAY FOR GETTING WET...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SW 
VIRGINIA. THIS IS WHEN THE ILL-DEFINED FRONTAL BOUNDARY OOZES SLOWLY 
INTO THE REGION. SATURDAY MAY PROVE TO BE FAIRLY DRY FOR MOST 
LOCATIONS HOWEVER SCATTERED ACTIVITY WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE 
AFTERNOON. 

PREFRONTAL WARMING WILL LIKELY OCCUR ON FRIDAY THUS SOME AREAS 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE COULD REACH THE LOWER 90S...AND IT WILL 
BE MUGGY. THE SUBSEQUENT DAYS WILL LIKELY BE COOLER WITH 
CLOUDY/RAINY TYPE CONDITIONS PERSISTING EACH DAY UNTIL THIS PESKY 
LOW DIMINISHES WHICH LOOKS TO BE THE END OF NEXT WEEK.

FXUS64 KMRX 260754
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT WED JUN 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS AGREE ACTIVE WEATHER ACROSS 
THE MIDWEST COULD IMPACT THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AS A SHORT 
WAVELENGTH TROUGH DRIVES EAST FROM THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY DURING THE 
MORNING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS TONIGHT. 
ATMOSPHERE IS PROGGED TO BE MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH INCREASING 
SHEAR LATER TONIGHT. SOME OF THE THUNDERSTORMS MAY BECOME SEVERE 
PRODUCING STRONG CONVECTIVE GUSTS AND LARGE HAIL. PRIOR TO THIS 
ACTION...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
DEVELOP AGAIN DURING THE DAY. PLACED A SLIGHTLY HIGHER CHANCE POP 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE MORNING AS 
A WEAK SHORT WAVE PRESSES EAST ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY TOWARD 
THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. STAYED WITH A BLEND OF MAV/MET MOS MAX 
TEMPS TODAY WHILE TRENDING ABOUT A DEGREE ABOVE THE WARMEST MOS MINS 
TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
EXPECTED TO BE ONGOING THURSDAY MORNING...THEN DECREASE THROUGH THE 
DAY FROM THE WEST WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AXIS. 
HOWEVER AN UNSETTLED PATTERN WILL CONTINUE AS AN UPPER LOW DROPS 
SOUTHWARD INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY. THIS WILL INCREASE 
POPS AGAIN FRIDAY AS A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA. MOISTURE WILL 
BE LIMITED WITH A WESTERLY 850 MB FLOW AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SO WILL 
KEEP POPS IN THE HIGH CHANCE RANGE FOR FRIDAY. 

A BROAD UPPER TROUGH WILL BE OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...THEN RETROGRADE AND EVOLVE INTO A CLOSED LOW OVER THE 
LOWER OHIO VALLEY/MID MS VALLEY BY MONDAY. SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE 
THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND WITH THE TROUGH OVERHEAD CREATING SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY...BUT ORGANIZED FORCING APPEARS LACKING AT THIS TIME 
ALONG WITH A LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE IN THE W-NW FLOW ALOFT. WILL 
CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. PRECIP CHANCES INCREASE 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY ONCE THE UPPER LOW BECOMES ESTABLISHED TO OUR 
WEST AND THE SOUTHERLY FLOW OF MOISTURE INCREASES. WILL HAVE HIGH 
CHANCE POPS BOTH DAYS...ALONG WITH TEMPS BELOW CLIMO AND GFS MOS 
GUIDANCE.

924 
FXUS64 KMRX 260146
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EDT TUE JUN 25 2013

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. MINOR UPWARD ADJUSTMENT TO DEW 
POINTS AND SUBSEQUENT RH. REMOVED POPS WITH LESS THAN 20 PERCENT 
EXPECTED. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...SHOWERS AND STORMS SHOULD 
QUICKLY DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET TONIGHT AS INSTABILITY BEGINS TO 
WEAKEN. HOWEVER...A FEW STORMS COULD BECOME STRONG BEFORE THEY 
DISSIPATE WITH THE MAIN THREATS BEING GUSTY WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN. NO 
BIG CHANGES TO PREVIOUS POPS AS THEY STILL LOOK REASONABLE AT THIS 
TIME. OVERNIGHT TEMPS SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO LAST NIGHT...SO WENT ONCE 
AGAIN WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST. TOMORROW THINGS BEGIN TO CHANGE 
AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH APPROACHES OUR AREA. AS OF NOW...I DON'T 
BELIEVE UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT WILL ARRIVE IN TIME TO IMPACT TOMORROW 
AFTERNOONS CONVECTIVE COVERAGE. THE NAM DOESN'T INDICATE THE 850MB 
JET REACHING THE PLATEAU UNTIL RIGHT AROUND 00Z. WITH THIS 
THINKING....GREATEST COVERAGE SHOULD CONTINUE TO FAVOR HIGHER 
ELEVATION LOCATIONS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS. IF THE NAM IS 
CORRECT...THE PLATEAU WILL BE AN AREA TO WATCH AS THE LATEST NAM 
SHOWS A LINE OF CONVECTION APPROACHING OUR WESTERN AREAS RIGHT 
AROUND THE 00Z TIME-FRAME WITH THE ARRIVAL OF THE 850MB JET. GFS IS 
SLOWER AND DOESN'T BRING THE JET IN UNTIL AROUND 06Z...WHICH WOULD 
LIMIT CONVECTION. OVERALL...KEPT POPS AND TEMPS SIMILAR TO THE 
PREVIOUS ISSUANCE THROUGH TOMORROW AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE PATTERN STILL
EXPECTED TO TRANSITION TO AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER MOST OF THE
EASTERN U.S. BY THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE INITIAL
SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS HANDLED SIMILARLY AMONGST VARIOUS MODELS...
WITH ORGANIZED CONVECTION LIKELY TO BE MOVING INTO THE NRN PLATEAU
AND SW VA AREAS BEFORE 12Z THURSDAY...THEN GENERALLY FROM NW TO SE
OVER REST OF THE AREA ON THURSDAY. THE 12Z NAM MODEL HAS SLOWED
DOWN A BIT AND IS IN LINE WITH THIS TIMING...SO POPS WERE ADJUSTED
ACCORDINGLY WITH A SWATH OF LIKELY POPS CARRIED ON THURSDAY.

OTHERWISE...POPS STILL NEEDED EVERY DAY OF THE EXTENDED WITH A 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY LIKELY TO BE IN THE VICINITY. SHORTWAVE ENERGY 
CARVING OUT THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MAY DEVELOP WEAK WAVES ALONG THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY...WHICH WOULD SUPPORT HIGHER THAN CLIMO POPS. 
MODELS HINT AT THIS HAPPENING ON SATURDAY AND AGAIN BY LATE MONDAY 
OR TUESDAY. FOLLOWED THE GFSX MOS TREND AND RAISED POPS SOME FOR 
SATURDAY AND INTRODUCED TUESDAY WITH CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. 

FOR TEMPS...GFS MOS MAX TEMPS LOOKED TOO WARM FOR THURSDAY AND I 
STAYED MUCH CLOSER TO THE COOLER NAM MOS MAXES. GFSX MOS MINS LOOKED 
QUITE GOOD EACH PERIOD...BUT I STAYED WELL BELOW UPPER 80S TO LOWER 
90S FOR HIGHS...GIVEN THE DEVELOPING TROUGH AND INCREASED RAIN 
CHANCES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  89  72  89  70 /  10  30  40  50  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  88  72  87  70 /  20  30  50  60  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       69  88  71  88  70 /  10  30  60  50  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              65  86  66  84  65 /  20  30  50  60  40

NOW...I DON'T BELIEVE UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT WILL ARRIVE IN TIME TO
IMPACT TOMORROW AFTERNOONS CONVECTIVE COVERAGE. THE NAM DOESN'T INDICATE
THE 850MB JET REACHING THE PLATEAU UNTIL RIGHT AROUND 00Z. WITH
THIS THINKING....GREATEST COVERAGE SHOULD CONTINUE TO FAVOR HIGHER
ELEVATION LOCATIONS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS. IF THE NAM IS
CORRECT...THE PLATEAU WILL BE AN AREA TO WATCH AS THE LATEST NAM
SHOWS A LINE OF CONVECTION APPROACHING OUR WESTERN AREAS RIGHT
AROUND THE 00Z TIME-FRAME WITH THE ARRIVAL OF THE 850MB JET. GFS IS
SLOWER AND DOESN'T BRING THE JET IN UNTIL AROUND 06Z...WHICH WOULD
LIMIT CONVECTION. OVERALL...KEPT POPS AND TEMPS SIMILAR TO THE
PREVIOUS ISSUANCE THROUGH TOMORROW AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE PATTERN STILL
EXPECTED TO TRANSITION TO AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER MOST OF THE
EASTERN U.S. BY THE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE INITIAL
SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS HANDLED SIMILARLY AMONGST VARIOUS MODELS...
WITH ORGANIZED CONVECTION LIKELY TO BE MOVING INTO THE NRN PLATEAU
AND SW VA AREAS BEFORE 12Z THURSDAY...THEN GENERALLY FROM NW TO SE
OVER REST OF THE AREA ON THURSDAY. THE 12Z NAM MODEL HAS SLOWED
DOWN A BIT AND IS IN LINE WITH THIS TIMING...SO POPS WERE ADJUSTED
ACCORDINGLY WITH A SWATH OF LIKELY POPS CARRIED ON THURSDAY.

OTHERWISE...POPS STILL NEEDED EVERY DAY OF THE EXTENDED WITH A 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY LIKELY TO BE IN THE VICINITY. SHORTWAVE ENERGY 
CARVING OUT THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH MAY DEVELOP WEAK WAVES ALONG THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY...WHICH WOULD SUPPORT HIGHER THAN CLIMO POPS. 
MODELS HINT AT THIS HAPPENING ON SATURDAY AND AGAIN BY LATE MONDAY 
OR TUESDAY. FOLLOWED THE GFSX MOS TREND AND RAISED POPS SOME FOR 
SATURDAY AND INTRODUCED TUESDAY WITH CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. 

FOR TEMPS...GFS MOS MAX TEMPS LOOKED TOO WARM FOR THURSDAY AND I 
STAYED MUCH CLOSER TO THE COOLER NAM MOS MAXES. GFSX MOS MINS LOOKED 
QUITE GOOD EACH PERIOD...BUT I STAYED WELL BELOW UPPER 80S TO LOWER 
90S FOR HIGHS...GIVEN THE DEVELOPING TROUGH AND INCREASED RAIN 
CHANCES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  89  72  89  70 /  10  30  40  50  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  88  72  87  70 /  20  30  50  60  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       69  88  71  88  70 /  10  30  60  50  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              65  86  66  84  65 /  20  30  50  60  40

600 
FXUS64 KMRX 250717
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 AM EDT TUE JUN 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
THE PAST FEW DAYS HAVE BEEN DIFFICULT TO GET A HANDLE ON CONVECTIVE 
COVERAGE AND LOCATION. WITH THE LACK OF WELL DEFINED FORCING 
MECHANISMS...THE GENERAL TREND HAS BEEN FOR CONVECTION TO FAVOR THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU. FOR TODAY AND 
TOMORROW...WILL CONTINUE THAT GENERAL TREND. THE NAM AND GFS 
CONTINUE TO HAVE LARGE DIFFERENCE IN POPS...WITH THE NAM IN THE 
LIKELY RANGE AND GFS SHOWING A LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP. WILL LEAN 
TOWARD THE LOWER SIDE WITH LOW CHANCE POPS IN THE VALLEY BOTH 
DAYS...AND HIGHER CHANCE POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS. WILL FOLLOW 
PERSISTENCE FOR HIGH AND LOW TEMPS.

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES REGION WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...AND THIS SHOULD GIVE US SOME BETTER 
LIFT FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. HOWEVER THE GULF REMAINS CUT OFF 
WITH A WESTERLY 850 MB FLOW...SO MOISTURE IS NOT PLENTIFUL. MODELS 
HAVE BEEN TRENDING DOWNWARD WITH POPS THIS PERIOD...SO WILL LOWER 
POPS A BIT TO A HIGH CHANCE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WHEN THE 
700 MB TROUGH AXIS PASSES THROUGH. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
BASICALLY STAYED WITH THE PREVIOUS FORECAST WITHOUT A GREAT DEAL
OF CONFIDENCE TO ADJUST POPS HIGHER OR LOWER IN ANY PARTICULAR
PERIOD. PERHAPS THE SLIGHTLY HIGHER CHANCE POP IS WARRANTED ON
SATURDAY AS MODELS SWING A SHORT WAVE FROM THE OHIO-MID MISSISSIPPI
VALLEY REGION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ENHANCING
CONVECTION. BEST TO KEEP THE LOW CHANCE PROBABILITY GOING SUNDAY
AND MONDAY WITH MEAN LONG WAVE EASTERN U.S. TROUGH HOLDING ITS
POSITION. WENT ABOUT A DEGREE UNDER MEX MOS MAX TEMPS THROUGH THE
PERIOD. STAYED CLOSE TO SUGGESTED MINS EARLY BUT ADJUSTED A LITTLE
MILDER DURING THE FINAL THREE DAYS OF THE EXTENDED.

.DISCUSSION...

APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK OVERALL. AN UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE CONTINUES

HELPED TO MAINTAIN SOME ISOLATED CLUSTERS OF STORMS THIS EVENING.
A SUBTLE VORT MAX OVER SOUTHERN KENTUCKY HAS TRIED TO TRIGGER SOME
ADDITIONAL ACTIVITY ALONG THE NORTHERN PLATEAU INTO EASTERN
KENTUCKY...BUT THE OVERALL INTENSITY OF THIS ACTIVITY HAS WANED
WITH THE SETTING SUN. THINK THAT THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE OVER THE
NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS...SO HAVE LIFTED MENTIONABLE POPS OVER THE
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY AFTER 04Z OR SO. STILL...THINK THAT
SOME ISOLATED STORMS REMAIN POSSIBLE ACROSS THE FAR NORTHERN AND
NORTHEAST ZONES OVERNIGHT GIVEN THE PRESENCE OF THIS FEATURE AND
THE WARM/MOIST AIRMASS IN PLACE. OTHERWISE...THINK THAT MOSTLY DRY
AND PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AFTER
MIDNIGHT WILL PREVAIL WITH EVEN WARMER LOWS DROPPING INTO THE MID
TO UPPER 60S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS.

FXUS64 KMRX 241904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT MON JUN 24 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE THEME OF A SUMMER TIME PATTERN CONTINUES DUE TO A BERMUDA HIGH 
OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST KEEPING US WARM AND HUMID. ONGOING CONVECTION 
THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD BEGIN TO WEAKEN AROUND SUNSET AS INSTABILITY 
DECREASES. ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NE TN AND SW VA DURING THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS AS A WEAK VORT MAX OVER W KY WILL SLOWLY MAKE ITS 
WAY ACROSS THIS AREA OVERNIGHT. AREAS THAT SEE RAIN TODAY OR TONIGHT 
COULD HAVE SOME FOG IN THE MORNING. AREA WIDE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
STORMS ARE ON TAP FOR TOMORROW AS LATEST NAM SOUNDINGS SHOW PWS 
INCREASING TO AROUND 1.5 INCHES AND INSTABILITY RANGING FROM 1500 TO 
2000 J/KG BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON. WILL CONTINUE WITH PERSISTENCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES TONIGHT AND TOMORROW.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
THE PATTERN MAKES A SIGNIFICANT TRANSITION WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO
THURSDAY AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PUSHES THE BERMUDA RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE SE. A DEEPER TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE THEN GRADUALLY
DEVELOPS OVER THE EASTERN U.S. FOR THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY. 

THIS SHOULD EQUATE TO WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND SCATTERED
THUNDERSTORMS LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...SO RAIN
CHANCES WERE INCREASED TO LIKELY ON THURSDAY. A FEW STRONG TO
SEVERE STORMS LOOK QUITE POSSIBLE FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND
EVENING...GIVEN THE INCREASED LIFT AND MOISTURE...PLUS COOLER TEMPS
ALOFT. 

OTHERWISE...TIMING ROUNDS OF CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION FOR THE REST
OF THE LONG TERM IS CHALLENGING...AS THERE IS A GOOD DEGREE OF
VARIANCE AMONGST THE MODEL SOLUTIONS. CAN'T LIMIT CONVECTION TO
JUST THE AFTERNOON OR EVENING IN GENERAL...BUT ALSO CAN'T REALLY
AGREE COMPLETELY WITH THE POPS WELL ABOVE CLIMO ON BOTH SATURDAY
AND SUNDAY. FOR NOW...ADDED NEW DAY 7 GRIDS (MONDAY) WITH CHANCE
POPS AND MADE SOME ADJUSTMENTS MOSTLY TO THE EARLIER PERIODS OF THE
LONG TERM. LOCAL APPLICATION PROGRAM SHOWS SEVERAL OPPORTUNITIES TO
IMPROVE OVER MOS FOR THE LONG TERM.

FOLLOWED THE GFSX MOS TEMPS OVERALL WITH THE 24/12Z TEMPS QUITE
CLOSE TO THE 24/00Z TEMPS...AND IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS MAX/MIN TEMP
GRIDS.

TOWARDS THE PLATEAU. CONVECTIVE COVERAGE SHOULD BE A LITTLE MORE 
WIDESPREAD THAN THE PAST FEW DAYS AND NOT LIMITED TO ONLY THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. ALSO...CAN'T RULE OUT AN ISOLATED SEVERE STORM TODAY DUE 
TO INCREASED INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE...WITH THE MAIN THREAT BEING 
DAMAGING WINDS. LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL IS ALSO POSSIBLE DUE TO SLOW 
STORM MOTIONS OF AROUND 9 KTS.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK. NO UPDATES 
PLANNED AT THIS TIME.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

MORNING...AND THE RUC SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
CONVERGENCE IN THIS AREA. THE RUC SHOWS THIS WEAKENING BY 12Z...BUT

IN THE AFTERNOON...WE WILL SEE A REMNANT VORT MAX FROM CONVECTION 
OVER W KY ENTER THE AREA...AND THE NAM DEVELOPS CONVECTION IN MIDDLE 
TN AND THE PLATEAU ALONG AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY. INSTABILITY APPEARS 
GREATEST IN THAT AREA...SO WILL HAVE HIGHEST POPS WEST TODAY...BUT

FOR TEMPERATURES TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)... 
BERMUDA RIDGE WILL REMAIN OVER THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES THROUGH
MID-WEEK. GFS AND NAM SHOW PWS AND INSTABILITY INCREASING TO 1.4 TO
1.6 INCHES FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY..SO COVERAGE AND INTENSITY OF
STORMS WILL LIKELY INCREASE TO SCATTERED. FOR THURSDAY INTO NEXT
WEEKEND...RIDGING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL WEAKEN
ALLOWING A SERIES OF UPPER SHORT- WAVES OVER THE GREAT LAKES INTO
THE NORTHEAST TO CARVE OUT A LONG- WAVE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN
UNITED STATES.

LOOKING AT INSTABILITY AND UPPER DYNAMICS...BEST CHANCE OF MORE 
WIDESPREAD STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS STILL POINT TO THURSDAY AND WILL 
MENTION IN THE HWO. A COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH SATURDAY WILL BRING 
IN DRIER DEWPOINTS FOR SUNDAY.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS NUMBERS CLOSELY..EXCEPT 
FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK. LOWER THICKNESS AND GREATER 
COVERAGE OF CLOUDS AND CONVECTION DOES NOT WARRANT THE GFS HIGHS..SO 
UNDER-CUT A DEGREE OR TWO.

994 
FXUS64 KMRX 231828
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT SUN JUN 23 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
BERMUDA HIGH OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC EXTENDING ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEAST...WITH A WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THE CLOSED UPPER LOW THAT HAS BEEN OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THE PAST FEW DAYS IS PROGGED TO DRIFT NORTHWARD TONIGHT...AND 
MERGE WITH THE STRONGER SOUTHWESTERLY UPPER-LEVEL FLOW OVER THE 
GREAT LAKES REGION. MODEL SOUNDINGS ON MONDAY REVEAL A SLIGHT 
INCREASE IN THE VERTICAL MOISTURE PROFILE OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
(COMPARED TO TODAY)...WHICH RESULTS IN A LITTLE MORE INSTABILITY 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY AFTERNOON. THUS...EXPECT A LITTLE 
BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION AREA WIDE ON MONDAY (COMPARED TO 
TODAY)...WITH A SLIGHTLY BETTER COVERAGE AROUND THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN 
THE GFS AND NAM MODEL GUIDANCE FOR TONIGHT AND MONDAY...WHICH IS 
ESSENTIALLY A PERSISTENCE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE THEME CONTINUES WITH 
THE LATEST FORECAST...SUMMER TIME PATTERN THROUGH MID-WEEK AND THEN 
A SHIFT TO A MORE ACTIVE PATTERN WITH THE APPROACH OF AN UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH. THE TROUGH LOOKS TO SETUP ACROSS OUR AREA TOWARD THE END OF 
THE WEEK AND REMAIN THROUGH THE END OF THE EXTENDED.

A BERMUDA HIGH WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
THROUGH MID-WEEK. LATEST GFS/NAM FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW PW VALUES 
INCREASING TO 1.3-1.6 INCHES FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...WHILE 
CAPES GENERALLY RANGE BETWEEN 1500-2000 J/KG. TYPICAL DIURNAL 
CONVECTION IS EXPECTED THROUGH THIS TIME-FRAME WITH THE GREATEST 
COVERAGE OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ONE INTERESTING NOTE IS THAT 
THE NAM SHOWS A 500 MB LEVEL SHORT WAVE MOVING DOWN INTO OUR AREA ON 
TUESDAY AFTERNOON OUT OF KENTUCKY...WHILE THE GFS KEEPS THE WAVE 
WEAKER AND FURTHER NORTH. IF THE NAM IS CORRECT...POPS MAY NEED TO 
BE INCREASED FOR TUESDAY AS THIS SHORTWAVE WILL HELP TO ENHANCE 
COVERAGE. FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE TO TREND CLOSER TO THE GFS AND 
KEEP POPS WHERE THEY ARE HAVE BEEN OVER THE PAST FEW ISSUANCES.

FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK...BERMUDA HIGH BEGINS TO WEAKEN AS 
AN UPPER TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEAST UNITED 
STATES. A SERIES OF FRONTS WILL MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/ 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AS THE UPPER TROUGH BECOMES MORE ESTABLISHED 
OVER THE EASTERN UNITED STATES INTO NEXT WEEKEND. THE UPPER TROUGH 
AND FRONTAL BOUNDARIES WILL INCREASE THE CHANCES OF CONVECTION. 
WOULD GO HIGHER WITH POPS...BUT STILL UNCERTAIN IN TIMING OF FRONTAL 
BOUNDARIES. BEST CHANCE OF MORE ORGANIZED SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE 
THURSDAY AS MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INCREASES AHEAD OF DEVELOPING 
UPPER TROUGH AND INITIAL BOUNDARY. THE MAIN CONCERN WILL BE DAMAGING 
WINDS...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL...AND MARGINAL SEVERE HAIL UP TO 1 
INCH.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS NUMBERS FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... 
BUT WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY GIVEN 
EXPECTED GREATER COVERAGE OF CLOUDS AND CONVECTION.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   68  88  68  90  70 /  20  30  20  30  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     66  86  67  90  69 /  20  40  20  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             65  86  68  90  69 /  20  30  20  30  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    60  86  62  87  64 /  20  40  20  30  20 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

TAF SITES...THEN FOG WILL LIKELY DEVELOP AT THAT SITE LATER TONIGHT 
TOWARDS SUNRISE. HOWEVER...WILL NOT MENTION ANY FOG AT THIS TIME DUE 
TO THE UNCERTAINTIES. OVERALL...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE 
EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD (OUTSIDE OF ANY TSTORMS) AT ALL 
THREE TAF SITES.

UPPER-LEVEL FLOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION TONIGHT. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS REVEAL A SLIGHT INCREASE IN THE VERTICAL MOISTURE PROFILE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA (COMPARED TO YESTERDAY)...WITH A WEAKER 
STABLE LAYER IN THE MID LEVELS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. THUS...WOULD EXPECT DEEPER AND STRONGER CONVECTION 
OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AND 
A GENERAL INCREASE IN CONVECTIVE COVERAGE EVERYWHERE THIS AFTERNOON 
(COMPARED TO YESTERDAY).

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS MORNING TO TWEAK TEMPS AND SKY CONDITIONS A LITTLE...AND TO 
RAISE POPS A LITTLE OVER SOUTHEAST TN.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
THE CLOSED UPPER LOW THAT HAS BEEN OVER THE AREA THE PAST FEW DAYS 
WILL DRIFT NORTH AND MERGE WITH AN OPEN WAVE TROUGH TO THE NORTH. 
WITH VERY LITTLE AIR MASS CHANGE EXPECTED TODAY...AND THE UPPER LOW 
PERSISTING OVER THE AREA...SCATTERED TO ISOLATED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT INSTABILITY PARAMETERS WILL BE MOST FAVORABLE FOR 
CONVECTION IN NORTHERN AREAS. SEVERE POTENTIAL LOOKS LOW...BUT 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE AS STORMS WILL HAVE A SLOW 
NORTHWARD MOTION. DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION WILL DISSIPATE BY 
MIDNIGHT. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO BE NEAR NORMAL.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
A BERMUDA HIGH WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL OVER THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS THROUGH MID-WEEK. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW PW
INCREASING TO 1.3-1.4 INCHES FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH
CAPES BETWEEN 1500-2000 J/KG. ANTICIPATE GENERALLY DIURNAL
CONVECTION EACH DAY WITH THE GREATEST COVERAGE OVER THE HIGH
ELEVATIONS.

FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK...BERMUDA HIGH WEAKENS AS AN UPPER 
TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEAST UNITED STATES. A 
SERIER OF FRONTS WILL MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN 
APPALACHAINS AS THE UPPER TROUGH BECOMES MORE ESTABLISHED OVER THE 
EASTERN UNITED STATES INTO NEXT WEEKEND. THE UPPER TROUGH AND 
FRONTAL BOUNDARIES WILL INCREASE THE CHANCES OF CONVECTION. WOULD GO 
HIGHER IN POPS...BUT STILL UNCERTAIN IN TIMING OF FRONTAL 
BOUNDARIES. BEST CHANCE OF MORE ORGANIZED SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE 
THURSDAY AS MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY INCREASES AHEAD OF DEVELOPING 
UPPER TROUGH AND INITIAL BOUNDARY. THE MAIN CONCERN WILL BE DAMAGING 
WINDS..LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND MARGINAL SEVERE HAIL UP TO 1 INCH.

WEDNESDAY...BUT WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER FOR THURSDAY THROUGH 
SATURDAY GIVEN EXPECTED GREATER COVERAGE OF CLOUDS AND CONVECTION.

FXUS64 KMRX 230137 AAC
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
937 PM EDT SAT JUN 22 2013

.DISCUSSION...
MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO THE FORECAST TONIGHT AS EVERYTHING APPEARS TO
BE ON TRACK. IT HAS BEEN A FAIRLY QUIET EVENING ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AS MOST OF THE
CONVECTION HAS BEEN VERY ISOLATED ALONG THE SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA MTNS OR TO THE NORTHWEST OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. ANY
LINGERING ACTIVITY WILL QUICKLY DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET RESULTING IN
MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS IN MANY SPOTS THIS EVENING. THIS WILL ALLOW
FOR A GREAT VIEW OF THE SUPER MOON TONIGHT IN MANY LOCATIONS. SOME
CLOUDS MAY INCREASE SLIGHTLY OVERNIGHT AS PATCHY FOG DEVELOPMENT
SEEMS LIKELY IN THIS MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER IN THE USUAL PRONE AREAS.
OTHERWISE...MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS WITH LOWS IN
THE 60S WILL PREVAIL IN MOST LOCATIONS TONIGHT.

&&

710 
FXUS64 KMRX 221903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT SAT JUN 22 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A WARM 
AND HUMID AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE 
A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL LOW CENTERED NEAR CHA...WHICH IS PROGGED TO 
SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHWARD TONIGHT AND SUNDAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A 
FAIRLY SIMILAR PROFILE TO TODAY...BUT WITH A LITTLE MORE MOISTURE ON 
SUNDAY. THUS...WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED AGAIN BY 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON...EXPECT SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION TO DEVELOP WITH A 
SLIGHTLY BETTER COVERAGE AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE GFS AND NAM MODEL
GUIDANCE...WHICH IS ESSENTIALLY A PERSISTENCE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM 
PREVIOUS DISCUSSION DUE TO THE TYPICAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN ACROSS OUR 
AREA. A BERMUDA HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH ABOUT MID-WEEK. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR GENERALLY 
DIURNAL CONVECTION POSSIBLE EACH DAY. COVERAGE WILL SLIGHTLY 
INCREASE EARLY NEXT WEEK AS SOUNDINGS SHOW A BIT MORE MOISTURE 
ACROSS THE REGION WITH PWS INCREASING TO 1.3 TO 1.4 INCHES BY 
TUESDAY. MOISTURE INCREASE IS DUE TO A MORE SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNING 
ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES. CONVECTION THROUGH THIS PERIOD WILL 
GENERALLY BE TERRAIN DRIVEN. THE TYPICAL AREAS SUCH AS THE PLATEAU 
AND THE SPINE OF THE APPALCHIANS WILL BE THE MAIN AREAS OF FOCUS... 
WITH A FEW STORMS DRIFTING DOWN INTO THE LOWER ELEVATIONS. TYPICAL 
ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS ARE WHAT CAN BE EXPECTED...WITH THE 
MAIN CONCERN BEING DAMAGING WINDS...HAIL UP TO QUARTER SIZE...AND 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL.

BY THURSDAY RIDGING WILL BEGIN TO WEAKEN AS AN UPPER TROUGH SWINGS 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES. AN 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL THEN MOVE INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON/EVENING...WITH SCATTERED TO BROKEN THUNDERSTORMS 
ANTICIPATED WITH THE FRONT. MORE SHOWERS AND STORMS ARE POSSIBLE 
SATURDAY AS THE FRONT MAY NOT BE COMPLETELY THROUGH THE AREA. 

AS WITH THE PREVIOUS ISSUANCE...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS NUMBERS 
CLOSELY. EXCEPT WENT A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER FOR MID-WEEK TO BLEND 
WITH SURROUNDING WFOS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   68  88  68  89  69 /  20  30  20  30  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     66  86  67  89  68 /  20  30  20  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             66  86  66  89  67 /  20  30  20  30  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    60  84  61  88  63 /  20  30  30  40  30

FXUS64 KMRX 220649
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 AM EDT SAT JUN 22 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
AN UPPER LOW REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS...AND WILL DRIFT SLOWLY NORTH THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. 
THE PAST FEW DAYS...DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION HAS DEVELOPED OVER 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND DRIFTED INTO THE VALLEY. EXPECT THAT THIS 
WILL BE THE SCENARIO AGAIN TODAY. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS ALONG THE 
MOUNTAINS WITH SLIGHT CHANCES IN THE VALLEY AND PLATEAU. THIS IS 
ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE...WHICH HAS BEEN TOO LOW LATELY. LIKE 
YESTERDAY...THE SEVERE THREAT APPEARS LOW...ALTHOUGH SOME GUSTY 
WINDS AND HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THE STRONGEST STORMS. 
WILL END POPS BY MIDNIGHT. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO BE NEAR NORMAL.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
A BERMUDA HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS THROUGH ABOUT MID-WEEK WITH GENERALLY DIURNAL
CONVECTION POSSIBLE EACH DAY. COVERAGE WILL BE A LITTLE MORE EARLY
NEXT WEEK AS SOUNDINGS SHOW A BIT MORE MOISTURE ACROSS THE REGION
WITH PWS INCREASING TO 1.3 TO 1.4 INCHES. GREATEST COVERAGE WILL BE
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. TYPICAL ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE
STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE EACH DAY WITH THE MAIN CONCERN BEING
DAMAGING WINDS...HAIL UP TO QUARTER SIZE AND LOCALLY HEAVY
RAINFALL.

BY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...RIDGING WILL WILL WEAKEN AS AN UPPER TROUGH 
SWING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES. A 
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA FOR FRIDAY. SCATTERED TO BROKEN 
THUNDERSTORMS ANTICIPATED WITH FRONT.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS NUMBERS CLOSELY..EXCEPT WENT A DEGREE OR TWO 
COOLER FOR MID-WEEK TO BLEND WITH SURROUNDING WFOS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             89  68  89  68  89 /  20  20  20  20  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  87  66  88  67  88 /  20  20  30  20  30

THE FORECAST AS WELL. OTHERWISE...IT WILL FEEL PLEASANT TONIGHT
WITH LOWS DROPPING INTO THE LOW TO MID 60S IN MOST VALLEY
LOCATIONS.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT FRI JUN 21 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL LOW
PRESSURE AREA OVER NORTHERN GA AND SOUTHEASTERN TN WILL REMAIN
NEARLY STATIONARY THROUGH SATURDAY. THIS UPPER LOW WILL CAUSE AN
INCREASE IN COVERAGE OF STORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. A FEW
THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE STRONG TO SEVERE...WITH LOCALLY HEAVY
RAINFALL THE MAIN THREAT DUE TO THE LIGHT WIND FLOW THROUGHOUT THE
TROPOSPHERE...BUT GUSTY WINDS AND HAIL WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE.
EXPECT THESE STORMS TO SLOWLY WEAKEN AND DISSIPATE AFTER
SUNSET...WITH CLOUDS LIKELY LINGERING THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT DUE TO
THE UPPER LOW. FOR SATURDAY...SOUNDINGS SHOW A SLIGHTLY DRIER
ATMOSPHERE...BUT WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS STILL
DEVELOPING IN THE AFTERNOON. THUS...COULD SEE ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING AGAIN...BUT MAINLY AROUND THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN NEAR SEASONAL NORMS...AND WILL
GENERALLY FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE FORECAST WITH CLOUDS FROM THE UPPER
LOW EXPECTED TO KEEP LOW TEMPERATURES WARMER THAN GUIDANCE TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WILL CONTINUE TO BE IN
A TYPICAL SUMMER PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED. THE RESULT WILL BE A
CHANCE OF DIURNAL CONVECTION EACH DAY WITH BEST CHANCES OVER HIGHER
TERRAIN. CONVECTION CHANCE INCREASE TOWARDS THE END OF THE PERIOD
AS A COOL FRONT IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL
BE NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1017 AM EDT FRI JUN 21 2013

.DISCUSSION...
MODELS SHOW A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER NORTHERN GA AND SOUTHEAST
TN TODAY...WHICH COULD HELP TO GENERATE A SLIGHTLY BETTER COVERAGE
OF CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON. OVERALL...MODEL SOUNDINGS LOOK VERY
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY...BUT WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS
DEVELOPING OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. THUS...WILL INCREASE
POPS A LITTLE FOR THIS AFTERNOON EVERYWHERE DUE TO THIS UPPER LOW
AND SLIGHTLY HIGHER INSTABILITY. AN MCS IN THE UPPER MS RIVER
VALLEY IS CURRENTLY MOVING TO THE SOUTHEAST...BUT MODELS DO NOT
SHOW THIS SYSTEM REACHING THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...MODELS
INDICATE AN INSTABILITY AXIS AHEAD OF THIS MCS EXTENDING DOWN
TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL HAVE TO MONITOR THE PROGRESS OF
ITS OUTFLOW TO SEE IF IT APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA LATER THIS
AFTERNOON. TEMPS THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD BE VERY SIMILAR TO
YESTERDAY...BUT SOME CLOUD COVER OVER EASTERN TN THIS MORNING
SHOULD KEEP TEMPS A DEGREE OR TWO COOLER THAN YESTERDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 210701
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 AM EDT FRI JUN 21 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
MOST OF THE CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPED YESTERDAY WAS ASSOCIATED WITH 
AN UPPER LOW. TODAY...THE LOW WILL BE POSITIONED OVER NE GA/SW NC/NW 
SC. THUS THE BEST CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT WILL BE IN 
OUR SW NC COUNTIES AND OVER THE SMOKIES. THE STEERING WINDS IN THE 
850-500 MB LAYER WILL BE MAINLY FROM THE EAST...SO STORMS THAT 
DEVELOP OVER THE RIDGE TOPS WILL LIKELY DRIFT INTO THE VALLEY. WILL 
SPREAD CHANCE POPS FROM THE MOUNTAINS INTO EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE 
TN VALLEY...WITH SLIGHT CHANCES NEAR THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. SEVERE 
THREAT LOOKS LOW...BUT HEAVY RAINFALL CERTAINLY LOOKS POSSIBLE AS 
THE STORMS WILL BE SLOW MOVING. THE DIURNALLY-DRIVEN CONVECTION 
SHOULD DISSIPATE BY MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
WEAK H5 LOW PRESSURE WILL WOBBLE AROUND THE SOUTHEAST FOR MUCH OF
THE PERIOD...AND SOMEWHAT ENHANCE THE PROBABILITIES OF DIURNAL
CONVECTION EACH DAY. VERY LATE IN THE PERIOD TROUGHING OVER THE
GREAT LAKES WILL SWING A SHORTWAVE AND SFC FRONT INTO THE
AREA...GFS AND ECMWF CURRENTLY IN AGREEMENT. SO WILL GO WITH 30 PCT
POPS NEXT THURSDAY NIGHT INSTEAD OF DIURNAL...AND WE WILL SEE WHAT
FUTURE MODEL RUNS OFFER.

DEVELOPMENT WILL LIKELY DEVELOP AGAIN LATE TONIGHT...WITH A HIGHER
CHANCE OF FOG WHERE STORMS OCCUR. ON FRIDAY...EXPECT THE SAME
PATTERN TO SET UP WITH DIURNAL CONVECTION AND THE HIGHEST CHANCES
OF CONVECTION AROUND THE PLATEAU AND THE MOUNTAINS. AS FOR
TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MOVING INTO A RATHER 
NORMAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN FOR THE EXTENDED.  THIS TRANSLATES INTO  
STRONG DAYTIME HEATING THAT WILL BE THE MAIN CONTRIBUTOR FOR DIURNAL 
CONVECTION.  WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE MOSTLY 20 TO 30 POPS EACH AFTERNOON 
WITH LOWER POPS OVERNIGHT.  TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR TO SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD.

258 
FXUS64 KMRX 200725
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT THU JUN 20 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A SURFACE HIGH WILL SLOWLY SLIDE EAST ACROSS THE AREA TODAY...WITH
A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE REMAINING IN PLACE OVER CENTRAL GEORGIA.
WITH A WARM/MOIST AND MARGINALLY TO MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS
PROGGED TO BE IN PLACE...THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME DIURNALLY INDUCED
CONVECTION ALONG THE MOUNTAINS...AND TO A LESSER EXTENT THE PLATEAU
AND VALLEY WILL BE POSSIBLE DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE
AFOREMENTIONED DISTURBANCE MAY ALSO PROVIDE AN EXTRA BIT OF LIFT
TODAY...AND PERHAPS AID IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS ISOLATED TO
SCATTERED ACTIVITY. BY AN HOUR OR TWO AFTER SUNSET...THIS
CONVECTION WILL WANE RESULTING IN A FAIRLY CALM AND DRY NIGHT ONCE
AGAIN. HIGHS WILL BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN WEDNESDAY...PEAKING
IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S IN MOST LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
RATHER TYPICAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN SETTING UP FOR THE LONG
TERM...WHICH KEEPS TEMPS VERY NEAR SEASONAL NORMALS...AND RAIN
CHANCES LIMITED TO DIURNAL ACTIVITY IN THE 20 TO 30 PERCENT RANGE
FOR POPS. LACK OF A FOCUS OTHER THAN TERRAIN AND DAYTIME HEATING IS
THE RULE...ALTHO MOISTURE DOES INCREASE BY MONDAY THRU WEDNESDAY.
THIS INCREASES INSTABILITY TO MODERATE LEVELS OR HIGHER EACH
AFTERNOON...PLUS A POSSIBLE WEAKNESS IN THE UPPER RIDGE BY TUESDAY
OR WEDNESDAY. 500 MB FLOW LOOKS QUITE DIFFLUENT BY THEN...WHICH
COULD EASILY ALLOW FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF MCS ACTIVITY TO TRACK SE
FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. OF COURSE MUCH UNCERTAINTY AT THIS
POINT...SO MAIN CHANGE WAS TO TREND UP ON POPS TO NEAR CLIMO VALUES
(30 TO 40 PERCENT) BY MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. GFSX MOS POPS ARE A
BIT HIGHER THAN CLIMO...BUT I WILL DEFER TO LATER SHIFTS TO MAKE
ANY FURTHER POP INCREASES.

FOR TEMPS...20/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE CONSISTENT WITH 19/12Z VALUES 
AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED...UNTIL THE MOISTURE INCREASES EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. AT THAT POINT...I STAYED A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW THE LOWER 
90S MAX TEMPS OFFERED UP FOR SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             88  65  90  66  88 /  20  20  20  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  85  64  88  65  88 /  20  20  20  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  63  88  64  88 /  20  20  20  20  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT WED JUN 19 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER CENTRAL GA AND 
SOUTHERN SC...WITH A WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
ISOLATED CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AS A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
DEVELOPS. OVERALL...IT APPEARS THAT A STAGNANT PATTERN...TYPICAL OF 
THIS TIME OF YEAR...WILL LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 
FRIDAY NIGHT. WITH A MARGINALLY TO MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
DEVELOPING EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING...EXPECT ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP (MAINLY AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS)...WITH A 
FEW STORMS POSSIBLY BECOMING STRONG TO SEVERE WITH DAMAGING WINDS 
AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WHICH IS 
ESSENTIALLY A PERSISTENCE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LOOKS LIKE AN UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE U.S. OVER THE WEEKEND 
SUPPRESSING CONVECTION TO SOME DEGREE...LIMITING DEVELOPMENT TO SOME 
OF THE MAJOR TERRAIN...INCLUDING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE 
MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. THE SURFACE THROUGH 85H 
RIDGE SLIPS JUST A LITTLE EAST THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK WHILE 
A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVELENGTH FEATURES RIDE OVER THE TOP OF THE BIG 
RIDGE EFFECTIVELY SUPPRESSING ITS INFLUENCE...ESPECIALLY BY 
WEDNESDAY. INCREASING SOUTHERLY FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW 
LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE CENTER WILL MOISTEN AND HELP TO DESTABILIZE THE 
LOCAL ATMOSPHERE LEADING TO A SLIGHTLY BETTER POSSIBILITY FOR THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. STILL...UNCERTAINTY A 
LITTLE HIGHER IN THIS ENVIRONMENT WITH NO MAJOR FOCUS...I.E. 
SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY TO KEY IN ON CONCERNING PROBABILITY OF 
PRECIPITATION. THUS...THE LOW CHANCE POPS. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE 
TO MEX/ECM MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE EARLY IN THE PERIOD WHILE OPTING 
FOR SLIGHTLY LOWER MAXES TOWARD THE END OF THE LONG TERM.

FXUS64 KMRX 191450
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1050 AM EDT WED JUN 19 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AND DIFFUSE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
EXTENDING WEST TO EAST ACROSS SOUTHERN KENTUCKY AND SOUTHERN WEST 
VA...WITH A WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY DRIFT SOUTHWARD INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...AND MAY TRIGGER SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A DRY VERTICAL PROFILE OVERALL...BUT THERE 
MAY BE ENOUGH MOISTURE AROUND 850 MB TO GENERATE SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. A 
WEAK STEERING WIND FLOW BETWEEN 5 AND 10 MPH MAY KEEP THIS 
CONVECTION CONFINED TO AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT WILL PLAN 
TO MENTION SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION FOR THE VALLEY AREAS SINCE THESE 
NORTHEAST WINDS AND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY MAY PUSH SOME OF THIS 
CONVECTION  OUT INTO THE VALLEYS. MODEL SOUNDINGS ALSO REVEAL A 
FAIRLY DRY MID LEVEL AND AN INVERTED V PROFILE IN THE BOUNDARY 
LAYER...SO AM CONCERNED THAT SOME DAMAGING WINDS COULD BE POSSIBLE 
WITH A FEW STORMS THAT MANAGE TO DEVELOP. THUS...WILL UPDATE THE 
HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION THIS POSSIBILITY.

OVERALL...WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO MENTION ISOLATED 
CONVECTION EVERYWHERE...AND TO TWEAK TEMPS AND SKY CONDITIONS A 
LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&

538 
FXUS64 KMRX 190712
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 AM EDT WED JUN 19 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER CONDITIONS EARLY THIS MORNING...ALONG WITH
CALM WINDS HAVE RESULTED IN PATCHY FOG DEVELOPMENT AND EVEN SOME
LOW STATUS NEAR AREA RIVERS AND LAKES. THIS FOG WILL LINGER THROUGH
DAYBREAK BEFORE DISSIPATING BY 12-13Z OR SO. A SURFACE HIGH WILL
CONTINUE TO NUDGE ITS WAY INTO THE REGION...RESULTING IN DRY
CONDITIONS AND A MOSTLY SUNNY SKY BY THE AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES
WILL BE WARMER THAN TUESDAY GIVEN THE CLEARER CONDITIONS...REACHING
THE LOW TO MID 80S IN MOST LOCATIONS...WITH SOME AREAS ALONG THE
SOUTHERN ZONES CREEPING INTO THE UPPER 80S. HOWEVER...DID TWEAK
TEMPERATURES DOWN A DEGREE OR SO GIVEN THE PREVAILING NORTHEAST
FLOW THAT SHOULD LINGER THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY. AN ISOLATED STORM
MAY BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS LATE IN THE DAY...BUT THINK
DRY CONDITIONS WILL BE THE PREVALENT IN MOST SPOTS. THERE MAY BE
ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SOME LOCALIZED AREAS OF FOG LATE TONIGHT...BUT
DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH CONFIDENCE THAT IT WILL BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO
MENTION IN THE FORECAST ATTM.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
DID NOT SEE MUCH OPPORTUNITY TO SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE ON PREVIOUS
FORECAST GRIDS. UPPER RIDGE BUILDING ACROSS THE REGION BEHIND THE
EXITING TROUGH TODAY...WITH LITTLE CHANGE UNTIL THE UPPER RIDGE
FLATTENS OUT A BIT BY MONDAY OR TUESDAY. THE SURFACE RIDGE STAYS
CENTERED GENERALLY TO OUR NORTH OR NORTHEAST UNTIL AT LEAST LATE
SUNDAY...THEN SLIDES OFF TO THE E TO SE...AND MAY ALLOW A WEAK
SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW BY EARLY NEXT WEEK.

THIS TYPICAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN DOES NOT SUPPORT MORE THAN ISOLATED 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING CONVECTION THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WHICH WAS 
ALREADY DEPICTED IN OUR FORECAST. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW PRECIPITABLE 
WATER INCREASING BY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...SO I NUDGED POPS UP 
TO LOW CHANCE IN MOST AREAS FOR MONDAY. THIS WAS ALSO THE TREND FROM 
18/12Z GFSX TO 19/00Z GFSX MOS POPS. NO CHANGES MADE FOR TUESDAY 
WITH CHANCE POPS DAYTIME AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NIGHTTIME SUFFICIENT 
FOR NOW. 

FOR TEMPS...GFS AND GFSX MOS TEMPS GENERALLY FOLLOWED...EXCEPT FOR 
STAYING MOSTLY BELOW THE 90S FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...GIVEN THE FALLING 
HEIGHTS AND INCREASING MOISTURE.

IN ZFP AND HWO PRODUCTS WITHOUT A FLOOD WATCH...DUE TO LATEST FLASH
FLOOD GUIDANCE AND COORDINATION WITH ADJACENT NWS OFFICES.

OVERNIGHT DUE TO TRAILING SECONDARY WEAK COLD FRONT AND YET ANOTHER
UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCE.

CLOSER TO THE PREVIOUS POP GRIDS FOR TONIGHT (HIGHER THAN GFS MOS). 
NAM MOS MAX TEMPS ONCE AGAIN FAVORED OVER THE WARMER GFS MOS...
THEN A MOS BLEND OF MINS FOR TONIGHT.
 

.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/.... 
A FAIRLY TYPICAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN WILL EXIST IN THE EXTENDED
PERIOD AS A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION IN WAKE OF
THE FRONTAL PASSAGE ON TUESDAY. THIS WILL RESULT IN MOSTLY DRY AND
SUNNY CONDITIONS FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...WITH PERHAPS SOME LOW
END ISOLATED CONVECTION POSSIBLE ALONG THE MOUNTAINS. PRECIP
CHANCES WILL INCREASE FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND AS THE RIDGE SLIDES
OFF TO THE EAST AND A MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO
INCREASES. THIS WILL LEAD TO SOME BETTER OPPORTUNITIES FOR DIURNAL
CONVECTION DURING THE LATTER HALF OF THIS PERIOD...PARTICULARLY ON
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH A WEAK SHORTWAVE PASSING THROUGH.
OTHERWISE...WARM AND SEASONABLE TEMPS IN THE MID 80S TO AROUND 90
DEGREES ARE EXPECTED EACH DAY WITH MOSTLY TO PARTLY SUNNY
CONDITIONS.

EVENT THAT IS FORECAST TONIGHT AND RUNNING THROUGH TUESDAY. IT
WON'T BE THE EASIEST THING TIMING THE BANDS OF PRECIP AS THEY ROLE
THROUGH...BUT POPS ARE HIGH TONIGHT AND TUES. MODELS DISAGREE A BIT
ON THE TIMING OF THE PRECIP DEPARTURE LATE TUESDAY...THE GFS IS
QUICKEST...BUT HAVE LEANED TOWARD THE SLIGHTLY SLOWER SOLUTIONS OF
THE NAM/CANADIAN/ECMWF...THUS TUES EVENING POPS ARE A LITTLE HIGHER
THAN MAV MOS...BUT NOT AS HIGH AS MET MOS.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT
AGREEMENT OVERALL...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOUT AVERAGE FOR
THIS TIME OF YEAR FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD. DRYER AIR WILL BE
MOVING INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY BEHIND THE COLD FRONT AS SURFACE
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN. CONVECTIVE ENERGY LOOKS MINIMAL SO WILL GO
DRY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED
TO OUR EAST AND UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD IN FOR FRIDAY THROUGH
MONDAY. MOISTURE MAY INCREASE ENOUGH FOR SOME MAINLY DIURNAL
CONVECTION...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EACH DAY. GFS MOS
TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL SO JUST SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
442 AM EDT MON JUN 17 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS PERFORMED RATHER POORLY ON 
THE BATCH OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS THAT MOVED ACROSS NE 
PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA AROUND MIDNIGHT TO 330 AM EDT. APPEARS 
THAT THERE WILL BE AT LEAST A FEW HOURS LAG BEFORE MORE CONVECTION 
MOVES IN FROM THE WEST AFTER SUNRISE. ALREADY SEEING EVIDENCE OF 
THIS CONVECTION UPSTREAM OVER MIDDLE TN AND NE AL...SO AT LEAST 
SOMEWHAT CONFIDENT IN INCREASING POPS FOR LATER THIS MORNING. 
SOUNDINGS ARE MORE UNSTABLE THIS MORNING THAN LATER TODAY...SO ADDED 
AT LEAST A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS. LOWERED POPS GENERALLY TO 
CHANCE NORTH...BUT KEPT LIKELY POPS OVER SE TN AND SW NC. THIS IS IN 
LINE WITH NAM MODEL DEPICTION AND ALSO NEEDED TO BLEND BETTER WITH 
FFC AND GSP FORECAST GRIDS. 

FOR TONIGHT...FRONTAL BOUNDARY SEEMS TO FINALLY SAG FURTHER SOUTH BY 
12Z TUESDAY...WITH GENERAL CONSENSUS AMONGST MODELS ON THE NEXT 
MAJOR WAVE OF CONVECTION APPROACHING LIKELY IN THE 06Z TO 12Z 
TUESDAY PERIOD. FORECAST SOUNDINGS LOOK MORE UNSTABLE THAN EARLIER 
THOUGHT...AS WELL AS SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY AFTER 06Z TUESDAY. 
THUS...I HAVE POPS INCREASING AFTER 06Z TUESDAY WITH SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS MENTIONED. 

FOR TEMPS...JUST DON'T SEE MAX TEMPS GETTING NEAR THE GFS MOS VALUES 
GIVEN THE ONGOING AND DEVELOPING CONVECTION. TRENDED CLOSE TO THE 
PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID...WHICH WAS VERY CLOSE TO THE COOLER NAM MOS 
HIGHS. MOS MINS LOOKED FINE FOR TONIGHT AND WERE FOLLOWED.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS STILL BRINGING MAJOR
SHORTWAVE INTO FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. THIS WILL
AFFECT HIGHS WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TUESDAY MORNING
DECREASING IN THE AFTERNOON. KEPT HIGHS BELOW GUIDANCE WITH
CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION. MODELS STILL HAVE FRONT
MOVING SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT OR EARLY WEDNESDAY.
STILL WEAK SHORTWAVE ENERGY TO TRIGGER MORE ISOLATED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. PATTERN OF SLIGHT
CHANCE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE END OF
THE WEEK AS THE TROUGH STAYS OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY.
DRIER AND COOLER AIR BEHIND BOUNDARY WILL KEEP HIGHS NEAR TO
SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL WITH DEEPER MOISTURE STAYING SOUTH OF THE
FORECAST AREA. MODELS TRY TO STRENGTHEN RIDGE TO THE WEST AND GFS
TRIES TO DEVELOP WEAK UPPER LOW ALONG SOUTHEAST COAST ON THE
WEEKEND. THIS COULD INCREASE POPS OVER EASTERN SECTIONS BUT WILL
KEEP 20 TO 30 PERCENT AFTERNOON AND EVENING POPS FOR SATURDAY AND
SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EDT SUN JUN 16 2013

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODE CHANGE NOW UNDERWAY AS 
WE TRANSITION BACK TO A WETTER PERIOD FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.  
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS EVENING...WEAK 
DISTURBANCE IS MOVING ACROSS THE AREA...AND IT WILL BE FOLLOWED LATE 
THIS EVENING BY ANOTHER DISTURBANCE ROTATING THROUGH FROM THE 
NORTHWEST.  SO THERE ARE A COUPLE OF TIMES FOR SLIGHTLY ENHANCED 
LIFT IN THIS FIRST PERIOD.  FOR MONDAY...MOISTURE HANGS IN THE 
AREA...WITH DEEPER MOISTURE AND MORE LIFT ACROSS THE SOUTH...SO 
HIGHER POPS THERE.  FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...PRECIP CHANCES 
REMAIN HIGH AS MOISTURE CONTINUES TO STREAM INTO THE AREA.  LOOKING 
AT MODEL SOUNDINGS...CAPE VALUES APPEAR LOW FOR MUCH OF THE 
TIME...EVEN LOOKING LIKE PLAIN RAIN AT TIMES.  IN GRIDS WENT WITH A 
CHANCE OF THUNDER THIS EVENING...THEN JUST SHOWERS FOR THE REST OF 
THE TIME THROUGH TUESDAY.  FOR TEMPERATURES...WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
FOR LOWS...ALTHOUGH BUMPED UP KTRI A COUPLE OF DEGREES MONDAY 
NIGHT...BUT FOR HIGHS...WENT ON THE COOL SIDE OF GUIDANCE AS CLOUDS 
AND RAIN WILL SUPPRESS HEATING.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A GENERALLY ZONAL 
PATTERN REMAINS IN VIEW TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH A 
MOSTLY DIURNAL CONVECTIVE REGIME. BEGINNING THURSDAY...UPPER LEVEL 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER TX/AR AND BUILD THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
THIS WILL PUT US UNDER A NW FLOW ALOFT WHICH LEAVES US VULNERABLE TO 
MCS ACTIVITY TOPPING THE RIDGE FROM THE OH VALLEY. BUT THE MODELS 
STRUGGLE TO IDENTIFY ANY CASE IN PARTICULAR...THE CANADIAN MODEL 
SUGGESTS W TN ON FRI WHILE ECMWF SUGGESTS E TN LATER SATURDAY. THIS 
PARTICULAR THREAT WILL BE HARD TO PIN DOWN THIS FAR AWAY. THUS A 
GENERALLY DIURNAL CONVECTIVE FORECAST WILL BE MAINTAINED THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED WITH POPS GENERALLY OF 20-30 PERCENT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
423 AM EDT SUN JUN 16 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE THIS MORNING FROM 
24 HOURS AGO...EXCEPT FOR TEMPS RUNNING A FEW DEGREES HIGHER. THE 
SURFACE RIDGE WILL BE SLIPPING OFF TO THE EAST...ALLOWING A SLIGHT 
INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE/INSTABILITY FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. THE MOISTURE DEEPENS BY TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...AS THE 
UPPER RIDGE ALSO FLATTENS. PREVIOUS WEATHER AND POP GRIDS LOOKED 
GOOD WITH GENERALLY NO RAIN CHANCES THROUGH ABOUT 16Z TODAY...THEN 
CHANCE POPS (OR SCATTERED WORDING) THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

JUST MINOR CHANGES MADE...SUCH AS SLIGHTLY LOWERING POPS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT TONIGHT FOR SOME LINGERING SHOWERS...WHICH COULD END.
PARTIAL CLEARING...IN ANY AREAS THAT DO RECEIVE RAINFALL...SHOULD 
LEAD TO PATCHY AREAS OF FOG LATE. 

FOR TEMPS...THE INCREASING MOISTURE AND DECREASING HEIGHTS ALOFT 
DON'T FAVOR THE WARMER GFS MAX TEMPS...SO I TRENDED CLOSER TO THE 
COOLER NAM/MET MOS MAXES. MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT WERE CLOSELY 
FOLLOWED.

THE THREAT OF STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE STORMS REMAINS VERY LOW
AT THIS TIME.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MOISTURE HAS INCREASED
SUBSTANTIALLY FROM SUNDAY WITH BROAD TROUGH SETTLING OVER EASTERN
HALF OF THE COUNTRY. CONSIDERABLE CLOUD COVER AND MUCH HIGHER RAIN
CHANCES MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY AHEAD OF WEAK COLD FRONT. FOLLOWED
CLOSER TO LOWER MET VALUES FOR HIGHS MONDAY AND TUESDAY AND
MET/MOS BLEND FOR LOW ON TUE MORNING. WEAK DISTURBANCES IN FLOW
WILL SET OFF PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. SOME MAY BECOME
STRONG DURING LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS IF THERE IS ENOUGH
HEATING BUT NO CLEAR TRIGGER FOR SEVERE STORMS AT THIS TIME.
RAINFALL AMOUNTS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING MAY BECOME HEAVY
BUT AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO BE LESS THAN 2 INCHES. FRONT MOVES JUST
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY AND THEN WASHES OUT BY FRIDAY.
EXPECT MORE DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
WITH MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCES OF AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS
AND SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST
PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 PM EDT SAT JUN 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...THIS FORECASTS STARTS 
WITH QUIET WEATHER...THE UPPER RIDGE OVERHEAD...BUT THE SURFACE 
RIDGE HAS NOW MOVED EAST OF THE AREA ALLOWING THE RETURN FLOW OF 
MOIST AIR TO BEGIN.  TRAJECTORY FORECASTS SHOW THE SOURCE REGION FOR 
OUR AIR MASS ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON IS PRESENTLY RESIDING IN THE 
SOUTHERN HALVES OF GA/AL WHERE DEW POINTS ARE 60-65 SRN GA...BUT 65-70 
IN SRN AL.  WOULD EXPECT DEWPOINTS IN OUR AREA BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON 
TO RANGE FROM THE LOWER 60S IN THE NORTHEAST TO UPPER 60S SOUTHWEST. 
THIS RESULTS IN MLCAPE VALUES OF ABOUT 500-1000 J/KG...SO STORMS NOT 
EXPECTED TO GET OVERLY STRONG. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW TALL/SKINNY CAPE 
ON ALL SOUNDINGS.  WITH THIS BEING SAID...THERE IS A WEAK UPPER 
LEVEL DISTURBANCE MOVING THROUGH THE AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON...SO 
ALTHOUGH CAPES WILL BE MARGINAL...THIS DISTURBANCE COULD HELP 
ORGANIZE THE CONVECTION AND HELP ADD A LITTLE LIFT.  ALSO...THERE IS 
A SECOND WAVE THAT ROTATES THROUGH OVERNIGHT.  WILL GO WITH 
NON-SEVERE THUNDER IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AND SHOWERS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT.  WENT ON HIGHER SIDE OF MOS IN GENERAL FOR THESE POPS.
MOS TEMPS AND DEW POINTS LOOKED PRETTY GOOD--WENT VERY CLOSE. ANY 
FOG OVERNIGHT TONIGHT...THINK IT WOULD BE PATCHY AND NOT OVERLY 
THICK DUE TO INCREASING CLOUDS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A FAIRLY ZONAL PATTERN WITH 
DISTURBANCES AND WIGGLES WILL KEEP THE AREA UNDER A REGIME OF 
OCCASIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY AND TUESDAY. FRONTAL 
PASSAGE WILL THEN SCOUR OUT THE BULK OF THE ACTIVITY BY WEDNESDAY 
ALTHOUGH MODELS DISAGREE JUST HOW FAR SOUTH THE BOUNDARY AND PRECIP 
WILL PUSH THROUGH...MAYBE MAINTAINING CHC POPS IN OUR FAR SOUTH 
WEDNESDAY. MOSTLY GOING TO MAINTAIN AN AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
CONVECTIVE REGIME FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK...WITH POPS MAINLY 
IN THE 20-30 PCT RANGE. HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT WILL BE BUILDING OVER 
TX/AR LATE IN THE WEEK...AND FLATTENING EASTWARD INTO OUR REGION BY 
DAY 9. THUS EXPECT A WARMING TREND DURING THE LATE PORTION OF THE 
EXTENDED...AND THEN BEYOND. ONE DISTANT PROBLEM TO BEAR IN MIND IS 
THAT AS THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER TX/AR...IT OPENS US UP TO NW 
FLOW TYPE MCS ACTIVITY...GFS AND ESPECIALLY DGEX HINT AT THAT FOR 
NEXT SATURDAY. WON/T BITE ON THAT YET FOR A DAY 7 FORECAST...BUT 
KEEP AN EYE OPEN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             66  88  68  86  68 /   0  40  30  70  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  88  67  84  67 /   0  30  50  70  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       65  88  66  84  67 /   0  40  50  70  70

GFS MOS MINS WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
FLATTENS OUT AND SHIFTS EAST SUNDAY AS IMPULSE MOVES ACROSS EASTERN
GREAT LAKES AND UPPER OHIO VALLEY. TRAILING SHORT WAVE ENERGY INTO
LOWER OHIO VALLEY AND MS VALLEY WILL MOVE INTO THE EASTERN TN
VALLEY AND FORECAST AREA LATE IN THE DAY WITH CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. MODELS INDICATE MORE SHOWERS POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT AND
THEN A STRONGER SHORTWAVE MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY INTO
TUESDAY AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. THE COLD FRONT MOVES JUST SOUTH OF
THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY. STILL KEEPING WEDNESDAY DRY. FRONT DOES NOT
MAKE IT FAR SOUTH AND SHOULD WASH OUT BY THURSDAY. SLIGHT CHANCE
SHOWERS BACK THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE COMING
BACK NORTH. HIGHS SUNDAY AGAIN NEAR TO ABOVE NORMAL AND THEN A FEW
DEGREES COOLER WITH BETTER RAIN CHANCES MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

177 
FXUS64 KMRX 141840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EDT FRI JUN 14 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT/...
IN WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT AND STORMS THAT MOVED THROUGH THE REGION
YESTERDAY...A CALM AND DRY DAY HAS PREVAILED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION WITH COOLER TEMPERATURES PEAKING IN THE UPPER
70S TO MID 80S IN MOST AREAS. FOR TONIGHT...A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE
WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD IN...RESULTING IN CONTINUED CLEAR AND DRY
CONDITIONS FOR THE DAY ON SATURDAY AS WELL. SOME FOG DEVELOPMENT
WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE TONIGHT IN THE USUAL FOG-PRONE POCKETS AND
NEAR BODIES OF WATER. AFTER SUNRISE HOWEVER...ANY FOG WILL
DISSIPATE QUICKLY AND WINDS WILL VEER TO THE SOUTHWEST...
RESULTING IN SUNNY AND WARMER CONDITIONS IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S
ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS...WITH LOWER 80S ACROSS THE
NORTHEAST ZONES.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY/...
THE SOUTHEAST RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO PROGRESS EASTWARD WHILE A 
TROUGH DROPS INTO THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND UPPER MS VALLEY REGION ON 
SUNDAY. WITH THE RIDGE WEAKENING...WE SHOULD SEE SOME SCATTERED TO 
ISOLATED STORMS SUNDAY AFTERNOON...AS WELL AS INCREASING MOISTURE 
WITH PW VALUES RISING ABOVE 1.5 INCHES. CONDITIONS APPEAR FAVORABLE 
FOR MCS DEVELOPMENT IN THE IA/MO/IL AREA ON SUNDAY...AND THE NAM 
BRINGS THE REMNANT VORT MAX OF THIS SYSTEM INTO OUR NORTHERN AREAS 
SUNDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. 

THE UPPER TROUGH/JET STREAK MOVE INTO THE LOWER GREAT LAKES/OHIO 
VALLEY ON MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT...WHICH WILL INCREASE LIFT ACROSS THE 
AREA. WITH REASONABLE AGREEMENT AMONG MODELS AND ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ON 
THIS TIMING...WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS FOR BOTH PERIODS. TIMING OF 
BEST LIFT AT NIGHT DOES NOT FAVOR SEVERE STORMS...AND THE BEST 
DIVERGENCE IN THE JET ENTRANCE REGION STAYS TO OUR NORTH. THERE MAY 
BE A THREAT OF SEVERE MONDAY AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY IF THE SYSTEM IS 
A BIT FASTER THAN THE MODELS CURRENTLY SHOW. CHANCE POPS LINGER INTO 
TUESDAY MORNING AS THE SYSTEM DEPARTS. 

WEDNESDAY LOOKS DRY WITH A DEEP NW FLOW BEHIND THE TROUGH. THE GFS 
SHOWS A WEAK UPPER TROUGH OVER THE AREA THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WHICH 
MAY SUPPORT DIURNAL SCATTERED TO ISOLATED STORMS BOTH DAYS.

&&

QUITE PLEASANT FOR MID JUNE FROM AROUND 50 TO LOWER 60S.

DRIER AIR MASS AND WARMING TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL SATURDAY.

TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY WARMER SOUTH AND MUCH WARMER NORTH AS RIDGE
STRENGTHENS. FLOW STILL OUT OF THE NW SATURDAY AND SHORTWAVE ENERGY
AHEAD OF COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. SATURDAY NIGHT AND
SUNDAY RIDGE FLATTENS OUT AND HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST ALLOWING
FOR MOISTURE RETURN INTO THE THE TN VALLEY. SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS SUNDAY AS WEAK TROUGH IN THE NEAR ZONAL
FLOW. RAIN CHANCES INCREASE MONDAY TO LIKELY AND CONTINUE TUESDAY
AHEAD OF NEXT SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT. THIS FRONT SHOULD SHIFT
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. WEDNESDAY STILL LOOKS
DRY AS FRONT STAYS SOUTH OF THE REGION. THE FRONT THEN BECOMES
STATIONARY BY THURSDAY WITH MOISTURE RETURNING BACK NORTH DURING
THE DAY THURSDAY SO ADDED SLIGHT TO CHANCE POPS ON THURSDAY.
WARMEST TEMPERATURES SUNDAY. LOWERED TEMPERATURES MONDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY A FEW DEGREES WITH HIGHER RAIN CHANCES EXPECTED AND MORE
CLOUD COVER.

FXUS64 KMRX 131827
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
227 PM EDT THU JUN 13 2013

.SHORT TERM...
CURRENTLY TWO LINES MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. THE LINE
FARTHEST WEST IS ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. THERE ARE SOME
WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS DEVELOPING ACROSS NORTH/NORTHEAST
KY/WV IN THE VICINITY OF THE COLD POOL ALOFT. HAVE LEFT SLIGHT
CHANCE OF SHOWERS INTO THE MID EVENING TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS.
OTHERWISE MUCH DRIER AND RELATIVELY COOLER AIR WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
REGION OVERNIGHT. FORECAST MODEL SOUNDINGS DIFFER WITH THEIR
HANDLING OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TOMORROW AT THE 850MB HEIGHT. THE
NAM IS NEARLY SATURATED WHILE THE GFS IS MUCH DRIER. USUALLY THE
NAM HANDLES THE VERTICAL LEVELS BETTER BUT WITH A DRY AIR MASS
FILLING IN BEHIND THE TROUGH AND THE EASTERN EDGE OF THE RIDGE
BRINGING SINKING AIR...FIND IT HARD TO BUY MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES
SHORTLY AFTER NOON. IN THE WAKE OF THE FRONT...DAYTIME TEMPERATURES
WILL BE PLEASANT GENERALLY LOWER TO MID 80S.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF
THIS PERIOD...HIGH PRESSURE HAS BUILT INTO THE REGION AT THE
SURFACE AND THE UPPER RIDGE CENTERED OVER TX IS TRYING TO BUILD
INTO THE REGION AS WELL. BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...THE SURFACE HIGH HAS
MOVED TO THE EAST ALLOWING A RETURN FLOW TO SET UP...AND THE RIDGE
HAS BEEN FLATTENED BY A DISTURBANCE. SURFACE DEWPOINTS WILL BE BACK
INTO THE 60S AREA-WIDE BY THEN...AND THE FIRST CHANCE OF
SHOWERS/STORMS COMES BACK INTO THE AREA. CHANCES OF SHOWERS/STORMS
CONTINUE THROUGH MONDAY...THEN TAPERS OFF SOMEWHAT BY TUESDAY.
SEVERE THUNDERSTORM CHANCES LOOK TO BE WELL WEST OF OUR AREA.

FINALLY BY WEDNESDAY...DRY AIR MOVES INTO THE REGION AND THE 
FORECAST IS DRY FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD.

FOR TEMPERATURES...MODEL GUIDANCE SEEMS GOOD OVERALL...WENT CLOSE 
TO GUIDANCE FOR MOST PERIODS.

FXUS64 KMRX 130111
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
910 PM EDT WED JUN 12 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR 
CHICAGO...WITH A VERY WARM AND HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A STABLE LAYER IN THE MID LEVELS THIS 
EVENING...WHICH HAS CAPPED ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS CAP IS EXPECTED TO WEAKEN OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
OVERNIGHT...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE LOWER OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL ALSO PUSH A COLD FRONT TOWARDS 
THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT...WITH CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT OVER 
THE GREAT LAKES REGION EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD TOWARDS THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS CONVECTION WILL NOT MOVE 
INTO SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN UNTIL AFTER SUNRISE TOMORROW... 
BUT IT APPEARS LIKELY THAT A FAST-MOVING MCS WILL ULTIMATELY RESULT 
FROM THIS CONVECTION. THUS...WILL KEEP A MENTION OF THE POSSIBILITY 
OF CONVECTION LATER TONIGHT TOWARDS SUNRISE OVER THE NORTHERN HALF 
OF THE FORECAST AREA.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO TWEAK PRECIP TIMING AND TEMPS A LITTLE 
ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

678 
FXUS64 KMRX 121908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT WED JUN 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...MUGGY CONDITIONS CURRENTLY
OCCURRING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREAS WITH ALL STATIONS REPORTING AT
LEAST 70 DEGREE DEWPOINTS. THE LACK OF A WELL DEFINED LIFTING
MECHANISM WILL LIKELY INHIBIT THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT THIS
AFTERNOON...HOWEVER THERE MAY BE AN ISOLATED STORM OR TWO THAT POPS
UP. OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL BE RATHER WARM TOO BEFORE THE
UPSTREAM SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH.

IN THE MEANTIME...OVERNIGHT HOURS LOOK RATHER BENIGN. AWAITING 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEX TO INITIATE OVER THE CHICAGO AREA THIS AFTERNOON. 
WE WILL AWAIT THE SHORTWAVE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ANTICIPATED SEVERE 
WEATHER OVER NORTHERN ILLINOIS/INDIANA. THE SHORTWAVE WILL TRANSLATE 
ACROSS NORTH KENTUCKY OVERNIGHT. AS SUCH...HAVE DELAYED THE ONSET OF 
PRECIPITATION UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT PARTICULARLY FOR SOUTHWEST VA. 
POPS WILL INCREASE RAPIDLY AFTER SUNRISE FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST 
AREA. WARM...MOIST AIR IS AWAITING THE SHORTWAVE. LI/S ARE PROGGED 
AT -8 DEGREES C AND MLCAPES RANGING FROM ABOUT 3000 TO 5000 J/KG. 
DAMAGING WIND GUSTS WILL BE THE MAIN THREAT FROM THESE STORMS BUT 
STRONG WIND SHEAR MAY BE ENOUGH TO PRODUCE AN ISOLATED TORNADO. THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE QUICKLY SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA AND 
EXPECT THE WORST TO BE OVER BY 5PM THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
THE COLD FRONT WILL BE QUICK TO EXIT THE REGION THURSDAY 
EVENING...BRINGING AN ABRUPT END TO THE THUNDERSTORM THREAT AFTER 
02-03Z OR SO. IN THEIR WAKE...A DRIER AND SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR MASS 
WILL MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AS A 
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL RESULT 
IN COOLER LOW TO MID 80S TEMPERATURES ON FRIDAY...BEFORE A WARMING 
TREND BACK INTO THE MID 80S TO LOW 90S OCCURS BY SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY. DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED UNTIL MONDAY AS INCREASED 
MOISTURE AND ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH/FRONT MOVES EAST INTO THE 
MISSISSIPPI AND EVENTUALLY TENNESSEE VALLEY. HAVE INCREASED POPS 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA...AND 
BECAUSE THERE IS FAIRLY GOOD MODEL AGREEMENT FOR SOME WIDESPREAD 
CONVECTION. LATE IN THE PERIOD...UPPER-HIGH PRESSURE RIDGING LOOKS 
TO BUILD BACK INTO THE REGION FOR THE MIDDLE TO LATER PART OF NEXT 
WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT TUE JUN 11 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL RIDGING OVER THE 
SOUTH CENTRAL STATES AND STRETCHING EAST INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
HAS KEPT THINGS WARM AND DRY THIS AFTERNOON OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
WEAK DEW POINT BOUNDARY OR FRONT LIES ALONG THE SOUTHERN BORDER WITH 
LOWER DEW POINTS NORTH. HEAT INDEX VALUES HAVE REACHED ABOVE 90 
AROUND CHA TODAY WITH DEW POINTS AROUND 70. AIR MASS IS VERY 
UNSTABLE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS BUT NO TRIGGER FOR CONVECTION 
TODAY.

MODELS DIFFER TONIGHT WITH OVERNIGHT CONVECTION DEVELOPING ALONG THE 
PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE AND MOVING SE TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA. GFS 
KEEPING ACTIVITY TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA AND NAM SHOWING ACTIVITY 
DEVELOPING OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND MOVING SE INTO SW VA 
AND NE TN LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY. NAM PUTS RAIN CHANCES AS 
HIGH AS 30 TO 40 PERCENT ACROSS NE PART OF THE REGION TONIGHT AND 40 
TO 50 PERCENT WEDNESDAY AS ACTIVITY CONTINUES TO DROP SOUTH AND 
WEST. HAVE COMPROMISED AND ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE LATE TONIGHT NE AND 
INCREASED POPS TO CHANCE NE BETWEEN 12 AND 18Z WEDNESDAY WITH SLIGHT 
CHANCE LATER. AS FOR TEMPERATURES SOME LATE NIGHT CLOUDS COULD HOLD 
TEMPERATURES UP CLOSER TO MET NUMBERS. WEDNESDAY GUIDANCE STILL 
RUNNING TO HIGH AT FOR SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL AREAS. WITH SOME CLOUDS 
AND SHOWERS...KEPT HIGHS CLOSER TO MET GUIDANCE BUT SLIGHTLY WARMER 
NE AND SLIGHTLY COOLER AT CHA WITH 92. IT STILL HAS NOT REACHED 90 
AT CHA THIS YEAR ALTHOUGH IT COULD TODAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL TWO COLD FRONTS AFFECTING THE FORECAST 
AREA...ONE ON THURSDAY AND THE OTHER ONE EARLY NEXT WEEK. AN UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION ON THURSDAY...WHICH WILL PUSH A COLD FRONT QUICKLY THROUGH A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE NOW 
REVEALING A LITTLE FASTER EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THIS COLD FRONT ON 
THURSDAY...WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION MOVING INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY MORNING. A FAIRLY STRONG WIND FLOW WITH 
THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD HELP TO PRODUCE SOME SEVERE STORMS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN BUILD OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR THE WEEKEND...BUT WITH NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT LINGERING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS PATTERN WILL BE 
CONDUCIVE FOR CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES FROM THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY TO 
MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY AS ANOTHER COLD FRONT SLOWLY APPROACHES 
THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST. THUS...WILL MENTION CHANCE 
POPS FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY...WITH A VERY UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP EACH DAY OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...SINCE THIS IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS AND THE GROUND REMAINS FAIRLY WET OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT MON JUN 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SKIES HAVE BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY 
THIS AFTERNOON BEHIND MORNING DISTURBANCE AND AIR MASS HAS BECOME 
UNSTABLE ENOUGH AHEAD OF UPPER LEVEL LOW/TROUGH MOVING EAST ACROSS 
THE OHIO AND MS VALLEYS THAT A NEW AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
WAS PROGRESSING TOWARDS THE NASHVILLE AND ADJACENT MIDDLE TN AND 
MIDDLE KY REGION. WITH SLIGHTLY LOWER FREEZING LEVEL AND STRONG WIND 
SHEAR LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS ARE POSSIBLE LATE THIS AFTERNOON 
THROUGH MID EVENING AS THE STORMS MOVE EAST. SUPERCELLS COULD FORM 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD AND MOVE INTO THE PLATEAU COUNTIES WITH AN 
ISOLATED TORNADO POSSIBLE. RAISED POPS SLIGHTLY TO LIKELY ALL OF 
EAST TN AND SW VA INTO THE EVENING HOURS AND ADDED SEVERE WORDING. 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS A POSSIBILITY WITH CURRENT WET GROUND BUT 
EXPECTING STORMS TO MOVE FAST ENOUGH THAT THE FLOOD THREAT WILL BE 
ISOLATED. DRIER AIR MASS WORKS IN TONIGHT AND TUESDAY BUT WITH 
EVENING RAIN PATCHY DENSE FOG POSSIBLE TUESDAY MORNING. LOWS TONIGHT 
SHOULD BE CLOSE TO MAV GUIDANCE NEAR 60 HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO MID 60S 
AROUND CHA. TUESDAY A FEW DEGREES WARMER BUT KEPT A FEW DEGREES 
BELOW GUIDANCE DUE TO THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE IN THE GROUND THAT HAS 
TO EVAPORATE BEFORE TEMPS REACH THE 90 DEGREE THRESHOLD.    

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL TWO MAIN FEATURES AFFECTING THE 
FORECAST AREA...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ON THURSDAY AND A COLD FRONT 
ON MONDAY. A VERY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY...WITH ISOLATED CONVECTION EXPECTED 
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. ANOTHER VERY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AGAIN ON THURSDAY...AS A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY PUSHES A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. WITH VERY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASSES EXPECTED ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...IT APPEARS THAT SEVERE 
CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE EACH DAY...BUT ESPECIALLY ON THURSDAY AS 
THE COLD FRONT TRIGGERS A BETTER COVERAGE OF CONVECTION. HIGH 
PRESSURE THEN BUILDS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT LINGERING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. 
IT APPEARS THAT THIS PATTERN WILL BE CONDUCIVE TO THE POSSIBILITY OF 
MCS ACTIVITY MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST...BUT 
WILL KEEP THE FORECAST DRY UNTIL LATE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY...WHEN A 
WEAK UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH PUSHES A COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE FORECAST 
AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...SINCE THIS IS IN 
BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS AND THE GROUND REMAINS 
FAIRLY WET OVER THE FORECAST AREA.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT MON JUN 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE 
THROUGH TODAY...AND AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL SWING ACROSS THE AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON INTO TONIGHT.  A BAND OF CONVECTION TO OUR WEST AHEAD 
OF THE WEAK FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA MAINLY THIS 
MORNING INTO EARLY AFTERNOON.  MAY BE A BREAK BEFORE ADDITIONAL 
CONVECTION FIRES AS THE UPPER TROUGH MOVES IN.  LOOKS LIKE ENOUGH 
SUNSHINE WILL BE AROUND BEHIND INITIAL CONVECTION TO ALLOW DECENT 
DESTABILIZATION...AND WITH COOLING ALOFT WITH THE TROUGH THERE MAY 
BE SOME STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS THIS AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING WITH 
HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS THE PRIMARY THREATS.  WITH HIGH PW VALUES 
THIS MORNING AND GROUND ALREADY ON THE WET SIDE IN SOME 
AREAS...LOCALIZED FLOODING ALSO POSSIBLE. THREAT DOES NOT APPEAR TO 
BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH FOR ANY FLOOD WATCH AT THIS POINT.  WILL 
MENTION LOCALIZED FLOOD THREAT AND SEVERE THREAT IN HWO.  MAV TEMPS 
LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH WILL 
BE MOVING AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON TUESDAY ALLOWING 
FOR A PERIOD OF RISING HEIGHTS ALONG WITH SOME DRYING. A MASSIVE 
UPPER LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRY TO EXTEND EAST FROM THE 
PLAINS ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION DURING THE LONG 
TERM PERIOD BUT WILL BE SUPPRESSED TO SOME DEGREE AS SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY RIDES OVER THE TOP OF THE RIDGE. THE MODELS GENERATE THE 
THUNDERSTORM COMPLEXES WELL NORTHWEST OF THE REGION AND SHIP THEM 
ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN THE PREVAILING 
NORTHWEST FLOW ON THE EDGE OF THE RIDGE. MODEL SOLUTIONS CONTINUE TO 
HINT AT THE POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION ON WEDNESDAY WITH ONE OF THESE 
SYSTEMS SO APPLIED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP HERE. IT LOOKS LIKE A BETTER 
CHANCE FOR MORE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION WILL OCCUR THURSDAY INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT WITH A MORE WELL DEVELOPED SYSTEM WHICH THE MODELS 
HAVE BEEN KEYING ON FOR THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS. AFTER THE PASSAGE OF 
THIS SHORT WAVE AND COOL FRONT THE MID AMERICA UPPER LEVEL RIDGE MAY 
BE ABLE TO MAKE INROADS INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. ALLOWING FOR A 
DRY AND WARM END TO THE WEEK. THE PRECIP FREE WEEKEND MAY BE 
INTERRUPTED BY YET ANOTHER MCS WHICH THE MODELS TRY TO BRING ACROSS 
THE MIDWEST AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY. FORECAST CONFIDENCE 
AT THIS REMOTE PERIOD IS RATHER LOW SO JUST USED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
FOR CONVECTION AT THIS TIME. TEMPERATURE FORECAST IS INTERESTING 
WITH THE GUIDANCE REALLY GOING THERMONUCLEAR WITH MAXIMUMS ON 
WEDNESDAY. WENT MUCH CLOSER TO THE COOLER MET MOS TEMPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY WHILE TRENDING CLOSE TO THE REMAINING MEX GUIDANCE 
SUGGESTIONS FOR MAXES. MIN TEMP GUIDANCE LOOKED REASONABLE IF NOT A 
COUPLE DEGREES TOO COOL IN SPOTS WITH THE BUILDING UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
AND THE APPROACHING SOLSTICE SO WARMED UP THE MINS JUST A TAD.

&&

TO MVFR WITH SOME OF THE MORNING CONVECTION...OTHERWISE WILL KEEP
THINGS VFR FOR NOW. HOWEVER...LOWER CONDITIONS CERTAINLY POSSIBLE.

HOWEVER MOST LOCATIONS WILL HAVE EXCELLENT CHANCES OF GETTING

HOWEVER THERE IS A CHANCE OF A FEW LOCATIONS GETTING MORE RAIN THAN
NEEDED.

TO LESSEN THROUGH THE DAY TOMORROW.

565 
FXUS64 KMRX 091817
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
217 PM EDT SUN JUN 9 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)... A SOUPY AIR MASS
WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA THROUGH TONIGHT AS A DEEP FLOW OF GULF
MOISTURE PERSISTS AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING TROUGH OVER THE MIDWEST.
TONIGHT...LIFT WILL BE PROVIDED BY LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE AND
FRONTOGENESIS. WITH WARM CLOUD LAYER DEPTH OF 3500-4000M AND PW
VALUES IN THE 1.75 TO 2 INCH RANGE...WHICH IS WELL ABOVE CLIMO
NORMALS...FLOODING IS A CONCERN ESPECIALLY IN SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF
THE AREA. WITH THE HIGH FREEZING LEVEL...HAIL IS NOT TOO MUCH OF A
CONCERN...AND SO FAR THERE HAS BEEN VERY LITTLE LIGHTNING SEEN WITH
THE CURRENT SHOWER ACTIVITY. SOME WIND GUSTS MAY OCCUR WITH THE
STRONGEST STORMS. POPS WILL BE CATEGORICAL OVERNIGHT...WITH A
MENTION OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN SOUTH AND WEST.

THE CLOSED UPPER LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE OH VALLEY TOMORROW...WITH A 
VORT MAX TRAILING ACROSS OUR AREA. DIVERGENCE WITH AN UPPER JET 
STREAK WILL ALSO HELP PROVIDE SOME LIFT...AND CAPE WILL BE IN THE 
1000-1500 J/KG RANGE. WE MAY GET SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS IN THE 
AFTERNOON TO HELP DESTABILIZATION...SO SEVERE POTENTIAL LOOKS A 
LITTLE BETTER THAN TODAY. WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON. WITH THE TROUGH AXIS PASSING THROUGH...DRY AIR ALOFT WILL 
BE BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST...AND POPS WILL BE DECREASING
OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS MAINLY IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS EXPECTED TUESDAY MORNING AS THE LOW MOVES NORTH 
INTO CANADA. MOISTURE WITH THIS LOW WILL PROGRESS NORTH...LEAVING 
THE AREA WITH CLEARING SKIES AND WARMING TEMPS. HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE MID WEST WILL SLOWLY WORK ITS WAY INTO THE AREA BEGINNING 
TUESDAY. KEPT TEMPS WELL BELOW GUIDANCE TUESDAY AND WED. MID AND 
HIGH CLOUDS WILL REMAIN THROUGH WEDNESDAY PREVENTING SIGNIFICANT HEATING 
THROUGH THE DAY. 

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT A SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE AROUND 
THE HIGH...BRINGING THE POSSIBILITY OF RAIN TO NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. MODELS HAVE BEEN DISAGREEING ON THIS 
TIMING...SO CONFIDENCE LOW. CONFIDENCE DOES INCREASE FOR THURSDAY AS 
THE SHORTWAVE INCREASES RAIN CHANCES ACROSS THE REST OF THE AREA 
THROUGH THE DAY. DUE TO UPPER LEVEL FORCING AND THE CAPE 
AVAILABLE...HAVE INCLUDED THUNDER IN THE FORECAST. SOUNDING DOES NOT 
LOOK TOO IMPRESSIVE FOR STRONG DEVELOPMENT AND SHEAR IS VERY MINIMAL 
THROUGH THE DAY...SO DONT EXPECT ANYTHING SEVERE AT THIS POINT. RAINFALL 
WILL MOVE OUT OF THE REGION OVERNIGHT THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY AS THE 
HIGH PRESSURE PROGRESSES FURTHER EAST OVER THE REGION. FRIDAY INTO 
THE WEEKEND WILL REMAIN DRY...WITH GRADUAL WARMING TEMPS EACH DAY.

FLOODING.
