976 
FXUS64 KMRX 090749
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 AM EDT SUN JUN 9 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WARM FRONT ACROSS THE GULF
COAST STATES WILL LIFT NORTH TODAY WITH INCREASING GULF MOISTURE
OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY. AN UPPER
TROUGH OVER THE MID-WEST WILL MOVE EAST SOUTHEAST INTO THE LOWER
OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT AND MONDAY. MODELS SHOW THE TENNESSEE VALLEY A
COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT/MONDAY MORNING.
WIDESPREAD CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF
THE AREA TODAY AND AREA-WIDE OVERNIGHT. STRONG ACTIVITY WILL BE
ACROSS THE PLATEAU INTO SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. 

GIVEN PWS NEAR THE 2 STANDARD DEVIATIONS ABOVE NORMAL..MODELS
SHOWING HIGH PRECIPITATION POTENTIAL PLACEMENT OVER THE WESTERN
TWO-THIRDS OF THE FOREACST AREA LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT...HAVE
INCLUDED LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL POSSIBLE. LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING
IS A CONCERN FOR THE PLATEAU INTO SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE.

ISOLATED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS ARE POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING...
BUT THE MAIN CONCERN IS FLOODING.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS BASICALLY AGREE ON THE 
LONG TERM SCENARIO WHICH BEGINS WITH AN AMPLIFIED LONG WAVE TROUGH 
AND ITS ASSOCIATED SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES ROTATING THROUGH THE 
MAIN CIRCULATION. STARTED OFF MONDAY MORNING WITH SOME LIKELY 
PROBABILITIES WITH A SYNOPTIC COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY MAKING ITS WAY 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. TRIED TO APPLY SOME HIGHER 
TIME RESOLUTION TO POPS WITH A GENERAL DECREASE THROUGH THE MORNING 
AS MODELS AGREE AXIS OF DEEPEST MOISTURE AND LIFT PUSH EAST INTO THE 
CAROLINAS. HOWEVER...ADJUSTED THE CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM BACK UP IN THE GRIDS LATER IN THE AFTERNOON AND THROUGH 
MONDAY NIGHT WHEN A FINAL SHORT WAVE DRIVES EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. NOT MUCH CHANCE FOR CONVECTION EXPECTED BEHIND THE MAJOR LONG 
WAVE TROUGH ON TUESDAY BUT HELD ONTO A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IF THE 
TRAILING DISTURBANCE IS A LITTLE SLOW TO DEPART. WAS ABLE TO 
MAINTAIN THE DRY PERIOD TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH SOME 
RIDGING AND DRIER WESTERLY FLOW BETWEEN SYSTEMS. MODEL AGREEMENT 
STILL NOTED LATER WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY WITH ANOTHER 
RELATIVELY SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL 
SYSTEM. WENT AHEAD AND TWEAKED POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
FOR THIS SYSTEM TO GOOD CHANCE ON THURSDAY DUE TO CONVERGENCE OF 
MODEL OPINION. HELD ONTO JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION 
NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY FOR THE SMALL 
CHANCE THAT CONVECTION MAY DROP ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS IN 
THE NORTHWEST FLOW BEHIND THE DEPARTED UPPER TROUGH. HOWEVER MODELS 
CONTINUE TO BUILD A MASSIVE UPPER RIDGE FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE 
EASTERN STATES AT THE END OF THE LONG TERM FORECAST. THIS SCENARIO 
WOULD LEAD TO A VERY WARM AND DRY END TO THE WEEK. TRENDED 
TEMPERATURE FORECAST CLOSE TO BUT NOT QUITE A WARM AS MOS MAXES 
WHILE STAYING FAIRLY CLOSE TO MINS.  

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 PM EDT SAT JUN 8 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
CU IS TRYING TO DEVELOP INTO SHOWERS...BUT A STABLE MID LAYER IS 
PREVENTING MUCH VERTICAL DEVELOPMENT. THERE COULD BE AN ISOLATED 
SHOWER TO TWO THROUGH THE REST OF THE AFTERNOON...WHICH CAN BE 
HANDLED WITH NOWCASTS RATHER THAN ADDING POPS FOR THE EVENING GRIDS.

THE AFTERNOON CU FIELD SHOULD DISSIPATE WITH SUNSET...LEAVING MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES. SOME PATCHY FOG MAY DEVELOP...ESPECIALLY NEAR BODIES OF 
WATER. LATER TONIGHT...A VORT MAX NOW OVER LA WILL TRACK NE. THIS 
WILL BRING CLOUDS TO SOUTHERN AREAS AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH RAIN 
CHANCES SPREADING NORTHWARD TOWARD SUNRISE. A DEEP SOUTHERLY 
MOISTURE FEED AND A JET STREAK OVER MIDDLE TN WILL KEEP POPS GOING 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY. LIFT APPEARS WEAK BUT IT WILL NOT TAKE MUCH TO 
PRODUCE SHOWERS IN THE MOIST AND WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS. POPS WILL 
RANGE FROM HIGH CHANCE NORTH TO LIKELY CENTRAL AND SOUTH. WENT ON 
THE COOL SIDE FOR MOS GUIDANCE FOR HIGH TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
EASTERN PLAINS TROUGH WILL BE TRANSLATING ACROSS THE MS AND OHIO 
RIVER VALLEYS THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. ABUNDANT MOISTURE AHEAD OF THIS 
TROUGH WILL ALLOW SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. ONCE THE THE TROUGH SWINGS EAST OF THE AREA...STABLE 
AIR WILL FOLLOW IN ITS WAKE ALONG WITH DECREASING RAIN CHANCES ON 
MONDAY NIGHT. TRIED TO ILLUSTRATE IN GRIDS THAT RAIN WILL GRADUALLY 
BE COMING TO AN END OVERNIGHT MONDAY INTO TUESDAY MORNING. AN 
ISOLATED STORM MAY POP UP TUESDAY AFTERNOON OR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON 
BUT MOST LOCATIONS WILL REMAIN DRY. MODELS CONTINUE TO BRING A 
SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY. EXPECT CONDITIONS TO BECOME DRY BY THE END OF NEXT WEEK 
AND INTO THE WEEKEND.

FXUS64 KMRX 080744

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EDT SAT JUN 8 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...EARLY THIS MORNING...AREA
OBSERVATION AND WEB-CAMS SHOW AREAS OF DENSE FOG ACROSS SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. AS UPPER TROUGH
LIFTS NORTHEAST..PER WATER VAPOR..CLOUD COVER IS CLEARING ALLOWING
RADIATIONAL FOG/LOW CLOUDS TO DEVELOP. HAVE ISSUED A DENSE FOG
ADVISORY FOR THESE AREAS UNTIL MID-MORNING.

UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED DIVERGENCE ALOFT/FRONTALGENETIC FORCING
CONTINUES TO PRODUCE AN AREA OF SHOWERS OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. SOME OF RAIN IS LOCALLY HEAVY. UPPER TROUGH IS
MOVING NORTHEAST FAIRLY QUICKLY SO THE COVERAGE AND INTENSITY WILL
DIMINISH THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING. MODELS SHOW ENOUGH INSTABILITY
REMAINING OVER THE NORTHEAST SECTIONS AND MOUNTAINS TO WARRANT A
SLIGHT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON/EVENING CONVECTION.

CLOUD COVER AND FOG WILL DISSIPATE BY EARLY AFTERNOON GIVING WAY TO
PARTLY CLOUDY SKY AND WARM TEMPERATURES. FOR TONIGHT...ANOTHER
ROUND OF PATCHY FOG ANTICIPATED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...LOOKS LIKE ACTIVE WEATHER TO 
START THIS PERIOD WITH A LONG WAVE TROUGH AMPLIFYING SUNDAY INTO 
MONDAY AS IT SHIFTS SOUTHEAST FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE 
APPALACHIANS. MOISTURE LADEN ATMOSPHERE WILL BE BUOYANT FOR 
CONVECTION WITH ENHANCEMENTS FROM SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES. 
STAYED WITH THE LIKELY PROBABILITY LATER SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY 
FOR THE CONVECTIVE EVENT AND THEN DROP POPS BACK FROM CHANCE MONDAY 
NIGHT TO SLIGHT CHANCE ON TUESDAY AS THE ATMOSPHERE DRIES OUT AND 
STABILIZES WITH A PERIOD OF RISING HEIGHTS. MODELS GENERALLY IN 
AGREEMENT WITH ARRIVAL OF NEXT UPPER TROUGH LATER WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
INTO THURSDAY SO BUMPED UP POP TO MEDIUM CHANCE CATEGORY FOR 
CONVECTION WITH THIS SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE WAVE. MODELS TRY 
TO DRY OUT THE REGION AGAIN FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY WITH A BIG RIDGE 
EDGING INTO THE EASTERN U.S. BROAD BRUSHED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR 
EASTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY FOR THE SMALL 
POSSIBILITY OF A TRAILING IMPULSE DROPPING INTO THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS IN THE PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW. CONCERNING 
TEMPERATURES TRIED TO BACK OFF A FEW DEGREES OFF MAXES DURING ACTIVE 
CONVECTIVE PERIODS AND SLOWED DOWN THE INTENSE WARMING TREND 
DEPICTED IN THE MOS FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.    

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             84  65  85  67  82 /  10  10  50  60  60

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT FRI JUN 7 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL BE MOVING ACROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING. 
SHOWERS ARE NOW DEVELOPING IN MIDDLE TN...AND THIS TREND WILL 
CONTINUE EASTWARD THROUGH MIDNIGHT. WILL HAVE CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS 
UNTIL THEN. THE VORT MAX LIFTS NE OF THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT...WHICH 
SHOULD END MOST POPS IN THE AREA. SATURDAY LOOKS DRIER AND MORE 
STABLE THAN THE PAST FEW DAYS...WITH PW VALUES IN THE MODELS FALLING 
TO AROUND 1 INCH AND MIDLEVEL TEMPS WARMING. THIS STABILIZATION 
ALONG WITH RISING HEIGHTS ALOFT SHOULD PREVENT CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT SATURDAY. WILL REMOVE ALL POPS FROM THE FORECAST. AFTER 
A CLOUD START TO THE DAY...THERE SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES IN THE 
AFTERNOON WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER TO MID 80S IN MOST SPOTS. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
AT THE BEGINNING OF THIS PERIOD THE AREA WILL BE UNDER RATHER STABLE 
AIR AHEAD OF A SHORTWAVE OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. BY SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON THE MODELS HINT ONCE AGAIN AT DESTABILIZATION AND 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE. THE UPPER 
TROUGH WILL WOBBLE OVER THE NORTHERN MS VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT WHICH 
WILL INCREASE OUR RAIN CHANCES. AS THE UPPER LOW TRACKS OVER THE 
GREAT LAKES MONDAY NIGHT OUR BEST CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
OCCUR ALONG A TRAILING COLD FRONT. CONFIDENCE IS ABOVE AVERAGE AS 
ALL MODELS ARE IN AGREEMENT WITH TIMING AND INTENSITY. AS SUCH HAVE 
GONE WITH LIKELY POPS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY MONDAY NIGHT. 

STABLE AIR SHOULD FILL IN BEHIND THE FRONT TUESDAY AND SLIGHT 
CHANCES OF RAIN PERSIST THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF NEXT WEEK AS WAVES 
IN THE NW FLOW...DEPENDING ON WHERE THEY TRACK COULD BRING US 
ADDITIONAL QPF BY LATE NEXT WEEK. CONFIDENCE OF PRECIP CHANCES AFTER 
TUESDAY IS LOW.

543 
FXUS64 KMRX 070753
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 AM EDT FRI JUN 7 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...REMAINS OF TROPICAL STORM
ANDREA WILL MOVE WELL EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA..HOWEVER..A
DEFORMATION ZONE WILL BE OVER THE FAR NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING PRODUCING A BAND OF RAIN. AN UPPER
TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON AND
EVENING. MODELS SHOW A JET OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WITH DIVERGENCE
ALOFT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. GIVEN THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE
AND MARGINAL INSTABILITY...EXPECT WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. MAIN CONCERN WILL
BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL.

AFTER SUNSET..LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING AND WAVE MOVING EAST OF THE
AREA WILL ALLOW CONVECTION WILL DIMINISH THIS EVENING. MODELS SHOW
CLOUD COVER DECREASING AS WELL...BUT WET GROUND..CLEARING SKY AND
LIGHT/CALM WINDS WILL SET THE STAGE FOR AREAS OF FOG...SOME LOCALLY
DENSE FOR TONIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...START OUT THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD WITH JUST A SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION FOR 
EASTERN AREAS AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY IS GRADUALLY LIFTING OUT FROM THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. USED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR AN 
ISOLATED SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ON SUNDAY WITH ENOUGH INSTABILITY 
PRESENT FOR DEVELOPMENT. MODELS CONTINUE TO TIME NEXT SIGNIFICANT 
SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM INTO THE REGION ON MONDAY 
SO KEPT A HIGH CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THIS 
PERIOD OF THE FORECAST TAPERING OFF TO A LOWER CHANCE RANGE MONDAY 
NIGHT AS COOL FRONT WORKS ITS WAY THROUGH THE AREA. NOT MUCH TO 
TRIGGER A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM ON TUESDAY WITH DRY ADVECTION AND 
STABLE AIR BUILDING IN WITH RISING HEIGHTS SO LOWERED POP TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE HERE. THIS MAY BE ABLE TO BE TWEAKED BACK FURTHER IN LATER 
FORECASTS! AGAIN WEDNESDAY DOES NOT LOOK TOO THREATENING FOR 
CONVECTION AS THE REGION REMAINS GENERALLY IN BETWEEN MORE 
SIGNIFICANT WAVES BUT DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AT LONGER TIME RANGES IN 
THE CONVECTIVE SEASON KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN PLACE. NOTED SOME 
CONVERGENCE OF SOLUTIONS IN THE MODELS FOR THURSDAY WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF THE ARRIVAL OF ANOTHER SHORT WAVE SYSTEM WITH FRONTAL 
SYSTEM. INDICATING A SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCE FOR CONVECTION AT THIS 
REMOTE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST...WENT WITH A LITTLE HIGHER POP AT 
THIS TIME. TRIED TO STAY AROUND A BLEND OF EXTENDED RANGE MOS 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

382 
FXUS64 KMRX 061839
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 PM EDT THU JUN 6 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
A MOIST AIR MASS WILL BE IN PLACE OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE 
PERIOD...WITH LITTLE IN THE WAY OF FORCING MECHANISMS FOR ORGANIZED 
LIFT. THIS MAKES FOR A LOW CONFIDENCE FORECAST. SOME SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND NOW DEVELOPING IN A WEAKLY UNSTABLE ENVIRONMENT. 
COVERAGE AND INTENSITY WILL BE MUCH LESS THAN YESTERDAY THROUGH THE 
EVENING. EXPECT THAT WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING...COVERAGE 
WILL DECREASE...BUT LOW CHANCE POPS WILL BE MAINTAINED OVERNIGHT AS 
ANY LINGERING BOUNDARIES MAY HELP SPARK SOME SHOWERS. WE WILL BE 
BETWEEN TS ANDREA TO THE EAST AND A BROAD TROUGH TO THE WEST 
TOMORROW. TIMING AND LOCATION OF THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES ARE 
DIFFICULT TO PIN DOWN...AND THE MODELS ARE IN POOR AGREEMENT. WILL 
FOLLOW PERSISTENCE AND HAVE CHANCE POPS IN THE MORNING WITH LIKELY 
POPS IN THE AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...
WHAT IS LEFT OF TROPICAL STORM ANDREA WILL BE TRACKING ACROSS
EASTERN VIRGINIA BY EARLY FRIDAY NIGHT. THE NEXT SYSTEM TO AFFECT
OUR AREA WILL BE WHAT IS EMBEDDED IN THE CLOUD MASS OVER EASTERN TX
AND AR. THIS SYSTEM WILL BRING THE BEST CHANCES OF RAIN OVER THE
WEEKEND PARTICULARLY FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS OF
TN. BY SATURDAY MORE STABLE AIR MOVES INTO THE REGION LIMITING
SHOWER DEVELOPMENT. HOWEVER BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON A FEW ISOLATED
THUNDERSTORMS COULD DEVELOP DURING THE AFTERNOON AS TEMPERATURES
WARM INTO THE MID 80S AND INSTABILITY INCREASES. ANOTHER TROUGH
TRANSLATES THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES REGION MONDAY DRAGGING A WEAK
FRONT ACROSS THE AREA. THE ECMWF AND THE GFS ARE SIMILAR IN THEIR
HANDLING OF THE UPPER TROUGH AND SURFACE FEATURES FOR THIS TIME
PERIOD. WILL CONTINUE TO WATCH HOW THIS DEVELOPS OVER THE NEXT FEW
MODEL RUNS. AFTER MONDAY...NORTHWEST FLOW AND A DIFFUSE QUASI-
STATIONARY BOUNDARY NEAR OUR FORECAST AREA WILL BE AN AREA WHERE
MCS SYSTEMS COULD MIGRATE. THUS HAVE CONTINUED WITH LOW END RAIN
CHANCES THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  81  63  83  64 /  30  60  30  10  10

254 
FXUS64 KMRX 060737
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT THU JUN 6 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FOR NOW OUR AREA IS BETWEEN PRECIP 
AREAS...HOWEVER...NEXT SYSTEM IS ON ITS WAY...NOW ENTERING MID TN. 
RAW TIMING OF PRESENT MOVEMENT...PUTS ARRIVAL TIME TO WESTERN CWA OF 
THIS PRECIP AT MID MORNING...BUT LIFT AHEAD OF THIS AREA WILL LIKELY 
FILL IN SOMEWHAT AHEAD OF THE MAIN CONVECTION.  THINK KCHA WILL HAVE 
PRECIP IN THE VICINITY AROUND DAYBREAK...AHEAD OF MAIN AREA.  CLOUD 
TOPS HAVE RAPIDLY WARMED OVER AL/GA AS CONVECTION DOWN THERE HAS 
WEAKENED...BUT NORTHERN PART OF CLOUD SHIELD HAS SHOWN SOME COOLING 
OVER NORTHERN AL. THIS SUPPORTS THE IDEA OF SHOWERS DEVELOPING AHEAD 
OF THE MAIN CONVECTION AS MENTIONED EARLIER.  NOT EXPECTING SEVERE 
STORMS TODAY...STRUGGLING TO GET 1000 J/KG OF SKINNY CAPE ON MODEL 
SOUNDINGS AT KCHA...AND GETS MORE STABLE FARTHER NORTH.

FOR POPS...HAVE HIGH POPS TODAY...TAPERING OFF THIS EVENING...BUT 
PICKING UP AGAIN FROM THE SOUTHWEST LATE TONIGHT.  THIS ENDS UP WITH 
POPS A LITTLE LOWER THAN GUIDANCE OVERALL.  QPF LOOKING LOWER NOW 
VERSUS LAST COUPLE OF FORECASTS...PW VALUES ARE DEFINITELY LOOKING 
TO BE LOWER NOW AS THE MOISTURE AXIS REFOCUSES ON TS ANDREA.  WENT 
CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...BUT HAVE SOME DIFFERENCES WITH THE SPECIFIC DETAILS 
REGARDING CONVECTION BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
PUSH A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY...AS 
MOISTURE FROM TROPICAL STORM ANDREA MOVES NORTHEASTWARD UP THE 
EASTERN SEABOARD. WITH HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES BETWEEN 1.5 
AND 1.75 INCHES...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR 
FLOODING APPEARS POSSIBLE ON FRIDAY. SOME LINGERING WEAK INSTABILITY 
ON SATURDAY MAY RESULT IN ISOLATED CONVECTION DURING THE DAY...BUT 
OTHERWISE...THE WEEKEND LOOKS DRY UNTIL POSSIBLY SUNDAY NIGHT. 
ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION ON SUNDAY NIGHT...WHICH WILL PUSH ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO 
BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE LOWER OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS 
EARLY NEXT WEEK...AS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BECOMES PARALLEL TO THIS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. AS A RESULT...CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE EACH DAY 
EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERAL MESOSCALE 
CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES DEVELOPING OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY TO 
EVENTUALLY AFFECT PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. BOTH THE GFS AND 
ECMWF MODELS INDICATE ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES AFFECTING THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY TIME PERIOD...BUT 
BOTH MODELS HAVE DIFFERENCES IN REGARDS TO TIMING AND THE EXACT 
TRACKS OF THESE COMPLEXES. THUS...WILL NOT TRY TO TIME THESE 
SYSTEMS...BUT WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST THROUGHOUT EARLY 
NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN 
THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN 
BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   83  67  82  62  84 /  60  40  60  30  20 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     81  66  81  62  83 /  80  30  60  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN             82  65  81  62  83 /  80  30  60  30  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    80  62  78  60  80 /  90  30  70  50  30

.AVIATION...

FAIRLY CLOSE TO THE AREA IN NC...MOVING ALMOST STRAIGHT NORTH...ANY
BACKING OF THE STEERING WINDS COULD BRING THEM CLOSER...HOWEVER
MODELS AGREE ON STEERING WINDS TO UNDERGO A SUBTLE VEERING
OVERNIGHT...SO NOT PUTTING IN ADDITIONAL SHOWERS/VCSH IN EARLY
PARTS OF THE TAFS. NEXT ROUND OF ORGANIZED PRECIP SHOULD MOVE INTO
THE WESTERN PARTS OF THE AREA BY DAYBREAK AND SPREAD ACROSS THE
REST OF THE AREA OVER THE REMAINDER OF THE MORNING. ONLY WEAK TO
MODERATE LIFT WITH TODAY'S SYSTEM...BUT DEEP MOISTURE. SO MUCH LIKE
WEDNESDAY'S EVENT...THIS ONE WILL LIKELY LINGER FOR A WHILE. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 PM EDT WED JUN 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...A MOIST AIR MASS WILL BE 
BUILDING OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE SHORT TERM...WITH SEVERAL VORT 
MAXES MOVING THROUGH A BROAD TROUGH OVER THE REGION. WITH A LACK OF 
SYNOPTIC SCALE FORCING MECHANISMS...THESE DISTURBANCES WILL BE THE 
MAIN FACTORS IN INITIATING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...AND 
UNFORTUNATELY THE MODELS ARE NOT IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON THEIR TIMING. 
GENERALLY...THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES APPEAR TO BE IN SOUTHERN AND 
WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA AS THE DISTURBANCES TRACK TO THE 
NE...AND A SE 850 MB FLOW SUPPLIES LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. SCATTERED 
SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGH THE NIGHT...BUT IT APPEARS THAT 
RAIN CHANCES WILL INCREASE THURSDAY AS THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AXIS GETS 
A LITTLE CLOSER. WILL HAVE CHANCE TO LIKELY POPS IN THE 
MORNING...RISING TO LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL IN THE AFTERNOON. SEVERE 
THREAT LOOKS LOW THROUGH THE PERIOD...BUT SLOW MOVING OR TRAINING 
STORMS COULD PRODUCE SOME LOCALIZED FLOODING IN THE PLATEAU BOTH 
THIS EVENING AND TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WILL BE IN A RATHER 
UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE EXTENDED.  THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SATURDAY...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVING THROUGH THE AREA AND AN AREA OF 
LOW PRESSURE MOVING NORTHWARD JUST EAST OF THE MRX CWA WILL 
GENERATES LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS.  WILL BE BETWEEN WEATHER 
SYSTEMS ON SUNDAY.  FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...MODELS TRENDING 
TOWARDS KEEP THE STATIONARY BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH ALONG THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY.  THIS COMBINED WITH DIURNAL HEATING SHOULD PROVIDE 
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORM EACH DAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT WED JUN 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY SOUTH OF THE AREA 
RIGHT NOW WILL MOVE NORTHWARD TODAY...AND MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH THE 
AREA THIS AFTERNOON.  SINCE WARM FRONT WILL BE MOVING...DOUBT THAT 
IT WILL SERVE AS MUCH OF A FOCUS SINCE THERE IS NO LOW LEVEL JET 
ETC.  BY LATE MORNING AND INTO THE AFTERNOON...INSTABILITY WILL BE 
BUILDING...WITH MAX MLCAPE VALUES OF ABOUT 1500-2000 J/KG.  COULD 
HAVE A FEW STORMS WITH POTENTIALLY DAMAGING WINDS AS WELL AS HAIL 
NEAR SEVERE CRITERIA.  WITH WEAK SHEAR FIELD...STORMS SHOULD BE 
MULTICELL.  A SHORT WAVE WILL BE MOVING ACROSS THE AREA AS WELL AND 
MAY BE ABLE TO ORGANIZE STORMS INTO A LINE DURING THE AFTERNOON.  IN 
THE WAKE OF THIS SHORTWAVE...THERE MAY BE A LULL IN THE 
PRECIPITATION THIS EVENING...THEN THE NEXT ROUND OF SHOWERS AND 
STORMS WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA TONIGHT.  WENT PRETTY CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE TEMPS...AND A LITTLE ABOVE GUIDANCE IN GENERAL FOR POPS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...BUT HAVE SOME DIFFERENCES WITH THE SPECIFIC DETAILS. ON 
THURSDAY...AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFYING OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY 
WILL PUSH A WEAK COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA...AS TROPICAL 
MOISTURE MOVES NORTHWARD FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO. AS A RESULT... 
WIDESPREAD CONVECTION IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 1.75 
INCHES WILL LIKELY RESULT IN SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL EACH DAY... 
WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR FLOODING. SOME LINGERING INSTABILITY ON 
SATURDAY MAY RESULT IN ISOLATED CONVECTION DURING THE DAY...BUT 
OTHERWISE...THE WEEKEND LOOKS DRY UNTIL SUNDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO AMPLIFY OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION ON 
SUNDAY NIGHT...WHICH WILL PUSH ANOTHER COLD FRONT TOWARDS THE 
FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO BECOME 
QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE LOWER OHIO AND TN RIVER VALLEYS EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...AS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BECOMES PARALLEL TO THIS FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY. AS A RESULT...SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL BE POSSIBLE EACH 
DAY EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME MCS DEVELOPMENT 
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY EVENTUALLY AFFECTING PORTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...ATMOSPHERE WILL BE GRADUALLY

WAVE FEATURE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON WEDNESDAY. NOT

POPS WHICH LOOK A LITTLE HIGH. STAYED A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE COOLER 
MOS MINS WHILE TRENDING IN THE MIDDLE OF GUIDANCE MAXES FOR 
WEDNESDAY.

TROUGH CONTINUES TO BUILD THROUGH THE SOUTH...MID SOUTH AND THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY INTO THE WEEKEND. LAYER HUMIDITY INCREASES PEAKING ON 
THURSDAY WITH PWAT VALUES AROUND 1.80 ACROSS THE EAST TN VALLEY. A 
SERIES OF SHORT WAVES WILL ENHANCE LIFT THROUGH FRIDAY ACROSS THE 
AREA. UP VALLEY STORM MOTIONS COULD LEAD TO REPEAT PERIODS OF 
MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINFALL. THE LONG WAVE TROUGH AXIS MOVES INTO THE 
MID TN VALLEY ON SATURDAY. MID LEVELS DRY AS LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM....CURRENTLY OVR GLFMEX MOVES NE THROUGH THE CAROLINAS. 
PRECIPITATION COVERAGE WILL DECREASE SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY AS 
DRIER AIR BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. A WEAK 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE TO N TN BORDER EARLY NEXT WEEK. STORM 
MOTIONS TO THE SE WILL BRING BACK CHANCE OF CONVECTION FAVORING 
NORTHERN AREAS. STAYED CLOSE TO TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE UNTIL THE 
WEEKEND. OPERATIONAL GFS MAX TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE APPEARS WELL ABOVE 
WHAT IS CURRENTLY EXPECTED SO WENT A COUPLE CATEGORIES BELOW THOSE 
HIGH TEMPERATURE NUMBERS FOR THE END OF THE PERIOD. ECMWF AND GFS 
ENSEMBLES ARE IN CLOSER AGREEMENT.

891 
FXUS64 KMRX 040749
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT TUE JUN 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION. MODELS REVEAL A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT A MID 
LEVEL STABLE LAYER SHOULD KEEP ANY CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY CAPPED... 
EXCEPT POSSIBLY AROUND THE MOUNTAINS WHERE THIS CAP WILL BE WEAKER. 
THUS....WILL MENTION ISOLATED CONVECTION AROUND THE APPALACHIAN 
MOUNTAINS DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CREATE DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY 
AND TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL COMPROMISE WHERE 
SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THE INITIAL PART OF THIS 
PERIOD LOOKS QUIET WITH AN UPPER TROUGH STILL WELL TO THE WEST...BUT 
THE SURFACE RETURN FLOW HAS STARTED AND MOISTURE BEGINS TO PUSH BACK 
INTO THE AREA AGAIN.  BY THURSDAY THE WEAK UPPER TROUGH IS CLOSING 
IN ON THE AREA AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES RISE APPRECIABLY.  AT THE 
SURFACE...AN INVERTED TROUGH SWELLS INTO THE AREA...AND KEEP RAINS 
OVER US...UNTIL IT YIELDS TO THE SYSTEM APPROACHING NORTHERN FLORIDA 
FROM THE NORTHEASTERN GULF.  AS THIS SYSTEM IS LIFTING OUT...LOOKS 
LIKE IT DRAGS A TROWAL FEATURE ACROSS OUR AREA THAT WILL KEEP PRECIP 
OVER AT LEAST PARTS OF THE AREA THROUGH FRIDAY.  ALSO...PWAT VALUES 
SEASONALLY HIGH WITH THIS SYSTEM...SO WOULD EXPECT PRETTY EFFICIENT 
RAINS.  WOULD EXPECT 1-3 INCH RAINS OVER THE AREA OVER THAT 48 HOUR 
PERIOD...UNLESS THE SYSTEM TAKES A MORE WESTWARD TRACK AND WE GET 
DRY SLOTTED.  

ONCE THE SYSTEM OVER FLORIDA TAKES CONTROL...OUR WINDS SHIFT TO THE 
NORTHWEST AND START TO DRY US OUT OVER THE WEEKEND.  SO THE TIMING 
OF OUR PRECIP COULD BE DETERMINED BY THE STRENGTH OF THE SYSTEM IN 
THE GULF...IF IT GETS STRONGER FASTER IT COULD DRY US OUT MORE 
QUICKLY...WHEREAS IF THIS SYSTEM IS A LITTLE MORE SLUGGISH TO 
STRENGTHEN THEN THE INVERTED TROUGH WILL LIKELY PERSIST LONGER. 

AM LOWERING POPS FOR SATURDAY...ALL MODELS AGREE THAT DEEP MOISTURE 
HAS EXITED TO THE NORTHEAST...AND MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE MINIMAL 
INSTABILITY.  THE ONE FLY IN OINTMENT IS THAT THE CORE OF THE TROUGH 
IS RIGHT OVER THE AREA...SO THERE COULD BE ENOUGH WEAK LIFT ALONG 
WITH THE MINIMAL INSTABILITY TO GET SOME SHOWERS AND GET A FEW 
CLICKS ON THE RAIN GAGE...SO NOT DRYING OUT AREA QUITE THAT QUICKLY.

FOR TEMPS...WENT A LITTLE COOLER THAN GUIDANCE FRI-SUN WHILE THE 
TROUGH IS STILL OVER US...MODEL TEMPS SEEMED A LITTLE TOO WARM.  
THINK SOME CLOUD COVER WILL BE OVER THE AREA AS WELL THAT WILL 
SUPPRESS SURFACE HEATING.
&&

REMAIN WARMER THAN THE FORECAST LOWS.

STRENGTHENS. APPLIED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP AGAIN OVER THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND 
JUST ENOUGH OROGRAPHIC LIFT AND INSTABILITY TO POP AN ISOLATED 
SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM. STAYED NEAR THE MILDER MIN TEMP GUIDANCE 
TONIGHT UNDER THE LOWER CLOUD DECK WHILE STAYING NEAR THE MIDDLE OF 
MAV/MET NUMBERS FOR MAXES ON TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
SLIDES EAST OF THE AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD. SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN 
CLIMO WITH A BETTER THAN NORMAL CHANCE OF AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. UPPER TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE NATIONS MID 
SECTION FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK. AN INVERTED SURFACE 
TROUGH DEVELOPS THROUGH THE TN VALLEY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. LAYER 
MOISTURE INCREASES WITH ABOVE NORMAL CHANCE OF CONVECTION INTO THE 
WEEKEND. LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER GULF OF MEXICO PROGGED TO MOVE NE 
THROUGH OR NEAR THE CAROLINAS THIS WEEKEND. TRACK UNCERTAIN AND 
INFLUENCE ON MRX CWA DOWNPLAYED AT THIS TIME. WEAKENING UPPER TROUGH 
AXIS MOVES EAST INTO SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY LATE IN THE WEEKEND. 
DIURNAL AS WELL AS MCS TYPE CONVECTION POSSIBLE NEXT WEEK. ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE.

577 
FXUS64 KMRX 030729
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT MON JUN 3 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WITH A VERY 
MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE MID 60S. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION LINGERING OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WHICH SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE 
DAY AS THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY ONLY SLOWLY DRIFTS EASTWARD. CLOUDS ARE 
PROGGED TO GRADUALLY DIMINISH BY THIS EVENING...ALTHOUGH A MID LEVEL 
INVERSION TONIGHT MAY LIMIT VERTICAL MIXING AND KEEP THESE CLOUDS 
FROM DIMINISHING TOO QUICKLY. THE AMOUNT OF CLOUDS TONIGHT WILL HAVE 
LARGE INFLUENCE ON HOW MUCH FOG DEVELOPS AFTER MIDNIGHT (WITH THE 
GROUND STILL REMAINING SATURATED FROM YESTERDAY'S RAINFALL). FOR 
NOW...WILL JUST MENTION SOME PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A BRIEF PERIOD OF ZONAL FLOW/ 
WEAK UPPER-RIDGING WILL OCCUR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...RESULTING IN 
MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS. WARMER HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO 
ENSUE...WITH THE MERCURY CLIMBING INTO THE MID TO UPPER 80S IN MANY 
LOWER ELEVATION LOCATIONS. HOWEVER...WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY...AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL MOVE NORTH INTO 
ALABAMA/GEORGIA FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO AND COMBINE WITH AN 
ADVANCING UPPER-TROUGH MOVING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. THIS... COMBINED 
WITH A VERY MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER WILL CREATE GOOD CHANCES FOR 
THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...AND EVEN BETTER CHANCES 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AS A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE REGION... 
SERVING AS A FOCUS FOR THESE SHOWERS AND STORMS. AS A RESULT...HAVE 
INCREASED POPS TO HIGH-END CHANCE THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...AND 
WENT LIKELY AREAWIDE ON FRIDAY WHEN THE FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE 
THROUGH. GIVEN THE HIGH PWAT VALUES...THE POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY 
RAINFALL AND LOCALIZED FLOODING WILL EXIST WHERE THE HEAVIEST CELLS 
DEVELOP AND TRAINING OCCURS. THEREAFTER...THINGS WILL GRADUALLY 
BEGIN TO DRY OUT HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND...BUT ADDITIONAL CHANCES 
FOR DIURNALLY DRIVEN SCATTERED STORMS WILL EXIST IN THE WARM/MOIST 
AIRMASS IN PLACE.
&&

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY),,,COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND
STORMS CONTINUES TO DECREASE OVER WRN 2/3RDS OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
HOWEVER...ALREADY SEEING ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOP
ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT MOVING INTO MIDDLE TN...WHICH
SUPPORTS CHANCE POPS OR SCATTERED WORDING THIS EVENING. I AGREE
WITH MODELS IN LIKELY POPS JUSTIFIED OVER THE ERN MOST AREAS LATER
TONIGHT...AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE VALLEY AND CONVERGENCE
INCREASES ALONG THE TN-NC LINE. BEST INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE
CONVERGENCE AT MID TO LATE AFTERNOON IS OVER NE GA AND NW SC...
AND THESE STORMS HAVE FLARED UP IN INTENSITY. HOWEVER...THINK WE
WILL SEE AT BEST JUST A FEW STRONG STORMS OVER OUR FORECAST AREA
INTO THE EVENING. 

FOR MONDAY...FRONTAL BOUNDARY APPEARS TO BE HUNG UP ACROSS TN-NC
LINE MONDAY MORNING. THUS...I STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS POP AND
WEATHER GRIDS...WITH DRY CONDITIONS RETURNING BY MONDAY AFTERNOON.
DRY AND COOLER MONDAY NIGHT...FOLLOWED BY RIDGING AND MOSTLY DRY
WEATHER TUESDAY. ONLY CHANGE WAS TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR
TUESDAY AFTERNOON IN THE SMOKIES AND NRN MTNS. 

GENERALLY FOLLOWED SIMILAR MOS TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD...EXCEPT
FOR CLOSER TO THE MOS BLEND ON HIGHS TUESDAY WHEN GFS LOOKED A BIT
WARM. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...CONTINUED TO BASIC IDEA 
OF THE PREVIOUS FORECAST WITH ATMOSPHERE GRADUALLY MOISTENING AND 
DESTABILIZING MID WEEK AHEAD OF WEAK LONG WAVE TROUGH AND SYNOPTIC 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. SLIGHT OR NO CHANCE POPS STILL LOOK GOOD FOR 
WEDNESDAY INCREASING FROM MEDIUM CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ON THURSDAY 
TO HIGH CHANCE POPS WITH THE BOUNDARY EDGING SLOWLY INTO THE REGION 
BY FRIDAY. MODELS SHOWING SUB TROPICAL LOW PRESSURE CENTER BUILDING 
NORTHEAST ALONG THE EAST COAST INTO THE WEEKEND AND THIS MAY 
INITIALLY SLOW THE BOUNDARY'S PROGRESS...KEEPING A CHANCE FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN PLACE FOR SATURDAY. WOULD EXPECT 
PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION TO BE SOMEWHAT LOWER BY SUNDAY AS THE 
TROPICAL FEATURE AND FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVE FURTHER AWAY FROM THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.DISCUSSION...CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION CONTINUES TO EXPAND THIS 
MORNING...AND NOW COVERS NEARLY ALL OF E TN AND SW VA. INTENSITY HAS 
BEEN INCREASING OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WHERE MOST OF THE 
LIGHTNING STRIKES WERE NOTED. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH...AIDED BY RIGHT 
REAR QUAD OF ASSOCIATED UPPER JET...PLUS ANY DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD 
KEEP RAIN CHANCES VERY HIGH TODAY. HOWEVER...THIS MORNING CONVECTION 
WILL LIKELY SERIOUSLY INHIBIT THE POSSIBILITY OF ANY SEVERE STORMS.
A MODIFIED 12Z OHX SOUNDING FOR HIGHS IN THE LOWER 80S YIELDED A 
POSITIVE CAPE OF JUST NEAR 500 J/KG. THE FREEZING AND WET BULB ZERO 
HEIGHTS REMAIN HIGH...SO THE THREAT OF LARGE HAIL IS QUITE LOW.

A BREAK IN THE SHOWERS AND STORMS IS POSSIBLE ON THE BACK SIDE OF 
THE UPPER TROUGH...BEFORE ADDITIONAL CONVECTION FORMS ON THE 
TRAILING COLD FRONT THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. 

FORECAST GRIDS GENERALLY ON TRACK...BUT I PLAN TO MAKE A FEW 
ADJUSTMENTS AND UPDATE ALL AFFECTED PRODUCTS BY 11 AM EDT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT SUN JUN 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A WARM AND VERY 
MOIST AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE AND RADAR IMAGERY 
REVEAL THAT MOST OF THE CONVECTION ASSOCIATED WITH THIS COLD FRONT 
WAS LOCATED SOUTH OF THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH NOT MUCH CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY CURRENTLY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. MODELS SHOW A FAIRLY 
AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY...WHICH WILL 
HELP TO TRIGGER ADDITIONAL CONVECTION OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS 
MORNING AS IT SLOWLY DRIFTS EASTWARD TODAY. MODELS INDICATE A 
MARGINALLY TO POTENTIALLY MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. ALSO...THE AIR 
MASS WILL BE VERY MOIST WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES BETWEEN 1.5 
AND 1.75 INCHES. THUS...WILL CONTINUE WITH HIGH POPS IN THE FORECAST 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY 
OF SOME STRONG TO SEVERE TSTORMS IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK. 
AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES WITH HIGHS TODAY...DUE TO THEIR DIFFERENCES IN TIMING 
OF THE CONVECTION. WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN 
THE TWO.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL 
BE POSSIBLE /PARTICULARLY ALONG THE EASTERN HALF OF THE AREA AND 
MOUNTAINS/ MONDAY MORNING...BEFORE THE FRONT FINALLY PUSHES EAST OF 
THE REGION BY THE AFTERNOON AND THE SHOWERS BEGINS TO TAPER OFF FROM 
WEST TO EAST. A BRIEF BOUT OF UPPER-RIDGING WILL TAKE PLACE FOR 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...ALLOWING FOR WARMER TEMPERATURES AND SOME 
DRIER WEATHER FOR THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WEEK. HOWEVER... 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL QUICKLY BE ON THE RISE THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY AS THE NEXT UPPER-TROUGH SWINGS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY... 
SWEEPING A COLD FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THIS FRONT WILL SERVE 
AS A FOCUS FOR THUNDERSTORMS IN THE WARM/MODERATELY UNSTABLE 
AIRMASS. HAVE INCREASED POPS TO SOLID CHANCE FOR THIS TIME PERIOD... 
BUT OPTED TO NOT GO HIGHER THAN THAT ATTM GIVEN UNCERTAINTIES IN 
TIMING/EXACT TRACK OF THE UPPER-LOW.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 PM EDT SAT JUN 1 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...CONVECTION CONTINUES TO
FIRE ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON AND MOVE NNE AT
ABOUT 25 MPH. EXPECTING SCATTERED COVERAGE INTO THE EVENING THEN AN
INCREASE ESPECIALLY OVER WRN 1/2 OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT.
NOT SEEING EVEN STRONG CONVECTION THUS FAR...WITH LITTLE LIGHTNING
DETECTED IN OR NEAR OUR CWA. STRONGER STORMS MAY NOT ARRIVE UNTIL
AFTER SUNSET THIS EVENING...THUS THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS SEEMS LOW
OTHER THAN OUR WRN MOST PLATEAU COUNTIES.

CATEGORICAL POPS STILL JUSTIFIED SUNDAY INTO EARLY SUNDAY NIGHT AS
THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES. ONLY MINOR CHANGES WERE TO NUDGE ALL
POPS UP TO AROUND 90 PERCENT FOR SUNDAY...PLUS THE FAR EASTERN
AREAS UP TO LIKELY POPS FOR EARLY MONDAY IN LINE WITH MODEL
TRENDS ON BOTH THE 00Z AND 12Z MODEL RUNS.

FOR TEMPS...PERSISTENCE ON MINS TONIGHT WHICH IS ALSO CLOSE TO BOTH
NAM AND GFS MOS. A MOS BLEND FOR MAXES SUNDAY GIVEN THE EARLY
ONSET AND COVERAGE OF CONVECTION...THEN CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR BOTH
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...START OF THE PERIOD 
STILL LOOKS DECENT AS WEEKEND UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO MOVE AWAY 
WITH DRIER WESTERLY FLOW AND BUILDING HEIGHTS FILLING IN BEHIND THE 
DEPARTING SYSTEM. CONTINUED THE TREND OF VERY GRADUALLY INCREASING 
POPS WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY WITH POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED TO WIDELY 
SCATTERED CONVECTION MAINLY ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES WHILE 
BROAD BRUSHING A MEDIUM CHANCE POP THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY AS A 
WEAKENING GREAT LAKES UPPER TROUGH PULLS A COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. INCREASING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
AND INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE SHOULD LEAD TO SLIGHTLY HIGHER 
PROBABILITIES FOR A SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM HEADING INTO FRIDAY WITH 
PERHAPS A CONTINUATION OF MEDIUM CHANCE POPS AS THE BOUNDARY SLOWS 
DOWN OR STALLS IN THE AREA. APPLIED A BLENDED ECM/MEX MOS APPROACH 
WITH MAX AND MIN TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

553 
FXUS64 KMRX 010749
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT SAT JUN 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
BERMUDA HIGH CENTERED OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC...WHICH WAS BRINGING 
A WARM AND MOIST SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
SATELLITE AND RADAR IMAGERY REVEALS A SOLID LINE OF CONVECTION OVER 
THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND OZARKS REGION CLOSER TO A COLD 
FRONT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A DEEPER LAYER OF MOISTURE OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS PROGGED TO 
DEVELOP AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON. THUS...IT APPEARS THE CHANCES FOR 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT WILL BE A LITTLE BETTER THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING COMPARED TO YESTERDAY. THESE MODEL SOUNDINGS ALSO CONTINUE 
TO INDICATE A VERTICAL MOISTURE PROFILE SUPPORTIVE OF DOWNBURSTS... 
WITH A DECENT MID-LEVEL DRY LAYER AND AN INVERTED-V PROFILE IN THE 
LOWER LEVELS. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION IN THE HAZARDOUS 
WEATHER OUTLOOK THE POSSIBILITY OF STRONG DAMAGING WINDS WITH ANY 
CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. EXTENSIVE CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT IS EXPECTED OVER THE LOWER OHIO AND LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEYS ALONG THE COLD FRONT THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH THE 
RESULTING PRE-FRONTAL SQUALL LINE POSSIBLY RACING EASTWARD TONIGHT 
OUT OF AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT. WHILE THIS SQUALL LINE IS EXPECTED 
TO WEAKEN AS IT APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT... 
INSTABILITY AND SHEAR PARAMETERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA ARE STILL 
SUPPORTIVE OF SOME STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS DURING THE EARLY MORNING 
HOURS. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH A PERSISTENCE FORECAST FOR 
HIGHS TODAY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER MINS FOR TONIGHT DUE TO THE EXPECTED 
HIGHER DEWPOINTS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL GRADUALLY 
TRACK INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY FROM MIDDLE TENNESSEE... 
SERVING AS A FOCUS FOR NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS... 
PARTICULARLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. THE FRONT WILL 
BE SLOW TO CLEAR THE REGION...SO SOME EXCELLENT CHANCES FOR 
PRECIPITATION WILL EXIST SUNDAY NIGHT AND INTO THE DAY ON MONDAY 
/ESPECIALLY ALONG THE EAST TENNESSEE MTNS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/. 
THE BEST LIFT/JET DYNAMICS WILL BE DISPLACED TO THE NORTH OF THE 
REGION...BUT GIVEN THE SOME MODERATE INSTABILITY PARAMETERS IN PLACE 
SOME STRONG TO SEVERE CLUSTERS OF STORMS SEEM PLAUSIBLE IN THIS 
WARM/VERY MOIST AIRMASS...WITH STRAIGHT-LINE DAMAGING WINDS AND 
PERHAPS SOME LOW-END SEVERE HAIL BEING THREATS. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE 
VERY HIGH PWATS VALUES RUNNING AT 1.5 TO 1.8 INCHES...A SLOW MOVING 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND THE MEAN FLOW MOVING PARALLEL TO THIS FRONT... 
THINK THAT THE POTENTIAL LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL UNDER THE HEAVIEST 
CELLS IS ALSO LIKELY...WITH LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING AND FLOODING A 
DISTINCT POSSIBILITY IN FLOOD PRONE AREAS IN LOCATIONS WHERE 
TRAINING OCCURS. 

GIVEN BETTER CONFIDENCE IN PRECIPITATION FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO CATEGORICAL AREAWIDE...BEFORE 
TAPERING THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST SLOWLY LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY AS BOTH THE NAM AND GFS HAVE SLOWED DOWN THE MOVEMENT OF THE 
FRONT AND SHOW DECENT CHANCES FOR SCATTERED TO PERHAPS WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS/STORMS INTO MONDAY. THEREAFTER...THINGS WILL FINALLY DRY OUT 
BY MONDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT EXITS AND A ZONAL FLOW ALOFT PREVAILS 
UNTIL THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. A GRADUAL WARM UP BACK INTO THE 80S 
WILL OCCUR WITH PARTLY TO MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS BEFORE CLOUDS AND 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES INCREASE ONCE AGAIN BY FRIDAY AS ANOTHER STORM 
SYSTEM TRACKS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY/GREAT LAKES. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 311904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EDT FRI MAY 31 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MOST CONVECTION THIS 
AFTERNOON IS MOVING NE THROUGH CENTRAL KY ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE VORTMAX. SPOTTY SHOWERS OR TSRA ARE STILL NOTED 
OVER MIDDLE TN AND NOW DEVELOPING AS WELL OVER NRN AL. NO ORGANIZED 
MOISTURE CONVERGENCE NOTED OVER GENERALLY ANY PARTS OF OUR FORECAST 
AREA THUS FAR...AND WITH INSTABILITY VERY SIMILAR TO PAST FEW DAYS.
WILL CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR FAR WRN AREAS AND JUST SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS ELSEWHERE THROUGH THIS EVENING. EXPECT CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS 
EARLY THEN AN INCREASE IN LOW CLOUDINESS FOR SE TN AND SW NC AREAS 
OVERNIGHT. 

FOR LATER PERIODS...ONLY MADE VERY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO GRIDS AS 
RAIN CHANCES INCREASE THIS WEEKEND...ESPECIALLY LATE SATURDAY NIGHT 
INTO SUNDAY. WENT CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS MINS AND A FEW DEGREES BELOW 
GFS MOS MAXES DUE TO HIGHER RAIN CHANCES.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...LONG WAVE TROUGH AND 
SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM WORK THROUGH THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY KEEPING A HIGH LIKELIHOOD OF SHOWERS GOING OVERNIGHT. MODELS 
STILL INDICATE SURFACE WAVE ALONG FRONT ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES 
MAY SLOW THE SYSTEM DOWN TO SOME DEGREE REQUIRING THE USE OF A 
MEDIUM THROUGH VERY LOW CHANCE POP GRADIENT FOR SHOWERS FROM EAST TO 
WEST MAINLY MONDAY MORNING. 12Z MODELS GENERALLY AGREE LATER WORK 
WEEK UPPER TROUGH NOT QUITE AS AMPLIFIED AS IT PASSES NORTHEAST 
THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES WITH MORE RIDGING INDICATED ACROSS MUCH OF 
THE SOUTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. 
MODELS TRY TO SHOW A SUBTROPICAL LOW OVER THE GULF WITH WESTERN 
ATLANTIC RIDGING WHICH WOULD GENERATE A BROAD EASTERLY FLOW ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA WHICH WOULD NOT BE CONDUCIVE TO ANY WIDESPREAD 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT IN THE REGION. THEREFORE...KEPT GENERALLY 
DRY PATTERN GOING MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH A COUPLE 
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE ON THE HIGHER TERRAIN ON WEDNESDAY AND THEN 
ADDING SLIGHT AND SMALL CHANCE POPS FOR CONVECTION THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY AS ATMOSPHERE ONLY SLOWLY MOISTENS AND DESTABILIZES. USED 
BLENDED MEX/ECM MOS GUIDANCE FOR THE LONG TERM.  


&&

247 
FXUS64 KMRX 310719
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT FRI MAY 31 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
BERMUDA HIGH OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC...WHICH WAS BRINGING A 
SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW AND AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON...ALTHOUGH MOISTURE 
WILL BE FAIRLY SHALLOW AROUND 800 MB. HOWEVER...MODELS KEEP HINTING 
AT SOME CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON...LIKELY DUE TO THE INFLUENCE OF AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM 
WEAKENING CONVECTION OVER THE WESTERN TN RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING. 
WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL MENTION ISOLATED CONVECTION AREAWIDE THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS ALSO INDICATE A VERTICAL MOISTURE PROFILE SUPPORTIVE 
OF DOWNBURSTS...WITH A DECENT MID-LEVEL DRY LAYER AND AN INVERTED-V 
PROFILE IN THE LOWER LEVELS. THUS...IT APPEARS THERE WILL BE A GOOD 
CHANCE FOR STRONG DAMAGING WINDS WITH ANY CONVECTION THAT MANAGES TO 
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. AS FOR TEMPS...NAM AND GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND 
ARE ESSENTIALLY A PERSISTENCE FORECAST.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE THE DOMINATE WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY ON SATURDAY. THIS WILL RESULT IN 
ONE MORE VERY WARM DAY ACROSS THE REGION...BEFORE A SLIGHT CHANGE IN 
THE PATTERN OCCURS. AN UPPER-TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS WILL 
BEGIN TO SHIFT FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES... 
PUSHING A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO 
SUNDAY. AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON SATURDAY...MODELS ARE INDICATING SOME 
DECENT CHANCES FOR ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION...ESPECIALLY 
ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TN. AS THE FRONT BEGINS 
TO SLOWLY TRACK ACROSS THE AREA ON SUNDAY...IT WILL BRING A MUCH 
BETTER SHOT OF SHOWERS AND STORMS SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. THUS... 
HAVE INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY TO DEFINITE ACROSS THE AREA DURING 
THIS TIME PERIOD. THUNDERSTORM CHANCES WILL BEGIN TO WANE BY MONDAY 
MORNING AS THE FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE REGION...BUT SOME ACTIVITY 
COULD LINGER ALONG THE MOUNTAINS INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. 
THEREAFTER...ANOTHER UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL MOVE OVER THE REGION... 
RESULTING IN A WARM UP BACK INTO THE 80S BY MID-WEEK AND SOME DRIER 
WEATHER. THE NEXT UPPER STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE UPPER- 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY LATE IN THE WEEK...POTENTIALLY DRAGGING A 
COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION LATE THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY AND GIVING THE 
AREA ANOTHER REASONABLE SHOT AT PRECIPITATION.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   87  67  85  69  84 /  20  20  30  40  80 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     89  64  86  67  83 /  20  20  20  30  80

794 
FXUS64 KMRX 301903
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT THU MAY 30 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...AXIS OF HIGHER THETA-E TO 
OUR WEST OVER NRN AL AND MIDDLE TN SEEMS TO BE THE FAVORED LOCATION 
FOR TSRA TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON. THIS ACTIVITY IS QUITE CLOSE TO 
OUR WRN MOST PLATEAU COUNTIES...SO I ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR 
THIS EVENING FOR THOSE AREAS. VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS SHOW SOME 
DEVELOPING CUMULUS OVER THE SMOKY MTNS...BUT THIS IS OCCURING IN AN 
AREA OF MUCH LESS INSTABILITY PLUS EVEN WEAKER MOISTURE CONVERGENCE 
THAN YESTERDAY. THUS...KEEPING THE SMOKY AND NRN MTNS DRY FOR 
TONIGHT. 

OTHERWISE...UPPER RIDGE IS THE MAIN FEATURE UNTIL THE COLD FRONT ON 
SUNDAY. MOISTURE IS NOTED TO INCREASE ON FRIDAY (MID TO HIGH LEVEL) 
THEN POTENTIAL FOR LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO INCREASE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY. FAVORED THE CLOUDIER NAM MODEL DEPICTION AND GENERALLY 
INCREASED SKY COVER FOR ESPECIALLY FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. I DID 
NOT INCREASE POPS QUITE AS MUCH AS THE MORE ROBUST NAM MOS POPS...
STAYING CLOSER TO PREVIOUS GRIDS OR A MOS BLEND WITH THE DRIER GFS. 

PERSISTENCE ON MIN AND MAX TEMPS WHICH IS QUITE CLOSE TO GFS MOS 
GUIDANCE AND PREVIOUS TEMP GRIDS.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...PLAINS STATES UPPER 
TROUGH FINALLY BUILDS THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. 
TWO TO THREE SHORTER WAVELENGTH ENHANCERS WILL ROTATE ACROSS THE 
AREA IN THIS REGIME. THE FINAL WAVE WILL INSURE A SLOW SURFACE COLD 
FRONTAL PASSAGE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. WENT WITH PREVIOUS PACKAGE 
HIGH POPS FOR THE CONVECTIVE EVENT TAPERING BACK TO LOW THROUGH 
MEDIUM CHANCE POPS ON MONDAY. NORTHWEST FLOW AND SURFACE RIDGING 
LATER MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY NIGHT FOR A DRY EARLY WEEK PERIOD. 
THE SURFACE RIDGE GRADUALLY SHIFTS EAST WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY 
WHILE INSTABILITY STRENGTHENS. ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM ON THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES ON WEDNESDAY WHILE 
BUMPING POPS UP TO THIRTY PERCENT BY THURSDAY AS NEXT UPPER TROUGH 
AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM PRESS EAST TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. 
TRENDED TEMPS TOWARD...IF NOT A COUPLE DEGREES BELOW THE ECM MOS 
MAXES AND CLOSE TO MINS.

AFTERNOON. THIS ACTIVITY INCREASES IN COVERAGE AS IT CONTINUES INTO 
SUNDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE AREA. THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS REMAINS WEST 
EARLY MONDAY WITH LINGERING CONVECTION. TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH 
MONDAY EVENING AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA FROM 
THE NORTH THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. ADJUSTED TEMPERATURES 
AND DEW POINTS DOWN SLIGHTLY FOR NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EDT WED MAY 29 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...BUILDING UPPER RIDGE OVER THE
EASTERN TN VALLEY TODAY WILL KEEP CONDITIONS SIMILAR TO TUESDAY.
RAIN CHANCES EVEN LESS THAN TUESDAY. EARLY THIS MORNING SKIES ARE
CLEAR WITH OVERNIGHT THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY CONFINED WAY TO THE
NORTH ACROSS THE MID MS VALLEY AND SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES ALONG A
STATIONARY FRONT. TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S IN THE
MOUNTAINS TO THE 60S IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS. TEMPERATURES EXPECTED
TO BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN TUESDAY WITH LOWS TONIGHT SIMILAR
TO THIS MORNINGS.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO ONGOING 
FORECAST. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE POSITIONED OFF THE OUTER BANKS FOR 
THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...BUT WILL GRADUALLY BE LOSING ITS GRIP ON 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS INTO THE WEEKEND. THURSDAY LOOKS DRY WITH 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS DUE TO SUBSIDENCE BENEATH THE RIDGE. THE SLOW 
EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE RIDGE ALLOWS FOR A SLIGHT INCREASE IN 
MOISTURE ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...MAINLY SOUTH AND WEST. THE NAM 
WHICH BRINGS NEGATIVELY TILTED SHORT WAVE INTO THE AREA IS MORE 
EXCITED ABOUT CONVECTION ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY THAN OTHER 
MODELS. PREFER THE DRIER SOLUTION AT THIS TIME. WILL CARRY A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP BOTH DAYS...WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS CONTINUING.

BROAD UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST THIS WEEKEND. BEST 
CHANCE FOR CONVECTION LATER SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT. THE UPPER 
TROUGH AXIS MOVES EAST ON MONDAY WITH POPS ENDING MONDAY AFTERNOON. 
MILD COOL DOWN AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE NORTH EARLY NEXT 
WEEK.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

690 
FXUS64 KMRX 281847
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT TUE MAY 28 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY/...
A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE CENTERED OFF OF THE FL/GA COAST WILL CONTINUE
TO BUILD NORTHWESTWARD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION THIS EVENING...RESULTING IN MOSTLY CLEAR AND
DRY CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT AND SETTING UP ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL AND VERY
WARM DAY ON WEDNESDAY. HIGHS WILL ONCE AGAIN PEAK IN THE MID TO
UPPER 80S ACROSS THE VALLEYS...WITH PERHAPS A ROUGE STORM POSSIBLE
ALONG THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS LATE IN THE DAY. HOWEVER...GIVEN
THE DRIER TRENDS WITH THE MODELS AND LACK OF ANY UPPER-LEVEL
FORCING...THINK THAT ANYTHING THAT DOES DEVELOP WILL BE SHORT-LIVED
AND VERY ISOLATED. THUS...HAVE OPTED TO REMOVE MENTIONABLE POPS
FROM THE GRIDS FOR THE AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY GIVEN THE LACK OF
CONVECTION THE PAST COUPLE DAYS ACROSS THE REGION.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE POSITIONED OFF THE OUTER BANKS FOR THURSDAY 
THROUGH SATURDAY...BUT WILL GRADUALLY BE LOSING ITS GRIP ON THE AREA 
AS WE GET INTO THE WEEKEND. THURSDAY LOOKS DRY WITH ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPS DUE TO SUBSIDENCE BENEATH THE RIDGE. THE SLOW EASTWARD 
PROGRESSION OF THE RIDGE ALLOWS FOR A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MOISTURE ON 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...MAINLY SOUTH AND WEST. THE NAM IS MORE EXCITED 
ABOUT CONVECTION ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY THAN THE GFS. PREFER 
THE DRIER SOLUTION AT THIS TIME. WILL CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP BOTH 
DAYS...WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS CONTINUING.

THE UPPER TROUGH THAT WILL BE APPROACHING FOR SUNDAY/MONDAY LOOKS A 
BIT MORE AMPLIFIED IN THE LATEST MODELS RUNS COMPARED TO PREVIOUS 
RUNS...WITH THE UPPER JET ENTRANCE REGION A BIT CLOSER TO OUR AREA. 
WITH THIS BETTER DYNAMIC LIFT AND CONTINUED GOOD AGREEMENT BETWEEN 
THE GFS AND ECMWF...CONFIDENCE IS HIGH ENOUGH TO RAISE POPS INTO THE 
LIKELY RANGE FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. THE THREAT 
OF SEVERE STORMS THIS PERIOD APPEARS MARGINAL AT BEST. WITH THE 
PASSAGE OF THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS...POPS SHOULD END MONDAY AFTERNOON. 
THERE WILL NOT BE A SIGNIFICANT AIR MASS CHANGE BEHIND THIS 
SYSTEM...SO TEMPS WILL CONTINUE AROUND NORMAL FOR TUESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  62  86  62  87  64 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  86  62  88  64 /  10  10  10  10  10

THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS LATE THIS AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...THINK
THAT MOST LOCATIONS WILL REMAIN DRY AGAIN AS RIDGING WILL CONTINUE
INTO THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS.

590 
FXUS64 KMRX 271855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT MON MAY 27 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT/...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE HAS SHIFTED INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
REGION TODAY...PROMOTING WARM TEMPERATURES AND MOSTLY TO PARTLY
SUNNY CONDITIONS. A SCATTERED CU FIELD HAS BEGUN TO FORM WITHIN THE
PAST COUPLE OF HOURS /AND WITH SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS HELPING TO DRAW GULF
MOISTURE BACK INTO THE AREA/...MODELS ARE STILL SHOWING SOME
SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING
/PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE HIGH TERRAIN/. THIS POTENTIAL COULD BE
AIDED BY A SHORTWAVE PASSING ALONG THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY OF THE
RIDGE THIS EVENING...THOUGH AM EXPECTING THAT GIVEN THE LOW
INSTABILITY/SHEAR ANYTHING THAT DOES DEVELOP WILL BE ISOLATED IN
NATURE AND SHORT-LIVED. SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL PICK UP ON TUESDAY AS
THE RIDGE SLIDES EAST OF THE REGION OVERNIGHT...RESULTING IN THE
POTENTIAL FOR EVEN WARMER TEMPERATURES TOMORROW IN THE MID TO UPPER
80S. AN OUTSIDE SHOT AT AN ISOLATED STORM REMAINS POSSIBLE ALONG
THE MOUNTAINS...BUT DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED IN MOST AREAS
TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
A RIDGE CENTERED OFF THE OUTER BANKS WILL EXTEND WESTWARD TO THE TN 
VALLEY REGION WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY. THE STRENGTHENING RIDGE WILL 
KEEP MOST THE AREA DRY EACH DAY WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES ABOVE NORMAL 
IN THE MID TO UPPER 80S. THE RIDGE BEGINS TO LOOSEN ITS GRIP A BIT ON 
SATURDAY AS A TROUGH MOVES INTO THE GREAT LAKES AND MS 
VALLEY...ALLOWING A LITTLE MORE GULF MOISTURE TO ADVECT NORTHWARD. 
WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AFTERNOON SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR 
SATURDAY.

THE SLOW APPROACH OF THE UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL 
BRING CHANCE POPS TO THE AREA SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY. THE GFS AND 
ECMWF ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS TIMING...SO POPS 
WILL BE RAISED TO A HIGH CHANCE THESE PERIODS. WITH THE UPPER JET 
POSITIONED WELL TO THE NORTH AND THE BROAD APPEARANCE OF THE 
WEAKENING TROUGH...SEVERE POTENTIAL LOOKS LOW FOR THE MOMENT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

786 
FXUS64 KMRX 261844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EDT SUN MAY 26 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE TO OUR WEST WILL 
EDGE EAST AND FLATTEN OUT A BIT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE 
CENTERED TO OUR EAST MONDAY.  SOME VERY WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY MAY 
BRUSH NORTHERN AREAS WITH A SPRINKLE OR LIGHT SHOWER LATE 
TONIGHT...BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP POPS BELOW SLIGHT CHANCE AND JUST 
INCREASE CLOUD COVER.   WHILE INSTABILITY LOOKS TO BE ON THE ANEMIC 
SIDE FOR MONDAY...MAY BE ENOUGH CONVECTIVE ENERGY FOR SOME 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS ESPECIALLY HIGHER TERRAIN NORTH.  WILL KEEP 
THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MOST ZONES...WITH LOW CHANCE SW VA AND SOME 
OF THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS ZONES.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE 
SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... A SUBTROPICAL UPPER-
RIDGE AXIS WILL MOVE OVER THE REGION AND BECOME CENTERED OFF THE
COAST OF THE CAROLINAS THIS WEEK...ALLOWING FOR MOSTLY SUNNY
CONDITIONS AND VERY WARM TEMPERATURES...WITH HIGHS RETURNING TO THE
MID TO UPPER 80S THROUGH FRIDAY TO CLOSE OUT THE MONTH OF MAY. SOME
MOISTURE UNDERNEATH THIS RIDGE WILL ALLOW FOR ISOLATED TO SCATTERED
DIURNAL CONVECTION ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST ZONES ON
TUESDAY AND PERHAPS INTO WEDNESDAY...BEFORE DRY CONDITIONS BEGIN TO
DOMINATE HEADING INTO THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. A COLD FRONT IS EXPECTED
TO BEGIN TO TRACK TOWARD THE REGION THIS WEEKEND...TRIGGERING OFF
SOME THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. HOWEVER...GIVEN
DIFFERENCES IN TIMING BETWEEN THE MORE PROGRESSIVE GFS AND THE
SLOWER ECMWF SOLUTION...HAVE KEPT POPS FOR DAY 7 AT SLIGHT CHANCE
FOR NOW.

269 
FXUS64 KMRX 261003
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
600 AM EDT SUN MAY 26 2013

.DISCUSSION...MORNING UPDATE TO ACCOUNT FOR MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION. 
RADAR RETURNS MORE ENHANCED THAN MODEL DEPICTED RAIN. ROBUST LIFT WILL
SQUEEZE OUT A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF RAIN THIS MORNING ACROSS CENTRAL PARTS
OF MRX CWA. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGING CONTINUES FROM THE 
GREAT LAKES DOWN TO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE PERIOD. A 
WEAKENING MID LEVEL IMPULSE IN NORTHWEST FLOW WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PART OF THE MRX CWA THIS MORNING. BEST LIFT WILL BE IN THE 
MORNING HOURS. MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL LOWER EARLY IN THE PERIOD. PWAT 
VALUES WILL INCREASE TO AROUND 1.20 ACROSS THE AREA. LOW LEVELS WILL 
REMAIN RELATIVELY DRY SO MEASURABLE PCPN WILL BE SPARSE. THICKNESS 
VALUES CHANGE LITTLE. CLOUDS WILL MODERATE TEMPERATURES WITH 
READINGS SLIGHTLY COOL OF NORMAL.  

LONG TERM (MEMORIAL DAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN EARLY IN THE PERIOD.  THE RETURN OF LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE AND STRONG DAYTIME HEATING WILL PROVIDE THE OPPORTUNITY FOR 
DIURNAL CONVECTION EARLY IN THE EXTENDED.  BEST CHANCES OF THIS WILL 
BE ON MONDAY AS A WEAK IMPULSE RIDES ALONG THE UPPER RIDGE.  DIURNAL 
CONVECTION WILL AGAIN PROVIDE A CHANCE OF CONVECTION TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY...WITH BEST LOCATIONS OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  THE RIDGE 
STRENGTHENS THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD AND STRONG SUBSIDENCE WILL 
DIMINISH CHANCE OF CONVECTION THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

197 
FXUS64 KMRX 251844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EDT SAT MAY 25 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...MID LEVEL MOISTURE AND SOME 
VERY WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY SPILLING OVER THE RIDGE TO OUR WEST WILL 
MOVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS OUR AREA...ESPECIALLY NORTHERN HALF.  WILL SEE 
AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS ESPECIALLY NORTHERN HALF...AND WHILE FORCING 
LOOKS QUITE WEAK COULD SEE A FEW SPRINKLES FALLING FROM A MID DECK 
OF CLOUDS LATE TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  WILL MENTION POSSIBILITY OF 
SPRINKLES NORTH AND CENTRAL ZONES.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE 
OVERALL SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.  

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)... A WARMING TREND
WILL BE IN STORE FOR THE REGION NEXT WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE
AXIS MOVES EAST FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI AND OHIO
RIVER VALLEYS...AND EVENTUALLY INTO THE CAROLINAS BY THE MIDDLE/END
OF THE WEEK. THIS WILL PROMOTE A WARM SOUTHWEST FLOW OFF THE GULF
OF MEXICO WHICH WILL HELP TO DRAW MOISTURE BACK INTO THE REGION. AS
A RESULT...SOME CHANCES FOR DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL EXIST EARLY
THIS WEEK /PARTICULARLY ON MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING/ AS A
SHORTWAVE TROUGH ROTATES OVER THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE.
SOME LOW-END DIURNAL THUNDER CHANCES WILL EXIST AGAIN ON
TUESDAY...AND ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST ZONES ON WEDNESDAY
AS WELL. HOWEVER...MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS SHOULD BE IN STORE FOR THE
REMINDER OF THE WORK WEEK GIVEN THE STRONG SUBSIDENCE IN PLACE.
DAYTIME HIGHS WILL RETURN TO THE MID TO UPPER 80S...WITH LOWS
REMAINING IN THE 60S OVERNIGHT. NEXT WEEKEND...ANOTHER FRONTAL
SYSTEM MAY APPROACH THE REGION...POTENTIALLY BRINGING THE NEXT
OPPORTUNITY FOR RAIN. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY IN THE
TIMING/TRACK BETWEEN THE MODELS THAT FAR OUT...HAVE NOT INTRODUCED
MENTIONABLE POPS FOR SATURDAY ATTM.



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 250652
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT SAT MAY 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO THE AREA FROM THE NW. COLD AIR ADVECTION 
BECOMES NEUTRAL EARLY. AFTER COLD START TODAY TEMPERATURES WILL WARM 
NICELY WITH PLENTY OF MINUTES OF SUNSHINE. HIGH TEMPERATURES A FEW 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. NORTHWEST FLOW CONTINUES ALOFT. MID LEVEL 
MOISTURE WILL MOVE SE INTO THE AREA LATER TODAY AND CONTINUE 
OVERNIGHT. LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL 
CONTINUE OVER THE REGION INTO SUNDAY.  A WEAK BOUNDARY MOVING ACROSS 
THE AREA MAY PROVIDE ENOUGH LIFT FOR SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER 
THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL SHIFT IN ON MONDAY AND WILL REMAIN THE MAIN WEATHER 
FEATURE THROUGHOUT THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.  AS THE RIDGE BUILDS 
IN...MOIST AIR WILL PUSH BACK INTO THE REGION.  THE ADDED LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE COMBINED WITH DAYTIME HEATING WILL ALLOW DIURNAL CONVECTION 
TO DEVELOP DURING THE LATER AFTERNOON EACH DAY WITH BEST CHANCES 
OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  AS FOR TEMPERATURES...A WARMING TREND WILL 
ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB ABOVE NORMAL BY THE END OF THE PERIOD.

644 
FXUS64 KMRX 241900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT FRI MAY 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A COLD FRONT JUST OFF THE CAROLINA COAST...WITH A LARGE DOME OF HIGH 
PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. A DRY AND 
UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT...AS THIS HIGH DRIFTS EASTWARD ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS WILL ALLOW FOR GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS TONIGHT...BUT THE CENTER OF THE HIGH 
WILL REMAIN NORTH OF THE REGION WITH A MODERATE NORTHWESTERLY WIND 
FLOW CONTINUING ALOFT. AS A RESULT...CONDITIONS ARE NOT THE MOST 
OPTIMAL FOR RADIATIONAL COOLING TONIGHT...WITH THE NAM GUIDANCE 
TEMPS ACTUALLY SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS DUE TO A TEMP 
INVERSION. THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE PREVIOUS FORECAST OF MENTIONING 
PATCHY FROST OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...MAINLY IN THE 
SHELTERED VALLEYS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE BETWEEN 
THE NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...WHICH 
STILL RESULTS IN NEAR RECORD TEMPS FOR THE 25TH (CHA 46...TYS 
44...OQT 40...AND TRI 42).

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
WILL BE SLOW TO PULL AWAY FROM THE EASTERN SEABOARD THIS WEEKEND... 
LEAVING THE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT AND COOLER AND DRY CONDITIONS ON SUNDAY AS WELL. HEADING INTO 
NEXT WEEK HOWEVER...AN UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO MOVE 
EASTWARD FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE OHIO/LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER 
VALLEY AND FLATTEN. THIS...ALONG WITH INCREASING THICKNESS VALUES 
AND A SOUTHWEST SURFACE FLOW WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO RETURN TO THE MID 
TO UPPER 80S FOR MOST OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. THERE WILL STILL BE 
A GOOD MOISTURE FETCH OFF OF THE GULF WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR SOME 
LOW-END DIURNAL THUNDERSTORMS CHANCES EACH DAY THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF 
THE WEEK /PARTICULARLY ON MONDAY WHEN A WEAK SHORTWAVE ROTATES OVER 
THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY OF THE RIDGE/. FOR THE MOST PART THOUGH... 
WARM AND DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR THE MIDDLE TO LATER PART OF 
THE WORK WEEK TO CLOSE OUT THE MONTH OF MAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   47  78  50  82  56 /   0   0  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     45  76  50  77  55 /   0   0  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             45  76  48  78  54 /   0   0  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    38  72  44  70  49 /   0   0  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 240747
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT FRI MAY 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER TROUGH AXIS WILL MOVE 
EAST THROUGH THE AREA EARLY THIS MORNING. DRIZZLE AND CLOUD COVER 
WILL DISSIPATE THIS MORNING AS A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN FROM THE NW. TODAY TEMPERATURES WILL BE 5 TO 10 DEGREES 
BELOW NORMAL ACCOMPANIED BY BREEZY NW WINDS. SKIES WILL BE CLEAR 
TONIGHT WITH THE WINDS LESSENING. NEAR RECORD LOW CAN BE EXPECTED 
TONIGHT ESPECIALLY ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN. RECORD LOWS FOR MAY 25 
ARE: CHA 46 IN 1942/TYS 44 IN 1979/TRI 42 IN 1942/OQT 40 IN 1979.
THE WINDS WILL LIKELY DECOUPLE LATE TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
SHELTERED VALLEYS. PATCHY FROST WILL BECOME POSSIBLE ACROSS THESE 
AREAS OF SW VA/NE TN AND CLOSE TO THE SMOKIES.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL 
CONTINUE TO REINFORCE THE DRY AND COOL AIR THAT IS IN PLACE ACROSS 
THE REGION ON SATURDAY.  HOWEVER...WITH STRONG DAYTIME HEATING AND 
MODERATING OF THE AIR MASS...WILL SEE A SLOW WARMING TREND FOR THE 
WEEKEND.  RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN ON MONDAY AND WILL 
DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED.  THIS WILL 
STRENGTHEN THE WARMING TREND WITH TEMPERATURES REACHING NEAR TO 
SLIGHT ABOVE NORMAL BY MID WEEK.  HOWEVER...AS THE RIDGE BUILDS 
IN...LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL RETURN AND EXPECT DAYTIME HEATING TO 
GENERATE DIURNAL CONVECTION...MAINLY DURING THE LATER AFTERNOON WITH 
BEST CHANCES OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.

832 
FXUS64 KMRX 231920
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT THU MAY 23 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
WEAK COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WITH RADARS 
REVEALING SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING OVER EASTERN KY AND 
SOUTHWEST VA. A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL CONTINUE OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA INTO THIS EVENING...AS A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
AMPLIFIES OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. MODELS INDICATE THAT 
THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SCATTERED SHOWERS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT...WITH MUCH COOLER AND DRIER AIR MOVING INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA BEHIND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY ON FRIDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT AND 
FRIDAY...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN NW 
FLOW PATTERN TO DROP TEMPERATURES MUCH BELOW NORMAL FRIDAY NIGHT 
WITH FROST POSSIBLE NE SECTIONS AND NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS. 
SW NORTH CAROLINA VALLEYS COULD ALSO DROP TO UPPER 30S. REFERRED TO 
FROST IN HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK AND COULD ISSUE AN ADVISORY AS 
EARLY AS FRIDAY MORNING IF CONFIDENCE IS HIGH. WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW 
COOLER MAV NUMBERS FRIDAY NIGHT. SATURDAYS HIGHS ONLY A FEW DEGREES 
WARMER THAN FRIDAY AS SURFACE HIGH MOVES SOUTHEAST FROM THE UPPER 
MIDWEST INTO THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. 
STILL SLIGHT COLD AIR ADVECTION WITH NORTHERLY FLOW. DEW POINTS WILL 
BE IN THE 30S TO LOWER 40S WHICH WILL KEEP RH VALUES LOW FOR THIS 
TIME OF YEAR. UPPER RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL STATES SATURDAY BEGINS TO 
SHIFT EAST WITH MOISTURE RETURNING TO THE MID MS VALLEY AS WESTERN 
PART OF COLD FRONT MOVES BACK NORTH AS WARM FRONT. WITH FLOW AROUND 
THE RIDGE CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT SHORTWAVE 
ENERGY MOVING AROUND RIDGE AND INCREASED MOISTURE WILL BRING CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE REGION MAINLY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENINGS MONDAY AND TUESDAY AND TO A LESSER EXTENT WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY AS RIDGE STRENGTHENS OVER THE GULF COAST AND TN VALLEY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON A SLOW WARMING TREND AS WARMER AIR FROM 
RIDGE SETTLES OVER THE TN VALLEY. LOWS WILL RISE BACK TO THE MID 50S 
TO LOWER 60S TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH HIGHS BACK TO THE UPPER 
70S TO LOWER 80S NORTH AND LOWER TO MID 80S SOUTH.

AROUND TEN TO ELEVEN THOUSAND FEET...SOME LARGE HAIL IS POSSIBLE.

THE AREA. STAYED CLOSE TO MOS MAX/MIN TEMP BLEND THROUGH THE
PERIOD.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...BUILDING SURFACE RIDGE OF
HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY NORTHWEST FLOW WILL PRODUCE UNSEASONABLY COOL
AND DRY CONDITIONS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. MAIN CONCERN WILL BE PATCHY/
AREAS OF FROST OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND FAR
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS.

FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...SURFACE RIDGE MOVES EAST OF THE AREA WITH
RETURN OF SOUTHERLY FLOW. A WARM FRONT WILL SETUP OVER THE LOWER
OHIO VALLEY. WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR
MAINLY THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. ALSO...INCREASING
MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL PRODUCE CONVECTION OVER THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE ON THE RISE AS UPPER RIDGE
BEGINS INTO THE AREA.

FOR WEDNESDAY...WARM FRONT LIFTS NORTH OF THE AREA. UPPER RIDGE
WILL BE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS PRODUCING VERY WARM AND
MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS. AGAIN...STILL EXPECT CONVECTION OVER THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

735 
FXUS64 KMRX 221906
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EDT WED MAY 22 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH AN OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARY BISECTING THE FORECAST AREA FROM LAST NIGHT'S CONVECTION 
OVER MIDDLE TN. BOTH THE GFS AND NAM MODELS REVEAL A MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS ALSO INDICATE A DECENT MID LEVEL WIND FLOW BETWEEN 20 AND 
40 KT...SO IT APPEARS THERE WILL BE A GOOD CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER 
INTO THIS EVENING. PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES REMAIN HIGH THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING (BETWEEN 1.5 AND 1.75 INCHES)...SO THINK THAT 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE A POSSIBILITY WITH SOME STORMS. 
MODELS ALSO INDICATE 0-1 KM HELICITY VALUES INCREASING AND LCL 
HEIGHTS LOWERING THIS EVENING...ESPECIALLY OVER NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA...SO IT APPEARS THAT THERE COULD BE AN ISOLATED TORNADO 
OR TWO. THE COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
ON THURSDAY...WITH WINDS INCREASING AND SCATTERED CONVECTION AGAIN 
POSSIBLE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT FOR TONIGHT AND THURSDAY...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME 
SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...DEEP UPPER
TROUGH FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR PUSHING A SECONDARY COLD FRONT
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING. AIR
MASS NOT AS UNSTABLE BY THURSDAY EVENING WITH MAINLY SHOWERS AHEAD
OF SECONDARY FRONT. BEST CHANCE OF RAIN ACROSS NORTHEAST SECTIONS.
LOWS SEVERAL DEGREES COOLER IN THE 50S TO POSSIBLY UPPER 40S HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE NW BUILDS IN FRIDAY WITH
TEMPERATURES AS MUCH AS 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL AND NORTH TO
NORTHWEST WINDS 10 TO 15 MPH. LOWS FRIDAY NIGHT DROPPING TO THE 40S
WITH UPPER 30S HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND HIGHER NE VALLEYS. FROST MAY
BE POSSIBLE IN ISOLATED LOCATIONS THERE. NORTHWEST FLOW WITH COOLER
TEMPERATURES TO CONTINUE SATURDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH
TEMPERATURES SLOWLY WARMING EACH DAY. MOISTURE TO INCREASE BY
SUNDAY AS FLOW AROUND RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL STATES BRINGS A FRONT
INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MID WEEK SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE AGAIN. ACTIVITY SHOULD BE HIGHEST DURING
PEAK HEATING HOURS OF THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING.

&&

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY OVER THE FORECAST AREA FROM LAST 
NIGHT'S CONVECTION OVER MIDDLE TN. A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS 
PROGGED TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS 
EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. AS A RESULT...SCATTERED 
CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON...BUT TIMING THE 
EXACT OCCURRENCE AT THE TAF SITES WILL REMAIN PROBLEMATIC. THUS... 
WILL JUST MENTION VCTS AT THE TAF SITES UNTIL EARLY EVENING. FOG 
SHOULD DEVELOP AGAIN LATE TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY IN AREAS THAT RECEIVE 
RAIN THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...BUT WILL ONLY MENTION MVFR 
VISIBILITIES AT KTRI SINCE CLOUDS MAY LIMIT THE EXTENT OF THIS FOG. 
WINDS SHOULD INCREASE AFTER SUNRISE ON THURSDAY...AS A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES THE TAF SITES.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 AM EDT WED MAY 22 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY OVER THE FORECAST AREA FROM LAST 
NIGHT'S CONVECTION OVER MIDDLE TN. THE LOCAL AIR MASS REMAINS VERY 
HUMID THIS MORNING...WITH THE GFS AND NAM MODELS BOTH REVEALING A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON AS AN UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. MODEL 
SOUNDINGS ALSO INDICATE A DECENT MID LEVEL WIND FLOW BETWEEN 20 AND 
40 KT...SO IT APPEARS THERE WILL BE A GOOD CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER 
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MODELS ALSO INDICATE 0-1 KM HELICITY 
VALUES INCREASING AND LCL HEIGHTS LOWERING THIS EVENING...ESPECIALLY 
OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...SO WILL PLAN TO MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF AN ISOLATED TORNADO OR TWO IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER 
OUTLOOK. WILL ALSO PLAN TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL...SINCE PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL REMAIN HIGH THIS 
AFTERNOON (BETWEEN 1.5 AND 1.75 INCHES).

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MORNING PRECIP WORDING...AND TO TWEAK 
TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS. WILL ALSO UPDATE THE 
HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK WITH THE THOUGHTS MENTIONED ABOVE. 
&&

931 
FXUS64 KMRX 220740
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT WED MAY 22 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MORE CONVECTION EXPECTED TODAY 
WITH PLENTY OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING THROUGH THE MEAN UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGH ACROSS MID AMERICA. WITH SOME HEATING AHEAD OF THE MAIN 
FEATURE...CURRENTLY BUILDING NORTHEAST THROUGH WEST TENNESSEE AND 
NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI...MODELS PROG RATHER DECENT INSTABILITY WITH 
CAPES BUMPING UP TO AROUND 2000 J/KG OR HIGHER AND LIFTED INDICES AS 
HIGH AS -8 BY EARLY AFTERNOON. BULK SHEAR NOT QUITE AS IMPRESSIVE 
BUT STILL AROUND 30 TO 35 KTS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH VALUES 
APPROACHING 40 KTS ON THE PLATEAU DURING THE AFTERNOON. 
THEREFORE...THERE IS A CHANCE FOR SEVERE CONVECTION MID DAY ON THE 
PLATEAU AND POINTS EAST THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. HELICITY VALUES NOT 
TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE SO THREAT FOR TORNADOES WILL BE REDUCED. MODELS 
SHOW WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY BUILDING INTO THE REGION TONIGHT 
WITH ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE ENERGY SWINGING ACROSS THE AREA SO WENT 
WITH LIKELY PROBABILITIES FOR ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
MAINLY THROUGH LATE EVENING WITH PERCENTAGES DROPPING OFF AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. TRIED TO STAY CLOSE A GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAX TEMPS DURING 
THE SHORT TERM WITH MAV MAXES A BIT TOO WARM MOST AREAS. STAYED 
CLOSER TO THE MILDER MIN GUIDANCE TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE
ACROSS THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS THURSDAY ALONG WITH A
SECONDARY COLD FRONT THAT WILL USHER IN UNSEASONABLY COOL AIR INTO
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW AIR-MASS WILL
ONCE AGAIN BECOME MARGINALLY UNSTABLE WITH CAPES OF 1000-1500 J/KG
DURING THE AFTENOON. BEST INSTABILITY AND MOISTURE WILL BE ACROSS
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. HAVE INCLUDE LIKELY POPS
NORTH TO LOW-CHANCE SOUTH FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON.

MODELS SHOW A GOOD DEAL OF COLD-AIR STRATU-CU AND SOME OROGRAPHIC
LIFT FOR THURSDAY NIGHT-ENDING FRIDAY MORNING. WILL MAINTAIN A GOOD
DEAL OF CLOUD-COVER AS WELL SCATTERED SHOWS. BEST CHANCES OVER THE
HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE NORTHWEST FLOW WILL PRODUCE OROGRAPHIC LIFT.

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND...UNSEASONABLY COOL AND DRY AIR-MASS
WILL BE RULE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WOULD NOT BE
SURPRISED TO SEE SOME FROST ACROSS THE NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS
FRIDAY NIGHT.

FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK..THE GFS AND ECMWF DIFFER GREATLY ON WHERE AND
EXTENT OF CONVECTION ALONG DEVELOPING WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS
THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. THE ECMWF IS MUCH MORE AGGRESSIVE.
WILL TREND TOWARD THE GFS..BUT SOME ENSEMBLE MEMBERS DO AGREE WITH
SOME HIGHER POPS.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE GFS MOS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

CHANCE POPS AT THIS TIME.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
352 AM EDT TUE MAY 21 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...EARLY MORNING DENSE
FOG ACROSS MAINLY SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.
CURRENTLY COVERAGE IS SCATTERED...PER SATELLITE/OBS...BUT WILL
MONITOR FOR POTENTIAL ADVISORY.

A LINE OF STORMS IS CURRENTLY ACROSS FAR WESTERN TENNESSEE. LATEST
NAM SUGGEST THE OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM THIS CONVECTION WILL MOVE
ACROSS TENNESSEE THIS MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON AND BE LOCATED OVER
THE PLATEAU BY 16-18Z. AIRMASS WILL BE MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH
CAPES OF 2000-2500 J/KG..SO SCATTERED TO BROKEN CONVECTION
ANTICIPATED ALONG THIS BOUNDARY AS WELL AS ALONG TERRAIN FEATURES.
A GOOD DEAL OF MID-LEVEL DRY AIR WILL PROMOTE DRY AIR ENTRAINMENT
INTO THE DOWNDRAFTS WITH DAMAGING WINDS A CONCERN. ALSO...WET BULB
ZERO HEIGHTS AND HAIL CAPE VALUES WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR MARGINAL
LARGE HAIL. HAVE INCLUDED WITHIN THE HWO.

CONVECTION WILL DIMINISH THIS EVENING DUE TO LOSS OF DAYTIME
HEATING. 

FOR WEDNESDAY...AN APPROACHING FRONT AND LIKELY OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES
COMBINED WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY WILL PRODUCE SCATTERED TO BROKEN
CONVECTION. MODELS CURRENTLY DO NOT FAVOR AN OUTBREAK OF SEVERE WEATHER..BUT
GIVEN THE INCREASING MID-LEVEL WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER TROUGH
OVER THE MID-WEST..WE WILL HAVE TO MONITOR FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF STRONG-
SEVERE STORMS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES  
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY MAKING SLOW PROGRESS AS IT SHIFTS FROM THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TO THE EASTERN SEABOARD BY 00Z SATURDAY. BUMPED 
POPS UP SLIGHTLY ON THURSDAY WITH A COLD FRONT BUILDING THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MAINTAINED SOME CHANCE POPS THURSDAY NIGHT 
TAPERING TO SLIGHT CHANCE ON FRIDAY AS MODELS INDICATE A FAIR AMOUNT 
OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND DEEP MOISTURE ROTATING THROUGH THE EASTERN 
U.S. LONG WAVE. STAYED WITH CONVECTION ON THURSDAY BUT WITH 
INCREASING STABILITY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY USED SHOWER WORDING. 
PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW WITH DRY ADVECTION AND A NICE EXPANSIVE 
SURFACE RIDGE SHOULD ALLOW FOR A DRY PERIOD SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. 
GFS/CMC HINT AT THE PASSAGE OF A SHORT WAVE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY 
WITH LOW LEVEL WARM AND MOIST ADVECTION DEVELOPING ON THE BACK SIDE 
OF THE DEPARTING RIDGE. THEREFORE KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER 
SUNDAY NIGHT WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A THUNDERSTORM ON 
MONDAY.
