.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...THOUGH A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
BE POSSIBLE TONIGHT OVER THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS...THE BULK OF THE 
AREA WILL REMAIN DRY AS AN UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD IN.  ON 
TUESDAY...WARM...MOIST AND WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR OVER THE REGION WILL 
WILL ALLOW FOR DIURNAL CONVECTION TO DEVELOP DURING THE AFTERNOON.  
THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD INITIATE OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH ONLY A FEW 
MOVING INTO THE VALLEY LATE IN THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WETTEST PERIODS OF THE LONG 
TERM STILL LOOK TO BE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT. NUDGED POPS UP TO LIKELY BY NOON WEDNESDAY 
ACROSS ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA...AND CARRIED 40 TO 50 PERCENT POPS 
FOR WEDNESDAY EVENING WITH SCATTERED WORDING.

FRONTAL PASSAGE NOT LIKELY TO OCCUR UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON OR 
EVENING WITH CHANCE POPS NEEDED THROUGH ABOUT 12Z FRIDAY. A SURFACE 
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE THEN BEGINS TO BUILD SE THROUGH THE WEEKEND
WHILE UPPER LEVEL HEIGHTS ALSO RISE. 12Z GFSX MOS POPS ARE TRENDING 
A LITTLE DRIER THAN THE 00Z GUIDANCE...BUT FOR NOW I KEPT IN LOW 
TOKEN POPS BOTH FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT FOR POSSIBLE SPOTTY DIURNAL 
CONVECTION. 

FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...A WARM FRONT APPEARS TO BE A FOCUS FOR SOME 
CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION TO OUR NW BY MONDAY...WITH 12Z GFS MODEL 
SHOWING A SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE UPPER RIDGE AND SPREADING 
CONVECTION SE INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND TO THE SRN APPALACHIANS BY 
MONDAY NIGHT. SOME LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW DOES RETURN BY MONDAY 
WHICH SUPPORTS AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SPOTTY DIURNAL 
CONVECTION. 

12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS HAVE TRENDED A FEW DEGREES COOLER ON BOTH MAX AND 
MIN TEMPS FROM THURSDAY THRU MONDAY. I STAYED A BIT CLOSER TO THE 
00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS AND ADJACENT NWS GRIDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 200739
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 AM EDT MON MAY 20 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PLENTY OF LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE
AND ENOUGH BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS..ESPECIALLY SOUTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA TO PRODUCE AREAS OF FOG..SOME LOCALLY DENSE.

UPPER LOW IS LOCATED ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING.
WEAK WAVES ROTATING AROUND THE LOW IS FOCUSING THE MODERATE
INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER EAST KENTUCKY INTO
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE THIS MORNING. DUE TO
CONTINUED HIGH PWS...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE THE MAIN
CONCERN TODAY WITH THE GREATEST COVERAGE OVER THE NORTHEAST
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. BESIDES THE HEAVY RAIN..ISOLATED
SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE WITH HAIL UP TO 1 INCH.

ELSEWHERE TODAY...AIRMASS WILL REMAIN MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH
CAPES OF 2000-2500 J/KG. UPPER RIDGING WILL BE BUILDING INTO THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY BUT NOT ENOUGH CIN TO SUPPRESS CONVECTION. WILL
CALL FOR ISOLATED-WIDELY SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION FOCUSING ON
THE LOCAL TERRAIN. PLENTY OF MID-LEVEL DRY AIR TO BE CONCERN OF
DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS FOR THE STRONGEST STORMS..AS WELL AS
MARGINAL HAIL AND LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINFALL.

FOR TONIGHT...LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING WILL ALLOW CONVECTION TO
DIMINISH THIS EVENING. RADIATIONAL COOLING AND PLENTY OF LOW-LEVEL
MOISTURE WILL PRODUCE PATCHY/AREAS OF FOG. SOME LOCALLY DENSE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WARM AND MUGGY CONDITIONS CAN 
BE EXPECTED THROUGH AT LEAST MID-WEEK AS SOUTHERLY FLOW PERSISTS 
AHEAD OF THE LARGE UPPER TROUGH TO THE WEST. THE UPPER TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WILL MEANDER SLOWLY EASTWARD BY 
WEDNESDAY INCREASING CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. WILL CONTINUE WITH BEST THUNDERSTORM CHANCES ON WED 
AFTERNOON AND THU NIGHT/MORNING. ANOTHER SHOT OF STORMS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK UNTIL THE MAIN TROUGH 
AXIS PASSES EAST OF THE AREA. THE COLD FRONT THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE REGION ON FRIDAY WILL PROVIDE THE REGION WITH COOLER THAN NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES AND A FEW DAYS OF SUNSHINE AND DRY WEATHER.

913 
FXUS64 KMRX 191336
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 AM EDT SUN MAY 19 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED MOISTURE 
CONVERGENCE BOUNDARY STRETCHING GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER 70S WEST OF IT (OVER MIDDLE TN 
AND NORTHERN AL) AND IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL SCATTERED CONVECTION OCCURRING ALONG THIS 
CONVERGENCE BOUNDARY...WITH SOME TRAINING CELLS OVER MARION COUNTY 
PRODUCING LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. THIS VERY HUMID SUMMER-LIKE AIR 
MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE SCATTERED 
CONVECTION TODAY...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH LINGERS OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. IN FACT...BOTH THE GFS AND NAM MODELS 
REVEAL A MODERATELY TO HIGHLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING TODAY 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH THE BEST INSTABILITY EXPECTED NEAR THE 
BOUNDARY OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THIS INSTABILITY SHOULD LEAD 
TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOME STRONG TO SEVERE TSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING...ALTHOUGH A FAIRLY WARM MID LEVEL LAYER MAY KEEP THIS 
ACTIVITY FROM BECOMING TOO WIDESPREAD. FAIRLY HIGH PRECIPITABLE 
WATER VALUES AROUND 1.5 INCHES SHOULD CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SOME 
LOCALIZED FLOODING WITH ANY SLOW-MOVING OR TRAINING CONVECTION.

HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO BEEF UP THE 
WORDING FOR TODAY SOME MORE...AND WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE ZONE 
FORECASTS THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MORNING PRECIP WORDING AND TO 
TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

557 
FXUS64 KMRX 190747
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 AM EDT SUN MAY 19 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAKENING UPPER TROUGH WILL
CONTINUE TO MOVE SLOWLY EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND
TONIGHT WITH THE AXIS BEING EAST OF THE AREA MONDAY MORNING. PLENTY
OF MOISTURE AND MODERATE INSTABILITY WILL PRODUCE SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE SHORT-TERM. MODELS SHOW CAPE OF 1500-2000
J/KG FOR THE PLATEAU WITH LESSER AMOUNTS EAST FOR THIS AFTERNOON-
EVENING. SOUNDINGS SHOW THAT HEAVY RAINFALL WILL ONCE AGAIN BE THE
MAIN THREAT TODAY-TONIGHT WITH MARGINAL HAIL UP TO 1 INCH POSSIBLE
WITH THE STRONGER STORMS.

FOR TONIGHT...ABUNDANT LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE AND CLOUD COVER FROM
UPPER LOW MOVING EAST WILL ALLOW FOR A GOOD AMOUNT OF RADIATIONAL
FOG DEVELOPMENT AREA-WIDE. HAVE INCLUDED AREAS OF FOG FOR
TONIGHT..SOME OF THE FOG WILL LIKELY BE DENSE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...BY MONDAY...THE UPPER TROUGH 
WILL STILL BE OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW 
WILL BE CO-LOCATED NEAR NORTHERN NEBRASKA AND BY MONDAY EVENING 
EXPECT ANOTHER LOW TO FORM FARTHER SOUTH OVER NE TEXAS. ALL THIS 
OCCURRING TO THE WEST WILL HELP DRIVE TEMPERATURES UPWARDS OVER THE 
BEGINNING HALF OF THE WEEK AND MAKE CONDITIONS RATHER MUGGY AND 
HUMID. 

A SHORTWAVE RIDGE OVER OUR AREA ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY WILL 
HELP INHIBIT WIDESPREAD THUNDERSTORMS BUT A FEW ISOLATED 
SHOWERS/STORMS WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE. IT WILL NOT BE UNTIL THE 
AFOREMENTIONED TROUGH TRANSLATES EAST THAT WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL OCCUR...WHICH SHOULD BE BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. COMPARING THE LONGER RANGE MODELS THIS MORNING ARE 
NEARLY OPPOSITE FROM LAST 00Z RUNS. THE GFS IS SLOWER WITH FROPA 
LATE THIS WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND...WHILE THE ECMWF IS QUICKER AND 
DRIER BY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. ALTHOUGH BOTH MODELS KEEP RELATIVELY 
DRY CONDITIONS INTO THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND AND TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN 
TO NEAR NORMAL BY THE END OF THE WEEK.

CONTINUE TO TRACK ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...BRINGING GOOD

LATER TONIGHT...ALONG WITH SOME LOCALIZED POCKETS OF FOG IN THE
USUAL FOG-PRONE SHELTERED AREAS. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL GENERALLY
REMAIN IN THE 60S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS OVERNIGHT GIVEN THE
DENSE CLOUD COVER/PRECIPITATION.

528 
FXUS64 KMRX 181911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT SAT MAY 18 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE WESTERN TN RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH A WARM AND VERY HUMID AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS AFTERNOON...WHICH SHOULD CONTINUE TO INCREASE IN AREAL 
COVERAGE AND INTENSITY AS DAYTIME HEATING COMBINES WITH AN UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH TO PRODUCE A POTENTIALLY MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR MASS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THE NAM MODEL ONLY REVEALS SOME MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR LATER TODAY AND AGAIN ON 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON...BUT THE GFS MODEL INDICATES MODERATE INSTABILITY 
DEVELOPING (DUE TO ITS WARMER SURFACE TEMPS) WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR 
A HIGHLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS AROUND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ON SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON AND AREAWIDE ON MONDAY AFTERNOON. IF THE GFS MODEL 
VERIFIES...THINK THAT SOME ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE 
ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY AFTERNOON...WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF 
DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE HAIL...AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL (DUE TO 
SLOW-MOVING CONVECTION IN AN ENVIRONMENT WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER 
VALUES RANGING BETWEEN 1.5 AND 1.75 INCHES). THIS SLOW-MOVING UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH WILL FINALLY DRIFT EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 
MONDAY...BUT COOLER NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BEHIND THE TROUGH WILL HELP 
TO DESTABILIZE THE LOCAL AIR MASS ALLOWING FOR ADDITIONAL SCATTERED 
CONVECTION TO DEVELOP. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A WARM...MOIST AIRMASS IN 
PLACE EARLY IN THE EXTENDED WITH SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. THE RESULT 
WILL BE DIURNAL CONVECTION TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. BROAD...WEAK 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY SLIDES THROUGH AROUND THURSDAY...AND WILL PROVIDE 
OUR BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION. TROUGH AXIS WILL MOVE THOUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...KEEPING UNSETTLED WEATHER OVER THE AREA. 
SATURDAY CURRENTLY LOOKS TO BE OUR BEST SHOT AT A DRY DAY...AS THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY PULLS AWAY FROM THE REGION.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   65  83  65  88  67 /  60  60  30  20  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     64  82  64  87  66 /  60  60  40  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             65  82  65  87  67 /  60  60  30  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    59  80  59  85  61 /  70  70  40  30  10

396 
FXUS64 KMRX 181415
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EDT SAT MAY 18 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER WESTERN KY...WITH A WARM AND HUMID SUMMER-LIKE AIR MASS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA THIS MORNING...WHICH WERE OCCURRING IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE OHIO AND TN RIVER 
VALLEYS. THIS UPPER TROUGH IS PROGGED TO LINGER OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS TODAY...WITH AN UNSTABLE AIR MASS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP 
THIS AFTERNOON. NAM MODEL ONLY REVEALS SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY 
DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT THE GFS MODEL INDICATES SOME 
MODERATE INSTABILITY DEVELOPING DUE TO ITS WARMER SURFACE TEMPS. IF 
THE GFS MODEL VERIFIES...THINK THAT SOME ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS WILL 
BE POSSIBLE. THUS...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER 
OUTLOOK TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF DAMAGING WIND AND LARGE 
HAIL...ALONG WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF LOCALIZED FLOODING DUE TO THE 
SLOW-MOVING CONVECTION.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS MORNING TO REMOVE ANY MORNING PRECIP WORDING AND TO TWEAK TEMPS 
A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.

FXUS64 KMRX 180737
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT SAT MAY 18 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...THE MAIN WEATHER
FEATURE WILL BE WEAKENING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY
AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND AFTERNOON AND
EVENING THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY.
INSTABILITY BECOMES A LITTLE BETTER SUNDAY AS A LITTLE MORE
INSOLATION ANTICIPATED. WILL CONTINUE WITH LIKELY POPS THROUGH MOST
OF THE PERIOD. AREA RAINS AND CLOUDS SLOWLY DIMINISHING THROUGH THE
PERIOD WILL ALLOW FOR RADIATIONAL FOG DEVELOPMENT FOR SATURDAY AND
SUNDAY NIGHTS. WOULD NOT BE SUPRISED TO SEE LOCALLY DENSE FOG.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES FOLLOWED A BLEND OF MET AND GFS MOS..WHICH HAS
WORKED BEST THE PAST COUPLE DAYS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE RIDGING 
WILL OCCUR ON MONDAY WITH CHANCES OF THUNDERSTORMS FOCUSED ON THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE MOUNTAINS OF NE TN AND SW VA. SOUTHERLY LOW 
LEVEL FLOW WILL PROVIDE ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BY TUESDAY. THE 
UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THE ASSOCIATED FRONT WILL BE ACROSS WEST 
TENNESSEE WEDNESDAY BUT SEEMS TO LOSE ITS IDENTITY BY THURSDAY. THE 
MORE DEFINED FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE ACROSS THE NORTHERN OHIO 
VALLEY. THE GFS SLOWLY BRINGS THE COOLER AIR INTO THE REGION 
SOMETIME FRIDAY WHILE THE ECMWF IS ABOUT 24 TO 36 HOURS SLOWER. 
ADDITIONALLY THE ECMWF IS MUCH LESS AMPLIFIED WITH ITS HANDLING OF 
THE MID-WEEK UPPER TROUGH AS IT TRACKS IT INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION RATHER THAN OVER THE SOUTHERN OHIO VALLEY. WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
THURSDAY LOOK LIKE THE BEST CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR 
THIS TIME PERIOD. TEMPERATURES EARLY IN THE WEEK WILL BE WELL ABOVE 
NORMAL AND SLOWLY TREND TOWARDS NORMAL BY THE END OF THE WEEK.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
952 PM EDT FRI MAY 17 2013

.DISCUSSION...
THE LATEST OBS INDICATE SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY ACROSS THE
REGION...WHICH HAS ALLOWED A FEW CLUSTERS OF THUNDERSTORMS TO
LINGER PAST SUNSET INTO THE MID/LATE EVENING HOURS. HOWEVER...AS
NIGHT SETTLES IN...THINK THAT MOST OF THE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY
WILL WANE WITH THE LOSS OF HEATING. HOWEVER...A BROAD AREA OF LIGHT
TO LOCALLY HEAVIER SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO WORK ITS WAY INTO THE
FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AS AN UPPER-TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION WILL BE
ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
EVENTUALLY SPREAD INTO THE CENTRAL/NORTHERN VALLEY AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA LATER TONIGHT. HAVE WENT AHEAD AND GONE DEFINITE POPS ACROSS
THE WESTERN/SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE REGION...BUT HAVE KEPT LIKELY TO
HIGH END CHANCE POPS ELSEWHERE...GIVEN THAT THE HEAVIER
PRECIPITATION GENERALLY SHOULD IMPACT THE WESTERN/SOUTHERN ZONES
BEFORE DAYBREAK.

&&

PROGGED TO MOVE OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...BRINGING AN

THEN WEAKEN BY SUNDAY...BUT A MARGINALLY TO POTENTIALLY MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON 
SUNDAY. THUS...WILL MAINTAIN HIGH POPS ON SUNDAY. IT APPEARS THAT 
THE SLOW-MOVING CONVECTION EXPECTED THIS WEEKEND MAY LEAD TO SOME 
LOCALIZED FLOODING CONCERNS...SINCE PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL 
BE AROUND 1.5 INCHES. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...LOW PRESSURE CONTINUE TO PULL 
AWAY FROM THE AREA ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY...AS A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN. AIDED BY DAYTIME HEATING...CONVECTION SHOULD 
REMAIN CONFINED TO FAR NORTHERN/EASTERN LOCATIONS. A WEAK COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION AROUND THE WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY TIME FRAME. 
MODELS SLOWING THIS FEATURE. WILL LEAVE HIGHEST POPS ON WEDNESDAY... 
BUT THIS MAY NEED TO BE PUSHED A BIT LATER IN THE PERIOD IF THE 
SLOWING TREND CONTINUES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

315 AM EDT FRI MAY 17 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FOR EARLY THIS
MORNING..LOCALIZED DENSE FOG BEING REPORTED OVER THE NORTHERN HALF
OF THE AREA WHERE SKY COVER IS MORE SCATTERED AND BETTER CHANCE OF
RADIATIONAL FOG. HAVE INCLUDED PATCHY FOG IN THESE AREAS THIS MORNING.

AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE SLOWLY ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE
TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS. ASSOCIATED UPPER DIVERGENCE AND
BOUNDARY-LAYER CONVERGENCE WILL PRODUCE BANDS OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. ALSO...INCREASING LOW- LEVEL MOISTURE WILL AID WITH
DESTABLIZING THE AIR-MASS WITH DIURNAL STORMS..ESPECIALLY OVER

THESE STORMS WILL BE LOCALIZED HEAVY DOWNPOURS/URBAN AND SMALL
STREAM FLOODING AND POSSIBLY SMALL HAIL. BEST CHANCE OF STRONG
STORMS WILL BE OVER THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE AREA WHERE MORE
SUNSHINE IS ANTICIPATED.

FOR TONIGHT...PERIODS OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDER ANTICIPATED
WITH THE BEST CHANCE OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST WHICH
WILL BE CLOSER TO THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED A MIX OF MET/MAV MOS TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM /SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY/...WET PATTERN IS EXPECTED TO 
CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS THE WEAK UPPER LOW PRESSURE CENTER 
TRUDGES EASTWARD WITH TIME. BY MONDAY...IT LOOKS LIKE THE UPPER LOW 
WILL BE FAR ENOUGH EAST TO ALLOW SHORT WAVE RIDGING TO BUILD OVER 
THE AREA.  MODEL SOUNDING SHOW SUBSIDENCE INVERSION BUILDING AS WELL 
IN THE 700-800 MB LAYER OVER MOST OF THE AREA BY MONDAY.  THIS 
PATTERN CONTINUES THROUGH TUESDAY...BUT THEN BY WED THE NEXT TROUGH 
IS APPROACHING ALONG WITH ITS ASSOCIATED LIFT.  WILL GO DRY IN MOST 
VALLEY LOCATIONS ON MON AND TUE.  FOR THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...HAVE IT 
DRY MON BUT SOME POPS ON TUE AS RIDGE IS BREAKING DOWN FASTER THAT 
FAR TO THE NORTHWEST.  BY THE END OF THE PERIOD...THIS SYSTEM MAKE 
MAKE IT OUT OF THE AREA...BUT HAVE LEFT SOME LIGHT POPS IN.

FOR TEMPS...WENT ON THE COOL SIDE OF MAX TEMPS ON SAT/SUN 
CONSIDERING EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER...BUT ALSO RELATIVELY COOL 
CONVECTIVE TEMPS...ESPECIALLY ON SATURDAY.  WITH LESS CLOUD COVER ON 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY NIGHT...WENT ON THE COOL SIDE OF MIN TEMPS.  

THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY AROUND FOR THE THREAT OF 
THUNDERSTORMS...BUT THE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY AND/OR WIND SHEAR IN 
THE ATMOSPHERE THIS FAR EAST SHOULD NOT GET OVERLY HIGH DURING THIS 
PERIOD...THEREFORE...THE SEVERE STORM THREAT WILL BE LIMITED. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             81  63  77  64  81 /  50  70  60  50  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  82  62  77  63  82 /  30  60  80  50  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       82  62  75  64  80 /  40  70  70  50  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              82  57  77  59  78 /  40  50  80  50  60

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT THU MAY 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...NOT MUCH CONVECTION AS OF THIS

SLOWLY MOISTEN AND DESTABILIZE THE AIRMASS HERE. INCREASED CHANCES
OF ...MOSTLY... DIURNAL CONVECTION ON FRIDAY...CONTINUING THROUGH
ANOTHER WET WEEKEND. THAT'S RIGHT. MORE ON THAT BELOW.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT
WE WILL REMAIN IN A RATHER UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN THROUGHOUT THE
EXTENDED. HOWEVER...MODELS DO SHOW ENOUGH DIFFERENCES IN DETAIL TO
MAKE TIMING OF CONVECTION A CHALLENGE. FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY...WARM...MOIST AND WEAKLY TO OCCASIONALLY MODERATELY UNSTABLE
AIR WILL BE IN PLACE. A BROAD WARM FRONT TO OUR NORTH THEN A LOW
MOVING THROUGH COMBINED WITH DIURNAL HEATING WILL BE ENOUGH TO
TRIGGER A CHANCE OF CONVECTION EACH PERIOD. CURRENT MODEL RUNS POINT
TO SATURDAY AS BEING OUR BEST CHANCE AT WIDESPREAD CONVECTION WITH
THE PASSAGE OF THE LOW. MONDAY NIGHT WE SHOULD BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS
AND LOOKS TO BE OUR BEST CHANCE AT A DRY PERIOD. A WEAK COLD FRONT
MOVES IN AROUND THE WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME FOR CONTINUED CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

755 
FXUS64 KMRX 160724
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 AM EDT THU MAY 16 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO HELP TRANSPORT A WARM/MOIST
GULF AIRMASS INTO THE REGION TODAY AS AN UPPER-LOW OVER THE MID-
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY PUSHES OUT AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE THAT HAS BEEN
PROMOTING THE SUNNY AND CLEAR CONDITIONS ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE
PAST SEVERAL DAYS. THE COLDER TEMPERATURES ALOFT WILL HELP TO
CREATE SOME INSTABLITY...AND ALLOW FOR SOME SCATTERED DIURNALLY
DRIVEN CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THIS ACTIVITY
MAY ALSO BE AIDED BY SOME LIFT FROM THE AFOREMENETIONED UPPER-LEVEL
DISTURBANCE...SO HAVE INCLUDED AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH
TODAY AND TONIGHT. THE WARM TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE...BUT MAY BE
A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN WEDNESDAY GIVEN THE INCREASED CLOUD COVER
AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES. 

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
A WARM AND MOIST AIRMASS LINGERS THROUGH THE LONG TERM PERIODS
WITH SLIGHT TO MODERATE INSTABILITY. THE CHALLENGE IS CHOOSING
WHICH DAYS HAVE THE BETTER FORCING AND COULD SEE 60 PERCENT OR
HIGHER COVERAGE OF TSRA. MODELS ARE MORE CONSISTENT AND IN BEST
AGREEMENT ON HIGHEST POPS JUSTIFIED FOR SATURDAY AT THIS POINT.
DAYTIME HEATING PLUS A WEAK UPPER LOW SUPPORTS PUSHING POPS UP TO
LIKELY OVER ALL BUT SE TN ON SATURDAY.

OTHERWISE...THE CLOSEST PROXIMITY OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR 
NORTH WILL BE FROM FRIDAY INTO SUNDAY...FAVORING SOMEWHAT HIGHER 
POPS IN GENERAL FOR SW VA AND NE TN. HOWEVER...THE BEST TARGETS FOR 
OPPORTUNITY TO BETTER GFSX MOS POPS DO APPEAR TO BE ON SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY. THUS...STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS FOR THOSE 
PERIODS...WHICH IS 20 PERCENT OR MORE BELOW THE 16/00Z GFSX MOS POPS.

WEDNESDAY IS NOW TRENDING WETTER WITH A POTENTIAL COLD FRONT 
APPROACHING...BUT STILL QUITE EARLY TO BUY HEAVILY INTO THIS TIMING. 
KEPT POPS AROUND 40 TO 50 PERCENT WHICH IS VERY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE.
THE THREAT OF ANY ORGANIZED STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS IS VERY LOW AT 
THIS TIME...PENDING THE DEVELOPMENT AND TIMING OF THE COLD FRONT 
EARLY TO MID NEXT WEEK. 

CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE 16/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS...EXCEPT FOR AREAS WITH 
HIGHEST POPS OVER THE WEEKEND.

FXUS64 KMRX 151912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT WED MAY 15 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...PATTERN CHANGING TO WARMER 
MORE SUMMER LIKE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS UPPER LEVEL SUBTROPICAL 
RIDGE CONTINUES TONIGHT. AT MID AFTERNOON SKIES REMAIN SUNNY AND 
TEMPERATURES ARE AT OR A LITTLE ABOVE NORMAL IN THE UPPER 70S TO MID 
80S. SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLE MODELS DEVELOP WEAK UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
PRESSURE AREA OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TONIGHT AND MOVE IT EAST WITH 
SHOWERS AND STORMS FORMING ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE BY MORNING. THE 
FORECAST AREA WILL REMAIN DRY BUT CLOUDS WILL INCREASE FROM WEST TO 
EAST LATE TONIGHT. THE MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW AROUND THE WEAK LOW WILL 
HELP INCREASE MOISTURE AND WITH MODERATE INSTABILITY THE CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL INCREASE THURSDAY NORTH AND ALL AREAS 
FRIDAY AS THE UPPER LOW BECOMES ABROAD TROUGH WITH EVEN MORE
COVERAGE FRIDAY. THE BEST RAIN CHANCES WILL BE LATE AFTERNOON AND
EVENING AFTER PEAK HEATING.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WEAK UPPER LEVEL
TROUGH SLIDES INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION OVER THE WEEKEND
WHILE A WEAK SYNOPTIC BOUNDARY TRIES TO DROP SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO
VALLEY INTO NORTHERN REACHES OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. MID
SPRING SEASON HEATING IS UNDERWAY NOW SO CONVECTION WILL BE THE
MODE OF PRECIPITATION. WENT WITH A LITTLE HIGHER CHANCE POPS ON
SATURDAY AS BOUNDARY EDGES A LITTLE FARTHER SOUTH WITH UPPER TROUGH
OVER THE AREA. THE WEAKNESS IN THE UPPER LEVEL HEIGHT FIELD DOESN'T
SHIFT EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS UNTIL MONDAY SO MAINTAINED MEDIUM
CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION ON SUNDAY. BY MONDAY THE FORECAST AREA IS
IN BETWEEN SYSTEMS WITH A NICE AMPLIFIED RIDGE IN PLACE AND
THEREFORE DOWNPLAYED PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION AT THIS TIME.
GRADUALLY TWEAKED POPS UP TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AS GENERAL MODEL
AGREEMENT WAS NOTED WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY
TUESDAY AHEAD OF A PLAINS STORM SYSTEM. THE UPPER TROUGH BUILDS
INTO THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION BY WEDNESDAY WITH A SYNOPTIC
FRONTAL BOUNDARY FORCING AN AREA OF CONVECTION ACROSS THE REGION
PERHAPS LATER TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. STAYED AROUND THE
MIDDLE OF A MEX/ECM MOS BLEND FOR TEMPERATURES.

893 
FXUS64 KMRX 150645
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT WED MAY 15 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL SUBTROPICAL RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO PROMOTE BEAUTIFUL
WEATHER ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION
TODAY. WITH ABUNDANT SUNSHINE...A PREVAILING SOUTHWEST FLOW AND
INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES...HIGHS TODAY WILL BE EVEN WARMER
/REACHING THE MID TO UPPER 80S IN MANY LOCATIONS ACROSS THE CENTRAL
AND SOUTHERN VALLEY/. AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL TRACK EASTWARD OVERNIGHT AND TRIGGER SOME
SHOWERS AND STORMS ACROSS WESTERN TENNESSEE. HOWEVER...LOCATIONS
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL REMAIN DRY...THOUGH CLOUD
COVER WILL INCREASE FROM WEST TO EAST AFTER MIDNIGHT /PROMOTING
MILDER LOWS IN THE MID TO UPPER 50S/. 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/... UPPER RIDGE HOLDS ACROSS
SE STATES UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AND SLIGHT
TO MODERATE INSTABILITY. HOWEVER...APPEARS THAT THE BETTER FOCUS
FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT WILL BE THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR
NORTH ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THUS...DID NOT ADJUST RAIN
CHANCES MUCH UNTIL SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WHEN THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY
SAGS SOUTH INTO SE KY TO THE CAROLINAS. WAS TEMPTED TO GO LIKELY
FOR POPS BY THE WEEKEND...NOTING THE INCREASING GFSX MOS POPS TO
LIKELY ACROSS THE BOARD FOR BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.
HOWEVER...NUDGED POPS UP TO HIGH CHANCE WITH SCATTERED WORDING FOR
NOW...WITH THE OPTION FOR DAY SHIFT TO PUSH POPS UP TO LOW END OF
LIKELY IF MODELS ARE CONSISTENT.

FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...BOUNDARY LIFTS NORTH AS A WARM FRONT MONDAY... 
LEAVING GENERALLY DIURNAL CONVECTION FOR MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.
CHANCE POPS ALREADY IN THE GRIDS FOR THOSE PERIODS AND LOOKS GOOD 
FOR NOW. GFS AND ECMWF DIFFER ON TIMING OF A COLD FRONT ON TUESDAY
SO BEST TO STICK WITH CHANCE POPS FOR A FEW MORE MODEL RUNS.

TEMPS STAY ON THE MILD TO WARM SIDE WITH LITTLE TARGETS OF 
OPPORTUNITY TO IMPROVE ON GFSX MOS...SO PREVIOUS MAX/MIN TEMP GRIDS 
WERE ADJUSTED VERY CLOSE TO THE 15/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

334 
FXUS64 KMRX 141845
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT TUE MAY 14 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE
AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT HAS SETTLED OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES THIS
AFTERNOON. A FEW WARM ADVECTION CLOUDS MOVED ACROSS THE NORTHERN
SECTIONS THIS MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON BUT SKIES NOW ARE MOSTLY
CLEAR. AT MID AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE UPPER 60S TO MID
70S WITH THE PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENING BETWEEN A SURFACE LOW IN
SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA AND HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE GULF COAST. LOWS
TONIGHT WILL BE MUCH WARMER IN THE 50S WITH SOME LIGHT SOUTHWEST
WINDS CONTINUING. WEDNESDAY WITH DRY AIR MASS STILL IN PLACE...FULL
SUN AND SOUTHWEST WINDS TEMPERATURES WILL REACH WELL INTO THE 80S.
DEW POINTS SHOULD STAY IN THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S WITH RH VALUES
AS LOW AS 25 PERCENT IN THE MOUNTAINS. WINDS HOWEVER WILL NOT BE
STRONG ENOUGH FOR RED FLAG CONDITIONS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...AFTER A DRY START 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...MOISTURE WILL BE INCREASING ACROSS THE AREA AS A 
WEAK UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES AND A WEAK COLD FRONT SAGS SOUTH TOWARD 
THE AREA THURSDAY.  THE FRONT IS NOT EXPECTED TO MAKE IT THIS FAR 
SOUTH HOWEVER. WHILE CAPE VALUES ARE EXPECTED TO STAY LOW...AND 
FORCING IS EXPECTED TO BE WEAK...STILL LOOKS LIKE CHANCE POPS ARE 
WARRANTED NORTH AND SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. LATEST GFS/CMC MODELS SHOW A 
SHORT WAVE BRUSHING NORTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA SATURDAY/SAT 
NIGHT...SO WILL CARRY HIGHEST POPS NORTH BOTH PERIODS.  UPPER RIDGE 
FORECAST TO BE OVER THE AREA LATE IN THE PERIOD...BUT WITH MOISTURE 
FORECAST TO LINGER OVER THE AREA SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WILL KEEP 
SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS GOING. FORECAST CONFIDENCE NO 
BETTER THAN AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR GIVEN MODEL 
INCONSISTENCIES AND UNCERTAINTY IN STRENGTH/TIMING OF ANY SMALLER 
SCALE FEATURES WHICH MAY TRIGGER CONVECTION. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             57  86  59  83  59 /   0  10  10  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  58  85  60  82  59 /   0  10  10  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  85  59  83  58 /   0  10  10  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              50  84  54  80  53 /   0  10  10  30  20

762 
FXUS64 KMRX 140745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT TUE MAY 14 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SCATTERED MID TO HIGH CLOUDS ARE 
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP TOWARD DAYBREAK...BUT CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT 
WINDS WILL AID THE DEVELOPMENT OF PATCHY FROST ACROSS SW VA/NE TN 
AND COUNTIES ALONG THE TN-NC LINE. ADDED OUR SW NC COUNTIES PLUS ERN 
PARTS OF POLK AND MONROE COUNTIES TO THE FROST ADVISORY FOR THIS 
MORNING. 

OTHERWISE...NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF CHANGES MADE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS... 
AS THE UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD EASTWARD THROUGH TONIGHT. THE 
SURFACE RIDGE WILL SLIP EAST AND ALLOW A SW GRADIENT TO STRENGTHEN 
INTO WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL MEAN MUCH MILDER MIN TEMPS TONIGHT...WHICH 
FAVORS THE NAM MOS MINS OVER THE COOLER GFS MOS. EXPECTING MAX TEMPS 
TODAY TO BE ABOUT 4 TO 8 DEGREES WARMER THAN MONDAY.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...AN UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL
BUILD INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY... PROMOTING SOME OF THE WARMEST
TEMPERATURES OF THE SPRING AS THE MERCURY SHOULD CLIMB INTO THE MID
TO UPPER 80S IN MANY LOCATIONS /ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE
CENTRAL/SOUTHERN VALLEY/. WHILE THE INFLUENCE OF HIGH PRESSURE
REMAINS INTACT LATE THIS WEEK INTO NEXT WEEK...SOME GULF MOISTURE
WILL GET PULLED UP INTO THE REGION BY THURSDAY. THIS WILL COINCIDE
WITH A SERIES OF UPPER-WAVES THAT WILL PROPAGATE ACROSS THE OHIO
VALLEY ON THE NORTHERN PERIPHERY OF THE AFOREMENTIONED RIDGE.
THIS...ALONG WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME DIURNALLY DRIVEN
CONVECTION WILL GIVEN THE REGION A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. SOME BETTER CHANCES MAY BE IN
STORE FOR MONDAY AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE REGION.
HOWEVER...BASED ON MODEL FLUCTUATIONS THAT FAR OUT... OPTED TO BE
CAUTIOUS ON RAISING POPS TOO HIGH ATTM. OTHERWISE... TEMPERATURES
WILL CONTINUE TO BE ON THE WARM SIDE...GENERALLY REACHING THE UPPER
70S TO MID 80S DURING THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             81  57  86  59  82 /   0   0  10  10  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  79  59  85  60  80 /   0   0  10  10  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       79  57  85  59  80 /   0   0  10  10  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              75  50  83  54  78 /   0   0  10  10  30 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FROST ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...FROST ADVISORY UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     EAST POLK...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JOHNSON...NORTHWEST 
     CARTER...NORTHWEST GREENE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...
     SULLIVAN...UNICOI...WASHINGTON TN.

025 
FXUS64 KMRX 131832
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
232 PM EDT MON MAY 13 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER 
FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND WILL SETTLE OVER THE REGION AS DEEP 
UPPER TROUGH FOR THIS LATE IN THE SPRING SHIFTS INTO THE NE STATES 
TONIGHT. SOME LIGHT SOUTHWEST WINDS TONIGHT SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES 
UP OVER WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA AND ALSO ACROSS MUCH 
OF SW VA. MODELS HINTING AT SOME MID LEVEL CLOUDS COMING IN AFTER 
ABOUT 6Z WHICH COULD AFFECT FALLING TEMPERATURES LATER TONIGHT. ONLY 
A FEW SPOTS ACROSS NE TN...SW VA AND EXTREME EASTERN MOUNTAIN 
VALLEYS SHOULD DECOUPLE ENOUGH FOR TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE MID 
AND UPPER 30S. THINK THERE WILL BE EVEN LESS AREA AFFECTED BY FROST 
TONIGHT SO WILL NOT ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY BUT KEEP IT IN THE 
WORDING IN THE ABOVE MENTIONED AREAS.

GENERALLY HAVE TEMPERATURES A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER IN THE NORMALLY 
COLD SPOTS TONIGHT AND UP TO 5 DEGREES WARMER ELSEWHERE. TUESDAY 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTER SHIFTS EAST WITH GOOD SOUTHWEST FLOW WARMING 
TEMPERATURES ABOUT 10 DEGREES ABOVE TODAYS EXPECTED HIGHS. THE 
COOLER MET GUIDANCE WAS FOLLOWED WITH HIGHS NEAR 70 HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SW VA TO NEAR 80 AT CHA. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE AND 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD PROVIDE DRY CONDITIONS INTO WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.  MODELS SHOW INCREASED MOISTURE FROM THURSDAY THROUGH THE END 
OF THE PERIOD.  MODELS DO NOT AGREE ON THE DETAILS...BUT A BROAD AND 
SHALLOW UPPER TROUGH FORECAST TO TRAVERSE THE AREA...THEN PERHAPS 
SOME BRIEF RIDGING SUNDAY AHEAD OF A MORE SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH 
AND COLD FRONT THAT MAY BE APPROACHING BY MONDAY.  GIVEN THE 
UNCERTAINTY OF ANY SMALLER SCALE FEATURES BUT WITH THE INCREASED 
MOISTURE IN PLACE...WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE/LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY TIME 
FRAME.  FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS ABOVE AVERAGE EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD...BUT FALLS A BIT BELOW AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR BY THE 
END OF THE PERIOD.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             45  81  58  86  60 /   0   0   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  44  79  59  85  61 /   0   0   0  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       43  79  57  86  60 /   0   0   0  10  10

471 
FXUS64 KMRX 130750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT MON MAY 13 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...NICE WEATHER IN STORE AFTER
SOME PATCHY FROST THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...07Z TEMPS WERE IN GENERAL
RUNNING ABOUT 2 TO 4 DEGREES ABOVE HOURLY GRIDS...EVEN WHERE WINDS
WERE CALM AND NO CLOUDS. OUTLYING RURAL AREAS PROBABLY DROP ENOUGH
TO HAVE AT LEAST PATCHY FROST BY DAYBREAK...SO WILL KEEP THE FROST
ADVISORY GOING THROUGH 9AM EDT. 

FROST STILL THE ONLY WEATHER STORY FOR TONIGHT...WITH MINS TONIGHT
NOT AS COOL THEN MUCH WARMER BY TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE SURFACE RIDGE
MOVES FURTHER SE. TIME HEIGHTS AND SOUNDINGS SHOW A SLIGHT INCREASE
IN MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS AFTER 06Z TUESDAY...SO NOT LIKELY TO
SEE ENOUGH FROST TO WARRANT ISSUING ANOTHER FROST ADVISORY AT THIS
POINT. 

OTHERWISE...WENT QUITE CLOSE TO GFS MOS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY.
FAVORED THE COOLER MINS JUST WHERE PATCHY FROST WAS POSSIBLE AND
MILDER MOS MINS IN WRN AND SRN AREAS...WHERE SOME WEAK LOW LEVEL
WARMING OCCURS LATE TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...AFTER ANOTHER COOL MORNING
ON TUESDAY...WARM-UP BEGINS WITH VALLEY HIGHS OF 75-80 TUESDAY
AFTERNOON. MUCH MORE SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES FOLLOW WITH WITH
VALLEY LOWS IN THE 50S AND 60S AND HIGHS IN THE 80S FOR THE REST OF
THE PERIOD. DRY WEATHER THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT BEFORE A LESS
AMPLIFIED AND MORE UNSETTLED PATTERN TAKES HOLD. THUS FROM THURSDAY
ONWARD...EXPECT SOMETHING OF A DIURNAL PATTERN OF MOSTLY SCATTERED
CONVECTION.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  45  81  58  85 /   0   0  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  67  43  79  58  84 /   0   0  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       68  42  78  57  84 /   0   0  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              64  35  76  51  83 /   0   0  10  10  10 

&&

782 
FXUS64 KMRX 121910
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT SUN MAY 12 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...PATCHY FROST IS POSSIBLE
TONIGHT AS OVERNIGHT MINS WILL APPROACH THE LOWER TO MID 30S ACROSS
THE MAJORITY OF OUR CWA. THE BIG QUESTION IS STILL THE WINDS. WINDS
MAY BE RELUCTANT TO DROP OFF COMPLETELY WHICH MAY PROHIBIT
WIDESPREAD FROST DEVELOPMENT. IF THE WINDS DO NOT COMPLETELY
SUBSIDE...THEN FROST WILL LIKELY BE MORE LOCALIZED TO SHELTERED
AREAS THAT ARE PROTECTED FROM WINDS. SOUNDINGS INDICATE ELEVATIONS
ABOVE 4500 FEET WILL SEE NEAR FREEZING TEMPS WHILE AREAS AROUND
5000 FEET WILL APPROACH THE UPPER 20S. MINS TONIGHT WILL BE CHILLY
ENOUGH TO BE CLOSE TO RECORD LOWS FOR MAY 13TH.

A PLEASANT DAY IS IN STORE FOR MONDAY. HIGHER PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO 
BUILD IN AS THE DEEP LONG-WAVE TROUGH PUSHES FURTHER EAST. 
HOWEVER...TEMPS ARE STILL EXPECTED TO BE ROUGHLY 10 DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD UPPER TROUGH 
SHIFTS EAST TO OFF THE EAST COAST BY TUESDAY. ONE MORE COLD NIGHT 
MONDAY NIGHT WITH LOWS MID TO UPPER 30S SHELTERED HIGHER VALLEYS IN 
THE MOUNTAINS AND NE TN AND SW VA. COULD BE A LITTLE MORE FROST 
EARLY TUESDAY THEN MUCH WARMER TEMPERATURES AS RIDGING ALOFT OVER 
THE WESTERN STATES SHIFTS EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA. A WEAK WARM 
FRONT PASSES THROUGH TUESDAY WHICH MAY PRODUCE SOME LOW AND MOSTLY 
MID LEVEL CLOUDINESS BUT NO SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL. EVEN WARMER 
TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY IN THE MID 80S AND CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS. 
HIGH PRESSURE AREA CENTER SHIFTS EAST AND SOUTHEAST TO THE EASTERN 
GULF COAST WITH A GOOD SOUTHERLY FLOW OF MOISTURE. DEWPOINTS WILL 
RISE AND THERE WILL BE A CHANCE OF MAINLY DIURNAL SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FROM THURSDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EDT SUN MAY 12 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHOWERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE
COLD FRONT THIS MORNING HAD DISSIPATED EXCEPT FOR SE KY AND SW VA. 
NOT MUCH MORE THAN A FEW SPRINKLES THIS MORNING...ALTHO EARLY
RISERS THIS MORNING WILL NOTE THE PASSING CLOUDS. SUNSHINE WILL BE
WELCOMED...BUT MAX TEMPS ARE LIKELY TO RUN ABOUT 10 DEGREES BELOW
NORMALS FOR MID MAY. WENT CLOSE TO THE COOLER MOS FOR HIGHS GIVEN
THE COOLING OF 850 MB TEMPS FROM YESTERDAY.

AREAS OF FROST STILL ARE EXPECTED FOR TONIGHT...ALTHO WINDS MAY BE
RELUCTANT TO DROP OFF COMPLETELY. ALSO...THERE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR
A FEW CLOUDS TO LINGER OVER SW VA AND NE TN. THUS...I KEPT MIN
TEMPS CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR TONIGHT WITH AREAS OF FROST
MENTIONED. HOWEVER...PER COORDINATION WILL DEFER A FROST ADVISORY
TO THE DAY SHIFT. MINS TONIGHT WILL BE CHILLY ENOUGH TO BE CLOSE TO
RECORD LOWS FOR MAY 13TH. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE AREA MONDAY WHICH WILL RESULT IN BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. THE THREAT OF FROST OF WILL OCCUR 
AGAIN MONDAY NIGHT ESPECIALLY OVER NE TN AND SW VA...AS WELL AS 
HIGHER ELEVATION OF THE SMOKYS.

UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL OCCUR TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. A RETURN TO 
NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED TUESDAY. RAIN CHANCES WILL 
REMAIN NEAR ZERO HOWEVER LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE ON THE INCREASE 
BY WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF A SHORTWAVE TRANSLATING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS. BY THURSDAY...AFTERNOON INSTABILITY WILL INCREASE CHANCES OF 
THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK AND POSSIBLY 
INTO SATURDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EDT SAT MAY 11 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...FOR TONIGHT...A DEEP LONG-WAVE
TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO SINK SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.
AN ASSOCIATED SECONDARY COLD FRONT WILL ACCOMPANY THE TROUGH AND
APPROACH OUR AREA AROUND THE 06Z TIME-FRAME. SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
REMAIN IN PLACE ACROSS THE NORTHERN AREAS WITH LOW END CHANCE POPS
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA IN ANTICIPATION OF FRONTAL PASSAGE. ANY
PRECIP THAT FALLS WOULD BE VERY LIGHT. NOT OVERLY CONFIDENT THAT
PRECIP WILL EVEN DEVELOP AS LIFT IS LACKING. WOULD NOT RULE OUT
SOME PATCHY AREAS OF FOG LATE TONIGHT...MAINLY WHERE RAIN OCCURS
TODAY. HOWEVER...WITH WINDS EXPECTED TO STAY UP AND LINGERING CLOUD
COVER...FOG SHOULDN'T BE A BIG ISSUE. TOMORROW LOOKS TO BE A MUCH
NICER DAY AS DRIER AND CLEARER CONDITIONS RETURN AS THE FRONT WILL
BE OFF TO OUR EAST. HOWEVER...COOLER AIR WILL SPILL IN BEHIND THE
FRONT...RESULTING IN MAX TEMPS ROUGHLY 10 T0 15 DEGREES BELOW
NORMAL ON SUNDAY.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
PERIOD STARTS OFF UNSEASONABLY COOL...MAY BE LOOKING AT PATCHY FROST 
MONDAY MORNING AND TUESDAY MORNING. NEAR RECORD LOWS ESPECIALLY 
MONDAY MORNING...LESS POSSIBLE FOR TUESDAY MORNING. WARM UP OCCURS 
TOWARD MIDWEEK WITH TEMPS FLIRTING WITH LOWER 80S. RIDGE WILL SLOWLY 
BREAKDOWN AND ALLOW DIFFUSE TROUGHING ALOFT...WITH MAINLY SCATTERED 
CONVECTION FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY.

AGAIN...MAINLY IMPACTING FROM TYS AND NORTH. THERE COULD BE A SPOTTY 
SHOWER OR TWO WITH THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE...ESPECIALLY TOWARD TRI...BUT 
CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO INCLUDE IN THIS ISSUANCE. TRI COULD

541 
FXUS64 KMRX 110729
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EDT SAT MAY 11 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FEW SHOWERS CONTINUE OVER THE
PLATEAU...SE KY AND SW VA AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. BETTER COVERAGE
OF CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION WAS NOTED ALONG THE COLD FRONT...AND
MODELS GENERALLY SUPPORT LIKELY POPS FOR TODAY OVER SW VA AND NE
TN. PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS RELFECTED THIS VERY WELL AND WERE
CLOSELY FOLLOWED. SOUNDINGS SUGGEST A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS WITH
HIGHER INSTABILITY THIS MORNING INTO THE EARLY AFTERNOON HOURS.
UNDERCUT MAX TEMPS JUST A COUPLE OF DEGREES OR SO...ALTHO MILD MINS
WERE IN PLACE AT 07Z ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

FOR TONIGHT...A MENTION OF SHOWERS AFTER 12/06Z MAY NOT BE NEEDED
AND LATER SHIFTS MAY BE ABLE TO DROP THE SHOWERS. WOULD NOT RULE
OUT SOME PATCHY AREAS OF FOG LATE TONIGHT...MAINLY WHERE RAIN
OCCURS TODAY. THE DEGREE OF CLEARING IS REASONABLE FOR ALL BUT NE
AREAS...AND THE SIMILAR MOS MINS LOOKED ON TRACK. 
 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...DRY NORTHWEST FLOW AND 
SURFACE RIDGING WILL START THE EXTENDED FORECAST FOR SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY. MAIN CONCERN WILL BE PATCHY/AREAS OF FROST ACROSS MOST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND NORTHEAST SECTIONS/MOUNTAINS FOR 
MONDAY NIGHT.

BY TUESDAY...THE SURFACE RIDGE MOVES EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WITH
RETURN OF SOUTHERLY FLOW PRODUCING WARM AIR ADVECTION AND WEAK
ISENTROPIC LIFT. HAVE INCREASED CLOUD COVER FOR TUESDAY AND
WEDNEDAY..BUT CHANCE OF SHOWERS ARE MINIMAL DUE TO LACK OF GULF
MOISTURE RETURN.

FOR THURSDAY...GULF MOISTURE FINALLY MOVES INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
WITH INSTABILITY AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT PRODUCING ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
(HIGH TERRAIN) DURING THE AFTERNOON/EVENING. FOR FRIDAY...COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA WITH CHANCE OF STORMS AREA-WIDE. ONCE TIMING 
OF FROPA BECOMES CLEARER...CHANCES OF CONVECTION WILL INCREASE FOR 
LATE IN THE WEEK.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFX MOS THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT FRI MAY 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...ABOVE NORMAL LAYER 
MOISTURE CONTINUES IN A WEAKLY DEFINED PATTERN. SHORT WAVE CURRENTLY 
MOVING NE ACROSS NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU PROVIDING MARGIN LIFT 
FOR AFTERNOON/EVENING CONVECTION. COVERAGE AND CONVECTIVE STRENGTH 
SHOULD LESSER OVERNIGHT AS THIS FEATURE PULLS AWAY. WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY MOVES SE AND MOVES THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY. SUFFICIENT 
LIFT AND MOISTURE KEEPS PRECIPITATION THREAT GOING INTO SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON. UPPER TROUGHING CONTINUES TO DIG INTO TN VALLEY SATURDAY 
NIGHT. SECONDARY SURFACE BOUNDARY ALSO APPROACHES THE AREA LATE 
SATURDAY NIGHT WITH A CONTINUED THREAT OF SCATTERED SHOWERS MAINLY 
ACROSS NE AREAS. LEANED ON THE WARM SIDE OF MIN TEMPERATURE MOS 
SINCE LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES HOLD UP THROUGH THE PERIOD. WENT ON 
THE COOL SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE FOR SATURDAYS HIGH EXPECTING GOOD 
CLOUD COVER.    

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
PERIOD STARTS OFF COOL...MAY BE LOOKING AT PATCHY FROST MONDAY 
MORNING AND TUESDAY MORNING. RIDGING OVER THE AREA DURING TUES/WED 
TIME FRAME MAY SEE WEAK DISTURBANCES IN THE NW FLOW OVER OUR FAR NE 
AREAS...AND MAYBE ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION OVER THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU. OTHERWISE...THE GRADUAL APPROACH OF THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM 
HAS DIFFICULTIES WITH MODEL TIMING AT THIS MOMENT...SO WILL CONTINUE 
TO KEEP IN LATE WEEK SLGT CHC OR CHC POPS.

379 
FXUS64 KMRX 100650
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EDT FRI MAY 10 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONVECTION OCCURRING OVER THE 
LOWER MS VALLEY REGION HAS A CHANCE TO REACH OUR WRN MOST COUNTIES 
TOWARD DAYBREAK. HOWEVER...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT ON THIS 
ACTIVITY WEAKENING...SO I SLOWED DOWN THE ONSET OF SHOWERS AND TSRA 
A BIT. FORECAST SOUNDINGS ARE UNSTABLE THROUGHOUT THE DAY AND ALSO
TONIGHT...SO CARRIED TSRA EXCEPT FOR A FEW HOURS EARLY TODAY.  

PATCHY DENSE FOG HAS SET IN AT TRI AND MAY ALSO BE OCCURRING OVER 
OTHER PARTS OF NE TN INTO SW VA...MAINLY WHERE THE SPOTTY CONVECTION 
OCCURRED ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON OR EVENING. ADDED PATCHY DENSE FOG TO 
WEATHER GRIDS TO ABOUT 14Z TODAY. 

CLOUDS ON THE INCREASE WILL AFFECT MAX TEMP...BUT IF CONVECTION DOES 
DISSIPATE THERE WILL BE ENOUGH SUNSHINE TO REACH THE SIMILAR MOS MAX 
TEMPS. CLOSELY FOLLOWED THE GFS MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODEL AGREEMENT HAS
BEEN TRENDING POORER AS HAS CONSISTENCY...SO THE LONG TERM PERIOD
STARTS OUT WITH A BIT ABOVE AVERAGE FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THIS
TIME OF YEAR BUT THEN GRADUALLY DIPS TO SLIGHTLY BELOW AVERAGE BY
THE END OF THE PERIOD. A COLD FRONT WILL EXIT THE AREA
SATURDAY...TO BE FOLLOWED BY A SECONDARY COLD FRONT LATE SATURDAY
NIGHT. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EARLY
SATURDAY THEN TRENDING DRIER DURING THE DAY. THE SECONDARY COLD
FRONT WILL NOT HAVE A LOT OF MOISTURE TO WORK WITH SO JUST SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS SOUTH TO LOW CHANCE NORTH LATE SAT NIGHT.
MAY BE A LINGERING SHOWER EAST EARLY SUNDAY...THEN SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BE BUILDING IN LATER SUNDAY INTO MONDAY TO BE
FOLLOWED BY AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BY MIDWEEK. IT WILL BE COOL SUNDAY
AND MONDAY THEN THERE WILL BE A WARMING TREND. SOME UNCERTAINTY IN
TIMING WITH GFS MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN ECMWF...BUT NEXT SYSTEM MAY BE
APPROACHING BY THE END OF THE PERIOD SO WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR
THU.

&&

GENERATING THE ISOLATED/SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS THE REGION RECENTLY 
IS SLOWLY EXITING THE AREA.  ANY LINGERING SHOWERS SHOULD END BY 
SUNRISE AND WILL THEREFORE KEEP THE FORECAST DRY FOR THE MORNING 
HOURS.  HOWEVER...WITH THE ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE NOW IN 
PLACE...AREAS OF FOG WILL DEVELOP BY SUNRISE.  LOCALLY DENSE FOG IS 
POSSIBLE BUT ALL SHOULD DISSIPATE AROUND MID MORNING.  THROUGHOUT THE 
DAY...MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL INVADE FROM THE WEST IN ADVANCE 
OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT.  THE AIR MASS WILL BECOMING WEAKLY 
UNSTABLE AND MAY SEE SOME ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION DEVELOP DURING 
THE AFTERNOON.  AS THE FRONT MOVES CLOSER OVERNIGHT...A FEW SHOWERS 
MAY DEVELOP OVER THE AREA IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT TOWARDS MORNING.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN FAIR 
AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY IS NOT TOO BAD...SO AVERAGE 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THE LONG TERM.  A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH 
APPROACH FRIDAY AND WILL PUSH THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY.  WITH QUITE 
A BIT OF MOISTURE TO WORK WITH AND SOME INSTABILITY STILL LOOKS LIKE 
LIKELY POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WARRANTED FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
INTO SATURDAY.  DRIER AND COOLER AIR WILL BE MOVING IN SUNDAY SO 
JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS EASTERN ZONES EARLY.  SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE FORECAST TO BE IN CONTROL FOR THE MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
PERIOD WITH DRY WEATHER EXPECTED...STARTING OUT ON THE COOL SIDE 
MONDAY THEN GRADUALLY WARMING THROUGH WEDNESDAY.


&&

MASS. WAS TEMPTED TO RAISE MIN TEMPS...PER PRESENT DEW POINTS...BUT
THINK FORMATION OF FOG WILL LOWER DEW POINTS ALLOWING MIN TEMPS TO
BE REACHED.

133 
FXUS64 KMRX 081829
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
211 PM EDT WED MAY 8 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...AREA CONTINUES TO BE UNDER THE 
INFLUENCE OF DEPARTING UPPER LOW THIS EVENING. WRAP AROUND MOISTURE
COUPLED WITH DIFFERENTIAL HEATING AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WILL KEEP 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION GOING INTO THE EVENING HOURS. TONIGHT...AFTER 
THE SHOWERS TAPER OFF AND THE CLOUD COVER DECREASES...FOG 
DEVELOPMENT APPEARS LIKELY...POSSIBLY BECOMING WIDESPREAD AND 
LOCALLY DENSE BY THURSDAY MORNING. WINDS WILL BECOME LIGHT AND 
BOUNDARY LAYER REACHES SATURATION. LOW TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR 
NORMAL. AIRMASS BECOMES SIGNIFICANTLY DRIER ON THURSDAY WITH GOOD 
WARM UP. MAX TEMPS A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. ISOLATED AFTERNOON 
CONVECTION POSSIBLE ACROSS ELEVATED AREAS THURSDAY.  

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
IN THE WAKE OF A BRIEF BOUT OF UPPER-RIDGING ON THURSDAY ANOTHER 
UPPER-TROUGH WILL DROP INTO THE OHIO VALLEY ON FRIDAY...PUSHING A 
COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION. THIS FRONT WILL SERVE IS A FOCUS FOR 
SOME ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON FRIDAY AND PERHAPS INTO 
SATURDAY DEPENDING ON THE TIMING. THE GFS AND ECMWF ARE SLIGHT MORE 
AGGRESSIVE WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...SHOWING A BULK OF THE 
PRECIPITATION EXITING THE REGION BY SATURDAY MORNING/MIDDAY. THE NAM 
IS A BIT SLOWER...SHOWING SOME HEAVIER ROUNDS OF SHOWERS LINGERING 
ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING. GIVEN THAT ALL SOLUTIONS 
INDICATE A GOOD POTENTIAL FOR PRECIPITATION FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND 
NIGHT...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY AREAWIDE AND WAS A LITTLE 
SLOWER ON CLEARING THEM ON SATURDAY. A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS ALONG 
WITH SOME COOLER CONDITIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE ON SUNDAY AS A 
SECONDARY WAVE MOVES THROUGH IN RESPONSE TO A STRONG STORM SYSTEM 
TRACKING ACROSS SOUTHERN CANADA. HOWEVER...HEADING INTO NEXT WEEK 
DRIER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED AS AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS BEGINS TO MOVE 
BY TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...WITH SOME WARMER TEMPERATURES POSSIBLE BY 
THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

AND NORTHEAST TN WHICH WILL BE CLOSER TO THE LOW. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES 
ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...ONE TROUGH LEADS TO 
ANOTHER. AFTER BOWLING BALL LOW LEAVES THE U.S. THURSDAY...NEXT EAST 
COAST TROUGH BUILDS IN FROM CANADA BEGINNING THIS WEEKEND AND 
REMAINS ENTRENCHED UNTIL TUESDAY. BEYOND OUR FORECAST PERIOD...BRIEF 
RIDGING FOR THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK WILL SURRENDER TO YET ANOTHER 
EAST COAST TROUGH BY NEXT FRIDAY.

BEST CHANCE OF RAIN IS EXPECTED FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY AS COLD 
FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THE WEEKEND TROUGH WILL DRAW UP GULF MOISTURE 
AHEAD OF IT. ONCE THIS SYSTEM CLEARS OUT AND THE COOLER AIR 
INVADES...LOOKING AT MOSTLY FAIR WEATHER JUST IN TIME FOR THAT 
ANTICIPATED NEW WORK WEEK.

965 
FXUS64 KMRX 061849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EDT MON MAY 6 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
THIS AFTERNOON...A LINGERING UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN VALLEY CONTINUES TO PROMOTE WIDESPREAD
CLOUD COVER AND COOLER TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
REGION. HOWEVER...SOME DRY AIR HAS BEEN ENTRAINED INTO THE CENTER
OF THE LOW...RESULTING IN SOME PARTIAL CLEARING/HEATING ACROSS MUCH
OF THE CENTRAL/NORTHERN VALLEY TODAY. THIS HAS ALLOWED TEMPERATURES
TO CLIMB INTO THE MID 60S IN THIS AREA...COINCIDING WITH A
CONFLUENT BOUNDARY EVIDENT ACROSS FAR EASTERN KY/SOUTHWEST
VS/NORTHEAST TN AND INTO CENTRAL NC. GIVEN THE DESTABILIZATION OF
THE BOUNDARY LAYER TAKING PLACE /WITH SB/MU CAPES AOA 500-1000
J/KG/ AND THE BOUNDARY IN PLACE...SOME ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS ARE
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNSET. SOME HAIL WILL
BE POSSIBLE WITH THE STRONGEST STORMS /PERHAPS SOME GETTING UP TO
LOW-END SEVERE LEVELS/ GIVEN THE COLD TEMPERATURES ALOFT AND STEEP
LAPSE RATES.

AFTER SUNSET...SOME DECENT CHANCES FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL
LINGER /PARTICULARLY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS/ AS THE UPPER-LOW
GRADUALLY ATTEMPTS TO DRIFT EASTWARD LATER TONIGHT AND INTO THE DAY
ON TUESDAY. ADDITIONAL GOOD CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL
EXIST TOMORROW ACROSS THE REGION AS WELL...PARTICULARLY ALONG THE
SAME FAVORED AREA AS TODAY. HIGHS ON TUESDAY MAY BE A TAD
WARMER...MAINLY ALONG THE SOUTHERN ZONES THIS TIME...BUT WILL REACH
THE 60S AREAWIDE.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND
INDICATE THAT THE CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW WILL SLOWLY DRIFT
NORTHEASTWARD AWAY FROM THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY. A WARM AND
HUMID AIR MASS WILL THEN LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY
AND THURSDAY...WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING EACH
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THUS...EXPECT SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION
EACH OF THESE DAY. CONVECTION SHOULD INCREASE IN AREAL COVERAGE BY
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION...AND PUSHES A COLD FRONT INTO THE
FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY WITH ANOTHER SECONDARY FRONT ON SUNDAY
MORNING. DRY AND UNSEASONABLY COOL CONDITIONS WILL THEN RETURN FOR
EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY COMPROMISED THROUGHOUT
THE EXTENDED PERIOD BETWEEN THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS AND THE COOLER
ECMWF GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

&&

244 
FXUS64 KMRX 061503 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1103 AM EDT MON MAY 6 2013

.DISCUSSION...
A DEEP UPPER-LOW CONTINUES TO SPIN ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION LATE THIS MORNING...MAINTAINING THE
COOL...CLOUDY AND DAMP CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.
TODAY...MUCH OF THE REGION HAS BEEN DRY SLOTTED THIS MORNING SO
FAR...WHICH HAS RESULTED IN AN OVERALL LACK OF PRECIPITATION OVER
EAST TENNESSEE AND EVEN SOME WELCOME PEEKS OF SUNSHINE FROM THE
BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS. HOWEVER...THERE CONTINUE TO BE TWO MAIN AREAS
OF PRECIPITATION OVER THE REGION. THE FIRST IS A HEAVIER BAND OF
SHOWERS DRIFTING WSW ACROSS NORTHERN ALABAMA /JUST TO THE SOUTHWEST
OF OUR SE TENNESSEE COUNTIES/ AND ANOTHER BROAD AREA OF SHOWERS
STREAMING TO THE NORTHWEST OVER FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE LOW. THIS ACTIVITY IS
EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY WANE AND SHIFT TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE
REGION LATER TONIGHT AND INTO THE DAY TOMORROW AS THE
AFOREMENTIONED LOW GRADUALLY ATTEMPTS TO MOVE EAST. HOWEVER...GIVEN
THE MOISTURE IN PLACE AND THE LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS STORM
SYSTEM... A REASONABLE CHANCE FOR SOME SCATTERED ACTIVITY WILL
REMAIN IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY
/PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING/.
GIVEN THE CLOUD COVER AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES...HAVE KEPT
TEMPERATURES ON THE COOL SIDE ONCE AGAIN...WITH HIGHS IN THE UPPER
50S AND LOWER 60S IN MOST PLACES.

909 
FXUS64 KMRX 060755
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT MON MAY 6 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE CORE OF THE CLOSED UPPER LOW 
WILL WOBBLE EASTWARD ACROSS SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF OUR AREA TODAY AND 
THEN OFF TO OUR EAST.  WITH THE COLDER AIR ALOFT PRECIP SHOULD 
BECOME MORE CONVECTIVE.  MAY EVEN BE SOME THUNDER ESPECIALLY THIS 
AFTERNOON...SO WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS.  SOME 
DRIER AIR WORKING IN ESPECIALLY CENTRAL AREAS SO WILL ONLY CARRY 
HIGH CHANCE POPS CENTRAL...LIKELY NORTH AND SOUTH TODAY.  GRADUAL 
DRYING TREND WILL CONTINUE INTO TONIGHT SO NO HIGHER THAN CHANCE 
POPS TONIGHT. MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE MOST PART...ALTHOUGH 
WILL TWEAK SOME MIN TEMPS UP A BIT FOR TONIGHT GOING WITH MORE OF A 
MAV/MET BLEND.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS UPPER 
LOW IS IN NO HURRY TO MOVE AWAY FROM THE REGION AND WILL BE THE MAIN 
PLAYER IN EXPECTED WEATHER ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS DEEP MOISTURE 
AND SHORT WAVE ENERGY CONTINUE TO ROTATE AROUND THE PRESSURE SYSTEM. 
DEEPEST MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT IMPACT SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE THROUGH THIS PERIOD WITH DECREASING POPS TUESDAY 
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE LOW FINALLY MOVES FARTHER AWAY 
FROM THE FORECAST AREA. WOULD STILL EXPECT A DECENT POSSIBILITY OF 
CONVECTION DURING THE DAYTIME PERIODS WITH NICE POCKET OF COLD AIR 
ALOFT COINCIDENT WITH THE UPPER LOW. A FAIR AMOUNT OF UNCERTAINTY IN 
THE FORECAST FOR THURSDAY WITH MODELS TRYING TO SHOW A WEAK SHORT 
WAVE FEATURE BUILDING SOUTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
AHEAD OF A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WHICH WILL BE DROPPING SOUTH INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY LATER THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. BEST GUESS HERE IS 
TO USE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR CONVECTION DURING THIS PART OF THE 
FORECAST. INCREMENTALLY ADVANCE POPS FROM LOW CHANCE ON FRIDAY TO 
HIGH CHANCE ON SATURDAY AS NEXT SIGNIFICANT UPPER TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACH THE REGION. UNCERTAINTY AT THIS 
TIME RANGE REQUIRED BROAD BRUSHING A MEDIUM CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR 
CONVECTION DURING THE DAY SUNDAY WITH EVEN A SLIGHT CHANCE SUNDAY 
NIGHT. LATER FORECASTS WILL FINE TUNE THE FRONTAL TIMING SATURDAY 
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.

877 
FXUS64 KMRX 051908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT SUN MAY 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
THE CLOSED UPPER LOW OVER NORTHERN MS WILL TRACK EAST THROUGH THE 
NIGHT AND MONDAY. THE COLD CORE OF THE LOW WILL OSCILLATE ALONG THE 
TN/AL/GA LINE...AND WITH MIDLEVEL TEMPS FALLING...WE WILL TRANSITION 
FROM STRATIFORM PRECIP INTO CONVECTIVE SHOWERS WITH A CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS. SOME LIGHT SHOWERS ARE DEVELOPING NOW OVER E AL/W 
GA...AND WILL SPREAD NORTH INTO THE SOUTHERN VALLEY THIS EVENING. 
WITH SOME STABILIZATION AFTER SUNSET AND THE DRY SLOT 
OVERHEAD...PRECIP CHANCES WILL DROP QUICKLY AFTER MIDNIGHT SOUTH AND 
CENTRAL...WHILE NORTHERN AREAS WILL MAINTAIN A STEADY RAIN UNDER THE 
ATLANTIC MOISTURE FEED. WEAKER LIFT AND DRIER PRECEDING CONDITIONS 
SHOULD PREVENT ANY FLOOD PROBLEMS IN THAT AREA. THE AXIS OF THE 
ATLANTIC MOISTURE FEED ROTATES NORTHWARD AS THE CLOSED LOW MOVES 
INTO NRN AL ON MONDAY. WHILE LIFT WILL BE WEAK BENEATH THE 
LOW...SOME DESTABILIZATION IS SHOWN BY THE MODELS AREA-WIDE MONDAY 
AFTERNOON. WILL HAVE LIKELY SHOWERS AND A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS 
FOR MONDAY.

WITH NO ADDITIONAL HEAVY RAIN EXPECTED IN THE WATCH AREA...THE
FLOOD WATCH WILL BE CANCELED. OBS OF WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS HAVE
STAYED BELOW CRITERIA...SO THE WIND ADVISORY WILL ALSO BE CANCELED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
PREVIOUS LONG TERM DISCUSSION PRETTY MUCH ON TRACK. MODELS IN
AGREEMENT EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH TYPICAL UNCERTAINTY SEEN IN THE
SECOND HALF OF THE EXTENDED.

MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...OUR WEATHER WILL STILL BE 
UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF THE SLOW MOVING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO OUR SOUTH. 
DURING THIS TIME-FRAME...POPS WILL GRADUALLY DECREASE FROM SOUTHWEST 
TO NORTHEAST AS THE LOW PROGRESSES A LITTLE FURTHER EAST EACH DAY. 
MOST AREAS WILL SEE VERY LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS DURING THIS TIME AS 
THE MAIN MOISTURE AXIS WILL HAVE SHIFTED TO THE LEE SIDE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS. HOWEVER...WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
LOW WILL PLACE NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA IN A FAVORABLE SPOT TO 
POTENTIALLY SEE 1 TO 2 INCHES OF RAIN THROUGH THIS PERIOD. 
ALSO...DIURNAL HEATING DURING THE DAY ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY COULD 
LEAD TO A FEW POP UP THUNDERSTORMS. CURRENT SOUNDINGS INDICATE CAPES 
RANGING ANYWHERE FROM 500 TO 1500 J/KG DEPENDING ON LOCATION. 

MODELS GENERALLY APPEAR TO BE INCREMENTALLY SLOWING DOWN APPROACH OF 
WESTERN STATES LONG WAVE TROUGH FOR THE LATE WORK WEEK PERIOD WITH A 
HINT OF A SHORT-LIVED RIDGE PUSHING INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY. THE 
RIDGE SHOULD HELP TO LIMIT CONVECTION...BUT DID ADD IN SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS TO FAVORED TERRAIN AREAS. POPS THEN BEGIN TO INCREASE ONCE 
AGAIN ON FRIDAY AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM THAT WILL ARRIVE JUST IN 
TIME FOR THE WEEKEND. HOWEVER...BETTER LIFT AND MOISTURE ADVECTION 
MAY HOLD OFF UNTIL LATER FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY SO ADJUSTED 
PROBABILITIES ACCORDINGLY. CHANCE POPS CONTINUE INTO SUNDAY AS MAIN 
FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH SOMETIME DURING THE DAY/EVENING. 
SCALED BACK POPS SUNDAY NIGHT TO TRY AND REFLECT PASSAGE OF FRONT. A 
FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE OVER THE WEEKEND AS 
SOUNDINGS SHOW A LITTLE BIT OF INSTABILITY PRESENT.

EXPECT A GRADUAL WARMING BEGINNING ON TUESDAY WITH TEMPS REACHING THE MID 
TO UPPER 70S BY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. SLIGHT COOL DOWN ON SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY AS CLOUDS AND RAIN CHANCES INCREASE FOR THE WEEKEND WITH 
TEMPS IN THE LOW TO MID 70S. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             49  65  48  72  52 /  90  60  30  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  50  67  50  70  51 / 100  60  40  30  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       50  67  50  71  51 / 100  60  40  30  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              51  65  49  67  49 / 100  80  60  50  40

831 
FXUS64 KMRX 051444 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1044 AM EDT SUN MAY 5 2013

.DISCUSSION...
WV IMAGERY CONTINUES TO SHOW A PLUME OF ATLANTIC MOISTURE FEEDING
INTO THE AREA ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF A STATIONARY LOW. IR SHOWS
CLOUD TOPS HAVE WARMED OVER THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE AREA AND
OVER GA...WITH THE COLDEST CLOUD TOPS OVER NORTHERN AREA AND
UPSTREAM OVER NC. SO THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU THAT HAVE SEEN THE MOST RAIN OVER THE PAST 48 HOURS WILL
SEE A BREAK FOR THE NEXT FEW HOURS. MODELS SHOW FRONTOGENETIC
FORCING HAS WEAKENED FROM YESTERDAY AS WELL...SO RAINFALL RATES
ACROSS THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL AREAS WILL BE LIGHT TO MODERATE
TODAY.

SOME DESTABILIZATION IS FORECAST BY THE MODELS IN SOUTHERN AREAS
LATER THIS AFTERNOON...WITH A LIFTED INDEX IN THE -3 TO -4 RANGE AT
CHA IN NAM AND GFS SOUNDINGS. A SURFACE LOW OVER NORTHERN GA WILL
PROVIDE CONVERGENCE FOR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. 

THE CURRENT FORECAST SEEMS TO CAPTURE THESE TRENDS WELL
OVERALL...SO NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES ARE NEEDED. 

OBSERVATIONS OF WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS HAVE BEEN MARGINAL OR JUST
BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. WILL KEEP THE WIND ADVISORY GOING FOR
NOW...BUT WILL LIKELY BE CANCELED LATER THIS AFTERNOON IF CURRENT
TRENDS CONTINUE.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FLOOD WATCH THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     JOHNSON...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST GREENE...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SULLIVAN...UNICOI...WASHINGTON 
     TN.

     WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...NW 
     BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...NORTHWEST COCKE...SEVIER SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS.

     FLOOD WATCH THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...EAST POLK...HAMILTON...LOUDON...
     MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...MORGAN...NORTHWEST MONROE...
     RHEA...ROANE...SCOTT TN...SEQUATCHIE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...

     RUSSELL...WASHINGTON.

FXUS64 KMRX 050743
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT SUN MAY 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL CONTINUE 
ITS SLOW TREK ACROSS THE REGION.  THE BETTER FORCING IS EXPECTED TO 
SHIFT FURTHER NORTH TODAY...WITH SOME DRYER AIR MOVING INTO SOUTHERN 
AREAS.  EXPECT LIGHTER PRECIP FOR A WHILE TODAY IN SOUTHWEST 
ZONES...BUT PRECIP MAY PICK UP AGAIN LATE IN THE DAY INTO TONIGHT AS 
THE SYSTEM DRIFTS EAST.  DOWNSLOPE FLOW SHOULD CONTINUE TO HELP TO 
LIMIT PRECIP AMOUNTS FURTHER NORTH.  WILL KEEP FLOOD WATCH AS IS FOR 
NOW.  WINDS STILL MAY REACH WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA AT TIMES IN SOME 
OF THE EASTERN HIGHER TERRAIN GIVEN THE STRONG SOUTHEASTERLY LOW 
LEVEL JET...SO WILL LEAVE WIND ADVISORY IN PLACE THERE. WILL 
GENERALLY UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS A BIT FOR TODAY...BUT NOT MUCH ARGUMENT 
WITH MAV MIN TEMPS TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS IN LINE EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD WITH TYPICAL UNCERTAINTY SEEN IN THE SECOND HALF OF THE 
EXTENDED. KEPT RELATIVELY HIGH POPS IN PLACE ON MONDAY AREA WIDE 
WITH UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WITH THE UPPER CENTER 
OVER THE REGION AND A TAD BIT MORE HEATING WOULD EXPECT THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME CONVECTION SO KEPT THIS IDEA GOING. TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY THE UPPER LOW SHIFTS VERY SLOWLY NORTHEAST JUST ON THE 
OTHER SIDE OF THE APPALACHIAN CHAIN MAKING IT TO THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC 
COASTAL REGION BY 00Z THURSDAY. IN THIS CONFIGURATION WITH 
SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES ROTATING AROUND 
THE LOW KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS GOING ACROSS 
MOST OF THE AREA WITH LIKELY PROBABILITIES ACROSS MUCH OF THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. TAPER POPS 
BACK A FAIR AMOUNT ACROSS THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY WITH DRIER AIR 
BUILDING IN BEHIND DEPARTING UPPER LOW. MODELS GENERALLY APPEAR TO 
BE INCREMENTALLY SLOWING DOWN APPROACH OF WESTERN STATES LONG WAVE 
TROUGH FOR THE LATE WORK WEEK PERIOD WITH A HINT OF A RIDGE PUSHING 
INTO THE AREA AROUND THURSDAY. THEREFORE...PULLED THE SMALL CHANCE 
POPS FOR THURSDAY WHILE DOWNPLAYING CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ON FRIDAY 
DAYTIME PERIOD. THE BETTER LIFT AND MOISTURE ADVECTION MAY HOLD OFF 
UNTIL LATER FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY SO ADJUSTED PROBABILITIES 
ACCORDINGLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
946 PM EDT SAT MAY 4 2013

.DISCUSSION...STRONG FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING ACROSS MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA..EXCEPT NORTHEAST SECTIONS. STRONG SOUTHEAST 850MB
JET WILL INCREASE TO 50-60KTS PULLING IN A PLUME OF MOISTURE FROM
THE EASTERN GULF/ATLANTIC OCEAN. PERIODS OF MODERATE TO LOCALLY
HEAVY RAIN WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE WATCH AREA. MADE NO CHANGES TO
CURRENT FLOOD WATCH.

STRONG 850MB JET WILL BE PERPENDICULAR TO THE APPALACHIAN
MOUNTAINS. SOUNDINGS DO NOT SHOW THE BEST THERMODYNAMIC SITUATION
FOR A MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT...BUT IS GOOD ENOUGH TO WARRANT A WIND
ADVISORY FOR THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN MOUNTAINS AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS.
HAVE INCLUDED THE CENTRAL MOUNTAINS INTO AN ADVISORY FOR TONIGHT
AND SUNDAY..AND THE NORTHERN AREAS THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.

TEMPRATURE FORECAST LOOKS GOOD.

048 
FXUS64 KMRX 041847
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT SAT MAY 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
REPORTS FROM THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
INDICATE NO FLOODING PROBLEMS THUS FAR...WITH ABOUT 2-3 INCHES 
RECEIVED SO FAR OVER THAT AREA. RADAR PRECIP ESTIMATES SO FAR HAVE 
BEEN EXCELLENT COMPARED TO GROUND TRUTH.

THE SLOW PROGRESSION OF THE UPPER LOW AND A STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS MEANS THAT A STEADY MODERATE TO OCCASIONALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE TONIGHT OVER THE SAME AREAS THAT HAVE 
ALREADY SEEN SEVERAL INCHES OF RAINFALL TODAY. DOWNSLOPE WINDS WILL 
CONTINUE TO HAVE AN IMPACT ON PRECIP AMOUNTS IN THE CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN VALLEY THROUGH SUNDAY. EVENTUALLY...MODELS SHOW THE 
FRONTOGENESIS ZONE LIFTING NORTHWARD TO KNOXVILLE SUNDAY 
MORNING...WHICH WILL HELP OVERCOME THE DOWNSLOPE DRYING EFFECTS. 
MIDLEVEL DRYING WILL MOVE IN FROM THE SW...SO PRECIP WILL BECOME 
LIGHTER AROUND CHATTANOOGA SUNDAY MORNING AND AFTERNOON. THE AREA 
WITH THE HEAVIEST RAINFALL ON SUNDAY IS EXPECTED TO BE SW NC. THE 
FLOOD WATCH WILL NOT BE CHANGED. OBSERVATIONS OF WINDS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS SHOW GUSTS TO AROUND 30 MPH SO FAR THIS AFTERNOON. GUSTS 
CLOSE TO 40 MPH MAY OCCUR AT TIMES OVERNIGHT...BUT NO WIND ADVISORY 
WILL BE ISSUED AT THIS TIME AS THE MAJORITY OF LOCATIONS WILL STAY 
JUST BELOW CRITERIA.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WITH
INDICATING THE CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW DRIFTING EAST-SOUTHEASTWARD
ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN PART OF THE NATION. THE CENTER OF THIS
UPPER LOW IS PROGGED TO REMAIN SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY
NIGHT AND MONDAY...WHICH WOULD KEEP THE FORECAST AREA ON ITS
NORTHERN SIDE WHERE AN EASTERLY WIND FLOW WILL BRING A GOOD FETCH
OF MOISTURE FROM THE ATLANTIC OCEAN. THUS...WILL MAINTAIN HIGH POPS
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...WITH DECREASING POPS THEREAFTER AS THIS
UPPER LOW DRIFTS TO THE CAROLINA COAST BY TUESDAY. A WARM AND HUMID
AIR MASS WILL THEN LINGER OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE MIDDLE OF
NEXT WEEK...WITH A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS DEVELOPING EACH
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THUS... EXPECT SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION
TO DEVELOP EACH DAY...WHICH SHOULD INCREASE IN AREAL COVERAGE
TOWARDS THE END OF THE WEEK AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH PUSHES A COLD
FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY
FOLLOWED THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED
PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.


&&

.AVIATION...
WITH A STALLED FRONT ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND A SLOW MOVING
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO THE WEST...A WIDE SWATH OF MODERATE RAIN
WILL CONTINUE OVER CHA FOR MOST OF THE TAF PERIOD. CONDITIONS ARE
EXPECTED TO BE PREDOMINANTLY IFR AT CHA THROUGH TONIGHT...THOUGH
EMBEDDED HEAVIER RAIN MAY LOWER VIS INTO LIFR RANGE AT TIMES THIS
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. A RETURN TO MVFR CONDITIONS MAY OCCUR IN THE
MORNING. DOWNSLOPE WINDS IN THE LEE OF THE APPALACHIANS WILL KEEP
CEILINGS VFR AT TYS AND TRI THROUGH TONIGHT WITH LIGHT RAIN. THE
RAIN MAY INCREASE ENOUGH AT TYS IN THE MORNING TO LOWER VIS TO
MVFR.

382 
FXUS64 KMRX 041437 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1037 AM EDT SAT MAY 4 2013

.DISCUSSION...
THE FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK SO FAR THIS MORNING...AS RAIN
SLOWLY PROGRESSES NORTHEAST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY. IT APPEARS THAT
DOWNSLOPE WINDS ARE HAVING SOME EFFECT AS THE RAIN MOVES INTO THE
SHADOW OF THE MOUNTAINS...AS THE RAIN BAND NOW ACROS KNOXVILLE IS
BECOMING MORE RAGGED IN APPEARANCE ON RADAR. ACCORDING TO RADAR
ESTIMATES...SOME LOCATIONS IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY HAVE ALREADY
RECEIVED ONE INCH OF RAIN...WHICH IS GENERALLY IN LINE WITH
FORECAST QPF AMOUNTS. THE STEADY NATURE OF THE RAINFALL SUGGESTS
THAT RIVER AND AREAL FLOODING ARE THE MAIN CONCERNS RATHER THAN
FLASH FLOODING. RIVERS THAT ARE OF PARTICULAR CONCERN THROUGH THE
WEEKEND INCLUDE THE SEQUATCHIE...SOUTH CHICKAMAUGA...OCOEE NEAR
COPPER HILL...AND PIGEON NEAR NEWPORT.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FLOOD WATCH FROM 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...FLOOD WATCH FROM 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: LOUDON...MORGAN...NORTHWEST 
     MONROE...ROANE...SCOTT TN...SOUTHEAST MONROE.

     FLOOD WATCH THROUGH MONDAY MORNING FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: 
     BLEDSOE...BRADLEY...EAST POLK...HAMILTON...MARION...

913 
FXUS64 KMRX 040740
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT SAT MAY 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE SLOW MOVING CLOSED LOW WILL 
CONTINUE TO APPROACH DURING THE PERIOD.  STRONG SOUTHEASTERLY LOW 
LEVEL JET WILL BRING ABUNDANT MOISTURE. PERSISTENT BAND OF SHOWERS 
WILL BRING HEAVY RAINFALL AMOUNTS TO SOUTHERN AND WESTERN ZONES.  
WITH THE WIND FLOW BEING DOWNSLOPE INTO THE VALLEY...RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LESS IN CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST VALLEY 
AREAS. WILL KEEP THE FLOOD WATCH AS IS FOR NOW.  WITH THE STRONG LOW 
LEVEL JET WINDS MAY APPROACH WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR SOME OF THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN AT TIMES...BUT FOR NOW WINDS EXPECTED TO GENERALLY 
STAY BELOW ADVISORY LEVELS SO NO WIND ADVISORY WITH THIS ISSUANCE. 
MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE.    

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE "BIG RAINER" IS STILL ON 
SCHEDULE WITH MODELS CLOSE IN AGREEMENT IN A LENGTHY PERIOD OF 
WIDESPREAD LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN AS DEEP MOISTURE IS LIFTED IN THE 
PRESENCE OF A SLOW MOVING VERTICALLY STACKED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. 
PROBABLY NO NEED TO FORECAST ANYTHING LESS THAN ONE HUNDRED PERCENT 
FOR SHOWERS ON SUNDAY AS STRONG LIFT PROGRESSES FROM SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA TO NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA LATER IN THE DAY. THE UPPER LOW MOVES TO NORTHERN 
GEORGIA BY 12Z MONDAY BUT DOES NOT MAKE MUCH PROGRESS NORTHEAST UP 
THE EASTERN SEABOARD DURING THE FOLLOWING 24 HOURS. WITH THE STILL 
DEEP LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM VERY CLOSE TO THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY 
KEPT LIKELY POPS GOING DROPPING BACK INTO THE CHANCE CATEGORY BY 12Z 
TUESDAY AS THE PRESSURE SYSTEM FINALLY MOVES A LITTLE QUICKER IN ITS 
TRACK ALONG THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC COAST. TAPERED POPS BACK TO SLIGHT 
THROUGH LOW CHANCE ON WEDNESDAY. UNCERTAINTY BUILDS DURING THE LAST 
COUPLE DAYS OF THE EXTENDED WITH MODELS HINTING AT A WEAK WAVE 
DROPPING SOUTHEAST BEHIND THE DEPARTING UPPER LOW ON THURSDAY SO 
LEFT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN ON THURSDAY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. LEFT A SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITY IN PLACE FOR 
FRIDAY WITH THE APPROACH OF ANOTHER SHORT WAVE TOWARD THE END OF THE 
WORK WEEK. TIMING IS SOMEWHAT OF AN ISSUE WITH THE GFS MORE 
RAMBUNCTIOUS TO BRING LIFT IN AHEAD OF SYSTEM WARM FRONT WHILE ECMWF 
A BIT SLOWER TO ADD PROBABILITY TO THE MIX WITH PRECIP BUILDING IN 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. IN TERMS OF PRECIP TYPE...ADDED THE 
POSSIBILITY OF CONVECTION BEGINNING MONDAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH 
THE END OF THE PERIOD WITH LIKELIHOOD BECOMING GREATER LATER IN THE 
WEEK AS STRENGTHENING INSOLATION ENCOURAGES GREATER INSTABILITY. 
BLENDED THE ECMWF AND MEX MOS FOR THE TEMPERATURE REGIME.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             57  48  61  48  65 / 100 100 100  70  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  50  61  50  65 /  90 100 100  80  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  49  59  51  66 /  90 100 100  80  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              65  47  61  51  64 /  30  70 100 100  70

BY LATE IN THE PERIOD.  DOWNSLOPE WINDS EXPECTED TO KEEP CONDITIONS
BETTER AT TYS AND TRI...WHERE WILL FORECAST VFR FOR NOW ALTHOUGH
CANNOT RULE OUT LOWER CONDITIONS LATER ON ESPECIALLY AT TYS.  


&&

169 
FXUS64 KMRX 031847
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT FRI MAY 3 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...
THE CLOSED LOW OVER THE MS VALLEY WILL REMAIN NEARLY STATIONARY OVER 
THAT REGION BUT GRADUALLY STRENGTHEN TONIGHT. THIS WILL RESULT IN A 
40-50 KT SE FLOW AT 850 MB...WHICH WILL TRANSPORT AN ATLANTIC 
MOISTURE PLUME INTO THE AREA. MODELS SHOW THAT LIFT IS STRONGLY TIED 
TO A FRONTOGENESIS ZONE...WHICH MOVES INTO THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY BY 
12Z SAT. THE SURFACE FRONT REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY FROM THE SW NC 
CORNER TO AROUND CSV THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. MODERATE TO HEAVY 
PRECIP WILL BE MOVING INTO CHA AROUND THIS TIME. FARTHER 
NORTH...DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS IN THE LEE OF THE MOUNTAINS WILL GIVE 
LIGHT QPF AMOUNTS THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH CHANCE POPS ONLY COMING 
INTO SW VA SATURDAY NIGHT. THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF THE SYSTEM IS A 
CONCERN FOR FLOODING IN SOUTHERN AND WESTERN AREAS. RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT ARE EXPECTED TO BE 2 TO 4 INCHES IN THOSE 
AREAS. A FLOOD WATCH WILL BE ISSUED FOR SW NC...THE SOUTHERN TN 
VALLEY...AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
NOT MUCH HAS CHANGED FROM THE PREVIOUS LONG TERM DISCUSSION. THE
GFS AND ECMWF CONTINUE TO BE IN VERY CLOSE AGREEMENT THROUGHOUT THE
EARLY PORTIONS OF THE LONG TERM WITH ONLY SLIGHT DIFFERENCES TOWARD
THE END OF THE PERIOD.

SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY OUR WEATHER WILL STILL BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE 
OF A STUBBORN CUTOFF LOW THAT WILL TAKE ITS TIME TREKKING ACROSS THE 
STATES JUST TO OUR SOUTH. THE SLOW PROGRESSION IS DUE TO A BLOCKING 
PATTERN OVER NORTH AMERICA. IT LOOKS LIKE AREAS FROM THE CENTRAL 
VALLEY AND SOUTH HAVE BETTER CHANCES OF SEEING HIGHER RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS ON SUNDAY. MEAN FLOW IS IN A SE TO NW ORIENTATION AS WE WILL 
BE POSITIONED IN THE NORTHWEST QUADRANT OF THE LOW. THIS SHOULD 
ALLOW THE APPALACHIANS TO PROVIDE SOME WHAT OF A RAIN SHADOW TO 
AREAS NORTHEAST OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY...THUS LIMITING THE HIGHER 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS THAT WILL LIKELY BE SEEN FURTHER SOUTH. PRECIP 
EFFICIENCY LOOKS OKAY FOR THIS EVENT BUT I THINK THE HIGHER AMOUNTS 
ARE GOING TO BE DUE TO MORE OF A DURATION TYPE CAUSE THAN PRECIP 
EFFICIENCY. WARM-LAYER CLOUD DEPTHS ARE ROUGHLY 8000 TO 
9000FT...WHICH IS WHAT WE WANT FOR HIGH EFFICIENCY...BUT CLIMATOLOGY 
SUGGEST PWS ARE MARGINAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR ALONG WITH A LACKING 
AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY. SOUNDINGS INDICATE PWS MAXING OUT JUST OVER 1 
INCH...WHICH PUTS US AROUND THE 50TH PERCENTILE BASED ON CLIMO. 
HOWEVER...BECAUSE OF THE SLOW PROGRESSION OF THE SYSTEM...DURATION 
ALONE SHOULD ALLOW AN ADDITIONAL 1 TO 2 INCHES TO FALL ACROSS AREAS 
GENERALLY SOUTH OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY ON SUNDAY...ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST NC. I THINK PWS ARE ON THE LOW SIDE BECAUSE THE MOISTURE 
FETCH IS NOT A PURE SOUTHERLY GULF FETCH. IT IS A ATLANTIC/GULF 
COMBINATION. DEEP OMEGA AND ROBUST VORTICITY WILL MAINTAIN A STEADY 
GENERATION OF SHOWERS THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY ON SUNDAY.

SHOWERS THEN CONTINUE INTO MONDAY...BUT AMOUNTS AND INTENSITY WILL 
DECREASE AS THE LOW MOVES FURTHER EAST. A FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS 
ARE POSSIBLE ON MONDAY AS 500 J/KG OF CAPE ARE PRESENT IN SOUNDINGS. 
HIGHER PRESSURE EDGES TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY WITH A DECREASING CHANCE FOR CONVECTION AS FURTHER DRYING 
CONTINUES. WEDNESDAY THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED LOOK GENERALLY 
DRY...EXCEPT FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF ISOLATED TERRAIN BASED 
CONVECTION ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. WENT SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE ON 
TEMPS THROUGH EARLY PERIODS BECAUSE OF INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND 
SHOWERS. TEMPS WILL GRADUALLY BEGIN TO WARM BY TUESDAY AND CONTINUE 
TO WARM THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             55  60  48  62  49 /  90 100 100  60  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  53  63  51  62  50 /  50  80 100  80  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       54  61  50  62  49 /  50  80 100  80  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              48  64  49  62  48 /  10  20  50  60  60 

&&
