337 
FXUS64 KMRX 030811
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT FRI MAY 3 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE RIDGE WILL REMAIN OVER THE 
NORTHEAST US...WHILE A CLOSED LOW WILL SLOWLY MOVE TOWARD OUR 
REGION.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE AS LOW LEVEL SOUTHEAST FLOW 
STRENGTHENS...BUT DOWNSLOPING IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY 
AREAS AND THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF THIS SYSTEM SHOULD PRECLUDE ANY RAPID 
SPREADING OF PRECIP ACROSS THE AREA.  WILL JUST CARRY CHANCE POPS 
SOUTH ZONES TODAY...WITH LIKELY TO LOW CAT POPS FAR SOUTHWEST ZONES 
TONIGHT DECREASING TO BELOW SLIGHT CHANCE NORTHEAST. INSTABILITY 
LOOKS VERY LIMITED SO WHILE A FEW RUMBLES OF THUNDER CANNOT BE 
COMPLETELY RULED OUT WILL NOT CARRY ANY THUNDERSTORMS IN THE 
FORECAST FOR NOW.  WINDS WILL BE GUSTY AT TIMES AND TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD BE CLOSE TO NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  JUST SOME MINOR 
TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS.   

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...00Z GFS AND ECMWF VERY 
CLOSE IN THE EARLY PORTION OF THE LONG TERM AND FOLLOWED AS THE 
SEASON OF SLOW MOVING UPPER LEVEL CLOSED LOWS HAS BEGUN. IT WILL 
TAKE TWO FULL DAYS FOR THE UPPER LOW TO MOVE FROM ARKANSAS TO 
NORTHERN GEORGIA IN A BLOCKED PATTERN OVER NORTH AMERICA. 
INCREASINGLY MOIST AIR...COMPLIMENTS OF THE GULF OF MEXICO AND THE 
ATLANTIC OCEAN WILL BE LIFTED IN A BROAD AREA OF SHOWERS CONTAINING 
MODERATE RAIN AT TIMES. MODELS INDICATE A BIT OF A SHADOW ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE DURING THE DAY SATURDAY 
BUT EVENTUALLY BRING HIGHER PROBABILITY OF RAIN TO THIS AREA 
SATURDAY NIGHT AS THE STORM SYSTEM PRESSES INTO DIXIE. STAYED WITH 
RELATIVELY HIGH POPS SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT WHICH MAY 
BE THE WETTEST PERIOD WITH BEST LIFT AND HIGHEST MEAN RELATIVE 
HUMIDITY IN THE WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN AHEAD OF THE STACKED LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM. BY MONDAY THE LOW MAY BE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS 
WITH A GENERAL DECREASE IN PROBABILITY OF PRECIP FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS SLIGHTLY DRIER ON THE BACK 
SIDE OF THE STORM SYSTEM MAKES PROGRESS INTO THE REGION. HIGHER 
PRESSURE EDGES TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY WITH A DECREASING CHANCE FOR CONVECTION AS FURTHER DRYING 
CONTINUES. PULLED POPS OUT OF THE FINAL DAY OF THE LONG TERM AS 
RIDGING MAKES INROADS ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES. WENT WITH A 
MEX/ECM MOS BLEND FOR MAX AND MIN TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

043 
FXUS64 KMRX 021846
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EDT THU MAY 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
A STRONG RIDGE WILL REMAIN OVER THE EAST COAST...WHILE A CLOSED LOW 
MOVES FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE MS VALLEY REGION BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 
WITH THE PATTERN BEING SLOW TO EVOLVE...WILL FOLLOW A PERSISTENCE 
FORECAST FOR TONIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. AS THE LOW TRACKS INTO THE 
MS VALLEY...THE SE FLOW WILL STRENGTHEN AND BRING INCREASING 
MOISTURE FROM THE ATLANTIC INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA. A 
CONFLUENT 850 MB FLOW AND FRONTOGENESIS WILL DEVELOP LATE IN THE DAY 
ACROSS NRN GA AND NRN AL. THE GFS IS FASTER TO SPREAD PRECIP NE THAN 
THE NAM...BRINGING PRECIP WELL UP THE VALLEY BETWEEN 18Z AND 00Z. 
GIVEN THE EXPECTED 40-50 KT DOWNSLOPE WINDS AT 850 MB...THIS SEEMS 
TOO AGGRESSIVE...SO WILL BRING IN CHANCE POPS TO JUST THE SOUTHERN 
VALLEY/PLATEAU AND SW NC AROUND 21Z.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE WEEKEND...SO CONFIDENCE
FAIRLY HIGH. FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE WEEKEND...A LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM WILL TRACK INTO THE TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEY BEGINNING FRIDAY
NIGHT. A COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW WILL BRING INCREASING
RAIN CHANCES TO THE AREA FRIDAY EVENING...AND REMAIN LIKELY TO
CATEGORICAL THROUGH THE WEEKEND. WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE
AVAILABLE...CAN EXPECT AN INCH TO TWO INCHES MAINLY ON THE PLATEAU
AND SOUTHEASTERN TENNESSEE. DO NOT SEE MUCH IN THE WAY OF
INSTABILITY SO KEPT THUNDER OUT OF THE FORECAST DURING THIS TIME.
GUSTY WINDS CAN BE EXPECTED SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AS THE LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA. UNSEASONABLY COOL TEMPS IN THE
MID TO LOW 60S WILL REMAIN THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD...AS COLDER
NORTHERN AIR AROUND THIS FRONT IS ADVECTED INTO THE AREA.

MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACK 
SIDE OF THIS LOW WILL KEEP RAIN CHANCES IN THROUGH THE WEEK. LOW 
INSTABILITIES AND LOW SHEAR WILL BE PRESENT THROUGH NEXT WEEK. A 
FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE EACH AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
NOTHING TO NOTE ON A SEVERE LEVEL THROUGH THE ENTIRE PERIOD. AS THE 
LOW MOVES OFF THE COAST...TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO RISE INTO THE LOW 
70S. 

&&

241 
FXUS64 KMRX 020715
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT THU MAY 2 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE
NORTHERN GULF/GULF COAST STATES WILL CONTINUE TO PULL THICK
HIGH/MID-LEVEL CLOUDS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS TODAY AND TONIGHT. A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL ALSO
REMAIN MAINLY EST OF AND APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. SOME SCT-BKN 5KFT
CLOUDS WILL ALSO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA AS WELL. EVEN WITH THE
MOISTURE...INSTABILITY WILL BE LIMITED...SO CONVECTION CHANCES ARE
VERY LOW. WILL MAINTAIN A DRY FORECAST.

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...THICK CLOUD COVER WILL NOT ALLOW TEMPERATURES
TO WARM MUCH TODAY. GENERALLY WENT A DEGREE OF TWO COOLER THAN GFS
MOS NUMBERS. LOWS WILL BE MILDER DUE TO THE CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH THE HANDLING OF A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW IN THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...AND GENERALLY SHOW THIS UPPER LOW SLOWLY DRIFTING 
EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. THIS SCENARIO WILL RESULT IN A WET AND UNSEASONABLY COOL 
PATTERN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. A 
STABLE AIR MASS WILL RESIDE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT...BUT THEN SOME WEAK INSTABILITY IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP ON 
SUNDAY AND THEREAFTER AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
THUS...WILL MENTION SHOWERS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL ADD A 
CHANCE FOR TSTORMS BEGINNING ON SUNDAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS... HAVE GENERALLY TRENDED TOWARDS THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             75  57  69  55  63 /  10  10  40  50  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  76  56  71  54  64 /  10  10  30  30  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       76  55  71  54  64 /  10  10  30  30  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              73  49  71  47  65 /  10  10  10  10  20

630 
FXUS64 KMRX 020211
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 PM EDT WED MAY 1 2013

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO INCREASE CLOUD COVER OVERNIGHT.
LAMP MOS IN LINE WITH CURRENT MIN TEMPERATURE FORECAST. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
WITH A BLOCKING RIDGE ALONG THE EAST COAST...FEW CHANGES TO THE 
SENSIBLE WEATHER ARE EXPECTED OVER THE NEXT 36 HOURS. AN EASTERLY 
DOWNSLOPE FLOW HAS KEPT THE TN VALLEY FREE OF CONVECTION 
TODAY...WITH BETTER CU DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. 
WITH THE SLOW EASTWARD MOVEMENT OF THE LOW IN THE PLAINS...THE EAST 
COAST RIDGE BECOME MORE PINCHED...TURNING THE 850 MB FLOW TO A MORE 
SE DIRECTION TOMORROW. THIS SHOULD HELP BRING A BIT MORE MOISTURE TO 
THE AREA. GREATER CU COVERAGE AND SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS IN THE 
PLATEAU ARE EXPECTED TOMORROW. HIGHS WILL BE A BIT COOLER THAN 
TODAY...IN THE MID TO UPPER 70S.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...
MODELS CONTINUE TO DIVERGE THROUGH THE PERIOD. GFS HAS HANDLED 
PRECIP A LITTLE BETTER THIS WEEK THAN THE OTHER MODELS...SO LEANED 
TOWARDS GFS THROUGH THE BEGINNING OF NEXT WEEK. A CLOSED UPPER LEVEL 
LOW WILL TRACK THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WITH AN ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT BRINGING RAIN CHANCES TO THE TN VALLEY THIS WEEKEND. 
FRIDAY LOOKS TO START OFF DRY...WITH PRECIP CHANCES INCREASING FROM 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST AS THE COLD FRONT APPROACHES EAST TENNESSEE. 
INSTABILITIES ARE LOW WITH SHEAR MINIMAL..DO NOT EXPECT ANY 
THUNDERSTORMS WITH THE BEGINNING OF THIS SYSTEM. THIS LOW PRESSURE 
WILL MOVE TOWARDS THE EAST COAST KEEPING RAIN CHANCES IN THE 
FORECAST ALL DAY SATURDAY...SUNDAY...AND INTO MONDAY. BY TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON...THE LOW PRESSURE WILL BE EAST OF THE APPALACHIAN 
MOUNTAINS. WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AROUND THIS LOW WILL KEEP RAIN 
CHANCES IN THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. MODELS HAVE DIVERGED 
FROM THIS POINT...WITH ECMWF BRINGING IN A NEW DISTURBANCE AT THE 
BEGINNING ON NEXT WEEK. HAVE KEPT POPS IN THE SLIGHT CHANCE 
CATEGORY...AND AWAIT FURTHER MODEL RUNS FOR BETTER TIMING. EXPECT 
HIGH TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE MID TO UPPER 60S AS THE COLD 
FRONT PASSES AND FLOW FROM THE NORTHWEST SETS UP. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             57  76  56  74  53 /   0  20  10  30  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  56  77  54  73  52 /   0  10  10  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       55  76  53  73  52 /   0  10  10  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              51  75  48  71  48 /   0  10  10  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
947 AM EDT WED MAY 1 2013

.DISCUSSION...
12Z RAOBS FROM OHX...FFC...AND GSO SHOW AN INVERSION AROUND 750
MB...WHICH SHOULD HELP CAP CONVECTION TODAY IN MOST LOCATIONS. THE
LATEST RUC SOUNDINGS SHOW THIS INVERSION WEAKENING A BIT THIS
AFTERNOON ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. IF ANY SHOWERS ARE ABLE TO
DEVELOP...THAT WOULD PROBABLY BE THE AREA IT WOULD OCCUR WITH THE
MIDLEVEL RIDGE AXIS TO OUR EAST. THE CURRENT FORECAST HAS A SLIGHT
CHANCE POP IN THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...AND THIS SEEMS REASONABLE.

FORECAST TEMPS LOOK A BIT COOL NORTH BASED ON THE LATEST OBS AND
GUIDANCE...AND LACK OF CLOUD COVER SO FAR. TRI SHOULD BE AT LEAST
AS WARM AS YESTERDAY WHEN THE HIGH REACHED 80. WILL ISSUE AN UPDATE
FOR TEMPS IN THAT AREA.

883 
FXUS64 KMRX 010654
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 AM EDT WED MAY 1 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A WEAK UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE
LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER IS PULLING A GOOD DEAL OF MID AND HIGH-
LEVEL CLOUDS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THESE
CLOUDS WILL REMAIN THROUGH TONIGHT...BUT OVERALL A PARTLY
SUNNY SOUTH TO MOSTLY SUNNY NORTH TONIGHT.

ABUNDANT HIGH/MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL ALSO KEEP FOG PATCHY AT BEST
THIS MORNING. 

SURFACE RIDGING INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND SOUTHEAST UNITED
STATES WILL KEEP GULF MOISTURE SOUTH OF THE AREA. THE LIMITED
SURFACE MOISTURE WITH DEWPOINTS ONLY IN THE 50S WILL KEEP AFTERNOON
INSTABILITY LIMITED AT BEST. WILL CONTINUE WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
AFTERNOON SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU WHERE CAPES ARE
HIGHER...BUT OVERALL A DRY SHORT-TERM.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES WITH THE HANDLING OF THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE IN THE 
EXTENDED...NAMELY THE TRACK OF A CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL LOW THAT 
INITIALLY DEVELOPS OVER THE PLAINS THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. THE 
ECMWF MODEL SHOWS THIS UPPER LOW DRIFTING NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE 
GREAT LAKES REGION BY SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH MINIMAL EFFECTS ON THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. HOWEVER...THE GFS 
MODEL SHOWS THIS UPPER LOW DRIFTING EASTWARD ACROSS THE OZARKS 
REGION THIS WEEKEND...AND ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY FOR EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. THIS GFS SOLUTION WOULD RESULT IN A WETTER SCENARIO FOR THIS 
WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE CANADIAN MODEL SUPPORTS THE 
GFS SOLUTION...SO WILL TREND THE EXTENDED FORECAST TOWARDS THIS 
WETTER SCENARIO. THE GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT A STABLE AIR MASS WILL 
RESIDE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT THEN SOME 
MARGINAL INSTABILITY DEVELOPS ON SUNDAY AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL MENTION SHOWERS THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT...WITH TSTORMS POSSIBLE FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGHOUT THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             79  56  77  54  74 /   0   0  20  20  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  80  55  76  53  73 /   0  10  20  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       80  55  76  53  73 /   0  10  20  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              76  50  74  49  71 /   0  10  20  20  20


103 
FXUS64 KMRX 301930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT TUE APR 30 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS ACROSS 
THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION WHILE LOWER PRESSURE EDGES 
EVER SO SLOWLY EAST ALONG THE WESTERN GULF COAST DURING THE SHORT 
TERM. IN THIS SCENARIO A DEEPENING EASTERLY FLOW DEVELOPS ADVECTING 
MOISTURE ACROSS THE EASTERN SEABOARD. WOULD NOT EXPECT A MAJOR 
INCREASE IN DEW POINT TEMPS ACROSS MUCH OF THE MRX FORECAST AREA AS 
THE SURFACE RIDGE PATTERN WOULD TEND CREATE A WEAK RELATIVELY DRY 
NORTHEASTERLY FLOW DOWN THE VALLEY. THE EASTERLY REGIME WOULD LEAD 
TO A DOWNSLOPING AND DRYING REGIME WEST OF THE APPALACHIANS AS WELL. 
THEREFORE...NOT SURE THE MODELS ARE DOING A GOOD JOB WITH MOISTURE 
FIELDS OVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA. OF COURSE...THE MOUNTAINS 
(AND TO AN EXTENT THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU) WILL HAVE SUFFICIENT 
MOISTURE FOR DECENT CLOUD FORMATION WITH UPSLOPE FLOW AND INDICATED 
WEAK INSTABILITY. THEREFORE...FORECAST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER 
OR THUNDERSTORM IN THESE AREAS. DUE TO EXPECTED SLIGHTLY LESS MOIST 
AIRMASS...EDGED MIN TEMPS JUST A BIT BELOW THE COOLEST MOS MINS 
TONIGHT WHILE GOING NEAR TO JUST ABOVE THE WARMEST MOS MAX TEMPS ON 
WEDNESDAY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
KEEP PRECIP CHANCES LOW THROUGH THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. LIGHT 
ISOLATED SHOWERS COULD BE POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN EAST 
TENNESSEE EACH AFTERNOON...AS FLOW IS PREDOMINATELY FROM THE EAST. 
AN OMEGA BLOCK HAS SETTLED OVER THE EASTERN US...AND MODELS HAVE 
BEEN TERRIBLE IN AGREEMENT AS TO WHEN THIS HIGH WILL BREAK DOWN AND 
MOVE EAST. WITH ECMWF AND GFS AT OPPOSITE ENDS OF THE 
FORECAST...HAVE SETTLED WITH THE CANADIAN MODEL THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
THE FLOW AROUND THE TROUGH IS FROM THE NORTHWEST...SO EXPECT THE 
HIGH TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN IN THE LOWER 70S THROUGH THE EXTENDED.

FOR FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH THE WEEKEND...A MID LEVEL LOW WILL 
PROGRESS OUT OF CANADA INTO THE MIDWEST AND THEN EAST NORTHEAST 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. A COLD FRONT WITH THIS LOW WILL CAUSE RAIN 
SHOWERS TO BEGIN AFFECTING THE AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON...MAINLY IN THE 
PLATEAU AND SOUTHWESTERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS COVERAGE 
WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY TO INCLUDE THE 
ENTIRE AREA. EXPECT RAIN SHOWERS EACH PERIOD WITH THUNDERSTORMS 
POSSIBLE SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH NEXT TUESDAY. THE GRADIENT WITH 
THIS FRONT IS NOT AS STRONG AS PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS...SO WIND THREAT 
NOT A BIG CONCERN.  THE HIGH PRESSURE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS OMEGA 
BLOCK LOOKS TO KEEP AN INFLUENCE OVER THE AREA WITH DRY MID LEVEL 
AIR PROMINENT EACH DAY. THIS IN TURN WILL KEEP SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS AT A MINIMUM...WITH SEVERE THREATS EXTREMELY LOW. 
CONFIDENCE LOWERS EACH DAY THROUGH THE EXTENDED DUE TO MODELS 
CONTINUING TO DIVERGE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             57  80  58  77  57 /   0   0   0  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  55  81  55  76  55 /   0   0   0  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       55  80  55  77  55 /   0   0   0  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              51  77  51  73  48 /   0   0   0  10  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

187 
FXUS64 KMRX 300701
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT TUE APR 30 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES EXTENDING SOUTHWESTWARD 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS 
OBSERVED OVER THE FORECAST AREA. IT APPEARS THAT FOG SHOULD BECOME 
FAIRLY WIDESPREAD THIS MORNING TOWARDS SUNRISE...AS THESE CLEAR 
SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS COMBINE WITH THE HIGH GROUND MOISTURE FROM 
THIS WEEKEND'S RAINS. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR FOR A POSSIBLE DENSE 
FOG ADVISORY LATER THIS MORNING...DEPENDING ON HOW WIDESPREAD THE 
DENSE FOG BECOMES TOWARDS SUNRISE. OTHERWISE...TRANQUIL CONDITIONS 
ARE EXPECTED TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION 
POSSIBLE OVER THE MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WHERE SOME 
WEAK INSTABILITY IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT 
WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...RIDGING BOTH SURFACE AND 
ALOFT WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYERS IN THE FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
FRIDAY. SURFACE RIDGE EAST OF THE SPINE OF APPALACHIANS WILL PRODUCE 
UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE WESTERN CAROLINA MOUNTAINS WITH SOME OF THE 
LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE SPILLING INTO FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS.. 
CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES OF NORTH CAROLINA AND EVENTUALLY INTO 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE/PLATEAU. UPPER RIDGING ALOFT AND SURFACE RIDGING 
WILL KEEP THE AIR MASS RELATIVELY STABLE WITH CONVECTION CHANCES 
LOW...SO HAVE LOWERED POPS TO NIL MOST LOCATIONS.

FOR THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...GFS AND ECMWF SHOW AN 
UPPER TROUGH IMPACTING THE WEATHER OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. THE 
EVOLUTION OF THE SYSTEM IS QUITE DIFFERENT WITH THE ECMWF KEEPING 
THE UPPER LOW FARTHER NORTH AND WEST. GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE 
GFS..BUT STILL THE WESTWARD PROGRESSION OF THE ASSOCIATED CONVECTION 
WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA AS UPPER TROUGH IS 
CUT-OFF FROM UPPER FLOW...THUS MOVEMENT IS SLOW. WILL GRADUALLY 
RAISE POPS AREA-WIDE TO HIGH CHANCE. INITIALLY...INSTABILITY IS 
LIMITED DUE TO PERSISTENT RIDGING INTO THE GULF LIMITS MOISTURE 
RETURN NORTHWARD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. BY LATE SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...MODELS SHOW ENOUGH INSTABILITY TO INCLUDE THUNDER.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFX MOS TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE EXTENDED.
&&

THESE AREAS. BUT ULTIMATELY...THINK THAT FOG...WITH AT LEAST IFR 
VISIBILITIES...WILL DEVELOP AT ALL THREE TAF SITES TOWARDS 
SUNRISE...AND WILL EVEN MENTION VLIFR CONDITIONS AT KTRI. OTHER THAN 
THIS MORNING'S FOG...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED FOR

235 
FXUS64 KMRX 291925
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT MON APR 29 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...HEIGHTS WILL SLOWLY BUILD 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM FORECAST ALLOWING FOR MORE SUNSHINE AND A 
LITTLE MORE WARMING ON TUESDAY. THERE MAY BE JUST ENOUGH WARMING TO 
COINCIDE WITH A MOIST AXIS IN THE VICINITY OF WEAK INSTABILITY OVER 
SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE 
NORTH CAROLINA BORDER FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A SHOWER. THE OTHER 
FEATURE OF NOTE IN THE SHORT TERM PERIOD IS THE POTENTIAL FOR FOG 
FORMATION AFTER THE WEEKEND SOAKING. THE STILL VERY WET GROUND AND 
POSSIBLE CLEARING SKIES MAY LEAD TO THE FOG BECOMING WIDESPREAD. THE 
QUESTION IS WILL THE FOG BECOME DENSE? CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ENOUGH AT 
THIS TIME TO ISSUE A DENSE FOG ADVISORY DUE TO THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME OF THE CU FLATTENING OUT INTO A STRATUS LAYER...ESPECIALLY 
NORTHERN SECTIONS LATER TONIGHT. IN THE MOIST OVERNIGHT ENVIRONMENT 
EDGED MIN TEMPS TOWARD THE MIDDLE OF MET/MAV GUIDANCE WHILE STAYING 
CLOSER TO THE SLIGHTLY COOLER MET MOS MAXES FOR TUESDAY.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...HIGHER PRESSURE WILL SET 
UP IN OHIO VALLEY WITH A CLOSED UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE GULF STATES 
TROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WORK WEEK. EXPECT A DIURNAL SETUP WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY WITH LOW PRECIP CHANCES IN THE MORNING...WITH SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING IN THE AFTERNOON. LOW INSTABILITY WITH 
LACK OF STRONG SHEAR AND UPPER LEVEL FORCING LEAVE THE SEVERE THREAT 
OUT FOR THESE DAYS. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON AND REMAIN THROUGH THE PERIOD. HIGH TEMPS WILL START OFF 
IN THE 80S WEDNESDAY AND DROP INTO THE 60S FRIDAY AS NEXT LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM AFFECTS THE AREA. 

FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL DIVE DOWN INTO 
THE MIDWEST STATES WHERE THE LOW WILL STRENGTHEN AND THEN SLOWLY 
MOVE NORTHEAST TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES. MODELS IN DISAGREEMENT AND 
TIMING OF THE LOW PRESSURE AFFECTING THE REGION...BUT WENT WITH 
ECMWF AS IT SEEMS TO BE HANDLING THE SYSTEM A LITTLE MORE 
CONSISTENTLY. A COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW WILL BEGIN TO 
AFFECT THE AREA FRIDAY EVENING...AS PRECIP CHANCES INCREASE AHEAD OF 
THIS FRONT. AGAIN...FROM LACK OF INSTABILITY AND THE SLOW MOVING 
FRONT...THE SEVERE THREAT WITH THESE THUNDERSTORMS IS VERY LOW. THIS 
FRONT WILL KEEP RAIN CHANCES WITH ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE 
AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND. ANOTHER WEAK DISTURBANCE MOVES IN LATE 
MONDAY EVENING. 

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 290743
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT MON APR 29 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE 
REMNANTS OF A WEAK COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...WITH A WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS OCCURRING ALONG THIS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY...AS A SLOW-MOVING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH PROVIDES SOME 
LIFT OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS UPPER TROUGH IS PROGGED TO ONLY 
SLOWLY DRIFT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...SO CLOUDS 
SHOULD LINGER THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS BEFORE GRADUALLY DISSIPATING 
IN THE AFTERNOON. THIS UPPER TROUGH IS PROGGED TO COMPLETELY EXIT 
THE REGION BY TONIGHT...WITH ZONAL FLOW DEVELOPING ALOFT. WITH LIGHT 
WINDS AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES EXPECTED TONIGHT...WILL MENTION AREAS 
OF FOG DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT DUE TO HIGH GROUND MOISTURE FROM 
THIS WEEKEND'S RAINS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE 
WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THOUGH SUNDAY)...THE COMBINATION OF GULF 
MOISTURE AND SOME DECENT HEATING WILL ALLOW FOR SOME DIURNALLY 
DRIVEN SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WORK 
WEEK. A SURFACE RIDGE BUILDING IN WILL ALLOW FOR SOME WARMER WEATHER 
AS WELL...WITH HIGHS RETURNING TO THE UPPER 70S AND LOWER 80S. BY 
FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY HOWEVER...A FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO 
APPROACH THE REGION FROM THE WEST. THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO 
DROP TO AT OR BELOW SEASONABLE LEVELS HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND. 
ATTM...THERE STILL EXISTS SOME CONSIDERABLE DIFFERENCES AMONG THE 
LONG-TERM MODELS REGARDING THE EXACT TRACK AND TIMING OF THE 
AFOREMENTIONED STORM SYSTEM...SO HAVE NOT GONE TOO HIGH WITH POPS AS 
OF YET. ONCE THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH HOWEVER...THE DEEPENING 
UPPER-LOW IN PLACE OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS SHOULD RESULT IN SOME 
DECENT PRECIPITATION CHANCES AND PERSISTENT COOLER TEMPERATURES 
HEADING INTO THE FOLLOWING WEEK.
&&

369 
FXUS64 KMRX 281920
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT SUN APR 28 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A GOOD FETCH OF GULF
MOISTURE CONTINUES TO STREAM IN AHEAD OF THE SLOW MOVING LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM AND WEAK COLD FRONT. TEMPTED TO DROP POPS
CONSIDERABLY OVER NRN PLATEAU COUTNIES...BUT FRONT HAS NOT YET
CLEARED THOSE AREAS AND AIRMASS IS SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE AS FAR WEST AS
MIDDLE TN AND CENTRAL KY. OTHERWISE...LOWERING POPS FROM THE NW TO
SE OVERNIGHT AND DROPPING ANY MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS AFTER
MIDNIGHT. TEMPS WON'T DROP MUCH MORE THAN A CATEGORT OR TWO OVERNIGHT.

FLOODING CONCERNS ARE MINIMAL THIS AFTERNOON AND SHOULD BE ABLE TO
LET THE URBAN AND SMALL STREAM FLOOD ADVISORY FOR MARION COUNTY
EXPIRE AT 415 PM CDT. EMORY RIVER AT OAKDALE IS STILL ON THE
INCREASE...BUT NOT EXPECTED TO GO NEAR OR ABOVE THE FLOOD STAGE OF
27.0 FEET. 

MINOR CHANGES FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT WERE TO LOWER POPS...
ESPECIALLY OVER THE WRN AREAS. LOOKS LIKE CLEARING MONDAY NIGHT AND
BOUNDARY LAYER WILL BE MOIST...SO INCLUDED PATCHY FOG LATE. 
LOWERED POPS CONSIDERABLY FOR TUESDAY WITH MAINLY DIURNAL
CONVECTION...WHICH SHOULD BE QUITE SPARSE IN COVERAGE OUTSIDE OF
MTN AREAS. OPTED FOR A MOS BLEND WITH DIFFERING MOS MINS FOR MONDAY
NIGHT. JUMPING INTO THE LOWER TO MID 80S FOR TUESDAY LOOKED A BIT
AGGRESSIVE TO ME...THUS I WENT CLOSER TO THE NOT AS WARM NAM MOS
MAXES.


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...PROGRESSION OF LONG
WAVE TRAIN ACROSS THE MID LATITUDES REALLY SLOWS DOWN AROUND THE
MIDDLE OF SPRING WITH CUT OFF LOWS TRUDGING ALONG AT A LEISURELY
PACE. BLOCKING RIDGE OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY WILL
KEEP SLIGHT AND SMALL CHANCES FOR CONVECTION IN PLACE ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCE IN THIS
SCENARIO BEING ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND ALONG THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU. BY FRIDAY THE UPPER TROUGH/CLOSED LOW AND ASSOCIATED
SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL HAVE MADE PROGRESS INTO THE EASTERN
HALF OF THE COUNTRY WITH MOISTURE/INSTABILITY AXIS BUILDING INTO
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. FORECAST HIGHEST CHANCE POPS
FRIDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE SURFACE COLD FRONT INCHES ITS
WAY ACROSS THE REGION. SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY THE BOUNDARY SLIPS
FURTHER NORTHEAST ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
WHERE POPS WERE HELD A LITTLE HIGHER THAN ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. DIFFICULT
TO SAY EXACTLY WHERE THE CUT OFF LOW WILL END UP BUT MODELS PLACE
THE LOW ACROSS THE UPPER MIDWEST BY SUNDAY AND A SOUTHERLY LOW
LEVEL COMPONENT WILL KEEP THE AREA SUPPLIED WITH JUST ENOUGH
MOISTURE ALONG WITH SOME DAYTIME HEATING FOR A SMALL CHANCE FOR A
SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM SO KEPT THIS IDEA GOING ON SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
156 PM EDT SUN APR 28 2013

.AVIATION...RAIN MAKING MACHINE WILL REMAIN IN PLACE THIS AFTERNOON
AS CONVEYOR BELT OF WARM AND MOIST AIR OUT OF THE GULF OF MEXICO
OVERRUNS RELATIVELY COOL AIRMASS ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY. WORST
CONDITIONS EARLY WILL BE AT CHA WHERE CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE BUT
FLIGHT WEATHER NOT THAT GREAT AT TYS AND TRI EITHER WITH OCCASIONAL
MVFR AND BORDERLINE IFR REDUCTIONS IN VSBY WITH LOWER CEILINGS. THE
RAIN GRADUALLY TAPERS OFF FROM WEST TO EAST OVERNIGHT WITH RAIN
MOVING OUT BUT SOME MVFR FOG AND LOW MVFR CEILINGS FORMING. DRIER
AIR ALLOWS FOR IMPROVED FLIGHT OPERATIONS BY MID TO LATE MORNING AT

.DISCUSSION...SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE THIS MORNING 
ACROSS THE BULK OF THE FORECAST AREA...AHEAD OF THE SLOW MOVING COLD 
FRONT. A SWATH OF HEAVIER RAINS TRACKED ACROSS PARTS OF THE SRN 
VALLEY COUNTIES NE TO TYS...WHERE 2.34 INCHES OF RAIN FELL OVERNIGHT 
AT MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT. COOP RAINFALL REPORTS ALSO INCLUDED 2.64 
INCHES AT DAYTON AND 2.43 INCHES AT DECATUR. KHTX AND KMRX RADARS
BOTH APPEAR TO BE SHOWING HIGHER RAINFALL ESTIMATES THAN THE 
AVAILABLE RAIN GAGES INDICATE FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS...AS WELL AS 
STORM TOTALS FOR THE WEEKEND. 

SEEING MINOR RISES AT THE EMORY RIVER AT OAKDALE AND THE SEQUATCHIE 
RIVER NEAR WHITWELL THIS MORNING...WITH THE SEQUATCHIE EXPECTED TO 
GET VERY CLOSE TO THE FLOOD STAGE OF 14.0 FEET BY MONDAY MORNING.
FLOOD STATEMENTS ISSUED RECENTLY FOR THESE 2 RIVERS.

FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK WITH OCCASIONAL SHOWERS AND ISOLATED TO 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE REST OF TODAY. MAY NEED TO LOWER MAX 
TEMP FORECAST GIVEN THE HIGH POPS AND SO MUCH CLOUD COVER.

955 
FXUS64 KMRX 280745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT SUN APR 28 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR EVANSVILLE INDIANA...WITH A WARM 
FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHEAST OF IT ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND INTO NORTHERN 
AL. AREA RADARS REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF WEAKENING CONVECTION OVER THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WHICH WAS SLOWLY MOVING EASTWARD. THIS ACTIVITY 
HAD PRODUCED SOME FLOODING OVER MIDDLE TN EARLIER IN THE NIGHT...SO 
WILL PLAN TO MENTION 'RAIN MAY BE HEAVY AT TIMES' IN THE ZONES. WITH 
THIS CONVECTION EXPECTED TO CONTINUE WEAKENING THIS MORNING...DO NOT 
SEE A NEED FOR A FLOOD WATCH OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT SOME URBAN 
AND SMALL STREAM FLOODING APPEARS TO BE POSSIBLE IN SOME AREAS THIS 
MORNING. THE SURFACE LOW IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MOVE NORTHEASTWARD 
TODAY...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY THIS MORNING... 
WHICH THEN BECOMES MORE SURFACE BASED BY THIS AFTERNOON. THUS...IT 
APPEARS THAT SOME STRONG TSTORMS WITH GUSTY WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE 
TODAY...ALONG WITH SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT MOST CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY WILL SLOWLY MOVING EAST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AXIS 
MOVES OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL 
COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THOUGH SATURDAY)...THE UPPER-TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO 
PULL EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY...AND WITH IT THE BETTER 
CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION. HOWEVER...STILL THINK THAT SOME DECENT 
CHANCES WILL EXIST ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND EASTERN ZONES DURING THE 
DAY...BEFORE DROPPING OFF QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET. ABUNDANT GULF 
MOISTURE AND SOME DECENT HEATING WILL ALLOW FOR SOME DIURNALLY 
DRIVEN THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS 
BEGINNING TUESDAY...ALONG WITH WARMER TEMPERATURES IN THE 70S TO 
EVEN LOWER 80S IN SOME PLACES DURING THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WEEK. 
HOWEVER...ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS 
WILL DRIVE A COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION ON FRIDAY AND LATE INTO THE 
WEEK. THIS WILL PROVIDE THE AREA WITH SOME GOOD OPPORTUNITIES FOR 
RAINFALL HEADING INTO THE WEEKEND...ALONG WITH NOTABLY COOLER 
TEMPERATURES.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT SAT APR 27 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SHOWERS SPREADING SLOWLY
EAST THIS AFTERNOON WITH LITTLE LIGHTNING NOTED OVER OUR REGION.
HOWEVER...ATMOSPHERE BECOMING MORE UNSTABLE TO OUR WEST ACROSS W TN
AND NRN MS...WITH A SEVERE TSTM WATCH EXPECTED SHORTLY. EXPECT THIS
CONVECTION TO INCREASE AND SPREAD EAST OVERNIGHT...WITH GOOD
COVERAGE AT LEAST THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. AIR MASS REMAINS SLIGHTLY
UNSTABLE OVERNIGHT...SO CARRIED A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS ALL BUT
NE TN AND SW VA. LOWERED POPS SLIGHTLY FROM W TO E BY SUNDAY
AFTERNOON.

SOME UNCERTAINTY ON HOW WIDESPREAD LINGERING CONVECTION IS BY
SUNDAY EVENING...WITH MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION ON TAP FOR MONDAY. 
MADE A FEW ADJUSTMENTS TO PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS FOR THOSE
PERIODS. GFSX MOS POPS LOOKED A BIT LOW TO ME FOR MONDAY...SO KEPT
CLOSER TO A BLEND OF NAM AND GFSX MOS.

OTHERWISE...CURRENT TEMPS MAY FALL A FEW DEGREES OVERNIGHT...WHILE 
MOS MAXES LOOK A FEW DEGREES TOO WARM EACH DAY. FOLLOWED A MOS
BLEND FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. RAINFALL TOTALS SHOULD END UP IN THE 1 TO 3
INCH RANGE IN GENERAL...SO NO SIGNIFICANT FLOOD CONCERNS AT THIS
POINT.  


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE 
SLOWLY MOISTENING AND DESTABILIZING EARLY IN THE PERIOD ON TUESDAY 
AND WEDNESDAY WITH SMALL CHANCE PROBABILITIES FOR CONVECTION EACH 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. WENT CLOSER TO THE SLIGHTLY FASTER GFS 
WITH A LARGE SLOW MOVING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH/CLOSED LOW AND SURFACE 
FRONTAL SYSTEM BUILDING TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY. THE 
SYSTEM ENTERS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY FRIDAY WITH SLOW 
EXIT ON SATURDAY. FOR THIS PERIOD KEPT POPS IN A LOW TO MEDIUM 
CHANCE RANGE WITH HIGHEST POPS DURING THE DAYTIME PERIODS WITH ADDED 
BENEFIT OF DIURNAL INSTABILITY. USED CONVECTION FOR THURSDAY WITH 
SUFFICIENT HEATING FOR THUNDERSTORMS WHILE OPTING FOR SHOWERS FRIDAY 
AND SATURDAY WITH A SLIGHTLY COOLER LOW LEVEL AIRMASS IN PLACE.

FXUS64 KMRX 270729
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT SAT APR 27 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...WITH A WARM FRONT 
EXTENDING EASTWARD FROM IT ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH. AREA RADARS REVEAL 
AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
THIS MORNING...WHICH SHOULD GRADUALLY FILL IN ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA AFTER SUNRISE AS AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE SLOWLY 
APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY DEVELOPING TODAY OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...SO WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION SCATTERED TSTORMS OVER 
SOUTHEAST TN...CENTRAL EAST TN...AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST NC. THE 
ELEVATED NATURE OF THIS INSTABILITY SHOULD KEEP ANY TSTORMS FROM 
BECOMING SEVERE OVER THE FORECAST AREA...BUT THE GFS MODEL INDICATES 
THAT RAINFALL COULD BE HEAVY AT TIMES LATER THIS MORNING AND EARLY 
AFTERNOON. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO ONLY SLOWLY DRIFT 
ACROSS THE WESTERN TN RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...WITH AN EXTENSIVE 
COVERAGE OF RAIN CONTINUING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA INTO TONIGHT. 
AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN UPPER-TROUGH MOVING THROUGH 
THE TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS ON SATURDAY WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE EAST 
ON SUNDAY...AND MAY WELL LINGER INTO MONDAY BEFORE FINALLY CLEARING 
THE AREA. WITH ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE IN PLACE ACROSS THE 
REGION...SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP AND MOVE ACROSS 
THE AREA ON SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY AND MOUNTAIN ZONES/...BEFORE THINGS GRADUALLY BEGIN 
TO TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO EAST ON MONDAY AS THE TROUGH FINALLY PULLS 
EAST. AM NOT EXPECTING ANY WIDESPREAD FLOODING CONCERNS...BUT 
BETWEEN 1-3 INCHES OF RAINFALL SEEMS POSSIBLE THIS WEEKEND INTO 
EARLY NEXT WEEK...SO LOCALIZED MINOR FLOODING OF LOW-LYING FLOOD 
PRONE AREAS WILL CERTAINLY BE A POSSIBILITY. 

THUNDERSTORMS CHANCES WILL PERSIST FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK 
THANKS TO GULF MOISTURE LINGERING ACROSS THE REGION AND A FEW 
SHORTWAVES MOVING ALONG THE SOUTHEASTERN UNITED STATES. LATE IN THE 
WEEK ON THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY A FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL PUSH THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA...PROVIDING EVEN BETTER CHANCES FOR STORMS TO CLOSE 
OUT THE WORK WEEK. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF SHOW A VERY DEEP CLOSED 
CUTOFF UPPER-LOW OVER THE CENTRAL UNITED STATES LATE NEXT WEEK. 
THOUGH THE TRACK AND INTENSITY ARE STILL UNCERTAIN ATTM...THIS COULD 
SPELL SOME SIGNIFICANTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES FOR THIS WEEKEND ACROSS 
THE REGION AND THE ENTIRE EAST COAST.
&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EDT FRI APR 26 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...STILL MANY HOURS AWAY FROM
ANY RAIN DEVELOPING AS HIGH CLOUDS WERE JUST STARTING TO REACH NE
TN AND SW VA. ISENTROPIC LIFT DEVELOPS TONIGHT AHEAD OF THE
APPROACHING SHORTWAVE COMING OUT OF THE CENTRAL PLAINS...BUT
CHANCES OF MEASURABLE RAIN LOOK SLIM FOR THE FAR NE CORNER THROUGH
12Z SATURDAY. NO THREAT OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR TONIGHT AND PROBABLY
JUST SOME LIGHT RAIN FOR WEATHER TYPE. ONLY SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS
NEEDED FOR TONIGHT'S GRIDS.

AIRMASS BECOMES SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE OVER WRN SECTIONS BY SATURDAY
AFTERNOON...WITH A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS JUSTIFIED FOR ALL BUT
NE TN/SW VA. MAX TEMPS TRICKY DUE TO CLOUDS AND HIGH POPS...BUT I
STUCK CLOSE TO THE SIMILAR MOS MAXES...WHICH SHOULD WORK IF WARM
FRONT STAYS SOUTH OF THE SRN VALLEY COUNTIES. ANYWAY...THIS IS THE
START OF A FEW DAYS OF WET WEATHER FOR THE REGION.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE SLOW MOVING 
TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT WILL BRING WET WEATHER THROUGH THE REMAINING WEEKEND. SUNDAY 
WILL BE MORE UNSTABLE THAN SATURDAY SO MORE RUMBLES OF THUNDER WILL 
OCCUR DURING THE DAY SUNDAY. ADDITIONALLY PERIODS OF HEAVIER 
RAINFALL WILL OCCUR WHERE THOSE THUNDERSTORMS DO OCCUR. THE SOUTHERN 
VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL LIKELY SEE THE HIGHEST RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
THROUGH MONDAY. ALL OF THE LONGER RANGE MODELS AND ENSEMBLES BEGIN 
TO DIVERGE AFTER MONDAY. HOWEVER...BEGINNING TUESDAY WE WILL LOOK 
FOR CHANCES OF AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY NEXT WEEK. THIS WILL 
BE IN RESPONSE TO AN INCREASE IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE 
NEXT FRONTAL SYSTEM THAT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE NEXT WEEK. AS 
MENTIONED EARLIER...MODELS DIVERGE AND PREFER THE ECMWF BRINGING THE 
FRONT INTO THE FORECAST AREA SOMETIME FRIDAY. THE TROUGH ON FRIDAY 
MAY SPILL IN MUCH COLDER I.E. UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR INTO THE REGION 
NEXT WEEKEND. THIS COLD AIR MAY CAUSE FROST/FREEZE CONDITIONS. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             52  68  56  71  55 /  60 100  90  90  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  51  62  52  70  56 /  50 100  90  80  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       50  61  53  70  55 /  60 100  90  80  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              44  63  49  67  50 /  30  70  80  80  70

MOVING EASTWARD ACROSS TN RIVER VALLEY...OUT AHEAD OF AN UPPER-LEVEL 
SHORT WAVE OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES. THESE HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD 
GRADUALLY INCREASE AND LOWER OVER THE TAF SITES TODAY...WITH 
OVERCAST CEILINGS THIS EVENING AND RAIN DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
HOWEVER...VFR CEILINGS ARE EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE TAF PERIOD AT ALL 
THREE TAF SITES...WITH MVFR VISIBILITIES DEVELOPING AT KCHA AND KTYS 
DUE TO LIGHT RAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT.

054 
FXUS64 KMRX 260742
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT FRI APR 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WITH A DRY 
AND UNSEASONABLY COOL AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALS SOME HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY... 
WHICH WERE MOVING EASTWARD TOWARDS THE TN RIVER VALLEY OUT AHEAD OF 
AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES. HIGH CLOUDS 
SHOULD CONTINUE TO INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...AS THIS 
SHORT WAVE SLOWLY DRIFTS EASTWARD INTO THE OZARKS REGION BY TONIGHT. 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL INCREASE OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...BUT THEY DIFFER ON THE EXACT LOCATION OF 
ANY RESULTING RAIN. WILL GENERALLY TREND THE PRECIP FORECAST WITH 
THE HIGHEST POPS OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR 
TONIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A VERY STABLE AIR MASS TONIGHT OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL NOT MENTION ANY THUNDER. AS FOR TEMPS... 
GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL 
QUICKLY OVERSPREAD THE REGION ON SATURDAY AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
SLOWLY DRAGS THROUGH THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. MODELS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT ON THE TIMING AND SHOW DECENT QPF SIGNALS MOVING IN 
AFTER 12Z AND INCREASING IN COVERAGE DURING THE AFTERNOON...EVENING 
AND INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. THUS...HAVE GONE CATEGORICAL POPS FOR 
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT GIVEN THIS HIGH CONFIDENCE. THE LATEST 
MODEL RUNS SHOW THE TROUGH LINGERING ACROSS THE REGION ON SUNDAY... 
WITH ADDITIONAL ROUNDS OF SHOWERS AND STORMS LIKELY. SO...HAVE 
INCREASED POPS PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE EASTERN AND MOUNTAINS ZONES 
ON SUNDAY. IN GENERAL...1-2 INCHES OF RAINFALL IS EXPECTED THROUGH 
SUNDAY EVENING WITH SOME LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE. THIS 
TROUGH SHOULD EVENTUALLY PULL EAST OF THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT INTO 
MONDAY...BUT THE POTENTIAL FOR DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL CERTAINLY 
EXIST INTO THE EARLY TO MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK. MODELS ARE THEN 
INDICATING A CUTOFF LOW TRACKING EAST ALONG THE GULF COAST FROM 
TEXAS ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...ALONG WITH ANOTHER UPPER-STORM 
SYSTEM OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES. THE LIFT FROM 
THESE TWO DISTURBANCES WILL COMBINE WITH THE ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE 
IN PLACE TO HELP GENERATE REASONABLE CHANCES FOR CONVECTION EACH DAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH A COLD FRONT POTENTIALLY LOOKING TO 
SWING THROUGH THE REGION ON THURSDAY.
&&

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     71  50  62  53  67 /   0  50 100  80  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN             71  51  61  53  67 /   0  50 100  80  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    68  44  61  50  63 /   0  30  70  80  80

FORECAST AREA. THIS DRY AIR MASS SHOULD COMBINE WITH THE COOL LAKE 
TEMPS TO PREVENT ANY FOG FORMATION AT THE TAF SITES THIS MORNING... 
SO WILL NOT MENTION ANY FOG IN THE TAFS. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS 
SOME HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY OCCURRING OUT AHEAD OF 
A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES. THE TREND 
SHOULD BE FOR THESE HIGH CLOUDS TO GRADUALLY INCREASE OVER THE TAF 
SITES TODAY...WITH OVERCAST SKIES EXPECTED BY THIS EVENING. 
HOWEVER...VFR CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE 
TAF PERIOD AT ALL THREE TAF SITES.

666 
FXUS64 KMRX 251830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT THU APR 25 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...AN AREA OF SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO EXTEND INTO THE AREA FOR THE PERIOD.  WILL 
BE MAINLY CLEAR...BUT EXPECT AN INCREASE IN MAINLY HIGH CLOUDS 
FRIDAY ESPECIALLY LATER IN THE DAY.  STILL APPEARS AREAS OF FROST 
WILL BE A GOOD BET OVER NORTH AND EAST AREAS INCLUDING NORTHERN 
PLATEAU...SO WILL KEEP FROST ADVISORY IN PLACE.  ALSO WILL INCLUDE   
MENTION OF PATCHY FROST MOST OTHER ZONES.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM 
MAV TEMPS.    

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH FROM CA 
QUICKLY MOVES INTO MO BY FRIDAY EVENING...THEN MORE SLOWLY CONTINUES 
INTO THE SE WITH WIDESPREAD RAINFALL ASSOCIATED WITH IT FOR THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS WEEKEND. AS THIS TROUGH SLIPS TO OUR EAST SUN NGT 
AND MON...WE MAY SEE DIURNAL CONVECTION CHANCES LINGERING EARLY IN 
THE NEW WORK WEEK.  FCST CONFIDENCE DROPS BY MIDWEEK DUE TO A 
BLOCKING PATTERN BECOMING SET UP OVER THE EAST COAST...AND A 
POTENTIALLY DEEP CUT OFF H5 LOW IN THE PLAINS. MODELS HAVE NOTABLE 
VARIATION OF THE MOISTURE FEED SOURCE INTO THAT CUTOFF. BASED ON THE 
ECMWF/S KS POSITION OF THE MIDWEEK TROUGH/CUTOFF...MOISTURE FLOW 
WILL BE PRIMARILY FROM THE GULF AS PER THE ECMWF...WHICH IS DRIER 
FOR OUR AREA. BUT THE GFS HAS THE CUTOFF OVER THE UPPER MISS RIVER 
VALLEY...AND TAPPING ATLANTIC MOISTURE...WHICH MAY DRAW IT ACROSS 
THE CAROLINAS AND E TN...THOUGH NOT A GUARANTEE. I/LL TRY TO SPLIT 
THE DIFF BETWEEN THE GFS AND MEX POPS...GOING WITH SCATTERED 
CONVECTION OVER THE MTNS AND ISOLATED OVER THE VALLEY...STILL 
EMPHASIZING A DIURNAL PATTERN...FOR DAY 6. CUTTING THAT BACK A 
LITTLE FOR DAY 7.


&&

915 
FXUS64 KMRX 250658
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 AM EDT THU APR 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE OZARKS AND WESTERN TN RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY. 
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS LINGERING OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING...WITH THIS MOISTURE TRAPPED 
BENEATH A MID-LEVEL INVERSION BETWEEN 850 AND 700 MB. THUS...EXPECT 
THESE CLOUDS TO ONLY SLOWLY DIMINISH THIS MORNING...AND WILL BE A 
LITTLE MORE PESSIMISTIC WITH THE WORDING OF SKY CONDITIONS. HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH 
THE WEAK COLD FRONT TO THE NORTHWEST APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA 
BY THIS EVENING...BUT ULTIMATELY DISSIPATING BEFORE REACHING THE 
FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE IS EXPECTED TO BECOME CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT...WHICH WILL LEAD TO A GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING SCENARIO WITH LIGHT WINDS AND MOSTLY CLEAR 
SKIES. WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO FALL INTO THE 30S ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VA...NORTHEAST TN...THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST NC 
AND THE MOUNTAINS...THINK THAT AREAS OF FROST WILL DEVELOP TOWARDS 
SUNRISE ON FRIDAY MORNING. THUS...WILL ISSUE A FROST ADVISORY FOR 
THESE AREAS...AND WILL MENTION PATCHY FROST ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TN. 
AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES 
ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED NORTHEAST OF THE AREA RIDGES INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. THIS FEATURE SHIFTS SLIGHTLY EAST WITH TIME. 
WEAK UPPER LOW MOVES EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY OVER THE WEEKEND. 
FRIDAY WILL BE DRY WITH COOL TEMPERATURES. UPPER IMPULSES AHEAD AND 
SOUTH OF UPPER LOW WILL MOVES EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH OVER THE 
WEEKEND RESULTING IN CLOUDY CONDITIONS. LAYER MOISTURE INCREASES 
OVER THE WEEKEND WITH PWATS HOVERING NEAR 1.00. A WET WEEKEND IS 
SETTING UP WITH BEST LIFT AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES ON SATURDAY 
NIGHT. UPPER FLOW BECOMES NW ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND THE UPPER LAYER 
BEGINS TO DRY OUT AS RIDGING BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST THROUGH THE 
REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW AND WEAK MID LEVEL 
STEERING WILL FAVOR SCATTERED DIURNAL...MAINLY OROGRAPHIC CONVECTION 
TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. OVERALL TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL AND 
WENT BELOW WARM LOOKING GFS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   69  42  74  52  67 /   0   0  10  30  70 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     66  40  71  50  66 /   0   0   0  40  60

FXUS64 KMRX 241902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EDT WED APR 24 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT MAKING ITS
EXPECTED EASTWARD PUSH INTO AND THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THIS
AFTERNOON. TSRA ARE FEW AND FAR BETWEEN...WITH PROSPECTS FOR
THUNDER BETTER TO OUR NORTH OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WHERE A
VORT MAX WAS TRACKING NE INTO THE ERN OHIO VALLEY. THE LIMITED
INSTABILITY JUST WARRANTED AN ISOLATED TSRA MENTION IN A PRE FIRST
PERIOD GROUPING. BACK EDGE OF SHOWERS IS IN VIEW SO I DROPPED POPS
SIGNIFICANTLY AFTER 02Z THURSDAY. EXPECT DECREASING CLOUDS AFTER
THE EVENING HOURS. TOOK THE PATCHY FOG OUT OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN
AREAS...AS SIGNIFICANT FOG USUALLY DOES NOT DEVELOP RIGHT AFTER
PASSAGE OF A COLD FRONT. FOLLOWED THIS THINKING ALSO IN THE 18Z TAF
PACKAGE. 

PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND TEMPS ONLY ABOUT 5 DEGREES BELOW SEASONAL
NORMALS FOR THURSDAY...AS A SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE BUILD SE INTO THE REGION BY THURSDAY NIGHT.

OTHERWISE...WENT VERY CLOSE TO A MOS BLEND FOR MINS TONIGHT AND
FAVORED THE GFS MOS FOR MAX TEMPS THURSDAY.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A SOUTHERN STREAM 
SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. 
ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL INCREASE LATE SATURDAY SPREADING SHOWERS IN THE 
AREA. AS WAVE MOVES THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...DIVERGENCE 
ALOFT WILL INCREASE STRENGTHENING FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING OVER THE 
REGION. WILL INCREASE POPS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY TO LIKELY 
POPS.

PLENTY OF MOISTURE REMAINS FOR MONDAY ALONG WITH INCREASING 
INSTABILTY. WILL LIKELY SEE SOME TERRAIN INDUCED LIFT PRODUCE MAINLY 
DIURNAL CONVECTION ON MONDAY. FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...A 
LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH MOVES FROM THE ROCKIES INTO THE PLAINS STATES 
WHICH WILL STRENGTHEN AN UPPER RIDGE OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. 
WARMER TEMPERATURES AND GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED. 

AS COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS THROUGH THE PERIOD...EXCEPT WENT A DEGREE 
OR TWO WARMER TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY DUE TO INCREASING UPPER RIDGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT WED APR 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
STRONG COLD FRONT OVER THE OHIO RIVER AND MS RIVER VALLEYS... 
STRETCHING GENERALLY ALONG A LINE FROM DAYTON TO EVANSVILLE TO 
MEMPHIS TO SHREVEPORT. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE EASTWARD 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY...AND SHOULD MOVE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE EARLY AFTERNOON HOURS. WINDS ARE EXPECTED 
TO QUICKLY INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA NEAR THE FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY...WITH MOST OF THE CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY ASSOCIATED WITH THIS 
COLD FRONT OCCURRING BEHIND THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAK OVER THE FORECAST AREA...SO 
WILL MAINTAIN THE 'SHOWERS WITH SCATTERED TSTORMS' WORDING. RAIN 
SHOULD QUICKLY EXIT THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WITH MUCH 
COOLER AND DRIER AIR MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA BEHIND THE FRONT. 
AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST THROUGH FRIDAY. DRY CONDITIONS WITH 
TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL FOR THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE SLIDES OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST OVER THE WEEKEND WITH RIDGING 
INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. LOW CONFIDENCE FORECAST FOR 
REMAINDER OF FORECAST WITH SMALL FEATURE TIMING AND MODEL SPREAD 
CONSIDERATIONS. A WEAKLY DEFINED UPPER LOW WILL MOVE SLOWLY EAST 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY OVER THE WEEKEND WITH A SERIES OF FLAT SHORT 
WAVES PRESSING EAST ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. TOP DOWN MOISTURE INCREASE 
WILL COMMENCE AND CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEKEND. BEST LIFT AND 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BE SAT AND SAT NIGHT BUT CHANCE 
PRECIPITATION CONTINUES INTO MONDAY. INCREASED SOUTHERLY FLOW AND 
MOISTURE RETURNS TO THE AREA TUESDAY FOR ANOTHER ROUND OF 
CONVECTION. LEANED ON THE COOL SIDE OF TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE WITH 
SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR MOST PERIODS.
&&

437 
FXUS64 KMRX 232015
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED TEMPS AND POPS SECTION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 PM EDT TUE APR 23 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVING ACROSS THE REGION HAS PROMOTED A BEAUTIFUL WARM AND 
SUNNY DAY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AS TEMPERATURES HAVE 
RISEN INTO THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S BY MID AFTERNOON. THE PLEASANT 
WEATHER WILL BE COMING TO AN END THOUGH AS A COLD FRONT WILL 
APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND THEN MOVE ACROSS THE REGION 
TOMORROW BRINGING A LINE OF SHOWERS AND SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS TO 
THE AREA. MODELS ARE CONTINUING TO TREND SLOWER WITH THE PASSAGE OF 
THE FRONT...SO HAVE TRIMMED POPS BACK TO BELOW MENTIONABLE LEVELS 
BEFORE 12Z...BEFORE RAMPING THEM UP TO CATEGORICAL FROM WEST TO EAST 
DURING THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY. BY EARLY TO MID EVENING...THE FRONT 
SHOULD BE CLEARING THE AREA...SO HAVE REMOVED THEM COMPLETELY AFTER 
06Z WEDNESDAY NIGHT. GIVEN THE SPEED OF THIS SYSTEM...AM NOT 
EXPECTING ANY PROLONGED RAINFALL/FLOODING CONCERNS. THERE WILL BE 
SOME INSTABILITY TO WORK WITH...AND PERHAPS THE POTENTIAL FOR A 
STRONGER STORM OR DURING THE AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...THIS ACTIVITY 
SHOULD STAY BELOW SEVERE LEVELS AND PRIMARILY BE SHOWERS WITH SOME 
EMBEDED THUNDER MIXED IN.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THURSDAY WILL BE COOL AND 
DRY BEHIND THE DEPARTING COLD FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH. HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL DRIFT EAST THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...AND BECOME POSITIONED ALONG 
THE SE COAST ON FRIDAY. A RETURN FLOW OF GULF MOISTURE AND AN 
APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL BEGIN TO SPREAD PRECIP INTO THE 
AREA FRIDAY EVENING. THE GFS...ECMWF...AND CMC ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ONSET OF PRECIP FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH THE STRONGEST LIFT 
PROVIDED BY THE UPPER JET STREAK ON SATURDAY. WITH THE TROUGH BEING 
SLOW TO MOVE THROUGH AND A PROLONGED MOISTURE FEED FROM THE 
GULF...MODEL QPF AMOUNTS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT 
EXCEED TWO INCHES FOR MOST OF THE AREA. FLOODING COULD POTENTIALLY 
BE A CONCERN THIS PERIOD. THERE IS VERY LITTLE INSTABILITY...AND 
WILL ONLY MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY WHEN THE 
LIFT IS STRONGEST. POPS WILL BE IN THE LIKELY RANGE FRIDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT.

MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE ON SUNDAY...WITH THE ECMWF BEING ALONE IN 
DEVELOPING A CLOSED LOW OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. THE GFS HAS A 
WEAK TROUGH LINGERING OVER THE AREA. WITH EITHER PATTERN LOOKING A 
BIT UNSETTLED...WILL HAVE LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST. CONFIDENCE IS LOW FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   55  68  43  69  42 /  10  90  20   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     54  69  43  66  41 /  10  90  30  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             54  67  41  67  40 /  10  90  30  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    47  69  40  64  37 /  10  90  40  10   0

975 
FXUS64 KMRX 231852
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EDT TUE APR 23 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT/...
A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE MOVING ACROSS THE REGION HAS PROMOTED A
BEAUTIFUL WARM AND SUNNY DAY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AS
TEMPERATURES HAVE RISEN INTO THE UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S BY MID
AFTERNOON. THE PLEASANT WEATHER WILL BE COMING TO AN END THOUGH AS
A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND THEN MOVE
ACROSS THE REGION TOMORROW BRINGING A LINE OF SHOWERS AND SCATTERED
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE AREA. MODELS ARE CONTINUING TO TREND SLOWER
WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE FRONT...SO HAVE TRIMMED POPS BACK TO BELOW
MENTIONABLE LEVELS BEFORE 12Z...BEFORE RAMPING THEM UP TO
CATEGORICAL FROM WEST TO EAST DURING THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY. BY EARLY
TO MID EVENING...THE FRONT SHOULD BE CLEARING THE AREA...SO HAVE
REMOVED THEM COMPLETELY AFTER 06Z WEDNESDAY NIGHT. GIVEN THE SPEED
OF THIS SYSTEM...AM NOT EXPECTING ANY PROLONGED RAINFALL/FLOODING
CONCERNS. THERE WILL BE SOME INSTABILITY TO WORK WITH...AND PERHAPS
THE POTENTIAL FOR A STRONGER STORM OR DURING THE AFTERNOON.
HOWEVER...THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD STAY BELOW SEVERE LEVELS AND
PRIMARILY BE SHOWERS WITH SOME EMBEDED THUNDER MIXED IN.



.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
THURSDAY WILL BE COOL AND DRY BEHIND THE DEPARTING COLD FRONT AND
UPPER TROUGH. HIGH PRESSURE WILL DRIFT EAST THROUGH THURSDAY
NIGHT...AND BECOME POSITIONED ALONG THE SE COAST ON FRIDAY. A
RETURN FLOW OF GULF MOISTURE AND AN APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH
WILL BEGIN TO SPREAD PRECIP INTO THE AREA FRIDAY EVENING. THE
GFS...ECMWF...AND CMC ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ONSET OF
PRECIP FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH THE STRONGEST LIFT PROVIDED BY THE UPPER
JET STREAK ON SATURDAY. WITH THE TROUGH BEING SLOW TO MOVE THROUGH
AND A PROLONGED MOISTURE FEED FROM THE GULF...MODEL QPF AMOUNTS FOR
FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT EXCEED TWO INCHES FOR MOST OF
THE AREA. FLOODING COULD POTENTIALLY BE A CONCERN THIS PERIOD.
THERE IS VERY LITTLE INSTABILITY...AND WILL ONLY MENTION A SLIGHT
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY WHEN THE LIFT IS STRONGEST. POPS
WILL BE IN THE LIKELY RANGE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT.

MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE ON SUNDAY...WITH THE ECMWF BEING ALONE IN 
DEVELOPING A CLOSED LOW OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN STATES. THE GFS HAS A 
WEAK TROUGH LINGERING OVER THE AREA. WITH EITHER PATTERN LOOKING A 
BIT UNSETTLED...WILL HAVE LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST. CONFIDENCE IS LOW FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             76  55  68  43  69 /   0  10  90  20   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  74  54  69  43  66 /   0  10  90  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       75  54  67  41  67 /   0  10  90  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              73  47  69  40  64 /   0  10  90  40  10

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO THE FORECAST THIS MORNING. A MOSTLY SUNNY
DAY AND WARM DAY IS ON TAP FOR THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS AS WINDS VEER TO THE SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST LATE
THIS MORNING AND THICKNESS VALUES INCREASE AS A RIDGE SLIDES OVER
THE REGION. TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED QUICKLY THIS MORNING AND
SHOULD BE ABLE TO REACH THE LOW TO MID 70S ACROSS MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA /EXCEPT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS/ BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON.
WINDS COULD BE BREEZY AT TIMES AS THE PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS
LATE IN THE DAY AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING STORM SYSTEM FROM THE WEST.

FRONT AND MAY REACH THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATE TONIGHT. WARMING 
TREND CONTINUES WITH H85 TEMPS RISING TO NEAR 10C. MODELS IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES TODAY AND ABOVE NORMAL 
READINGS TONIGHT. 
 
.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...FROPA STARTS US OFF ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH CATEGORICAL POPS...SCATTERED TSTMS ALSO. COOLER WX 
BEHIND THE FRONT WITH CHILLY MIN TEMPS THURS AND FRI...MAYBE SOME 
PATCHY FROST OVER NE TN / SW VA / MTNS. WEATHER BECOMES UNSETTLED 
AGAIN BY SATURDAY WITH LIKELY POPS APPEARING. MODELS ARE STRUGGLING 
WITH SYNOPTIC PATTERN AS IT APPEARS TROUGHING OVER THE EAST COAST IS 
EXPECTED BUT HOW QUICKLY AND HOW SHARPLY IS STILL IN DOUBT. THUS 
DETAILS FOR LATE IN THE PERIOD ARE BLURRY...AND CHC OR SLGT CHC POPS 
ARE MAINTAINED FOR NOW. THE UNCERTAINTY WILL ALSO BE REFLECTED IN 
THE TEMPS FOR NEXT WEEK. NOT DEPARTING TOO FAR FROM NORMAL FOR NOW 
BUT FUTURE MODIFICATIONS ARE POSSIBLE.

441 
FXUS64 KMRX 221853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EDT MON APR 22 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
A SURFACE RIDGE HAS CONTINUED TO BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS
AFTERNOON...PROMOTING MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS...ALONG WITH
A SUBTLE WIND SHIFT TO THE ESE/SE. THIS HAS HELPED TO ALLOW
TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 60S TO AROUND 70 DEGREES BY
MID AFTERNOON. THE MOSTLY CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS WILL PERSIST
OVERNIGHT...ALLOWING SOME GOOD RADITIONAL COOLING TO TAKE PLACE.
TEMPERATURES WILL FALL OFF QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET...BEFORE BOTTOMING
OUT IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S ACROSS THE NORTHERN/CENTRAL VALLEY
AND THE UPPER 40S ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. WINDS WILL VEER TO
THE SOUTHWEST ON TUESDAY AHEAD OF AN APPORACHING COLD FRONT FROM
THE WEST. CLOUDS MAY INCREASE...BUT GIVEN THE SOUTHWEST FLOW...
INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES AND STILL AMPLE SUNSHINE...HIGHS WILL
CLIMB INTO THE LOW TO MID 70S ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH A COLD FRONT PUSHING INTO THE AREA 
ON WEDNESDAY. FRONTOGENETICAL FORCING AND UPPER DIVERGENCE WILL 
PROVIDE LIFT OVER THE AREA FROM 12Z WED IN THE PLATEAU TO AROUND 21Z 
IN THE MOUNTAINS. NO SEVERE THREAT IS EXPECTED DUE TO THE LACK OF 
INSTABILITY AND POSITION OF THE UPPER JET WELL TO OUR NORTH. WILL 
MENTION A CHANCE OF THUNDER WITH CATEGORICAL SHOWERS. WITH THE UPPER 
TROUGH BEING RATHER BROAD...THE FRONT IS SLOW TO CROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS...SO WILL KEEP SOME CHANCE POPS INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  

DRY WEATHER WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPS ARE EXPECTED FOR THE END OF THE 
WORK WEEK. THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE AREA ON 
SATURDAY. THE GFS AND ECMWF CONTINUE TO HAVE SOME SIGNIFICANT 
DIFFERENCES. THE ECMWF SHOWS A SLOWER MOVING CLOSED LOW WITH HEAVY 
QPF AMOUNTS IN OUR AREA SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. THE GFS HAS 
AN OPEN SHORTWAVE TROUGH THAT MOVES THROUGH SATURDAY AND SATURDAY 
NIGHT. THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN HAS MOST OF ITS PRECIP SATURDAY...SO 
WILL RAISE POPS TO LIKELY THAT PERIOD...WITH CHANCE POPS FOLLOWING 
THROUGH SUNDAY. CONFIDENCE FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY IS LOW WITH THE 
MODEL DISAGREEMENTS AND GENERALLY WEAK FORCING PATTERN. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             72  49  75  55  67 /   0   0  10  20  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  70  45  74  54  67 /   0   0  10  10  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       72  46  74  55  65 /   0   0  10  20  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              67  39  72  48  66 /   0   0   0  10  80

528 
FXUS64 KMRX 211828
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
228 PM EDT SUN APR 21 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE
CENTERED TO OUR NORTHEAST WILL CONTINUE TO EXTEND INTO THE AREA.
WILL SEE SOME SCATTERED TO BROKEN CLOUDS AROUND AT TIMES...BUT WILL
BE PRECIP FREE FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. APPEARS TEMPERATURES WILL
DIP INTO THE UPPER 30S IN NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS TONIGHT...AND WILL
MENTION PATCHY FROST THERE. NO FROST ADVISORY AS ANY FROST COVERAGE
NOT EXPECTED TO BE WIDESPREAD. MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL
STAY CLOSE.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... AFTER A BOUT OF DRIER
AND SLIGHTLY WARMER WEATHER ON TUESDAY...THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM
PROGGED TO BRING THE REGION SHOWERS AND STORMS WILL MOVE INTO THE
AREA ON WEDNESDAY. GIVEN THAT THE GFS HAS SLOWED DOWN THE
PROGRESSION OF THE COLD FRONT/PRECIP AND HAS COME MORE IN LINE WITH
THE NAM AND ECMWF...HAVE REMOVED MENTIONABLE POPS BEFORE 06Z
WEDNESDAY...AND THEN HAVE LOW END CHANCE POPS BEFORE 12Z.
HOWEVER...HAVE GONE CATEGORICAL POPS DURING THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY AS
ALL SOLUTIONS INDICATE THAT THE GREATEST POTENTIAL FOR SHOWERS AND
STORMS WILL OCCUR DURING THIS PERIOD. THEN...HAVE GRADUALLY TAPERED
THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST AS SOME ACTIVITY COULD LINGER ACROSS THE
EASTERN/MOUNTAIN ZONES THROUGH 12Z THURSDAY. DRIER WEATHER LOOKS TO
BE ON TAP FOR THE END OF THE WORK WEEK BEFORE ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH
MOVES INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN UNITED STATES THIS WEEKEND. THE GFS HAS
ALREADY STARTED TO COME IN LINE WITH THE SLOWER ECMWF
SOLUTION...AND THUS FELT COMFORTABLE GOING HIGH-END CHANCE POPS FOR
SATURDAY AND INCREASING POPS TO CHANCE ON SUNDAY AS WELL.
HOWEVER...WILL HOLD OFF ON SHOWING MUCH DETAIL ATTM...GIVEN
DIFFERENCES IN TRACK AND MODEL FLUCTUATION THAT FAR OFF.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  71  47  72  56 /  10  10  10  10  20

FXUS64 KMRX 210728
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT SUN APR 21 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL CONTINUE 
TO EXTEND DOWN THE APPALACHIANS AND INTO THE DEEP SOUTH THROUGH THE
PERIOD. AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY 
TODAY PUSHING SOME HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS THROUGH THE MID SOUTH. 
TEMPERATURES REMAIN BELOW NORMAL AS WEAK WARMING TREND GETS 
UNDERWAY. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...CURRENT MODEL RUNS TRENDING 
TOWARD KEEPING A WEAK SHORT WAVE EAST OF THE AREA ON MONDAY AND HAVE 
REMOVED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS.  WEAK RIDGING EXPECTED ON TUESDAY.  MAIN 
SYSTEM FOR THE EXTENDED CONTINUES TO BE A COLD FRONT PROGGED INTO 
THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH WEAK 
INSTABILITY ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL GENERATE 
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
IN ON FRIDAY.  MODELS SHOWING SOME DIFFERENCES BUT ARE INDICATE AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE MOVING IN FOR THE WEEKEND AND ANOTHER CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ON SATURDAY.

980 
FXUS64 KMRX 201848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EDT SAT APR 20 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY...
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL CONTINUE TO
PROVIDE SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES TO THE REGION
OVERNIGHT. MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES...DEWPOINTS NEAR FREEZING AND LIGHT
WINDS WILL ALLOW THE TEMPERATURES OVER THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...ALL
OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND PARTS OF NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE TO DROP
BETWEEN 33 AND 36 DEGREES. THUS A FROST ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED FOR
TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES WILL QUICKLY WARM AFTER SUNRISE SUNDAY. LOOK
FOR SEASONAL AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES AND INCREASING HIGH LEVEL
CLOUDS.

.LONG TERM /SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY/...
WARMER AND DRIER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED EARLIER THIS WEEK AS WINDS 
VEER BACK TO THE SOUTHEAST FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY AND A SURFACE 
RIDGE BUILDS IN. HOWEVER...THE PASSAGE OF AN UPPER-WAVE ON MONDAY 
COULD TRIGGER OFF SOME LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE SO HAVE ADDED SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND ALONG THE MOUNTAINS GIVEN 
THAT THE NAM HAS SHOWN THESE WEAK SIGNALS FOR SEVERAL RUNS NOW. THE 
MAIN WEATHER FEATURE FOR THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK WILL BE A COLD 
FRONT PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY...BRINGING A GOOD 
CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY DECENT 
AGREEMENT ON TIMING...SO THUS HAVE HIGH-END LIKELY POPS FOR THIS 
PERIOD...BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST RAPIDLY 
WEDNESDAY EVENING/NIGHT. A BRIEF STINT OF DRY/MILD WEATHER IS 
EXPECTED FOR THE LATER HALF OF THE WORK WEEK BEFORE THE NEXT 
UPPER-TROUGH MOVES TOWARD THE REGION THIS WEEKEND. THIS WILL BRING 
GOOD CHANCES FOR THUNDERSTORMS ONCE AGAIN...BUT GIVEN THE HIGH 
VARIABILITY BETWEEN THE MODELS WITH TIMING...HAVE OPTED TO STICK WITH 
LOWER CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       37  67  42  66  45 /   0   0   0  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              32  65  37  64  39 /   0   0  10  20  10 

&&

     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

     SUNDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...
     CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1027 AM EDT SAT APR 20 2013

.DISCUSSION...
BEAUTIFUL DAY ON TAP ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. TEMPERATURES WILL RUN ABOUT 10 DEGREES
BELOW NORMAL TODAY. CLOUDS OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WILL BREAK UP
MORE BY THE AFTERNOON AS THE BASE OF THE EASTERN U.S. TROUGH MOVES
FARTHER EAST. UNTIL THEN...BROKEN CLOUDS CAN BE EXPECTED. WILL
UPDATE THE SKY GRIDS BUT WILL NOT SEND A NEW ZONE PACKAGE FOR THAT
MINOR CHANGE. ALL OTHER FORECAST PARAMETERS LOOK LIKE THEY ARE ON
TRACK.

FXUS64 KMRX 200707
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EDT SAT APR 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES NORTH 
THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TODAY AND INTO THE GREAT LAKES TONIGHT.
TEMPERATURE ADVECTION BECOMING NEUTRAL EARLY TODAY AND LOW LEVEL 
THICKNESS VALUES RISE TONIGHT. MARGINAL FROST CONDITIONS THIS 
MORNING AND FROST ADVISORY MAY BE CANCELLED EARLY. COOL TEMPERATURES 
TODAY WELL BELOW NORMAL. FROST FREEZE CONDITIONS ALSO MARGINAL FOR 
TONIGHT FOR CENTRAL AND NORTHERN AREAS. DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE WITH 
SOME HIGH CLOUDS MOVING IN TONIGHT.   

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...COOL SURFACE HIGH DOMINANT 
FEATURE ON SUNDAY BUT WINDS SHIFTING TOWARDS THE SOUTH WILL BEGIN A 
SLIGHT WARMING TREND FOR THE EARLY PART OF THE EXTENDED.  CONTINUE 
TO SEE DIFFERENCES IN MODELS REGARDING TRACK OF A MINOR IMPULSE 
MOVING INTO THE CAROLINAS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  WITH LIMITED 
MOISTURE AND UNCERTAINTY ON STRENGTH AND TRACK...WILL LEAVE THINGS 
DRY FOR NOW.  MAIN SYSTEM OF CONCERN DURING THE EXTENDED WILL BE A 
COLD FRONT MID WEEK.  MODELS TRENDING SLIGHTLY SLOWER AND HAVE 
LOWERED POPS A BIT TUESDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUED LIKELY POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN ON THURSDAY.  MODELS HINTING AT 
ANOTHER SYSTEM WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA ON FRIDAY BUT IS NOT 
EXPECTED TO EFFECT THE MRX CWA UNTIL THE WEEKEND.

241 
FXUS64 KMRX 191847
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EDT FRI APR 19 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...COLDER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO 
PUSH IN TONIGHT BEHIND THE RETREATING COLD FRONT.  PRECIP SHOULD BE 
GONE BY TONIGHT BUT CLOUDS WILL LINGER INTO TONIGHT BEFORE 
DECREASING FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST.  TEMPS WILL DIP INTO THE MID 
TO UPPER 30S ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA IN THE FREEZE PROGRAM. WHILE 
THERE MAY BE ENOUGH WIND AND CLOUDS TO KEEP FROST FROM BEING TOO 
WIDESPREAD...APPEARS THERE IS ENOUGH OF A FROST RISK TO ISSUE A 
FROST ADVISORY FOR THOSE AREAS IN THE FREEZE PROGRAM.  HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BE IN CONTROL SATURDAY WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE EXPECTED.  MAV 
TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...COOLER AND DRIER
AIR WILL CONTINUE TO WORK ITS WAY INTO THE REGION IN WAKE OF THE
FRONTAL PASSAGE ON FRIDAY. WITH CLEARING CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS
SATURDAY NIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL FALL INTO THE MID TO UPPER 30S IN
MANY LOCATIONS...RESULTING IN A HIGHER PROBABILITY OF A FROST. AM
STILL MONITORING FOR THE POTENTIAL FOR A FREEZE AS WELL...AND DO
THINK THAT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS /AS WELL AS SOME SHELTERED AREAS
ACROSS THE NORTHEAST ZONES/ COULD DIP AT/BELOW THE FREEZING MARK.
HOWEVER...DO NOT THINK IT WILL BE VERY WIDESPREAD OR ENOUGH TO
WARRANT A WATCH ATTM. BY SUNDAY INTO MONDAY WINDS WILL VEER TOWARD
THE SOUTHEAST...RESULTING IN A SLIGHT WARM UP INTO THE UPPER 60S TO
LOWER 70S EARLY THIS WEEK. ANOTHER UPPER-WAVE PASSAGE ON MONDAY
COULD BRING SOME LIGHT SHOWERS ALONG THE FAR SOUTHERN ZONES AND
MOUNTAINS...BUT GIVEN THE HIGH VARIABILITY BETWEEN MODELS/RUNS AND
THE VERY WEAK QPF SIGNALS HAVE KEPT POPS BELOW MENTIONABLE LEVELS.
THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE NEXT WEEK WILL BE ANOTHER COLD FRONT
MOVING INTO THE REGION LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY
EVENING...BRINGING A GOOD SHOT OF SHOWERS AND STORMS FOR THE MIDDLE
OF THE WEEK. THE GFS IS A LITTLE FASTER THAN ECMWF...BUT BOTH
MODELS INDICATE A BULK OF THE PRECIPITATION OCCURRING ON
WEDNESDAY...SO HAVE LIKELY POPS AREAWIDE THEN...BEFORE CLEARING
THINGS OUT FROM WEST TO EAST BY THURSDAY. THEREAFTER...RIDGING
BEGINS TO MOVE IN...WITH DRIER WEATHER EXPECTED FOR THE END OF NEXT
WEEK.




&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

REMAIN POSSIBLE WITH ONGOING CONVECTION THOU THUNDERSTORM THREAT IS
VERY LOW. TEMPERATURES WILL FALL THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS. HAVE
MADE THESE ADJUSTMENTS TOP GRIDS AND ZONES. 

&&

FRONT AND REMAIN BREEZY THROUGH TODAY. WIDESPREAD CONVECTION WILL
CONTINUE ALONG FRONT AND BECOME SCATTERED BEHIND FRONT WHERE THERE
WILL BE CONTINUE UPPER SUPPORT INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. CIGS AND
VSBY WILL LOWER TO MVFR IN CONVECTION. MVFR CIGS WILL PERSIST
BEHIND THE FRONT THROUGH THE DAYTIME HOURS TODAY. SKIES WILL CLEAR
FROM THE SOUTHWEST TONIGHT AND WINDS WILL SLACKEN.

919 
FXUS64 KMRX 190713
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT FRI APR 19 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH 
THE AREA THIS MORNING. LOW LEVEL SOUTHERLY JET NEAR 60 KNOTS ACROSS 
THE AREA EARLY TODAY IN ADVANCE OF FRONT. SOME CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
VALLEY AREAS AND PORTIONS OF SW VA OUTSIDE OF CURRENT WIND ADVISORY 
WILL SEE SOME GUSTY WINDS THIS MORNING BUT PREVAILING CONDITIONS 
SHOULD BE BENEATH WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA. STRONG WINDS ARE EXPECTED 
WITH SOLID CONVECTION THAT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. WEST 
WINDS WILL ALSO BE BREEZY BEHIND FRONT THIS AFTERNOON. THESE 
CONDITIONS WILL BE MONITORED AND WINDS PRODUCTS WILL BE ADJUSTED IF 
NEEDED. LOW SEVERE THREAT CONTINUES THIS MORNING WITH DAMAGING WINDS 
THE GREATEST POSSIBILITY. MODERATE BULK SHEAR MOVES INTO THE AREA 
THIS MORNING. SOME STRONG WINDS MAY MIX DOWN WITH ONGOING 
CONVECTION. LOW LEVEL FAIRLY STABLE BUT SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY 
AVAILABLE. MAX TEMPERATURES WILL BE REALIZED THIS MORNING. CLOUDS 
AND PRECIPITATION WILL INHIBIT HEATING EARLY THEN COLD AIR ADVECTION 
GETS UNDERWAY THIS AFTERNOON. SOME POST FRONTAL CONVECTION MAY 
LINGER ACROSS NE AREAS THIS EVENING. TEMPERATURES FALL INTO THE 30S 
TONIGHT. MIXING SHOULD KEEP FREEZING THREAT AT BAY ACROSS VALLEY 
LOCATIONS. 
     
.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...BEHIND FRIDAY COLD 
FRONT...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND MUCH COOLER AIR WILL MOVE IN THE 
THE WEEKEND.  SATURDAY HIGHS WILL GENERALLY RANGE FROM THE MID 50S 
TO MID 60S.  SATURDAY NIGHT LOWS WILL FALL INTO THE 30S AND LOW 
40S...AND EXPECT A FROST ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED IN SOME NORTHERN 
LOCATIONS.  A WARMING TREND WILL BEGIN ON SUNDAY INTO MONDAY WITH 
SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNING TO THE AREA.  MODELS DIFFERING ON TRACK OF 
A SHORT WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE CAROLINAS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  
NAM BRINGS IT INTO THE APPALCHIANS WHILE THE GFS KEEP IT NEARER THE 
COAST.  WITH CONFIDENCE LOW...WILL ONLY INCREASE CLOUDS OVER THE 
AREA FOR NOW.  MAIN SYSTEM OF THE EXTENDED WILL BE A COLD FRONT 
MOVING IN TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY FOR LIKELY POPS AS A LINE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVES THROUGH.  COOLER...DRIER AIR WILL 
PUSH IN BEHIND THE FRONT FOR THURSDAY.

932 PM EDT THU APR 18 2013

.DISCUSSION...NOT SEEING ANY CONVECTION DEVELOP OVER OUR FORECAST

CAPPING INVERSION AROUND 700 MBS. IN FACT...AIRMASS OVER WRN TN AND 
WRN KY STARTING TO STABILIZE AND THE APPROACHING CONVECTION HAS 
GREATLY WEAKENED. DAY ONE OUTLOOK HAS SHIFTED THE FOCUS FOR SEVERE 
STORMS FROM SRN MIDDLE TN SOUTH INTO ERN MS/WRN AL FOR REST OF THE 
NIGHT. 

HOWEVER...STRENGTHENING LOW LEVEL JET WILL SET UP SOME ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY TOWARD DAYBREAK...SO EXPECT AN AREA OF SHOWERS WITH 
EMBEDDED TSRA ARRIVING ON THE PLATEAU IN THE 09Z TO 12Z PERIOD.
CURRENT FORECAST GRIDS RELFECT THIS TIMING...SO NO CHANGES PLANNED 
FOR NOW. VERY MILD TEMPS AT 01Z AND HOURLY GRIDS MAY GET SOME SLIGHT 
ADJUSTMENTS AFTER 03Z OBSERVATIONS COME IN. 

WILL CONTINUE THE WIND ADVISORY AS SPEEDS ON PLATEAU AND HIGHER 
TERRAIN SHOULD INCREASE OVERNIGHT.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EDT THU APR 18 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH 
THE AREA LATE TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY...EXITING TO THE EAST EARLY FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON.  STRONG LOW LEVEL JET AHEAD OF THIS FRONT WILL BRING 
STRONG WINDS TO SOME OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TONIGHT...SO WILL KEEP 
WIND ADVISORY AS IS.  APPEARS INSTABILITY WILL BE ON THE WEAK 
SIDE...BUT STILL EXPECT THUNDER AND WITH IMPRESSIVE LOW LEVEL WIND 
FIELD THERE IS STILL SOME RISK OF SEVERE STORMS...ESPECIALLY WESTERN 
ZONES. WILL KEEP MENTION IN HWO.  THUNDER SHOULD EXIT BY AFTERNOON 
WITH SOME SHOWERS LINGERING...THEN ENDING FROM WEST TO EAST BY LATE 
IN THE DAY.  WILL BUMP SOME MAV TEMPS UP A BIT FOR TONIGHT...BUT 
OVERALL NO MAJOR ARGUMENTS.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... COOLER AND DRIER
WEATHER WILL BEGIN TO TAKE HOLD THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK
IN WAKE OF THE COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE ON FRIDAY. WITH A LINGERING
NORTHEASTERLY FLOW...HIGHS ON SATURDAY WILL LIKELY STRUGGLE TO
CLIMB MUCH ABOVE THE 60 DEGREE MARK IN MANY LOCATIONS... WHILE LOWS
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT WILL DIP BACK INTO THE MID 30S TO LOWER
40S. THUS...THE POTENTIAL FOR A FROST ADVISORY TO BE NEEDED FRIDAY
NIGHT AND ESPECIALLY FOR SATURDAY NIGHT WILL NEED TO BE MONITORED.
WINDS WILL EVENTUALLY VEER BACK TO THE SOUTH BY SUNDAY AND
MONDAY...ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO REBOUND INTO THE UPPER 60S TO
LOWER 70S WITH MOSTLY/PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS. ANOTHER UPPER-WAVE
PASSAGE LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY COULD TRIGGER SOME LOW-END
PRECIPITATION CHANCES ALONG AND EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS. THEN...
ANOTHER MUCH DEEPER UPPER-TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION ON
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING A GOOD SHOT SHOT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
FOR THE MIDDLE OF THE WORK WEEK. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL
RAPIDLY CLEAR THE REGION BY THURSDAY...BRINGING IN DRIER AND COOLER
CONDITIONS TOWARD THE END OF NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT THU APR 18 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH AND 
ASSOCIATED STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE REGION LATER 
TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING. TODAY WILL BE A DRIER DAY THAN 
YESTERDAY WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE. STRENGTHENING PRESSURE GRADIENT 
WILL BOOST SOUTHERLY WINDS TO AROUND 10 TO 25 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS. 
APPLIED A WIND ADVISORY TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN TONIGHT AS 85H JET 
BUMPS UP TO AROUND 45 TO 50 KNOTS. LINE OF CONVECTION JUST AHEAD OF 
FRONT WILL MOVE ONTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU A FEW HOURS AFTER 
MIDNIGHT WITH THE LINE PROGRESSING TO NEAR A TYS AND CHA POSITION 
09-13Z AND ACROSS MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA BY MID 
DAY FRIDAY. QUITE A BIT OF SHEAR AVAILABLE WITH STORMS AS BULK SHEAR 
JUMPS UP TO AROUND 45-50 HOWEVER...BUOYANCY WILL BE VERY LIMITED 
WITH THE LINE BUILDING INTO THE REGION DURING THE EARLY MORNING 
HOURS. CERTAINLY IF ANY OF THE HIGHER VELOCITY FLOW CAN BE BROUGHT 
TO THE SURFACE...A FEW SEVERE GUSTS WILL BE POSSIBLE. BEST CHANCE 
FOR STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS WOULD BE ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
CLOSER TO THE BETTER INSTABILITY. TWEAKED MAX TEMPS JUST A BIT 
HIGHER THAN THE WARMEST GUIDANCE TODAY AND STAYED NEAR THE MIDDLE OF 
GUIDANCE FOR MINS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...PRECIP WILL BE EAST OF 
THE AREA BY 00Z SAT...SO WILL CARRY NO POPS INTO FRIDAY NIGHT 
PERIOD. COLD ADVECTION AND CLEARING SKIES WILL DROP LOWS INTO THE 
30S IN MOST SPOTS SATURDAY MORNING...BUT REMAINING ABOVE FREEZING 
OUTSIDE THE HIGHEST MOUNTAINS PEAKS. SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WILL BE DRY 
AND SUNNY WITH SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL TEMPS AS HIGH PRESSURE MOVES 
OVER THE REGION.

THE MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON A TROUGH TAKING SHAPE OVER THE PLAINS 
ON MONDAY...HOWEVER THE GFS AND ECMWF DIFFER ON PRECIP CHANCES FOR 
OUR AREA. THE ECMWF SHOW A SHORTWAVE TROUGH...WELL AHEAD OF THE 
DEEPENING LONGWAVE TROUGH...THAT BRINGS GULF MOISTURE ON 
MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT. THE GFS IS DRY THIS PERIOD...HOLDING OFF PRECIP 
UNTIL THE LONGWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES ON TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY. 
WITH THESE UNCERTAINTIES...WILL NOT MAKE MAJOR CHANGES TO THE 
FORECAST...AND KEEP MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT DRY WITH CHANCE POPS COMING 
IN FOR TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

WITH STRONG WINDS ALOFT BUT BEST INSTABILITY WILL SHIFT EAST OF THE 
MOUNTAINS BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. IF THE LINE DIMINISHES BY EARLY

AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILD THURSDAY NIGHT AND NOT RISE 
MUCH FRIDAY WITH FRONT AND RAIN MOST OF THE DAY. A FEW SHOWERS 
LINGER EARLY FRIDAY EVENING THEN CLEARING WITH LOWS DROPPING INTO 
THE MID TO UPPER 30S IN THE NE AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY WILL SUNNY AND DRY AS COLD HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE NORTHWEST. TEMPERATURES STAY BELOW NORMAL BUT BEGIN TO 
MODERATE MONDAY. SOUTH FLOW WILL INCREASE BY MONDAY NIGHT AS HIGH 
SHIFTS EAST. SHOWERS BACK IN FORECAST TUESDAY AHEAD OF NEXT FRONT 
AND CONTINUE WEDNESDAY AS FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION.
