FXUS64 KMRX 170748
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT WED APR 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CONVECTION WHICH FIRED ACROSS 
NORTHERN KENTUCKY TUESDAY EVENING IN ASSOCIATION WITH SHORT WAVE 
ENERGY TRAVERSING THE REGION HAS PROPAGATED SOUTHEAST INTO SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE EARLY THIS MORNING. A SIGNIFICANT 
PORTION OF THIS ACTION WILL HAVE PASSED SOUTH INTO CENTRAL EAST 
TENNESSEE BY 12Z THIS MORNING. APPLIED A CHANCE POP FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE NORTH CLOSER TO THE STATIONARY FRONT IN 
POSITION JUST NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AS WELL AS ANY OUTFLOW 
BOUNDARY FROM THE EARLY MORNING CONVECTION. MODELS NOT REVEALING ANY 
SIGNIFICANT SHEAR TODAY BUT DO SHOW SOME INSTABILITY DURING PEAK 
HEATING THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EARLY EVENING PERIOD. DOESN'T APPEAR 
TO BE ANY MAJOR FOCUS FOR CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON WITH FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY EDGING NORTH IN RESPONSE TO MAJOR UPPER TROUGH BUILDING 
EAST ACROSS THE ROCKIES. THEREFORE...FORECAST A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION IN THE VALLEY WHILE USING LOW CHANCE PROBABILITIES FOR 
THE MAJOR TERRAIN FEATURES. VERY LITTLE CHANCE FOR ANY CONVECTIVE 
PRECIP LATER IN THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT WITH ATMOSPHERE 
STABILIZING. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS TODAY AND TONIGHT.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...WITH A DEEP TROUGH CROSSING 
THE PLAINS ON THURSDAY...WE WILL SEE A TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENT 
BRINGING BREEZY CONDITIONS TO THE AREA. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE 
A STABLE ENVIRONMENT AND STRONG CAP THAT WILL KEEP US DRY UNTIL LATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF 
BRINGING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE PLATEAU JUST BEFORE 12Z 
FRIDAY...MOVING THROUGH THE TN VALLEY FRIDAY MORNING AND EARLY 
AFTERNOON. GIVEN THE STRONG UNIDIRECTIONAL SHEAR...EXPECT THAT THE 
STORMS WILL TAKE THE FORM OF A SQUALL LINE WITH SOME EMBEDDED BOW 
SEGMENTS...SOME OF WHICH MAY BRING THE 60 KTS WINDS AT 850 MB DOWN 
TO THE SURFACE IN SOME AREAS. THE LACK OF INSTABILITY WILL BE A 
LIMITING FACTOR FOR SEVERE STORMS. PRECIP WILL BE DECREASING THROUGH 
THE AFTERNOON WITH THE ADVECTION OF A COLDER AND DRIER AIR MASS 
FRIDAY NIGHT. LOWS WILL DROP INTO THE 30S IN SOME LOCATIONS ACROSS 
THE NORTH AND THE MOUNTAINS BOTH FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY NIGHT. 

THE WEEKEND WILL BE DRY AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA FROM 
THE WEST. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A BIT BELOW NORMAL. A SOUTHERLY FLOW 
BRINGS TEMPS BACK TO NORMAL BY MONDAY AS THE HIGH MOVES OFFSHORE. A 
GRADUAL INCREASE IN BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE IN THE SOUTHERLY FLOW 
REGIME MAY BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR TUESDAY. 

&&

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR SRN AND ERN AREAS WEDNESDAY EVENING...BUT KEPT THURSDAY DRY 
FOR NOW AS AIRMASS IS A LITTLE DRIER AND MUCH LESS UNSTABLE THAN 
WEDNESDAY. MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT AND CONSISTENT FROM 
EARLIER MODEL RUNS ON TIMING THE NEXT COLD FRONT FOR FRIDAY MORNING. 
SEVERE WEATHER PARAMETERS ARE NOT VERY NOTABLE FOR FRIDAY...DUE IN 
LARGE PART TO THE EARLY PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT. PREVIOUS POP AND 
WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED RIGHT ON TRACK FOR NOW. THE CONVECTION COULD 
END PRIOR TO FRIDAY EVENING...AND LIKELY AS EARLY AS THE AFTERNOON 
FOR WRN MOST AREAS.

A PLEASANT WEEKEND WITH A ZONAL TO SW FLOW ALOFT...WHILE A LARGE 
SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE COVERS THE ERN THIRD OF THE NATION. 
NOT SEEING MUCH SUPPORT FOR ANY RAIN CHANCES ON MONDAY...SO OPTED TO 
DROP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OUT OF THE FORECAST GRIDS. ANOTHER COLD 
FRONT IS INDICATED BY TUESDAY WITH SOME SIMILARITY BETWEEN THE GFS 
AND ECMWF MODELS. 12Z GFSX MOS WAS QUITE CLOSE TO 00Z GUIDANCE WITH 
LITTLE CHANGES MADE TO PREVIOUS MIN/MAX TEMP GRIDS.

084 
FXUS64 KMRX 160751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
351 AM EDT TUE APR 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
A MORE SUMMER-LIKE PATTERN SETS UP OVER THE REGION FOR THE NEXT FEW 
DAYS AS HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE ATLANTIC COAST BRINGS A S-SW FLOW TO 
THE TN VALLEY. TODAY...THE MODELS BRING AN AREA OF ENHANCED 850 MB 
THETA-E UP FROM THE DEEP SOUTH...ALONG WITH WEAK LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE AND A 500 MB VORT MAX. THIS SHOULD BRING SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS TO THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY...WITH DIMINISHING 
COVERAGE NORTH AND EAST WHERE THE CAP WILL BE STRONGER CLOSER TO THE 
RIDGE. LI AND MLCAPE VALUES SUGGEST SOME LOW POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE 
STORMS IN THE PLATEAU THIS AFTERNOON...WITH WINDS BEING THE MAIN 
THREAT ALONG WITH SOME MARGINALLY SEVERE HAIL. THE WARMING TREND 
CONTINUES...WITH MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS IN THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S.

SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION IS EXPECTED AGAIN ON 
WEDNESDAY...ALTHOUGH WITH LESS INSTABILITY AND LESS DYNAMIC FORCING 
IN SUPPORT AS THE MIDLEVEL RIDGE BUILDS SLIGHTLY OVERHEAD. HIGHS 
WILL REACH THE LOWER 80S IN MOST SPOTS. THURSDAY LOOKS DRY AS THE 
CAPPING INVERSION STRENGTHENS AND PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES DROP. 
TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE ABOVE NORMAL...WITH LOWS IN THE 
UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S AND HIGHS IN THE 80S.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS RELATIVELY CLOSE IN DEPICTION OF LATE WORK WEEK SYSTEM AS
ANOTHER DEEP UPPER LEVEL TROUGH ADVANCES INTO THE EASTERN U.S. LATE
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY WITH A HEALTHY COLD FRONT PRESSING INTO
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY
FRIDAY. TWEAKED POPS UP TO CATEGORICAL FOR THE EVENT WHICH LOOKS
LIKE IT WILL ARRIVE IN THE FORM OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.
TIMING STILL A BIT UNCERTAIN THIS MANY DAYS OUT SO BROAD BRUSHED
HIGH POPS FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO THE AFTERNOON ON FRIDAY.
MAINTAINED SOME SLIGHT THROUGH LOW CHANCE POPS LATE DAY AND EARLY
EVENING AS MODELS HINT AT SOME TRAILING SHORT WAVE ENERGY AND
MOISTURE BEHIND THE MAIN FRONTAL PUSH. KEPT A DRY AND COOLER
WEEKEND IN PLACE AS A COOL SURFACE RIDGE TAKES UP RESIDENCE ACROSS
THE EASTERN U.S. FORECAST CONFIDENCE LOWER DURING THE FINAL DAY OF
THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH SOME TIMING AND STRENGTH ISSUES WITH
ARRIVAL OF NEXT STORM SYSTEM SO JUST MAINTAINED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
FOR POSSIBILITY OF SHOWERS ON MONDAY.


&&

.DISCUSSION...

COVER ON THE LEESIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS AND WHETHER SOME OF IT WILL
BE ABLE TO WORK ITS WAY INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT.

SOME AT LEAST SOME LOW STRATUS ACROSS THE REGION...ALONG WITH SOME
PATCHY FOG ACROSS THE USUAL FOG-PRONE AREAS WHERE WINDS WILL BE
COMPLETELY DECOUPLED AND THE TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES COOLER.
HAVE GONE WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH BRIEF
MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FAR NORTHERN/NORTHEAST ZONES
AND THE MOUNTAINS LATE TONIGHT. HAVE ALSO GONE AHEAD AND ADDED A
MENTION OF PATCHY FOG BETWEEN 09-14Z TO ACCOUNT FOR THAT POTENTIAL
LATER TONIGHT AND EARLY TOMORROW MORNING. OTHERWISE...IT WILL BE A
FAIRLY MILD NIGHT DESPITE THE CLEAR AND CALM CONDITIONS WITH LOWS
BOTTOMING OUT IN THE 50S TO LOWER 60S.

JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON. MODELS SEEM TO BE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT ON THE NEXT SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT TO APPROACH BY 
12Z FRIDAY...SUPPORTING HIGH POPS FOR FRIDAY DAYTIME. NUDGED POPS UP 
TO UPPER BOUNDS OF LIKELY AND CATEGORICAL POPS MAY BE NEEDED.

PRECIPITATION ENDS BY 06Z SATURDAY WITH ANOTHER DRY AND PLEASANT 
WEEKEND IN STORE FOR THE REGION. TEMPS WILL BE SLIGHTLY BELOW 
SEASONAL NORMALS SATURDAY THEN QUITE CLOSE TO NORMAL FOR SUNDAY.
WEAK SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW RETURNS BY MONDAY...WITH GFS DRY WHILE 
ECMWF DEVELOPS DIURNAL CONVECTION AGAIN. I OPTED TO JUST CARRY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY NIGHT. GFSX MOS 
POPS WERE TRENDING LOWER ON 15/12Z RUN FROM 15/00Z GUIDANCE...SO
WILL WAIT AND SEE WHAT THE TREND IS FROM LATER RUNS. CLOSELY 
FOLLOWED THE LATEST GFSX MOS TEMPS FOR ALL PERIODS. 

STRONG TO MARGINALLY SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE FOR LATE TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING ACROSS MAINLY OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES...WHILE 
TIMING OF STORMS ON FRIDAY MORNING DOES NOT LOOK VERY FAVORABLE FOR 
A SEVERE THREAT AT THIS TIME. WILL FRESHEN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER 
OUTLOOK PRODUCT TO RELFECT THIS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 AM EDT MON APR 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
PRECIP IN SW VA WILL BE OUT OF THE AREA BY 12Z. WHILE SOME POCKETS 
OF DRIZZLE MAY LINGER...NO POPS WILL BE CARRIED IN THE FORECAST 
AFTER THIS TIME DUE TO DECREASING MOISTURE DEPTH AND LACK OF LIFT. A 
THIN SATURATED LAYER FROM 950-900 MB REMAINS IN PLACE THROUGH MOST 
OF THE MORNING...GRADUALLY SCATTERING OUT BY NOON. TEMPERATURES 
TODAY WILL BE VERY TRICKY DUE TO UNCERTAINTIES WITH CLOUD 
COVER...BUT GENERALLY LEANED ON THE COOL SIDE OF MOS FOR HIGHS. 

FOR TONIGHT...A SURFACE RIDGE WILL EXTEND SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE
CAROLINAS...WITH A SE FETCH OF MOISTURE BRINGING SOME CLOUDS AROUND
THE END OF THE APPALACHIANS INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE TN VALLEY
LATE. LOW TEMPS WILL BE FAIRLY MILD AS A RESULT...IN THE UPPER 50S
SOUTH...WITH LOWER 50S NORTH UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
SURFACE RIDGING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WILL KEEP WINDS ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA EAST TO SOUTHEAST TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.
SOUTHERLY WINDS OUT FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL PULL MOISTURE INTO
THE WESTERN AND MIDDLE TENNESSEE VALLEY. MODELS SHOW A CONVERGENCE
BOUNDARY ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE FOR TUESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY WHICH WILL ACT AS A FOCUS FOR MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION.
ALSO...CONVECTION ALONG AND TERRAIN FEATURES IS ALSO ANTICIPATED.

FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...A STRONG UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST INTO 
THE PLAINS STATES WITH STRONG CYCLOGENESIS MOVING TOWARD THE GREAT 
LAKES. THE ASSOCIATED TRAILING COLD FRONT WILL SWEEP ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA FRIDAY PRODUCING WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A 
THUNDERSTORM. MODELS SHOW INSTABILITY QUITE LIMITED ALONG AND AHEAD 
OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. ANOTHER FACTOR THAT WILL LIMIT STRENGTH OF 
CONVECTION IS TIMING OF FRONTAL PASSAGE..WHICH CURRENTLY LOOKS LIKE 
FROPA IN THE MORNING.

SURFACE RIDING BUILDS BACK INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR NEXT WEEKEND 
WITH RETURN OF DRY CONDITIONS.

THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE WHERE SOME 
SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

RIDING THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW WILL COMBINE WITH DIURNAL HEATING FOR 
SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. BEST 
CHANCE OF CONVECTION WILL BE OVERNIGHT TERRAIN. MAIN SYSTEM OF 
CONCERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED CONTINUES TO BE A STRONG COLD FRONT 
MOVING IN BY THE END OF THE WEEK. MODELS CONTINUE TO DIFFER IN 
TIMING...GENERALLY TRENDING TOWARD A SLOWER FRONTAL PASSAGE. WILL

945 AM EDT SUN APR 14 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WITH SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALING AN 
EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER THE SOUTHEAST ASSOCIATED WITH AN 
UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO RAPIDLY 
INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...AS THE SHORT WAVE SWINGS 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. AREA RADARS REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF 
SHOWERS AND SOME TSTORMS OVER THE DEEP SOUTH WITH THIS SHORT WAVE... 
BUT LOCAL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR MASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. THUS...EXPECT ONLY SCATTERED SHOWERS TO MOVE ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS...WITH THIS 
SHOWER ACTIVITY GRADUALLY SPREADING NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA LATER DURING THE EVENING HOURS.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO BE MORE 
PESSIMISTIC WITH SKY COVER...AND TO TWEAK THE PRECIP WORDING A LITTLE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

882 
FXUS64 KMRX 140729
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 AM EDT SUN APR 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL BE AFFECTING THE AREA LATE TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. THE TROUGH THAT IS NOW OVER TX WILL LIFT NE AND CROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AROUND 00Z. THE BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIP 
WILL BE IN SOUTHERN AND EASTERN AREAS AS THE GFS AND THE NAM SHOW 
THE BEST LIFT WITH THE TROUGH OVER NRN GA. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS 
SOUTH COMING IN AT 21Z...THEN LIKELY POPS IN THE SOUTHERN TN VALLEY 
AND SW NC AT 00Z. POPS DROP TO A SLIGHT CHANCE IN NW SECTIONS. HIGH 
CLOUDS WILL SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING...WITH MIDLEVEL 
CLOUDS THICKENING IN THE AFTERNOON SOUTH...SO NORTHERN AREAS MAY SEE 
THE MOST SUNSHINE AND WARMEST TEMPS IN THE MID 70S.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
A WEAK SHORT-WAVE EXITS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MONDAY MORNING
WITH THE FIRST HALF OF THIS WEEK DOMINATED BY A FAIRLY ZONAL FLOW.
AN UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES MONDAY WILL MOVE
NORTHEAST ACROSS SOUTHEAST CANADA. THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL
MOVE SOUTH INTO THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY...BUT THE WEST TO SOUTHWEST
FLOW ALOFT WILL KEEP THE BOUNDARY NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA.

BY MID-WEEK...GULF MOISTURE WILL INCREASE OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY PRODUCING DIURNAL CONVECTION FOR WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. GREATEST COVERAGE WILL BE OVER THE LOCAL 
TERRAIN. FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK...A STRONG UPPER TROUGH 
WILL MOVE OUT OF THE GREAT BASIN INTO THE PLAIN STATES FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY. DEEP CYCLOGENESIS WILL MOVE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE 
PLAINS STATES INTO THE GREAT LAKES BY THURSDAY. TRAILING COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THURSDAY...THEN INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR FRIDAY. 

STRONG FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING WILL ONCE AGAIN COMBINED WITH MODERATE 
INSTABILITY TO PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE 
AREA FOR LATE THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. AGAIN...WILL NEED TO WATCH 
THE EVOLUTION OF THIS SYSTEM FOR THE POTENTIAL OF STRONG-SEVERE 
STORMS. THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE OUT OF THE AREA FOR FRIDAY NIGHT WITH 
DRY CONDITIONS RETURNING FOR SATURDAY.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT SAT APR 13 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND SEASONABLY MILD TEMPS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL MOVE NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT...BUT THERE SHOULD BE ENOUGH RADIATIONAL COOLING OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN TO PRODUCE SOME PATCHY FROST TOWARDS 
SUNRISE. THIS UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA LATE SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT...PRODUCING SCATTERED 
SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THE NAM AND GFS MODELS REVEAL SOME 
LARGE DISCREPANCIES WITH HOW MUCH SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL BE GENERATED 
WITH THIS SHORT WAVE OVER THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH THE 
NAM MODEL MORE AGGRESSIVE THAN THE GFS MODEL. FOR NOW...WILL TREND 
TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO SOLUTIONS...WHICH SEEMS TO BE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ECMWF MODEL. OVERALL...MOST OF THE SHOWER 
ACTIVITY WITH THIS SHORT WAVE SHOULD OCCUR FARTHER EAST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA OVER THE CAROLINAS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH MONDAY...BUT THEN 
REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR MONDAY NIGHT WHEN A COMPROMISE BETWEEN 
THE TWO SEEMS PRUDENT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WEAK UPPER RIDGE IN PLACE 
WITH A LOW LEVEL MOISTURE RETURN WILL PROVIDE DIURNAL CONVECTION 
ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCE OVER HIGHER TERRAIN. 
THE PATTERN CONTINUES INTO WEDNESDAY AND WITH INCREASING MOISTURE 
AND A WEAK IMPULSE MOVING THROUGH...WILL PROVIDE BETTER CONVERGE OF 
CONVECTION. MODEL CONSISTENCE HAS BEEN POOR WITH TIMING OF AN 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT FOR THE MIDDLE PART OF THE EXTENDED. CURRENT 
TREND HAS BEEN SLOWER AND HAVE SLIGHTLY LOWERED POPS ON THURSDAY 
WITH BEST CHANCES OF THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. THE FRONT SHOULD 
EXIT THE AREA WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR SATURDAY. 
AS FOR TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE AND STAY CLOSE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 AM EDT SAT APR 13 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE BUILDING INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST 
TODAY. WITH A DRY WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT...WE WILL SEE MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES TODAY. HIGH TEMPS UNDER FULL SUN AND NEUTRAL ADVECTION WILL 
RISE A FEW DEGRESS FROM YESTERDAY...FROM LOWER 70S SOUTH TO MID 60S 
NORTH. WITH CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS...LOWS TONIGHT WILL DROP INTO 
THE 40S IN MOST SPOTS.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A FAIRLY FLAT ZONAL FLOW WILL 
START THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH A WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE CLIPPING 
THE FORECAST AREA FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY WITH A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS. A STRONGER NORTHERN STREAM UPPE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS/NORTHERN GREAT LAKES WITH ASSOCIATED TRAILING COLD 
FRONT MOVING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY FOR LATE MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

MODELS SHOW A GOOD DEAL OF GULF MOISTURE MOVING NORTH INTO THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND WESTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR TUESDAY...THEN 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THIS 
INCREASING MOISTURE WILL INCREASE CHANCES OF DIURNAL CONVECTION WITH 
GREATER COVERGE OVER THE TERRAIN FEATURES FOR WEDNESDAY.

FOR WEDENSDAY AND THURSDAY...A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE OUT 
OF THE GREAT BASIN INTO THE PLAIN STATES. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL 
PRODUCE A SERIES CYCLOGENESIS OVER TX/OK WHICH WILL MOVE NORTHEAST 
INTO THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY/LOWER GREAT LAKES REGION FOR THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT. THE TRAILING COLD FRONT WILL SWEEP ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY MORNING. STRONG/SEVERE 
CONVECTION WILL ACCOMPANY THIS FRONT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EDT FRI APR 12 2013

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR CHANGES MADE TO THE FORECAST THIS EVENING AS MOST
EVERYTHING APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK. A SURFACE HIGH WILL CONTINUE TO
BUILD INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT...PROMOTING MOSTLY CLEAR AND DRY
CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS WILL RESULT IN COOLER
TEMPERATURES TONIGHT AS SOME DECENT RADIATIONAL COOLING WILL TAKE
PLACE THIS EVENING. HOWEVER...SOME LIGHT WESTERLY WINDS ARE PROGGED
TO REMAIN IN PLACE OVERNIGHT WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR SOME MIXING...AND
THIS COMBINED WITH DEWPOINTS GENERALLY HANGING IN MID 30 TO LOWER
40S WILL PREVENT TEMPS FROM COMPLETELY CATERING OVERNIGHT. AS A
RESULT...THINK THAT LOWS IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL REMAIN IN
THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S...GENERALLY PREVENTING ANY WIDESPREAD
FROST. THUS...WILL HOLD OFF ON A FROST ADVISORY. HOWEVER...SOME
SHELTERED LOCATIONS ALONG THE FOOTHILLS...MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU MAY
DIP INTO THE LOW TO MID 30S...SO HAVE ADDED A MENTION OF PATCHY
FROST TO THE ZONES LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY MORNING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

564 
FXUS64 KMRX 121900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 PM EDT FRI APR 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...WITH THE COLD FRONT OFF TO OUR 
EAST...DRIER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER IN OVERNIGHT. THE DRIER AIR 
IS HAVING A HARDER TIME WORKING ITS WAY IN ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS MOISTURE HAS POOLED UP AGAINST THE MOUNTAINS 
AND IS TRAPPED UNDER A MID-LEVEL INVERSION. CURRENT THINKING IS THAT 
FROM KNOXVILLE NORTH WILL HANG ON TO A FEW CLOUDS OVERNIGHT WITH THE 
NORTHERN AREAS HAVING AN EVEN BETTER CHANCE. HIGHER DEWPOINTS 
COMBINED WITH THIS CLOUD COVER SHOULD PREVENT FROST ACROSS NORTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. LOWS WILL DROP INTO THE LOWER 40S IN MOST 
SPOTS...WITH SOME 30S NORTH AND IN THE MOUNTAINS. LOWS WILL BE 
AROUND 5 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FROM KNOXVILLE SOUTH WITH NORTHEAST TN 
BEING CLOSE TO CLIMO. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN TO BUILD IN 
OVERNIGHT AND CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY WHILE THE MEAN FLOW WILL STAY 
MOSTLY ZONAL. CLOUDS MAY LINGER ACROSS THE NORTHERN AREAS TOMORROW 
MORNING BUT EVERYONE SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY BY LATE MORNING/EARLY 
AFTERNOON. OVERALL...SATURDAY SHOULD BE A VERY PLEASANT DAY WITH 
HIGHS EXPECTED TO BE NEAR CLIMATOLOGY. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
SHIFTING EAST AND OUT OF THE AREA ON SATURDAY NIGHT...EARLY SUNDAY 
WILL ALLOW AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TO SLIDE NORTHEASTWARD FROM 
THE GULF OF MEXICO LATE SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY NIGHT.  MODELS SHOWING 
DIFFERENCES IN THE TRACK OF THE LOW PRESSURE...VARYING FROM BRINGING 
IT ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS TO THROUGH THE CAROLINAS.  WILL 
COMPROMISE FOR NOW WITH LOW POPS FAR SOUTH LATE SUNDAY AND LOW POPS 
NORTHWEST TO CHANCE POPS SOUTH AND EAST FOR SUNDAY NIGHT.  WILL 
LINGER LOW POPS ACROSS THE AREA ON MONDAY.  A COUPLE OF WEAK 
IMPULSES MOVING THROUGH COMBINED WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME DIURNAL 
CONVECTION WILL KEEP 20 TO 30 POPS IN PLACE TUESDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY.  A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
TO THURSDAY.  MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW DIFFERENCES IN TIMING BUT THE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE WILL PROVIDE OUR BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION DURING 
THE EXTENDED.  THIS SYSTEM SHOULD BE MOVING OUT FOR A DRY FRIDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.AVIATION...

THROUGH THE TAF PERIOD. TYS SHOULD GO FROM BKN TO SCT SHORTLY AS 
DRIER AIR MOVES IN...WITH SCT CLOUDS HANGING IN THROUGH THE TAF 
PERIOD BUT REMAINING VFR. CHA IS IN GOOD SHAPE AND IS EXPECTED TO 
REMAIN VFR.

SKIES WILL CONTINUE TO CLEAR FROM WEST TO EAST AS THE FRONT MOVES 
FURTHER OFF TO THE EAST AND DRIER AIR FILTERS IN ACROSS OUR REGION.

474 
FXUS64 KMRX 120718
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 AM EDT FRI APR 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SURFACE COLD FRONT IS MOVING INTO THE AREA AT THE MOMENT...WITH A 
LINE OF SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS ALONG THE FRONT. THIS LINE 
OF SHOWERS IS PROJECTED TO EXIT THE AREA BEFORE 12Z. THE 850 MB 
FRONT LAGS BEHIND A BIT...AND WILL HOLD A CHANCE POP NORTHEAST UNTIL 
THE 850 MB FRONT EXITS AROUND 15Z. AFTER THIS TIME WE WILL SEE RAPID 
CLEARING...WITH FULL SUN EXPECTED THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. THIS 
WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO REACH INTO THE 60S UNDER COLD ADVECTION. WITH 
CLEAR SKIES CONTINUING OVERNIGHT AND WINDS BECOMING LIGHT...LOWS 
WILL DROP INTO THE 40S IN MOST SPOTS...WITH SOME 30S NORTH AND IN 
THE MOUNTAINS. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
A FAST SOUTHERN STREAM ZONAL FLOW THROUGH MONDAY. A SHORT-WAVE
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES LATE SUNDAY THORUGH MONDAY
MORNING. GFS/ECMWF SHOW THAT THE SOUTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS OF
THE FORECAST AREA COULD SEE SOME LIGHT SHOWERS FROM THIS SYSTEM.

A STRONG NORTHERN STREAM UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES/NORTHERN PLAINS PULLING A COLD FRONT INTO THE SOUTHERN OHIO 
VALLEY FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. A GOOD DEAL OF GULF MOISTURE WILL 
PULL INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR MID-WEEK WITH CHANCES OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK...A MUCH STRONGER UPPER TROUGH WILL 
MOVE THE GREAT BASIN INTO THE PLAINS STATES WITH AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE MOVING SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. TRAILING COLD 
FRONT WILL SWEEP THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THURSDAY/THURSDAY 
NIGHT. ANOTHER ROUND OF STRONG-SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE AGAIN 
PROBABLE. WILL NEED TO MONITOR THIS POTENTIAL NEXT WEEK.



207 
FXUS64 KMRX 111916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT THU APR 11 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF 
THE FORECAST WILL BE THE THREAT FOR SEVERE WEATHER THIS EVENING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THE COLD FRONT IS CURRENTLY LOCATED BACK 
ACROSS WEST TN. MODELS HAVE CONTINUED TO TREND SLOWER WITH THE 
TIMING OF THE FRONT AND ITS ASSOCIATED SQUALL LINE. SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE CURRENTLY ONGOING ACROSS MIDDLE TN. THESE STORMS 
ARE EXPECTED TO STRENGTHEN LATER THIS AFTERNOON...AS FRONTOGENETIC 
FORCING RAMPS UP DURING THE AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING HOURS. THE MAIN 
LINE OF CONVECTION WILL PROBABLY ARRIVE ON THE PLATEAU BETWEEN 21Z 
TO 00Z...ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND SOUTHWEST NC BETWEEN 00Z AND 
03Z...AND ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA BETWEEN 03Z AND 05Z. 
HOWEVER...SCATTERED STORMS COULD DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF THIS MAIN 
LINE...ESPECIALLY AS WE BECOME INCREASINGLY MORE UNSTABLE LATER THIS 
AFTERNOON. SOUNDINGS INDICATE CAPE VALUES APPROACHING 600 TO 1200 
J/KG BY LATE AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING. THE INSTABILITY...COMBINED 
WITH STRONG UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS...WILL ALLOW FOR STRONG TO SEVERE 
STORMS TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MEAN FLOW IS NEARLY 
PARALLEL TO THE FRONT...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW STORM MODE TO STAY MAINLY 
LINEAR. EVEN THOUGH THERE IS A LACK OF DIRECTIONAL SHEAR...SPEED 
SHEAR COULD ALLOW FOR AN ISOLATED EMBEDDED SUPERCELL WITHIN THE 
LINE. THE MAIN THREATS EXPECTED WITH THESE STORMS WILL BE DAMAGING 
WINDS AND HAIL UP TO ONE INCH...THOUGH A BRIEF ISOLATED TORNADO 
CANNOT BE RULED OUT AS WELL. IT IS WORTH MENTIONING THAT THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY HAS A SLIGHTLY HIGHER RISK FOR AN ISOLATED TORNADO 
AS PARAMETERS ARE A LITTLE MORE FAVORABLE. SPC CURRENTLY HAS THE 
MAJORITY OF THE CWA UNDER A 2% TOR RISK WHILE THE EXTREME SOUTHERN 
AREAS ARE UNDER A 5% RISK.

IN ADDITION TO THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT...HEAVY RAINFALL COULD POSE 
A PROBLEM AS WELL. GIVEN THE SLOW MOVING NATURE OF THE FRONT... 
COMBINED WITH HIGH PWATS ACROSS THE REGION...THE POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY 
RAINFALL/TRAINING IS POSSIBLE. SOUNDINGS INDICATE PWAT VALUES 
RANGING FROM 1.61 SOUTH TO 1.3 NORTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ARE 
POSSIBLE BY THIS EVENING. BASED ON CLIMATOLOGY...THESE VALUES ARE 
NEAR/ABOVE THE 99TH PERCENTILE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. THIS MEANS 
THERE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY RAINFALL AND LOCALIZED FLOODING 
ACROSS THE REGION.

AFTER 06Z TO 09Z...THE HEAVIEST ACTIVITY WILL BEGIN TO PUSH EAST 
ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS INTO NORTH CAROLINA...WITH MOST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA DRYING OUT BY DAYBREAK ON FRIDAY MORNING. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
CLOSE TO NORMAL ON FRIDAY.

DRY WEATHER AND A GRADUAL WARMING TREND RETURN FOR THE WEEKEND AS 
SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE RETURN.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...ON SUNDAY...WEAK RIDGING 
CONTINUES TO BUILD IN FOR DRY AND A BIT WARMER CONDITION.  A COUPLE 
OF WEAK IMPULSE IN THE UPPER FLOW WILL MOVE THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH TUESDAY.  THIS WILL AID IN MAINLY DIURNALLY DRIVEN 
CONVECTION AND HAVE KEPT LOW POPS IN PLACE FOR THIS PERIOD.  A COLD 
FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR THURSDAY... 
PROVIDING OUR BEST CHANCE OF CONVECTION FOR THE EXTENDED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   52  68  43  72  45 / 100   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     55  67  43  67  43 / 100  10  10   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             53  68  42  68  41 / 100  10  10   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    57  68  41  69  36 / 100  20  10   0  10 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

842 
FXUS64 KMRX 110753
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 AM EDT THU APR 11 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE FORECAST WILL BE THE THREAT FOR A SEVERE
WEATHER OUTBREAK LATER THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA. EARLY THIS MORNING...A COLD FRONT AND ITS ASSOCIATED LINE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IS LOCATED ROUGHLY ALONG THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER. AHEAD OF THE FRONT...MID/HIGH CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO
OVERSPREAD THE FORECAST AREA AS SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS TRANSPORT GULF
MOISTURE INTO THE REGION AND ALSO HELP TO PUSH HIGHS BACK INTO THE
UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S BY THE AFTERNOON. THIS FRONT AND LINE OF
STORMS WILL CONTINUE TO GRADUALLY TRACK EASTWARD INTO MIDDLE AND
EVENTUALLY EAST TENNESSEE AND THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION BY
THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MODELS HAVE CONTINUED TO TREND
SLOWER WITH THE TIMING OF THE FRONT AND THE ASSOCIATED SQUALL LINE
TO THIS TIME PERIOD WHICH WILL ALLOW SOME HEATING/DESTABILIZATION
DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS AND SOME APPRECIABLE INSTABILITY VALUES
WITH MUCAPE VALUES AOA 750-1500 J/KG AROUND 00Z. THIS INSTABILITY
COMBINED WITH THE STRONG JET DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS UPPER-
LEVEL STORM SYSTEM WILL RESULT IN THE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE
THUNDERSTORMS /LIKELY IN THE FORM OF A LINE/...WITH DAMAGING WINDS
AND HAIL BEING THE PRIMARY THREATS...THOUGH A BRIEF ISOLATED
TORNADO CANNOT BE RULED OUT AS WELL.

IN ADDITION TO THE SEVERE WEATHER THREAT...GIVEN THE SLOW MOVING
NATURE OF THE FRONT...THE HIGH PWATS VALUES ACROSS THE REGION AND
THE MAIN FLOW MOVING PARALLEL TO THIS FRONT...THE POTENTIAL FOR
HEAVY RAINFALL/TRAINING SEEMS PRETTY LIKELY WITH THE SHOWERS AND
STORMS THAT DO MOVE THROUGH. THUS...THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALIZED
FLOODING WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE REGION AS WELL LATER THIS
EVENING AND WILL HIGHLIGHT THIS IN THE HWO. AFTER 06Z...THE
HEAVIEST ACTIVITY WILL BEGIN TO PUSH EAST ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS INTO
NORTH CAROLINA...WITH MOST OF THE AREA DRYING OUT BY DAYBREAK ON
FRIDAY MORNING. 

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
SHOWERS SHOULD EXIT THE EASTERN MOST AREAS FRIDAY MORNING...FOLLOWED
BY DECREASING CLOUDS. PREVIOUS GRIDS STILL ON TRACK WITH JUST MINOR
TWEAKS TO MAX TEMPS.

DRY WEATHER AND A GRADUAL WARMING TREND RETURN FOR THE WEEKEND AS 
SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE RETURN. MODELS START TO DIVERGE A BIT FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH JUST LOW POPS JUSTIFIED FOR NOW FOR POSSIBLE 
DIURNAL CONVECTION ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY. MOISTURE RETURN IS BETTER 
BY TUESDAY...BUT BEST RAIN CHANCES WOULD APPEAR TO HOLD OFF UNTIL 
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ACCEPTING THE NEXT FRONTAL PASSAGE 
LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT..SO POPS WERE INCREASED TO GOOD CHANCE AT THAT 
TIME.

OTHERWISE...GFSX MOS GUIDANCE HAS BEEN CONSISTENT FOR PAST FEW RUNS 
AND THE MAX/MIN TEMPS CLOSELY FOLLOW THE 11/00Z GFSX MOS.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

225 
FXUS64 KMRX 101924
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT WED APR 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
ANOTHER WARM NIGHT IS IN STORE AS OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL ONLY DROP DOWN 
INTO THE MID 50S NORTH TO NEAR 60 SOUTH...WHICH WILL RESULT IN LOWS 
THAT ARE 10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. 

THE PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL CONTINUE TO STEEPEN OVERNIGHT IN ADVANCE OF AN 
APPROACHING UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. THE GRADIENT FURTHER 
STEEPENS TOMORROW WHICH WILL RESULT IN SOME BREEZY TO GUSTY 
SOUTHWEST WINDS DEVELOPING AFTER SUNRISE.  

SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TOMORROW AS A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES THE AREA. SOME OF THESE STORMS COULD BE SEVERE AS THERE 
WILL BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY AND SHEAR TO PROMOTE STRONG STORMS. IT IS 
POSSIBLE THAT A FEW STORMS COULD DEVELOP OUT AHEAD OF THE MAIN 
LINE...BUT NOT OVERLY CONFIDENT BECAUSE OF A LACK OF FOCUSING 
MECHANISM FOR DEVELOPMENT. NAM SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT ANY CAPPING 
SHOULD BE GONE BY AROUND 15Z TO 18Z...WITH TRI POSSIBLY NOT CAP FREE 
TILL AROUND 20Z. MODELS CONTINUE TO AGREE THAT THE ARRIVAL OF THE 
MAIN LINE OF CONVECTION WILL PROBABLY ARRIVE BY AROUND 20Z ON THE 
PLATEAU AND 00Z FOR THE EAST TN VALLEY AND OTHER LOCATIONS. FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE A UNIDIRECTIONAL WIND PROFILE WITH STRONG SHEAR 
TO ENHANCE UPDRAFTS. SOUNDINGS SHOW ANYWHERE FROM 800 TO 1000 J/KG 
CAPE FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS. FREEZING AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS ARE 
MARGINAL FOR LARGE HAIL...SO MAIN THREAT LOOKS TO BE DAMAGING WINDS 
AND ISOLATED TORNADO THREAT. PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS WERE 
FOLLOWED CLOSELY. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AS IS TYPICALLY THE CASE 
MODEL FORECASTS ARE ON THE SAME PAGE FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD BUT DIVERGENT SCENARIOS EMERGE LATE. FRIDAY...THE 
BACK EDGE OF THE PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH THE NEGATIVE TILT 
SHORT WAVE MOVES OUT DURING THE MORNING LEAVING THE ENTIRE FORECAST 
AREA WITH A DRY AFTERNOON. DRY ADVECTION AND THEN RISING HEIGHTS 
ALLOW FOR A CONTINUATION OF DRY WEATHER THROUGH THE DAYTIME PERIOD 
SUNDAY. SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY TIME FRAME...MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN 
AGREEMENT BUT GENERALLY POINT TOWARD A SHORT WAVELENGTH FEATURE 
BUILDING ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. WITH AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE 
AND INSTABILITY LEADING TO THE POSSIBILITY OF A PERIOD OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS. BROADBRUSHED SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS TO 
ACCOUNT FOR THIS CHANCE OF RAIN. TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY MODEL 
FORECASTS CONTINUE TO SHOW GRADUALLY INCREASING MOISTURE ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. WITH A STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW AND SUFFICIENT 
INSTABILITY FOR A PERIOD OR TWO OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. THE 
GFS TRIES TO BRING A FRONTAL BOUNDARY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION TOWARD THE END OF THE LONG TERM RESULTING IN INCREASING 
MOISTURE CONVERGENCE/LIFT WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. THE ECMWF AND CMC 
BECOME MORE AMPLIFIED WITH AN UPPER RIDGE MAKING SLOWER PROGRESS 
ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. DECIDED TO ADJUST POP UP TO LOW CHANCE 
CATEGORY FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. 
WILL HAVE TO WAIT ON FUTURE MODEL FORECAST GUIDANCE TO DEAL WITH 
CORRECT FRONTAL TIMING DURING THIS PART OF THE LONG TERM.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             60  76  52  69  42 /  10 100  80   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  59  76  55  68  43 /  10  80  80  10  10


468 
FXUS64 KMRX 100734
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
334 AM EDT WED APR 10 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
AN UPPER-RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO SLIDE EASTWARD OFF THE SOUTH
CAROLINA COAST...BUT IT'S BROAD INFLUENCE WILL CONTINUE TO PROMOTE
MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND DRY WEATHER TODAY...ALONG WITH
CONTINUED WARMTH. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL BE SHARPENED ACROSS
THE REGION TODAY AS AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS
ACROSS THE MISSOURI VALLEY. THIS WILL RESULT IN SOME BREEZY TO
GUSTY SOUTHWEST WINDS...WHICH WILL AID THE SOLAR HEATING IN PUSHING
HIGHS INTO THE LOW TO MID 80S IN MANY AREAS BY THE AFTERNOON. BY
THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT...MID TO HIGH CLOUDS WILL BEGIN FILTER
INTO THE AREA AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT THAT WILL BE SLOWLY MOVING
THROUGH THE MID-SOUTH. THE LATEST MODEL PROJECTIONS CONTINUE TO
TREND DRIER OVERNIGHT AND DO NOT SHOW ANY CONVECTION MOVING IN
UNTIL WELL AFTER SUNRISE THURSDAY. THUS...HAVE REMOVED MENTIONABLE
POPS FROM THE FORECAST OVERNIGHT.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
MAIN PERIODS OF CONCERN WILL BE THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT AS
CONVECTION DEVELOPS AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT. MODELS
HAVE ALL GENERALLY SLOWED DOWN THE ONSET OF TSRA UNTIL PROBABLY MID
TO LATE MORNING ON THE PLATEAU AND AFTERNOON/EVENING OVER REMAINDER
OF E TN/SW VA/SW NC. AIRMASS WILL LIKELY HAVE TO RECOVER FROM
DECAYING MCS ACTIVITY LEFTOVER FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. FORECAST
SOUNDINGS INDICATE A UNIDIRECTIONAL WIND PROFILE WITH STRONG SHEAR
TO ENHANCE UPDRAFTS. FREEZING AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS ARE
MARGINAL FOR LARGE HAIL...SO MAIN THREAT LOOKS TO BE DAMAGING WINDS
AND ISOLATED TORNADO THREAT. PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS WERE
FOLLOWED CLOSELY.

SHOWERS END EARLY FRIDAY WITH RATHER LARGE DIFFERENCES FROM MOS 
GUIDANCE ON HIGHS FOR FRIDAY. BASED ON EXPECTED 850 MB TEMPS AND 
CLEARING...I OPTED FOR A FEW DEGREES BELOW THE GFS MAXES AND NOT AS 
COOL AS THE NAM MAXES.

KEEPING THE WEEKEND DRY FOR NOW AS PATTERN SUPPORTS THE UPPER RIDGE 
TO BUILD...WHILE SURFACE RIDGE AXIS HOLDS ACROSS THE EASTERN STATES 
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. SOME WEAK SOUTHERLY FLOW BY MONDAY WITH A WARM 
FRONT MOVING NE FROM THE MID MS VALLEY INTO THE OHIO VALLEY. 
PREFERRED TO NOT GO ANY HIGHER THAN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW ON 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...WITH THESE PERIOD SHOWN TO BE THE BEST 
TARGETS OF OPPORTUNITY TO IMPROVE OVER THE GFS MOS. 

10/00Z GFS MOS POPS HAVE INCREASED FOR TUESDAY WITH SOME INDICATION 
OF THE NEXT COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE BY TUESDAY NIGHT. I INCREASED 
SOUTHERN AREA POPS UP TO LOW CHANCE FOR NOW...AND WILL LET DAY SHIFT 
CONSIDER ANY HIGHER POP INCREASES FOR THE FORECAST AREA FOR DAY 7. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             84  60  77  52  69 /   0  10 100  80  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  82  59  78  55  68 /   0  10  80  80  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       82  59  78  54  68 /   0  10 100  80  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EDT TUE APR 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...ENJOY THE WARMTH. ANOTHER
MILD SPRING NIGHT TONIGHT WILL GIVE WAY TO MORE WARMTH
WEDNESDAY...PROBABLY A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY. WINDS NOT

THE SMOKIES BUT STICKING WITH NO MEASURABLE PRECIP.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL
APPROACH LATE WED NIGHT/EARLY THURSDAY...AND WILL PUSH THROUGH LATE
THURSDAY/THU NIGHT. EXACT TIMING STILL SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN AS MODELS
HAVE SHOWN LESS THAN IDEAL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY AND AGREEMENT.
WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WEST ZONES LATE WED NIGHT....THEN
LIKELY TO CAT POPS ALL ZONES THU AND THU NIGHT. STILL SOME
UNCERTAINTY HOW MUCH INSTABILITY WILL BE AVAILABLE...BUT GIVEN AT
LEAST SOME INSTABILITY AND THE EXPECTED WIND FIELDS THERE STILL
APPEARS TO BE A THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS. WILL KEEP MENTION IN HWO.
MAY BE A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS MAINLY EAST EARLY FRIDAY...THEN
EXPECTED TO BE PRECIP FREE THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS SURFACE HIGH
PRESSURE MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. STILL FAIRLY LOW FORECAST
CONFIDENCE FOR THE END OF THE PERIOD AS MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW
POOR RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY AND AGREEMENT. HOWEVER...MOST AGREE
THAT MOISTURE WILL BE INCREASING FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY SO WILL
CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS BOTH DAYS.

671 
FXUS64 KMRX 090818
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
418 AM EDT TUE APR 9 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STILL HAVE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES 
AND MILD TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING. UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDING BACK TODAY AS THE UPPER LOW DEEPENS OVER THE SW STATES. 
WEAKER SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW TODAY AND LESS LOW LEVEL RH...SO
EXPECTING JUST SOME PASSING HIGH CLOUDS AND A FEW TO SCATTERED 
CUMULUS CLOUDS. PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID LOOKED VERY GOOD WITH HIGHS 
IN THE 70S TO LOWER 80S...WARM BUT NOT CLOSE ENOUGH TO RECORD HIGHS 
(CHA 89 - TYS 86 - TRI 83). 

CUMULUS CLOUDS DISSIPATE THIS EVENING LEAVING POSSIBLY SOME HIGH 
CLOUDS OVERNIGHT. WINDS DIMINISH AS WELL...SO MINOR TWEAK TO LOWER 
MIN TEMPS FOR TONIGHT...BUT NOT TOO FAR FROM GFS MOS OVERALL. 


.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE OFF THE CAROLINA COAST WILL CONTINUE TO
PROMOTE PARTLY SUNNY AND DRY WEATHER FOR WEDNESDAY...ALONG WITH A
STOUT SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AHEAD OF AN AN APPROACHING STORM SYSTEM
FROM THE WEST. THIS WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO POTENTIALLY REACH THE
WARMEST LEVELS OF SPRING SO FAR...WITH THE MERCURY CLIMBING INTO
THE LOW TO MID 80S IN MANY AREAS. HOWEVER...AN UPPER LOW SWINGING
FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES WILL DRAG A COLD
FRONT THROUGH THE AREA THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL
TRIGGER OFF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...SOME WHICH COULD BECOME
STRONG TO SEVERE. THE DYNAMICS/WIND SHEAR ASSOCIATED WITH THIS
STORM SYSTEM ARE CERTAINLY MOST IMPRESSIVE. INSTABILITY WILL BE MUCH
MORE OF A QUESTION THOUGH...GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY IN THE TIMING OF
THE FRONT. BY 12Z THURSDAY...A SQUALL LINE MAY BE ONGOING ALONG THE
FRONT IN WEST/MIDDLE TN AND WILL GRADUALLY PUSH ITS WAY TOWARD THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING THE DAY. THOUGH HEATING MAY BE
HINDERED SOMEWHAT GIVEN THE DENSE CLOUD COVER AND PREFRONTAL SHOWER
ACTIVITY...THIS STORM SYSTEM WILL CERTAINLY ALLOW FOR A DAMAGING
WIND THREAT AS WELL AS SOME SEVERE HAIL AS WELL. THIS...COMBINED
WITH THE STRONG JET ENERGY AND WIND SHEAR WILL CREATE AN ELEVATED
POTENTIAL FOR A SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK ON THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT.
THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO LEAVE A MENTION OF THIS IN THE HWO AND
MONITOR THE LATEST OBS/TRENDS.

THEREAFTER...SOME COOLER BUT PARTLY SUNNY AND DRY WEATHER WILL
ENSUE FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND AS ANOTHER UPPER-RIDGE AXIS BUILDS
IN. THE NEXT UPPER-WAVE THAT WILL IMPACT THE REGION LOOKS AS THOUGH
IT WILL SHIFT TOWARD THE AREA LATE SUNDAY INTO MONDAY...RESULTING
IN SOME SLIGHT CHANCES FOR RAIN HEADING INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             82  57  85  61  71 /   0  10  10  20  90 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  80  57  83  60  71 /   0  10  10  10  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       81  57  84  60  71 /   0  10  10  20  90

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.SHORT TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AN UPPER RIDGE OF HIGH

DEVELOPMENT. SATELLITE SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF MOISTURE BETWEEN 5-7KFT
PRODUCING BROKEN CLOUDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THESE AREA CLOUDS

RIDGE. OVERALL..MOSTLY CLOUDY TONGIHT AND PARTLY SUNNY TUESDAY.

TEMPERATURES WITH UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS FOR MID-WEEK.
FOLLOWED GFS NUMBERS CLOSELY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPPER RIDGE WILL BE
IN CONTROL EARLY...SO DRY TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AND QUITE
WARM. MODELS STILL HAVING SOME TIMING ISSUES WITH THE FRONT THAT
AFFECTS THE AREA THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT. GFS IS THE FASTEST...BUT
SINCE IT IS A BIT OF AN OUTLIER AT THIS POINT WILL USE A COMPROMISE
BUT LEAN TOWARD THE SLOWER NAM. WILL CARRY LOW POPS MAINLY SOUTH
AND WEST ZONES LATE WED NIGHT...THEN CAT TO LIKELY POPS THU AND THU
NIGHT. STILL APPEARS THERE MAY BE SOME SEVERE THUNDERSTORM
THREAT...SO WILL CONTINUE MENTION OF SEVERE THREAT IN HWO. AFTER
ANY LINGERING SHOWERS EXIT EARLY FRIDAY SHOULD BE DRY FOR THE
WEEKEND AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TAKES CONTROL. LOW FORECAST
CONFIDENCE FOR THE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY PERIOD AS MODELS
SHOW POOR AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY...BUT NEXT SYSTEM
MAY BE AFFECTING THE AREA SO WILL CARRY LOW POPS.

VARIABLE AMOUNTS OF MID AND HIGH CLOUDS PASS ACROSS BOTH TODAY AND
TONIGHT. SOUTHERLY FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE SURFACE RIDGE WILL
BRING AN INCREASED AMOUNT OF CUMULUS CLOUDS TODAY...WITH A BROKEN
LAYER ALREADY ADVANCING INTO THE SRN VALLEY AND SW NC THIS MORNING.

SOME GUSTINESS EXPECTED BY LATE MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS...
BUT NO NEED FOR ANY ADVISORIES. OTHERWISE...DRY AND WARM WEATHER IN 
THE SHORT TERM THRU MID WEEK. GFS MOS CLOSELY FOLLOWED FOR MAX TEMP 
AND A DEGREE OR SO ABOVE GFS MINS FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT MANY CHANGES TO
PREVIOUS FORECAST AS MODELS STILL KEEP STRONG UPPER RIDGING OVER
THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH VERY WARM TEMPERATURES
AND SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. VARIABLE CLOUD COVER AND SOUTH TO
SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL BE MORE LATE SPRING LIKE. SLOW MOVING FRONTAL
BOUNDARY MOVES INTO LOWER MS VALLEY WEDNESDAY AND THEN ADVANCES
ACROSS THE TN VALLEY THURSDAY. STRONG WIND FLOW AHEAD OF SYSTEM
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MAY REQUIRE A WIND ADVISORY TO BE
ISSUED. ALSO SOME STORMS COULD BE SEVERE THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND
EVENING. MODELS BRING THE FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY
FRIDAY. SHOWERS TO LINGER FRIDAY WITH WRAP AROUND CLOUDINESS AND
PRECIPITATION. MODELS SPEEDING UP SYSTEM SO POST FRONTAL SHOWERS
MAY ONLY AFFECT NORTHERN SECTIONS. TEMPERATURES MUCH COOLER BY
FRIDAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE WEEKEND. HIGHS WILL BE ONLY BE IN
THE 60S FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AND THEN WARMING SLIGHTLY ON SUNDAY AS
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE NW SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             76  56  82  59  82 /   0  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  76  56  81  59  82 /  10  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       75  56  81  59  82 /  10  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              74  48  79  52  81 /   0  10  10  10  10

333 
FXUS64 KMRX 071901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT SUN APR 7 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDS 
FROM OFFSHORE THE CAROLINAS TO NORTHERN FLORIDA. SOUTHWESTERLY LOW 
LEVEL FLOW WILL CONTINUE THE WARMING TREND. H85 TEMPS RISE TO 10C OR 
BETTER BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. HIGH CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO STREAM 
ACROSS THE AREA FROM THE WEST. MODELS APPEAR TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH LOW 
LEVEL CLOUD COVER WITH RETURN FLOW. UNDERCUT MODEL CLOUD COVER. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MONDAY NIGHT WILL 
CONTINUE WITH WARM AND MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. THIS IS AHEAD OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVING INTO THE TEXAS 
PANHANDLE AND THE ASSOCIATED DEEP UPPER TROUGH OVER THE FOUR 
CORNERS. EXPECT DAYTIME TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY TO BE 
IN THE 70S AND LOWER 80S WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE 50S AND 60S. 

THE MERIDIONAL FLOW WILL BY WEDNESDAY WILL BE NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY THUS IT WILL BE A SLOW MOVER. MODELS ARE IN BETTER 
AGREEMENT BRINGING THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ALONG AND AHEAD OF 
THE FRONT THURSDAY. ALL AREAS IN ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE...SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA WILL LIKELY SEE MEASURABLE 
PRECIPITATION BEFORE SUNSET THURSDAY. SOME STORMS MAY BE SEVERE 
THURSDAY/THURS NIGHT BUT CURRENT MODEL DATA INDICATES MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY ACROSS OUR AREA. 

MODELS DIVERGE IN THEIR PRECIPITATION SOLUTION LATER FRIDAY INTO 
SATURDAY. THE ECMWF IS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH POST FRONTAL 
PRECIPITATION FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. AT THIS TIME WILL CONTINUE 
WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR NEXT WEEKEND I.E. SAT AND SUN.

887 
FXUS64 KMRX 071423
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1020 AM EDT SUN APR 7 2013

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH CLOUDS THINNED OUT OVER THE 
EARLY MORNING HOURS BUT THE UPPER RIDGE WILL FLATTEN TODAY...AS A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND ERN GREAT LAKES 
REGION. SATELLITE PICS SHOW AN INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS AGAIN...ALTHO 
TIME HEIGHT SECTIONS INDICATE THESE CLOUDS MAY GIVE WAY TO AT LEAST 
PARTLY SUNNY SKIES IN THE AFTERNOON. LIGHT SOUTH WINDS HAVE KEPT 
TEMPS UP SO FAR OVERNIGHT...SO IT WON'T TAKE MUCH SUNSHINE TO REACH 
THE 60S TO MID 70S...AS TEMPS GET SUCH A MILD START TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT...EXPECTING PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES AS SURFACE 
RIDGE EASES FURTHER EAST. A BIT STRONGER SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW 
SHOULD SPREAD SOME LOW CLOUDS INTO AT LEAST SRN 1/2 OF THE FORECAST 
AREA BY AND AFTER 06Z MONDAY. THIS ALL FAVORS GOING A FEW OR MORE 
DEGREES ABOVE THE GFS MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...LATEST MODEL RUNS STILL 
SHOWING DIFFERENCES IN TIMING OF WHEN UPPER RIDGING BREAKS DOWN AND 
ALLOWS A STRONG FRONT TO MOVE EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATE IN 
THE WEEK. GFS SHOWS THE SYSTEM APPROACHING WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY WITH THE ECMWF NOT UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH THE 
CANADIAN MOVING THROUGH THURSDAY. SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT KEEPS REGION 
WARM AND BASICALLY DRY FROM MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH 
TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL MONDAY AND THEN EVEN 
WARMER TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. HIGHS REACH THE UPPER 70S TO LOWER 80S 
BOTH TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...AS WARM AS ITS BEEN SINCE LAST FALL. 
KEPT RAIN CHANCES IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT BEST CHANCES FOR 
SIGNIFICANT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. A 
COLD FRONT THAT WILL BE HUNG UP ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY SHOULD START 
TO MOVE TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY WITH LOW PRESSURE MOVING 
INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. STRONG 
SOUTHWEST WINDS ALOFT AS EARLY AS EARLY THURSDAY MORNING BY THE GFS 
AND INSTABILITY SHOULD BE ENOUGH FOR STRONG STORMS TO DEVELOP AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. WITH SHOWERS AND CLOUDS 
MORE NUMEROUS TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY COOLER. MUCH COOLER BEHIND THE 
FRONT FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WITH SKIES CLEARING SATURDAY AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  74  56  76  55  81 /   0   0  10  10  10

FXUS64 KMRX 061852
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT SAT APR 6 2013

.SHORT TERM SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL INCREASE AS HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS 
EAST OF THE AREA. WARMING TREND BEGINS TONIGHT AND CONTINUES SUNDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL SUNDAY. HIGH LEVEL 
CLOUDS WILL STREAM INTO THE AREA IN UPPER SW-W FLOW. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS REVEAL SOME 
TIMING DIFFERENCES WITH THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF A STRONG COLD 
FRONT FOR LATE NEXT WEEK...WHICH WILL REALLY BE THE ONLY NOTABLE 
WEATHER FEATURE TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD. 
A DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW WILL CONTINUE OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...RESULTING IN A WARMING TREND WITH 
ABOVE NORMAL TEMPS UNTIL THE FRONTAL PASSAGE LATER IN THE WEEK. A 
QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PROGGED TO LINGER OVER THE OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY EARLY IN THE WEEK...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY EXPECTED TO REMAIN NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. GFS MODEL 
REMAINS FASTER THAN THE ECMWF MODEL WITH THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF 
THE COLD FRONT FOR LATE IN THE WEEK...WITH THE GFS MODEL SHOWING A 
THURSDAY PASSAGE AND THE ECMWF MODEL SHOWING A FRIDAY PASSAGE. 
DESPITE THE TIMING DIFFERENCES...BOTH MODELS AGREE THAT A STRONG 
WIND FIELD AND MODERATE LEVELS OF INSTABILITY WILL COMBINE TO 
PRODUCE SOME STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.

984 
FXUS64 KMRX 061515
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1115 AM EDT SAT APR 6 2013

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE BUILDS TODAY THEN IS 
ADVERTISED TO FLATTEN BY TONIGHT AS A SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES ACROSS 
THE UPPER MIDWEST STATES. SURFACE RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE EASTERN 
GREAT LAKES WILL MOVE EAST BY THIS AFTERNOON...AND ALLOW A WEAK 
SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW TO DEVELOP. THE SOUTHERLY FLOW CONTINUES 
TONIGHT WITH JUST A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MOSTLY HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS. 
FINALLY SEEING TEMPS FEEL MUCH MORE SPRING-LIKE WITH GFS MOS MAXES 
CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 

A COMBINATION OF A FEW CLOUDS AND SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW TONIGHT
WILL FAVOR AT LEAST A MOS BLEND...RATHER THAN THE COOLER MINS WHERE 
SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED. 

APRIL WILL BE NEARLY ONE THIRD DONE BEFORE STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS 
LOOM POSSIBLE BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGING OVER THE SOUTHEAST 
CONTINUES SUNDAY WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. A NEARLY STATIONARY 
FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY MONDAY. THE FORECAST AREA THOUGH 
WILL STAY DRY THROUGH TUESDAY. LOW PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE MS VALLEY 
WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE INCREASES FROM THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST WITH 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF 
A SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT. THE THUNDERSTORMS MAY BECOME STRONG TO 
SEVERE THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY EVENING AHEAD OF THE FRONT. 
TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THURSDAY AND 
THEN SLIGHTLY COOLER FRIDAY.

&&

SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW TO DEVELOP. THE SOUTHERLY FLOW CONTINUES 
TONIGHT WITH JUST A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MOSTLY HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS. 
FINALLY SEEING TEMPS FEEL MUCH MORE SPRING-LIKE WITH GFS MOS MAXES 
CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 

A COMBINATION OF A FEW CLOUDS AND SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW TONIGHT
WILL FAVOR AT LEAST A MOS BLEND...RATHER THAN THE COOLER MINS WHERE 
SLIGHT DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED. 

APRIL WILL BE NEARLY ONE THIRD DONE BEFORE STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS 
LOOM POSSIBLE BY THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGING OVER THE SOUTHEAST
CONTINUES SUNDAY WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. A NEARLY
STATIONARY FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY MONDAY. THE FORECAST
AREA THOUGH WILL STAY DRY THROUGH TUESDAY. LOW PRESSURE MOVES INTO
THE MS VALLEY WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE INCREASES FROM THE SOUTH AND
SOUTHWEST WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
NIGHT AHEAD OF A SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT. THE THUNDERSTORMS MAY
BECOME STRONG TO SEVERE THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY EVENING AHEAD OF THE
FRONT. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH
THURSDAY AND THEN SLIGHTLY COOLER FRIDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

944 
FXUS64 KMRX 051900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT FRI APR 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES SE 
THROUGH THE AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. DRY CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS 
CAN BE EXPECTED. NEUTRAL TEMPERATURE ADVECTION TONIGHT WITH WARM AIR 
ADVECTION SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL RISE TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL. 
A MID LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE ITO THE WESTERN OH VALLEY BY 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON. THIS FEATURE MAY BRING SOME HIGH CLOUDINESS 
ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS LATE. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE REMAINDER OF THE 
WEEKEND WILL BE DRY WITH TEMPERATURES AT OR SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN 
AVERAGE. 

THE UPPER FLOW WILL GENERALLY BE ZONAL WITH A FEW EMBEDDED 
SHORTWAVES ENHANCING SOME HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS. BY MONDAY A 
DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN U.S. AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW IS 
EXPECTED TO ADVECT WARMER TEMPERATURES AND HIGHER LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THIS WILL CAUSE DAYTIME HIGHS TO RISE INTO 
THE UPPER 70S AND 80S BY TUESDAY. 

THE MODELS VARY SIGNIFICANTLY WITH REGARDS TO TIMING. THE ECMWF IS 
ABOUT 24 HOURS SLOWER WITH THE FRONT WHILE THE GFS IS THE MORE 
AGGRESSIVE. THE LOW-RES EC WANTS TO DIG THE WESTERN TROUGH INTO 
SOUTHWEST ARIZONA. IF THIS VERIFIES THE FRONT WILL NOT MOVE THROUGH 
OUR AREA BY WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER THE GFS DRAGS THE FRONT INTO E TN/SW 
VA BY WEDNESDAY. THE DEEP UPPER FLOW ADVERTISED BY THE GFS BECOMES 
PARALLEL TO THE SURFACE FRONT. THE SLOW MOVING OR NEARLY STALLED 
FRONT REMAINS IN THE AREA AND PRECIPITATION CHANCES PERSIST THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT. NEEDLESS TO SAY THE TIMING OF THE PRECIPITATION AND 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY CAUSE A HIGH LEVEL OF UNCERTAINTY THUS CONFIDENCE 
IS RATHER LOW. SOMETHING TO WATCH WILL BE THE INSTABILITY AHEAD OF 
THE FRONT WHENEVER IT DOES DECIDE TO MOVE THROUGH THE REGION BECAUSE 
A FEW STORMS COULD BE SEVERE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
413 AM EDT FRI APR 5 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SATELLITE PICS SHOW AN UPPER LOW 
MOVING EAST ACROSS AL AND WRN GA THIS MORNING...WITH MAIN SURFACE 
LOW PRESSURE CENTER ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA COAST. SOME SCATTERED 
PATCHES OF LIGHT RAIN ACROSS EXTREME SRN COUNTIES CURRENTLY AND

LIGHT PRECIPITATION SHOULD END BEFORE 12Z...FOLLOWED BY CLEARING 
SKIES. LOW TEMPS ON THE MILD SIDE AT 07Z...SO I SEE NO REASON WHY WE 
CAN'T REACH A MOS BLEND FOR HIGHS TODAY.

OTHERWISE...STILL LOOKS MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY TONIGHT AS AN 
UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILD INTO THE REGION. 
LIGHT NORTHERLY WINDS AND LACK OF CLOUDS FAVORS THE COOLER MOS MINS. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...ZONAL FLOW WITH RIDGING
ALOFT ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES BRINGS MUCH WARMER WEATHER FOR
THE FORECAST AREA THIS WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR TO ABOVE
NORMAL EACH DAY. LOW PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT LAKES WITH FRONT
DEVELOPING JUST NORTH OF THE OH VALLEY SUNDAY WILL BECOME NEARLY
STATIONARY AND LINGER TO THE NORTH OF THE REGION THROUGH TUESDAY
BEFORE SAGGING SOUTH TOWARD THE TN VALLEY WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.
THE COLD FRONT WILL APPROACHES THE EAST TN AREA LATE THURSDAY
INCREASING RAIN CHANCES. TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH
THE EXTENDED. SKIES WILL BE PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY SUNNY THROUGH
TUESDAY THEN MOSTLY CLOUDY AS THE FRONT APPROACHES. THE AIR MASS
WILL BECOME UNSTABLE BY WEDNESDAY WITH THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY. ITS STILL TOO EARLY TO
PREDICT IF THE STORMS WILL BE SEVERE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
244 PM EDT THU APR 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH CONTINUES 
OVER THE AREA TONIGHT AS SURFACE LOW MOVES NE THROUGH GA AND SC.
UPPER LOW WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE SOUTH WITH AXIS CROSSING EAST 
OF THE AREA AROUND 05/12Z. BEST ISENTROPIC LIFT AND UPPER DIVERGENCE 
WILL MOVE NE OF AREA TONIGHT. RAIN CHANCES REMAIN HIGH EARLY TONIGHT 
BUT COVERAGE AND AMOUNTS WILL BE LESS THAN TODAY. UPPER DRY SLOT 
MOVING NE INTO THE AREA LOWERING PWATS. LOW LEVEL AIRMASS WILL 
CHANGE LITTLE TONIGHT WITH FOGGY CONDITIONS AND NEARLY STEADY 
TEMPERATURES. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST FRIDAY WITH 
DRIER AIRMASS. MAX TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE BELOW NORMAL. 

.LONG TERM...GENERALLY A ZONAL SOUTHERN STREAM FLOW WILL START THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD FOR THIS WEEKEND WITH SURFACE RIDGING INTO THE 
SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
NEAR FREEZING AT TRI...BUT NOT WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO WARRANT A FREEZE 
WATCH. 

A MODERATION OF THICKNESS/850MB TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE WEEKEND 
WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO BECOME MORE SEASONAL TO SLIGHT ABOVE BY 
SUNDAY. FAST ZONAL FLOW WILL ALLOW PERIODS OF HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS TO 
SPREAD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THE CIRRO-STRATUS WILL BE THICK AT 
TIMES PRODUCING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES...BUT OVERALL WILL GO WITH 
PARTLY CLOUDY FOR THE WEEKEND.

FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...A STRONG LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO 
THE WESTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY. THE DOWNSTREAM UPPER RIDGE WILL 
STRENGTHEN OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION WITH UNSEASONABLY 
WARM TEMPERATURES FOR THE FIRST HALF OF NEXT WEEK AS WELL AS DRY 
CONDITIONS. WE MAY HAVE FIRE WEATHER ISSUES EARLY NEXT WEEK AS 
AIRMASS WILL REMAIN DRY AND SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL INCREASE.

FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH A COLD FRONT MOVING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BECOME 
LIKELY FOR THURSDAY. WILL NEED TO WATCH THE LATTER HALF OF NEXT WEEK 
FOR THE POTENTIAL OF STRONG-SEVERE STORMS.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED MEX MOS THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST.

FXUS64 KMRX 040633
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 AM EDT THU APR 4 2013

.SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A LARGE BAND OF SHOWERS IS MOVING 
NORTH ACROSS THE MRX CWA THIS MORNING.  WITH A DRY AIR MASS IN 
PLACE...IT IS TAKING TIME FOR THE ATMOSPHERE TO MOISTURE BUT THE 
PRECIP WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY SPREAD NORTH OVER THE AREA TODAY 
PROVIDING CATEGORICAL POPS.  TEMPERATURES WILL WARM WELL INTO THE 
40S AND 50S FOR AN ALL RAIN EVENT.  THE WIDESPREAD RAIN WILL 
CONTINUE OVER THE AREA INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS WITH THE SYSTEM 
SLOWLY PULLING OUT TOWARDS MORNING. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODEL TREND HAS BEEN TO 
SPEED UP EXIT OF PRECIP FRIDAY...SO WILL ONLY HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE 
VALLEY AND LOW CHANCE POPS EASTERN MOUNTAINS EARLY FRIDAY FOR A FEW 
LINGERING SHOWERS...THEN DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN.  HIGH PRESSURE AT 
THE SURFACE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT THEN 
SET UP TO OUR EAST. MEANWHILE LOW AMPLITUDE RIDGE ALOFT WILL BUILD 
OVER THE REGION.  THIS WILL ALLOW FOR MUCH WARMER CONDITIONS BY THE 
WEEKEND AND THESE WARMER CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE END OF 
THE PERIOD.  THERE IS SOME MODEL DISAGREEMENT IN HANDLING OF FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY THAT SETS UP TO OUR NORTH BY THE LATTER PART OF THE WEEKEND 
INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.  12Z ECMWF HAS THIS BOUNDARY FURTHER 
SOUTH...WHILE GFS/CMC HAS IT FURTHER NORTH.  ECMWF SOLUTION HAS BEEN 
LESS STABLE...AND GIVEN ITS LACK OF SUPPORT ELSEWHERE WILL LEAN 
TOWARD A FURTHER NORTH SOLUTION. THIS MEANS WILL HAVE A PRECIP FREE 
FORECAST UNTIL TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...WHEN MOISTURE SHOULD BE 
INCREASING AHEAD OF THE NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM.  FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD IS ABOVE AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME 
OF YEAR EARLY...BUT JUST AVERAGE FOR THE MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
PERIOD GIVEN MODEL DISAGREEMENTS NOTED ABOVE.


&&

CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION. CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGERY 
REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW MOVING 
NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION...WITH RADAR 
IMAGERY REVEALING SOME LIGHT RAIN ENCROACHING ON THE SOUTHERN TN 
BORDER. THIS LIGHT RAIN SHOULD ONLY SLOWLY MOVE NORTHWARD TONIGHT... 
AS A VERY DRY AIR MASS REMAINS ENTRENCHED OVER THE FORECAST AREA.

OVERALL...WILL UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO INCREASE THE SKY 
COVER ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...AND TO TWEAK THE PRECIP 
WORDING FOR TONIGHT.
&&

674 
FXUS64 KMRX 031902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EDT WED APR 3 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
SLIDE SE THROUGH THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. LOW LEVEL AIRMASS 
VERY DRY IN RIDGE AND ACROSS NE AREAS INITIALLY. DAMPENING SHORT 
WAVE WILL MOVE NE INTO THE TN VALLEY TONIGHT. HIGH AND MID LEVEL 
CLOUDINESS WILL INCREASE FROM THE SW. LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL 
ADVANCE NE TO NEAR KNOXVILLE OVERNIGHT. LEANING TOWARD THE WARM SIDE 
OF MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE. ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES THURSDAY 
WHILE PWATS INCREASE TO 1.00 TO .75 SW TO NE. INVERTED SURFACE 
TROUGH DEVELOPS ALONG AND WEST OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. RAIN WILL 
INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY THROUGH THE DAY. DOWNSLOPING 
WINDS THURSDAY MORNING WILL HINDER PCPN ACROSS NE VALLEY AREAS. WENT 
ABOVE TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE FOR THESE AREAS. WIDESPREAD RAINFALL 
CONTINUES THU NIGHT IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING SHORT WAVE. DEEPER 
MOISTURE AND RAINFALL WILL MOVE OFF TO THE EAST FRIDAY MORNING AS 
SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN WEAKLY FROM THE WEST. LOWER THICKNESS VALUES 
REMAIN NORTH OF THE AREA SO NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THIS PERIOD THE LOW PRESSURE CENTER IS TO OUR EAST WITH UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING BEGINNING TO TAKE PLACE AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES 
TO BUILD INTO THE AREA.  BY SATURDAY THE SURFACE HIGH HAS ALREADY 
MOVED TO THE EAST ALLOWING A RETURN FLOW OF SOUTHERLY WINDS TO 
BEGIN. THROUGH THE WEEKEND...THE WEAK RIDGING GETS FLATTENED OUT AND 
EVEN BEGINS TO BACK AS A LARGE TROUGH DEVELOPS IN THE ROCKIES AND 
HIGH PLAINS.  ALTHOUGH MODELS SHOW MID LEVEL MOISTURE AROUND FOR 
SUNDAY AND MOS GUIDANCE HAS SOME POPS...AM HOLDING OFF ON POPS UNTIL 
MONDAY AND CONTINUING WITH POPS FOR AT LEAST SOME PART OF THE AREA 
THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST AS THE TROUGH IN THE PLAINS TRUDGES 
THIS WAY.  FOR TEMPERATURES...WENT CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
THROUGHOUT...WEND A LITTLE COOLER ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
AREA ON SUNDAY...MOS MAX TEMPS LOOKED TO NEED MORE OF A GRADIENT 
NORTH TO SOUTH CONSIDERING THICKER CLOUD COVER TO THE NORTH ON 
SUNDAY.  FOR WEATHER...ONLY VERY WEAK LIFT IS EXPECTED WITH ANY OF 
THE PRECIP...AND MINIMAL INSTABILITY...SO WILL GO ONLY WITH SHOWERS 
FOR PRECIP MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

099 
FXUS64 KMRX 030630
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 AM EDT WED APR 3 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CLOUD COVER HAS KEPT TEMPERATURES 
UP A BIT THIS MORNING BUT AN FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT 
THROUGH 13Z.  AN APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO 
SPREAD HIGH TO MID LEVEL CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA TODAY.  
ADDITIONALLY...DEW POINTS SHOULD SLOWLY RISE.  THIS WILL RESULT IN 
HIGHS REACHING INTO THE 50S TO MAYBE AROUND 60 ACROSS THE TN 
VALLEY.  CLOUDS WILL LOWER OVERNIGHT AS THE SYSTEM APPROACHES.  
ASSOCIATED RAIN SHOULD REACH INTO SOUTHERN AREAS TOWARD MORNING AND 
WILL HAVE POPS AT LIKELY CATEGORY OVER FAR SOUTHERN LOCATIONS.  LOWS 
ACROSS NORTHEASTERN TN SHOULD DROP TO NEAR FREEZING BUT BELOW FREEZING 
LOCATIONS SHOULD MINIMAL AND WILL NOT ISSUE AND FREEZING 
WATCH/WARNING AT THIS TIME. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODEL AGREEMENT AND
CONSISTENCY IS DECENT OVERALL...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THE
LONG TERM PERIOD IS A BIT ABOVE AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. A
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK BY TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST THURSDAY
AND THURSDAY NIGHT...BRINGING RAIN TO THE AREA. THERMAL PROFILES
ARE WARM ENOUGH THAT THIS EVENT SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID. WILL CARRY
CAT POPS ALL ZONES BOTH PERIODS. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE PULLING AWAY
ON FRIDAY...SO MAY BE SOME LINGERING SHOWERS EARLY BUT THEN DRYING
EXPECTED. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE AREA LATER FRIDAY AND
FRIDAY NIGHT...THEN OFF TO OUR EAST ALLOWING WARMER AIR TO MOVE IN.
AN UPPER RIDGE WILL ALSO BUILD ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST US. DRY AND
WARM CONDITIONS EXPECTED FOR THE WEEKEND INTO AT LEAST MONDAY. BY
TUESDAY THE NEXT SYSTEM MAY BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO BRING SOME
SHOWERS...SO WILL INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY.

056 
FXUS64 KMRX 021917
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT TUE APR 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...MUCH DRIER AIR MASS HAS WORKED 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH TEMPERATURES ONLY IN THE 
MID 40S TO MID 50S AT MID AFTERNOON. THE TEMPERATURES ARE A FEW 
DEGREES LOWER THAN ORIGINALLY FORECAST. DEW POINTS HAVE FALLEN INTO 
THE TEENS TO MID 20S. HIGH PRESSURE WORKING SOUTHEAST FROM THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS WAS IN CONTRAST TO SOUTHERN PLAINS SYSTEM THAT WAS 
ALREADY SPREADING A COLD RAIN INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS WITH 
THUNDERSTORMS IN OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS.

MAIN FORECAST PROBLEM TONIGHT IS EXTENT OF CLOUD COVER ACROSS 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS AND POTENTIAL RAIN SHOWERS AND LOWS CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN SECTIONS. WITH LARGE TEMPERATURE...DEW POINT SPREADS AND 
SOME LIGHT WINDS POTENTIAL FOR FROST NOT TO GOOD BUT TEMPERATURES 
STILL LOOK TO DROP TO FREEZING OR BELOW FROM CENTRAL EAST TN NORTH. 
WILL CHANGE FREEZE WATCH TO FREEZE WARNING WITH ZONE FORECAST 
ISSUANCE. WEDNESDAY STILL ON TRACK FOR SUNSHINE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS 
AND SLIGHTLY WARMER WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY SOUTH. HIGHS WEDNESDAY A FEW 
DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY IN THE 50S TO NEAR 60.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND GENERALLY REVEAL A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHEAST BRINGING LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. MODELS 
SOUNDINGS REVEAL A WARM VERTICAL TEMP PROFILE ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY MORNING...SO DO NOT EXPECT ANY WINTRY PRECIP INITIALLY AS 
THE RAIN SPREADS NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THE BEST 
COVERAGE OF RAIN SHOULD BE ON THURSDAY NIGHT...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH SWINGS ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH. THEREAFTER...AN AREA OF HIGH 
PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE WESTERN 
ATLANTIC...WHICH WILL BRING A WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. AN UPPER-LEVEL 
RIDGE IS ALSO PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHEAST BY EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...WHICH WILL HELP TO CAUSE TEMPS TO WARM ABOVE NORMAL WITH A 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY. WITH THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY EXPECTED TO REMAIN NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.
&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 AM EDT TUE APR 2 2013

.SHORT TERM TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL EXTEND 
INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  SOME 
MID LEVEL MOISTURE WILL BRUSH AT LEAST SOUTHERN AREAS LATER TODAY 
AND TONIGHT.  THIS WILL BRING AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS SOUTHERN HALF. A 
FEW SPRINKLES OR LIGHT SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE MAINLY EARLY TONIGHT 
ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS.  FOR NOW WILL KEEP POPS BELOW SLIGHT CHANCE 
AND JUST MENTION SPRINKLES.  FURTHER NORTH THERE WILL BE MUCH LESS 
CLOUDS AND TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO DIP TO NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING 
ACROSS NORTHERN AND PERHAPS CENTRAL ZONES.  WILL KEEP THE CURRENT 
FREEZE WATCH IN PLACE FOR NOW AS STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ABOUT HOW 
MUCH OF THE WATCH WILL NEED TO BE UPGRADED TO A WARNING.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR 
NORTH WILL DOMINATE AREA WEATHER ON WEDNESDAY.  HOWEVER...THE STORM 
TRACK WILL LIE TO OUR SOUTH AND MAY CARRY IN A FEW BANDS OF CLOUDS.  
THE HIGH WILL LIFT NORTHEAST AND OUT OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS 
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SLIDES NORTHEAST AND INTO THE AREA.  PRECIP 
WILL SPREAD FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH 
CATEGORICAL POPS FOR THURSDAY.  COULD SEE SOME LIGHT SNOW OVER FAR 
NORTHERN LOCATION AND HIGHER TERRAIN LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT 
TEMPERATURES WILL WARM ENOUGH ON THURSDAY FOR AN ALL RAIN EVENT.  
THE SYSTEM AND ASSOCIATED SHOWERS WILL SLOWLY PULL OUT OF THE AREA 
LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN FOR 
THE WEEKEND FOR A WARMING AND DRYING TREND.  THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE 
APPROACHING THE AREA ON MONDAY BUT EXPECT THIS TO STAY NORTH OF THE 
AREA THROUGH MONDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN            60  32  61  37  55 /  10  10   0  30  90 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN   54  28  58  33  52 /   0   0   0  20  60

918 
FXUS64 KMRX 011937
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 PM EDT MON APR 1 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...COLD FRONT IS NOW
MOVING THROUGH EXTREME EASTERN TENNESSEE WITH A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS
AHEAD OF IT. WINDS HAVE SWITCHED TO THE NW AND ARE USHERING IN A
COLDER AND DRIER AIR MASS. TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED TO THE UPPER
50S TO UPPER 60S FOR THE MOST PART BUT A LITTLE COLDER IN SW VA
HIGHER VALLEYS. TONIGHT SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR AND DROP
INTO THE 30S BUT BELOW FREEZING HIGHER ELEVATIONS BY TUESDAY
MORNING. PATCHY FROST IN SHELTERED VALLEYS NORTH LATE BUT WINDS AND
DRIER AIR MASS SHOULD LIMIT COVERAGE OF FROST. TUESDAY A COOLER
MOSTLY SUNNY DAY WITH HIGHS IN THE 50S. TUESDAY NIGHT LOWS EXPECTED
TO BE BELOW FREEZING FROM AROUND INTERSTATE 40 NORTH SO ISSUED A
FREEZE WATCH FOR NORTHERN TN AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. ACROSS
SOUTHEAST TN SYSTEM MOVING SE FROM THE PLAINS TUESDAY WILL SPREAD
CLOUDS INTO THAT AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. MODELS TRY TO BRING A LITTLE
RAIN IN BUT FOR NOW WILL KEEP IT DRY.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...BY WEDNESDAY THE UPPER 
TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL BEGIN TO TRANSITION EASTWARD. 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE ENTRENCHED OVER THE FORECAST AREA AND 
SLIDE OFF THE VA/NC COASTLINE. THE NEXT SHORTWAVE WILL TRANSLATE 
ACROSS WEST TEXAS AND INTO TENNESSEE THURSDAY. INCREASING 
MOISTURE...FIRST IN THE FORM OF CLOUDS WILL SPREAD OVER THE AREA. 
THEN LIGHT RAIN WILL INCREASE IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY FROM SOUTH 
TO NORTH BEGINNING DURING THE DAY ON THURSDAY AND PERSIST INTO 
FRIDAY. IT MAY TAKE A WHILE TO SATURATE THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE 
ATMOSPHERE ON THURSDAY SO RAINFALL MAY BE SLOW TO ACCUMULATE UNTIL 
THURSDAY EVENING WHEN THE COLUMN BECOMES SATURATED. CURRENTLY ALL OF 
THE MODELS ARE IN EXCELLENT AGREEMENT WITH THE HIGHEST RAINFALL 
TOTALS SITUATED GENERALLY SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40. A FEW LOCATIONS 
COULD SEE LOCAL TOTAL RAINFALL ACCUMULATIONS OF A LITTLE OVER AN 
INCH WITH SEVERAL LOCATIONS GETTING A HALF INCH OR MORE.  THE UPPER 
AIR PATTERN AFTER FRIDAY NIGHT BECOMES MORE ZONAL AND SHOULD HELP 
THE AREA TO NEAR SEASONAL NORMS I.E. WARMER.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       34  56  31  61  39 /  10   0  10   0  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              32  53  27  58  32 /  10   0   0   0  10

744 
FXUS64 KMRX 010913
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
513 AM EDT MON APR 1 2013

.DISCUSSION...JUST SENT QUICK UPDATE TO INCLUDE A DENSE FOG
ADVISORY FOR THE NEXT FEW HOURS. PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FOLLOWS. 

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SECONDARY COLD FRONT WILL PUSH 
THROUGH THE AREA TODAY.  NOT MUCH FORCING OR MOISTURE WITH THIS 
FRONT...SO JUST SOME LOW POPS MAINLY NORTHEAST.  WITH COLDER AIR 
PUSHING  IN...MAY NEED A FROST ADVISORY  OR POSSIBLY A FREEZE 
WARNING LATE TONIGHT FOR MAINLY NORTHERN AREAS THAT ARE ALREADY IN 
THE PROGRAM.  HOWEVER...STILL TOO MUCH UNCERTAINTY TO ISSUE AT THIS 
POINT SO WILL ALLOW THE DAY SHIFT TO TAKE ANOTHER LOOK.  MAV TEMPS 
LOOK REASONABLE FOR THE MOST PART SO WILL STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS IN FAIRLY DECENT 
AGREEMENT DURING THE LONG TERM WHICH FEATURES A RATHER COOL PERIOD 
THROUGH FRIDAY AS THE EASTERN U.S. UPPER TROUGH TAKES IS TIME MOVING 
AWAY. ASSOCIATED CANADIAN HIGH SURFACE PRESSURE BUILDS SOUTHEAST 
ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY THROUGH MID WEEK. AT THE SAME 
TIME A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE WITH BUILD ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN 
U.S. RELATED SURFACE LOW PRESSURE WAVE WILL SHIFT NORTHEAST FROM THE 
WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO TO THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC COAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL STRENGTHEN THROUGH THE 
PERIOD PRODUCING WIDESPREAD RAIN SHOWERS DURING THIS PORTION OF THE 
FORECAST. DRIER AIR AND MILDER AIR WILL FOLLOW BEHIND THIS FEATURE 
INTO THE WEEKEND ALLOWING FOR WHAT MAY END UP BEING A RATHER 
PLEASANT WEEKEND WITH SUNSHINE AND HIGH TEMPERATURES NEAR TO JUST A 
LITTLE ABOVE NORMAL FOR EARLY APRIL.   


&&

     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...HAMILTON...

739 PM EDT SUN MAR 31 2013

.AVIATION...
PERIODS OF MVFR CONDITIONS DUE TO SHOWERS WILL END BY 01-02Z THIS

LIGHT/CALM WINDS AND MOIST GROUND WILL SET THE STAGE FOR WIDESPREAD 
FOG AND LOW CLOUD DEVELOPMENT WITH CONDITIONS BECOMING IFR TO LIFR 
AFTER 06Z AND CONTINUE THROUGH 12-14Z MONDAY. 

A GRADUAL IMPROVEMENT TO VFR CONDITIONS WILL OCCUR AT ALL TAF SITES


927 
FXUS64 KMRX 311906
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EDT SUN MAR 31 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...
EXTRAPOLATION OF PRECIP NOW OVER MIDDLE/WEST TN BRINGS THE BACK EDGE 
TO A TRI-TYS-CHA LINE AROUND 00Z...AND TO THE MOUNTAINS AROUND 01Z. 
WILL CARRY SOME LIKELY POPS IN SW NC AFTER 00Z WITH CHANCE POPS IN 
THE VALLEY. THERE IS NOT MUCH SURFACE DRY AIR OBSERVED UPSTREAM 
BEHIND THE WEAK SURFACE FRONT...SO DEWPOINTS WILL ONLY DROP SLIGHTLY 
TONIGHT FROM CURRENT VALUES. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN LOW STRATUS OR 
FOG DEVELOPMENT. MIXING FROM LIGHT WINDS IN NORTHERN AREAS SHOULD 
GIVE LOW CLOUDS THERE...WITH CALM WINDS SOUTH PRODUCING FOG. WILL 
MENTION PATCHY FOG NORTH AND AREAS OF FOG SOUTH. 

A STRONGER COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING INTO THE AREA TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON. HOWEVER MOISTURE AHEAD OF THIS FRONT IS MUCH MORE LIMITED 
AS THE MID/UPPER TROUGH IS VERY BROAD. WILL HAVE SOME LOW TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE DAY WITH LIGHT QPF. TEMPS WILL BE VERY 
DEPENDENT ON CLOUD COVER...WHICH IS VERY UNCERTAIN RIGHT NOW. GIVEN 
THE EXPECTED FOG AND LOW CLOUDS IN THE MORNING THAT WILL HAVE TO 
BURN OFF...AND ADDITIONAL HIGHER CLOUDS IN THE AFTERNOON WITH THE 
FRONT...WENT ON THE COOL SIDE OF MOS FOR HIGHS...FROM UPPER 50S 
NORTH TO UPPER 60S SOUTH. A MUCH COLDER AIR MASS WILL BEGIN TO 
INFILTRATE THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT. GRADUAL CLEARING FROM THE NORTH 
WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO FALL INTO THE LOWER 30S NORTH TO AROUND 40 
SOUTH. A FREEZE WARNING MAY BE NEEDED LATER...BUT AT THIS TIME IT 
APPEARS TOO MARGINAL TO GO WITH A FREEZE WATCH.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
A BROAD UPPER TROUGH SETS THE STAGE FOR BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES
THROUGH THE MAJORITY OF THE EXTENDED. ON TUESDAY WE ARE STILL UNDER
THE INFLUENCE OF THE UPPER TROUGH TO OUR NORTH...WHICH WILL HELP TO
KEEP TEMPS BELOW NORMAL. THE QUESTION IS...WHERE WILL THE BOUNDARY
SETTLE THAT IS ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER TROUGH. LATEST 12Z NAM AND GFS
MOVING IN OPPOSITE DIRECTIONS REGARDING POSITIONING OF BOUNDARY.
12Z NAM BRINGS BOUNDARY FURTHER NORTH THAN 06Z RUN...WHICH PUTS THE
BOUNDARY DIRECTLY OVER OUR AREA. 12Z GFS PUSHES THE BOUNDARY
FURTHER SOUTH COMPARED TO 06Z RUN...WHICH PLACES IT SOUTH OF OUR
AREA. AT THIS TIME...WILL STILL TREND TOWARD THE GFS AND
EURO...THUS A DRIER SOLUTION. LATER SHIFTS MAY HAVE TO INTRODUCE
POPS DURING THE TUESDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME IF BOUNDARY DOES INDEED
END UP DRAPED ACROSS OUR AREA. TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY THE
TROUGH BEGINS TO MOVE EAST OF OUR AREA BUT A LARGE COLD SURFACE
RIDGE EDGES IN FROM THE NORTHWEST BEHIND THE DEPARTING TROUGH. THE
CENTER OF THE SURFACE HIGH REMAINS TO OUR NORTH AND WILL SLOWLY
MIGRATE EAST ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THIS FEATURE WILL CAUSE
TEMPERATURES TO BE A GOOD FIVE TO TEN DEGREES BELOW NORMAL TUESDAY
THROUGH THURSDAY.

A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE LOCATED ACROSS THE ARKALATEX REGION 
BEGINS TO APPROACH OUR AREA LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. 
PREVIOUS FORECASTS TIMING AND CHANCE OF POPS LOOKED PRETTY GOOD. SO 
DIDN'T REALLY CHANGE MUCH OTHER THAN A FEW MINOR TWEAKS. KEPT THE 
NICE PROGRESSION OF CHANCE POPS LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INCREASING TO 
LIKELY PROBABILITY FOR SHOWERS FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST DURING 
THE DAY THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE WAVE PROGRESSES EAST. 
MAINTAINED SOME RATHER HIGH POPS EARLY ON FRIDAY AS SLOW MOVING 
TROUGH DOES NOT SHIFT EAST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS UNTIL LATER 
IN THE DAY FRIDAY OR FRIDAY NIGHT. LATEST 12Z GFS HINTS AT WAVE 
EXITING A LITTLE QUICKER ON FRIDAY COMPARED TO PREVIOUS RUNS...WILL 
KEEP POPS UNCHANGED FOR NOW. IF THE TREND OF A QUICKER EXIT 
CONTINUES...MAY HAVE TO SCALE BACK POPS FOR FRIDAY. TEMPS WILL 
CONTINUE TO REMAIN BELOW NORMAL ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY DUE TO THE 
COLD SURFACE RIDGE NOW OFF TO OUR NORTHEAST. THE PLACEMENT OF THE 
CENTER OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL HELP TO SUPPRESS THE SOUTHERN STREAM 
SHORT WAVES SOUTHERLY SURFACE FLOW UP INTO OUR AREA. PRECIP AND 
CLOUD COVER ON THURSDAY/FRIDAY SHOULD ALSO AID IN BELOW NORMAL TEMPS. 

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT SOUTHERLY FLOW AND INCREASING 
HEIGHTS BEGIN TO MAKE A RETURN ON SATURDAY AND INTO SUNDAY...HELPING 
US TO CLIMB CLOSER TO SEASONAL NORMALS AND PERHAPS EVEN SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SUN MAR 31 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE

EAST...THEN EXPECT PRECIP TO EXIT.  WILL MAKE SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO 
MAV TEMPS...BUT WILL STAY CLOSE OVERALL.    

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MORE POLAR AIR IN STORE FOR 
THE REGION THIS WEEK AS A BROAD UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES MONDAY INTO 
TUESDAY ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. MODELS STILL HINT AT A SMALL 
POSSIBILITY OF LIGHT PRECIP WITH THE FRONTAL PUSH SO KEPT A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP IN PLACE MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT. LARGE COLD SURFACE 
RIDGE EDGES SLOWLY SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE 
NATION PULLING TEMPERATURES DOWN A GOOD FIVE TO TEN DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. MODEL SOLUTIONS INDICATING BETTER
AGREEMENT WITH A HEALTHY LOOKING SOUTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE TROUGH 
AND SURFACE WAVE/INVERTED TROUGH WHICH SHIFTS EAST ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEASTERN STATES THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. KEPT THE NICE PROGRESSION 
OF CHANCE POPS LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INCREASING TO LIKELY PROBABILITY 
FOR SHOWERS FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST DURING THE DAY THURSDAY INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE WAVE PROGRESSES EAST. MAINTAINED SOME RATHER 
HIGH POPS ON FRIDAY AS SLOW MOVING TROUGH DOES NOT SHIFT EAST OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS UNTIL LATER IN THE DAY FRIDAY OR FRIDAY NIGHT. 
WE MAY BE ABLE TO ENJOY A PRECIP FREE SATURDAY WITH DRY ADVECTION 
AND BUILDING HEIGHTS ALOFT. HAD TO UNDERCUT TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE 
DURING MOST OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST.
