FXUS64 KMRX 301859
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EDT SAT MAR 30 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...
RAIN OVER NRN AL ASSOCIATED WITH A WARM FRONT IS PROJECTED TO REACH 
CHA BEFORE 00Z...AND SPREAD NORTHWARD ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE 
NIGHT. THE STRONGEST LIFT OCCURS OVER THE AREA AROUND 06Z JUST AHEAD 
OF THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH AXIS AND IN THE LEFT EXIT REGION OF AN UPPER 
JET STREAK. AVERAGE QPF AMOUNTS OF A HALF INCH ARE FORECAST...WITH 
CATEGORICAL POPS EVERYWHERE. A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER WILL BE 
MENTIONED SOUTH WHERE THERE WILL BE SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY 
OVERNIGHT. 

WE SHOULD SEE A BRIEF LULL IN THE PRECIP SUNDAY MORNING BEFORE A 
SECOND MIDLEVEL TROUGH AND UPPER JET APPROACH THE AREA IN THE 
AFTERNOON. A PERIOD OF BROKEN CLOUDS MAY ALLOW TEMPS TO RISE INTO 
THE MID 60S IN THE VALLEY. FORCING FOR LIFT APPEARS A BIT WEAK AS 
THE FLOW IS NOT VERY AMPLIFIED...BUT THERE WILL BE BETTER 
SURFACE-BASED INSTABILITY AVAILABLE. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS SOUTH AND 
CHANCE POPS NORTH IN THE AFTERNOON...WITH A CHANCE OF THUNDER 
EVERYWHERE. COLD FRONT PASSAGE OCCURS SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH LIFT AND 
MOISTURE SHIFTING TO OUR EAST AFTER MIDNIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
THE MODELS REMAIN A LITTLE BOUNCY IN THEIR SOLUTIONS. NOW THE
MONDAY NIGHT EVENT LOOKS VERY PIDDLY...MOSTLY A PATCH OF CLOUDINESS
WORKING ITS WAY THROUGH OVERNIGHT WITHOUT MUCH MEASURABLE
PRECIP...MAINTAINED 20 PERCENTS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND SW VA.
OTHERWISE A DRY SPELL WILL HOLD THROUGH WEDNESDAY. MORE
SIGNIFICANTLY...THE 00Z EC CONTINUES WITH ITS WET SOLUTION FOR
THURSDAY...AND NOW THE 12Z GFS HAS COME INTO GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH
THE EC...AND EVEN THE CANADIAN IS WET FOR THURSDAY. SO...I WILL RUN
MY POPS CLOSE TO THE MAX ENSEMBLE POP FROM THE 00Z
ENSEMBLES...MEANING 60 PERCENT POPS CROSSING THE CWA THURSDAY AND
THURSDAY NIGHT. ADJUSTED MAX TEMPS DOWN A LITTLE ON THURS TO MORE
CLOSELY MATCH THE WETTER 12Z GFS EXTENDED MOS. DRY WEATHER RESUMES
FRIDAY AFTN THROUGH SATURDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT SAT MAR 30 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREA OF LIGHT RAIN EXPECTED TO

THE AREA FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST...WITH CAT POPS ALL ZONES BY 
LATE TONIGHT.   INSTABILITY WILL BE QUITE LIMITED...BUT WILL INCLUDE 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE SO 
WILL NOT STRAY FAR.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A SHORT WAVE TROUGH AND COLD 
FRONT WILL PRODUCE SCATTERED SHOWERS ALONG WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A 
FEW THUNDERSTORMS AS IT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION ON SUNDAY. MOST OF 
THE RAIN WILL HAVE ENDED BY SUNDAY EVENING. UNFORTUNATELY ANOTHER 
DEEP UPPER TROUGH WILL BE DROPPING SOUTHEAST OUT OF CANADA IN TIME 
TO YANK TEMPERATURES BACK BELOW NORMAL THROUGH MUCH OF THE WEEK. THE 
FRONT WILL NOT ARRIVE IN TIME TO PUT A CHILL IN THE AIR MONDAY. 
HOWEVER THERE WILL BE AN INCREASING CHANCE FOR SHOWERS MONDAY INTO 
MONDAY NIGHT AS MOISTURE IS LIFTED AHEAD OF THE POLAR AIRMASS. DRY 
AND COLD AIR WILL BE IN PLACE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH 
TEMPERATURES A GOOD TEN TO FIFTEEN DEGREES BELOW NORMAL ALTHOUGH 
THERE WILL BE SOME SUNSHINE TO LIFT SPIRITS DURING THIS PERIOD. 
MODEL SOLUTIONS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT TOWARD THE END OF THE LONG 
TERM FORECAST WITH THE ECMWF INDICATING A MORE ROBUST SOUTHERN 
STREAM SYSTEM FOR THE THURSDAY/FRIDAY TIME FRAME WHILE THE GFS AND 
CANADIAN SHOW A SLIGHTLY WEAKER AND MORE SUPPRESSED SYSTEM. EDGED 
THE FORECAST A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE MORE SUPPRESSED SCENARIO WITH A 
SMALL CHANCE OF SHOWERS TO WRAP UP THE END OF THE WORK WEEK. WARM 
AIR ADVECTION AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM SHOULD BOOST TEMPERATURES A 
LITTLE CLOSER TO NORMAL FOR EARLY APRIL.

FROM THE SW LATE IN THE DAY AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING SHORTWAVE TROUGH.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...

FROPA AND SHWRS/TSTMS ARE HITTING HIGH POPS SATURDAY NIGHT AND
SUNDAY MORNING BEFORE HEADING OUT OF THE AREA. THE SECOND FROPA
BRINGING IN THE COLDER AIR IS AROUND LATE MONDAY. GOOD CONFIDENCE
IN THE SEASONABLY WARM TEMPS SUNDAY AND MONDAY. THE COOL DOWN
BEHIND THE SECOND FRONT ON TUESDAY WON'T LINGER TOO LONG...AS TEMPS
WILL REBOUND CLOSE TO NORMAL ON THURSDAY. EXTENDED MODELS STILL
STRUGGLING WITH LATE PERIOD EVENT. GFS IS NOW DRY WITH A SOUTHERN
STREAM SYSTEM IMPACTING THE GULF COAST WHILE THE EC HAS A DEEPER
TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS BRINGING UP GREATER MOISTURE AND SIGNIFICANT
PRECIP INTO TE AREA LATE THURS/EARLY FRI. WASN/T THE EC THE DRIER
MODEL YESTERDAY AND THE GFS THE WETTER CONCERNING LATE NEXT WEEK?
WILL STICK WITH LOW CHANCE POPS FOR LATE NEXT WEEK TIL THINGS ARE A
LITTLE LESS UNCERTAIN.

THERE IS SOME DRY LOW LEVEL AIR TO BE OVERCOME...AND SOME OF THE
LIGHTER PRECIP ON RADAR IS PROBABLY NOT REACHING THE
GROUND...IT APPEARS THAT MEASUREABLE PRECIP WILL REACH THE TN
VALLEY BY NOON. TEMPS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              51  34  61  44  63 /  30  20  10  70  70

552 
FXUS64 KMRX 290821
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT FRI MAR 29 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL SPREAD 
INTO ESPECIALLY CENTRAL ZONES TODAY...BRINGING SOME LIGHT RAIN.  NAM 
DEPICTION OF CURRENT PRECIP LOOKS BETTER THAN THE GFS...SO WILL LEAN 
TOWARD THE NAM SOLUTION.  EXPECT RAINFALL AMOUNTS TO BE QUITE LIGHT 
GIVEN LIMITED MOISTURE INFLUX AND WEAK FORCING...BUT THINK LIKELY 
POPS WARRANTED CENTRAL WITH CHANCE NORTH AND SOUTH AND SLIGHT CHANCE 
FAR NORTH FOR THIS AFTERNOON.  A FEW PATCHES OF LIGHT RAIN OR 
DRIZZLE MAY LINGER INTO TONIGHT...WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ALL 
ZONES.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE OVERALL...SO WILL STAY CLOSE FOR 
THE MOST PART.     

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN FOR 
THE FIRST SEVERAL DAYS OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST AS THREE FEATURES 
AFFECT THE REGION. THE EARLY PART OF THE FORECAST WILL FEEL A LITTLE 
MORE LIKE SPRING WITH TEMPERATURES CLOSER TO NORMAL FOR LATE MARCH 
AND EARLY APRIL. THE INITIAL SYSTEM IS A LOW AMPLITUDE WAVE THAT 
BUILDS ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST U.S. ON SATURDAY. THERE MIGHT BE A 
SHOWER OR TWO ACROSS MAINLY THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE VIEWING AREA AS 
MOISTURE IS LIFTED IN A WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN ACROSS THE 
REGION. NEXT AN UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT ADVANCE 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND SWINGS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ON SUNDAY. JACKED UP POPS FOR SHOWERS WELL AHEAD OF THE 
FEATURE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY WITH CONVECTION POSSIBLE DURING 
THE DAY SUNDAY JUST AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. DRIER AIR BUILDS INTO 
THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. HOWEVER...A MORE AMPLIFIED 
UPPER TROUGH DROPS INTO THE EASTERN U.S. LATER MONDAY INTO TUESDAY 
BRINGING MORE SHOWERS AND MUCH COLDER AIR BACK INTO THE AREA. 
COLD...DRY CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY PULLING TEMPERATURES A GOOD FIVE TO TEN 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. A SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM BUILDS EAST ACROSS 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY AND ADDED 
SOME SMALL POPS FOR SHOWERS AT THE END OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD FOR 
THIS POSSIBILITY. HAD TO UNDERCUT GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST (SMALL DEVIATION INITIALLY FOLLOWED BY GREATER DEVIATION) 
DUE TO THE BLOCKING PATTERN WHICH IS NOT ALLOWING A MORE TYPICAL 
SPRING TO EMERGE ACROSS NORTH AMERICA.  

&&

587 
FXUS64 KMRX 290207
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 PM EDT THU MAR 28 2013

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
THE PERSISTENT NORTHWEST FLOW WILL CONTINUE THROUGH TONIGHT. CLEAR 
AND CALM CONDITIONS WILL ALLOW LOWS TO DROP INTO THE 20S AND 30S. 
THE FREEZE WARNING WILL BE CONTINUED AS IS. A 850 MB RIDGE WILL MOVE 
INTO THE TN VALLEY FRIDAY...WITH THE FLOW AT THAT LEVEL SHIFTING TO 
THE W-SW. THIS WILL RESULT IN WARM ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT AT 
THE 295-300K LEVEL...AIDED BY A WEAK 500 MB VORT MAX. THE NAM 
APPEARS TO BE OVERDONE WITH ITS QPF AND POPS (ABOUT 70 PERCENT 
HIGHER THAN ABOVE GFS MOS) CONSIDERING THE WEAK LIFT AND LACK OF 
DEEP MOISTURE AVAILABLE. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS BEGINNING FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON AND CONTINUING THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH THE HIGHEST 
CHANCES SOUTH. WE SHOULD SEE ENOUGH SUNSHINE FRIDAY MORNING TO BRING 
HIGHS INTO THE MID 50S AND LOWER 60S BEFORE CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE 
IN THE AFTERNOON. 

LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
THIS PERIOD WILL BEGIN WITH MODERATING TEMPERATURES AND INCREASING
HUMIDITY SATURDAY...IN LIEU OF FRONTAL PASSAGE SUNDAY THAT WILL BE
ACCOMPANIED BY AT LEAST LIKELY POPS FOR SHOWERS...AND A FEW
THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE ALSO. THE COOL DOWN BEHIND THIS FRONT WILL
NOT BE SUBSTANTIAL...BUT A REINFORCING SHOT OF COLDER AIR WILL COME
IN WITH ANOTHER FRONT ON MONDAY. CHANCES OF RAIN WILL AGAIN BE
NOTED WITH THE SECOND FRONT...HOWEVER IT WILL BE LIGHTER AMOUNTS.
THE SECOND FRONT SHOULD SUCCESSFULLY PUSH THROUGH AND CLEAR US
OUT...SO EXPECT A DRY MIDWEEK. MODELS DIVERGE LATE WITH THE GFS
BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF RAIN WITH A DISTURBANCE IN THE
WESTERLIES...WHILE THE EC HAS A STRONGER TROUGH OVER THE
EAST...THUS COOLER AND DRIER THAN GFS. I'LL LEAN TOWARD THE EC BUT
NOT WITHOUT CARRYING SOME LOW POPS DOWN SOUTH THURSDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             34  63  46  64  51 /   0  30  40  40  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  31  58  42  63  49 /   0  30  30  30  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       30  58  42  63  49 /   0  30  30  20  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              26  57  37  61  41 /   0  20  20  10  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...FREEZE WARNING FROM 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ TO 10 AM EDT /9 AM CDT/ 
     FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...
     BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...

CENTRAL.

505 
FXUS64 KMRX 280737
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
337 AM EDT THU MAR 28 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND
SURFACE RIDGING WILL BE THE THEME ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH
TONIGHT. PERSISTENT LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE FAR
NORTHEAST TODAY WITH SCATTERED TO BROKEN CLOUDS AT 5KFT. ANOTHER
AREA OF MID-LEVEL MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK MID-LEVEL ISENTROPIC
LIFT WILL PULL CLOUDS INTO THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA
TODAY PRODUCING PARTLY-MOSTLY CLOUDY SKY. A GRADUAL WARM-UP IS
STILL ANTICIPATED AS THICKNESS/850MB TEMPERATURE RISE.

FOR TONIGHT...EVEN THOUGH 925/850MB TEMPERATURES RISE...MOSTLY
CLEAR SKY..LIGHT/CALM WINDS AND DRY AIRMASS WILL PRODUCE GOOD
RADITIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS..ESPECIALLY FOR SHELTERED VALLEYS.
TEMPERATURES AT OR BELOW FREEZING IS EXPECTED OVER MOST OF THE VALLEY..
EXCEPT NEAR CHA FOR TONIGHT. WILL INCLUDE ANOTHER FREEZING WARNING
FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A LARGE DOME OF SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION ON FRIDAY. LOW 
LEVEL SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS ARE PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS HIGH...WHICH WILL SLOWLY PUSH A WARM 
FRONT INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. NORTHWEST 
FLOW ALOFT WILL COMBINE WITH THIS WARM FRONT TO TRIGGER A FEW 
SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. A COLD 
FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON EASTER 
SUNDAY...WITH THE GFS MODEL INDICATING SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION A CHANCE FOR 
TSTORMS ON SUNDAY. ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY...AS A LARGE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
AMPLIFIES OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
ALTHOUGH THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY 
TUESDAY...UNSETTLED CONDITIONS MAY LINGER THROUGH WEDNESDAY AS THE 
MODELS SUGGEST A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING ALONG THE GULF 
COAST. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH 
THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.



&&

541 
FXUS64 KMRX 280215
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 PM EDT WED MAR 27 2013

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. LOW LEVEL CLOUDS ACROSS NE AREAS
WILL SLOWLY DECREASE OVERNIGHT. FORECAST MINS IN LINE WITH LAMP 
DATA. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...THERE IS LITTLE CHANGE TO THE 
OVERALL WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PERIOD AS LOW 
PRESSURE REMAINS NEARLY STATIONARY OFF THE COAST OF NOVA SCOTIA. A 
NW FLOW WILL CONTINUE OVER OUR AREA...WITH COOL MIDLEVEL TEMPS OVER 
NORTHERN SECTIONS PROVIDING AN OVERCAST TO BROKEN STRATOCU DECK. 
ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS MAY CLIP WISE AND RUSSELL COUNTIES 
OVERNIGHT...BUT NO ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED. A SURFACE RIDGE WILL 
BUILD IN TONIGHT...AND LOWS WILL DROP INTO THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 
30S. THE FREEZE WARNING LOOKS ON TRACK AND WILL BE UNCHANGED. SOME 
MIDLEVEL STABILIZATION AND RISING 500 MB HEIGHTS TOMORROW SHOULD 
RESULT IN LESS CLOUD COVER FOR NORTHERN AREAS. HIGHS WILL REACH INTO 
THE 50S IN MOST SPOTS...WITH 40S CONTINUING FOR SW VA AND THE TN 
MOUNTAINS. 

LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WILL BE IN AN 
UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE REGION THURSDAY NIGHT WILL SLIDE EAST OF THE AREA 
AS A SHORT WAVE MOVES IN ON FRIDAY.  PRECIP WILL MOVE IN FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS.  TEMPERATURES WILL BE WARM ENOUGH 
FOR ALL RAIN.  ANOTHER WAVE MOVES IN QUICKLY ON ITS HEELS ON 
SATURDAY.  THEN...THE FIRST OF TWO COLD FRONTS PUSHES IN ON SUNDAY 
FOR ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS.  WEAK INSTABILITY ACCOMPANYING THE 
FRONT MAY PROVIDE SOME EMBEDDED THUNDERSTORMS AS WELL.  THERE IS 
SOME DISCREPANCY IN TIMING...BUT THE SECOND FRONT SHOULD REACH INTO 
THE AREA AROUND MONDAY NIGHT.  ANOTHER ROUND OF COLD...OR AT LEAST 
COOLER AIR...WILL FILTER IN BEHIND THE SECOND FRONT BRINGING 
TEMPERATURES DOWN TO BELOW NORMAL LEVELS.  WILL LEAVE LOW POPS IN 
PLACE THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED AS THE FRONT EXITS THE REGION 
AND MODELS HINT THAT ANOTHER WAVE WILL BE APPROACHING FROM THE SOUTH 
BY WEDNESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     30  54  31  57  39 /   0   0   0  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN             29  55  32  57  39 /   0   0   0  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    28  48  28  54  35 /  10   0   0  20  10 

&&

NC...NONE.

571 
FXUS64 KMRX 270721
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 AM EDT WED MAR 27 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WRAP-AROUND LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE
WILL CONTINUE TO PULL INTO THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA
TODAY AND FAR NORTHEAST TONIGHT. OROGRAPHIC LIFT INTO THE HIGHER
TERRAIN WILL PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS TODAY WITH A CHANCE
OF FLURRIES OVER THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL
ONCE AGAIN BE UNSEASONABLY COOL TODAY WITH A FREEZE LIKELY TONIGHT.
EVEN THOUGH IT HAS BEEN COLD THE PAST WEEK...AREA BERRIES AND FRUIT
TREES WILL REMAIN SUCEPTIBLE TO FURTHER CROP DAMAGE. A FREEZE
WARNING HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND PLATEAU FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A LARGE DOME OF SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION ON THURSDAY. THIS 
HIGH IS PROGGED TO DRIFT SOUTHEASTWARD THROUGH FRIDAY...WITH 
SOUTHWESTERLY LOW-LEVEL WINDS DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON 
FRIDAY. THESE SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL BRING WARM AND MOIST AIR BACK 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA...WITH NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT COMBINING TO 
GENERATE A FEW SHOWERS BEGINNING FRIDAY NIGHT AND LINGERING THROUGH 
EASTER SUNDAY. A COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY ON EASTER SUNDAY...WHICH SHOULD CREATE A BETTER COVERAGE OF 
SHOWERS. GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY WILL 
DEVELOP AREA WIDE ON SUNDAY...SO WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE FOR TSTORMS 
ON EASTER. A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL THEN DEVELOP OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...WHICH WILL CONTINUE 
UNSETTLED CONDITIONS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             53  32  60  33  62 /   0   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  45  29  54  30  60 /   0   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       46  29  54  30  59 /   0   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              42  29  47  27  55 /  10   0  10   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT TUE MAR 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...MAINTAINED THE 
WINTER STORM WARNING AND ADVISORY PRODUCTS AS ATMOSPHERE IS AT THE 
PEAK OF INSTABILITY DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON PERIOD AND MOIST 
UPSLOPE FLOW CONTINUES TO PRODUCE LIGHT SNOW IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
AREAS. SNOWFALL RATE SHOULD DIMINISH THIS EVENING THROUGH THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS AS THE LOWER LEVEL ATMOSPHERE STABILIZES. KEPT THE 
FREEZE WARNING IN PLACE FOR TONIGHT AS WELL AS THE WATCH FOR A 
CHILLY WEDNESDAY NIGHT COMPLETE WITH LIGHT WIND AND ONLY PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES. WEDNESDAY SHOULD BE A BETTER DAY AS CLOUDS BREAK UP 
DURING THE MORNING REVEALING A FAIR AMOUNT OF SUNSHINE DURING THE 
AFTERNOON. AS USUAL...MOISTURE WILL BE LIFTED IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
INTO A FEW SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH THE DAY BUT AMOUNTS WILL BE VERY 
LIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
MOVES SE ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH SATURDAY. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. 
LAYER HEIGHTS REMAIN STEADY AND TEMPERATURES CONTINUE BELOW NORMAL. 
LOW LEVEL ISENTROPIC LIFT BEGINS FRIDAY NIGHT WITH AN INCREASE IN 
CLOUDS AND A CHANCE FOR RAIN SOUTHERN AREAS ON SATURDAY. WARM FRONT 
MOVES NE THROUGH THE AREA ON SUNDAY BRINGING TEMPERATURES UP TO NEAR 
NORMAL. WEST TO EAST ORIENTATING COLD FRONT SETTLES INTO THE TN 
VALLEY WITH PRECIPITATION CHANCES INCREASING SUNDAY WITH WESTERLY 
FLOW ALONG SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT. FRONT MOVES SE THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY MONDAY. RAIN CHANCES TAPER OFF MONDAY. 
GFS ENSEMBLE QPF IN SPREAD WIDELY THROUGH THE CHANCE CATEGORIES 
SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. BEST CHANCES FOR PCPN APPEAR SUNDAY IN 
PREFRONTAL WARM SECTOR. ALSO BANKING ON FRONT TO MOVE SUFFICIENTLY 
SE NEXT WEEK TO LEAN TOWARD DRIER SOLUTION. WENT BELOW TEMP GUIDANCE 
NEXT WEEK. SURFACE RIDGE BUILDING IN FROM NW WITH CONTINENTAL 
ORIGIN.

.AVIATION...LOTS OF MOISTURE BELOW 700 MB STREAMING SOUTHEAST

TERMINAL DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. FLIGHT WEATHER WILL IMPROVE
FROM SOUTHWEST THROUGH NORTHEAST FROM AROUND 14-16Z WEDNESDAY
MORNING WITH A RETURN TO VFR CONDITIONS.

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST IN RELATIVELY GOOD SHAPE WITH A CONTINUATION
OF SNOW SHOWERS AS LAPSE RATES POP UP TO AROUND 8.5 DEGREES C/KM
WITH MOISTURE LADEN COLD NORTHWEST FLOW IN PLACE. OROGRAPHIC LIFT
IN THE HIGH TERRAIN TO KEEP THE SNOW ACCUMULATING IN THE WINTER
STORM WARNING REGION. LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD CONTINUE DURING THE
DAY TODAY ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND GREAT VALLEY. BEST
CHANCE FOR A SLICK SPOT HERE AND THERE WILL BE IN THE WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY AREA ON THE PLATEAU AND ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE
WHERE TEMPERATURES WILL BE A COUPLE DEGREES COLDER. WILL TWEAK
TEMPS BACK JUST A TAD MOST AREAS IN THE FORECAST UPDATE. WILL
LIKELY SEE A FEW MORE BREAKS IN THE OVERCAST ACROSS SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE DURING THE AFTERNOON AS DEPTH OF MOIST COLUMN DECREASES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
725 AM EDT TUE MAR 26 2013

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OFF 
THE NORTHEAST COAST...WITH AN ELONGATED AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE PLAINS. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN THESE TWO SYSTEMS WILL 
PRODUCE GUSTY WINDS AT THE TAF SITES DURING THE LATE MORNING AND 
AFTERNOON HOURS. AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE...CURRENTLY GENERATING 
LIGHT SNOW AT THE TAF SITES...WILL SWING EAST OF THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THIS MORNING. AS A RESULT...THIS SNOW SHOULD GRADUALLY 
COME TO AN END IN THE NEXT FEW HOURS AT KCHA AND KTYS...AND THEN AT 
KTRI IN THE AFTERNOON. LOWER VISIBILITIES DUE TO SOME SCATTERED 
HEAVIER SNOW SHOWERS MAY AFFECT THE TAF SITES THIS MORNING...BUT 
WILL NOT MENTION IN THE TAFS SINCE TIMING THEIR EXACT OCCURRENCE AT 
THE TAF SITES WILL BE PROBLEMATIC. OTHERWISE...VFR CONDITIONS ARE 
EXPECTED AT ALL THREE SITES FOR MOST OF THE TAF PERIOD.
&&

NC...NONE.

     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

817 
FXUS64 KMRX 260726
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT TUE MAR 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OFF THE NORTHEAST COAST...WITH A LARGE AREA OF 
HIGH PRESSURE AREA OVER THE PLAINS. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN 
THESE TWO SYSTEMS WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE GUSTY WINDS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA TODAY...BUT WIND SPEEDS SHOULD STAY BELOW ADVISORY 
CRITERIA. AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL SWING ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA TODAY...AND WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON. THESE SNOW SHOWERS AND THE WESTERLY WINDS WILL GRADUALLY 
DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET THIS EVENING. WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER STORM 
WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES WITHOUT ANY CHANGES. TEMPS ACROSS THE LOWER 
ELEVATIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BE ABOVE FREEZING FOR MOST OF THE DAY... 
SO THINK THAT MOST SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS 
SHOULD BE ON GRASSY SURFACES. OUTSIDE OF THE WARNING AND ADVISORY 
AREAS...TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO RISE INTO THE 40S THIS AFTERNOON...SO 
THINK THAT ANY SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS IN THESE AREAS SHOULD BE 
AROUND AN INCH OR LESS. SINCE AREA GROWERS HAVE INDICATED THAT THE 
GROWING SEASON HAS STARTED FOR EAST TN (OUTSIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS)... 
WILL ISSUE A FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...PERSISTENT UPPER TROUGH OFF 
THE NORTHEAST/MID-ATLANTIC COAST WILL FINALLY RELEASE ITS EFFECTS ON 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY LATE WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH THE 
LOW CLOUDS ERODING. WILL CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS FOR 
THE HIGHER MOUNTAINS OF FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY.

DRIER NORTHWEST FLOW AND SURFACE RIDGING WILL DOMINATE THE FORECAST
FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MOST OF SATURDAY. SURFACE RIDGING AND 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKY WILL PRODUCE GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS 
WITH TEMPERATURES BELOW FREEZING AGAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY 
NIGHT. AFTER TALKING WITH LOCAL CROP SPECIALIST...AREA BERRIES AND 
FRUIT TREES HAVE PROGRESSED FAR ENOUGH ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
AND PLATEAU THAT FREEZING TEMPERATURES ARE AN IMPACT. WILL INCLUDE A 
FREEZE WATCH FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

FOR LATE SATURDAY THOUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...THE GFS AND ECMWF SHOW A 
NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WHICH WILL PULL
A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE 
SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. AT THIS TIME...INSTABILITY LOOKS LIMITED...
SO HAVE NOT INCLUDED THUNDER.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   45  31  52  32  58 /  30   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     42  30  47  30  55 /  50  10   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             42  30  47  30  56 /  60   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    40  28  42  28  47 /  80  30  10  10  10 
&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 PM EDT MON MAR 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...MAINTAINED CURRENT WINTER STORM 
WATCH AND WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY AREAS. IN A LATE MARCH SNOW EVENT 
EMPHASIS WILL BE IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE VERY COLD AIR ALOFT AND 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT SUPPORT HEAVY SNOWFALL. TRAILING SHORT WAVE FEATURE 
ROTATES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT ENHANCING 
SNOWFALL. WOULD EXPECT ROAD SURFACE TEMPERATURE TO ALLOW FOR A FAIR 
AMOUNT OF MELTING DEEP INTO THE EVENING MOST OF THE CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN VALLEY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR THE SNOWFLAKES 
TO HAVE A BETTER CHANCE AT ACCUMULATING...ESPECIALLY LATER 
TONIGHT...ACROSS THE ADVISORY AREAS INCLUDING THE NORTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. 
COLD AIR ALOFT SUPPORTS INTENSE LAPSE RATES AGAIN DURING THE DAY 
TUESDAY IN A MOIST ENVIRONMENT AND WOULD EXPECT THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME MORNING SLICK SPOTS ON ROADS ACROSS THE ADVISORY AREA BEFORE 
SURFACE TEMPERATURES EDGE ABOVE FREEZING...AS WAS THE CASE TODAY. 
UNDERCUT TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE IN THIS COLD AND CLOUDY REGIME. 
FINALLY...MAINTAINED THE WIND ADVISORY THROUGH EARLY EVENING AS 
CONVECTIVE MIXING APPEARS TO CONTINUE TO PULL HIGHER SPEED FLOW TO 
THE SURFACE. WIND SPEED SHOULD DROP BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA AFTER 
SUNSET.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST...BECOMING CENTERED OVER THE AREA 
BY FRI NIGHT. PERSISTENT NW FLOW ALOFT WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW 
NORMAL. UPSLOPE SHOWERS REMAIN POSSIBLE ACROSS FAVORED AREAS THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. SURFACE RIDGE SLIDES EAST OVER THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES 
WARM BACK UP TO NEAR NORMAL BY SUNDAY AHEAD OF STRONG COLD FRONT. 
BEST CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION ON SUNDAY WITH COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE 
EARLY MONDAY.

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AS DEEP LOW PRESSURE

FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE LOWER TEMPERATURES WILL HELP TO
PRODUCE MORE EFFECTIVE SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION WITH ADDITIONAL HELP
FROM OROGRAPHIC LIFT. NO SIGNIFICANT WARMING ON TAP FOR TODAY WITH
TEMPERATURES TOPPING OUT IN THE 30S NORTH AND JUST BARELY MAKING IT
INTO THE LOWER 40S ACROSS MUCH OF THE SOUTH. AS THE STRONGER FLOW
ALOFT MIXES DOWN TO THE SURFACE IN THE STEEP LAPSE RATE ENVIRONMENT
WIND SPEED WILL POP INTO THE ADVISORY RANGE SO WILL KEEP THE NPW 
GOING.

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER

DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. THESE WINDS SHOULD QUICKLY WEAKEN AFTER 
SUNSET THIS EVENING. LIGHT SNOW WILL CONTINUE AT THE TAF SITES THIS 
MORNING...BUT WILL PROBABLY LOWER VISIBILITIES BELOW SIX MILES ONLY 
AT KTRI AND KTYS. SCATTERED SNOW OR RAIN SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED THIS 
AFTERNOON...BUT TIMING THE EXACT OCCURRENCE AT THE TAF SITES WILL BE 
PROBLEMATIC. THUS...WILL MENTION VCSH AT KTYS (WHERE TEMPS SHOULD 
RISE INTO THE LOWER 40S THIS AFTERNOON)...AND LIGHT SNOW AT KTRI 
(WHERE TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN IN THE 30S THIS AFTERNOON).

986 
FXUS64 KMRX 250802
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT MON MAR 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN OHIO...WITH AN OCCLUDED 
FRONT EXTENDING SOUTH OF IT ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN THIS LOW 
AND A LARGE HIGH PRESSURE AREA OVER THE PLAINS WILL GENERATE VERY 
STRONG WESTERLY WINDS OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. IN ADDITION...A 
LARGE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WILL 
HELP TO GENERATE SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE REGION TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL FAIRLY STEEP LOW-LEVEL LAPSE 
RATES...WITH CAPE VALUES BETWEEN 50 AND 100 J/KG OVER THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...EXPECT THESE SCATTERED SHOWERS TO 
PRODUCE BRIEF SNOW SQUALLS OVER PORTIONS OF THE AREA...WHICH WILL BE 
ABLE TO GENERATE A QUICK INCH OR TWO OF SNOW. TEMPS IN THE LOWER 
ELEVATIONS ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING TODAY...SO THINK 
THAT MOST SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS SHOULD BE ON 
GRASSY SURFACES. WILL PLAN TO ADD A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR 
TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY OVER NORTHEAST TN AND THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...WHERE THE COVERAGE OF SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE BETTER AND THE 
SNOW WILL HAVE A BETTER CHANCE TO ACCUMULATE. FARTHER SOUTH ACROSS 
CENTRAL EAST TN AND SOUTHEAST TN...TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO RISE INTO 
THE 40S THIS AFTERNOON...SO THINK THAT ANY SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS IN 
THESE AREAS SHOULD BE AROUND AN INCH OR LESS. WILL NOT EXPAND ANY 
ADVISORIES OVER EXTREME SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC FOR TODAY... 
BUT AN ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED LATER FOR TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE REVEALING DISCREPANCIES FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER NAM 
NUMBERS DUE TO THE STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A SECONDARY UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL PASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY...PROVIDING ENOUGH LIFT 
TO TRIGGER AN ADDITIONAL ROUND OF SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE REGION. 
THE MOST FAVORED AREAS FOR MORE MEASURABLE SNOWFALL AND APPRECIABLE 
ACCUMULATIONS WOULD BE ACROSS THE MOUNTAIN ZONES OF SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE WHERE TOTALS IN EXCESS OF 4 INCHES WILL 
BE POSSIBLE THANKS TO THE STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW...WHICH WILL ENHANCE 
THE POTENTIAL FOR OROGRAPHICALLY INDUCED SNOW SHOWERS TO PERSIST 
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN INTO THE EVENING AND NIGHTTIME HOURS BY 
TUESDAY EVENING. OTHER VALLEY LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA...FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COULD 
SEE BETWEEN 1-2 INCHES OF ACCUMULATIONS AS WELL IN CERTAIN AREAS 
GIVEN THE MOISTURE IN PLACE AND THE COOLER TEMPERATURE PROFILES 
THERE. OTHER LOCATIONS ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY ARE 
NOT EXPECTED TO RECEIVE ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL...WITH TOTALS BEING 
VERY MINOR AND LESS THAN 1/2 AN INCH. BY WEDNESDAY MORNING...PRECIP 
CHANCES WILL DROP DRAMATICALLY AS THE STORM SYSTEM PULLS OFF TO THE 
EAST...YIELDING SOME DRIER BUT COOLER WEATHER WITH NORTHWEST WINDS 
REINFORCING THE DRY/COLD AIR MASS. HIGHS WILL REMAIN AROUND 10-15 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL DURING THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WEEK BEFORE WINDS 
BACK TO THE SOUTHWEST ALLOWING FOR A BRIEF WARM UP LATE THIS WEEK. 
HOWEVER...THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE IN FROM THE WEST... 
BRINGING SOME LOW-END PRECIPITATION CHANCES INITIALLY FOR FRIDAY 
INTO SATURDAY...AND PERHAPS A BETTER SHOT HEADING INTO EASTER SUNDAY 
AND THE FIRST FULL WEEK OF APRIL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   45  33  45  30  51 /  30  30  30  10   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     41  32  42  30  46 /  60  50  40  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             41  32  42  30  46 /  60  50  40  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    38  30  39  28  40 /  80  80  60  20  10 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 8 PM EDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...BRADLEY...CAMPBELL...CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...EAST POLK...GRAINGER...HAMBLEN...HAMILTON...
     HANCOCK...HAWKINS...JEFFERSON...JOHNSON...KNOX...LOUDON...
     MARION...MCMINN...MEIGS...MORGAN...NW BLOUNT...NORTH 
     SEVIER...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER

SUNSET...WITH MVFR CEILINGS EXPECTED AT KTRI FOR MOST OF THE DAY. 
SINCE TIMING THE EXACT OCCURRENCE OF ANY SNOW OR RAIN SHOWERS AT 
KTRI AND KTYS WILL BE VERY DIFFICULT...WILL PLAN TO MENTION PRECIP 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY WITH NO VISIBILITY RESTRICTIONS (THE STRONG WINDS 
MAY CAUSE ANY LOWERING VISIBILITIES TO BE BRIEF). AT KTYS (WHERE 
TEMPS SHOULD RISE INTO THE LOWER 40S THIS AFTERNOON)...WILL MENTION 
A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND SNOW. AT KTRI (WHERE TEMPS SHOULD ONLY RISE 
INTO THE UPPER 30S THIS AFTERNOON)...WILL MENTION SNOW.
&&

AHEAD OF THE FEATURE AND WINDS ARE EVEN STRONGER BEHIND IT. THE
SHOWERS ARE JUST AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. JUST STARTED THE WIND
ADVISORY AS WINDS GUSTING OVER 35 MPH ALONG THE PLATEAU AND
SOUTHERN VALLEY THE PAST HOUR. HAVE REMOVED THUNDERSTORMS FROM THE
WORDING AS INSTABILITY HAS DECREASED. TEMPERATURES HAVE NOW DROPPED
BELOW 40 OVER PARTS OF THE PLATEAU AND ARE BELOW 40 IN THE HIGHER
NE MOUNTAINS. EXPECT THE CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS AROUND MIDNIGHT
OVER PLATEAU COUNTIES AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS BUT 6 TO 9Z FARTHER
SOUTH AND EAST. WILL UPDATE WSW SOON WITH NO CHANGES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT SUN MAR 24 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...OTHER THAN THE SLIGHTLY
PROLONGED DRY SLOT THIS AFTERNOON...FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK. STRONG
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKING NE FROM WRN KY THIS AFTERNOON WITH
CONVECTION DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. TSRA HAVE BEEN
PRODUCING 1/2 TO 3/4 INCH HAIL OVER MIDDLE TN...ALTHO INSTABILITY
MAY DIMINISH BY THE TIME THIS ACTIVITY REACHES OUR WRN COUNTIES.

WESTERLY WINDS KICK IN AND RAIN SHOWERS CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS
AFTER 06Z MONDAY...AS THE LOW TRACKS FURTHER NE. TRENDED CLOSE TO
PREVIOUS SNOW AMOUNTS IN THE WATCH AREA...WITH THE ADDITION OF
GENERALLY 1 TO 3 INCH AMOUNTS FOR OUR PLATEAU COUNTIES AND LOWER
ELEVATIONS OF NE TN BY TUESDAY. LAPSE RATES ARE QUITE STEEP ON
TUESDAY WITH LOW LEVEL CAPE NEAR 100 J/KG...SO ADDITIONAL SNOW
ACCUMS AT LEAST THROUGH DAYTIME TUESDAY.

WATCH AREA WAS UPGRADED TO A WINTER STORM WARNING. STRONG GRADIENT
IN PLACE BEHIND THE PASSING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...SO POSTED A WIND
ADVISORY FOR ENTIRE FORECAST AREA THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON.

HEAVY RAIN IN CHA AREA OVERNIGHT HAS SENT THE SOUTH CHICKAMAUGA
CREEK ON A MINOR RISE TODAY...BUT APPEARS TO BE HEADED TOWARD A
CREST BETWEEN 17 AND 18 FEET AT THIS POINT...JUST BELOW THE FLOOD
STAGE OF 18 FEET.

THANKS TO ADJACENT NWS OFFICES FOR COORDINATION ON THIS LATE MARCH
WINTRY WEATHER SYSTEM.  


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NASTY EASTERN U.S. UPPER 
TROUGH WILL BE IN NO HURRY TO EXIT WITH HINTS OF SUFFICIENT MOISTURE 
AND WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY DROPPING THROUGH THE PREVAILING NORTHWEST 
FLOW MAINLY TUESDAY NIGHT. LEFT A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SNOW SHOWER IN 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE TN-NC 
BORDER THROUGH WEDNESDAY IN THIS PATTERN. WAS ABLE TO HOLD ONTO THE 
DRY PERIOD FROM WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. FORECAST UNCERTAINTY 
DEFINITELY INCREASES DURING THE LAST PART OF THE EXTENDED WITH 
GFS/ECMWF SOLUTIONS DIVERGING INTO THE WEEKEND. APPLIED A PERIOD OF 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR RAIN SHOWERS FROM FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT FOR REMOTE POSSIBILITY OF ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE 
DROPPING OUT OF THE GREAT LAKES/NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. STAYED SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW MOS TEMPERATURE 
GUIDANCE IN THE NEVER ENDING EASTERN U.S. COLD PATTERN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1002 AM EDT SUN MAR 24 2013

.DISCUSSION...INITIAL ROUND OF SHOWERS HAS MOVED THROUGH MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. DRY SLOT NOW MOVING IN WILL REQUIRE 
LOWERING RAIN CHANCES FOR AT LEAST A FEW HOURS. LATEST RUC MODEL 
SPREADS MORE SHOWERS OUR WAY BEFORE HEAVIER SHOWERS AND ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS OCCUR WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY BY MID TO LATE 
AFTERNOON. FREEZING LEVEL QUITE LOW ALREADY FOR LATE MARCH AND WILL 
LOWER EVEN MORE AS COLDER AIR APPROACHES THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
SEVERE THREAT SHOULD BE MAINLY LARGE HAIL WITH STRONGEST STORMS THAT 
DEVELOP. 

WINTRY WEATHER PARTS OF FORECAST LOOK ON TRACK FOR NOW. SYNOPTIC 
SCALE FORCING IS GONE AFTER MONDAY MORNING...LEAVING A PROLONGED 
PERIOD OF NW FLOW WITH UPSLOPE LOW LEVEL FORCING. MOISTURE LOOKS 
DEEP AND LAPSE RATES ARE QUITE STEEP ON MONDAY AFTERNOON...WITH EVEN 
MORE INSTABILITY (CAPES OF AROUND 100 J/KG) NOTED FOR TUESDAY 
DAYTIME. OUTSIDE OF THE WATCH AREA...THINK BANDS OF SNOW SHOWERS 
WILL PROVIDE A HIT OR MISS PATTERN OF LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS...AND 
GENERALLY MEETING ADVISORY CRITERIA OR LESS. WILL DEFER ANY CHANGES 
BEYOND TODAY TO THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE. 

UPDATED GRIDS AND PRODUCTS BY AROUND 11 AM EDT.

715 AM EDT SUN MAR 24 2013

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
NORTHERN AL...WITH A LARGE AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN MOVING 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS LOW WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEASTWARD 
THIS MORNING...WITH A DRY SLOT CREATING A LULL IN THE RAIN ACTIVITY 
BY LATE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON. TSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO DEVELOP 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING...AS AN AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH SWINGS ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE TAF SITES THIS EVENING...WITH WINDS STRENGTHENING 
BEHIND THE FRONT AND BECOMING GUSTY AT ALL THREE TAF SITES. SNOW 
SHOWERS MAY AFFECT THE TAF SITES AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...BUT WILL 
NOT INCLUDE IN THE TAFS FOR NOW....SINCE THIS WILL OCCUR TOWARDS THE 
END OF THE TAF PERIOD.

516 
FXUS64 KMRX 240809
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EDT SUN MAR 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN MS...WITH A WEAK 
INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING NORTHEAST OF IT INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF RAIN SPREADING NORTHEASTWARD OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS MORNING...WITH THE MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT A BRIEF LULL IN THIS RAINFALL ACTIVITY DEVELOPING BY LATE 
MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON. A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
IS THEN PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING...HELPING TO TRIGGER CONVECTION ALONG A 
COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. A MARGINALLY 
UNSTABLE AIR MASS WITH DECENT WIND SHEAR IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON...WITH THE FREEZING LEVEL 
DROPPING TO AROUND 6000 FT MSL. THUS...IT APPEARS THAT A LINE OF 
CONVECTION WILL LIKELY DEVELOP ALONG THIS COLD FRONT LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING...WITH A FEW STORMS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING 
LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS. WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO BECOME GUSTY 
THIS AFTERNOON...AND ESPECIALLY TONIGHT BEHIND THE COLD FRONT...BUT 
IT APPEARS THAT WIND SPEEDS WILL REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA 
UNTIL MONDAY. RAIN SHOULD QUICKLY CHANGE TO SNOW TONIGHT BEHIND THE 
PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT...WITH SNOWFALL STARTING TO ACCUMULATE 
MAINLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SINCE THE ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL 
SHOULD BEGIN LATE TONIGHT...WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER STORM WATCH AND 
WILL LET THE DAY SHIFT UPGRADE AS NECESSARY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...STRONG GRADIENT WINDS WILL 
CONTINUE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY IN THE WAKE OF A COLD 
FRONTAL PASSAGE AND AS A STRONG 60+ KT 850 MB JET AND A SUBSEQUENT 
STRONG MID TO UPPER-LEVEL JET STRUCTURE ALL ROTATING OVER THE AREA. 
THIS IS EXPECTED TO RESULT IN SUSTAINED WINDS OF 20 TO 30 MPH WITH 
GUSTS UP TO 45 MPH. THUS...A WIND ADVISORY WILL ALMOST CERTAINLY BE 
NEEDED FOR MONDAY...WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A HIGH WIND WARNING 
ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE LOCALLY HIGHER WINDS/GUSTS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE. 

THE OTHER STORY WILL BE THE COLDER AIR THAT WILL MOVE INTO THE 
REGION IN WAKE OF THE AFOREMENTIONED FRONT. THIS COLDER AIR WILL 
COMBINE WITH SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE ON THE BACKSIDE OF A 
DEPARTING UPPER-LOW AND THE LIFT PROVIDED BY A APPROACHING SECONDARY 
WAVE TO GENERATE SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD SHOWERS/SNOW SHOWERS MONDAY 
AND MONDAY NIGHT...AND INTO THE DAY ON TUESDAY. INCREASING THE 
SNOWFALL POTENTIAL IS A PROGGED STOUT NORTHWEST FLOW WHICH WILL HELP 
TO ENHANCE OROGRAPHIC LIFT ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE 
AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. WHILE MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL RECEIVE 
VERY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OF LESS THAN HALF AN INCH...THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS SHOULD SEE A MODERATE TO PERHAPS LOCALLY HEAVY SNOWFALL 
GIVEN THE SETUP. THUS...HAVE GRIDS SHOWING LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL 
POPS OVER THE TERRAIN DURING THIS PERIOD AND AM EXPECTING THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SNOWFALL TOTALS IN EXCESS OF 4 INCHES IN THESE AREAS. 
THUS...A WINTER STORM WATCH IS IN EFFECT FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON. MOST AREAS 
IN THE LOWER-ELEVATIONS SHOULD SEE LOW-END ADVISORY LEVEL CRITERIA 
SNOWFALL OR LESS...WITH SEVERAL AREAS RECEIVING LESS THAN HALF AN 
INCH.

THEREAFTER...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL HELP TO KEEP THE COOLER AIR 
IN THE REGION FOR MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK WITH HIGHS 
REMAINING 10-15 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. THEN...WINDS BACK TO THE 
SOUTHWEST ALLOWING FOR AN ADDITIONAL WARM UP THE REST OF THE WEEK 
BEFORE THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM ROLLS IN FROM THE WEST...BRINGING SOME 
LOW-END PRECIPITATION THE WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   61  36  43  32  44 / 100  50  20  10  30 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     57  36  42  31  42 / 100  60  40  40  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN             57  36  42  32  41 / 100  60  40  40  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    52  32  38  31  39 / 100  80  60  70  40 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

VA...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...
     WASHINGTON...WISE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
135 AM EDT SUN MAR 24 2013

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
SOUTHERN MS...WITH A LARGE AREA OF RAIN WITH EMBEDDED THUNDER 
SPREADING NORTHEASTWARD OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS LOW WILL 
CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEASTWARD THIS MORNING...WITH LOWER 
VISIBILITIES AND CEILINGS EXPECTED AS THIS RAIN INTENSIFIES AROUND 
THE TAF SITES TOWARDS SUNRISE. WILL MENTION SOME THUNDER AT KCHA 
THIS MORNING...WHERE SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY. A 
LULL IN THE RAIN SHOULD THEN DEVELOP AFTER SUNRISE AND INTO THE 
EARLY AFTERNOON HOURS...BEFORE TSTORMS DEVELOP ALONG THE COLD FRONT 
BY LATE AFTERNOON AND AFFECT ALL THREE TAF SITES. AFTER FRONTAL 
PASSAGE THIS EVENING...WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE WEST AND BECOME 
STRONG AND GUSTY.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY

FXUS64 KMRX 231926
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EDT SAT MAR 23 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A BREAK IN THE RAIN THUS
FAR...BUT SEEING SHOWERS DEVELOP OVER N MS AND SW TN. TWEAKED POP
GRIDS DOWN A BIT FOR THE CURRENT AND EARLIEST EVENING GRIDS.
OTHERWISE...GRIDS WERE GENERALLY ON TRACK FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY.
SHOWERS WITH A GOOD CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS THOSE PERIODS...AND
CAN'T RULE OUT SOME HAIL ON SUNDAY DUE TO COLD POOL ALOFT AND LOW
FREEZING LEVEL. STRONG WINDS SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...WHICH MAY
REQUIRE A WIND ADVISORY.

MAIN CONCERNS ARE A PROLONGED PERIOD OF SNOW SHOWERS FOR SW VA...
NRN MTNS AND SMOKY MTNS RIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY DAYTIME. DEEP
MOISTURE...SYNOPTIC FORCING AND OROGRAPHIC LIFT AFTER FRONTAL
PASSAGE...ALL SUPPORT A WINTER STORM WATCH. KEPT SNOW AMOUNTS DONW
IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS DUE TO UNCERTAINTY AND TOO WARM DAYTIME
TEMPS. UNDERCUT MOS HIGHS CONSIDERABLY IN THE WATCH AREA.

WILL ISSUE WSW PRODUCT THEN UPDATE OUR HAZARDOUS WEATHER PRODUCT TO
REFLECT THESE UPDATED HAZARDS. 
 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...FINAL SHORT WAVE 
SLIDES EAST OF THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT ALLOWING FOR AN END TO  
SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITIES FOR MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA. STILL 
APPEARS THERE WILL BE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE WITH UPSLOPE COMPONENT TO 
KEEP SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER. KEPT MOST OF THE AREA DRY ON WEDNESDAY BUT 
PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW AND SOME LINGERING MOISTURE MAY PROVIDE 
FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE THAT A SNOW SHOWER MAY OCCUR IN THE HIGHEST 
TERRAIN SW VA AND THE PEAKS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. WAS 
ABLE TO KEEP A DRY PERIOD GOING FROM WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE 
DAYTIME PERIOD ON FRIDAY AS SURFACE RIDGE SLIDES EAST ACROSS THE 
REGION. FORECAST UNCERTAINTY BUILDS AT THE END OF THE EXTENDED WITH 
SOME DIVERGENCE OF OPINION BETWEEN THE ECMWF AND GFS. EDGED THE 
FORECAST A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE ECMWF ADDING A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A 
SHOWER FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT AS DEEPER MOISTURE MAKES 
AN ADVANCE ON THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ALONG WITH SOME WARM AIR 
ADVECTION/ISENTROPIC LIFT. HAD TO CUT BACK SIGNIFICANTLY ON 
SUGGESTED MEX MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
DUE TO THE CONTINUATION OF A RATHER BLOCKED UP PATTERN. THE 
HEMISPHERIC PATTERN REFUSES TO ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO RETURN TO 
PLEASANT CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMS FEATURING HIGHS IN THE 60S AND LOWS IN 
THE 40S.

GRIDS ALREADY. AN UPDATE OF GRIDS AND ANY AFFECTED WEB PRODUCTS WILL 
BE DONE AROUND 11 AM EDT.

973 
FXUS64 KMRX 230800
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SAT MAR 23 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A WEAK 
INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING NORTHEAST OF IT INTO MIDDLE TN. THIS LOW 
PRESSURE AREA IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT NORTHEASTWARD AND DEEPEN 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS. A WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WAS HELPING TO CREATE 
SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING...BUT MODELS AGREE THAT A LULL IN PRECIP ACTIVITY WILL 
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON BEFORE DEEPER MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
LOW SPREADS NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY OVER THE SOUTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...SO WILL MENTION A 
CHANCE OF TSTORMS FOR THESE AREAS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR TODAY (MOST LIKELY 
DUE TO CLOUD COVER DIFFERENCES)...BUT ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR 
TONIGHT. WILL GENERALLY COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO WHERE DIFFERENCES 
ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM 
DROPPING SOUTH FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL BE THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THOUGH THE MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK. THIS 
STORM SYSTEM HAS THE POTENTIAL TO BRING STRONG WINDS TO THE 
REGION...ALONG WITH WELL-BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR LATE MARCH 
AND GOOD PRECIPITATION CHANCES /INCLUDING THAT OF THE WINTRY VARIETY 
BEGINNING SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH AT LEAST THE DAY ON TUESDAY/.

A STRONG COLD FRONT AND ITS ASSOCIATED UPPER LOW WILL MOVE INTO THE 
OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEY ON SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT. AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT...STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL BE ENHANCED BY AN INTENSE 
LOW-LEVEL JET OF 60+ KT WINDS AT 850 MB AND A SUBSEQUENT STRONG MID 
TO UPPER-LEVEL JET STRUCTURE ALL ROTATING OVER THE AREA. THIS WILL 
RESULT IN SOME STRONG GUSTY WINDS ACROSS THE REGION BEGINNING SUNDAY 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT AND CONTINUING SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY IN WAKE 
OF THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. ADVISORY LEVEL WINDS ACROSS THE VALLEYS AND 
FOOTHILLS SEEM PROBABLE ATTM...WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME PERIODS 
OF HIGH WIND WARNING CRITERIA TO BE MET ALONG THE EAST TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS AS WELL. 

IN ADDITION TO THE STRONG WINDS...SOME GOOD PRECIPITATION CHANCES 
WILL EXIST GIVEN THE DEEP MOISTURE IN PLACE AND THE STRONG LIFT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM. SHOWERS AND SOME ISOLATED TO SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE DURING THE DAY ON SUNDAY. THEN...IN 
WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT THE COOLER AIR FILTERING IN WILL CHANGE RAIN 
SHOWERS OVER TO A RAIN/SNOW MIX IN THE VALLEYS AND ALL SNOW IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN. ADDITIONAL SNOW SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ON MONDAY AND ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS EVEN COLDER AIR FILTERS INTO THE REGION AND 
ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE PASSES THROUGH THE REGION. GIVEN THE 
PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW...ADDITIONAL OROGRAPHICALLY ENHANCED SNOW 
SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE TUESDAY NIGHT AND PERHAPS INTO WEDNESDAY 
ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. 
THESE AREAS WILL LIKELY EXPERIENCE SOME MINOR TO MODERATE SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS GIVEN THE MOISTURE IN PLACE AND THE PREVAILING 
NORTHWEST FLOW ENHANCING OROGRAPHIC LIFT. LOWER ELEVATIONS /MAINLY 
ACROSS SW VIRGINIA AND NE TENNESSEE AND PERHAPS THE NORTHERN 
PLATEAU/ COULD ALSO SEE SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OF A DUSTING TO NO 
MORE THAN HALF AN INCH AS WELL. BY THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY CLEARING IS 
EXPECTED TO TAKE PLACE...RESULTING IN SOME WARMING AHEAD OF THE NEXT 
SYSTEM PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA SOMETIME EASTER WEEKEND.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     54  46  58  35  42 /  50  90 100  50  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN             54  46  58  34  41 /  50  90  90  50  40

REACH THE GROUND. HAVE SLOWED PROGRESS OF THE RAIN DOWN EVEN MORE BY
LOWERING POPS SOME MORE THIS EVENING WITH MEASURABLE RAIN BECOMING
LIKELY MAINLY AROUND 6Z SOUTHEAST SECTIONS AND 9 TO 12Z NE. 
TEMPERATURES WILL NOT FALL MUCH MORE IN THE SE TO THE LOWER 40S
BUT SHOULD FALL INTO THE 30S NE. STILL LOOKS LIKE THERE MAY BE SOME
SNOW HIGHER ELEVATIONS NE TN AND SW VA LATE TONIGHT BUT SHOULD
QUICKLY CHANGE TO RAIN SATURDAY MORNING AS ATMOSPHERE WARMS.

LOW PRESSURE GRADUALLY DEEPENS WHILE SHIFTING EAST INTO THE LOWER
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY SATURDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES AHEAD OF THE
FEATURE DROPPING CEILINGS AS LIGHT SHOWERS DEVELOP AT THE
TERMINALS. CONDITIONS LOWER INTO THE MVFR RANGE FROM AROUND 09Z AT
CHA TO 10Z AT TYS. TRI MAY HOLD ONTO VFR CONDITIONS UNTIL ABOUT 12Z
SATURDAY UNTIL BECOMING MVFR. CONDITIONS IMPROVE EARLY AFTERNOON
SATURDAY AS SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEAST.

695 
FXUS64 KMRX 221926
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EDT FRI MAR 22 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MOST RAIN THIS AFTERNOON
HAS REMAINED TO OUR SOUTH...BUT SHOULD GRADUALLY DEVELOP THIS
EVENING. MODELS HAVE SUCH GOOD AGREEMENT ON MOST MEASURABLE RAINS
OCCURRING OVER THE SRN 2/3RDS OF THE FORECAST AREA...THAT PREVIOUS
GRIDS WERE STILL ON TRACK. KEPT CATEGORICAL POPS SRN AREAS TO JUST
SLIGHT CHANCE OVER SW VA. MIN TEMPS SUPPORT MORE THAN JUST RAIN...
BUT WITH ONLY 0.01 INCH IN GRIDS FOR COLDER AREAS...THERE WAS NO
REASON TO HIGHLIGHT SNOW MUCH AT ALL. DEW POINT TEMPS STILL VERY
LOW...PLUS HIGHS HAVE STRUGGLED TODAY UNDER CLOUD COVER. THUS...
EVAPORATIVE COOLING COULD EASILY LOWER TEMPS TO GFS MOS MINS...
EVEN UNDER SO MUCH CLOUD COVER. 

THE ISENTROPIC LIFT SPREADS LIGHT RAIN ACROSS THE SRN APPALACHIANS
MAINLY DURING THE MORNING SATURDAY...THEN RAIN CHANCES DROP OFF.
THERE APPEARS TO BE A BREAK BEFORE THE STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM
PUSHES SHOWERS OUR WAY SATURDAY NIGHT. BEST LIFT AND INCREASED
INSTABILITY DUE TO COOLER AIR ALOFT ON SUNDAY...SO WE SHOULD
DEFINITELY SEE A FEW THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP BY THEN.

I GENERALLY FOLLOWED A MOS BLEND WHERE LARGER DIFFERENCES WERE
NOTED IN MAX TEMPS EACH DAY...BUT CLOSER TO MILDER NAM MOS MINS FOR
SATURDAY NIGHT.

SOME STRONG WINDS ON SUNDAY...BUT 12Z NAM HAS COME MORE IN LINE
WITH THE GFS TRACK OF THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...RESULTING IN A
WEAKER 850 MB LOW LEVEL JET. IT HAD LOOKED EARLIER LIKE A POTENTIAL
MTN WAVE PATTERN. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...BIG SLOW MOVING UPPER LOW 
MIGRATES EAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY 
NIGHT WHILE WRAPPED UP SURFACE LOW DRIVES NORTHEAST FROM KENTUCKY 
INTO WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA. MORE THAN ADEQUATE MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH 
THIS SYSTEM WILL RESULT IN SNOW SHOWER PRODUCTION MAINLY IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU NORTHEAST THROUGH SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AS WELL AS THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. A 
MIXTURE OF LIGHT RAIN AND LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE THE PREVAILING 
PRECIP TYPE IN THE GREAT VALLEY. UNFORTUNATELY THIS GENERAL PATTERN 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY AS A TRAILING SHORT WAVE DROPS INTO 
THE BASE OF THE LONGWAVE TROUGH ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST STATES 
GENERATING MORE SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS WITH A 
MIXTURE OF RAIN AND SNOW IN THE VALLEY. PRECIPITATION SHUTS DOWN BY 
WEDNESDAY MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE ONLY SPOTS THAT MAY SEE A 
SNOW SHOWER ON WEDNESDAY WILL BE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER AS UPSLOPE 
FLOW GRADUALLY WINDS DOWN. THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
SHOULD BE DRY BUT MODERATION IN TEMPERATURES WILL BE A SLOW GO WITH 
A PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW. HAD TO UNDERCUT GUIDANCE TEMPS BY 
SEVERAL DEGREES IN THIS BLOCKED COLD PATTERN.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             43  56  50  62  36 /  80  90 100  90  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  38  54  47  61  36 /  70  70 100 100  50

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

700 AM EDT FRI MAR 22 2013

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE MID MS AND OHIO RIVER VALLEYS...WITH AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE CENTERED OVER NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED MOISTURE SLOWLY 
SPREADING NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. AS A RESULT... 
CEILINGS WILL GRADUALLY LOWER AT THE TAF SITES THROUGHOUT THE DAY... 
WITH SOME LIGHT RAIN DEVELOPING AROUND KCHA AND KTYS TONIGHT. VFR 
CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS ARE EXPECTED FOR MOST OF THE TAF 
PERIOD...ALTHOUGH MVFR CEILINGS ARE EXPECTED AT KCHA AFTER SUNSET 
THIS EVENING.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.


802 
FXUS64 KMRX 220801
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT FRI MAR 22 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY DRIFT SOUTHEASTWARD TODAY INTO THE LOWER 
MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED MOISTURE SPREADING EASTWARD 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. AS A RESULT...CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO 
INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH LIGHT RAIN DEVELOPING 
OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...AND 
THEN SPREADING NORTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A FAIRLY DRY BOUNDARY LAYER OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...SO THIS RAIN MAY INITIALLY TAKE A WHILE 
TO MOISTEN THE LOWER LEVELS AND MAKE ITS WAY TO THE GROUND. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE 
NOTED.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL STORM SYSTEM 
DROPPING SOUTH FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND 
THE SOUTHERN APPALCHIANS WILL BE THE DOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE WEEKEND THROUGH THE EARLY TO MIDDLE PART 
OF NEXT WEEK. THIS STORM SYSTEM WILL BRING GOOD PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES AND MUCH COOLER TEMPERATURES TO THE REGION FOR LATE MARCH... 
PROLONGING THE ONSET OF SPRING ACROSS THE AREA FOR THE TIME BEING.

A COLD FRONT WILL DROP SOUTH OF THE AREA SATURDAY MORNING...BRINGING 
A SHORT BREAK IN APPRECIABLE PRECIPITATION CHANCES FOR THE AREA. BY 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY THE AFOREMENTIONED STORM SYSTEM WILL 
BECOME STRONGLY NEGATIVELY TITLED AS AN INTENSE UPPER-JET ROTATES 
OVER THE AREA. THIS FEATURE WILL PRODUCE SOME STRONG LIFT AND 
GENERATE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA...PARTICULARLY ON 
SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION. IN 
WAKE OF THE FRONT...EVEN COOLER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALCHIANS RESULTING IN A CHANGEOVER TO SNOW SHOWERS SUNDAY NIGHT 
IN MANY LOCATIONS. THE LOW WILL DEEPEN AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE OHIO 
VALLEY AND WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE EAST...ALLOWING FOR CONTINUED SHOWER 
ACTIVITY ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE LOW ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY. GIVEN THE 
COLD AIR IN PLACE...SNOW WILL LIKELY BE THE DOMINANT PRECIPITATION 
TYPE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING BEFORE IT CHANCES BACK OVER 
TO RAIN ON TUESDAY AND TAPERS OFF BY TUESDAY EVENING. WHILE 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE HIGHLY UNCERTAIN ATTM...THE HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS 
WILL LIKELY SEE SOME MINOR TO MODERATE SNOWFALL GIVEN THE MOISTURE 
IN PLACE AND THE PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW ENHANCING OROGRAPHIC 
LIFT. LOWER ELEVATIONS /MAINLY ACROSS SW VIRGINIA AND NE TENNESSEE/ 
COULD ALSO SEE AT LEAST SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS AS WELL...SO THE 
PROGRESS OF THIS SYSTEM AND THE LATEST FORECAST TRENDS WILL 
CERTAINLY NEED TO BE MONITORED.

IN ADDITION TO THE WINTER WEATHER POTENTIAL...THE STRONG JET ENERGY 
WITH THIS STORM SYSTEM /WITH 850 MB WINDS AOA 60 KTS/ AND A STEEP 
PRESSURE GRADIENT WITH THE AFOREMENTIONED PASSING LOW WILL RESULT IN 
SOME STRONG GUSTY WINDS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...AND PERHAPS INTO 
MONDAY. THE POTENTIAL FOR WIND ADVISORY LEVEL WINDS ACROSS MUCH/ALL 
OF THE AREA CERTAINLY SEEMS PLAUSIBLE...WITH HIGH WIND WARNING 
POTENTIAL ALONG THE SPINE OF THE MOUNTAINS DURING THIS TIMEFRAME. 
BY MIDWEEK THE UPPER LOW LOOKS TO FINALLY MOVE EAST RESULTING A SOME 
DRIER AND SLIGHTLY WARMER WEATHER HEADING INTO THURSDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   52  43  56  48  61 /  50  80  50 100  90 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     50  39  55  46  58 /  30  70  40 100 100

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT THU MAR 21 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...STEEP LAPSE RATES GENERATED A
FAIR AMOUNT OF CUMULUS CLOUDS OVER SW VA AND NE TN THIS AFTERNOON...
BUT THESE CLOUDS WILL BE DISSIPATING SHORTLY. ISENTROPIC LIFT GETS
UNDERWAY LATE TONIGHT OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY REGION...WITH CLOUDS
INCREASING IN THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS INTO OUR FORECAST AREA.
OPTED TO JUST ABOUT DROP ANY MENTION OF PRECIPITATION FOR TONIGHT.
GFS MOS MINS LOOKED QUITE REASONABLE AS WINDS DIMINISH AND SKIES
STAY MOSTLY CLEAR OVER NE HALF OF THE REGION. 

ISENTROPIC LIFT CONTINUES ON FRIDAY WITH LIGHT RAIN GRADUALLY
REACHING ALL BUT EXTREME NE TN AND SW VA...ALTHO I DID INCREASE
CLOUD COVER THERE WITH A MENTION OF SPRINKLES LATE. CARRIED A SMALL
AREA OF LIKELY POPS OVER THE SEQUATCHIE VALLEY AND EXTREME SRN TN
VALLEY BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. THE CLOUDINESS SEEMS TO FAVOR THE
MUCH COOLER GFS MOS HIGHS OVER SE TN AND SW NC...WITH A MOS BLEND
IN THE FAR NE WHERE CLOUDS ARRIVE LATER.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...VERY ACTIVE EXTENDED. 
FRONTOGENETIC FORCING WILL PRODUCING AN AREA OF PRECIPITATION 
(MAINLY RAIN) OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING.

FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...A STRONG NEGATIVE TILTED UPPER 
TROUGH WILL MOVE FROM THE MID-SECTION OF THE NATION TOWARD THE OHIO 
VALLEY. STRONG UPPER JET STRUCTURE WILL PRODUCE LARGE SCALE LIFT 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THE UPPER JET WILL ENHANCE THE 
FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING ALONG A FRONTAL PASSAGE SUNDAY. MODELS SHOW 
ENOUGH INSTABILITY AND SYNOPTIC FORCING TO INCLUDE A CHANCE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR SUNDAY.

THE TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT AROUND DEEP CYCLOGENESIS WILL PRODUCE AN 
850MB LOW-LEVEL JET OF 50-60KTS AFTER FROPA. THESE WINDS WILL LIKELY 
MIX DOWN TO THE SURFACE ALONG WITH STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION TO 
PRODUCE WINDY CONDITIONS AREA-WIDE SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. THE 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL QUICKLY COOL THE VERTICAL TEMPERATURE 
COLUMN TO ALLOW THE PRECIPITATION TO CHANGE TO SNOW. 

FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE TERRAIN 
FEATURES ALONG WITH PERIODS OF LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY WILL PRODUCE 
SNOW SHOWERS OVER MOST OF THE AREA. ACCUMULATING SNOWS ARE LIKELY 
FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...FAR EASTERN 
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND POSSIBLY THE NORTHER PLATEAU.

THE UPPER LOW AND DEEP CYCLO-GENESIS FROM SECONDARY LOW OFF THE EAST
COAST WILL MOVE EAST FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH A WARMING TREND 
AND DRY CONDITIONS.

FROM THE WEST FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY. THE PRECIPITATION WILL FAVOR 
SW AREAS AND MAY BEGIN AS VERY LIGHT SNOW AND FLURRIES FRIDAY 
MORNING. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH MOVES NE INTO THE AREA SATURDAY 
WITH WEAK WARMING TREND AND INCREASED PROBABILITY FOR MAINLY LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION. SURFACE LOW MOVES NE THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ON 
SUNDAY...DEEPENING MOISTURE ACROSS THE REGION. COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL PERSIST. LOW 
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION...INCLUDING SNOW POSSIBLE ACROSS NORTHERN 
AREAS AND THE SMOKIES.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
358 PM EDT WED MAR 20 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...JUST STARTING TO SEE CLOUDS

THIS EVENING. THIS WILL BE A SHORT DURATION EVENT...LIKELY WINDING 
DOWN RAPIDLY AFTER 06Z THURSDAY. KEPT SNOW ACCUMS LIMITED TO HIGHER 
TERRAIN WITH LESS THAN 1 INCH IN GRIDS. INITIAL SHOWERS OCCUR WITH 
SURFACE TEMPS MUCH TOO WARM...THEN TEMPS DROP INTO THE 20S OVERNIGHT.

OPTED TO KEEP THE RED FLAG WARNING GOING FOR SW VA...AS W-NW WINDS 
SHOULD STAY GUSTY THROUGH THE EARLY EVENING HOURS AT LEAST. ALSO...
NOTICED SOME LOW RH VALUES WHERE DEW POINT TEMPS HAVE REMAINED IN 
THE 10 TO 20 DEGREE RANGE. HWO PRODUCT WAS UPDATED TO INCLUDE THE 
FIRE DANGER THREAT PLUS POSSIBLE PATCHY BLACK ICE OVERNIGHT WHERE 
SNOW SHOWERS ARE LIKELY. 

OTHERWISE...WINDS AND CLOUDS EARLY TONIGHT FAVOR MORE OF A MOS BLEND 
THAN THE COOLER GFS MOS MINS. SUNSHINE RETURNS ON THURSDAY...BUT 850 
MB TEMPS REMAIN QUITE COOL OVER NE HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
TWEAKED THE THURSDAY MAX TEMP GRID TO REFLECT THIS.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...BUSY WEATHER
PATTERN FOR THESE PERIODS...BUT NOT A LOT OF SYSTEMS...RATHER
JUST SIMPLY...WE ARE AT THE LATITUDE WHERE WE ARE CLOSE TO IF NOW
COMPLETELY WITHIN THE AREA OF LIFT FOR A COUPLE OF SYSTEMS. SYSTEM
TO SOUTH AT BEGINNING OF ALL THIS LOOKS LIKE IT WILL ONLY BE
FLURRIES AT BEST OVER THE SOUTHERN AREAS FRIDAY...THEN WARMER AIR
BUILD INTO THE AREA...MAKING THE PRECIP TYPE THROUGH THE REST OF
THE WEEKEND ALL LIQUID. FOR POPS...HAVE THE NORTHERN AREAS BELOW
GUIDANCE IN THE EARLIER PERIODS AS OTHER MODELS AND ENSEMBLES HINT
THAT MAIN PRECIP AREAS MAY BE FARTHER SOUTH. FOR LATER PERIODS...
COLD AIR COMES PLUNGING IN AGAIN FOR NEXT WEEK...WENT WELL BELOW
GUIDANCE ON TEMPS. NOT MUCH MOISTURE LEFT AROUND...SO POPS TAPER
OFF AFTER MONDAY NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
427 AM EDT WED MAR 20 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY AND COLD HIGH PRESSURE
OVER THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PLAINS WAS SHIFTING SLOWLY SE INTO
THE LOWER MS AND TN VALLEYS THIS MORNING. THE AIR MASS HAD BECOME
VERY DRY. TEMPERATURES WERE STILL IN THE LOWER 30S TO MID 40S AT
THIS HOUR. AT THE SAME TIME AN UPPER LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES WAS
BRINGING A SHORTWAVE SE IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT THROUGH THE MID
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS FEATURE WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE OHIO AND
TN VALLEYS THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT AND TRIGGER RAIN AND SNOW
SHOWERS BEFORE IT MOVES OUT EARLY THURSDAY. THESE SHOWERS WILL
AFFECT MAINLY THE TERRAIN AREAS OF SW VA AND NE TN WITH UP TO ABOUT
AN INCH OF SNOW OVERNIGHT. WINDS WILL PICK UP THIS AFTERNOON OUT OF
THE WEST WITH LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY. WILL HIGHLIGHT THE WINDS AND
RH VALUES WITH THE FIRE WEATHER FORECAST. HIGHS TODAY LOWER 40S
NORTH TO UPPER 50S NEAR CHA. TONIGHT FOLLOWED GUIDANCE BLEND IN THE
20S WITH TEENS HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND NORTHEAST TN.

.LONG TERM....LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LITTLE
CHANGE TO ONGOING FORECAST.

COOL AND WET WEATHER IS EXPECTED THROUGH TUESDAY AS A CLOSED UPPER 
LOWS AFFECTS THE REGION THIS WEEKEND. A SURGE OF ABNORMALLY COLD AIR
WILL RESULT IN HIGH TEMPS ON THURSDAY ONLY IN THE 30S NORTH AND 40S 
SOUTH. 

CLOUDY AND WET PERIOD FOR THE WEEKEND.

MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THEIR GENERAL PRECIP 
DEPICTIONS FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BRING 
LIGHT SNOW INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA EARLY FRIDAY THAT 
SPREADS NORTHWARD AND CHANGES TO RAIN. LIFTING FREEZING LEVEL AND 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE COINCIDE NICELY TO FAVOR ONLY LIGHT SNOW THIS FAR 
NE. SHIFT IN MODEL SOLUTIONS COULD RAMP SNOW UP EARLY FRIDAY. 
SYNOPTIC LIFT STRENGTHENS...WARMING CONTINUES AND THE RAIN PERSISTS 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS LOW PRESSURE MOVES NE THROUGH THE TN VALLEY 
ON SUNDAY.

COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH BY EARLY MONDAY. STRONG SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE AND COLD AIR MASS WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION AND PERSIST 
THROUGH THE WEEK. CLIPPER SYSTEMS COULD POSSIBLY BRING PRECIPITATION 
TO NORTHERN AREAS BUT DRIER CONDITIONS SHOULD DOMINATE THE COOL WEEK.

286 
FXUS64 KMRX 191852
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
252 PM EDT TUE MAR 19 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)... 
IN WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH THE REGION LAST
NIGHT...A SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE HAS BUILT INTO THE
AREA...PROMOTING CLEAR AND DRY CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON. A LOW-
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GREAT LAKES HAS HELPED TO KEEP NORTHWEST
FLOW IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION AND REINFORCE THIS COOLER AND DRIER
POSTFRONTAL AIRMASS. HOWEVER...A SHORTWAVE ROTATING AROUND THE
AFOREMENTIONED LOW WILL DROP SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE LOWER OHIO
VALLEY AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALCHIANS LATE TONIGHT INTO
TOMORROW. THIS DISTURBANCE WILL INCREASE CLOUD COVER OVERNIGHT INTO
THE DAY TOMORROW AND PROVIDE ENOUGH LIFT TO TRIGGER SOME ISOLATED
TO SCATTERED PRECIPITATION TOMORROW AFTERNOON AND EVENING. GIVEN
THE DRYNESS AT THE LOW-LEVELS AM NOT EXPECTING VERY MUCH IN THE WAY
OF ACCUMULATIONS. LOCATIONS ACROSS THE NORTHERN/NORTHEAST
ZONES...AND ALONG THE MOUNTAINS WILL BE THE MOST FAVORED AREAS FOR
PRECIPITATION. GIVEN THE COLDER AIR IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION BY
TOMORROW EVENING...RAIN SHOWERS WILL QUICKLY CHANGEOVER TO SNOW
SHOWERS AFTER SUNSET /WITH SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE ALONG
THE HIGHER TERRAIN/. AFTER MIDNIGHT...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL
WANE AS THE DISTURBANCE TRACKS OFF TO THE SOUTHEAST.
 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
COOL AND WET WEATHER IS EXPECTED THROUGH TUESDAY AS A SERIES OF 
CLOSED UPPER LOWS CONTINUE TO AFFECT THE REGION. A SURGE OF 
ABNORMALLY COLD AIR BEHIND THE CLOSED LOW OVER NEW ENGLAND WILL 
RESULT IN HIGH TEMPS ON THURSDAY ONLY IN THE 30S NORTH AND 40S 
SOUTH. AT LEAST THURSDAY LOOKS DRY AND MOSTLY SUNNY BEFORE WE HEAD 
INTO A CLOUDY AND RAINY PERIOD FOR THE WEEKEND.

MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THEIR GENERAL PRECIP 
DEPICTIONS FOR FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY. ISENTROPIC LIFT AND WARM 
ADVECTION ALOFT SPREAD RAIN INTO SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA ON 
FRIDAY...SPREADING NORTHWARD THROUGH SATURDAY. FORCING THIS 
PERIOD LOOKS GENERALLY WEAK AND CONFINED TO THE LOW LEVELS BENEATH 
WEAK MID/UPPER LEVEL RIDGING...SO WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE 
RANGE. SYNOPTIC LIFT STRENGTHENS ON SATURDAY NIGHT AS THE CLOSED LOW 
TRACKS INTO THE PLAINS AND DIVERGENCE INCREASES AHEAD OF AN UPPER 
JET STREAK. ECMWF...GFS...GEFS MEAN...AND CANADIAN ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE POSITION OF THE LOW...AND ALL POINT TO SATURDAY 
NIGHT/SUNDAY PERIODS FOR THE GREATEST PRECIP CHANCES...SO WILL RAISE 
POPS INTO THE LIKELY RANGE. THUNDER COULD BE POSSIBLE THIS 
PERIOD...BUT THIS WILL DEPEND ON FINER DETAILS OF FRONTAL 
POSITIONS...WHICH ARE TOO UNCERTAIN AT THIS TIME TO WARRANT ADDING A 
MENTION OF TS.

THE MODELS DIVERGE A BIT WITH THE TRACK OF THE UPPER LOW AFTER THIS 
POINT...WITH THE ECMWF BEING MORE PROGRESSIVE THAN THE GFS. IF THE 
GFS IS CORRECT...THE CLOSED LOW WILL SIT OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES/MID-ATLANTIC AND CONTINUE TO PUMP COLD ARCTIC AIR INTO OUR 
AREA. WILL KEEP A CHANCE POP NORTH FOR MONDAY...AND START TUESDAY 
DRY WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPS.


&&

THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE

SW VA. ONLY VERY LIGHT AMOUNTS EXPECTED AROUND ONE INCH OR LESS
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...TRACE ELSEWHERE. TEMPERATURES ONLY UPPER 40S TO
UPPER 50S WEDNESDAY. FOLLOWED COOL SIDE OF GUIDANCE. WEDNESDAY
NIGHT AND THURSDAY MUCH COLDER AS TROUGH DEEPENS MORE. LOWS 20S
WITH TEENS IN THE HIGHER NE VALLEYS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HIGHS
THURSDAY ONLY 40S WITH 30S HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND NE. HIGH MOUNTAINS
MAY NOT REACH ABOVE FREEZING EVEN WITH HIGHER PRESSURE BUILDING
BACK IN. SW VA MAY SEE MORE CLOUDS TOO WHICH WILL HOLD TEMPERATURES
DOWN.

FOR THURSDAY NIGHT INTO THE WEEKEND TROUGH STAYS OVER THE EAST
WITH INCREASED RAIN AND SNOW CHANCES EARLY FRIDAY THROUGH THE
WEEKEND. CONTINUED TO FOLLOW THE COLDER GUIDANCE NUMBERS WITH
TEMPERATURES WARMER FRIDAY THAN THURSDAY BUT STILL BELOW NORMAL.
HIGHS IN THE 40S TO MID 50S AND LOWS MOSTLY IN THE 30S. WEAK SYSTEM
THAT PASSED THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL MOVE BACK NORTH THURSDAY
AS LOW PRESSURE IN EAST TEXAS MOVES ALONG FRONT. OVER RUNNING
MOISTURE WILL MOVE BACK IN FRIDAY MORNING AND THEN OFF AND ON AGAIN
SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP NORTH OF THE FRONT OVER THE FORECAST AREA
THROUGH AT LEAST SUNDAY NIGHT OR EARLY MONDAY.

590 
FXUS64 KMRX 190057
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
855 PM EDT MON MAR 18 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT STRETCHING GENERALLY 
ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY MILD AIR MASS 
STILL LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS INDICATE THAT 
THE EARLIER CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY WAS SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS EVENING...BUT A BROKEN LINE OF LIGHT SHOWERS WAS 
REDEVELOPING ALONG THE COLD FRONT OVER THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. MODELS INDICATE THAT ADDITIONAL SHOWERS WILL FORM ALONG THE 
COLD FRONT TONIGHT...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES SOME OVER 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING AND THE EARLIER 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY HAVE COMBINED TO PRODUCE A STABLE AIR MASS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...AND THINK THAT ANY ADDITIONAL 
SHOWER DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE COLD FRONT TONIGHT SHOULD BE SCATTERED. 
THUS...WILL PLAN TO LOWER POPS EVERYWHERE FOR TONIGHT...AND WILL 
REMOVE ANY MENTION OF THUNDER. OTHERWISE...THE REST OF THE FORECAST 
APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT CHANGE THIS EVENING.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   42  59  36  59  29 /  50   0   0  10  10

513 
FXUS64 KMRX 181912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT MON MAR 18 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TUESDAY/...
THIS AFTERNOON...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD
THE AREA AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT THAT IS SLOWLY MOVING TOWARD THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.T HE REMNANTS OF A LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS IS
CONTINUING TO HOLD TOGETHER ACROSS EASTERN MIDDLE TN AND NORTHERN
AL...AND WILL CONTINUE TO APPROACH THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU BY THE
LATE AFTERNOON. GIVEN SOME MODEST ELEVATED INSTABILITY ACROSS
SOUTHERN PLATEAU/SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...A COUPLE OF STORMS
COULD BECOME SEVERE...WITH DAMAGING WIND GUSTS BEING THE PRIMARY
THREAT. A WEAK WARM FRONT IS DRAPED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY
WHICH COMBINED WITH SOME DECENT LOW-LEVEL HELICITY VALUES AND LOW-
LEVEL WIND SHEAR COULD HELP PRODUCE A BRIEF TORNADO AS
WELL...THOUGH DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WINDS AND PERHAPS SOME SMALL
HAIL WILL BE THE PRIMARY THREATS. NORTH OF THIS BOUNDARY...THE
ATMOSPHERE IS MORE STABLE...AND THOUGH ELEVATED STORMS ARE EXPECTED
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON...THE OVERALL SEVERE THREAT IS
CERTAINLY DIMINISHED FURTHER NORTH.

WITH INSTABILITY DECREASING AFTER SUNSET...THE SEVERE THREAT WILL
DIMINISH AREAWIDE...BUT SHOWERS AND SOME ISOLATED STORMS WILL
CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT HOURS AS STRONG LIFT AHEAD
OF THE FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE THIS ACTIVITY. THUS HAVE
GONE CATEGORICAL POPS AREAWIDE THROUGH 06Z...BEFORE DIMINISHING
THEM FROM WEST TO EAST BETWEEN 06Z TO 12Z AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES
THROUGH. SOME GUSTY WINDS /MAINLY GRADIENT IN NATURE/ WILL STILL BE
POSSIBLE ALONG/AHEAD OF THE FRONT OVERNIGHT GIVEN THE STRONG JET
DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS STORM SYSTEM. BY TUESDAY MORNING...
CLEARING WILL OCCUR AND TEMPERATURES WILL BE LOWER AS COLDER AND
DRIER AIR FILTERS INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH ROTATES AROUND THE CLOSED UPPER LOW OVER THE
UPPER GREAT LAKES...WITH THE CHANNELED VORT MAX SKIRTING OUR
NORTHERN SECTIONS WEDNESDAY. THOUGH MOISTURE IS LIMITED...COOL
MIDLEVEL TEMPS SHOULD PRODUCE SOME INSTABILITY FOR ISOLATED TO
SCATTERED SHOWERS IN THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. A DEEP NW FLOW
BEHIND THE TROUGH BRINGS COLDER AIR IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND
THURSDAY...WITH TEMPERATURES WELL BELOW NORMAL.

POSITIVE THETA-E ADVECTION WILL RETURN TO THE AREA ON FRIDAY AS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER TX/OK. THE ECMWF AND GFS HAVE SOME 
TIMING AND POSITION DIFFERENCES WITH THIS SYSTEM...WITH THE ECMWF 
BEING THE FASTER OF THE TWO AND FARTHER SOUTH WITH THE 850 MB LOW 
PLACEMENT. NEITHER MODEL HAS STRONG SYNOPTIC FORCING AS THE 
MID/UPPER FLOW IS SOMEWHAT ZONAL UNTIL SUNDAY...SO CONFIDENCE IS 
LOW. BOTH MODELS HAVE SOME TIMING OVERLAP WITH THEIR PRECIP 
DEPICTIONS FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY...AND THIS IS THE TIME PERIOD OF 
GREATEST GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN PRECIP AS WELL...SO WILL RAISE POPS A BIT 
IN THESE PERIODS TO A HIGH CHANCE. MODEL DISPARITIES PREVENT LIKELY 
POPS AT THIS TIME. LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS CONTINUE IN NORTHERN 
AREAS THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT AS THE UPPER LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY. WILL START MONDAY DRY AS SHOWN BY THE GFS...WITH BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             42  59  36  59  29 /  90  10   0  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  56  33  56  27 /  90  10   0  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       40  55  32  57  27 /  90  10   0  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              38  51  27  49  24 /  90  10  10  30  20

FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE REGION LATE TONIGHT. BY DAYBREAK...VFR

394 
FXUS64 KMRX 181520 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1120 AM EDT MON MAR 18 2013

.DISCUSSION...
THE THREAT FOR THUNDERSTORMS /SOME BECOMING STRONG TO SEVERE/ WILL
INCREASE OVER THE COURSE OF THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS A
DEEPENING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS PUSHES A
STRONG COLD FRONT TOWARD THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON. AHEAD OF THE
ACTUAL FRONT...A LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS HAS DEVELOPED ACROSS
SOUTHERN KENTUCKY AND MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THIS LINE WILL CONTINUE
TRACKING EASTWARD AND WILL APPROACH OUR CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES
BY EARLY TO MID AFTERNOON /WHERE A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH IS
ALREADY IN EFFECT/. A STRONG LOW-LEVEL JET COUPLED WITH A STRONG
MID-LEVEL JET TO THE NORTHWEST OF THE AREA IS PROVIDING SOME STRONG
BULK SHEAR VALUES...ALLOWING FOR GOOD STORM ORGANIZATION. OF
CONCERN FOR OUR AREA...ELEVATED INSTABILITY VALUES ACROSS THE WARM
SECTOR /PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE EAST
TENNESSEE/ WILL ALLOW THIS LINE OF STORMS TO MAINTAIN
ITSELF/STRENGTHEN AS IT MOVES INTO THE FORECAST AREA. GIVEN THE
STRONG DYNAMICS WITH THIS SYSTEM...THE PRIMARY THREAT OF SEVERE
WEATHER WILL BE DAMAGING WINDS. LOW-LEVEL SHEAR WILL BE SOMEWHAT
STRONG BUT IS MORE UNIDIRECTIONAL IN NATURE BY THE AFTERNOON.
STILL...AN ISOLATED BRIEF TORNADO CANNOT BE RULED OUT GIVEN THE
STRENGTH OF THE LOW-LEVEL WINDS AND LOW-LEVEL HELICITY VALUES
PROGGED TO BE AOA 200-400 M2/S2 BY THE AFTERNOON. THUS HAVE
HIGHLIGHTED THIS THREAT IN THE HWO AS WELL.

AHEAD OF THE MAIN LINE...THE STRONG LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS STORM
SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO TRIGGER SCATTERED SHOWERS AND ELEVATED
STORMS ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE/SOUTHWEST NC...AND EVENTUALLY INTO
NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA AS THE WARM FRONT GRADUALLY PUSHES
TO THE NORTH AND EAST LATER TODAY. BREEZY GRADIENT SOUTHERLY TO
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL ALLOW FOR GOOD WARMING TODAY INTO THE MID
TO UPPER 60S AREAWIDE...EXCEPT FOR THE FAR NORTHEAST ZONES WHICH
MAY BE JUST NORTH OF THE WARM FRONT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       67  41  56  32  54 / 100  90  10   0  10

FXUS64 KMRX 181137
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
738 AM EDT MON MAR 18 2013

.AVIATION...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE REGION AROUND 
19/00Z. SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL BECOME BREEZY BY THIS AFTERNOON. 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP IN ADVANCE OF THE COLD FRONT. STRONG 
GUSTY WINDS MAY OCCUR WITH THESE STORMS. A BREAK IN THE 
THUNDERSTORMS IS EXPECTED THIS EVENING. AN UPPER DISTURBANCE WILL 
MOVE INTO MIDDLE TN THIS EVENING RESULTING IN REDEVELOPMENT OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ALONG AND BEHIND THE FRONT TONIGHT.
WINDS WILL BECOME NW BEHIND THE FRONT.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE OVER W TN 
WILL MOVE NE TO THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES TODAY. LOW LEVEL SWRLY JET 
INCREASES ACROSS THE E TN VALLEY THIS MORNING. THE LAYER FLOW ALSO 
INCREASES AND BECOME VERY MOIST BY THIS AFTERNOON. INSTABILITY IS 
LOW. THE INCREASED SHEAR ALONG WITH SOME VEERING WILL ALLOW FOR THE 
POSSIBILITY FOR SOME SEVERE STORMS BY THIS AFTERNOON. MOST OF THE 
ACTIVITY WILL BE LINEAR BUT SOME DISCREET MESOCYCLONES COULD DEVELOP 
AHEAD OF THE BULK CONVECTION...ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS. DAMAGING WINDS 
ARE THE MAIN THREAT BUT LARGE HAIL IS ALSO POSSIBLE. EARLY 
DOWNSLOPING ACROSS NE AREAS WILL HINDER CLOUDS AND PCPN EARLY. 
INCREASE JET SEGMENT THIS EVENING...SE OF NEGATIVELY TILTING UPPER 
TROUGH...COULD ENHANCE AND PROLONG CONVECTION ACROSS THE AREA THIS 
EVENING ALONG AND BEHIND FRONT THAT MOVES EAST INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS AROUND MIDNIGHT. TEMPERATURE ABOVE NORMAL WITH LATE 
NIGHT COLD AIR ADVECTION.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVER 
FAR NORTHEASTERN LOCATIONS EARLY TUESDAY MORNING AS A COLD FRONT 
EXITS THE AREA.  BEHIND THE FRONT...COOLER...DRIER AIR WILL FILTER 
IN.  A WEAK DISTURBANCE TRACKING THOUGH THE UPPER TROUGH ON 
WEDNESDAY MAY BRING A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS.  
MODEL DIFFERENCE BECOME MORE SIGNIFICANT DURING THE LATER PART OF 
THE EXTENDED AND CONFIDENCE LOW.  FOR NOW...EXPECTED TO BE BETWEEN 
SYSTEMS ON THURSDAY FOR DRY CONDITIONS.  THEN...WILL TRANSITION INTO 
AN UNSETTLE PATTERN FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AS A COUPLE OF SYSTEM 
MOVES THROUGH.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EDT SUN MAR 17 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED STATIONARY 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WHICH WAS PRODUCING A 
STRONG TEMP GRADIENT OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH TEMPS IN THE MID 
60S OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND MID 40S OVER SOUTHWEST VA. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL A FEW SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS DEVELOPING NORTH OF THIS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER SOUTHEAST KY AND SOUTHWEST VA...WITH SCATTERED 
TSTORMS OCCURRING FURTHER WEST OUT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY NEAR 
AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE. THIS AREA OF LOW PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO 
STRENGTHEN OVERNIGHT...AND WILL PUSH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY NORTHWARD 
AS A WARM FRONT. MODELS INDICATE THAT SOME PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION 
MAY MOVE INTO THE WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT 
TOWARDS SUNRISE...BUT OVERALL...ONLY A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS ARE 
EXPECTED OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS EVENING TO TWEAK THE WORDING FOR TONIGHT A LITTLE.
