FXUS64 KMRX 171857
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EDT SUN MAR 17 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER 
NORTHEAST TN WILL LIFT SLOWLY NORTH AS A WARM FRONT TONIGHT...THEN A 
A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH IN FROM THE WEST LATE MONDAY.  WILL CARRY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH TONIGHT IN VICINITY OF WARM FRONT. 
OTHERWISE JUST SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS LATE MOST ZONES WITH CHANCE 
OVER THE PLATEAU AS PRECIP APPROACHES AHEAD OF THE FRONT.  WILL 
CARRY CAT POPS ALL ZONES MONDAY.  INSTABILITY LOOKS FAIRLY LIMITED 
BUT ENOUGH FOR THUNDER TO BE CARRIED ALL ZONES.  ALSO...STILL 
APPEARS THERE WILL BE SOME SEVERE THREAT GIVEN SIGNIFICANT LOW LEVEL 
WIND FIELDS...MAINLY SOUTHWESTERN TWO THIRDS.  WILL MENTION IN 
HWO...WITH DAMAGING WINDS THE PRIMARY THREAT.  WILL TWEAK SOME MAV 
TEMPS UP A BIT FOR TONIGHT...BUT NOT MUCH ARGUMENT WITH HIGHS FOR 
MONDAY.      


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... A COLD FRONT WILL
CONTINUE TO PROGRESS EASTWARD INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION MONDAY EVENING AND NIGHT. DEPENDING ON
THE TIMING...THERE COULD SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY TO WORK WITH
OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY TO SUPPORT
STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS THROUGH MID TO LATE EVENING. GIVEN THE
STRONG DYNAMICS WITH THIS STORM SYSTEM...DAMAGING WIND GUSTS WILL
BE THE PRIMARY THREAT WITH THESE STORMS. DEPENDING ON THE TIMING OF
THE FRONT...SHOWERS AND STORMS COULD CONTINUE ACROSS MUCH OF THE
AREA FOR MOST OF THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD GIVEN THE STRONG FORCING
AHEAD OF THE FRONT THAT WILL BE LIFTING INTO NORTHEAST TN AND
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AFTER SUNSET. HOWEVER...BY 12Z TUESDAY MOST OF
THE ACTIVITY SHOULD BE EAST OF THE AREA...WITH CLEARING OCCURRING
BY THE AFTERNOON IN WAKE OF THE FRONT.

COOLER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK AS 
CONTINUED NORTHWEST FLOW PREVAILS AND A SERIES OF DISTURBANCES MOVE 
ACROSS THE REGION. A CLIPPER SYSTEM ON WEDNESDAY COULD BEING SOME 
CLOUDS AND SLIGHT CHANCES FOR RAIN ACROSS THE NORTHEAST ZONES...BUT 
THE PRIMARY SYSTEM OF CONCERN WILL BE MOVING IN THURSDAY/THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...PROVIDING CONTINUED CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WORK WEEK AND WEEKEND. THERE IS STILL 
QUITE A BIT OF MODEL SPREAD REGARDING THE TIMING...TRACK AND THE 
RESULTING PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM SO HAVE NOT GONE 
TERRIBLY HIGH WITH POPS YET ATTM. STILL...THINK CHANCE POPS ARE 
WARRANTED THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH AT LEAST SATURDAY NIGHT. WITH SOME 
COLDER AIR IN PLACE...SOME SNOW WILL CERTAINLY BE POSSIBLE DURING 
THE OVERNIGHT HOURS...MAINLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND NORTHEAST 
ZONES. GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PART OF THE 
FORECAST...WILL NOT GET TOO SPECIFIC FOR NOW AND WILL CONTINUE TO 
MONITOR THE LATEST TRENDS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT SUN MAR 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY REMAIN DRAPED 
ACROSS THE AREA NEAR THE NORTHERN TN BORDER. SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE 
THIS MORNING ALONG AND NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT 
AND WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT ALONG FRONT. MOST MODELS APPEAR TOO 
AGGRESSIVE WITH CLOUDS AND PCPN ACROSS CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS 
TODAY AND LEANED TOWARD A DRIER SOLUTION. THIS LEADS TO GOING TOWARD 
THE HIGH END OF MOS TEMP GUIDANCE WHICH HAS BEEN THE TREND WITH THIS 
CURRENT SCENARIO. FRONT MOVES NORTHWARD TODAY BUT HANDS ACROSS NE 
AREAS WHERE BETTER PCPN CHANCE LINGERS INTO THE AFTERNOON. SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE MOVES NE INTO W TN TONIGHT. UPPER JET INCREASES ACROSS 
MIDDLE TN AND LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE WILL AID IN CONVECTION THAT WILL 
MOVE TOWARD THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATE TONIGHT.
 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAIN WEATHER FEATURE THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED WITH BE A STRONG COLD FRONT TRACKING ACROSS THE AREA 
MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT.  A STRONG WIND FIELD COUPLED WITH WEAK TO 
MODERATE INSTABILITY WILL ALLOW FOR A LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS TO 
DEVELOP AND MOVE THROUGH THE AREA.  THERE REMAINS SOME POTENTIAL FOR 
SOME OF THE STORMS TO BECOME QUITE STRONG AND EVEN SEVERE.  
INSTABILITY DROPS OF QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET...BUT MAY SEE ANOTHER LINE 
OF SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORM MOVING THROUGH OVERNIGHT.  BEHIND 
THE FRONT...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN WITH COOLER...DRIER AIR MOVING 
IN.  FLOW ALOFT BECOMES MORE ZONAL BY THE END OF THE PERIOD AS WE 
MOVE INTO AN UNSETTLED PATTERN FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

460 
FXUS64 KMRX 170042
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
840 PM EDT SAT MAR 16 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED COLD 
FRONT OVER KENTUCKY...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL A FEW SCATTERED LIGHT 
SHOWERS LINGERING OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA THIS EVENING... 
WITH THE LOSS OF DAYTIME HEATING HELPING TO STABILIZE THE LOCAL AIR 
MASS WHICH WAS RESULTING IN THIS WEAKENING CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY. THE 
COLD FRONT OVER KENTUCKY IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY MOVE SOUTHWARD 
TONIGHT...WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE LATER TONIGHT POSSIBLY 
TRIGGER ADDITIONAL SHOWERS TOWARDS SUNRISE.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL UPDATE THIS EVENING TO LOWER POPS A LITTLE OVER SOUTHWEST VA 
AND NORTHEAST TN...AND TO REMOVE ANY EVENING WORDING.

491 
FXUS64 KMRX 162336
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
736 PM EDT SAT MAR 16 2013

.AVIATION...FRONTAL BOUNDARY WITH A RATHER INTENSE TEMPERATURE
GRADIENT LIES NORTHWEST OF THE TERMINALS THIS EVENING...HAVING
MADE PROGRESS ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER DURING THE DAY. THE TAIL END OF
AN AREA OF SHOWERS THAT HAD DEVELOPED AHEAD OF THE SURFACE FRONT
WAS WORKING EAST OF TRI EARLY THIS EVENING. WITH LOSS OF INSOLATION
BELIEVE TRI MAY STAY DRY THROUGH MUCH OF THE NIGHT DESPITE THE
BOUNDARY SLIPPING STEADILY SOUTH. EXPECT THE BOUNDARY TO CONTINUE
TO A POSITION BETWEEN TRI AND TYS LATER TONIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING.
ANOTHER WAVE MOVES ALONG THE BOUNDARY EARLY ON SUNDAY AND MAY SPARK
ANOTHER SHOWER AROUND TRI AS THIS FEATURES SHIFTS EAST. ADDED A
VICINITY SHOWER TO THE MIX HERE MAINLY DURING THE MORNING FOR THIS
POSSIBILITY. NOT SURE IF TYS MAY SEE A SHOWER AS THE SHORT WAVE
MOVES TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BUT PROBABILITY LOOKS A
LITTLE TOO LOW TO MENTION HERE. CEILING WILL HOLD AROUND 4-6
THOUSAND FEET AT THE TERMINALS WITH THE BOUNDARY IN THE AREA. THE
TROUBLE SPOT WILL BE AT TRI WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF AN MVFR CEILING
FORMING TOWARD DAYBREAK AS THE LOWER LEVELS SATURATE BEHIND THE
STRONG COLD FRONT. SOME FOG MAY ALSO DEVELOP DURING THIS PERIOD
BEFORE DISSIPATING WITH IMPROVING CEILINGS AROUND 13-14Z.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

528 
FXUS64 KMRX 161855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT SAT MAR 16 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH 
INTO THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE AREA.  EXACTLY HOW FAR SOUTH IT 
WILL MAKE IT BEFORE STALLING TONIGHT IS STILL PROBLEMATIC...BUT IT 
APPEARS IT WILL HAVE A HARD TIME MAKING IT AS FAR SOUTH AS I-40. 
EXPECT THE FRONT BEGIN MOVING BACK NORTH AS A WARM FRONT ON SUNDAY.  
INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAK SO NO THUNDER MENTION...BUT WILL CARRY HIGH 
CHANCE POPS NORTH TO SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH TONIGHT AND LOW LIKELY FAR 
NORTH TO LOW CHANCE CENTRAL SUNDAY.  EXPECT SOUTH ZONES TO BE PRECIP 
FREE SUNDAY. WINDS WILL BE SUBSIDING LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO THIS
EVENING AND THINK THEY WILL BE BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA...SO WILL
CANCEL THE WIND ADVISORY IN THE MOUNTAINS A FEW HOURS EARLY. WILL
TWEAK SOME MAV TEMPS UP A BIT MAINLY SOUTH...BUT NO MAJOR
DEPARTURES.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A WARM FRONT WILL
LIFT NORTH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO SOUTHERN KENTUCKY...HELPING TO
DECREASE CLOUD COVER AND RAIN CHANCES SOMEWHAT FOR THE OVERNIGHT
PERIOD. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE CLOSE PROXIMITY OF THE FRONT TO OUR
NORTHERN ZONES...SOME CHANCES FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL CERTAINLY
EXIST SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH SOME LOWER SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EXISTING
ROUGHLY SOUTH OF THE I-40 CORRIDOR.

ATTENTION WILL THEN TURN TO MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT AS CONFIDENCE IS 
INCREASING THAT MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWER AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY 
WILL IMPACT THE AREA AS A DEEP NEGATIVELY TILTED UPPER LOW OVER THE 
MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY PUSHES A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA. AHEAD OF THE FRONT...INCREASING MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL TRIGGER 
SHOWERS AND SOME THUNDERSTORMS DURING THE MORNING HOURS. THEN BY THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING ...A GREATER AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY MAY BE IN 
PLAY...ALONG WITH SOME STRONG DYNAMICS THANKS TO A LOW TO MID LEVEL 
JET DISPLACED TO THE NORTHWEST OF THE AREA. THIS COULD TRIGGER A 
LINE OF STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS MOVING FROM MIDDLE TENNESSEE 
INTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY DURING THE 
LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING ALONG THE COLD FRONT. WHILE THE AMOUNT OF 
INSTABILITY IS STILL IN QUESTION...GFS SOUNDINGS AT KCHA AND TO A 
LESSER EXTENT KTYS SHOW SOME MODERATE ELEVATED INSTABILITY VALUES 
FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. THE NAM IS LITTLE MORE PESSIMISTIC...THOUGH 
IT STILL SHOWS SOME MODEST VALUES ALOFT AS WELL. GIVEN THE STRONG 
DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS STORM SYSTEM...STORMS THAT DO FORM 
WILL CERTAINLY HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO BECOME ORGANIZED AND STRONG TO 
SEVERE...PARTICULARLY IF THE ATMOSPHERE IS ABLE TO DESTABILIZE MORE. 
THUS...A THREAT FOR PRIMARILY DAMAGING WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE MONDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...MAINLY ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EAST 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. INSTABILITY VALUES DROP OFF QUICKLY AFTER 
SUNSET...AND ARE MUCH LOWER ACROSS NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA.  

BY TUESDAY MORNING...THE FRONT WILL HAVE CLEARED THE AREA AND 
OVERALL QUIET AND DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED FOR THE MIDDLE OF THE 
WEEK. DESPITE THE SUNSHINE...TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE A LITTLE ON 
THE COOL SIDE FOR THIS TIME PERIOD GIVEN THE NORTHWEST FLOW 
REINFORCING A COOLER POST-FRONTAL AIR MASS. BY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY ANOTHER DISTURBANCE LOOKS TO MOVE INTO THE AREA...BRINGING 
THE REGION SOME DECENT CHANCES FOR RAIN TO CLOSE OUT THE WORK 
WEEK. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             51  75  55  72  45 /  20  10  20  90  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  52  71  52  70  42 /  30  20  30  90  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       50  70  51  70  42 /  30  30  30  90  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              47  64  45  64  40 /  40  50  40  90  80

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 160733
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 AM EDT SAT MAR 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE LOW PRESSURE OVER S IL 
EARLY THIS MORNING WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS 
TONIGHT. SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA TODAY AS THE 
LOW MOVES THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. CONDITIONS WILL BECOME WINDY 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA. WARM AIR ADVECTION AND MOISTURE TRANSPORT REMAINS 
MODERATELY STRONG ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TODAY. MOISTURE POOLS 
AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING FRONTAL BOUNDARY WHICH SLIDES TO NEAR N TN 
TONIGHT. PREFRONTAL CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT APPEARS LIKELY TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. STEERING FLOW FAVORS NORTHERN AREAS OF MRX CWA WITH ONGOING 
STORMS MARCHING NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE FRONT. BULK SHEAR IS NEAR 60 
KTS. INSTABILITY AND LAPSE RATES ARE FAIRLY LOW BUT ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS CAN BE EXPECTED. THERE IS A LOW THREAT OF DAMAGING 
WINDS. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ON TRACK. 
 
.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY REMAINS 
STALLED TO OUR NORTH ON SUNDAY AND WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS IN THE 
FORECAST OVER NORTHERN LOCATIONS WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OVER THE 
SOUTH.  THE BOUNDARY LIFTS A BIT NORTHWARD SUNDAY NIGHT...LOWERING 
POPS A BIT.  MAIN WEATHER EVENT WILL BE MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT AS 
A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA.  WEAK TO MODERATE 
INSTABILITY SUFFICIENT FOR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT AS THE LINE OF 
CONVECTION MOVES THROUGH.  A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER OVER THE AREA 
EARLY TUESDAY...OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR DRY 
CONDITIONS INTO WEDNESDAY.  A COUPLE OF DISTURBANCES MOVES THROUGH 
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY FOR UNSETTLED WEATHER.

405 
FXUS64 KMRX 151859
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 PM EDT FRI MAR 15 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL SAG SOUTH 
TOWARD THE AREA.  HOW FAR SOUTH IT WILL MAKE IT DURING THE PERIOD IS 
STILL AN AREA OF UNCERTAINTY.  GFS A BIT MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THE 
SOUTHWARD PUSH...BUT THINK THE NAM POSITION LOOKS BETTER WITH THE 
FRONT IN THE TRI-CITIES AREA BY LATE SATURDAY AFTERNOON.  WILL SEE 
SOME SHOWERS ESPECIALLY NEAR THE FRONT. INSTABILITY LOOKS 
UNIMPRESSIVE SATURDAY...BUT STILL ENOUGH TO WARRANT A MENTION OF 
THUNDER.  WILL CARRY HIGHEST POPS NORTH...AND MENTION SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF THUNDER ALL ZONES SATURDAY.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE 
OVERALL...SO JUST A FEW MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.   

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)... A FRONT WILL DROP
SOUTH OUT OF SOUTHERN KENTUCKY AND TRIGGER OFF SOME SHOWERS OVER
THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT AND INTO THE DAY ON SUNDAY...BEFORE IT
RETREATS BACK NORTH SUNDAY NIGHT. THE POTENTIAL FOR SCATTERED
SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE INTO MONDAY MORNING...BUT CONFIDENCE IS
INCREASING FOR EVEN MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND ESPECIALLY
THUNDERSTORMS MONDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. A DEEPENING UPPER-LOW
WILL MOVE INTO THE MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON MONDAY AND BECOME
NEGATIVELY TILTED THIS WILL DRIVE A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE OHIO AND
TENNESSEE VALLEYS BY MONDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING AND INTO THE SOUTHERN
APPALCHIANS THAT EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. WITH ABUNDANT GULF MOISTURE
IN PLACE...A STRONG LOW TO MID LEVEL JET TO THE NORTHWEST OF THE
AREA...AND LOW TO MODERATE INSTABILITY VALUES IN PLACE ACROSS THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND ACROSS THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY...THE
POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL CERTAINLY EXIST ALONG/AHEAD
OF THE FRONT MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE STRONG DYNAMICS WITH
THIS SYSTEM SUGGEST A DAMAGING WIND THREAT FROM A LINE OF STORMS
ADVANCING FROM THE WEST...BUT GFS MODEL SOUNDINGS AT KCHA AND EVEN
KTYS INDICATE THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME SUPERCELL STRUCTURES AS WELL.
THUS WILL MAKE A MENTION OF THIS SEVERE POTENTIAL IN THE HWO. THE
BEST CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY
EVENING AS INSTABILITY VALUES DROP OFF QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET...AND
ARE MUCH LOWER ACROSS NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA.

ONCE THE FRONT EXITS THE AREA BY TUESDAY MORNING...SOME CLEARING AND 
DRIER WEATHER CAN BE EXPECTED AS AN UPPER RIDGE AXIS BUILDS IN. SOME 
COOLER TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE ON THE HORIZON FOR THE MIDDLE OF 
NEXT WEEK GIVEN THE NORTHWEST FLOW/POST-FRONTAL AIR MASS IN PLACE. 
BY LATE WEEK...ANOTHER DISTURBANCE WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST INTO THE MID 
TO LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY...GIVING THE AREA ANOTHER SHOT OF 
PRECIPITATION TO CLOSE OUT THE WORK WEEK.    


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO THE NORTH. ONGOING SHOWER ACTIVITY MAY 
MARCH INTO SW VA AND NE TN LATER TONIGHT.   

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
A FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE STALLED JUST TO OUR NORTH EARLY IN THE 
EXTENDED.  HOWEVER...THERE REMAINS SOME MODEL DIFFERENCES IN THE 
POSITION OF THE BOUNDARY.  THIS FEATURE SHOULD BE THE MAIN WEATHER 
FOCUS FOR THE WEEKEND AND INTO MONDAY...AND WILL KEEP A CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS OVER THE AREA FOR THIS PERIOD WITH BEST CHANCES ACROSS 
NORTHERN LOCATIONS.  A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH AROUND 
THE MONDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME FOR LIKELY POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA.  
THIS WILL ALSO BE OUR BEST CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT AS 
WELL.  COOLER...DRIER AIR MOVES IN ON TUESDAY WITH SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN.  THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVES IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EDT THU MAR 14 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE REGION EARLY TONIGHT.  MOISTURE AND FORCING LOOK QUITE
LIMITED...SO JUST SOME SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER PARTS OF THE AREA AND 
SPRINKLES/FLURRIES MENTIONED ELSEWHERE TONIGHT. WARMER AIR WILL BE 
MOVING IN FOR FRIDAY...WITH A PARTLY SUNNY (NORTH) TO MOSTLY SUNNY 
(SOUTH) SKY. EXPECTED.  TEMPS SHOULD REBOUND INTO THE 60S MOST 
VALLEY LOCATIONS AND MAY REACH 70 FAR SOUTH. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... A FRONT WILL
GRADUALLY DROP SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND INTO SOUTHERN
KENTUCKY FRIDAY NIGHT...AND IS PROGGED TO STALL OUT JUST NORTH OF
THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY. THIS FRONT WILL BE THE FOCUS FOR
PRECIPITATION THIS WEEKEND AS A SERIES OF UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCES
PASS BY. ATTM...THERE IS A BIT OF QUESTION REGARDING PRECIP CHANCES
GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY ON HOW FAR SOUTH THE FRONT WILL GO.
HOWEVER...MUCH HIGHER CHANCES APPEAR MORE PROBABLE ACROSS THE
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT DUE
IT BEING CLOSER TO THE AFOREMENTIONED BOUNDARY. THE NAM /ALONG WITH
THE ECMWF/ SHOW THIS BOUNDARY FURTHER NORTH THAN THE GFS.
HOWEVER... THIS FRONT WILL GRADUALLY MOVE SOUTHWARD ON SUNDAY
INCREASING RAIN CHANCES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN ZONES AS WELL AS
ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH SWINGS ACROSS THE REGION. A STRONG UPPER
TROUGH MOVING FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES WILL
THEN BECOME NEGATIVELY TILTED ON MONDAY AS IT TRACKS EAST...PUSHING
A STRONG COLD FRONT TOWARD THE AREA MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT. GIVEN
THE HIGH GULF MOISTURE IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION...ALONG WITH SOME
INSTABILITY TO WORK WITH AND SOME GOOD DYNAMICS...SOME
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE PROBABLE ALONG/AHEAD OF THE FRONT. IN WAKE OF
THE FRONT SOME COOLER AND DRIER WEATHER WILL ENSUE FOR THE MIDDLE
OF THE WEEK AS SOME UPPER-RIDGING MOVES IN...BEFORE THE NEXT
DISTURBANCE MAY BRING SOME ADDITIONAL RAIN CHANCES WEDNESDAY NIGHT
INTO THURSDAY.

633 
FXUS64 KMRX 140739
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT THU MAR 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW CLOUDS SHOULD LARGELY 
DISSIPATE ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE EARLY IN 
THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH SUNSHINE EXPECTED FOR MUCH OF THE AREA 
THROUGH THE MORNING. SOME CI AND AC WILL BE ON THE INCREASE DURING 
THE AFTERNOON AS YET ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE SHIFTS SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
THE MIDWEST...AND EVENTUALLY...OVER THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER SYSTEM LACKING SIGNIFICANT 
LIFT AND DEFINITELY LACKING MOISTURE SO KEPT POPS QUITE LOW. 
TEMPERATURE PROFILE TONIGHT ALLOWS FOR A FEW SPRINKLES OR A COUPLE 
LIGHT RAIN DROPS IN SPOTS MAINLY NORTH OF I-40. AS THE LOW LEVELS 
COOL...WILL PROBABLY SEE A FEW SNOW FLURRIES. THE BEST CHANCE OF 
PRECIP...AND THAT CHANCE IS LOW...WILL BE OVER THE NORTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...EXTREME NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. PRECIP 
WOULD MOST LIKELY BE A MIXTURE OF LIGHT RAIN DROPS AND FLURRIES IN 
THE LOWER ELEVATIONS WITH LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 
IT DOES NOT LOOK LIKE THERE WILL BE ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR 
ACCUMULATIONS MUCH ABOVE HALF AN INCH EVEN IN THE HIGHER MOUNTAIN 
ELEVATIONS. TRIED TO STICK CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS TEMP GUIDANCE FOR 
THIS PART OF THE FORECAST.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A DEEP NW FLOW OF DRY AIR 
THROUGH THE COLUMN WILL PROVIDE A DRY DAY ON FRIDAY BEFORE WE HEAD 
INTO A PROLONGED WET PERIOD. A FRONT SLOWLY PUSHES SOUTHWARD TOWARD 
THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...STALLING NEARBY ON SATURDAY AS IT BECOMES 
PARALLEL TO THE ZONAL UPPER FLOW. THIS BOUNDARY WILL SERVE AS A 
FOCUS FOR PRECIP THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS A SERIES UPPER LEVEL 
DISTURBANCES DRIFT BY. PRECIP CHANCES AND AMOUNTS WILL DEPEND ON THE 
POSITION OF THE FRONT...WHICH IS HIGHLY UNCERTAIN AT THIS TIME. THE 
ECMWF AND MOST ENSEMBLE MEMBERS PLACE THE PRECIP FARTHER NORTH THAN 
THE GFS. HOWEVER THE CONSENSUS BETWEEN THE GFS/ECMWF/GFS ENSEMBLE 
MEAN IS THAT THE BEST RAIN CHANCES WILL BE ON SUNDAY WITH A WEAK 
UPPER TROUGH PASSAGE...THEN AGAIN ON MONDAY NIGHT AS THE FLOW ALOFT 
BECOMES MORE AMPLIFIED AND A COLD FRONT PUSHES THROUGH. WILL HAVE 
LIKELY POPS IN THESE TWO PERIODS...WITH CHANCE POPS BETWEEN. COLDER 
AND DRIER AIR WILL BUILD IN ON TUESDAY BEHIND THE FRONT AND UPPER 
TROUGH...WITH A RIDGE BUILDING IN ON WEDNESDAY.

CENTRAL STATES. TEMPERATURES A LITTLE ABOVE NORMAL SATURDAY THROUGH

407 
FXUS64 KMRX 130744
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT WED MAR 13 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES A BIT AS 
IT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION TODAY. COLD AIR ADVECTION STRENGTHENS 
INTO THE AFTERNOON WITH LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES TOPPING OUT AROUND 8-9 
DEGREES C/KM. TEMPERATURE PROFILE ARGUES FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SNOW 
SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN WITH FLURRIES/SPRINKLES ACROSS VALLEY 
LOCALES MAINLY ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS 
WELL AS THE MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA. THE PROBLEM IS THE 
SYSTEM WILL BE MOISTURE STARVED SO KEPT PROBABILITIES LOW WITH SOME 
ENHANCEMENT IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE OROGRAPHIC LIFT WILL AID THE 
FORMATION OF SNOW SHOWERS DURING THE DAY TODAY AND OVERNIGHT AS SOME 
TRAILING MOISTURE AND SHORTWAVE LIFT DROP INTO THE REGION ON THE 
BACK SIDE OF THE DEPARTING LONGWAVE TROUGH. MIXING SHOULD BRING THE 
FAST WESTERLY FLOW TO THE SURFACE TODAY RESULTING IN A RATHER BREEZY 
DAY TODAY. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND FOR MAX/MIN TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A SHORTWAVE TROUGH EMBEDDED 
IN THE NW FLOW WILL CROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THURSDAY 
NIGHT. MOISTURE IS LIMITED...BUT THE GFS CRANKS OUT A COUPLE TENTHS 
OF QPF DOWN TO KNOXVILLE. THIS SEEMS OVERDONE...AND WILL LEAN MORE 
TOWARD THE SREF...WHICH HAS LESS THAN AN TENTH IN NORTHERN AREAS. 
FRIDAY LOOKS DRY AND WARMER AS THE FLOW ALOFT BECOMES MORE ZONAL. 

THE GFS AND ECMWF BRING A FRONT INTO THE AREA ON SATURDAY...WHICH 
STALLS DUE TO THE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT BEING PARALLEL TO THE E-W 
ORIENTED FRONT. THIS RESULTS IN A WET PERIOD WITH CHANCE POPS FROM 
SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. A FEW WEAK DISTURBANCES MOVING 
THROUGH THE ZONAL FLOW MAY ENHANCE RAIN CHANCES ON SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE IN THE DETAILS OF THIS PATTERN IS LOW. 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES WILL NOT BE MADE FROM THE PREVIOUS 
FORECAST...WITH POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE EACH DAY. WILL HAVE TEMPS 
ON THE COOL SIDE OF MOS DUE TO EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP. AN 
UPPER TROUGH PUSHES A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY 
NIGHT...WITH DRIER AIR FOLLOWING FOR TUESDAY.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             52  28  55  40  65 /   0   0   0  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  26  52  37  61 /  10   0  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  25  53  37  60 /  10   0  10  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              40  23  46  32  57 /  20  10  10  40  10

FXUS64 KMRX 130156
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 PM EDT TUE MAR 12 2013

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE SE THROUGH 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT. GOOD COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES REMAIN 
POSSIBLE SW VA/NE TN LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY THU DESPITE WEAK MODEL 
SUPPORT. BOUNDARY LAYER HAS DRIED OUT BUT H85-H70 LAYER MOISTENS UP 
INTO THE LOWER DENDRITIC ZONE. MODERATE LAPSE RATE UP TO H70. SOME 
DIFF POT VORT ALSO AVAILABLE TO AID SHOWERS. SON 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH OVER THE REGION 
WITH CONTINUED COLD ADVECTION.  OVERNIGHT LOWS AND WEDNESDAY HIGH 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW SEASONAL AVERAGES.  A WEAK IMPULSE WILL 
TRACK THROUGH OVERNIGHT INTO EARLY WEDNESDAY.  WITH UPSLOPE FLOW AND 
MINIMAL MOISTURE...WILL SEE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT SNOW OR 
FLURRIES ACROSS NORTHERN LOCATIONS AND THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS.  
LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED.  

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY 
CONSISTENT FOR THE EARLY TO MID PERIODS OF THE LONG TERM...BUT STILL 
SOME SIGNIFICANT TIMING DIFFERENCES FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY OF NEXT 
WEEK. POSSIBILITY FOR SOME PASSING SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY NIGHT IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT...BUT I KEPT 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY DRY FOR NOW. THESE SNOW/FLURRY EVENTS LOOK LIKE 
TRACE TO A FEW HUNDREDTHS QPF AT BEST...SO I KEPT POPS QUITE LOW. 

AN EAST TO WEST FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS STILL PROGGED TO SAG SOUTH INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...WITH PREVIOUS POP 
AND WEATHER GRIDS HANDLING THIS SCENARIO QUITE WELL. AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE IS THEN EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND MID 
MS VALLEY REGIONS EARLY MONDAY. MODEL TIMING AND TRACK DIFFERENCES 
OF THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ARE PROBLEMATIC FOR OUR MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY FORECASTS. GIVEN SOME UNCERTAINTIES...KEPT FAIRLY HIGH 
CHANCE POPS IN THE GRIDS UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON. ALSO...ADDED A 
MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS IN SOUTHERN AREAS FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY 
EVENING.

OTHERWISE...TRENDED CLOSE TO SIMILAR 12/00Z AND 12/12Z GFSX MOS 
TEMPS. SAW TUESDAY AS A TARGET OF OPPORTUNITY TO IMPROVE OVER MOS 
POPS AND TEMPS...SO UNDERCUT A BIT.

231 
FXUS64 KMRX 120738
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 AM EDT TUE MAR 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
RAIN SHOWERS OVER THE NE COUNTIES EARLY THIS MORNING ARE PROJECTED 
TO BE CLEAR OF THE AREA BY 12Z. COLD ADVECTION WILL BUILD INTO THE 
AREA BEHIND THE DEPARTING COLD FRONT...WITH GRADUALLY CLEARING 
SKIES. TEMPS WILL BE TRICKY AND DEPENDENT ON HOW QUICKLY THE CLOUDS 
CLEAR OUT. WILL LEAN ON THE COOL SIDE OF MOS FOR HIGHS IN NORTHEAST 
SECTIONS WHICH WILL CLEAR OUT SLOWEST.

A CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL TRACK ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND NEW 
ENGLAND...WITH A MIDLEVEL THERMAL TROUGH SWINGING OVER OUR AREA 
TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING. THE RESULTING STEEP LAPSE RATES WILL 
HELP GENERATE SOME SCATTERED TO ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS...WITH A 25-30 
KT UPSLOPE FLOW ENHANCING SNOW IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. THE GFS IS MORE 
BULLISH ON MOISTURE DEPTH THAN THE NAM...BUT THE SREF PUTS OUT SOME 
PRECIP AS WELL. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS IN SW VA AND IN THE NORTHERN 
MOUNTAINS...WITH SOME SLIGHT CHANCES IN THE NORTHERN VALLEY AND 
PLATEAU. WITH SYNOPTIC LIFT BEING QUITE WEAK...ANY ACCUMULATIONS 
SHOULD BE LIGHT...LESS THAN 1 INCH IN MOST SPOTS.

A RIDGE WILL BE WEST OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY...PROVIDING A DRY NW FLOW. LOW TEMPS WILL BE DROPPING WELL 
INTO THE 20S IN MOST SPOTS WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH HIGHS THURSDAY IN 
THE MID 40S TO MID 50S. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH IN THE NW FLOW CROSSES 
THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT. THE NAM IS DRY BUT THE GFS AND ECMWF 
PRODUCE SOME LIGHT PRECIP. WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF POP FOR 
NOW.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
UNCERTAINTY STILL PLAYS A ROLE IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH
DIFFERING MODEL SOLUTIONS. TRIED TO STAY THE COURSE FROM THE
PREVIOUS PACKAGE TWEAKING A BIT HERE AND THERE TRENDING TOWARD THE
00Z GFS WHICH INDICATES A SMALL CHANCE OF A SHOWER LATE FRIDAY
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AS A SHORT WAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE
NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION DRIVING A SURFACE WAVE AND SLOW
MOVING COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER SATURDAY NIGHT
INTO SUNDAY WITH AN INCREASING CHANCE OF RAIN SUNDAY INTO MONDAY AS
THE BOUNDARY DROPS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND YET ANOTHER
WAVE PRESSES EAST ACROSS THE REGION ON MONDAY. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE
TO MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE THROUGHOUT THE LONG TERM.

685 
FXUS64 KMRX 120130 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT MON MAR 11 2013

.DISCUSSION...
THIS EVENING...A COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO TRACK EASTWARD ACROSS THE
REGION. IN ITS WAKE...DRIER AND COOLER HAS BEGUN TO FILTER INTO THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...AND WILL EVENTUALLY SPREAD INTO THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATER TONIGHT. AHEAD OF THE
FRONT...A BROAD AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN WILL CONTINUE TO
PUSH OUT OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE BY LATE
THIS EVENING...THOUGH A SECONDARY AREA OF SHOWERS HAS FORMED ALONG
THE ACTUAL FRONT ITSELF AND WILL CONTINUE TO TRACK ALONG AND EAST
OF THE I-75 CORRIDOR THOUGH MIDNIGHT OR SO. GIVEN THE PROGRESSIVE
MOVEMENT OF THESE SHOWERS...HAVE SCALED BACK POPS TONIGHT...AND
HAVE REMOVED THEM ALL TOGETHER ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE CWA
AFTER 06Z. HOWEVER...SOME LINGERING SCATTERED ACTIVITY WILL BE
POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHEAST ZONES AND MOUNTAINS THROUGH 12Z THIS
MORNING. THOUGH SOME BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS WILL TAKE PLACE
OVERNIGHT...THINK THAT CLEARING WILL BE SLOW OVER A GOOD PORTION OF
THE AREA...AND WAS SLOWER TO SCALE BACK ON CLOUD COVER TONIGHT.
THINK THAT THESE CLOUDS MAY ALSO HELP TO KEEP LOWS A DEGREE OR TWO
WARMER TONIGHT AND BOTTOM OUT IN THE MID TO UPPER 30S...WITH THE
POSSIBLE EXCEPTION OF THE FAR WESTERN ZONES WHICH COULD DIP INTO
THE LOW 30S. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...THE WIDE BAND OF SHOWERS MOVING

TO END AT 20Z.  COOLER...DRIER AIR WILL FILTER IN ON TUESDAY WITH 
HIGHS CLIMBING INTO THE 50S ACROSS THE TN VALLEY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL LINGER OVER THE ERN STATES THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...LIFT NE ON 
THURSDAY FOLLOWED BY SOME PROLONGED NW FLOW ALOFT. HEIGHTS DON'T 
REALLY RISE MUCH...ALTHO UPPER FLOW DOES BECOME MORE ZONAL BY LATE 
IN THE WEEKEND. UNFORTUNATELY...MODELS STILL DIVERGE A GOOD DEAL 
FROM LATE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... LEAVING CONFIDENCE 
GENERALLY LOW FOR SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY OF NEXT WEEK. 

SOME VERY LIGHT QPF IS INDICATED FOR MAINLY SW VA AND NE TN DURING 
THE NW FLOW PERIOD...BUT THESE LOOK TO BE TRACE TO A FEW HUNDREDTHS 
EVENTS AT BEST. THUS...STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS AS MUCH AS 
POSSIBLE. FRONTAL BOUNDARY SAGGING SOUTH SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY 
SUPPORTS SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. MONDAY WAS INTRODUCED 
WITH LOW POPS AS WELL...GIVEN THE LATEST DIFFERENCES BETWEEN GFS AND 
ECMWF. 

FOR TEMPS...STARTING OUT BELOW SEASONAL NORMALS THEN WARMING TO AND 
ABOVE BY SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY. MIN TEMPS LOOK SUFFICIENTLY WARM 
ENOUGH FOR MAINLY LIQUID PRECIPITATION AFTER THURSDAY MORNING. THE 
12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE QUITE CLOSE TO 00Z NUMBERS...SO LITTLE 
VARIANCE FROM THE 00Z MOS FOR NOW.

THE PERIOD.  MVFR CONDITIONS DUE TO LOW CLOUDS AND POSSIBLY BRIEF 
REDUCTION IN VISIBILITY SHOULD BE EXPECTED.  THE MAIN BAND OF RAIN 
SHOULD EXIT THE AREA BETWEEN 00Z AND 04Z.  BEHIND THE FRONT...LOCAL 
MVFR CONDITIONS MAY CONTINUE THROUGH THE REST OF THE NIGHT AS A FEW 
SHOWERS LINGER OVER THE REGION.  IMPROVING CONDITIONS WITH VFR 
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED BY 12Z.

.AVIATION...
AN AREA OF RAIN IS SLOWLY MOVING EAST...AND WILL GRADUALLY SPREAD
INTO THE TAF SITES THROUGH THE DAY. DRY LOW LEVEL AIR WILL RESULT
IN VFR CONDITIONS WITH RAIN INITIALLY...WITH MVFR CONDITIONS ONCE
RAIN INTENSIFIES...WHICH SHOULD OCCUR AROUND 15Z AT CHA...18Z AND
TYS...AND 21Z AT TRI. IFR CONDITIONS MAY OCCUR WITH HEAVIER
RAINFALL...BUT CONFIDENCE IS TOO LOW TO MENTION AT THIS TIME. RAIN
SHOULD LAST ABOUT 6 HOURS AT ALL SITES BEFORE ENDING...THOUGH
CEILINGS ARE EXPECTED TO LINGER OVERNIGHT. WINDS WILL BE GUSTY TO
AROUND 25 KTS...AND SHIFT TO THE W AS A COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH
THIS EVENING.

FXUS64 KMRX 110704
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 AM EDT MON MAR 11 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
RAIN OVER MIDDLE TN IS NOT MAKING MUCH EASTWARD PROGRESS AT THE 
MOMENT...BUT WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE AREA LATER THIS MORNING AS 
THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS AND UPPER JET SHIFT EAST. MODELS ARE IN 
AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF THE STRONGEST LIFT OVER THE 
AREA...BETWEEN 15Z AND 21Z. FRONTAL PASSAGE APPEARS TO BE BETWEEN 
21Z AND 03Z. WILL KEEP A CHANCE POP GOING UNTIL THE MIDLEVEL TROUGH 
PASSAGE OCCURS AROUND 12Z.

CURRENT OBS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS SHOW WIND GUSTS IN THE 
30-40 MPH RANGE SO FAR...WITH SUSTAINED WINDS AROUND 15 MPH.
EXPECT WINDS TO CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING AS
THE LLJ SHIFTS EAST. THE CURRENT WIND ADVISORY LOOKS ON TRACK AND
WILL NOT BE CHANGED...ALTHOUGH SOME PORTIONS OF THE ADVISORY
OUTSIDE THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LOOK MARGINAL FOR REACHING CRITERIA.

TEMPS ARE STARTING OUT QUITE WARM SO FAR THIS MORNING...AND
DOWNSLOPE WINDS MAY HELP ADD A FEW DEGREES TO HIGH TEMPS IN THE
VALLEY...SO WILL GO ON THE WARM SIDE OF MOS GUIDANCE TODAY. TEMPS
WILL BE FALLING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON AS PRECIP SPREADS EAST.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH MOST OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST. DRIER
AIR WILL SPILL INTO THE REGION FOR TUESDAY WITH RETURN OF SUNSHINE
BY AFTERNOON...BUT A SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE CENTRAL
APPALACHIANS TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING BRINGING WITH IT A
SHOT OF COLDER AIR. ENOUGH WRAP-AROUND BOUNDARY LAYER
MOISTURE/UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE MOUNTAINS AND LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY
TO PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE
FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURE PROFILE WILL BE COLD ENOUGH TO SUPPORT
SNOW SHOWERS. LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATIONS ARE ANTICIPATED.
PRECIPITATION ENDS BY AFTERNOON WEDNESDAY.

DEEP UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES BEGINS TO MOVE 
EAST LATE IN THE WEEK WITH A WARM FRONT SETTING UP ACROSS FROM THE 
MID-WEST INTO THE OHIO/TENNESSEE VALEYS BY FRIDAY. INCREASING CLOUD 
COVER ANTICIPATED BY FRIDAY. ECMWF AND GFS BEGIN TO DIFFER GREATLY 
IN EVOLUTION OF THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND CYCLOGENESIS ALONG THE 
FRONT..SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW IN POPS AND CLOUDS FOR NEXT WEEKEND. 
EITHER WAY...A BOUNDARY WILL BE ALONG/NEAR THE FORECAST AREA WITH A 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS. INSTABILITY LIMITED NEXT WEEKEND...SO KEPT 
THUNDER OUT OF THE FORECAST..BUT GIVEN TIME-OF-THE-YEAR..THUNDER 
BECOMES MORE OF A POTENTIAL WITH THESE TYPES OF WEST TO EAST 
BOUNDARIES.

GENERALLY FOLLOWED MEX MOS NUMBERS CLOSELY..SINCE EXACT LOCATION OF 
THE BOUNDARY WILL HAVE A MAJOR IMPACT ON TEMPERATURES LATE THIS WEEK 
AND NEXT WEEKEND.

FXUS64 KMRX 110202 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1002 PM EDT SUN MAR 10 2013

.DISCUSSION...
THE MAIN WEATHER STORY FOR THIS EVENING WILL BE THE STRONG GRADIENT
WINDS AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AND COLD FRONT
FROM THE WEST. WITH SOUTHERLY TO SOUTHEASTERLY WINDS EXPECTED OVER
THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU AND A STOUT 50-60 KT OVER MIDDLE
TENNESSEE...SOME LOCALIZED MOUNTAIN WAVE ACTIVITY WILL POSSIBLE
TONIGHT AND INTO THE MORNING HOURS TOMORROW ACROSS THE FAVORED
AREAS ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE LATEST
OBS/TRENDS AND THE OVERALL PRESSURE FALLS TO THE WEST OF THE REGION
NOT PROGGED TO BE AS HIGH AS IN PREVIOUS EVENTS THIS YEAR...HAVE
OPTED TO STICK WITH THE WIND ADVISORY FOR NOW...AS SUSTAINED WINDS
AND GUSTS SHOULD STAY BELOW THE REQUIRED CRITERIA FOR A HIGH WIND
WARNING. HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THROUGHOUT THE EVENING
AND OVERNIGHT AS IT DOES APPEAR TO BE SOMEWHAT OF A CLOSE CALL. 

OTHERWISE...CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD THE AREA AND WILL
LOWER OVER THE COURSE OF THE NIGHT AS THE BOUNDARY LAYER
MOISTENS. SOME LIGHT SHOWERS ARE CURRENTLY TRACKING ACROSS MIDDLE
TENNESSEE AND COULD VERY WELL WORK THEIR WAY INTO THE CUMBERLAND
PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AFTER MIDNIGHT...SO HAVE INCREASED
POPS THERE TO LOW END CHANCE AFTER 06Z. OTHERWISE...THE BREEZY
SOUTHERLY WINDS AND CLOUD COVER WILL HELP TO KEEP LOWS FAIRLY MIND
IN THE MID 40S TO LOWER 50S IN MOST SPOTS.

&&

185 
FXUS64 KMRX 101931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT SUN MAR 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING ALONG THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD...WITH A SOUTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF IT 
BRINGING UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL STRENGTHEN FURTHER TONIGHT AND MONDAY...AS A 
COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVES EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. IN 
FACT...MODELS INDICATE THAT A STRONG 850 MB JET (AROUND 60 KT) WILL 
DEVELOP TONIGHT OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A SOUTHERLY WIND 
FLOW AND STABLE LAYER OCCURRING OVER THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS. 
THUS...IT APPEARS THAT CONDITIONS WILL BE CONDUCIVE FOR THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF MOUNTAIN WAVES IN THE FOOTHILLS. WITH THIS IN MIND... 
WILL EXPAND THE WIND ADVISORY TO INCLUDE MORE OF THE FOOTHILLS...AND 
WILL ALSO INCLUDE THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WHERE SOME MOUNTAIN WAVE 
WINDS MAY DEVELOP AS WELL. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THIS COLD FRONT...AND INDICATE THAT THE MAIN 
AREA OF SHOWERS WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TOWARDS 
NOON ON MONDAY. THESE SHOWERS SHOULD THEN SPREAD ACROSS THE REST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA MOSTLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS ON 
MONDAY. NAM MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME WEAK 
INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON...BUT 
WILL NOT MENTION ANY THUNDER SINCE THE GFS MODEL SOLUTION IS MORE 
STABLE. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY LOOK 
TO BEGIN A WARMING TREND OVER THE AREA WITH INCREASING CLOUDS EACH 
DAY. THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT WAS CAUSING RAIN SHOWERS OVER THE 
AREA EARLIER IN THE WEEK HAS MOVED NORTHEAST...AND WILL CONTINUE TO 
STRENGTHEN. WINDS ON WEDNESDAY...MAINLY IN THE MORNING HOURS...COULD 
BE STRONG WITH GUSTS BETWEEN 30 AND 40 MPH. THIS IS DUE TO A LOW 
LEVEL JET MOVING AROUND THE DEPARTING LOW. MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL 
BEGIN INCREASING HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS ACROSS THE AREA. A 
BOUNDARY WILL SET UP ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE CWA THROUGH THE 
REST OF THE WORK WEEK...AS THE FLOW ACROSS THE US BECOMES MORE 
ZONAL. DUE TO UPSLOPE FLOW AND THE MOISTURE INCREASE. HAVE KEPT IN 
SLIGHT POPS FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND AREAWIDE FRIDAY. A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR LIGHT SNOW CAN BE 
EXPECTED EARLY FRIDAY MORNING...BUT EXPECT MAINLY LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS 
WITH THESE POPS THROUGH THE DAY FRIDAY. CHANCE POPS WILL CONTINUE 
INTO SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. MODELS CONTINUE TO DISAGREE SLIGHTLY ON 
TIMING AND LOCATION OF THESE RAIN SHOWERS...SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW. 
INSTABILITY AND SHEAR HAVE INCREASED FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY FROM 
PREVIOUS RUNS. AT THE MOMENT...EXPECT ISOLATED TO SCATTERED RAIN 
SHOWERS THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THE THREAT FOR THUNDERSTORMS DOES NOT 
LOOK STRONG ENOUGH TO WARRANT INCLUDING IN FORECAST...BUT MORE MODEL 
RUNS NEEDED TO SAY WITH MUCH CERTAINTY.
&&

OBSERVATIONS INDICATE THAT WINDS ARE RAPIDLY INCREASING WITH HEIGHT
OVER MIDDLE TN AND NRN AL THIS MORNING...SO LLWS WILL BE KEPT IN
THE CHA TAF FOR A FEW MORE HOURS. DAYTIME MIXING WILL BRING THESE
STRONGER WINDS TO THE SURFACE IN THE FORM OF GUSTS LATER THIS
MORNING. ALL SITES WILL REMAIN VFR THROUGH THE TAF PERIOD...WITH
MAINLY MIDLEVEL CLOUDS TODAY. LLWS RETURNS AT ALL SITES TONIGHT AS
SURFACE WINDS BECOME LIGHTER BUT A LOW LEVEL JET MOVES OVER THE
AREA. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WIND ADVISORY FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM EDT MONDAY FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY 
     MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI.

VA...NONE.

293 
FXUS64 KMRX 100804
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
404 AM EDT SUN MAR 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL BE STRENGTHENING THROUGH THE DAY AS THE TN 
VALLEY GETS SQUEEZED BETWEEN HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE ATLANTIC COAST 
AND A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKING ACROSS THE PLAINS. WARM 
ADVECTION WILL BRING TEMPS WELL INTO THE 60S IN MOST SPOTS...POSSIBLY
TOUCHING 70 IN THE VALLEY. CURRENT VWP FROM KHTX SHOWS SOME STRONG
WINDS JUST ABOVE THE SURFACE...AND WITH DAYTIME MIXING WE COULD SEE
SOME GUSTY WINDS IN THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. THE LLJ
CONTINUES TO STRENGTHEN TONIGHT AS THE NAM AND GFS SHOW 850 MB
WINDS 50-60 KTS. CONFIDENCE IS HIGH ENOUGH TO GO WITH A WIND
ADVISORY FROM 00Z MONDAY TO 20Z MONDAY FOR THE MOUNTAINS. 

PRECIP CURRENTLY SEEN ON RADAR ACROSS WEST/MIDDLE TN AND NRN AL IS
NOT REACHING THE GROUND...AND THE COLUMN WILL REMAIN DRY UP TO 700
MB TODAY AND THIS EVENING. LOW LEVELS DO NOT BEGIN TO MOISTEN UNTIL
LATE TONIGHT...AND LIFT REMAINS WEAK THROUGH THE NIGHT. WILL LOWER
POPS BACK TO JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH AND WEST LATE TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
FOR MONDAY...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO AND
TENNESSEE VALLEYS WITH A NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM JETS
COMBINING TO PRODUCE STRONG UPPER DIVERGENCE OVER THE FORECAST
AREA. DIRECT CIRCULATION AROUND THE JET WILL ENHANCE THE FRONTO-
GENETIC FORCING ALONG THE FRONT MONDAY AND MONDAY EVENING. WILL
CONTINUE WITH CATEGORICAL POPS FOR MONDAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS CONTINUE
TO SHOW A VOID OF INSTABILITY EVEN THOUGH DYNAMICS IS STRONG. WILL
KEEP THUNDER OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR NOW. AS WAS STATED BY THE
SHORT-TERM FORECASTER...STRONG LOW-LEVEL JET WILL PRODUCE WINDY
CONDITIONS ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND BREEZY IN THE VALLEY. A
MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WIND EVENT IS EXPECTED...SO WINDY CONDITIONS
ACROSS THE ADJACENT FOOTHILLS ARE ANTICIPATED MONDAY.

FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...RE-ENFORCING COLD AIR WILL KEEP BROKEN 
CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE NORTHEAST THIRD OF THE AREA..ESPECIALLY THE 
MOUNTAINS WITH A CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS. NO SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED.

FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK (ESPECIALLY NEXT WEEKEND)...UPPER 
FLOW WILL REMAIN NORTHWEST/WEST WITH A BOUNDARY SETTING UP OVER THE 
LOWER OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEYS. MODELS SHOW INCREASING GULF MOISTURE 
JUST SOUTH OF THE BOUNDARY WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY. INCREASING 
CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST SAT MAR 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING ALONG THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD...WITH A SOUTHWESTERLY WIND FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF IT 
BRINGING MILD TEMPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW WILL STRENGTHEN FURTHER ON SUNDAY...WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO RISE 
SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. CLOUDS WILL ALSO INCREASE ON SUNDAY... 
AS A COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVES INTO THE MS RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THIS COLD FRONT... 
AND PROGNOSTICATE IT TO MOVE ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY 
WITH SHOWERS SPREADING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING. NAM MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME 
WEAK INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY AFTERNOON...BUT 
FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION ONLY SHOWERS SINCE THE GFS MODEL 
SOLUTION IS MORE STABLE...AND ALSO TO MAINTAIN FORECAST CONTINUITY. 
AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SLIGHT DIFFERENCES 
ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS IN SLIGHT 
DISAGREEMENT ON TIMING OF THE RAIN EXITING THE REGION. DECIDED TO GO 
WITH GFS SHOWING THE FRONT EAST OF THE AREA BY TUESDAY EVENING... 
WITH LIGHT ISOLATED RAIN SHOWERS POSSIBLE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...WARMER WEATHER AND CLEAR SKIES WILL 
SET IN AS THE LOW PRESSURE MOVES WELL NORTH OF THE AREA INTO CANADA. 
THIS LOW SEEMS TO STALL OUT...KEEPING NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE AREA 
AND SHOWERS TO OUR NORTH. A SERIES OF SHORTWAVES EXPECTED TO MOVE 
AROUND THIS LOW. MODELS IN DISAGREEMENT ON LOCATION AND TIMING OF 
RAIN...SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW. HAVE INCLUDED SLIGHT CHANCE FOR RAIN 
SHOWERS LATE THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY...MAINLY IN NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE AFTER 
MIDNIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...WITH RAIN SHOWERS FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY. INSTABILITY LOW SO NO SEVERE THREAT AS OF NOW. GUSTY WINDS 
CAN BE EXPECTED FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 090816
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 AM EST SAT MAR 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A DEEP HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL BE MOVING EAST ACROSS THE 
APPALACHIAN REGION TODAY...WITH A SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW 
DEVELOPING ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AS THE RIDGE AXIS MOVES EAST OF THE 
MOUNTAINS. HIGH CLOUDS FROM A JET STREAK OVER LA/AR WILL BE 
OVERHEAD...BUT SATELLITE TRENDS THIS MORNING SUGGEST THAT CLOUDS 
SHOULD REMAIN SCATTERED ENOUGH TO HAVE LITTLE IMPACT ON THE SENSIBLE 
WEATHER. TEMPERATURES WILL RISE INTO THE 60S IN MOST LOCATIONS 
OUTSIDE THE MOUNTAINS. FALLING 500 MB HEIGHTS AND AN APPROACHING 
UPPER JET WILL BRING GREATER CLOUD COVER TO THE AREA LATE 
TONIGHT...AS WELL AS A STRENGTHENING LLJ AS THE 850 MB LOW TRACKS 
ACROSS THE PLAINS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
RIDGE AXIS WILL BE EAST OF THE AREA FOR SUNDAY WITH INCREASING
HIGH AND MID-LEVEL CLOUDS AND QUITE MILD. FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND
ESPECIALLY MONDAY...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE TOWARD THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY WITH ASSOCIATED UPPER JET OVER THE EASTERN OHIO VALLEY
PLACING THE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE FAVORED DIVERGENCE ALOFT. THE
UPPER JET WILL HELP MAINTAIN THE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING ALONG AND
FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY AFTERNOON. AN
AREA OF SHOWERS WILL ACCOMPANY THE FRONT. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW
LIMITED INSTABILITY FOR THUNDER...SO HAVE KEEPED ONLY SHOWERS IN
THE FORECAST.

THE ECMWF AND GFS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN REGARD TO TIMING OF THIS 
FEATURE SO HAVE GONE WITH HIGH/CAT POPS FOR MONDAY. BESIDES THE 
SHOWERS...50-60 KT LOW-LEVEL JET (850MB) WILL PRODUCE WINDY/BREEZY 
CONDITIONS FOR MONDAY. MINOR MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WIND EVENT POSSIBLE 
FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS MONDAY.

PLENTY OF WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE AND SOME UPSLOPE INTO THE MOUNTAINS 
TO KEEP A CHANCE OF SHOWERS/LIKELY MOUNTAINS FOR MONDAY 
NIGHT/TUESDAY MORNING. RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE AREA FOR 
WEDNESDAY...BUT BOTH THE ECMWF/GFS SHOW ANOTHER WEAK SHORT-WAVE IN 
NORTHWEST FLOW MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN FORECAST AREA FOR THURSDAY 
AND THURSDAY NIGHT. CONFIDENCE ON TIMING AND STRENGTH OF THIS 
SHORT-WAVE REMAINS LOW.

NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. NOT EXPECTING THUNDERSTORMS WITH THIS 
SYSTEM...LITTLE TO NO INSTABILITY THROUGHOUT THE EVENT. WINDS HAVE 
WEAKENED SINCE PAST MODEL RUNS...BUT STILL EXPECT SOME GUSTY WINDS 
MAINLY EARLY MONDAY MORNING AND INTO EARLY AFTERNOON. LOW PRESSURE 
WILL CONTINUE TO DEEPEN AND MOVE INTO NORTHERN CANADA...AS HIGHER 
PRESSURE AND NORTHWEST FLOW SETTLE INTO THE AREA FOR THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED. KEPT HIGH TEMPS IN THE UPPER 50S/LOWER 60S AND BELOW 
GUIDANCE DUE TO THE NORTHWEST FLOW. DRY CONDITIONS AND CLEAR SKIES 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE EXTENDED. MID AND UPPER LEVEL SHORTWAVE 
BRINGING SLIGHT RAIN CHANCES TO THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE CWA BY 
FRIDAY MORNING. TOO EARLY FOR MUCH CONFIDENCE WITH THIS NEXT RAIN 
CHANCE.

THROUGH TODAY AND TONIGHT. LINGERING CLOUDS EARLY THIS MORNING ARE 
ALREADY ERODING...AND WE SHOULD SEE CLEAR SKIES BY LATE MORNING. 
WITH A CLOSED LOW STATIONARY OFF THE MID ATLANTIC COAST AND THE HIGH 
AMPLITUDE RIDGE TO THE WEST...MODELS INDICATE THAT THERE WILL BE A 
FAIRLY TIGHT 1000-850 MB THICKNESS GRADIENT ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. 
THIS WILL RESULT IN A LARGE NE-SW TEMPERATURE DIFFERENCE...WITH MID 
40S NE TO UPPER 50S SW. WITH CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT AND NEARLY CALM 
WINDS...LOWS WILL BE IN THE MID 20S TO LOWER 30S. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL BEGIN THE LONG
TERM FORECAST FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT WITH INCREASING HIGH
AND MID-LEVEL CLOUDS. FOR SUNDAY...RIDGE AXIS MOVES EAST OF THE
AREA WITH GOOD SOUTHERLY FLOW AND THICKENING HIGH AND MID-LEVEL
CLOUDS. THE ECMWF AND GFS SHOWS BOTH NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM
TROUGHING MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES AND SOUTHERN
PLAINS. THE MEDIMUM RANGE MODELS DO DIFFER ON THE STRENGTH OF THE
SOUTHERN STREAM ENERGY WITH THE GFS THE STRONGEST AND THE ECMWF
KEEPING A MORE AMPLIFIED NORTHERN STREAM WAVE. HOWEVER...BOTH
MODELS KEEP PRECIPITATION WEST OF THE AREA THROUGH SUNDAY WITH
BRUNT OF THE SHOWER ACTIVITY FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT AS
FRONTAL-GENETIC FORCING INCREASES.

MODEL SOUNDINGS DO NOT WARRANT MENTIONING OF THUNDER IN THE FORECAST 
AS INSTABILITY NOT PRESENT...BUT THIS COULD CHANGE WITH LATER RUNS.
COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH MONDAY/EARLY MONDAY NIGHT WITH RAIN ENDING 
TUESDAY MORNING.

FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED (WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY)...MEDIMUM RANGE 
MODELS DIFFER ON AMPLIFICATION OF NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH WITH THE 
ECMWF DEEPER AND COLDER FOR THE AREA. WILL TREND TOWARD THE LESS 
AMPLIFIED GFS MODEL.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

500 
FXUS64 KMRX 072003
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST THU MAR 7 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING OVER MOST OF THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION...WITH SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALING AN 
EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST AREA BENEATH A 
MID-LEVEL INVERSION. THIS INVERSION IS PROGGED TO REMAIN OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH THE SHALLOW LAYER OF MOISTURE BENEATH 
IT ONLY SLOWLY ERODING AWAY. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO BE PESSIMISTIC 
WITH THE CLOUD COVER FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL LINGER OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT...BRINGING TRANQUIL CONDITIONS AND A WARMING TREND. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...NEXT SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO 
THE AREA SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE THROUGHOUT 
THE DAY AS A DEEP TROUGH BRINGS A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE SOUTHEAST. 
ISOLATED SHOWERS CAN BE EXPECTED AHEAD OF THIS FRONT IN THE EARLY 
EVENING. NO LARGE WEATHER THREAT EXPECTED WITH THIS SYSTEM. 
INSTABILITY IS LOW...BUT DECENT AMOUNT OF WIND SHEAR AND SPEEDS 
PRESENT IN THE LOWER AND MID ATMOSPHERE. WITH THE WARM UP THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND AHEAD OF THIS FRONT...CAN EXPECT AN ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORM TO BE POSSIBLE. WIND EXPECTED TO BE THE MAIN THREAT... 
ALTHOUGH AT THIS MOMENT...DO NOT EXPECT ANYTHING SEVERE. 
OTHERWISE...RAIN EXPECTED THROUGH THE DAY MONDAY AND INTO TUESDAY. 
SYSTEM WILL BE EAST OF THE REGION BY TUESDAY EVENING...WITH COOLER 
TEMPERATURES SETTLING IN FOR THE NIGHT. HIGHER PRESSURE AND 
NORTHWEST FLOW THEN BECOME THE DOMINANT WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH THE 
END OF THE PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO THE UPPER 50S AND LOWER 
60S...WITH CLEAR SKIES EXPECTED EACH DAY.

534 
FXUS64 KMRX 070823
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EST THU MAR 7 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
A PERSISTENT DECK OF LOW CLOUDS CONTINUES TO REMAIN ENTRENCHED
ACROSS THE AREA EARLY THE MORNING...AND IS ACTUALLY EXPANDING TO
THE SOUTH AND WEST GIVEN THE LIGHT NORTH/NORTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE
AREA. GIVEN THE LATEST TRENDS...FEEL THAT THIS CLOUD COVER WILL BE
SLOWER TO ERODE THAN THE MODELS ARE SHOWING AFTER SUNRISE...
PARTICULARLY ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES...BEFORE THEY BEGIN TO
ERODE FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST BY THE AFTERNOON. THUS...HAVE
INCREASED CLOUD COVER TO MOSTLY CLOUDY/OVERCAST DURING THE MORNING
HOURS. SOME LOCALIZED LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE
ACROSS MUCH OF THE NORTHEAST ZONES THROUGH MID-MORNING GIVEN THE
MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER...SO HAVE KEPT A MENTION OF THIS AS WELL
THROUGH 14Z. GIVEN THE LINGERING CLOUDS...HIGHS MAY BE A FEW
DEGREES COOLER THAN PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT...BUT THEY WILL STILL BE
10-15 DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY IN SEVERAL AREAS...REACHING THE
UPPER 40S TO MID 50S IN THE CENTRAL/LOWER VALLEY. TEMPS WILL BE A
LITTLE COOLER FURTHER TO THE NORTHEAST IN THE UPPER 30S/LOWER 40S
ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. BY THE EVENING...SKIES WILL
BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR IN MANY AREAS...THOUGH MODEL DATA IS INDICATING
SOME LOW STRATUS RETURNING ACROSS THE NORTHEAST ZONES LATE TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
SHOULD BE ONE OF THE BEST 
WEEKENDS FOR THE FORECAST AREA IN QUITE A LONG TIME. SURFACE AND 
UPPER RIDGE BUILD INTO THE REGION...WITH THE UPPER RIDGE AMPLIFYING 
ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS BY SATURDAY. SURFACE RIDGE WILL BE ALONG THE 
EASTERN COAST BY SUNDAY ALLOWING A GOOD FETCH OF SOUTHERLY FLOW TO 
WARM TEMPS TO ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS FOR A WELCOMED CHANGE. 

COLD FRONT APPROACHES ON MONDAY AND I DID NOT SEE ANY REASON TO 
INCREASE POPS JUST YET FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. TIMING OF LIKELY POPS ON 
MONDAY LOOKED ON TRACK AND I KEPT A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. NOT 
QUITE CERTAIN ENOUGH TO GO LIKELY POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT...SO STAYED 
WITH 50 PERCENT FOR NOW. GFS AND CANADIAN MODELS SUPPORT LOWERING 
POPS TO 20 TO 30 PERCENT BY TUESDAY...WHILE ECMWF WAS A BIT SLOWER 
WITH SOME LINGERING SHOWERS ON BACKSIDE OF EXITING SYSTEM TUESDAY. 
KEPT CONTINUITY WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS IN LINE WITH GFS AND CANADIAN 
MODELS. DRY WEDNESDAY WITH SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

OTHERWISE...07/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE SIMILAR OVERALL TO CURRENT 
GRIDS. I DID MAKE A FEW ADJUSTMENTS IN MAX AND MIN TEMPS OVER THE 
WEEKEND TO BE CLOSER TO 00Z GFSX. BEST PERIOD FOR IMPROVEMENT OVER 
GFSX MOS STILL APPEARS TO BE TUESDAY...WHILE LITTLE IMPROVEMENT FOR 
OTHER PERIODS AT THIS TIME.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST WED MAR 6 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OFF THE MID ATLANTIC 
COAST...WITH AN UNSEASONABLY COLD AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL ONLY LIGHT SNOW FLURRIES OVER THE REGION THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH MODELS INDICATING THAT ANY ADDITIONAL ACTIVITY 
TONIGHT WILL BE ISOLATED AND LIGHT DUE TO THE MOISTURE LAYER 
BECOMING FAIRLY SHALLOW AFTER SUNSET. THUS...WILL PLAN TO CANCEL THE 
WINTER WX ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS...SINCE ANY ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL
ACCUMULATIONS TONIGHT SHOULD BE LESS THAN AN INCH. OTHERWISE...HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION OVER THE 
NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND A WARMING TREND EXPECTED 
TO DEVELOP THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...LOOKS LIKE A NICE WEEKEND 
AHEAD WITH AN AMPLIFIED RIDGE THAT TAKES ABOUT A DAY AND A HALF TO 
MAKE THE JOURNEY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA KEEPING PLEASANT...DRY AND 
MILDER AIR IN PLACE BOTH SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. THE NEXT FRONTAL 
SYSTEM IS DUE IN THE AREA ON MONDAY WITH COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE LATER 
IN THE DAY (WENT WITH THE FASTER ECMWF). RAISED POP TO LIKELY 
CATEGORY ON MONDAY AND ADDED A CHANCE FOR CONVECTION AS THE 
ATMOSPHERE DESTABILIZES AHEAD OF THE FRONT. POPS WERE MAINTAINED ALL 
THE WAY INTO TUESDAY AS DEEP MOISTURE AND TRAILING SHORT WAVE LIFT 
FILL IN BEHIND THE MAIN SYSTEM DEPARTURE. WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION 
HAD TO MIX IN SOME LIGHT SNOW WITH THE RAIN LATER MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY WITH EMPHASIS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
REMAINS NORTHWESTERLY AND MODELS HINT AT ANOTHER SHORT WAVELENGTH 
FEATURE DROPPING ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN 
THIS FLOW ON WEDNESDAY BUT KEPT THE FORECAST DRY DUE TO UNCERTAINTY 
IN THIS LATE PERIOD OF THE EXTENDED.

ADVISORY CONTINUE SINCE WIND SPEEDS SHOULD INCREASE SOME THIS 
AFTERNOON. FOR NOW...WILL LET THE WINTER WX ADVISORIES/WARNINGS 
CONTINUE AS IS...BUT WILL PROBABLY BE ABLE TO CANCEL THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU ADVISORIES EARLY THIS AFTERNOON.

036 
FXUS64 KMRX 060925
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
425 AM EST WED MAR 6 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
EARLY THIS MORNING...SCATTERED NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS
CONTINUE TO PUSH OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON THE
BACKSIDE OF AN UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM THAT IS SHIFTING
EAST INTO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. THESE SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO
DEVELOP AND MOVE ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING...WITH SOME LOCALLY
HEAVIER ACTIVITY POSSIBLE ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN...ESPECIALLY
FROM 09Z THROUGH 15-18Z WHEN MOISTURE/LIFT VALUES WILL BE GREATEST.
HOWEVER...LIGHT TO MODERATE SHOWERS WILL LINGER THROUGH THE
AFTERNOON/EVENING AND OVERNIGHT ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE
SMOKIES BEFORE FINALLY TAPERING OFF BY THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT
HOURS. THESE SHOWERS WILL FAVOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF EAST
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...AS WELL AS PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU.

A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THE NORTHERN
PLATEAU...FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...WHERE
GENERALLY BETWEEN 1-4 INCHES IS EXPECTED THROUGH MIDNIGHT TONIGHT.
ANOTHER WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA FOR 1-4 INCHES AS WELL...BUT ONLY WILL GO THROUGH 7 PM AS
THE SNOW WILL DIMINISH THERE BY SUNSET. A WINTER STORM WARNING IS
IN EFFECT FOR WISE COUNTY VA AND THE MOUNTAIN ZONES OF EAST
TENNESSEE WHERE BETWEEN 4-8 INCHES IS EXPECTED...WITH UP TO FOOT
POSSIBLE ALONG THE HIGHEST PEAKS BY 6 AM THURSDAY. MOST VALLEY
LOCATIONS ARE EXPECTED TO RECEIVE MINOR ACCUMULATIONS...WITH ONLY A
DUSTING TO PERHAPS HALF IN INCH TO AN INCH IN A SOME LOCALIZED
AREAS. ALSO...GIVEN THE STRONG GRADIENT WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS
STORM SYSTEM...A WIND ADVISORY WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT THOUGH 22Z.
THE HIGHEST GUSTS WILL OCCUR ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN...WHICH WILL
LEAD TO BLOWING/DRIFTING SNOW...FURTHER EXASPERATING THE TRAVEL
CONDITIONS IN THE WARNING AREAS TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
SOME LINGERING LOW CLOUDS 
OVER FAR NE AREAS THURSDAY MORNING SO ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW 
SHOWERS. OTHERWISE...SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE WORK EAST INTO THE TN 
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY FRIDAY. HEIGHTS INCREASE ALOFT 
INTO SUNDAY WITH SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW DEVELOPING BY SATURDAY 
NIGHT. TEMPS RISE TO SEASONAL VALUES BY FRIDAY THEN SEVERAL DEGREES 
ABOVE NORMAL BY THE WEEKEND.

FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK...MODELS SEEMED TO BE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT AND 
IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS. A COLD FRONT APPROACHES SUNDAY 
NIGHT WITH THE ASSOCIATED AREA OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING NE THROUGH 
THE OHIO VALLEY INTO ERN CANADA BY EARLY TUESDAY. GOOD CONTINUITY IN 
BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS (NO WINTRY PCPN!) ON MONDAY...SO NUDGED POPS 
UP TO 50 PERCENT FOR NOW. KEPT LOW POPS LINGERING INTO TUESDAY AS 
BEFORE...BUT STAYED ABOUT 20 PERCENT BELOW 06/00Z GFSX MOS POPS. 
THIS LOOKS TO BE A TARGET OF OPPORTUNITY TO IMPROVE OVER GUIDANCE AS 
QPF WOULD BE VERY LIGHT EARLY TUESDAY...PROBABLY TRACE AMOUNTS SOUTH 
TO JUST A FEW HUNDREDTHS NORTH. KEPT QUITE CLOSE TO 06/00Z GFXS MOS 
TEMPS THROUGH THE LONG TERM.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
838 PM EST TUE MAR 5 2013

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPDATE WILL BE NEEDED TO ADJUST TEMPERATURES CLOSER TO
OBSERVATIONS...WHICH ARE DROPPING QUICKLY AS COLD ADVECTION BUILDS
IN BEHIND AN EXITING COLD FRONT. THE 00Z OHX SOUNDING SHOWS
SATURATION BELOW -10C WITH DRY AIR ABOVE...SO WE ARE NOT LIKELY TO
SEE MUCH ADDITIONAL PRECIP UNTIL THE STRONG VORT MAX AND 500 MB
TEMP MIN OVER MO/IL MOVES INTO THE AREA TO INCREASE MOISTURE DEPTH
AND LIFT. MODELS PROJECT THIS TO OCCUR AFTER 06Z. SOME POP/WX
ADJUSTMENTS WILL BE MADE TO REFLECT THIS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
613 PM EST TUE MAR 5 2013

.AVIATION...
A COLD FRONT IS PUSHING ACROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING...AND RAIN
AHEAD OF THE FRONT WILL BE EXITING SHORTLY. VIS/CIGS SHOULD RISE TO
VFR AT ALL SITES BEHIND THE FRONT...THEN MVFR CONDITIONS ARE
EXPECTED TO BUILD BACK IN AT TYS AND TRI AROUND 09Z WHEN AN UPPER
LEVEL LOW WILL BRING DEEPER MOISTURE AND A CHANCE OF SNOW. THE SNOW
IS EXPECTED TO BE HEAVIEST AT TRI WHERE IFR CONDITIONS WILL OCCUR
AT TIMES. WIND GUSTS SHOULD DROP OFF OVERNIGHT...BUT RETURN DURING
THE DAY TOMORROW TO THE 25-30 KT RANGE. WINDS WILL ALSO BE SHIFTING
TO A MORE N-NW DIRECTION TOMORROW MORNING. SNOW IS EXPECTED TO END
IN THE EARLY AFTERNOON...WITH VFR CONDITIONS RETURNING AT ALL SITES.

&&

639 
FXUS64 KMRX 052001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EST TUE MAR 5 2013

.SHORT TERM... (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...TRANSITION TAKES 
PLACE TONIGHT AS COLD FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH THE AREA AND COLD UPPER 
LOW COMES FOLLOWING AFTER. EXPECTING A DECREASE IN PRECIP THIS 
EVENING WITH TEMPORARY DRY SLOTTING. THEN AROUND 11PM-1 AM THE UPPER 
LOW WILL PASS ALONG THE NRN BORDER OF NE TN. SOME INSTABILITY AT 
THAT TIME MAY HELP TRIGGER INITIAL SNOWS...THEN WRAP-AROUND AND NW 
FLOW TYPE SNOW WILL CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY AND TAPER OFF 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. TEMPS WILL PROBABLY RUN BELOW GUIDANCE FOR 
WEDNESDAY HIGH TEMPS...SO CONTINUED TO UNDERCUT THEM. WINDS 
ASSOCIATED WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE AND SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT HAS 
LED US AND OTHER NEARBY OFFICES TO HOIST A WIND ADVISORY FOR TONIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY. WINDS GUSTING UP TO 40 MPH. WILL DIE DOWN LATE 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

BEST SNOWS IN THIS EVENT WILL BE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND MOUNTAINS. 
HAVE ALSO BROUGHT THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY A LITTLE SOUTH OF THE 
VA STATE LINE TO INCLUDE THE TRI-CITIES AREA AND FAR NORTHERN VALLEY 
OF NE TN.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE AT THE 
SURFACE WILL BUILD IN THURSDAY WITH THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDING OVER 
THE AREA INTO THE WEEKEND.  SHOULD BE DRY THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY 
WITH A WARMING TREND.  MODELS HAVE HAD ONLY FAIR AGREEMENT AND 
CONSISTENCY FOR THE LATTER PART OF THE PERIOD...SO CONFIDENCE NO 
HIGHER THAN AVERAGE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.  APPEARS NEXT SYSTEM WILL 
AFFECT THE REGION EARLY IN THE WEEK...BUT TIMING UNCERTAIN.  FOR NOW 
WILL LEAN TOWARD A 12Z GFS/00Z ECMWF COMPROMISE...AND WILL CARRY 
CHANCE POPS BOTH MONDAY AND MOST OF THE AREA TUESDAY. GFS MOS TEMPS 
APPEAR TO BE REASONABLE OVERALL SO WILL GENERALLY NOT STRAY FAR.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       32  40  31  51  28 /  60  50  10   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              30  38  30  46  26 /  80  60  20  10   0

.DISCUSSION...
UPDATED TO REFRESH FIRST PERIOD WORDING AND TO HEDGE DOWN A TAD ON
MAX TEMPS TODAY MAINLY OVER VA. HOW FAR WILL THE WAA GET BEFORE THE
CAA ARRIVES? THUS THE NORTHERN VALLEY MAX TEMP FCST IS CHALLENGING.

THE WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT...AND THE WATCH WILL BE
UPDATED TO ADVISORY OR WARNING BEFORE THE AFTERNOON FORECAST
PACKAGE. CURRENT THINKING IS TO LEAN TOWARD ADVISORY CRITERIA IN
THE WATCH AREA...AND WILL HAVE TO DECIDE UPON THE FINAL AREAS TO
INCLUDE AMONG THE NORTHERN VALLEY. MORE DETAILS ON ALL OF THAT WILL
FOLLOW AFTER THE 12Z MODEL RUNS ARE CONSIDERED.

IN THE MEANTIME...THE INITIAL RAIN AREA IS MOVING INTO THE
NORTHEASTERN CWA WHILE THE NEXT MORE CONVECTIVE AREA OF PRECIP IS
MOVING THROUGH NASHVILLE/S CWA NOW. COLD FRONT IS OVER WESTERN TN
AND WILL ADVANCE QUICKLY EASTWARD. EXPECT THE FROPA 5-8 PM ACROSS
THE CWA...AND THE FROPA WILL END MUCH OF THE PRECIP TEMPORARILY.
ONCE THE UPPER LOW MOVES OVERHEAD AROUND 1 AM...AND EAST OF THE
AREA BY 4 AM...THEN WRAP- AROUND SNOW CHANCES WILL RAPIDLY INCREASE
AND PERSIST THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY WEDNESDAY.

497 
FXUS64 KMRX 050901
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
401 AM EST TUE MAR 5 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...RAIN STARTING TO INCREASE
OVER MIDDLE TN AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. OTHER
THAN SLOWING DOWN THE ONSET OF LIGHT RAIN THIS MORNING...LITTLE
CHANGES WERE MADE FOR TODAY. KEPT SHOWERS AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON...WHEN SOUNDINGS SUGGEST SOME ELEVATED
INSTABILITY. 

FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...00Z GFS MODEL SEEMS MUCH CLOSER TO NAM
IN TIMING THE ARRIVAL OF THE COLD AIR. THIS SUPPORTS VIRTUALLY NO
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS UNTIL TONIGHT...OF COURSE STARTING EARLIEST ON
THE NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE SMOKIES. ONE
TROUBLESOME FEATURE IS THE HINT OF A DRY SLOT INITIALLY BEHIND THE
COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE...WHILE ANOTHER IS THE DIFFERING PATHS OF
HEAVIER QPF. SOME CONCERN THAT NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES COULD EXCEED 4
INCHES OF SNOW IN 12 HOURS...AND ALSO HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA. 

BY WEDNESDAY MORNING...COLD AIR AND MORE MOISTURE WRAP AROUND INTO
THE REGION...WITH PLENTY OF PRECIPITABLE WATER TO GENERATE MORE
SNOWFALL. THERE IS A PERIOD OF GOOD UPSLOPE FLOW INTO THE FAVORED
AREAS SUCH AS SMOKIES...GENERALLY FROM 15Z TO 21Z WEDNESDAY. THESE
AREAS SHOULD HAVE NO PROBLEM GETTING 6 INCHES OR MORE OF TOTAL SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS. CUTTING MAX TEMPS CONSIDERABLY ON WEDNESDAY AS IN
PREVIOUS GRIDS...WHICH ALLOWS FOR ACCUMULATING SNOW INTO WEDNESDAY 
EVENING.

BASED ON ALL OF THE ABOVE REASONING AND PER COORDINATION WITH NWS
NEIGHBORS...DECISION WAS MADE TO UPGRADE NRN AND SMOKY MTNS TO A
WARNING. WENT WITH A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR ERN POLK...CLAY
AND CHEROKEE COUNTIES. TOUGHER CALL ON NRN PLATEAU AND SW VA...
SO OPTED TO GIVE THE DAY SHIFT SOME TIME TO LOOK AT THE 06Z AND 12Z
MODEL RUNS. KEEPING THOSE AREAS AS A WATCH FOR NOW. EXTENDED THE
WARNING AND ADVISORY GROUPS ENDING TIME TO 11Z THURSDAY IN LINE
WITH ERN NWS NEIGHBORS. WIND SPEEDS AND GUSTS TONIGHT INTO
WEDNESDAY MAY REACH ADVISORY CRITERIA.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
SNOW SHOWERS WILL GRADUALLY TAPER OFF WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE 
UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKS EAST INTO THE MID ATLANTIC 
REGION. STILL...SOME SCATTERED NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF EAST TENNESSEE AND ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THROUGH 12Z THURSDAY...WITH SOME LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE. THEREAFTER...WARMER AND DRIER CONDITIONS ARE 
EXPECTED FOR THE LATTER PART OF THE WORK WEEK AND INTO THE WEEKEND 
AS AN UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE AREA. SW FLOW...ABUNDANT 
SUNSHINE AND INCREASED THICKNESS VALUES WILL ALLOW HIGHS TO JUMP 
BACK INTO THE UPPER 50S AND LOWER 60S BY FRIDAY AND INTO THE MID TO 
UPPER 60S IN MANY LOCATIONS BY THE WEEKEND. ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH 
WILL EVENTUALLY PUSH TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA LATE SUNDAY INTO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...BRINGING INCREASED CLOUD COVER/PRECIP CHANCES LATE IN 
THE PERIOD...ALONG WITH SOME SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES HEADING 
INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.  


&&

IN THE TAF PERIOD JUST AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT...AND

NEAR THE FRONT.

367 
FXUS64 KMRX 042035
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EST MON MAR 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...FROM FAIR AND CHILLY TODAY TO
WET AND WARMER TUESDAY. AND THAT IS JUST THE BEGINNING OF THE
ROLLER COASTER THAT WILL INCLUDE SNOW FOLLOWED BY WARM SPRINGTIME
TEMPS IN THE LONG TERM. BUT ZEROING IN ON TONIGHT AND TUESDAY...
HIGH CLOUDS MOVING IN AHEAD OF DEVELOPING STORM SYSTEM. TEMPS AT 3
PM STILL FAIRLY COOL AND DEWPOINTS STILL VERY DRY. MIN TEMPS
TONIGHT MAY BE INTERESTING...I TRIED TO HIT THE MINS DURING THE LATE
EVENING OVER THE SW PORTION OF THE CWA FOLLOWED BY GRADUAL
OVERNIGHT WARMING. IN CENTRAL AREAS HAVE FLIRTED WITH MIN TEMPS
NEAR MIDNIGHT WITH LITTLE CHANGE THE REST OF THE NIGHT. FOR THE
NORTHEASTERN AREAS...MOSTLY A FAIRLY NORMAL DIURNAL CURVE.
SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL ONSET IN THE SW AREAS AT SOME POINT OVERNIGHT
BUT PROBABLY LIGHT AND VAR IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY
TONIGHT. RAIN CHANCES RISE RAPIDLY ESPECIALLY AFTER
MIDNIGHT...COMING IN FROM THE WEST. FOR TUESDAY...CATEGORICAL RAIN
SHOWERS. I INCLUDED MENTION OF ISOLATED AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS...
MOSTLY CONSTRAINED TO WARM SECTOR NEAR SURFACE FRONT AS IT MOVES
THROUGH AT THAT TIME. DIDN/T PUT THE TSTMS INTO VA OR TRI-CITIES
VICINITY BUT DID FOR MOST OF THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF
AREA. FROPA LATE IN THE DAY WILL EASE US INTO THE WINTRY SCENARIO
DISCUSSED BELOW.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...PERIOD STARTS OUT COLD
WITH POSSIBILITY OF SOME SIGNIFICANT SNOW ESPECIALLY HIGHER
TERRAIN. MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT IN HANDLING OF COLDER AIR
COMING IN BEHIND THE DEPARTING COLD FRONT...AS AN UPPER LOW TRACKS
ACROSS THE REGION. APPEARS THERE WILL BE ADEQUATE LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE...AND LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY LOOKS FAIRLY IMPRESSIVE AT
LEAST FOR A PERIOD LATER TUESDAY NIGHT AS UPPER LOW MOVES ACROSS.
FLOW TURNS MORE NORTHWEST WEDNESDAY...BUT MOISTURE STARTS TO BECOME
MORE SHALLOW BY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. IT APPEARS THE GREATEST
THREAT FOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS THAT WOULD REACH WARNING CRITERIA
WILL BE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA AND THE NORTHERN AND
CENTRAL TN MOUNTAINS DOWN AS FAR SOUTH AS MONROE COUNTY.
HOWEVER...AT THIS TIME WILL LEAVE WINTER STORM WATCH AS IS SINCE
WARNING CRITERIA SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE STILL POSSIBLE IN NORTHERN
PLATEAU AND SW NC/POLK MOUNTAIN ZONES...BUT THESE AREAS ARE MORE
LIKELY TO END UP WITH AN ADVISORY RATHER THAN A WARNING THAN ARE
THE OTHER WATCH AREAS. SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS ALSO POSSIBLE IN
VALLEY AREAS MAINLY NORTH INTO CENTRAL VALLEY AS WELL AS SOUTHERN
PLATEAU COUNTIES. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN THURSDAY WITH
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN BY THE WEEKEND...SO EXPECT DRY AND WARMING
CONDITIONS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK. MODELS STILL INCONSISTENT
FURTHER OUT...BUT NEXT SYSTEM MAY APPROACH BY MONDAY. WILL UNDERCUT
MAV TEMPS EARLY...ESPECIALLY WEDNESDAY...OTHERWISE MAINLY JUST SOME
TWEAKS TO GFS MOS TEMPS.

FXUS64 KMRX 040927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
427 AM EST MON MAR 4 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FORECAST FOR TODAY WILL FEATURE 
JUST INCREASING CLOUDS...ALTHO PESKY LOW CLOUDS REFUSE TO DISSIPATE 
OVER SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN THIS MORNING. SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE 
QUICKLY SLIP EAST...AHEAD OF THE DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER 
THE NRN AND CENTRAL PLAINS. WARM AIR ADVECTION DEVELOPS OVER THE 
LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON...BUT MOST MODELS KEEP OUR 
WEATHER DRY. THUS...I DROPPED THE SPRINKLES FOR NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON. WARMER TEMPS SUGGESTED FOR TODAY...BUT CLOUDS 
MAY HINDER WARMING INTO UPPER 50S. STAYED CLOSE TO GFS MOS FOR HIGHS 
EXCEPT SLIGHTLY BELOW FOR CHA AREA. 

ISENTROPIC LIFT DEVELOPS TONIGHT AS THE SURFACE LOW MOVES NE INTO 
THE MEM TO PAH AREA...AND PREVIOUS POP AND WEATHER GRIDS LOOKED 
RIGHT ON TRACK. FAVORED THE MILDER GFS MINS OR A FEW DEGREES ABOVE
WHICH KEEPS ANY PRECIPITATION ALL LIQUID (LIGHT RAIN).

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...TUESDAY MODELS STILL IN
GOOD AGREEMENT OF STRONG UPPER TROUGH MOVING INTO THE MISSISSIPPI
RIVER VALLEY WITH AN UPPER JET DIVING SOUTH TOWARD THE NORTHERN
GULF COAST STATES. WARM FRONT EXPECTED TO PASS THROUGH THE REGION
BY 12Z MONDAY AND WITH THE DEEP COLD AIR ALOFT STEEP LAPSE RATES
WILL MAKE THE AIR MASS SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE AND ALLOW A FEW
THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY MILD IN THE WARM
SECTOR WITH SW WINDS WARMING HIGHS TO THE UPPER 40S HIGHER
ELEVATIONS NORTH TO THE UPPER 50S AROUND CHA. THEN TUESDAY NIGHT
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION ALOFT BEHIND COLD FRONT AS UPPER LOW
MOVING SE FROM THE OHIO VALLEY PRODUCES CONTINUED SHOWER ACTIVITY
OVERNIGHT FREEZING LEVELS DROP LOW ENOUGH TO CHANGE RAIN TO SNOW IN
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AROUND 00Z AND THEN LOWER ELEVATIONS AROUND
MIDNIGHT. SNOWFALL WILL BEGIN TO ACCUMULATE IN THE EVENING IN THE
MOUNTAINS AND AFTER MIDNIGHT LOWER ELEVATIONS. A FEW INCHES WILL
LIKELY FALL BY MORNING IN THE MOUNTAINS WITH LIGHT AMOUNTS IN THE
VALLEYS. THE SNOW WILL CONTINUE IN THE MOUNTAINS ALL DAY AS COLD
AIR ADVECTION AND INCREASING NW FLOW PATTERN TAKES OVER. LOWER
ELEVATIONS SHOULD HAVE SOME MORNING SNOW SHOWERS BUT MAY WARM
ENOUGH FOR SNOW TO CHANGE TO RAIN IN THE AFTERNOON. THE SNOW WILL
CONTINUE OVERNIGHT IN THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN AND SW VA WITH
ANOTHER INCH OR TWO BEFORE ENDING. FOR LOWS WENT SLIGHTLY BELOW
GUIDANCE TUESDAY NIGHT WHICH WAS JUST BELOW FREEZING MOST PLACES
EXCEPT CHA. WEDNESDAY FOLLOWED EXISTING NUMBERS SEVERAL DEGREES
BELOW GUIDANCE WHICH HAS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BELOW FREEZING AND
OTHER AREAS 5 TO 10 DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE. WILL ISSUE A WINTER
STORM WATCH SHORTLY FOR THE VIRGINIA AND TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS...THE
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
NORTH CAROLINA. AMOUNTS MAY REACH 6 TO 10 INCHES IN THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY LOWS DROP TO BELOW
FREEZING ONCE MORE WITH POSSIBLE SNOW COVER.

FOR THE THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY TIME FRAME A WARMING TREND WITH
HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT. HIGHS WARM TO THE ABOVE
NORMAL 60S ON THE WEEKEND. SOME CLOUDS MAY SPREAD IN SUNDAY AHEAD
OF A WEATHER SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS AND MS VALLEY SUNDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

234 
FXUS64 KMRX 032027
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EST SUN MAR 3 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...AS UPPER TROUGH
ACROSS THE NORTHEAST MOVES EAST...THEN LOW-CLOUDS AND FLURRIES WILL
DISSIPATE THIS EVENING/TONIGHT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. FOR MONDAY...
RIDGING WILL DOMINATE BOTH SURFACE AND ALOFT...BUT PLENTY OF HIGH
AND MID-LEVEL CLOUDS WILL SPILL OVER THE RIDGE INCREASING CLOUDS
ONCE AGAIN. FOR MONDAY NIGHT...A STRONG UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES WILL DEEPENING SURFACE LOW
HEADING SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. INCREASING SOUTHERLY
WINDS WILL PRODUCE ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. RAIN
WILL SPREAD INTO THE REGION WITH HIGHEST POPS OVER THE PLATEAU AND
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE.

FOR TUESDAY...STRONG UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE MID-
MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY WITH UPPER JET DIVING INTO THE NORTHERN
GULF COAST STATES. THE JET WILL PLACE THE FORECAST AREA UNDER THE
FAVORED RIGHT EXIT REGION OF THE JET. THE CIRCULATION AROUND THE
JET WILL ENHANCE THE FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING WITH THE INCOMING
FRONTAL BOUNDARY. ECMWF/GFS SHOW STRONG FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING OVER
THE AREA DURING THE AFTERNOON. SINCE THE UPPER TROUGH HAS DEEP COLD
AIR WITH 500MB TEMPERATURES BELOW -30 DEGREES CELCIUS...LAPSE RATES
WILL STEEPEN WITH CAPES ALONG AND AHEAD OF FROPA TO WARRANT A
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. 

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION ALOFT
ASSOCIATED WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE UPPER LOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA
WILL CONTINUE TO STEEPEN THE LAPSE RATES. CAPES OF 100-150 J/KG
WILL PRODUCE WIDESPREAD SHOWER ACTIVITY TUESDAY NIGHT DIMINISHING
SLOWLY WEDNESDAY. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW PRECIPITATION WILL
QUICKLY CHANGED TO SNOW SHOWERS TUESDAY EVENING. ALONG WITH THE
INSTABILITY...INCREASING NORTHWEST BOUNDARLY LAYER FLOW WILL
PRODUCE GOOD OROGRAPHIC/NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL INTO THE MOUNTAINS
FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...THEN DIMINISHING WEDENSDAY NIGHT. 

HEAVY SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE FOR THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE
MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...SUCH AS
HIGH KNOB. A WINTER STORM WATCH MAY BE NEEDED FOR THESE AREAS.
WIDESPREAD SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY MAY ALSO
PRODUCE LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS FOR THE PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA MOUNTAINS AND PARTS OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL TENNESSEE
VALLEY.

FOLLOWED GFS MOS NUMBERS THROUGH TUESDAY...BUT UNDERCUT DUE TO THE
CLOUDS AND PRECIPITATION ON WEDNESDAY.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A FAIRLY BENIGN PERIOD WITH 
NICE SPRING WARMTH TO MAKE UP FOR ALL OF THE RECENT COLD. I WILL TRY 
TO HEDGE A BIT HIGHER ON MAX TEMPS LATE NEXT WEEK THAN THE 00Z MEX 
AND ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE GAVE...TIPPING THE HAT IN THE DIRECTION 
TOWARD THE WARMEST ENSEMBLE MEMBERS. THE ECMWF IS MORE CONSISTENT 
WITH ITS SOLUTION OF A SLOWER AND DEEPER ROCKIES TROUGH LATE IN THE 
PERIOD THAT WILL HELP US WARM A LITTLE MORE THAN THE 00Z EXTENDED 
GFS AND ENSEMBLE MOS WAS THINKING...AND THUS I WOULD EXPECT US TO 
REMAIN DRIER A LITTLE LONGER THAN GFS WANTS TOO. NO PRECIP MENTIONED 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. 

LOOKING AHEAD...THE GFS RUNS ARE A LITTLE BOUNCY WITH THE DAY 8-9 
FORECAST...WHILE THE ECMWF IS MORE CONSISTENT WITH A FAIRLY 
SIGNIFICANT TROUGH SWEEPING THROUGH THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT OR TUESDAY 
MORNING. GIVEN THE WARMTH AHEAD OF IT TO WORK WITH...THE BIRD'S EYE 
VIEW MIGHT EXPECT A CONVECTIVE EVENT DURING THAT TROUGH PASSAGE. 
PROBABLY A QUICK RESUMPTION OF SPRING TIME TEMPS THE NEXT DAY 
FOLLOWING THE TROUGH PASSAGE.

&&

THE COOLER GFS MOS AND NAM MOS FOR MINS. OTHERWISE...NO CONCERNS AS

OHIO AND TN VALLEYS INTO MONDAY.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...TRANSITORY HIGH PRESSURE
SYSTEM OVER THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY WILL SLOWLY SHIFT EAST AS NEXT
SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS MOVES SE INTO THE MS VALLEY MONDAY. MUCH
WARMER TEMPERATURES MONDAY WITH HIGHS 10 DEGREES WARMER THAN TODAY.
THIS SYSTEM WILL SPREAD CLOUDS INTO THE TN VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT AND
AS A WARM FRONT CROSSES THE AREA LIGHT RAIN WILL BECOME LIKELY.
TUESDAY SURFACE LOW AND COLD FRONT BRINGS MORE RAIN AND CONTINUED
MILD TEMPERATURES. TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY COLDER AIR MASS ON
BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM WILL DROP FREEZING LEVELS WITH RAIN
CHANGING TO SNOW AND AT LEAST A FEW INCHES ACCUMULATIONS IN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND POSSIBLE SLIGHT ACCUMULATIONS IN THE LOWER
ELEVATIONS NORTH. THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY HIGH PRESSURE WITH
RIDGING ALOFT WILL BRING MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND TEMPERATURES
WARMING TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL READINGS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
212 PM EST SAT MAR 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH WAS SLOWLY 
EXITING THE E TN REGION THIS AFTERNOON. A LOOK AROUND AT AREA WEB
CAMS AND SPOTTER REPORTS INDICATE LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WITH A
FEW AREAS MEASURING UP TO 2 INCHES OF SNOW. THERE WILL STILL BE
LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS PARTICULARLY IN THE FOOTHILLS AND SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BEGIN TO SUBSIDE CLOSE TO
6PM...WHEN THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY EXPIRES. THERE COULD BE A
FEW ADDITIONAL SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH THE NIGHT ESPECIALLY OVER
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NE TN/MOUNTAINS. NO SIGNIFICANT SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED. THE REST OF NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST
VA COULD EXPERIENCE SNOW FLURRIES OVERNIGHT AS WELL. THE COOLER MAV
GUIDANCE WAS PREFERRED FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY WITH COLD ADVECTION
ANTICIPATED ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE BUILDING RIDGE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SPRINGTIME
TEMPERATURES ARE ON THE WAY. EXPECT A NICE WARM UP FOR MONDAY AND
TUESDAY... INTERRUPTED BY THE NEXT UPPER LOW TO TRAVERSE THE AREA
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. DEPENDING ON THE TRACK OF THE LOW...A
RETURN OF SNOW SHOWERS IS PROBABLE FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. BUT AFTER THE SYSTEM PASSES...RIDGING ALOFT WILL
RETURN QUICKLY TO THE AREA WHILE DEEP TROUGHING OCCURS OVER THE
ROCKIES. THUS WARMER AND FAIRER WEATHER RESUMING ON THURSDAY WILL
BECOME MORE ENTRENCHED FRIDAY AND THROUGH NEXT WEEKEND...WITH THE
SPRING WARMTH PERHAPS ENDURING MOSTLY UNABATED FOR MUCH OF THE 8 TO
14 DAY PERIOD...
