AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
422 AM EST SAT MAR 2 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD AIR REMAINS IN PLACE WITH 
SUFFICIENT MOISTURE OF AROUND 1/3RD OF AN INCH PRECIPITABLE WATER 
THIS MORNING. HOWEVER...FORCING REMAINS QUITE WEAK...AND COMBINE THE 
LACK OF LIFT WITH WARM SURFACE AND BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS...RESULTS IN 
VERY WEAK RADAR RETURNS AND NOT MUCH KNOWN SNOW ACCUMULATIONS THUS 
FAR. CALLS MADE TO CST COUNTIES IN THE WRN MOST WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORY...INDICATED LITTLE TO NO SNOW ACCUMULATIONS YET. LIGHT 
DRIZZLE OVERNIGHT AT CHA WITH BLEDSOE COUNTY ALSO HAVING MOSTLY 
LIGHT RAIN. THUS...WILL CARRY A PRE-FIRST PERIOD WITH HIGH POPS THEN 
TREND INTO PREVIOUS POP GRIDS FOR TODAY. COORDINATED WITH HUN AND 
OHX ON ENDING THE CST WSW AT 10 AM EST. 

AFTER 12Z TODAY...THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS MOVES SE OF THE REGION 
IN THE AFTERNOON. BEST LIFT SHOULD BE FOCUSED OVER THE SMOKY MTNS 
WHERE A BRIEF PERIOD OF LINGERING INSTABILITY AND NW UPSLOPE FLOW 
OCCURS. WILL KEEP A SWATH OF LIKELY OR SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS FOR THE 
SMOKIES AND THAT WSW GOING THRU 6 PM EST. ENDING SW VA WSW AT 1 PM 
EST AS CURRENT...BUT DAY SHIFT COULD OPT TO END THAT ONE EARLIER. 

FOR TEMPS...GOING ABOUT 2 TO 3 DEGREES BELOW THE GFS MOS HIGHS...
WHICH IS CLOSER TO A MOS BLEND. FOR MINS...WRN MOST AREAS INCLUDING 
CHA MIGHT CLEAR OUT IN THE 06Z TO 12Z PERIOD SUNDAY...WHILE CLOUDS 
COULD HOLD IN OVER REMAINING AREAS. THIS LED ME TO GO CLOSER TO THE 
MILDER NAM MOS MINS EXCEPT FOR CHA. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...DEEP TROUGH LINGERS OVER THE
SE STATES INCLUDING THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY BUT HIGH PRESSURE WILL
MAKE FOR SUNNY SKIES AND SOME WARMING SOUTH BUT ABOUT THE SAME
CENTRAL AND NORTH. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 10 TO 15 DEGREES BELOW
NORMAL. THE COLD SURFACE HIGH WILL FINALLY SHIFT EAST SUNDAY NIGHT
WITH RIDGING ALOFT MONDAY AND A WARMING TREND AFTER ANOTHER COLD
NIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT WITH LOWS IN THE 20S EVEN COLDER MOUNTAINS. 

MONDAY NEXT LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL SLOWLY
SHIFT EAST INTO THE MS VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT WITH WARM FRONT
EXTENDING TO THE EAST OVER THE TN VALLEY. CLOUDS INCREASE WITH RAIN
MOVING INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND ALL AREAS
TUESDAY. COLD AIR MASS WITH WRAP AROUND ON BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM
TO PRODUCE SOME SNOW FOR AT LEAST THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHERN
SECTIONS. SNOWFALL AMOUNTS MAY BE ONLY A TRACE IN THE VALLEYS BUT A
FEW INCHES POSSIBLE IN THE MOUNTAINS. THURSDAY AND FRIDAY HIGH
PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN WITH WARMING TEMPERATURES. HIGHS FRIDAY
BACK TO THE 50S TO LOWER 60S.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
357 PM EST FRI MAR 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SLOW PROGRESSION OF PRESENT 
SYSTEM WITH PERIODS OF LIGHT SNOW AT TIMES OVER VARIED SECTIONS OF 
THE AREA.  SECTION NUMBER ONE...WILL ISSUE WINTER ADVISORY FOR SWRN 
SECTIONS FOR HIGHER TERRAIN ON PLATEAU AS LIFT AND UNSTABLE AIR 
MOVES SWD OVER THE AREA.  THINK THE SRN PLATEAU WILL GET AROUND AN 
INCH WITH ISOLATED AMOUNTS APPROACHING 2 INCHES.  OVER WISE... 
RUSSELL AND LEE VA...STEADY STREAM OF WEAK LIFT WILL EVENTUALLY GET 
A COUPLE OF INCHES IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. AND FINALLY IN THE E TN 
MOUNTAINS...OVERNIGHT THE AMOUNTS WILL LIKELY BE LIGHT...BUT UPSLOPE 
OF MOIST AND SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE AIR WILL LIKELY GET 2-4 INCHES IN THE 
MOUNTAINS.  FOR VALLEY LOCATIONS...MOST AREAS WILL STRUGGLE TO GET A 
DUSTING...AND WITH TEMPERATURES JUST HOVERING AROUND FREEZING 
OVERNIGHT...WOULD EXPECT ROADS TO MOSTLY JUST GET WET.  FOR 
TEMPERATURES...WILL STAY ON COLD SIDE ON MAX TEMPS THROUGH SATURDAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WITH CURRENT SYSTEM 
DEPARTING...LINGERING PRECIP WILL OCCUR SATURDAY NIGHT. DRY WEATHER 
IS IN STORE FOR SUNDAY...WITH HIGHER ELEVATION RAIN SHOWERS RESUMING 
MONDAY AFTERNOON. NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM ENTERS THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT 
AND TUESDAY...A LITTLE WARMER WITH SW FLOW ALOFT AHEAD OF THE 
TROUGH...SO PRECIP TYPES WILL VARY WITH HEIGHT...WITH BRIEF ICE 
POSSIBLE IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS EARLY TUESDAY WHICH WILL QUICKLY MELT 
OFF. WITH PASSAGE OF TROUGH...RAIN WILL MIX WITH SNOW RATHER THAN 
ICE BEFORE THE EVENT ENDS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WE WILL THEN FINALLY GET 
A WARM SPELL IN TIME FOR LATE WEEK WHICH WILL PERSIST INTO NEXT 
WEEKEND.

.DISCUSSION...
LIGHT SNOW FIGHTING WITH RELATIVELY WARM TEMPERATURES
TODAY...EXPECTED TO RESULT IN LITTLE IF ANY IMPACTS THIS AFTERNOON.
TEMPERATURES ARE AT OR ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA. SO
STILL NOT PLANNING TO ISSUE AN ADVISORY AT THIS POINT. DEEPER
MOISTURE AND A LITTLE MORE INSTABILITY ARE EXPECTED THIS
AFTERNOON...BUT STILL EXPECTING SNOW AMOUNTS TO STAY BELOW
ADVISORY CRITERIA. THINKING NORTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES MAY GET A
HALF INCH OR SO. WITH THAT BEING SAID...HAVE RAISE POPS OVER
WESTERN AND NORTHERN SECTIONS...AS CHANCES OF MEASURING .01 LIQUID
ARE PRETTY GOOD. WEAK WIND FIELD NOT SUPPORTING GOOD UPSLOPE
EITHER. 

TEMPERATURES AND WINDS LOOK GOOD AS-IS...SO KEEPING MAX TEMPS THE
SAME TODAY.

189 
FXUS64 KMRX 010921
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
421 AM EST FRI MAR 1 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AREA RADARS NOT SHOWING 
MUCH IN THE WAY OF PRECIPITATION THIS MORNING...ALTHO SURFACE 
OBSERVATIONS INDICATE SOME FLURRIES AT TYS AND TRI. NW CYCLONIC FLOW 
AND COLD AIR ADVECTION PERSIST...BUT FORCING IS RATHER WEAK AT THIS 
TIME. FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW SOME POSITIVE CAPE THIS MORNING AND 
AFTERNOON...BUT THE LOW LEVEL WINDS ARE MORE WEST THAN NORTHWEST AND 
NOT THAT STRONG (SO UPSLOPE FLOW SHOULD BE WEAK). ALSO...SURFACE 
TEMPS WILL INHIBIT MOST SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. TOTAL SNOW GRID FOR NEXT 
36 HOURS VARIES FROM TRACE TO ISOLATED SPOTS OF 2 INCHES IN THE 
HIGHEST TERRAIN...SO NO WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES NEEDED. 

KEPT THE LIKELY POPS ACROSS NRN 2/3RDS AS IN PREVIOUS GRIDS...AND 
LIKELY AGAIN TONIGHT OVER NRN/SMOKY MTNS PLUS UPSLOPE AREAS OF SW 
VA. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS MOVES ESE ACROSS AND OUT OF THE SRN 
APPALACHIANS BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON...BUT AGAIN FORCING LOOKS WEAK 
WITH TEMPS GENERALLY TOO WARM TO AID SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. THUS...I 
KEPT JUST CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY AND LOWERED THE LIGHT SNOW 
AMOUNTS FOR SATURDAY. 

CLOUDS AND COLD AIR HAVE KEPT THE RANGE FROM MIN TO MAX TEMP SMALL. 
THIS WILL BE THE PATTERN AGAIN...SO UNDERCUT MAX TEMPS BOTH TODAY 
AND SATURDAY. WENT A FEW DEGREES ABOVE THE GFS MOS MINS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD UPPER TROUGH
HAS MOSTLY PUSHED THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY NIGHT.
HOWEVER WEAK SHORTWAVES MAY STILL PRODUCE A LITTLE LIGHT SNOW OVER
THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS SATURDAY NIGHT AND IN THE
MOUNTAINS SUNDAY MORNING. SKIES SUNDAY NIGHT WILL BE PARTLY TO
MOSTLY CLOUDY AND TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S. SUNDAY HIGHER PRESSURE
BUILDS IN BUT COLD NORTH TO NW FLOW ALOFT TO BRING DOWN COLD AIR
MASS WITH TEMPERATURES JUST A FEW DEGREES WARMER SOUTH THAN
SATURDAY AND ABOUT THE SAME NORTH AS SATURDAY. SUNDAY NIGHT AND
MONDAY FLOW BECOMES MORE WESTERLY. CLEAR AND COLD SUNDAY NIGHT AND
A LITTLE WARMER MONDAY. NW FLOW PATTERN RESUMES MONDAY NIGHT AND
BRINGS ONE SYSTEM THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH RAIN
INITIALLY AND A CHANCE OF SNOW BEHIND IT FOLLOWED BY A TUESDAY
NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY SYSTEM REINFORCING THE COLD AIR MASS WITH RAIN
AND A CHANCE OF SNOW. HIGHER PRESSURE WITH RIDGING ALOFT BUILDS IN
THURSDAY WITH WARMING TEMPERATURES AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.
&&

CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED 
OFF THE NEW ENGLAND COAST...WHICH WAS COVERING MOST OF THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION WITH CLOUDS AND LIGHT PRECIP. AREA RADARS REVEAL 
SOME LIGHT SNOW OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS...WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED 
WITH A BROAD BUT WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE THAT WAS SLOWLY SINKING 
SOUTHWARD. IT APPEARS THAT ANY PRECIP TONIGHT WILL BE VERY LIGHT AS 
THIS UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL 
PLAN TO LOWER POPS FOR TONIGHT IN MOST AREAS. ANY ACCUMULATIONS OF 
SNOW WILL LIKELY BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 
FEET...WHERE ONLY UP TO AN INCH APPEARS POSSIBLE. WILL ALSO PLAN TO 
TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE ACCORDING TO THE LATEST TRENDS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   32  42  33  44  29 /  20  30  40  40  10 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     31  40  32  42  28 /  50  60  50  40  10

848 
FXUS64 KMRX 282042
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
342 PM EST THU FEB 28 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...ANOTHER ROUND OF LIGHT SNOW
SHOULD MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE TONIGHT AND INTO FRIDAY...AS COLD LOW
LEVEL MOISTURE AND SLIGHT INSTABILITY SWALLOW UP THE AREA. THE
ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE LIGHT AS THE TEMPERATURES REMAIN RELATIVELY
WARM AND SNOW WILL BE LIGHT AS DENTRITIC TEMPERATURES ARE BARELY
TAPPED INTO. FOR TEMPERATURES...OVERNIGHT MIN TEMPS LOOKED
GOOD...BUT MAX TEMPS FRIDAY LOOKED FAR TOO WARM...WILL GO AT LEAST
ONE CATEGORY BELOW GUIDANCE OVER ENTIRE AREA. THINK MOST PRECIP
DURING THE DAY FRIDAY WILL BE SNOW. THINK SLOW SNOWFALL RATES WILL
KEEP ACCUMULATIONS BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD AIR WILL BE IN 
PLACE FOR SEVERAL DAYS AS OUR UPPER TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE WILL BE 
REINFORCED BY NEW DISTURBANCES. NOT A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF MOISTURE 
TO WORK WITH BUT ENOUGH TO YIELD OCCASIONAL LIGHT SNOW OR LIGHT 
RAIN...WITH SOME LIGHT ADVISORY TYPE ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE FRIDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH MIDDAY SATURDAY...MOSTLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 
THEN WE WILL GET A DAY OR SO OF FAIR WEATHER BEFORE THE NEXT SYSTEM 
ARRIVES...ALTHOUGH THE PRESENT COLD AIR WILL HAVE DEPARTED BY THEN. 
THE MODELS SEEMED TO BE IN FAIR AGREEMENT UNTIL THE 12Z ECMWF CAME 
IN...IT IS NOW SLOWER WITH THIS SYSTEM WITH PRECIP LINGERING TIL 
THURSDAY MORNING. OUR FORECAST WILL KEEP POPS IN THROUGH THE DAY 
WEDNESDAY AT THIS TIME. THE TRACK OF THIS MID WEEK LOW MAY BE KEY TO 
A MORE SIGNIFICANT WINTER WEATHER PUNCH AS OPPOSED TO THE MOSTLY 
LIGHT AND DRAWN OUT WINTRY WEATHER THAT WILL END THE CURRENT WEEK.

TEMPERATURES ARE A BIT OF A CHALLENGE AS MOS FOR TODAY WAS TOO 
HIGH...SEEMS MOS FOR FRIDAY IS GONNA BE TO HIGH...THUS I CARRIED 
THAT INTO THE WEEKEND WITH UNDERCUTTING OF MOS MAX TEMPS. NEXT WEEKS 
SYSTEM WILL ALSO BE TOUGH ON THE TEMP FORECAST GIVEN THE TIMING AND 
PLACEMENT OF THE LOW AND PRECIPITATION. LEANED TOWARD COOLER THAN 
MOS MAX TEMPS DURING NEXT WEEKS EVENT.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

237 AM EST THU FEB 28 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE IN THE WEATHER 
PATTERN THROUGH THE SHORT TERM WITH AN UPPER LOW REMAINING IN PLACE 
TO OUR NORTH...ROTATING A SERIES OF WEAK DISTURBANCES THROUGH THE 
REGION.  CURRENT WAVE MOVING THROUGH THE AREA AND GENERATING 
SCATTERED LIGHT PRECIP WILL PULL OUT OF THE AREA MID MORNING.  A 
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT UNTIL 15Z FOR HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS.  THE LIGHT COVERAGE SHOULD DECREASE DURING THE 
AFTERNOON...THOUGH LOW CLOUD COVER WILL REMAIN IN PLACE.  
ADDITIONALLY...THE WIND FIELD CONTINUES TO WEAKEN OVER THE 
AREA...BUT WILL SEE ANOTHER DAY OF LOCALLY BREEZY AND GUSTY 
CONDITIONS.  THE NEXT DISTURBANCE MOVES THROUGH TONIGHT WHICH WILL 
BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF LIGHT PRECIP.  SCATTERED RAIN WILL TRANSITION 
TO SNOW ACROSS LOWER ELEVATIONS OVERNIGHT WITH LITTLE TO NO 
ACCUMULATIONS.  MOSTLY SNOW EXPECTED AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE.  FAVORED NORTHWEST FLOW LOCATIONS COULD SEE 
1 TO 2 INCHES.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN FAIR 
AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY HAS ALSO BEEN DECENT...LEADING 
TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE AVERAGE FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THIS TIME OF 
YEAR.  UPPER TROUGH WILL BE SLOWLY TRAVERSING THE AREA EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD...WITH CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE OVER THE AREA.  DESPITE THE COLD 
ADVECTION PATTERN AND SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE...APPEARS NORTHWEST LOW 
LEVEL FLOW WILL BE TOO WEAK FOR STRONG OROGRAPHIC LIFT...SO WILL 
JUST CONTINUE TO CARRY CHANCE POPS VALLEYS AND LOW LIKELY MOUNTAINS 
FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...THEN WILL LOWER POPS SAT NIGHT AND GO 
DRY BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE MAINLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN EACH PERIOD THROUGH SAT 
NIGHT...AND WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION IN THE HWO. SHOULD BE DRY 
MONDAY...THEN THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL APPROACH BY TUESDAY.  WILL 
UNDERCUT GFS MOS HIGH TEMPS FRI THROUGH SUNDAY...OTHERWISE WILL 
GENERALLY NOT STRAY FAR.

664 
FXUS64 KMRX 272030
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST WED FEB 27 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...A SERIES OF SHORT-
WAVES WILL ROTATE AROUND BROAD UPPER LOW CENTERED ACROSS THE LOWER
GREAT LAKES. FIRST WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS EARLY THIS EVENING WITH
RADAR ALREADY SHOWING AN AREA OF LIGHT PRECIPITATION OVER BNA. THIS
WAVE WILL PRODUCE LIGHT RAIN (LIGHT SNOW HIGHER ELEVATIONS)...BUT THE
MAIN WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS OVERNIGHT WITH COLD AIR ALOFT ASSOCIATED
WITH SYSTEM. STEEPENING LOW-LEVEL LAPSE RATES AND WESTERLY UPSLOPE
FLOW. PRECIPITATION WILL ONCE AGAIN DEVELOP WITH RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS.
TEMPERATURE PROFILE BECOMES COLD ENOUGH FOR ALL SNOW AT OR ABOVE
2500 FEET WITH ACCUMULATIONS UP TO 2 INCHES ANTICIPATED.

MODELS SHOW THE SYSTEM MOVING EAST OF THE AREA THURSDAY MORNING.
NEXT WAVE MOVING INTO THE REGION FOR THURSDAY NIGHT. NORTHWEST
OROGRAPHIC FLOW STRENGTHENS..SO ANTICIPATE LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS TO
INCREASE IN COVERAGE/INTENSITY. ANOTHER 2 INCHES OF SNOW
ACCUMULATION POSSIBLE FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
ON FRIDAY AND LINGER THROUGHOUT THE WEEKEND...PROMOTING COLDER TEMPS 
AND THE POTENTIAL FOR NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWERS /PARTICULARLY 
FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY/. ON FRIDAY...COLDER AIR WILL SPILL INTO 
THE REGION AS WINDS ALOFT SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST. THE NAM CONTINUES 
TO SHOW MORE SPOTTY QPF SIGNALS ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY...BEFORE 
EXPANDING THEM FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY AS AS MOISTURE/LIFT RAMPS UP. 
THE GFS IS A LITTLE MORE AGGRESSIVE SHOWING MORE WIDESPREAD AND 
PERSISTENT PRECIPITATION LINGERING THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT AND INTO 
THE DAY ON SUNDAY...MAINLY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS. WITH WESTERLIES AT 
THE SURFACE PREVAILING DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY...THINK THAT 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT SNOW SHOWERS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN MAY BE 
MITIGATED SOMEWHAT...WHILE IN THE VALLEY RAIN SHOWERS WILL BE 
LIKELY GIVEN THE EXPECTED WARMER TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S THERE. 

HOWEVER...AS SURFACE WINDS VEER TO THE NORTHWEST FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY SOME HEAVIER SNOW SHOWERS WILL CERTAINLY BE POSSIBLE ALONG 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN...AND TEMPERATURES IN THE VALLEY WILL BE COLD 
ENOUGH TO SUPPORT A DUSTING TO PERHAPS UP TO HALF INCH OF SNOW IN 
SOME SPOTS BY SATURDAY NIGHT AS WELL. WILL PROBABLY NEED TO THINK 
ABOUT A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE MTNS AND PERHAPS PARTS OF 
FAR NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTH FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY 
MORNING...BUT GIVEN THAT THIS IS STILL 2-3 DAYS OUT AND THE 
UNCERTAINTIES IN THE DURATION OF THE SNOW SHOWERS AND THE TOTAL 
SNOWFALL WILL CERTAINLY HOLD OFF ON ISSUING ANYTHING ATTM. THOUGH 
THE PRECIP SHOULD BE TAPERING OFF BY SUNDAY...IT WILL LIKELY BE A 
VERY COLD DAY WITH HIGHS STRUGGLING TO CLIMB MUCH ABOVE THE MID 30S 
TO THE 40 DEGREE MARK. 

THEREAFTER...A BRIEF WARMUP IS EXPECTED EARLY NEXT WEEK AS AN 
UPPER-RIDGE AXIS SCOOTS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...RETURNING HIGHS 
BACK INTO THE 50S BEFORE THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM MOVES INTO THE AREA 
LATE TUESDAY INTO MIDWEEK. MODELS DIFFER QUITE A BIT WITH THE 
TIMING/TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM SO HAVE REMAINED CAUTIOUS ON ADJUSTING 
POPS TOO MUCH IN THIS PERIOD AND WILL WAIT FOR LATER MODEL RUNS TO 
BETTER DIAGNOSE THIS PART OF THE FORECAST.      

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
238 AM EST WED FEB 27 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW TO OUR NORTH WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE THE MAIN WEATHER INFLUENCE THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.  A 
FEW LIGHT SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING AS A WEAK 
WAVE ROTATING AROUND THE LOW EXITS THE AREA.  HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
COULD SEE A FEW FLURRIES AS THIS PULLS AWAY.  THE PRESSURE GRADIENT 
REMAINS TIGHT ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION AND WHILE WINDS 
ARE EXPECTED TO STAY BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA...WILL SEE CONTINUED 
BREEZY AND GUSTY WINDS THROUGHOUT THE DAY.  ANOTHER SHORT WAVE WILL 
MOVE THROUGH THE AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT...BRINGING 
ANOTHER ROUND OF RAIN AND SNOW.  RAIN WILL MIX WITH AND EVEN CHANGE 
OVER TO SNOW OVERNIGHT EVEN AT SOME VALLEY FLOOR LOCATIONS.  PRECIP 
SHOULD BE LIGHT ENOUGH FOR LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATIONS.  
HOWEVER...MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OF LESS THAN AN INCH IS POSSIBLE OVER 
FAVORED NORTHWEST FACING SLOPES OF THE MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT OVERALL AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN FAIR...SO 
FORECAST CONFIDENCE FOR THE LONG TERM IS A BIT ABOVE AVERAGE FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR.  UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL LINGER OVER THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION FOR MUCH OF THE PERIOD.  A REINFORCING UPPER LOW 
WILL DROP INTO THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY AS WELL.  APPEARS 
WE WILL BE IN FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF COLDER THAN NORMAL 
CONDITIONS WITH SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE AROUND...AND RAIN SHOWERS AND 
SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE IN THE FORECAST FOR THE THU NIGHT THROUGH 
SUNDAY PERIOD.  APPEARS PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE 
OVERALL. WHILE SOME ENHANCEMENT IS EXPECTED FROM UPSLOPE FLOW THE 
FLOW STARTS OUT A BIT TOO WESTERLY TO BE IDEAL...AND ONCE IT TURNS 
MORE NORTHWEST THE LOW LEVEL FLOW IS EXPECTED TO BE LIGHTER THAN 
IDEAL.  UPSHOT IS WHILE SOME SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS CAN BE 
EXPECTED OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN DUE TO THE EXTENDED NATURE OF THE 
PRECIP...ACCUMULATIONS IN ANY GIVEN PERIOD ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE 
HEAVY.  WILL MENTION SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN IN THE 
HWO. SHOULD BE DRY MONDAY...THEN ANOTHER SYSTEM MAY BRING PRECIP
CHANCES BACK BY TUESDAY. WILL GENERALLY UNDERCUT GFS MOS TEMPS
SIGNIFICANTLY FOR HIGHS THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...OTHERWISE WILL
NOT STRAY FAR.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             52  35  47  33  46 /  20  20  20  20  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  33  45  33  44 /  20  40  30  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  33  45  33  44 /  20  40  30  30  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              45  30  42  31  42 /  30  70  40  40  50

924 
FXUS64 KMRX 262027
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST TUE FEB 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...LOW PRESSURE AREA HAS 
BROADENED THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY. PRESSURE GRADIENT 
HAS RELAXED ACROSS WESTERN AREAS AND IS STILL QUITE GUSTY OVER SW VA 
AND EXTREME NE TN. TEMPERATURES VARY WIDELY WITH 40S IN THE 
MOUNTAINS TO UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S IN THE VALLEYS WHERE WINDS HAVE 
BEEN GUSTY. BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS GAVE SOME AREAS SOME SUN DURING THE 
DAY WHICH ALONG WITH THE WIND GAVE TEMPERATURES A BOOST. RAIN 
SHOWERS HAVE DECREASED RAPIDLY WITH THE ONLY AREA NOW WEST AND NORTH 
OF MRX MOVING TOWARDS KY. LOW PRESSURE AREA AND UPPER LOW ACROSS OH 
VALLEY WILL CONTINUE TO SHIFT NE TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES THE NEXT 24 
HOURS WITH COUNTER CLOCKWISE FLOW AROUND THE LOW EVENTUALLY BRINGING 
MORE CLOUDS BACK INTO THE REGION WITH COLDER TEMPERATURES. RAIN 
SHOWERS WILL BE MOST NUMEROUS OVER THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...NORTHERN 
VALLEY AND SW VA THROUGH WEDNESDAY. SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE 
OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AS FREEZING 
LEVELS DROP TO AROUND 2000 FEET. TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY WILL BE IN 
THE UPPER 30S AND LOWER 40S HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO NEAR 50 ELSEWHERE. 
WINDS WILL BE GUSTY OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST AS WELL.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A BROAD UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION AND 
LINGERING THROUGH THE WEEKEND CREATING BELOW NORMAL TEMPS AND 
SCATTERED RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS EACH DAY. THIS UPPER TROUGH IS 
PROGGED TO FURTHER AMPLIFY ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...BRINGING A 
SLIGHTLY BETTER COVERAGE OF RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS AREAWIDE...BUT WITH 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT FAVORING THE UPSLOPE (NORTHWEST-FACING) SLOPES 
OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS 
GUIDANCE THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1051 AM EST TUE FEB 26 2013

.DISCUSSION...DEEP LOW PRESSURE AREA MAKING A SLOW TRACK NORTH
THROUGH EASTERN MO THIS MORNING WITH HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS MID
ATLANTIC COAST. PRESSURE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN SYSTEM CREATING STRONG
LOW LEVEL JET ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH WINDS FROM THE SOUTH AND
SOUTHEAST GUSTING TO ABOUT 35 MPH IN THE VALLEYS AND AROUND 60 MPH
AT THE PREFERRED MOUNTAIN WAVE LOCATIONS AT THIS TIME. WINDS NOT
QUITE AS STRONG AS EXPECTED ALTHOUGH MODELS SHOWING PEAK TIME FOR
THE WIND GUSTS ABOUT NOW OVER THE SMOKIES AND A FEW HOURS LATER IN
SW VA. ADJUSTED POPS DOWN AS STEADY RAIN SHOWERS HAVE MOVED INTO
FAR NORTHEAST SECTIONS. TEMPERATURES COOLER THAN FORECAST AT THIS
HOUR SO DROPPED HIGHS SLIGHTLY WEST. WHERE THE SUN HAS COME OUT
TEMPERATURES HAVE ALREADY REACHED THE 50S WITH CHEROKEE COUNTY IN
SW VA ALREADY ALMOST 60. EXPECT HIGHS MAY BE REACHED EARLY WEST AS
COLD FRONT NOW APPROACHING MIDDLE TN MOVES THROUGH THE PLATEAU
COUNTIES. COLD AIR ADVECTION ON BACK SIDE OF BROAD LOW PRESSURE
AREA MAY START TEMPERATURES FALLING THIS AFTERNOON ON THE PLATEAU.

006 
FXUS64 KMRX 260745
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EST TUE FEB 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
LIFT NORTHEAST FROM THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TOWARD THE SOUTHERN GREAT 
LAKES REGION DURING THE SHORT TERM.  MAIN BAND OF RAIN WILL LIFT 
NORTHEAST AND OUT OF THE AREA...BUT SOME SHOWERS EXPECTED TO 
LINGER.  COLDER AIR WILL BE PUSHING IN LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT 
WHILE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL LINGER TONIGHT FLOW NOT FAVORABLE FOR 
UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS...SO WILL JUST CONTINUE THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR TONIGHT ALL ZONES. HIGH WIND THREAT WILL CONTINUE FOR THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AND FOOTHILLS THIS MORNING INTO EARLY AFTERNOON WITH 
STRONG SOUTH TO SOUTHEAST FLOW AND MOUNTAIN WAVE ENHANCEMENT.  WILL 
CONTINUE HIGH WIND WARNING.  WILL ALSO CONTINUE WIND ADVISORY FOR 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF THE PLATEAU AND WESTERN PORTION OF SW VA.  

.LONG TERM  (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WILL BE IN A RATHER ACTIVE 
WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  A BROAD UPPER TROUGH 
WILL REMAIN IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION.  THIS WILL KEEP THE MRX CWA 
IN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT...WHICH WILL CONTINUE TO BRING IN 
SEASONALLY COOL AIR.  A SERIES OF WEATHER DISTURBANCES MOVING THOUGH 
THE UPPER TROUGH WILL TRACK ACROSS THE AREA AND PROVIDE OCCASIONAL 
BANDS OF SHOWERS OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.  A MIX OF 
RAIN AND SNOW IS EXPECTED WITH THE BEST CHANCE OF MEASURABLE SNOW IN 
THE NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE LOCATIONS.  HIGH PRESSURE IS CURRENTLY 
PROGGED TO BUILD IN FOR MONDAY.

&&

126 
FXUS64 KMRX 260119
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
819 PM EST MON FEB 25 2013

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED ZONES AND NPW TO INCLUDE SULLIVAN COUNTY
(PRIMARILY FAR EASTERN PART OF SULLIVAN COUNTY NEAR THE MOUNTAINS
AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS) INTO THE HIGH WIND WARNING. LOOKING AT THE
LOCAL 4KM MODEL...SHOWS VERY STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS OF 60 TO 70 MPH
BY EARLY TUESDAY MORNING. ALSO...INCLUDED WESTERN POLK COUNTY INTO
THE WIND ADVISORY.

AN OCCLUDED FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER WILL MOVE
TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING. SURFACE
BASED INSTABILITY IS NO EXISTANT...BUT NAM/GFS SOUNDINGS SHOW
ELEVATED CAPE ABOVE 850MB. MODELS SHOW BETWEEN 250-500 J/KG OF MOST
UNSTABLE CAPE FOR CHA AND TYS LATE TONIGHT/TUESDAY MORNING...SO HAVE
CONTINUED FORECAST OF CHANCE OF STORMS. A STRONG STORM IS NOT OUT
OF THE QUESTION DUE TO THE STRONG UPPER DYNAMICS IN THE FORM OF JET
DYNAMICS...FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING AND ISENTROPIC LIFT.

UPDATED FORECAST HAS BEEN SENT.

927 
FXUS64 KMRX 252030
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST MON FEB 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...FORECAST AREA IS STILL BEING 
INFLUENCED BY HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MID ATLANTIC THIS 
AFTERNOON. MID AND HIGH CLOUDS HAVE THINNED AND TEMPERATURES HAVE 
FINALLY RISEN TO THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S AT THIS HOUR. BIG CHANGES 
TONIGHT AS DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE AREA NOW OVER THE ARK-LA-TEX MOVES 
NE TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. THE 
LARGE PRESSURE DIFFERENCE WILL INDUCE STRONG SE TO SOUTH WINDS ALOFT 
WITH HIGH WINDS EXPECTED IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN FOOTHILLS AND 
MOUNTAINS. WIND SPEEDS OF 30 TO 40 MPH WITH GUSTS OF 60 TO 80 MPH 
ARE LIKELY IN THE MOUNTAIN WAVE FAVORED LOCATIONS LATE THIS EVENING 
THROUGH EARLY AFTERNOON TUESDAY. THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST NC MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS LEE AND WISE COUNTIES ARE 
EXPECTED TO HAVE HIGHER WINDS TOO AND HAVE WIND GUSTS OF 40 TO 50 
MPH.

HAVE SLOWED THE RAIN PROGRESSION SLIGHTLY WITH BEST CHANCE LATER 
TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. THERE WILL BE A BRIEF PERIOD OF 
HEAVY RAIN BUT A DRY SLOT WILL COME IN SOUTH OF THE SURFACE LOW SO 
RAIN WILL TAPER OFF FROM SW TO NE DURING THE DAY TUESDAY. RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS LOOK TO AVERAGE ABOUT ONE HALF TO ONE INCH BY TUESDAY 
EVENING. DEW POINTS ARE STILL RATHER LOW SO TEMPERATURES WILL FALL 
SEVERAL DEGREES LATER TONIGHT AS THE RAIN BEGINS. TEMPERATURES MAY 
ACTUALLY RISE AROUND DAY BREAK AS WINDS INCREASE. LOWERED HIGHS A 
FEW DEGREES TUESDAY WITH MOST LOCATIONS IN THE 50S BUT LOWER IN THE 
MOUNTAINS. WITH THE STRONG WIND FIELD BUT VERY LOW INSTABILITY 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE LATE TONIGHT IN THE SW AND DURING 
THE DAY TUESDAY FARTHER NE AS UPPER LOW AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW 
MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY LATE IN THE DAY.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A BROAD UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION AND 
LINGERING THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS STAGNANT PATTERN WILL CREATE 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...RESULTING IN BELOW NORMAL TEMPS AND A PERSISTENT CHANCE OF 
RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS AS SEVERAL SHORT WAVES ROTATE THROUGH THE LONG 
WAVE UPPER TROUGH. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND COOLER THAN THE GFS 
GUIDANCE THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT 
WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

ZONES. MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT STILL LOOKS PROBABLE LATE TONIGHT AND

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST MON FEB 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL LIFT NORTHEAST OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY DURING THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE AHEAD 
OF THIS SYSTEM...WITH RAIN ARRIVING BY THIS EVENING SOUTH AND THEN 
SPREADING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA.  LOW LEVEL JET 
WILL BECOME VERY STRONG FROM THE SOUTHEAST AND SOUTH...AND APPEARS 
THAT CONDITIONS WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR A MOUNTAIN WAVE WIND EVENT 
TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY IN THE USUAL AREAS...AND IT COULD BE A HIGHER 
END EVENT.  WILL UPGRADE THE HIGH WIND WATCH TO A HIGH WIND WARNING. 
INSTABILITY LOOKS QUITE LIMITED...BUT MAY BE ENOUGH ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY FOR A FEW RUMBLES SOUTHWEST ZONES TONIGHT...SO WILL 
CONTINUE MENTION OF SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER THERE.  RAIN SHOWERS 
WILL TAPER OFF TUESDAY AS THE MAIN FORCING LIFTS NORTHEAST OF OUR 
AREA.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION MAY NOT SEE AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE FOR QUITE SOME TIME DUE TO A 
VERY BLOCKED UP PATTERN. THE DEEP UPPER LOW WILL LUMBER VERY SLOWLY 
NORTHEAST UP THE OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY WHILE A 
SHORT WAVE TROUGH BUILDS INTO THE REGION LATER WEDNESDAY INTO 
THURSDAY FOLLOWED BY YET ANOTHER FEATURE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. IN 
THE LOW LEVELS THE HEIGHT GRADIENT REMAINS FAIRLY TIGHT WITH WEST 
THROUGH NORTHERLY FLOW...PRODUCING COLD AIR ADVECTION SEEMINGLY 
FOREVER. IN THIS COLD REGIME SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE PREVALENT IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN IN UPSLOPE FASHION AND WILL BE PRESENT AT TIMES MIXED 
WITH RAIN ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY...ESPECIALLY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. IN THIS COLD PATTERN HAD TO 
ADJUST MAX/MIN TEMPS BELOW GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

FXUS64 KMRX 242028
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EST SUN FEB 24 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SHORTWAVE RIDGING WILL
PERSIST OVERNIGHT. EXPECT MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WITH INCREASING
CLOUDS THROUGH SUNRISE. LEANED TOWARD THE WARMER MAV GUIDANCE
NUMBERS. DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGH AT LEAST NOON FOR
ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA. THERE ARE SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES IN
THE LATEST MODEL DATA IN REGARDS TO THE ONSET OF RAINFALL AND
COLUMN SATURATION. WHILE RAINFALL AMOUNTS AFTER 18Z WILL GENERALLY
BE NEAR ONE HUNDREDTH OF AN INCH WITH THE ONSET OCCURRING IN FAR
SOUTHERN/SOUTHWESTERN AREAS SUCH AS CHATTANOOGA. THE MODEL
DIFFERENCES IN TIMING WERE ENOUGH TO DROP CONFIDENCE IN RAIN
STARTING EARLIER THAN 00Z AND ONLY MADE MINOR CHANGES TO THE
PREVIOUS POP FORECAST MONDAY AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE
SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MONDAY EVENING THEN
ACROSS THE LOWER MS VALLEY INTO THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY AND
THEN THE GREAT LAKES TUESDAY NIGHT. A STRONG SE FLOW OVER THE
MOUNTAINS WILL INCREASE WINDS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH
DAMAGING WINDS POSSIBLE LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY IN THE
MOUNTAIN WAVE PRONE AREAS. A HIGH WIND WATCH IS BEING ISSUED THIS
AFTERNOON. WITH THE STRONG WIND FIELDS A FEW THUNDERSTORMS MAY
DEVELOP OVERNIGHT BUT OVERALL THE AIR MASS WILL BE FAIRLY STABLE. A
DRY SLOT WILL FORM IN THE DEVELOPING SYSTEM AS IT MOVES NORTH
TUESDAY SO RAIN WILL DECREASE FROM SOUTH TO NORTH. A COLDER AIR
MASS FILTERS IN AS WELL WITH A SMALL AMOUNT OF SNOW POSSIBLE EARLY
WEDNESDAY MAINLY IN SW VA MOUNTAINS. THE BROAD SURFACE LOW AND
ASSOCIATED UPPER LOW WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES WEDNESDAY AND
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THEN INTO THE NE STATES THURSDAY. RAIN SHOWERS WILL
BE MOSTLY NORTH WEDNESDAY THEN AS SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATES AROUND
THE UPPER LOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY THERE WILL BE RAIN AND
SNOW SHOWERS. AS AN UPPER TROUGH SETS UP OVER THE EASTERN STATES
NORTHERLY FLOW WILL BRING DOWN MORE IMPULSES WITH CHANCES OF SNOW
THROUGH AT LEAST SATURDAY. KEPT SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW BUT TEMPERATURES
WILL REMAIN COLD AS TROUGH PERSISTS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN TODAY 
AND WILL CONTROL OUR WEATHER THROUGH TONIGHT.  WILL SEE PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE TODAY...WITH JUST AN INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS TONIGHT AHEAD 
OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SO JUST A FEW MINOR 
TWEAKS.    

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...AN INTENSIFYING STORM SYSTEM 
WILL PRESS SLOWLY NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE LOWER 
OHIO VALLEY FROM 12Z MONDAY TO 12Z TUESDAY. MODELS CONTINUE TO BACK 
OFF ON SHOWERS DEVELOPING OVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA PRIOR TO 
00Z TUESDAY SO MADE THESE ADJUSTMENTS AWAITING THE MAIN EVENT MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DRAWS MOIST AIR 
FROM THE PACIFIC AND THE GULF OF MEXICO. CRANKED UP THE POPS A BIT 
MORE THROUGH TUESDAY AS THE LOW SHIFTS SLOWLY NORTHEAST TO THE UPPER 
OHIO VALLEY BY 12Z WEDNESDAY. ALSO...LOOKS LIKE ANOTHER MOUNTAIN 
WAVE EVENT MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING WITH A 65-70 KT LOW 
LEVEL JET PROGGED ACROSS THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER PERPENDICULAR TO 
THE AXIS OF THE APPALACHIANS. THE UPPER LOW IS IN NO HURRY TO MOVE 
OUT. THE PRESSURE SYSTEM LOOKS LIKE IT WILL TAKE ANOTHER 48 HRS TO 
MAKE IT OFF THE NORTHEASTERN U.S. COAST. SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND 
SHORT WAVE LIFT WILL BE AVAILABLE IN THIS PATTERN THROUGH FRIDAY FOR 
SLIGHT THROUGH MEDIUM CHANCES FOR RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS AS COLDER 
AIR FLOWS INTO THE REGION COMPLIMENTS OF THE PREVAILING 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW. UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN WILL 
BE A COMMON THEME THROUGH THIS PERIOD...EVEN INTO SATURDAY AS YET 
ANOTHER HEALTHY LOOKING UPPER TROUGH BUILDS SOUTHEAST OUT OF ALBERTA 
ARRIVING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING THE FIRST DAY OF 
THE WEEKEND.     

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EST SAT FEB 23 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...
A VORT MAX OVER THE RED RIVER THIS AFTERNOON WILL TRACK ACROSS OUR 
AREA TONIGHT. THE ONLY IMPACT WILL BE A BRIEF INCREASE IN MIDLEVEL 
CLOUDS AROUND MIDNIGHT. AFTER THE VORT MAX PASSES THROUGH...WE WILL 
SEE CLEAR SKIES AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AT THE SURFACE. FALLING 
DEWPOINTS THROUGH THE EVENING SHOULD PREVENT WIDESPREAD FOG 
DEVELOPMENT. HIGH TEMPS UNDER FULL SUN AND WEAK 850 MB COLD 
ADVECTION TOMORROW WILL REACH THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S IN MOST 
SPOTS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SKIES WILL REMAIN 
MOSTLY CLEAR SUNDAY NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY SHIFTS EAST. HIGH 
CLOUDS MAY INCREASE FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND WEST LATE BUT THEY ARE 
NOT EXPECTED TO KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM FALLING INTO THE UPPER 20S TO 
MID 30S. MODELS SHOW NEXT SYSTEM TO AFFECT THE REGION WILL BE A 
STACKED LOW THAT WILL SLOWLY EVOLVE OR DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN 
ROCKIES AND SOUTHERN PLAINS SUNDAY THAN PICK UP OLD BOUNDARY NOW IN 
THE GULF AND SPREAD CLOUDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY. THE 
PROGRESS OF THE SYSTEM HAS SLOWED AND IT WILL TAKE AWHILE FOR THE 
AIRMASS TO MOISTEN SO NOT MUCH CHANCE OF RAIN UNTIL MONDAY NIGHT. 
DEEP SURFACE LOW AND UPPER LOW MOVES INTO LOWER MS VALLEY MONDAY 
NIGHT AND HEADS ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE GREAT LAKES BY 
TUESDAY EVENING OR WEDNESDAY MORNING. TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENT
AROUND THE SYSTEM MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WILL INCREASE WINDS 
ESPECIALLY OVER THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS WITH AT LEAST A 
WIND ADVISORY POSSIBLE. 

BEHIND THE FRONT TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER WITH A CHANCE OF SNOW
SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY. THE
LARGE UPPER LOW MOVES SLOWLY ENE TO OFF THE EAST COAST BY FRIDAY.
ALSO A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH FORMS OVER THE EASTERN STATES. THERE
MAY BE A BRIEF BREAK WEDNESDAY BUT WEAK UPPER LEVEL SYSTEMS ROTATE
AROUND THE UPPER LOW AND THEN MOVE SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE TROUGH
FROM WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE END OF THE EXTENDED. THIS WILL
BRING ON AGAIN OFF AGAIN RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS AS FREEZING LEVELS
STAY LOW. THERE WILL LIKELY BE SOME ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE HIGHER
EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS AND EVEN LOWER ELEVATIONS LATE IN THE PERIOD
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN. HIGHS WILL BE SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL
WITH LOWS MOSTLY MID 30S AND BELOW.

INTERSTATE 40. A MUCH BETTER CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO TUESDAY MORNING AS THE SURFACE LOW DRIVES NORTHEAST TOWARD THE

DRIER AIR WILL EVENTUALLY BUILD IN BEHIND THE DEPARTING STORM SYSTEM 
TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY ALLOWING FOR A BREAK IN THE ACTION. 
HOWEVER...HIGH LATITUDE BLOCKING WILL KEEP A MEAN UPPER LEVEL 
LOW/TROUGH IN PLACE ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION 
THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. SHORT WAVELENGTH FEATURES 
WILL ROTATE SOUTHEAST AROUND THIS CIRCULATION AND ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATER WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY WITH PERIODS OF 
RAIN SHOWERS...MIXED WITH SNOW SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY HIGHER TERRAIN 
AND OVERNIGHT PERIODS AS COLDER AIR BUILDS ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S.

354 
FXUS64 KMRX 222019
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EST FRI FEB 22 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...
A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH EJECTING OUT OF THE DEEP DESERT SW LONGWAVE 
TROUGH WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA TONIGHT...INDUCING THE DEVELOPMENT 
OF A WEAK SURFACE LOW ALONG A FRONT THAT HAS STALLED OVER MIDDLE TN. 
THE 12Z NAM IS MOST ENTHUSIASTIC WITH DEVELOPING THIS
LOW...BRINGING A STRIPE OF A HALF INCH OF QPF LATE TONIGHT. THE GFS
SHOWS MEASURABLE PRECIP ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA BUT MUCH LESS
QPF...JUST OVER A TENTH IN MOST SPOTS. GIVEN THE WEAK FORCING
INVOLVED...WILL LEAN TOWARD THE LOWER QPF OF THE GFS...BUT STILL
CARRY CATEGORICAL POPS IN THE EASTERN SECTIONS WITH LIKELY POPS IN
MOST OF THE TN VALLEY AND CHANCE POPS IN THE PLATEAU. BOTH MODELS
AGREE THAT PRECIP WILL BE DECREASING EARLY SATURDAY MORNING WITH
DRY AIR ALOFT BUILDING IN FROM THE SW. BY MID AFTERNOON WE SHOULD
SEE DECREASING CLOUDS AND SOME SUNSHINE...WHICH WILL WARM TEMPS
INTO THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S IN MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. THIS IS A
BIT COOLER THAN THE TEMPS SHOWN BY MOS GUIDANCE.

THE 18Z NAM HAS SIGNIFICANTLY BACKED OF QPF AMOUNTS FOR
TONIGHT...LENDING CONFIDENCE TO THE LOWER QPF SOLUTION OF THE 12Z
GFS.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGHER PRESSURE AND 
WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT KEEPS MOSTLY CLEAR AND DRY CONDITIONS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH SUNDAY. A FEW CLOUDS SATURDAY EVENING WILL 
LINGER OVER NE SECTIONS EARLY THEN MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES. TEMPERATURES 
NEAR SEASONAL WITH LOWS IN THE 30S AND HIGHS SUNDAY NEAR TO SLIGHTLY 
ABOVE NORMAL. PATTERN BEGINS TO CHANGE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY AS A 
DEEPENING AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS MOVES INTO 
THE MS VALLEY. WARM AIR ADVECTION AHEAD OF AN ASSOCIATED WARM  FRONT 
WILL SPREAD CLOUDS AND RAIN INTO THE EASTERN TN VALLEY DURING THE 
DAY MONDAY AND THEN THE COLD FRONT WILL FOLLOW MONDAY NIGHT OR EARLY 
TUESDAY. 

AN UPPER LOW DEVELOPS WITH THE SURFACE LOW AND IT MOVES SLOWLY NE 
FROM THE MS VALLEY TO THE GREAT LAKES BY TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. THIS KEEPS THE EASTERN STATES IN A MEAN TROUGH AS SEVERAL 
WEAK UPPER LEVEL SYSTEMS WILL ROTATE AROUND THE UPPER LOW WHICH WILL 
FINALLY MOVE INTO THE NE STATES FRIDAY AND KEEP NORTHERN AREAS COOL 
TO COLD AND SHOWERY AND SOUTHERN AREAS PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY 
CLOUDY WITH A FEW SHOWERS AROUND. THERE WILL BE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
EACH DAY AND NIGHT WITH SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE NORTHERN SECTIONS AND 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE WARMEST 
MONDAY AHEAD OF THE PRECIPITATION AND FRONTAL SYSTEMS THEN MUCH 
COOLER TUESDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD WITH HIGHS IN 
THE UPPER 30S TO AROUND 50 EACH DAY AND LOWS IN THE MID 20S TO LOWER 
30S EACH NIGHT AFTER MONDAY.

DEPARTURE OF INCLEMENT WEATHER EARLY ON SATURDAY SO HELD ONTO A POP 
GRADIENT WITH HIGHER CHANCE POPS EAST THROUGH LOWER VARIETY WEST AS 
DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT EXITS ACROSS THE TERRAIN. ABOUT THE ONLY 
PERIOD WITH NO POPS IN THIS FORECAST WILL BE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
MUCH OF SUNDAY NIGHT AS A PERIOD OF RIDGING AND MAINLY DRY ADVECTION 
KEEPS PRECIP AT BAY. HOWEVER...AMPLIFYING PLAINS TROUGH SLOWLY 
APPROACHES SUNDAY NIGHT WITH GRADUALLY INCREASING MOISTURE AND LIFT 
AHEAD OF SURFACE WARM FRONT WHICH WILL BE BUILDING NORTHEAST ACROSS 
THE DEEP SOUTH DURING THIS PERIOD. THEREFORE...SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA LATE WITH AREA WIDE 
GOOD CHANCE POP FOR RAIN SHOWERS DURING THE DAY MONDAY INCREASING TO 
LIKELY POPS MONDAY NIGHT AS SYSTEM COLD FRONT PINWHEELS AROUND 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LOW PRESSURE CENTER. FORECAST UNCERTAINTY CRANKS 
UP TUESDAY THROUGH THE END OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD AS A DEEP UPPER 
LEVEL LOW SHIFTS SLOWLY FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE 
OHIO VALLEY/MIDWEST. SEVERAL SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES ARE PROGGED 
TO ROTATE AROUND THE BROAD CIRCULATION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS WITH A CHANCE OF PERIODIC RAIN SHOWERS. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE COLDER DURING THIS PART OF THE FORECAST WITH A PREVAILING 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW. THUS...THERE WILL BE A POTENTIAL FOR PERIODIC 
SNOW SHOWERS ESPECIALLY HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS.          

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             55  45  62  35  61 /  40  70  10  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  53  45  60  34  58 /  30  70  20  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       54  43  59  33  58 /  30  50  10  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              53  40  57  31  53 /  40  70  40  10   0

067 
FXUS64 KMRX 220346
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 PM EST THU FEB 21 2013

.DISCUSSION...LARGE AREA OF RAIN TO CONTINUE OVER THE AREA THROUGH 
MIDNIGHT. KEEPING AN EYE ON TEMPERATURE PROFILE ACROSS NORTHEAST 
AREAS FOR FREEZING POTENTIAL. MODEL PROGS SUPPORT STEADY OF SLOWLY 
RISING TEMPS OVERNIGHT. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH UP EAST TN VALLEY 
COULD SHIFT WEST SLIGHTLY AND DRAW COOLER AIR INTO THE AREA. NAM 
STILL DEPICTING STRONGER SE WINDS ACROSS SMOKYS TONIGHT BUT NOT AS 
STRONG AS PREVIOUS RUN. WILL WATCH FOR WIND EVENT BUT CURRENTLY DOES 
NOT APPEAR LIKELY. ADJUSTED CURRENT TEMPS AND MIN TEMPS DOWNWARD. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...
MIDLEVEL MOISTURE WILL BE INCREASING THROUGH THE LATE 
AFTERNOON/EVENING...WITH DEEP LIFT FROM UPPER DIVERGENCE AND 
ISENTROPIC UPGLIDE PRODUCING PRECIP AFTER 00Z. WITH DEWPOINTS STILL 
IN THE TEENS IN MANY SPOTS...PRECIP AT THE GROUND MAY BE SLIGHTLY 
DELAYED TO AROUND MIDNIGHT. THE MAIN CONCERN WILL BE THE POTENTIAL 
FOR FREEZING RAIN ALONG OUR EXTREME NE BORDER IN SW VA AND NE TN 
MOUNTAINS. THE GFS HAS THE COOLER TEMPERATURE PROFILE COMPARED TO 
THE NAM. THE GFS APPEARS TO BE IN LINE WITH THE SREF...WHICH ALSO 
SHOWS SOME MODERATE PROBABILITIES OF FZRA IN THIS AREA BETWEEN 
09Z-15Z. LOCAL MICROCLIMATE COULD BE A DETERMINING FACTOR FOR ANY 
ICE ACCUMULATIONS...WHICH ADDS UNCERTAINTY TO THE FORECAST. WILL 
LEAN TOWARD THE COOLER GFS/SREF AND MENTION FZRA IN THE WX GRIDS 
ACROSS RUSSELL/WASHINGTON VA/JOHNSON COUNTIES...WITH ONLY A FEW 
HUNDREDTHS OF ICE ACCUMULATION. THIS IS NOT LIKELY TO HAVE A 
SIGNIFICANT IMPACT OVER A WIDE AREA...SO WILL NOT ISSUE ANY ADVISORY 
STATEMENTS...AND WILL CONTINUE WITH JUST THE HWO MENTION. 

IF THE NAM IS FOLLOWED...WE COULD SEE A BORDERLINE HIGH WIND/WIND 
ADVISORY EVENT IN THE MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS LATE TONIGHT WITH THE 
SE 850 MB FLOW AROUND 50 KTS. HOWEVER THE GFS IS ABOUT 20-25 KTS 
LOWER WITH WIND SPEEDS AT 4000 FT. THE GFS IS THE PREFERRED MODEL 
FOR THE SHORT TERM...SO WILL NOT ISSUE A WIND ADVISORY AT THIS TIME.

PRECIP WILL BE TAPERING OFF TO DRIZZLE THROUGH FRIDAY AS DRY AIR 
ALOFT BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST...OUTPACING THE SURFACE FRONT WHICH 
BECOMES PARALLEL TO THE FLOW ALOFT AND STALLS NEAR THE APPALACHIANS 
LATE IN THE DAY.

LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...AS THE FRONT STALLS 
NEAR THE APPALACHIANS LATE FRIDAY ANOTHER IMPULSE WILL MOVE UP FROM 
THE GULF ALONG THE BOUNDARY. MOISTURE MOVING OVER THE FRONT WILL 
KEEP THE THREAT FOR SOME LIGHT RAIN ACROSS THE EASTERN TWO THIRDS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. SKIES WILL CONTINUE TO 
BE CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY WITH MILD LOWS IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 
40S. WEST TO SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL KEEP HIGHS ABOVE NORMAL IN THE MID 
50S TO NEAR 60. RAIN MAY SHIFT EAST EARLY IN THE DAY. THERE MAY BE 
SOME SUN LATER IN THE DAY WHICH WILL ADD TO THE WARMING. 

WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. HIGHS
NORTH SLIGHTLY COOLER BUT ABOUT THE SAME SOUTH AS SATURDAY WITH
SUNSHINE. NEXT SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE ROCKIES SUNDAY AND MOVES
INTO THE PLAINS SUNDAY NIGHT AND INTO THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY. A
DEEP UPPER LOW OVER THE PLAINS WILL MOVE INTO THE GREAT LAKES
MONDAY NIGHT. THE INITIAL SYSTEM WILL BRING WARM AIR BACK INTO THE
REGION SUNDAY NIGHT AS A WARM FRONT. RIGHT NOW KEEPING FORECAST
AREA DRY WITH BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS MONDAY. THINK INSTABILITY AND
BEST DYNAMICS WITH THE SYSTEM PRODUCING THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE TO
THE SOUTH OF TN. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD PASS THROUGH LATE MONDAY
NIGHT OR EARLY TUESDAY WITH WRAP AROUND SHOWERS TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY MAINLY NEAR THE KY BORDER AND IN SW VA. SOME SNOW SHOWERS
MAY MIX IN BUT DOES NOT LOOK COLD ENOUGH FOR ANYTHING SIGNIFICANT.
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY A REINFORCING SHORTWAVE ROTATING
AROUND THE COLD UPPER LOW TO THE NORTH WILL KEEP THE THREAT FOR
RAIN OR SNOW SHOWERS BUT TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY BE COLD ENOUGH IN
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS FOR ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOW SHOWERS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             40  56  43  60  35 / 100  40  40  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  38  55  43  60  35 / 100  50  40  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  56  42  59  35 / 100  40  30  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              36  48  38  57  31 / 100  70  50  40  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

DGS/TD

FXUS64 KMRX 212310 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
615 PM EST THU FEB 21 2013

.AVIATION...
MIDLEVEL CLOUDS WILL INCREASE THROUGH THE EVENING...WITH RAIN  
MOVING IN FROM THE SW. DRY LOW LEVEL AIR IN PLACE WILL MEAN 
VFR VIS AND CIGS FOR A FEW HOURS AFTER PRECIP BEGINS REACHING THE 
GROUND. CONSIDERED ADDING LLWS...BUT AT THIS TIME IT APPEARS THAT 
THE TOP OF THE WIND SHEAR LAYER WILL BE ABOVE 2000 FT...SO WILL NOT 
MENTION IN THE TAFS. MVFR CIGS AND VIS MAY DEVELOP OVERNIGHT...MAINLY
AT CHA AND TYS. PRECIP SHOULD BECOME LIGHTER AROUND DAY BREAK AS DRY 
AIR ALOFT MOVES IN...TURNING PRECIP TO DRIZZLE. NORTHEAST WINDS  
WILL TURN TO A MORE SOUTHEASTERLY DIRECTION BY TOMORROW MORNING.
PRIMARY FREEZING LEVEL REMAINS NEAR 9000 FEET.

TENNESSEE LATE TODAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. RAIN AND LOWERING CLOUD

770 
FXUS64 KMRX 210849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 AM EST THU FEB 21 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL
MOVE EAST OF THE AREA TODAY WITH A DEVELOPING STORM SYSTEM ACROSS
THE PLAINS STATES. AS THE RIDGE MOVES EAST...STRONG SOUTHERLY LOW-
LEVEL JET WILL DEVELOP OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AS PRESSURE
GRADIENT TIGHTENS IN RESPONSE TO CYCLO-GENESIS OVER THE SOUTHERN/
CENTRAL PLAINS. IN RESPONSE...ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL INCREASE WITH
MOISTURE SPREADING NORTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA. A LARGE AREA OF
RAIN WILL SPREAD INTO THE REGION THIS EVENING AND CONTINUE
OVERNIGHT. THE BEST ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BE BETWEEN 00-06Z
TONIGHT...SO GREATEST COVERAGE OF RAIN WILL OCCUR THEN. 

INITIALLY SURFACE WILL BE DRY WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE TEENS/SINGLE
DIGITS NORTH. A GOOD DEAL OF EVAPORATIVE COOLING WILL ALLOW THE
SURFACE TO BRIEFLY FALL BELOW FREEZING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. A BRIEF PERIOD OF FREEZING RAIN IS
EXPECTED...POSSIBLY MIXED WITH SLEET FAR NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS.
LITTLE TO NO ICE ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED.

ANOTHER CONCERN IS STRENGTH OF PRESSURE GRADIENT SOUTHERLY JET OVER
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. THIS JET COMBINED WITH FAVORABLE TEMPERATURE
SOUNDING PROFILE WILL SET THE STAGE FOR MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WINDS
FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS/FOOTHILLS. A WIND ADVISORY WILL LIKELY BE
NEEDED FOR THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS/FOOTHILLS...
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA STARTING AROUND 06Z
AND CONTINUE TO 15-18Z FRIDAY.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE SYNOPTIC-SCALE PATTERN THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND 
REVEAL A PROGRESSIVE PATTERN WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AFFECTING 
THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...AND A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. A BROAD 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS WILL HELP TO GENERATE A LARGE 
AREA OF CONVECTION OVER THE SOUTHEAST ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT... 
WHICH SHOULD MOSTLY STAY SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
HOWEVER...THERE APPEARS TO BE ENOUGH MOISTURE AND LIFT OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY FOR THIS UPPER TROUGH TO PRODUCE SOME LIGHT SHOWERS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON SUNDAY 
NIGHT...AND WILL THEN MOVE NORTHEASTWARD TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION. ALL THE EXTENDED MODELS NOW APPEAR TO BE IN BETTER AGREEMENT 
WITH THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...AND ALL GENERATE A LARGE AREA OF 
CONVECTION OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY AND DEEP SOUTH ON SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND MONDAY. THIS CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY MAY CUT OFF THE FLOW OF 
DEEPER MOISTURE NORTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA...SO THINK THAT 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS ON MONDAY NIGHT COULD BE LIGHT (LESS THAN AN INCH) 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A GOOD SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW IS PROGGED TO 
DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...SO IT 
APPEARS THAT MOST OF THE PRECIP WITH THE SYSTEM OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA SHOULD BE LIQUID. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             58  42  58  44  61 /  30 100  50  40  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  52  39  56  43  59 /  20 100  50  40  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       51  39  56  43  59 /  30 100  50  40  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  34  53  40  56 /   0 100  50  40  40

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

497 
FXUS64 KMRX 210230
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EST WED FEB 20 2013

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO ADJUST TEMPS DOWNWARD. SOME HIGH AND 
MID LEVEL CLOUDS OVERNIGHT. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
A MID-UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS WILL BE OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM AS A CLOSED LOW TRACKS NE ACROSS THE PLAINS. HIGH CLOUDS FROM 
THIS SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE 
EVENING. SATELLITE SHOWS SOLID CLOUD COVER UPSTREAM TO WEST TX...SO 
WE WILL LIKELY SEE BROKEN TO OVERCAST CONDITIONS THROUGH THURSDAY. 
THIS WILL LIMIT RADIATIONAL COOLING...SO WILL FORECAST LOW TEMPS 
TONIGHT ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE. WE WILL PROBABLY NOT SEE MUCH SUNSHINE 
THURSDAY EITHER...SO WILL HAVE HIGHS A BIT LOWER THAN MOS. THE SREF 
SHOWS SOME LOW PRECIP CHANCES ENTERING THE PLATEAU IN THE 21Z-00Z 
TIME FRAME. WILL INCLUDE A LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP WEST...BUT 
EXPECT THAT PRECIP WILL NOT ARRIVE IN KNOXVILLE UNTIL AFTER 00Z.

LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR THE THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY SYSTEM
AND THROUGH THE WEEKEND. MODELS BEGIN TO DIFFER ON THE
MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT SYSTEM REGARDING TIMING AND TEMPS.

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS ON THURSDAY...AND WILL MOVE NORTHEASTWARD THURSDAY 
NIGHT SPREADING SHOWERS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A LARGE AREA OF 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY AND DEEP SOUTH ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...WHICH MAY CUT 
OFF THE FLOW OF DEEPER MOISTURE NORTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
THUS...RAINFALL AMOUNTS ON THURSDAY NIGHT MAY BE FAIRLY LIGHT (LESS 
THAN AN INCH) OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A GOOD SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW IS 
PROGGED TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY...SO IT APPEARS THAT PRECIP ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WILL 
BE LIQUID. HOWEVER...THERE MAY BE A FEW ISOLATED LOCATIONS ACROSS UPPER 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA THAT COULD SEE PATCHY LIGHT FREEZING 
DRIZZLE FOR AN HOUR OR SO TOWARD SUNRISE. CONFIDENCE IS HIGHER IN 
SEEING ALL LIQUID PRECIP DUE TO SW FLOW SO NOT PLACING FREEZING 
DRIZZLE IN GRIDS...BUT WANTED TO MENTION THE SLIGHT POSSIBILITY OF 
ITS OCCURRENCE. 

AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH THEN AMPLIFIES OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY...WHICH 
WILL HELP TRIGGER ADDITIONAL SHOWERS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. 

THE NEXT SYSTEM FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK APPEARS FAIRLY SIMILAR TO THE 
THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY SYSTEM...IN THAT CONVECTION OVER THE DEEP 
SOUTH MAY CUT OFF DEEPER MOISTURE FROM REACHING THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
THE ECMWF AND CANADIAN MODELS REVEAL A SLOWER EASTWARD PROGRESSION 
WITH THIS SECOND SYSTEM THAN THE GFS MODEL...WHICH WILL RESULT IN A 
WARMER SCENARIO OVER THE FORECAST AREA...RESULTING IN ALL LIQUID 
PRECIP. LATEST GFS CONTINUES TO SHOW FASTER SOLUTION AND KEEPS THE 
TROUGH MORE NEUTRAL OVER OUR AREA AS COMPARED TO ECMWF AND CANADIAN. 
THE NEUTRAL TROUGH ALLOWS FOR A COLDER SOLUTION THAN THE OTHER TWO 
MODELS. FOR NOW...WILL STILL TREND THE FORECAST FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK 
TOWARDS THIS WARMER SOLUTION. WILL SEE HOW THE NEXT FEW LONG RANGE 
MODEL RUNS HANDLE THIS SYSTEM BEFORE JUMPING TOWARD A COLDER GFS 
SOLUTION. BOTH ECMWF AND GFS SHOW SOME INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER 
THE SOUTHERN AREAS ON THE FRONT END OF MONDAY'S SYSTEM. WILL KEEP 
MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS OUT OF GRIDS FOR NOW...WILL MONITOR FUTURE 
RUNS TO SEE HOW INSTABILITY CONTINUES TO DEVELOP.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             28  56  42  58  46 /   0  20  90  60  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  27  52  39  59  43 /   0  10  90  40  40 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       26  51  39  59  43 /   0  20  90  40  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              23  49  34  55  39 /   0   0  90  50  40

890 
FXUS64 KMRX 202005
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST WED FEB 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...
A MID-UPPER LEVEL RIDGE AXIS WILL BE OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM AS A CLOSED LOW TRACKS NE ACROSS THE PLAINS. HIGH CLOUDS FROM 
THIS SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE 
EVENING. SATELLITE SHOWS SOLID CLOUD COVER UPSTREAM TO WEST TX...SO 
WE WILL LIKELY SEE BROKEN TO OVERCAST CONDITIONS THROUGH THURSDAY. 
THIS WILL LIMIT RADIATIONAL COOLING...SO WILL FORECAST LOW TEMPS 
TONIGHT ABOVE MOS GUIDANCE. WE WILL PROBABLY NOT SEE MUCH SUNSHINE 
THURSDAY EITHER...SO WILL HAVE HIGHS A BIT LOWER THAN MOS. THE SREF 
SHOWS SOME LOW PRECIP CHANCES ENTERING THE PLATEAU IN THE 21Z-00Z 
TIME FRAME. WILL INCLUDE A LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE POP WEST...BUT 
EXPECT THAT PRECIP WILL NOT ARRIVE IN KNOXVILLE UNTIL AFTER 00Z.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR THE THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY SYSTEM
AND THROUGH THE WEEKEND. MODELS BEGIN TO DIFFER ON THE
MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT SYSTEM REGARDING TIMING AND TEMPS.

A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS ON THURSDAY...AND WILL MOVE NORTHEASTWARD THURSDAY 
NIGHT SPREADING SHOWERS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A LARGE AREA OF 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY AND DEEP SOUTH ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...WHICH MAY CUT 
OFF THE FLOW OF DEEPER MOISTURE NORTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
THUS...RAINFALL AMOUNTS ON THURSDAY NIGHT MAY BE FAIRLY LIGHT (LESS 
THAN AN INCH) OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A GOOD SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW IS 
PROGGED TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY...SO IT APPEARS THAT PRECIP ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WILL 
BE LIQUID. HOWEVER...THERE MAY BE A FEW ISOLATED LOCATIONS ACROSS UPPER 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA THAT COULD SEE PATCHY LIGHT FREEZING 
DRIZZLE FOR AN HOUR OR SO TOWARD SUNRISE. CONFIDENCE IS HIGHER IN 
SEEING ALL LIQUID PRECIP DUE TO SW FLOW SO NOT PLACING FREEZING 
DRIZZLE IN GRIDS...BUT WANTED TO MENTION THE SLIGHT POSSIBILITY OF 
ITS OCCURRENCE. 

AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH THEN AMPLIFIES OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY...WHICH 
WILL HELP TRIGGER ADDITIONAL SHOWERS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. 

THE NEXT SYSTEM FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK APPEARS FAIRLY SIMILAR TO THE 
THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY SYSTEM...IN THAT CONVECTION OVER THE DEEP 
SOUTH MAY CUT OFF DEEPER MOISTURE FROM REACHING THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
THE ECMWF AND CANADIAN MODELS REVEAL A SLOWER EASTWARD PROGRESSION 
WITH THIS SECOND SYSTEM THAN THE GFS MODEL...WHICH WILL RESULT IN A 
WARMER SCENARIO OVER THE FORECAST AREA...RESULTING IN ALL LIQUID 
PRECIP. LATEST GFS CONTINUES TO SHOW FASTER SOLUTION AND KEEPS THE 
TROUGH MORE NEUTRAL OVER OUR AREA AS COMPARED TO ECMWF AND CANADIAN. 
THE NEUTRAL TROUGH ALLOWS FOR A COLDER SOLUTION THAN THE OTHER TWO 
MODELS. FOR NOW...WILL STILL TREND THE FORECAST FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK 
TOWARDS THIS WARMER SOLUTION. WILL SEE HOW THE NEXT FEW LONG RANGE 
MODEL RUNS HANDLE THIS SYSTEM BEFORE JUMPING TOWARD A COLDER GFS 
SOLUTION. BOTH ECMWF AND GFS SHOW SOME INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER 
THE SOUTHERN AREAS ON THE FRONT END OF MONDAY'S SYSTEM. WILL KEEP 
MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS OUT OF GRIDS FOR NOW...WILL MONITOR FUTURE 
RUNS TO SEE HOW INSTABILITY CONTINUES TO DEVELOP.

FXUS64 KMRX 200814 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EST WED FEB 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BOTH 
SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL PRODUCE DRY CONDITIONS TODAY. A GOOD DEAL OF 
CI/CS WILL SPILL OVER ADVANCING RIDGE AXIS TO PRODUCE PARTLY SUNNY 
CONDITIONS MOST OF THE DAY. FOLLOWED GFS MOS NUMBERS CLOSELY FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...AND REVEAL A PROGRESSIVE PATTERN WITH 
TWO LOW PRESSURE SYSTEMS AFFECTING THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE 
THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY AND MONDAY/MONDAY NIGHT TIME FRAMES. A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON 
THURSDAY...AND WILL MOVE NORTHEASTWARD THURSDAY NIGHT SPREADING 
SHOWERS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY AND 
DEEP SOUTH ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...WHICH MAY CUT OFF THE 
FLOW OF DEEPER MOISTURE NORTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THUS... 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS ON THURSDAY NIGHT MAY BE FAIRLY LIGHT (LESS THAN AN 
INCH) OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A GOOD SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW IS PROGGED 
TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY...SO IT 
APPEARS THAT PRECIP ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WILL BE LIQUID. AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH THEN AMPLIFIES OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY ON FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON SATURDAY...WHICH WILL HELP TRIGGER 
ADDITIONAL SHOWERS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. THE NEXT SYSTEM FOR EARLY 
NEXT WEEK APPEARS FAIRLY SIMILAR TO THE THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY 
SYSTEM...IN THAT CONVECTION OVER THE DEEP SOUTH MAY CUT OFF DEEPER 
MOISTURE FROM REACHING THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THE ECMWF AND CANADIAN 
MODELS REVEAL A SLOWER EASTWARD PROGRESSION WITH THIS SECOND SYSTEM 
THAN THE GFS MODEL...WHICH WILL RESULT IN A WARMER SCENARIO OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA RESULTING IN ALL LIQUID PRECIP. FOR NOW...WILL PLAN TO 
TREND THE FORECAST FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK TOWARDS THIS WARMER SOLUTION 
SINCE THIS LATEST GFS MODEL SOLUTION IS DIFFERENT THAN ITS PREVIOUS 
MODEL RUNS. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS THROUGH THE WEEKEND...BUT WILL TREND CLOSER TO THE WARMER 
ECMWF NUMBERS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.


407 
FXUS64 KMRX 192009
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EST TUE FEB 19 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...
POST-FRONTAL BREEZES WILL CONTINUE BUT DIMINISH DURING THE
EVENING. EXPECT SKIES TO CONTINUE CLEARING QUITE NICELY. COLD AIR
ADVECTING IN WILL RESULT IN BELOW AVERAGE MINS TONIGHT AND MAXES
WEDNESDAY...ROUGHLY 8 TO 10 DEGREES BELOW AVERAGE. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL WILL COME TO AN END BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND
THURSDAY MORNING AS OUR NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES. NAM AND GFS ARE IN
GOOD AGREEMENT ON A STRONG UPPER SHORT-WAVE MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS
THE CENTRAL PLAIN STATES LATE IN THE WEEK. AT THIS TIME...MODELS
ALSO IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON THE TIMING OF THE PRECIP ACROSS OUR AREA.
CURRENT RUNS SHOWING BULK OF PRECIP ARRIVING AFTER 00Z. INCREASING
ISENTROPIC LIFT AND FRONTOGENESIS BEGIN TO MOVE IN AROUND THE 00Z
TIMEFRAME. THIS YIELDS A HIGH CONFIDENCE IN POPS FOR THURSDAY
NIGHT. POPS DECREASE FRIDAY MORNING AS LIFT WEAKENS AND MOISTURE
AXIS MOVES EAST.

BECAUSE OF THE NEGATIVE TILT OF THIS SYSTEM...A FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
BECOMES SOMEWHAT SEPARATED FROM THE MAIN LOW OF THURSDAY NIGHT'S 
SYSTEM. THIS WEAK FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA BY LATE FRIDAY/FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND THEN STALLS OUT TO OUR SOUTH AS THE MAIN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE MOVES OFF ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES. KEPT CHANCE POPS DURING 
THIS PERIOD AS FRONT MOVES THROUGH. GFS AND ECMWF SHOW THE FRONT 
STALLING OUT ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES FOR THE WEEKEND. LATEST 
GFS RUN HAS SHIFTED THE BOUNDARY FURTHER SOUTH. THIS BOUNDARY WILL 
HAVE A GREAT IMPACT IN DETERMINING POPS FOR SATURDAY. BECAUSE OF THE 
SOUTHWARD SHIFT...HAVE DECIDED TO REDUCE POPS ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
AREAS FOR SATURDAY. LEFT CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AREAS AT 
THIS TIME. IF LATER RUNS STILL SUPPORT THIS SOUTHWARD SHIFT...POPS 
MAY BE FURTHER REDUCED IN THE FUTURE. A SECONDARY UPPER LEVEL WAVE 
THEN MOVES THOUGH SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...AND INCREASES 
FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING/STRENGTHENING ALONG THE STALLED OUT BOUNDARY. 
IF THE BOUNDARY STAYS SOUTH...AS SUGGESTED BY LATEST GFS...THIS 
KEEPS THE HEAVIER PRECIP TO OUR SOUTH ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES 
AND WILL KEEP US DRIER THROUGH THIS PERIOD. THOUGH...IF THE BOUNDARY 
WERE TO SHIFT BACK NORTH...IT WOULD ALLOW FOR HIGHER POPS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN AREAS. FOR THIS REASON...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY 
NIGHT ACROSS A FEW AREAS EVEN THOUGH LATEST GFS RUN IS DRIER.

GFS AND ECMWF SUGGEST DRIER WEATHER RETURNS FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. 
DYNAMICS OF THE NEXT SYSTEM VARY GREATLY BETWEEN THE GFS AND ECMWF. 
HOWEVER...BOTH ARE IN FAIR AGREEMENT ON TIMING. MODELS SHOW NEXT 
SYSTEM ARRIVING LATE MONDAY AND INTO TUESDAY...GIVING US OUR NEXT 
CHANCE OF RAIN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             26  49  27  57  41 /   0   0   0  20  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  25  45  25  52  39 /   0   0   0  20  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       24  44  24  52  38 /   0   0   0  20  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              20  41  19  50  33 /   0   0   0  10  60 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

FXUS64 KMRX 190809
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 AM EST TUE FEB 19 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG A LOUISVILLE TO 
NASHVILLE TO TUPELO LINE...WITH AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF LIGHT TO 
MODERATE RAIN OCCURRING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPS ARE RELATIVELY 
WARM THIS MORNING...WITH MANY SITES REPORTING IN THE 40S. THUS... 
WHILE SOME EVAPORATIVE COOLING WILL LIKELY CAUSE THESE TEMPS TO FALL 
SOME MORE WITH THE RAIN...THINK THAT ANY THREAT FOR WINTRY PRECIP 
OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND SOUTHWEST NC APPEARS TO BE SMALL. WINDS HAVE 
BEEN GUSTY THIS MORNING AHEAD OF THE RAIN...WITH THE CAMP CREEK AND 
COVE MOUNTAIN OBS ALREADY REPORTING WIND GUSTS IN THE 70 TO 75 MPH 
RANGE. THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE HIGH WIND WARNING UNTIL 7 AM FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS AND THEIR ADJACENT FOOTHILLS...BUT WILL CANCEL THE WIND 
ADVISORY SINCE WIND SPEEDS HAVE REMAINED BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. 
GUSTY WESTERLY WINDS ARE EXPECTED TO REDEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON BEHIND 
THE COLD FRONT...BUT IT APPEARS THAT THESE WINDS WILL ALSO REMAIN 
BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA (SUSTAINED WINDS OF 25 MPH OR GREATER). 
OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA INTO 
TONIGHT...WITH TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT... 
AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH A STRONG UPPER SHORT-WAVE MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL PLAIN STATES LATE IN THE WEEK WITH INCREASING ISENTROPIC 
LIFT PRODUCING AN AREA OF RAIN FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. A WEAK 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA BY LATE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. 

GFS AND ECMWF SHOW THE FRONT STALLING OUT ACROSS THE GULF COAST 
STATES FOR NEXT WEEK WITH A GOOD DEAL OF FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING 
STRENGTHENING ALONG THIS BOUNDARY. A GOOD DEAL OF RAINFALL WILL ONCE 
AGAIN MOVES ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH AT 
LEAST SATURDAY. THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS SHOW LARGE DIFFERENCES ON 
HOW MUCH PRECIPITATION PULLS NORTH INTO THE AREA OVER THE WEEKEND. 
THE GFS IS MUCH MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH PULLING RAIN BACK INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA AS INVERTED TROUGHING SETS UP ACROSS THE EASTERN 
TENNESSEE VALLEY.

CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON DEGREE OF MOISTURE RETURN...BUT WITH COMPROMISE 
BETWEEN GFS/ECMWF AND BRING POPS BACK UP FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY... 
BUT NOT AS AGGRESSIVE AS THE GFS. DRIER WEATHER RETURNS LATE SUNDAY 
AND SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT ANOTHER SYSTEM IN FOR LATE MONDAY.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1009 PM EST MON FEB 18 2013

.DISCUSSION...CLOUDS ARE NOW INCREASING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
AS SHORTWAVE MOVES EAST ACROSS THE MS RIVER WITH SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS DECREASING IN INTENSITY OVER WEST TN. STRONG LOW
LEVEL WINDS HAVE PICKED UP AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM AND WIND GUSTS HAVE
REACHED NEAR 70 MPH THE PAST HOUR AT CAMP CREEK IN GREENE COUNTY
AND ABOUT 45 MPH AT COVE MOUNTAIN. PLATEAU WINDS HAVE GUSTED TO
35 MPH IN MARION COUNTY AND AT SIGNAL MOUNTAIN NORTH OF CHATTANOOGA.
TEMPERATURES ARE FALLING A LITTLE SLOWER THAN FORECAST IN THE UPPER
30S TO MID 40S NE TO UPPER 40S AND LOWER 50S SOUTHWEST. DEW POINTS
ARE LOWER TOO THAN EXPECTED TOO...MAINLY IN THE 20S. THINK LOWS MAY
NOT FALL AS FAR AS IN FORECAST BUT WITH LOWER DEW POINTS LOWS MAY BE
REACHED WHEN RAIN STARTS. HAVE UPDATED GRIDS TO SLOW PROGRESSION OF
MAIN PRECIPITATION AREA SLIGHTLY. STILL LOOKS LIKE RAIN SHOULD
BEGIN ABOUT MIDNIGHT ON THE PLATEAU AND REACH NE SECTIONS BEFORE
SUNRISE. THERE MAY BE A LITTLE SLEET OR SNOW WHEN PRECIPITATION
BEGINS IN THE NE LATE TONIGHT BUT WARMING ALOFT WITH STRONG LOW
LEVEL JET SHOULD CHANGE THE PRECIPITATION TO ALL RAIN QUICKLY.
UPDATE ALREADY SENT.

857 
FXUS64 KMRX 182053
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 PM EST MON FEB 18 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...HEALTHY LOOKING SHORT WAVE 
TROUGH AND SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM ON THE MOVE THROUGH THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LATE THIS AFTERNOON. QUICK SHOT OF RAIN WITH THE 
FRONT LATER TONIGHT WITH TIMING ON THE PLATEAU AROUND 05-06Z AND 
INTO THE HIGH TERRAIN ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER AROUND 08-12Z.
STRONG WARMING HAS OCCURRED ACROSS THE REGION TODAY WITH A NICE 
SOUTHERLY WIND. WARMING WILL CONTINUE ALOFT TONIGHT WITH THE ADVANCE 
OF A STRONG 85H JET WITH SPEEDS AROUND 50-60 KNOTS DUE TO A TIGHT 
LOW LEVEL PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN THE MILD CENTRAL U.S. AIRMASS 
AND THE RETREATING MODIFIED ARCTIC AIR. JET POSITIONING ALONG WITH A 
DEVELOPING SURFACE THROUGH 850 MB INVERSION SHOULD AID THE FORMATION 
OF A MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT ALONG THE HIGHER EAST TENNESSEE BORDER 
TERRAIN AND ADJACENT FOOTHILLS. UPGRADED HIGH WIND WATCH TO HIGH 
WIND WARNING AND ADDED A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
TERRAIN WHICH WILL BE CLOSER TO THE LOW LEVEL JET. SIGNIFICANT 
WARMING WILL BE OCCURRING TONIGHT ALOFT BUT SURFACE TEMPERATURES MAY 
DROP RAPIDLY ACROSS PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AS WELL AS EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. IN THESE 
AREAS TEMPERATURES MAY DIP INTO THE LOWER 30S FOR A SHORT TIME 
BEFORE THE WARMER...MOIST AIR ADVANCES. KEPT A CHANCE FOR A BRIEF 
PERIOD WITH A MIXTURE OF SLEET AND SNOW BEFORE PRECIPITATION CHANGES 
ENTIRELY TO RAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. ALSO ADDED A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MIXED PRECIP ACROSS A PART OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. THE RAIN ENDS FROM WEST TO EAST QUICKLY ON 
TUESDAY WITH CLEARING SKIES THROUGH THE DAY. STAYED RELATIVELY CLOSE 
TO GUIDANCE BLEND CONCERNING MIN/MAX TEMPS DURING THE PERIOD.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WINDS WILL SHIFT TO A 
NORTHWEST FLOW AFTER THE FRONTAL PASSAGE ON TUESDAY. THIS WILL ALLOW 
DRIER AIR TO FILTER IN ACROSS THE REGION...THUS PROVIDING CLEARING 
CONDITIONS ON TUESDAY NIGHT. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL PERSIST THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING COOLER TEMPS...AS WELL AS CALM AND TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS. THINGS BEGIN TO CHANGE BY THURSDAY AS CLOUDS WILL 
INCREASE ONCE AGAIN AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM 
MOVING FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE UPPER MIDWEST. THURSDAY'S 
SYSTEM WILL BE WEAKER AND LESS ORGANIZED THAN THE PREVIOUS ONE DUE 
TO THE EXTREME NEGATIVE TILTING THAT WILL OCCUR BEFORE IT REACHES 
OUR AREA. THE MAIN UPPER LEVEL LOW STAYS WELL TO OUR NORTHWEST 
ALLOWING THE SYSTEM TO BECOME SOMEWHAT DISORGANIZED BY THE TIME IT 
REACHES OUR AREA. THE NEGATIVE TILTING IS DUE TO A BIT OF OMEGA 
BLOCKING THAT WILL BE TAKING PLACE. HOWEVER...THERE WILL STILL BE 
PLENTY ENOUGH LIFT AND MOISTURE TO PRODUCE SHOWERS OVER OUR AREA. 
SHOWERS WILL BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND 
OVERSPREAD THE REGION OVERNIGHT. SOME ISOLATED POCKETS OF SNOW WILL 
BE POSSIBLE ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VA AND FAR 
NORTHEAST TN...BUT TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE 
FREEZING AT THE SURFACE IN MOST LOCATIONS. A CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS 
WILL LINGER ACROSS THE AREA DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY. SOUTHWEST FLOW 
PICKS BACK UP AHEAD OF A SECONDARY UPPER-WAVE PROGGED TO MOVE 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND INTO SATURDAY...LIFT AND MOISTURE INCREASE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE WAVE WILL ALLOW FOR ADDITIONAL CHANCES OF 
SHOWERS DURING THIS PERIOD. THEREAFTER...UPPER-RIDGING WILL BRIEFLY 
RETURN ON SUNDAY PROMOTING MILD AND DRY WEATHER. ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL 
SYSTEM APPROACHES SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND GIVES US OUR NEXT 
SHOT OF RAIN.



&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EST MON FEB 18 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING ALONG THE SOUTHEASTERN COAST...WITH A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. THIS LOW IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION TODAY... 
BUT IT WILL BRING A COLD FRONT EASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
TONIGHT. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS DEVELOP A VERY STRONG 850 MB 
JET (BETWEEN 70 AND 80 KT) ALONG THIS COLD FRONT...WITH A SOUTHERLY 
WIND FLOW AND STABLE BOUNDARY LAYER OCCURRING OVER THE MOUNTAINS. 
THUS...IT APPEARS THAT CONDITIONS WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR THE 
FORMATION OF MOUNTAIN WAVES IN THE FOOTHILLS. IN FACT...THE VERY 
STRONG 850 MB JET MAXIMUM LOCATED NORTHWEST OF THE MOUNTAINS MAY 
ENCOURAGE A HIGH-END WIND EVENT TO OCCUR (WITH WIND GUSTS IN THE 
FOOTHILLS BETWEEN 80 AND 90 MPH). THUS...WILL ISSUE A HIGH WIND 
WATCH FOR TONIGHT ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND THEIR ADJACENT FOOTHILLS. 
ANOTHER POSSIBLE CONCERN FOR TONIGHT INVOLVES THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME 
FREEZING RAIN AND/OR SLEET ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA 
LATE TONIGHT. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION 
PATTERN OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...WITH THE 850 MB LAYER 
WARMING ABOVE FREEZING AS A LARGE AREA OF RAIN MOVES INTO THE AREA. 
HOWEVER...COLD AIR (BELOW FREEZING) MAY REMAIN ENTRENCHED IN THE 
VALLEYS OF EXTREME SOUTHWEST NC...SO WILL MENTION A MIX OF RAIN... 
FREEZING RAIN...AND SLEET FOR LATE TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND 
NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE. WILL PLAN TO COMPROMISE WHERE SOME 
SLIGHT DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...PRECIPITATION WILL TAPER OFF 
FROM WEST TO EAST ON TUESDAY AS A COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE 
REGION...SHIFTING SOME BREEZY WINDS TO THE WEST TO NORTHWEST BY THE 
END OF THE DAY. CLEARING CONDITIONS AND A NORTHERLY FLOW WILL ALLOW 
FOR SOME COOLER CONDITIONS HEADING INTO MIDWEEK...WITH LOWS TUESDAY 
NIGHT BOTTOMING OUT IN THE UPPER TEENS TO MID 20S AND HIGHS ONLY 
CLIMBING INTO THE 40S ON WEDNESDAY. BY THURSDAY...CLOUDS WILL 
INCREASE ONCE AGAIN AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM 
MOVING FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE UPPER MIDWEST. SHOWERS WILL 
BEGIN TO MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON AS MOISTURE/LIFT 
INCREASES AND OVERSPREAD THE REGION OVERNIGHT. SOME ISOLATED POCKETS 
OF SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VA 
AND FAR NORTHEAST TN...BUT TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE 
FREEZING AT THE SURFACE IN MOST LOCATIONS. SOUTHWEST FLOW RAMPS UP 
AHEAD OF A SECONDARY UPPER-WAVE PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH FRIDAY INTO 
FRIDAY NIGHT...BRINGING ADDITIONAL SOLID CHANCES FOR SHOWERS DURING 
THIS PERIOD...ALONG WITH SOME WARMER HIGHS IN THE 50S TO AROUND 60 
DEGREES. THEREAFTER...UPPER-RIDGING WILL BUILD IN FOR THE WEEKEND 
PROMOTING MILD AND DRY WEATHER.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   60  40  53  25  48 /   0  90  50   0   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     58  38  49  23  44 /   0  80  60   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             58  38  50  23  44 /   0  80  60   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    53  34  45  21  39 /   0  80  70   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 172009
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EST SUN FEB 17 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...TRANQUIL AND DRY WEATHER
FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE SHORT TERM AS SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE
MOVE OVER THE REGION. STILL ON THE CHILLY SIDE TONIGHT FOR ERN
AREAS WHERE SURFACE RIDGE AXIS WILL PROVIDE NEAR CALM WINDS. GFS
MOS MINS WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED FOR TONIGHT WITH GFS MAXES QUITE
REACHABLE ON MONDAY...AND ACTUALLY SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL.

MODELS HAVE BACKED OFF ON THE STRENGTH OF THE LOW LEVEL JET MONDAY 
NIGHT AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. ALSO...SOUTHERLY DIRECTION IS SHOWN 
FOR JUST A BRIEF PERIOD FROM 19/06Z TO BARELY 19/12Z...THEN LOW 
LEVEL WINDS VEER TO SW DIRECTION. SINCE THIS IS NOT IDEAL FOR A MTN 
WAVE EVENT...PROBABLY LOOKING A WIND ADVISORY EVENT FOR HIGHER 
TERRAIN AREAS. USED NAM 12KM WINDS WHICH ADVERTISE SPEEDS OF 15 TO 
30 MPH AND GUSTS TO 45 MPH FOR HIGHER TERRAIN OF PLATEAU AND ERN
MTNS. TIMING OF SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE FRONT WAS SIMILAR TO PREVIOUS
GRIDS...WITH JUST MINOR ADJUSTMENTS MADE OVERALL. STILL LOOKS LIKE
BEST COVERAGE OF LINGERING SHOWERS TUESDAY WILL BE IN THE 12Z TO
18Z PERIOD.

INCREASING CLOUDS AND STRENGTHENING SOUTHERLY FLOW DOES NOT FAVOR 
THE COOLER GFS MOS MINS AT ALL FOR MONDAY NIGHT...SO STUCK CLOSE TO 
THE MUCH MILDER NAM MOS MINS. BLEND OF MOS CHOSEN FOR HIGHS ON 
TUESDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE LONG TERM BEGINS 
WITH DRY ADVECTION AND AN APPROACHING UPPER LEVEL RIDGE. THIS 
PATTERN BRINGS PLEASANT...DRY WEATHER THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
FOLLOWED BY AN INCREASING CHANCE FOR SHOWERS DURING THE DAY THURSDAY 
AS A MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS ACROSS MUCH OF THE EASTERN U.S.
KEPT PROBABILITY FOR SHOWERS IN THE LIKELY CATEGORY THURSDAY NIGHT 
AS DEEP MOISTURE BUILDS AHEAD OF A COOL FRONTAL BOUNDARY. FORECAST 
UNCERTAINTY INCREASES FRIDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS THE BOUNDARY 
SLIPS ONLY SLOWLY SOUTH WITH WAVES OF LOW PRESSURE RIDING NORTHEAST 
ALONG THE AIR MASS DISCONTINUITY. GRADUALLY TAPERED POPS BACK FRIDAY 
INTO FRIDAY NIGHT FOLLOWING A SCENARIO WHICH ENDS UP WITH THE FRONT 
MOVING FARTHER SOUTH AND EAST THROUGH THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. COASTAL 
PLAIN. THEREFORE...KEPT THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST DRY BUT WILL 
NEED TO MONITOR THIS PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 170842
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST SUN FEB 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
ELONGATED AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY... 
WITH A VERY COLD AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. A HIGHLY 
AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION 
WILL SLOWLY MOVE EASTWARD TODAY...WITH MODELS INDICATING THAT A WEAK 
SHORT WAVE WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SOME SCATTERED FLURRIES OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN THIS MORNING. OTHERWISE...SKIES SHOULD 
BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA BY THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH BREEZY WESTERLY WINDS LINGERING UNTIL SUNSET. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A BRIEF WARM UP WILL TAKE 
PLACE ON MONDAY AS STRONG SOUTHERLY TO SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS AND AMPLE 
SUNSHINE WILL HELP TO PUSH HIGHS BACK INTO THE MID 50S TO AROUND 60 
DEGREES IN MOST SPOTS. THIS DEEP SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL HELP TO 
TRANSPORT WARM/MOIST GULF AIR BACK INTO THE REGION...AND WILL SET 
THE STAGE FOR SOME WIDESPREAD SHOWER ACTIVITY MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY AS A COLD FRONT SWEEPS EAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. AHEAD OF THIS FRONT...A STRONG 60+KT 850 MB JET WILL ALSO 
CREATE SOME WINDY CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT...WITH ADVISORY LEVEL WINDS 
/PERHAPS HIGHER/ LIKELY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND POSSIBLE ACROSS 
PORTIONS OF THE VALLEY. THUS...HAVE ADDED A MENTION OF THIS IN THE 
HWO AND WILL MONITOR THE PROGRESS OF THIS STORM SYSTEM. IN WAKE OF 
THE COLD FRONT ON TUESDAY...COOLER AND DRIER AIR MOVES IN ALONG WITH 
AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS FOR THE MIDDLE OF THE WORK WEEK. HOWEVER... 
ANOTHER UPPER-STORM SYSTEM SHIFTING FROM  THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TOWARD 
THE GREAT LAKES WILL DRIVE ANOTHER FRONT THROUGH THE REGION AND 
BRING SOME MORE CHANCES FOR SHOWERS  BEGINNING THURSDAY EVENING 
THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING. ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR RAINFALL MAY 
VERY WELL LINGER INTO SATURDAY AS THE FRONT STALLS NEAR THE SOUTHERN 
BORDER OF THE CWA BEFORE THINGS EVENTUALLY TAPER OFF THAT NIGHT.
&&

EXTREME NE TN...AS UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO FLEX EASTWARD. DRY WEATHER

SURFACE RIDGE AXIS ACROSS ERN AREAS SUNDAY NIGHT WILL KEEP THOSE

FRONT ACROSS WRN AREAS.

PERIODS...STAYED CLOSE TO GFS MOS ON MAXES...WITH MILDER NAM MOS

TROUGH AND SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM SWEEPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING BRINGING A PERIOD 
OF SHOWERS TO THE REGION. DRY ADVECTION AND RISING HEIGHTS KEEP DRY 
WEATHER IN PLACE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING. THE NEXT 
UPPER TROUGH SWINGS NORTHEAST FROM THE FOUR CORNERS AREA THROUGH THE 
NORTHERN PLAINS AND WESTERN LAKES IN NEGATIVE TILT FASHION PUSHING A 
COLD FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY 
PRODUCING ANOTHER PERIOD OF SHOWERS IN THE WARM ADVECTION AREA AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON WITH CONTINUATION THROUGH 
FRIDAY MORNING. LOOKS LIKE A DRY START TO THE WEEKEND WITH 
TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL AS UPPER FLOW STAYS WEST TO SOUTHWESTERLY 
BEHIND THE DEPARTING SYSTEM.

THIS MORNING...LEAVING CLOUDS AND COLD AIR ADVECTION FOR THE TN 
VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS. THOSE CLOUDS WILL BE STUBBORN TO EXIT 
GIVEN THE CYCLONIC FLOW ALOFT. PARTIAL CLEARING OVER WRN PARTS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA WILL LIKELY FILL BACK IN...DUE TO STEEP LAPSE 
RATES AND MOISTURE IN THE 850 TO 700 MB LAYER.

THERE IS A SLIGHT AMOUNT OF LOW LEVEL POSITIVE CAPE THIS AFTERNOON 
...BUT WIND DIRECTION AND/OR SPEEDS DON'T SEEM THAT FAVORABLE FOR 
UPSLOPE SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. THUS...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK 
FOR TODAY...WITH 20 TO 40 PERCENT POPS SUFFICIENT. FORECAST HIGHS 
NEAR THE 00Z NAM MOS LOOK GOOD AT THIS POINT...SO AN UPDATE OF GRIDS 
AND PRODUCTS MAY NOT BE NEEDED. 
 
&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
615 AM EST SAT FEB 16 2013

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE CAROLINA 
COAST...WITH A COLD AND DRY AIR MASS MOVING INTO THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WILL FURTHER AMPLIFY OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY TODAY...CREATING GUSTY WINDS AT THE TAF SITES ALONG 
WITH SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS. TIMING THE EXACT OCCURRENCE OF THESE 
SHOWERS AT THE TAF SITES WILL BE PROBLEMATIC...AND VISIBILITIES MAY 
NOT EVEN FALL BELOW 6 MILES WITH THESE SHOWERS. THUS...WILL MENTION 
JUST SOME MID-LEVEL CLOUDS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS. AFTER SOME 
EARLY MORNING MVFR CEILINGS AT KTRI...VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED 
FOR MOST OF THE TAF PERIOD AT ALL THREE TAF SITES.
