523 
FXUS64 KMRX 160854
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EST SAT FEB 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT ALONG THE CAROLINA COAST...WITH A COOL AND DRY AIR MASS 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A BROAD 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION WILL AMPLIFY 
OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL BRING A SURGE 
OF COLDER AIR AND GUSTY WINDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...ALONG 
WITH SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS. BOTH THE GFS AND NAM MODELS AGREE THAT 
MOISTURE WILL LIMITED ENOUGH FOR ONLY MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS... 
MAINLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE UP TO AN INCH APPEARS 
POSSIBLE. THUS...WILL NOT PLAN TO ISSUE ANY ADVISORIES TODAY FOR THE 
MOUNTAINS. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL QUICKLY SWING EAST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA TONIGHT...WITH A VERY DRY AIR MASS MOVING INTO THE REGION. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT 
FOR TODAY...BUT REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES FOR TONIGHT. WILL PLAN TO 
TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER NUMBERS THROUGH THE PERIOD...DUE TO THE 
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS AN UPPER RIDGE AXIS MOVES OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA. NORTHWEST FLOW WILL KEEP THE COOL AIR IN PLACE ACROSS THE 
REGION DURING THE DAY AS HIGHS WILL PEAK IN THE MID 30S TO MID 
40S...AND WITH CLEARING CONDITIONS LATER THAT NIGHT LOWS WILL PLUNGE 
BACK INTO THE UPPER TEENS AND 20S ONCE AGAIN. WINDS WILL BACK TO THE 
SOUTHWEST AND INCREASE AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING UPPER-TROUGH TO THE 
WEST ON MONDAY...HELPING TO PUSH HIGHS BACK INTO THE 50S TO AROUND 
60 DEGREES...AS WELL AS INCREASE SOME LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE FROM THE 
GULF OF MEXICO. THESE STRONG GRADIENT WINDS WILL INCREASE OVERNIGHT 
MONDAY /ESPECIALLY ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN/ AS A 50-60 KT 850 MB 
JET ROTATES OVER THE REGION. THIS MAY VERY WELL HELP TO CREATE 
ADVISORY LEVEL WINDS ALONG THE MTNS AND FOOTHILLS...AND PERHAPS DOWN 
IN SOME SPOTS IN THE VALLEYS AS WELL. SHOWERS WILL THEN BEGIN TO 
OVERSPREAD THE REGION FROM WEST TO EAST BY LATE MONDAY NIGHT AND 
INTO THE DAY ON TUESDAY AS LIFT INCREASES FROM THE APPROACHING STORM 
SYSTEM AND A COLD FRONT SWEEPS EAST INTO THE AREA. GIVEN THAT 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO BE ABOVE FREEZING AT THE SURFACE...THIS 
WILL BE AN ALL-RAIN EVENT FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. 
THEREAFTER...ANOTHER PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED BY MIDWEEK AS 
AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS SWINGS OVER THE AREA. HOWEVER...ANOTHER STORM 
SYSTEM SHIFTING FROM THE MISSOURI VALLEY INTO THE GREAT LAKES WILL 
PUSH ANOTHER FRONT INTO THE AREA LATE THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY... 
YIELDING ANOTHER ROUND OF DECENT RAIN CHANCES TO CLOSE OUT THE WORK 
WEEK.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     38  21  41  26  56 /  30  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN             38  20  42  26  57 /  30   0   0   0  10

190 
FXUS64 KMRX 151956
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EST FRI FEB 15 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...PRECIPITATION WITH THE 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT HAS BEEN RATHER ANEMIC THIS AFTERNOON... 
MUCH MORE IN LINE WITH THE CONSISTENT NAM MODEL. BASING FORECAST ON 
NAM FOR NOW...AS 12Z GFS RUN FLIPPED BACK TO MORE QPF...AND ALSO WAS
AN OUTLIER ON THE SURFACE LOW FOR SATURDAY. SHORTWAVE ENERGY DOES 
DEEPEN THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE REGION SATURDAY...WHICH SHOULD KEEP 
CLOUDS AROUND AND COLD TEMPS...BUT CAN'T SEE THAT MUCH QPF ACROSS 
WRN NC. HPC WINTER WEATHER DESK ALSO DISCARDED THIS SOLUTION. THUS
I OPTED TO STAY THE COURSE WITH OUR PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR TONIGHT 
THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. 

SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES POSSIBLE IN GENERAL WITH THE 
SHORTWAVE ENERGY AND COLD AIR ADVECTION...BUT NOT REALLY SEEING 
STRONG SIGNS OF A NW UPSLOPE EVENT. WIND DIRECTION OFF A BIT PLUS 
LIGHTER SPEEDS...WITH ONLY SIGNIFICANT LOW LEVEL CAPE FOR DAYTIME 
SATURDAY ACROSS SWRN VA. UPPER FLOW REMAINS CYCLONIC UNTIL LATE 
SATURDAY NIGHT...SO KEPT CLOUDS IN THROUGH ABOUT 06Z SUNDAY. DRY 
WITH SUNSHINE FOR SUNDAY AND GFS MOS MAXES WERE CLOSELY FOLLOWED. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SHORT WAVE RIDGING KEEPS 
THE START OF THE LONG TERM DRY WITH RAIN BACK IN THE FORECAST MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WITH LIKELY POPS MONDAY NIGHT WITH THE SYSTEM 
COLD FRONT SWEEPING THROUGH THE REGION DURING THE DAY TUESDAY. DRY 
WESTERLY FLOW AND SLOWLY BUILDING HEIGHTS PROVIDES ANOTHER PLEASANT 
PERIOD OF QUIET WEATHER TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. NEXT 
SHORT WAVE DRIVES NORTHEAST FROM THE DESERT SOUTHWEST INTO THE GREAT 
LAKES THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY DRIVING A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE FORECAST 
AREA THURSDAY NIGHT WITH EXIT DURING THE DAY FRIDAY. THUS ANOTHER 
PERIOD OF RAIN WITH LIKELY POPS FOR SHOWERS ENDING OVER MOST OF THE 
REGION BY MID DAY. HAD TO ADJUST MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE...ESPECIALLY 
LATE IN THE LONG TERM...DUE TO FRONTAL PASSAGE TIMING AND EFFECT OF 
CLIMATOLOGY ON MORE EXTENDED RANGE GUIDANCE.

162 
FXUS64 KMRX 150853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST FRI FEB 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT OVER KENTUCKY AND WEST TN...GENERALLY EXTENDING ALONG A 
LINE FROM LEXINGTON TO NASHVILLE TO MEMPHIS. SATELLITE IMAGERY 
REVEALS SOME HIGH CLOUDS OCCURRING BEHIND THIS COLD FRONT...AS AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. MODELS AGREE 
THAT THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL PROVIDE ENOUGH LIFT TO PRODUCE SCATTERED 
RAIN SHOWERS LATE THIS MORNING AND INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS... 
ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WHERE 
MOISTURE WILL BE DEEPER. ANOTHER SECONDARY COLD FRONT WILL THEN 
QUICKLY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...BRINGING DRIER AIR BUT 
WITH SOME LINGERING SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE. IT APPEARS 
RIGHT NOW THAT MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED ENOUGH TONIGHT...SO THAT ANY 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
ABOVE 2500 FEET WHERE UP TO AN INCH APPEARS POSSIBLE. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND APPEAR REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A SHARP UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON SATURDAY INTO 
SATURDAY NIGHT...PROVIDING SOME ADDITIONAL MOISTURE/LIFT FOR A 
NORTHWEST FLOW SNOW SHOWER EVENT ALONG THE EAST TENNESSEE 
MTNS...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND PORTIONS OF THE UPPER/MID VALLEY 
ZONES. MOST ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT...WITH AN 
ADDITIONAL INCH TO PERHAPS TWO INCHES POSSIBLE IN A FEW LOCALIZED 
SPOTS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN. THE MAIN STORY WILL BE THE BITTER 
COLD AIR THAT WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA AS LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT WILL 
LIKELY DROP INTO THE TEENS ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION. 

BY SUNDAY MORNING...ANY LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS WILL TAPER OFF AND A 
WARM UP WILL ENSUE AS WINDS VEER TO THE SOUTHWEST AND INCREASE... 
ALONG WITH THICKNESS VALUES AND TEMPERATURES ALOFT...RETURNING HIGHS 
CLOSER TO SEASONABLE LEVELS. MOISTURE WILL ALSO INCREASE AHEAD OF 
ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM THAT WILL PASS THROUGH THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO TUESDAY. GIVEN THE WARMER TEMPERATURES...ANY PRECIPITATION THAT 
FALLS WILL BE IN THE FORM OF RAIN. YET ANOTHER WARM UP WILL BE IN 
STORE HEADING INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK AS AN UPPER-RIDGE AXIS 
SHIFTS OVER THE REGION. HOWEVER...ANOTHER STRONG UPPER-LEVEL STORM 
SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO DIG OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE 
LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY THURSDAY NIGHT...DRIVING A COLD FRONT 
TOWARD THE REGION. THIS WILL GIVE THE AREA ANOTHER SHOT OF RAIN 
AND SOME WINTRY PRECIP AS ANOTHER SHOT OF COLD AIR MOVES IN ONCE 
AGAIN. 
&&

637 
FXUS64 KMRX 142015
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST THU FEB 14 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A LOVELY DAY OF SUNSHINE 
WILL GIVE WAY TO A GRADUAL INCREASE IN CLOUDS TONIGHT...AHEAD OF A 
YET ANOTHER WEATHER SYSTEM. SHOULD SEE PRECIPITATION SPREADING INTO 
NW PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON... 
WITH BEST COVERAGE ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN. TEMPERATURES TOO WARM FOR 
MUCH SNOW ACCUMULATIONS UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING...AND THIS SNOW SHOULD 
BE LIMITED TO OUR TYPICALLY FAVORED HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW VA...PLUS 
THE NRN AND SMOKY MTNS OF E TN. OPTED TO KEEP A SWATH OF LIKELY POPS 
FOR THOSE FAVORED AREAS FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND ALSO INTO FRIDAY 
EVENING. 12Z GFS MODEL RUN BACKED OFF CONSIDERABLY ON QPF WITH THIS 
SYSTEM...WHICH SEEMS MORE REASONABLE AND IN LINE WITH THE CONSISTENT 
NAM MODEL. 

THE SYNOPTIC SCALE FORCING IS OF SHORT DURATION...WITH MUCH OF THE 
LIFT OCCURRING PRIOR TO TEMP PROFILE COOLING ENUFF TO SUPPORT A 
CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS. THE TOP OF THE MOIST COLUMN DOES COOL TO 
AROUND -10 TO -15 DEGS CELSISUS...COLD ENUFF FOR SOME SNOW GROWTH. 
PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES ARE STILL RUNNING AROUND 0.40 TO 0.50 INCH 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON...THEN DROP TO LESS THAN 0.25 INCH BY 12Z SATURDAY. 
GENERALLY AFTER 06Z SATURDAY...THIS EVENT SHIFTS TO A NW FLOW EVENT 
WITH MOISTURE BECOMING MORE SHALLOW AND LIFT IN THE FORM OF NW LOW 
LEVEL UPSLOPE AND COLD AIR ADVECTION. KEPT SOME CONTINUITY WITH 
PREVIOUS SNOW AMOUNT GRIDS AND THOSE AMOUNTS APPEAR TO BE BELOW
ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR NOW. WILL LET MIDNIGHT SHIFT SEE HOW THINGS
EVOLVE...AND ONLY HIGHLIGHT IN OUR HWO PRODUCT AT THIS TIME.

FOR TEMPS...FOLLOWED THE SIMILAR MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT AND FRIDAY 
NIGHT...AND THE COOLER NAM MOS HIGHS ON FRIDAY. THE COLD AIR 
ADVECTION ON SATURDAY LOOKS MUCH TOO STRONG TO GO ANYWHERE NEAR THE 
GFS MOS FOR HIGH TEMPS. IN FACT...I STAYED A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW THE 
COOLER NAM MOS HIGHS SIMILAR TO PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID FOR 
SATURDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THIS PERIOD OF THE 
FORECAST WILL BE ACTIVE WITH AN EXITING SYSTEM ON THE FRONT END WITH 
TWO MORE AMPLIFIED TROUGHS EXPECTED TO PASS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS. AFTER AN EXITING AND WEAKENING LIGHT UPSLOPE SNOW 
SHOWER PRODUCING SYSTEM SATURDAY NIGHT THE FORECAST AREA ENJOYS A 36 
HOUR PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER AS UPPER HEIGHTS BUILD AHEAD OF THE NEXT 
SHORT WAVE TROUGH DUE TO IMPACT THE REGION WITH SHOWERS MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO TUESDAY. ANOTHER PERIOD OF MOSTLY QUIET WEATHER WILL ENSUE 
TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MID DAY THURSDAY WHEN THE NEXT DEEP TROUGH 
BUILDS FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE MIDWEST DRIVING A COLD FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY TOWARD THE REGION PRODUCING RAIN SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE 
COLDER AIRMASS THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. MADE SOME ADJUSTMENTS 
TO GUIDANCE TEMPS WITH ARCTIC AIRMASS DROPPING INTO THE REGION OVER 
THE WEEKEND WITH A RELATIVELY SLOW EXIT. HOWEVER...TEMPS DO REBOUND 
AHEAD OF THE EARLY WEEK SYSTEM ALLOWING FOR A RAIN EVENT MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. AT THIS TIME...IT APPEARS TEMPERATURES WARM 
SUFFICIENTLY IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE SECOND SYSTEM TO KEEP SNOW OUT 
OF THE FORECAST FOR THE THURSDAY SYSTEM. 


&&

AFTERNOON...SO ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT IN 
THOSE FAVORED AREAS MENTIONED. COLD AIR ADVECTION...LINGERING LOW

INTO AT LEAST SATURDAY. PLAN TO EVALUATE THIS SYSTEM MORE IN THE

FXUS64 KMRX 140908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
408 AM EST THU FEB 14 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW CLOUDS HAVE HELD SO FAR
THIS MORNING ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA AND TEMPERATURES HAVE
NOT DROPPED AS LOW AS EXPECTED YET. NO FOG HAS FORMED BUT THERE MAY
BE SOME EARLY THIS MORNING AS SKIES BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR BEFORE OR
AROUND SUNRISE. HIGH PRESSURE IS BUILDING IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST
THIS MORNING AND SKIES WILL CLEAR RAPIDLY WITH TEMPERATURES WARMING
INTO THE MID 40S TO MID 50S. SOME MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS WILL
AFFECT NORTHERN SECTIONS AS AN UPPER LOW AND ASSOCIATED LOW
PRESSURE AREA AND SHORTWAVE MOVES BY TO THE NORTH. OVERALL HIGH
PRESSURE WILL PREVAIL TODAY AND EARLY TONIGHT. AN UPPER TROUGH
SINKING SOUTH FROM SOUTHERN CANADA WILL START TO AFFECT THE
NORTHWEST SECTIONS LATER TONIGHT AS A FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE AND
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT APPROACHES. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE
LATE TONIGHT FROM THE NORTHWEST. LOWS STILL EXPECTED TO FALL INTO
THE LOWER TO MID 30S LOWER ELEVATIONS AND 20S IN THE HIGHER
EASTERN MOUNTAINS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...PROGRESSIVE PATTERN 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED. A COLD FRONT MOVES EAST THROUGH THE AREA ON 
FRIDAY. MOISTURE SOURCE IS FROM THE NW AND IS LIMITED WITH PWATS 
VALUES RANGING FROM .45 TO .55 NE TO SW. SCATTERED SHOWERS CHANGING 
TO LIGHT SNOW BY FRIDAY EVENING. THIS LIGHT SNOW WILL CONTINUE AS 
UP SLOPE SHOWERS THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT WITH LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS...MAINLY ACROSS SW VA AND ELEVATED AREAS OF E TN.  
STRONG POST-FRONTAL COLD AIR ADVECTION GETS UNDERWAY AS LARGE COLD 
SOURCE SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM THE NW. COLD TEMPERATURES 
CONTINUE INTO MONDAY MORNING. RETURN FLOW AND WARM UP BEGINS ON 
MONDAY. UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST ACROSS NORTHERN TIER OF U.S. WITH 
BASE OF TROUGH MOVING THROUGH E TN TUE EVENING. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
THROUGH TN VALLEY IN ADVANCE OF UPPER TROUGH. GULF OF MEXICO 
MOISTURE WILL BE DRAWN NORTHWARD INTO THE PRE-FRONTAL WARM SECTOR. 
ONGOING CONVECTION CAN BE EXPECTED MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE. GFS SEEMS A BIT FAST WITH THIS SYSTEM. A 
SOUTHERN ZONAL JET ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH MAY ENHANCE SOUTHERN 
CONVECTION AND STARVE AREA OF DEEP MOISTURE. TOO EARLY TO TELL BUT 
WORTH WATCHING. UP SLOPE SNOW SHOWERS AGAIN POSSIBLE BEHIND FRONT 
TUESDAY NIGHT.

309 PM EST WED FEB 13 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY) WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW ACROSS
THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE EXITING
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. THUS...SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE
CONTINUES FROM THE CENTRAL VALLEY COUNTIES AND SMOKIES OF EAST TN
NE INTO SW VA. DEW POINT TEMPS REMAIN IN THE 40S EXCEPT FOR NRN
PLATEAU AND EXTREME WRN PARTS OF SW VA...WHERE MID 30S WERE NOTED.
SURFACE AND BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS LOOK MUCH TOO WARM FOR ANY SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS...IF PRECIPITATION (PCPN) LASTS LONG ENOUGH FOR THE
COLDER AIR TO ARRIVE THIS EVENING. THE DEPTH OF THE MOISTURE DROPS
CONSIDERABLY THIS EVENING AND THE TOP OF THIS MOIST COLUMN IS NOT
REALLY COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW GROWTH (-6 TO -8 DEGS CELSIUS).

THUS...I DID NOT CHANGE PREVIOUS SNOW AMOUNT GRIDS MUCH AT
ALL...SHOWING A FEW TENTHS OF AN INCH IN FAVORED SPOTS OF SW VA AND
NRN MTNS OF E TN. POPS WERE INCREASED OVER NRN AND NERN MOST
COUNTIES WHERE THIS LIGHT PCPN LINGERS LONGEST. OTHERWISE...BLENDED
INTO PREVIOUS POP/WX GRIDS AFTER 15/06Z.

GIVEN CURRENT DEW POINT TEMPS...CLOUDS AND SOME WIND OVERNIGHT... 
FELT IT WAS WISE TO GO JUST ABOVE THE COOLER GFS MOS MINS. DRY AND
WARMER FOR THURSDAY WITH 12Z GFS MAX TEMPS CONSISTENT AND CLOSELY
FOLLOWED.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...PROGRESSIVE PATTERN THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE SW THURSDAY 
THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY WITH WARMING TREND. COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON 
FRIDAY. AVAILABLE MOISTURE LIMITED WITH THIS FRONT WITH SCATTERED 
SHOWERS CHANGING TO LIGHT SNOW FRIDAY EVENING. THIS SNOW WILL 
CONTINUE AS UPSLOPE SHOWERS INTO SATURDAY. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION 
GETS UNDERWAY AS LARGE COLD SOURCE SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS IN FROM THE 
NW. COLD TEMPERATURES CONTINUE INTO MONDAY MORNING. RETURN FLOW AND 
WARM UP BEGINS ON MONDAY. STRONG SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM DEVELOPS AND 
AND MOVES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON TUESDAY. THUNDERSTORMS
ARE POSSIBLE WITH THIS FRONT. POST FRONTAL SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE 
BEYOND FORECAST PERIOD.

326 PM EST TUE FEB 12 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY/...
THIS AFTERNOON...CLOUDS HAVE ALREADY OVERSPREAD THE ENTIRE
AREA...AND SOME LIGHT RAIN IS JUST NOW BEGINNING TO MOVE FROM
NORTHERN ALABAMA/GEORGIA INTO THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE. THIS PRECIPITATION WILL CONTINUE TO OVERSPREAD THE
REGION THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS
THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
REGION. AM NOT EXPECTING ANY PARTICULARLY HEAVY RAINFALL WITH THIS
SYSTEM AS THE BEST MOISTURE/LIFT WILL BE DISPLACED TO THE SOUTH AND
EAST OF THE AREA. HOWEVER...GOOD CHANCES FOR MEASURABLE RAIN WILL
BE PRESENT ACROSS THE ENTIRE REGION TONIGHT AND INTO THE DAY
TOMORROW. 

A SECONDARY WAVE OF PRECIP MAY MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN ZONES AS
THE BASE OF THE TROUGH MOVES THROUGH TOMORROW...AND LINGER ACROSS
THE NORTHEAST ZONES OVERNIGHT. GIVEN THE COLDER AIR PROGGED TO MOVE
INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE PASSAGE OF THE TROUGH...A CHANGE OVER TO
SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF EAST TENNESSEE AND ACROSS PORTIONS
OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA IS EXPECTED AFTER 00Z
THURSDAY. HOWEVER GIVEN THE LIGHT NATURE OF THIS PRECIPITATION...
AM NOT EXPECTING AN ACCUMULATIONS GREATER THAN A DUSTING IN MOST
SPOTS...WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN WHICH COULD SEE
BETWEEN HALF AN INCH TO AN INCH BY 12Z THURSDAY. THURSDAY
/VALENTINES DAY/...IS EXPECTED TO BE PLEASANT AND EVEN A BIT WARMER
GIVEN THE PARTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS AND STOUT SOUTHWEST FLOW...WHICH
WILL PUSH HIGHS BACK INTO THE MID TO UPPER 50S.


.LONG TERM /THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...
A BREAK IS EXPECTED BETWEEN SYSTEMS THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY
BEFORE A SHORTWAVE BRINGS THE NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN LATE FRIDAY
NIGHT AND SATURDAY. GFS HAS CONSISTENTLY BEEN DRIER THAN THE ECMWF
THROUGH THE PAST COUPLE OF RUNS...SO DECIDED TO LEAN MORE TOWARDS
THE ECMWF MODEL. BECAUSE THE MODELS DISAGREE ON PRECIP
CHANCES...CONFIDENCE IS STILL LOW. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN
THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. PRECIP EXPECTED TO START AS RAIN LATE
FRIDAY AND CHANGE TO SNOW AREA WIDE BY MIDNIGHT. WENT A COUPLE OF
DEGREES COOLER THAN MOS ON TEMPS THROUGH THIS PERIOD. HIGHER
PRESSURE WILL MOVE THROUGH FOR SUNDAY EVENING AND MONDAY...WITH
DRIER WEATHER A SLIGHT WARMING TREND. CONFIDENCE HIGHER WITH THIS
SYSTEM AS MODELS AGREE ON TIMING AND PRECIP CHANCES LATE MONDAY
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. RAIN IS THE MAIN PRECIP EXPECTED...BUT SNOW IS
POSSIBLE IN SW VIRGINIA AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS EARLY TUESDAY
MORNING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             56  43  52  33  59 /  60 100  60  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  56  42  47  32  55 /  30  90  70  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       56  41  48  32  56 /  20  90  80  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  38  45  29  51 /  10  80  90  40  10

1035 AM EST TUE FEB 12 2013

.DISCUSSION...
MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS ARE PREVAILING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA
LATE THIS MORNING...BUT CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE FROM THE
SOUTHWEST BY THE AFTERNOON AS AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM APPROACHES
THE REGION. ACCOMPANYING THIS CLOUD COVER WILL BE SOME RAIN SHOWERS
PROGGED TO MOVE IN BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON...MAINLY ACROSS THE FAR
SOUTHERN ZONES. DO NOT EXPECT ANY PRECIP WILL MAKE IT NORTH OF THE
I-4O CORRIDOR BEFORE 00Z THIS EVENING. GIVEN THE MOSTLY/PARTLY
SUNNY CONDITIONS EXPECTED THROUGH EARLY TO MID AFTERNOON...SOME
DECENT HEATING WILL TAKE PLACE AND ALLOW HIGHS TO REACH THE LOW TO
MID 50S IN MOST AREAS...DESPITE THIS CLOUD COVER AND A PERSISTENT
NORTHEAST FLOW. NO MAJOR CHANGES MADE TO THE FORECAST EXCEPT TO
DECREASE CLOUDS A BIT ACROSS THE NORTHERN/NORTHEAST ZONES AS MOSTLY
SUNNY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO PREVAIL THERE THROUGHOUT MOST OF
THE DAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 120932
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
432 AM EST TUE FEB 12 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES
SWIFTLY EAST THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. SHORT WAVE APPROACHES FROM THE
WEST TONIGHT. MID LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS FROM THE LOWER MS VALLEY TO
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT. DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW MOVES
FROM THE NW GULF OF MEXICO TO THE SOUTHEAST TN VALLEY LATE TONIGHT.
MOISTURE INCREASES FROM THE TOP DOWN TODAY IN MODERATE ZONAL FLOW.
LOW LEVELS MOISTEN UP TONIGHT AS FLOW INCREASES AND BECOMES
INCREASINGLY SWRLY IN THE LOW LEVELS. GOOD MODEL AGREEMENT WITH
DEPICTED ISENTROPIC LIFT AND CATEGORICAL POPS SPREADING NE
OVERNIGHT. WARM AIR IN PLACE WITH NEUTRAL TEMPERATURE ADVECTION
TODAY. AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES MODERATED BY CLOUDS AND SIMILAR TO
MONDAY. WARM AIR ADVECTION TONIGHT WITH TEMPS ABOUT 10 DEGREES
ABOVE NORMAL.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE LOW WITH SOUTHERN
SHORTWAVE TO TRACK ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY WITH LIGHT
RAIN TO CONTINUE THROUGHOUT MUCH OF THE DAY AND THEN TAPERING OFF
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS MUCH COLDER AIR MASS MOVES IN ON THE BACK SIDE
OF THE LOW. FREEZING LEVELS DROP LATE WEDNESDAY WITH THE RAIN
CHANGING TO SNOW DURING THE EVENING. TRACE AMOUNTS POSSIBLE AT THE
LOWER ELEVATIONS AND AN INCH OR SO IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST AND EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. NEXT
SYSTEM TO MOVE BY TO THE NORTH THURSDAY AS TROUGH DIGS SOUTH OVER
THE EASTERN STATES. SOME HIGHER LEVEL CLOUDINESS POSSIBLE NORTH
OTHERWISE FORECAST AREA WILL BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF WEAK
SURFACE HIGH MOVING EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHERN STATES. TEMPERATURES
SLIGHTLY WARMER THURSDAY THAN WEDNESDAY EXPECTED. FRIDAY ANOTHER
WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL SPREAD SOME CLOUDS ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS BUT
NO PRECIPITATION. NEW COLD FRONT TO BRING ANOTHER CHANCE OF
PRECIPITATION FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. THIS PRECIPITATION MAY
START AS RAIN BUT THEN QUICKLY CHANGE TO SNOW OVERNIGHT AND
SATURDAY. AMOUNTS RIGHT NOW DO NOT LOOK THAT SIGNIFICANT BUT THE
MAIN EFFECT WILL BE MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES FOR THE WEEKEND WITH
HIGHS ONLY REACHING THE 30S TO LOWER 40S AND LOWS IN THE TEENS TO
LOWER 20S.

905 PM EST MON FEB 11 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS AND 
THE DEEP SOUTH...WITH AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS STRETCHING SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME LIGHT RAIN OVER CENTRAL AL AND CENTRAL GA... 
AS STRONG SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT PRODUCES SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT 
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. WITH THE NORTHERN EDGE OF THIS LIGHT RAIN 
MOVING TOWARDS NORTHERN AL AND NORTHERN GA...THINK THAT SOME PATCHY 
LIGHT RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC 
OVERNIGHT. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A LARGE AREA OF CLOUDS OVER THE 
TN RIVER VALLEY THIS EVENING...WITH THE NORTHERN EDGE OF THESE 
CLOUDS LOCATED OVER THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST 
VA. EXPECT SOME BREAKS TO DEVELOP IN THESE CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...AS DRIER AIR SLOWLY WORKS ITS 
WAY SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...AND 
WILL NOT PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING.

343 
FXUS64 KMRX 112004
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
304 PM EST MON FEB 11 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT/...
CLOUD COVER HAS BEEN SLOW TO DIMINISH THIS AFTERNOON AS A COLD
FRONT GRADUALLY PUSHES ITS WAY INTO THE FORECAST AREA. BEHIND THE
FRONT...DRIER AIR HAS BEGUN TO FILTER IN...ERODING ANY REMAINING
LOW CLOUD COVER AND LIGHT SHOWERS /EXCEPT ACROSS FAR SOUTHEAST
TENNESSEE AND THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS/...WHERE SOME LOCALIZED
LIGHT ACTIVITY HAS PERSISTED INTO THE MID AFTERNOON. THINK THAT
THIS LIGHT RAIN WILL END QUICKLY...BUT GIVEN THAT THE NAM CONTINUES
TO SHOW SOME LIGHT QPF SIGNALS ACROSS THE FAR SOUTHERN ZONES
OVERNIGHT AND INTO THE DAY TMRW...HAVE KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP
THERE GIVEN ITS PROXIMITY TO A STALLED OUT FRONT. HOWEVER FOR
MOST LOCATIONS...DRY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL OVERNIGHT AS PARTIAL
CLEARING MAY EVEN OCCUR /PARTICULARLY NORTH OF THE I-40 CORRIDOR/.

RAIN CHANCES WILL SLOWLY INCREASE BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING
AS AN UPPER-TROUGH PUSHES INTO THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.
SHOWERS WILL OVERSPREAD THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT FROM SOUTHWEST TO
NORTHEAST AND SHOULD REMAIN IN THE FORM OF RAIN GIVEN THE WARMER
SURFACE TEMPS IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. PRECIPITATION WILL
CONTINUE ACROSS THE REGION /FAVORING THE EASTERN HALF OF THE AREA
ON WEDNESDAY/...BEFORE GRADUALLY TAPERING OFF LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT
AS THE BASE OF THE TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH. GIVEN THAT THE GREATEST
MOISTURE/LIFT WILL BE DISPLACED TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE
AREA...AM NOT EXPECTING PRECIPITATION TOTALS TO BE TERRIBLY
IMPRESSIVE. THE PRIMARY CONCERN WILL BE THE COLDER AIR SPILLING
INTO THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT...CHANGING OVER ANY LINGERING
RAIN ACROSS THE NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAIN ZONES TO WINTRY
PRECIPITATION...LIKELY IN THE FORM OF SNOW. GIVEN THE MODEST QPF
AMOUNTS...AM EXPECTING THAT VERY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE
/ON THE ORDER OF 1/2 AN INCH OR LESS IN MOST PLACES/ AND CONFINED
TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY/...
MODELS ARE NOT IN AGREEMENT ON TIMING THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
PERIOD...SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW. HIGHER PRESSURE MOVES THROUGH THE 
REGION THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. MOISTURE REMAINS ALOFT SO KEPT HIGH 
CLOUDS IN THE FORECAST OVER NORTHERN HALF OF AREA. NEXT SYSTEM 
EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE FRIDAY EVENING. PRECIP WILL 
BEGIN AS RAIN...AND CHANGE TO SNOW AREA WIDE SHORTLY AFTER MIDNIGHT 
AS A COLD FRONT BRINGS FREEZING TEMPS TO THE SURFACE. LIGHT 
SNOW SHOWERS COULD LINGER OVERNIGHT INTO SUNDAY AS THE FRONT MOVES 
EAST OF OUR AREA. DUE TO THE MODEL INCONSISTENCIES WITH THIS 
SYSTEM...KEPT POPS LOW CHANCE. WENT A COUPLE OF DEGREES BELOW MOS 
DUE TO THE DEEP TROUGH AND CONSISTENT NORTHWEST FLOW. GFS AND ECMWF 
SHOW SLIGHTLY DIFFERENT PATTERNS FOR MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY...BUT 
SEEM TO AGREE ON A SHORTWAVE TROUGH BRINGING THE NEXT CHANCE FOR 
RAIN.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  36  53  41  49  33 /  10  20  60  60  20

DRYING AND COLD AIR ADVECTION TONIGHT....ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN 
AREAS...WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO APPROACH NORMAL TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODEL/RUN CONSISTENCY POOR AND 
CONFIDENCE LOW THROUGH THE EXTENDED.  HOWEVER...TREND HAS BEEN TO 
KEEP A FRONTAL BOUNDARY STALLED TO OUR SOUTH ON TUESDAY WITH 
SCATTERED SHOWERS POSSIBLY WORKING THEIR WAY NORTH INTO THE MRX CWA.  
TRACK OF A LOW PRESSURE MOVING THROUGH TRENDING A BIT NORTHWARD BUT 
SHOULD STILL PROVIDE LIKELY POPS ACROSS THE AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY.  SHOULD BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  A 
COUPLE OF WEAK SYSTEMS MOVES THROUGH DURING THE FRIDAY NIGHT/ 
SATURDAY TIME FRAME.  THESE SYSTEMS WILL USHER IN MUCH COOLER AIR 
AND PROVIDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY 
DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.

830 PM EST SUN FEB 10 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A NORTH-TO-SOUTH ORIENTED COLD FRONT 
OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A WARM FRONT AHEAD OF IT EXTENDING 
GENERALLY ALONG A PADUCAH TO TUPELO TO BIRMINGHAM LINE. SATELLITE 
IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CONVECTION OVER THE DEEP 
SOUTH...WHICH APPEARS TO HAVE DISRUPTED THE FLOW OF DEEPER MOISTURE 
TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING. AS A RESULT...AREA RADARS ARE
CURRENTLY ONLY REVEALING SOME LIGHT RAIN ALONG THE MOUNTAINS...WHICH 
WAS QUICKLY MOVING EASTWARD. IT IS APPEARING LESS LIKELY THAT THE 
DEEPER MOISTURE OVER THE DEEP SOUTH WILL MOVE INTO SOUTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST NC...BEFORE THE COLD FRONT ARRIVES AROUND SUNRISE ON 
MONDAY MORNING. WHILE SOME REDEVELOPMENT OF RAIN IS EXPECTED LATER 
TONIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING AS THE COLD FRONT ARRIVES...IT APPEARS 
THAT THE THREAT OF FLASH FLOODING HAS ENDED. THUS...WILL PLAN TO 
CANCEL THE FLASH FLOOD WATCH ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC.

LATEST OBSERVATION FROM THE NOAA WIND TOWER AT CAMP CREEK (SOUTHEAST 
GREENE COUNTY) INDICATES WIND GUSTS UP TO 85 MPH...WHILE THE COVE 
MTN OB (IN GSMNP) HAS BEEN REPORTING GUSTS UP TO 56 MPH. THUS...WILL 
LET THE HIGH WIND WARNING CONTINUE THROUGH THE NIGHT...WITH 
SOUTHERLY 850 MB WINDS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE BETWEEN 65 AND 70 KT FOR 
SEVERAL MORE HOURS. 

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO CANCEL 
THE FLASH FLOOD WATCH...TO LOWER POPS AREA WIDE...AND TO RAISE MINS 
FOR TONIGHT A LITTLE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST SUN FEB 10 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL 
PUSH INTO THE AREA TONIGHT...AND EXIT DURING EARLY MORNING HOURS 
MONDAY.  AN AREA OF RAIN WILL MOVE THROUGH...AND MAY BE ENOUGH 
ELEVATED INSTABILITY FOR SOME RUMBLES OF THUNDER ESPECIALLY SOUTH 
AND WEST.  WILL GO WITH 100 POPS ALL ZONES...AND MENTION SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF THUNDER ALL BUT NORTHEAST.  RAIN MAY BE HEAVY AT TIMES 
ESPECIALLY SOUTH...SO WILL LEAVE FFA AS IS FOR NOW.  STILL LOOKS 
LIKE MOUNTAIN WAVE WINDS ARE LIKELY IN THE NORMALLY FAVORED AREAS 
GIVEN STRONG SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET AND VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILES. 
WINDS ALREADY GUSTING INTO THE 50S AT COVE MOUNTAIN IN THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAIN NATIONAL PARK. WILL CONTINUE HIGH WIND WARNING AS IS.  
PRECIP WILL QUICKLY EXIT LATE TONIGHT/EARLY MONDAY...WITH DRIER AIR 
MOVING IN BEHIND THE FRONT.    

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)... IN WAKE OF THE
FRONTAL SYSTEM THAT WILL DROP THROUGH THE REGION TONIGHT...DRY
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED BY MONDAY NIGHT AS THE FRONT SAGS SOUTH AND
SOME CLEARING ACTUALLY OCCURS ACROSS THE NORTHERN ZONES. THIS BOUT
OF DRY WEATHER COULD ACTUALLY PERSIST WELL INTO TUESDAY AS MODELS
ARE NOW DELAYING THE NEXT WAVE OF MOISTURE/PRECIP UNTIL TUESDAY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SHIFTS INTO THE
LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. SHOWERS ARE AGAIN EXPECTED TO QUICKLY
OVERSPREAD THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT FROM SOUTHWEST TO
NORTHEAST...WITH LIKELY POPS PERSISTING THROUGH WEDNESDAY BEFORE
THE BASE OF THE TROUGH SHIFTS EAST OF THE REGION AFTER 00Z
THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES ARE TRENDING SLIGHTLY WARMER...SO THINK THAT
IT WILL BE AN ALL RAIN EVENT EVEN DURING THE OVERNIGHT
PERIOD...WITH THE EXCEPTION OF A BRIEF CHANGE OVER TO LIGHT SNOW IN
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT.

DRIER AND SLIGHTLY WARMER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR THURSDAY 
/VALENTINES DAY/...AS A SUBTROPICAL RIDGE AXIS BUILDS OVERHEAD. THE 
FORECAST BECOMES A BIT MURKIER THEREAFTER AS MODELS ARE NOT IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT ON THE TIMING/TRACK OF THE NEXT UPPER-WAVE PROGGED TO MOVE 
IN THIS WEEKEND. SOME LIGHT PRECIPITATION MAY BE POSSIBLE LATE 
FRIDAY...BUT THE LATEST TRENDS ARE INDICATING MORE OF A 
SATURDAY/SUNDAY TIMEFRAME. THE PRIMARY CONCERN WILL BE THE COLD AIR 
THAT WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BY FRIDAY AND WILL LINGER THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND. THIS WOULD SUPPORT A MOSTLY SNOW EVENT. GIVEN THE HIGH 
MODEL SPREAD AND UNCERTAINTY...DID NOT GO TERRIBLY HIGH WITH POPS 
FOR NOW AND WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE LATEST TRENDS IN THE COMING 
DAYS.

400 AM EST SUN FEB 10 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE EAST OF THE AREA AND WEAKEN SLIGHTLY TODAY. LOW PRESSURE 
WILL MOVE NE FROM THE UPPER MS RVR VALLEY TO THE W GREAT LAKES BY 
TONIGHT. STRONG PRESSURE GRADIENT SETS UP ACROSS THE TN VALLEY 
TODAY. SOUTHEAST WIND COMPONENT ACROSS THE SMOKIES COUPLED WITH 
STRENGTHENING 850 MB JET ACROSS MIDDLE TN SETS UP GOOD POTENTIAL FOR 
DOWNSLOPING WINDS ACROSS THE WESTERN SLOPES OF THE SW VA/E TN MNTS 
AND FOOTHILLS TODAY AND TONIGHT. A WIND ADVISORY MAY BE REQUIRED 
ACROSS OTHER AREAS LATER TODAY BUT LOW LEVEL JET MIXING DOWN REMAINS 
QUESTIONABLE. WARM FRONT MOVES NORTH THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. 
PWAT VALUES INCREASE TO 1.00 WITH VALUES APPROACHING 1.50 ACROSS 
SOUTHERN AREAS TONIGHT. INCREASED AND LOWERING CLOUD COVER WITH 
LIGHT RAIN MOVING IN WITH SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT. LAYER MOISTENS UP 
DRAMATICALLY TONIGHT WITH GOOD SET UP FOR WARM RAIN PROCESS. HIGHER 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS EXPECTED ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS OVER RELATIVELY 
MOIST GROUND. ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS COULD ALSO ENHANCE RAINFALL 
RATES. COLD FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE AREA EARLY MONDAY. LAYER 
MOISTURE DROPS FAST. BREEZY POST FRONTAL WINDS WILL CONTINUE. ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES MAY BE ENHANCED ACROSS DOWNSLOPE AREAS THIS 
AFTERNOON. OTHERWISE MAXS COULD BE UNDERDONE PENDING EXTENT OF CLOUD 
LAYER THICKENING. VERY WARM TONIGHT WITH CONTINUED WARM POST FRONTAL 
ON MONDAY WITH WESTERN ORIGIN AIRMASS. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS TRENDING TOWARDS 
SAGGING THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY FURTHER TO OUR SOUTH MONDAY NIGHT BUT 
STILL MAY SEE A FEW SHOWERS MOVE INTO OUR SOUTHERN AREAS THROUGH 
THE NIGHT.  A SHORT WAVE RIDING ALONG THE BOUNDARY IS EXPECTED TO 
LIFT INTO THE AREA ON TUESDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS 
INTO THE SOUTHERN MRX CWA.  THE LOW PRESSURE CENTER WILL THEN TRACK 
ACROSS THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY FOR LIKELY POPS.  HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVES 
IN LATE IN THE PERIOD.  MOISTURE IS LIMITED AND WILL KEEP POPS AT 
SLIGHT CHANCE BUT MUCH COOLER AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM 
ALLOWING FOR PRECIP TO FALL AS LIGHT SNOW ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA  
BY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT.

149 
FXUS64 KMRX 092020
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST SAT FEB 9 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL RETREAT 
TONIGHT. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL TRACK OUT OF THE PLAINS TOWARD 
THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES REGION ON SUNDAY...PUSHING A COLD FRONT 
TOWARD OUR AREA.  LOW LEVEL JET WILL INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH ON 
SUNDAY...AND WHILE SET UP DOES NOT LOOK IDEAL AT THIS POINT THERE 
DOES APPEAR TO BE SOME THREAT OF MOUNTAIN WAVE HIGH WINDS IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN AND FOOTHILLS BY LATE SUNDAY.  WILL ISSUE A HIGH WIND 
WATCH FOR NOW...WITH EITHER A WIND ADVISORY OR WARNING LIKELY TO BE 
ISSUED LATER.  CLOUDS WILL INCREASE TONIGHT AND SUNDAY AS MOISTURE 
INCREASES.  RAIN WILL START TO MOVE IN SUNDAY AFTERNOON...SO WILL 
HAVE HIGHEST POPS SOUTHWEST ZONES.  

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)... A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL
STORM SYSTEM WILL IMPACT THE REGION EARLY THIS WEEK...BRINGING SOME
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND STRONG GRADIENT WINDS TO THE AREA LATE
SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY NIGHT. A BOUNDARY WILL MOVE INTO THE
REGION LATE SUNDAY AND COMBINE WITH A STRONG LOW-LEVEL 850 MB JET
THAT ROTATE OVER THE REGION THAT EVENING... PROVIDING THE LIFT FOR
NUMEROUS SHOWERS IN THE MOIST GULF AIR MASS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD
AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF THE PRECIP SHOWING IT MOVING INTO THE
WESTERN ZONES AFTER 18-21Z AND QUICKLY EXPANDING OVER THE ENTIRE
FORECAST AFTER 00Z...BEFORE BEGINNING TO TAPER OFF MONDAY AS THE
BOUNDARY SAGS SOUTH. PWATS ARE RUNNING UP TO 1.5 INCHES ON SUNDAY
NIGHT WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND LOCALIZED
FLOODING CONCERNS IN AREAS THAT RECEIVE HEAVIER BURSTS OF RAINFALL
AND EXPERIENCE TRAINING CELLS. HOWEVER...GIVEN THAT THIS SHOULD NOT
BE A LONG DURATION HEAVY RAINFALL EVENT...WITH GENERALLY 1 TO 2.5
INCHES /WITH SOME LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS/...OVER A 12-18 HOUR
PERIOD...AM NOT EXPECTING ANY SIGNIFICANT FLOODING CONCERNS... AND
THUS WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY HYDROLOGICAL WATCHES FOR NOW.

THE MAIN CONCERN SUNDAY NIGHT MAY VERY WELL BE AFOREMENTIONED 
GRADIENT WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE 60+ KT LOW-LEVEL JET THAT WILL 
ROTATE OVER THE REGION. THIS MAY LEAD TO ADVISORY LEVEL WINDS IN THE 
VALLEY AND EVEN STRONGER WINDS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND 
FOOTHILLS...WHERE A MOUNTAIN WAVE EVENT WILL BE POSSIBLE GIVEN THE 
STRONG SOUTHEAST FLOW AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM. AS A RESULT...WE HAVE 
ISSUED A HIGH WIND WATCH FOR THESE AREAS FROM 20Z ON SUNDAY THROUGH 
09Z MONDAY MORNING. 

WITH THE BOUNDARY SAGGING SOUTH OF THE AREA...PRECIP WILL TAPER OFF 
SIGNIFICANTLY MONDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT...AND SOME CLEARING ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN ZONES MAY EVEN OCCUR. A SECOND UPPER-WAVE WILL THEN 
MOVE TOWARD THE REGION TUESDAY AND BRING INCREASING CHANCES FOR SOME 
SHOWERS TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...BEFORE CLEARING OUT LATER 
THAT NIGHT. AN UPPER-RIDGE WILL PROMOTE PLEASANT CONDITIONS FOR 
THURSDAY /VALENTINES DAY/...BEFORE THE NEXT UPPER-WAVE APPROACHES 
THE REGION FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND. WITH COLDER AIR IN PLACE SOME 
SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG WITH SOME RAIN...BUT GIVEN THE 
HIGH MODEL SPREAD ON THE TIMING/TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM HAVE NOT GONE 
ABOVE 20-30 POPS FOR NOW AND WILL WAIT FOR BETTER CONTINUITY.   


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             37  60  50  63  39 /   0  80 100  40  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  34  60  46  61  37 /   0  50 100  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       35  57  45  62  36 /   0  60 100  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              26  60  42  60  34 /   0  20 100  30  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...HIGH WIND WATCH FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT 
     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS...JOHNSON...NW BLOUNT...NORTH SEVIER...
     NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST COCKE...NORTHWEST GREENE...
     NORTHWEST MONROE...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST 
     CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...SOUTHEAST MONROE...UNICOI...
     WASHINGTON TN.

     FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: RUSSELL...WASHINGTON.

796 
FXUS64 KMRX 090810
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 AM EST SAT FEB 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
WEAKLY FROM THE NORTH TODAY. UPPER RIDGING BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST. 
LOW LEVEL THICKNESS VALUES RISE THROUGH THE PERIOD. INVERSION AROUND 
2800 FEET WILL MIX OUT EARLY TODAY RESULTING IN CLEARING SKIES. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TODAY. UPPER RIDGE AXIS 
SHIFTS EAST TONIGHT. HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO 
INCREASE TONIGHT. ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES TONIGHT ESPECIALLY IN 
THE SW.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WILL BE IN AN ACTIVE WEATHER 
PATTERN FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.  THE MAIN SYSTEM OF THE PERIOD 
WILL BE A STRONG COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE AREA LATE SUNDAY AND 
SUNDAY NIGHT.  DEEP GULF MOISTURE ACCOMPANYING THE FRONT WILL 
PROVIDE THE POTENTIAL FOR LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS AS THE LINE OF 
CONVECTION MOVES THROUGH.  ADDITIONALLY...A STRONG 850MB JET WILL 
INCREASE THE WIND FIELD OVER THE AREA...CREATING STRONG AND GUSTY 
WINDS LATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  
THE FRONT WILL STALL TO OUR SOUTH ON MONDAY WHICH WILL CONTINUE TO 
PROVIDE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER THE AREA MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY....ESPECIALLY OVER SOUTHERN LOCATION.  A SECONDARY UPPER 
TROUGH WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM AND PROVIDE ANOTHER ROUND OF 
PRECIPITATION ON WEDNESDAY.  COOLER AIR FILTERING IN BEHIND THE COLD 
FRONT WILL BE IN PLACE AND COULD SEE SNOW OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND 
SOME NORTHERN AREAS.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THURSDAY 
AND SHOULD CONTINUE TO BE THE MAIN INFLUENCE OVER AREA WEATHER INTO 
FRIDAY AS THE NEXT SYSTEM ADVANCE TOWARDS THE AREA.

102 
FXUS64 KMRX 081940
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST FRI FEB 8 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT HAS EXITED THE 
AREA.  BRIEF SHOT OF COLDER AIR WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH IN THIS 
EVENING. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN OVERNIGHT AND LOW 
AMPLITUDE UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD IN THROUGH SATURDAY.  LINGERING 
CLOUDS SHOULD CLEAR OVERNIGHT...THEN JUST SOME HIGH CLOUDS STARTING 
TO MOVE IN ON SATURDAY.  MAV TEMPS LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL STAY 
CLOSE.   

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)... A VERY ACTIVE
WEATHER PATTERN WILL ENSUE NEXT WEEK AS A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES
REGION...SHOVING A COLD FRONT SOUTH AND EAST THROUGH THE
OHIO/MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALCHIANS ON
MONDAY. AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM...STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS SUNDAY WILL
ADVECT SOME DEEP GULF MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. THIS MOISTURE
COMBINED THE LIFT PROVIDED BY THE STRONG 850 MB JET ROTATING OVER
THE REGION AND A PREFRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL YIELD HIGH CHANCES FOR
SHOWERS AND LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL BEGINNING LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON
AND PICKING UP SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING...BEFORE TAPERING
OFF SOMEWHAT BY MONDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. MONDAY NIGHT THE COLD
FRONT WILL DROP SOUTH THROUGH THE REGION AND IS PROGGED TO STALL
JUST TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE AREA...PROVIDING SOME ADDITIONAL
CHANCES FOR SHOWERS PRIMARILY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN ZONES ON MONDAY
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING. WITH PWATS RUNNING OVER ONE INCH...THE
POTENTIAL FOR LOCALIZED FLOODING WILL CERTAINLY BE POSSIBLE SUNDAY
NIGHT INTO MONDAY WITH SLOWER MOVING/TRAINING SHOWERS.
ADDITIONALLY...WITH SOUTHERLY WINDS IN PLAY AND A 60+ KT 850 BB JET
ROTATING OVER THE AREA...THE POTENTIAL FOR ADVISORY LEVEL WINDS IN
THE VALLEY AND HIGH WIND WARNING CRITERIA IN THE MTNS TO BE MET
WILL CERTAINLY EXIST. THIS TREND WILL NEED TO BE CLOSELY MONITORED
IN THE COMING DAYS.

A SECONDARY UPPER-TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO SWING THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY...GIVING THE AREA ANOTHER DECENT SHOT FOR SHOWERS HEADING 
INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE WORK WEEK. COLDER AIR MOVING IN BEHIND THIS 
SYSTEM WILL ALSO YIELD THE POSSIBLY OF A CHANGE OVER TO SNOW IN THE 
COLDER AREAS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN BRIEFLY OVERNIGHT TUESDAY. BY 
WEDNESDAY...CLEARING WILL BEGIN TO TAKE PLACE AS THE TROUGH DEPARTS 
TO THE NORTHEAST AND A BRIEF STINT OF UPPER-RIDGING MOVES OVER THE 
AREA FOR VALENTINES DAY. HOWEVER...ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM MAY BE ON 
THE HORIZON FOR FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND...BRING SOME ADDITIONAL 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES TO CLOSE OUT THE WEEK.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA WEATHER ON SATURDAY FOR DRY AND WARM CONDITIONS.  WILL MOVE 
INTO AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN FOR MUCH OF THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED.  AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL INCREASE CLOUDS AND MAY 
BRING IN SOME ADVANCE CONVECTION ON SUNDAY.  MAIN LINE OF 
SHOWERS...AND POSSIBLY A FEW THUNDERSTORMS SOUTH...WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE MRX CWA SUNDAY NIGHT.  STRONG LIFT AND DEEP MOISTURE ALONG THE 
FRONT WILL PROVIDE OUR BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP FOR THE EXTENDED AND 
HAVE CONTINUED WITH CATEGORICAL POPS.  THE FRONT MOVES OUT OF THE 
AREA FOR MONDAY WITH ASSOCIATED CONVECTION DECREASING FROM NORTHWEST 
TO SOUTHEAST.  A WEAK DISTURBANCE TRACKING THROUGH THE FLOW ALOFT 
WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE FRONT AND BRING ANOTHER CHANCE OF SHOWERS TO 
THE AREA LATE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN 
FOR THURSDAY FOR A RETURN TO DRY CONDITION.  AS FOR 
TEMPERATURES...GUIDANCE NUMBERS REASONABLE AND STAYED CLOSE.

SURFACE LOW AND THE SURFACE RIDGE ACROSS THE MID ATLANTIC STATES WAS

E TN. SEEING MAINLY TRACE TO 0.01 INCH REPORTED IN THOSE AREAS...
ALTHO ERN MTNS PLUS CHEROKEE/CLAY COUNTIES CERTAINLY HAVE MEASURED 
SOME LIGHT RAIN AMOUNTS.

WITH 40S GENERALLY NOTED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. COLDER TEMPS JUST 
ACROSS THE LINE OVER NWRN NC WHERE 08/00Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOWED 850 
MB ZERO DEGREE ISOTHERM...WITH SURFACE TEMPS ONLY LOWER TO MIDDLE 
30S. 

FORECAST GRIDS LOOK RIGHT ON TRACK AT THIS TIME WITH RAIN CHANCES 
FALL SHARPLY FROM THE WEST FOR THE REST OF THE NIGHT...THEN 
INCREASING JUST AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT FROM 09Z TO 12Z FRIDAY.

PLAN TO FRESHEN HOURLY GRIDS AND ZFPMRX PRODUCT BY AROUND 1030 TO 11 
PM EST.

492 
FXUS64 KMRX 071931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EST THU FEB 7 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO OUR 
SOUTH WILL MOVE NORTHEAST UP THE EAST COAST. SOME LIGHT RAIN HAS 
MADE IT INTO EASTERN ZONES...AND APPEARS BEST CHANCES FOR PRECIP 
WILL CONTINUE TO BE EAST EARLY TONIGHT BEFORE TAPERING OFF.  WILL 
CARRY LIKELY POPS EAST FOR THIS.  NEXT SHORT WAVE AND A COLD FRONT 
WILL APPROACH LATE TONIGHT AND SWING QUICKLY THROUGH FRIDAY.  WILL 
BRING LIKELY POPS INTO WESTERN ZONES LATE TONIGHT AS THIS SYSTEM 
APPROACHES...AND THEN LIKELY ALL ZONES FRIDAY MORNING BEFORE 
TAPERING POPS OFF FROM WEST TO EAST IN THE AFTERNOON.  APPEARS TEMPS 
WILL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID PRECIP IN THE SHORT TERM...AND 
PRECIP AMOUNTS SHOULD BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE.  ONLY MINOR TWEAKS TO 
MAV TEMPS MAINLY TO ADJUST MINS UP SLIGHTLY FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FAIRLY ACTIVE
PATTERN CONTINUES IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD AS A COUPLE OF LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEMS WILL BRING PRECIPITATION CHANCES TO THE REGION
HEADING INTO THE EARLY TO MIDDLE PART OF NEXT WEEK.

FOR SATURDAY THOUGH...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD BACK INTO 
THE REGION...PROMOTING SUNNY AND WARM CONDITIONS IN THE MID 50S TO 
AROUND 60 DEGREES IN MOST AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE NORTHEAST AND 
MOUNTAIN ZONES. BY SUNDAY HOWEVER...CLOUDS AND MOISTURE WILL BEGIN 
TO INCREASE AHEAD OF AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM MOVING FROM THE 
CENTRAL PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES. THIS WILL DRIVE A COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALCHIANS/TENNESSEE 
VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY. A PREFRONTAL TROUGH COULD TRIGGER 
OFF SOME SHOWERS /AND PERHAPS SOME THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS SOUTHEAST 
TN/ SUNDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING...BEFORE A BULK OF THE PRECIP CHANCES 
ARRIVE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY WITH THE FRONT. MODELS THEN INDICATE 
THAT THIS FRONT WILL HANG UP JUST TO THE SOUTH AND EAST OF THE 
AREA...YIELDING SOME ADDITIONAL SOLID CHANCE POPS FOR THE SOUTHERN 
AND EASTERN MOUNTAIN ZONES ON MONDAY...BEFORE THINGS TAPER OFF 
BRIEFLY MONDAY NIGHT. IN ADDITION TO THE RAINFALL CHANCES... 
SOUTHERLY GRADIENT WINDS LOOK TO BE FAIRLY STRONG SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT...SO A WIND ADVISORY FOR THE VALLEYS AND POTENTIALLY A WARNING 
FOR THE MOUNTAINS COULD BE NEEDED...AND THUS WILL CONTINUE TO 
MONITOR. 

THEREAFTER...A SECONDARY UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO MOVE FROM 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND INTO 
THE AREA ON TUESDAY...BRINGING ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR SHOWERS 
TO MOVE INTO THE REGION STARTING TUESDAY...WITH THE BEST CHANCES 
LIKELY BEING TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...BEFORE RIDGING BUILDS IN 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. GIVEN THE COLDER AIR EXPECTED TO 
FILTER INTO THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY...A CHANGE OVER TO SNOW 
WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR A FEW HOURS DURING 
THE LATE NIGHT/EARLY MORNING. HOWEVER...MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL 
REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING AND ONLY EXPERIENCE RAIN.       


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             41  56  29  59  38 /  50  60   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  50  28  56  35 /  50  70   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       41  51  28  54  35 /  40  70   0   0  10

646 AM EST THU FEB 7 2013

.AVIATION...LIGHT RAINFALL EXPECTED TODAY AT THE TERMINALS. THE
STRONGER LIFT IS CLOSER TO THE LOW LEVEL PRESSURE CENTER NEAR THE
CENTRAL GULF COAST AND WITH A LOT OF DRY AIR IN PLACE ACROSS EAST
TENNESSEE...IT WILL TAKE A FEW HOURS TO MOISTEN UP THE LOW LEVELS
ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY. THIS FACT AND THE LIGHT NATURE OF THE
PRECIPITATION MAY ALLOW VFR FLIGHT THROUGH MUCH OF THE FORECAST
PERIOD. BEST CHANCE OF MVFR CONDITIONS DEVELOPING WILL BE AT CHA
BUT LATER TONIGHT...SURFACE CONDITIONS MAY SATURATE A BIT ALLOWING

775 
FXUS64 KMRX 070855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST THU FEB 7 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RELATIVELY WEAK SHORT WAVE TROUGH 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST QUARTER OF THE NATION TODAY WITH EXIT 
ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN ATLANTIC COAST BY 12Z FRIDAY. MUCH OF THE 
DEEPER MOISTURE WITH THIS SYSTEM WILL BE SOUTH OF THE NORTHERN 
ALABAMA/GEORGIA BORDER. USUALLY GET BURNED TRYING TO KEEP 
PRECIPITATION OUT OF THE GAUGES WITH THESE TYPE OF SYSTEMS. ALTHOUGH 
THE RAIN SHOULD BE LIGHT...THERE IS A BETTER THAN 50/50 CHANCE OF 
GETTING A HUNDREDTH OF AN INCH GENERALLY NORTH AND EAST OF 
INTERSTATES 40 AND 75. THEREFORE INSTEAD OF LOWERING POPS TODAY 
EITHER MAINTAINED SAME NUMBERS OR TWEAKED UP ABOUT 10 PERCENT FROM 
THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. SYSTEM BASICALLY SHIFTS EAST TONIGHT BUT HELD
ONTO TO SOME BETTER PROBABILITIES ALONG THE MOUNTAINS FOR SOME 
TRAILING DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE EXITING 
SYSTEM. THE NEXT SHORT WAVE IS A NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH WITH A COLD 
FRONT NEARING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AROUND 12Z FRIDAY SO ADJUSTED 
POPS A LITTLE HIGHER FOR MORE LIGHT RAIN AFTER AN EVENING LULL IN 
THE ACTION. STAYED IN THE MIDDLE OF TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE DURING THE 
SHORT TERM.   

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL PUSH 
ACROSS THE AREA ON FRIDAY MORNING...THEN DRY AIR ALOFT WILL BUILD IN 
THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. ALL PRECIP SHOULD END AREA WIDE BY SUNSET. A 
PERIOD OF COLD ADVECTION WILL DROP TEMPS INTO THE 20S FRIDAY 
NIGHT...BUT A BUILDING HIGH AMPLITUDE RIDGE WILL BRING HIGH TEMPS A 
FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL ON SATURDAY. 

A CLOSED LOW TRACKS NORTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAINS TO THE UPPER GREAT 
LAKES BY MONDAY. A STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL 
BRING INCREASING CLOUDS SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH INCREASING RAIN 
CHANCES ON SUNDAY. THERE APPEARS TO BE GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THIS 
SYSTEM BETWEEN THE GFS...ECMWF..AND CMC...SHOWING THE BEST PRECIP 
CHANCES WILL BE SUNDAY NIGHT. CLUSTERING OF GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS 
LENDS CONFIDENCE TO RAISE POPS TO CATEGORICAL IN SOUTHERN SECTIONS 
FOR THIS PERIOD. A STRONG LLJ AND GOOD UPPER DIVERGENCE COULD BRING 
A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS AND HEAVY RAINFALL...MAINLY IN THE 
SOUTHERN TN VALLEY AND SW NC. WILL ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER 
SOUTH. 

COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE OCCURS MONDAY...AND IT APPEARS THAT MOST GFS 
ENSEMBLE MEMBERS KEEP THE FRONT TO OUR SOUTH THROUGH TUESDAY. ONLY A 
COUPLE MEMBERS HAVE ANY PRECIP MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...SO WILL 
LOWER POPS TO JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH. THE GFS AND ECMWF BOTH 
SHOW A SHORTWAVE TROUGH SPREADING PRECIP BACK INTO THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT...SO WILL BRING CHANCE POPS BACK IN FOR THAT PERIOD.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 062010
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST WED FEB 6 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
TRACK WELL TO OUR SOUTH DURING THE PERIOD.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE 
AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM...BUT BETTER LIFT SHOULD STAY TO OUR SOUTH AND 
EAST.  TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR PRECIP TO BE ALL 
LIQUID FOR THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  WILL SEE INCREASING CLOUDS 
TONIGHT...THEN SOME LIGHT RAIN WILL MOVE IN THURSDAY ESPECIALLY 
SOUTH AND EAST.  WILL CARRY CHANCE POPS NORTHWEST...AND HIGH LIKELY 
TO LOW CAT POPS SOUTH AND EAST ZONES.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.    

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS STILL IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THAT SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO LIFT NE ACROSS 
FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT WHILE A FAST MOVING NORTHERN STREAM 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH JUST BEHIND IT CONTINUES THE THREAT OF SHOWERS 
THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF FRIDAY. SURFACE COLD FRONT FOLLOWING 
NORTHERN STREAM FRIDAY WILL USHER IN MUCH DRIER AIR MASS FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH QUICKLY FRIDAY 
MORNING AND AFTERNOON. HAVE HIGH RAIN CHANCES THURSDAY NIGHT SOUTH 
AND EAST WITH ONLY CHANCE POPS ON FRIDAY. LOWS THURSDAY NIGHT ABOVE 
FREEZING WITH ALL RAIN EXPECTED. FOLLOWED LOWER MAV GUIDANCE FOR 
HIGHS FRIDAY AS COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND SYSTEM ON FRIDAY AND EARLY 
CLOUDS AND RAIN WILL HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN. 

RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS REGION FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AND PROVIDE 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. THE NEXT 
SYSTEM WILL SPREAD PRECIP INTO THE AREA SUNDAY. GFS AND ECMWF ARE 
NOT IN GOOD AGREEMENT AS A CLOSED LOW CROSSING THE PLAINS SUNDAY AND 
MOVES INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION MONDAY. THE MODELS BRING THE COLD 
FRONT THROUGH MONDAY BUT STALL THE FRONT TO THE SOUTH THE GFS 
FARTHER SOUTH THAN THE ECMWF SO IT KEEPS RAIN SOUTH UNTIL TUESDAY 
NIGHT. THE ECMWF STALLS THE FRONT JUST TO THE SOUTH BUT OVERRUNNING 
BRINGS STEADY RAIN ACROSS SOUTHERN SECTIONS MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY. WITH COLD FRONT JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE AREA 
TUESDAY...KEPT TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER THAN GUIDANCE. 
MODELS STILL DISAGREEING ON TIMING OF THE RAIN EXITING THE 
REGION...SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE PRECIP IN THROUGH WEDNESDAY.

300 
FXUS64 KMRX 060840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EST WED FEB 6 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FEW CLOUDS WILL BUILD ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TENNESSEE EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD AS A SHORT WAVE EXITS THE CONTINENT. THERE SHOULD BE A BIT OF 
FOG AS WELL IN SPOTS ACROSS THE VALLEY WHICH SHOULD DISSIPATE FAIRLY 
QUICKLY. SHOULD BE CLEAR SAILING AFTER THAT WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE 
AND TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE LATER TONIGHT AS A 
SHORT WAVE MOVES OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. STAYED CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE TEMPS FOR THE SHORT TERM FORECAST. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A SOUTHERN STREAM SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH WILL BE LIFTING NE ACROSS THE AREA ON THURSDAY...AND MERGE 
WITH A NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH OVER THE MID-ATLANTIC ON FRIDAY. 
MODELS ARE IN MUCH BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM COMPARED TO 
YESTERDAY. SATURATION OF THE COLUMN WILL OCCUR QUICKLY THURSDAY AS 
ISENTROPIC LIFT STRENGTHENS AND THE JET ENTRANCE REGION MOVES INTO 
THE TN VALLEY. THE NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH AND SURFACE COLD FRONT 
FOLLOW CLOSE BEHIND ON THURSDAY NIGHT/EARLY FRIDAY...BUT WITH WEAKER 
LIFT AND LOWER QPF THAN THE SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH. FROPA OCCURS 
AROUND MIDDAY...WITH DRIER AIR BUILDING IN QUICKLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON.

A BUILDING RIDGE ALOFT WILL PROVIDE MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES AND ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPS FOR SATURDAY. HOWEVER...WITH AN INCREASINGLY AMPLIFIED 
PATTERN...THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL SPREAD PRECIP INTO THE AREA ON 
SUNDAY. GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH A CLOSED LOW 
CROSSING THE PLAINS ON SUNDAY AND MOVING INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION 
BY MONDAY...WITH GOOD CLUSTERING AMONG ENSEMBLE MEMBERS AS WELL. 
WILL BUMP POPS UP TO LIKELY ON SUNDAY NIGHT. THE STRONG LLJ SHOWN BY 
THE GFS SUGGESTS THUNDERSTORMS WITH HEAVY RAIN AND GUSTY WINDS MAY 
BE POSSIBLE...BUT WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY MENTION OF THUNDER FOR NOW. 
FROPA OCCURS ON MONDAY...THEN THE FRONT STALLS TO OUR SOUTH TUESDAY. 
HOW FAR SOUTH REMAINS UNCERTAIN AND DIFFICULT TO DETERMINE THIS FAR 
OUT IN THE FORECAST. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING IN SOUTHERN 
AREAS FOR TUESDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 PM EST TUE FEB 5 2013

.DISCUSSION...UPDATE TO REDUCE CLOUD COVER OVERNIGHT. CLOUD FIELD 
OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WILL REACH SW VA LATER TONIGHT. TEMPERATURES 
IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK IMPULSE MOVING THROUGH 
ALOFT WILL CARRY IN A FEW CLOUDS OVERNIGHT...GENERAL ACROSS NORTHERN 
AREAS. LOWS WILL FALL INTO THE 30S TONIGHT WITH MOST LOCATIONS 
STAYING ABOVE FREEZING. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR 
WEDNESDAY CONTINUING THE WARMING TREND.

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS STILL SHOW SOME 
VARIABILITY FROM 00Z TO 12Z RUNS ON THE SRN STREAM SYSTEM FOR 
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. NAM MOS POPS WENT FROM AS HIGH AS CATEGORICAL 
FOR THURSDAY ON 00Z RUN TO JUST 15 TO 30 PERCENT ON 12Z RUN TODAY. 
OPTED TO IGNORE THE FLIP-FLOP FROM NAM AS OTHER MODELS ARE MORE IN 
LINE...AND SUPPORT LIKELY POPS FOR SRN AREAS BY LATE THURSDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. SOME LINGERING LIGHT SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE 
FOR FRIDAY MAINLY WITH THE APPROACH OF A WEAK COLD FRONT. MINOR 
COOLING OF 850 MB TEMPS...BUT SEE NO THREAT OF ANYTHING BUT LIQUID 
PRECIPITATION.

SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE KEEP SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY DRY...BEFORE THE 
NEXT SYSTEM BEGINS TO AFFECT THE REGION. MORE AMPLE SUPPLY OF 
MOISTURE AND STRONGER FORCING COULD POSE A HEAVIER RAIN THREAT...
BUT STILL A GOOD DEAL OF UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING AND TRACK. STAYED 
CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT UNTIL MODELS 
COME TO BETTER AGREEMENT. 

MODELS IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT ABOUT FRONT PASSING THROUGH THE AREA 
ON MONDAY...ALTHO ECMWF HOLDS BACK SOME ENERGY AND DEVELOPS ANOTHER 
WAVE ON THE FRONT ON TUESDAY. THUS...MODELS DO NOT AGREE ON TIMING 
OF FRONT EXITING THE AREA. KEPT CHANCE POPS IN THROUGH THE DAY 
TUESDAY IN CASE GFS IS TOO FAST WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE...ALTHO   
EXPECT SYSTEM TO MOVE EAST OF THE AREA BY EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON.

MOS TEMPS DIFFER JUST ABOUT EACH PERIOD...WITH LITTLE CONSISTENCY 
FROM RUN TO RUN. HOWEVER...IN GENERAL I FAVORED THE MILDER MINS AND 
CLOSER TO THE COOLER MAXES DUE TO CLOUDS...RAIN CHANCES AND SLIGHT 
DROP IN 850 MB TEMPS OVER NRN AREAS ON SATURDAY.

FOR TEMPS ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY...WENT SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE 
GUIDANCE AS FLOW WILL REMAIN FROM THE WEST SOUTHWEST.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             37  60  40  58  43 /   0   0  10  60  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  34  55  35  55  41 /   0   0  10  50  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       34  54  35  55  40 /   0   0  10  40  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              31  50  29  54  36 /  10   0   0  40  50

815 
FXUS64 KMRX 051149
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
649 AM EST TUE FEB 5 2013

.AVIATION...SHORT WAVE TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED LOW CLOUD DECK HAVE
MOVED ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING. LOOKS LIKE THE LIGHT PRECIP IS
MOVING AWAY FROM THE TERMINALS AT THE CURRENT HOUR. STAYED A
LITTLE ON THE PESSIMISTIC SIDE CONCERNING THE GREAT VALLEY
FORECAST WITH A RATHER BROAD AREA OF LOW CLOUDS EVIDENT ON
SATELLITE IMAGERY EXTENDING AS FAR NORTHWEST AS THE OHIO RIVER.
APPLIED WIDESPREAD MVFR CEILINGS OCCASIONALLY DROPPING TO IFR
CATEGORY. FLIGHT WEATHER WILL EVENTUALLY GO VFR AT THE TERMINALS
LATER TODAY OR EARLY THIS EVENING. ANOTHER WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL
BUILD SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT WITH LIMITED IMPACT OVER
MOST OF THE GREAT VALLEY. HOWEVER...FORECAST AN IFR CEILING AT TRI
LATER TONIGHT AS SOME LOWER CLOUDS MAY FILTER INTO THE CENTRAL
APPALACHIANS IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS FEATURE.


691 
FXUS64 KMRX 050905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EST TUE FEB 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ARE MOVING ACROSS SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA 
THIS MORNING AHEAD OF A WEAK 850-700 MB TROUGH. EXTRAPOLATION OF THE 
SHOWERS TAKES THEM TO OUR EASTERN BORDER AROUND 12Z...SO WILL ONLY 
HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR A FEW HOURS AFTER SUNRISE. IR SATELLITE 
SHOWS CLOUDS HOLDING IN LONGER...WITH CLEARING COMING IN THE 
AFTERNOON. WILL HAVE HIGH TEMPS LEANING TOWARD THE COOLER NAM MOS. 

A WEAK RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE REGION FOR TONIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...PROVIDING DRY WEATHER AND WARMER TEMPERATURES. 
HIGHS WEDNESDAY SHOULD REACH THE LOWER 60S SOUTH WITH 50S ELSEWHERE. 

THE MODELS SEEM TO BE HAVING TROUBLE WITH A WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM 
SYSTEM FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WITH SIGNIFICANT TIMING DIFFERENCES 
AND INTERNAL RUN-TO-RUN INCONSISTENCIES. FOR THIS PERIOD...WILL LEAN 
TOWARD THE SREF AND GFS ENSEMBLES...WHICH SPREAD PRECIP INTO THE 
AREA FROM THE SOTUH BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON. THIS IS FASTER 
THAN THE PREVIOUS FORECAST...BUT SLOWER THAN THE NAM WHICH APPEARS 
TO BE AN OUTLIER. HIGHEST POPS LOOK TO BE THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL 
KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE DUE TO MODEL UNCERTAINTIES. THE GFS 
INDICATES PRECIP ENDING FRIDAY MORNING AS THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN 
STREAM SYSTEMS MERGE OFF THE MIDATLANTIC COAST.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON WEATHER SCENARIO THROUGH ABOUT SUNDAY
EVENING WITH DIVERGENCE SEEN BETWEEN THE GFS AND THE ECMWF/CANADIAN
WHICH ARE SIMILAR WITH A MORE AMPLIFIED SHORT WAVE DRIVING
NORTHEAST OUT OF THE CENTRAL PLAINS ON SUNDAY AND THEN SWINGING
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES BY 12Z MONDAY. STAYED CLOSER TO THIS
SOLUTION WHICH FEATURES A DEEPENING SURFACE LOW WHICH DRAGS A COLD
FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATE IN THE DAY MONDAY OR MONDAY
EVENING. WAS ABLE TO KEEP THE DRY FORECAST IN PLACE FROM FRIDAY
NIGHT THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY AND REMOVED THE SLIGHT AND LOW
CHANCE POPS FOR FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT LEAVING JUST A SMALL
AREA OF SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITIES FOR SHOWERS ACROSS EXTREME
SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS AND ONLY GRADUALLY ADJUSTED POPS
HIGHER FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST ON SUNDAY AWAITING DEEPER
MOISTURE ADVECTION AND LIFT AS THE STRENGTHENING SURFACE LOW
PRESSURE SYSTEM BUILDS TOWARD THE AREA ON MONDAY WHERE HIGHEST POPS
WERE MAINTAINED. FRONT MAKES ITS WAY THROUGH THE SOUTHERN
APPALACHIAN REGION MONDAY NIGHT SO KEPT THE DIMINISHING TREND IN
PROBABILITIES GOING DURING THIS REMOTE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST.
STAYED IN THE BALLPARK WITH MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE EXCEPT SUNDAY
NIGHT WHERE I WENT SEVERAL DEGREES HIGHER THAN GUIDANCE AS THE
SOUTHERLY FLOW STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY FRONTAL
SYSTEM.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             56  36  62  39  58 /  10   0   0  10  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  52  34  56  35  55 /  10   0   0  10  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       53  33  56  35  55 /  10   0   0  10  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              46  33  51  29  54 /  10   0   0   0  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST TUE FEB 5 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS ARE MOVING 
ACROSS SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THIS MORNING AHEAD OF A WEAK 
850-700 MB TROUGH. EXTRAPOLATION OF THE SHOWERS TAKES THEM TO OUR 
EASTERN BORDER AROUND 12Z...SO WILL ONLY HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
FOR A FEW HOURS AFTER SUNRISE. IR SATELLITE SHOWS CLOUDS HOLDING IN 
LONGER...WITH CLEARING COMING IN THE AFTERNOON. WILL HAVE HIGH TEMPS 
LEANING TOWARD THE COOLER NAM MOS. 

A WEAK RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE REGION FOR TONIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...PROVIDING DRY WEATHER AND WARMER TEMPERATURES. 
HIGHS WEDNESDAY SHOULD REACH THE LOWER 60S SOUTH WITH 50S ELSEWHERE. 

THE MODELS SEEM TO BE HAVING TROUBLE WITH A WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM 
SYSTEM FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WITH SIGNIFICANT TIMING DIFFERENCES 
AND INTERNAL RUN-TO-RUN INCONSISTENCIES. FOR THIS PERIOD...WILL LEAN 
TOWARD THE SREF AND GFS ENSEMBLES...WHICH SPREAD PRECIP INTO THE 
AREA FROM THE SOTUH BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON. THIS IS FASTER 
THAN THE PREVIOUS FORECAST...BUT SLOWER THAN THE NAM WHICH APPEARS 
TO BE AN OUTLIER. HIGHEST POPS LOOK TO BE THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL 
KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE DUE TO MODEL UNCERTAINTIES. THE GFS 
INDICATES PRECIP ENDING FRIDAY MORNING AS THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN 
STREAM SYSTEMS MERGE OFF THE MIDATLANTIC COAST.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY AGREE ON 
WEATHER SCENARIO THROUGH ABOUT SUNDAY EVENING WITH DIVERGENCE SEEN 
BETWEEN THE GFS AND THE ECMWF/CANADIAN WHICH ARE SIMILAR WITH A MORE 
AMPLIFIED SHORT WAVE DRIVING NORTHEAST OUT OF THE CENTRAL PLAINS ON 
SUNDAY AND THEN SWINGING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES BY 12Z MONDAY. 
STAYED CLOSER TO THIS SOLUTION WHICH FEATURES A DEEPENING SURFACE 
LOW WHICH DRAGS A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA LATE IN THE 
DAY MONDAY OR MONDAY EVENING. WAS ABLE TO KEEP THE DRY FORECAST IN 
PLACE FROM FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY AND REMOVED THE 
SLIGHT AND LOW CHANCE POPS FOR FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT LEAVING 
JUST A SMALL AREA OF SLIGHT CHANCE PROBABILITIES FOR SHOWERS ACROSS 
EXTREME SOUTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS AND ONLY GRADUALLY ADJUSTED 
POPS HIGHER FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST ON SUNDAY AWAITING DEEPER 
MOISTURE ADVECTION AND LIFT AS THE STRENGTHENING SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM BUILDS TOWARD THE AREA ON MONDAY WHERE HIGHEST POPS 
WERE MAINTAINED. FRONT MAKES ITS WAY THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION MONDAY NIGHT SO KEPT THE DIMINISHING TREND IN 
PROBABILITIES GOING DURING THIS REMOTE PERIOD OF THE FORECAST. 
STAYED IN THE BALLPARK WITH MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE EXCEPT SUNDAY 
NIGHT WHERE I WENT SEVERAL DEGREES HIGHER THAN GUIDANCE AS THE 
SOUTHERLY FLOW STRENGTHENS AHEAD OF THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY FRONTAL 
SYSTEM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1245 AM EST TUE FEB 5 2013

.AVIATION...SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE TERMINALS DURING
THE FORECAST PERIOD. MOISTURE AND LIFT WITH THE FEATURE
UNIMPRESSIVE SO FLIGHT WEATHER IMPACTS SHOULD BE LIMITED TO
CEILINGS JUST ABOVE MVFR CATEGORY. PERHAPS THE BEST CHANCE FOR AN
IFR CEILING TO FORM WILL BE AT TRI AROUND 09Z AND LATER. LIGHT RAIN
AT CHA AND TYS ALONG WITH LIGHT RASN AT TRI MAY NOT LIMIT VSBY
SUFFICIENTLY FOR FLIGHT CONDITION TO DROP INTO AN MVFR CATEGORY.
DRYING BEHIND THE SYSTEM BRINGS AN END TO THE LOW CLOUD DECK AROUND
20Z THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

756 
FXUS64 KMRX 050253 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
953 PM EST MON FEB 4 2013

.DISCUSSION...
AN UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBACE WILL MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA
TONIGHT...BRINGING WITH IT SOME CHANCES FOR LIGHT PRECIPITATION
ACROSS THE AREA. HAVE ADJUSTED POPS TO MENTIONABLE LEVELS AREAWIDE
FOR THE ENTIRE OVERNIGHT PERIOD...AS DOPPLER RADAR HAS INDICATED
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED ACTIVITY MOVING ACROSS NORTH MIDDLE TN INTO
NORTHEAST TN/EASTERN KY/SOUTHWEST VA. ADDITIONAL SPOTTY SHOWERS
WERE MOVING FROM MIDDLE TN TOWARD THE SOUTHERN/CENTRAL PLATEAU AS
WELL THIS EVENING. ANY ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE MODEST GIVEN THE LACK
OF DEEP MOISTURE AND THE STILL DRIER AIR PRESENT AT THE SURFACE. AM
EXPECTING THIS LIGHT ACTIVITY TO OVERSPREAD THE AREA OVERNIGHT AS
THE TROUGH AXIS NEARS THE AREA. FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT /OUTSIDE OF
THE HIGHER TERRAIN/ PRECIP WILL FALL AS LIGHT RAIN. HOWEVER...AS
TEMPERATURES DROP LATE TONIGHT...THIS LIGHT RAIN WILL CHANGE OVER
TO SNOW ACROSS PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST TN/SOUTHWEST VA...THOUGH ONLY
VERY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OF A HALF INCH OR LESS ARE EXPECTED BY
TOMORROW MORNING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             37  57  36  59  35 /  20  20   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  35  53  34  53  33 /  20  20   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       35  53  33  52  32 /  30  20   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              30  48  32  48  25 /  40  30  10   0   0

.AVIATION...
VFR CONDITIONS WILL BE THE PREDOMINANT FLIGHT CATEGORY AT EACH
TERMINAL THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. MID/HIGH CLOUD DECKS WILL GRADUALLY
LOWER OVERNIGHT AS ANOTHER UPPER-LEVEL DISTURBANCE MOVES INTO THE
REGION LATE TONIGHT. SOME MVFR CIGS AT KTYS/KTRI ARE EXPECTED LATE
TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY MORNING...WITH SOME -RA/-RASN AT EACH SITE
RESPECTIVELY. THEN...A RETURN TO VFR CONDITIONS IS EXPECTED AS SW
WINDS GRADUALLY PICK BY THE AFTERNOON AND CLEARING OCCURS.

640 
FXUS64 KMRX 042004
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST MON FEB 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...TROUGH AXIS MOVING THROUGH THE 
REGION LATE TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING.  SUFFICIENT LIFT AND WEAK 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD BE ENOUGH FOR SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS.  
ABOVE FREEZING TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY SHOULD KEEP 
PRECIP AS RAIN.  LIGHT SNOW POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER ELEVATION AND SOME 
NORTHERN AREAS.  MOISTURE LIMITED AND PRECIP AMOUNT SHOULD BE 
LIGHT.  MOST LOCATIONS WHERE SNOWFALL IS EXPECTED SHOULD ONLY SEE 
ACCUMULATIONS OF A DUSTING TO A HALF INCH.  FAVORED HIGHER TERRAIN 
COULD SEE UP TO AN INCH.  NO ADVISORY IS EXPECTED AT THIS TIME.  
WARMING TREND WILL CONTINUE ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON WITH HIGHS EXPECTED 
TO CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 40S AND 50S OVER VALLEY LOCATIONS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE RIDGE AND ZONAL 
FLOW ALOFT WILL KEEP EARLY PARTS OF THE LONG TERM DRY THROUGH 
THURSDAY MORNING. MOISTURE STARTS TO RETURN THURSDAY NIGHT WITH A 
GULF COAST LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...WITH TIMING NOW SUGGESTING RAIN 
LIKELY CENTERED AROUND FRIDAY MORNING. KEEPING THIS AS AN ALL RAIN 
EVENT AND RAINFALL AMOUNTS WON'T BE THAT SIGNIFICANT. WILL HOLD OFF 
ANOTHER MODEL RUN OR TWO BEFORE GOING WITH LIKELY RAIN CHANCES ON 
FRIDAY. SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE ON SATURDAY WILL PRODUCE DRY WEATHER 
AND GFSX MOS CONTINUES TO ADVERTISE THE WARMEST TEMPS ON SATURDAY.

OTHERWISE...DOWNPLAYED FOG A BIT FOR TUESDAY NIGHT IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN AREAS. 12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE SIMILAR TO 00Z NUMBERS WITH 
ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO PREVIOUS MINS/MAXES.

RAIN CHANCES INCREASE THROUGH THE DAY SUNDAY AS A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM MOVES NORTH OF THE AREA SUNDAY EVENING INTO MONDAY. MODELS 
DISAGREEING A LITTLE ON TIMING OF THIS RAIN. FLOW EXPECTED TO KEEP 
RAIN OVER AREA FOR THROUGH TUESDAY SO KEPT CHANCE POP IN FOR ALL 
PERIODS. 



&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

SYSTEM APPROACHES THE AREA.  CIGS WILL LOWER OVERNIGHT WITH SCT -RA 
MOVING IN.  MOST OF THE AREA WILL REMAIN VFR.  HOWEVER...OCCASIONAL 
MVFR CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE WITH THE BEST CHANCES NORTH...NEAR 
TRI.  IMPROVING CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED LATE IN THE PERIOD.

&&

NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.

130 
FXUS64 KMRX 040750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EST MON FEB 4 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A BROAD MID/UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. HIGH CLOUDS WILL BE INCREASING AND LOWERING THROUGH THE 
DAY...BUT MODEL MOISTURE PROFILES SHOW LOW LEVELS STAYING QUITE DRY. 
VIRGA WILL BE POSSIBLE WEST IN THE LATE AFTERNOON...BUT PRECIP
ACCUMULATION AT THE GROUND WILL LIKELY HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER 00Z.
EVEN THEN...WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT AND 850-700 MB CONVERGENCE ACROSS
THE NORTHERN HALF WILL STRUGGLE TO PRODUCE EVEN A TENTH OF QPF
OVERNIGHT. UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT FOR DEEP LIFT WILL BE LACKING. THE
HIGHER QPF AMOUNTS OF THE NAM APPEAR TO BE AN OUTLIER...AS THE
GFS...SREF...AND CMC ALL SHOW VERY LIGHT AMOUNTS. THUS POPS WILL
REMAIN IN THE CHANCE RANGE. TRI SOUNDINGS IN THE NAM AND GFS SHOW
AN ABOVE-FREEZING LAYER FROM THE SURFACE TO AROUND 850 MB ALL
NIGHT...SO PRECIP WILL BE MAINLY RAIN FROM THERE SOUTH. SOME HIGHER
ELEVATIONS AND PORTIONS OF SW VA MAY CHANGE TO SNOW LATE
TONIGHT...BUT ANY ACCUMULATION WILL BE LESS THAN 1 INCH.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR
TUESDAY. DYNAMICS WEAK...SO RAIN CHANCES LOW IN THE MORNING. PLENTY
OF LEFT OVER LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE... CONTINUED WET GROUND...WEAK/CALM
WINDS AND CLEARING SKY WILL ALLOW FOR AREAS OF FOG...SOME LOCALLY
DENSE...FOR TUESDAY NIGHT.

FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD...UPPER FLOW BECOMES ZONAL 
WITH A SERIES OF WEAK SOUTHERN AND NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVES 
MOVING ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. MORE SUBSTANTIAL WAVES 
MOVES THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. ISENTROPIF LIFT AND ANOTHER 
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL PRODUCE A CHANCE/LIKELY CHANCES OF RAIN. 

NEXT SATURDAY WILL BE DOMINATED BY RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT WITH 
DRY AND UNSEASONABLY MILD CONDITIONS. STRENGTHENING SOUTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT WILL ONCE AGAIN SET THE STAGE FOR SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL AND 
POSSIBLY FLOODING FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY OF NEXT WEEK. WILL HAVE 
TO WATCH THE EVOLUTION OF THE SYSTEM CLOSELY SINCE THE AREA IS 
ALREADY VERY SATURATED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST SUN FEB 3 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS...WITH TEMPS WELL 
ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL 
SOME SCATTERED SNOW FLURRIES LINGERING OVER NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT IT APPEARS LIGHT ENOUGH TO END THE 
ADVISORIES IN THESE AREAS. ANOTHER WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS THEN 
PROGGED TO MOVE EASTWARD ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY... 
BUT THE MODELS AGREE THAT PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT WITH THIS 
SYSTEM AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES NEARLY ZONAL. TEMPS ALSO 
APPEAR WARM ENOUGH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH THIS SYSTEM FOR 
MOSTLY RAIN...ALTHOUGH UP TO AN INCH OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS MAY BE 
POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST 
TN. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL PASS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON 
TUESDAY...BUT A DECREASE IN CLOUDS BEHIND THIS FRONT SHOULD ACTUALLY 
HELP TO CREATE WARMER TEMPS ON TUESDAY. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS REVEAL SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MINS FOR TONIGHT... 
BUT ARE THEN IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. FOR NOW...WILL 
TREND TOWARDS A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO FOR TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVING ACROSS THE 
REGION. A SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH TO OUR SOUTH AS A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES FROM THE NORTH THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...AND WILL BRING 
A CHANCE OF RAIN INTO THE AREA. TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH 
FOR MAINLY RAIN WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SOME SNOW POSSIBLE OVER HIGHER 
TERRAIN. BEHIND THE FRONT...A SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN FOR A RETURN TO 
DRY CONDITIONS ON SATURDAY. A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SLOWLY 
MOVE THROUGH THE AREA SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY...THOUGH MODELS 
NOT IN AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING. HOWEVER...EXPECTING PRECIP CHANCES 
TO INCREASE THROUGH THE PERIOD.

THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VA. OTHERWISE...WILL PLAN TO LOWER HIGHS 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON...SINCE SNOW COVER AND NORTHWEST WINDS SHOULD 
HELP TO KEEP THE FORECAST AREA COOLER.

FXUS64 KMRX 030806
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 AM EST SUN FEB 3 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
A CHANNELED VORT MAX ACROSS THE UPPER MS VALLEY THIS MORNING WILL 
BRING ANOTHER SHOT OF SNOW TO THE AREA LATER THIS MORNING. WEAK LIFT 
FROM 500 MB PVA AND STEEP LAPSE RATES BENEATH THE MIDLEVEL THERMAL 
TROUGH WILL CROSS THE AREA BETWEEN 12-15Z. AN ADDITIONAL ONE HALF TO 
2 INCHES WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE ADVISORY AREAS...SO WILL KEEP THE 
ADVISORY GOING AS IS. SINCE THIS HAS BEEN A 24 HOUR SNOW 
EVENT...WARNING CRITERIA OF 6 INCHES IN 24 HOURS WILL LIKELY NOT BE 
MET OUTSIDE OF THE HIGHEST PEAKS. AFTER 15Z...MIDLEVEL MOISTURE 
DROPS BELOW THE DENDRITE GROWTH ZONE...ENDING MOST OF THE 
ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL. LEANED TOWARD THE COOLER SIDE OF MOS FOR 
TEMPS TODAY DUE TO EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND SNOW COVER IN NORTHERN 
AREAS. SKIES SHOULD CLEAR IN THE EVENING...AND LOW TEMPS TONIGHT 
WILL FALL INTO THE UPPER TEENS NORTH TO MID 20S SOUTH. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...
FOR THE EXTENDED...THE NORTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE EASTERN HALF OF
THE NATION BECOMES ZONAL BY MID-WEEK WITH A WARM-UP ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA. FOR LATE MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING...A FAST
MOVING NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM WAVES WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO
VALLEY AND GULF COAST STATES. DYNAMICS FROM THESE SYSTEMS WILL BE
MAINLY NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. GIVEN LIMITED
DYNAMICS...WILL KEEP PRECIPITATION CHANCES AND QPF AMOUNTS LOW.

SURFACE RIDGING WILL AND FAST ZONAL FLOW WILL DOMINAT THE FORECAST 
FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH DRY CONDITIONS.  FOR THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND FRIDAY...A NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES WITH A TRAILING WEAKENING COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA FRIDAY. DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE LIMITED...SO AGAIN POPS WILL BE 
LOW.

A MUCH STRONGER UPPER TROUGH MOVES INTO THE ROCKIES FOR NEXT 
WEEKEND. THIS SYSTEM WILL BRING MUCH BETTER CHANCES OF RAINFALL FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK.


&&

053 
FXUS64 KMRX 030243 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
943 PM EST SAT FEB 2 2013

.DISCUSSION...
SNOW CONTINUES TO FALL ALONG THE MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE THIS
EVENING AND ACROSS FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA...BUT THE OVERALL TREND THROUGH 06Z WILL BE A DIMINISHING
ONE AS AN UPPER-WAVE EXITS THE FORECAST AREA. SNOWFALL TOTALS HAVE
BEEN FAIRLY IMPRESSIVE IN THESE AREAS...WHERE GENERALLY 2-4 INCHES
HAS BEEN OBSERVED...WITH A FEW POCKETS UP TO 5 INCHES IN THE HIGHER
TERRAIN. WHILE SOME LOCATIONS COULD PICK UP ANOTHER INCH /TO
PERHAPS TWO INCHES IN VERY LOCALIZED AREAS IN THE MOUNTAINS/...
LIGHT SNOW WILL BE THE PREVAILING CONDITION ACROSS THESE AREAS FOR
THE REMAINDER OF THE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT. SINCE TOTALS ARE WELL
WITHIN OUR ADVISORY CRITERIA...AND AM NOT EXPECTING MUCH IN THE
WAY SOME MEANINGFUL ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS TONIGHT...WILL HANG ON
TO THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH NOON SUNDAY.

FURTHER TO THE NORTHWEST...THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU HAS
RECEIVED 1-2 INCHES...WITH A FEW LOCATIONS APPROACHING THE 3 INCH
BENCHMARK. AN ADDITIONAL UPPER-WAVE WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA LATE
TONIGHT AND INTO TOMORROW...AND PERHAPS BRING ANOTHER BURST OF
LIGHT SNOW. HOWEVER...MOISTURE PROFILES ARE DEFINITELY NOT AS DEEP
AS WHAT WAS OBSERVED TODAY...SO THINK THAT ANY ACCUMULATIONS
ACROSS THE REGION TOMORROW SHOULD BE FAIRLY MINOR AND LESS THAN ONE
INCH. HOWEVER...EXTREME CAUTION IS URGED FOR MOTORISTS IN THE
ADVISORY AREA WHERE SNOW COVERED/SLICK ROADS HAVE BEEN REPORTED
THIS EVENING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST SAT FEB 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR DETROIT...WITH 
ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY. WARMER TEMPS IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S WERE BEING 
OBSERVED JUST OUTSIDE OF THE FORECAST AREA IN ALMOST ALL 
DIRECTIONS...SO IT APPEARS THAT THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA MAY STILL RISE ABOVE FREEZING THIS AFTERNOON BEFORE THE SUN 
SETS. AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO GENERATE 
OCCASIONAL LIGHT TO MODERATE PRECIP OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING...WITH THE PREDOMINANT PRECIP TYPE BEING 
SNOW...BUT ALSO SOME RAIN AND SLEET ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT AND EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... 
BRINGING ADDITIONAL SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS. WINTER WX ADVISORY AREAS 
AND SNOW AMOUNTS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK FOR TONIGHT AND SUNDAY 
MORNING...AND WILL NOT CHANGE. IT APPEARS THAT OUTSIDE OF THE 
ADVISORY AREAS AROUND AN INCH OF ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE. 
ANOTHER 'CLIPPER' SYSTEM THEN MOVES INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON 
MONDAY NIGHT...BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF LIGHT PRECIP. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
MAXES THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BUT SHOW SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH MINS. 
FOR NOW...WILL TREND TOWARDS THE COOLER GFS NUMBERS AT NIGHT...DUE 
TO THE EXPECTED SNOW COVER IN MANY AREAS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN 
STREAM SYSTEM TRACKING THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW WILL BE EXITING THE 
AREA ON TUESDAY. MAIN ENERGY PROGGED TO STAY TO OUR NORTH AND SOUTH 
BUT MAY CONTINUE TO SEE A FEW ISOLATED POCKETS OF PRECIPITATION... 
MAINLY RAIN SOUTH AND LIGHT SNOW OR FLURRIES NORTH. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. MODEL AND RUN 
CONSISTENCY REMAINS POOR FOR THE NEXT SYSTEM. IT SHOULD MOVE IN 
AROUND THE LATE THURSDAY INTO EARLY SATURDAY TIME FRAME. WILL TREND 
THE MAIN BAND OF PRECIP THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. A MIX OF RAIN AND 
SNOW IS EXPECTED OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS BUT TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE 
WARM ENOUGH FOR AN ALL RAIN EVENT IN THE TN VALLEY. ANOTHER SYSTEM 
APPROACHES THE AREA SATURDAY EVENING INTO SUNDAY. EXPECTING PRECIP 
CHANCES TO INCREASE THROUGH THIS PERIOD.
