.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE 
CAROLINA COAST...WITH AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED NEAR CHICAGO 
AND ITS COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWEST ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER 
VALLEY. AREA RADARS REVEAL AN AREA OF LIGHT PRECIP OVER THE SOUTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH MOSTLY LIGHT SNOW BEING REPORTED 
BUT SOME "BRIGHT BANDING" ON RADAR ALSO INDICATES SOME SLEET MIXING 
IN WITH THE SNOW. THIS AREA OF PRECIP IS PROGGED TO EXPAND SOME MORE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
AMPLIFIES OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. MODELS STILL INDICATE 
SOME SURFACE WARMING ABOVE FREEZING THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS...SO IT WOULD APPEAR THAT THE 
SNOW SHOULD NOT ACCUMULATE MUCH MORE THAN AN INCH IN THESE AREAS. 
THE WINTER WX ADVISORIES APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK FOR TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...AND WILL NOT PLAN TO CHANGE.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR THIS AFTERNOON APPEARS ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL UPDATE THIS MORNING MAINLY TO REMOVE ANY MORNING WORDING.

614 
FXUS64 KMRX 020809
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 AM EST SAT FEB 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...
A SERIES OF WEAKLY AMPLIFIED SHORTWAVE TROUGHS WILL BE MOVING ACROSS 
THE AREA THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. AN INITIAL DISTURBANCE IS 
CURRENTLY BRINGING INCREASING MIDLEVEL CLOUDS EARLY THIS MORNING. 
THE SECOND WILL BRING SOME STRONGER LIFT AND DEEPER MOISTURE THIS 
AFTERNOON. LIFT WILL BE PRIMARILY DRIVEN BY WEAK 500 MB PVA AND 
850-700 MB CONVERGENCE. PRECIP ONSET WILL BE IN THE 15-18Z TIMEFRAME 
FROM WEST TO EAST...AND TEMPS AT THIS TIME LOOK COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW 
INITIALLY IN ALL LOCATIONS. SREF MEAN SHOWS THE RAIN/SNOW LINE 
GRADUALLY LIFTING NORTHWARD THROUGH THE AFTERNOON...BECOMING 
POSITIONED NEAR MRX AROUND 21Z. NAM AND GFS SOUNDINGS AT TRI SHOW AN 
ALL SNOW EVENT AT TRI...WITH TYS CHANGING TO RAIN IN THE EARLY 
AFTERNOON. CHA SHOULD BEGIN AS SNOW BUT QUICKLY CHANGE TO RAIN WITH 
NO ACCUMULATION. A THIRD DISTURBANCE WILL COME LATE 
TONIGHT...AFFECTING MAINLY NORTHERN AREAS. DRYING AND STABILIZATION 
ALOFT WILL END PRECIP SUNDAY MORNING. 

MODELS APPEAR TO BE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH QPF AMOUNTS. 
THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND NORTHERN TN VALLEY...INCLUDING THE 
TRI-CITIES AREA...ARE EXPECTED TO SEE AMOUNTS IN THE 1-3 INCH RANGE. 
WILL ADD THE TN COUNTIES ALONG THE VA BORDER TO THE ADVISORY AREA. 
SW VA...NE TN MTNS...AND THE SMOKIES WILL BE IN THE 2-4 INCH RANGE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
THE DOMINANT UPPER NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BECOME WESTERLY DURING THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR A WARMING TREND NEXT WEEK. DUE 
TO THE FAST AND LESS AMPLIFIED WESTERLY FLOW...SHORTWAVES WILL BE
WEAKER. A NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM WAVES WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS AND GULF COAST STATES MONDAY AND TUESDAY. GFS
AND ECMWF THAT THESE WAVES WILL SHOW LITTLE IF ANY PHASING. SINCE
THE ENERGY FOR THESE WAVES GENERALLY STAY NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE
FORECAST AREA...PRECIPITATION CHANCES AND AMOUNTS WILL BE LOW...PER
GOING FORECAST.

SURFACD RIDGING WILL DOMINATE FOR MID-WEEK PRODUCING DRY CONDITIONS. 
A MORE AMPLIFIED NORTHERN STREAM WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
GREAT LAKES FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...BUT BULK OF THE ENERGY AND 
MOISTURE WILL STAY NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER SURFACE RIDGE 
BUILDS INTO THE AREA FOR FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 020224 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
924 PM EST FRI FEB 1 2013

.DISCUSSION...
VERY MINOR TWEAKS MADE TO THE FORECAST THIS EVENING AS EVERYTHING
LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK. IN WAKE OF A COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE...COLDER
AND DRIER AIR HAS FILTERED INTO THE REGION AS A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE
OVER THE OHIO VALLEY AS BUILT INTO THE AREA. THIS STRONG
SUBSIDENCE HAS PROMOTED CLEAR CONDITIONS THIS EVENING AND ALLOWED
TEMPERATURES TO FALL OFF QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET. THE COMBINATION OF
THE CLEAR...CALM AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL ALLOW LOW TEMPERATURES TO
DROP INTO THE MID TEENS TO AROUND 20 DEGREES IN MANY LOCATIONS...
THE COLDEST OF THE WINTER SEASON SO FAR. THE ONE WILD CARD WILL BE
SOME INCREASING MID/HIGH CLOUD COVER FROM THE NORTHWEST FROM AN
UPPER-WAVE THAT WILL IMPACT THE REGION TOMORROW. STILL...GIVEN THE
COLD/DRY AIR IN PLACE AND MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS EXPECTED THROUGH
THE EVENING AND PART OF THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD...THINK THE INHERITED
TEMPERATURE FORECAST WAS ON TRACK.

&&

705 
FXUS64 KMRX 012006
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EST FRI FEB 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE LOWER 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY...WITH A VERY COLD AND DRY ARCTIC AIR MASS OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. IN FACT...IT APPEARS THAT TEMPS TONIGHT COULD BE 
THE COLDEST SO FAR THIS WINTER SEASON. MODELS INDICATE A WARM AIR 
ADVECTION PATTERN DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...AS 
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. 
THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL HELP TO GENERATE LIGHT PRECIP OVER THE OHIO 
AND TN RIVER VALLEYS ON SATURDAY...ESPECIALLY DURING THE AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING HOURS. MODELS ARE REVEALING SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH HOW 
WARM THE VERTICAL TEMP PROFILE WILL BE OVER THE FORECAST AREA... 
WHICH IS LIKELY THE RESULT OF DIFFERENCES WITH THE MODELS ABOUT HOW 
MUCH EVAPORATIVE COOLING WILL DEVELOP IN THE DRY LOW-LEVEL AIR. WITH 
THE BULK OF THE PRECIP EXPECTED TO DEVELOP DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EARLY EVENING HORUS (WHEN TEMPS WILL LIKELY BE ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA)...THINK THAT ANY APPRECIABLE SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE 
MOUNTAINS...NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...AND SOUTHWEST VA. 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THEN DEVELOPS OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH AXIS MOVES 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. THUS...EXPECT SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS 
MAINLY OVER THE FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WITH 
ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND SATURDAY NIGHT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE 
MOUNTAINS OF NORTHEAST TN...WHERE LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OF ONE TO 
FOUR INCHES APPEAR POSSIBLE. ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE LOWER 
ELEVATIONS...WARM TEMPS IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER SHOULD LIMIT ANY 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS TO AROUND AN INCH OR LESS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS 
AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT THROUGH SUNDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL COMPROMISE WHERE SOME DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE EXITS THE AREA ON 
MONDAY AS THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES THE AREA. THE INCOMING FRONT 
WILL SPREAD A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY. A FEW FLURRIES MAY LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING BUT 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN DURING THE DAY FOR DRY AND 
WARMER CONDITIONS THROUGH THURSDAY. MODELS DIVERGE BY THE END OF THE 
EXTENDED AND CONFIDENCE LOW BUT WILL HAVE LOW POPS ON FRIDAY FOR THE 
APPROACH OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   22  43  32  48  25 /   0  40  30  10   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     19  40  30  44  23 /   0  60  60  20   0

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT NEAR THE CAROLINA 
COAST...WITH A VERY COLD ARCTIC AIR MASS MOVING IN BEHIND IT OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. IN FACT...TEMPS WILL LIKELY REMAIN BELOW FREEZING 
IN MANY AREAS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THIS AFTERNOON. 
SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS A FEW CUMULUS CLOUDS LINGERING OVER THE

ADVECTING INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY SHOULD CONTINUE TO DIMINISH THESE 
CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON.

ADVISORY HEADLINES AND ANY MENTION OF MORNING PRECIP.

875 
FXUS64 KMRX 010816
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 AM EST FRI FEB 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
PROJECTED MOVEMENT OF THE SNOW NOW MOVING THROUGH THE AREA TAKES IT 
TO OUR EAST BY 10Z. IT APPEARS THAT MOST LOCATIONS IN THE ADVISORY 
WILL SEE A DUSTING TO 1 INCH BEFORE THEN. SOME POCKETS UP TO 2 
INCHES WILL BE POSSIBLE IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL KEEP A LOW TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING AFTER 12Z ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS AND THE 
MOUNTAINS WHERE UPSLOPE WINDS WILL BE FAVORABLE...BUT WITH 
DECREASING MOISTURE ALOFT...LITTLE ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED AFTER 
SUNRISE. WITH TEMPS FALLING INTO THE 20S...ICY ROADS COULD KEEP
CONDITIONS HAZARDOUS DESPITE LIGHT SNOW AMOUNTS...AND SO THE
ADVISORY WILL BE CONTINUED TO 10 AM EST.

OBS ACROSS THE AREA HAVE SHOWN WIND GUSTS IN THE 30-40 MPH RANGE. 
FRONTAL PASSAGE IS EXPECTED AROUND 09Z...WITH WINDS BECOMING 
WESTERLY AND GRADUALLY DECREASING THEREAFTER. THE WIND ADVISORY WILL 
BE CONTINUED UNTIL 6 AM.

AS THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS MOVES TO OUR EAST...WE WILL SEE CLEARING 
THROUGH THE MORNING. DESPITE THE SUNSHINE...COLD ADVECTION WILL KEEP 
TEMPS QUITE COLD...WITH HIGHS FROM THE LOWER 20S NORTH TO MID 30S 
SOUTH. HIGH PRESSURE WILL SETTLE OVER THE AREA TONIGHT...ALLOWING 
TEMPS TO DROP INTO THE TEENS TO LOWER 20S. SOME INCREASING CLOUDS 
LATE IN THE NIGHT MAY PREVENT TEMPS FROM FALLING FURTHER.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)... 
FOR MOST OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST UPPER FLOW WILL BE NORTHWEST
WITH A SERIES OF FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVES MOVING ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN/CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. FIRST WAVES MOVE THROUGH SATURDAY
AND SUNDAY WITH MODELS SHOWING FAIRLY STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT. SOME
UPPER JET ENERGY AS WELL AIDING SOME MODERATE FRONTO-GENETIC
FORCING. ALSO...BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW WILL BECOME MORE WEST-NORTHWEST
SUNDAY PRODUCING OROGRAPHIC LIFT INTO THE NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS.

WILL CALL FOR ANOTHER LIGHT SNOWFALL OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT WITH HEAVIER AMOUNTS ACROSS
THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN MOUNTAINS. SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE FOR THE 
NORTHEAST SECTONS ON SUNDAY WITH LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY AS DEPICTED 
OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON.

ANOTHER QUICK MOVING ALBERTA CLIPPER-LIKE SYSTEM FOR MONDAY NIGHT/
TUESDAY MORNING AND AGAIN TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING...BUT BEST 
DYNAMICS STAYS NORTH OF THE AREA WITH NORTHEAST SECTIONS ONLY 
GETTING BRUSHED.

FOR END OF THE EXTENDED...UPPER FLOW BECOMES MORE WESTERLY WITH DRY 
WEATHER UNTIL NEXT WEEKEND.


&&

573 
FXUS64 KMRX 312017
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST THU JAN 31 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH A 
COLD AND DRY AIR MASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS AGREE THAT A 
SHORT WAVE UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH WILL DIVE SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT...WHICH WILL QUICKLY PUSH THIS COLD FRONT 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA WITH SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS DEVELOPING 
ALONG AND BEHIND IT. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE SOME LOW-LEVEL 
INSTABILITY DEVELOPING OVER THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT...WITH 
CAPE VALUES UP TO 50 J/KG. ALTHOUGH THE MODELS DO NOT INDICATE MUCH 
MOISTURE WITH THIS QUICK-MOVING FRONT...THIS LOW-LEVEL INSTABILITY 
SHOULD HELP TO PRODUCE SOME INTENSE SNOWFALL RATES WITH THESE SNOW 
SHOWERS. IN ADDITION...TEMPS IN THE 20S TONIGHT SHOULD HELP TO 
ENSURE THAT ANY SNOW THAT FALLS ACCUMULATES QUICKLY (AND POSSIBLY 
WITH A SNOW-TO-LIQUID RATIO HIGHER THAN THE STANDARD 10:1 RATIO). 
WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL EXPAND THE WINTER WX ADVISORY TO INCLUDE 
ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA EXCEPT THE LOWER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHEAST TN 
WHERE ANY ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE NO MORE THAN AN INCH. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT WINDS WILL INCREASE AGAIN THIS EVENING WITH THE COLD 
FRONT...SO WILL EXPAND THE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS TO 
CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING. ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL THEN 
QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY NIGHT...BRINGING 
ANOTHER QUICK SHOT OF PRECIP. LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS AGAIN 
APPEAR POSSIBLE WITH THIS QUICK-MOVING SYSTEM...MAINLY OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...A FEW POCKETS OF LIGHT SNOW 
WILL LINGER OVER NORTHEASTERN LOCATIONS ON SUNDAY MORNING. 
OTHERWISE...SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. A WEAK 
SYSTEM STILL ON TRACK FOR TUESDAY. MODELS SHOW LITTLE MOISTURE WITH 
THE SYSTEM AND 20 TO 30 POPS SHOULD COVER WITH SNOW NORTH AND RAIN 
SOUTH. A FEW SHOWERS MAY LINGER INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. THE NEXT 
SYSTEM WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA ON THURSDAY. CURRENT MODELS PUT 
TIMING BEYOND THURSDAY AND WILL LEAVE THE DAY DRY FOR NOW.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    22  27  18  37  29 /  70  30   0  50  60

     FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...
     WASHINGTON...WISE.

FXUS64 KMRX 311544
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1040 AM EST THU JAN 31 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LEE TROUGH ALONG THE EASTERN 
FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. SATELLITE IMAGERY REVEALS AN EXTENSIVE 
AREA OF CLOUDS OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AND THE EASTERN HALF OF 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY...WHICH WILL LIKELY LINGER THROUGH THE AFTERNOON 
HOURS AS THIS NEXT COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA WITH A 
BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH LINGERING OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION. THIS 
UPPER TROUGH MAY HELP TO GENERATE ADDITIONAL SNOW FLURRIES THROUGH 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA... 
SO WILL PLAN TO MENTION THIS IN THE UPDATED FORECAST THIS MORNING.

THE REST OF THE FORECAST FOR TODAY APPEARS TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE...AND 
WILL CONTINUE THE WIND ADVISORY IN THE MOUNTAINS THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS.

.AVIATION...
GUSTY SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS WILL CONTINUE THIS MORNING AND INTO THE
AFTERNOON AT EACH TERMINAL AS AN UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM MOVES
ACROSS THE REGION...BEFORE THEY FINALLY TAPER OFF AFTER SUNSET.
VFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED...BUT SOME OVC/BKN DECKS OF LOWER
CLOUDS WILL LINGER THROUGH LATE MORNING...BEFORE BECOMING SCT AT
TYS/CHA BY MIDDAY. -SN IS EXPECTED LATE IN THE PERIOD AT
KTYS/KTRI AS A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE AREA...SHIFTING WINDS TO
THE WNW AREAWIDE.

AMP






346 
FXUS64 KMRX 310929
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
429 AM EST THU JAN 31 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
IN WAKE OF THE THUNDERSTORMS AND HEAVY RAIN THAT MOVED ACROSS THE 
REGION TODAY...SOME MINOR FLOODING IS STILL OCCURRING ALONG SOME 
AREA STREAMS AND RIVERS...PRIMARILY ALONG THE MOUNTAINS AND 
FOOTHILLS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE. SOME LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS ARE ALSO DRIFTING ACROSS THE AREA THANKS TO SOME COLDER
AIR THAT HAS MOVED IN AND THE LINGERING MOISTURE STILL IN PLACE.
HOWEVER... AS MENTIONED THIS PRECIPITATION WILL BE LIGHT WITH VERY
MINOR ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS AND PERHAPS UP
TO AN INCH ALONG THE HIGHEST MOUNTAIN PEAKS THROUGH THIS MORNING.
THE MAIN STORY TODAY WILL BE THE PERSISTENT GUSTY WINDS ASSOCIATED
WITH THE PASSAGE OF AN UPPER-TROUGH. A WIND ADVISORY IS STILL IN
EFFECT FOR THE MOUNTAIN ZONES OF EAST TENNESSEE THROUGH 23Z
TODAY...BEFORE THEY FINALLY BEGIN TO RELAX AFTER SUNSET.

THE PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE SHORT-LIVED AS A 
CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL DROP INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FROM THE OHIO 
VALLEY...BRINGING IN ANOTHER SHOT OF COLD AIR. WITH SOME SUBSTANTIAL 
MOISTURE AND LIFT TO WORK WITH...SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP 
AND MOVE ACROSS THE REGION LATE THIS EVENING. WITH SOME APPRECIABLE
LIFT AND SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY...PERIODS OF LIGHT TO MODERATE
SNOW ARE EXPECTED AT TIMES...PARTICULARLY AFTER MIDNIGHT AND ALONG
THE MOUNTAIN ZONES OF EAST TENNESSEE AND THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. SOME LIGHT SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS OF BETWEEN
1-2 INCHES ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND
THE HIGHER FOOTHILLS AND MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE WILL BE
POSSIBLE BY FRIDAY MORNING. THEREFORE HAVE DECIDED TO ISSUE A
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THOSE AREAS FROM 03Z TONIGHT THROUGH
15Z FRIDAY MORNING. LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS WILL BE POSSIBLE ALONG
THE PEAKS OF THE SMOKIES. MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS ARE EXPECTED TO
RECEIVE VERY MINOR ACCUMULATIONS LESS THAN ONE INCH AND WERE NOT
INCLUDED IN THE ADVISORY.

.LONG TERM /FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...
ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN CONTINUES WITH THE COLDER TEMPERATURES
MAKING FOR SOME ADDED CHALLENGES. GFS...NAM AND ECMWF ARE ALL
ADVERTISING A BIT MORE QPF WITH THE FAST SHORTWAVE TROUGH ON
SATURDAY...WHILE THE SREF AND CANADIAN ARE SHOWING MUCH LIGHTER
QPF. FORECAST SOUNDINGS DON'T FAVOR ALL SNOW EXCEPT FOR SW VA AND
PERHAPS NRN MTNS OF E TN... WHICH ALSO ADDS A GOOD DEAL OF
UNCERTAINTY. HOWEVER...FELT THAT MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION (PCPN) IS
MORE LIKELY NOW ON SATURDAY... SO POPS WERE INCREASED TO LIKELY
ACROSS THE NRN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. LATER SHIFTS CAN
DETERMINE IF A SNOW ACCUMULATION THREAT IS JUSTIFIED...WITH 0.5 TO
AROUND 1.0 INCH OF SNOW IN THE GRIDS FOR NOW IN THE FAVORED AREAS.

THE SYSTEM FOR LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY IS STILL QUESTIONABLE...
WITH A DRY TREND NOTED IN THE 31/00Z GFS MODEL RUN...WHILE LATEST 
CANADIAN AND ECMWF ARE SUPPORTIVE OF 20 TO 30 PERCENT POPS FOR 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. THESE PERIODS ARE A TARGET FOR IMPROVEMENT 
SO I KEPT CLOSE TO PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR NOW. KEEPING SUNDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY DRY WITH VERY MINOR TEMP ADJUSTMENTS IN LINE WITH 31/00Z 
GFS MOS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             46  26  36  22  47 /  10  30  10   0  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  42  21  32  20  42 /  10  50  10   0  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       43  21  33  20  40 /  10  40  10   0  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              37  19  28  14  39 /  20  60  30   0  60 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EST 
     FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...
     JOHNSON...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST GREENE...SEVIER 
     SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST GREENE...
     SOUTHEAST MONROE...SULLIVAN...UNICOI...WASHINGTON TN.

     WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...UNICOI.

VA...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EST 
     FRIDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...
     WASHINGTON...WISE.

BUT SOME OVC/BKN LOW VFR CIGS ARE GENERALLY EXPECTED TO PERSIST
THROUGH THE NIGHT AND DAY TMRW. SOME ISOLATED -RA WILL BE POSSIBLE
OVERNIGHT...BUT DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH CONFIDENCE TO MENTION IN THE
TAF. -SN IS EXPECTED LATE IN THE PERIOD AT KTYS/KTRI.

FXUS64 KMRX 310255

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 PM EST WED JAN 30 2013

.DISCUSSION...SURGE OF COLDER AIR BEGINNING TO WORK INTO THE AREA
BEHIND THE EXITING COLD FRONT. SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL CONTINUE TO
EXIT...BUT SOME SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER ESPECIALLY IN THE
MOUNTAINS FOR SEVERAL HOURS. WILL LOWER POPS...AND WILL TWEAK
TEMPS AND DEW POINTS. FLOOD WATCH WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE...BUT
WATER LEVELS WILL BE SLOW TO SUBSIDE IN MANY LOCATIONS AND SOME
RIVERS CONTINUE TO RISE WHICH WILL BE HANDLED WITH FLOOD WARNINGS.
WIND ADVISORY FOR THE TN MOUNTAINS WILL REMAIN AS IS FOR NOW.

BEFORE MAIN AREA OF RAIN EXITS. AS THE COLDER AIR PUSHES IN MAY SEE

LW







683 
FXUS64 KMRX 302018
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST WED JAN 30 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH ANOTHER 
SECONDARY COLD FRONT FURTHER WEST OVER THE LOWER OHIO AND WESTERN TN 
RIVER VALLEYS. A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MS 
RIVER VALLEY WILL SWING EASTWARD OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS 
EVENING...CONTINUING TO GENERATE AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF LIGHT TO 
MODERATE RAIN WITH AN ADDITIONAL INCH OR TWO OF RAINFALL POSSIBLE. 
THUS...WILL CONTINUE THE FLOOD WATCH INTO THIS EVENING...SINCE THIS 
RAIN WILL FALL ON ALREADY SATURATED GROUNDS FROM THE SIGNIFICANT 
RAINFALL EARLIER THIS MONTH. AS FOR THE WIND ADVISORIES AND 
WARNINGS...WIND SPEEDS FROM THE LATEST OBS ARE WELL BELOW ADVISORY 
AND WARNING LEVELS...BUT MODELS INDICATE THAT WINDS WILL INCREASE 
AGAIN THIS EVENING WITH THE SECONDARY FRONT. HOWEVER...IT APPEARS 
THAT WINDS WILL REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA OUTSIDE OF THE 
MOUNTAINS...SO WILL CANCEL THE WIND ADVISORIES AND WARNING FOR 
EVERYWHERE EXCEPT THE MOUNTAINS WHERE A WIND ADVISORY WILL REMAIN IN 
EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE 
VERTICAL TEMP PROFILE WILL COOL QUICKLY LATER THIS EVENING...AS THE 
SECONDARY FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...BY THE 
TIME THE RAIN CHANGES TO SNOW...IT APPEARS RIGHT NOW THAT THE BULK 
OF THE MOISTURE WILL HAVE EXITED THE FORECAST AREA WITH ONLY LIGHT 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS OF AN INCH OR TWO POSSIBLE IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT AND LOOK REASONABLE. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WEATHER DURING THIS PERIOD 
OF THE FORECAST SHOULD BE MORE TYPICAL OF WINTER AS A LONG WAVE 
TROUGH HOLDS ITS POSITION OVER THE EASTERN U.S. AT LEAST A COUPLE OF 
SHORTER WAVELENGTH FEATURES WILL MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION IN THE PREVAILING NORTHWEST FLOW. THE FIRST 
FEATURE WILL MOVE TOWARD THE AREA SATURDAY MORNING WITH MODELS 
AGREEING IMPACT NOT OCCURRING UNTIL THE AFTERNOON HOURS. LOOKS LIKE 
TEMPERATURES MAY NOT RISE SIGNIFICANTLY ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AS WELL AS THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE BEFORE THE PRECIPITATION 
BEGINS AROUND MID DAY INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. THEREFORE...STAYED 
WITH SNOW SHOWERS AS PREDOMINANT PRECIP TYPE IN THESE AREAS WHILE 
MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA MAY BE WARM ENOUGH FOR 
RAIN. THE SHORT WAVE CONTINUES THROUGH THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
PRECIPITATION WOULD LIKELY CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THIS TIME FRAME BUT THE SHORT WAVE WILL BE 
MOVING RAPIDLY EAST THROUGH THE NIGHT BRINGING AN END TO ANY FROZEN 
PRECIP ACROSS MUCH OF THE LOWER ELEVATIONS BY MIDNIGHT. KEPT UPSLOPE 
SNOW SHOWERS GOING ACROSS HIGHER TERRAIN OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING WHEN THE LOW 
LEVEL FLOW DRIES OUT. VALLEY LOCATIONS AROUND CENTRAL EAST TENNESSEE 
MAY SEE A DUSTING WITH THIS EVENT WHILE LOWER ELEVATIONS ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA MAY SEE AMOUNTS AROUND 
ONE INCH. HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS MAINLY OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER COULD SEE AT LEAST A COUPLE INCHES 
WITH THE CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEM. THE FORECAST AREA DRIES OUT COMPLETELY 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH ABOUT MONDAY AFTERNOON WHEN THE NEXT SHORT 
WAVE AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM BUILD SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE 
REGION. MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT AT THIS TIME SO KEPT POPS 
IN A LOW CHANCE CATEGORY. LOOKS LIKE ENOUGH WARMING AHEAD OF THIS 
SYSTEM FOR PRECIP TO BE MAINLY IN THE FORM OF RAIN BUT MAY END AS 
SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN TUESDAY NIGHT. WAS 
ABLE TO KEEP WEDNESDAY DRY WITH SOME RIDGING BUILDING INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   32  46  24  36  22 /  40  10  20  10   0 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     31  43  21  33  19 /  60  10  40  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN             31  43  20  33  18 /  60  10  30  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    30  38  18  28  15 /  80  20  60  20   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: CHEROKEE...CLAY.

TN...FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 10 PM EST /9 PM CST/ THIS EVENING FOR THE 
     FOLLOWING ZONES: ANDERSON...BLEDSOE...BLOUNT SMOKY

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1125 AM EST WED JAN 30 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT OVER MIDDLE TN...WITH 
UNSEASONABLY WARM AND MOIST AIR REMAINING AHEAD OF IT. AREA RADARS 
REVEAL A LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH SOME 
EMBEDDED TSTORMS ON ITS FRONT EDGE ALONG THE FOOTHILLS OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER 
THE PLAINS WILL CONTINUE TO SWING EASTWARD THIS AFTERNOON...AND WILL 
CONTINUE TO GENERATE AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA AS THE COLD FRONT SLOWLY MOVES THROUGH. MODELS INDICATE THAT 
ANOTHER ONE TO TWO INCHES WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS AFTERNOON...SO THINK A FLOOD WATCH WOULD BE PRUDENT WITH THE 
GROUND ALREADY SATURATED FROM RAINFALL EARLIER THIS MONTH. AS FOR 
THE WIND ADVISORIES/WARNINGS...IT APPEARS THAT WINDS MAY NOT REACH 
ADVISORY CRITERIA OUTSIDE OF ANY CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY ON THE LEADING 
EDGE OF THE PRECIP...BUT WILL LET THE WIND ADVISORY CONTINUE THROUGH 
THE AFTERNOON JUST IN CASE.

OVERALL...WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH AREA 
WIDE TO ACCOUNT FOR THE ADDITIONAL RAINFALL EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON. 
&&

.AVIATION...
STRONG GUSTY WINDS ALOFT WILL TRANSLATE TO THE SURFACE THIS
MORNING...CREATING VERY BREEZY/GUSTY CONDITIONS THROUGHOUT THE DAY.
A LINE OF TSRA WILL ADVANCE INTO THE REGION FROM WEST TO EAST THIS
MORNING....BEFORE MOVING OUT OF THE AREA BY EARLY AFTERNOON. IFR
CONDITIONS WITH LOCALIZED STRONG WIND GUSTS ARE EXPECTED AS THIS
LINE PASSES THROUGH EACH TERMINAL. A RETURN TO VFR CONDITIONS IS
EXPECTED IN WAKE OF THE STORMS BY THE AFTERNOON...BUT GUSTY
WESTERLY WINDS WILL PERSIST THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT.

915 
FXUS64 KMRX 300923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
423 AM EST WED JAN 30 2013

.SHORT TERM /TODAY AND TONIGHT/...
VERY BUSY FORECAST IN THE SHORT TERM AS THE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE
WEATHER WILL EXIST ACROSS THE REGION TODAY...FOLLOWED BY A SHARP
COOL DOWN AND SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL ALONG THE HIGHER
TERRAIN LATER TONIGHT.

A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL
CONTINUE TO TRACK EASTWARD INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TODAY.
AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE
OHIO/TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEYS AND INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN
REGION TODAY. ADDITIONALLY...A STRONG 60-70 KT 850 MB JET AND AN
EVEN STRONGER 100-120 KT 500 MB JET WILL ROTATE OVER THE AREA.
THIS STRONG SOUTH/SOUTHWEST FLOW HAS HELPED TO PUSH SOME VERY
WARM/MOIST GULF AIR INTO THE REGION...AS NIGHTTIME TEMPS HAVE
REMAINED IN THE 60S...WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S
IN MANY LOCATIONS. THIS STRONG WIND SHEAR AND JET DYNAMICS...ALONG
WITH THE LIFT PROVIDED FROM THE FRONT WILL COMBINE WITH SOME
INCREASED INSTABILITY THIS MORNING TO PROVIDE THE INGREDIENTS
NECESSARY FOR SEVERE WEATHER ACROSS THE AREA TODAY.

EARLY THIS MORNING...A QLCS CONTINUES TO MARCH EASTWARD ACROSS
WESTERN KENTUCKY AND MIDDLE TENNESSEE MOVING EAST AOA 35-40
KTS...WHICH SHOULD PLACE IT ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AROUND
DAYBREAK...MOVING ACROSS THE AREA DURING THE MORNING/EARLY
AFTERNOON. AHEAD OF THIS SQUALL LINE...SOME ADDITIONAL SCATTERED
SHOWERS HAVE ALSO BEGUN TO DEVELOP ACROSS NORTHEAST ALABAMA AND
MOVE INTO SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. WITH CAPE VALUES INCREASING TO
AROUND 1000 J/KG ACROSS THE VALLEY ALONG THE I-75 CORRIDOR AND WITH
INHIBITION GRADUALLY DECREASING OVERNIGHT...SOME ADDITIONAL
SCATTERED/DISCRETE ACTIVITY WILL BE POSSIBLE AHEAD OF THE
AFOREMENTIONED LINE. GIVEN THE STRONG JET DYNAMICS...THE PRIMARY
THREAT WITH THIS STORM SYSTEM WILL BE DAMAGING WINDS...BOTH
CONVECTIVE /FROM THE THUNDERSTORMS/ AND GRADIENT IN NATURE GIVEN
THE STRONG LOW/MID-LEVEL WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS STORM SYSTEM
THAT WILL TRANSLATE DOWN TO THE SURFACE AFTER SUNRISE. AS A
RESULT...A WIND ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA
THROUGH 9 PM TONIGHT AND A HIGH WIND WARNING FOR THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS OF EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FROM 5 AM TO 7
PM TODAY.

HOWEVER...GIVEN THE STRONG LOW-LEVEL SHEAR AOA 30+ KTS...SOME
BACKED WIND PROFILES NOTED AT KCHA AND KCSV AND PROGGED HELICITY
VALUES OVER 500 M2/S2 THIS MORNING ACROSS THE VALLEY...THE THREAT
FOR ISOLATED TORNADOES CANNOT BE RULED OUT...ESPECIALLY IN SUPERCELL
STRUCTURES THAT MAY DEVELOP JUST AHEAD OF OR EMBEDDED IN THE LINE.
ADDITIONALLY...SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH
QPF VALUES BETWEEN 1 TO 1.5 INCHES EXPECTED OVER MOST OF THE
FORECAST AREA.

LATER TONIGHT BEHIND THE FRONT...COLDER AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE
AREA...CHANGING ANY LINGERING RAIN SHOWERS OVER TO SNOW SHOWERS
OVER THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST ZONES. ANY ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE
LIGHT AND MAINLY CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HOWEVER...SOME
PEAKS ALONG THE SMOKIES COULD GET UP TO 2 INCHES BY DAYBREAK. 

.LONG TERM /THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY/...
STILL A RATHER UNSETTLED PATTERN FOR THE LONG TERM. AN UPPER
TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE NE STATES THURSDAY NIGHT AND
FRIDAY...PUSHING SOME COLDER AIR INTO THE SRN APPALACHIANS. PATTERN
SUPPORTS SOME UPSLOPE SNOWFALL FOR FAVORED PARTS OF SW VA AND NRN
MTNS DOWN TO THE SMOKIES AT LEAST. BEST PERIOD FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW
ACCUMULATION LOOKS TO BE 06Z TO 15Z FRIDAY...WITH NW LOW LEVEL
WINDS MAINLY FOR SW VA AND NRN MTNS PLUS DECENT LOW LEVEL CAPES OF
50 TO 100 J/KG. SOUNDINGS...ESPECIALLY NAM...SHOW SUFFICIENT
MOISTURE AND ABOUT -20 DEGS C AT THE TOP OF THE MOIST COLUMN.
HOWEVER...EVEN NAM SOUNDINGS SHOW THIS MOISTURE TO BE VERY SHALLOW
BY 15Z FRIDAY AND VIRTUALLY NO CAPE BY EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON.
PREVIOUS GRIDS HAD LIGHT SNOW AMOUNTS FOR THESE AREAS... SO MAIN
ADJUSTMENT WAS TO NUDGE POPS UP TO LIKELY. STAYED WITH CHANCE POPS
ELSEWHERE IN LINE WITH A MOS BLEND. KNOCKED FRIDAY MAX TEMPS DOWN
BY SEVERAL DEGREES...QUITE CLOSE TO GFS MOS.

OTHERWISE...NEXT SYSTEM OF ANY SIGNIFICANCE APPEARS TO BE LATE 
SATURDAY INTO SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH A FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE DROPPING 
ESE OUT OF THE MID MS VALLEY REGION. NOT SURE IF THIS ONE HAS ENOUGH 
MOISTURE TO GENERATE A LOT OF PRECIPITATION...PLUS SRN HALF OF THE 
AREA LOOKS WARM ENUFF FOR RAIN AND NRN AREAS COLD ENUFF FOR SNOW OR 
A MIX. THUS...WILL LET DAY SHIFT EXAMINE THIS AGAIN. 

ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND SURFACE RIDGE KEEP SUNDAY INTO EARLY MONDAY 
DRY. KEPT POPS IN FOR LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY FOR AN APPROACHING 
COLD FRONT...WITH GFS AND ECMWF SIMILAR AND IN LINE WITH THESE 
GRIDS. TEMPS WERE GENERALLY NUDGED DOWNWARD MOST DAYS IN LINE WITH 
30/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             68  30  45  28  40 / 100  40  10  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  69  30  41  24  36 / 100  60  10  40  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       68  29  41  23  34 / 100  50  10  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              65  29  37  22  30 / 100  70  10  50  20

BE POSSIBLE AS THIS LINE MOVES THROUGH. A RETURN TO VFR CONDITIONS

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
944 PM EST TUE JAN 29 2013

.DISCUSSION...
FOR TONIGHT...LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS OVER NE GA AND UPSTATE SC ARE
SPREADING NORTHWARD...ASSOCIATED WITH AN AREA OF ISENTROPIC LIFT.
SOME ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE MAIN CONVECTIVE LINE MAY BEGIN
TO AFFECT THE PLATEAU COUNTIES IN THE 11-13Z TIMEFRAME. WILL NOT
MAKE ANY CHANGES TO POP OR WX GRIDS. TEMPERATURES MAY NEED SOME
SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS AS CURRENT OBS ARE BELOW FORECAST. WINDS SPEED
OBS ACROSS THE AREA ARE GRADUALLY INCREASING...AND THE CURRENT
WIND ADVISORY AND HIGH WIND WARNING AREAS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK AND
WILL NOT BE CHANGED.

CURRENT PROJECTED TIMING OF THE MAIN CONVECTIVE LINE BRINGS IT
THROUGH THE TN VALLEY AREA BETWEEN 14-18Z. THIS IS MORE IN LINE
WITH THE FASTER TIMING OF THE GFS. THE NAM HAS BEEN SLOWER IN THE
12Z AND 18Z MODEL RUNS...AND IT STILL APPEARS SLOWER WITH ITS 00Z
RUN. THE 00Z OHX SOUNDING SHOWS AN ELEVATED MIXED LAYER BETWEEN
800-500 MB...WHICH WILL SUPPLY SOME INSTABILITY. WHILE SHEAR IS
STRONG...IT IS MAINLY UNIDIRECTIONAL...SUGGESTING LINEAR STORMS
WITH THE MAIN THREAT BEING STRAIGHT-LINE DAMAGING WINDS. A LOW
TORNADO THREAT MAY EXIST IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY WHERE SURFACE WINDS
WILL BE A BIT MORE BACKED TO PROVIDE DIRECTIONAL SHEAR.

POSSIBLE AS IT MOVES THROUGH. VFR CONDITIONS SHOULD FOLLOW THE

GUSTY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 PM EST TUE JAN 29 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...STRONG SYSTEM HEADED THIS
WAY. HAVE WIND ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS STARTING TONIGHT AND GOING
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED GOOD...ONLY WARMED
UP NE FOR LOWS TONIGHT A FEW DEGREES. WILL HAVE WIDESPREAD
CONVECTION ALONG AND AHEAD OF FRONT ON WEDNESDAY. THUNDER IS
SOMEWHAT OF A QUESTION...BUT HAVE SHOWERS WITH A CHANCE OF STORMS
AS THE WORDING. MAIN SEVERE THREAT IS HEAVILY WEIGHTED TOWARD
DAMAGING WINDS. AS MENTIONED BEFORE THUNDER MAY BE A QUESTION...BUT
EVEN WEAK DOWNDRAFTS IN SHOWERS WILL BE ABLE TO BRING ADDITIONAL
MOMENTUM DOWN TO THE GROUND...ENHANCING DAMAGE POTENTIAL. RAINS
WILL BE HEAVY AT TIMES...BUT CONSIDERING EXPECTED AMOUNTS AND FLASH
FLOOD GUIDANCE HAVE DECIDED NOT TO ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH FOR ANY PART
OF THE AREA. QPF TOTALS RANGE FROM A LITTLE OVER AN INCH ON THE
PLATEAU TO 1.50 TO 2.00 IN SW NORTH CAROLINA. NORTHEASTERN AREAS
ARE IN THE 1.00 TO 1.50 INCH RANGE. THINK MAIN CONVECTIVE LINE WILL
RACE THROUGH THE AREA...ENTERING THE AREA ROUGHLY 12-13Z...AND
EXITING THE AREA ROUGHLY 18-19Z. SHOWERS WILL BE DEVELOPING AHEAD
OF THE MAIN LINE...AND LINGERING STRATOFORM RAINS WILL SLOWLY
FOLLOW THE CONVECTIVE LINE.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SHOWERS WILL TAPER 
OFF AND END WEDNESDAY NIGHT/EARLY THURSDAY...BUT WITH COLDER AIR 
MOVING IN MAY SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS BEFORE THE PRECIP ENDS. LOOKS 
LIKE ANY SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL BE FAIRLY BRIEF AND DOES NOT LOOK 
LIKE A GOOD SET UP FOR UPSLOPE COLD ADVECTION SNOW...BUT STILL COULD 
SEE SOME LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  WILL MENTION 
IN HWO.  A FAST MOVING WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL SWING ACROSS THE REGION 
THURSDAY NIGHT ALONG WITH A COLD FRONT.  MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED 
WITH THIS SYSTEM...BUT APPEARS THERE COULD BE SOME LIGHT SNOW 
ESPECIALLY NORTHERN HALF FOR A FEW HOURS DURING THE NIGHT.  SINCE IT 
WILL BE QUITE COLD...THERE IS THE AT LEAST SOME POTENTIAL FOR MINOR 
ACCUMULATIONS WITH THIS SYSTEM...MAINLY NORTHERN HALF...ALTHOUGH 
STILL CONSIDERABLE UNCERTAINTY ABOUT HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL BE 
AVAILABLE.  FOR NOW WILL JUST BEEF POPS UP AS HIGH AS HIGH CHANCE 
NORTH FOR THURSDAY NIGHT.  THERE MAY BE YET ANOTHER FAST MOVING WEAK 
SYSTEM FOR SATURDAY...ALTHOUGH MODEL HANDLING OF THIS HAS BEEN 
INCONSISTENT SO FORECAST CONFIDENCE IS LOW...AND FORECAST CONFIDENCE 
CONTINUES TO BE ON THE LOW SIDE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD.  WHILE TIMING IS UNCERTAIN...A MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM MAY 
BRING MAINLY RAIN FOR MONDAY INTO TUESDAY.

373 
FXUS64 KMRX 290914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
414 AM EST TUE JAN 29 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WARM AIRMASS CERTAINLY IN 
PLACE THIS MORNING WITH SOME LINGERING SPOTS OF -RA OR SPRINKLES 
NOTED ACROSS MAINLY SW VA. GOING WITH A MOSTLY DRY FORECAST FOR 
TODAY WITH HIGHS IN THE 50S AND 60S AHEAD OF THE STRONG COLD FRONT. 
OPTED TO ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AN AFTERNOON SHOWER FOR EXTREME SE 
TN INTO SW NC...AND KEPT SPRINKLES FOR REST OF SE TN. MOS HIGHS 
QUITE CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. 

THE MOST SIGNIFICANT WEATHER DEVELOPS LATE TONIGHT AHEAD OF THE
STRONG COLD FRONT. MODELS ADVERTISE A VERY STRONG S-SW LOW LEVEL
JET DEVELOPING BY 06Z TO 09Z WEDNESDAY...ALTHO PATTERN DOES NOT
SUGGEST A MTN WAVE WITH THIS SYSTEM. CONVECTION ARRIVES PROBABLY A
BIT LATER BY 12Z TO 15Z IN GENERAL...BRINGING DAMAGING WINDS WITH
SHOWERS AND/OR ANY TSRA. FELT IT WAS PRUDENT TO ISSUE A HIGH WIND
WATCH FOR MTN AREAS IN OUR FAR ERN COUNTIES...STARTING AT 5AM THRU
7PM WEDNESDAY. REMAINING AREAS WILL LIKELY BE UNDER A WIND ADVISORY
FOR THIS SAME PERIOD. THANKS TO ADJACENT NWS OFFICES FOR THE
COORDINATION ON THE HIGH WIND WATCH. A FLOOD WATCH WAS DISCUSSED
BUT THE FAST MOVEMENT OF CONVECTION...PLUS VERY LIGHT RAINFALL PAST
FEW DAYS...KEEPS THREAT OF ANY FLOODING MINIMAL OVER OUR FORECAST
AREA. 

SEVERE THREAT IS MAINLY CONFINED TO THE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON
HOURS TOMORROW...WITH DAMAGING WINDS THE MAIN THREAT PLUS ISOLATED
TORNADO. OTHERWISE...MILD TEMPS AGAIN TONIGHT WITH MAX TEMPS
OCCURRING WEDNESDAY MORNING THEN FALLING IN THE AFTERNOON.


.LONG TERM.../WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
IN WAKE OF THE COLD FRONT/STORMS THAT WILL PASS THROUGH THE REGION 
ON WEDNESDAY...A COLDER AIRMASS WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA. THIS 
WILL RESULT IN LINGERING RAIN SHOWERS CHANGING OVER TO SNOW SHOWERS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...WITH SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE ALONG THE PEAKS. 
WINDS WILL GRADUALLY BE TAPERING OFF WEDNESDAY EVENING...SO WILL 
ALLOW THE HIGH WIND WATCH TO EXPIRE AT 00Z. HOWEVER...SOME 
BREEZY/GUSTY GRADIENT WINDS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT. 

A BROAD UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES WILL BE THE 
PREDOMINANT WEATHER FEATURE ACROSS THE EASTERN CONUS FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF THE WEEK AND WEEKEND...WITH A FEW UPPERWAVES/FRONTS 
PASSING THROUGH THE REGION DURING THIS TIME. SOME BRIEF CLEARING 
WILL OCCUR ON THURSDAY BEFORE INCREASING CLOUDS DEVELOP QUICKLY 
AFTER SUNSET AS THE FIRST OF THESE FRONTS PASSES THROUGH THE AREA. 
WITH MOISTURE INCREASING ACROSS THE REGION WITH THE PASSING OF THIS 
WAVE THURSDAY NIGHT...AND THE COLDER AIR IN PLACE...SNOW SHOWERS ARE 
EXPECTED ACROSS THE REGION ONCE AGAIN...BEFORE TAPERING OFF BY 
FRIDAY MORNING /EXCEPT ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND THE NORTHEAST 
ZONES...WHERE THEY COULD LINGER INTO FRIDAY/. ANOTHER PERIOD OF 
BRIEF CLEARING IS EXPECTED FRIDAY NIGHT...BEFORE THE NEXT UPPERWAVE 
WILL BRING SOME ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING...WITH SNOW SHOWERS LIKELY ONCE 
AGAIN AFTER SUNSET AS COLDER AIR FILTERS IN BEHIND THE FRONT. 

A WARM UP IS THEN EXPECTED FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS HIGHS WARM BACK 
INTO THE 50S AS UPPER-RIDGING BUILDS BACK INTO THE SOUTHEAST. 
HOWEVER...ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM MAY BE ON THE HORIZON FOR THE MONDAY 
NIGHT/TUESDAY TIME PERIOD...WITH ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR 
PRECIPITATION POSSIBLE HEADING INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.  


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED

608 PM EST MON JAN 28 2013

.AVIATION...
DEVELOPMENT OF LOW CEILINGS IS EXPECTED AGAIN TONIGHT AT CHA AND
TYS AS A SW WIND FEEDS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. THE SW
WIND OVERNIGHT SHOULD PROVIDE ENOUGH MIXING TO PREVENT FOG
DEVELOPMENT. CONDITIONS WILL BE LOWEST AT CHA...WHERE IFR CIGS ARE
FORECAST AFTER MIDNIGHT AND CONTINUING INTO THE MORNING HOURS. CIGS
ARE EXPECTED TO LIFT A BIT THROUGH THE DAY...AND INTO THE MVFR
RANGE IN THE AFTERNOON. CONFIDENCE IS LOWER AT TYS...WHERE MVFR
CIGS WILL BE FORECAST AS PREDOMINANT THROUGH THE MORNING...BUT
LOWER CONDITIONS COULD POSSIBLY OCCUR LATE TONIGHT. TRI APPEARS TO
BE VFR THROUGH THE TAF PERIOD. WINDS TOMORROW AFTERNOON WILL RISE
TO NEAR OR ABOVE 10 KTS FROM THE S-SW.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

620 
FXUS64 KMRX 281941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EST MON JAN 28 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WARM ADVECTION TO CONTINUE 
THROUGH THIS PART OF THE FORECAST WITH UNSEASONABLY WARM READINGS.  
MINIMAL POPS NORTH TONIGHT...AND ONLY CHANCE OF SPRINKLES SOUTH 
TUESDAY.  THE BIG SYSTEM OUT TO THE WEST LOOKS LIKE IT WILL NOT BE 
CLOSE ENOUGH TO SPREAD ANYTHING THIS WAY BY TUESDAY...SPRINKLES 
MENTIONED MAINLY JUST FROM SUPER-SATURATED AIR MASS WITH ANY LITTLE 
WAVE OF LIFT POSSIBLY CAUSING THE SPRINKLES.  WENT VERY CLOSE ON 
TEMP GUIDANCE...A COUPLE OF SITES NEEDED MINS BUMPED UP A COUPLE OF 
DEGREES OVERNIGHT...OTHERWISE LOOKED GOOD.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL TRACK FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...AS AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH APPROACHES.  
A STRONG SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST LOW LEVEL JET WILL BRING ABUNDANT 
MOISTURE TO THE AREA AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT THAT WILL SWING THOUGH 
THE AREA WEDNESDAY.  COULD BE SOME THUNDER AHEAD OF THE FRONT LATE 
TUESDAY NIGHT WEST AND ALL AREAS WEDNESDAY...AND GIVEN IMPRESSIVE 
WIND FIELDS THERE IS A THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS.  LIMITING FACTOR MAY 
BE INSTABILITY WHICH LOOKS FAIRLY WEAK AT THIS TIME...BUT STILL 
ENOUGH FOR SEVERE STORMS TO BE A CONCERN.  ALSO COULD BE SOME FAIRLY 
STRONG WINDS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY...ESPECIALLY OVER THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  FOR NOW WILL KEEP MENTION OF THE WINDS AND 
SEVERE THREAT IN THE HWO. LOOKS LIKE SOME SNOW SHOWERS MAY AFFECT 
ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY 
THURSDAY...BUT DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A GOOD UPSLOPE EVENT SO WILL NOT 
PLAY UP SNOW POTENTIAL...KEEPING POPS FAIRLY LOW FOR NOW.  A WEAK 
AND FAST MOVING SYSTEM MAY BRING SOME SNOW SHOWERS THURSDAY NIGHT 
INTO EARLY FRIDAY...ESPECIALLY NORTH...SO WILL KEEP SOME SLIGHT 
CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS.  ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM MOVING THROUGH THE 
FAST FLOW MAY BRING SHOWERS/SNOW SHOWERS TO THE AREA SAT INTO SAT 
NIGHT...THEN EXPECT SUNDAY AND MONDAY TO BE PRECIP FREE.  FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE IS PRETTY GOOD EARLY ON...BUT QUICKLY DETERIORATES TO 
BELOW AVERAGE GIVEN MODEL/ENSEMBLE INCONSISTENCIES IN HANDLING THE 
WEAK FAST MOVING SYSTEMS.

397 
FXUS64 KMRX 280938
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
438 AM EST MON JAN 28 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE AND 850 MB RIDGE HAVE 
SHIFTED TO ALONG THE EAST COAST THIS MORNING. THE WARM SOUTHERLY 
FLOW INTO THE TN VALLEY AND SRN APPALACHIANS HAS THANKFULLY PURGED 
THE ARCTIC AIR MASS OUT OF THE REGION. APPEARS THAT A WARM FRONT HAS 
MOVED NE INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...LEAVING VERY MILD TEMPERATURES 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA MOSTLY IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S.  

AN AREA OF LIGHT RAIN FELL ACROSS THE NRN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA 
LATE SUNDAY EVENING...WITH SPOTTY AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN OVERNIGHT. THE 
WARM AND MOIST S-SW FLOW CONTINUES TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT ANY 
ORGANIZED OR SIGNIFICANT LIFT SEEMS TO BE LACKING. THUS...I OPTED TO 
KEEP POPS ON THE LOW SIDE WITH BETTER CHANCES FROM THE NRN PLATEAU 
COUNTIES INTO SW VA FOR THESE PERIODS. CAN'T RULE OUT LIGHT RAIN FOR 
REMAINING AREAS...BUT I WOULD THINK A TRACE EVENT AT BEST. 

CLOUD COVER WILL BE PROMINENT AND COULD INHIBIT WARMING OUT OF THE 
50S...SO I TRENDED CLOSE TO A MOS BLEND FOR HIGHS TODAY. LOWS 
TONIGHT SHOULD BE IN THE 40S IF NOT MILDER...SO NO LOWER THAN UPPER 
30S FOR ANY AREAS. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...CHANGEABLE PATTERN OVER THE
FIRST FEW DAYS AS DEEP TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN STATES CAUSES
RIDGING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. ABUNDANT MOISTURE OVER MOST OF THE
REGION BUT WEAK LIFT WILL KEEP THE AREA MOSTLY CLOUDY EXCEPT ACROSS
THE NE AND INCREASING SOUTH WINDS WILL BRING HIGHS TO ALMOST 20
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL...IN THE MID 60S TO NEAR 70. TUESDAY NIGHT AND
WEDNESDAY STRONG SOUTHWEST WINDS ALOFT DEVELOP WITH HIGHEST WINDS
AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS. A WIND
ADVISORY WILL LIKELY BE NEEDED FOR TUESDAY EVENING INTO WEDNESDAY.
LOWS TUESDAY NIGHT WILL STAY VERY MILD DUE TO CLOUDS AND WINDS. A
SQUALL LINE MAY FORM TO THE WEST AHEAD OF THE FRONT WITH ADDITIONAL 
SHOWER ACTIVITY DEVELOPING ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE IN
THE NIGHT. THE STRONG FLOW ALOFT MAY BRING DAMAGING WINDS TO THE
SURFACE WITH THE SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS EARLY WEDNESDAY
THROUGH MID AFTERNOON. HIGHS WEDNESDAY TRICKY AS GFS MODEL BRINGS
FRONT THROUGH THE REGION IN THE MORNING WHILE NAM IS SEVERAL HOURS
SLOWER. COMPROMISED WITH HIGHS AND WENT A FEW DEGREES BELOW
GUIDANCE BUT ONLY A FEW DEGREES ABOVE WEDNESDAY MORNING LOWS. HEAVY
RAIN A POSSIBILITY WITH SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS
WEDNESDAY BUT HE SPEED OF THE SYSTEM WILL LIKELY KEEP FLOODING TO A
MINIMUM. MUCH COLDER AIR MASS MOVES IN BEHIND FRONT WITH RAIN
SHOWERS CHANGING TO SNOW SHOWERS OVERNIGHT AND INTO THURSDAY.
LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION LIKELY WITH THIS FIRST SYSTEM. ANOTHER
FAST MOVING SYSTEM FRIDAY AND LATE SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY WILL BRING
A COUPLE MORE SHOTS OF SNOW. AS TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLDER IN THE
NW FLOW PATTERN FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND THE NE
THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA COULD SEE A FEW INCHES OF MEASURABLE SNOW. 

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 272046
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 PM EST SUN JAN 27 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...LOW LEVEL RIDGING EAST OF 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS CONTINUES TO MOVE SE INTO THE ATLANTIC 
THROUGH THE PERIOD. MID LEVEL SPEED MAX MOVES NE THROUGH THE 
NORTHERN TN VALLEY THIS EVENING. CLOUDS HAVE ALREADY INCREASED 
ACROSS THE AREA. WEAK LIFT WILL RESULT IN LIGHT PRECIPITATION ACROSS 
NORTHERN AREAS THIS EVENING AND TONIGHT. MIN TEMPERATURES ACROSS NE 
AREAS OVERNIGHT A BIT TRICKY BUT MOST AREAS SHOULD STAY ABOVE 
FREEZING. SWRLY 850 MB FLOW INCREASES EARLY MONDAY MOVING INTO 
SOUTHERN AREAS. THIS FEATURE WILL ALSO TRANSPORT INCREASING LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE. LIGHT PRECIPITATION POSSIBLE FAVORING EXTREME SE TN 
AND SW NC EARLY AND THE NORTHERN PLATEAU LATER ON MONDAY. HEIGHTS 
BUILD THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD AND LOW LEVEL SWRLY FLOW 
INCREASES WITH TIME. TEMPERATURES WILL STEADILY CLIMB TO WELL ABOVE 
NORMAL BY TUESDAY.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...STILL A BUSY PATTERN 
AHEAD...WITH COLD FRONT DUE IN MID WEEK...THEN UPPER NORTHWEST FLOW 
SENDING CLIPPERS OVER THE AREA.  ONE NOTE TO THIS NORTHWEST FLOW IS 
THAT IT IS A RELATIVELY FLAT NW FLOW...MEANING THAT THE MOIST FETCH 
FROM THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES WILL LIKELY STAY NORTH OF US...SO WE 
WILL BE DEPENDING MORE ON ORGANIZED SYNOPTIC LIFT.  WITH THIS IN 
MIND...I HAVE TRIMMED THE UPSLOPE FLOW PRECIP CHANCES SOMEWHAT IN 
SOME OF THESE LATER PERIODS...MAINLY KEEPING POPS IN THE NORTHERN 
MOUNTAINS.

WILL NEED TO WATCH CLIPPER SYSTEM DUE IN THURSDAY NIGHT OR 
FRIDAY...AIRMASS IS COLD AND DENTRITIC GROWTH REGIONS WILL BE 
UNUSUALLY LOW...MAKING IT MUCH MORE EFFICIENT FOR SNOW GROWTH...EVEN 
IF THE MOISTURE IS NOT OVERLY DEEP.  TRACK IN DIFFERENT MODELS WITH 
THIS SYSTEM IS WAFFLING NORTH-SOUTH...WITH NORTHERN AREAS IN CWA 
HAVING BETTER CHANCES.

TIMING FOR STORMS STILL SEEMS TO BE LACKING SOMEWHAT FOR GOOD 
ORGANIZATION SINCE IT LOOKS LIKE THE BEST CHANCE FOR THE PASSAGE OF 
THE INSTABILITY AXIS IS DURING THE COOLER HOURS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT 
OR WEDNESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST SUN JAN 27 2013

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SON

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE MOVING EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS TODAY WILL ALLOW A WARMING SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW TO 
DEVELOP. CLOUDS INCREASE TODAY AND THERE APPEARS TO BE A CHANCE OF 
LIGHT RAIN BY MAINLY LATE EVENING AND OVERNIGHT...AS AN ASSOCIATED 
WARM FRONT LIFTS NORTHEAST INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. QPF LOOKS 
VERY LIGHT WITH BEST CHANCES MOSTLY ACROSS NRN PLATEAU COUNTIES AND 
SW VA. KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR EXTREME SRN AREAS TONIGHT...BUT 
COULD JUST BE CLOUDS FOR THOSE SRN AREAS.

GIVEN THE SOUTHERLY FLOW...850 MB TEMPS AND CLOUDS...I OPTED TO KEEP 
OUR MINS TONIGHT AT AND ABOVE 32 DEGREES...SO ONLY LIGHT RAIN FOR 
PCPN TYPE. FOR MAX TEMPS TODAY I FAVORED A BLEND OF MOS.

LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...WARM ADVECTION LIGHT RAIN 
STILL LOOKS TO BE POSSIBLE MONDAY MORNING AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVES 
EAST ACROSS THE TN AND OH VALLEYS EARLY MONDAY. SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY 
CLOUDY AND SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST FLOW BRINGS MORE WARMING TEMPERATURES. 
MONDAY NIGHT LOOKS MOSTLY DRY AS RIDGING BUILDS UP FROM THE SOUTH 
KEPT A SLIGHT CHANCE ALONG THE NORTHERN BORDER AS NAM SHOWS SOME 
WEAK SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING NE FROM THE MS AND LOWER OH VALLEYS 
INTO EASTERN KY AND EXTREME NORTHERN TN. TUESDAY RIDGE CONTINUES TO 
BUILD NORTH WITH DEEPENING TROUGH TO THE WEST. TEMPERATURES MUCH 
ABOVE NORMAL WITH VERY SLIGHT CHANCE SHOWERS NORTHERN PLATEAU. MAJOR 
TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY. STRONG SOUTHWEST WIND FIELD MAY WARRANT A WIND 
ADVISORY TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE 
POSSIBLE. THUNDERSTORMS MORE PROBABLE WEDNESDAY MORNING JUST AHEAD 
OF COLD FRONT. A SQUALL LINE TO THE WEST OF THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT 
MAY INTENSIFY AS WINDS ALOFT WILL STRENGTHEN ALONG THE FRONT EVEN 
THOUGH INSTABILITY WILL BE LIMITED. WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT 
MUCH COLDER WITH STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION. RAIN SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS CHANGE OVER TO SNOW SHOWERS AS NW FLOW PATTERN SETS 
UP. A FEW INCHES POSSIBLE IN THE MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
THE NE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. COLDER PATTERN CONTINUES 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED WITH A COUPLE FAST MOVING SYSTEMS FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY BRINGING MORE SNOW CHANCES. FRIDAYS SYSTEM LOOKS MORE 
SIGNIFICANT WITH COLDER TEMPERATURES. A COUPLE INCHES POSSIBLE 
NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA.

WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT MUCH COLDER WITH STRONG COLD AIR
ADVECTION. RAIN SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CHANGE OVER TO SNOW
SHOWERS AS NW FLOW PATTERN SETS UP. A FEW INCHES POSSIBLE IN THE
MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE NE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO
THURSDAY. COLDER PATTERN CONTINUES THROUGH THE EXTENDED WITH A
COUPLE FAST MOVING SYSTEMS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY BRINGING MORE SNOW
CHANCES. FRIDAYS SYSTEM LOOKS MORE SIGNIFICANT WITH COLDER
TEMPERATURES. A COUPLE INCHES POSSIBLE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST
AREA.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 PM EST SAT JAN 26 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER OHIO WILL SLIDE SE THROUGH THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TO THE 
VA/NC COAST BY SUNDAY. STUBBORN LOW LEVEL TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED 
CLOUD COVER HAS LINGERED OVER SW VA AND NE TN. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD 
ERODE AS LOWER DEW POINTS ASSOCIATED WITH NORTHERN RIDGE SHOULD JUST 
CLIP NE AREAS OVERNIGHT ...OTHERWISE AIRMASS ACROSS MRX CWA CHANGES 
LITTLE OVERNIGHT. ..CONTINUE TO EXPECT THESE CLOUDS TO ERODE 
TONIGHT. UPPER HEIGHTS RISE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH SUNDAY. WEAK 
WARMING AND MOISTURE TRANSPORT IN THE 700 MB LAYER WILL BRING IN 
SOME MID CLOUDS FROM THE SOUTHWEST. TEMPERATURES SHOULD CLIMB TO 
ABOVE NORMAL DESPITE LATE CLOUD COVER. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...VERY VERY BUSY PATTERN 
WITH RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD ALONG WITH 
ASSOCIATED WARM ADVECTION PRECIPITATION...FOLLOWED BY LARGE TROUGH 
THAT SWINGS INTO THE AREA FOR THE MID AND LATTER PARTS OF THIS 
PERIOD...THAT SENDS A SERIES OF CLIPPER SYSTEMS OUR WAY.

WITH WARM ADVECTION AT ALL LEVELS AND BLANKETING CLOUDS MOVING INTO 
THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT...FEEL THAT GUIDANCE LOW TEMPS ARE TOO LOW 
ACROSS THE AREA...HAVE BUMPED UP BY 1-2 CATEGORIES.  THIS RESULTS IN 
PRECIP THAT MOVES IN TO BE ALL LIQUID EVEN IN THE MOUNTAINS.

TIMING OF COLD FRONT AND STORMS STILL A LITTLE IN QUESTION...BUT 
PRETTY MUCH BRACKETED BY TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. CHANCES OF 
SEVERE STORMS NOT THAT GREAT FOR NOW...UNLESS TIMING OF FRONT ENDS 
UP BEING DURING MAX HEATING.

COLD AIR AND CLOUDS HANGING IN ON THURSDAY...WILL GO WELL BELOW 
GUIDANCE ON MAX TEMP AND THINK THAT SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE THE RULE ON 
THURSDAY FOR PRECIP TYPE IN THE NERN HALF OF AREA.

STILL UNSETTLED TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD AS SHORTWAVES STILL 
LOOK TO BE RIDING ACROSS THE AREA.

565 
FXUS64 KMRX 261554
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1055 AM EST SAT JAN 26 2013

.DISCUSSION...MINOR UPDATE TO TODAYS FORECAST. EDGED TEMP AND DEW POINTS
UPWARD. LOWERED CLOUD COVER SLIGHTLY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING 
IN FROM THE NW. NEAR NEUTRAL TEMPERATURE ADVECTION. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOW CLOUDS LINGER ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA...BUT RADARS ARE GENERALLY ECHO FREE. CLOUD HEIGHTS 
ARE LIFTING AND VISBYS IMPROVING...SO FOG IS NOT MUCH OF AN ISSUE AT 
THIS TIME. CLOUDS HAVE KEPT TEMPS FROM DROPPING BELOW 32 DEGREES 
OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA...CERTAINLY BENEFICIAL IN LOCATIONS 
THAT RECEIVED THE ICY PRECIPITATION FRIDAY. 

SUNSHINE TO RETURN TODAY...BUT I AM SKEPTICAL THAT TEMPS CAN WARM TO 
THE GFS MOS HIGHS. 850 MB TEMPS ARE MORE SUPPORTIVE OF THE COOLER 
NAM MOS HIGHS...ESPECIALLY OVER SW VA AND NE TN. LOW LEVELS STAY DRY 
TONIGHT WITH AN INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUDS AHEAD OF THE WEAK SYSTEM ON 
SUNDAY. GFS MINS LOOKED REASONABLE FOR TONIGHT.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE AREA BEGINS TO 
SHIFT TO THE EAST COAST SUNDAY AS LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPS OVER THE 
CENTRAL STATES. SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL WARM TEMPERATURES ABOUT 5 DEGREES
SOUTH TO 10 DEGREES NORTH. CLOUDS INCREASE AS WARM FRONT MOVES NORTH 
ACROSS THE TN VALLEY LATE SUNDAY INTO THE OH VALLEY MONDAY. AS 
ATMOSPHERE MOISTENS RAIN POSSIBLE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY BUT ONLY 
LIGHT AMOUNTS EXPECTED. SOUTHWEST UPPER FLOW INCREASES TUESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY WITH CONTINUED WARMING AND A CHANCE FOR THUNDERSTORMS BY 
WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. DEEP TROUGH BEHIND THE FRONT BRINGS 
MUCH COLDER AIR MASS INTO THE REGION WITH THE SHOWERS CHANGING TO 
SNOW SHOWERS LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. SKIES BEGIN CLEARING 
LATE THURSDAY AND THEN WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL KEEP SKIES SUNNY 
THROUGH FRIDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
500 PM EST FRI JAN 25 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...THE WINTER STORM SYSTEM IS 
EXITING THE AREA AND FREEZING RAIN ENDING ACROSS THE MRX CWA.  A 
FREEZING RAIN ADVISORY WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT THROUGH 7 PM ACROSS 
THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST NC.  THROUGH THE REST OF 
THE EVENING...AREAS OF DRIZZLE AND FREEZING DRIZZLE WILL CONTINUE 
OVER THE REGION WITH PATCHY FREEZING FOG EXPECTED TO DEVELOP 
OVERNIGHT.  THIS WILL CONTINUE TO ALLOW FOR HAZARDOUS DRIVING 
CONDITIONS INTO THE EARLY MORNING HOURS.  IMPROVING CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED ON SATURDAY WITH TEMPERATURES CLIMBING INTO THE 30S NORTH 
AND 40S SOUTH.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...FAST MOVING SOUTHERN 
STREAM WILL PULL ANOTHER SYSTEM INTO THE PLAINS STATES FOR SUNDAY. 
THIS WAVE ALONG WITH SURFACE HIGH MOVING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS 
WILL INCREASE THE SOUTHERLY FLOW INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WITH 
INCREASING CLOUDS FOR SATURDAY AS A WARM FRONT APPROACHES.  

FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...WARM FRONT MOVES NORTHEAST ACROSS THE 
AREA WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN...POSSIBLY BEGINNING AS FREEZING RAIN 
OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. STRONG SOUTHWEST UPPER 
FLOW AHEAD OF A STRENGTHENING LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE 
SOUTHWEST UNITED STATES WILL PRODUCE A WARMING TREND FOR EARLY NEXT 
WEEK.

BY MID-WEEK...THE DEEP LONG-WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE PLAINS 
STATES WITH STRONG CYCLOGENESIS MOVING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKE STATES. STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
WEDNESDAY. AT THIS TIME...INSTABILITY LOOKS LACKING...BUT WILL NEED
TO WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL OF THUNDER. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION FOR 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WILL CHANGE RAIN TO SNOW SHOWERS...
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

752 
FXUS64 KMRX 250912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
412 AM EST FRI JAN 25 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CHALLENGING FORECAST THIS MORNING 
AS PRECIPITATION (PCPN) IS JUST DEVELOPING TO OUR WEST OVER MIDDLE 
TN. COLD AIR MASS WEDGED IN PLACE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA IS VERY 
DRY WITH ARCTIC DEW POINTS. THUS...INITIAL PCPN WILL STRUGGLE TO 
REACH THE SURFACE...AND THE WARMER AIR ALOFT WILL CREATE A WINTRY 
MIX TODAY. NAM AND SREF MODEL SOUNDINGS HAVE TRENDED WARMER AND NOT 
AS SUPPORTIVE FOR WARNING AMOUNTS OF ICING. GFS MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE 
SLIGHTLY COLDER AND IN LINE WITH 1/10 TO 1/4 INCH ICING...WHICH 
SEEMS REASONABLE GIVEN THE COLD AIR MASS IN PLACE. FREEZING RAIN WILL 
BE THE MOST COMMON PCPN TYPE THIS MORNING...ALTHOUGH SOUNDINGS FOR SW 
VA AND EXTREME NE TN INDICATE POTENTIAL FOR LIGHT SNOW AS WELL. 

PCPN TYPE BY THIS AFTERNOON SHOULD TRANSITION TO A COLD RAIN ON THE 
PLATEAU...SE TN AND UP THE CENTRAL VALLEY OF EAST TN. SHELTERED OR 
DEEPER VALLEYS COULD SEE LIGHT FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET LINGER...SUCH 
AS NOTED FOR OUR SW NC COUNTIES. INTERESTING EVENT AS ELEVATIONS 
PROBABLY ABOVE 2500 FEET IN THE SMOKIES GET MOSTLY RAIN. UNDERCUT 
THE WARMER GFS MOS MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY...IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS MAX 
TEMP GRID. OTHER THAN A FEW TWEAKS ON QPF/SNOW/ICE AMOUNT GRIDS...
CLOSE FOLLOWED PREVIOUS FORECAST. FREEZING RAIN AND WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORIES LOOK ON TRACK...FOR TIMING AND GENERALLY ON AMOUNTS. 

FOR TONIGHT...PCPN EVENT WRAPS UP IN THE EVENING WITH NO CHANGES 
MADE FOR NOW. MIN TEMPS WERE NUDGED UP A BIT IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS 
NUMBERS AND TO MESH WITH NWS NEIGHBORS. MAY NEED TO CONSIDER ADDING 
SOME PATCHY FOG OR DRIZZLE (FREEZING?) LATE TONIGHT...BUT SOUNDINGS 
SEEMED TO DRY OUT THE BOUNDARY LAYER.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING SE 
FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS AND WESTERN GREAT LAKES WILL BRING A SUNNY 
AND WARMER DAY TO THE REGION SATURDAY. THINK NE TN AND SW VA WILL 
HAVE SOME SNOW AND ICE COVER AND ALL AREAS WILL STILL HAVE COLD AIR 
ADVECTION CONTINUING DURING THE DAY SATURDAY. AS A RESULT UNDERCUT 
HIGHS A FEW DEGREES WITH MID 30S TO NEAR 40 NE TN AND SW VA TO THE 
MID TO UPPER 40S ELSEWHERE. SATURDAY NIGHT MOSTLY CLEAR WITH SURFACE 
HIGH SETTLING OVER UPPER OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS. LOWS AGAIN 
BELOW FREEZING SATURDAY NIGHT WITH LIGHT WINDS. SUNDAY RIDGING 
BUILDS OVER THE EASTERN STATES AHEAD OF DIGGING TROUGH OVER THE 
WESTERN STATES. MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
WITH CLOUDS INCREASING. SUNDAY NIGHT A WARM FRONT MOVES NORTH ACROSS 
THE REGION. SOME LIGHT RAIN POSSIBLE SUNDAY NIGHT WITH THE FRONT AND 
MUCH WARMER LOW TEMPERATURES. SOME LIGHT FREEZING RAIN IS POSSIBLE 
OVER THE NE TN VALLEYS BEFORE TEMPERATURES WARM MONDAY MORNING. 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY A SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT WILL BRING ADDITIONAL 
RAIN CHANCES TO THE FORECAST AREA AND MUCH WARMER TEMPERATURES AS 
GULF MOISTURE IS PUMPED UP INTO THE REGION WITH A SOUTHERLY FLOW. 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY THE AIR MASS BECOMES UNSTABLE ENOUGH FOR 
SOME THUNDERSTORMS. HIGHS TUESDAY SHOULD REACH THE 60S. AFTER COLD 
FRONTAL PASSAGE WEDNESDAY IT WILL BE MUCH COOLER WITH ANOTHER SHOT 
OF SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING CLEARING LATER 
THURSDAY.    

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 250236
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 PM EST THU JAN 24 2013

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE WITH 
COLD ARCTIC AIR CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION...WITH AN AREA 
OF LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPING OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THIS AREA OF 
LOW PRESSURE IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEY 
DURING THE LATE MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON HOURS ON FRIDAY...WITH A 
STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN AHEAD OF IT BRINGING A DEEP (900 
TO 700 MB) ABOVE-FREEZING LAYER OVER A SUB-FREEZING LAYER REMAINING 
ENTRENCHED AT THE SURFACE. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THE VERY 
DRY LOW-LEVEL AIR MASS SHOULD CREATE ENOUGH EVAPORATIVE COOLING AT 
THE ONSET OF PRECIPITATION (TOWARDS SUNRISE) TO CREATE FREEZING RAIN 
AND SLEET THROUGH THE MORNING HOURS. A SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW NEAR THE 
SURFACE MAY HELP TO PUSH TEMPS ABOVE FREEZING DURING THE AFTERNOON 
HOURS ACROSS MOST OF EAST TN AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST NC. WITH THIS IN 
MIND...IT APPEARS THAT ANY ICE ACCUMULATIONS (AND POSSIBLY SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS OVER SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN) WILL REMAIN IN THE 
ADVISORY CATEGORY...WHICH WILL BE ENOUGH TO CAUSE TRAVEL PROBLEMS IN 
MOST AREAS ON FRIDAY.

OVERALL...PREVIOUS FORECAST APPEARED TO BE ON TRACK FOR TONIGHT AND 
FRIDAY...BUT ALREADY UPDATED EARLIER THIS EVENING TO TWEAK THE 
WORDING A LITTLE TO REFLECT THE LATEST THOUGHTS ABOVE.

FXUS64 KMRX 242345
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
645 PM EST THU JAN 24 2013

.AVIATION...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH CONTINUES STEADILY EAST ACROSS THE
PLAINS STATES EARLY THIS EVENING ON ITS WAY INTO THE EASTERN U.S.
LATE TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY. AVIATION WEATHER WILL DETERIORATE BUT IT
WILL TAKE QUITE A WHILE TO DEVELOP AN MVFR CEILING AS WARM...MOIST
AIR OVERRIDES A SUBFREEZING SURFACE AIRMASS. BEST BET IS FOR A
MIXTURE OF FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET BEGINNING AT CHA AROUND 12Z IN
MVFR CONDITIONS. AS THE SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL FLOW STRENGTHENS DURING
THE MORNING WOULD EXPECT PRECIP TO SWITCH TO RAIN AT CHA WITH
CONDITIONS DROPPING INTO THE IFR CATEGORY. MVFR FLIGHT CONDITIONS
MAY NOT DEVELOP AT TYS UNTIL 13Z WHERE THE MAIN PRECIP TYPE MAY BE
SLEET (AND SOME SNOW) TO START BUT WOULD TRANSITION TO FREEZING
RAIN BY LATE MORNING BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN AROUND EARLY
AFTERNOON. IFR FLIGHT LOOKS PROBABLE BY LATE MORNING AS A CEILING
LOOKS TO FORM JUST UNDER 3000 FT. TRI MAY STAY VFR ALL THE WAY
UNTIL 14Z AS LIGHT SNOW AND SLEET FALL INTO THE COLDER LOW LEVEL
AIRMASS GENERATING A CEILING RIGHT AROUND 3000 FT. DETERIORATION TO
IFR FLIGHT WOULD BECOME MORE LIKELY BY NOON HERE AS PREDOMINANT PRECIP
TYPE CHANGES TO SLEET WITH INCREASING DEPTH OF WARM AIR ALOFT AHEAD
OF THE 85H TROUGH. BY THE END OF THE EVENT AROUND 20Z AND LATER IFR
CONDITIONS SHOULD PREVAIL DUE TO A CEILING UNDER 3000 FT BUT PRECIP
SHOULD BECOME MUCH LIGHTER IN INTENSITY AND MAY HAVE CHANGED TO
LIQUID WITH JUST ENOUGH WARMING TO RAISE SURFACE TEMPERATURES ABOVE
FREEZING.

181 
FXUS64 KMRX 242024
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
249 PM EST THU JAN 24 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE 
SE FROM THE SE OHIO RIVER VALLEY TO EAST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. AN UPPER SPEED MAX WILL MOVE SE INTO THE OH 
RIVER VALLEY FRIDAY. DRY COLD AIRMASS WILL BE IN PLACE TONIGHT 
ACROSS THE AREA. STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION AND MOISTURE TRANSPORT 
WILL OCCUR IN THE 850-700 MB LAYER. THIS MOIST LAYER WILL MOVE EAST 
INTO THE AREA SHORTLY BEFORE DAY BREAK. GOOD ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL 
AID IN THE PRECIPITATION PROCESS. THE FREEZING LEVEL WILL INITIALLY 
BE NEAR 3500 FEET WITH WARMER TEMPS ALOFT. THE FREEZING LEVEL 
SHRINKS TO NEAR 2000 FEET BY MID DAY FRIDAY. THE WARM LAYER IS 
SUFFICIENTLY DEEP TO MELT SNOW AND FAVOR RAIN OVER SLEET. THE RAIN 
WILL FALL THROUGH THE COLD LAYER AND FREEZE ON CONTACT WITH ALL 
SURFACE. EXPECTED ICE ACCUMULATION IS LESS THAN 1:1 WITH QPF 
EXPECTED RAINFALL RATES TO BE CLOSE TO MODERATE AT TIMES WHICH WOULD 
HINDER ACCRETION.  THE WARM LAYER EXTENDS TO NE TN DURING THE DAY. 
SOME SLEET CAN BE EXPECTED NEAR THE BOUNDARY WITH MOSTLY SNOW 
EXPECTED NE OF THE ELEVATED FREEZING BOUNDARY. SLIGHTLY ABOVE 
FREEZING SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL MOVE NE UP THE E TN VALLEY BY 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON HELPING TO LIMIT ADDITIONAL ICE ACCUMULATIONS. 
WENT SLIGHTLY BELOW AGREEABLE MOS GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...THE MAIN STORM SYSTEM 
WILL BE WINDING DOWN FRIDAY NIGHT...HOWEVER THERE WILL BE LINGERING 
WINTRY PRECIPITATION CONTINUING INTO THE EVENING HOURS. ONLY LIGHT 
ACCUMULATIONS OF SNOW AND/OR ICE ARE EXPECTED AND THIS SHOULD HAVE 
MINIMAL IMPACTS ESPECIALLY COMPARED WITH WHAT COULD OCCUR EARLIER ON 
FRIDAY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY WITH DAYTIME TEMPERATURES IN THE 30S NORTH AND 40S SOUTH.

FOR MONDAY A SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS E TX AND INTO E TN MONDAY 
BRINGING SLIGHT CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION TO THE AREA. A LARGER TROUGH 
ON MONDAY WILL BE MOVING ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES. THIS SYSTEM WILL 
BE STRONG ENOUGH TO PULL IN PLENTY OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ALONG THE 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. THE FRONT WILL BEGIN TO IMPACT E TN...SW VA 
AND SW NC TUESDAY NIGHT. SOME SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS COULD 
ACCOMPANY THE RAIN TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL 
CERTAINLY BE NOTICEABLY WARMER WITH FORECAST HIGHS NEAR 60 DEGREES. 

COLD AIR BEHIND THE FRONT WILL DROP OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES ON 
WEDNESDAY INTO THE UPPER 20S AND 30S FOR MUCH OF THE REGION. LOW 
LEVEL NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BE FAVORABLE FOR SOME WINTRY 
PRECIPITATION ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. AT THIS THE FORECAST 
CONFIDENCE FOR THIS TO OCCUR IS LOW AND THERE IS NO RELIABLE 
INDICATION OF HOW MUCH...IF ANY ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE.
DAYTIME TEMPS GET BACK TO NEAR SEASONAL ON THURSDAY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             29  37  29  48  27 /  40 100  30  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  25  35  28  43  24 /  20 100  30  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       25  34  27  43  24 /  20 100  30  10   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              19  33  26  39  18 /  10 100  40  10   0

.AVIATION...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY COOL AIRMASS BUILDING IN 
FROM THE NORTH EARLY IN THE PERIOD. THE HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS RAPIDLY 
EAST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE 
IN A WARM LAYER ABOVE 2500 FEET EARLY FRI. SURFACE TEMPERATURES WILL 
REMAIN BELOW FREEZING AT THE ONSET OF THE RAIN. FREEZING RAIN IS 
EXPECTED TO BECOME SIGNIFICANT AT THE END OF THE PERIOD.

IS POSSIBLE OVER THE NORTHEAST TN MOUNTAINS BUT IS NOT EXPECTED TO

SKIES AND VFR CONDITIONS THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT.  ANOTHER 
APPROACHING SYSTEM WILL INCREASE CLOUDS LATE IN THE PERIOD BUT 
ASSOCIATE PRECIP SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER 12Z FRIDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST THU JAN 24 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FEW PATCHES OF DRIZZLE OR 
FREEZING DRIZZLE MAY LINGER OVER FAR NORTHEASTERN MOUNTAINS EARLY 
TODAY.  OTHERWISE...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BRIEFLY BUILD IN FOR 
DRY CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING.  AN APPROACHING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MAY BEGIN TO EFFECT WESTERN LOCATIONS LATE TONIGHT.  
MODELS REMAIN IN SOME DISAGREEMENT WITH TIMING AND EXACT TRACK OF 
THE LOW.  WILL CONTINUE 20 TO 30 POPS OVER WESTERN LOCATIONS BETWEEN 
06Z AND 12Z.  PRECIP TYPE ALSO IN QUESTION WITH TEMPERATURE PROFILE 
LEANING TOWARD INITIAL PRECIP AS FREEZING RAIN.  HOWEVER...SOME SLEET 
MAY MIX IN WITH THIS AS WELL.  A WINTER WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN 
PLACE THE ACROSS AREA BEGINNING AT 06Z.  

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MESSY SITUATION FOR 
FRIDAY...AND CONFIDENCE ON THE EXACT DETAILS STILL FAIRLY LOW.  
HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE IS FAIRLY HIGH THAT WE WILL SEE A WINTRY MIX OF 
PRECIP...WITH SNOW...SLEET...FREEZING RAIN AND POSSIBLY RAIN 
NORTH...AND FREEZING RAIN...SLEET AND RAIN FURTHER SOUTH.  STRONG 
WARM ADVECTION ALOFT AS LOW LEVEL JET STRENGTHENS...BRINGING 
MOISTURE AND WARMING ALOFT.  HOWEVER...COLD AIR NEAR THE SURFACE 
UNDER THE INVERSION WILL BE SLOW TO RETREAT...SETTING UP THE 
POTENTIAL FOR A SIGNIFICANT ICE STORM. STILL TOO MUCH UNCERTAINTY TO 
ISSUE ANY WARNINGS AND THIS WILL BE A MOSTLY A PERIOD 3 EVENT...SO 
WILL LEAVE WINTER STORM WATCH AS IF FOR NOW.  MAY BE A FEW LINGERING 
SHOWERS/SNOW SHOWERS AROUND FRIDAY NIGHT MAINLY NORTHEAST...THEN 
DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN AS HIGH PRESSURE TAKES CONTROL FOR THE 
WEEKEND.     

SURFACE HIGH IN CONTROL SUNDAY NIGHT WILL DROP SOUTH AND EAST AS
THE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES THE AREA. WILL MOVE INTO AN UNSETTLE
WEATHER PATTERN FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED BUT CONFIDENCE LOW ON
THE DETAIL OF THE INCOMING SYSTEM. CURRENT TREND PUTS A WARM FRONT
LIFTING TO OUR NORTH WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS MOVING ACROSS
THE MRX CWA MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL WARM TEMPERATURES
WELL ABOVE NORMAL ALLOWING THE SYSTEM TO BE AN ALL RAIN EVENT. THE
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT AND OUR BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS SHOULD MOVE
THROUGH AROUND THE TUESDAY WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME.

WHILE TRI MAY PICK UP A SLIGHTLY LOWER CEILING...ALTHOUGH STILL
VFR...FOR A BRIEF TIME IN THE MIDDLE OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.
SURFACE WINDS SHIFT FROM SOUTHWESTERLY TO A NORTHWEST TO NORTHERLY
DIRECTION AS THE CLIPPER RACES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC
COAST.

040 
FXUS64 KMRX 232115
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 PM EST WED JAN 23 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...UPPER SPEED MAX WILL MOVE 
SOUTHEAST THROUGH SW VA TONIGHT. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE QUICKLY 
SUPPRESSES SOUTH OF THE AREA. A SHOT OF WEAK WARM AIR ADVECTION IS 
UNDERWAY IN ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. DEW POINTS COMING 
UP BUT WILL DROP SHARPLY AGAIN BEHIND THE FRONT. LIGHT SNOW EXPECTED 
NEAR UPPER JET WHERE AVAILABLE MID LEVEL MOISTURE IS IN THE SNOW 
GROWTH REGION. THIS SNOW WILL FALL THROUGH A VERY DRY 850-700 LAYER 
LIMITING AMOUNTS. OTHERWISE...MOISTURE WILL TRANSPORT IN THE 
1000-850 MB LAYER IN ADVANCE OF THE COLD FRONT.
LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE AND FREEZING RAIN EXPECTED WITH VERY WEAK 
LIFT. ANY ACCUMULATION WILL BE LIGHT. COLD FRONT MOVES SE OF THE 
AREA EARLY THU WITH HIGH PRESSURE AND A DRY AIRMASS IN ITS WAKE. 
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE. LEANED ON THE COOL SIDE OF 
GOOD MODEL AGREEMENT. 

.MID TERM.../THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY/...THE MAIN FOCUS OF 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD IS THE WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE AREA 
LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...BEFORE EXITING THE REGION FRIDAY 
NIGHT. THE FORECAST REMAINS COMPLICATED TO SAY THE LEAST...WITH THE 
BIGGEST QUESTION BEING PRECIPITATION TYPE AND THE DURATION FOR A 
GIVEN LOCATION. HOWEVER...MODELS HAVE COME INTO GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
TIMING...AND THE POTENTIAL FOR BTWN 0.25 TO 0.75 INCHES OF LIQUID 
EQUIVALENT PRECIPITATION...WITH THE HIGHER VALUES OF 0.50 TO 0.75 
INCHES GENERALLY FAVORING AREAS ALONG AND SOUTH OF THE INTERSTATE 40 
CORRIDOR. THE PEAK TIME FOR PRECIPITATION APPEARS TO BE BETWEEN 
12-21Z ON FRIDAY...BEFORE THINGS BEGIN TO TAPER OFF SLOWLY FROM WEST 
TO EAST. HAVE RAISED POPS TO LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL DURING THIS TIME 
PERIOD AS A RESULT. 

ATTM...MODEL SOUNDINGS AT KCHA AND KTYS HAVE CONTINUED THEIR TREND 
OF PERSISTENT SUBFREEZING SURFACE TEMPERATURES AND A VERY PRONOUNCED 
WARM NOSE /WITH 5000 FT TEMPS WARMING TO 3-6 DEGREES CELCIUS/. THIS 
IS INDICATING THE POTENTIAL FOR A LONG DURATION FREEZING RAIN EVENT 
FOR THE SOUTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY ZONES AND A SLEET/FREEZING RAIN 
EVENT FOR THE CENTRAL/NORTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY ZONES. THIS WOULD 
RESULT IN A SIGNIFICANT ICE STORM FOR MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA...AS 
WIDESPREAD 0.10-0.15 INCH AMOUNTS EXPECTED AND THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SEVERAL POCKETS APPROACHING A QUARTER OF INCH ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. ACROSS FOR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA...MODELS SHOW THAT THE ENTIRE VERTICAL PROFILE REMAINS AT 
OR BELOW FREEZING FOR THE ENTIRE EVENT...SUGGESTING AN ALL-SNOW TO A 
SNOW-SLEET MIXTURE FOR THESE AREAS...WITH TOTAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
BEING BETWEEN 1-4 INCHES...GENERALLY TO THE NORTH AND EAST OF 
MORRISTOWN. 

THE ONE UNCERTAINTY AS ALWAYS WILL BE HOW MUCH WARMING WILL TAKE 
PLACE DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY. GIVEN THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND 
PRECIPITATION...AM NOT EXPECTING TEMPERATURES TO WARM AS MUCH AS MOS 
VALUES ARE SHOWING...PARTICULARLY IF A LIGHT NORTHEAST FLOW PERSISTS 
DOWN THE VALLEY /SOMETHING THAT MODELS USUALLY STRUGGLE WITH 
IDENTIFYING/. THIS WOULD RESULT IN THE COLDER AIR BEING MUCH SLOWER 
TO ERODE FROM THE VALLEYS EVEN IF WINDS ALOFT VEER TO THE SOUTHWEST. 
THIS THINKING IS SUPPORTED BY THE SOUNDING PROFILES...ESPECIALLY THE 
NAM WHICH SUGGESTS WINTERY PRECIPITATION PERSISTING THROUGH THE 
ENTIRE EVENT IN NEARLY ALL AREAS. GIVEN THIS...WILL ISSUE A WINTER 
STORM WATCH FROM 06Z FRIDAY THROUGH 00Z SATURDAY.  

SHOULD THIS SCENARIO PLAY OUT AS THE FORECAST SUGGESTS...THIS RARE 
AND SIGNIFICANT ICE STORM WOULD RESULT IN EXTREMELY HAZARDOUS 
TRAVEL CONDITIONS AND THE POSSIBILITY FOR WIDESPREAD POWER OUTAGES. 
IT CANNOT BE UNDERSCORED ENOUGH THAT RESIDENTS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION SHOULD FOLLOW THE PROGRESS OF THIS STORM SYSTEM 
CLOSELY AND THE POTENTIAL FOR HAZARDOUS WINTER WEATHER CONDITIONS ON 
FRIDAY!       

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A RIDGE POSITIONED OFF THE 
COAST OF GA WILL PROVIDE A WARMING TREND FOR SUNDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY...WITH HIGHS TUESDAY REACHING WELL INTO THE 60S ACROSS MUCH 
OF THE TN VALLEY. THE EASTWARD DRIFT OF THE RIDGE AND THE APPROACH 
OF A POSITIVELY TILTED TROUGH FROM THE WEST WILL BEGIN TO ADVECT 
GULF MOISTURE INTO THE AREA LATE MONDAY. GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS SHOW 
GOOD CLUSTERING OF PRECIP OVER THE APPALACHIANS ON TUESDAY 
NIGHT...AND WILL RAISE POPS TO A HIGH CHANCE FOR THIS PERIOD. THE 
TROUGH SHOWS SLOW EASTWARD PROGRESS...AND THE ECMWF IS SLOWER WITH 
THE PRECIP THAN THE GFS...SO WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING INTO 
WEDNESDAY.
&&

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  40  26  35  26  33 /   0  20  10  40  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       40  25  35  27  32 /   0  10  10  40  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              33  22  30  22  31 /  10  20  10  10  80

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA PROGGED TO WEAKEN
SUBSTANTIALLY TODAY. MODELS AGGRESSIVE WITH RETURN FLOW AND WARM
AIR ADVECTION. THIS SEEMS TO BE OVER DONE A BIT...ESPECIALLY NE
AREAS. ADJUSTED TEMP AND DEW POINTS SLIGHTLY AND LOWERED MAX TEMPS
A DEGREE OR TWO. THIS LINES UP CLOSE TO A SREF MEAN THOU THE SPREAD
IS FAIRLY WIDE FOR THE SHORT TERM. CLOUDS SHOULD DECREASE SOME IN
THE NE AND INCREASE SOME IN THE SW BY THIS AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM...VERY DIFFICULT FORECAST FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY.
MODELS HAVE BEEN INCONSISTENT...AND MODEL AGREEMENT LACKING AS WELL
SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW. WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM FORECAST TO MOVE
FROM THE PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION...WITH WARM ADVECTION
DEVELOPING OVER OUR AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. LIGHT PRECIP IS
FORECAST TO BREAK OUT WITH THE ISENTROPIC LIFT...BUT HOW MUCH
MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE IS STILL UNCERTAIN. MODEL SOUNDINGS
INDICATE A WINTRY MIX. WITH WARMER AIR MOVING OVER THE COLDER
AIR AT THE SURFACE...FREEZING RAIN MAY BE A THREAT OVER MUCH OF THE
AREA. ANY SNOW SHOULD BE MAINLY LIMITED TO NORTHERN AREAS. WILL
KEEP AMOUNTS FAIRLY LIGHT AT THIS POINT...AND WILL CONTINUE MENTION
IN HWO. LOOKS DRY FOR THE WEEKEND...THEN INCREASING MOISTURE AND
WARMER AIR BRING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST TUE JAN 22 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...LARGE UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES 
OVER THE EASTERN STATES THIS AFTERNOON. A COLD SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
AREA IS STILL ALSO BUILDING SE INTO THE FORECAST AREA. MID TO HIGH- 
LEVEL CLOUDINESS IS ALSO STREAMING SE TOWARDS THE REGION. DRY AIR IN 
PLACE HAS KEPT CLOUDS ERODING AS THEY APPROACH. HOWEVER SOME CLOUDS 
MAY MAKE IT INTO THE WESTERN SECTIONS BY THIS EVENING. AS SURFACE 
HIGH SETTLES OVERHEAD TONIGHT...WINDS WILL DROP OFF WITH THE LOWS 
FALLING INTO THE TEENS TO LOWER 20S. ON WEDNESDAY...TROUGH SHIFTS 
EAST WITH W TO SW FLOW WARMING TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES. 
HOWEVER...SHORTWAVE ENERGY IN NW FLOW ALOFT WILL BRING A MID TO LOW- 
LEVEL CLOUD DECK...WHICH MAY KEEP HIGHS LOWER CLOSER TO NAM GUIDANCE 
OR SLIGHTLY BELOW. WARMED HIGHS INTO THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S NE 
MID 30S TO NEAR 40 CENTRAL AND LOWER TO MID 40S SOUTHERN VALLEY. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH REVEALING A WEAK LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO/TN RIVER VALLEYS DURING THE 
THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY TIME PERIOD...BUT SHOW SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH 
THE AMOUNT OF MOISTURE AVAILABLE WITH IT. BEFORE THEN...A WEAK COLD 
FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...WHICH APPEARS TO HAVE ENOUGH MOISTURE WITH IT TO INCLUDE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN OR LIGHT SNOW IN THE FORECAST. A STRONG 
WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN THEN DEVELOPS THURSDAY NIGHT OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF THE DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS...WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING AN ABOVE-FREEZING 
850 TO 750 MB LAYER PRODUCING THE POSSIBILITY OF A LIGHT WINTRY MIX 
OF LIGHT RAIN...LIGHT SLEET...OR LIGHT FREEZING RAIN ON THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. LATEST GFS AND ECMWF MODEL RUNS ARE IN 
BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE TRACK OF THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ON 
FRIDAY...AND GENERALLY INDICATE THAT ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY AFTERNOON PRODUCING A QUICK 
CHANGE OVER TO SNOW FOR THE AFTERNOON. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL 
CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SOME SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS THROUGH SATURDAY 
MORNING...BEFORE A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE 
EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. A STRONG WARM AIR 
ADVECTION PATTERN WILL THEN DEVELOP ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS HIGH... 
WITH A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS POSSIBLE UNTIL THE NEXT STRONGER LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM ARRIVES DURING THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 211954
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST MON JAN 21 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE 
EASTERN STATES AS ARCTIC AIR SLIDES SOUTHEAST OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALCHIANS AND EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL FALL INTO THE TEENS AND LOW 20S IN VALLEY 
LOCATIONS TONIGHT. HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS EVEN LOWER.

WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS WILL CONTINUE FROM 10 TO 20 MPH WITH HIGHER 
GUSTS OVERNIGHT AND TUESDAY. THIS WILL BRING WIND CHILL VALUES DOWN 
TO JUST BELOW ZERO AT TIMES ACROSS SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT 
NOT QUITE LOW ENOUGH TO BE IN THE WIND CHILL ADVISORY RANGE. 
W TO NW FLOW IS STILL LOOKING DRY...BUT SOME LOW TO MID CLOUDS 
MOVING SOUTHEAST SHOULD MAKE SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY TUESDAY WHICH MAY 
HELP TO HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN INTO THE TEENS HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO 
THE 20S TO LOWER 30S LOWER ELEVATIONS EXCEPT MID TO UPPER 30S SE TN 
VALLEYS.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD WITH REVEALING A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO/TN RIVER VALLEYS DURING THE THURSDAY 
NIGHT/FRIDAY TIME FRAME...BUT SHOW SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE EXACT 
TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM. BOTH THE GFS AND ECMWF MODELS AGREE THAT SOME 
WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL PRODUCE SOME LIGHT 
RAIN OR SNOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. 
A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION THEN DEVELOPS THURSDAY NIGHT OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF THIS DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...WITH THE 
MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING AN ABOVE-FREEZING 850 TO 750 MB LAYER. 
THIS WARM LAYER WILL SPREAD OVER A SUB-FREEZING SURFACE AIR MASS 
REMAINING ENTRENCHED AT THE SURFACE OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS 
SCENARIO WOULD SUGGEST THE POSSIBILITY OF A LIGHT WINTRY MIX OF 
RAIN...SLEET...OR FREEZING RAIN ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING 
OVER MOSTLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. LATEST ECMWF 
MODEL RUN INDICATES A MORE SOUTHERLY TRACK TO THE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM ON FRIDAY...WHICH WOULD BRING IN COLDER AIR INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA ON FRIDAY RESULTING IN MORE SNOW THAN RAIN. SINCE THIS IS THE 
FIRST MODEL RUN TO SUGGEST A MORE SOUTHERLY TRACK OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY...WILL CONTINUE TO TREND THE FORECAST TOWARDS A WARMER 
SOLUTION OF MOSTLY RAIN FOR FRIDAY...BUT SWITCHING TO SNOW ON FRIDAY 
NIGHT BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL TREND CLOSE TO THE 
GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
