754 
FXUS64 KMRX 210934
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST MON JAN 21 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL DEEPEN OVER 
THE EASTERN US...AND A SURGE OF ARCTIC AIR WILL INVADE OUR AREA. THE 
DEEP WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BE FAIRLY DRY...SO WHILE THERE WILL 
BE SOME CLOUDS AT TIMES NOT EXPECTING EXTENSIVE OR PERSISTENT CLOUD 
COVER AND NO PRECIP IS FORECAST FOR THE SHORT TERM.  TEMPERATURES 
WILL DROP INTO THE TEENS AND LOW 20S IN VALLEY LOCATIONS 
TONIGHT...WITH SINGLE DIGITS IN SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN.  WIND 
CHILL VALUES EXPECTED TO DIP BELOW ZERO AT TIMES ACROSS SOME OF THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE LOW ENOUGH TO WARRANT 
ANY WIND CHILL ADVISORY.          

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE TO BULGE INTO THE AREA TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY WITH THE 
PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND SURFACE FRONTAL 
SYSTEM WILL APPROACH THE REGION ON THURSDAY WITH WARM AND MOIST AIR 
BEING LIFTED OVER THE COOLER AIRMASS IN PLACE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO 
FRIDAY. USED A BLEND OF THE FASTER ECMWF AND SLOWER GFS FOR THE 
EVENT. IT APPEARS MODELS TRY TO WARM THE LOW LEVEL AIRMASS JUST A 
LITTLE TOO QUICKLY DURING THIS TIME FRAME SO HAD TO ADJUST SURFACE 
TEMPERATURES TO A CERTAIN DEGREE. IT LOOKS LIKE A MIXED BAG OF 
PRECIPITATION WILL BE POSSIBLE FOR A PERIOD LATER THURSDAY NIGHT 
INTO FRIDAY AS NOT ENOUGH MELTING OCCURS IN STILL CHILLY LOW LEVEL 
ATMOSPHERE BEFORE PRECIP CHANGES ENTIRELY BACK TO RAIN IN THIS AREA. 
EASTERN U.S. UPPER LEVEL TROUGH REALLY AMPLIFIES FRIDAY INTO 
SATURDAY AND MUCH COLDER AIR WILL SPILL INTO THE REGION BEHIND THE 
DEPARTING FRONTAL SYSTEM SO HAVE RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW LATER FRIDAY 
INTO SATURDAY WITH SNOW SHOWERS FAVORING THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER ON SATURDAY. 
DRY...COLD WEATHER ENSUES ON SUNDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE FILLS IN BEHIND 
THE EARLY WEEKEND SYSTEM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
321 PM EST SUN JAN 20 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)... A PERSISTENT LONG WAVE TROUGH
WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT THE EASTERN UNITED STATES...WITH SLIGHT
DEEPENING OF THE TROUGH ON MONDAY. THIS WILL BRING A REINFORCING
SHOT OF ARCTIC AIR TO THE AREA LATE MONDAY. THE DEEP N-NW FLOW
ALOFT REMAINS MOSTLY DRY THROUGH THE PERIOD...SO NO PRECIP IS
EXPECTED. MODELS SHOW A THIN LAYER OF MOISTURE AROUND 800 MB
TOMORROW AFTERNOON AHEAD OF THE 850-700 MB TROUGH AXIS...SO WE CAN
EXPECT A LITTLE MORE CLOUD COVER TOMORROW. THE SURFACE COLD FRONT
WILL BE CLOSE TO OUR PLATEAU AND SW VA COUNTIES BY LATE
AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING. HIGH TEMPS SHOULD REACH INTO THE MID 40S
AND LOWER 50S BEFORE DROPPING SHARPLY IN THE EVENING.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...AS LONG WAVE TROUGH
SETTLES OVER EASTERN STATES MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT VERY
COLD AND DRY AIR MASS ON N TO NW WINDS BRINGS LOWS BELOW 20 DEGREES
AND SINGLE DIGITS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND POSSIBLY HIGHER VALLEYS NE
TN AND SW VA EACH NIGHT. HIGHS TUESDAY 10 TO 15 DEGREES BELOW
NORMAL IN THE 20S AND 30S. AS TROUGH AND ARCTIC HIGH MODERATES AND
SHIFTS EAST WEDNESDAY TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO WARM BACK UP WITH
HIGHS RISING ABOVE FREEZING IN MOST AREAS. WEAK SYSTEMS IN NW FLOW
MAY BRING SOME CLOUD COVER INTO THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LOWS WILL REBOUND THURSDAY MORNING TO THE MID 20S
TO LOWER 30S AS THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM APPROACHES. THIS SYSTEM MAY
START WITH A WINTER MIX EARLY THURSDAY BUT SHOULD QUICKLY CHANGE TO
ALL RAIN BY LATE MORNING OR EARLY AFTERNOON AS A WARM FRONT PASSES
THROUGH. THE WARM PERIOD WILL BE SHORT LIVED AS THE COLD FRONT
FRIDAY CHANGES THE RAIN BACK TO SNOW ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS AND
HIGHER ELEVATIONS DURING THE DAY FRIDAY. SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER
WITH WRAP AROUND MOISTURE FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY BEFORE
SKIES BEGIN TO CLEAR LATER SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER
COLD BLAST BEHIND THIS FRONT SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST SUN JAN 20 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A MOISTURE STARVED COLD FRONT WILL 
PUSH THROUGH THE AREA TODAY. NOT MUCH COLD ADVECTION BEHIND IT AS 
STRONG PUSH OF COLDER AIR WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER THE SHORT TERM 
PERIOD.  STILL SHOULD BE QUITE A BIT OF SUNSHINE TODAY ALTHOUGH SOME 
STRATOCU MAY INVADE NORTHERN AREAS BRIEFLY. SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR 
SKY TONIGHT.  MAV TEMPS LOOK TO BE IN THE BALL PARK OVERALL.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...LONG WAVE TROUGH WILL 
ESTABLISH ITSELF ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S. MONDAY AND TUESDAY. COLD 
AIR WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION ON MONDAY BUT WON'T BE TOO HARD TO 
TAKE AS HIGHS WILL BE RIGHT AROUND SEASONAL NORMALS FOR THE DATE. 
HOWEVER...THE PREVAILING NORTHERLY FLOW WILL PULL ARCTIC AIR ACROSS 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU INTO THE GREAT VALLEY AND APPALACHIAN 
MOUNTAINS LATER MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
ABOUT 15 TO 20 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL ON TUESDAY RANGING FROM THE 
UPPER TEENS ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
ALONG THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER TO THE LOWER AND MIDDLE 30S ACROSS 
MUCH OF THE GREAT VALLEY. ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIDE OVER THE 
REGION TUESDAY NIGHT CAUSING TEMPERATURES TO FALL INTO THE TEENS 
ACROSS MOST OF THE REGION. HEIGHTS START TO BUILD WEDNESDAY INTO 
THURSDAY WITH THE APPROACH OF ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM WHICH SHOULD 
ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB BACK CLOSER TO NORMAL FOR LATE JANUARY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. MODELS WERE SOMEWHAT CLOSER IN 
DEPICTION OF THE LATE WEEK WEATHER SCENARIO WHICH INCLUDES A FRONTAL 
SYSTEM APPROACHING THE REGION ON THURSDAY WITH A SURGE OF MILDER AIR 
AS SYSTEM WARM SECTOR BUILDS EAST. TWEAKED POPS UP FROM SLIGHT AND 
LOW CHANCE LATER THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO MEDIUM CHANCE BY LATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND HIGH CHANCE CATEGORY FOR FRIDAY. WILL NEED TO 
WATCH NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WITH THE 
POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING OR FROZEN PRECIP OCCURRING WITH CHILLY LOW 
LEVEL AIRMASS IN PLACE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING. LOOKS 
LIKE ENOUGH WARMING FOR RAIN SHOWERS EVERYWHERE BY LATE MORNING 
FRIDAY. UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE EASTERN STATES ON FRIDAY AS 
ADDITIONAL SHORT WAVE ENERGY DROPS THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
TROUGH PULLING MUCH COLDER AIR BACK ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION. WOULD EXPECT PRECIP TO CHANGE FROM RAIN SHOWERS TO SNOW 
SHOWERS WITH UPSLOPE ENHANCEMENT IN THE TERRAIN FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY. WINTERY PRECIP APPEARS LIKE IT WILL END EVERYWHERE BUT THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS ALONG THE 
NORTH CAROLINA BORDER DURING THE DAY SATURDAY. BASICALLY UNDERCUT 
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES FROM TUESDAY THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE 
FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EST SAT JAN 19 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...VISIBLE SATELLITE SHOWS A GOOD 
DEAL OF SNOW MELTING THIS AFTERNOON. BY THE END OF THE DAY...ONLY 
PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WILL HAVE 
SIGNIFICANT SNOW ON THE GROUND. THIS WILL PLAY INTO HOW MUCH FOG IS 
ANTICIPATED TONIGHT..LOWS TONIGHT AND HIGHS SUNDAY. WILL INCLUDE 
PATCHY FOG FOG TYS NORTHWARD...SOME LOCALL DENSE POSSIBLE AGAIN.

FOR HIGHS SUNDAY..WILL A DEGREE OR TWO LOWER THAN GUIDANCE FOR THE
NORTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA.

A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY. A 
SHORT-WAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN GREAT LAKES WILL PULL A 
COLD FRONT THROUGH THE AREA SUNDAY MORNING. MOISTURE IS VERY SHALLOW 
WITH FROPA AND CONFINED TO THE BOUNDARY LAYER. WILL INCREASE CLOUD 
COVER BETWEEN 10-15Z SUNDAY FOR TYS AND TRI..THEN SUNNY AREA-WIDE. 
COLD AIR ADVECTION IS WEAK BEHIND INITIAL FRONT.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD AIR ADVECTION 
SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY FROM ARCTIC FRONT TO BRING MUCH COLDER 
AIR MASS INTO THE REGION. LOOKS LIKE THE COLDEST OF THE WINTER AND 
IN THE PAST COUPLE YEARS. NW FLOW BEHIND FRONT WILL ALSO INCREASE 
WINDS PRODUCING WIND CHILLS IN THE SINGLE DIGITS TO BELOW ZERO IN 
THE MOUNTAINS AND NOT QUITE AS LOW IN THE VALLEYS. WENT BELOW 
GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH ARCTIC AIR MASS. 
LOWS WILL BE IN THE SINGLE DIGITS TO TEENS MOST PLACES MONDAY NIGHT 
AND TUESDAY NIGHT. AREAS WITH LEFT OVER SNOW COVER STILL ON THE 
GROUND IN SW VA MAY BE EVEN DROP TO NEAR ZERO. TEMPERATURES BEGIN TO 
WARM WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE EASTERN 
THIRD OF THE COUNTRY BEGINS TO SHIFT EAST. THE BREAK IN THE COLD 
PATTERN WILL BE BRIEF AS NEW SHORT WAVE DIGS SOUTH ACROSS THE MID MS 
VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT AND INTO THE TN VALLEY FRIDAY. WARMING 
TEMPERATURES WILL ALLOW RAIN TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE TN VALLEY 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. HOWEVER COLD AIR TRAPPED ACROSS NE 
SECTIONS MAY ALLOW SOME FREEZING RAIN TO OCCUR LATE THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND EARLY FRIDAY BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN. FREEZING LEVELS DROP 
RAPIDLY FRIDAY NIGHT AND THE RAIN SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY...AS SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVES IN ON THE 
BACK SIDE OF THE SYSTEM. A FEW INCHES OF SNOW COULD FALL ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS BEFORE ENDING SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE TO 
WATCH AS NEW MODEL INFORMATION COMES IN THE NEXT FEW DAYS AS 
UNCERTAINTY IN THE TIMING OF THE SYSTEM WILL AFFECT PRECIPITATION 
TYPES.

AFTER MORNING FOG LIFTS SHOULD SEE PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TODAY...THEN A

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE PERIOD BEGINS WITH DRY COLD 
FRONTAL PASSAGE ON SUNDAY BUT THE STRONGEST COLD AIR ADVECTION 
BEGINS LATER SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AS THE LONG WAVE TROUGH 
OVER THE EASTERN U.S. DEEPENS WITH SHORT WAVE ENERGY BUILDING 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION. MODELS 
AGREE THAT ARCTIC AIR WILL BE TAPPED ON STRENGTHENING NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW. INCREASINGLY COLDER AIR WILL LIMIT HIGH TEMPERATURES TO THE 
UPPER 30S AND 40S ON MONDAY AND MID 20S TO THE MID 30S TUESDAY WHILE

BRIEF PERIOD OF UPPER LEVEL RIDGING WILL BE MAINTAINED LATER 
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY WHILE THE FORECAST AREA AWAITS THE NEXT 
STORM SYSTEM. UNCERTAINTY IN SYSTEM TIMING INCREASES AT THE END OF 
THE LONG TERM PERIOD WITH THE GFS QUITE A BIT SLOWER WITH SYSTEM 
FROPA THAN THE ECMWF. WENT MUCH CLOSER TO THE FASTER EUROPEAN MODEL 
WHICH SMOKES A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING 
THE DAY FRIDAY. USED A MEDIUM RANGE CHANCE PROBABILITY FOR SHOWERS 
FOR THE EVENT WITH A BIT OF SNOW MIXED IN WITH THE RAIN FOR 
PRE-FRONTAL PRECIP LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING 
DEVELOPING OVER STILL CHILLY AIR RESIDING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. RAIN WOULD LIKELY CHANGE OVER TO SNOW 
SHOWERS AREA WIDE FRIDAY NIGHT AS MUCH COLDER AIR FILLS IN BEHIND 
THE DEPARTING COLD FRONT WITH PLENTY OF SHORT WAVE ENERGY DROPPING 
INTO THE BACK SIDE OF THE LONG WAVE TROUGH. UNDERCUT MEX MOS TEMP 
GUIDANCE A FAIR AMOUNT ON MONDAY WITH FRONT MOVING IN EARLY IN THE 
DAYTIME PERIOD AND GENERALLY CLIPPED A COUPLE DEGREES OFF THE 
NUMBERS THROUGH MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST.

219 
FXUS64 KMRX 190307
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 PM EST FRI JAN 18 2013

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. MINOR UPWARD ADJUSTMENT TO TEMPS 
AND DEW POINTS. SOME ICY ROADS EXPECTED AND PATCHY FREEZING FOG. SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SNOW MELT UNDERWAY THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH SOME LAST REMNANT OF LOW CLOUDS HANGING ON AT 
LONESOME PINE (LNP) IN WISE COUNTY VA. AREAS OF NE TN AND SW VA THAT 
GOT HEAVIER SNOWS WERE STRUGGLING TO GET OUT OF THE MID 30S.

FORECAST SEEMS STRAIGHT FORWARD FOR TONIGHT...ALTHO THE MELTING SNOW 
SHOULD KEEP THE BOUNDARY LAYER MOIST...SO I ADDED PATCHY AREAS OF 
FOG FOR TRI INTO SW VA. MOS DEW POINT TEMPS WERE RUNNING A FEW TO 
SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW ACTUAL DEW POINT TEMPS...SO SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS 
WERE MADE THROUGH TONIGHT. MOS MINS...MAINLY THE COOLER GFS...LOOKED 
QUITE REASONABLE.

PLENTY OF SUNSHINE ON TAP FOR SATURDAY WITH S-SW LOW LEVEL FLOW 
RETURNING...SO EXPECT A GREAT DEAL OF THE REMAINING SNOW TO MELT 
AWAY. HIGHS IN THE 40S TO MID 50S LOOKS RIGHT ON TRACK.

MOTORISTS SHOULD WATCH FOR ANY WET AREAS TO ICE OVER AGAIN TONIGHT
ESPECIALLY OVER THE SECONDARY AND BACK ROADS OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
AREAS. THIS WAS HIGHLIGHTED IN THE HWO PRODUCT AND WILL ALSO ISSUE A 
SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT (SPS). 


LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SFC RIDGE WILL 
CONTINUE TO SLIDE OFF TO OUR EAST ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND INTO SUNDAY. 
A LOW AMPLITUDE SHORT WAVE TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND 
NEW ENGLAND AREA ON SUNDAY WITH A COLD FRONT THAT EXTENDS DOWN 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. DUE TO THE FAR NORTHERN LOCATION 
OF THE SHORT WAVE...THE FRONT WILL NOT BRING MUCH OF AN AIRMASS 
CHANGE ACROSS OUR AREA. THE FRONT SHOULD ONLY KNOCK BACK TEMPS A FEW 
DEGREES OFF SATURDAY'S HIGHS. SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW FROM SATURDAY 
SHIFTS TO A NORTHWEST FLOW ON SUNDAY AFTER THE PASSAGE OF THE FRONT. 
SOME OF THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON BUILDS INTO THE REGION ON 
MONDAY AS MORE ENERGY DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF CENTRAL CANADA. AN 
ARCTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SHOVE IT'S WAY INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE DAY INITIATING THE BEGINNING OF A VERY 
COLD PERIOD. LATEST NAM AND GFS DIFFER ON THE ARRIVAL TIME OF THE 
FRONT. THE NAME BRINGS IT IN AROUND 18Z WHILE THE GFS IS CLOSER TO 
00Z. THE TIMING WILL EFFECT HIGH TEMPERATURES FOR THE DAY ON MONDAY. 
TRENDING TOWARD THE GFS AND ITS LATER ARRIVAL SOLUTION AT THIS 
TIME...THUS GOING WITH WARMER TEMPS. HIGHS WILL NEED TO BE ADJUSTED 
DOWN IF THE NAM IS CORRECT WITH ITS EARLIER ARRIVAL. TEMPS WILL BE 
AROUND 10 TO 15 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL ON TUESDAY AS NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW CONTINUES ALOFT. THE COLD NORTHERLY FLOW WILL BE A BIT TOO DRY 
FOR PRECIPITATION. BY WEDNESDAY HEIGHTS START TO SLOWLY BUILD AS THE 
EASTERN U.S. TROUGH MOVES OUT TO SEA. THE MID JANUARY CHILL WILL 
MODERATE TO SOME DEGREE ON WEDNESDAY AS THE COLDEST AIR SHIFTS EAST. 
FURTHER WARMING IS EXPECTED ON THURSDAY DUE TO THE APPROACH OF AN 
UPPER TROUGH THROUGH THE WESTERN STATES. THIS SYSTEM MOVES RAPIDLY 
EAST WITH A SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM MAKING ITS WAY THROUGH THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. EDGED POPS UP 
SLIGHTLY TO LOW CHANCE LATE THURSDAY NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT BUILDS 
TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. CHANCE POPS ON FRIDAY THROUGH FRIDAY 
EVENING AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. PRECIP STARTS TO EXIT 
THE AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SAT MORNING. USED LIQUID PRECIP FOR 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA BUT HAD TO APPLY SOME SNOW TO PARTS OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WITH THE SYSTEM MOVING IN 
DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS AND EXITING DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS ON 
FRIDAY. CONCERNING THE TEMPERATURE FORECAST FOR THIS PACKAGE...HAD 
TO UNDERCUT GUIDANCE THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM WHICH LOOKS LIKE 
IT MAY NOT HANDLE THE FRIGID ARCTIC AIR VERY WELL.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             29  54  32  55  28 /   0   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  27  52  31  51  27 /   0   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       28  53  31  51  26 /   0   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              22  49  27  45  23 /   0   0   0   0  10

129 
FXUS64 KMRX 182015
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST FRI JAN 18 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SNOW MELT UNDERWAY THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH SOME LAST REMNANT OF LOW CLOUDS HANGING ON AT 
LONESOME PINE (LNP) IN WISE COUNTY VA. AREAS OF NE TN AND SW VA THAT 
GOT HEAVIER SNOWS WERE STRUGGLING TO GET OUT OF THE MID 30S.

FORECAST SEEMS STRAIGHT FORWARD FOR TONIGHT...ALTHO THE MELTING SNOW 
SHOULD KEEP THE BOUNDARY LAYER MOIST...SO I ADDED PATCHY AREAS OF 
FOG FOR TRI INTO SW VA. MOS DEW POINT TEMPS WERE RUNNING A FEW TO 
SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW ACTUAL DEW POINT TEMPS...SO SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS 
WERE MADE THROUGH TONIGHT. MOS MINS...MAINLY THE COOLER GFS...LOOKED 
QUITE REASONABLE.

PLENTY OF SUNSHINE ON TAP FOR SATURDAY WITH S-SW LOW LEVEL FLOW 
RETURNING...SO EXPECT A GREAT DEAL OF THE REMAINING SNOW TO MELT 
AWAY. HIGHS IN THE 40S TO MID 50S LOOKS RIGHT ON TRACK.

MOTORISTS SHOULD WATCH FOR ANY WET AREAS TO ICE OVER AGAIN TONIGHT
ESPECIALLY OVER THE SECONDARY AND BACK ROADS OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
AREAS. THIS WAS HIGHLIGHTED IN THE HWO PRODUCT AND WILL ALSO ISSUE A

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
947 AM EST FRI JAN 18 2013

.DISCUSSION...IMPROVING WEATHER ON TAP FOR TODAY...ALTHO A 
PERSISTENT AREA OF FREEZING FOG AND STRATUS CLOUDS WAS HINDERING 
THINGS A BIT THIS MORNING FROM THE LAKEWAY AREA NE INTO THE TRI 
CITIES AREA. EXTENSIVE WET SNOW COVER WILL ABSORB A LOT OF THE 
INCOMING SUNSHINE TODAY...SO MAY NEED TO TRIM MAX TEMPS BACK IN 
THOSE AREAS IN A LATE MORNING UPDATE. HOURLY TEMPS ALREADY LAGGING 
BEHIND THE GRID TEMPS BY A FEW DEGREES...ESPECIALLY IN THE FOGGY 
AND/OR SNOW COVERED LOCATIONS. 

ROADS SHOULD SEE CONSIDERABLE IMPROVEMENT...WITH GOOD NEWS BEING A 
WEEK LONG RUN OF DRY WEATHER AHEAD!

FXUS64 KMRX 180853
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST FRI JAN 18 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEATHER WILL BE MUCH MORE TRANQUIL 
THAN RECENT DAYS AS HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN CONTROL.  THE 
ATMOSPHERE WILL BE QUITE DRY...SO EXPECT MAINLY SUNNY/CLEAR 
CONDITIONS FOR THE SHORT TERM.  WILL CONTINUE SPS FOR ICY CONDITIONS 
INTO THIS MORNING.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL 
STAY CLOSE.  

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...85H-SFC RIDGE WILL BE 
MAKING ITS WAY SLOWLY SOUTH AND EAST OUT OF THE AREA ON SATURDAY FOR 
A PLEASANT DAY COMPLETE WITH A SOUTH TO SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AND 
SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPERATURES. HOWEVER...A LOW AMPLITUDE SHORT WAVE 
TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND NEW ENGLAND ON SUNDAY AND A 
COLD FRONT WILL ACCOMPANY THIS FEATURE. THE FRONT WILL JOURNEY INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS KNOCKING TEMPERATURES BACK A FEW DEGREES 
OFF SATURDAY'S HIGHS. SOME OF THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON BUILDS 
INTO THE REGION ON MONDAY AS MORE ENERGY DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF 
CENTRAL CANADA. AN ARCTIC FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL SHOVE IT'S WAY INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION DURING THE DAY INITIATING THE 
BEGINNING OF A VERY COLD PERIOD. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOUT 5 
TO 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL ON MONDAY DROPPING TO AROUND 10 TO 15 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL ON TUESDAY AS NORTHWESTERLY FLOW CONTINUES 
ALOFT. THE COLD NORTHERLY FLOW WILL BE A BIT TOO DRY FOR 
PRECIPITATION. BY WEDNESDAY HEIGHTS START TO SLOWLY BUILD AS THE 
EASTERN U.S. TROUGH MOVES OUT TO SEA. THE MID JANUARY CHILL WILL 
MODERATE TO SOME DEGREE ON WEDNESDAY AS THE COLDEST AIR SHIFTS EAST. 
FURTHER WARMING IS EXPECTED ON THURSDAY DUE TO THE APPROACH OF AN 
UPPER TROUGH THROUGH THE WESTERN STATES. THIS SYSTEM MOVES RAPIDLY 
EAST WITH A SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM MAKING ITS WAY THROUGH THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. EDGED POPS UP 
SLIGHTLY TO LOW CHANCE LATE THURSDAY NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT BUILDS 
TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. USED LIQUID PRECIP FOR MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BUT HAD TO APPLY SOME SNOW TO PARTS OF SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WITH THE SYSTEM MOVING IN DURING 
THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. CONCERNING THE TEMPERATURE FORECAST FOR THIS 
PACKAGE...HAD TO UNDERCUT GUIDANCE THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM 
WHICH LOOKS LIKE IT MAY NOT HANDLE THE FRIGID ARCTIC AIR VERY WELL.

FROM THE NW. TEMPERATURES WILL DIVE TO BELOW FREEZING WITH COLD

895 
FXUS64 KMRX 172059
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
359 PM EST THU JAN 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...STORM SYSTEM NOW OVER THE
AREA. DYNAMIC COOLING HAS TURNED LEADING EDGE PRECIPITATION TO
SNOW...AND EVEN SOME THUNDER SNOW IN SOME PLACES. WRAP AROUND
PRECIP HAS CLOSED THE GAP AND AND IS WORKING ITS WAY TO THE
NORTHEAST...AND IS ABOUT HALF WAY THROUGH THE AREA. SYSTEM IS
CHUGGING ALONG...WITH THE EXPIRATION TIME OF 10PM FOR WINTER STORM
WARNING...LOOKING ON TRACK. HAVE BUMPED UP SNOW VALUES FROM KNOX
NORTHWARD BY ABOUT AN INCH OR SO...AND ADDED WORDING OF LOCALLY
HEAVIER AMOUNTS IN LOCAL SNOW BANDS. SOME ROADS GETTING COATED WITH
RAPID SNOWS EVEN IN VALLEY...THINK SOME MELTING WILL OCCUR WHEN
SNOW SLOWS DOWN AND TERRESTRIAL WARMING CATCHES UP.

WENT 1-2 DEGREES HIGHER THAN MIN TEMPS DUE TO WINDS AND MOISTURE
TONIGHT...AND WENT ABOUT 3 DEGREES COOLER THAN MAX TEMPS FOR FRIDAY
DUE TO SATURATED GROUNDS USING UP A LOT OF ENERGY VIA EVAPORATION.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS STILL IN GOOD
AGREEMENT FOR DRY AND COOL PATTERN TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEKEND
AND THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. ONE WEAK COLD FRONT TO PASS
THROUGH SUNDAY AND THEN ANOTHER FRONT LATE MONDAY THAT WILL BRING A
FEW MORE CLOUDS INTO THE NORTHERN SECTIONS. REMOVED PRECIPITATION
CHANCES FOR MONDAY NIGHT AS LESS MOISTURE AVAILABLE IN DRY AIR
MASS. ANOTHER POSSIBLE QUICK MOVING SYSTEM TUESDAY NIGHT NOW LOOKS
TOO DRY FOR ANY PRECIPITATION. NEXT SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM TO SPREAD
CLOUDS IN THURSDAY WITH CHANCE OF RAIN THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY
JUST OUTSIDE THE 7 DAY FORECAST. LOWS FRIDAY NIGHT QUITE COLD AND
MAY BE EVEN COLDER DEPENDING ON SNOW DEPTH FRIDAY MORNING AND HOW
MUCH MELTING OCCURS. HIGHS SATURDAY 5 TO 10 DEGREES WARMER AS
SOUTHERLY WINDS DEVELOP AS HIGH PRESSURE AREA MOVES EAST. AGAIN
HIGHS MAY BE AFFECTED BY SNOW COVER BUT FULL SUN IS EXPECTED.
SATURDAY NIGHT LOWS SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER BUT STILL MOSTLY
BELOW FREEZING. SUNDAY HIGHS START A COOLING TREND AS SOME CLOUD
COVER MOVE IN AND COLD FRONT BRINGS RE-INFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR.
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY COLDER TEMPERATURES CONTINUE BEHIND COLD
FRONT. THIS PATTERN CONTINUES MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY. SOME
HIGHS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS BELOW
FREEZING. THURSDAY TEMPERATURES WARM TO THE MID 40S TO NEAR 50 AHEAD
OF NEXT SYSTEM AS HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS EAST AND SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST
FLOW SETS UP.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             29  44  28  54  31 /  10   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  26  45  25  51  30 /  30   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       26  43  26  51  30 /  20   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              25  36  21  48  27 /  60   0   0   0   0

.AVIATION...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN

CLOUDS WILL PERSIST THROUGH 03Z WITH REDUCED VIS DUE TO THE SN FOR 
WIDESPREAD MVFR TO IFR CONDITIONS WITH OCCASION LIFR CONDITIONS 
POSSIBLE.  SNOW WILL EXIT DURING THE EVENING...BUT WITH RECENT 
ABUNDANT RAINFALL...AREAS OF LOW CLOUDS MAY PERSIST THROUGH 
MIDNIGHT.  IMPROVING CONDITIONS EXPECTED ON FRIDAY WITH VFR 
CONDITIONS AND LIGHT WINDS EXPECTED LATE IN THE PERIOD.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1127 AM EST THU JAN 17 2013

.DISCUSSION...
INTENSE LITTLE LOW PRESSURE CENTER NOW HEADED TOWARD THE AREA.
EXPECT THE CENTER TO PASS SOUTH OF THE AREA...BUT WITH
PRECIPITATION STREAMING TO THE NORTH. CIRCULATION AROUND LOW WILL
ALSO TRY TO BRING UP SOME WARM AIR INTO THE REGION...THAT WILL MEAN
A MIXED PRECIP RAIN...SLEET...SNOW AT TIMES UNTIL LOW GETS FARTHER
TO THE EAST. GAP CURRENTLY SEEN BETWEEN RAIN IN E TN AND SNOW IN
FARTHER WEST. THIS GAP IS EXPECTED TO CLOSE...ESPECIALLY FOR THE
NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA...THIS IS WHERE THE MIXED PRECIP IS MOST
LIKELY. FARTHER SOUTH...THE GAP WILL BE SLOWER TO FILL...AND SO FOR
KCHA THERE IS A BREAK IN THE PRECIP STARTING NOW FOR A FEW HOURS.  

WITH THE MIXING OF SLEET...HAVE TRIMMED BACK THE SNOW ACCUMULATIONS
A SLIGHT AMOUNT OVER THE AREA...BUT STILL KEEPING WARNINGS AND
ADVISORIES INTACT.

.AVIATION...
MVFR CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY WITH 
PERIODS OF R-/R CHANGING TO SNOW BETWEEN 18-20Z. VISIBILITIES
WILL GENERALLY BE 2 MILES WITH THE SNOW...BUT PERIODS OF HEAVY
SNOW ARE POSSIBLE PRODUCING LIFR CONDITIONS DUE TO VISIBILITIES
AT 1/2 MILE. UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA THIS EVENING 
WITH SNOW ENDING BETWEEN 23-03Z...THEN SKIES CLEARING BY 06Z.

DUE TO DEEPENING SURFACE CYCLOGENESIS OVER GEORGIA...WINDS WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE BRISK OUT OF THE NORTH BETWEEN 10 AND 15KTS WITH 
GUSTS TO 20KTS TODAY.

716 
FXUS64 KMRX 170826
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST THU JAN 17 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VERY DYNAMIC SYSTEM WILL LIFT 
NORTHEAST FROM THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY TO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS TODAY AND EXIT THE AREA EARLY TONIGHT. DOUBLE JET 
STRUCTURE ALOFT WILL PRODUCE LARGE SCALE ASCENT WITH STRONG Q-VECTOR 
FORCING MOVING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. STRONG AGEOSTROPHIC 
CIRCULATION ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER JET WILL ENHANCE FRONTO-GENETIC 
FORCING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE STRONG FORCING WILL 
PRODUCE DYNAMIC COOLING OVER THE AREA WHICH IS EVIDENT BY THE 850MB 
TEMPERATURES. 

THE STRONG LIFT AND TAP OF GULF MOISTURE DUE TO DEVELOPING 
CYCLOGENESIS OVER GEORGIA WILL PRODUCE ANOTHER ROUND OF MODERATE 
RAINFALL WITH 1 TO 2 INCHES OF PRECIPITATION ANTICIPATED WITH 
HEAVIER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE ALONG THE TENNESSEE AND NORTH CAROLINA 
STATE-LINE. DUE TO THE RETURN OF SIGNIFICANT RAINS...ADDITIONAL 
FLOODING CONCERNS ARE POSSIBLE..SO WILL MAINTAIN FLOOD WATCH.

NAM AND GFS BUFR SOUNDINGS SHOW HOW THE DYNAMIC COOLING REDUCES THE 
TEMPERATURE PROFILE QUICKLY LATE THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON. THE 
COOLING WILL ALLOW THE RAIN TO CHANGE TO SNOW TODAY..ESPECIALLY THIS 
AFTERNOON. HAVE MAINTAINED WINTER STORM WARNING FOR THE MOUNTAINS 
(SNOWFALL OF 6 TO 12 INCHES) AND ISSUED WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES 
ELSEWHERE FOR 1 TO 4 INCHES. FOR THE VALLEY...MAIN ACCUMULATION WILL 
BE ON GRASSY SURFACES...BUT MAY BE SOME TRAVEL PROBLEMS DURING THE 
AFTERNOON RUSH HOUR.

SYSTEM QUICKLY MOVES EAST FOR THIS EVENING WITH PRECIPITATION ENDING 
BY MIDNIGHT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT A DRY AND TRANQUIL WEATHER PATTERN WILL DEVELOP FOR THE WEEKEND 
AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPS EXPECTED FOR 
EARLY NEXT WEEK AS A PAIR OF COLD FRONTS MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA. THE FIRST COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING TIME FRAME. 
MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS COLD FRONT WILL HAVE LIMITED 
MOISTURE AND WEAK UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH IT...SO 
EXPECTING MAINLY JUST AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS. ANOTHER COLD FRONT WITH 
STRONGER UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS IS THEN PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT...AND COULD CREATE A FEW SNOW 
SHOWERS OVER MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE 
ECMWF MODEL SOLUTION.
&&

.AVIATION...
MVFR TO IFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BE THE PREVAILING FLIGHT 
CATEGORY AT EACH TERMINAL THROUGH 23-01 UTC AS AN APPROACHING STORM 
SYSTEM ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY LIFTS NORTHEAST ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A LARGE AREA OF RAIN WILL MOVE INTO THE 
AREA THIS MORNING..THEN CHANGE TO SNOW BETWEEN 19-21 UTC. PERIODS OF 
MODERATE TO LOCALLY HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE..ESPECIALLY FOR TRI AND 
TYS.

SNOW WILL END BY 00 UTC AT CHA TO 03 UTC AT TRI WITH CLEARING SKY BY 
06 UTC. WINDS WILL INCREASE TO 5 TO 15KTS TODAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
940 PM EST WED JAN 16 2013

.DISCUSSION...MINOR ADJUSTMENT TO TONIGHTS FORECAST. RAISED
PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION AND LOWERED MINS A DEGREE. 

FLOODING REMAINS A CONCERN. MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW CONTINUES INTO
EARLY THU. HEAVY RAINFALL EXPECTED TO MOVE UP SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
THROUGH THU.

HEAVY SNOWFALL RATES REMAINS A GOOD BET FOR THU. UPPER LOW TRACKS
ACROSS SOUTHERN APPS BY THU AFTERNOON. GOOD DEFORMATION ZONE SETS
UP ACROSS MRX CWA. TROWAL FEATURE ALSO DEPICTED NICELY BY MODELS.
SURFACE LOW SHIFTS EAST THROUGH SC. 1000-H85 FLOW SHIFTS RAPIDLY TO
THE NE WITH STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION. 17/18Z SOUNDINGS REMAIN
NEARLY ISOTHERMAL AT 0C BUT SHOULD SNAP QUICKLY TO BELOW ZERO. WET
SNOWFALL RATES NEAR TWO INCHES PER HOUR VERY POSSIBLE. SURFACE
TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY REMAIN AT OR ABOVE FREEZING DURING MOST OF
EVENT BUT RATES SHOULD OVERCOME MELTING ALLOWING FOR
ACCUMULATION...ESPECIALLY ON GRASSY AREAS AND TREE BRANCHES. 

UPDATE...LATEST 17/00Z NAM TRACKS UPPER LOW SIMILAR TO PREVIOUS 
MODEL RUNS. DEPICTED SNOWFALL NOT AS ROBUST AS PREVIOUS RUNS BUT 
CLOSE TO CURRENT FORECAST. VALLEY ACCUMULATIONS REMAIN QUESTIONABLE
BUT BRIEF HEAVY SNOWFALL SHOULD BE EXPECTED. ADVISORY CONDITIONS 
SHOULD ALSO BE EXPECTED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
THE SE TN VALLEY.

.AVIATION...
IFR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BE THE PREVAILING FLIGHT CATEGORY AT
EACH TERMINAL FOR MOST OF THE PERIOD AS LOW CIGS AND -RA CONTINUE
TO MOVE OVER THE REGION. LATER TONIGHT...VIS IS EXPECTED TO DROP AS
WELL...TO MVFR LEVELS AT FIRST AND EVENTUALLY IFR LEVELS BY
DAYBREAK. LATE IN THE PERIOD...A CHANGE OVER TO -SN IS EXPECTED AS
COLDER AIR FILTERS INTO THE AREA.

070 
FXUS64 KMRX 162045
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 PM EST WED JAN 16 2013

.NEAR TERM (TONIGHT)...PLUME OF MOISTURE WITH CURRENT EVENT
CONTINUES TO FADE THIS AFTERNOON...AND IT SHOULD CONTINUE INTO THIS
EVENING. THERE SHOULD BE NO FURTHER CONTRIBUTION TO FLOODING
THROUGH THIS EVENING. PLAN TO LET FLOOD ADVISORIES OVER WESTERN
AREAS EXPIRE AT 4PM. FLOOD WATCH WILL CONTINUE AS IT STANDS THROUGH
THURSDAY.

NEXT SYSTEM...LAST SYSTEM IN THIS SERIES...WILL BE AFFECTING THE 
AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT...WITH RAINS SPREADING ACROSS THE SOUTH BEFORE 
DAYBREAK.  TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY STAY ABOVE FREEZING OVERNIGHT 
ACROSS MOST OF THE AREA.  NOT EXPECTING ANY WINTRY PRECIP OVERNIGHT. 

.SHORT TERM (THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL DEVELOP AND MOVE ALONG THE APPALACHIANS ON THURSDAY.  THIS WILL 
BRING ANOTHER ROUND OF WIDESPREAD RAIN INTO THE AREA TUESDAY 
MORNING. AN ADDITIONAL RAINFALL OF 1 TO 2 INCHES IS POSSIBLE...AND 
THIS WILL CONTINUE FLOODING CONCERNS THROUGH THE DAY THURSDAY.  A 
FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 00Z FRIDAY.  AIR MASS WILL 
COOL QUICKLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON ALLOWING RAIN TO TRANSITION TO 
SNOW.  WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE DECREASING AS THE COOLER AIR MOVES IN 
COMBINED WITH A WARM GROUND...SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ALONG THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND THE TN VALLEY SHOULD REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY 
CRITERIA.  THE TRI-CITIES AREA AND THE LOWER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VA 
MAY SEE ACCUMULATIONS HIGH ENOUGH FOR A SNOW ADVISORY...BUT WILL 
WAIT FOR LATER MODEL RUNS BEFORE THAT CAN BE DETERMINED.  WITH DEEP 
MOISTURE LINGERING OVER THE MOUNTAINS AS THE COLD AIR MOVES 
IN...ANTICIPATE BRIEF HEAVY SNOW ACROSS THE EAST TN MOUNTAINS AND 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA.  ACCUMULATIONS OF 4 TO 8 INCHES 
MAY QUICKLY ACCUMULATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND INTO THE EVENING.  
SNOW WILL TAPPER OFF TO FLURRIES AND THEN EXIT THE AREA OVERNIGHT AS 
THE LOW PULLS AWAY FROM THE REGION.  A WINTER WATCH WARNING WILL BE 
ISSUED FOR THIS AREA.  ADDITIONALLY...AS THE SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS THE 
REGION...WINDS WILL INCREASE...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER ELEVATION.  
THIS MAY CAUSE SOME DRIFTING OF SNOW AND OCCASIONALLY REDUCE 
VISIBILITIES.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A MUCH DIFFERENT PATTERN IS IN 
STORE FROM WHAT WE HAVE RECENTLY BEEN EXPERIENCING. MODELS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A DRY AND TRANQUIL WEATHER PATTERN WILL DEVELOP 
BY THE END OF THE WEEK...AS HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE TN RIVER 
VALLEY. THE BRIEF RETURN OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO 
JUMP UP INTO LOW TO MID 50'S ON SATURDAY BEFORE THE ARRIVAL OF A 
WEAK COLD FRONT THAT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA DURING THE SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING TIME FRAME. MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS COLD FRONT WILL HAVE LIMITED MOISTURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH IT...SO EXPECTING MAINLY JUST AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS. 
MUCH COLDER AIR WILL BEGIN TO SPILL DOWN FROM CANADA WITH THE 
ARRIVAL OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT THAT IS PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT. ALONG WITH COLDER TEMPS...THERE 
SHOULD BE ENOUGH MOISTURE AND LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT FOR A 
CHANCE OF SOME SNOW SHOWERS OVER MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE MONDAY NIGHT/TUESDAY TIME FRAME. A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS CAN'T BE RULED OUT ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE 
CENTRAL VALLEY. FROM TUESDAY NIGHT ONWARD...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
SLOWLY BEGIN TO BUILD BACK IN AND CONTINUE THROUGH THE REST OF THE 
EXTENDED. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO TREND A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE 
00Z GFSX GUIDANCE THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.AVIATION...
RAIN IS WEST OF MOST OF THE TERMINAL SITES FOR NOW. WILL LEAVE
CONDITIONS MOSTLY DRY AND EVEN IMPROVING THIS AFTERNOON AND THROUGH
THIS EVENING. HOWEVER...STRONG SYSTEM PASSING TO OUR SOUTH WILL
LIKELY SPREAD PRECIPITATION ACROSS SE TN BEFORE DAYBREAK...AND WILL
SPREAD FARTHER NORTH DURING THE MORNING. ALTHOUGH COLDER AIR WILL
BE MOVING INTO THE AREA...IT LOOKS LIKE CHANGE OVER TO SHOW WOULD
LIKELY BE AFTER THESE TAFS EXPIRE...AFTER 18Z...BUT THE CHANGE OVER
WILL BE PRETTY CLOSE TO THIS TIME.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1109 AM EST WED JAN 16 2013

.DISCUSSION FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT...
PRECIP FOR TODAY LOOKS LIKE IT IS WANING OVER THE EASTERN AREAS.
SOME SHOWERS ARE HEADED UP THIS WAY AND MAY FILL THE GAP
SOMEWHAT...BUT NOT EXPECTING MUCH ADDITIONAL PRECIP AMOUNTS. WILL
GO WITH MOSTLY CHANCE POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON. ALSO HAVE UPDATED
OVERNIGHT TO KEEP EVENING DRIER AS WELL. PRECIP WILL BE INCREASING
AGAIN LATE TONIGHT...WITH COLDER AIR ON THE WAY. HAVE NO INTRODUCED
ANY SNOW TONIGHT AS COLD AIR WILL BE ARRIVING MAINLY ON THURSDAY.

LEFT TEMPERATURES AS-IS FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT.

630 AM EST WED JAN 16 2013

.AVIATION...
MVFR TO IFR CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE FORECAST AT ALL TAF 
SITES. A STREAM OF SUB-TROPICAL MOISTURE WILL KEEP PERIODS OF -RA/RA 
WITH CEILING BETWEEN 5-15KFT. ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM WILL LIFT 
NORTHEAST FROM TEXAS TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR THURSDAY. 
PERIODS OF RAIN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH TONIGHT WITH VISIBILITIES 
GENERALLY 4 MILES OR MORE.

WINDS WILL REMAIN LIGHT THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD.

335 AM EST WED JAN 16 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...ACTIVE FORECAST 
CONTINUES AS THE STRONG FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING THAT HAS PRODUCED THE 
HEAVY RAINFALL EVENT OVER THE AREA WEAKENS TODAY. HOWEVER...UPPER 
TROUGH...CURRENTLY OVER TEXAS...LIFTS EAST NORTHEAST TOWARD THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR THURSDAY. NAM AND GFS MODELS ARE IN PRETTY 
GOOD AGREEMENT IN SHOWING STRONG DYNAMIC FORCING MOVING INTO THE 
AREA FOR THURSDAY. DOUBLE JET STRUCTURE WILL PRODUCE STRONG LIFT 
WITH AGEOSTROPHIC CIRCULATION ENHANCING FRONTO-GENETIC FORCING 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. CROSS-SECTION ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS SHOWS DEEP STRONG OMEGA WHICH WILL PRODUCE DYNAMIC 
COOLING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

THE FORECAST OF 850 MB TEMPERATURES SHOW THIS DYNAMIC COOLING QUITE 
WELL WITH TEMPERATURES CHILLING OFF QUICKLY THURSDAY. HEAVY 
PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS OF 1 1/2 TO 2 1/2 INCHES FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND THURSDAY WILL PROLONG FLOODING CONCERNS...SO HAVE EXTENDED FLOOD 
WATCH THROUGH 00Z FRIDAY. THE MAIN CONCERN FOR FLOODING WILL BE 
ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS WITH ADDITIONAL RIVER 
FLOODING POSSIBLE.

THE DYNAMIC COOLING WILL ALLOW THE RAIN TO CHANGE TO SNOW ACROSS 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH A PERIOD OF HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE 
ACROSS THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA MOUNTAINS. 
HAVE ISSUED A WINTER STORM WATCH FOR HEAVY SNOWFALL OF 4 TO 8 INCHES 
WITH HEAVIER AMOUNTS UP TO 1 FOOT OVER THE HIGHEST TERRAIN OF THE 
EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. FOR THE VALLEY...SUCH AS THE 
TRI-CITIES...RAIN WILL LIKELY CHANGE TO SNOW WITH ACCUMULATIONS 
ANTICIPATED. A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY MAY BE NEEDED FOR THE 
TRI-CITIES..PLATEAU AND VALLEYS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR THURSDAY.

UPPER TROUGH EXITS THE AREA FOR THURSDAY NIGHT WITH PRECIPITATION 
ENDING

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
THAT A DRY AND TRANQUIL WEATHER PATTERN WILL DEVELOP BY THE END OF 
THE WEEK...AS HIGH PRESSURE SETTLES OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. A WEAK 
COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO QUICKLY MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THE SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING TIME FRAME. MODELS ARE IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS COLD FRONT WILL HAVE LIMITED MOISTURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH IT...SO EXPECTING MAINLY JUST AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS. 
ANOTHER STRONGER COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY NIGHT...BRINGING MUCH COLDER TEMPS AND A 
CHANCE FOR SOME SNOW SHOWERS OVER MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO TREND A LITTLE COOLER 
THAN THE GFS GUIDANCE THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD...WHICH IS IN 
BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE ENSEMBLE MEANS.
&&

749 
FXUS64 KMRX 160244 AAB
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
944 PM EST TUE JAN 15 2013

.DISCUSSION...
RAIN WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT FROM
THE SOUTH AND WEST...PRODUCING AN ADDITIONAL 1-2 INCHES ACROSS THE
REGION /WITH PERHAPS A FEW LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS IN SOME AREAS/.
THE REGION HAS RECEIVED SEVERAL INCHES OF RAINFALL OVER THE PAST 48
HOURS OR SO...WITH TOTALS RANGING BETWEEN 3-6 INCHES IN MANY
AREAS. THESE RAINFALL ACCUMULATIONS HAVE BEEN GRADUAL...BUT THEY
HAVE ADDED UP OVER TIME AND HAVE CREATED SOME SIGNIFICANT FLOODING
CONCERNS AS EXCESSIVE RUNOFF AS CAUSED THE FLOODING OF CREEKS AND
STREAMS...ROADS/UNDERPASSES AND OTHER LOW-LYING LOCATIONS AREAWIDE.
AS A RESULT...A FLOOD WARNING IS IN EFFECT FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST
AREA THROUGH TOMORROW MORNING. DEPENDING ON THE LATEST TRENDS...
THIS WARNING MAY NEED TO BE EXTENDED FURTHER...BUT WILL LET THE
NEXT SHIFT EVALUATE THAT. 

THE OTHER FORECAST CONCERN FOR THE EVENING WAS TEMPERATURES ON THE
BACKSIDE OF THE FRONT ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU. A FEW HIGHER
ELEVATIONS AREAS THERE WILL LIKELY FLIRT WITH THE FREEZING MARK
OVERNIGHT...RESULTING IN SOME INTERMITTENT PERIODS OF LIGHT
FREEZING RAIN. THIS COULD RESULT IN SOME PATCHY SLIPPERY ROADS IN
THESE AREAS OVERNIGHT. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE ISOLATED NATURE OF THIS
/AS MOST LOCATIONS IN THESE ZONES WILL EXPERIENCE MID/UPPER 30
TEMPERATURES AND RAIN/ HAVE OPTED TO HANDLE WITH AN SPS THROUGH
13Z. OVERALL...THE FORECAST CONTINUES TO LOOK WET TONIGHT AND INTO
THE DAY TMRW SO THOSE WITH TRAVEL PLANS SHOUILD DEFINITELY STAY
AWARE OF THE LATEST CONDITIONS AND USE CAUTION /ESPECIALLY AT
NIGHT/ GIVEN THE HIGH THREAT CONTINUED FLOODING AREAWIDE.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
324 PM EST TUE JAN 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...WET SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT
WILL CONTINUE. THUS RAIN WILL CONTINUE. WE FIND OURSELVES ON THE
COOL SIDE OF A STATIONARY SURFACE FRONT...AND EXPECT TEMPERATURES
TO MOVE ONLY VERY SLOWLY. RAINFALL AMOUNTS THROUGH SUNRISE MAY BE 
ANOTHER INCH OR TWO ON THE AVERAGE. INTENSITY WILL GREATLY
DIMINISH BY LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING. ALSO ANTICIPATING THE MOIST
CONDITIONS TO CONTRIBUTE TO AREAS OF REDUCED VISIBILITY IN FOG.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AXIS AND 
SURFACE RIDGING MOVE IN WED NGT WITH A DECREASE IN PRECIPITATION AND 
THE ONSET OF COLD AIR ADVECTION. THE NAM MODEL CONTINUES TO BE MORE 
AGGRESSIVE WITH THE SHORT-WAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO GA ON THU. LEANED AWAY FROM NAM TO A MORE 
SOUTHERLY SOLUTION. STRONG JET SEGMENT EAST OF THE SHORTWAVE WILL 
BRING A RETURN OF DEEPER MOISTURE AND AN INCREASE IN PRECIPITATION. 
WENT BELOW MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE EXPECTING STRONGER COLD AIR 
ADVECTION THU AS COLD CORE ALOFT SHIFTS EAST. FREEZING LEVEL WILL 
DROP TO AROUND 2000 BY LATE THU AFTN. RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW BY 
THU AFTN AS BRUNT OF MOISTURE SHIFTS EAST. LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
CAN BE EXPECTED ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF EAST TN AND SW NC. 

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND A DRY AIRMASS SETTLE INTO THE AREA THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND. UPPER TROUGH BUILDS ALONG WEST COAST WITH BROAD 
TROUGHING OVER THE EASTERN 2/3RD OF NA. STRONG COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS EARLY NEXT WEEK. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
ARE PROGGED WITH LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE...MAINLY ACROSS SW 
VA.

.AVIATION...SURFACE FRONT WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

LATE IN THE PERIOD. STRONG LOW LEVEL INVERSION WILL KEEP MOISTURE
TRAPPED ACROSS THE EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY. LIFR STRATUS AND FOG WILL BE
PREVAILING CONDITIONS. SHALLOW SUB FREEZING COLD AIRMASS WILL
REMAIN NW OF THE AREA. PRIMARY FREEZING LEVEL WILL REMAIN HIGH NEAR
9500 FEET.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1108 AM EST TUE JAN 15 2013

.DISCUSSION...

RAIN CONTINUES. MAYBE A LITTLE SUGGESTION THAT THE DIGGING TROUGH
OVER THE SOUTHWEST STATES MAY LAG A TAD AND PERHAPS ASSIST OUR RAIN
BAND TO SHIFT A LITTLE WEST...WHICH MIGHT HELP ALLEVIATE A LITTLE
BIT OUR AGGRAVATED RIVERS. WE WILL SEE. ANYHOW... RAIN CHANCES ARE
CATEGORICAL STILL THROUGH TONIGHT...WE'LL TRY TO HOPE THAT FUTURE
RAINFALL AMOUNTS WON/T BE AS HIGH AS FEARED. NO UPDATE TO THE
FORECAST THIS MORNING.

.AVIATION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY

EXTENSIVE AREA OF LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN MOVING NORTHEAST UP ALONG

AND TONIGHT...RAIN AND LOW CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED AT ALL THREE TAF 
SITES THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE TAF PERIOD. OVERALL...EXPECT SOME IFR 
CONDITIONS THIS MORNING...MVFR CONDITIONS DURING THE AFTERNOON

443 
FXUS64 KMRX 150807
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EST TUE JAN 15 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONTAL BOUNDARY GENERALLY ALONG 
THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A SHARP 
CONTRAST IN TEMPS FROM EAST TO WEST ACROSS THIS BOUNDARY. IN FACT... 
TEMPS ARE CURRENTLY IN THE MID 30S AROUND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU... 
WHICH MAY POSE A PROBLEM WITH FREEZING RAIN IF ANY MORE COLD AIR 
ADVECTION OCCURS. OVERALL...NOT EXPECTING ANY PROBLEMS WITH FREEZING 
TEMPS...BUT WILL HAVE TO CONTINUE TO KEEP A CLOSE EYE ON THINGS THIS 
MORNING. A RAINY PERIOD WILL CONTINUE FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AS A 
DEEP AND UNSEASONABLY MOIST SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW (ORIGINATING FROM THE 
EASTERN PACIFIC OCEAN) CONTINUES OVER THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE A 
DECENT AREA OF LIFT OVER THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA...WHICH SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO PRODUCE A WIDESPREAD LIGHT TO MODERATE RAINFALL THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. WILL PLAN TO EXPAND THE FLOOD WATCH TO INCLUDE 
SOUTHWEST VA...SINCE THE MODELS INDICATE BETTER LIFT OVER THIS AREA 
FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT WITH NO DOWNSLOPING FLOW EXPECTED. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE. OVERALL...NOT EXPECTING MUCH 
OF A DIURNAL RANGE BETWEEN THE HIGHS AND LOWS FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THE NAM MODEL CONTINUES TO BE 
MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THE SHORT-WAVE TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE NORTHERN GULF COAST STATES FOR THURSDAY. 
GFS AND ECMWF ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN PULLING MOISTURE BACK INTO 
THE SOUTHERN AND EASTERN FORECAST AREA..SO WILL UP POPS FOR 
CAT-LIKELY FOR SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND ALONG THE TENNESSEE/NORTH 
CAROLINA STATE-LINE FOR THURSDAY. VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE SHOWS 
A POTENTIAL MIX OF RAIN/SNOW FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BY LATE 
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF THE FAR EASTERN MOUNTAINS ARE POSSIBLE LATE THURSDAY 
AND THURSDAY NIGHT.

FOR FRIDAY...SHORT-WAVE QUICKLY MOVES EAST OF THE AREA WITH UPPER 
FLOW BECOMING MORE WEST-NORTHWEST WITH WELCOME PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER 
FOR FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND. GFS/ECMWF SHOW ARCTIC AIR SPILLING INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA FOR LATE WEEKEND/EARLY NEXT WEEK. TIMING OF COLDER 
AIR IS DIFFERENT BETWEEN MODELS. ALSO...THE ECMWF MODEL SHOWS 
POTENTIAL OF PRECIPITATION WITH ARCTIC FRONT FOR MONDAY 
NIGHT/TUESDAY OF NEXT WEEK.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 150113
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
813 PM EST MON JAN 14 2013

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED FORECAST TO ADD FREEZING RAIN INTO THE
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES OF TN AND PART OF SW VA. TEMPERATURES
DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING HAVE DROPPED MUCH
FASTER THAN EXPECTED INTO THE LOWER TO MID 30S IN PARTS OF
BLEDSOE...MARION...MORGAN AND SCOTT COUNTIES IN TN AND LEE AND WISE
IN VA. ELSEWHERE FARTHER EAST IN THE VALLEY TEMPERATURES HAD
DROPPED INTO THE UPPER 30S BELOW FORECAST LOWS. SHORTWAVE ENERGY
MOVING UP FROM THE SW WILL CONTINUE THE NEXT 3 TO 6 HOURS WITH
LIGHT RAIN OVER THE WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA AND
TEMPERATURES IN THE ABOVE COUNTIES STAYING IN THE LOWER 30S. WITH
THE ROADS STILL QUITE WARM FROM THE LAST SEVERAL DAYS OF WARM
WEATHER ICING IS MOST LIKELY ON EXPOSED SURFACES LIKE TREES AND
POWER LINES AND POSSIBLY CARS THAT HAVE SAT OUTSIDE. NORTH WINDS OF
ABOUT 10 MILES PER HOUR WILL MAKE IT FEEL EVEN COLDER. BOTH THE NAM
AND RUC KEEP THIS AREA ON THE EDGE OF THE MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION
SHIELD OVERNIGHT TONIGHT. AS A RESULT HAVE ISSUED A WINTER WEATHER
ADVISORY UNTIL 9Z TUESDAY. FLOOD WATCH WILL BE REISSUED LATER WITH
BEST FLOODING POTENTIAL ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY AND SOUTHEAST TN
AND SOUTHWEST NC REGION.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 142018
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EST MON JAN 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL HOLD ITS 
POSITION ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS DURING THE NEXT 24 
HOURS. ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN VERY MOIST WITH PACIFIC AIR FEEDING 
THE UPPER LEVELS AND THE GULF OF MEXICO SUPPLYING A FAIR AMOUNT OF 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WHICH WILL BE LIFTED ISENTROPICALLY OVER THE 
COOLER AIRMASS OVER THE GREAT VALLEY. IN ADDITION...SEVERAL 
DISTURBANCES WILL RIDE NORTHEAST OUT OF THE BASE OF THE BROAD 
WESTERN AND PLAINS STATES UPPER TROUGH ENHANCING LIFT THROUGHOUT THE 
PERIOD. PRECIPITABLE WATER QUITE IMPRESSIVE FOR JANUARY IN THE 1.5 
TO 2 INCH RANGE THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON. WILL KEEP FLOOD WATCH IN 
PLACE FOR EAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT. HAVE ALREADY SEEN WIDESPREAD 1 TO 2 INCH RAINFALL 
TOTALS ACROSS MUCH OF THE WATCH AREA WITH SOME LOCALLY HIGHER 
AMOUNTS ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. WOULD EXPECT AN ADDITIONAL 1 TO 
AT LEAST 1.5 INCHES ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY. THE 
OTHER ASPECT TO THE SYSTEM IS THE THREAT OF BEING A LITTLE TOO CLOSE 
TO THE CHILLY AIRMASS BANKED UP AGAINST THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. 
HOWEVER...BELIEVE THE TERRAIN MAY BE TOO MUCH TO OVERCOME KEEPING 
THE SUB-FREEZING AIR OUT ACROSS MIDDLE AND WESTERN TENNESSEE AND 
THEREFORE ONLY LIQUID PRECIP FOR THE FORECAST AREA. THERE WILL NOT 
BE MUCH MOVEMENT IN TEMPERATURES TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY WITH LOWS 
IN THE MID AND UPPER 30S ON THE PLATEAU AND LOW TO MID 40S 
ELSEWHERE. WE MAY ONLY SEE ABOUT A FIVE DEGREE RISE ON TUESDAY WITH 
HIGHS MAINLY IN THE 40S.   

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE SETUP FOR HEAVY 
RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE EARLY...WITH DEEP MOISTURE REMAINING IN PLACE 
ACROSS THE REGION AND A STALLED COLD FRONT DRAPED ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS...COMBINED WITH 
INCREASED UPPER-LEVEL LIFT FROM AN INTENSIFYING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
WILL HELP TO GENERATE SEVERAL ROUNDS OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. WITH PWATS PROGGED TO BE AOA 1.2-1.5 INCHES...THESE SHOWERS 
WILL BE VERY EFFICIENT RAIN PRODUCERS WITH STORM TOTAL AMOUNTS 
APPROACHING 2-4 INCHES THROUGH WEDNESDAY IN SOME 
AREAS...PARTICULARLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE EAST 
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. THIS PROLONGED HEAVY RAINFALL COULD LEAD TO 
SIGNIFICANT RUNOFF ISSUES IN AREAS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND 
FLOODING CONCERNS ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE AREA...ESPECIALLY IN 
URBANIZED AREAS AND LOCATIONS NEAR CREEKS/STREAMS. A FLOOD WATCH IS 
IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS POTENTIAL IN 
THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. HAVE GONE CATEGORICAL POPS AREAWIDE FOR 
BOTH PERIODS...BEFORE TAPERING THEM TO CHANCE/SLIGHT CHANCE ON 
WEDNESDAY. AMP

.(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THE UPPER JET AXIS WILL SHIFT 
EAST OF THE MRX CWA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. LAYER RELATIVE HUMIDITY WILL 
DROP OFF SIGNIFICANTLY. RELEASING CUT OFF LOW WEAKENS AS IT MOVES 
THROUGH GA ON THURSDAY. INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH WILL EXTEND NORTH TO 
EXTREME SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. PRECIPITATION CHANCES INCREASE THU 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHERN MRX CWA. FREEZING LEVEL DROPS THU NIGHT. 
PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE TO SNOW AS PRECIPITATION TAPERS OFF AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. LARGE SCALE TROUGHING BEGINS TAKING SHAPE INTO THE OH AND 
TN VALLEYS INTO NEXT WEEK. A SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL LINGER 
IN THE AREA UNTIL A COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE SUNDAY/EARLY MONDAY. SON

948 AM EST MON JAN 14 2013

.DISCUSSION...MAIN IDEA OF THE FORECAST ON TRACK THIS MORNING WITH

AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. RADAR ESTIMATES AND GROUND TRUTH 
INDICATE A GOOD INCH TO INCH AND A HALF RAINFALL TOTALS ACROSS

LOCALLY HIGHER TOTALS. ENHANCEMENT OCCURRING ACROSS THE NORTHEAST
HALF OF THE WATCH AREA THIS MORNING AFTER THE NICE WATERING ACROSS
SOUTHWESTERN SECTIONS DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. WE SHOULD SEE THE
NEXT WAVE WITH DECENT OMEGA BUILD NORTHEAST INTO SOUTHERN SECTIONS
OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER THIS AFTERNOON WITH THE LIFT
OVERSPREADING THE REMAINDER OF THE FLOOD WATCH AREA TONIGHT INTO
TUESDAY. THEREFORE WILL KEEP THE WATCH GOING AND WILL NEED TO TWEAK
TEMPERATURES BACK A BIT TODAY WITH LITTLE IN THE WAY OF WARMING OFF
CURRENT READINGS EXPECTED.

924 
FXUS64 KMRX 140834
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EST MON JAN 14 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH A 
SHARP CONTRAST IN TEMPS ACROSS THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY. IN 
FACT...TEMPS ARE CURRENTLY IN THE UPPER 30S ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...WHICH MAY POSE A PROBLEM WITH FREEZING RAIN IF ANY MORE 
COLD AIR ADVECTION OCCURS. TEMPS OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU ARE 
EXPECTED TO BOTTOM OUT AROUND THE MID 30S THIS MORNING...SO NOT 
EXPECTING ANY PROBLEMS BUT WILL HAVE TO KEEP A CLOSE EYE ON THINGS. 
OTHERWISE...A RAINY PERIOD IS EXPECTED FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AS 
THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY LINGERS AROUND THE MOUNTAINS. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL INCREASE OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
THIS AFTERNOON...LEADING TO INCREASED LIFT AND HEAVIER RAINFALL OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA. OVERALL...IT APPEARS THAT A WIDESPREAD RAINFALL 
TOTAL OF ONE TO TWO INCHES WILL BE POSSIBLE TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...WHICH SHOULD GENERALLY BE A GOOD SOAKING RAIN FOR THE 
REGION. THE PROLONGED NATURE OF THIS EVENT MAY EVENTUALLY LEAD TO 
SOME MINOR FLOODING ISSUES ALONG SOME WATERWAYS AND OTHER LOW LYING 
AREAS...SO WILL CONTINUE THE FLOOD WATCH. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...THE SETUP FOR HEAVY RAINFALL 
WILL CONTINUE TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH DEEP MOISTURE 
REMAINING IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION AND A STALLED COLD FRONT DRAPED 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS...COMBINED 
WITH INCREASED UPPER-LEVEL LIFT FROM AN INTENSIFYING UPPER-LEVEL 
TROUGH WILL HELP TO GENERATE SEVERAL ROUNDS OF SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. WITH PWATS PROGGED TO BE AOA 1.2-1.5 INCHES...THESE 
SHOWERS WILL BE VERY EFFICIENT RAIN PRODUCERS WITH STORM TOTAL 
AMOUNTS APPROACHING 2-4 INCHES THROUGH WEDNESDAY IN SOME 
AREAS...PARTICULARLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE EAST 
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. THIS PROLONGED HEAVY RAINFALL COULD LEAD TO 
SIGNIFICANT RUNOFF ISSUES IN AREAS ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND 
FLOODING CONCERNS ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE AREA...ESPECIALLY IN 
URBANIZED AREAS AND LOCATIONS NEAR CREEKS/STREAMS. A FLOOD WATCH IS 
IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS POTENTIAL IN 
THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. HAVE GONE CATEGORICAL POPS AREAWIDE FOR 
BOTH PERIODS...BEFORE TAPERING THEM TO CHANCE/SLIGHT CHANCE ON 
WEDNESDAY. 

BY LATE TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING...THE PRECIPITATION WILL 
BEGIN TO TAPER OFF A BIT FROM WEST TO EAST AS AN UPPER-WAVE SCOOTS 
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY...PUSHING THE COLD FRONT EAST AND BRINGING 
SOME COLDER AIR INTO THE REGION. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE A PROFILE 
FAVORABLE FOR FREEZING RAIN/DRIZZLE ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU IF 
TEMPERATURES WERE TO DIP BELOW FREEZING LATE TUESDAY NIGHT. 
HOWEVER...GUIDANCE IS NOT INDICATING A BLAST OF SUBFREEZING AIR TO 
MOVE THAT FAR SOUTH AND EAST...AND SO HAVE KEPT RAIN SHOWERS IN THE 
FORECAST FOR NOW...BUT WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THE TRENDS. SOME 
LINGERING SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY /ESPECIALLY ALONG THE 
MOUNTAINS/ BEFORE THINGS BRIEFLY DRY OUT WEDNESDAY NIGHT. BOTH THE 
ECMWF AND GFS THEN BRING AN UPPER-TROUGH THROUGH THE SOUTHEASTERN US 
ON THURSDAY...BRINGING SOME ADDITIONAL RAIN CHANCES DURING THE DAY 
AND PERHAPS A LIGHT RAIN/WINTERY MIX THURSDAY EVENING AS THINGS 
TAPER OFF AND COLDER AIR MOVES IN WAKE OF ITS PASSAGE. THUS...HAVE 
INTRODUCED CHANCE POPS INTO THE FORECAST FOR THIS PERIOD. THEREAFTER... 
GENERALLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT AND DRIER WEATHER IS EXPECTED TO PREVAIL 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE WEEK.
&&

A COUPLE DEGREES WESTERN SECTIONS AND ADJUSTED RAIN CHANCES EAST
SLIGHTLY AHEAD OF LINE. FRONT STILL LOOKS TO SLOW ON SOUTHERN END
AS LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPMENT OCCURS TO THE SW. BEST HEAVY RAIN
POTENTIAL ACROSS SOUTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS TONIGHT THROUGH
TUESDAY. LOCALIZED FLOODING STILL LOOKS POSSIBLE MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 132009
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EST SUN JAN 13 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...BRUNT OF CONVECTION NOT
REALLY AFFECTING OUR WRN COUNTIES YET...JUST SOME SCATTERED LIGHT
SHOWERS. DROPPED ANY MENTION OF TSRA AFTER THE LATE AFTERNOON GRIDS
PASS...AS AIRMASS IS STABLE BOTH SURFACE BASED AND ELEVATED. 

MAIN CHANGE WAS TO ISSUE A FLOOD WATCH FROM NOON MONDAY THROUGH 7AM
EST WEDNESDAY...AS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO ENTER THE FORECAST AREA
AND THEN STALL. PROLONGED SW FLOW ALOFT PARALLEL TO THE FRONT AND
UNUSUALLY HIGH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES MAY LEAD TO AT LEAST SOME
LOCALLIZED FLOODING...AS WELL AS MINOR FLOODING OF SOME OF OUR
CREEKS AND STREAMS. A CONTINGENCY RIVER FORECAST WITH 48 HOURS OF
QPF SUGGESTED A FEW RIVERS GETTING AT LEAST TO ACTION STAGE...SO
THE ADDITIONAL QPF OUT TO TUESDAY NIGHT MAY PUSH THOSE UP TO FLOOD
STAGE. 

SINCE THERE IS UNCERTAINTY AS TO EXACTLY WHERE THE FRONT STALLS...
I OPTED TO ISSUE THE FLOOD WATCH FOR ALL OF OUR TN COUNTIES AND SW
NC. THANKS TO FFC AND GSP FOR THE COORDINATION ON THE WATCH. 

OTHERWISE...DID NOT STRAY MUCH FROM PREVIOUS TEMP GRIDS...JUST A
FEW TWEAKS IN LINE WITH 12Z MOS NUMBERS. RAIN CHANCES WERE
GENERALLY NUDGED UPWARDS TO REMAIN IN LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL RANGE
FOR NEARLY ALL OF THIS PERIOD. 


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SUBTROPICAL HIGH EDGES 
VERY SLOWLY EAST TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY ALLOWING BROAD UPPER 
TROUGH TO MAKE PROGRESS INTO THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION. 
THIS WILL HELP TO BRING AN END TO THE PERSISTENT RAIN OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. NEXT FEATURE 
OF INTEREST WOULD BE A SHORT WAVE TROUGH BUILDING EAST ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. ON THURSDAY. STAYED THE COURSE WITH A DRY FORECAST 
ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT BELIEVING THE FEATURE WILL REMAIN 
RATHER WEAK AND FAR ENOUGH SOUTH TO KEEP PRECIP OUT OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. LONG WAVE TROUGH APPEARS TO DEEPEN OVER THE EASTERN U.S. 
BRINGING COLD AIR...MORE TYPICAL OF WINTER...BACK TO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. STAYED CLOSE TO MEX MOS GUIDANCE MIN TEMPS BUT 
HAD TO TRIM A COUPLE DEGREES OFF SUGGESTED MAXES THROUGH MOST OF THE 
LONG TERM.

951 AM EST SUN JAN 13 2013

.DISCUSSION...SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS STILL MAINLY JUST 
WEST OF OUR FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...MOVING NE AND REACHING I-75 
IN ERN KY. 12Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW THE FLOW ALOFT IS PRETTY MUCH 
PARALLEL TO THE COLD FRONT...SO COLD FRONT WON'T ADVANCE EASTWARD A 
LOT THIS AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...LOOKS LIKE OUR WRN MOST COUNTIES HAVE 
A DECENT SHOT OF GETTING MEASURABLE RAIN BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON... 
WHILE NE AREAS MAY STAY DRY. 

WILL UPDATE THE POP AND WEATHER GRIDS TO REFLECT A TIGHTER GRADIENT 
AND TO MESH WITH OHX AND JKL HIGHER POP GRIDS NEAR OUR PLATEAU 
COUNTIES. ALSO...ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR THOSE 
AREAS AS WELL.

OTHERWISE...STILL NO MAJOR FLOOD CONCERNS THIS MORNING...AS RFC 
RIVER FORECASTS USING 48 HOURS OF POTENTIAL RAINFALL DID NOT PRODUCE 
ANY SIGNIFICANT RISES ON AREA STREAMS. FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE 1 AND 3 
HOURLY VALUES ARE QUITE HIGH...AND THE RAIN WILL BE SPREAD OUT OVER 
A 2 TO 3 DAY PERIOD. HIGHLIGHTING IN THE HWO PRODUCT AND VIA OUR 
GRAPHICAST SEEMS THE BEST WAY TO HANDLE THIS EVENT AGAIN TODAY. 

WILL FRESHEN GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS SHORTLY WITH TEMPS LOOKING ON 
TRACK AT THIS TIME.

218 
FXUS64 KMRX 130828
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST SUN JAN 13 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER CENTRAL INDIANA...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWESTWARD ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO AND LOWER MS 
RIVER VALLEYS. AREA RADARS CURRENTLY REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF 
CONVECTION ALONG THIS FRONT OVER THE LOWER OHIO AND LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEYS. THIS COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO ONLY SLOWLY DRIFT EASTWARD 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY...AS A LARGE AND HIGHLY-AMPLIFIED 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE NATION PRODUCES A 
DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. NAM 
AND GFS MODELS INDICATE THAT THE BULK OF THE PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH 
THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD ARRIVE IN THE FORECAST AREA AFTER SUNSET 
TONIGHT...BUT IT APPEARS THAT ISENTROPIC LIFT MAY CREATE SCATTERED 
SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY BEFORE THE FRONT ARRIVES. AS 
FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR 
TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND LOOK REASONABLE. NEAR RECORD HIGHS WILL 
AGAIN BE POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON...ALTHOUGH THE RECORDS FOR TODAY 
ARE A LITTLE HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY (CHA 74...TYS 74...OQT 72...TRI 
72).

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE SETUP FOR LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL WILL BE IN PLACE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS WEEK. 
CURRENT PROGS SUGGEST THE POTENTIAL FOR WIDESPREAD 2-3 INCH RAINFALL 
TOTALS...WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS FROM SEVERAL ROUNDS OF SHOWERS 
THAT ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA. A COLD FRONT THAT WILL 
PUSH INTO THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT WILL STALL OUT ACROSS THE REGION 
ON MONDAY. THE COMBINATION OF THIS BOUNDARY AND SOME DEEP MOISTURE 
/WITH PWATS RUNNING BTWN 1.2 TO 1.5 INCHES/...ALONG WITH SOME ADDED 
SYNOPTIC LIFT FROM AN APPROACHING UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM WILL 
CREATE VERY GOOD CHANCES FOR RAINFALL MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT...BEFORE THINGS SLOWLY BEGIN TO TAPER OFF ON WEDNESDAY AS THE 
BASE OF THE TROUGH MOVES THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY. MODELS 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT... SHOWING STRONG QPF SIGNALS MOVING ACROSS 
THE AREA MONDAY MORNING AND GRADUALLY SAGGING SOUTHEAST WITH THE 
FRONT AND FAVORING THE MTNS BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. THEN MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO TUESDAY...ANOTHER ROUND OF HEAVY PRECIPITATION/TRAINING SHOWERS 
IS EXPECTED AS UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT INCREASES WITH THE APPROACHING 
UPPER-TROUGH. HAVE GONE WITH HIGH-END LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS ON 
MONDAY AND THEN CATEGORICAL POPS AREAWIDE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. 
THEREAFTER...HAVE LIKELY POPS /TO HIGH-END CHANCE POPS IN THE 
NORTHWEST ZONES/ ON TUESDAY NIGHT...BEFORE LOWERING THEM 
SIGNIFICANTLY ON WEDNESDAY AND MAINLY CONFINING THEM TO THE MOUNTAIN 
ZONES. DRY WEATHER IS THEN EXPECTED DURING THE LATTER HALF OF THE 
WEEK AS A SURFACE HIGH BUILDS IN AND GENERALLY ZONAL FLOW PREVAILS 
ALOFT.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

300 PM EST SAT JAN 12 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SHOWERS TO OUR WEST OVER
MIDDLE TN CONTINUE TO TRACK NE AND HAVE JUST BARELY CLIPPED OUR
NWRN MOST COUNTIES ON THE NRN PLATEAU. COLD FRONT NOT YET EVEN INTO

MOS GUIDANCE DEW POINT TEMPS ARE WAY OFF THE MARK GIVEN THE 19Z DEW
POINT TEMPS IN THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S. POPULATED GRIDS WITH NAM
12KM DEW POINTS UNTIL AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE LATE SUNDAY NIGHT. FELT
IT WAS PRUDENT TO GO SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE GFS ON MIN TEMPS...
ESPECIALLY OVER CENTRAL AND SRN AREAS (TYS/CHA).  

SUNDAY...MODELS ALL SEEM TO BE DELAYING THE SIGNIFICANT RAINS AHEAD
OF THE FRONT...SO I TRIMMED POPS BACK FOR ERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST
AREA. SLOWER TIMING SHOULD ALLOW MAX TEMPS TO REACH 60S TO LOWER
70S...BUT MY CCF HIGHS ARE IN GENERAL ABOUT 2 DEGREES BELOW RECORD
HIGHS FOR SUNDAY THE 13TH. RECORDS FOR TOMORROW ARE...CHA/TYS - 74
TRI - 72 AND OQT - 69. KEPT A MENTION OF ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS FOR
WRN AREAS IN THE AFTERNOON.

SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...WE SHOULD ACTUALLY SEE SIGNIFICANT RAINS
FINALLY ARRIVE IN OUR REGION WITH THE FRONT...WHICH SHOULD SLOW OR
STALL INTO EARLY TUESDAY. HPC QPF A BIT HEAVIER THIS RUN...BUT
AFTER COORDINATION WITH NWS NEIGHBORS...FELT THAT CONDFIDENCE WAS
TOO LOW ON GETTING FLOODING RAINS AT THIS TIME. WILL UPDATE THE HWO 
PRODUCT AGAIN. A BLEND OF MOS FOR MINS AND MAXES...WITH TEMPS NOT
REALLY GOING UP MUCH AT ALL ON MONDAY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...THE ECMWF AND GFS CAME 
INTO A LITTLE BETTER AGREEMENT FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD. THE MODELS 
INDICATE A DEEP PERSISTENT SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL KEEP A CORRIDOR 
OF MOIST AIR IN PLACE ALONG A BOUNDARY SEPARATING MUCH COLDER AIR 
OVER THE MIDWEST FROM PLEASANT SPRING-LIKE WARMTH ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S. A SURFACE LOW WILL RIDE NORTHEAST ALONG THE 
BOUNDARY LATER MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY ENHANCING PRECIP. THE 
LENGTHY PERIOD OF DEEP MOISTURE AND LIFT COULD LEAD TO SOME 
EXCESSIVE RAINFALL OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THE RAIN SHOULD GRADUALLY 
TAPER OFF TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING AS THE LONG WAVE 
TROUGH FINALLY SHIFTS INTO THE EASTERN U.S. COLDER AND DRIER WEATHER 
WILL FOLLOW FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AS A MEAN 
TROUGH HOLDS ITS POSITION OVER THE EASTERN STATES.


&&

IT IS POSSIBLE THAT THE BEST FLYING CONDITIONS WILL BE IN PLACE AT
TRI AS THE DOWNSLOPE COMPONENT WARMS AND DRIES OUT THE LOW LEVELS.

TONIGHT BUT WOULD NOT EXPECT ANY LOWER CEILINGS HERE UNTIL AFTER
THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. ADDED A VICINITY SHOWER AT CHA
AROUND 15Z AS MOISTURE INCREASES AHEAD OF THE SLOW MOVING FRONT
WHICH ADVANCES TO THE OHIO AND LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY BY 
12Z SUNDAY.

.DISCUSSION...MOIST AND MILD AIRMASS IN PLACE THIS MORNING...WITH 
MAIN FORM OF LIFT WARM AIR ADVECTION (ISENTROPIC LIFT) OVER MIDDLE 
TN AND THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. RAIN CHANCES ARE VERY LOW AT LEAST 
FOR THE REST OF THE MORNING IN MANY AREAS...PROBABLY 20 PERCENT AT 
BEST...WHILE HIGHER CHANCE POPS ARE CERTAINLY JUSTIFIED ACROSS OUR 
WRN MOST COUNTIES OF EAST TN. OVERALL...CURRENT POP AND WEATHER 
GRIDS LOOK ON TRACK. MODIFIED 12Z OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS YIELDED VERY 
LITTLE INSTABILITY...SO JUST SHOWERS EXPECTED.

TEMPS STARTING OUT AROUND 15 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL HIGHS FOR MID 
JANUARY...WELL INTO THE 50S TO MID 60S ALREADY. A LOT OF CLOUD COVER 
AND MOIST LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES...BUT A SLOW RISE IN TEMPS SHOULD 
SEND MOST AREAS TO RECORD HIGHS FOR THIS DATE.

WILL FRESHEN THE HOURLY GRIDS OVER THE NEXT HOUR OR SO...AND UPDATE 
ANY AFFECTED PRODUCTS. 

LOOKING FURTHER OUT...HEAVIER RAINS STILL DON'T GET UNDERWAY UNTIL 
SUNDAY EVENING...THEN PROLONGED INTO TUESDAY AT LEAST. I PLAN TO 
EVALUATE 12Z MODEL RUNS AND AT LEAST UPDATE THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER 
OUTLOOK THIS AFTERNOON.

868 
FXUS64 KMRX 120844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST SAT JAN 12 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH 
ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHWESTWARD ACROSS THE OZARKS. 
A LARGE AND HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE A DEEP SOUTHWESTERLY 
WIND FLOW OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT. MODELS 
INDICATE THAT SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL CREATE SCATTERED SHOWERS FOR 
TODAY...WITH MORE ISOLATED COVERAGE EXPECTED FOR TONIGHT. AS FOR 
TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT TODAY... 
WITH NEAR RECORD HIGHS EXPECTED AREAWIDE (CHA 71...TYS 73...OQT 
70...TRI 69). FOR TONIGHT...WILL TREND WARMER THAN BOTH SETS OF 
GUIDANCE...SINCE AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS IS IN PLACE 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH NOT MUCH COLD AIR ADVECTION EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...VERY WARM TEMPERATURES WILL 
CONTINUE FOR ONE MORE DAY ON SUNDAY AS STRONG SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT WILL PUSH HIGHS BACK INTO THE 
UPPER 60S TO LOWER 70S IN MANY AREAS. HOWEVER...THE MAIN WEATHER 
STORY EARLY THIS UPCOMING WEEK WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY 
RAINFALL AREAWIDE AS THE AFOREMENTIONED FRONT MOVES INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION SUNDAY AFTERNOON/ EVENING AND STALLS OUT 
ACROSS THE REGION MONDAY INTO TUESDAY... BEFORE EXITING THE AREA BY 
WEDNESDAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TIMING OF THIS 
FRONT/PRECIP AND SHOW SOME STRONG QPF SIGNALS MOVING INTO THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU MID/LATE AFTERNOON ON SUNDAY AND OVERSPREADING 
THE AREA OVERNIGHT AND INTO THE DAY ON MONDAY. THEN...ADDITIONAL 
ROUNDS OF HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY 
AS SOME UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT FROM AN ADVANCING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH 
COMBINES WITH THE STALLED BOUNDARY AND DEEP MOISTURE IN PLACE ACROSS 
THE AREA. WITH THE BASE OF THE TROUGH SWINGING THROUGH THE OHIO 
VALLEY AND MIDDLE/EAST TENNESSEE LATE TUESDAY NIGHT INTO 
WEDNESDAY...POPS WILL THEN BEGIN TO TAPER OFF FROM WEST TO 
EAST...WITH A DRY FORECAST EXPECTED BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE 
REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.  

GIVEN THE FACTORS MENTIONED ABOVE...THINK THAT THE PROSPECTS FOR 
HEAVY RAINFALL OF BETWEEN 2-3 INCHES WILL BE COMMON ACROSS MOST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. MODEL SOUNDINGS ARE INDICATING PWAT VALUES TO BE BTWN 1 TO 
1.5 INCHES SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY WHEN THE HEAVIEST RAINFALL 
POTENTIAL IS EXPECTED...WHICH ARE ABNORMALLY HIGH FOR MID JANUARY. 
HAVE RAISED POPS TO CATEGORICAL SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY NIGHT...WITH 
HIGH-END LIKELY POPS FOR THE DAYTIME HOURS MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THEN 
BEGIN TAPERING THEM OFF TO CHANCE POPS TUESDAY NIGHT. ALSO...HAVE 
INCLUDED THE POTENTIAL FOR MIXED PHASE PRECIPITATION LATE TUESDAY 
NIGHT ALONG THE PLATEAU AS A SHOT OF COLDER AIR MOVES BEHIND THIS 
STORM SYSTEM...ALLOWING FOR SOME SNOW TO MIX IN WITH THE RAIN. 
&&

409 
FXUS64 KMRX 112017
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
317 PM EST FRI JAN 11 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SHOWERS WERE NOT VERY
IMPRESSIVE THIS AFTERNOON...BUT CLOUDS GENERALLY KEPT TEMPS BELOW
RECORD HIGHS. SCATTERED SHOWERS CONTINUE TO OUR SOUTH AND MODELS
TRY TO BRING A FEW SHOWERS NORTH OVERNIGHT. I RAN 30 TO 40 PERCENT
CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE SRN THIRD OVERNIGHT...TO MOSTLY SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS FOR NE TN/SW VA. PARTIAL CLEARING MAY SET THE STAGE FOR
AT LEAST PATCHY AREAS OF FOG. WENT ABOUT 1 TO 3 DEGS ABOVE GFS MOS
ON MINS WHICH FITS THE PATTERN OF LATE IN THIS VERY MILD AIRMASS.

FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...MODELS SEEM TO HAVE TRENDED A
LITTLE WETTER FOR SATURDAY BUT I AM NOT READY TO BUY INTO THIS
SCENARIO JUST YET. WE STAY IN THE MOIST AIRMASS BUT THE NEXT COLD
FRONT IS QUITE FAR TO OUR WEST...SO I AM WONDERING WHERE ANY
ORGANIZED LIFT WILL COME FROM. THUS...I FAVORED JUST SLIGHT TO LOW
CHANCE POPS FOR NOW ON SATURDAY...AND ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR
SATURDAY NIGHT. RECORD HIGH TEMPS ARE IN JEOPARDY AS ALREADY
ADVERTISED. 

FOR SUNDAY...COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND EXPECT AT LEAST WESTERN
2/3RDS OF THE FORECAST AREA TO GET SOME SHOWERS BY SUNDAY
AFTERNOON. AIRMASS BECOMES SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE ON MAINLY THE PLATEAU 
SO I ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR WRN MOST AREAS
SUNDAY AFTERNOON. NO REASON TO DIFFER MUCH FROM SIMILAR MOS MAX
TEMPS. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO 
CONVERGE ON WEATHER SCENARIO IN THE EARLY PORTION OF THE FORECAST 
BUT WANDER INTO SLIGHTLY DIFFERING SOLUTIONS...DIFFERENT 
TIMING...DURING THE LATTER HALF OF THE EXTENDED. BASICALLY STAYED 
THE COURSE EARLY WHILE EDGING POPS HIGHER INTO THE CATEGORICAL RANGE 
WITH SOME LIKELY PROBABILITIES ALONG WITH HEAVY RAINFALL SUNDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. MODELS HAVE CONVERGED ON THE GFS IDEA FROM 
THURSDAY'S MODEL RUN WHICH SHOWED INCLEMENT WEATHER SHIFTING EAST AT 
A LITTLE QUICKER PACE. THEREFORE STARTED TO DROP POPS BACK FROM 
LIKELY CATEGORY MONDAY NIGHT INTO MEDIUM TO HIGH CHANCE FOR SHOWERS 
BY TUESDAY AFTERNOON AS THE DEEP UPPER TROUGH SHIFTS INTO THE 
EASTERN U.S. ONLY HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER EASTERN SECTIONS 
BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. FOR THIS PART OF THE FORECAST (TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING) EDGED THE DEPARTURE OF THE RAIN CLOSER TO 
THE SLIGHTLY SLOWER ECMWF DEPICTION. KEPT A DRY FORECAST GOING 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY TRENDING A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE GFS BUT 
CONFIDENCE IS NOT TERRIBLY HIGH WITH A DEEPENING EASTERN U.S. TROUGH 
HINTING AT THE POSSIBILITY OF BRINGING A LIGHT NORTHWEST SNOWFALL 
EVENT TO THE REGION SOMETIME WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY WHILE A 
SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE RIPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN TIER PRODUCING MORE 
LIGHT PRECIPITATION LATER THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. 


&&

734 
FXUS64 KMRX 110846
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST FRI JAN 11 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE MISSOURI/IOWA BORDER...WITH 
ITS ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT EXTENDING SOUTHEASTWARD ACROSS THE WESTERN 
TN RIVER VALLEY INTO NORTHERN AL...AND ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
EXTENDING SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE MS RIVER VALLEY. AREA RADARS REVEAL A 
FEW LIGHT SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WHICH WILL 
LIKELY EXPAND IN COVERAGE AS THE WARM FRONT MOVES NORTHEASTWARD INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA AFTER SUNRISE AND AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE MOVES 
ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THE WEAK COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO 
MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATER THIS AFTERNOON...AND THEN STALL 
OUT SOMEWHERE AROUND THE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT. AS A RESULT...SCATTERED 
SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO BE POSSIBLE TONIGHT...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS 
OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WHERE DEEPER MOISTURE 
RESIDES. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS AND NAM GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT...BUT WILL TREND TOWARDS THE WARMER 
NAM NUMBERS SINCE AN UNSEASONABLY WARM AND MOIST AIR MASS IS ALREADY 
IN PLACE OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...NEAR RECORD WARM CONDITIONS 
ARE EXPECTED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS WEEKEND...AS A STOUT 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL RAMP UP AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING STORM- 
SYSTEM/COLD FRONT TO THE WEST AND A LARGE SPRAWLING SUBTROPICAL HIGH 
TO THE SOUTHEAST. WITH SUCH STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION...HIGH 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO CLIMB WELL INTO THE MID/UPPER 60S TO 
PERHAPS THE LOWER 70S ON SATURDAY AT TYS/CHA. THESE READINGS WOULD 
TIE OR SET RECORD HIGHS FOR THAT DATE. THE CLOUD COVER AND POTENTIAL 
FOR SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS MAY KEEP TEMPS COOLER ON SUNDAY...BUT 
THEY ARE STILL EXPECTED TO REACH THE MID TO UPPER 60S AREAWIDE.

A COLD FRONT IS THEN PROGGED TO PUSH INTO THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY 
EVENING/NIGHT AND STALL OUT ACROSS THE REGION EARLY NEXT WEEK.THIS 
FRONT WILL BRING COOLER TEMPERATURES AND SOME VERY GOOD CHANCES FOR 
PRECIPITATION SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY AND TUESDAY...BEFORE THINGS 
BEGIN TO TAPER OFF BY WEDNESDAY. GIVEN THE DEEP MOISTURE THAT WILL 
BE IN PLACE OVER THE AREA...A STALLED/SLOW MOVING FRONT AND SOME 
UPPER-LEVEL SUPPORT FROM A SLOW MOVING UPPER-TROUGH OVER THE OHIO 
VALLEY...THE POTENTIAL FOR VERY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL EXIST OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS WEEK /ESPECIALLY DURING A MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY TIMEFRAME/. HPC STORM TOTAL RAINFALL AMOUNTS THROUGH 12Z 
WEDNESDAY ADD UP TO AROUND 2-3 INCHES OVER A BULK OF THE REGION. AS 
A RESULT...HAVE INCREASED POPS SLIGHTLY DURING THE SUNDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME TO REFLECT THIS THINKING. HAVE LIKELY 
POPS STARTING LATE SUNDAY NIGHT...LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS MONDAY 
AND MONDAY NIGHT AND LIKELY POPS AGAIN FOR TUESDAY. THEN GRADUALLY 
TAPER THINGS OFF FROM WEST TO EAST BEGINNING TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE 
FRONT GRADUALLY SLIPS OUT OF THE AREA /BUT STILL HAVE CHANCE TO 
LIKELY POPS THROUGH 12Z WEDNESDAY/. THERE IS SOME DISCREPANCY IN THE 
MODELS LATE IN THE PERIOD...WITH THE GFS SHOWING ZONAL FLOW AND 
DRIER WEATHER...AND THE ECMWF INDICATING A PASSING SHORTWAVE AND 
ADDITIONAL RAIN CHANCES. FOR NOW...GIVEN THE UNCERTAINTY HAVE KEPT 
THE FORECAST DRY AND WILL WAIT ON ANOTHER MODEL RUN OR TWO BEFORE 
MAKING ANY CHANGES.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN   69  59  72  56  69 /  80  40  30  20  60 
KNOXVILLE AIRPORT, TN     67  56  70  53  67 /  80  30  20  20  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN             67  56  70  53  67 /  80  30  30  30  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN    64  50  68  48  66 /  80  20  20  20  30

FXUS64 KMRX 101957
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EST THU JAN 10 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF
SHOWERS THIS AFTERNOON...GIVEN THE GULF COAST CONVECTION TO OUR SOUTH
PLUS SOME WEAK DOWNSLOPE FLOW INTO THE CENTRAL AND NRN VALLEY 
COUNTIES. A FEW AREAS OF SUNSHINE WERE NOTED WITH TEMPS RISING INTO
THE MID TO UPPER 60S IN THOSE SPOTS. 

TONIGHT...THE CLOSED UPPER LOW THAT WAS OVER SRN TX IS NOW ON THE
MOVE NE THROUGH OK...AND WILL SEND MORE SHOWERS OUR WAY BY THE 06Z
TO 12Z PERIOD ON FRIDAY. GOOD AGREEMENT BETWEEN SHORT RANGE MODELS
AND SREF FOR THESE SHOWERS SWEEPING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON
FRIDAY...WITH A DECREASE IN POPS FROM THE WEST BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON.
MINS TONIGHT SHOULD BE QUITE MILD...ACTUALLY AT OR A FEW DEGREES
ABOVE SEASONAL HIGHS FOR THIS TIME OF THE YEAR. WITH THE SHOWERS ON
THE DECLINE BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON...I FELT AT LEAST A MOS BLEND WAS
REACHABLE FOR MAX TEMPS. APPEARS THESE HIGHS OVERALL WILL BE BELOW
RECORD HIGHS...SO NO MENTION IN THE ZFP PRODUCT. 

FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...BRUNT OF DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT IS
WELL TO OUR WEST FOR THESE PERIODS...SO KEPT JUST MINIMAL POPS IN
FOR NOW IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS. THOSE RECORD HIGHS MAY BE IN
JEOPARDY ON SATURDAY...SO ADDED RECORD HIGH WORDING. 

RECORD HIGHS FOR FRIDAY (1/11/13)...CHA - 78...TYS - 71...TRI - 64.
RECORD HIGHS FOR SATURDAY (1/12)....CHA - 70...TYS - 71...TRI - 69.

MOS MINS CLOSE AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED EACH NIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS HAVE
TRENDED A LITTLE CLOSER IN DEPICTION OF EXPECTED WEATHER THROUGH
12Z WEDNESDAY. TRENDED POPS BACK A FAIR AMOUNT SATURDAY NIGHT INTO
THE FIRST HALF OF THE DAY SUNDAY AS MODEL FORECASTS APPEAR TO BE IN
AGREEMENT MAIN AXIS OF DEEP MOISTURE AND LIFT SITUATED ALONG THE
SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY POSITIONED OVER THE WEST TENNESSEE.
DOWNSLOPING FLOW ACROSS THE TERRAIN MAY EVEN KEEP A GOOD PART OF
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE DRY UNTIL SUNDAY
AFTERNOON THE FRONT MAKES SLOW PROGRESS TOWARD THE APPALACHIANS.
THE BOUNDARY STILL LOOKS LIKE IT MAY STALL OR MAKE EXTREMELY SLOW
PROGRESS ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. THEREFORE
KEPT LIKELY POPS GOING DURING THIS PERIOD AS NUMEROUS SHOWERS FORM
IN THE MOIST ENVIRONMENT WITH THE HELP OF SEVERAL WAVES OF LOW
PRESSURE RIDING ALONG THE BOUNDARY. WILL HAVE TO WATCH FOR
EXCESSIVE RAINFALL MONDAY AND TUESDAY WITH THE STALLED BOUNDARY
AIDING AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF LIFT. TRENDED POPS BACK DURING THE DAY
WEDNESDAY AS THE FRONT FINALLY SLIPS ACROSS THE TERRAIN MAKING ITS
WAY ACROSS THE EASTERN SEABOARD. STAYED CLOSER TO THE GFS FOR THE
PERIOD WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WHICH MOVES THE INCLEMENT WEATHER
EAST WITHOUT THREATENING THE ARRIVAL OF ANOTHER STRONG SOUTHERN
STREAM SHORT WAVE WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF MORE SOUTHEASTERN U.S.
RAINFALL. STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO MEX MOS TEMP GUIDANCE ALTHOUGH
UNDERCUT THE PROJECTED LOWER 70 DEGREE HIGHS ON SUNDAY WITH THICKER
CLOUD COVER AND SCATTERED SHOWERS BUILDING INTO MOST AREAS BY
AFTERNOON.

.AVIATION...HEALTHY SHORT WAVE/UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE PLAINS WILL
GET A KICK TO THE NORTHEAST DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD ENDING UP
OVER THE EASTERN LAKES AROUND 18Z FRIDAY. STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW IS
MOISTENING THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. WITH RATHER LOW CEILINGS. MOST OF
THE RAIN ACROSS THE MID SOUTH IS ORIENTED ALONG A WARM FRONTAL
BOUNDARY PRESSING NORTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY. ALTHOUGH THERE ARE
A FEW SMALL AREAS OF LIGHT SHOWERS OVER NORTHERN SECTIONS OF
ALABAMA AND GEORGIA AND A COUPLE OF THESE MAY MOVE ACROSS CHA THIS
AFTERNOON SO KEPT MVFR VSBY IN PLACE HERE FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. THE
LOW LEVELS ARE SO MOIST IN THIS AREA THAT CHA MAY EVEN FLIRT WITH
AN IFR CEILING IF A SHOWER OR TWO BUILD OVER THE TERMINAL. THOUGHT
THE CEILINGS MAY IMPROVE A BIT LATER THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EARLY
EVENING HOURS SO INDICATED SOME SLIGHT BETTER ALBEIT MVFR WEATHER
HERE. TYPICALLY WITH A STRONG SOUTHERLY FLOW IN THIS SCENARIO A
DOWNSLOPING FLOW CROSSING THE NORTH CAROLINA BORDER SHOULD ALLOW
FOR MUCH BETTER FLIGHT CONDITIONS AT TYS AND TRI WITH THE BEST OF
THESE TERMINALS OCCURRING AT TRI. TYS MAY DROP INTO MVFR RANGE
LATER TONIGHT AS A COUPLE LIGHT SHOWERS BUILD THROUGH THE VALLEY
BUT TRI MAY NOT BECOME MVFR UNTIL MID MORNING FRIDAY WHEN THE MAIN
BODY OF THE PLAINS TROUGH BUILDS NORTHEAST TOWARD THE GREAT LAKES.

.DISCUSSION...STARTING OUT GENERALLY DRY ACROSS THE REGION THIS

INTO MAINLY THE SW HALF OF EAST TN.  THE 12Z OHX SOUNDING HAD 
PRECIPITABLE WATER (PW) VALUE OF JUST OVER 1.35 INCHES (300 PERCENT 
OF NORMAL). 12Z RNK SOUNDING MUCH DRIER WITH LESS THAN 1/2 INCH PW.
12Z UPPER PLOTS SHOW A LIGHT SOUTHERLY FLOW AT 850 MB LEVEL...SO A 
BIT OF DOWNSLOPING IS LIKELY AFFECTING PARTS OF NE TN AND SW VA. 
ANOTHER FACTOR FOR LACK OF RAIN THIS MORNING IN OUR AREA MAY BE THE 
STRONG CONVECTION ALREADY OCCURRING OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY REGION.

LATEST RUC MODEL RUN AND SREF ARE ONLY SHOWING SOME SCATTERED AREAS 
OF RAIN DEVELOPING OVER OUR WRN MOST COUNTIES LATER TODAY. THUS...
PLAN TO DO A MID MORNING UPDATE TO LOWER RAIN CHANCES. 

MAX TEMP FORECAST IS PROBABLY ON TRACK...ALTHO WARM FRONT IS STILL 
TO OUR SOUTH. 14Z TEMPS WERE VERY MILD AND ALREADY ABOVE SEASONAL 
HIGHS FOR MID JANUARY...SO ANY BREAKS OF SUNSHINE OR DOWNSLOPING 
SHOULD SEND HIGHS INTO THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S.
