651 
FXUS64 KMRX 100919
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
419 AM EST THU JAN 10 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WAS CENTERED OVER
THE OHIO VALLEY WITH LOW PRESSURE OVER TEXAS WITH A FRONTAL
BOUNDARY OVER THE SOUTHERN STATES. WARM MOIST AIR MASS WAS
OVERRUNNING THE FRONT AND KEEPING LOW CLOUDS AND FOG ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. PATCHY DENSE FOG HAD VISIBILITIES AT
AROUND ONE HALF MILE IN A FEW SPOTS EARLY THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES
HAVE BEEN NEARLY STEADY TO SLOWLY RISING WITH SOME SPRINKLES OR
DRIZZLE ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS. MODELS BRING THIS BOUNDARY NORTH
AS A WARM FRONT THIS AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT. THE FRONT WILL REACH
THE NE SECTIONS BY LATE TONIGHT. LIGHT WINDS THIS MORNING WILL
INCREASE LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT OUT OF THE SOUTHEAST AND WILL BE
GUSTY OVER THE PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS AS THE PRESSURE GRADIENT
TIGHTENS BETWEEN THE HIGH PRESSURE AREA ALONG THE EAST COAST AND
LOWER PRESSURE OVER THE MS VALLEY. PATCHY LIGHT RAIN WILL BE MORE
LIKELY WEST TODAY AND LATE TONIGHT BUT AMOUNTS WILL STILL BE LIGHT.
HIGHS TODAY SHOULD REACH THE 60S LOWER ELEVATIONS AND 50S MOUNTAINS
WITH LOWS TONIGHT STILL MILD IN THE MID 40S TO MID 50S.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...VERY WARM AND WET
CONDITIONS ON TRACK. QUESTIONS REMAIN WITH EARLY PRECIPITATION
TIMING AND SURFACE FRONTAL POSITION LATE.

SHORTWAVE WILL SWING THROUGH MIDDLE TN AND W KY EARLY FRIDAY. THIS 
WILL MOVE SURFACE WARM FRONT NORTH THROUGH THE E TN VALLEY AND THE 
SOUTHERN APPS. GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ALONG FRONT AND TEMPS 
CONTINUE TO RISE. CONDITIONS DRY OUT SOME FRI NIGHT THROUGH SAT 
NIGHT AS MAIN FOCUS OF WEATHER WILL BE ALONG COLD FRONT EXTENDING 
FROM E TX THROUGH MID MS VLY TO THE S GREAT LKS. THIS FEATURE WILL 
HAVE PARALLEL FLOW ALOFT RESULTING IN WIDESPREAD RAINFALL. 
LOCALLY...TEMPERATURES REMAIN WELL ABOVE NORMAL. LONG FETCH UPPER 
SWRLY FLOW AND DEEP LAYER MOISTURE WILL SLOWLY SHIFT EAST OVER THE 
WEEKEND. WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE EASTWARD INTO THE E TN 
VALLEY ON SUNDAY. PWAT VALUES REMAIN VERY HIGH FOR THE EARLY WINTER 
SEASON. PROTRACTED RAINFALL EXPECTED AS UPPER SWRLY FLOW REMAINS 
OVER W TN. THERE IS SOME QUESTION ABOUT SURFACE FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
EXTENDING SE OF THE S APPS EARLY NEXT WEEK. SE RIDGE HAS BEEN 
STUBBORN TO RETREAT THIS SEASON SO EXPECT FRONT TO REMAIN ALONG E 
MRX CWA FOR MUCH OF EARLY NEXT WEEK. GFS APPEARS TOO AGGRESSIVE WILL 
BUILDING IN SURFACE RIDGE AND DRIER AIR MASS BY TUE. STAYED WITH 
WARMER AND WETTER SOLUTION FOR NOW AT BACK END OF FORECAST. 

ONCE AGAIN--THE TIME FRAME OF SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WILL NEED TO BE 
WATCHED CLOSELY FOR HEAVY RAINFALL/FLOODING POTENTIAL. ALONG WITH 
THE NEAR OR ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES...PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES 
WILL BE PEGGING MAX VALUES FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR...AND MOISTURE 
TRANSPORT ACROSS THE AREA WHEN THE MAIN RAIN AXIS WOULD BE OVER US 
WILL BE VERY STRONG.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 092018
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EST WED JAN 9 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...INITIAL ROUND OF RAIN/SHOWERS 
SHOULD CONTINUE THE WEAKENING TREND OF THE AFTERNOON HOURS. HOWEVER 
THE CLOSED UPPER LOW OVER NRN MEXICO/SRN TX WILL QUICKLY SEND 
ANOTHER VORTICITY LOBE AND MORE SHOWERS OUR WAY AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
SPLIT THE WEATHER AND POP GRIDS IN HALF FOR TONIGHT...WITH LIKELY 
POPS FOR CHA AND THE SEQUATCHIE VALLEY AREAS IN THE 06Z TO 12Z 
PERIOD. TIMING THIS PRECIPITATION TO MAINLY AFFECT THE REGION 
THROUGH NOON THURSDAY...WITH GREATER LIKELIHOOD OF RAIN ACROSS THE 
WRN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE S-SE LOW LEVEL GRADIENT SUGGESTS 
SOME DOWNSLOPING FOR NE TN AND PARTS OF SW VA THURSDAY...SO I STAYED 
CLOSE TO THE MOS BLEND OF MAINLY CHANCE POPS THERE.

OTHERWISE...TEMPS HAVE STRUGGLED TO CLIMG MUCH TODAY...BUT WILL STAY 
VERY MILD FOR TONIGHT...SO WENT A COUPLE OF DEGREES ABOVE THE COOLER 
GFS MOS MINS. WARM FRONT APPROACHING THURSDAY AFTERNOON COULD SEND 
CHA EASILY INTO THE UPPER 60S...WITH UPPER 50S TO MID 60S POSSIBLE 
ELSEWHERE. 

.LONG TERM 1 (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)..SURFACE RIDGE
REMAINS OFF TO OUR EAST ON THURSDAY NIGHT IN ADVANCE OF AN
APPROACHING SHORTWAVE THAT WILL SWING ACROSS WESTERN KENTUCKY AND
MIDDLE TN DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY. VORTICITY SWINGING THROUGH THE
BASE OF THE SHORT WAVE...COMBINED WITH A SATURATED AIR MASS...WILL
ALLOW FOR LIKELY POPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AREAS EARLY FRIDAY.
VORTICITY AND SATURATED AIR MASS QUICKLY EXIT OUR AREA AS THE WAVE
BECOMES INCREASINGLY NEGATIVELY TILTED AND CONTINUES TO MOVE
NORTHEAST DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY. THIS WILL LEAD TO A DECREASE IN
POPS THROUGHOUT THE DAY AND A DRIER AIR MASS THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT.
SURFACE RIDGE BEGINS TO BUILD BACK IN AS WAVE EXITS. MOISTURE WILL
BEGIN TO RETURN ON SATURDAY BUT FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR
PRECIPITATION IS LACKING. NAM SEEMS TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE ON LACK
OF LIFT WHILE GFS SEEMS TO HAVE A WETTER SOLUTION. CURRENT THINKING
IS TO TREND TOWARD THE NAM FOR SATURDAY MORNING AND ONLY KEEP A
SLIGHT CHANCE OF POPS. INCREASING POPS FROM WEST TO EAST ON
SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS A SIGNIFICANT FRONTAL BOUNDARY
ESTABLISHES FROM E TX NE THROUGH THE MS/W TN AND W OH VALLEY AND
BEGINS TO SLOWLY MOVE EAST TOWARD OUR AREA.

.LONG TERM 2 (SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...DURING THIS PERIOD A
HEAVY RAIN EVENT IS EXPECTED TO OCCUR SOMEWHERE IN TENNESSEE--THE
EAST-WEST SETUP DETAILS WILL BE AN IMPORTANT ISSUE. RIGHT NOW THERE
IS MODERATE AGREEMENT FOR THE PRIME RAIN AXIS TO BE WEST OF OUR
AREA ON SUNDAY...GETTING CLOSER AND POSSIBLY OVER THE AREA
MONDAY...THEN OVER THE AREA ON TUESDAY AS THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY
HANGS UP IN THE AREA. FOR WEDNESDAY...THERE IS ALSO AGREEMENT THAT
THIS SYSTEM WILL BE MOVING OUT OF THE AREA...WHILE THE NEXT UPPER
LOW IS STALLED IN THE DESERT SW. FOR PRECIP CHANCES HAVE SETTLED
WITH THE ECMWF PATTERN OF A STEADILY SETTLING OF THE PRECIP INTO
THE AREA...RATHER THAN THE GFS PATTERN OF PUSHING PRECIP
THROUGH...THEN BUILDING IT UP AGAIN. THIS RESULTS IN HIGHER POPS IN
OUR WESTERN AREAS SLOWLY SPREADING EASTWARD SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY
NIGHT...THEN BY TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT HAVING HIGH POPS ACROSS
THE WHOLE AREA...AND ONCE AGAIN STARTING TO EXIT ON WEDNESDAY.

AT THE SURFACE...A COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING IN WITH THIS SYSTEM.  
TIMING OF THE FRONT IS QUESTIONABLE...BUT WITH THE FRONT SHALLOW AND 
THE MOISTURE HIGH...THE EXACT LOCATION OF ANY PARTICULAR SITE WILL 
NOT BE SIGNIFICANTLY DIFFERENT WITH RESPECT TO MAX/MIN TEMPS.  THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY PLACEMENT WILL BE MORE SIGNIFICANT ON THE MECHANISM 
FOR FOCUSING THE HEAVIEST RAINS.  BOTH GFS AND KEEP THE FRONT IN THE 
AREA UNTIL ABOUT WEDNESDAY...WHEN THEY PUSH IT EASTWARD.

TEMPERATURES WILL BE MUCH ABOVE NORMAL ON SUNDAY...WITH RECORDS 
THREATENED.  AM KEEPING FRONT SLOW TO MAKE IT THROUGH THE AREA...SO 
WENT ON THE HIGH SIDE OF GUIDANCE MONDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY...ESPECIALLY ON MIN TEMPS.

ONCE AGAIN--THE TIMEFRAME OF SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WILL NEED TO BE
WATCHED CLOSELY FOR HEAVY RAINFALL/FLOODING POTENTIAL. ALONG WITH
THE NEAR OR ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES...PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES
WILL BE PEGGING MAX VALUES FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR...AND MOISTURE
TRANSPORT ACROSS THE AREA WHEN THE MAIN RAIN AXIS WOULD BE OVER US
WILL BE VERY STRONG.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  46  64  51  68  55 /  40  50  60  60  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  64  51  67  55 /  40  50  50  60  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
435 AM EST WED JAN 9 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE
EAST COAST THIS MORNING WAS GIVING WAY TO MOISTURE INCREASING FROM
THE SOUTHWEST AS CLOUDS INCREASE AND LOWER THIS MORNING TEMPERATURES
ARE IN THE 30S NE VALLEYS TO 40S ELSEWHERE. SOUTHERLY FLOW AND
ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL BRING LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS INTO THE SE PART OF
THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AND SPREAD NE LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT. WEAK
LIFT WILL BRING ONLY A FEW HUNDREDTHS TO THE REGION. HAVE CONTINUED
TO UNDERCUT HIGHS SOUTHEAST AS CLOUDS AND RAIN SHOULD HOLD
TEMPERATURES DOWN. IN THE NE WENT WITH GUIDANCE WHERE RAIN IS LESS
LIKELY AND WOULD SPREAD NE LATE. WEAK LIFT CONTINUES OVERNIGHT
TONIGHT WITH BEST RAIN CHANCES SOUTH. LOWS WILL STAY ABOVE NORMAL
WITH CLOUDS IN THE 40S TO NEAR 50.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...RIDGE SLIDES EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS THURSDAY WITH WARM FRONT MOVING NORTH THROUGH THE AREA. 
GOOD CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT ALONG WARM FRONT. 
SURFACE RIDGE MOVES OFF ATLANTIC COAST AND SLIDES SOUTH ESTABLISHING 
OFF THE CAROLINA COAST FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. AIR MASS 
DRIES OUT SOME ON FRIDAY THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY. FOCUSING MECHANISM 
FOR PRECIPITATION LACKING OTHER THAN LOW LEVEL CONVERGENCE FAVORING 
WESTERN AREAS. SIGNIFICANT FRONTAL BOUNDARY ESTABLISHES FROM E TX NE 
THROUGH THE MS/W TN AND W OH VALLEYS OVER THE WEEKEND. LARGE 
AMPLITUDE TROUGH SETS UP OVER THE INTERIOR W U.S. WHILE LARGE SE 
RIDGE REMAINS ANCHORED FROM THE E GLFMEX THROUGH FL TO OFF THE MID 
ATLANTIC COAST. PARALLEL FLOW ALONG SURFACE BOUNDARY...ENHANCED BY 
UPPER IMPULSES...COUPLED WITH DEEP RETURN MOISTURE WILL RESULT IN A 
PROLONGED PRECIPITATION EVENT. THIS ACTIVITY WILL SLOWLY SHIFT 
EASTWARD AFFECTING THE E TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATER 
IN THE WEEKEND AND CONTINUING EARLY NEXT WEEK. PWAT VALUES ARE 
PROGGED TO BE EXTRAORDINARILY HIGH AND CONFIDENCE IN MODELS IS HIGH. 
LIKELY POPS DAY 4-7 MAY BE UNDERDONE. ANTICIPATED FLOODING SW AND W 
OF THE AREA MAY DEVELOP ACROSS MRX CWA AND IS WORTH WATCHING CLOSELY.

WELL ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED THROUGH THE PERIOD. SOME 
RECORDS MAY BE THREATENED THIS WEEKEND AND CLOUD COVER WILL BE 
DETERMINING FACTOR AS THICKNESS VALUES ARE QUITE HIGH. FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS DO NOT APPEAR POSSIBLE 
THROUGH TUESDAY.

966 
FXUS64 KMRX 081955
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST TUE JAN 8 2013

.SHORT TERM...
SOME PASSING MID TO HIGH CLOUDS AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING STORM
SYSTEM OVER TEXAS IS THE ONLY WEATHER TO SPEAK OFF AS MOSTLY SUNNY
CONDITIONS ARE PREVAILING ACROSS MUCH OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES ARE ONCE AGAIN
MILD /AND WITH THE AMPLE SUNSHINE AND VEERED SE/SSE WINDS/ HAVE
RISEN INTO THE LOW TO MID 50S AREAWIDE. OVERNIGHT HOWEVER...LOW
CLOUDS WILL BECOME DENSER AS LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE INCREASES AHEAD OF
THE AFOREMENTIONED STORM SYSTEM. SOME AREAS OF REDUCED VIS FROM
LIGHT FOG WILL ALSO BE POSSIBLE...BUT DO NOT THINK IT WILL BE DENSE
OR WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO WARRANT A MENTION IN THE ZONES ATTM. 

BY EARLY TMRW MORNING...ALL MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE THE
POTENTIAL FOR SOME SCATTERED LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS MOVING INTO THE
REGION FROM THE SOUTHWEST. THEREFORE...HAVE INCREASED POPS
SLIGHTLY TO CHANCE FOR LOCATIONS GENERALLY SOUTH AND WEST OF
MORRISTOWN...AND HAVE GONE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SOUTHWEST VA/
NORTHEAST TN BY THE LATE AFTERNOON. THE BEST CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL
BE FOR THOSE LOCATIONS ACROSS SE TENNESSEE/SW NORTH CAROLINA. WITH
SOUTHERLY WINDS...A MILDER NIGHT CAN BE EXPECTED...FOLLOWED BY
ANOTHER UNSEASONABLY WARM DAY. HAVE UNDERCUT HIGHS BY A FEW DEGREES
FROM MOS GIVEN THE EXPECTED RAIN/CLOUD COVER...BUT READINGS IN THE
MID TO UPPER 50S AREAWIDE ARE EXPECTED BY THE AFTERNOON AGAIN.

.LONG TERM /WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY/...  
DEEP MOISTURE WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND
THURSDAY...ALTHOUGH LIFT WILL BE WEAK BOTH PERIODS. LIGHT PRECIP
WILL COME FROM A DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW AND ISENTROPIC LIFT...WITH THE
BEST CHANCES SOUTH. ENSEMLE POP SPREAD IS VERY LARGE THESE PERIODS
DUE TO THE WEAK FORCING...SO CONFIDENCE IS LOW. POPS WILL STAY IN
THE CHANCE/SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE. SYNOPTIC FORCING WILL INCREASE
THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE LOW TRACKS INTO MISSOURI. THE 850 MB JET
PICKS UP TO 40-50 KTS...AND UPPER DIVERGENCE INCREASES AHEAD OF A
NEGATIVELY-TILTED UPPER TROUGH. POPS WILL RISE ACCORDINGLY INTO THE
LIKELY RANGE...ALONG WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS IN
SOUTHERN AREAS. THE SYSTEM EXITS FRIDAY...WITH DECREASING POPS
THROUGH THE DAY. HOWEVER TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN QUITE WARM INTO
SATURDAY AS A DEEP SW FLOW CONTINUES ON THE WEST SIDE OF A STRONG
EAST COAST RIDGE.

AN UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN REMAINS THROUGH THE END OF THE 
EXTENDED...WITH A LONGWAVE TROUGH SITTING OVER THE ROCKIES AND 
PLAINS. MODEL AGREEMENT IS GOOD WITH RELATIVELY LOW ENSEMBLE 
SPREAD...AND SOME SLIGHT TIMING DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE ECMWF AND 
THE GFS. WITH HIGH PRESSURE REMAINING IN PLACE TO OUR 
SOUTHEAST...THIS SYSTEM WILL HAVE PLENTY OF GULF MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE...AND A BOUNDARY RUNNING PARALLEL TO THE UPPER FLOW WILL 
BE NEARLY STATIONARY ACROSS THE MS/OH VALLEY REGIONS. SLOW 
PROPAGATION OF THE SYSTEM WILL KEEP A HIGH CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS 
OUR AREA FROM SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILD AHEAD OF FRONT ON SUNDAY AND THEN COOLER 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

&&

LOW DEVELOPS ALONG FRONT IN THE GULF THE FRONT SLOWS DOWN JUST TO

OVER THE FORECAST AREA. THIS HIGH WILL CONTINUE TO BRING MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...AND WILL NOT 
PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING.

224 
FXUS64 KMRX 071958
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
258 PM EST MON JAN 7 2013

.SHORT TERM /TONIGHT AND TOMORROW/...
VERY QUIET WEATHER CONDITONS IN THE SHORT TERM AS AN UPPER-LEVEL
AXIS OF HIGH PRESSURE HAS BEGUN TO BUILD NORTHWESTWARD INTO THE
FORECAST AREA. AS A RESULT...CLEAR CONDITIONS AND DRY WEATHER IS
PREVAILING THIS AFTERNOON PUSHING HIGHS BACK INTO THE UPPER 40S TO
LOWER 50S IN MOST LOCATIONS. FOR TONIGHT...THE CLEAR...CALM AND DRY
CONDITIONS WILL PROMOTE GOOD RADITIONAL COOLING TONIGHT AS
TEMPERATURES WILL FALL PRETTY QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET AND DIP BELOW
FREEZING IN THE MID 20S TO LOWER 30S IN MOST AREAS. FOR
TOMORROW...SOME MID TO UPPER-LEVEL MOISTURE WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO
INCREASE AS WINDS VEER TO A SOUTHERLY DIRECTION AHEAD OF A STORM
SYSTEM IN TEXAS...RESULTING IN SOME HIGH CLOUDS SPREADING INTO THE
FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY TMRW. HOWEVER...GIVEN THE ABOUNDANT
SUNSHINE AND INCREASED THICKNESS/TEMPS ALOFT...HIGHS WILL BE 5-10
DEGREES WARMER BY THE LATE AFTERNOON...REACHING THE MID TO UPPER
50S ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM /TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY/...
WARM ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA
ON WEDNESDAY AS A RIDGE SITS OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST AND A CLOSED
LOW TRACKS INTO TX. AS THE LOW TRACKS TOWARD THE NORTHEAST...THE
SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL STRENGTHEN AND BRING DEEPER MOISTURE TO THE
AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. HOWEVER LIFT REMAINS WEAK AS
THE MIDLEVEL CIRCULATION STAYS WEST OF THE MS RIVER. BETTER UPPER
DIVERGENCE AND A 50 KT LLJ DEVELOP THURSDAY NIGHT...WHICH APPEARS
TO BE THE PERIOD OF THE BEST PRECIP CHANCES...ALONG WITH A SLIGHT
CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. ENSEMBLE SPREAD IS QUITE HIGH WITH THIS
SYSTEM...SO OVERALL CONFIDENCE IS LOW...THUS WILL KEEP POPS WITHIN
THE CHANCE RANGE. PRECIP CHANCES WILL DECREASE FRIDAY AS THE LOW
TRACKS INTO CANADA...BUT TEMPS WILL REMAIN MILD AS THE FLOW ALOFT
REMAINS FROM THE SW.

STRONG RIDGING WILL QUICKLY BUILD IN ACROSS OUR REGION AFTER THE 
PASSAGE OF THE WARM FRONT FRIDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL CAUSE AN 
UNSEASONABLE WARMING TREND...ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO RISE INTO THE 
60S TO NEAR 70 FOR THE WEEKEND. MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH 
SHOWING THE NEXT FRONT TO MOVE IN AND SPREAD ANOTHER ROUND OF 
SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL 
DROP WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE ON MONDAY BUT SHOULD REMAIN WELL ABOVE 
NORMAL.


&&

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  51  29  57  39  59 /   0   0   0  10  20

HOWEVER...A DEEPENING UPPER-LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER TEXAS
WILL GRADUALLY PUSH TOWARD THE LOWER-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND
EVENTUALLY THE OHIO VALLEY...BRINGING A GOOD CHANCE FOR
PRECIPITATION HEADING INTO THE LATTER HALF OF THE WORK WEEK. BY
WEDNESDAY...MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE ACROSS THE REGION AS A
SOUTHERLY FLOW RAMPS UP AHEAD OF THIS STORM SYSTEM. SOME LIGHT
PRECIPITATION MAY BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN ZONES ON
WEDNESDAY...BUT BETTER CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL BEGIN WEDNESDAY
NIGHT...AND ESPECIALLY THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT AS DEEP MOISTURE
MOVES OVER THE FORECAST AREA...COMBINED WITH THE ENHANCED LIFT FROM
THE APPROACHING STORM SYSTEM. SOME DECENT CHANCES FOR RAIN WILL
EXIST ON FRIDAY...BEFORE THINGS TAPER OFF BY FRIDAY EVENING/NIGHT.
A BREAK IN THE PRECIPITATION WILL BE SHORT-LIVED IT APPEARS AS
THOUGH ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE MID-SOUTH/OHIO
VALLEY BY THE WEEKEND.

GIVEN THE FACT THAT THE GFS/ECMWF HAVE BEGUN TO FINALLY COME IN LINE 
WITH TIMING...HAVE INCREASED POPS TO HIGH-END CHANCE TO LIKELY ON 
THURSDAY...AND HAVE GONE LIKELY AREAWIDE THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH 
HIGH-END CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY AS WELL. ADDITIONALLY...GIVEN THE 
STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION EXPECTED AHEAD OF THIS STORM SYSTEM...HAVE 
BUMPED TEMPS UP WEDNESDAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS WELL...THOUGH HAVE 
UNDER CUT GUIDANCE A BIT TO ACCOUNT FOR CLOUD COVER/PRECIPITATION. 
STILL...HIGHS WILL REACH THE MID/UPPER 50S TO LOW 60S IN MOST AREAS 
LATE THIS WEEK/WEEKEND.

AREA. AREA RADARS REVEAL SOME LIGHT RAIN OVER THE FORECAST AREA...

MIXING WITH THIS RAIN AT TIMES...WITH MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATING THAT

TO SNOW TONIGHT. A RELATIVELY WARM 850 TO 700 MB LAYER IS PROGGED TO 
LINGER THROUGH THE NIGHT...WHICH APPEARS TO BE WARM ENOUGH TO KEEP 
THE PRECIP AS A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND SLEET...MAINLY OVER THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. EVEN THOUGH SOME WINTRY PRECIP WILL BE 
POSSIBLE TONIGHT...IT APPEARS THAT PRECIP AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT 
ENOUGH TO NOT NEED A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY. HOWEVER...WILL PLAN TO 
ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR THE MOUNTAINS TO MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SLIPPERY ROADS LATER TONIGHT.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST APPEARS TO BE ON TRACK...BUT WILL UPDATE 
THIS EVENING TO TWEAK PRECIP WORDING AND TO REMOVE ANY EVENING 
WORDING.

PLACE ACROSS THE MID SOUTH. THE PROBLEM IS LACK OF LOW LEVEL INFLOW
OFF THE GULF OF MEXICO. SOME LIGHT RAIN ONGOING ACROSS THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY OF ALABAMA IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE WAVE WILL BUILD
ACROSS THE GREAT VALLEY TONIGHT AND WOULD EXPECT A FEW DROPS OF
RAIN AS THE LOW LEVEL MOISTEN BUT PROBABLY NOT MUCH MORE THAN THAT.
KEPT FLIGHT WEATHER VFR FOR THE MOST PART WITH CEILINGS GENERALLY
NOT DROPPING MUCH BELOW 3500 FEET. HOWEVER...THERE IS A CHANCE THAT
A LOWER CEILING MAY DEVELOP...MAINLY AROUND CHA LATER TONIGHT. KEPT
A BKN-OVC LAYER GOING AROUND 3500 FEET UNTIL MID TO LATE MORNING.
WOULD EXPECT MIXING TO DISSOLVE THIS LAYER FOR A FEW HOURS OF SCT
CLOUDS. NEXT SHORT WAVE DROPS SOUTHEAST INTO THE AREA DURING THE
AFTERNOON AND ADDED SCT-BKN MID DECK AS THIS FEATURES MOVES INTO
THE REGION.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

676 
FXUS64 KMRX 052007
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EST SAT JAN 5 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL PUSH EAST 
TONIGHT.  MOISTURE RETURN AHEAD OF THIS WILL BE SOMEWHAT WEAK BUT 
STILL EXPECT SOME LIGHT RAIN TO MOVE IN THIS EVENING...SO WILL CARRY 
LIKELY POPS SW NC ZONES WITH CHANCE POPS MOST OF THE REMAINDER OF 
THE AREA.  PRECIP AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT AND PRECIP TYPE 
SHOULD BE RAIN AT THE ONSET...BUT AS PRECIP TAPERS OFF LATE 
TONIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY PRECIP TYPE BECOMES MORE PROBLEMATIC.  MODEL 
SOUNDINGS INDICATE ICE CRYSTALLIZATION MAY BE DIFFICULT AS TEMPS DO 
NOT GET VERY COLD IN THE CLOUD LAYER.  ALSO THE MOISTURE GETS RATHER 
SHALLOW.  SURFACE TEMPS MAY DIP BELOW FREEZING ESPECIALLY IN SOME OF 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN LATE TONIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY...SO WILL MENTION SOME 
LIGHT SNOW OR FREEZING DRIZZLE TONIGHT LATE AND WILL MENTION 
FREEZING DRIZZLE EARLY SUNDAY IN SOME OF THESE AREAS.  GIVEN LOW 
CONFIDENCE THAT ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOW OR ICE ACCUMULATIONS WILL OCCUR 
NO WSW PLANNED A THIS TIME.  SUNDAY ANOTHER SHORT WAVE WILL BE 
PUSHING IN LATE...SO WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR FAR 
NORTHEAST ZONES FOR SOME SHOWERS/SNOW SHOWERS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)... SOME LIGHT
RAIN/WINTRY PRECIP COULD LINGER ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN SUNDAY
EVENING AS ANOTHER UPPER WAVE SCOOTS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.
HOWEVER...DRY AND MILDER CONDITIONS WILL BE THE PRIMARY STORY
HEADING INTO THE NEW WORK WEEK AS SUBTROPICAL RIDGING BUILDS BACK
INTO THE REGION. THIS WILL HELP TO PROMOTE MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS
AND PUSH HIGHS BACK INTO THE 50S AREAWIDE BY TUESDAY.

THE MAIN FOCUS FOR MID TO LATE WEEK CONTINUES TO BE A STRONG 
UPPER-LEVEL STORM SYSTEM PROGGED TO DIG OUT OF THE DESERT 
SOUTHWEST/BAJA CALIFORNIA AND MOVE TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI/OHIO 
VALLEYS. THERE IS STILL SOME SIGNIFICANT DISAGREEMENT BETWEEN THE 
EXTENDED MODELS REGARDING THE EXACT TIMING OF THE MOISTURE/PRECIP... 
WITH THE GFS BRINGING SOME HEAVY QPF SIGNALS INTO THE AREA LATE 
TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY AND THE ECMWF DOING SO 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND ESPECIALLY INTO THE DAY THURSDAY...BEFORE 
TAPERING THINGS OFF BY FRIDAY MORNING. GIVEN THE RECENT PERFORMANCE 
OF THE ECMWF AND THE WAY THE NAM HAS STARTED TO TREND LATE IN ITS 
RUN...HAVE TRENDED MORE TOWARDS THE LATER ECMWF SOLUTION. STILL... 
FELT CONFIDENT ENOUGH THAT SOME PRECIP MAY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO GO LOW-END CHANCE POPS THEN...AND HAVE 
RAISED THEM TO THE HIGH-END CHANCE TO LIKELY CATEGORY FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS CONFIDENCE IS INCREASING THAT SOME LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL WILL OCCUR DURING THESE PERIODS. THEN...HAVE THE 
PRECIP TAPERING OFF FROM WEST TO EAST THURSDAY NIGHT /WITH CHANCE 
POPS HUGGING THE E TN/SW NC MOUNTAIN ZONES/. THEREAFTER... WARM AND 
DRY CONDITIONS ARE ANTICIPATED FOR FRIDAY WITH UPPER RIDGING 
BUILDING IN ONCE AGAIN. 


&&

APPROACHING SYSTEM.  GFS CONTINUES TO BE FAST...BRING THE NEXT ROUND 
FOR RAIN INTO THE AREA LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  THE ECMWF 
REMAINS MUCH SLOWER...BRINGING PRECIP IN THURSDAY.  MADE LITTLE 
CHANGE TO THE FORECAST WHICH HAS LOW POPS WEDNESDAY...BEST CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS ACTIVITY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY AND LOW POPS INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT.  LEFT FRIDAY DRY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN.

163 
FXUS64 KMRX 042000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST FRI JAN 4 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...UPPER RIDGE AND SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE AREA WILL SHIFT EAST DURING THE SHORT TERM.  MOISTURE WILL 
START TO INCREASE SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE UPPER TROUGH LIFTING 
NORTHEAST OUT OF THE PLAINS.  CLOUDS WILL INCREASE DURING THE DAY 
SATURDAY...AND SOME LIGHT SHOWERS MAY MOVE INTO OUR AREA LATE IN THE 
DAY ESPECIALLY SOUTH AND WEST.  WILL INCLUDE A 20 POP LATE FOR ALL 
BUT NORTHEAST ZONES.  WILL UNDERCUT SOME MAV TEMPS SLIGHTLY FOR 
HIGHS SATURDAY GIVEN COLD START AND EXPECTED CLOUD INCREASE...BUT 
OVERALL WILL STAY CLOSE.       

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)... SOME LOW-END
PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL CONTINUE OVERNIGHT SATURDAY AS A
WEAKENING UPPER-TROUGH PASSES OVER THE REGION. GENERALLY LIGHT RAIN
SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED IN THE LOWER ELEVATIONS...BUT SCATTERED SNOW
SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND EAST TENNESSEE THROUGH EARLY SUNDAY MORNING. GIVEN THE
LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE AND LIFT...THIS ACTIVITY IS NOT EXPECTED TO
BE VERY HEAVY...WITH MINOR ACCUMULATIONS OF LESS THAN AN INCH
GENERALLY EXPECTED ALONG THE MOUNTAINS. ANOTHER UPPER-TROUGH WILL
THEN SWING THROUGH THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT AND PUSH A COLD FRONT
THROUGH THE AREA. THIS FRONT WILL BRING SOME COLDER AIR INTO THE
REGION...AND COMBINED WITH SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND OROGRAPHIC
LIFT...WILL YIELD THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LIGHT SCATTERED NORTHWEST
FLOW SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN OVERNIGHT.

THEREAFTER...DRIER AND WARMER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED AS SUBTROPICAL 
RIDGING BUILDS BACK INTO THE REGION FROM THE SOUTH. THE MAIN 
FORECAST CONCERN HEADING INTO NEXT WEEK WILL BE ANOTHER STORM SYSTEM 
PROGGED TO DIG OUT OF BAJA CALIFORNIA/DESERT SOUTHWEST AND TRACK 
EAST TOWARD THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER BY MID/LATE WEEK. ATTM...THERE IS 
STILL A SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCE OF ABOUT 24 HOURS BETWEEN THE GFS AND 
ECMWF ON THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM. THE GFS BRINGS IN DEEP 
MOISTURE/PRECIP LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND THE 
ECMWF WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. GIVEN THE HIGH MODEL 
SPREAD...HAVE OPTED TO NOT GET TOO SPECIFIC REGARDING TIMING...AND 
HAVE MENTIONABLE POPS AREAWIDE WEDNESDAY...AND SOLID CHANCE POPS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...BEFORE TAPERING THEM OFF FROM WEST TO 
EAST THURSDAY NIGHT. HAVE TRENDED A BIT TOWARD THE ECMWF GIVEN ITS 
PERFORMANCE IN RECENT WEEKS. BY FRIDAY INTO NEXT WEEKEND A BOUT OF 
WARMER AND DRIER WEATHER MAY BE ON THE HORIZON ONCE AGAIN AS 
SUBTROPICAL RIDGING RETURNS.

AGREEMENT BY THE END OF THE EXTENDED...ESPECIALLY WITH THE TIMING OF 
AN APPROACHING SYSTEM.  GFS CONTINUES TO BE FASTER...BRINGING THE 
PRECIP IN WEDNESDAY...WITH THE ECMWF 12 TO 24 HOURS SLOWER WITH 
PRECIP NOT MOVING IN UNTIL THURSDAY.  HAVE CONTINUE WITH A 
COMPROMISE SOLUTION...HAVE INTRODUCES LOW POPS WEDNESDAY...HIGHEST 
CHANCE ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 20 TO 30 POPS CONTINUING INTO 
THURSDAY.  BOTH MODELS DO KEEP TEMPERATURES WARM ENOUGH FOR AN ALL 
RAIN EVENT FOR NOW.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...LAST OF THE CLOUD COVER EXITING

AGREEMENT OVERALL AND LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)... AN UPPER-TROUGH
WILL TRACK NORTHEASTWARD FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT
LAKES THIS WEEKEND...BRINGING WITH IT SOME PRECIP CHANCES SATURDAY
AFTERNOON AND NIGHT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS ARE NOT OVERLY
IMPRESSIVE WITH QPF SIGNALS GIVEN THE LACK OF DEEP MOISTURE...SO
HAVE GONE WITH LOW TO MODERATE CHANCE POPS FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS
MOVING UP FROM THE SW SATURDAY AFTERNOON... FAVORING THE SPINE OF
THE MTNS OVERNIGHT. WITH COLDER AIR WORKING ITS WAY INTO THE REGION
BEHIND THE SYSTEM...SOME LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES ARE
EXPECTED LATE SATURDAY NIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY MORNING /MAINLY ACROSS
THE HIGHER TERRAIN/...WITH MINOR TO NO ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED.
ANOTHER UPPER-WAVE MOVING THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT WILL
DRAG A WEAK FRONT THROUGH THE AREA. IN ITS WAKE SOME LINGERING
MOISTURE COMBINED WITH NORTHWEST FLOW WINDS COULD YIELD SOME
SCATTERED OROGRAPHICALLY INDUCED SNOW SHOWERS...SO HAVE ADDED A
SLIGHT CHANCE MENTION OF THIS IN THE MTN ZONES OF SW VA AND E TN.

THEREAFTER...DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE 
WEEK AS UPPER RIDGING MOVES INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN UNITED STATES. 
HOWEVER...LATE IN THE PERIOD THERE IS SIGNIFICANT MODEL DISCREPANCY 
REGARDING THE NEXT UPPER-LOW MOVING EAST FROM THE DESERT SOUTHWEST. 
THE GFS IS MUCH MORE BULLISH WITH THIS SYSTEM AND SHOWS IT TRACKING 
EAST THROUGH THE OHIO/TENNESSEE VALLEYS WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...BRINGING WITH IT SOME VERY GOOD PRECIP CHANCES. THE ECMWF ON 
THE OTHERHAND IS ABOUT A 12-24 HOURS SLOWER...BRING A BULK OF THE 
PRECIP INTO THE REGION LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY 
EVENING. GIVEN THE DIFFERENCES...HAVE TRIED TO DO SOMEWHAT OF A 
MODEL BLEND...SLIGHTLY FAVORING THE ECMWF. HAVE ADDED LOW-END CHANCE 
POPS IN THE EXTENDED FOR WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL WAIT FOR LATER MODEL RUNS AND BETTER CONTINUITY 
BEFORE MAKING ANY FURTHER ADJUSTMENTS TO THE EXTENDED. 


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             25  48  27  48  32 /   0   0   0  30  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  24  44  25  46  30 /   0   0   0  20  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       24  45  26  47  30 /   0   0   0  20  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              21  43  21  45  28 /   0   0   0  10  30

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST THU JAN 3 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS DID NOT HANDLE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE TRAPPED UNDER AN INVERSION WELL AT ALL ON WEDNESDAY AND 
THERE ARE SIMILARITIES TO THAT DEBACLE THIS MORNING WITH A LOW LEVEL 
SATURATED LAYER STAYING IN PLACE WITH COLD NORTHERLY FLOW NEAR THE 
SURFACE AND SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS ABOVE THIS LEVEL. TRIED TO GO WITH A 
SLOWER EROSION OF CLOUDS TODAY THAN MODEL DEPICTION AND USED THE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER MAV MOS MAX TEMPS AS A LOW AMPLITUDE UPPER TROUGH 
SLIDES EAST ACROSS THE NORTHEASTERN QUARTER OF THE NATION. A COLDER 
NIGHT IS IN STORE WITH LESS CLOUD COVER EXPECTED AS SURFACE HIGH 
BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. 

.SHORT TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A CLOSED SOUTHERN STREAM 
LOW OVER THE DESERT SW WILL DRIFT NE AND MERGE WITH A NORTHERN 
STREAM TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS ON FRIDAY. THE GFS IS A BIT WETTER 
THIS THIS SYSTEM THAN YESTERDAY...BUT IT IS STILL THE DRIEST AMONG 
THE NAM/ECMWF/CMC/SREF. THESE MODELS SPREAD RAIN INTO THE AREA FROM 
THE SW SATURDAY AFTERNOON...WITH PRECIP MOVING THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT. SOME COLD ADVECTION AFTER MIDNIGHT WILL CHANGE PRECIP FROM 
RAIN TO SNOW. SINCE THE GFS APPEARS TO BE AN OUTLIER...WILL RAISE 
POPS FOR THESE PERIODS TO A CHANCE...AND LOWER POPS ON SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON AS THE DEEP MOISTURE PUSHES TO OUR EAST BY THEN. 

MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY WILL BE DRY WITH A SLIGHT WARMING TREND AS 
A LARGE RIDGE WILL BE OVER MUCH OF THE EASTERN CONUS. A SOUTHERN 
STREAM CLOSED LOW MAY AFFECT THE AREA BEYOND DAY 7.

006 
FXUS64 KMRX 021935
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST WED JAN 2 2013

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...WITH WEAK LOW LEVEL FLOW AND 
MOISTURE LINGERING BENEATH THE INVERSION THE LOW CLOUDS OVER THE 
AREA HAVE HELD STUBBORNLY IN PLACE.  WHEN THE LOW CLOUDS DO BREAK UP 
STILL WILL BE SOME HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE AREA...SO EXPECT 
CONSIDERABLE CLOUDINESS FOR MUCH OF THE NIGHT.  CLEARING SHOULD 
START WORKING IN LATER TONIGHT FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST...THEN 
EXPECT PLENTY OF SUNSHINE FOR THURSDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES TO BUILD IN ALONG WITH DRIER AIR. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK 
REASONABLE FOR THE SHORT TERM SO WILL STAY CLOSE.    

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MAIN WEATHER CONCERN 
IS THE AMOUNT OF PHASING BETWEEN THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM 
WAVES AND EXTENT OF GULF MOISTURE RETURN INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. GFS AND ECMWF AGREE FAIRLY WELL WITH 
A GOOD DEAL OF PHASING BETWEEN THE TWO SYSTEMS...BUT THE GFS IS WEAK 
IN RETURN OF GULF MOISTURE. THE ECMWF AND NAM MODELS SHOW A GOOD 
DEAL MORE MOISTURE/ISENTROPIC LIFT AND ASSOCIATED PRECIPITATION 
MOVING NORTHEAST INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.

SINCE MODELS ARE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE PHASING OF THE 
TWO WAVES...I PREFER GOING WITH THE HIGHER POPS. INTERESTING THAT 
THE GFS POPS ARE IN THE 30S AND 40S...BUT SHOW LITTLE IN THE WAY OF 
QPF. LATER SHIFTS WILL LIKELY HAVE TO BUMP UP THE POPS.

THE TEMPERATURE PROFILE SHOWS A MIX BAG OF SNOW..SLEET..RAIN AND 
POSSIBLY FREEZING RAIN WITH THIS SYSTEM. SINCE DEWPOINTS WILL BE 
INITIALLY QUITE DRY..A GOOD DEAL OF EVAPORATIVE COOLING EXPECTED 
WHICH WILL HELP COOL COLUMN.

UPPER TROUGH LIFTS OUT FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY WITH RIDGING BOTH 
SURFACE AND ALOFT FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED. ANOTHER SYSTEM 
MAY BEGIN TO PULL MOISTURE BACK INTO THE FORECAST FOR MONDAY...BUT 
WILL KEEP DRY FOR NOW.


&&

719 
FXUS64 KMRX 020914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST WED JAN 2 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL SLIP EAST 
OF THE REGION TODAY WHILE COLDER AIR TRIES TO SPILL OVER THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND INTO THE GREAT VALLEY. THIS 
PROCESS IS TAKING A WHILE DUE TO THE FACT THAT THE LOW LEVEL 
PRESSURE GRADIENT IS SOMEWHAT ANEMIC WITH A CONTINUATION OF 
SOUTHWESTERLY WINDS ALOFT. MODELS DEPICT A RELATIVELY QUICK EROSION 
OF THE LOW CLOUD DECK BUT SATELLITE AND OBSERVATIONS REVEAL A RATHER 
BROAD AREA OF MOISTURE BELOW 85H WITH A FAIR AMOUNT OF CIRRUS 
STREAMING OUT OF THE TROPICS. THEREFORE TRIED TO BE A LITTLE MORE 
PESSIMISTIC ON CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA...WITH 
PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE BREAKING OUT 
INTO SOME SUNSHINE TOWARD EARLY AFTERNOON. LIGHT PRECIPITATION IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH THE DEPARTING WAVE IS MOVING OUT FAIRLY QUICKLY 
THIS MORNING. SOME OF THE PRECIP ON THE EXTREME NORTHERN FRINGES OF 
THE FORECAST AREA IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS WELL AS ALONG THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN IN NORTHEAST TENNESSEE IS PROBABLY REACHING THE SURFACE AS A 
MIXTURE OF FREEZING DRIZZLE WITH A SNOWFLAKE OR TWO MIXED IN. IN 
THESE AREAS...THE COLDEST AIR HAS ARRIVED WITH TEMPERATURES HOVERING 
CLOSE TO IF NOT A DEGREE OR TWO BELOW FREEZING. SATURATED AIR IS 
ALSO RESULTING IN SOME FREEZING FOG AS WELL. EXPECT THERE WILL BE A 
FEW SLICK SPOTS IN THIS AREA THIS MORNING WITH THIS LIMITED WINTERY 
SITUATION SO WILL KEEP THE SPS GOING TO HIGHLIGHT. NOT EXPECTING A 
GREAT DEAL OF WARMING TODAY WITH CLOUDS AND COLDER AIR OOZING SOUTH 
SO GENERALLY UNDERCUT GUIDANCE TEMPS. TONIGHT SHOULD BE PARTLY 
CLOUDY BUT DRY AS WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY RIDES NORTHEAST ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEASTERN CORNER OF THE NATION.   

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A POSITIVELY-TILTED MIDLEVEL 
TROUGH WILL BE PUSHING ACROSS THE AREA ON THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT. 
MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED SO THERE WILL BE LITTLE IMMEDIATE IMPACT TO 
THE SENSIBLE WEATHER. HOWEVER COOLER TEMPERATURES WILL FOLLOW FOR 
FRIDAY. 

A RIDGE WILL BE BUILDING IN BRIEFLY FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY BEFORE 
ANOTHER POSITIVELY-TILTED UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWS FOR SATURDAY 
NIGHT/SUNDAY. THIS TROUGH LOOKS DEEPER THAN THE PREVIOUS ONE...WITH 
A BIT MORE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH. STILL...LIFT APPEARS VERY WEAK. 
THE ECMWF AND CANADIAN ARE MORE BULLISH ON PRECIP CHANCES THAN THE 
GFS. WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP GOING FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. MONDAY AND TUESDAY WILL FEATURE A DRY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WITH 
HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE...AND NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES.

&&

529 
FXUS64 KMRX 011931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EST TUE JAN 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...LARGE BAND OF RAIN AND DRIZZLE 
WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS.  
PRECIP WILL SLOWLY END FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST OVERNIGHT.  AS 
TEMPERATURES DROP THROUGH THE NIGHT...LINGERING RAIN SHOWERS MAY 
SWITCH TO SNOW...ESPECIALLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  LITTLE TO NO 
ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED.  IMPROVING CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH SKIES SLOWLY CLEARING AS THE SYSTEM CONTINUE TO PULL 
AWAY TO OUR SOUTH.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY SHOW 
GOOD CONTINUITY IN THE EARLY PERIODS OF THE LONG TERM AND ALSO ON 
DAYS 6 AND 7. HOWEVER...STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY FOR SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY WITH POSSIBLY A TARGET OF OPPORTUNITY TO IMPROVE ON THE GFSX 
MOS FOR THOSE PERIODS. 12Z GFS MODEL RUN SHOWS LESS PHASING OF THE 
NRN AND SRN STREAMS ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY THAN WITH THE 00Z 
RUN...WHILE THE ECMWF AND CANADIAN MODELS STILL ADVERTISE THE SRN 
STREAM SYSTEM TAPPING INTO A GREAT DEAL OF GULF MOISTURE FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT. BELIEVE THAT THIS GULF MOISTURE IS LIKELY OVERDONE 
...BUT THIS DOES WARRANT ADDING A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA FOR SATURDAY NIGHT. FOR SUNDAY...A SENSIBLE FORECAST 
WOULD BE SOME LIGHT SNOW OR RAIN LIMITED TO MAINLY THE NRN PLATEAU 
...SW VA AND THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF EAST TN. 

OTHERWISE...12Z GFSX MOS TEMPS WERE VERY MUCH IN LINE WITH THE 00Z 
NUMBERS AND GENERALLY FOLLOWED. DRY FORECAST CONTINUED FOR MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY WAS INTRODUCED AS DRY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER THAN 
NORMAL...AS SOME DEGREE OF UPPER RIDGING SPREADS OVER THE REGION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  36  47  31  50  27 /  80  10  10  10  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
649 AM EST TUE JAN 1 2013

.AVIATION...FLIGHT WEATHER WILL BE EXTREMELY POOR THROUGH THE
FORECAST AS A STEADY SUPPLY OF DEEP MOISTURE IS LIFTED OVER A COOL
SURFACE AIRMASS RESULTING IN AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF LIGHT TO
MODERATE RAIN. IFR CONDITIONS WILL LIKELY BECOME LIFR LATER TODAY
AND TONIGHT AS THE LOW LEVELS SATURATE IN THE MOIST ENVIRONMENT. IT
IS POSSIBLE THAT SOME LIMITED IMPROVEMENT IN VISIBILITY AND CEILING
WILL BE NOTED AT CHA AROUND 06Z AND LATER AS THE PRECIPITATION
TAPERS OFF.

131 
FXUS64 KMRX 010900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST TUE JAN 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
A PLUME OF DEEP SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE SEEN IN WV IMAGERY WILL BE OVER 
THE TN VALLEY REGION TODAY...PRODUCING LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN ALL
DAY. FORCING FOR LIFT IS WEAK...AND PRECIP APPEARS TO BE DRIVEN
MAINLY BY DEEP ISENTROPIC LIFT AND WARM ADVECTION. A DEEP SW FLOW
WILL MEAN SLOW EASTWARD MOVEMENT OF THE RAIN. BY 06Z THE NAM AND
GFS SHOW STRONG MIDLEVEL DRY ADVECTION AS A 850-700 MB SHORTWAVE
TROUGH MOVES THROUGH...WHICH SHOULD QUICKLY END ALL PRECIP BY 09Z.
COLD ADVECTION ALSO KICKS IN AT THE SAME TIME...SO WHILE THERE MAY
BE A CHANGE TO SNOW...IT WILL BE VERY BRIEF BEFORE ENDING...WITH
VERY LITTLE ACCUMULATION.

CLEARING OF LOW CLOUDS WILL COME WEDNESDAY MORNING...WITH MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES BY THE AFTERNOON. DRY AND MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. A BROAD TROUGH WITH POSITIVE TILT 
WILL APPROACH THE AREA ON THURSDAY...BUT WITH VERY LITTLE MOISTURE 
ALOFT TO WORK WITH...WE WILL STAY DRY WITH MAYBE JUST A SLIGHT 
INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUD COVER NORTH. TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM PERIOD WILL BE FORECAST LOWER THAN MOS...WHICH HAS BEEN TOO 
WARM THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
BASICALLY STAYED THE COURSE FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST WHICH
FEATURES A BUILDING UPPER LEVEL AND SURFACE RIDGE FRIDAY INTO
SATURDAY. MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT WITH SPLIT FLOW PATTERN
OVER THE WEEKEND. BOTH THE 00Z ECMWF AND GFS DEPICT A MORE PHASED
AND THUS STRONGER SYSTEM WHICH INDICATES DEEPER MOISTURE AND LIFT
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THE CANADIAN IS GENERALLY WEAKER EARLY
IN THE WEEKEND WITH MORE SEPARATION BETWEEN NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN
STREAMS BUT ENDS THE WEEKEND (SUNDAY) WITH AN AMPLIFIED NORTHERN
BRANCH SYSTEM. FORECAST UNCERTAINTY IS STILL RATHER HIGH WITH
DIFFERING MODEL SOLUTIONS DURING THIS PERIOD SO KEPT A DRY FORECAST
GOING THROUGH MONDAY. DID NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM MEX MOS GUIDANCE
WHICH FEATURES A MODEST WARMING TREND.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             46  36  48  32  50 / 100  60  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  45  35  46  31  46 / 100  60  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       44  34  45  30  46 / 100  50  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              44  34  42  28  45 / 100  60  10  10  10

541 
FXUS64 KMRX 010856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST TUE JAN 1 2013

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...A PLUME OF DEEP 
SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE SEEN IN WV IMAGERY WILL BE OVER THE TN VALLEY 
REGION TODAY...PRODUCING LIGHT RAIN ALL DAY. FORCING FOR LIFT IS 
WEAK...AND PRECIP APPEARS TO BE DRIVEN MAINLY BY DEEP ISENTROPIC 
LIFT AND WARM ADVECTION. THUS QPF AMOUNTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LIGHT 
EVEN THOUGH THE RAIN WILL LAST ALL DAY. A DEEP SW FLOW WILL MEAN 
SLOW EASTWARD MOVEMENT OF THE RAIN. BY 06Z THE NAM AND GFS SHOW 
STRONG MIDLEVEL DRY ADVECTION AS A 850-700 MB SHORTWAVE TROUGH MOVES 
THROUGH...WHICH SHOULD QUICKLY END ALL PRECIP BY 09Z. COLD ADVECTION 
ALSO KICKS IN AT THE SAME TIME...SO WHILE THERE MAY BE A CHANGE TO 
SNOW...IT WILL BE VERY BRIEF BEFORE ENDING...WITH VERY LITTLE 
ACCUMULATION. 

CLEARING OF LOW CLOUDS WILL COME WEDNESDAY MORNING...WITH MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES BY THE AFTERNOON. DRY AND MOSTLY CLEAR CONDITIONS WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. A BROAD TROUGH WITH POSITIVE TILT 
WILL APPROACH THE AREA ON THURSDAY...BUT WITH VERY LITTLE MOISTURE 
ALOFT TO WORK WITH...WE WILL STAY DRY WITH MAYBE JUST A SLIGHT 
INCREASE IN HIGH CLOUD COVER NORTH. TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM PERIOD WILL BE FORECAST LOWER THAN MOS...WHICH HAS BEEN TOO 
WARM THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...BASICALLY STAYED THE COURSE 
FROM THE PREVIOUS FORECAST WHICH FEATURES A BUILDING UPPER LEVEL AND 
SURFACE RIDGE FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. MODELS NOT ENTIRELY IN AGREEMENT 
WITH SPLIT FLOW PATTERN OVER THE WEEKEND. BOTH THE 00Z ECMWF AND GFS 
DEPICT A MORE PHASED AND THUS STRONGER SYSTEM WHICH INDICATES DEEPER 
MOISTURE AND LIFT SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. THE CANADIAN IS 
GENERALLY WEAKER EARLY IN THE WEEKEND WITH MORE SEPARATION BETWEEN 
NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAMS BUT ENDS THE WEEKEND (SUNDAY) WITH AN 
AMPLIFIED NORTHERN BRANCH SYSTEM. FORECAST UNCERTAINTY IS STILL 
RATHER HIGH WITH DIFFERING MODEL SOLUTIONS DURING THIS PERIOD SO 
KEPT A DRY FORECAST GOING THROUGH MONDAY. DID NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM 
MEX MOS GUIDANCE WHICH FEATURES A MODEST WARMING TREND.
